Reviews.Title: “By no means fancy but location and price are hard to beat.”
Reviews.Author: jhk200
Reviews.Content: This was once a grand hotel but those days are gone. I have stayed here twice and the rooms were clean. You pay for in room internet service which is slow. There is no mini bar or cool lounge in the lobby but the price is low and the location is great. You are close to Times Square and Herald Square which is were Macys is located and the subway is across the street. The people who check you in can be a bit quick and rude but don't take it to heart. You are not here for the service. If you spend most of your time visiting and sight seeing then it won't matter.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL”
Reviews.Author: Lindsay E
Reviews.Content: We took a school trip here from the UK Students out in rooms across all floor not together, not enough beds, some rooms hadn't been cleaned from previous guests.Dogs all over the hotel. Rooms smelt, showers disgusting. Tramps and druggies hanging around in and outside of the lobby. Staff slow, rude, unhelpful and did not resolve issues, in fact at one stage one of the "managers" was hiding from us in the back. Some staff I would even describe as agressive. Location didn't make up for the awful hotel and staff. Stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for your money!”
Reviews.Author: D0lceV1ta
Reviews.Content: Hotel Pennsylvania's location and price is well worth any issues you might encounter. We took the train to New York City and got off Penn Station which is right across the street from the hotel. We were a few blocks from Times Square and right across from Macy's. Our room was on the smallish side but the bed was large and very comfortable and the sheets were clean. The bathroom was small but clean and the towels were changed everyday. The walls are not very well sound insulated but we were lucky to have nice, quiet neighbors and slept peacefully all week. It is a very large hotel (1,700 rooms) and it is amazing that things runs so smoothly (check-in, check-out, room service and housekeeping). I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay again- just okay”
Reviews.Author: susiedreamer
Reviews.Content: When I walked into the lobby of this hotel I thought I had walked into the wrong place. It looked like an airport. There were hundreds of people! There were easily 80-100 people in the sitting area with luggage. There were about 50 people in line to check in. There were people everywhere. After waiting 20 minutes I finally checked in, though when I saw the sign that said "portable smoke detectors available" I hesitated. The room was a decent size for NY standards. The 2 double beds were not the worst I've slept on but not the best. The heater/AC unit did not work- fortunately it was spring and I didn't need either. The phone didn't work in the room or in the common area near the elevators. There was no ice bucket and I had to wait 40 minutes for one. The blow dryer didn't work- my replacement never came. The window opened- I was shocked- but there was no screen. The TV had basic channels. The room was very old and outdated but I will say it did not smell at ALL. The bathroom was so old and pretty nasty. Layers of dust and grime on everything. Not a very good cleaning crew here! Only thing offered was shampoo and bar soap. When I called asking for a wine opened I was told they are not a full service hotel. There are a few little stores in the lobby. There are 2 restaurants but I did not eat at either. Not the worst hotel but far from the best. I paid $200- next time I'll pay a little more for a better place.

Reviews.Title: “Only if desperate”
Reviews.Author: Sheryl C
Reviews.Content: If you don't have allergies you might stand the stale air, the tiles & caulking in the bath are cracking and loose, There is mold stains all over the tub area, including the ceiling. Make certain that you have flip flops to walk around the room as the rugs are very old and you'll probably get a fungal infection from the rug &/or tub area. It's noisy because the walls are so thin you can hear every word others say & I have moderate hearing loss. In addition, the street is busy so you get the traffic noise too.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: napierbride
Reviews.Content: after reading bad reviews of this hotel I was dreading opening the hotel room door but was pleasantly surprised.Was good room.Don't know about other people but ours was great.Towels clean everyday,toiletries restocked,power shower with bath,large tv and massive bed.Book with info gallore and fridge if needed.We were in room 1040 and could not pick up much outside noise.view of side street.Lighting not great but we managed.Being opposite Madison Square Garden extra bonus as we went across to the boxing.Next block Macys and Old Navy down side of us.Lobby huge with coffee shoips and tourist ones and eating places.Only 20 minutes away from Time Square and other way same to Central Park.We only used hop on off bus for 48 hours then walked our little legs off everywhere..quicker than taxi maybe with all traffic congestion.We even walked all way down island to catch Staten Island free ferry and all way back.On last day our transfer not til $pm so stored our luggage in basement for $4 each bag which was very cheap

Reviews.Title: “DON'T KNOW WHAT THE HOOPLA IS ALL ABOUT!”
Reviews.Author: LilMizMargi
Reviews.Content: I don't know what people expect from budget hotels & I don't understand all the negative reviews! I grew up in Brooklyn and now live in Miami, Florida. My husband had never visited NYC so we extended a ministry trip to Yorktown Heights to include 3 days in Manhattan. I researched reasonably priced hotels and found The Pennsylvania. I was quite pleasantly surprised at the centrality of the location and the level of service we received. Our room was small but had been newly remodeled. The room was clean, warm and very quiet. Beds comfortable and linens clean. Heating unit worked well. Never tried the A/C as we traveled in March and it was cold and rainy. The bathroom was also small but quaint. Towels exchanged every day. When you realize the hotel dates back to the 1910's you chalk some things up to charm and go on. The lobby is HUGE and quite busy. Loads of tourists from all over the world convene there. Also available in the lobby is a business center and tour desk. Customer service was optimum and we were treated very well every time. Central location is its best feature. Across the street from Madison Square Garden & Penn Station; one block from Macy's; within walking distance to the Jacob Javits Convention Center; and about ten blocks from Times Square. Easy access to subway and if you need a cab, you can get one right out front. If you need a cab to the airport, the concierge desk will arrange it. They were also very helpful in steering us around the area. Had the weather cooperated, we would have had an amazing NYC mini vacation. Next time we return to NYC, to redo our mini vacation in good weather, we will certainly book the Pennsylvania.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!!”
Reviews.Author: Cakie123
Reviews.Content: This is the worse hotel I've ever been to. It was so bad - that myself and coworkers ended up leaving (paying for our rooms) and checking into the Hampton Inn down the street. It is not sanitary and very creepy. I wasn't concerned about bed bugs, but what else could I get from this room. Go down the street to the Hampton Inn and you will be much happier!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Believe Everything You Read”
Reviews.Author: L_Fenton
Reviews.Content: This is an old hotel, it was built in 1919 and has the original doors to prove it (which are very unusual). We took a group of 38 to this hotel and yes it was a bit run down due to years of wear and tear but it was clean and tidy. The room was cleaned every day, the bed was comfortable and clean. The shower was fine once it got going, it's best to let it run for 5 minutes before you get in and then the temperature heats up. This is a budget hotel in an excellent location. You can't expect to pay the prices charged and have 5* luxury, however, I would not hesitate in using this hotel again. The staff were friendly and very helpful. We stayed on the 8th floor (I was in 813 which was a large double). The rooms have been overpainted many times and the furniture is quirky but we all liked this. Each room has a tv, iron, hairdryer, clock radio alarm, lots of lamps and towels. If you want somewhere on a budget in Manhattan then this is it.

Reviews.Title: “New York State of Mind”
Reviews.Author: cniemec926
Reviews.Content: I have regular business in NYC and wanted to find a hotel that was reasonable in price as well as quality. I took a chance on this hotel because of the great rate and proximity to Penn Station! I was so pleasantly surprised. The hotel staff were very efficient and friendly and they gave me a free upgrade so I had a nice suite for $146. Wow! Talk about customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Our room was just fine”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer G
Reviews.Content: My mother and I syated at this hotel March 26th and 27th 2012. We took the Amtrak into Penn Station, so this hotel was extremely convenient, being right across the street! There is 3 gift shops in the lobby, two restaurants, and a coffee shop. We checked in @4:30 pm and our wait was 10 to 15 minutes. This hotel is old and worn, but it met our needs. We were in room 1541, which was fine. I have heard that the higher the floor, the better the rooms. The tv was tiny though. The bathroom was kind of charming, with a black and white checkered floor. Shampoo and soap were provided, as was a hair dryer, iron and ironing board. Housekeeping did come and clean the room, but they seemed to be kind of stingy with washcloths. I was able to hear noise from the street, but it wasn't loud enough to keep me up! I had booked through Priceline, so we paid $129/night. At that price in NYC, I can deal with older decor!

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience for many years”
Reviews.Author: SteenKR
Reviews.Content: From the beginning Hotel Pennsylvania disqualified itself by (in the rudest possible way) demanding 4 dollars per suitcase for holding them for one hour. (The room wasn't ready so we had to pay extra.) That is more or less the quality of service for this hotel. Rude staff who is absolutely unwilling to help let alone send you a smile seems to be company culture. We don't expect that to change, sorry. (And we are positive people who always meet people with a smile. Only one receptionist returned that gesture and did what he could for us. As you will know from other reviews the hotel is quite run down. Rooms are dark brown with insufficient lighting and not in any way renewed for decades. Off course there was neither fan nor air condition in the room. The socalled business lounge contains of two coffee machines, two computers of old age and generally old fashioned cafe furniture. The carpet was totally worn down. The two computers was at all times occupied by kids and young people who used them for Facebook for hours. The hotel doesn't seem to care for the travellers using mobile devices as smart phones or iPads. The only way to get your own device online was by cable in the room at USD 11 plus taxes. And we even paid extra for free wifi and a superior room! This had been confirmed twice to our travel agent thus making us choose HP because of the location. Breakfast is served in the socalled business lounge and consists of rolls, croissants, jam and coffee plus a watery orange cordial. No yogurt, no fruit, no juice, no milk, no cheese, no meat - nothing but rolls, jam, thin cordial and coffee. We even got a "special deal" paying 208 per night for a double. Or ... no ... perhaps we didn't. Because when we arrived we were told that the rate differed from day to day ending at 262 dollars per night. Plus taxes of course. And this was late March 2012 implying low season. Wonder how much they're gonna charge you in July? NEVER get anywhere near Hotel Pennsylvania.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect much, but for the money paid this is a good deal”
Reviews.Author: HaifaMiu
Reviews.Content: Very good location, right next to the Madison Square Garden. Near to the center and shopping all within 10-20 minutes walk. Rooms are in bad condition, but i did not observed any bed bugs as claimed by other reviewers. Deal i got was very cheap, included continental snack for breakfast and even ticket to fairy boat to see the statue view. Would not recommend for families, but for a short stop it is just ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you don't mind filthy, dingy, smelly room”
Reviews.Author: NancySantaCruz_CA
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a conference that took place in the Hotel Pennsylvania. I got a great price ($119) considering the location and figured if the conference was happening there it would be fine. WRONG. The room was really horrible. The rug and bedspread looked as if they hadn't been updated in 25 years and maybe not even washed or shampooed in all that time. The bathroom was ugly but not too scary because the smell of bleach was so strong I knew nothing too bad could survive there. (I got a headache from the fumes, though.) The walls were dirty and the room so dark it would have been depressing even if it had been clean. I checked the sheets for bedbugs and they were clean, but I was still worried. In the end, I survived the two nights without getting bedbugs or any other disease I know of, and the location really is fantastic. If you must stay here, bring slippers because you won't want your feet touching the floor, don't spend any more time in your room than you have to, and keep your expectations low. If you pay very little, you will get what you pay for!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Center of Manhattan at a Bargain Price”
Reviews.Author: James H
Reviews.Content: A tourist hotel, this very busy and crowded hotel is frequented by groups, the young, the foreign tourists on a budget. It has few amenities (no place to eat a regular meal) and there is usually a long checkin line. An older building, it is hardly antiseptic and often could use paint. That said: it is across the street from Penn Station, atop four subway lines, one short block from the original Macy's, surrounded by city bus lines, in the midst of any number of moderate cafes, a few blocks from the Empire State Building. Easily catch a bus to the United Nations. Walk 10 short blocks to Times Square theater district. Catch a bus to the Metropolitan Museum of Art. It does have a concierge who can book tours, restaurants, and get tickets to whatever. This is the heart of uptown Manhatten. You can train from Newark airport to Penn Station. You can walk a few blocks to Grand Central Station. And on and on. For a family on a budget, for anyone interested in the sights of Manhatten more that elegance in a hotel, this is a great place to check out. I have stayed here numerous times, and continue to feel that I am getting a real bargain for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for visiting New York”
Reviews.Author: Paul K
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights over St. Patricks weekend with a large group. After reading the previous reviews I was unsure as to how the rooms may look. They are basic but comfortable. I slept well everynight and there was always hot water to shower with. The hotel staff were all friendly and they kept the room clean. Always plenty of towels layed out. This is a perfect base for setting out to see NY and I can't fault it too much. If you plan on staying in your room all the time then why are you in NY?? Only gripe was that there was no WiFi in the rooms! Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just home”
Reviews.Author: gliss
Reviews.Content: We were dreading this hotel after reading some of the reviews here. We stayed on the second floor in a very large room. The furniture is old and wobbly but the beds are comfy with clean linens and towels every day. Bathroom was spotless. I ran my hand over the inside of the windows and there was no dust at all, so despite all the dust on the outside, she still cleans the inside. Problem is, the fabric of the building is tired and needs decorating. So no matter how clean the place is, it never looks any better. It has been a really grand hotel in its day (go and look at the history on the 18th floor). Staff are very friendly and helpful and the check in is busy nearly all day. Clearly this place is still very popular and that is due to the location and price. Lots of Americans were staying there also and quite a few conferences going on as well. With the recession, this will continue.

Reviews.Title: “Omg. Run as fast as you can AWAY”
Reviews.Author: churdles
Reviews.Content: By far the worst hotel I ever ALMOST stayed in. We checked in in a fairly nice lobby and then proceeded to go to the room. All the doors looked worn and had paint falling off. First clue. There were people pounding on doors Second clue. There was the smell. Third clue. Then the cu-de-grace the room!!!! Where to start? The carpet that hadn't been cleaned maybe ever? The bed that sagged worse than a 20 year old horse? The feeling that bugs were climbing up your back as you stood there? Or the creepy door that led off to some unknown room with an adjoining door without a lock? Safe to say we got out of there pronto. The girl at the front desk was very non chellant about canceling the booking. Like she knew it would happen or has happened many times before. If I could rate this -1 I would.

Reviews.Title: “very reasonable hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: john s
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 3 friends during shore leave in New York. we booked this hotel as it was very reasonable priced, and ideally located. The reception area in huge, and check in is very straight forward. There is a small gift shop and a small bar selling basic meals. The bar shows sports and has very friendly staff. The rooms are average, clean and basic. The hotel is dead opposite maddison square gardens, and is a short walk from almost anything you could want. If I ever returned to New York, I would certainly look to book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrific!!!”
Reviews.Author: wsheldon518
Reviews.Content: This scam of a hotel took $240 off my credit card without telling me they were going to do it. When I noticed that the money was missing and called, they said it was in case I watched any movies. First they told me I would get my moneyback after 5 to 10 days, then they said 7 to 10 days. Apparently, the desk clerk was supposed to inform me they were taking the money. He did not! The rooms are dingy, my sheets were filthy and looked like they hadn't been washed, the bed was hard as a board. I will never, ever stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: maddiescoots
Reviews.Content: I just recently returned from staying at the Hotel Pennsylvania New York. I was concerned about staying here after reading some of the reviews but we met a nice gentleman on the plane who asked where we were staying and when I told him he said "that is a very nice hotel" I asked if he was sure because some of the reviews were a little sketchy. He commented that I shouldn't read reviews. When we arrived I was pleasantly surprised as the lobby area was nice and grand. That wore off pretty quick after it took 45 minutes to check in. Upon checking in we were told that even though we had reserved a King size room there were none available and would be given a double instead. I asked if there would be a price reduction and was told that since I had prepaid there was nothing that could be done about the price. It was late and I was tired so I just let it go. The clerk then said that we could look into changing to a king size room the next day. As we proceeded to get to our room I saw what others had mentioned in their reviews. The hotel has not been updated and the carpet and walls were dingy. As we opened the room I was disappointed. The walls had paint peeling and the bathroom had not been serviced. I called the front desk to mention about the bathroom and the person on the other end of the line seemed bothered. After 1 hour maintance finally took care of one problem. When I requested housekeeping I felt that I was a bother but was told they would be right over. Needless to say they never appeared that night. I was so distrubed that I slept in my clothes. The next day housekeeping did come but my request to change to a king room was once again denied. It was finally on my third night my request to change to a king room (the one I had reserved) was granted. I will say that the king room was in much better shape than the double room we had been staying in. The walls are very thin and you can hear everything. Now the positive thing about the hotel is it's location. It is located in Midtown Manhattan and is right next to the subway. There were always people and police officers around so I always felt safe. Would I stay there again? Probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but fulfils needs!”
Reviews.Author: the-wandering-ginger
Reviews.Content: Very dingy place, corridors reminded me of something out of a horror movie! Very basic but had big rooms, and beds were comfy. Brilliant location, staff were nice and friendly. Has it's very own Central Perk cafe! Nothing fancy, would stay here for price and location and nothing much else!

Reviews.Title: “Dingy”
Reviews.Author: PamandSam
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference. The conference facilities were fine but the hotel rooms were dank and dingy. Broken tiles in bathroom. Not enough blankets. No wake-up service. I met others at the conference that stayed a few blocks away and walked over. I would do the same next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice on the outside, not so much on the inside”
Reviews.Author: Beachkat9
Reviews.Content: I take a group of students to NYC every year for a conference and we stay at the Hotel Pennsylvania every time. Why? Because our school will only let us stay at the place with the lowest bid and Hotel Penn always has the lowest bid. It is doable. There were no bed bugs on any occasion, but the rooms are old and in need of repairs. Our room this year smelled terribly of smoke, the AC and fan were broken, the bathroom door didn't close and there was jackhammering outside our window from midnight until 2AM every morning. The sheets were clean and the towels looked clean, but didn't smell super fresh. If I had a choice to go somewhere else I would, but given the situation the Hotel Penn isn't so bad that I won't go back again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Basic rooms, but good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Faye827
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews after booking this hotel I was very nervous about staying here and expecting the worst. Upon checking in I found the staff to be very friendly and helpful, arriving in the room we found it to be very clean, although the decor is dated and could do with being re decorated. The room was basic but had everything we needed, the room was cleaned and we had clean towels every day. The location of this hotel was excellent and for the price we paid we were very happy. We had a great time in New York and if we return will not hesitate to stay here again

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL IN NYC”
Reviews.Author: Mark N
Reviews.Content: We proceeded out of penn station to this good looking hotel. From the second we walked in the lights all dimmed, and huge lineup. We get the room and go up the old, old, old elevator and to our suprise the hallways look like the gates of hell. The numbers on the doors are all falling off. We get in the room and the carpet is almost half gone. Theres stains on the mattresses. The toilet is broken, the tub is missing half the bottom and the chairs are half gone. Terrible just terrible

Reviews.Title: “Don't even think about it!!!”
Reviews.Author: PjtSzaro
Reviews.Content: Awful - just awful! Carpets stained and disgusting! Bedding YEARS old!!! Tiles broken and tub all chipped. Walls all smudged. Curtains covered in dirt and dust. I have pics to prove it! Pay more and stay somewhere else. Management didn't care!

Reviews.Title: “No so bad Hotel, whit excellente location”
Reviews.Author: juliuxagain
Reviews.Content: A very good location in NYC. I read alot of bad reviwe about this hotel, but everyone has a differet way to think. When i visit a new city I would like to see everything on this, so the hotel is just for bedtime and take a shower. The Pennsylvania Hotel have a great location to explore NYC and more, whit the PennStation just cross street, subway station a few steps and more. Enjoy this great city wlaking arround, taking the subway or in a city tour, all this you can do it very fast and easy due the location of the hotel. For me one of the most important in a vacation travel. The room is not the best, so simple whit a bed, tv, badroom and a closet....enoght for me the bed was soft not the softest bed in the world but.....good for a good sleep. The badroom very simple to, whit hot water...very important So, if you want to visit NYC and all arround and the hotel is not the most important on your travel issues..this is the best option

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe all the bad reviews that you read”
Reviews.Author: Alana M
Reviews.Content: I found my stay in the hotel last week a really great experience. The location could not of been any better it was so central to everything in New York. It was cheap and a bargain in my opinion. it was cleaned every day and the bed made. fresh towels and the bins were emptied. i dont know what people want when you are only spending the amount of money that we did but i would recommend it and would definitely stay there again. if you want luxury then spend the money and get luxury. at the end of the day you are in the city that never sleeps it was ideal and comfy to sleep in and somewhere to shower. you do not go to new york to sit in the hotel room. it does not deserve any of the bad reviews that it got and i myself was a bit worried about staying there after reading the reviews. i am very glad that i didnt take them seriously and went to see for myself.

Reviews.Title: “Cancelled reservation - AND THEY STILL CHARGED ME”
Reviews.Author: Luv2SkiTahoe
Reviews.Content: After reading the scathing reviews from our fellows on Tripadvisor, I called to cancel my reservation for late February. Again, worried about all the issues regarding this hotel, I actually wrote down the cancellation confirmation number and name of the reservation agent. Of course, on my next AMEX statement is the room charge from the hotel. When I called the accounting department at the hotel to give them my cancellation confirmation number, I was told I had to write an email explaining "my error" and why they should refund the charge. I requested and received the hotel manager, who basically told me there was nothing she could do. I told her I would be contacting AMEX to resolve the issue and instead take my time providing my scathing review of her hotel WHERE I DID NOT EVEN STAY! I am personally amazed based on the negative reviews at this hotel that it even stays in business.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: Fatma A Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel 3 times. i like it and find it very convenient for my business. its clean and they change the beddings every day my only problem is the fact that i cannot negotiation my check out time due to the relationship between guests and staff being impersonnal because i guess of the hotel size

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bad everything else”
Reviews.Author: Patrick M
Reviews.Content: I never go to the trouble of giving bad reviews to hotels, restaurants, bars, etc. However, in the case of Hotel Pennsylvania, I'm more than willing to make an exception. This place was/is an absolute dump. I understand the appeal of an historic hotel in NYC, but I have no tolerance for old, ratty linens, dirty bathrooms, non-working lights, missing amenities (i.e. ironing board), and just a general lack of being with the times. The room was $120 for one night, which, by NYC standards, is cheap. Holiday Inn Express was the exact same price, and I wish I had gone with them instead of Hotel Pennsylvania. I'm not what anyone would call a frequent traveler, so any hotel losing my business is far from an issue for them. However, I hope I can influence anyone else that is even considering this place. If you enjoy staying at any hotel with modern amenities and acceptable upkeep/cleanliness, DO NOT stay at the Hotel Pennsylvania. Consider yourselves forewarned :)

Reviews.Title: “VILE!”
Reviews.Author: Cathy F
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 2 years ago and have never got over it. Having visited NY last month, staying in the superb Hotel Park South I felt compelled to write a review. This hotel is atrocious, the staff are rude, aggressive and totally disorganised. The rooms were disgusting, upon arrival we were faced with dirty, unmade beds, filthy carpets, wet used towels heaped on the floor and as for the bathroom, dont go there, urghh! How they get away with it I dont know, the management should be ashamed of themselves. Oh, I nearly forgot to add that the Westminster Dog Show being held in Madison Square Gdns, hence the hotel was full of dogs and their owners, which resulted in dog wee and poo in the reception area, corridors and lifts, honestly I'm not exaggerating. Do not stay here, ever!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: tracynjones
Reviews.Content: Went on a four night trip to New York all I can say is WOW! This hotel is not the Ritz, however, it is comfortable excellent location. I read reviews on trip advisor and was having second thoughts and was feeling a little nervous about my choice of hotel..we started our trip from Manchester Airport and went to Chicago and caught the connecting flight to Newark airport, we took a train straight through to Penn station which is3 stops from Newark Airport and exits facing the hotel. We checked in really quickly and went to our room..first impressions of the lobbys in the hotel was dark and miserable, the room was dated but comfortable. We had clean linen and towels daily, the room had an iron and ironing board, hairdryer and a tv..shampoo and soap was also supplied all you need is to turn up with your luggage! I would recommend the hotel to anyone who needs a basic base in New York! The hotel is very central Madison Square Garden across the road,turn right out of the hotel for a 15minute walk to broadway and times square, about 1 hour walk to central park. turn left out the hotel for about 1hour 10 min walk to groung zero, wall street and a little further walk to staton island ferry to see the statue of liberty.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location but not the cleanest!”
Reviews.Author: MrsSparrow2011
Reviews.Content: We arrived very early hours of the morning and had to queue for over an hour to check in! We'd been up nearly 24 hours at this point so were pretty shattered! We got to our room and it was cold, dingy and dated. It had clearly had a leak at some point as you could see all the damp on the ceiling. The bathroom wasnt clean and there was blood on the wall. The carpets hadn't been hoovered either. At this point we were exhausted and the queue was still huge downstairs so we slept and went down first thing to complain. To be fair to the hotel there was no quibble, I think they must be used to it!! They upgraded us immediately to a suite overlooking Madison square garden which was fine. The bathroom was still dated but clean. The purpose of the trip was to celebrate my father in laws 60th. Prior to the visit I wrote to the hotel explaining and on arrival they were upgraded to a lovely, more modern suite overlook the empire state. The hotel is ideally located. A few minutes walk to times square and the empire state. Opposite Maddison square garden and penn station. At the end of the day we wanted to be out enjoying NYC not sat in a hotel so it was fine. Pick this hotel if you want cheap, easy location and not too worried about modern fancy rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but convenient and clean”
Reviews.Author: Ladydi6
Reviews.Content: Came into Penn station from Boston and were searching for a hotel overnight to catch an AM train to Montreal. The property is old, built at the beginning of the last century, but clean and the restaurant/steakhouse was great. Double bed- which wouldn't suit everyone - but we were fine. Good value for a very low price!

Reviews.Title: “Old style beauty”
Reviews.Author: watvy
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location , within walking distance to everything. Restaurants in hotel a little pricey. Very nice customer service. Stay positive and you will have an amazing stay at the hotel. Only criticism is the batroom being small. I would stay here again !

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: ka1ueh
Reviews.Content: We were looking for an inexpensive place to stay near Penn Station, as we travelled to NY on Amtrak. I read the reviews after making my reservation and was VERY nervous. It was a pleasant surprise to find a clean, comfortable room on the 10th floor. I am an RN so cleanliness is very important to me :-) No odors, no bugs, no garbage! It was a bit shabby but very clean and fresh. Plenty of hot water and linens. All the staff we met were very courteous. We had a clean, comfortable room-that was all we needed. Great value for the cost and I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: mikeswuk
Reviews.Content: I spent a week in the hotel. The room was large and clean, house staff were efficient and friendly and the central location can be useful, halfway between Greenwich Village and Times Square. The style is faded chic, and i enjoyed my stay. Check-in was very long, and there are lines for both checking in and out. The area is not good for good evening food, although you can find places if you look hard enough - best get a 7 day metro card and travel around. All in all, good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Am I the only one who enjoyed my stay?”
Reviews.Author: Mercedes69
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my (adult) daughter November 2011 for 7nights...yes a whole 7 nights 8 days!!!! I booked through expedia.com and it was pretty much the cheapest option with flights etc for our requirements to stay in New York city. Never having been before I chose it for its price primarily, then location...flying into Newark Airport it was a 30 minute train ride away to Penn Station (New York not Newark!!! That was my mantra...). I did indeed read all the reviews before travelling and after booking and oh dear I was petrified. I contemplated booking elsewhere but was talked out of it...thank God. First of all the location is great which seems to be universally agreed...and it couldn't be better for a first timer to the city. Easy access from the airport, cheap train fare...out of Penn station and straight across the road to the hotel. No need for taxis, buses etc... It's 10 minutes from Times Square walking and well basically central to everywhere...perfect. The hotel check-in took about 45 minutes yes...but we checked in at 3pm ( check-in time ) and so it was expected to be busy as its a huge hotel. Yes we were tired and amazingly hot (temperatures were unseasonably warm ) but you know it has to be done so why moan about it???? On our way out an hour or so later there was no queue whatsoever! The lifts are plenty and always available quickly.... the long hallways are a step back in time with the art deco doors but it's history folks....does it matter? Our room smelt very clean on entering and I was pleased to see it was FINE!!!!!! The carpet felt clean as it could be and I had no problems walking BAREFOOT... The sheets were spotless, crisply laundered and the bed was comfy....I shared with my slim daughter (I'm not so slim) and it was ample big enough. We both slept soundly and comfortably. The sheets appeared to be changed every day of our stay...they were fresh as a daisy and the sharp ironing creases definitely looked new each day. The bathroom was clean as a whistle...yes it had mould on the ceiling and the bath enamel had come away around the plug hole but OH MY WORD does this matter???? We paid peanuts and we weren't staying in the PLAZA after all.... The furniture was dated, the view not great but again I'm not sitting in my room all day...if thats what you do in New York then stay elsewhere. WIFI.....oh heavens above the complaints I see in the reviews about it being expensive and not in the rooms blah blah....then book a hotel that has it!!!!!! Otherwise walk out of the main entrance, turn left....walk across the road at the crossing...keep going for about 30 seconds and enter a nice, warm and comfy Starbucks...order a coffee ( or tea...very nice. If you want a good English tea ask for black tea/ or breakfast tea and put in your own milk etc...as good as PG tips ). Yep it costs a couple of dollars but you can sit there to your hearts content as we did every morning. Or there is McDonalds a few seconds away...or Macy's....in fact you can pretty much get internet access anywhere. We only had two dealing with reception, check-in and check out. No problems...not rude, not anything. But then....erm....we aren't rude either! The cleaning ladies said hello whenever we saw them and we politely said hello back. We kept our room tidy ( we even left valuables and they didn't get pinched! Wow) and we got a great service back from them. All in all there was no smells, not dirty (old and dated agreed), very comfortable, convenient and a perfectly fine place to sleep for a perfectly decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: AndyJK981
Reviews.Content: Hallways are old an dirty and smell odd, perhaps some pesticide or mold. Room dirty, bathtub was missing some coating. Paint in was old and had cracks. Bed linen make me and my wife itchy.

Reviews.Title: “Location only good thing”
Reviews.Author: ianryanjaz
Reviews.Content: Location great otherwise you a a complete burden for the hotel and its staff . Took ages to check in about 40 min queue . Staff typical NY rude , rooms VERY basic and not that clean , desperate to be made over .

Reviews.Title: “Websites a bit deceptive!”
Reviews.Author: Jeff P
Reviews.Content: The website made it seem the hotel was much nicer than they are, don't be fooled like we were! We had mold growing all over the back of our bathroom door....not good! THe pillows were rocks, I hade to go and buy some for our stay. The cleaning wtaff was really nice though! We won't stay here again, however we did save a lot of money on lodging on this trip!

Reviews.Title: “Twin rooms not tripples”
Reviews.Author: jasonbevan
Reviews.Content: When booking a group trip to the hotel Penn I was not put off by the bad reviews on this site as I knew students not want to be 'told off' for being noisy or up late.However there were far more worrying things happening than just nasty rooms. We were met by the Bell Captain on arribal who had all our keys ready, which was very appreciated. On inspection of the rooms however we had been allocated 18 twin rooms and 4 single rooms but booked 9 tripples, 9 twins and 4 singles. We needed accommodation for 9 extra people! I returned to the reception, spoke to the manager to sort this out. She informed me that they were going to put ‘cots’ in 9 of the twin rooms. This was just not acceptable as once this started to happen it was very evident the rooms were simply not big enough to fit extra beds in and still have floor space. One room looked as it it had one massive bed covering the whole floor. I returned to reception and told them this was not going to work and asked them to find us 9 tripple rooms. The hotel issued us with new rooms for 3 of those allocated on another floor but after inspection, they were the same rooms but on a different floor. I returned the keys and asked them to try again. The hotel finally managed to find 2 tripple rooms but had to squeeze the extras into the rooms we had. We still needed to find rooms for 4 students so asked the hotel if they could give us an extra two tripple rooms. They refused and said that beds were being sent up to the rooms we had. One of our lecturers had enough of this situation and gave his own room up for 2 of those students and went to find another hotel to check into. We then convinced the final 2 students to bed share with their friends in the rooms they had as it was just pointless to try and find any other solution to our problem as it was now very late in the evening and students wanted to go to bed. In a nutshell we asked for and paid for 9 tripple rooms, we eventually had 2 and the rest had to sleep in a cot or bed share. One member of staff stayed in another hotel. We did not engage with anyone from the hotel after the first evening as it was an absolute waste of our time doing so.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant suprise.”
Reviews.Author: Angela W
Reviews.Content: Stayed over new year, was a little scared before I went as read other reviews- I am not massively fussy but I want somewhere clean. (Having read some of the previous reviews I took slippers as I was scared of standing on the floor!!!) However, in my opinion it was fine. A little run down, but in a kind of charming way! Perfectly clean and functional and the location is second to none. I would definitely stay here again. They don't let you check in until 3pm but we just left our luggage in the storage area (about $4) and came back later- didn't have to queue. The lobby is lovely. May have just been very lucky given some of the other reviews but it is possible to have a nice visit to this place!

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs do well!”
Reviews.Author: KathyL909
Reviews.Content: We came home with horrible bed bug bites. The heater didn't work beacuse the outlet didn't work. The bathroom was filthy. The only good thing was the facility for the dogs during Westminister.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER WILL I STAY HERE AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: Chela v
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights with some friends and....IT WAS HORRIBLE! As I was checking in a woman came down with pictures in her cell to show the staff how dirty her room was. That should've been my first sign to leave! We checked in and entered our room, there was hair on our pillows and dust everywhere. We cleaned up and asked for extra pillow cases. My friend called for towels and we NEVER received them. Later on that night, the room (1153) was FREEZING and we spent the night with no heat. The next morning I went down to the front desk to complain and I was told that I needed to wait until 1pm to change rooms. I explained to the staff that it was an inconvenience for us because we shouldn't have to pay all this money to stay in a room with no heat then be told that we need to wait more than 3 hours for the room to be changed. Eventually our room was changed to 603...the bathroom was DISGUSTING with the exception of the brand new toilet...I have pictures of the bathroom in 603. SMH...Oh yeah, this room had no heat neither!..NEVER AGAIN WILL I STAY AT THIS HOTEL! You are basically paying for the location, but it is FILTHY.

Reviews.Title: “Great prices, horribly maintained”
Reviews.Author: Alf113
Reviews.Content: This hotel has always been "old" but in the past an OK place to stay. My last visit was nothing but a nightmare. It took two room changes to at least find one that wasn't filthy dirty and in some reasonable degree of order.And that only happened after two arguments with the concierge. The location is just wonderful in the city. The prices are very affordable but the hotel is so miserably maintained that it is very close to being condemned in my opinion. For the price one does not expect the Hilton but for heavens sake please keep the rooms, the furniture, bathrooms and linens clean.

Reviews.Title: “Tired,Dull, Old, Tatty”
Reviews.Author: Adrian1966
Reviews.Content: Ok lets start with a few positives....its close to Madison Square Gardens, its not too far from Time Square, the Empire state Building is close too. Now for the rest............. Rude reception staff. Tired, dull, old Tatty everything. Dim lite walkways. Expensive WIFI Expensive food No room safes,though the hotel has a (limited) number of safe deposit boxes in a room by reception. So to conclude: No it was not THE worst place I`ve ever stayed in but its close. I would not say "dont ever stay there" but I would recomend a long long search for alternatives first.

Reviews.Title: “Panties in the bed! Nasty Nasty Nasty!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cook4815
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel I have ever been to! We checked in Knowing this place was not the Hilton, but we thought at least the room would be clean. The staff at the front desk were very rude and nasty with us from check in. We then went to our room and noticed that the lock was broken on our door. We called the front desk to ask if we could move to another room but were told that none were available. The manager advised us that they would repair it in the morning. A little later that evening we decided to go to bed I noticed a pubic hair on the sheets. I then moved all of the covers and found a pair of woman's black panties in the bed! The panties put us over the top. We went to the front desk and demanded a refund. Only after they saw the picture on our phone of the panties would they check us out without penalty! Never stay here. It is a filthy hotel. I think the homeless shelter would be better than this dump! I don't think this place deserves 1 star but a 0 is not an option!

Reviews.Title: “dont b fooled...”
Reviews.Author: Missmomof3
Reviews.Content: omg where 2 even start..this is the dumpiest hotel i have ever been in in my entire life..i brought my 3 daughters here 4 a family vacation hoping 4 some relaxing yet entertaining fun..we couldnt relax cus the room was so disgusting we didnt even wanna sleep on the beds let alone use the restroom..there was drink or food spatterd all over the walls the curtains or bedding hadnt been washed in i dont know how long..the carpet was filty n cobwebs all over..i complete dump..i felt cleaner out in the city then i did in the room..n the staff omg how RUDE!! n these ppl r supposed 2 b professionals i tell u there was professionalism what so ever..the receptionist was a complete b*tch..the housekeepers were just as bad..the only thing this hotel has goin 4 it is the lobby area that is nice but plz dont b fooled they share it with alot of other companies that r down in that part but as soon as u hit those elevators its all gone n ur on ur way 2 HELL..if ur taking the trains its nice cus its just a matter of a few steps from there n that was the reason we took this hotel..plz walk a lil farther n get something nice its worth it trust me as i wish i had...n 2 top it all off my daughters ipod was stolen from our room n nobody would do anything bout it...so there is nothin good bout this place save ur $$ n the aggravation ur gettin get from here n book somewhere else...

Reviews.Title: “Dump in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: JSES
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. Antiquated rooms, poor service, expensive Internet with wireless only available in lobby. No plug ins for electronics, felt like a firetrap. I have read that there are plans to demolish it, needs to happen! Would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “"this hotel is a zoo"”
Reviews.Author: Pepper2429
Reviews.Content: BEST location, right opposite Penn Station & subway, less than 10 blocks away from Times Square, & plenty of shops & restaurants all around. However... our room was SO dark & dingy & the window view looked out into other hotel rooms so you always had to keep your curtains shut to avoid peeping toms peering into our room. The room was SO small, limited space in the wardrobe for 2 people, there was a chair but with no dressing table. The beds had only 1 flimsy pillow each, the walls were dirty, peeling & actually covered in squashed bugs, & the ceiling had mould growing all over. In the bathroom, there was more mould on the ceiling, the bath was dirty & all cracked, you had to let the water run for over 10mins before it became hot & it literally was either scolding hot OR cold, no warm water, & the vent was out of use & covered up by a plastic bag. There was no safety deposit box in the room so we had to keep our personal expensive items in the safety deposit room all the way down in the lobby which was so inconvenient. Also no free wifi, the charge to use the wifi service in the hotel was so expensive so we would have to take our laptop down the road & sit in McDonalds to get free access. The amount you pay for the hotel you would expect to get free internet service included. Ridiculous. What really let the hotel down during our stay was a Dog show they had on. We wouldn't have cared as we love dogs, but we weren't told this event was going on. They let all the dogs stay with the owners in the hotel rooms & the room next to ours had this small yappy dog which barked ALL night long & because the walls were so thin it was really loud. Also opposite our room was a stage door which all the dog owners would access & I was woken up at 5am by an owner training his dog yelling comands "stay" "sit" which continued for over an hour. Not only this but the whole hotel STANK of dogs, not want you expect at a "decent" New York hotel. Was like living in a zoo. Me & my friend complained about our terrible night due to these dogs & the staff were so rude & non-understanding. They refused to do anything about the situation, & refused to give us a refund so we could relocate hotels. So I asked to speak to the manager who could only move us the following night as they claimed they were "fully booked". The staff didn't seem to care about their normal guests & all attention went to the dog owners. I refuse to ever stay there again as it was a terrible experience. I had stayed at the DAYS INN HOTEL on 94th Street the week before & just really wish I stayed there for my whole trip. I do not recommend the Pennsylvania Hotel & would totally recommend the Days Inn Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't get much worse”
Reviews.Author: afliesaway
Reviews.Content: Location is good, but that's all. No cooling on warm fall or winter days, have to open the screen less window. Dirty, nasty, circle of hell.

Reviews.Title: “Should be condemned...”
Reviews.Author: Alison C
Reviews.Content: The lobby is deceptive and makes you think the hotel might be okay, but it's NOT. Checked into a room that had a used chapstick container and m&m's on the floor. The water was brown when we turned on the shower and would not drain. The paint was peeling off the walls in the room and in the hallways. All the hallways and elevators were filthy and looked like they hadn't seen a vacuum in years. Called the front desk and they were extremely rude, interrupted me on the phone and said they 'would send up a bellman to move our room.' No one ever came. After an hour we called the front desk again and got hung up on. FInally we went down to the lobby and the front desk clerk gave us a new room. This room was equally as dingy. The water this time would alternate between scalding and frigid no matter what you sent the temperature at. You couldn't even shower. And to make things worse, they tried to charge us twice as much for this room because it was 'PEN 5000.' So if you want a dingy double bed, unregulated water temperatures and garbage, and front desk staff that yell at you, book here. It was so bad we had to find another hotel for the next night. Save yourself, don't book here!

Reviews.Title: “pit of despair”
Reviews.Author: ktmBoston
Reviews.Content: This hotel has one thing going for it, it is across from Madison Square Garden. Not sure where to start with the negatives... I guess check-in: Huge line, which is understandable since we were there for the dog show. But, once we finally reached the counter our room was not available, we'd need to wait in the line again to check in... want to leave your luggage with them? $4 a bag!!!! Oy! Once we finally got our room, it was tiny and really gross: Dirty carpets Dust basically everywhere, if you open the historic valet doors, you will find enough dust to clog any vacuum cleaner. Furniture was basically falling apart Heat either pumped out too much hot air, or was freezing, with basically no way to control the temp. Outlets were incredibly loose and often your electronics just fell out of them. Terrible pillows with no extras available. The walls were paper thin. Ice machine was not working on our floor. Ok on to the bathroom: Yuck!!!! Mold everywhere! Peeling paint and huge holes in the walls Huge stains on the marble shower was at about chin level and was so forceful it actually hurt to use it The wind from the forceful shower pulled the curtain in to the shower area so it stuck to you while bathing. This also lead to a huge amount of water on the floor of the bathroom. The temp was impossible to control and often would scald you. The tub stopper was not connected to the chain, so impossible to empty the tub. We figured that housekeeping would help with this issue, but nope, returned to find a tub filled with the same water... Had to jam a hanger in there to unstop! Basically it was nice to be able to walk to the dog show and hang with pups in the lobby. Everything else was awful!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Poor Quality Rooms”
Reviews.Author: paul_oneill2001
Reviews.Content: Just back from a stay at the Pennsylvania with a friend and have to say I'm dissapointed that the rooms are still in such a shabby state. I stayed at this hotel once before - 8 years ago, - and had hoped that by now the rooms would have been refurbished a bit. However it's still the same old worn-out carpets, bad paintwork and dusty surroundings as last time. The lobby is impresive, and there is a couple of nice places in the hotel to enjoy a drink and a meal in the evenings if you don't feel like verturing out after a long day of sightseeing. In terms of the other postives, - the hotel is in an ideal location in mid-town Manhattan, a 5-10 minutes walk from Time Square, 5 minbutes from the Empire state building, and 5 minutes walk from the main shopping streets of New York. Penn (train) Station is directly across the street, - take the red subway line No 1 for easy access to the Downtown Manhattan sites (Financial District, Ground Zero, and Battery Park, - where you board the boat for the Liberty Island and Ellis Island tours, etc.) Also, it's quite a safe area at night. Overall the hotel is good value for money for the location, - and would do the trick if you were in town for one night for a concert or something like that, - however you really know (and are made to feel by the staff) that you are in a sub-standard place. Won't be giving the Pennsylvania any more chances, I'm afraid. If I am going back to New York again I will pay a little extra for somewhere a bit more upmarket. If anyone from the Pennsylvania Management reading this - it wouldn't kill you to paint the rooms and change the carpets even once every 4 or 5 years - you're making enough money!!!!!! .

Reviews.Title: “Never choose this hotel - It really is that bad !”
Reviews.Author: Jon B
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I have travelled extensively and stayed in hotels all over the world, from 3rd world to 1st world and this is by far the worst hotel I have ever ever stayed in. It exists solely because of it's location opposite Madison Square Garden. On arrival the lobby was extremely crowded with huge queues for check in, OK I can except that, there was a major dog show happening at the garden and they had a lot to contend with, what is completely unacceptable is the surly attitude from the staff, but I could even excuse that due to the stress of the amount of dogs and people they were trying to manage. What is completely unacceptable is after leaving the lobby (which looks great) and getting out of the elevator onto my floor, finding carpets torn walls scraped, fixtures hanging off the walls, carpets stained (and I haven't even made it to my room yet). The room was small, even by NYC standards, it should have had 2 queen beds and instead we got 2 beds that were slightly smaller than a regular double. The walls had holes, the carpet had stains, everything looked and felt dirty. The sheets had cigarette burns in them. I can honestly say I have stayed in slum hotels in China and India and left feeling cleaner than staying at the Hotel Pennsylvania, I am amazed they get passed by the NYC health authority. The only thing this hotel has going for it is the location for Madison Square Garden. Take my advise, choose the Hotel Affinia one block down, it is about 1000 times better. Oh, and to the owners / manager of the Pennsylvania, why not save money on printing special room keys for dog shows and putting your name on the city maps and put that money into renovating this complete dump? If I had been showing my dog I would have walked out, because it was not fit for their paws !

Reviews.Title: “nice on outside, shame about rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mr_LJP
Reviews.Content: this hotel looks lovely on the outside, but it's interior is shabby and not befitting of a central new york hotel. bathroom had mould all over it and outside the rooms in the hallway, the paint was peeling off the walls. we were really disappointed given how nice it looks on the outside. you have to queue up for ages to be seen at the reception too, they are quite a slow hotel. however, that said, we enjoyed our trip to new york so at least that was good.

Reviews.Title: “CAUTION ** CAUTION ** CAUTION ** CAUTION ** CAUTION ** CAUTION”
Reviews.Author: Naiymah S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 days and was in 3 different rooms the last day of my stay a room attendent was cleaning and dropped my $368.00 ceramic irons the hotel was willing (haha) to pay $50.00 because they seen it on a ebay website for that price. the staff is so rude and they babrely speak english! If your looking to break your bank and be disrespected and violated then this will be the place for you! but like i said CAUTION! THE MAIDS DONT EVEN KNOCK BEFORE ENTERING YOUR ROOM!

Reviews.Title: “CHANGED ROOMS TWICE IN THREE NIGHTS BECAUSE COCKROACHS”
Reviews.Author: Angie P
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for three nights with a large party. My first experience you walk through and the lobby looked great but when you go to your rooms it's a different story the showe and bed was rotten I had to ask to move as I had stains on my bed sheets and insects in the shower I'm never a fussy person!! They moved me from 467 to 459 then I go out during the day to find three cockroaches in my bath Terrible I told the receptionist as I refused to go in there so she sent me to the top floor 14 she was very rude but I request if you come hear make sure your above level 10 but I defiantly wouldn't recommend this to any one was vile and dirty the lady admitted they always have cockroaches due to the dirtiness!! Also there was a dog show hear which I found disgusting as it said no animals and there was dogs not on leads running everywhere!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: Irina4
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near the Empire State Building and is the only positive thing. Everything else is just awful. The walls of the rooms were shabby and dirty, it was impossible to cold. Sleep was not possible because noise in the room was like on the street. Would not come back ever, that's for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate base hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: xtenkfarpl
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week in Feb 2012 with family; reason being my daughter's Vet school interviews, but an excuse for a New York trip anyway. Hotel did the job we needed: basic accommodation in a very central location (almost all major subway lines within one block, Penn station right across the street). Room was reasonably sized and not extortionate. Usual services all OK. Beds changed daily (no, there were no bedbugs: I think that's an urban myth that's sweeping the Internet)! Check-in was immediate (though we arrived at a quiet midweek/midday time; I can imagine it might get congested at other times, we did see a few crowds from time to time). Can't comment on any other services since we didn't need any. Cons to note. The bathroom shows the age of the property. It's small and not well ventilated; tends to steam up. Family members complained that the shower temperature fluctuated (I don't care, I take baths myself)! But if bathroom luxury is important to you, this is NOT the place for you. Also no in-room wifi. Not an issue on this trip, but would be a negative for business travel. Overall, I would consider staying here again on a future trip, though it would not be an immediate first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad stay”
Reviews.Author: Danielle K
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel March 2008 on a budget which is great as hotels in New york are very pricey i had read the reviews and was dreading the stay whether i was quite lucky and got an OK room i dont know but it wasnt bad very old fashioned but bakery in reception was gorgeous and staff were nice so i would reccomend it for a budget stay.

Reviews.Title: “Worse hotel ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: TheHortonsWarrington
Reviews.Content: Dirty and unkempt. Dust everywhere, air con broken (front falling off) and cracked toilet seat. Decieving from the outside and reception. But central and easy access to everywhere either on foot or subway. Would we go back to that hotel - No.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Mariida17
Reviews.Content: Spent eight nights in January 2012 and shared a room with a friend. We spent most of the time outside the room, so choosing a glamorous hotel would've been a waist of money. The furniture was a bit worn, but the room was clean. Walls are thin and you can hear some of the noise from the street (have ear plugs with you if you know that you might be disturbed by it). The radiator broke down and the temperature on it could not be changed. But after contacting the lobby they fixed it right away - took about five minutes so did not bother us. All in all, if your looking for a hotel with excellent location, clean with friendly service, yet not glamorous, this hotel is a great option. I'd definitely go again!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Pennsylvania”
Reviews.Author: lbourg1
Reviews.Content: The lobby of this hotel is beautiful. But you will soon realize that is where the beauty ends. The whole building hasn't been renovated since who knows when. The walls are paper thin. The bathrooms are old, tiny, and drafty. The carpet looks like it was laid in the 60's. It's peeling back everywhere. The walls are scuffed, old, and dirty. The location of this hotel is great. It's right across from Madison Square Garden and just a few blocks from Times Square and everything Midtown has to offer. If you are a young person coming into the city for a concert and just need a place to crash, this will do the trick. But if you are looking for a comfortable, clean hotel where you can stay for a vacation, this is NOT it.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job...price is right and so is location”
Reviews.Author: silvershakti
Reviews.Content: Having to travel to NYC frequently over the next few months for my daughter's college theater department auditions, finding an inexpensive place to stay in Manhattan that doesn't break the bank account was a challenge. I learned about this place but was very leary after reading reviews that included bed bugs, etc. I took a chance because of the good reviews and was glad I did. First tip - I initially made my reservation through bookit.com - my go-to cheap travel website but upon checking the hotel website a few days prior - found that they offered a special $10 cheaper that included breakfast. - Let me clarify that breakfast is just juice/coffee/tea and one choice of a pastry - but still - included makes all the difference. I changed my reservation to the cheaper one easily. The lobby was huge and really nice and includes a couple restaurants, souvenir shops and tvs with news channels on - and lots of couches to sit on if you arrive too early for check-in which we did. The bellboy lent us a door key so we could use the bathroom on premises. The people at check in were very nice and very helpful. Of course once heading up to our room on the 10th floor - you definitely can see the carpets need replaced but they were decent enough. Historic vault doors were cool on the rooms. The room itself of course needed an update - worn carpeting and mushy bed. But I stripped down the sheets and didn't see any evidence of bed bugs (peppery matter) - and the shower - tho also could use some work - worked - and had plenty of towels, shampoo and soap. I did have a problem with getting the shower completely turned off and called to have the problem handled. Within 5 minutes someone was at our door and I appreciated that. They easily fixed the problem (the one shower spigot needed tightened, which can happen anywhere) and left in record time. Problems don't bother me - them not being handled does. In this case, it was quickly handled so no problem. Tho I wish it felt a little cleaner - not well dusted around the edges and worn furniture, etc. - we were only there one night - so it completely did the job. The location can't be beat - right across from Madison Square Gardens and just a few blocks from times square and near a ton of shops and a mall - and the service was really great and within a block or two of several different subway stops. FYI - no internets in room - except for a fee - and they will store your luggage at $4 - but they can also include that in your room check-out invoice. Another little touch included the subway map that comes with your key. I kept mine and it has been useful on subsequent visits. I will be staying there again for another college audition - and tho not my favorite - it completely did the job!

Reviews.Title: “Some rooms not as bad as reviews”
Reviews.Author: Jcy1234
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the penn 22ND Jan for 4 nights, When I booked my trip with Expedia I paid a bit extra to upgrade to a Penn5000 room as I was told these were better, Waste of time as we were given an awful small room with only a 3/4 bed! Thankfully for me and my wife the bed was unmade, Wet towels on the floor and in a nutshell the room was a mess, It turns out the room had not been made from the last guests, So thinking she was doing me a favour the lady gave us the upgraded room I had booked in the first place! This was room 1395 and was fantastic, Super king size bed, nice size and a fantastic view of the empire states building from our window, Not a fantastic hotel but fantastic location and price not bad when compared with others, I would stay at the penn again But would book directly as not to get a bad room as if we had to have that first room we were shown then that would have spoilt our trip, It really was that bad and some of the earlier reviews are justified, Also watch the showers as ours went from nice and warm to dangerously hot! and read that of someone else's earlier review so there must be a problem, If considering Super Shuttle for your transfers then be warned we were 2+1/2hrs getting to our hotel and there was a man already on the bus and his was 3hr in total, Our driver went from terminal to terminal in JFK to do pick ups, All this time he had an ipad in his hand reading bookings from it and this made an awful journey, Our return journey went a lot better (different driver who probably had a licence) and took less than the up to 60 Min's average so I take the rough with the smooth and may use super shuttle again for the price. To recap there are better hotels in New York but for the price the location is great, Also the corridors are spooky and this is the only hotel I wouldn't leave my wife to walk down to reception alone

Reviews.Title: “Yes its not great.... but the location !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tinyb1973
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Nov 2011 for four nights, The staff checked us in even though we arrived 11 and the check in is 3 so good start. I was a bit horrified at the room, but then factored in the price we were paying and the absolutely cannot fault location ! The rooms are tired and in desperate need of a change of mattresses and bedding TV and definately heating, we were freezing, but the shower was always hot !!!!!!(I had taken disinfectant wipes having read previous reviews) the room was spacious and we had a walk in wardrobe void of more than three hangers but so what..... If you booked this for a honeymoon uh oh, but for a whistle stop see as much as you can sleep and get out again, this place is perfect as long as you can get over anything luxurious... If it offered the "normal" standard, it would be priced out of the market. Location is everything as they say, we went to see the Foo's in NJ (the whole purpose of us abandoning our families in London) the train service and subway are second to none, and you can get anywhere form Penn station opposite. Don't eat here, grab a coffee elsewhere, bring pyjamas and the beds.. well just dont look, enjoy the NY lifestyle outside of the hotel and use this as a crash pad, drink enough and you wont even notice !!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but poor service”
Reviews.Author: Peter W
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a pre-paid deal and waited 15 mins at check in to find they had no room for us due to a convention that weekend. After about 5 mins they gave us room 1778. Having trudged down long corridors we were faced with a door with paint flaking off. Inside the room was a decent size, but obviously had not been used for a while. Someone had raced up to open a window. Luckily the weather was unseasonably mild for January so we could unplug the heater that would have kept the whole of Manhattan awake all night! Paint was flaking off the walls and ceiling in the bathroom, the toilet seat was stained and the toilet got blocked on day 2 and was not dealt with by the cleaners during the day so we had to delay our departure to the theatre to wait to get it fixed. We could have complained and others on our deal did, but they lost a whole day of their holiday changing to various other rooms. Staff were not good by UK standards let alone US. It was just good luck that the weather was so good that all we needed was a reasonably clean bed. We have been to worse hotels, just can't remember when!!!

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised....”
Reviews.Author: steph N
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on recomendation from my sister and 2 friends who have all stayed there numerous times, however imade the mistake of reading the reviews on here before we went so was dreading what we were going to! How wrong i was though..... On arrival it took approx 20 mins to check in, the staff were friendly and answered all our questions and allocated our room. We booked a Penn 5000 room - which i would deffo reccomend you do as its onlya few extra £'s and you get access to the Penn Site ( a room with 2 internet PC's and tea/cofee makers, and breakfast which is just bagels and pastries but was unlimited and did the job the hot drinks were available all day, every day!) and its my understanding the rooms are bigger and slightly better than the standard rooms. (plus you get a fridge!) Our room was clean, but basic its not a 4* hotel its about a basic 3 BUT its clean and location wise cant be faulted - the showers take some working out but they do work and our shower was great, the beds were made daily, bins emptied and the rooms tidyed - what more do you want when you are only in the room overnight??? Yes the decor is dated, yes some of the rooms need updating - did it ruin my holoday NO as im not really bothered what colour the carpet is or if there is some pant flaking off a corner when im in NYC! Yes, when you come out of the lifts onto the floors there is an element of'the shining' as the halls are quite dim but also bear in mind there are 1700 rooms in the hotel, if you want a personal service then go stay in a smaller hotel. each floor has its own team of cleaners who are there most of the day every day and are lovely! Check out took less than 5 mins, we left our bags in the secure area for $4 per bag - BARGAIN and when we had to leave forthe airport we decided to make our own way there by train - Pemm station is directly opposite and for $12.50 each it took us into Newark Airport station in 25 minutes - MUCH cheaper than the taxi's or pre booked transfers and quicker as no traffic jams! The pre booked transfers will collect you 5 HOURS before your flight to allow for traffic delays, we left the hotel 3 hours before the flight and checked in trouble free. One piece of advice for UK travellers - dont take your hairdryer (save the suitcase space) as its different vaultage and yours will be naff - we had 2 in the room a crappy bathroom one but also a very good mains one. Enjoy it, and please dont be put off by the negative comments on here.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Room Ever”
Reviews.Author: michele8040
Reviews.Content: DO NOT SYAY HERE - Ever We paid through our Travel agent $430 per night for 3 people. The rooms are disgusting. Please look at the photos.

Reviews.Title: “a great deal”
Reviews.Author: jrtierney
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent the weekend in NY. We wanted a convenient inexpensive place to stay. Is that possible in NY? Yes it is - the Hotel Penn right across the street from the LIRR. (We live on Long Island).

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Pennsylvania”
Reviews.Author: paulaga
Reviews.Content: Okay, first of all this is a budget hotel. It was better than what I expected. My friend and I went to NYC for a long weekend and did not want to spend too much money on hotels. For the price, I thought the hotel was okay. Our room was clean. The room was spacious. It is definitely outdated and needs some major renovations and updating. The walls are thin and you can hear everyone around you especially our loud Italian neighbors that sounded as if they were in our room talking. But honestly, we were out all day and we just wanted a clean place to rest our heads and this was the place. The staff was friendly. The location is fantastic! It's too bad some developer doesn't buy and it and really put money into it, it could be a cash cow. Our bathroom was clean and the shower had good pressure but the cold/hot water was kind of wacky. It would start our warm and go to cold and then to scalding. That was definitely an adventure. The beds were okay and the heater worked fine. Like I said this hotel is for people that are not picky and understand that you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location for very reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: aimeeandlee
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Hotel Pennsylvania for four nights and were really happy with our stay. The hotel is situated in the ideal location, opposite Madison Square Gardens and within 10 minutes walking distance of the Empire State Building and Times Square. It is also close to the blue A line which takes you to Howard Beach station, which links you directly to JFK. The room was comfortable and was cleaned daily, with free television. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly, especially the guys in the luggage room, who were happy to help us. Overall, great hotel for a very reasonable price.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Newcastle upon Tyne, England, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the horror stories”
Reviews.Author: cocomosey
Reviews.Content: So it's a little old, a little shabby and pretty strange.... you'll see what I mean when you get there, but overall it was excellent! We went in winter and it was warm, and really spacious (we had a family room). The heater looked old and grubby but worked fine and warmed the room up really quickly. The shower was hot and really powerful (maybe too powerful!), and the beds were comfy. The bed linen, bathroom and towels were clean and room service were great. The carpet was pretty worn, the skirting boards chipped and a little shabby, but for the money, in central NY, it was PERFECT! If you want luxury, then I guess you'll have to pay for it. This place is excellent on a budget, generally clean and in a great location. The only real downside for us was no wifi in the hotel - rooms have an ethernet cable, which was useless for our kindles, iphones, ipods and notebook laptop. But hey - there's a Starbucks on every corner with free wifi, so we got over it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect city location”
Reviews.Author: BrianWorcester
Reviews.Content: My partner and I travelled to New York about a year back and could not have chosen a better location, especially from a) the cost, and b) the horror stories we've heard over the years of having to get half hour long coach trips everywhere from outside the city itself. With Times Square on the door step, and a Metro station just out of the front door, even Madison Square Garden just across the road, it truly is perfect. Rooms were modest, (and could be perhaps described as 'classic' décor wise), if difficult to find at times and smelled slightly, but we agreed for the price and location, it wasn't really a problem. Also, don't expect a quiet nights sleep here, it really is slap, bang in the middle of it all, sirens blaring, loud music playing, school parties cheering and all manner of noises, which in all honesty added to the experience rather than becoming a hindrance. The building itself is far grander than you'll find in Britain, and the beauty of the lobby will truly have your jaw hitting the floor upon first sight, it really feels like you're part of the glitz and glamour of the big Apple. All in all, great, Great! stay, would just recommend some, if minor renovation to the rooms. Though in fairness, you're not going to be in the rooms for long if you truly want to enjoy yourself in NYC. Would DEFINITELY stay again, having this place at the forefront of our mind for our next planned trip there.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: Ben G
Reviews.Content: I booked 4 rooms in mid December for 5 days. It was not cheap, total was £633 per room. Our rooms were all differant, 2 were big (one massive) and 2 very small. All 4 rooms had damp patches on walls and ceilings, very bad electrics and stains on carpets and beds. My room had a large stain which smelt of vomit. The windows were very dirty and mine woldnt shut. Not good in December. I had asked for all of our rooms to be next to each other ( had booked tis in August) however although all on 7th floor we were spread all over it. The corridors were dirty, peeling paint and damp. No wifi in he rooms, also electric sockets right above the sink, a small splash of water would have gone in it. Whilst downstairs, outside on side entrance for a smoke, I was offered sex and drugs by men and women. When I complained to the reception, they said dont smoke! I pointed out that rentboys were in the lobby and they said "we get all sorts in here". It was only when I threatened to call the police that someone went over and asked them to leave.
