They were there the next day. Man at lifts is supposed to check only guests going up in lifts, he never once asked to see our card keys. Our floor had several people wandering around at night who were clearly not guests and twice someone tried the handle to my room. This place is a rip off and filthy. Needs shutting down and refurbished from top to bottom. Staff were not rude, just ground down. All I heard was people complaining about the state of the place and the lack of security. Someone was robbed in a corridor whilst we were there. There are also homeless people sleeping in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Penn Hotel. Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: Duffman77
Reviews.Content: Loved the penn hotel in NYC. Great value for money and my partner and i will be definatley goin back in years to come. Being australian i felt more at home in NYC than i would have felt in Sydney. Thanks NYC for having us.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experince”
Reviews.Author: 09Evans2009
Reviews.Content: Very expensive, but not very clean, and staff are very rude to their customers. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. by: Linda Evans Photos: 24

Reviews.Title: “Good for shopping weekend”
Reviews.Author: NinaSProfile
Reviews.Content: Modest but always clean. Have stayed there for at least 4 times and everytime the room has been clean. And I haven't seen any bugs anywhere. :) That's a big plus. The hotel is located right where it happens / a short distance from Times Square. There's also a metro station right underneath the hotel, so you are able to get everywhere pretty easily. The hotel is suitable for a shopping weekend but I wouldn't recommend it for the honeymooners.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff”
Reviews.Author: sean B
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through their website before traveling to NYC. We were using a card with my name on it but for other reasons I would not be have the card with me when traveling. I called when making the booking to find out if this was okay. If it wasn't I would have booked using a different card. I was told by a young man over the phone that this would not be a problem. When I arrived after waiting in a long time in line I made it to the counter. I was asked for a card and when I said I told the woman at the counter what happend I was called a liar before I even got out what I was trying to say. She refused to even listen. I asked for a manager who I assumed would be upset with the attitude of her employee. After another long wait the manager came over and loudly began arguing before I could even speak. I just put the room on another card and moved on. The hotel was dirty and smelled but I didn't expect much because of the price. My main concern was due to the complete lack of civility from the staff. I hope this issue is addressed immediately, this was the worst customer service experience I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: 265tomc
Reviews.Content: I was a touch worried about staying here after reading some of the reviews on this site, bed bugs etc. We arrived, and on first impressions the hotel and its lobby are very impressive. At first glimpse the rooms are very dated. Paint peeling off bathroom walls, dated paint work, broken lamps. But as somewhere to lay your hat in NYC, it is more than adequate. NYC is not somewhere you spend time in your hotel room except to sleep and shower. Its not the Waldorf-Astoria, its not the Plaza, but as somewhere to catch 40 winks inbetween checking out NYC, its perfect/

Reviews.Title: “Its fine, really!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth W
Reviews.Content: Take no notice of the bad reviews here, this hotel is fine. We stayed for 6 nights and had a great time. Check in was about 5 mins long, check out less than a minute. The staff were very helpful and polite at all times. The room was clean, I pulled the bed apart and the mattress looked new, sheets pristine every night, super clean towels every day. Yes it is a little dark, but hey just put on the light doh!!! The hotel is aging and yes could do with a refurb but all in all its perfect, location is excellent, when you're in NYC you will spend as little time as possible in your hotel anyways. Honestly peoples this hotel is perfectly fine.

Reviews.Title: “As Bette Davis once said....”
Reviews.Author: yorkieman8
Reviews.Content: On the key cards for the rooms, The Hotel Pennsylvania, which sits on Seventh Avenue, and opposite the Penn Station, proclaims itself as "The World's Most Popular Hotel" (their capitals). This description wantonly flies in the face of the British Trades Descriptions Act. It is certainly busy, a place where visitors will flock, because it is in the bargain bucket range of establishments. That does not mean that the place has to be scruffy - which it is - dirty (it is the only hotel in which I have stayed in nearly fifty years of travel where there have been piles of litter in the corridors) and generally unloved and unkepmt. Built in the 1920's and fabled in the hit song by Glenn Miller (Pensylvannia 6-5000 is the hotel's telephone number) it has seen far, far better times. As Miss Bette Davis once neatly observed, "what A DUMP!" The vast lobby is unwelcoming and austere - as was the woman on the front desk (you wait in a long queue and no apologies are offered or smiles given) who was clearly trying out for the title of Ice Queen of 2012. The corridor on the 15th floor was bestrewn with discarded pizza boxes, and beverage holders, and a few used tissues. The walls are grubby and smeared with paint marks (is someone actually going to do some decorating?) and my room had chipped and ancient furniture and a bathroom in which you could, with some difficulty, swing a mouse. The bed linen was clean, however, and there was a view of the Empire State Building from the window, one of the few good things to say about this truly ghastly experience. Returning from a dinner with frinds, a homeless man had installed himself on a bench in the lobby, and was snoozing with his drink propped between his knees. We only spent one nIght in this sad shadow of a hotel - if someone was able to spend a good few million on it, close it down to refurbish from top to bottom, and then re-open it after a through restoration project, the Penn might, just might, be worth a visit. As it is, it is a clasic monument on how not to run a hotel. What makes one shivver is that the Penn is a historic building, a riot of art deco style - but clearly no-one in charge loves it or respects it. It is one step up from a doss house.... and, if you want to see what a few dollars will do, walk around the block to Eighth Avenue, and discover the re-modelled New Yorker, which is everything that a tourist's hotel should be - kindly and attentive staff, a great little cocktail bar off the lobby, clean and modern rooms, efficient service. WHAT a difference - the New Yorker was also a child of the 1920's, but this has been embraced and cleverly enhanced. Every detail is spot on. And I know which place I'll be going back to!

Reviews.Title: “Price + location = perfect”
Reviews.Author: Nina1985
Reviews.Content: The lobby of the hotel is really nice and you get a good impression. When you approach the rooms, you will most likely be disappointed. While my friends' room had a really nice bathroom, mine wasn't. Without flipflops, I wouldn't have dared to take a shower. But for a couple of days, it was ok. Otherwise, the room was clean. The location is the best thing about the Pennsylvania. It is located next to the Madison Square Garden and quite close to the Empire State Building. Although it might not be worth 2 stars, I would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, dated and in need of some updating”
Reviews.Author: Mich67
Reviews.Content: It's a bit of a double edged sword when you find an old hotel with all of the interesting and fascinating features of an age gone by which offers a museum like experience in itself, one which is sitting right opposite Maddison Square Garden (priceless on a game night) and opposite Penn Station (priceless if your sleeper train pulled in after an over night trip from Orlando), where Macy's is right outside your window and a whole range of eateries are on the doorstep, a couple of minutes walk from Times Square and the Empire State Building right around the corner... and then you get to your room to find that it's rather delapidated and in need of some TLC and certainly nothing to write home about or what you'd have chosen had you stayed there previously. But then you think about the $94 dollars you paid for the night for three people, the beds that are far from the comfiest you're experienced but provide somewhere to lie your head for the night, lighting that works but is very dim,(perhaps on purpose) decor that really could benefit from some brightening up, carpets that need replacing... but then you find a large roll top bath with a wobbly but serviceable basin and nice clean fluffy towels an ironing board and iron hair dryer and some fab TV stations as standard and you kind of get an acceptable night. The hotel is huge, with I believe over a thousand rooms, it's an impressive building and the staff were great, letting us check in at 11am. In hotel facilities were good and meant if you were using this as a stop over you didn't need to go anywhere else if you didn't want to. The lobby is impressive and the business centre which you use on pay as you go rechargeable cards was really good and efficient. The rooms let this place down but if you want somewhere impressive to look at from a historical and architectrual perspective, somewhere in a fabulous location with great facilities and staff where you can take a good soak in a deep tub and have a peaceful sleep then this place is for you . So long as you don't mind your room being a bit dingy and grotty yet clean and comfy enough.

Reviews.Title: “do not stay here its a dirty dump”
Reviews.Author: linzi698
Reviews.Content: do not stay in this dump it looks nice as u walk in it took an hour n half 2 check in then we was givin a key 2 r room only 2 find someboby else was stayin in it when i went 2 reception i was told i wouldnt get an up grade agen. the room was disgustin and dirty the bath was dirty wot u had 2 stand in 2 have a shower which was broke.the only good thing was the coffee shop thank god new york was so amazin otherwise it would of spoit r trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price for Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: travelmom519
Reviews.Content: Due to the past reviews, I was very concerned about staying here on my weekend in NYC with my teenage daughter. It turned out much better than I expected. The check in was quick and the staff was wonderful. The front desk personnel were very helpful and cheerful in checking rooms for us that were "newer" due to my allergies and even offered to upgrade us to a two bed room rather than the king I reserved. He noted that all the double bed rooms were smoking and not good for my allergies so we kept the king. He then showed me great places to go in NYC (that we have never heard of and it turned out to be a great recommendation) and couldn't be nicer. We were on the eleventh floor and I truly don't understand the references to asylums and "The Shining". Yes, it was not extremely well lit but for an old hotel it was fine and acceptable. We walked in our room expecting the worst and were very pleasantly surprised. The brown carpet is worn and flat (reminds me of outdoor carpet) but the room was a good size (better than the Sheraton on Times Square at 3 times the price) and very clean. No musty smell. The bed was a true king size, the TV was a flat screen, we had a nice sized refrigerator in the room, two end tables and a closet. The closet was narrow but you could hang things in it and just kind of slant the hangers a bit. The bathroom was clean and well appointed with a shelf over the sink and toilet, a wide sink, a tub/shower combo and excellent hot water and water power. The hotel supplied soap, shampoo, conditioner, lotion, shoe buffer, and shower cap plus a hairdryer along with 2 bath towels, 2 hand towels and a wash cloth. All linens were clean, no stains and no bed bugs were found (a big concern in NYC). The bed itself was on the hard side and the king sized pillows were a bit flat for me but after a long day in NYC I slept like a rock. I would recommend bringing earplugs for sleeping if you are a light sleeper. City noises (siren, car honking, etc.) and bathroom noises can be heard, but I bring my plugs everywhere. Even the best hotels can be noisy. So, the wall paint could be freshened up, the carpet renewed, but for under $100 a night in NYC it was fantastic. We stayed at the Waldorf one time and even that hotel needed to be refreshed so it was definitely a good deal. Complaints would be the restaurant attached to the hotel is way over priced (for a good breakfast at reasonable prices would be Lenny's which is to the right of Madison Square Garden less than a block away), the TV was a bit wonky as the volume was at full blast every time I turned it on and it took some finesse to turn the TV off as it kept coming back on (I kept the off button down for a bit longer than normal that did the trick), but that's it. We really enjoyed our stay there and I will definitely be bringing my family back. Now, one side note is that we talked to some other guests and their experiences were not as nice as ours so I guess it really is a luck of the draw but from our recent experience it was a great place to stay. Be nice to the staff, don't be expecting 5 star for 1 star prices, appreciate the fantastic location (we walked to Broadway/Times Square, the garment district, and the fashion district) and I hope you have as nice an experience as ours.

Reviews.Title: “stay here its ok.”
Reviews.Author: Lisa M
Reviews.Content: I stayed hear just before xmans 2011. Previous reviews made me worried i had booked the wrong hotel and would not enjoy my New York experiance. I was not looking forward to the holiday and expected the worse. upon arrival i was pleasantly suprised the lobby was bright and inviting, fast check in only waited 5 mins, drinks machine, ice machine near room and well lite landings. Room has 2 double beds only booked double room, the room was spacious clean, fresh towells every day and bed linen clean NO BED BUGS. Would stay hear again don't worry if you have booked this hotel it is'nt bad as previous reviews make out, maybe i was lucky as we had the 3rd floor. Due to the location everything is within walking distance. Love New York will go again.If you want to tour bus around new sites got to New York taxi tours agets are based outside Empire State building 5 min walk from hotel, $35 per person for 2 day tours don't use hotel tourist information as only uses expensive tours but are all the same.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here, ever.”
Reviews.Author: ARP2011_12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for my birthday in October, obviously because the location is ideal and we got it as a package deal on expedia.com for an unbeatable price. Literally, this was the worst hotel experience of my entire life. Thank God we did not spend much time there, but I would never, ever step foot in here again. The wait time to get checked in took us an hour and half, because they don't let anyone in to their rooms until 3pm. That was the first red flag. We go upstairs to our floor, and walking out of the elevator was like entering a scene from the movie the Shining. All I could hear in my head was "Redrum... Redrum". The floors were filthy and there was a red couch in the corner that was torn to shreds. The doors themselves looked like something that would be in the basement of the Titanic. They were metal and rounded and vault like. Our room was even worse. There was one thin polyester sheet on the bed, with two flattened pillows that might as well have not been there. The radiator either blasted out heat or didnt work at all, and dont even get me started on the tv/armour. All of the knobs were missing on the armour so you couldn't even open it to use it if you wanted to. The 1984 television set was remote-less, and every time you tried to flip through channels it would freeze on channel 3 and you would have to pull the entire armour out to unplug the tv and then start over. We were there for 3 days and every time we took a shower and the maid service would come, they would take our towels and then not replace them. Make sure to bring your own shampoo and soap, because they definitely do not supply you with either one of these things. Also, you may want to bring a portable battery for your cell phone as none of the outlets work. The staff is rude, unhelpful, and overall I am not sure how this place stays in business.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: carol s
Reviews.Content: The location is great, that is it! The looby looks nice, but when you get out of the lift to the bedrooms, it looks like an old mental hospital, the carpets are dirty, the walls have watermarks, the rooms are disgusting, the bath was cracked, wallpaper falling off the walls, damp in the corners, the tv was from the 1950's and did not work, there was no wardrobe to hang your clothes, When I was told the rooms were of the same standard, I checked out and went to the Park Central, 100% nicer!! It's dirty and will ruin your holiday... DO NOT STAY!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: mhpnp
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference that was being held in the hotel, so it was convenient. The hotel was scarey - dark hallways, confusing room numbers, no ice, sink falling off the wall, etc. There are so many hotels to chose from in New York City - do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel in a prime location.”
Reviews.Author: jmb2262
Reviews.Content: Yes yes it's an old hotel....historical...etc.....but you just cannot beat the location!!!! We stayed in a Penn 5000 double....don't waste your money for their continental breakfast...just get a room and go across the street to the station and visit the delis in there for bagels and baked goods for breakfast. DO NOT go into Lindys restaurant that is right in the front of the hotel.....very expensive breakfast!!! $13 for 4 pancakes....just pancakes, nothing else! Hotel staff was great....asked for extra pillows and got them without a problem. Room is dimly lit.....probably to not draw attention to the old conditions....carpet is dark ugly brown...no nap at all...hard and cold. Bath was clean...old black and white ceramic tile...great water pressure....bright....much brighter than the room itself! Biggest selling point is location location! In two and a half days we went from one end of NYC to the other....walked to Empire State Building, Times Square; even Central Park-straight up 7th Ave several blocks, but fun to walk it and see so much! #1 subway right there to take you to Battery Park/Statue of Liberty/Ellis Island. We took train from Buffalo on Sat morn....got to NYC and hotel by 4....walked to Time Square that night to get our bearings...spent two more whole days touring and went back home on the 4th day. Hotel Penn may not be "glitzy" but it was suitable to our needs...a place to lay our heads at night and central to the sights of NYC.

Reviews.Title: “aaaaaaaaaagh !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SAIMOHAN
Reviews.Content: terrible terrible terrible . if you ever want to see a hotel that simply survives on location this is it . i stayed in this property for so many years i dont even know why ????? the bed sheets smell of guests that have stayed here in the past . the rooms were dirty the bathrooms broken the sofas in the suites had no cushions yuck !!!! the service and staff was disgusting and rude like crazy !!!!!! never again would i want to go back here !!!! never ever !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not great but could have been worse”
Reviews.Author: JStravelerfromPA
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and our two daughters have stayed in many hotels in NYC (we go about 4x per year) but this was the first time we weren't staying at a chain. It was a bit of a spur-of-the-moment Sat/Sun trip in January and the cost was a lot less than where we usually stay (Hilton, Sheraton). It was in a convenient location across from Penn Station and just a few blocks from Koreatown, (an area of Korean restaurants on 32nd) where you can get great Korean bbq cooked right at your table. The lobby is beautiful -- massive with marble floors, chandeliers, leather seating and a large bank of elevators -- and the outside of the multi-story building looks old and charming (I believe it's from the 1920s). Our room, however, was another story. The brown flat carpet was dirty all around the edges of the room, as was the edge of the bathroom floor. There was mold on the bathroom ceiling and door & some chipped paint and cracks in the walls and ceiling throughout the room. But despite the bit of mold and the bit of dirt, the room did not smell (which we have experienced in the past on an East Coast driving trip when we had to stop without reservations -- so this was better than that!). We did check for bedbugs and there were none; the sheets were clean and so were the towels though my 16-year-old daughter didn't trust the sheets so slept on her sweater on top of the pillow. Beds were uncomfortable and there was a dip in the middle. Flatscreen TV was nice though the remote didn't work so we had to get up and change the channel -- but at least the cable continued to work! There is 5 minutes of free internet then it is $9.95 per day. There was good quality soap and shampoo provided and the shower, sink and toilet all worked well in our room though the shower head was about at my eye level (5-foot-4 inches), but we're all short in my family so it was OK! There is a Lindy's (cafe) in the lobby, also small coffee shop with a couple tables, a restaurant (steakhouse, I believe), a large gift shop, a newsstand and several tiny gift shops (just t-shirts and mugs) plus TV screens showing news in the lobby and in all the elevators. Luggage storage was $4 per bag. So my feeling is it could have been worse (as some of the reports about it have noted the horrors of their rooms).

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel of our stay in america”
Reviews.Author: Susanmax
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent.... Thats where it ended, the bed was awful and uncomfortable, lumpy pillows, the sheets didn't fit, it wasn't clean, and the tap in the bathroom leaked and dripped all night. It was very nice in the foyer, made us think it was a nice hotel, wrong.... Never stay there again, definitely the worst hotel on our trip across America.

Reviews.Title: “wear socks in shower”
Reviews.Author: daniel d
Reviews.Content: it is a very good location,but so are the ears on the side of my head and they are clean,when you read a review about this hotel you realize it is as bad as the say,its not cheap its dirty,and again filthy carpet,hole in tub that leaks on floor when using,mold does not describe mini frig,dirty walls ,dirty every thing,I would(will) pay more next time in New York we did finally decide it was better than camping if you did not have a tent and it was cold and rainy.Oh the best part about this place is no one cares,it is what it is ,dirty,filty moldy with incredibbly dirty carpet and we had two rooms for 3 nites and we cold not decide which was worst,even though my sons room wash basin was full of water that someone had brushed there teeth and spit out,sink did not drain time we wher there.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly What Our Family Needed”
Reviews.Author: sherri999
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our 22 and 18-year old daughters to NYC at Christmas (2011) for a three-day, two-night stay. We wanted two hotel rooms and I searched the Internet for hours looking for a hotel that didn't seem sleazy and yet was affordable. I decided to go with Hotel Pennsylvania based on its location and pictures I saw on its website. And, it worked pefectly for our needs. We took a bus from suburban DC and it dropped us just a few short blocks from the hotel, so we didn't have to drive into the city. And, the hotel is right across the street from Penn Station for those traveling by train. Access to the subway is right there as well. Madison Square Garden is right across the street, Macy's is just around the corner, local restaurants are all around (Andrews is a great diner in the next block!), and Times Square is just a few blocks away. We walked everywhere: from the hotel to Times Square where we bought tickets for various shows from the TKTS booth (be sure to at least check out these discount booths for Broadway and off-Broadway shows), and walked to our off-Broadway show, and the ones on Broadway as well. Rockefeller Center was about the same distance from the hotel as Times Square, and our kids took the subway from the hotel to Central Park. The room itself was in need of a remodel: old carpet, loose headboard. But, there was a flat-screen TV and a small refrigerator in the room. And the size was quite adequate for two people who were there to be out in the city and not staying in the room much. The staff were all very friendly and helpful, and I would definitely stay there again for the convenience of the location combined with the price.

Reviews.Title: “Only if the location is your first consideration”
Reviews.Author: DenisVitchevsky
Reviews.Content: Let's get the location thing out of the way: This hotel is an an awesome, awesome location: across the street from Madison Square Garden, right near 1/2/3 subway line. Stores, restaurants, Midtown attractions - you're in the center of it all. Don't stay there. This hotel is more than 90 years old, and it shows. It's not a charming historical hotel, but a huge and badly maintained dump. The room I've stayed at had stains on the walls and the carpet was weird, the TV was an old CRT, and some of the wiring was carelessly done. Lighting was inadequate, room was almost always dark. The bed seemed old as well, not very comfortable. The window, which overlooked one of the folds of the hotel and not the street, was thin enough to allow a lot of noise in, which is a problem in the city that never sleeps. The bathtub had a huge ugly stain around the drainage hole, and the shower head was uncomfortable. That said, I wouldn't call Pennsylvania hotel unsanitary - no bed bugs, the bed sheets were clean and so were the towels. Another lackluster aspect was the customer service. Due to unforeseen circumstances my girlfriend needed to book the hotel for me, and she has done so with her credit card since I didn't have mine on me. When I checked into a hotel in DC with the same situation, they were friendly and just asked me for a 100$ security deposit, which I was happy to provide. At Penn, they refused to do that, claiming it's the hotel policy and they're not to blame it wasn't made clear when I ordered on third party website. The supervisor even had the audacity to answer the question "Where does it say that I have to have a credit card" with a vaguely threatening "You don't wanna go down that road with me". In the end, I was only allowed to check in after my girlfriend photographed her cc and drivers license, and sent it to them by email (How very secure). I understand that this hotel is usually one of the cheapest in Manhattan, but seriously, it doesn't worth the 20-40$ a night you'll save if you're a tourist. If you just need a place to stay at cheaply near MSG, well, it beats staying on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap Pitts”
Reviews.Author: QC0805
Reviews.Content: Well, this hotel is RIGHT across the street from Penn station. One can't pick a better location!!! However, the room are old. The service is lousy. And everything is cheap. Because this hotel is so inexpensive, the 'Occupy Wallstreet' kids shared it with me when Bloomberg kicked them out of the park. They were mild mannered but they were MASSIVE! The elevators were super slow! However, I checked my bags after checkout and had a positive experience. Post baby I've been a bit weight conscious... The bag check guy's flattering comments more or less made my month!!! Ladies, the bag check guys are worth the shoddy stay!!

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is.”
Reviews.Author: PKVA
Reviews.Content: I booked it direct via their website for about the price I could get it via an agent and they even had a price match guarantee they matched (saved $5 a night) for $110 on Christmas day. What did we get for that $110? A clean, decently sized room (for NYC) with a flat screen TV with about 40 channels in a quiet area of the hotel. The fridge was a former "mini bar" and had a dismantled lock on it. Cute. Note we paid an extra $14 to get these frills and I would recommend it. A continental breakfast (danish, OJ, coffee, bagels) and the staff replenished the supplies right up until it closed at 10AM and then leftovers after that. A 1970's style lounge with 2 old computers with DSL style internet. And a fantastic location (right across from Penn Station). So not bad really. I've paid about the same on special for other rooms which were like closets (super tiny. Like on a train.) Plus the room had "atmosphere" (ok, a bit musty but get this: You can open the windows even if only a tiny bit!) The staff was very friendly to us and helpful with information about the city. Our check in/out took about 20 minutes each but we always got there early to beat the rush. (Folks, if you wait until the last minute to check in/out, you're going to have to wait. ANYWHERE!) No doubt there were some rooms worse than ours and I was careful to check for critters in the mattress (were none.) The bathroom was small, but you got a shower/tub, sink, blow drying and a foldout shaving mirror. You get out of it what you put into it so to speak. Have a good attitude, get there early, and do your best. It's NYC after all. Bottom line: We left with nice memories and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to complain about but the size!”
Reviews.Author: RosieBath
Reviews.Content: The main problem I found was that I had been allocated a room at the far end of the block from the lifts. It's a very large hotel with 1700 rooms apparently. Now if you want to use WIFI you have to do so in the ground floor lobby area as it doesn't work elsewhere. So you have to flog a block to your room to get the laptop and a block back to use it then another block to put it away and a fouth block to go out! The gym is not that easy to find - at the top of the hotel, out the back staircase and up some more steps! It could do with a rowing machine but is otherwise perfectly adequate. The bed was comfortable and the sheets were clean although the bedding was a bit worn. There wouldn't be much room to move around if there were two of you. The worst thing was the shower which was either hot or cold and impossible to adjust to a normal temperature. Yes the walls were scuffed and the carpets worn. ~The domestic staff and the porters were friendly and helpful. The receptionists were in auto and could do with some incentive to smile. The cafe in the lobby is very useful It would be good to know beforehand that there is an excellent bus service to and from JFK from right across the street. Also it is in a great position for the subway and getting to anywhere easily by foot.

Reviews.Title: “Horror Movie Mental Institute Feel”
Reviews.Author: Chantelle C
Reviews.Content: First off, if you are an international traveller you struggle to do your booking if you decide to do a group booking... I struggled 3 months to book 5 rooms for 19 people. Our check in was very quick, this I give to the hotel staff. Literally not 5 minutes to check in 19 people - this deserves a well done. This creates an expectation... Do not be fooled!! Arriving on the 10th floor, the minute you step out of the lift it feels like you are entering the Twilight Zone ride in Disney World. The room doors are Valet Doors from 1919 and heavy as hell. If you have large luggage pieces you will struggle to get your luggage in your room. Upon entering the room, you will be shocked. It is DIIIRRRTTTYYY!!!! The walls have not been painted since the 1940's (rough estimate but it sure looks it) Our blanket had holes in. Our telephone in our room had no buttons, so we were not able to phone reception to complain. The shower has two settings, freezing or boiling hot! If you flush the toilet the shower automatically choosed boiling hot, scorching the person in the shower. The bath had HOLES in! My sister found an old nose ring in her bed. Eeeuuuww. I asked the concierge to phone our transfer company where he told me he couldn't I had to do it myself. Eventually the one receptionist connected me to Supershuttle. The location is good, but that is truly the only good thing I can say about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sleeping on the street would have been better.”
Reviews.Author: RicciBerrie
Reviews.Content: When I booked, I thought i'd spend 3 nights at the YMCA and then i'd spend a bit more for 2 nights in a hotel. I should have stayed with the YMCA!!!! When I arrived, the check in staff were pleasant, but over worked. The hotel has no wi-fi facilities... given the day and age, I was surprised, but was able to pay to use the internet in the lobby. The room was absolutely putrid. There was a dirty great hole in the wall, the carpet was frayed and lifting, and the bathroom was like stepping into a 1950's flashback. The enamel was coming off the bath tub, and the whole room just stank. The window didn't open or close properly, and the monstrosity that I assume was the air conditioning looked like it hadn't worked in about 10 years. You could also hear a lot of street noise, and I think from memory I was on about the 10th floor! The bed was uncomfortable, and the bed/linen smelt questionable. The only thing that stank more than the room itself, was the lobby of my floor (complete with ancient shag pile carpet and fixtures + fittings from the 50s. I can honestly say i'll never be back.... certainly not worth the $200/night it cost me to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bad hotel, bad rooms!”
Reviews.Author: agnursmith
Reviews.Content: NYC is a hard place to find good hotels with fair prices. I stayed in Hotel Pennsylvania in July 2009. The price was not so expensive, so I stayed with 3 more friends, for 4 nights. The first room we were given was RIDICULOUS. Very dirty, the bed had blood on the sheets, the walls were kind of falling, also they gave us 2 queen beds and in our reservation we had asked for a room with 4 single beds. After some conversation, they gave us a better room on a higher floor. It seems that they are rebuilding the hotel and started from the higher floors. The room was better, I can not complain. It was a larger room, with 4 beds, and at least it was not dirty. The hotel is very crowded, all the time. The facilities (internet at the lobby) are terrible. no WiFI at the time.

Reviews.Title: “on par with a cheap motel”
Reviews.Author: Fulano D
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for four nights from the 29th to the 2nd for new years. Very expensive, but it was the only thing I could find in Manhatten. I give it an A+ for location but everything else is an F. I had the first room on the 10th floor around the corner from the elevators. I opened the door to the room and was instantly disappointed. I've seen cheap motel rooms that were better than this one. The room itself and the bathroom were both very small. I had a king size bed and that took up most of the space in the room. The room had old, worn out furniture. It was dark and dingy. Bad lighting, only 3 lamps that were very dim. The carpet was old, stained in a lot of places and ripped in others. Paint was chipped and peeling off the ceiling. The door knob to bathroom was just about falling off. None of the drawers in the room opened so there was no place to put things away. Bathroom was small and had no kind of counter to put things on. Just a small sink, public bathroom style toilet and tub. As far as the bed goes, all the bedding (pillows, sheets, blankets; i don't remember a comforter) were all sub-par. There was a television, about an 18" tube television. Walls and door were also paper thin. I could hear everything going on in the hallway and also every time the elevator door would ding when opening. That made it very difficult to sleep. I would never stay here again, especially for the outrages price I paid. VERY DISAPPOINTED.

Reviews.Title: “3 days NYE week for Phish”
Reviews.Author: ashley f
Reviews.Content: my boyfriend and i stayed at the hotel for 3 nights. we checked in on wednesday planning on only staying wed n thursday for phish, walked in kinda sketched out because reviews i read, i bought bed bug spray for the bed and the luggage, once we got to the room, i searched the entire room before putting things down, no bed bugs. yes the room was old but it was fine!! people need to stop! we ended up liking it so we booked for a third night, yes we are going back. but remember people if you are staying in NYC its not really the hotel that carries the bugs, its the people who stay in the rooms before you. hotel cannot manage to deal with millions of people from different backgrounds. just enjoy your stay, if you got bugs, change rooms, not all the rooms will have them

Reviews.Title: “My POOR experience at Hotel Pennsilvania, New York”
Reviews.Author: Baig1
Reviews.Content: Location is very good, close to everything but the the rooms are TERRIBLE! Paint coming of the walls, carpet is filthy, the whole place needs a revamp- BAD! The service wasn't the best, very abrupt and dismissive. If your here in New York to visit for a couple days and not to botherd about the rooms then it's ok but a week or longer, I wouldn't recommend this hotel at ALL! Not the best experience and not as good as I expected! Disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay based on location !”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca k
Reviews.Content: I really think a lot of these reviews on here have to be fake. There is no way this place deserves one star, let alone three. The lobby is deceiving. Mostly clean with newer furniture so, you think you're getting a good deal. Once you get off the elevator you know you've made a mistake. When we got to our room we considered sleeping in the car as an option. Mold and dirt everywhere, especially in the bathroom. Stained yellowish mattress with the oldest bedding I have ever seen. Woke up every 15 minutes itching like crazy. Don't stay here based on the location. There are so many other hotels nearby that don't have you wondering whether or not you've contracted some kind of disease.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel in New York?”
Reviews.Author: TTGA
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of hotels in New York, so ranking it as the worst would be difficult to do. But, I'm sure it would be among the leading candidates. I often travel to NY on business. Based on price and location, one of our secretaries booked this hotel for our trip. The rate was low for Manhattan, and it was located across the street from our client. So, for cost and convenience it was a good choice. But it's not a good choice, if: - You don't want to stand in line nearly an hour to check in - You don't want to stand in line nearly an hour to check out - You don't want to stay in soiled room - You don't want a permantly stuck open window during a frigid night - You don't to shower in a pitch black bathroom - You don't want to shave by using the light of your cellphone This hotel has become the butt of several jokes in our office since our trip. We feel like survivors.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs and long waits - although good location”
Reviews.Author: Chris_hlf
Reviews.Content: Covered in bites after one night in this hotel. Check-in process was insane, I have never waited so long to check in in my life. Sure the location is great for tourist stuff, but I wouldn't stay here again. Save some extra pennies and find somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great, if you need no frills”
Reviews.Author: Lemm01
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for guests using the room for sleeping quarters only. It is perfect for needing a place to crash after a show at MSG. I wouldn't have chosen another hotel for my concert experience.

Reviews.Title: “Do not waste your money”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne M
Reviews.Content: I Booked a two night stay for my parents here. It looked nice and it was a great price. It's in a great location and in walk distance to most things. I was so disgusted with the room and how they were treated. The room was filthy. There light blanket that wouldn't cover much or keep you warm. They requested a blanket, that never came and extra pillow that also never appeared. The outside and lobby area looks lovely but the rest of this establishment has a lot to be desired. They saw a mouse running in the hallway as they walked to their room. They told the receptionist and her response was "well it is New York what do you expect"? Do not waste your money!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pennsylvania Horror”
Reviews.Author: David F
Reviews.Content: I have been to New York many times. I am aware of what to expect in pricing and condition of rooms. I have traveled to USA once a month for a year and a half. Two hotels have been worse that Pennsylvania. One with 7 roaches found in one minute and the other with mossy carpets. Lineups of 45 minutes to check in, double beds the size of cots are the best of it. Getting of the elevator brings you to a Stephen King horror set. Painting might have occured 50 years ago. Fear of taking off your shoes in case you catch something. Didn't bother using the shower and waited to get to my next hotel which was great and half the price. The owner of the hotel should be jailed or fined for perpetrating a fraud in my opinion. Serious disapointment and I do not stay at the Ritz nor was I expecting that. You can tell who is checking in and who is coming to the counter to try and change their room. One is smiling and the other is very angry.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Penn-great find!”
Reviews.Author: Monread
Reviews.Content: This hotel is across from Macy's. It may be a little walk from times square but this hotels clean rooms,friendly staff and great price more than make up for a little hike.My friend and I would definately stay here again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Not for location but needs improvements”
Reviews.Author: John M
Reviews.Content: The hotel is has a ideal location.and price was right but the rooms were very small the beds were hard. As for clean well the the walls were dirty the washrooms had black mold in the rooms.Room 685 was the worsted one.Its old and needs alot of updates.Holes filled paint job and a good scrub down with javex or something to kill the mold.Other then that we like the staff know problems there and the price was right for New York.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap cheap hotel - you get what you pay for, but you're asleep most of the time”
Reviews.Author: runnoff
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in NYC for one night to visit our son, so we wanted a cheap hotel in a midtown location. Hotel Pennsylvania was the cheapest available, and was priced below many hotels in less popular destinations, so it was a real bargain at $130. And the location is one of the best in NYC. This grand old lady has a huge old fashioned lobby with the largest reception desk I have ever seen. Despite the large crowd and long line at check in, we were processed promptly and professionally. Unfortunately, that was the highlight of our stay. The room was tiny (although comparable to other budget tourist hotels in NYC) and the king sized bed took up most of the floor space. The walls and carpet were not clean. Electrical outlets were old and worn out, and some wires were exposed. The bathroom was out of date, very small (could only fit one person at a time), and had mold on the walls. Climate control was not effective - on this cold rainy late autumn day we had to open our windows to moderate the heat. Because of the room temperature, we had to keep the window open a crack at night, which enabled us to hear street noise. Unfortunately, we did not sleep well. The continental breakfast included in our room charge was served in a very small over-crowded room with too many people to be comfortable. We skipped it and went out to eat. I have stayed at much worse hotels in small towns along the highway as I have travelled around the country. This hotel is very cheap relative to the NYC market. If you are not coming for a romantic vacation and can forgive the substandard room and amenities, this is a bargain and worth it for the location.

Reviews.Title: “bernethaSC”
Reviews.Author: Bernetha B
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on the 21st-23rd of December. The stay was great, the staff was friendly. The room was small but what more do you want, you're in New York City. The rooms were clean and overall the service was satisfactory, and the location was great. All the shows and time square were minutes from the hotel. And I almost forgot that I was upgraded to a king size room at check-in. I had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: RichardH100
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel solely for its location. It is right next to Penn St train station which meant we could travel by train straight from Newark airport and no taxis. Its location is also perfect for many of the main attractions. Macy's is next door, Empire State is 2 blocks away and Times Sq is a 10 min walk. There is alot of history to this place, but it looks like the decor is still as it was when it was built. It needs a major refurbishment but we coped ok for our 4 night stay. I don't think that we would go back to this hotel but that is mainly due to wanting to try other hotels, but we were glad we have experienced a piece of NYC history.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Emmajayne16
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel 16th-20th December! Hotel and lobby look great,Checked in within minutes,friendly staff,quick lifts,long hallways but there are over 1700 rooms!yes the doors are old but there only doors!the room had a massive double bed,telly worked fine with lots channels,noisy heater but kept room very warm! We had a quick clean around the bathroom but other than that was a good clean/ tidy room! Had a great powerful shower with plenty hot water! I would recommend this hotel and stay there again! It's so close to everything was handy to pop back and drop shopping bags off and had a reasonable coffee snack shop by lobby!

Reviews.Title: “For a central New York hotel at a very good price this is an excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: chrisandrab
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to New York, and we LOVED it!! Stayed at the Hotel Pennsylvania which was very central and ideal for all locations. also very reasonably priced. It was however very basic. But suited us. Staff were friendly. Rooms were clean if somewhat small. Rooms needed a good update and re-decoration but then I guess that would put the price up? Situated opposite Madison Square Garden and a couple of 100 yards from Macys and the Empire State building!! We ate out on all but our first evening when we ate at the hotel restaurant which was fine, nice food and good service. Hope this review helps you I only gave 3 stars as the hotel was only average, BUT this was made up for by location, staff and price!!

Reviews.Title: “Saved by a great location but in desperate need of a facelift”
Reviews.Author: ECB2010
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel on a number of occasions but its usually a last resort and / or a sign of desperation. The lines at check-in can be massive and the hotel now charges a fee to hold your bags. The interiors desperately need refurbishing. The rooms are large but resemble a bad Eastern European communist era hostel. Unlike other guests I was fortunate enough to get a clean room but I had trouble sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “My hotel from hell”
Reviews.Author: Steve W
Reviews.Content: I have spent a better night in a police cell. From the check in to check out was like pulling teeth. The room was disgustingly dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Run Away Fast”
Reviews.Author: JAY M
Reviews.Content: We selected this Hotel because of the great location. The Hotel is dated and in need of serious renovations.It appears that they have not up dated anything since 1919 when it opened. The rooms are dark and filthy from stained comforters and blankets to filthy dirty sofas and chairs in the room which could use a steam cleaning.The rug is dark brown and turned our socks black. We then kept our slippers on all the time after that. The bathroom had mold and rot around the sides of the tub to the floor,.the ceiling was peeling paint, light fixtures were rusted,the blow dryer attached to the wall did not work and the towels had multiple brown spots on them..We went to the local store and purchased towels to use. The room was not vacuumed prior to arrival as remnents of candy..popcorn and toe nail clippings surrounded the base of the bed. The hallway to our room 1096.had petrified vomit on the rug that housekeeping passed by every day. Other guests that we met complained of rude staff and bedbugs. When we complained to the front desk staff..we were told we could leave but there would be no refunds. You might think that this rewiew sounds harsh .. however it is true..I have never stayed somewhere .that there is a total un awareness to detail and cleanliness.Also there was no escape plan posted on the back of the room door on how to escape in the event of fire. Run do not walk away from this hotel untill they close it down and renevate

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Pennsylvania, New York”
Reviews.Author: Lisa W
Reviews.Content: I'm amazed that such a run down dump as this hasn't been shut down. I cannot believe that it cost £100 for a night's stay. The staff were rude. The room was filthy and the whole place felt in the mid stages of decay. The walls in the corridors and rooms were a disgrace, the carpets filthy and torn. (I think the sheets and towels were clean, but wouldn't vouch for the blanket or bed cover!). An absolute disgrace.

Reviews.Title: “Find somewhere else to stay”
Reviews.Author: PanamaMatt
Reviews.Content: Room was small and dirty, mold in the bathroom, lamp was buzzing and started burning the wire (which was when we noticed there were no sprinklers), the tv barely worked, and to top it off, we saw a rat in the bathroom next to the luggage room. The breakfast cafe was ridiculously bad. I have no idea how this place has been going for so long. The only thing it has going for it is the location.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Ness D
Reviews.Content: First when look at the rooms online they make them look better than what they are. The lobby is nice and cozy but as soon as you go up to your room the halls are like a ghost town. When we opened the door to our room I was disgusted, the room was so depressing with one small window. I regret not taking pictures of this place. The walls were dirty, the ceiling in the bathroom was cracked and the bathtub was rusted. EWE, let me tell you, i got 6 bedbug bites on my right leg from this place. We stayed in the room for about an hour, i literally almost began crying from how depressing and dirty this room was. I got on my phone and googled other hotels and found Park Central for $30 cheaper. We checked out of the hotel and spent an additional $480 for the new hotel. We didnt care about the extra money we had to spend, we were on vacation and i refused to stay in a dirty room. FYI the staff offered to change our room but I refused to stay there. Im not the type of person to bash a place but I had no choice to write up a review, i just dont want others to be fooled about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Old Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MSCDynamic
Reviews.Content: If you like history and want to be a part of it, this is the hotel for you! Rooms VERY small and haven't been updated in many years. However, sheets were clean and so was the bathroom! If you are out and about all day with taking in all NYC has to offer, its just a place to lay your head at night-so it was a good value for that.

Reviews.Title: “Stay someplace else”
Reviews.Author: Smallz82
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night and was amazed that the hotel hasn't been shut down yet. Yes the location is great but the hotel itself is a dump. We were given a room with broken carpet, paint peeling off the wall, and hard as wood beds. After I showered I decided to blow dry my hair and every two minutes the smoke alarm would go off. I went down to the front desk and demanded another room and, only because I told them that I had taken pictures of the room, was I then given a much better room. Don't let a cheaper stay spoil your vacation, stay someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location...but that is all”
Reviews.Author: K4r3nfr4
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fantastic location and this was the reason we booked it, before reading many reviews. That was a big mistake! First impressions from the outside and the hotel lobby were good, it looked very grand and clean. We were checked in quickly and made our way to the elevators which were nice, even with a mini tv in them, but once we got out of these and went along the corridor the good first impressions quickly faded. The corridors were dingy and creepy and the doors were very strange "original vault doors" from the early 1900s...creepy! The first room we went into was cold (window was wide open and difficult to shut), cramped and felt dirty and shabby. The bathroom was disgusting, cracked bath, dirty floor etc. We went straight down to reception and asked for a different room. Room 2 was very slightly cleaner and more spacious but the bathroom was also grotty looking, around the edges of the room were dirty and this bath too was cracked. TV signal was awful and powerpoints were unreliable. The hairdryer (in the bathroom) was rubbish and it took ages to dry our hair and although there was a mini fridge in our room it was not clean. The bathroom door handle was broken and I cut my finger trying to open it one morning. Customer service was very poor, the best staff being down in the luggage room. The hotel toilets down in the basement are also disgusting. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone as it was the low point of our trip to New York.

Reviews.Title: “dirty hotel”
Reviews.Author: sam p
Reviews.Content: just got back from this hotel last week. i stayed it from sunday untill thursday. we booked the whole trip online and it was very cleap, pulled up outside the hotel and it looked good, lobby was good, lots of marble and very clean etc, get into the lift, go up and doors up and it turned into a dump. got in the room and it was so dark, no light in the room just to dim lamps, stains on carpet, paint coming off the walls all over, shower is good if your 4 foot tall, all door frame broken, view of an x factor sign and not the 7th ave view we was told 5 mins before. cleaners liked walking in every morning at 8? no towels in room from 1st day, called up and they turned up 2 hours after after we called another few times. turned up after we gave up and went to bed. alot of the things we was told the room came with was missing. at the end of the day it did was it was meant to, we went out at 8 in the morning and came back at 9 and just wanted to sleep so you forgot about how dirty it was. the staff in the lobby was very friendly and helpfull. only good thing is this hotel is in the middle and walking distance to everything you get what you pay for. wouldnt reccomend or use again.

Reviews.Title: “dec 10 thru dec 12 2011”
Reviews.Author: Laurie W
Reviews.Content: The bath tub did not drain for hours and the corners were gross. There were cracks on the wall everywhere. However it was warm. The employees down stairs did not know New York at all. When asked where the nyairporter bus was located for pickup they had no idea.

Reviews.Title: “It is not that bad”
Reviews.Author: Eilidh973
Reviews.Content: I booked five nights this month in the Hotel Pennsylvania and was thoroughly scared by the review comments. But it was fine. I arrived early afternoon and had only a couple of minutes to wait at reception. A friend and I had booked a superior double, and my heart was in my mouth when we opened the door (one with the original valet panel mounted). But the room was huge, had two double beds, and two windows which could be opened. Yes, the hotel is shabby. It needs a fortune spent on it. The plaster is cracking in the upstairs lobby - it is the first thing you see coming out of the lifts - and the plaster was cracked in our bathroom and the bedcovers and carpet had seen better days. But the sheets were clean, the hotel was warm, the towels were fresh each day, the shower was powerful with plenty of hot water, and the hotel was generous with soaps and shampoos. There are no tea/coffee making facilities in the bedrooms, but the hotel has good facilities in the lobby and with plenty of lifts it was a quick trip down and back up each morning for coffee to start the day. (And the prices in the hotel cafe and its shops were very reasonable) The Penn does not have wi-fi, which is very surprising these days. It does have computer access in a "business suite" on the ground floor, but it was a bit dodgy and I used that only when I had to use it (and when it worked). It is not the scary nightmare other travellers make out. It is a tired old hotel, but clean enough to stay in, and gloriously central. It is right across from Penn Station, next to Macy's and the Empire State Building, and we booked a couple of Broadway shows just blocks away. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gabo13
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is great, but the hotel is just no good. The pros are: the location, the fact that it has 12 elevators, so you never have to wait for one to arrive. It's also not expensive compared to other hotels in NYC. The cons are: the air conditioning does not work (at least ours didn't), the bathroom is very old and not very well kept, the shower is crazy (you can get burned like five times during a 10-minute shower and there's almost no water pressure what so ever), the hotel has like a million rooms so the lobby area is always very very crowded, the rooms are very dark, and the hotel needs a makeover urgently. It's quite old.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLULTE CRAPPY HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Andy C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutley garbage. A Holdiay Inn is nicer than this place. I AM NOT KIDDING. Don't let the picture of the lobby trick and fool you that it is a classy and upscale hotel. It is filthy and old. The WHOLE place needs to be renovated. Trust me, I walk through its lobby everyday going to and from work. It is a shame the hotel tries to attract to tourists to this dump who have no idea how crappy this place is. You will regret it if you stay here. If you don't believe me than just stay there and make sure your reply and tell me that I was right. DON'T TELL ME I DIDN'T WARN YOU IN ADVANCE!

Reviews.Title: “A Nightmare Hotel; Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: nybd40
Reviews.Content: When I arrived the lobby was clean and renovated. I had to change my room two times and the lack of customer service was awful. The manager of this hotel should go through every room and inspect everything! It was gross and much needed repair! I booked through Expedia and was upset that they promote this horrible hotel to people! They should stay in the rooms to rate them! This hotel needs new management who will take the maintenance and housekeeping to new levels! What a disgrace for the money that I paid!

Reviews.Title: “1920's Deco, stuck in the past”
Reviews.Author: Kayleigh33
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here between 8th December - 12th December. The lobby is well decorated and unfortunately gives a false impression of things to come. The rooms are outdated and in our case bordering uninhabitable. The window did not close properly causing a draft into the room, the radiator / heating system did not work. Despite upgrading to a Penn 5000 room the room was worse than a bog-standard room we had last year. The corridors could do with a major replaster which can also be said for the rooms. Location is excellent, this is a cheap hotel where you really do get what you pay for, which is not much. Fortunately we did not have any issues with bed bugs.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Location " But in needs,redecoration"”
Reviews.Author: spanner59
Reviews.Content: We arrived around three pm the hotel was very busy at that time, as the New York marathon was taking place.We had no problems booking in ,and the staff were friendly and courteous. Our room was on the sixth floor but was to small for four of us , we requested to be moved to a larger room if possible. Our request was dealt with out any fuss and we were moved to a much larger room on the second floor.The room was spotless but was in need of decoration ,ie painting carpets and new electrical sockets. The hotel lobby has a very public feel to it there is a small coffee shop , and a couple of small souvenier shops there is also a diner and a restaurant attached to the hotel.When you exit the hotel you are on 7th avenue Madison Square Garden is straight across the road as is Penn Station where you can travel up or down town on the subway for two hours for $2.50. There are plenty of delis and cafes nearby and for shopping there is Macys and KMart around the corner.Time Square is a ten minute walk up 7th avenue the Empire State building is five minute walk.The Statue of LIBERTY Ellis Island Wall Street Battery Park Ground Zero China Town and Little Italy are all only a few minutes down town on the subway. I would recommend Ellen's Stardust Diner off Time Square where the waiters and waitresses will entertain you while you enjoy your meal, also Buba Gump's in Time Square is worth a visit. As i said earlier on the hotel is in a great location, it,s just a pity about the décor .New York is fantastic place and we had a .great time

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley filthy, nothing to do with being aged--just filthy.”
Reviews.Author: eva h
Reviews.Content: I visited NY 2nd Dec 2011 for 4 nights with family. This hotel had nice glossy pictures on trip advisor and some good, somehorrible ones and bad reviews, well I travel lots for work and don't pay attention to the reviews much as most places seem to be fine when you get there, the line of busienss I am in i book hotels for staff and generally we all feel the same, it is fine, that the hotels are fine when you get there. THIS HOTEL WAS FAR FROM IT, I WILL ADHERE TO TRIP ADVISOR FROM NOW ON!! The lobby seemed ok, the Chritmas tree and decorations anyway, the staff were nice enough, so we made our way to our 3 double bedded superior room, out of the lift we came to a corridor, dark and dingy, the doors had apparently the original valet door stuck to it from the 1920's, they curve out and remind me of a jail door, my sister commented it looked like something out of an old asylum or something, THE DIRT WAS LEFT OVER FROM 1920'S by the look of them, anyway on we went to the room. 3 single beds, the maid was changing the beds and cleaning! so we waited, we could see the matresses, stained and very uninviting, the clean sheets were threadbare and well stained with what could only be described as various bodily fliuds, the outer cover was not changed, and on one of the beds there was excrament on that outer cover. The light shades torn, the lamps covered in dust, the television and cabinet you could plant veg in the dirt, the window would not close, we asked for someone to come sort it, it didnt happen, we slept that night sitting up, laid on top of the bed on the towels, (oh the towels were spotless funny enough) full clothed in coats to keep warm, the damp all down one wall was terrible, i have returned home with a chest infection after sleeping in that den. Now the highlight, THE BATHROOM, this was awful, ok old you can handle, this was filthy, the plughole was covered in hair, rust, mold, the paint not just chipped, peeling off, the bath had been painted, white and grey, yes I did say the bath, it was cracked and jagged, we had to put a towel down to stand on to shower. The toilet had been bleached, though the seat not cleaned, sorry I dont want to see other peoples pubic hair or any other remains. Other people have posted photos, I have taken loads and apologies I cannot upload, one lady checked in and straight out again as they could not move her, a couple were moved 4 times, they were there for 5 nights, one guy paid $1400 for 3 nights to find remains of a pizza in his bed and when he complained was told if he didn't like it move on, I will my two sisters complained, after no joy, I had the travel company move us, i was lucky as i put a lot of business through them, some people may not be, my sister cried when she saw a couple with small children and a baby trying to move, they had been bitten by flees or bugs. We had to stay there 1 night, we found a local shop and bought cleaning stuff just so we could try and feel comfortable whilst we were stuck there and did the best we could, this was not just 3 sisters moaning, other guests stuck there did the same. I DO NOT KNOW WHY THIS HOTEL IS STILL OPEN, THESE PEOPLE COMPLAINING ARE NOT A BUNCH OF WHINGERS OR OCD CLEANING FREAKS, THIS HOTEL SHOULD BE CLOSED DOWN, STRIPPED OUT, SCRUBBED AND HAVE A MAJOR REFURBISH, THE ROOM IS LIKE SOMETHING YOU WOULD SEE IN A FILM, USUALLY INVOLVING A CHEAP FLITHY ROOM THAT WOLD BE USED FOR ILLICIT LIAISONS, OH AND THE TAXI DRIVERS FIGHTING OUTSIDE, PHYSICALLY PUNCHING EACH OTHER AND IN THE LOBBY, WE ACTUALLY FELT UNSAFE. MAKE UP YOUR OWN MIND, HOWEVER GENERALLY IT COSTS THE SAME AS ANY OTHER HOTEL, SHOP AROUND, THE AFFINIA 2 DOORS DOWN WAS SUPERB AND SPOTLESS, THE NOVOTEL AT TIME SQUARE AND THE HOLIDAY INN ARE LOVELY.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY IN THIS HOTEL!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tracy A
Reviews.Content: I have travelled around the world and stayed in more hotels than I could possibly count. Many, many, many cost significantly less than this hotel. Absolutely none approached the absolutely awful conditions of this hotel. We had black mold in the room and the bathroom was so disgusting I was afraid to touch fixtures/walk without socks on the floor. The bedding was disgusting, and filth in the bathroom made me use wash cloths to touch everything. A colleague from Austria said "the room was fine as long as you didn't touch anything. Sirens all night outside as well. This hotel survives because there are suckers born every day....absolutely no one who has ever stayed in the hotel once would ever return again. ABSOLUTELY DISGUSTING. Filthy, smelly, disgusting and totally ruined my experience of NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Respect for an iconic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneSwannies
Reviews.Content: This is the fourth time we have stayed at this historic Hotel and have always found the facilities to be adequate. Sure the rooms are old but for the price and location you could not do better. The terrible reviews that many people give this Hotel are not warranted and would put off many wary people who would accept the condition of the old rooms under the circumstances. IT IS OLD, respect it for what it is and once was. Treat the staff with respect and they in turn respond. We have never had a problem because we have manners. The housekeeping staff work hard to maintain the rooms that some people leave like pigstyes - some people seem to think that is their right. Our rooms have always had clean bedding, change of towels everyday and clean bathroom. Being in New York we spend little time in our room and it serves our purpose well. Quite honestly I don't know what some people are expecting for the very fair cost of staying in the heart of NY opposite Penn Station. It appears to me that some people on this site try and out-do each other for the worst horror review. Just go stay somewhere else and make a bit more room for those of us who respect the age of this grand old Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I was told by the reception staff to go back to my own country if I didn't like the service!”
Reviews.Author: Elsawoo
Reviews.Content: We have travelled around many countries and stayed in a variety of accommodation and we were fully expecting the room to be basic. But what we did not expect was the disgusting attitude of the staff which I have never come across in my life. It took over an hour to check in and I was met with a very aggressive man when I told him I was not happy with this. The room was so poor we found it funny that they had the cheek to ask people to pay. The only thing going for it was the location which was good and the cleaners did a good job with what they were working with and that is the only reason it has a score.

Reviews.Title: “dont bother!”
Reviews.Author: AmieLouise
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few years ago (though trip advisor would only let me select 2011) on a trip with university and I wasn't expecting much. Pulled up outside and thought I had got a bargain, the lobby was lovely and seemed quite expensive for how much we paid, and I was really looking forward to seeing the room. We got to the room and it was pitch black, we had to have the light on constantly whenever we were in the room. All the furnishing is dark also, so that didn't help. It smelt very musty, almost as if this room hadn't been used in a very long time. The bathroom was horrible, the paint was peeling from the walls and there was mould in the corners. I know most people only need somewhere to sleep when you go to New York, and that is all I used it for, but trust me, you can get a much better hotel up on the upper west side, for about the same amount of money and not be scared you will wake up next to a rat or cockroach. The one positive I have is that the location is brilliant, but I would give that up in an instant. I cant believe people have memberships to this place!!!!! On my second trip to New York I took my parents to show them how bad it was, and they realised i was not exaggerating! Please avoid, and just pay a little extra!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Basic and Central”
Reviews.Author: Alan S
Reviews.Content: Here are the pros and cons of this Hotel in a nutshell: - Pros 1 Central location 2 Clean towels every day Cons 1 Basic rooms in need of decoration 2 Rude and extremely unhelpful reception staff 3 Fittings and fixtures not working

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: DenmarkIquack
Reviews.Content: Was quite worried after reading all the bad reviews, so Hotel Pennsylvania was a pleasant surprise. Loved the old-fashioned lobby....and the perfect little coffee-bar with GREAT coffee and muffins. Asked for a nice room and was given room # 722 - the biggest hotelroom I've ever seen in NY. Huge room with two full size beds, nice bathroom with a tub and a walk-in closet ! Yes, the furniture is dated, but everything was clean and in working condition. The staff was helpful and polite and the check-in was quick and easy. I will definitely stay at Hotel Pennsylvania again.

Reviews.Title: “Worse than Faulty Towers!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Daryl D
Reviews.Content: On arriving at the hotel at 10.30pm New York time after starting our trip at 11am (GMT) We thought it looked awesome!!! Got keys to room No.777.This was a room for 2 adults and 2 children(11 and 8yrs old.) There was not enough room to swing a cat. There was mouldy walls in bathroom.The ceiling paint was flaking and it smelt mouldy. We then requested another room which we waited for another 30mins. On arrival at the new room(No.310) We opened the door to the very strong smell of cigarettes and a camp bed in the middle of the room. This room was worse than the first room. So we requested another room which was (No.1002A) This room was a very large room with 4no. single beds. Still had flaky paint on the ceilings but it look slightly acceptable. My wife did although mention to the manager about having single beds, only to be told," what ever room we had in the hotel was of the same standard. On the first morning while getting ready to leave the room at 8.30am. There was a knock on the room door where a cleaner asked us if we were now going out. As we weren't ready she tutted. Over-all rating of hotel - Very poor with very unhelpful staff. STAY AWAY!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Interesting to say the least”
Reviews.Author: Kim P
Reviews.Content: I had 10 nights at this hotel and was asked to change rooms half way through because the toilet mysteriously stopped working? They gave me an upgrade when changing rooms which I was appreciative for. Sure, the lines at check in counter were so long it was absolutely ridiculous, but I just decided whenever the lines were long to hold my query and come back later so I did. I went to New York to see the sights not stay in my room. At the end of each day I came back to a bath which was fantastic. I don't know if every room has a bath or not but both of mine did and that is a huge bonus after a tiring day sightseeing. The bathroom was horrible and there was paint scratched off and rust, etc BUT I LOVED HAVING A BATH so really did it REALLY matter? I didn't find any bed bugs in either of my beds and slept really well. First room 11th floor and bit noisy. Second room quieter (1384 - business PENN room) - but I think it depends on which side and how high maybe? Internet far too expensive and I didn't use it. I asked the guy at reception really nicely (begged him, actually) and he gave me a key to get into the business centre so I could use the free internet. Later on when another person found out they immediately took the key off me again. Oh well I had three days of free internet. If you need a really cheap place to stay this is an adequate hotel. I am sure there are bed bugs many places and you probably won't know until you get allocated your room. Oh, the lighting was inadequate so don't expect to read at night unless you have a torch. Wasn't a huge drama for me, just bit frustrating. I am sure many people will have different experiences. I really think it depends upon the time of year and the room you get allocated. My experience was pleasant enough. I put up with it because I had a bath every night which I never get at home as I have four teenagers and two exchange students!!!!!!!!!!! Kim, Maroochydore, Qld Australia

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting.”
Reviews.Author: Leonora
Reviews.Content: The location is nice, as is the lobby, but I felt like I walked into a scene from "1408." There isn't a clock, the AC blows out hot air, there was a dirty sock on the floor, and a reddish/brown stain on the sheets-blood? Also, our shower was rusty and torn up, so we called the front desk 5 times for a bath mat. We ended up buying a bath mat because the shower was so gross. The walls and ceilings were peeling and falling apart, and the shower rack was all rusty. Also, don't go to the mezzanine. The elevator doors open to a cement wall and an empty elevator shaft. I do not reccommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Worse and worse”
Reviews.Author: matthijst
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the 7th time in about as many years and this hotel keeps getting worse. The rooms seem to get dirtier each time we visit. There's a Penn 5000 check in counter that's just never open, so you have to stand in line for an hour, just to check in. Front desk was rude, claimed I didn't have a Penn 5000 room when it clearly stated it on my Expedia reservation, so I guess they don't want you to reserve through another site. The bathroom in the room was disgusting; stain everywhere, so bad my wife cleaned it herself right after check in. I can honestly say: enough is enough, this was the last time we stayed at hotel Pennsylvania.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs, rude management”
Reviews.Author: Kln1130
Reviews.Content: stayed in december2011 room 1570. All was fine, had three bedroom three bathroom suite. At 130am we found bedbugs crawling across two of the beds. Took pics, called manager. Manager came up said he didnt see anything but moved our room anyhow. Had to sleep on roll out cart in a dinky room th at had not beed cleaned, as there was hair in sink and cheerios on floor. It was disgusting. The whole experience was terrible and even though we were downgraded due to bedbugs they refused to give any money back until the exterminator came and would only reimberse us if the bugs were in fact bedbugs. Wouldnt matter if they were ants, fleas or mites, no money back. Ive been coming to new york for years and never had such a crappy experience. DO NOT STAY HERE. Location is great but its not worth it

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!!!!!! DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: Hotelscreener26
Reviews.Content: So we came here on a school trip with 25 high school kids. The first night one of the rooms had be bugs and they had to change rooms at 3 in the morning. A day later they tested the room and it came back positive for bugs. That same next day a girl in our group in the next room had bites and rashes all over her. They were already in a tiny room. They then got moved into a room that couldn't even fit 2 suitcases. We only had 1 towel and we called down. We didn't get them. After calling 5 times and 3 hours later we got towels. This is honestly the grossest hotel. DO NOT COME HERE!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location to explore nyc”
Reviews.Author: mellaanne1
Reviews.Content: Adequate clean no frills, but I would stay again. Make sure to check out well before 12 as they will bill another night if a minute over. 4 dollar charge to hold luggage on arrival before 3pm and that's per bag. Great location just great. Staff were nice I thought.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY!!!! EVER!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TAM_SEB
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here on a shopping Trip and booked before reading these reviews. All I can say is that I am not fussy in the least and wasn't planning on spendnig time in the room (hence us going there for shopping) but what I can say is, pay an extra $50.00 and stay elsewhere. We stayed on the 3rd floor in room 313 - It's haunted and I don't believe in ghosts. The ceiling was hanging off with paint and plaster The Light switches plug sockets are not safe for any human Carpets and bedding smell of mould Bed bugs on my friends bed The bathroom is beyond vile - rust/dirt/stench Noisy from every angle Zero sleep in 3 days and lived on redbull Try to move rooms and that failed Tried to move hotel and that failed I REPEAT DO NOT STAY - WORSE THAN ANYTHING I'VE EVER STAYED IN!

Reviews.Title: “Location +++ Hotel -----”
Reviews.Author: Rititi
Reviews.Content: If it's your first time in New York, I advise you to look for a hotel near the Times Square, where everything happens. This was the main reason why we've chosen Pennsylvania. The hotel is located in front of (literaly!) Penn Station, on the 7th Av. and 10 minutes walking distance from some of the main spots. Regarding the hotel service, if you are looking for a pleasant place, with a nice service and a neat and comfortable room... forget Pennsylvania! We've paid a little more for a room "Penn 5000", with breakfast included, thinking that we would have a bigger room but I can tell you that the only thing big in there was the furniture!
