Furthermore, the breakfast room was a standard room size for, what it seemed to me, a all floor, with only 4 tables... Hotels are expensive in New York, but I can guarantee you that this is not a "great value" for its service, only for its location!

Reviews.Title: “A Good Place to Stay Close to The Action”
Reviews.Author: danielle p
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in Feb of 2011. I had read all the reviews ahead of time and was a bit freaked out. When I got there after a 6 hour plane ride and a motion sick Taxi ride from the airport I was in a bad mood and felt like crap. But I walked in with my bags and did have to wait in line for a while to get my key. I went up to my floor and was a bit freaked out. The hall ways are scary and you think a ghostly little girl will pop out at anytime. I got to my room and it did smell like smoke but I was ok with that seeing as I am a smoker. I checked the sheets and bed for bed bugs and stains and I found none. The bathroom was so so. It was clean but really outdated. The shower had good temp and pressure. The sheets where changed daily and the room cleaned. I had no issue with staying here. I am 26 and have been around the world It was just as good as some of the hostiles I stayed at in downtown paris. I would recomend if you do not mind non flashy things and needed a place to stay that is close,cheap and you wont spend a ton of time in. Nothing wrong with this hotel other then what I said. Yes It does need some help but it is going to be demolished soon sadly :(

Reviews.Title: “OKAY STAY”
Reviews.Author: Meganx33
Reviews.Content: bath room was dirty and there was a whole in the sofa chair that was covered by duck tape... some of the carpet into the bathroom was also ripped up. I was surprised because we were actually UPGRADED! Decent hotel ... great location defiantly! just wish they could fix it up some. However the staff was AWESOME! they were extremely nice and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “LOTS OF ROOM”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer F
Reviews.Content: Hotel Pennsylvania may have some bad reviews, but if you need lots of space for reasonable money you need to reserve one of the suites. My family spent the Thanksgiving Holiday (Wed thru Mon) at the Hotel Pennsylvania in one of the suites and we had lots of room. The suite had one bedroom with queen size bed and full bath, second bedroom had 2 queen size beds and full bath, living room had pull out couch. So you can easy sleep 8 people at one price. Room furnishings are old but if you need a great location without spending a lot of money this is it,and if your in New York to spend too much money on a room don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: IrishAdvisor
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel is a case of "you get what you pay for". First the positives. For a city centre hotel the price is very affordable. The bedroom was fairly clean and comfortable. On the negative side, the bathroom was in much need of a rehaul. The paint was falling off and it was generally very rough around the edges. The shower was an absolute disaster which was constantly dripping even when turned off and when it was turned on it wasn't much better! During peak check in times there is a queue that snakes around the lobby and almost out the door (even though there were about 6 check in desks unused). If you're looking for somewhere cheap and central and you don't intend spending too much time in the hotel then go for it. But if you want to hang around in the hotel or if the weather is really bad then it might be worth your while spending some extra dollars and going with somewhere a little more polished.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and noisy becayse they began to dux simething in the room beside mine too early without any warning”
Reviews.Author: Arzalapataqmepisas
Reviews.Content: Dirty towels Dirty walls Dirty rugs Dirty blankets... And so on

Reviews.Title: “Really not the bad... You don't go to NY to stay in your hotel room.”
Reviews.Author: Lou_Lou84Uk
Reviews.Content: It's really not a bad hotel. Truly!! My parents have stayed here 3 times over the years and wouldn't go anywhere else. I stayed here for the first time this year because it was cheap and i was on a budget. This was not my first time to NY so i had a pretty good idea on the good location this hotel has. I'm not the fussy when it comes to hotels in NY because i know that they are reallly, really expensive...Sometimes even more that the flight i've paid for from the UK. Ok, the room i was in was maybe small and so was the bathroom. But all i use my hotel room for is to sleep, change, wash and keep my luggage there. THAT'S IT!! So it did the job!! I leave my hotel room at 8:30 and return at about 11pm!! It's tidy, clean, sheets and towels replace EVERYDAY and a FANTASTIC LOCATION. 15 min walk to Times Square and about 5-10 minute walk to the Empire State Bulilding and 5th Ave!! Will i stay here again?? HELL YES!!! So if you want to pay more $$$$ for a hotel room that you're hardly going to be in because you're out seeing the sights all day and night then this hotel is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location but low quality rooms”
Reviews.Author: skier872
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the most fantastic location being opposite Madison Square Gardens. It supposedly offers a central location at a reasonable price. We paid $970 for 4 nights. We therefore didn't expect 4 star facilities. In fact, The public foyer is really nice and was brightly decorated for Christmas. It also has a 24 hour coffee bar. We didn't, though, expect airport like queues on arrival to check in. Neither did we expect to be told that as we were one hour early we would have to pay €4 for each bag stored for that period. Luckily, the receptionist took pity on us and we were given access to our rooms. This is when reality hit. The rooms have more of a feeling of a hostel than a hotel. They are dark, with little natural light, decorated in shades of brown and furnished with items that looked as though they had been purchased from the local second hand store. The bathroom was truly awful. The bath had been so well scrubbed that large chunks of enamel were missing. However, in contrast, they did supply an array of lotions and shampoos. It also didn't feel very clean. However, we spent very little time in the room so it was fine. I do think there must be something that offers better value for money in the same vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I was expecting”
Reviews.Author: Mattlangton
Reviews.Content: Right then, after booking this hotel in August for November this gave me plenty of time to read the reviews and to be honest I was dreading it. To my delight it couldn't of been more opposite,check in was fast and efficient,we were booked into room 987 (remember this) and the room was clean and tidy. Massive bed!!! Also had a view of the empire state. The window outside was a little dirty but I could live with that. Bed sheets and towels were changed everyday. The bathroom had the odd chipped enamel in the bath and the odd flake of paint on the ceiling but again I could live with that. There was no mould or bed bugs anywhere. So if you are reading this wondering what to do all I can say is that if you have room 987 then I can't see why you would be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Pay the extra $ and stay elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: DivaBach
Reviews.Content: Mold on the bathroom ceiling. Dark hallways that clearly have not seen the inside of a paint can in years. Dated, shabby rooms. For $200 plus per night, we could have stayed at the Y and had a better experience. I will say that the maids were nice. The people behind the desk were rude. JUst don't do it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Its all about the location!”
Reviews.Author: samtogo
Reviews.Content: Stayed five nights in a delux double just last week with my sister.I have stayed in many hotels around the world (mainly five star) and as I have stayed in this hotel on four previous occasions I knew exactly what to expect. Picture the hotel in the Shining and your not far off that! Carpet is disgusting and is a brownish colour in all the rooms that I have stayed in. The reason why I return to this hotel is not the quality but for location, its close to everything and you barely see your room when in nyc as its constant go go go. The bed was a big king size bed and was cleaned daily (however I do bring my own pillow cases and sheets from Macy's), room did smell badly of cigaretts but managed to open the window to let in some air, bathroom cleaned daily. Not really a lot more to say on this hotel other than I would return only for location and convenience, so if you do decide to book this hotel DON'T expect anythying great just place to rest the head while in NYC! You get what you pay for and I like to spend my dough shopping!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: EG625
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a week and was really pleased. Sure, the hotel could do with a lick of paint and new carpets but the rooms and bathrooms were clean and very comfortable. I was so relieved after reading all the horrible reviews of the hotel on here, but it really is not that bad! I think people are expecting the Ritz or something - um, this hotel is cheap and right in the middle of Manhattan - what on earth are people expecting??!!!! If you want a 5* hotel in the centre of town then pay the price. I was actually really angry with the bad reviews as it made me really dread my trip to NY and i have never been so relieved as when i turned up and saw my room - it was really ok! I also managed to see into a couple of the other rooms when the cleaning staff were working and they looked really nice, again clean and dare i say it, for NY, almost spacious! Staff weren't overly friendly but were efficient and at the end of the day i'm not looking for them to be my friend but to deliver good customer service which they did. Trust me i have stayed in FAR worse in NY and would stay at the Hotel Pennsylvania again in a heartbeat. Only tip, avoid checking in during peak hours - i arrived at 9pm and sailed through but did notice the queue could get quite long. However this only seemed to be when a huge coach trip had arrived which any hotel would struggle with.

Reviews.Title: “Very shabby”
Reviews.Author: Trudi58
Reviews.Content: Stayed here end of October 2011 - took a long time to check in - the original room we were given was tiny and dark - the bed was a small double and quite wobbly on its legs - the bathroom was not good at all, it didn't even have a toilet seat let alone a shower curtain! I returned to reception to ask for a rooom change and was asked to come back tomorrow after mid-day - although this was a major inconvenience in view of the fact that we had limited time in New York I decided that I would. After an even longer wait at reception I was finally given an upgrade to a much better room - it was larger and brighter with a large kingsize bed - however it was not particularly clean and very shabby decor wise to say the least. The entire hotel could do with major redecoration, particularly the bathrooms. Having said all that it is in a brilliant location.

Reviews.Title: “Miserable experience”
Reviews.Author: believememyfriend
Reviews.Content: The only positive about this hotel is the location. (literally steps away from Madison S.G.) I went this past summer to stay here for a few days and it was probably the worst hotel experience I've ever had. The beds were uncomfortable and everything seemed kind of dirty and old. Not worth the headaches. I was on a strict budget so this was the cheapest I could find, but was still expensive for what it is

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Pennsylvania, NYC, Looks are Deceiving”
Reviews.Author: jjohnson76
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in the Hotel Pennsylvania on October 25th, 2011. I was attending the Duran Duran concert at Madison Square Garden that night. I went on-line and searched several hotels in the area. The hotel room was about 280.00 plus tax and it came to about 335.00 with tax. I thought that was a little pricey, but compared to others in the area it was the cheapest.I figured it is NYC and close to many tourist attractions. I also picked it because it was close to the concert and for the train to head back up-state. When I first entered the lobby there was a huge line for check-in. I think my friend and I waited about 30 minutes. The lobby area was busy and seemed nice.It probably was the best part. There was a lot of people sitting around waiting. We finally checked-in and were sent to the 12th floor. Once we got the 12th floor it became very dark and dingy looking. The doors were these huge former bank vaults from like 1919. Sure, that was cool, but try opening it over and over. They weighed a ton! We finally got our our room, 1256. It was like a cave! It was dark, old, musty, and just plain ugly. The room needed up updates for sure. The carpet had a lot of mysterious stains. The first thing we did was check the bed for bed bugs. It was ok, but I heard others were not so lucky. The bed was hard. I like a firm bed, but this was like concrete and very low. I did not sleep well. The bathroom was small and I did not want to touch floor. It had some various hairs laying around etc. The toilet and shower were close making for sitting on the toilet a tight fit. The view was into what seemed to be more hotel rooms. I just feel that this hotel that is a bit out-dated and for the money they should really do some up-dates to 2011-2012. We were invited to the club room/lounge and that was where we had breakfast. They had bagels, muffins and coffee in a small room with like a lot of people. This hotel was just ok for a 1 night stay if your just going to a concert or something near by. If I was a foreigner who saved up a lot of money to come to NYC and I was staying here, I would be really really disappointed. If you are staying longer in NYC, I would try something else like the Marriott or Doubletree mid-town. I stayed at those as well for a weekend trip and they were better. We checked out around 11.a.m and wandered around the city till our train. For an extra 4 dollars you can keep your bags in the basement luggage room, which was helpful so we didn't have to carry our bags around the city til our train. I guess I like more up-dated modern hotels, and this was just dark, old and lacked something. The lobby, the website make it look really nice, but once you get there.. it looks very different. So, be careful, research and remember you always get what you pay for, well sometimes.

Reviews.Title: “A dump in the centre of new York”
Reviews.Author: malcolmd9427
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed in this dump The lobby is the best part of the hotel The bathrooms are not fit for a pig. The paintwork was all peeling off. The bath was rusty and the shower curtain was just about to fall of. The bedroom the carperts were all stained. Not even talking about the filthy bed covers. In the 5 days we stayed in the hotel the carperts were never vacumed. This place need a good makeover or needs to be removed from the NY skyline If you are looknig for budget I am sure you can find better and cleaner

Reviews.Title: “Grand old Dame does the trick!!”
Reviews.Author: samoasal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pennsylvania 20 & 21 October en route to the Caribbean from Australia, and again overnight on way back.I wanted to have a look at New York city! This hotel reminds me of a grand old dame! Look it is a wonderful old hotel of the Big Band era, and I loved the architecture, lobby etc. The staff were helpful and the rooms although they are not flash and are a bit tired (carpets and bathroom in particular) .... the bed was big and comfortable, the room was very clean and had a TV and the shower was hot and worked beautifully! The location is perfect and you can walk to Broadway Theatres in a 12 minute stroll! If you are looking for big flash rooms then you are going to pay big dollars! Cost here was perfect! By the way great food at the Carnegie deli on 7th Ave near 55th street. Loved their Red Velvet cake ... delicious!!! but the sandwiches are far too big 6 inches high!

Reviews.Title: “hotel penn is awful”
Reviews.Author: jeffery e
Reviews.Content: check in took forever hardly anyone speaks perfect english, the place is falling apart aside from the lobby which is the only decent part of the hotel. our room was not ready 30 mins after check in time so they had to give us another one that apparently a blind person cleaned bc it was disgusting. used soap left in the shower, hair on the floor and toilet seat. blankets had hard crusty parts on them. The only nice people there were the men in the basement who hold your bags before check in. worst hotel ive ever stayed in and i am a poor community college student the location is good thou but not that good

Reviews.Title: “Be advised”
Reviews.Author: Trerob626
Reviews.Content: If you stay here make sure that you only stay or request the 12th floor or a suite! I left my boyfriend in the first room we were given by a rude front desk Asian man to switch rooms and he was scared in that tiny smoked scented rat hole (requested non-smoking) anywho a very nice Hispanic lady offered me and upgrade which I had to pay almost $200 more for the 6 days we stayed, the room was way nicer still small but felt more safe. The location is ideal walking distance from time square Penn station Madison square garden rocefeller center and the empire state building.

Reviews.Title: “BEST LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: kateefc
Reviews.Content: Right in middle 5 mins to walk from time square 2 mins from 5th avenue main bus stop for tours opposite hotel is old but clean, at end of day you only sleep there and rooms were clean had sky tv in them hot water big beds what more you need view from our room empire state building amazing at night defo stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: daren777
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel to be an excellent location but in complete need of a refurbishment and a good clean. For the price paid, there are much better Manhattan hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Mold infested and horrible, rude service”
Reviews.Author: CCMOH
Reviews.Content: If this site would let me, I'd post a picture of the black mold on the ceiling and the hole in the wall. The carpet was ripped and rumpled. Check-in tool 50 minutes and he front desk workers were rude and incompetent.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location but tired old hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Walkonthebeachslow
Reviews.Content: We stayed mid November tired old hotel but clean sheets on bed. Bathroom had hair on floor and bath was chipped and flakey. Shower was hot and soap and towels were plentiful. Location was fab, times square and Madison square garden. Penn station and 5th avenue. Staff were rude and unhelpful so get a thicker skin quick.

Reviews.Title: “Don't worry it is fine”
Reviews.Author: missylyons
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here and had no problems at all. The room was clean, bed very ,and comfortable check in was 10 min. The location was great , your right by the subway so you can get anywere in manhattan fast .Macy's is just a 2 min walk along with lots of other shopping. We had a penn 5000 room so we had a mini fridge and breakfast. The breakfast was bagel , cream cheese, mini muffins , danishes, orange juice, coffee, tea and apples. The penn room was open 24hrs with coffee which was very handy .The room could use new carpet , draps nothing was wrong with them just old and outdated but other then that it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting beyond belief”
Reviews.Author: Debbie B
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Pennsylvania. I was so disappointed. After saving for a vacation, looking at the hotel pictures of a nice hotel, it was beyond belief that this place is open to the public. I have never stayed in a place so dirty. The paint is falling off the walls. The lights had no light bulbs. The furniture was broken and missing drawers. The hotel smelled of cigarette smoke everywhere. I did not even dare walk barefoot in the room. I am so disappointed that this hotel uses its nice lobby to lure people in. I felt like I had stepped into a horror movie.

Reviews.Title: “Pennsylvannia Hotel and Hotel.com”
Reviews.Author: Ana Teresa N
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation at Hotel.Com for Hotel Pennsylvannia NY for the period of 10/07/2011 thru 10/13/2011 and it was charged to my credit card. When my wife and I arrived at Hotel Pennsylvannia the room we got was incredibily dirty, the toilet seat was dirty (having still toilet paper inside the toilet), the bed was not changed and besides the walls were peeling away and dirty, the closet was full of mould, the wall paper was very very dirty, the electric wires was exposed, etc., etc. We immediately complained with the management and they gave us another even worse dirty room as all can see by the photos in attached. Again we talked to the manager of Hotel Pennsylvania who said there was no clean room avaiable and that we would have to to wait until past mid-day of the next day so he would try to get us a clean and a better room. How is possible not to have a clean room if I had booked the hotel (through Hotel.Com) months in advance and everything was paid in full? Not to mention that we expend around four hours going from one dirty room to another dirty room carrying our suitcases (because they didn't have anyone to do this for us at that time) and after a long flight needind a shower, etc. So, we tried to use the telephone in order to make a reservation in some other hotel and the telephone of the room wasn't working. Again, we went downstairs to use a computer from a internet room, paid the use for it, made a reservation in another hotel (obviously talking to the Hotel Pennsylvania manager first), and we left for a decent and clean hotel. We contacted Hotel.Com and told them everything (probably they recorded every phone call), and they told us they would reimburse only part of it, which they did. How can they charge for one night if they had no clean room for us? Wasn't our fault, we made a reservation, paid in advance and full, showed up on the day we said we would, but they had no clean room. ...Again, obviously the responsibility for all of this wasn't mine, Hotel Pennsylvannia and Hotel.Com are the ones responsible because they charged for a service they didn't provided. I want full reimbursement because besides that, we spend money with a cab to another hotel), we spend money with internet, we spend money with another hotel (was expensive as we did'nt have time to check prices in diferent hotels), not counting the emotional distress we had with all of this. As I said before, attached you will find photos of the dirty room they gave us. It speakes for itselves.

Reviews.Title: “What a grand but sad hotel”
Reviews.Author: Benwifey
Reviews.Content: We were wary about staying here after reading the reviews online,but we found the hotel brilliant excellent location, the room was cleaned everyday the only problems we could see was the decor was very tired it needed updating the staff were very helpful and the hotel has a lot of history it seems a shame that the decor and furnishings let it down, we would still go back anyway ideal for the location and price

Reviews.Title: “Awful Service after 27hrs of travel”
Reviews.Author: i_an_outtathaway
Reviews.Content: We had a group of seven people stay at Hotel Pennsylvania from for two nights We had two rooms book, 4 people in one room and 3 people in the other room. We checked it after 27hrs hours of traveling at 1am and of course were exhausted and the lady at the counter had no idea what she was doing. She was completely confused and so were we. It took well over 30mins to check in. She took our passports and had to keep doing the same thing with them because she was distracted and wasn't paying attention as she was partly on the phone while checking us in. It wasn’t busy; we were the only ones there so she has no excuse for being incompetent. They rooms we booked were not cleaned so they gave us an extra room. (I don’t understand why the room was not ready when we arrived at 1am in the morning, there should have been ample time to get it ready). She didn't tell us where to go or what level we were on. We got to the rooms and there was only enough beds for 6 people, not 7. We had to check each room, all in different levels lugging our luggage around to try and find which room had the extra bed hidden. Eventually we gave up and didn't want to go complain because she was useless. Three of us just slept in the king bed for both nights. The other thing was our window was open so our room was freezing as it was about to snow the next day. We got three keys for one of the rooms and two of them didn't work and the door wouldn't shut properly so this was another inconvenience. I also asked the lady at check in if there would be any charge or on hold money when she took our credit card numbers. She said no. One of the cards got charged $40 and has been returned to her now but I was charged $267.70 and it has not been returned. I called the accountants twice now and no one can tell me why I was charged this amount. It's a very random number, when we checked out they said there was no extra charges for extra services. We were very unhappy with our stay at Hotel Pennsylvania and higher standards were expected of the hotel and hope that no one else has to go through what we did.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome spot”
Reviews.Author: JenMer1
Reviews.Content: The bad reviews put me off this place, but honestly, it was fine. We actually spent quite a bit of time in the hotel room resting our sore feet after walking all over Manhattan (and even to Brookylyn one day). The location is superb - close to Times Square (which was so touristy), Empire State Building and the Flatiron District as well as Rockerfeller Centre and Central Park. Being near Penn Station meant the subway was an easy and convenient way to get around. Long queues at the desk moved quickly and we didn't have to wait more than 10 minutes at a time (we chose our times well, not when the rush was on) and the people at the counters were polite, though not overly friendly, but that was fine. They did what they had to do quickly for us. The sheets were clean and we had fresh towels everyday. The room was a bit shabby and had seen better days, but we had a fridge and TV and a tired, but adequate bathroom. We were upgraded (to what we weren't sure - possibly to the king-sized bed) and the bed we had was super comfy. It was a little expensive, but we did only book the week before we were in NYC. All in all it was fine and all we needed!!

Reviews.Title: “Cold sweat...”
Reviews.Author: ZipcodeFrance
Reviews.Content: OMG that was the worst possible experience and I didn't even stay in the place! I had booked in for two nights and by the time I had checked out my room for 30 seconds, I was out in a cold sweat and had to cancel my room and ask for a refund. There was no way I could spend a night there. After the 20 minute queue for check in that made me feel I was at a railway station, the sourness of the reception staff, the elevators that kept taking me into the crypts, the miles of dark laberynth to get to my room, the unexpected prison door to actually get into my cell, it was doomed before it started...Once inside, the panic remained. A dirty walls, midget bed, a cold 1920's bathroom with a dripping tap, cracked bath with no enamel...In brief, I just wanted out...Be warned!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - lousy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jason B
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night on a very short business trip. This was one of the worst hotels I have stayed in for many years. they put me in a disgusting smelling smoking room and said they had no alternatives when I asked to change. The decor was very poor, ceiling tiles hanging down, paint peeling, bath enamel cracked and missing, shower dripped all night and couldn't be shut off, tap was loose in sink and the list just goes on and on. There was mould in the bathroom, but the room itself wasn't actually dirty. Don't expect to able to find your room easily either. The floor layout is labyrinthine and signage is very poor. TV worked but the remote didn't. The room was on the 7th floor and there was constant noise from traffic going over some kind of noisy grille outside. Bed sheets didn't fit the bed properly and if I hadn't just got off a plane from London I doubt I would have got any sleep at all. The longest wait in line I had on the whole trip was to check in for this dump of a hotel. Staff were brusque. Location was very convenient but I won't be returning here.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place ever”
Reviews.Author: Krissy M
Reviews.Content: I needed a place to stay for one night just to sleep. I looked at all the reviews, good and bad and understood that it was an old place and figured we would take it as it was. We had to stand online for over 20 minutes just to check in. We went up to our room and felt like we were in a horror movie walkign off the elevator. The hallway looked creepy and very un welcoming. We got into our room and it was very dim and there were marks all over the walls. The bathroom light flickered on and was no better. It seemed like it hasn't been updated since it opened. The bathroom door could barely close also, and the handle was falling off. The heat and ac did not work since we woke up with the room being ridiculously hot. The bed was so uncomfortable and had a sore back from it. The cleanign lady tried getting in our room around 9:15 am which check out is 12 so there is no reason why they should have been trying to get in. I also found a pair of dusty glasses under the desk, which did not belong to my boyfriend or me so it shows how much they don't clean. Would not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Just Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Jayden S
Reviews.Content: I went on a short 5 day trip with some friends and we booked the Penn as it had a central location (although went back 3 months later and stayed at Hilton a few blocks away). The lobby of the Hotel is probably the nicest part of it. The room's were outdated infact only one of our lamps worked so it got pretty dark in there. The beds were very uncomfortable and the bathroom was a state. Personally I think it needs a complete rennovation - I would be happy to may more for better quality!

Reviews.Title: “To everyone, their own.”
Reviews.Author: Johnthe5
Reviews.Content: Straight up you get what you pay for. Room is actually decent for a single bed room, aside from outdated bathroom, its still clean. We read reviews first, were very weary, checked the bed for bed bugs as soon as we came in, none of course. Idk if these otherpeople were expecting a hotel with a 5 star rating and gourmet restaurants, but its very clear this hotel is older and even if its to save money it embraces some of its history. Kinda cool. Were from vegas, use to excellent service and immaculate rooms, but I can't find a reason to say this place is nasty or horrible. I have bad asthma was scared after some reviews but nothing out of ordinary, the only negatives I can point out is the heat/ac is super old and probably doesn't work properly, and the walls seem thin at times. I didn't come to sit in my room so I don't mind. Bed is clean and comfy, water is hot, tv works, has iron etc. its an average room. Location is EXCELLENT. DO NOT pay to eat here, ridiculous, you can go to a number of places right outside for les then half. Pretty happy, I would come back just for the convenience and price. Only posted bc so many negatives and its really not horrible.

Reviews.Title: “First and Last time”
Reviews.Author: ReviewerO
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the nice look of the hotel from the outside or its lobby. Everything but the location was terrible. As soon as we stepped off the elevator to our floor, there was the smell of cigarette smoke. It didn't go away when we entered our Non Smoking room. The pictures of the rooms on the site were Nothing like it looked. The entire room was old and worn. The floor had thin carpet that felt hard like concrete, there were wires coming out of the walls, the bathroom paint was peeling everywhere, the tub was molding and dirty, the sheets smelled of cigarette smoke, the pillows were so flat it felt like you weren't laying on anything, there was so much outside noise I couldn't fall asleep until 3 am. The bolt on the door was broken. Was told this was a 3 star hotel, but it was more like a 1 star for me. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Just Awful”
Reviews.Author: Optimize_Marketing
Reviews.Content: If I could give this place a zero, I would. When you first walk to your room, you feel like you're in a time warp as you walk down the halls. You open the door, and your first reaction is "I finally booked a place that feels like I'm homeless". Teeny room with a rock hard bed, with fixtures and painting of 50 years past. The TV is definitely from 30 years ago, as I remember these TVs vividly when I was a boy. You get scared right away, and immediately check for bed bugs, which I did not find (or were aware of). I was most incensed when I checked out. In order to have them store your bags, you have to stand in the check-in line, so that you can pay the $4 per bag for them to store them for you. The line was an hour long because of their poor service at the front desk. I have previously never had to pay for bag storage, nor stand in line at the registration desk to do so. Most of the staff is apathetic, although I found a few that were really nice. They mentioned customer horror stories of bed bugs and stained sheets. They mentioned to write a letter to Jim Flynn, the General Manager, if I want to send some feedback, which I will. The best thing going for Hotel Pennsylvania is location, and low prices. Both of which are difficult to beat in New York City. I think that's why the hotel is very busy.

Reviews.Title: “The truth about Club Penn 5000. Avoid shuttle, it's not reliable”
Reviews.Author: avri
Reviews.Content: Starting in this that the hotel, provide service of transportations to the airports. When all is ok, there is not a problem but otherwise there is none responsibility. always the others are responsible (Supershuttle or the hotel service). To make a long story short, we lost the money that we paid to the hotel for the transportation because they register us to JFK instead of to NEWARK and we have to take a taxi. There was tries to solve the problem but when we so that there was a bunch of stories we did not take a chance. Avoid shuttle, it's not reliable. The hotel offers rooms of Club Penn 5000 that are more expensive. The impression that was created is that rooms are better rooms. The truth is that they are normal rooms that added to them refrigerator and possibility to connect from the room to Internet (extra charge). Likewise is offered a continental breakfast at one of the rooms of the hotel that turns to the a club penn 5000 lounge there are in him about 5 tables for about 3 people to eat beside them. obviously the morning is crowded . Many take the coffee (after the staying the line) and the pastry and leave or concede on breakfast. In the rest of the day there is a hot free drinks and possibility to surf on the internet from 2 computers that are in this room (free). Is this worth the differences of the price? In our opinion, not. In spite of all the complaints, the hotel is situated best in Manhattan and with recipients a reasonable and quiet room it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff, OK room = Very good”
Reviews.Author: Volle1953
Reviews.Content: You stay neer everything... This is a great location. The staff is friendly and helpfull. The rooms are old but OK. The front desk can be busy. All in all my rating will be "Very good" and I will go there again.

Reviews.Title: “NOT as bad as other reviews.”
Reviews.Author: Luke G
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel for 6 nights from October 26 2011. Having read the reviews on here I was really concerned that the hotel was going to be awful and was ready on arrival to complain and request other rooms. On arrival the check in took 15 minutes, all of the desks were open and the line (around 40 people) moved very quickly. I have stayed in many other cities and hotels and have waited much longer. The lifts where fine, they were all in working order and we never had to wait during our 6 night stay. On leaving the lifts the floors were very dated. It would not be fair to say they are dirty; they are old and do need renovating but our floor was cleaned each day (we saw this several times) and was fine - not good but fine. We stayed on the 15th floor - the hotel has 18 floors in total - which avoided much of the noise issues but we could still hear alot of noise if the window was open so we went crazy and shut the window at night. The room was clean and tidy however it was old, needed refurbishment and had seen much better days. The paint on the walls was cracked and the bath room needs a refit. HOWEVER we could not find any bugs, dirt, mold or any of the other things listed in other reviews in our room. The TV worked fine, the sheets on the beds were clean and fresh and the towels in the room were also clean (and all were white so everything would of shown up). The matress on the bed was new as where two of the units in the room. Everyday during our stay the room was cleaned (and hovered), the beds made and fresh towels provided. Each door to the room is getting on for 100 years old - each has a sign to prove that they where fitted in 1919 - but ours was secure and could not be breached (we tried as we had read a review that here that said differently). During our stay we felt safe in every part of the hotel that we went to. The staff we spoke to where helpful and we got the impression like they knew about the press the hotel gets and were doing the best they could with what they have which is a very old building that has not had any investment. Where we were at the recepion we saw several people who were making comments about the rooms they were in and each was offered another room without question - I have stayed in other hotel where best offer I got was a refund and had to find another place to stay. I slept fine each night; the location was really good - as most people have said. To sum up; if you wish to stay in a hotel that is modern, newly built and has top features then book into a 4 or 5 star hotel and pay the extra cash. This is a two star hotel and gives a two star service. Yes it needs a serious amount of money spending on it to bring it up to moden standards and I am sure there are rooms that are awful but our stay was fine. Being perfectly honest, this hotel was 20% cheeper than any other we found in the same area and I would much sooner save the money to spend on seeing NYC. And despite the condition of the room we were in it for less than 7 hours a day which was spent sleeping - if you go to NY for the hotel room then stay at home; it is a truly fantastic city and needs to be seen. One final point - if you are traveling as a group (4 or more) I would consider renting an appartments - costs are about the same but you will get more for your money - I would do this if I went to NY again.

Reviews.Title: “budget hotel very central located”
Reviews.Author: traveladdictedBankok
Reviews.Content: five nights in NY could be very expensive, but the Penn is the perfect place to stay. Is a big hotel more than 1000 rooms ( I guess), I booked the 5000 pen with breakfast included. The room was quiet tiny for the no-european standard, but confortable.: two single beds, closet with iron board and a lot of space for luggage, sat tv, bathroom with tube.....everything do you need after a busy day between shops and museum. The breakfast was served in a room: coffe, thea, bagles, muffin, jam...everything you need to satrt a new day!!! I think that in NY is better to save money for shopping( a lot of shopping) so Penn hotel is THE PLACE! the location is perfect, few block from Time Square, I've never use the metro ( I prefer to walk or call a cab) but there is the metro station in fron of the hotel. The room was clean and the amenities good. I'll come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Please Dont Be Worried - It's OK”
Reviews.Author: Lisa D
Reviews.Content: God............i dont know where to start, other than reading these reviews worried the life out of me, to the point i had reviewed other hotels nearby in case this was actually the hell hole people made it out to be. We arrived last Thursday at 3pm, it took 40 mins to check in. We were greeted by George, who was very friendly. We asked for a room on a high floor (to try and avoid the traffic noise) and one with a view - we were given room 1513. Now ok, the room wasnt draped in silk, but it was more than ok. The room was spacious and very clean (not a bed bug in site) the bathroom was a decent size with soaps, shampoo and kleenex tissues for our use. The hot water was plentiful, if anything there was too much of it. The bed was the same size as a uk double, quite firm but comfy. You only get 1 pillow each, but you only need to ask and you can get more. Tip - take ear plugs - you are in New York and the 'whoop whoopin' sirens (which i enjoyed) will wake you even on the high floors - but really.......what do you expect............this is not the countryside. The Wifi is only available in the lobby (reception). $2 for 30 mins, $3 for an hour and $6 for 12 hours. I used this service without any problems and was able to skype home for a fraction of what a normal phone call would be. Just be aware that it can be busy so if you are skyping take a usb phone to cut down on the lobby noise. The location of this hotel is fantastic. We were able to walk to most places of interest to us, and to be honest the only time we got a taxi is when time was getting short. I would strongly recommend everyone to check out the New York Pass website. I can honestly say, it saved us a fortune, but also opened up other tourist attractions which we hadnt originally thought of doing. New York itself is a wonderful place to explore and you will make many great memories there........if you feel you have found yourself a bargain on booking, then you probably have. We paid 382 GBP for 3 nights and would and will go back again. Tip - there are 4 (very) local bars that i recommend for both food and drink starting closest first :- Blarney Rock (out the front of hotel, turn right and first right100 yrds) Stout - next door to Blarney Rock - free Wifi here. Mustang Harrys - (out of front of hotel, turn left, about 300 yrds) Mustang Sallys - bout 10 doors down from Harrys. Think its always good to know what it on your doorstep. The hubby has just reminded me to mention that if you dont have a New York Pass then avoid the New York Skyride (situated in the Empire State Building) - waste of time and money. Also, if you dont want to miss any premiership football games, its good to know that the 'legends bar' is only a 5 minute walk from the hotel. (out the front door, turn right and right again) walk to the Empire State is on your left and Legends is opposite. They open at daft o'clock. We were there at 7am on Saturday morning!!!! Tip - 9/11 memorial was a very humbling experience On a last note - please dont let the paintwork of this hotel upset your stay here

Reviews.Title: “A hole”
Reviews.Author: kaj98
Reviews.Content: This is a hole. A disgusting, filthy hole - going into the room was like entering a tomb. If you want to experience the worst scenario after you die - try this before you die. $300.00 a night for a crypt. They should be shut down immediately and the owners put in jail.

Reviews.Title: “no smoke alarm”
Reviews.Author: Paul K
Reviews.Content: i regret not taking notice of these reviews on here,thought people were being to fussy but it's a discgrace. shower tray was black, electric socket was cracked, no smoke alarm in room, tried to call reception no one answered. the staff seemed lazy and had a could not careless attitude,charged four dollars per bag to store luggage paid $239 per night what a rip off for single room, but didn't let these b*****ds ruin my stay i enjoyed it inspite of them not because of them.

Reviews.Title: “Good Old Hotel Pennsylvania”
Reviews.Author: Traveljunkie72
Reviews.Content: I have always found this hotel ideal for me as a businessman being that it is central to both work and leisure. Mass transit is at your fingertip. The staff although always very busy is quite accommodating. Although the entire building could do with a complete carpet overhaul, it's a nice place situated in the heart of mid-town NYC, no wonder I've been in and out of that place for more than 15 years.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: lovemexico33
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and the only good thing about it is the location - right across the street from Madison Square gardens...come on now! I absolutely love NYC, if you're looking for a place to hang your hat and just sleep/shower/change than this is your hotel. Do not expect any luxurious because you will not find it here. The bathrooms are an absolute joke (what is wrong with the shower curtain??). I would not stay here again. Happy Travels!

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: nilsonjunior
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 14th and it was recently renewed. No complains about it, it's not a great hotel for the price you pay, but I had a good stay in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Think carefully!”
Reviews.Author: Becky W
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a trip to NY staying at the Pennsylvania . I knew beforehand that it was a 3 star and that it was an average price. The 4 start hotels seemed a lot more expensive. First impressions were ok, very helpful man checked us in and said he would find us a nice room. He found it difficult to see on his comouters which rooms had been cleaned! As we approcahed our room on the 9th floor we were met with a disgusting patterened carpet that was disgiused by dim brown lighting. The room was very small with a carpet that you wouldn't want to walk on in bare feet! The beds were rickety and if you sat on one side they collapsed, the sheets were washed but did not fit the bed, therefore not tucked in and a furry cover that had obviously not been washed! I am convinced there was evidence of bed bugs and I am sure there were other creatures! The curtains were brown and dismal and hanging on. The windows had not been cleaned in year sand you didn't want to go near them. The paint was coming off the walls, there were cracks and water stains. The air conditioning system had so much dust in it that I woke up with breatihng difficulties, sore throat and a cold. This cleared as soon as we were outside! But the worst room was the bathroom, the bath was unusable its enamel was peeling, it was stained, no plug and the overflow was missing and there was just a huge hole. The shower and taps were rusted and falling apart. The tiles had not been cleaned and the floor tiles were grimey. We poiltely complained and they moved us without question to floor 17, this room was much better as it was larger, however it was still disgustingly unclean. I am not sure what the cleaners do in this hotel! In hindsight we should have moved again but not sure whether it got any better! However the Hotel is well situated in the heart of Manhatten you could walk everywhere and Penn station is on the doorstep. If you really only wanted to sleep in the hotel it was probably bearable. But on no account would I stay there again or reccommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “a hotel for travelers, not tourists”
Reviews.Author: seeker
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just fine and served its purpose. We got a cheap package deal; the price was right and the location is perfect, right smack dab Midtown with subway stops steps away. I imagine this hotel was quite grand in its day. The building has been declared a historical landmark (to prevent tear-down) but so far none have stepped up to put $$$ into it for renovation. Yeah, our room was shabby, the baseboards were scuffed, the bathroom lavatory was missing a leg but so what. Everything was clean and the bed was comfortable. Nary a bedbug to be found. The shower was forceful with plenty of hot water and our room, located at the rear of the hotel was blessedly quiet. I'd stay here again for sure. It had a pleasant haunted vibe and the staff provided good service.

Reviews.Title: “Stepping back in time”
Reviews.Author: gary e
Reviews.Content: We booked last minute and the price was ok. We arrived at 9pm and found check in empty and modern , no problem. Stepping out of the lift was like going back in time, paint peeling old carpet and plaster falling off the walls. The doors are original 1916 but been fitted with modern card readers, stepping thru the door reveals a dated tired room in desperate need of a revamp.The room was small and so were the "double"beds.On the up side we had clean sheets and the beds were made each day,the towels were clean each day and there was always hot water . The location is fantastic and the staff were very helpful. With a lick of paint it could be so much betterbut you do get what you pay for. Last point walls are thin and New york is loud all night1

Reviews.Title: “How is this hotel still allowed to operate?”
Reviews.Author: 360Marie
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe that this place is still allowed to operate. Damp, old, oppresive....AC flithy, could not close window (broken hinge). Outlets hanging from wall. Hot water is hit and miss, cleanliness of bathroom is very questionable. The cracked tiles in the shower really added to its ambiance. Never removed my shoes, no main light in room - and I had one of the upgraded rooms......had originally 2 nights booked, moved out after first night. A lot of foreign toursits staying at the hotel and if this is their first impression of the US - what an awful representation of the US and New York it is making. Considering all the health and safety regulations we have I do wonder how this place has an operating license.

Reviews.Title: “Remember - you get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: SelSurrey
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my son for 3 nights, on a quick break to NYC - just back today. Unlike most others reviewing here, I've got positive things to say. The staff at both check in and check out were extremely accommodating and pleasant, as were the guys in the luggage room ($4 per bag to leave). The queue at check in was short - perhaps 3 minutes' wait. Our room was on the 13th floor and was a good size, with a fully operational flat screen TV, a window that opened, 2 large and comfortable double beds and clean sheets. The bathroom was clean, the towels, replaced each day, were plentiful and not old or worn. Granted, one wall of the room was scratched and needed a coat of paint but everything, from lights to hairdryer, worked. As for noise, the only disturbance was distant traffic noise - I'd expect that in this fantastic, central location. This is a 2 star hotel in the middle of a very expensive city. You get what you pay for and my expectations of the hotel were not anything grand at all. I would have complained if the room was dirty or if something didn't work, but that was not the case at all. And the location really can't be bettered.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, not great hotel”
Reviews.Author: melerom
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Penn and the location is great! You are across from madison square garden and extremely close to subway access. From the outside the hotel looks nice and fun. The lobby is rather large and nice as well. As soon as you leave the main floor, the true colors of the hotel come out. The floors look like a scene from a haunted movie and this hotel really does need to be renovated. The rooms are tiny and the beds are small as well. The floor is dirty and the bathroom is old and can use a remodel. At night time you can hear the sounds of rats and mice in the walls and my friend and i had a hard time sleeping a few of the nights. I definitely recommend staying somewhere else for the price as we then switched hotels eventually to somewhere in lower manhattan and had a WAY better room that was updated.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as these reviews suggest”
Reviews.Author: rgehring
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 1111. I suggest you request this room and you won't be as upset as some of these reviewers seem to be with their rooms. Was it high end, no, but this is the cheapest hotel in NYC and you get what you pay for. They may be tearing it down when the economy gets better to build a high rise office building, so they are no longer investing in the property. My bedding was clean, I had a view of Macy's, the Chrysler building, the Pan Am (Metlife) building, etc.... My window opened. I had one of the best selections of channels on a hotel TV I have seen in quite sometime. Never heard a peep out of anyone from hallways, etc.... This was one of the 5000 club rooms, and perhaps it is worth the upgrade. Check in took me 5 minutes, clerk was very friendly. Location could not be beat. Compared to most hotels in the states, this place is a dump, but average for the city. Those who rate this a one should stay in a nicer hotel and they would be happier. I stayed October 20th thru the 24th, for 4 nights. Jay Kerch

Reviews.Title: “GROSS!”
Reviews.Author: LizABC
Reviews.Content: The only beneficial thing about this hotel is the location. Other than that, there's mold on the walls of the bathroom, the air conditioning/ heater is broken, you have to figure out the hot water on the knob of the shower, if not it comes out cold (turn it little by little till you find the hot water or you might miss it), there's flying insects coming out of the drain.... definitely not worth the 230.00 a night. I rather pay 400 a night for a hotel that probably won't give me an infection.

Reviews.Title: “Tired.”
Reviews.Author: TylerOnTheRoad
Reviews.Content: It's not as bad as most say. My room was old and tired and that's it. It was large for an NYC hotel room but in need of an update for sure. Looks like the spent all their money on the front desk. If your expectations are in line with NYC prices you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Won't return, won't recommend!”
Reviews.Author: crazy_rachie
Reviews.Content: We went on a trip round the USA in August for a month and crammed quite alot in, we stayed here for 5 nights in the middle of our stay. Firstly I have to say the location was good for us, right opposite Penn station and about four blocks (ten mins walk) from Times Square, this is why I've rated it 3 stars/average. However the location was the only plus for us really. We booked early and got a good deal online for a Penn 5000 room, this is a room on a particular floor where you get access to the Penn 5000 club room with internet access, light breakfast and TV, this deal implies that you are getting a great room etc. Our room was bad so I cannot imagine what other rooms must have been like. Our room was old, damp and the bed wasn't a queen bed it was tiny, like an old double bed it was so small. A pet hate of mine is damp, dirty sheets and I asked staff to change our sheets for this reason. Whether you stay in a 1 star hotel or a 5 star I believe that you should be given a clean bed with clean sheets - end of! The aircon was old and very noisy, the floor itself was noisy and they put us in an adjoining room and because the hotel is old with thin walls, we could hear absolutely everything going on in the room next to us, including a crying baby night after night, poor thing! In general the hotel was just really disappointing I've stayed in cheap hostels that were cleaner and had more attentive staff. The staff really were rude, perhaps it was the time of year? Who knows! The night that topped it off for us was when we'd been to see a show, the one night during our stay that we came in quite late for us and I decided to take a shower, it was just before 1am and we had some crazy maintenance man (who could have been anyone intially!) knocking on our door telling us that the room downstairs "had a god damn leaky ceiling and to have a shower with the god damn curtain closed". I was very annoyed at his attitude towards us and pointed out that only morons shower with the shower curtain open! Obviously I had it closed and there wasn't any water on our bathroom floor etc etc! I firmly believe that if the room below had a leaking ceiling there was no way we could have known/avoided this! I rang reception to complain about the man and his rudeness and that they should perhaps maintain the rooms/plumbing better etc and not shout at guests late at night etc, the female manager wasn't interested and told me that I was wrong and that their maintenance man hadn't said any such things to us and somehow it was our fault that the shower was leaking, through the walls! I couldn't wait to get out of this hotel, the service was ridiculous! Breakfast in the "Penn 5000" room was basically a muffin and tea/coffee from the very basic tea maker. I did worry a little because the reviews on here were not good just before we left for the states. I would in future pay a little bit more and stay somewhere else and just get a taxi to the station because this hotel was quite awful. I would never stay here again or recommend it. :(

Reviews.Title: “Ancient and run down, but location is awesome.”
Reviews.Author: x10white
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very old so it's been worn down by all New York tourists for about 100 years. The rooms are very big considering that it's New York but it's kinda dark inside & filthy. Location is very good because it's right next to Madison Square Garden and 34th street so there's tons of thing to do, plus it's NY so there's no reason to be in your room anyway. Price is average going rate of about $200 a night for 2 full beds but the remember it's not as sparkling clean as you want it to be.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be scared!”
Reviews.Author: Andreas B
Reviews.Content: I just returned from NY and Hotel Pennsylvania after staying there for a week. After reading reviews of the hotel on this website, I was quite concerned about what we could expect. My conclusion is that I understand what people are complaining about, most things are true (long line for check-in, worn furniture and surroundings, etc), but all-in-all I am pleased with the experience in total. The room was big and clean - we got a 3 single bed corner room on the 15th floor with a nice view of the neighborhood. During our weeks stay, we did almost never see or hear any other guests on our floor, so it was nice and quiet. The location is great with easy access to the subway and Penn station and with walking distance to everything that happens on Midtown Manhattan. It is important to be prepared on the fact that this is a 2 star hotel, not a 4/5 star. (I think a lot of earlier reviewers on this site has forgotten about this). With that in mind, I think this is a quite OK hotel and I would recommend the Hotel to other budget travellers!

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: Jan R
Reviews.Content: Staff were helpful and mostly friendly, and the bed was comfortable, but that was the best that could be said of this hotel. Having paid for what was advertised as a larger room, I was surprised to find the room small and dingy. One powerpoint looked like a fire hazzard. They even charged me to leave a bag for 3 hours after my checkout before I left the city. Not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Dark, dirty, overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Kelly W
Reviews.Content: I booked my room at this hotel based on the pictures on their website and the price. I was in town for a conference nearby. I was very disappointed. The pictures didn't match the actual rooms at all. The lobby looks immaculate and the location is convenient but that's about it. Check-in on a Thursday night at 10 pm took 20 minutes. There were 3 attendants checking in a long line of people. The attendants were not friendly. They were argumentative with guests who were obviously disappointed with what they got. When I went to the 7th floor and found my room the door was open. When I opened the door I was slightly worried that someone was going to jump out of the shower with a butcher knife. Once I turned on the light I noticed the threadbare, dirty carpet. The room itself was depressing. The bathroom dirty. No hair dryer (as promised on website). I stayed in a room with two queen beds. Both beds were rock hard and uncomfortable. The pillows flat and stiff. I stayed in a corner room and every night (I stayed 4 nights) there was a banging sound. I couldn't figure out what it was - luckily I had a white noise app on my iPhone to drown out the horrible sound. I wouldn't stay here again or recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE! DIRTY!”
Reviews.Author: Elsie C
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE! Don't let the great location FOOL you! -FILTY, worst then a MOTEL! -Molds on the wall, dusty! -AC does not work & rusty -Wore my flip flops in the shower -DISHONEST! RUDE STUFF! I ONLY stayed there 1 night and couldn't get out of it faster, AND They are trying to charge me for 2 night! MY RECOMMENDATION -stay at http://Yotel.com which is less than 10 min away (closer to timesquare) 1000% better!

Reviews.Title: “the worst hotel i have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: john l
Reviews.Content: i cant believe that this dump is allowed to trade, its filthy and must pose a health risk. The first room i checked into had a reciept behind the bedside locker for 10 weeks previous and was caked in dust. The 2nd room had mould in the bathroom and unsecure plumbing. I have stayed in hotels in 3rd world countries that have been miles better than this dump

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, rooms are very tired, cheap deal”
Reviews.Author: Blended_Bunnies
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel, opposite Maddison Square Gardens and Penn station is perfect for getting around Manhatten Island. Entrance lobby impressive, staff friendly. Housekeeping was very good, all things in the room considered! The room we got was on the 5th floor, and I would recommend asking for an upgrade - we got a king size bed and the room, although needing a paint and refurbishment, was clean as it could be. Air-conditioning rattled, but functioned. Shower was very strong and plenty of hot water. Bed was firm but comfortable. All in all the hotel is well past it's best, but provides cheap accommodation for those who want to rest in-between trips around New York. Don't stay here if you are expecting beautifully clean and up to date accommodation. Do stay here if you want cheap and functional, it is better than youth hostels.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: agneta m
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel Pennsylvania for 3 nights. Not worth the money. Hotelroom dirty, had to quee for 20 min. everytime I wanted to speak with the reception, and only internet in the lobby (that had to be paid for). Location of hotel OK, but try to find a better and cleaner hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Some many things to say… but one word: DISASTER !”
Reviews.Author: Celiasp
Reviews.Content: First of all, to check in we had to wait almost 30 minutes, the front desk is huge but there are only 3 employees. They don't really care about the customers and they're not particularly helpful and friendly. We took the old and dirty elevator to our room on the 10th floor and what a surprise! Dust, mildew in the bathroom, the toilet is not even clean, I don't really wanna describe it… We called the front desk and asked for a room move.The person who answered first put me on hold without a word which is very upsetting! When we saw the 2nd room on the 4th floor, this one was worse than the first!!! I really thought it was a joke! There was smell of tobacco, dirty foot print on the bathroom floor… As you can understand we became very upset, and they gave us another room on another floor, nothing changed, I guess nobody cares about sanitary conditions in this hotel. We asked to see the manager, but she could not give us something better, she was rude with us and told us that if we want something better we have to go somewhere else… Guess what we did? Of course we found another hotel near Times Square, cheaper and just renovated! (I'm gonna write a comment on this hotel too, a good one!) I understand that a hotel is old, but I can't take a nasty place like that! Don't go there if you don't wanna sleep with rats!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with no view!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MoniLuvAshley
Reviews.Content: It was a nice hotel and good front desk service upon check in. The room was small but nice with no view. lol Conveniently located in midtown close to entertainment, food, and transportation. All for a decent price. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: paul1967sydney
Reviews.Content: Check in was simple and efficient. Room was basic and functional. Location was OK.

Reviews.Title: “Roach Spray Hell Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chris M
Reviews.Content: Ouch!!! I made a mistake, which could only be described as monumental, when, at short notice and without checking, checked into the HotHell Pennicylin-required-vanian. After receiving my key card, I made my way to the public restroom, before taking the elevator to the Filth floor, on knocking at the locked door, It was opened and I was greeted by a male prostitute, touting for business, after decling, he left with his "friend" inside I was met by profuse graffitti, ironically almost all Homophobic (and racist) in nature. The signs were there. Next I took the elevator to the Filth floor, correctly named as the filthy carpet was was covered in white delousing powder, upon opening the door, things got even worse (yes), not only was the room liberally sprinkled with the same delousin agent, it was filled with a noxious substance used for killing roaches. Exit stage left. Two minutes later, I'm in the lobby, screaming and yelling at the manager (I'm British, no shame), result full refund given with no penalty. Thirty minutes later I'm in a superb private residential apartment in The Chelsea Hotel Building on West 23rd Street. Strange thing, it cost less than the the hellhotel on 7th.

Reviews.Title: “Suggestion to the management...”
Reviews.Author: Steve P
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Unfortunately that's the only good thing to say about it. The rooms and even the corridors are best described as 'shabby'. The bathrooms are in great need of refurbishment. By other city standards this hotel is a very low performer. Even the front desk service is slow with too many unattended places. Would not go back or recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bad room, terrible service!”
Reviews.Author: diego_dl
Reviews.Content: The hotel was expensive, room ugly and small but clean. Perfect location but terrible service! I would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: QueenMumKaren
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the price and got very worried when I read so many negative reviews but in the end, we had a great stay! Yes, it is very old real estate but it's in the most perfect location next to shops, subways, atmosphere. We arrived by Amtrak from Boston and literally walked across the street to the hotel. Our check in at 4:30 only took ten minutes. As for the rooms, there is a big difference so I highly recommend you pay a bit extra and book a Penn 5000 Club room. I say this because the first room we were given was as bad as all the reviews - dark, dirty, paint peeling etc. It only had one lamp, one nightstand and no room to move. It was awful! If I had to stay there for six nights I would be writing a very different review but weI went to the desk and asked if we could have a different room with more light and the guy very happily changed us to a much better room. (I actually think he didn't see I had booked a Penn 5000 club because the second room had two nightstands, a soft chair, a desk and desk chair and the promised refrigerator.) You get free continental b/f with this deal but yes, the room is small and gets very crowded. We ended up getting coffee and then going to a place around the corner (from front door go left, left again and find the second cafe on the right for all your meals at a great price!) Cheers, Kaz from Australia (p.s. I think the rooms are very clean from a housekeeping point of view but there's only so much they can make clean. Everything else like the curtains, carpets etc. need to be replaced a.s.a.p.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel in New York”
Reviews.Author: natalie7190
Reviews.Content: Arriving at Hotel Pennsylvania, it seemed a fantastic place; large lobby, plenty of guests and a great location. This initial impression could not have been further from reality! Room 1: Mould in the bedroom and bathroom, paint hanging off the ceiling and no working lights. Room 2: The same as before plus hairs in the bath. On complaining we were told to just pick them all out or the housekeeper could come and do it for us. Room 3: We were told this was an "upgrade". It was even worse than the previous two, having the same reasons for complaint plus the smell of weed lingered throughout the corridor and the room. It was unbearable! Room 4: Great – It was clean and looked fine. The only complaints would be that the bed had numerous blood stains on it and the windows were so dirty someone had inscribed the word “WEED :)”. However, by this time, they were the least of our worries! If you visit this hotel and the room is not suitable make sure you complain! The Manager will happily tell you the rooms are poor quality because you chose to stay in a one star! We were also informed that it has just recovered from being the worst hotel in New York for bed bugs, not really what you want to hear but then again not a surprise!

Reviews.Title: “Consider it a hostel”
Reviews.Author: KaliSkiles
Reviews.Content: Great location. Can't be beat. Bed had a nail sticking out of it, old TV, window covered in dirt, broken hair dryer (although they did bring another one), mold in the bathroom, bath tub stopper didn't work. Felt like a hostel. We were the only people on our floor who spoke English, which was nice. The place needs updated, but it's not horrible.

Reviews.Title: “An ordinary hotel in a great City.”
Reviews.Author: Lennart C
Reviews.Content: Great hotel to stay during a city trip to New York City. Beds are fine, bathroom is clean(hygienic). Hotel can use a make-over but maby the prices will rise. I like the Pennsylvania hotel. Visit is already 2 times and will stay here next time i visit NYC. I'm not gonna waste money for a fancy hotel, i waste it on shopping !. Checking in takes about 30/45 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but hotel has seen better days”
Reviews.Author: BeverleyBlue
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here once before in 2006, I was hoping there would have been an improvement in the standard of the rooms, but sadly this was not to be. It’s a huge hotel (around 1700 rooms) which is very well situated on 7th Avenue, handy for Penn Station, Macys, Empire State Building and many more sights, but the grand lobby at odds with state of rooms. Our room this time was clean enough with an adequate bed, but had bad natural light and no bedside lighting. Electrics were insecure and with wiring partially exposed; luckily we were an adult couple with no inquisitive kids! A huge TV cabinet dominated the room but there was little closet space for clothes. It’s far from being the best value for money in NYC, with no complimentary breakfast, Wi-Fi or in-room coffee maker. The staff were generally helpful, but you sense the owners of the hotel are not interested in anything but making as much money as possible and relying on the largely young clientele to put up with the basic accommodation on offer. I won’t be going back a third time.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in a Great City!”
Reviews.Author: TigEngland
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Pennsylvania for two nights on a flying visit to New York. I have stayed at the Hotel Pennsylvania on a number of occasions and as usual it was a great base for a short break. The hotel is ideally located for most major attractions, Empire State, Times Square, and Madison Square Garden’s and so on. The rooms are very spacious, which is rare for a lot of hotels within New York, and the prices are equally very good for the location. It is worth noting however that the hotel is ageing, and even though there is a refurbishment programme going on, some of the rooms have not been refreshed since my previous visit which is a little disappointing. I have stayed at the hotel 4 times, 3 have been great however my most recent visit did disappoint a little as the room I stayed really was showing the wear and tear and the bathroom was especially poor. I’d certainly recommend enquiring if the room has been refurbished recently. All of the above aside, remember you are in New York City and you really don’t want to be inside your hotel missing all that the city has to offer! Overall I would still recommend the Hotel Pennsylvania as a good “budget” hotel, but not the 3 or 4 star that it bills itself as.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with no frills”
Reviews.Author: chicochica1
Reviews.Content: Stayed in June with my 2 children. Check in line took around 40 mins....front desk guy was pleasant went to room came back to front desk straight away...bathroom was unclean and room stank. Given another room back down again 5 mins later...again room was unfit. The guy was nice enough to talk to a manager and we were then given a room on the executive floor which had new carpet but room could still do with modernising. As we were staying for a week i wanted as comfortable for the children as possible. The selling point is the location...everything is accessible. overall ok for the price but definitely for short term stays

Reviews.Title: “Nice location.”
Reviews.Author: Rogi00
Reviews.Content: Very nice location, with restaurants and fast foods next to the hotel. The furniture and accomodantions could be more modern. Nice price and good staff.

Reviews.Title: “If you want a horrible hotel - this is the place”
Reviews.Author: marit l
Reviews.Content: What an awful hotel! Long queues, bad rooms. Our room was actually quite big, but that doesn't help when you don't even want to walk on the carpet without your shoes on. It felt like you breathed in fungus somehow, the room felt dirty. Bed bug heaven? I'm sure! Also, it was so dark and gloomy I kept watching my back and turning to see behind me. It actually felt like I was walking in some housing for poor people and inside the doors people were dealing drugs. I'm NOT saying this is happening, but that is the sensation I felt. And you did ask for my opinion! There are so many hotels in NYC, you don't want this to ruin your trip to this great city!

Reviews.Title: “Filthiest hotel I've ever visited”
Reviews.Author: LarsLyn
Reviews.Content: Hotel Pennsylvania on 7th Avenue, opposite Penn station, is the filthiest hotel I've ever visited. Hotestly, I doubt the have cleaned it since it was built long time ago.

Reviews.Title: “I can't believe this hotel is still in business and making bank.”
Reviews.Author: deardementia
Reviews.Content: I walked into the lobby and was excited. The lobby is clean, large, and fancy. As soon as the elevators opened to my floor I could not believe this was the same hotel. Extremely run down, filthy, torn up and I worried about bed bugs (thankfully there were none.) Our climate control in the room did not work. There was no screen on the windows so make friends with the birdies. Our view was a brick wall. There was dust so deep behind our beds that I spent most of the time in the room blowing my nose from allergy problems. The bathtub would back up and you would be standing in a foot or more of gross water. Towels were never exchanged. Prison toilet. No ventilation in the bathroom so after a shower you nearly die to get out of there. Nothing has been remodeled it looks like.... ever. Terrible sleep. Terrible beds. Terrible noise. I would be okay dealing with all these things if I were playing $40 a night but I was paying more like $250. Ouch. The only thing is place has going for it is the location. Very close to timesquare and all other exciting things in the area. That is about it. I would never, ever stay here again. Ever.

Reviews.Title: “ADEQUATE”
Reviews.Author: potbellypig26
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Penn for a week, reading some of the previous reviews, you must think we are mad! If you want to read a review about 5* luxury accomodation, then read no further. If you want to read about a large hotel , situated in the heart of tourist New York, then spare a few minutes and read on. To be honest, it's not that bad. Its a huge hotel 1700 rooms I was told, with a massive turn over of guests every day. In general the hotel has a tired feel about it, but it also has character. The reception hall/area, did resemble a railway station, with the ammount of people passing through and line for checking in can/does get very long When we checked in there were 5 people behind the reception, so the line moved at a steady rate. The lady that checked us in was very helpful, polite and curteous, which is how we found all the staff we encountered during our stay. The corridor on our floor did have a musty smell to it, but there were no windows which couldnt have helped. Yes it wasn't the brightest of rooms, but I think the height of the New York skyline had something to do with that. The carpet had a bleach like stain on it, and some of the paintwork had seen better days. The curtains needed replacing to be honest, but did the job. The air con was a bit suspect and quite noisy, but worked. The bedsheets were crisp and clean, the bathroom was tired but clean enough, we recieved clean towels every day. We took a look at the higher floors (we were on the ninth) and it looks like refurbishment is on going, from the top downwards perhaps.The hotel came as part of a package, so I dont know the actual cost of our stay. From our experiance I think the Penn was adequate, especially If you think how much time you actually spend in the room. The hotel is situated in prime position for the New York tourist, with a subway station directly outside. Madison Square gardens is opposite, The Empire State building 2 or 3 blocks away, Times square 10 minutes walk, or one subway stop uptown. The rest of Manhatten 10 minutes on the subway away. OK its not the greatest but its more than adequate. Oh yes, if you are from the UK, the lady in the City Perk cafe in the hotel makes a good cup of tea! We encountered a problem with the internet in the business centre, which the manager sorted immediatly, by giving us a key to free internet access, so no complaints there! There is a very large , well run luggage room, for $4 a bag, our bags were looked after in a staffed environment, between checking out and leaving for our late departure at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even think about it!”
Reviews.Author: kittyboymoi
