Reviews.Content: Appalling does not tell the story. This is a great location for the most terrible hotel I have ever stayed in in sixty-five years. It just won the Energy Saver Award. No wonder, the halls ,rooms,corridors, lobby.... all dark and gloomy. There is a sign on each room door boasting the invention "Valet Door" from 1919. That means this hotel has the same doors from 90,repeat 90 years ago! Awful staff, rude and just plain nasty. The hotel will be torn down and replaced with an office tower, which the city approved in 2010. Sometimes we mourn the passing of a tired old lady. This piece of rubble ain't no lady and the faster it is torn down the better.

Reviews.Title: “Average doss house accommodation”
Reviews.Author: susan D
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms for one night and found the rooms dark, accommodation of a very poor standard, overpriced and depressing. I am glad it was for only one night but I resent the money spent there. The staff at the admission desk were unfriendly, very slow and generally not sympathetic to the travelling tourist. It is not an experience I would wish on others and considering, that for a short taxi ride there are a much nicer neighbourhoods, there is nothing to recommend it to other than for those catching an early train.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs, and i am serious about this”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMarc
Reviews.Content: We had a reservation at "The Penn" for a "Superior with 2-Double Beds", for 2 guests for 3 nights. Total costs would have been USD 873.44. This after a recommendation, and checking out the internet site where this room is perfectly presented thru pics. After one of those rather long haul delay arrival experiences one can have at JFK, we were looking foreward to our stay. At entrance we had to line up and wait about 45 min. (!!) till we were served. The staff was okay, but sadly not friendly. The lobby is huge and looks realy great for an entrance, they obvious put alot of efforts to keep this part of the hotel clean and shiny. Then...we entered our room at the third floor. The corridors to the rooms are poorly lighted/ dark, the corridors carpets show vissable stains, it looked more like entering a floor wich actualy has been closed for the last 5 years, left alone due a allergy to any kind of cleaning. The roomdoor is the original one from the once oh so luxury past of this hotel (bck to 1919!), but looks more like entering a prison in the modern world. Then we entered the room, I have been travelling thru Africa, and other third world countries, where you know you sometimes have to accept low luxury standards. But this room looked even worse...... Lets start with a more deeper view: The sheets in the beds showed visable stains, and i am not sure if they were realy fresh...their smell did not even came close to soap. The carpet in the room looked like it had a maximum 1,5 minute turbo cleaning leaving 60% of all dirt very visiable behind. This is the first time i actualy felt very uncomfortable, better said dirty, walking barefeet on a hotel carpet. (and no...i am not a hygienic-weenie) The room had no romance at all, dirt und dust was visable on lights, chair and in the bathroom (second hand hair smiling at you from the walls after "some kind of cleaning" had taken place....) The windows were dirty, on the inside, the "museum-suspect-looking airconditioning system" was dirty. The curtains had visable stains, and looked somehow not cared for. On the wall was one painting only with again visable pieces off. This room looked like abandoned, and had no friendly welcome aura in the most minimum way. A small fridge was "parked" somewhere in a corner, the television showed cleaning stripes like you see them when you clean your television with a wet towel after 10 years of dusteating...to be short....it looked like we entered a room for the homeless (with all respect for these ppl) who cannot afford anything more then a bed and a once a year cleaning. Noise....came from the neighbours till 3 am. The walls are like paper. A few loud fist drums from our side on the "paper-walls" finaly brought some silence We left this hotel after one night and found a better place two streets away at the Wingate hotel, and that even for half the money! (tip!!) If the Penn realy is so good as they try to present themselfs in the internet, they failed 100% to do so with our reservation. If all rooms look like ours did (wich i do not hope so) this hotel should be closed down on instant.

Reviews.Title: “Just bearable.”
Reviews.Author: Ytte
Reviews.Content: I was afraid that there would be bed bugs, but luckily no. The room was terrible but I got used to it after a while. Great location but I won't come back to this hotel. Even though the room was terrible, it was far from cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed. Bad service, dark room.”
Reviews.Author: lilafeld
Reviews.Content: Apart from the location, which is in the centre of Manhattan, right in front of Penn Station (very convenient if you are traveling to/from Newark airport), we were very disappointed about this hotel. We regret we didn't read reviews carefully before booking. We had to stand in a long que more than half an hour to check in. Obviously this is not because we were unlucky but it is always like that. The hotel staff in general looked reluctant to help the guests. The room had two little bedside lamps. No light on the ceiling. It was really dark!! The room was very old, though kept reasonably clean and quite large for one in NYC. It was also really hot and humid. We turned AC on, but it didn't help making it drier. Staying in the room made us very uncomfortable. The bathroom was ok. We paid additional fee to get the access to Penn 5000 club - free access to internet, coffee, and continental breakfast. The 'continental breakfast' wasn't what we had expected. We had to squeese in a small room where a few people couldn't even find a seat to sit down to eat, and all we found were some cheap pastries and bagles, apples, oragne juice, tea and coffee. Not really worth it. The hotel was obviously too busy and short-handed. When we tried calling the front desk from our room telephone, they didn't pick it up. Next time we stay in NY, we will choose a better hotel though the price may be a lot higher.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced, grotty at the edges and rude staff”
Reviews.Author: Clare S
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location and terrible hotel. Vastly overpriced. Our first room was small - there were pringles all over the carpet behind the telly, the bathroom door didn't close and there was thick dust on the carpets all round the edges of the furniture. We were moved to a slightly bigger room and this time the bathroom door closed but the hot tap in the sink was jammed solid and the bedside table has a greasy film. The fridge leaked so the carpet was wet. When I mentioned this at reception I was told the room shouldn't have a fridge and why was I mentioning my disappopintment after I had already slept in the room for a night - unbelievable! no eye contact from reception staff, let alone a smile - very rude. UK travellers who are used to Premier Inn and Travelodge will be shocked at poor standards and high price. Wouldn't stay here again - ever!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Margaret S
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Pennsylvania was by far the worst hotel I have ever stayed in other than a horribly poor hostel in India, and I have traveled extensively. My friend and I had booked a room with 2 beds for 4 nights in the Hotel Pennsylvania. We arrived from Vancouver at 12:30 at night and waited a long time to be able to check in. We finally got the key, went upstairs, and found that the room had only one bed. We went downstairs again, back in the line, and after another long wait received another key. So up we went, and again found only bed. Down again, back in the line-up for the third time. We were told that we would have to talk to the manager. I called his number and it rang over 20 times before we picked, up,. He told me that the hotel was full. I explained again that we had not walked in off the street - we had made a reservation from Vancouver weeks before. He then talked to the staff person and we received yet another key. This room had 2 beds but they were unmade and the housekeeping staff were just starting to clean. It was now 2:20 am. So we had to go downstairs and wait until the staff person made the beds. We then returned upstairs and lay on the beds in utter exhaustion while the staff person cleaned the bathroom and vacuumed the floor. Finally at 3:00 a.m., we were able to get to bed. Then in the morning, we noticed that there was at least ½” of water on the bathroom floor. We told the staff person in the hall who burst out laughing, and said that she reported the water several times but no one in management seemed to care. She suggested that we call downstairs so we did, but no one came to fix the leak for the next two days. The housekeeping staff would clean up the water every morning and it would just fill up on the floor again throughout the day. The shower didn’t exactly “drip’ hot water, it “ran” hot water in a steady stream all day and all night. The hair dryer hanging on the wall in the bathroom had been smashed to pieces. The whole plastic casing was missing, leaving just a handle with a bunch or wires and a cord. We found another hair dryer in the closet - bonanza! But no, this one started to smoke as soon as I turned it on. It immediately turned itself off. The 20 minutes later for no apparent reason, it turned itself on again! Overall the room was dirty, dingy, dark and depressing. Welcome to the Hotel Pennsylvania – nothing quite like it!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not worth it to stay”
Reviews.Author: Dewsif
Reviews.Content: This hotel is massive but dosnt care about it's customers. The staff are rude, lines are huge, rooms average. The whole place is dated. Everyone seems stressed, we stayed because it was well priced for the location but wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Pennsylvania Hotel, NYC”
Reviews.Author: waggers58
Reviews.Content: Old, tired. Cracks in plaster and mould on bathroom ceiling. Room serviced daily. Clean towels & beds made. No bed bug issues. Staff efficient but stressed. 1700 rooms. Fantastic location opposite Penn station & access to Amtrak for trips to Washington etc. Wouldn't hurry to stay there again though. Financially, I think were were ripped off. Certainly not woth the money we paid to stay there. For the same nightly rate, we were able to stay at the Bellagio in Vegas! Have been told the building will be demolished in the near future for a new facility.

Reviews.Title: “Helish the rooms ar a mess”
Reviews.Author: Jamesdalgleish
Reviews.Content: Terible rooms ar badlay neading atenshon and i just hav walkted in my 3rd room since the outher 2 wer deskusting i hav staid in far better frentch youth hostals that ar cleener

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the area”
Reviews.Author: Ryan_Wales_UK
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice before and have just booked it once again via expedia. Location wise it simply couldn't get much better with great transport links via Penn Station and a taxi dispatch right across the road. With Madisson Square right across the road aswell. In fairness the rooms are tired and could do with a refurb but they are not dirty. When I'm in New York I simply use the Hotel as somewhere to sleep and if you are going to New York to sit in your hotel then this isn't the hotel for you. There is also a little Tim Hortons next to the hotel that sell great tea/coffee and doughnuts. I recommend this hotel as a base for anyone visiting NY on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “awful- PLEASE dont - you have been warned!”
Reviews.Author: goodadvice3000
Reviews.Content: This hotel has alot of mixed reviews. Read the bad ones and think very carefully before you book this. On the plus side it is very well located , easy to get to from Newark airport and some of the rooms arent too bad. I stayed on a business trip as because of the UN special assembly all the other hotels were full. It is grotty , incredibly badly organised and there was a 30 person queue to check in and out. It is noisy ( I changed rooms once as I was next to a party ) , disorganised I had to change rooms three times in total the first one had someone in ; they kept locking me out of my room , told me that I wasnt booked in on one occassion, there is no internet in the room only in the incredibly busy lobby and no breakfast. My only difference from the other bad reviews is actually the staff were quite friendly and on the whole helpful in addressing complaints. If you get it as part of a really cheap package 50 USD per night or something you might risk it. Do NOT stay here if you are on business or convention.

Reviews.Title: “A slum in the city”
Reviews.Author: ciderjim
Reviews.Content: Do not book if you like cleanliness, a dump of a hotel, worst hotel inthe USA.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: waterdog9119
Reviews.Content: Ww paid $300 usd per night for a room that doesn't look anything like the photos. Our bathroom was falling apart, the walls were crumbling and looked like there were water damage. We were told all rooms are the same so there were there was no point in changing room. They make you wait until 3 pm to check in and if you want to check you bags, it was $4 each. Other places we stayed did not charge anything. Some desk clerks were very rude and argumentative. After one night we found a nicer place that was less, had wireless, breakfast and close to Time Square. Even if the location was great, I would not suggest you stay here until the whole places was renovated and the staff were retrained.

Reviews.Title: “Horrificaly BAD”
Reviews.Author: divemanMexico
Reviews.Content: For a three night stay I paid 1050 usd. This included a grotty cell like room. No breakfast no internet A 30min queue just to check in Extremely Rude staff A dirty bathroom Seems this hotel thinks location alone is good anough NEVER AGAIN

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the money”
Reviews.Author: Chemandy
Reviews.Content: We got a sale on this hotel and figured why not, if it is too horrible we'll just move on. I can't say this place was Amazing... but it was decent for the location and the price. It is right next to madison square garden. I absolutely loved the location. I had never been to NYC before and there was plenty around me I was never bored. The lobby area is really nice, large, open and very clean. The rooms on the other hand..... aren't horrible. Our room wasn't like some of the bad ones pictured. The walls were white and in some spots dirt was on them. The room itself was clean and so was the bathroom. I honestly thought the place just needed a new painting. We also requested a room with a window. I am so glad they were able to do this because adjusting the heat in the room was tricky. Having the window gave us some needed ventilation. :) By requesting the window we actually got a free upgraded room. YAY! Over all I would stay here again if the price was right. Location was amazing and the hotel itelsf was O.k.

Reviews.Title: “Just plain disgusting”
Reviews.Author: Kat S
Reviews.Content: I didn't mind the long check-in line but I did not appreciate the ignorance of the check-in staff. They didn't welcome us to the hotel (because they don't care). They didn't offer to explain the hotel ammenities. I asked for a comment card when checking out and they handed me a blank sheet of computer paper....what???? The room was filthy. There was a dead bug squished on the dirty drapes. The carpet must not have been cleaned in a decade. The bed was uncomfortable. The bathroom sink was missing one of the four legs. I thought it was going to fall onto the floor. The TV had a quarter inch of dirt on the screen. Best of all, there are paint chips falling from the ceilings over the beds!!!!! I would NEVER stay here again. They just don't care about their customers.

Reviews.Title: “Be realistic! You're in the centre of NYC”
Reviews.Author: morwood37
Reviews.Content: I had five nights at this hotel. It is old and quite tired but in a fantastic position. I asked for and got a room that was quiet and up from the street. (1580) There was no view but I wasn't spending much time there. It was perfectly clean and had everything I needed although a coffee maker would have been nice. I found without exception that every one of the staff I spoke to was pleasant and extremely helpful. If you make the effort with them you get so much more back. The small restaurant adjacent (Lindy's) do an excellent 3 course dinner for $19.95 with vegetables!!!! so at the end of a long day it is convenient. Lots of other places nearby. I would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, Handy, what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: HappyCustomer620
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week at Hotel Pennsylvania and was terrified what to expect after reading reviews on here prior to going. Not sure if people expect a whole lot for little money or just like to complain. I found the hotel, clean tidy and really handy to everywhere. Sure it's an old building so it has a few cracks and bruises around the edges, but the rooms were clean when we arrived and cleaned everyday with fresh towels each day. The staff who cleaned the room were helpful and extremely friendly, a real happy bunch, who made you smile each morning. Reception could be busy but this is due to the huge demand of customers checking in/checking out etc. A little bit of patience and it's all straight forward. Hotel Staff in general were really helpful and went out of their way to accommodate any request. All in all if your looking for somewhere to put your head down that's clean, cheerful and handy to everywhere then this hotel is spot on. If your looking for an amazing high class, high quality hotel then pay the money and stay in one.

Reviews.Title: “Skunky and scruffy”
Reviews.Author: supergaggle
Reviews.Content: The Pennsylvania is a dump - and a huge one. Despite its superb location, right across Madison Square, Penn Station and Macy's around the corner, it's a terrifying experience. It starts with long lines for check-in and ends in a skunky small room with scruffy blankets and stains all over the carpet. Not to mention the worn out bathroom. The only positive thing was that our bicycles (rentals) could stay overnight in the storage room, as we joined next day the Five Boro Bike Tour. Consider spending a bit more for a decent place in NYC; otherwise, for the same money you can book a 4-star hotel in Jersey City (see my other reviews) or Newark, all within easy reach of PATH trains.

Reviews.Title: “Not Fancy but so convienient”
Reviews.Author: jajd68005
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old and a little worn but within walking distance to so many attractions. Madison Square Garden is across the street as is Penn Station. Who wants to stay in their hotel room with so much to do in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Old, shabby but good location for first timers in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Vivmodi
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to NYC hence being opposite to Penn station was great. The room are really small, shabby and advisible if you want to crash out for a few hours only. Hotel is too busy, one has to wait for long to get a checkin. Staff though courteous cant do much to help you. There are coffee shops, restaurants and take away shops all around to keep you busy. Wakling distance from Time Square, overall a good place if you plan to be out of hotel for most of your stay. Economical by NYC standards

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Pennsylvania July 2011”
Reviews.Author: vanessa r
Reviews.Content: Huge hotel,during July extremely full. Not recommended. Room was nice and clean and the beds were comfy but for almost $250 a night the package I choose was overpriced. Breakfast included NOT recommended. They do not have your room ready at 3pm & you have to pay $8 to leave your luggage. Pros (several places to eat near and nice stores (Manhattan mall,Kmart , H & M and pizza places). Front desk service poor. Not so close to times square for the price I would rather stay in another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: Crystal R
Reviews.Content: Hotel Pennsylvania was a life saver at a great price, I booked it last minute to have somewhere to crash until my plans were straightened out. It is super busy!! Money saving Guest galore are lined up to check in from all over the world. Be prepared to wait up to an hour to check in or have them hold your luggage. To be honest, I'm not picky, but this an oldie Motel Quality Hotel with very old Rooms, furniture, and T.V. I was not pleased with the stinky carpet and broken hair dryer. It's a safe and affordable place to be in NYC right in the middle of it all, but I checked out to book else where. The staff was friendly and Maria who checked me in left a memorable NYC impression, she was a tough cookie with Sharp Customer Service. Tips: ° Best Priced Hotel in Times Square. ° Hotel Quality. °Your trapped in the 80's era with your surroundings. ° A bit Creepy, but I liked that ° A/C is old school and did not cool for me :(

Reviews.Title: “Very good situated”
Reviews.Author: SilviaBN
Reviews.Content: My husband and me stayed here for four nights. We stayed in a simple and small room with old furniture. The room was dark and the bed wasn't very comfortable, but the room was very clean. The situation in hotel is very very good. It is an big hotel with simple rooms for a affordable price if we think in the situation.

Reviews.Title: “Old, drab and sad”
Reviews.Author: acamacho1970
Reviews.Content: I think the only good thing to say about this hotel is it's location right in from of Madison Square Garden and across the street from Penn station. Other than that, it is highly overpriced with small and old rooms. The air conditioning was at least 30 years old and correspondingly noisy. Bathroom was also old and chipped!!! The carpet stained and dirty. Staff couldn't really care about any of ones concerns as they are busy all day long. If you have another choice, which I am sure at that rate there are many go for some thing else

Reviews.Title: “Gone down hill badly in recent years”
Reviews.Author: gazlough
Reviews.Content: My wife & I have can review this hotel with some expertise given the number of times we have stayed here in recent years. The location is fantastic - right beside Macy's & The Empire State building & just across the road from the best Irish bar in New York City - The Blarney Rock. The downside is that in recent years the Penn has gone down hill very very rapidly - we checked in & were greeted with the usual poor attitude we come to expect from the counter staff - no way friendly & you are really only a hindrance to them. The room we were given was exceptionally BAD - masonry was crumbling off the wall, graffiti on the walls, bathroom shower was in very bad repair & floors looked like they hadn't been hoovered that month!! The bed linen wasn't great either & it wasn't a bad idea to check given the poor state of the room. I demanded another room which was quickly given to me but wasn't much better - in the end we decided to clean it up as best we could and put up with it. I do remember the time this was a pleasant place to stay - not luxury but clean. Those days are but a distant memory. I would only stay here again if I was on a strict budget or if there was absolutely nowhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Thackers75
Reviews.Content: That is all this hotel has going for it, the check in line was rediculous. We arrived late afternoon and did not get into our room until after 9pm. The rooms were massive but smelled old and musty however the bathrooms were small and outdated. Paint chips and rust covered the bathroom. The room was over priced. I would not recommend this hotel, not even for one night which is all i stayed for.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck!”
Reviews.Author: Connie115
Reviews.Content: The hallway smelled liked weed, I'm all for the oldies but this was gross. The beds were terrible the bathtub was all peeling and falling apart. I love old things but this place smelled like mufa.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay again ...they are cheats....”
Reviews.Author: piyushkh
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel during the Hurricane Irene period. Can you imagine they charged me ~US$20 per minute for making international calls back home to India and Singapore. They are cheats. Will never ever go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Try to find another option”
Reviews.Author: MarceloPace
Reviews.Content: The hotel is always crowded and noisy. The location is good but the block is the most crowded of Manhathan! The prices are reasonable in comparison with the other options in the same neighborhood. The positive point is the private bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “2 big thumbs DOWN!”
Reviews.Author: Kristine0210
Reviews.Content: What can I say? I read the reviews and had my doubts, but it was only for 2 nights, so I thought I'd take the risk. But I would NEVER go there again! It's okay if you just need a bed to sleep, but don't expect anything more. Huge room with tiny bathroom, paint chipped everywhere, everything outdated. Halls feel more like prison. No wifi, internet in the lobby (pay). Waiting line for check-in. My pillow smelled bad... I never even bothered to take pictures. No, we enjoyed our 5-day stay at Comfort Inn Theatre District (with only 2 stars) so much more!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and easily accessible, but barely livable!”
Reviews.Author: torquan
Reviews.Content: The Pennsylvania prides' itself of having been the temporary home of 100 millions tourists since opening in 1919. But don't be fooled by the grandeur of the facade or the lobby which you will have plenty of time to admire because of the long waiting time to receive your keys. The rest of the premises has definitely seen better days. The hotel was saved from demolition a couple of years ago. The rooms are large by New York standards and relatively cheap since we paid less than 300 USD for a family room with 4 single beds and a large storage cabinet for the luggage. Staring at the ceiling we noticed a large humidity stain on the ceiling and numerous moisture stains on the walls. We stayed there during Irene and water was dripping from the ceiling when the storm was at its worst. Loose electrical wires were hanging near my bed. If the bedroom was run down, the bathroom was filthy with horrible stains in the tub. Towels were clean and changed daily. The cleaning ladies are really doing a great job and deserve a special mention for working in such an unhealthy environment. They truly keep the building from falling apart. For females travelers and children, walking the long, dim-lighted corridors can be somewhat spooky at night. All things considered, great location in the very heart of the city with Madison Square Garden, Macy's, the Empire State Building and Times Square just around the corner, but barely acceptable in terms of comfort. No WiFi in the rooms and for a charge a very poor signal in the lobby. Beware also of the Statler Grill which applies mandatory tipping where the amount of 18% is added automatically to the customer's bill.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel we have ever stayed in!!!”
Reviews.Author: partyboi
Reviews.Content: This is definitely the worst accommodation I have ever stayed in, and I have stayed in a lot of hotels and hostels. Let me start of first by saying I am in no way picky about hotels that I stay in, as long as they are clean I am happy, after all I don’t go on holiday to stay in the hotel room. But this hotel was beyond a joke! We waited in line for about 40 minutes to check in, but we didn’t let this dampen our spirits to much as we were just beginning our holiday (road tripping around America). Our excitement could only hold so much, as when we got to our room we were absolutely disgusted as to the shape it was in. There was large chips knocked out of the walls, stains everywhere, the carpet was disgusting. The bathroom had damp and mould growing everywhere, and I am not being carried away here, literally the whole bathroom ceiling was covered in damp. We went back downstairs to complain and get another room, but reception was chaotic. So being in New York for one night and having plans to meet friends we decided we would get our room changed when we got back. We then tried to ignore the hotel for the rest of the evening and ventured out into New York to enjoy ourselves. When we returned to the hotel the feeling of dread had came over us (which should not be the case on holidays) and so we marched to reception, which still had a short line at 1:30am. We informed them about the shape of our room and that we wanted it changed to another room, and that it was a disgrace they even gave it to us. The receptionist was ignorant as to why we had left it so long to change the room (As I said we where only in New York one night and we were not wasting it at the hotel reception), she then tried to make the excuse that the hotel was old! I have stayed in buildings that would be over twice as old, but they clearly knew how to clean, paint and repair! I informed her that I had paid a lot of money for a room and that I expected it to be to a certain standard, at least being able to sleep in the room without feeling disgusted would be a start. She then continued to let us know that lots of people are always complaining and changing rooms, which really made us feel bad about choosing this hotel, and this doesn’t really say much about it when lots of people have to change rooms. What annoys me most is if someone moves out of a room for a perfectly good reason, why not then fix the problem rather than pass the room on to the next victim. We eventually got out room changed, but alas the second room was not much better, though it was cleaner and had less damp. I would not stay in this hotel again, and would not advise anyone else to do so. It was expensive for one night, and I understand that it’s pretty central in New York City, so I tried to let that be the reason for the expense. But there is no excuse for the room being in a condition that you would not let your dog sleep in. DO NOT STAY HERE!! Pay a little more and stay at a better hotel! Though that being said what we paid was not cheap!

Reviews.Title: “not bad for affordable stay in the heart of Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: shoot123
Reviews.Content: Was shocked about the great location, the Rates were very good, the room was not that great when I complained they gave me a beeter room next day, loved it. not the best but Ok. location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the middle of everything in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: betobeto
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on the company's bill so rather than focusing on the price/value ratio I'll focus on the place itself and services offered. If you want to be close to everything in NYC this place is hard to beat - Penn Station in front, Times Square 8 blocks away. It bills itself as the "largest hotel in NYC" and it certainly looks so - tons of people coming and going all the time, which can be a problem. There's a guard at the entrance of the elevators but honestly they couldn't care less about who gets in and out, so street smarts apply as you go into your room. The room doors at least have keyless/deadbolt locks. If I had to describe this place in a single word I would say "functional". Not luxurious, not upscale, simply functional. The hallways look sketchy and in desperate need of a paint job. At least the room was clean and with a straight view of the Empire State Building as a bonus. Guest service is barebones and, as it seems to be painfully usual across hotels, there isn't free wireless Internet (there's for-pay wireless, but only works in the highly trafficked lobby). Good points: Plenty of cafes / restaurants nearby, easy access from/to anywhere (subway, trains etc) and a taxi stop in front to get from/to the airport. Plus a basic fitness center on the 18th floor if you're on a gym routine. If you are the kind of person who doesn't expect much from a hotel above the basics and values location above everything, this place may be spot on for you.

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor”
Reviews.Author: garrytex
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel based on the recommendation of my sister. She had obviously stayed in a much better room than I was offered. The first room was to say the least, the worst room that I have ever been offered (anywhere). The door was broken and we had to call the caretaken . We decided that the room was not in a suitable state to stay in and we asked for a replacement room.The room smelt and the carpets and curtains were badly worn. As we were staying two nights, I thought the second room would be better. Only marginally, the bathtub had the enamel paint flaking off and the room was in an overall poor state. There was toothpaste on the towels when we arrived into the second room and we recieved no apology for the inconvience from the management.The standard of these rooms were third world in comfort (and I have stayed in hotels in the third world). The location of this hotel is excellent, however if you really need to stay here, check in advance that the room has been renovated in the last 10 years otherwise your stay will be as unpleasent as our stay was. This is a busy hotel with guests staying from around the world, it was obvious to me that the management has little concern for the comfort of their guests, as they see the door revolving with new guests to replace those dissatisified with the standards offered. New York is a wonderful place to visit but be advised of where you stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Smoke gets in your nose ...”
Reviews.Author: doug_humes
Reviews.Content: The hotel is directly cross the street from Penn Station, and just ten blocks from Times Square. Great location. Wonderful old hotel. We had a decent hotel rate (for NYC!). We were there early and they let us check our bags for $4. Came back and checked in and went up to the room - Rm 794 - so about 100 rooms to a floor, and 28 floors. A huge old hotel. It's been a while since the halls, carpets and doors have had a face lift. Low light. As soon as we walked in to the room, we smelled cigarette smoke - heavy smoke. It stunk. We are not smokers, are not ridiculously sensitive to it, but the room stunk. It was small - big enough for a bed - that's par for NYC. We were there largely just to sleep - so didn't spend a lot of time. The room was clean, as was the bathroom. It was quiet at night. But when we got in, we hid under the sheets to sleep. The smell was overpowering. Checked out early. Perhaps it's so old that the smell is permanent. Perhaps simply the occupant before us smoked the place up. Can't tell. All we know is it stunk.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Experience for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Csiki
Reviews.Content: Came to New York City on short notice to take care of some business. Didn't want to pay an arm and a leg for a room but opted out of crack motels as well so the Hotel Pennsylvania seemed like a reasonable pick right down the middle. Arrival at the hotel was a pleasant experience since the lobby was nice, the line at the front desk proceeded fast and check-in was a breeze. Also, this place only charges $20 a night for incidentals on debit cards! Unfortunately, when I got to the room I couldn't help but notice the mold(!) spot, around 5" in diameter on the ceiling so I called front desk for a room switch and sure enough they sent the bellman with keys to another room. The curtains were also torn off and the paint was stripping off the wall... Not sure if they figured they could get away with selling a room with mold -or, they're just not that particular keeping the rooms up to par?! Overall, the bathroom and the bedsheets were(looked, felt) clean and everything was working. I heard from a store clerk on 32nd that they're planning on turning the entire hotel into an apartment building in the future. That would explain a lot about the present condition of this historic 92-year-old landmark.

Reviews.Title: “An Upscale Dive in the Heart of Tourist Country”
Reviews.Author: delarana
Reviews.Content: At just under $200 a night for a 2-bed room, I wouldn't call this a budget hotel anywhere but Manhattan. The building is cool, historic (dates to 1919, I believe), and massive! Rooms are nothing special but clean and comfortable, The marble lobby is huge and hints at former elegance... but it's hard for a room packed with the great, unwashed masses to look elegant, no matter how hard it tries. There's always a line-up to check in and out; there's a paid luggage storage room in the basement; there's a WAY overpriced breakfast joint off the lobby ($12.95 for a medium-sized Belgian waffle)... There was no Wifi when we stayed there, though they told us there was. But who cares? This place is smack in the middle of tourist-land, noisy night and day (if your room's on a high enough floor you may not hear the miscreants shouting on the street below). Walk to Empire State, Times Square, Broadway shows, the main post office, central library, Grand Central Station... Penn Station's RIGHT across the street, handy for catching bus or train to the airport in Newark & probably other airports as well. Seemed like a afe area, near lots of restaurants, etc. Subway a block away in several directions... Overall a good choice for a first visit, but you might want to upgrade to a funkier part of town if you've already seen the sights in this 'hood.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for what we needed but it isn't somewhere I would recommend to friends and family.”
Reviews.Author: Jillian B
Reviews.Content: We went to New York for our honeymoon and were VERY excited about our trip. On arrival at the hotel, we were amazed by the location and how perfect it was - The Empire State was just a few blocks away, Times Square was a litte further along. Maddison Square Gardens was across the road. Great access to the subway providing access to the whole city. We went to check in were impressed by the reception area; grand and elegant. We asked about an upgrade and were given a King size bed rather than a double. That was about the only good thing about the room! We were staying on the 10th floor - one window overlooked a block of offices, the other I don't know as we kept the curtains shut! The carpet was thin and looked dirty. The bathroom had missing tiles and holes in both the sink and bath. The plugs were loose and only one of the four worked. The television remote was missing. The bed however was incredible and despite the constant noise from the city below, we slept like babies every evening. My husband said they're in the process of renevating the hotel - they must be staying in the Pent House suites! To be fair, you don't go to New York to stay in the hotel, so we only really needed a room in order to sleep and freshen up from the day to evening, therefore, we weren't really in the room long enough from one day to the next. Ultimately, you're paying for the loaction. Having said all that, I still expected a little more from the room itself. The staff were mixed... there was a lovely lady on the information desk who was more than happy to assist us in finding our way from A to B. The other staff were not as helpful. The little cafe attached to the hotel was very expensive!! Our first morning we went for breakfast and didn't go again. The staff however were lovely and very friendly. All in all, it was fine for what we wanted and needed but it isn't somewhere I would recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Old Hotel but decent for price and location”
Reviews.Author: roobrian
Reviews.Content: Don't let the lobby fool you on this hotel....it's a show. Besides waiting forever to check-in the floors are old and non-renovated. However, some of the rooms have at least been repainted and have new mattresses. The bathroom is still old....nothing new about it. We stayed there for a bachelor party so it may not be the best review but we were barely in the room. Felt safe, the hotel itself is massive and it was clean.....as clean as it could be. I did not notice any bedbugs and I looked. I did not notice any bugs for that matter. The staff was friendly and when I asked for the upgrade, I think I got it. We had two rooms. One had a view of the Empire State Building. The other was in the center of the hotel but was definitely. Look for price and location the hotel is clean if you want a really nice hotel room then you should look around some more. Plenty of places in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. OK price. Bad room and ammenities.”
Reviews.Author: LA_Traveller13
Reviews.Content: What I liked about the hotel was the location and price. There are bars within stumbling distance and a few blocks away from Times Square. The rate per night was descent. If you're on a budget traveling alone, and don't care much, this would be cool. Only issue regarding the billing is they charge $4.00 to hold your luggage. Every hotel I have been in has never done this. So, this was a shock. The room itself is a bit dingy. The window doesn't prop open. You have to remove the lower half to get outside ventilation. Also, the shower is crap at best. It looks old and dirty, and the bathtub has significant yellowing. The shower head itself shoots water out pretty hard. So, if you need to shower, don't turn the knobs up all the way. I got a room with a king size bed. It was nice and comfortable. But, there is alot of dust on the outdated appliances, including the radiator. The lobby looks really cool. But, the elevators and floors are nasty. And, the business center is terrible. Internet is slow, barely any features on the computer. Doesn't allow you to open PDF files. If you have to use internet, pay for the WiFi which is $10/day or go down to Kinko's to print stuff. I would personally recommend spending the extra buck and staying somewhere nice, like the Hilton. Only reason I didn't stay at the Hilton was because they didn't have any rooms available. If I spend money to stay somewhere, I expect it to be clean, comfortable and appealing. Pros: Price, location Cons: Cleanliness, out of date appliances, horrible business center, dingy bathroom, charge to hold luggage, no hospitality room.

Reviews.Title: “Just the ticket for being at the heart of the Big Apple!”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsFrary
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed in this hotel for 5 nights on our first trip to NYC. Perfect location just opposite Madison Sq Gdn, and a short walk from Times Sq and 7th Ave. Easy access to all the places you will want to visit, and of course all the shops. The rooms are clean comfy and ideal for a place to lay your head down in the city that never sleeps. Its not a 5 star luxury hotel with all the bells and whistles but quite frankly why pay all that money when there's so much waiting for you right on your door step. The staff are friendly and helpful too.

Reviews.Title: “Only by being a good place”
Reviews.Author: AndersonLeal
Reviews.Content: Too old , but the localization is very good. We can find very interesting attractions a few steps from the hotel. (Madison Square Garden, Macy´s, etc)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: zabka123
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in central location.Very close to the shops and cafes. The rooms are a bit noisy,you can hear everything , specialy slamming doors as they are made from very heavy metal and people come back at different time as NYC never sleeps.If you are not very light sleeper you would be fine.

Reviews.Title: “What do you expect..”
Reviews.Author: spectatrice
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the first thing you hit what getting off a train....it's a way station for people who don't know where they are..I used to walk through the lobby as a shortcut to Herald Square. It "is" almost like sleeping on the street. Yeah the location is great if you wouldn't mind sleeping in Penn Station either cause that's practically what you're doing! There's lot of homeless people who sleep there too. lol I do remember all the dog owners. Ah Only in New York. Guess Bloomberg better step in on this one like Times Square. Clean up the underbelly of the city which is all over NY. Don't be so naive people, the whole city stinks.

Reviews.Title: “but they take dogs”
Reviews.Author: EBPandDSP
Reviews.Content: HP is just about the most shopworn hotel I've ever stayed in. The staff is nice and the lobby is fine. The location is terrific, but the rooms are pretty dreadful. It's just your basic old, shabby New York hotel. I'm sort of stuck between 2 and 3 stars but I gave it the higher rating based on location. Being right across from Madison Square Garden and just down from the theater district and Times Square was very convenient. And did I mention they take dogs? Yep. We came to go to Westminster Dog Show and tons of the competitors with their human side kicks stayed at HP. Now THAT was fun!

Reviews.Title: “Not a safe place”
Reviews.Author: 17wandalust
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel based on location and price. It is not worth it, no matter what the deal. Fortunately, I stayed here with my partner, because during the middle of the night, someone unlocked our door, and started to come in...my partner yelled, and his voice must have scared the intruder away. This place has one redeeming quality--it's location. Otherwise, avoid it like you might avoid bedbugs!

Reviews.Title: “I beg you not to stay here.”
Reviews.Author: n17ved
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I've ever stayed at. The staff are so rude its beyond belief. The hotel needs cleaning top to bottom, it smells of urine in corridors and the bedrooms are the same. Before leaving after 3 days of hell at this hotel. We made the mistake of leaving our luggage at the hotel and we realised when we got home that items were missing. Please I beg you not to stay here unless your homeless, even then the streets a better option.

Reviews.Title: “The absolute worse hotel I have ever stayed in and possibly the world!”
Reviews.Author: Andy O
Reviews.Content: The view in the lobby was wonderful. A person would really think that this would be a great hotel, but this is where it all ends. It is just to get you in! When we checked in, the first thing they told you is that there is a $50 dollar early check out fee and if you wanted internet service you would have to pay and asked for a credit card. I did not think anything of it because from what I have seen so far everything look great. When we try to go to the elevators there is a gentleman there (like a guard) who stops us and says you cannot bring up you own luggage and that a bell-hop must bring it up via the service elevator. Again I did not think much of that either. So we waited for the bell-hop who begins to take our luggage to our room and we left to go to our rooms. Once out of the elevator everything changes! The smell of old stained wet musty carpet is overwhelming. Walking down the poorly lit hallway with falling plaster, falling paint chips everywhere you look, doors CHAINED CLOSED, doors busted open. The longer I walked the madder I became, but it does not end there. Once to our room door which was filthy, paint peeling, marred we opened the door to a room that has not been renovated for many years! I'm guessing 50yrs! The room had a dark brown carpet that smelled old and musty, the carpet does not look as it has been changed in fifty years. The door bolt was literally just hanging on the door by 1 screw. Old bed, old tube tv with a broken remote held together by black tape. A hole in the wall where an electrical socket used to be, an electrical socket that does not work. Four person room with towels and wash cloths for two people. Old, marred, and scratched furniture, no clock, broken hair dryer, a view of garbage from our window which has bars on them. Now as I sat there I started thinking why they are charging a $50 dollar early check-out fee, why a bell-hop takes your luggage, why the lobby was so nice. It is all to get you in and keep you there. When you read this you may think that maybe I am too picky or high maintenance. This is not the case at all. I have stayed in many hotels and motels in my life. This hotel is simply disgusting! I have never stayed in a hotel like this. Please do not stay here. You will really regret them taking your money and making you feel like a fool! Look at the photos from people who have posted them. These pictures cannot convey the disgust of this hotel! IF YOU DO NOT BELIEVE ME PLEASE DO THIS FIRST!. Get at the hotel before check-in time a go to directly to the elevator (DO NOT CHECK IN) and see for yourself. If you like living in a disgusting hotel for a couple of days then go back down stairs and check-in. If you don't go back out the doors a get a cab and ask them where to find a good hotel, of if you have a laptop make a right out the doors you came and go to McDonalds which has FREE internet service and look for another hotel. I really hope this helps you. New York is awsome and I hope you have a wonderful time. I think you will!

Reviews.Title: “"brilliant location, just a few blocks from the empire state building!"”
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel, it was in a great location and we were greeted by smiles. The room was everything I was expecting from a four star hotel. The view from my window wasnt good but not every room will have a great view. The hotel made my first holiday to new York special, I will defiantly be heading back soon.

Reviews.Title: “It was terrible. The hotel is disgusting.”
Reviews.Author: Christopher C
Reviews.Content: The experience was more than terrible. First there was 1 hr long wait on the check-in line. There were perhaps 12 stations from which customers could be served, but only 3 were open. The room was beyond filthy. Paint peeling from the walls. What appeared to be juice was on one wall. Mildew in the bathroom. The rug was filthy. The hotel staff were downright rude! I have since complained to Hotel Pennsylvania and it has not responded. I am not convinced that it will. I changed to another hotel the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't even take shower because we were so grossed out”
Reviews.Author: ZenFinder
Reviews.Content: Stayed in hotel Pennsylvania during a family trip to New York. Conveniently located, yes, but you have to ask yourself what type of quality you want to sacrifice for a low price. The hotel advertises having rooms with "city views", do you know what part of the city we saw? The brick wall of the adjacent building. I think the only way this hotel still functions as a business is to mislead potential patrons to stay here and lure people with lower prices. I've stayed at really nice hotels, and I've stayed in a sleeping bag on cold wet leaves too-I know not everything can be the Ritz Carlton; but I personally did not care for this hotel whatsoever. Do yourself a favor and spend a little more to give yourself a vacation that's you're going to remember for the great things you did, not for the sub-par hotel you stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Restful stay”
Reviews.Author: chinito05
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel for a good price but local restaurant kind of overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Moldy.............”
Reviews.Author: kmjimenez
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel about five or six years ago and had a great room,clean, nice linens etc. So I thought I'd try it again. Bad Idea! The first room I was put in the furniture broken, the carpet was threadbare and the bathroom floor, shower and sink were all rusted out. It was so disgusting I asked to be moved. I moved to a second room that smelled like it had either been sprayed for insects or cleaned with nasty chemicals. Didn't realize until I'd been there a day that the carpet was damp from the air conditioning unit and I think I've been exposed to mold. I'm having an allergic type reaction that I can't shake and it has been two weeks. Additionally, only the top three floors have wifi. Don't stay here!! Only good thing I can say is that the people at the desk were accommodating and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “bed bugs! disgusting rooms! rude staff!!”
Reviews.Author: karina f
Reviews.Content: i payed 1400 dollars for NOTHING!! bedbugs!!!- my dad got bit the 3rd night! HOTEL WAS OLD. MUSTY, DISGUSTING!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “don't be scared off by the negative reviews!”
Reviews.Author: WandaCanada
Reviews.Content: After booking a package that included this hotel, I read reviews that almost made me change my booking. But the hotel is just fine. She's grand old lady who has seen better days, but our room was clean and cool and the location is great. The line-ups at the desk can be long but the staff are friendly and helpful and you can avoid the line-ups if you have some flexibility. I was with my 25 year old daughter and we would stay there again. It was much better than the bargain hotel we stayed at in NYC the year before.

Reviews.Title: “Worst US hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: fusansan
Reviews.Content: I didn't listen to the reviews but the place was pretty bad. Rooms hadn't been fixed up in years, peeling paint, loud AC that broke while we were there, bathroom door wouldn't close and there was a metal thing sticking out of the bed that hurt several of us. Caught my foot and actually bled. The smell was really bad- like grandma's attic. Hotel desk was ridiculously crowded, see the attached photo. At least an hour to check in or just get a key, even after 10pm. For the $179 price was totally not worth it. There is 1 elevator that takes you down to the luggage room for storage, there's even a wait for that, and a charge. Only good part was the convenient location, across from Penn Station and no bed bugs.

Reviews.Title: “only the lobby was nice enough”
Reviews.Author: eadytch
Reviews.Content: The lobby is pleasant. The rest is SAD at best. Old and moldy, dank and damp.You get what you pay for. We will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Beware: Look under the sheets and brace yourself!”
Reviews.Author: Mils03
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I booked this hotel online. We were impressed by it's great location, and that's where it ends. After a LONG chek-in line (what felt like the continuation of the airport experience), we stepped out of the elevator & into a scene from the Shining, plus 50 years of wear. The walls were painted in patches, the doors were from an asylum & hard to open. Once you kicked your door open, becareful not to hit the bed, which is right by the door. We were in shock! Food crumbs on top of your bed. I had to lift the sheets to check this out & Guess what?! Pubic Hairs!!! The shower was still dripping, hairs on the "clean" towels, and the tiles on the bathroom were falling to pieces. We were switched to 3 other rooms, all with the same problem!!! Pubic hairs!! I had spoken to the manager & finally, after being treated rudely (like I had never experienced before, not even in Miami) we opted to pay the website more $ to stay in the Heart of Brooklyn. Even Brooklyn was waaaay better than that hotel. We just wanted clean sheets & not to worry about the many horror stories of BEDBUGS we had heard of since landing & telling New Yorkers of our intended Hotel destination (Penn Hotel). We left & gladly took the subway 30 mins to Manhattan everyday

Reviews.Title: “3rd time back and still Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: SunQueen1982
Reviews.Content: Great location. Quite pricey if you buy anything from the shop in the hotel! Therer is a restaurant attached to the hotel which serves scrummy pancakes and is a must! One thing to watch if you are planning on a trip out all day is that they like to refill (for free!) your coffee every ten minutes! Great perk but careful you don't get caught short whilst out! LOL!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mr_caroline
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Hotel Pennsylvania for three nights in Jan 2011 (three adults). Arrived at the Hotel Pennsylvania late on a Friday night, queued at check infor approx 20minutes. We had booked a room on the club floor with two double beds. The room we were given was HUGE. I think we actually ended up with interconnecting rooms. The Pennsylvania isn't a hotel you would want to book as a couple. It is shabby, the bed linen was like felt and the bathroom reminded me of the movie What Lies Beneath. However as a group of three adults, in New York for a couple of days and looking for something cheap and central it was fine! The hotel is right opposite Maddison Square Gardens, and maybe a ten minute (max) walk to Times Square. Yes somebody could come in and do a multi-million dollar refurbishment and return it to its former glory, but the rates would shoot through the roof. Pennsylvania is a cheap hotel, its perfectly located. I can overlook flaking paint and dodgy bathrooms when I consider how little we paid. I believe you get what you pay for. Our room was clean, quiet and had a pretty good view. It was also nice to see a security by the lifts to the rooms 24hrs. My only real critism was that we booked a 'club level' room, with access to the Penn100 Club room, but it wasn't explained to us on check-in how we accessed that facility. Overall, this isn't the terrible hotel it has been reveiwed to be. I would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Don't give up easily”
Reviews.Author: xpis3
Reviews.Content: When looking for hotel in NYC, I came across the reports about Pennsylvania hotel. It did not look too promising, but with limited resources I finally decided to give it a try, and booked it via my travel agent. It was last October, in the afternoon. I was looking for a long line for reception. It was a good surprise to find reception without any line. I asked for a twin bed room. My sister-in-law waited at the lobby and I went to look up the room. I found a room with 2 narrow beds, stinking from mold on its walls and especially in the bathroom. I went back to the same receptionist and told her that mp way I will take it. She gave me another room; again I went there and found the same kind of beds. There were no mold in the room, the beds were the same narrow ones and the air-condition was overloud, and no way we could sleep in this room. Again I went to reception, and as the receptionist was occupied I talked to another one. I explained to him what happened with the former rooms and why I want another one. He consulted his colleague and sent me to yet another room. This new room no. 999 was larger than the former ones with 2 queen size beds and a small refrigerator. We took it and enjoyed it. Conclusion – don't compromise especially if you already paid for it.

Reviews.Title: “Check in and check out lines longer than at the airport”
Reviews.Author: oteaatea
Reviews.Content: My colleague and I had to make a last minute business trip to NYC and all of our usual hotels were booked. We ended up having to go to this one. I was dismayed after reading the reviews. The positive part of the stay was that the room didn't have bed bugs -- I did a thorough check before using it. I had a fairly spacious room and it was very clean. Guest services were very efficient. I needed help closing a window, and help arrived very quickly after my call. The negatives were: (1) noise - both in the hotel and outside on the street. There was some kind of machine running a loud engine outside most of my first night. The walls are paper thin, and there was a family with a crying baby next door. Hallway noise was loud and ongoing for most of the night. (2) Elevators were excruciatingly slow, and often full. (3) The very worst was the wait in line at the check-in desk. They had one or two very slow customer service reps, and the line always had at least 15-20 people or more. This was true both for check-in and check-out -- worse than at the airport! The customer service rep was very friendly, though. I can't recommend this hotel. There are so many wonderful hotels in NYC in the same price range. Look for a nice boutique hotel or one of the more comfortable chains instead.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the Leary”
Reviews.Author: XHotelier
Reviews.Content: If you are unsure of smaller, boutique hotels, this one will confirm that you don't always get what you expect. Stayed here first hand and have some pictures to share of the first TWO rooms they put me in (beware of the 6th floor). There were hand prints on the wall (really???), dingy air conditioning unit, and mildew in the shower. I was traveling with a colleague who was put on the 13th floor and was happy with his accommodations. I asked the front desk to move me once again to that floor and was of course told there would be an increase in the rate for doing that. I feel that I was taken advantage of and that the hotel lacked customer service in general. Their attitude of "we'll just resell the room when you leave" was not appreciated either. I left after the first night. This hotel needs a major over haul!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if Possible”
Reviews.Author: ABartlett092
Reviews.Content: A very poor hotel, with its only positive aspect being its location. Queues for check-in are massive as at one time they typically have two (very slow) staff actually doing something, and another two or three wandering around at the back looking useless. To make matters worse, there are no toilet facilities located in the lobby! The hotel itself is in dire need of redecoration, as the paint is cracked/chipping/peeling in many places. In our room, the electrical wiring behind a socket was exposed. The cleaning staff are also useless; my mother's nightdress was thrown in with the sheets and lost, and when she enquired about it, was not even offered an apology, as she was told "it was her fault" as she "should not have left it on the bed". Where else do you leave night-clothes!?! We got locked out of our room once, and queued for about an hour at reception only to be told very rudely when we got there that we should instead go to security. No signs or staff were available to tell us beforehand, and I noticed several other guests being told they were in the wrong queue after an hour of queueing. All in all, a very poor hotel - if you can find somewhere else - go for it. Only come to Hotel Pennsylvania as a last resort. One positive thing I will say is that the restaurant off the lobby (The Statler Grill, not actually part of the hotel) was very good - well worth eating at wherever you end up staying.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back!”
Reviews.Author: LittleSugarplumfairy
Reviews.Content: On arrival, the Pennyslvania lobby looks impressive - but the queue for check-in and the less than helpful check-in staff, set the tone for what was to come! There were at least 40 people in the queue in front of us, and not one member of hotel staff attempting to establish who was checking in or who was checking out, or helping to speed up the process. Nearing the check-in desk (at 1 pm), after at least a 35 minute wait, the couple in front of us informed us that this was their second attempt to check-in that day, as they had been brusquely told earlier they couldn't check-in until 3 pm. (The sign indicating this was behind the desk some way away from those in the queue, and not mentioned in my booking documentation). Our check-in clerk looked like she really didn't want to be there, made no attempt to apologise for the delay, and informed us we couldn't check in (as no twin rooms were clean) unless we wanted a king-size room instead. If we didn't want that, then we would have to PAY $4 per case for the left luggage! We took the room. The corridor to our room... the room door... the room... well, what can I say. It reminded me of a haunted house... dark and dingy grey (although there was evidence of someone attempting to paint along the corridor). The room door looked like it came off a coffin. The room had NO natural light and was old fashioned in the extreme. The bathroom wasn't much better - a broken light, a hairdryer with a plug which had clearly blown some time ago, no plug in the bath.... There was no Wifi connection (free or otherwise) in the hotel - a 'given' these days in lots of decent hotels - unless you went to the internet room on the ground floor. No tea/coffee facilities in the room. No wardrobe. A large black mark on the carpet beside the bed which looked like a tin of black shoe polish had been spilt there. The one and ONLY plus for this hotel is its location, smack opposite Penn Station and Madison Square Garden on 7th Avenue and round the corner from the Empire State Building. Having said that I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone and will not be darkening its doors again. Anyone who has given this hotel a good rating either needs to visit a good optician or needs to view room 1057 where I stayed last week!

Reviews.Title: “great location, nice staff and cosey rooms”
Reviews.Author: jamesisrael
Reviews.Content: the first thing to say about this hotel is the location is really the highlight, if you want to get around New York this place is right in the middle of it all. The hotel is not amazing but the rooms are good to relax in after a day of being out and about in the city, and the staff were friendly and helpful. All in all the price and location is what makes you want to stay here, and any horror stories i've read about the place seem to be made up or exaggerated.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy chamber of horrors!!”
Reviews.Author: jdvm1
Reviews.Content: Rude staff some of which can barely speak English. Never ever have I experienced anything near this atrocious level of service. Waited nearly 3 hours to check in on Sunday night. Just two very slow agents on duty?? Room was dirty and smelly. Probably no maintenance for many years. Hallways were like ovens with dirty worn carpets, old faded paint everywhere. If you have a car they will charge you $50.00 a night!! They carefully never disclose this on their internet site, wonder why, as most decent Hotels do. Avoid at all costs – total disgrace.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but little old”
Reviews.Author: Pedro28Portugal
Reviews.Content: Very good location. The hotel is old. Ideal for vacations with friends.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but good location”
Reviews.Author: NL1955
Reviews.Content: we stayed a whole week, its a 2 star hotel and thats all you get. overall we had good experience with personnel, got an extra bed for free (however you felt the springs in it so had to be covered more) daily cleaning was done very good. sometimes 2 times a day rooms are a bit run down. leakage at a window with a heavy rain. aircos work well but old and noisy. what can you expect. would I return? I would search for a better place but location is indeed great. middle of manhattan. they should upgrade the rooms, install wireless etc. its typically run down a bit. strange to read in other reviews that people state they lost money in a shirt. i always take money with me. i left my new ipad there as i am no donkey and that still here.

Reviews.Title: “Old, gross, everything is falling apart”
Reviews.Author: nchernia
Reviews.Content: There is only one thing to recommend this hotel, and that's the fact that you don't have to lug your suitcases very far from Penn station. Otherwise, it's terrible. A huge hotel, extremely crowded, difficult to check in or check out (because it's very poorly staffed), they make you pay to store your luggage upon check out, the rugs are disgusting and badly need to be replaced, the bathrooms have faucets from the early 70s, the beds are squeaky and old and uncomfortable. Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “NEW YORK VACATION”
Reviews.Author: denverhigh
Reviews.Content: The little problems were annoying. for our stay in room #671 First:. The tub was dirty and need new grout. Wife bought Clorox and cleaned it. 2nd. The leg fell off the sink. Maid said it always falls off. It was left on the floor for seven days. 3rd. The shower handle stripped of and could not shut off or start the shower. Service man came tightened if and never came back. 4th.The tub water dripped for seven days and has nothing to do with controlling the shower head water that also dripped for seven days.. 5th. A clicking noise was constantly behind the bathroom mirror. 6th. The hair drier never worked we turned it in and it was never replaced. 7th. The ironing board was missing and we got one stuck open all the time, since it was broken and would not fold. 8th. The curtain rod handle was off the curtains for seven days. 9th. The shade on the small desk fell of the frame since it was held on by tape that let go because of the heat in the room. I guess it was just small items that happen in a $200.00 a night room. It was great when some of the staff was friendly but many time they were annoyed that we had a problem. The standard answer was "It is like that all the time." One of their techs said about the elevator, "You should be happy that it is working sometimes." The best thing was the location of this Hotel. Across the street is Penn Station and Madison Square Garden that we wanted to see but it was closed for remodeling. The subway entrances were almost on every corner around us. The bus system is great and the driver were the most helpful and friendly. Many people helped us on the bus with suggestions and even gave us maps. The bus as well as the subway were really clean and looked new. If you are a senior riding a bus it is only $1.10 a ride with a transfer to another bus withing a two hour period. To bad we didn't learned about this until the last day. We found the #1 subway takes you to the Ellis Island and Statue of Liberty. Make sure you pre-buy the tickets and they guide you past the people waiting in line. That also applies at the Empire state building. Show them the pre printed papers and they pass you on. Brooklyn Bridge.take the #15 it takes you right to the bridge. We only walked to the first arch and we walked back sitting down several time. Good thing it sprinkled some rain to cool us off. Remember this Eight Avenue runs up town which is North one way. Seventh Avenue rungs Down Town which is Sough. one way. All Streets run East to West.most are one ways. We never saw an accident and all the people drive like maniacs and use their horn constantly. People cross the street before its time to cross since they only have to look one way but nobody gets hit. Supper Shuttle is a great way to get to airport of the hotel. Best i think is JFK. But if there is two of you of more take a Taxi. I never rode one but during the heat way I almost took one. The show we took in was "CHICAGO" we have seen the video and this was just a good. They are seldom sold out and the cost is only $60.00 and many offers are made in Times Square for tickets at lower prices. From the hotel Macy.s is only two blocks north. HUGE department store. it has three Starbucks on different floors. Take up a whole city block and six floors. It has a Mc Donald's and two bakeries as well as pizza all on different floors. If you go to Visitor Services they will give you a Discount on anything you buy, because you are a visitor. There are so many restaurants to choose from. Forget finding a Mexican one of a good Chinese in that area. Restaurants on Eight avenue near the Broadway shows are plenty. We are at a place called "PIETRA PASTA" WOW. What great pasta and the Parmesan Chicken was so great tasting. It came with vegetables, french bread rolls with some sort of garbanzo dip. We split the dish since my wife was not feeling good about her stomach. But after tasting it she devoured it. A down pour of rain started right after we entered the restaurant and every one outside was wrapped in plastic bags or umbrellas. Times Square Area was one block up and we went to purchase candy at the M & M Store that is three stories high. It was now 10 o'clock in the evening the hordes of people walking to and from now where and not knowing just where they were going was a sight to see. We were like sardines jammed together just justifying to make a head way. We walked all the way from 50th ave to 33rd ave. and it was just a fun time. We stopped and ate a Gelato and "The Bread Factory" A 24 hour restaurant that we liked. Finally Make sure you have cash or a MET card with money on it if you take a bus. They do not take Bills. Again for the location of this Hotel it is great and no "BED BUGS" Just don't look under the bed. For value I still like "Motel 6" just $39.00 all over the country.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: DDDDDDDDDDDDDD_11
Reviews.Content: i whent to the penn hotel last week...as a travel agent i had to visit a few hotel but choose to stay at the pennsilvania.. all the reviews for this hotel were negative...but i find that this hotel offers a great value for your money...verry good location...close to everything... peen subway station verry close to the hotel...the room was basic but clean...AND THERE WAS NO BED BUGS! the staff was verry helpfull... i recomend this hotel for anyone that whants a good location in NYC at a verry resonable price...

Reviews.Title: “Best possible location but an Average Hotel. Location makes up for everything else”
Reviews.Author: sandeeppratima
Reviews.Content: Hotel Hotel Pennsylvania Address: 401 7th Avenue New York City, NY, US 10001 Best possible location. One cannot ask for anything better. Small room, oversize furniture as if the room was a dumpyard. Small bathroom. Staff capable of telling white lies coupled with rude behaviour making one feel that they were doing a favour. They gave us a room smaller than what was booked by Orbitz for us and stated that Orbitz was to blame since they had booked a smaller room. A call to Orbitz and then everything fell into place. Yet, when they gave us our correct sized room, they made it sound as if a Big Favour was being done. Saw a Guest literally throw his room keys at the Receptionist while Checking Out and when the Receptionist showed displeasure at his act, the Guest said that the Staff of the Hotel deserved no better. Maybe it was this particular Hotel Staff who was rude. I cannot say the same about the balance of the Staff. The location is so good that everything else can be ignored.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience !!! Money was Stolen from inside my Suitcase...”
Reviews.Author: Juttie1923
Reviews.Content: Hotel Pennsylvania was Bad News the first night of my Stay on July 21, 2011. Upon checking in, I asked for an updated Room and the agent said in a grumpy voice it's to late. I took my keys for my Hotel room and went to the room assigned to me . Upon my arrival to my Hotel Room, I met the door unlocked and wide open !!!! That was the first Red flag. I was scared and upset and called the Front Desk . I asked for a Manager and spoke to a nice Manager named Mark, He changed my room. I felt scared for my life meeting the door of my Hotel Room opened and not Locked . Second Red Flag was day Two, July 22, 2011, the entire rug on the floor where the TV and the window by the Ac was was soaking wet.. I had to keep my shoes on inside m y room all the time in my room. I told the Maid outside the same day even brought her in the room and showed her . She said they would take care of it. She will tell her Supervisor. It did'nt happen. The night before my departure, Saturday Night, at 9:30pm is when a man from engineering knocked on my Hotel Room door telling me he was from engineering coming to look at the Ac and th water soaked Moldy rug. . I was not letting any Man from any where come in my room while alone. I told him I was leaving the next day on Sunday and it was no use to come in tonight . Do it when I leave Sunday. Whywould engineering come so so late at night , and I was out shopping all day. I reported this on the second day of my stay and only the night before m y departure engineering comes to look at the situation. An Operator named Rose was Rude when I called to tell the Manager named Mantoo about the Rug being soaked and smelling moldy she hung up on me .She had me on hold for a long time til the Manager finally came to the phone after calling back 4 times and she would'nt answer the phone seeing my room number displayed.... I went downstairs and spoke to Mantoo the Manager. .I told him this was not my first stay but it will definitely be my Last !! I told him of my Terrible stay I was having and why Operators are hanging up on guests. Icing on top of the cake was Sunday July 24, 2011, That Morning I went to my Suitcase for my Money, and discovered it was gone. I had $400.00 hidden in a shirt and it was Stolen, Disappeared !!!!. It was there the afternoon of Saturday when I got some money out of it. It was there every day until Sunday Morning. I called Guest Services told them , they called Security which this man just toook my name and address .That's it !!! No Report was filled out or anything. I spoke to NIcole Small Asst Director of Front Services the Sunday morning before my checking out when I discovered my money stolen,. She told me it would be investigated. Let's see what Happens !!! She did not tell me who cleaned my room that day my money was missing she said because of the Union . I had $400.00 stolen from me and She and Security for Hotel Pennsylvania , acted like they did'nt care as long as they got their money for my Hotel stay. I'm letting everyone know that my friends family and Co workers will never stay at the Hotel Pennsylvania when coming to New York. We will tell everyone about this Horrible Ordeal I suffered on my recent Vacation July 21 - 24 2011 at the Pennsylvania Hotel.. There are dishonest people working at the Hotel Pennsylvania in New York and they need to be weeded out.. My money was in my suitcase, No one had any reason to search my Suitcase and steal my Money. My Suit Case was my Privacy.. Beware of the Hotel Pennsylvania in New York City at 401 7th ave and 33rd st.. I'm going to tell everyone about my experience. Don't Stay at the Hotel Pennsylavania they search your Suit Cases and Steal Money there !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the worst hotel I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: TheUKLegend
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in March 2010 with a trip to New York with college. Everything seems very nice and appealing from outside and the lobby, but this is when it stops. All other floors of the hotel and rooms are extremely dated, rooms tiny and neglected. On the plus side, ideal as in the centre of New York and in easy reach of all the tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever again.”
Reviews.Author: JamesTrimble
Reviews.Content: Dreadful service and 1hr25m queue to check in...only to be told it's our fault that we wanted to checkin now.

Reviews.Title: “Run away from this haunted mansion”
Reviews.Author: ericmgl
Reviews.Content: I have never posted a review of a hotel until now. I feel I owe a duty to my fellow man to make sure that nobody EVER considers for one minute or one second staying at this hotel. I am a former New Yorker who went back with his family to stay in the city for a few days and thought The Hotel Pennsylvania was a good idea because of its location. Well I was wrong. Words simply cannot describe the condition of this place. It looks like sledge hammers were taken to the ceiling and to the walls. GIANT holes with exposed electrical wires everywhere!
