Water leaks and stains everywhere. Shredded carpet throughout. Peeling Paint. Terrible smell. AND THESE ARE THE GOOD POINTS! As a former New Yorker I felt embarassed that out of towners ever step foot in the place and that this is their first impression of New York. It's simply amazing to me that The City of New York allows this hotel to remain open. We checked out instantly. It's not even worth it if the hotel paid you $200.00 per night to stay there. One funny thing though.....when I complained to my 80 year old mom about it she told me that she spent her wedding night at the hotel in June of 1950. Believe me.......nothing has changed a bit

Reviews.Title: “BLAGH!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MelRi82
Reviews.Content: Don’t be fooled by the decency of the main lobby. Once we checked in, we head to the elevator, take it up to our floor and then, surprise…… Welcome to a horror movie set. The long corridors are filthy from top to bottom, covered in dirt, smudges and peeling paint. The doors to all the rooms are mucky. It’s dark, dreary and filthy. Upon entering the room, or should I say, a transformed utility closet, the carpet was instantly noticed. You literally could feel the adhesiveness of the carpet underneath your feet. When we turned the lamp on, we noticed the carpet near the lamp had a dust covered layer of about an inch just caked on top. If I had to guess, it’s been at least a decade since that carpet has seen a vacuum. I had to turn the lamp off as to not see what was around me. When we were walking back to the hotel later that evening, I saw a few homeless people laying around in one area and I have to admit, for a brief moment I contemplating joining them. Big pieces of the ceiling literally fell on the bed and floor the next morning when I woke up. The size of the room I could handle but the filth???? Blagh. In order to shower, we laid towels inside the shower so as to not endure direct contact. Run away as fast as you can. The night before staying at the Here, I stayed at Herald Square hotel for less money, a comfy bed and a very clean room. Don’t be fooled into thinking this hotel is worth anything positive. Worst hotel ever! A super 8 or motel 6 would be a HUGE upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service EVER!”
Reviews.Author: Nightshade81
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very tired but comfortable enough. It takes about an hour to check in..even when you've booked and paid online. The room keys and locks break every other day. It took us two trips downstairs and an hour to get back into our room when the lock froze. You have to line up for an hour if you want to drop off your bag ... so no point...just head to the airport..otherwise you'll stand inline for another hour to get it back. Room wasn't cleaned despite a number of phone calls. Hallways smell terribly of smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Deplorable Conditions!”
Reviews.Author: lesliejoann
Reviews.Content: I was in town for business and I travel to the city pretty frequently. That being said I've stayed at many different hotels in Manhattan. This was by far and away the WORST hotel i have EVER had in the city!!!! I found the staff to be friendly.... well that was after I waited over an hour to check in!!! I was told that SOME of the rooms were renovated, well let's just say I wasn't lucky enough to get one of those rooms. My bathroom sink was literally falling off the wall. The paint was repulsive and chipping away from the walls. And the "A/C" is certainly not A/C!!!! Don't be fooled by the pictures on the website, this place is unacceptable in my opinion!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “hotel was OK-staff was extremely rude”
Reviews.Author: pjc0920
Reviews.Content: the hotel was just OK-- clean enough but the rooms were very small and quite outdated. But our biggest complaint was the rudeness of the staff- we did not find one nice person on staff who was helpful-- especially since this was our first time in New York-- in fact I can almost say they were downright rude. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: BroadwayWestendLover
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely not 5*, but that doesn't really matter as in NY you are very rarely actually at your hotel as there is just so much to do! The location is ideal, just a stones throw away from Time Square and you are right opposite Madison Square Gardens! The rooms are massive, loads, if not too much, floor space and massive beds too. Good hotel, good price, nothing amazing, but just what you need as a base for your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but still old and smelling”
Reviews.Author: Yaww
Reviews.Content: Huge hotel with excellent location, but although i booked Penn 5000 King size bed rooms, room was pretty small and it was smelling old carpet. They most probably stopped investing at renovation long time ago. Windows and A/Cs are old on top. But compared to NYC center hotels, the rate was good (around 150 USD/night after tax). They charge you 4 USD per luggage to use luggage room. No free internet except two desktops on 12th floor; but appreciated free printer there.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: jf90
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location and friendly staff. We asked for a twin room and were given two kingsize beds so that was a nice suprise. The rooms are basic but they are clean and this was fine for me as I literally just slept and showered there. Have already booked to go back there in a couple of months.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and great location”
Reviews.Author: Alder300
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for! Fantastic location in the centre of it all. We had three singles and one double booked, everyone of the singles got a good size room with one of the party getting a suite! The room for myself and partner was so small,there was nowhere to store our cases and the view was terrible. However we booked the breakfast option which was strange as it was a small room which got very busy with nowhere to sit, on one morning a guy was sleeping on the sofa in the breakfast room he had clearly been drunk and wondered in, security was informed and did nothing leaving him sleeping with his hands down his pants and nowhere for customers to sit as he had the whole sofa. Yes hotel is looking worn but you would pay double for the location at other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was great-Hotel was not so great.”
Reviews.Author: FitnessProLiane
Reviews.Content: If you can stand not to think of what might be on the floor/bed and only plan on sleeping briefly for a few days..then stay. The location is great especially if you are travelling through penn station, staff was more than wonderful when I needed to change dates from a family emergency, print out tickets, directions.. I HEARD some rooms were updated..For as busy as it was in lobby, I hope they hurry and renovate all rooms soon..bad news spreads fast. I would think that hotel owners would want to provide electrical outlet covers and somewhat fresh paint in all rooms, if only for appearances. At least create the illusion of a kept hotel, if you can't afford to re-do entire room..And dont bother buying the 5000 room, it only gets you acess to 24/7 coffee and breakfast? plain bagels and store bought muffins for 15$ I would have bought 3 dunkin donut coffee's and a decent pastry around the block..All of the hotels staff I encountered were awesome..Desk, bell hop, front door and even managment went out of their way to help.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs, terrible service”
Reviews.Author: laurawesome
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Hotel Pennsilvania, and the customer service was not good. My internet wasn't working, and it took 3 phone calls to try and get an IT person to my room, but they still didn't come up so I had to come down to the lobby to switch rooms The room had bed bugs, and I have bites all over my legs And one of my rooms wasn't cleaned at all. I was in the lobby to use my laptop and supposedly I had my plug in an outlet I wasn't allowed to use, so one of the employees just unplugged it and told me to find another plug quite rudely

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location.. decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bella_Juventina
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Penn during the 4th of july weekend and I have to say I'd definitely stay there next time I visit NY. The Hotel has the best location; it's in front of the Madison Square Garden/ Penn Station and only a couple blocks away Times Square. I paid $995 USD for a 6 day DBL Room for me and 3 of my friends. The rooms are pretty austere but for someone who's only gonna sleep over the night it's pretty decent. The hotel doesn’t include neither breakfast nor WI-FI, only at the lobby and it is very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “just awful......!”
Reviews.Author: madaccfv
Reviews.Content: the worst hotel I have ever stayed! I work in hospitaly for many years and I never though a hotel in the center of Manhattan, with so many rooms, always fully booked could have such a lousy service. the rooms were small, not very clean, no air condition, no mini bar, WC was disgusting, the staff was extremely rude.......... the only positive aspect I found here was the location. I am sure you can find much better hotels in the heart of Manhattan and with much nicer prices than Hotel Pennsylvania!! Don't waste your money in this one......

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: edith048
Reviews.Content: the rooms dirty, for check in you have to wait for hours, only rooms upon 7th floor are suitable - you have to look first how your room looks like and then have to upgrade it its not suitable .....lots of complains also from other guests...

Reviews.Title: “Very Great Location, Take only PENN ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: pahmed
Reviews.Content: I stayed there fir 5 nights with my husband and my son 1.5 years.This is our 2nd time in new york.We stayed before in Holiday Inn Express in Manhatten.Pennsylvania is found in a very good location, it is very near to every thing,near Penn Stataion, Times square, K Mart, many shops around you It is really a central location much better than Holiday Inn in the location.the regular rooms are very bad.They gave me a small room, when i enetred it i got a small electric shoc when i was opening the light in the bath room. It really needs a lot of renovation. I complained about my room in the reception to an Indian Man. I told him i have a baby 1.5 years and this room is not safe. He upgraded me to PENN ROOM without any problem but without breakfast. The PENN room is much much better, it is renovated, clean, comfortable, safe. It is a small room but no problem as we just want the room for having some rest during the day and for sleep. No one go to New York needs more than this room in such location. As u r going to New York to have fun and visit such a nice city , I advice you to stay in this hotel but take only PENN ROOMS not regular room. You will not regret this location.u will really enjoy yr trip. If u want to ask about any details, please email me on passhoss@gmail.com or u can write to me on trip advisor.I will be very happy to help any one has inquiries. I was searching before traveling and i know that many persons can have many questions.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but service not so awesome”
Reviews.Author: yellowmarcy
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a girl's trip to NYC where we stayed at Hotel Pennsylvania. When we arrived, we were dismayed to find that there was quite the line to check in. However, we were able to check in within about 30 minutes of arriving so we were hopeful things would be better. We were further discouraged when we went to our rooms (we thought it was supposed to be 2 double beds in each room) and found we had a single double bed in each and the rooms were on different floors (they were supposed to be next door to each other since we were traveling together). After further review, we found that our plan coordinator may have made a mistake on the reservations, so to correct it, we went to the front desk. Of course, no other rooms available with different bed types. So, we settled for a roll-away bed in one (no room for a roll-away in the other). We attempted the next day to upgrade to a 2-bed room again and were once again told (in a wonderfully hateful tone) that there were no rooms available and to check back after 1:00 PM and she would note my room as requesting a double double room. Based on the check-in line when we returned (more on that later), we chose to avoid the lines and just make do with the accommodations we had. In my room, the A/C never really cooled the room. The roll-away bed was horribly uncomfortable and there was black in the caulking of the bathtub/shower. Our room was pretty small, but expected that with it being in NYC and it was actually larger than our traveling partners'. Throughout our stay, there was generally an extremely long check-in line in the lobby. The restaurants were overpriced and service was horrible. I recommend eating at locations outside of the hotel if at all possible. The gift shops were ok, though nothing different than you find lining 7th Avenue. I don't recommend wasting your time on their continental breakfast or their "business centers". We were never able to get breakfast because in the room that had the continental breakfast was always horribly full of people and rarely did the coffee machines work correctly or at all. The first day, there was trash overflowing from the trashcan right next to the food and beverages. If you want tickets to a show, don't use the service they provide. After waiting 20 minutes with one person in front of us, they told us their tickets started at $130 for a Broadway show. When I told them that was ridiculous and we could find them online cheaper, the lady argued with me and said that our seats would be bad if we got them online and theirs were "good seats" (we ended up in the 8th row orchestra for less than $70 with tickets we found online). Requests to the front desk are worthless by phone and not much better in person (as outlined above). We called on our last night there because the maid service had not put a flat sheet on the roll-away bed. The man on the phone told me they would send someone right up with the sheet for us. We fell asleep waiting and never received it. Overall, it's a clean place to stay and in a great location. But if you're like us and going to be walking all over the city with very busy days, you might want to find a different location to stay so you can rest well. I can't say whether I would stay here again; it's very convenient to almost everything, so it's hard to find anything better than that. But I like good customer service and that was severely lacking at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I found the rooms disgusting”
Reviews.Author: bfeuerman
Reviews.Content: I live in New York but because I was having two full day meetings at Madison Square Garden I decided to stay at the hotel for two days (for the convenience). First, it took me over an hour just to check in. The lines were long and wrapped around yet there were only three people working at the registration desk. Second, the room was gross. Smelly, small and uncomfortable with a soft uncomfortable bed. I left right away.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely disgusting and foul”
Reviews.Author: joyma255068
Reviews.Content: Wow, just wow. When reading the reviews previous to checking in at this hotel I assumed that it couldn't be THAT bad, but yes, it could!!! The lobby makes the hotel look nice and fancy but this is not the case. There always seemed to be a mysterious long queue at the front desk - with only one member of staff checking people in, as slowly as she could. The staff are rude, they don't look at you when they talk and everything about this hotel's service is poor. There are 12 elevators, but only 3 or so of them work and they are EXCEPTIONALLY stuffy. When we arrived at our room we saw a strange vault like thing on the door, completely irrelevant and had no function. Our room had a holes in the walls. This was where the last person who stayed there had obviously hit their head repeatedly on the wall out of frustration to hopefully put themselves out of their misery. Next we found a mysterious blue substance at the bottom of the bath, along with multiple cracks, possibly another result of frustration? When we had our showers the water temperature would vary from boiling hot to extremely cold. You had no control over the temperature. The beds are extremely basic and squeak when you make the slightest move. No wifi in the room but you can reach Penn station's wifi for a fee. The airconditioner looks like it may have been installed in the 1800's and has probably never been serviced.The only nice thing I can say about this hotel is its position, right across the road from Penn station and very close to macy's and times square. Take my advice, DO NOT STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Loveya1977
Reviews.Content: What a deal! My friends and I checked in and had orginally asked for a 2 queen bedroom but got placed in a tiny room with 1 bed. They immediatly fixed the problem, giving us a suite. The closet in this room was bigger than the first room they showed us! Upgrade! The lobby was awesome, marble floors, gold elevators. Staff was awesome and very helpful. The best part is the amazing location! Perfect for exploring the city. Loved my stay in NYC! Love you Pennsylvania Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty awful for what you pay”
Reviews.Author: alexthimm
Reviews.Content: This place felt more like a giant hostel. We were pretty shocked by the standard of our room. The bathroom was lovely - back in 1965 was it was first installed! This place is in serious need of updating. I have heard that NY hotels are expensive and rough at times but that should not be an excuse. The location is very central - you can walk to Times Square etc. The only good thing if that is important to you. Next time I would not go there again. What really annoyed me is being charged loads for using a slow internet connection as I had to book some tickets, That is taking the mickey considering the price of our room and of course should be free for guests.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!!”
Reviews.Author: Onunez
Reviews.Content: The rooms were dirty, I had an awful stay. There was no wi fi, bad smell, and a lot of humidity in the rooms and hallways.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Angelique_op_Reis.
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at hotel Pennsylvania in New York, from the 19th of August untill August 22nd. We had a room on the 16th floor and our roomnumber was 1617a. The room was very basic, muffy and the tv wasn’t working. The location of this hotel was great! Right across the street from Madison Square Garden and the subway station and five minutes’ walk away from Times Square. The convenience of these facts makes it worth considering for a second stay in this hotel. But, we found out (thanks to the NYC forum) that the hotel is nowadays in terrible condition and will be torn down soon. That is a pity, but we are sure we can find a better hotel near Times Square! Have fun in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Just a Room to sleep.”
Reviews.Author: IndianWandererDelhi
Reviews.Content: Since I wanted a hotel easily accessible by train and sightseeing tours, this was the nearest. You just come out of Penn Station and there it is, across the road. If you want just a room to sleep, then this is a convenient place, though not cheap. The drawbacks: The rooms need refurbishing very badly. The room I had looked dated. The bathroom towels seemed from yesteryears. The breakfast was just breads etc. and juice/tea/coffee kept in a small room. There was no coffee/tea/drinking water in the rooms. The ice machine was empty at 11.30pm. The plus points. It was easily accessible and close to Times Square (12-15 minutes walk from the hotel), where all the fun is at night. Lots of Theaters there and full of life. It feels as if the city does not sleep. In case you want to see the shows, make sure you book tickets at least a day in advance. There is a counter in the hotel premises that helps in arranging tickets for the shows, apart from arranging other things eg. transport. (Maybe they charge a small commission but maybe its worth it as it saves you the bother of going out and buying it yourself). The Grand Central Station is also a 10-12 minutes walk from the hotel in case you want to travel to other parts around New York and has excellent eateries too. The Sight seeing operators (Hop on - Hop off bus) stand outside the hotel itself and sell the tickets then and there. It included the cruise around the Statue of Liberty. (timings of the cruise were 10am,11am,2pm and 4pm so you can plan) These are valid for 2 consecutive days. Step out of the Hotel and you are in Shopping Paradise. In case you go to Macy's, a block away, make sure you get your discount card from the visitor center of Macy's which was 10% when I was there. This was over and above the discounts offered by the establishment. If you are a foodie, step outside and all kinds of cuisines are available in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “needs renovation..poorly maintained”
Reviews.Author: ashish707
Reviews.Content: the hotel is poorly maintained dirty corridors...rooms not worth of the amount they charge..whitewash falling..a big tym waste of money to stay here except for the location..i advise to find another hotel maybe marriott near times square..at hotel penn even the hotel staff doesnt know how to talk to the customers..they should get training for this..

Reviews.Title: “Poor , but superb for it's location”
Reviews.Author: GaiaGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: Since the very 1st time we went to or passed by NYC , this hotel has been our 1st choice , regarding it's location on 7th Avenue , front to Madison Square . Although it's 2 stars (deserved) do not grant any of that special treatment we are used to on 4stars hotels , it´s a perfect solution in terms of NYC' geography . Adjacent to Macy's , very near to Mustang Harry's , The Stout , GAP , some minutes distant to METRO , MOMA , Central Park , Broadway , Southstreet Seaport , Bluenote , it's centrality deserves the small sacrifice to pay , in terms of it's stared quality .

Reviews.Title: “Please don't stay here........”
Reviews.Author: wire2009
Reviews.Content: What an awful experience! My wife and I would not usually write such a bad review if it wasn't justified but our time at the Pennyslvania was a nightmare. After leaving the relatively pleasant reception area the hotel goes downhill very quickly. The corridors are shabby, tired and in need of a total revamp. Our room was tiny with a view of a brick wall and was in need of a thorough clean. After our first night we attempted to leave the hotel to discover that the door would not lock from the outside therefore leaving all our valuable at risk. We reported this to reception who promised to send someone straight away. After an hour waiting in the room we reported the problem again only to be told that someone was on their way, a further hour later, sick of wasting our holiday in New York, we packed our bags and arrived at reception to be greeted by a very rude gentleman. He was totally uninterested in the problem and the fact that we were unable to secure our luggage. We demanded the hotel store our luggage whilst we went out and it required us to escalate this problem to the manager who was able to secure us a different room later that same day. Unfortunately, prior to leaving the UK, we had booked a further stay at the Pennyslvania later in our holiday. On our 2nd arrival we were allocated a room with a broken tap which could not be turned off. After a further room move we were allocated a large, but very unclean, room... the bathroom was covered in hairs which certainly didn't belong to us and the carpet was filthy and covered in cigarette burns. In summary... Hotel is very TIRED, rooms are NOT CLEAN and staff are RUDE (although are probably overun with complaints day in day out). If you can afford just a little more money per night PLEASE stay elsewhere. The great location of this hotel does not begin to outweight the negatives...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Good enough room”
Reviews.Author: uscmike1
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is wonderful- right across the street from Madison Square Garden and Penn Plaza/Subway station. The convenience of these two facts alone make it worth considering. The lobby is gorgeous. The corridors/rooms are indeed old and feel like you're looking through a time warp, but that doesn't mean that they aren't capable of providing a safe and comfortable place to sleep in NYC. It's hard to call anything in NYC a good value since the prices are so much higher in the city than what I'm used to being from the Southeast US, but I thoroughly enjoyed my visit to NYC and sightseeing. The hotel met my expectations and the location exceeded them. Enjoy your travels!

Reviews.Title: “Brutal for the price, run down property”
Reviews.Author: jaybar1
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly staff, but awful rooms. Bed was awful, plaster falling off walls, dreary rooms, smelt awful. One gets what they pay for. Over priced for quality of room. Only decent thing is the great location. TV was awful, dull hallways, bad experience. Will never stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: DANYSTYLE
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Penn for four five nights. Check in took quiet a while as there are only 3 counters open but staff was friendly. The room was small, clean but gloomy due to the lights. The bathroom needs an upgrade as water keeps dripping all the time and towel hangers are only for decoration. The cleaning staff can be very noisy in the early mornings but rooms very always cleaned very good.

Reviews.Title: “Nothings Changed SINCE 2002 !!!”
Reviews.Author: debz1096
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel in 2002 and delighted when we walked through the FRONT doors. It looked amazing..... THEN, we had to walk to the lift area. My enthusiasm soon disappeared!! Cushioned front doors awaited us on the front doors of the lift! We then proceeded to our room along corridors that had you looking behind you. Very uninviting. We walked into our room and Bam! Our feet were stuck to the carpet literally from the dirt embedded into it! We opened the curtains, oh what a view..... a brick wall!!!! We pulled back the sheets.... wow the sheets were spotlessly clean. Then we pulled the sheet back.... well lets say, sleeping on the streets would be cleaner. We opened the bedside draw and found a cup and saucer in the draw growing green mould. My husband called to me that there was a rat by the table and I literally ran out the room..... we later found out it was a pair of filthy boxers shorts that had been screwed up and thrown on the floor.... but by WHO and WHEN!!! We queued for an hour with other disgruntled guests , only to be told there were no more rooms available and we would have to stick with what we had! They promised to sent up the maids to clean the room again!! They did a much better job the second time around. The reception staff were rude, but probably because they were having the same conversation continuously day in , day out! MY ADVICE..... I went there in 2002 and it was the worst experience of my life. And it certainly wasn't a cheap weekend break from the UK. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS HOTEL.....YOU'VE BEEN WARNED!

Reviews.Title: “Vacuum free hotel”
Reviews.Author: SoftwareKing
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel with bed bugs, slow service, and no vacuum on the property, this is the place for you. Don't walk but run from this place!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a hotel that some will love and some will hate!”
Reviews.Author: FoxySwanseaUK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is like being in a time warp, but full of character all the same. Yes the reception/foyer is manic 24/7, yes the corridors are straight out of The Shining, yes the rooms are small, basic and in need of maintenance, however you do grow to like the place... honestly! After all you come to New York to see the place not stay in your hotel. That said,our room was serviced daily to a good standard and the staff were friendly. The location is the hotel's biggest asset within walking distance of Times Square and next to the subway so getting arouind is easy. A. word of warning ; be careful of Lindy's diner attached to the hotel . Went there for breakfast ...ridiculous prices.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go here”
Reviews.Author: hawkeyejohn11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Penn Hotel a couple weeks ago when we were in NYC for our daughter's college graduation. It was supposed to be a fun time. We arrived and were given a room on the 4th floor. Walking down the hall made you feel like you were in a submarine. The doors have this small insert in them that makes them feel very small. We entered the room where the lights and TV were on. I thought we had been given the wrong room but after calling out loudly, no one answered. The next thought was someone laying dead in the bath tub. The carpet was filthy. Stains on it and in need of vacuuming. We called the front desk and they moved us to the 11th floor. A slight improvement as the lights and TV were off when we entered the room but about as bad. I would go out of my way to never stay there again and tell as many people as I know not to either. This is a hotel hell.

Reviews.Title: “DIRTY LOOKING - OH WHY OH WHY DO I SEE ...”
Reviews.Author: moresitestosee
Reviews.Content: Literally steps away from Penn Station and Madison Sq. Garden. That is the ONLY thing that is good about this hotel! Decent check in area. We stayed there 5 days 4 nights. EVERY TIME we took elevator only 3 were working during our trip. The doors to the rooms looked like they were from an insane asylum! The carpet was thread bare, tub had a multitude or cracks, no lock on bathroom door, and no stopper in sink. We went to People's Court for taping, got back to change (since it was 99 degrees outside and we dressed up), got back to room at 3:30 pm, housekeeping didn't hesitate to take the tip $$ BUT ROOM WASN'T EVEN CLEAN YET. PLUS go into the bathroom and THERE WAS A FREAKING COCKROACH CRAWLING IN SINK!!!!!!! Called management - no sorry only "I'll move you". Ya think!!! Walking through hallway to elevator (no hallways were air conditioned by the way) to get to new room on 7th floor my daughter tells me OH MY GOD DON'T LOOK UP. Well, what's the first thing I do - LOOK UP!! Big mistake - more cockroaches in light fixtures!!!. Went into room new room and shower was non-stop running - NO way am I going to listen to that all night!!!! They put us on the 14th floor where they said it was renovated. Sure bathroom was decent but again the carpet was thread-bare. PLUS we could hear the other occupants in the other rooms talking. Walls aren't thick enough. Thank God it was hot and we were at least able to turn on the air conditioner to drown out their mouths! We had a continental breakfast every morning - 3 dirty tables to choose from, inside a small room, and coffee, juice, bagels (to toast in a dirty toaster), and sweet rolls. There is no way that I would ever recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, opposite Madison Sq. Garden”
Reviews.Author: ster312
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a decent one as compared to other hotels in the city. The location is perfect and the rooms are decent sized as compared to the average rooms in hotels in NY. The price of this hotel is also very competitive, but it doesn't belong to any big brand, so if you are one those people who like to collect points, look somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “nothing wrong with it”
Reviews.Author: missy044
Reviews.Content: just back from 5 nights in hotel penn myself and my daughter we were lucky room on 2nd floor was huge 2 king size beds very comfortable beds very clean changed every day towels fresh every day bathroom spotless lovely hot water cheeck in and out only a few mins wait mabye we were lucky we can not fault this hotel would go back near to every thing felt very safe

Reviews.Title: “Unfair reviews!!!”
Reviews.Author: SFrater
Reviews.Content: When I read the reviews for this hotel I was a little nervous about staying here, but they could not be more wrong!! Yes, the actual rooms and hallways are a little dated, but this hotel was not even close to the nightmare people are saying! We stayed here for a week at the end of May, and could not be happier with our hotel selection! The staff as friendly, and helpful. The location is wonderful, and our room had an amazing view of the Empire State Building!! The only "issue" I had was the bathroom; It was very small, but do able, the shower was the problem, the water temperature was not consistant at all. It as definitely not a big enough issue to warrant an awful review!! I'm not sure what these other people are expecting for the price you pay here, it is NEW YORK!!! I would suggest this hotel to anyone! Do not let the bad reviews put you off from this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: melb02
Reviews.Content: I dont know what is wrong with a lot of these people who have wriiten such ghastly reviews!! I stupidly read all of them and took note of all the bad ones expecting some sort of rat-infested, dark, dingy new york maffia style hotel! Thankfully I was plesantly suprised and relieved. The hotel itself is a big old fashoined typical new york building wonderful to look at. Really busy loads of different tourists from all around the world and so big!! The staff must have their work cut out for them. Staff themselves were okay, not overly friendly but not rude either, just left us to it which is what I like anyway. Okay so the hotel isn't the five star plaza, if you want to spend an extra few grand, dont stay there!!! For its price it was absolutely fine. Had a huge....I mean huge room with clean towels and sheets, which were changed daily. A big bed which was really comfortable and a tv with loads of channels. Yes hotel is in need of some T.L.C and yeah the decor is looking tired and could do with upgrading but honestly who cares??? I actually thought the old rustic tired look reminded me of like a time warp being in some new york 1920's hotel had a nice, old charm about the place! The location is amazing I mean amazing and completely makes up for any lack of the basic hotel, you're opposite the train station a minute away from the metro. You step outside the hotel straight into the hussle and bussle the streets of NYC, you walk a minute down the road and can see the Empire State Building which is in the next street. Madision Sqaure Gardens is opposite the hotel on the other side of the road, you're 2 mins away from Macy's and right in the heart of Manhattan, anyone would be crazy not to stay here just on location itself! I think the prices are so cheap considering where it is! If you're a fussy person who only wants the best and wants 5 start treatment then no, dont stay here but if you're like me, a level headed normal average joe who wants somewhere to rest your head down each night in the heart of this amazing city then trust me, dont be put off!

Reviews.Title: “Bus stops here!”
Reviews.Author: bostongolfers
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel which needs a major overhaul and rennovation. Its very large and inexpensive but the check in service is horrible, no matter what time.Understaffed! There is no bill in your room when you depart so you need to wait another half hour to get a copy upon departure.. Too few people on staff and not well trained. They gave me a smoking room when I requested non smoking. Waited in line (they are extensive) about 30 min to get another room. Be advised its a tourist hotel and cheap and rooms are musty! The only saving grace is its near Penn Central and pretty central. You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “the best location, the less comfort”
Reviews.Author: minnyn
Reviews.Content: I suppose it has one of the best locations in New York. Just opposite of Madison Square, 2-3 street far way from Empire state and very close to 5th avenue and Times Square. No need to take a bus or subway. Breakfast seems good. But the hotel is so huge that's why so crowded. For sure, it is multi national! The rooms are not comfortable so much, especially the bathroom is a shame!. I've never seen a washstand like that before. It seems it was just manufactured manuelly. So poor! I think it's not so clear by the way. Also the doors of the rooms are very strange, you feel that you're in a butcher shop and the door is its cold room's door. But if you don't take account the details like that and if you don't spend so much time in room (why should you?) it's a good opportunity to be very close to all functions of NY.

Reviews.Title: “dirty but very well located”
Reviews.Author: bATMAN07
Reviews.Content: ... we stayed three friends there, couple of years ago, in a moody triple room. Very basic furnishing, poor toilet, but the hotel is one of the cheapest options around there. So I would call it good value for money. At least service was nice and cheerful. ... not recommended for travellers that can afford something better ...

Reviews.Title: “In Need of renovation”
Reviews.Author: PaulandJanet
Reviews.Content: This Hotel has a great location for visiting New York and has a wonerful history - this is where Glenn Miller wrote "Pennsylvania 6500" during a stay there sadly it has not been decorated since then!!

Reviews.Title: “Oh Dear - I am in the dog house”
Reviews.Author: just2collect
Reviews.Content: What an eyeopener - Smashed doors - thread bare carpets - Security on the lifts, was I the unlucky one. We enter the foyer - beautiful marble floor - very nice. Reception average to good little bit slow on checkin but, hey, we are on holiday. given the room key and off to floor 12. Thought to myself I have definitely scored some brownie points with my wife, she has been looking forward to this for months. I should have smelt a rat when we had to pass through security barrier to get to the lifts, into the lift very nice - modern and clean. Press the button and off we go - bing - we reach our floor doors open and that was when the smell of musty old carpets hit us, off down to our room - not looking good - arrive at the door and notice that it had been patched up around the lock about 3 times , was not getting a good feeling. Got into the room clean -nice fresh sheets but dated decor and furniture. Was getting an earful off the wife but as we were only staying one night we agreed to put up with it as we were going to a show and then out on the town so would not be in the room much. When checking out I express my concerned and was told that as they were very busy at the time we were staying we had not been put on one of the refurbished floors as we were only there one night. Hmmm - would be interested in hearing if any one has stayed there since !. I can now see why it was one of the cheaper hotels in the area ( even though it was still over the 100 dollar a night So we are going back to New York at the end of 2011 but have been instructed by the darling wife to make sure I do not book here again. Sorry !!

Reviews.Title: “Needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: MarthaBermuda
Reviews.Content: We love this location so we always stay here. But it is clear that they need a serious upgrade. The phone did not work in the room. The two single beds were flimsy and we wanted a queen. It seems you have to stay on another floor to get a decent room. They need a serious upgrade, old and shabby rooms. Depressing! The lobby is fantastic. The people are very helpful. Most of all - DO NOT USE THE ATM MACHINE IN THE LOBBY. They stole my money and when I called the number on the machine, they were rude! The front desk staff knew about the crappy machine, and put it down to scammers in New York. The hotel needs to NOT have that ATM there. Oh my gosh! Terrible! Use the Citi B ank and HSBC banks to get your money!

Reviews.Title: “Small dirty room with cockroaches in the bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Cazzy-j
Reviews.Content: Great location, however you get what you pay for, the hotel is cheap relative to manhattan hotel prices. WhT you get in return is dated dirty room, the bed was clean, the bathroom ceiling plaster was falling off. We moved to a second room after the cockroach and the new room was the same if slightly worse, so I'm guessing all the rooms are in the same condition. Stay at your peril...

Reviews.Title: “Waste your entire NYC stay in line checking into your hotel at Hotel Pennsylvania (and checking out)”
Reviews.Author: 1forAll
Reviews.Content: Waste your entire NYC stay in line checking into your hotel at Hotel Pennsylvania (and checking out). There are almost no staff at this LARGE NYC hotel in peek season. I stay over 100 nights a year in hotels all over the world. NEVER stay at Hotel Pennsylvania ever. EVER.

Reviews.Title: “if you get one of the good rooms you'll be fine..otherwise we aware”
Reviews.Author: lunalovegood17
Reviews.Content: this hotel was very odd. firstly we arrived into the hotel, there were 6 of us in total. my parents (one room), my sister & partner and me & my friend (second room) we are all aged 23-26. we got sent to a room (2 doubles) to find that it was the filthiest room I have been in. apart from the walls paper hanging off, ceiling tiles missing, the carpet dirty, sheets dirty,it also turned out that the bins were full, and towels still in the bath and the floor- obivously not been cleaned. We phoned the reception to get "someone will clean it soon" - this was not good enough even with a clean, the room was still not liveable. I am not a fussy person I have stayed in many hostels but this was the worst room I have ever seen. after complaining they moved us to another room. this time the room was lovely...a disabled room, the room was huge, walk in shower, wardrobe. apart from it had 1 bed for 4 people - not wanting to lose the nice room (we saw the bad rooms) we got promised 2 camp beds. - 3 hours later these arrived (not the best service. This was the worst day. so we ended up paying £700 to sleep on camp beds!! If we were luckly the maids will clean the room...some days they left us sheets to change the beds ourselves!! other days missed us completely. my parents room was average- inbetween the dire room and our lovley room. when we were in new york it was freezing but the room temp was always comfy and never felt cold (apart from outside!) there is a lovely cafe to the left of the hotel just outside (cafe europa) which we used for a meeting place and breakfast. The location was amazing. minutes from many different subway stops, 5 minutes from macys and main shopping areas. This was our 3rd time to NYC and I usually stayed in hostels, and was my first time in a hotel. personally I would chose a hostel..cheaper and still have good locations. I would only return to this hotel if I could guarantee a room like the disabled one. (floor 17) as having seen the one we could have been given. as it is NYC you sleep & rest there...and that is what it could be good at.

Reviews.Title: “pathetic hotel never recommend anyone”
Reviews.Author: jitinsanghvi
Reviews.Content: we booked the penn 5000 room,we had 7 rooms as we were a big famiy all in the penn 5000 rooms it took us about more than 90 mins to check-in the front desk guy was very rude left in middle of check-in,inspite of the voucher saying penn 5000 guest would have express check-in.rooms were stinking very old rooms in breakfast for vegetarians only bread that too would get over by 9.30.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms a big let down but great location”
Reviews.Author: Merlin26
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in an ideal location. Web site very misleading. The room that we stayed in was dingy and dirty with electrics that made you wonder how many fires they have in a year! However the linen was very clean & towels changed daily. After the initial shock of our room not looking anything like the one featured on the web site we realised what little time we spent in the room was not too traumatic. Staff friendly enough. Be prepared for a long check in time as constant queues. I would be inclined to look for another hotel however it didnt spoil our time in new york.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect, but not half as bad as I expected”
Reviews.Author: lolstar6
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a weeks holiday in New York. After reading all of these reviews I was more then dubious about this hotel but I honestly was pleasantly surprised. No its not the most modern of hotels, the rooms could seriously do with a make over and there is a faint musty smell all around the corriders, but honestly, what do you expect for a 2 star hotel? First of all the reception staff were perfectly friendly and helpful in my experience contrary to what I had read here. The reception area is more like a station, very grand and large. There was also a massive queue every morning, although we were lucky when we arrived as the queue wasnt that bad, but I can imagine this must be frustrating for others. The hotel room doors do look like prison doors as stated in other reviews, but they are doors?! Who cares! The only complaint I really had was the room service. For half of the week it was fine, clean sheets every day, clean bathroom, new towels etc.. but for a few days we would return back to the hotel at about 4 -mainly to get out of the intense heat NYC saw last week-and the room still hadnt been done! We complained to the reception staff and eventually it was done, but the staff didnt bother to change the bins. This really was my only complaint about the hotel. The dated decor wasnt really an issue as I wasnt expecting the ritz. The location is superb, you couldnt be more central and in the hub of Manhattan. Overall this hotel exceeded my expectations, no its not perfect and the hotel could certainly benefit from a make over, but if your just looking for a place to sleep, ina great location you could do a lot worse.

Reviews.Title: “Dont know what all the complaints are about”
Reviews.Author: Traveller8620
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel in Feb 11 and would not fault it. Perfect location right opposite Penn Station and Madison Sq Gardens, 2 mins from Empire State, Macys and 5th ave and 5 mins from Time Sq. The hotel is not the most up to date or modern decor but really who cares? This didnt bother us in the slightest, we were in New York! I wasnt really too concerned if the carpet was a bit dingy or there was a bit of mould on the tiles in the bathroom. I wouldnt say it was really dirty and didnt feel gruby or uncomfortable staying there. Lovely power shower and towels changed daily. I would definatly stay here again. It all depends what your looking for, if your really picky i suggest a 5* hotel, if you just want somewhere comfortable and convenient this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “The Unbeatable Location”
Reviews.Author: MichalCichecki
Reviews.Content: New York was one of the places I visited during my around the world trip and I stayed in the Hotel Pennsylvania for two nights in March 2011. The train stops, you exit the station, enter the hotel’s lobby, check-in, then you get to your room. You look at your watch and realize that it passed only 20-25 minutes since you left the train and you are ready to take a shower. What an unbelievable feeling especially for a long term traveler! I had been on the way for 2 months when I reached New York. The Amtrak’s Lake Shore Limited from Chicago arrived at Penn Station around 7:00pm. I left the station at 7:10pm and entered the lobby of the Pennsylvania Hotel at 7:12pm. 15 minutes later I was enjoying the shower. It was like the heaven after nearly 20 hours train ride. The Pennsylvania Hotel has just unbeatable location - 5 minutes walk from the Time Square, both - the Penn train station and the Madison Square Garden, where you can enjoy either the NBA or NHL games, are just across the street. Empire State Building? Here you are - just 5 minutes away. Several cafes, a bookstore, boutiques, restaurants, easy access to the underground - everything is there, what you have to do is just exit the hotel’s lobby door. But a great location is not the only thing which offers a great value for money. The service itself was also very good. I got a specious room with a bath, a huge bed and a huge desk, where I could sit down and catch up with my writings from the journey. The room was clean and very cozy. Moreover, the next day after my arrival, I got a telephone call from Jerry, who helped me to arrange my stay, and he said that the management of the hotel, knowing that I was doing my around the world trip, was happy to meet me personally before I go. So on the day of my departure I met up with Bertrand - the Director of Group Sales. There are hundreds of people staying in the hotel each day, and the fact that someone from the management found a moment for me during a busy day made me feel like I was a world wide known traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Nipper7272
Reviews.Content: I have read the reviews and agree that the hotel does need updating but our room was clean and we felt safe in the hotel. The main attraction is the location it's close to Times Square , Empire state and tube/ rail networks. Like everything in life you get what you pay for , don't expect 5* , it's a good standard hotel in it's price range .There was only one issue which was down to a staff member who was pretty miserable when I was checking in. The next morning I came down early to use a deposit box . The same guy was there again and still no smile , when I asked about a box he said "it's a bit early " . Overall I would use this hotel again , had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: stz2000
Reviews.Content: Super value for money, great location, room were fine but dated, cleaned everyday, friendly staff, definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: RossInLondon
Reviews.Content: I was dreading my stay in this hotel after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. I was, however, pleasantly surprised. I have stayed in over 15 hotels in the last year and I can confidently say that this hotel is what it's advertisements promise - value for money, excellent location and big. This is a two star hotel and that is what it is - nothing more, nothing less. I stayed on the 12 th floor - the room was clean, comfortable and well equipped. The decor is not contemporary by any stretch of the imagination, but the room was fine. The staff cleaned the room every day and provided fresh towels. The location is superb - close to Chelsea, Soho and Times Square. Lots of shopping and touristy places nearby. There is free wi fi at Borders across the road. If you are planning on spending your whole holiday in your room and expect to be treat like royalty when checking in - do not stay here. If you want a cheap, superbly located, comfortable and clean hotel to use as a base while you explore this amazing city - book a room!

Reviews.Title: “The location was great, the hotel rooms were terrible”
Reviews.Author: jamaicafuninthesun
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect, near Time Square, Central Park, and the subway station. Lots of stores, restaurants and coffee shops. The room however was terrible, the carpet dirty, the beds were lumpy, the room small. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “So disgusting”
Reviews.Author: Me_088
Reviews.Content: I went on a school trip to NYC recently and unfortunately we had to stay at this hotel because our original hotel canceled our reservation very last minute. The location is amazing, and the staff is very nice and accommodating. We asked for two more towels and got four pretty quickly. Those are literally the only good things i can think of about this hotel. The rooms were so gross. The paint was chipped, the shower/bathtub had brown, i'm assuming rust marks. The shower was unbelievable. I flooded the bathroom the first day trying to turn off the shower but the handle came loose or got stuck or something and the water pressure got so hard we couldn't figure out how to turn it off. Then every other day after that it felt like kinves were hitting us when we showered. Our friends had a dead cockroach in their room. The rooms smelled, the carpets were old and dirty, the sheets and beds were old and dirty. One of the beds even broke. This hotel is in such a great area, and it was pretty busy when we were there in the beginning of May, so they can afford to clean the place up. Just change the carpets, or clean them, paint, fix some of the dents and holes in the walls and clean it down good and then maybe I'd consider recommending this place, but I would never ever go back there again. I felt so gross the entire time.

Reviews.Title: “Memorial Day weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: Bmoron
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights, no complaints. Room was clean, yes could use update but for price and location is exactly what we were looking for and would not hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and does not merit the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne1Cork_Ireland
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this hotel. I was travelling by myself and was apprehensive about staying here after reading the reviews. But it was actually fine. I arrived before check in time but was still given a room. The person I met at reception said "I have a nice room for you". It was on the 17th floor ( I have heard that the higher the floor, the nicer the room). The room was fine, the decor is outdated but it was clean and the bathroom had been recently renovated. Saying that, the shower head wouldn't stay in an upright position and I ended up having to hold it above my head! Also, the TV didn't work but it was fixed within 20 minutes of ringing the front desk so no complaints there. The location is excellent. Just one block from Macy's (in fact I could see it from my bedroom window) and opposite Penn Station. There is a pub called Tir na Nog (on 8th ave) close by and this was good for dinner. I wouldn't recommend the cafe Lindseys attached to the hotel. The food was very poor here. The lifts in the hotel and plentiful and you are never waiting more than one or two minutes. I would stay here again if I was looking for a central location in NY.

Reviews.Title: “You pay for the location, and the mouse in the room too”
Reviews.Author: mooning_88
Reviews.Content: There was a mouse in my room. There is little water pressure in the shower and they are hard to turn off; if you're not careful it will run and run. The hotel is not one of the cheapest but there are deals to be had via Expedia and such like. The location was totally fantastic. Could not have asked for better in that regard I could have asked.for free WiFi, and think that it is not too much to ask for. Would recommend only for the location, nothing else, be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location at a great price”
Reviews.Author: dougukLondon
Reviews.Content: I know there is a lot of negative reviews about this hotel and I was dreading to what was going to greet me. I even considered cancelling and booking elsewhere. I'm glad I didn't as it wasn't the horror story that some people are saying. OK, it's not the Ritz and it's a bit dated but my room was cleaned everyday ( you HAVE to place the service sign outside for this to be done) and the location makes up for everything. I'm trying to book in again for next year but it's already booked up. If you want the Ritz, Waldorf or the Charlton and are prepared to pay their prices then do so, but then don't whinge when booking a "buget" hotel like this.

Reviews.Title: “Noise and humidity in the room”
Reviews.Author: alfredo5656
Reviews.Content: In spite of the fantastic location, the Hotel does not care about the darkness of the corridor, the doors of the rooms looks like a refrigerator door!!!! The tapestry looked like were there since the openning of the Hotel!!! the computers were so slow. Looks like that are slow in order to keep you longer there ( with this, they can charge you more) I had credit in my card that used to be connected, and could not receive the credit back!! The bathroom was terrible!!

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: dzordzdzordz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in great location in the middle of NYC. Hotel is old and you can not compare it to brand new hotel. But if you want to sleep in classic clean old New York building with great atmosfere try this one!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, terrible room.”
Reviews.Author: onthegotraveler2011
Reviews.Content: If you want to safe money in order to be in a great location, this hotel is perfect for you. But I can say I wouldn't return to this hotel anymore. When we got there and looked around the lobby (which is nice), we thought "maybe the reviewers on Tripadvisor were too demanding. However... The Penn Station was very convenient and the location was awesome. But the bathroom was creepy, the room was disgusting. In the end, the rate was too high for what it was offered. I can't say our vacation was disastrous because of our choice. But it could have been much more decent.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location”
Reviews.Author: hayley1605
Reviews.Content: Well for my first Trip to New York it was the most AMAZING trip ever! i couldnt fault anything! the Hotel was slightly Grimey but the Location and Price couldn't of been better. Staff were helpful if anything was needed and the Staff cleaning the rooms were always very friendly! all the people whinging about this Hotel need to be prepared to pay more for a better stay!

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: lucyjjo85
Reviews.Content: The hotel looked nice from the outside and in the lobby it was big, marbled and lovely. However when we started walking through the corridor to our room with the 70's carpet i thought mmm. But when we got into our room. Budget is not the word! the walls were crumpling, the plug sockets hanging off the wall. The tv was something from the 60's. The bathroom was sort of clean although the shower could have done with a good scrub. I know you go to new york to see the sights but this really put a dampner on our holiday. iknow that u tip however outside the hotel we flagged down our taxi got in but then the hotel porter stopped the taxi and wouldnt let us leave until we gave him a tip. It has really put us off going to new york again which is a shame.

Reviews.Title: “Worst dump ever”
Reviews.Author: Chr1
Reviews.Content: 300 $ per night for a filthy dump, that can't be reasonable - not even in NY. They haven't done anything at this hotel since it's founding, a smell of smoke and barf in the hallways and rooms, the rooms just outright terrible. Carpets that you don't want to touch with the soles of your shoes, broken . And the biggest joke of all times: the "club 5000" - pay more for the same dirt - and a complimentary continental breakfast. Lousy!!.

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST HOTEL EVER”
Reviews.Author: sybros
Reviews.Content: The room was dirty, and had an awfull smell. The staff wasn't so friendly....The only good thing is the location, but unfortunatly the whole situation can't help. It was as a nightmare i was counting the days to leave. I didn't enjoy at all my staying there. No breakfast, no free internet.

Reviews.Title: “This is the worst hotel I've ever been to. Don't stay there.”
Reviews.Author: sc12258
Reviews.Content: The line waiting to check in took over an hour. We lost the key card on one occasion and that took another hour to be seen by the front desk. On entering the room the decor is dowdy and appears not to have been refurbished in decades. The room was filthy, the TV didn't work and actually had a big hole in the front of it. When we phoned to ask for it to be fixed we were told they were 'very busy'. Nobody showed. The staff appear to have lost all hope. When we asked how to complain at the front desk they said there was no system for that. Spoke to a manager who seemed to suffer complaint fatigue and said he couldn't authorize any cancelation and repayment of the money already paid to the travel company. We checked out anyway as this is the worst hotel I've ever stayed in by a very large margin and it would have been too depressing to spend the rest of our NYC stay in that establishment. It should be closed down. I can't believe travel companies send people there.

Reviews.Title: “sucks!”
Reviews.Author: dudong
Reviews.Content: we read all the review about this hotel and we were anxious about it but we dont have a choice all hotels are fully book. upon entering the looby its so dark and so busy the check in counter has a long line, while we are in the elevator were thingkin about our room hoping it will be ok........when my wife open the room i want to back out and check out our room so untidy the carpet its full of mud stain the washroom some tiles are missin lights full of dust with flies, the shower so slow its like the water is running out. the good thing in this hotel is the location is accessible to all.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Content: OurGrand Daugter's senior class trip was to New York just last week. The tour group changed the lodging to this hotel. The 15 teenagers and the 3 chaperons were to be able to check in upon arrival at approximately 10:30 am but when they arrived, they were told they could not check in before 4:00, so they walked the streets of New York. That was just the start of it all, the rooms were Nasty, light fixtures held together with duck tape, rust and mold on the racks in the bath room and very poor plumbing. The lobby in this place looks like a 5 star Hotel, but when you go thru to the rooms are disgusting and that is putting it mildly. At midnight my granddaughter and her 3 roommates had to be moved to another room because the toilet would not work, That same night the Sr. class advisor requested to be moved from athe room next to the elevator and storage room for the cleaning equipment, the noise was outrageous, in the 5 days they were there, 2 more of the rooms for their group had to be moved because of plumbing problems. This place should be shut down by the health department. Perhaps they could just rent out the lobby, good location, but horrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some improvements, but its location/price ratio can't be beaten”
Reviews.Author: pvdesign
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel in May 2011. It was our first trip to NY, and I can't think of a best location to a hotel in Manhattan. It has Penn Station across the street, and you can see the Times Square from the entrance. Turn right at the corner and there's the Empire State, just a couple of blocks away. Walk just a bit more to the north and you will reach the Rockefeller Center and Central Park. The problem is that the hotel must be about a century old. The furniture in my room was older than me, for sure! Some things should have been already replaced, such as the air conditioning and the TV. As far as cleanliness is concerned, no issues at all: our bathroom was perfectly clean, and so were the linens. Not even dust trace on the furniture. It was a convenient choice for us. We came from JFK by train, only with two backpacks, for maximum mobility, so we just had to cross the street after leaving Penn Station. The concierges were not the most polite guys you wound find, but I wouldn't care either. They have a good shuttle service back to JFK - it was expensive, but worked well. I think it's more interesting to spend $ enjoying the city, so I don't see a point in spending much with hotel. This is not a real good one, but it is ok. Just use it for what it is for: to replenish your energy and recharge your camera batteries before going out again!

Reviews.Title: “Yuck!”
Reviews.Author: Dabiztravler
Reviews.Content: Last minute business trip, and needed a central location. I discovered there is a reason the Hotel Pennsylvania had the only room with conferences and graduations in town. This is the most filthy pit I have ever stayed in. My business associates joked me about bedbugs but I couldn't bring myself to pull back the sheets to check knowing I had no options. I came up with every excuse to stay out of the hotel/room, and used the location as a great starting point for early morning runs. When I jogged past some people sleeping under blankets in central park, I briefly contemplated the fact that I would be in more sanitary conditions if I slept in the grass. Unfortunately I needed to be able to shower, shave and put a suit on. I barely slept for fear of what may be lurking in the darkness. Couple that with the drunk in the next room trying to open the lockoff door at 2 am and this was a horrific experience at a stiff price.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: lesley48_11
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after our original booking was cancelled. We then read the reviews... We were worried to say the least. We arrived, lobby large and clean, we checked in with ease, and the staff were friendly and helpful. Ok so onto next dreaded step, the corridors 14th & 16th were clean and tidy. Our rooms, they were ok, yes in need of lots of T.L.C and updating, but beds were comfy and clean. towels were changed daily, house keeping staff were happy to provide extra`s. This is a 2 star hotel so dont expect 4 star facilities. We went to New York to see the sights not sit a hotel room. after a busy day all we wanted was a hot shower and comfy bed, and thats what we got. Rooms may differ, as do peoples expectations. The location cannot be disputed, its perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Greedy hoteliers taking advantage and exploiting visitors to N.Y.City”
Reviews.Author: peggysue472
Reviews.Content: Upon reading some of your other reviews stating the accomodation was reasonably priced, well I for one think it was way OVERPRICED for the state of the place. My first visit to America, what a disappointment. Do you not have hotel inspectors checking STANDARDS? Terrible state of disrepair. Has it actually been painted since it was built? Bedroom doors what is that all about? The question of SMOKING was never mentioned to me and I was digusted with the constant smell of this and other unknown aromas....Hall and Bedroom carpets, I would'nt dare walk in my bare feet was'nt sure what I would pick up. My family and I consisted of 9 visitors from Canada and Scotland I was totally embarrassed as I had suggested your hotel. Will never recommend to anyone again.

Reviews.Title: “One Word...DUMP”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler1868
Reviews.Content: Where should I start. Took 45 min to check in. When I reached my room there were dirty towels on the floor, only one light worked, none of the outlets had covers, cold water in sink did not work, sink did not drain. I told the front desk I was checking out and they stated they had nobody there to clean the room and I would be charged. This place is the worse hotel I have ever been in. Do NOT stay here. Warn your friends, family, co-workers, etc about this place.

Reviews.Title: “So central you can't go wrong”
Reviews.Author: irishpocahontas
Reviews.Content: I have been to New York Nov 04, Jan 05, Sept 05, Nov 06, Dec 07, Nov 08, and Nov 09. Each time I have stayed with groups of friends and or my husband in this hotel. The only exception being in Sept 05 when I was lucky enough to have won a trip and we stayed elsewhere which was way up on 57th st and we spent so much money on cabs getting to and from places. The hotel is so central you literally are within walking distance of everything. You step out the front door look to your right and there is Times Square, right across from you is Madison Square Garden. Penn Central Station is right underneath you. Manhattan Mall is right at the back of the hotel. You literally can shop around the hotel and go back and drop your bags to your room and head out again. We preferred to save our money rather than stay in a top notch place and use this money for more shopping for us. Okay so The hotel is quite dated in terms of decor, parts of it are redecorated, some of the staff on the reception desk need some refresher courses on customer service but these are all niggly details. We honestly spent so little time there only to drop bags off and go to sleep that it didn't bother us. You have the helpful staff in the concierge area, the bellboy is always very nice, the staff downstairs who hold your luggage are very nice. So it all balances out. There are plenty of delis around the hotel to grab food from. I would personally recommend a visit to Little Italy for a meal it is fabulous. I would also highly recommend a trip to Jersey Gardens, I much prefer this to Woodbury Common as I find with Woodbury Common all the outlets are individual buildings spread out so you literally need to map out where you want to go and if you are travelling in a group you might spend half your time waiting outside places on other people and not getting everywhere you want to go to yourself. Where as with Jersey Gardens it is literally a massive mall everytime I go I get there before 10am, at 8pm at night I still havent gotten around to every shop but have to go home! Dont forget to show your passport at the info desk where you get a book of coupons for various stores which comes in handy. I would recommend this hotel to people on a budget wanting to buy lots of shopping who aren't too fussed on the 5 star quality of rooms but rather having a place for your head to hit the pillow. You will save so much on cab fares being so central all the high street stores are literally around the hotel and Times Square is a 2-3 min walk away. I have gone to numerous Knicks Games in Madison Square Garden each time also and would highly recommend you doing this if you know what dates you are travelling in advance book through The Gardens website. If you arrive at the hotel and aren't satisfied with your room, go straight to reception and ask to be moved they will do this straight away. Tip the bellboy he will be helping you with your bags checking out!! and the doorman if he hails you a cab, he will get you one quicker each time you need one. The Empire State is literally a 5 minute walk from the hotel I would book tickets for this and anything on else with viator they do better deals then paying at the desk when you get there, you get a voucher to print off and come with you but you need to know what date range you will be visiting. Tickets are also available for Madame Tussauds and Broadway shows etc..

Reviews.Title: “Great location Good value for the price we paid”
Reviews.Author: mightymin52
Reviews.Content: I must admit, when I read the reveiws on here before we left for our trip, I was rather anxious.!! My friend and I stayed here from April 29 - May 2nd. Booking in was quick, apart from that we didn't really have to chat to the staff, The Lobby was very grand , and although the hallways and corridors were rather dark and shabby ! Our room was spotless, The beds were very comfortable, room had it's own air con, the bath and shower was very clean, and we had pure white fluffy towels and crisp white bed linen changed every day!! The chamber maids were always very friendly and helpful! the location was great 1 block from Macy's and The Empire State building could be seen from our room. This is a budget Hotel, which in my opinion gave excellent value for money, and I would certanly return. And I certainly didn't experience any bugs in the room!! At the end of the day, I think I got exactly what I paid fo! a lost cost room in a budget hotel which was more than adequate for my needs. Thank you Hotel Penn.

Reviews.Title: “location great, hotel dire”
Reviews.Author: patrick090
Reviews.Content: we went for superior room,it was tiny, tired and dated, reception looked and felt like train station, obviously managagement feel they do not need to spend money on improvements. we were on 15th floor at one side so at least there was very little noise. it is easily possible to get better hotels in similar area for same price, shopping for those is very very important.

Reviews.Title: “No service, no comfort, old, noisy, stinky, expensive”
Reviews.Author: Soizal
Reviews.Content: Never had such an hotel, looks like a prison, long queue to check in to check out, no service, luggage room at 4$/piece, not requested wake up call at 4pm, very old, room and bathroom damaged

Reviews.Title: “Room was horrible”
Reviews.Author: UNCLEREMUS_7
Reviews.Content: Oriental girls who checked us in was full of attitude,when I asked her for non-smoking she replied "you should have asked for that when you made reservation" she pounded her keyboard so hard,I thought she was going to break it.Room was awful, dirty carpets,bathroom,wallpaper falling off walls,looked like it hadnt been renovated in years. Front desk staff blew us off,made no attempt to change room for us.They did send maintencance man named Alejandro to check heater which wasnt working.Even he was appalled by our room.By the grace of God he got us moved to a much nicer rooma t no charge.He was our angel in all of this.Would never stay there again though.Good location in midtown ,ext to penn station,thats the only good thing I could say about it.

Reviews.Title: “What a horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: shazmo58
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel to my worse enemy. The rooms were terrible not very clean and we had to ask to be moved on our 2nd day as we had the biggest cockroach you have even seen in our room. we also did not get the room we had booked (2 doubles) got 2 singles. When we complained they said what do you expect for 2 stars!! We found the majority of the staff very unhelpful and some even rude. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Total waste of money !”
Reviews.Author: Marc11trip
Reviews.Content: Way too expensive for the mediocre quality. the place has old and quite dirty carpets, rusted electrical plugs in the bathroom, etc... It was a very disappointing experience!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute WORST hotel stay and the hotel DOUBLE-CHARGED us”
Reviews.Author: cjk10
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay in NY for a wednesday night during the week of Easter. All the hotels were fully booked in our range ($200-300) so we made a reservation through Priceline for $275/night at the Hotel Pennsylvania. We knew the rate was high for this hotel but it was the same with all the other hotels and this was the only one available. We checked in at 5pm, once we got to our floor, we started to worry about the condition of the hotel. It was old, which shouldn’t be a problem if it was well kept and maintained through the years but this wasn’t the case. It was old, dirty and poorly lit (probably to hide all the flaws). When we got to our room, we were just appalled. It was so old and looked horribly dirty probably because it was soooo old. Paints were peeling, the telephone was covered in dirt, and the washroom.... I have stayed at motels/inns before but I’ve never stayed at a hotel room where you have a washroom designed like a public washroom. It reminded me of my high school washroom. The toilet was a tankless style with a flushometer valve, exactly the ones you use in public washrooms. We didn’t ask for a different room because we were only staying one night anyways and there’s no guarantee a different room would be any better. We decided to spend the least amount of time in the room to minimize our discomfort. We stayed out all night, came back around 1am, slept and checked out at 7am the next day. When we checked out, we had to pay $1.20 for an incoming call (the other hotels usually only charge $1.00 per call). We paid $1.25 cash, and they said they don’t have change.. A few days ago we got our Visa statement, and to our disbelief we were charged TWICE for the stay. We were charged by Priceline which is where we made our reservation with a full payment of $275, and we were charged AGAIN by Hotel Pennsylvania two days after our stay for $250. This is ABSOLUTELY UNACCEPTABLE. If the hotel were to charge us, they should have said something when we checked out. When we checked in, we already gave them our confirmation number so they should already have a record of our payment. We called them immediately but it was after office hours, so we called again the next morning. The accounting clerk we spoke to did NOT apologize for the mistake they made, and she said it takes 7-10 business days to get our refund back. We are from Canada, our Visa card is in CAD currency. For Hotel Pennsylvania to make the mistake of double-charging us, we are probably going to lose $5 due to the currency exchange rates. That is $5 I am NOT WILLING to lose because this is the Hotel’s mistake. The service at the hotel was not good, everyone who worked there acted like they dreaded the work. Next time if all the hotels are fully booked, I would rather stay at a hostel for $25/night. Honestly, if you like the location (next to Madison Square Garden), if you don’t care about the condition of the room, and if you can find a deal for $50 or less at this hotel, it might be worth considering. But for us, we would NEVER go back.

Reviews.Title: “Bad choice”
Reviews.Author: Bunhun
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Penn for a night and i was glad that it was only a night. The hotel had an impressive lobby and it was just opposite the Penn Station and Madison Square Garden which makes the location ideal. However, the rooms are really in need for renovation. The bed feels rough and it is not comfortable to sleep in. The television is not working properly and images are blurred all the time. For the price that i paid for my night stay (USD180), i would strongly recommend to look for another hotel and pay a higher price as Hotel Penn is really not worth wasting your money on.

Reviews.Title: “WHEN IN NYC, you dont spend time in your hotel!”
Reviews.Author: amylouise23
Reviews.Content: 11 students, 2 teachers and myself stayed in this hotel at the end of March on a business trip with college to go to the UN (and a bit of shopping). IT ISN'T THAT BAD. LOCATION WAS BETTER THAN ANYTHING, slap bang in the middle of everything you want to go and see and right near to Penn sub station. When you're in New York, you are NEVER in your hotel, only to sleep, and then you're too tired to notice the peeling wallpaper! We were getting up at 7/8 and getting back at 11.30/12 every night so this was the only time we were in the room. The lobby is pretty impressive and staff are so friendly and nice. The room was HUGE. Our shower didn't have a tap or socket or anything to turn it on, the toilet seat was broken and there was no plug or stopper in the sink just a hole to the drains which you could see right down. Luckily because we were with a college group we were able to use our friends bathroom but if we were on our own God knows what we would have done. We had no view at all just the other side of the hotel where you could see straight in to people rooms. Television was tiny and old but watchable to catch up with the world news as you're getting ready in the morning. Beds were really comfy and clean sheets were put on every single day. Carpets were hoovered everyday. The actual room was perfect for what we needed, bar the bathroom.
