I'd hesitate to re book to go back here, but for what we needed it was PERFECT and I had the most amazing time in NYC. If you're looking for somewhere cheap, near to everything in walking distance, and comfy beds to sleep in (CAUSE THATS ALL YOU DO IN THE HOTEL) then book here now.

Reviews.Title: “Good location-hotel in need of refurbishment.”
Reviews.Author: owen96
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in April, 2011 as part of a Newmarket package holiday.The hotel is old but the lobby was very impressive and the location was good.It was only 10 minutes walk down Seventh Avenue to times Square.The room on the 8th floor was spacious although the metal dor to the rooms were offputting.The bathroom was very basic and it would have been nice to have a large bathtowel.However, room service was satisfactory and I enyoyed my brief stay.The corridors and the public areas were in need of refurbishment.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value but really sad”
Reviews.Author: Exvornado
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Pennsylvania this week with my wife and 2 teenage daughters. We got one of the upgraded rooms in the Penn 5000 section. Knowing the history of the building in its heyday with the famous phone number and Glenn Miller song was an interesting sideline for my family. But the harsh reality is that the hotel is long past its prime and pretty dirty. Peeling paint is everywhere and if its not peeling, its marked up, scratched and dirty. Heaven forbid if you need the bathroom before you check in as the public restrooms are key access to guests only. Which makes little sense as if you have a room, you can use the bathroom there. The grey metal doors on most of the rooms reminded my daughter of gas chambers during WWII. Not exactly inviting. The good part was reasnonably priced available rooms at short notice. The Penn 5000 rooms did have flat screen tv, but the reception was so bad it looked like from an old tv antenna 100 miles from the station. Which is nuts because the stations broadcast from the Empire State Bldg a few blocks away. The continental breakfast was good, fresh and plenty to eat. Complementary coffee and tea was available 24/7 in the Penn 5000 lounge. The staff was very nice, but the wait at the front desk was long, even at 9 PM. Vornado is just buying their time before the wrecking ball hits the wall here and it shows. I worked for Vornado many years ago when they ran the Two Guys dept store chain. Which they made millions off by closing the stores down and leasing the properties. Vornado is now a major NY real estate holding company and the rest is well known. It will be sad to see the Hotel Penn go eventually, but for all its shortcomings, its not a bad place to spend the night.

Reviews.Title: “Should be renamed "Hotel Fright"!”
Reviews.Author: vaytay
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the worst hotel I have ever ALMOST stayed in! My sister and I booked through a VISA rewards points program (which will remain nameless). We understood we were not staying at a four star hotel, but we did have a level of confidence that the accommodations would be suitable. We checked in and it went downhill from there. The hallway was musty and dark with chipped paint and carpet that was lifting and dirty. Our room was even worse. The pictures speak for themselves. Both managers on duty were horribly rude and the "executive room" that they tried to move us to had a window that was gaping open and would not close and the a/c unit did not blow air. After three hours of incompetence and rudeness, we finally moved to another hotel and enjoyed the rest of our stay. Keep away from this hotel!! The money you save is not worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Good location in Midtown”
Reviews.Author: mpn7330
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel in midtown manhattan. Sure it is a bit worn, but has seen alot of history of NYC. My room was fairly large, with light furnishings, small refrigerator, desk and tv/dresser combo. Bed was king size and reasonable decent. This is not a high dollar hotel, but is adequate for a visit to the city. However.... The location rocks! Walk to theaters, Times Square, across the street from Penn Station, very safe feeling area. I was out until late ( early morning) every night and it was fine. I would recommend using it if you don't spend much time in the rooms, however they work for what you want,,,,Sleep

Reviews.Title: “Single worst hotel stay ever. My nightmare has come to life.”
Reviews.Author: JKCPATraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was apparently built in 1919, and I don't think it has been upgraded since then. I opened my hotel door with the paint peeling off to find the woman from housekeeping sitting at the desk chair watching the very old television. The heat has not worked during my stay here and accordingly to the truly nice woman at the front desk there is no known timeline for repair. The rooms are extremely damp like being in a basement, so my mold allergies are just adding to the misery. The regulator in the shower does not work correctly so the water is freezing one second and scalding hot the next. The room carpet and finishings are old and dirty and there were so few electrical outlets that I had to charge my iPad overnight in the bathroom. The only other outlet I could find was built into the lamp and only supported charging my phone. The staff have been very friendly but other than that I cannot wait to check out!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel location made it a great visit!”
Reviews.Author: Delilah36
Reviews.Content: The hotel was dated decoration wise but other than that, I couldnt say any bad points about it. You can leave your luggage for $8 for as long as you want if you have a late flight, there is a shop in the lobby for bottles of water and small snacks. We barely stayed in the hotel as there was so much to do so the hotel was great for our kind of trip. Would recommend this hotel to anyone going who is going to New York with a busy holiday schedule!

Reviews.Title: “If location is your aim but you are willing to put up with toe nail clippings, rust, damp carpets etc. then the HP is right up y”
Reviews.Author: Jensen_niki
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I picked the Hotel Pennsylvannia because of its location. What a mistake! Our first impression as we set our eyes on the hotel was omg. The revolving doors hadn't been cleaned for days, the foyer was full of people lying (feet up) on the furniture and the receptionists was ungracious and blunt. We watched so many of those holiday nightmare shows and we always felt that the guests were over fussy but now we understand how they felt. As we made our way to our room, we found tissue paper in the lift and a dark patch. Then came our room. There were toe nail clippings on the floor, the heater was omitting a strange smell and the bathroom hadn't been cleaned. We made a mistake and should have read the reviews before booking. If you want a good location great hotel but be warned you'll have to sacrifice what you would expect is standard service for any hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Vicki_J_1989_11
Reviews.Content: I went to New York with my college last year as part of my college course, and i would have to say that i enjoyed every minute of staying in this hotel. the staff were the nicest Amercian people that i have met, the room and everything about them was clean, the location was central to all of New York's best attractions such as times square, macy's, broadway, etc. i dont agree with the comments that the hotel was dirty, it was far from it! i believe these people need their eyes tested!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location! Don't expect a glamourous hotel though.”
Reviews.Author: MarDar13
Reviews.Content: My partner, myself and two friends stayed in this hotel. Facing forward, you're looking straight onto Madison Square Gardens. One block to the right and you're looking at Macy's. This hotel really is in a superb location. The lobby is very impressive, however, where style is concerned, it ends in the lobby. The rooms are basic but clean. The bathroom door wouldn't close fully and in general it was a bit shabby. However, you're not in New York City to sit in your hotel room. If you're like me and you will be out sightseeing the whole time, then does the style of the hotel room really matter? Once it's clean and safe. And seriously, we could see the Empire State Building clearly from our hotel room. The staff were friendly and very patient. By patient, I'm referring to the safety deposit boxes. These are kept in a secure location behind reception and a member of staff has to retrieve your box for you, but you can access them as many times as you like through the day. We never got any attitude from the staff when we were constantly going to our safety deposit box. There is an Irish Bar on the ground floor, if you're into that. We didn't go to NYC to sit in an Irish bar! I would advise anyone considering this hotel to do it! However, don't go expecting to get a stylish NYC hotel like in the movies. But you really can't beat the location of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as it was written in the reviews”
Reviews.Author: Evangelia-haris
Reviews.Content: First of all we must point out that the location of this hotel is perfect, since it is only 30 minutes away from the airport-via train- and is very close to all the sightseeings of N.Y. When I first read the rest reviews I was very disappointed and I decided not to book a room there for my 8nigts stay in the City. However the prices of all the other hotels-even the worst ones- were very expensive and I thought that this hotel was good value, because after all we only wanted it for one sleep.The room was vey warm, it was being cleaned evry day, the staff was very kind and I had no problem at all when checking in and out. The bathroom was very old and needed renovation but the water was hot all the time.It is recomended to persons that prefer to spend their money on shopping and want a good, safe hotel just for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the ok lobby fool you”
Reviews.Author: SJW1000
Reviews.Content: I don't normally write reviews but thought it was important to do so for the hotel. The lobby looks not bad but the room was terrible. The carpet is old brown carpet from the 70's. I didn't take my shoes off it looked so dirty. The bathroom was scary, stained tub and not clean. The bed was similar to a pop up camping bed. I was not good. We moved the next morning to another hotel so we could shower and feel clean again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Experience of My Life”
Reviews.Author: KTWALK
Reviews.Content: I have never been to a hotel so disgusting in my life. I cannot even describe how repulsive it was. There was dust piled up inches thick behind the bed. Not to mention the rust and paint IN THE BATHTUB!! The bathroom was so disgusting that none of us took showers. If you do go to this hotel, I suggest you bring shower shoes. And who knows, I wouldn't trust that water. The beds were hard and the carpet was disgusting. The hallways of the hotel were dirty - you would think they could AT LEAST vacuum? Also, when we checked into our room, the room had not been cleaned!!! There was wet paint on the walls in the hallways as well. And the hallways were creepy and dark, it was like the movie "The Shining". The hotel staff was rude and when we went to talk to a manager they told us we weren't allowed to! Don't let the pictures on the website deceive you, there are no flat screens in the room, I would have rather stayed in a crappy cheap motel than this place. WAY overpriced. The bottom level of the hotel looks so nice , but once you go up to the next floor--it's hell. Also, the location isn't that great. It's 10 blocks from Times Square! The only good thing is that it is across the street from Madison Square Garden.

Reviews.Title: “Should be demolished! No security what so ever!”
Reviews.Author: Rosapink2011
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the WORST place i ever been in NYC. As soon as a checked in, their staff were EXTREMELY rude, she cut me off and "yelled" at me in the front desk answering a simple question about the check in. She handed me a paper saying about the hotel security and said loudly "YOU BETTER READ THIS!!!". As soon as i got upstairs the smell of the place made me feel so sick, smells like a 100 year old carpet that never been washed. Inside of the room, it was worse!! The carpet had tons of stains on it of all colors, the bathroom was SO DIRTY and OLD! The bed sheets were made of a synthetic fabric that didn't look clean AT ALL! I tried to find a new place to stay in the city but it was spring break and every single hotel was packed! I only found +$500 rooms, i end up having to stay 5 days on this horrible hotel in order to don't have to cancel the attractions i had booked to go with my family. In the second day, i came in my room, and somebody not even wearing a uniform were forcing on my door (?), he ran away to the elevator when we walked in the hallway. The truth is that ANYBODY have access to the rooms upstairs, they have a sign saying "show your card after this point" but ANYBODY just walk in and take the elevators accessing the rooms area at any time they desire! I didn't feel safe at all and every time i had to go out i had to lock up every single item of my luggage in order to feel a little more safe since they had very very tiny safe boxes downstairs, you won't even have a place to safely put your electronics if you don't have luggage with locks. One of the the house keepers just HANDED ME on the third day of my stay!!! I never seen a hotel which the guest changes their own sheets!!!! They don't have wireless in the rooms and The cable internet (THAT YOU PAY FOR AND OVERPRICED) wasn't working because the RJ-Cable you connect to the computer were broken and for some reason the modem didn't have a power cord, i called the front desk, they got someone to bring me a new Rj cable I called them again and said that it wasn't still working she told me she wasn't of the IT and that she already sent me a cable, i tried to explain and she again, cutting me off started to yell on the phone saying "I already sent you a cable!", she wouldn't let me talk on the phone only YELL and say obvious things such as "connect the cable on your computer", she end up hanging up the phone on me!!! The business center downstairs have very old computers and is EXTREMELY overpriced and DIRTY! I could keep on going with BAD THINGS to talk about this hotel in only 5 days of stay!! But this hotel should definitely go trough a HUGE makeover on everything, mostly on the STAFF!

Reviews.Title: “Keep hold of your Money”
Reviews.Author: ihatethiefs64
Reviews.Content: Stayed christmas time with the family, hotle itself was not too bad and was as expected for the price- Good location though. In all my times of travelling(30 years +) this is the first hotel where I have had money stolen from my room, not only did they (actually "She" it did not take the brains of an archbishop to know who did the theft) go through our bags to find a small amout of money,but the necky thief took my loose change of about $2 in 1&5 cent copper coins. There are safe deposit boxes if you are willing to wait up to an hour for your cash as the desk tends to ignore you.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected.”
Reviews.Author: Domneil
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I feared the worst. But I can honestly say the hotel exceeded my expectations. Sure, some of the hotel was a bit shabby in places, but the room was clean, fresh towels everyday and the staff were helpful and polite. The location is fantastic, within a five minute walk of Times Square, 5th Ave. and the ESB. We had a fantastic holiday and a pleasant stat here.

Reviews.Title: “exellent location for little money”
Reviews.Author: TomDePreter
Reviews.Content: Last year, we spend a few days in this enormous hotel just in front of penn station. Luxury wasn't our main concern so the hotel suited just fine because of its exellent location (penn station across the street, just as madison square garden). 5th avenue and times square just around the corner. Exellent subway connections to JFK and Newark airports, Coney Island etc

Reviews.Title: “Negative experiances all round”
Reviews.Author: NB1983
Reviews.Content: Travelling with a group of girls New York was the last stop on our trip. Months in advance we had booked two rooms to sleep 3 in each. When we checked in late on the Thursday evening we was informed the hotel did not in fact have two rooms available for us. First issue considering that is what we had booked our rooms and therefore expected what we had paid for. We was finally given a second room consisting of a double bed telling us another bed would be brought to our room. Over two hours later, several phone calls and trips to reception my 'cot' arrived. Tired from travelling the thin mattress on a metal frame was hardly the highlight of my trip. The fact my feet hung off the end was bad enough then the phone rings not far off 1am to check i had finally got the bed. Do this hotel not communicate?!?! Next day after a disappointing start to our stay we asked to be transferred in to another more appropriate room. At 2.15pm we was allocated a room with 2 double beds, again not what we had booked. We went to the room and left items there including purchased presents and sunglasses. When we returned to the room gone 9pm all items had been removed from the room!!!! We had been checked in to the room but it appeared they had not communicated this to house keeping. We received some items back but not all, after being told they was in lost and found!! (This was after several phone calls where i kept being transferred and hung up on.) Surely it was not lost if we had left them in what we thought was our room where our belongings were safe. We was later informed by an individual on the front desk that "If you leave items on the bed or floor than housekeeping dont care and could remove it", Also security told us they often had problems with items going missing....we did not feel safe leaving important items in the room after this. On top of this the hair dryer did not work, the enamel was coming off the bath and the walls and ceilings had the paint peeling off it. I dont normally write reviews however i think people should be aware of my experience and looking at other reviews this is not the first time similar things have happened. So whilst it is cheap in comparison to other hotels and the location is good. You could run the risk of not getting what you booked, Risk you stuff being taken from your room and staying some where that appears far from clean and well kept.

Reviews.Title: “DISAPPOINTED”
Reviews.Author: kimmykim12
Reviews.Content: I usually do not write reviews but I thought it might be useful to someone who's planning on staying there. I stayed at the Hotel Pennsylvania this weekend with a friend from the UK. As I entered the room, to my dismay, I noticed the paint was peeling of the walls and the walls were quite dirty. The bed was really small & quite lumpy. I called for 2 extra pillows on the 1st nights stay & I never rec'd them. I would say the service was poor. OVERALL! I would not give a THUMBS UP to this hotel. GOOD LUCK!

Reviews.Title: “Condemn this hotel as unfit for human use.”
Reviews.Author: drscience
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 1441. The carpet was dirty, there were old hairpins on the floor, the light didn't work, the outlet covers were off, bare wires lay cut on the floor, and above all I woke up covered head to foot with bedbug bites. Over the next 24 hour these swelled and began to cause a severe allergic reaction and I had to have emergency medical treatment. I am still taking prescription drugs every six hours to keep down the swelling, four days later. Apparently there are some clean rooms in the hotel. The location is good. But some rooms even have broken glass - we could see them out of our window. This building should be condemned at once.

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: firehouse1
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a conference and it was so old and dirty. Nothing good too say about this place. Was changed to another room bc the ac didnt work , was "upgraded" to a pen 5000 room not worth the money i paid for a lesser room. Fitness center was a joke. Conference area was under renovation, and it was loud and noisy. Doubletree is much nicer

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: Derek16956
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our stay at the Pennsylvania. It is a big old hotel with a history linked with Glen Miller and the famous 65000 number. The Hotel lobby was always crowded and lively. Sometimes had to wait a while for an elvator as often crowded.The reception staff were polite and efficient. Our room on the tenth floor was clean and tidy. there were new towels every day, the showers were hot and the bed comfortable. A request for extra pillows was furnished within 15 minutes. I would like to have had tea/coffee making facilities in the room, but a 5-minute trip to the cafe in the lobby for a $1-50 coffee to go wasn't the end of the world. The position of the Hotel is perfect. Very easy to get to all the attractions. I don't normally write reviews...in fact this is the first I have done and this is purely due to the negative reviews the hotel had been getting. I think they are very unjust. Don't believe them and enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay --- highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: debral625
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to stay at this hotel because of the poor reviews, but my stay was far from bad. The Penn 5000 room I stayed in was clean and the breakfast was wonderful. The only thing I would recommend is a larger room for the breakfast -- the room is quite small and it gets crowded. For the money, this is an excellent hotel and is close to everything. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Rosemaryeaston
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at the Penn for a 6 day stay in NY, I had never been before and although our room was small, it was clean and tidy, they upgraded us to have access to the Breakfast room, where a light breakfast was provided free with internet access etc. and newspapers. check in and out was quick, all in all a pleasant experience> Location was fabulous, spent a bit of time at Maceys which has a good food court area for quick cheap meals. I would recommend the Pen as we had absolutely no problems.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel for the price. perfect location in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: mitchie01
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights with three teenaged girls, daughter and nieces. Clean spacious rooms, pleasant staff and wonderful location for exploring Manhattan. Subway on the corner. Huge hotel so don't expect too much in the way of room service. However, needed extra blanket which arrived in 10 mins. Old hotel in need of refurbishment but so what. Can't understand negative feedback. Maybe we were lucky but no complaints whatsoever. Stayed on 11th floor. Could possibly be rather noisy if much below. Recommended for location for people who want to sleep, get up early and go out and come back for quick shower and out again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the BAD reviews scare you...we LOVED our stay!”
Reviews.Author: jenfish326
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, I booked THIS hotel because of the price and it looked decent from the website pics. The LOCATION can not be beat. The hotel staff were EXCELLENT and FRIENDLY. The Hotel itself IS old and shows it's age and wear in some places....SO WHAT! Our room was clean and stayed clean the entire week we were there. They clean in the morning and turn down at night. I was horrified and unsure of what we were getting ourselves into but was ABSOLUTELY THRILLED with our accomodations. You will not regret it. I'm planning 2 more trips b4 the end of summer and will only stay here.

Reviews.Title: “JUST SAY NO”
Reviews.Author: zipp1212
Reviews.Content: I hate to say it , but this place is really really BAD!!!!! Waiting on line for a sold out international flight during a high terror alert status is faster more enjoyable than check in at this nightmare hotel. after that hour and a half experience we went to to our room that looked like some one was already there. the bed was not made the tv was blaring, the bathroom was a obviously not cleaned , we actually thought we had the wrong room, when we called the front desk, the reply was "you do realize this is only a 2 star hotel". I still cant figure out how they pulled off that many stars! The only saving grace is that we checked in very late and left very early the next day. I heard that this is the offical hotel for the westminster dog show, I just cant imagine anyone letting there dog stay here. Do your homework before coming to NY. Many better hotels at even better prices and locations. In hind sight, we both feel very stupid for staying here

Reviews.Title: “Don't Panic!! It's not bad at all!”
Reviews.Author: JanGirl81
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel Penn through an agent as part of a flight+hotel package and I didn't read any reviews before I paid only when I'd paid I decided to read some reviews on this site and I nearly cried, it sounded like I'd booked into the dirtiest and most dangerous hotel in the city, needless to say I was absolutely dreading my stay here and I was staying for 12 whole nights. We arrived from Newark at midnight and checked in after waiting in line for about 5 minutes, the lady who checked us in was very friendly. The Lobby was very grand, shiny marble floors and chandeliers. We made our way to our room (1696) and walking up the corridors both repeating 'red rum red rum' as the whole thing had become a bit of a joke by then. The carpets in the corridors were a bit worn and the doors to the rooms looked weird but nothing like the hell on earth people had been describing on here! We anxiously opened the door to our room expecting pools of blood, 100's of rats, serial killers etc and when we walked in we both let out a huge sigh of relief! The room was ABSOLUTELY FINE! The furniture and decor was a bit shabby due to age etc but the room WAS NOT DIRTY, there was not a single mark or speck of dirt on the carpet (yes I got on my knees and checked' the bathroom again was well used but very clean, you could almost see your reflection in the tiles on the wall. Everything in the room worked perfectly the bed was comfortable and it was very quiet, even with the window wide open. The staff were very friendly and helpful at all times. The hotel had every facility a person would ever require in the lobby- ATM machines, Bell Captain, Seating areas, internet lounge with printer, cafe, two restaurants, gift shop, phones, post box, concierge. Another issue people seem to have with the hotel is safety, I don't understand this! I felt very safe all the time, for starters there's a security guard sitting by the lifts 24/7, a lock on your door etc. The location this hotel is in is absolutely perfect, across the road from Madison Square Garden and Penn Station, a 2 minute walk to Macys, a 5 minute walk to Times Square. Please don't be put off by all the bad reviews, people just love to moan about stuff and exaggerate. This is really a nice hotel and at a great location and price. I would stay here again and I hope they don't pull it down! THANK YOU HOTEL PENN FOR MAKING MY DREAM HOLIDAY EVEN BETTER :)

Reviews.Title: “Old,Flithy,Nasty,Bad Service,DO NOT STAY PLEASE!”
Reviews.Author: chrystyn09
Reviews.Content: double beds were the size of a single bed, the bathroom are small hairdryer doesnt work and when i called 3 times for a new one they still never brought it. Scolding hot showers and turns to cold in seconds. waited 5 hours for a roll away bed. the shower i didnt know whether i was taking a bath or a shower bc i was standing in ankle high water. the room was as small as a closet. it was very hot in the room and we could not turn on the fan on the air condition to give us air. we litereally had to change our room bc our first room was so HORRIBLE! i do not reccomend this hotel to anyone its ridiculous. pay extra money its worth it then to deal with this hotel!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “An Absolute Disgrace and Danger to Young People”
Reviews.Author: GoNats
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review on here before but I feel compelled following my recent visit. I am a school teacher and brought over 40 students to visit New York. This hotel almost ruined what was a fantastic few days and I genuinely felt that my students were not safe in this hotel. The smell of drugs was everywhere, one female member of staff was hit upon by a gang of men, people were going into rooms with bundles of cash in the early hours of the morning and one student witnessed an expletive filled row between a couple. Add to this the blood in a bath, pubic hair on pillows and general filth and you get a feel for this hotel. When we complained we were told that 'people were entitled to do what they like in their own rooms'! The only redeeming feature is the location. DON'T BRING SCHOOL GROUPS HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel from hell!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hudddles
Reviews.Content: I had been warned about the state of ths hotel but I had no input into the trip i had to go along with it. It was just as I had been told. My first experence was the porter who helped unload the luggage a large very rude man and it went down from there. We were unable to get our room until 4.00 and when we had been up since 3 am in the uk were were so tired. When we finally got into our room it was very large with 2 double beds in the carpet was stained and looking very tired. The bathroom was disgusting the bath I think it was original had little enamel left on it, you could see bear metal through it and the shower was either too hot or freezzing cold. I had to wash my hair in the sink as i could not stand under the shower. The toilet leaked and was hard to flush. The sheets were clean but the bedspreads smelt. The paint work was grey and the lighting was dull but I guess that was not so bad. The noise from the traffic meant that we got very little sleep the windows did not fit well and were so dirty it ws hard toi tell what the weather was outside. THis place needs to be pulled down soon I know that it has a good position but in the 21st century we deserve better.

Reviews.Title: “Great week spent here with my girlfriend and 2 kids”
Reviews.Author: Tom110972
Reviews.Content: I was a bit dubious about this hotel after reading some of the reviews on here, but I can honestly say that my family and I found it hard to find fault with it. Location is perfect, just 5 mins walk from Times Square, and only a stones throw from Penn St Station and Madison Square Garden. Check in took 5 minutes and the express check out system was even quicker. The room was not 5 star but I wasn't expecting it to be. Clean sheets and clean towels everyday we returned. 12 lifts/elevators meantyou never had to wait more than a couple of minutes to get to your floor. 24hr coffee shop was very good for late night returning to the room too. I would definitely stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “A bed (or 3) for the night.”
Reviews.Author: aselco
Reviews.Content: There is nothing special about this hotel. But in a city with astronomical hotel prices, the pickings are slim. It's old, hasn't had a coat of paint or maintenance in a long time. But I didn't feel unsafe. It is packed with people, yet I had the quietest night in NY I've probably ever had. When I've stayed in friend's beautiful million dollar apartments, and you hear sirens, garbage trucks, people walking, etc. But my interior room (window looking into an air shaft) was super quiet. Would I stay here again, probably not. I'd probably look for another cheap option. Plus, there were three double beds in our huge room (per our request). Now that is unusual!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good VFM”
Reviews.Author: Suzie118
Reviews.Content: OK so there are lots of reviews on here which really slate this hotel. Yes it is old and yes the rooms are small (as are all NYC Hotel rooms). But in terms of value for money I think this was great. We had upgraded when booking, for only a few pounds, to a Penn 5000 room - this basically puts you on a higher floor. The check in was simple and the staff polite and helpful. We had no issues. We were on the 11th floor & yes the hotel could do with a makeover and modernising, but our room was clean as were the towels and the bathroom. The maid came everyday. She cleaned, left fresh towel and changed the bed linen. The TV worked and again we had no issue with this or the room. I think if you do have problems the staff will be willing to help in anyway they can so long as your are reasonable and polite - afterall they are there to help and the few occasions we asked they were really helpful. There isn't a safe in the room, but the hotel does provide free safety deposit boxes - again simple straightforward and not an issue for us. The location of this hotel is fantastic. It is right opposite Penn Station with easy access to all the NYC Subway has to offer. You can step around the corner and see the Empire State Building anytime you want to and Macy's is just a block away. We didnt find (or look) for the coffee lounge that is available to those who upgrade, but there is so much food & drink on offer close by that there seemed little point. My only "don't bother" is for the Lindy's Diner attached to the hotel - it is overpriced and actually just a short walk away is the Moonstruck Diner on 38th & Madison which is far better value and has good service with a vast menu. Little Korea is a must - don't be put off by the lines at the restaurants - they are usually fairly short and the food is again excellent quality and tasty. Another suggestion would be that if you want to avoid the line for the Statue of Liberty is to pre-book before you go. It will stop you waiting for a couple of hours to get through security and on to a ferry. Another favourite of ours is the Brooklyn Diner on 57th and 7th. It is the same as the one off Times Square but is a little less touristy and has excellent food/shakes. Don't forget to check out the East Village - St Marks Place has great restaurants and is very vibrant and colourful at night. We enjoyed Virage. When it comes to gift shop shopping - shop about - those on or close to Times Square charge a few bucks more for most things than those off the beaten track. Especially those at South Street Sea Port at Pier 17. I would stay here again and I would recommend it - the only bedbug we saw was a giant inflatable one in Times Sq - go figure!

Reviews.Title: “WORST STAY EVER”
Reviews.Author: spounds
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be condemned!!!! This place is old, dirty, filthy and a health hazard!!! The rooms are small and extremely filthy!!!! One person found a pool of blood on the floor when he checked into his room!!! I was amazed that this place could be open and allowing people to stay here!!! The carpet was filthy, the walls and doors were dirty, and the bathroom was totally disgusting!!! NOT WORTH THE MONEY!!! A TRUE HORROR HOTEL!!! I will never stay here again!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: jick57
Reviews.Content: after reading reviews not really expecting much but was very pleasantly surprised. we upgraded to a king size bed and to include breakfast for a small price. room was pleasant and clean. staff were all friendly and helpful. fabulous location. if travelling from jfk airport the train station is opposite and so is the subway and short walk to lots of attractions. if we return to NY will definately stay here again. loved the location. great base.

Reviews.Title: “nice location , huse hotel with no service”
Reviews.Author: Horizon080
Reviews.Content: its not so near from times square so dont get fooled with location map huge hotel , all choas around. it take one hour for check in rooms are old with all old furniture. no service in roosm at all small bed and tv. broken bathroom with old taps , shower dont work times square is minimum 20 min walk from their no free wifi , everything is charged hotel is not worth more than 50 usd a day

Reviews.Title: “This could be an awesome place to film an horror movie”
Reviews.Author: AFau21
Reviews.Content: This is BY FAR the worst hotel I have EVER seen! I arrived here in the middle of the night. The people doing the check in looked like the didn't really want to work and didn't care at all. We went up to the room. It smelled really weird and the corridors looked like a scene of a horror movie. We went in the room and it was an horror movie... We could hear the people screaming in the room beside us. The walls were all scratched and the wallpaper was falling down. The rug was GROSS and there were white stains on the blankets (mmmm what where those I wonder). So I put the blankets up to do a scan of the bed and what do I find... Bed bugs! Let me tell you that my friends and I came out of there pretty fast. We cancelled our reservation, which didn't seem to bother (probably cause it happens all the time) and then we went to the Best western president plus which was awesome and bed bugs free, for only 30$ more a night! So if you want a good itch, try this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “RUN DON'T WALK....”
Reviews.Author: Wehatethecape
Reviews.Content: ....As fast as you can AWAY from this hotel. Dark, filthy, dangerous, crowded. HITCHCOCK on meth. Makes the chelsea hotel of the early 80's lopok like the RITZ.

Reviews.Title: “Very deceiving from the beginning.”
Reviews.Author: bampy524
Reviews.Content: Just to mirror some of the other reviews we also found the Hotel dirty and dark. To begin we tried to check in early but to no avail wanted to leave luggage with bell services but had to bring luggage to the "dungeon" aptly named ,cold dark and filthy area on bootom floor where they hold your luggage. There was a station next to the check in area labeled Bell Services but I guess that doesn`t apply to luggage holding for guests. Told to come back after 1 there should be something then,came back about 2 and the other 75 people in line must have been told same thing,anyway got room 697 in back of hotel down two dark smelly corridors noticing all the large areas on walls with paint literally hanging off the walls(wondering if it`s lead paint) opening the door to the smallest room for price I have ever seen.. Opened up the curtains and viewed a brick wall 30 feet away with no view of anything The curtains were riddled with holes and tears not that any sun was going to find it`s way to the room..Smoke dectector hanging from the ceilingopened no battery(but you can rent a dectector at front desk at check in. There was no receptacle to plug in clock or light on night stand inbetween beds(I later found plug behind mattress of bed ,doesn`t sound to safe to me. No fitted sheets on bed tossing and turning during sleep is not optioned or you will be wrapped up in ill fitting bedding. I am just 6ft tall and feet hung iff end by ankles meust be a special size New York bed. The bathroom was horrendous paint chipped everywhere took 5 minutes to get hot water for shower shelf above sink and toilet only 5 inches wide everything falls off etc.

Reviews.Title: “central hotel”
Reviews.Author: ginagspot
Reviews.Content: room was cosy if a bit small, but onlly slept in it so it done the job. bathroom was nice and clean. reception was lovely and check in and check out speedy. didnt eat in hotel so cant comment on food. but staff were pleasant. now for the best bit-location location bang in the middle of everything. next door to macys, round the corner from empire state and times square practically on door step. walked to lady liberty from hotel going through the village. took about an hour but it was a lovely and interesting walk. bout same distance to central park on foot. and accross road from madison square garden. hotdogs sold at penn station accross road are to die for.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel shouldn't even be in business”
Reviews.Author: AllyP1025
Reviews.Content: This is the worst experience I've ever had this place is horrible noisy dirty old and overall discusting this is a big waste of money ...and a horrible experience I don't even know why even bother to even stop by there is reaLly worst than apartment buildings ....I wouldn't never suggest anyone to stay there I waS traveling with my husband and two kids a 7 yr old and aa 3 yr old and I'm from new York and would never come there again the worst night ,......

Reviews.Title: “Horror on the elevator..my life at risk!!! DONT GO THERE!”
Reviews.Author: Hamzaraj
Reviews.Content: I am an airline employee and I travel a lot because of my work and I think that now that I have visit a lot of destinations and seen many hotels I am able to give a professional opinion. I can stongly say that this was the worst I have ever been. In my trip to New york I had 12 people with me and all of them travel agents. We were all shoked from the hotel. First they did not allow us to do a group check-in ( or at least allow one of us to queue) ...nooooooooooo we had to wait for more than 1 hour to check-in and the staff was really really rude. Next thing I know is that the corridors were very very dirty and smelly. The rooms were also old and smelly, but at least not that dirty. The location of the hotel was very good, but this is the only good thing about it. I have never felt safe during all 3 days there and it turned that my feelings were right ( I will show more about it in below). A lot of people were in and out of the hotel without no control at all (most of them were not staying at the hotel at all). Tha last day in the evening all the others were in their rooms and I was in the lobby working in my laptop ( as in my room the hotel never took the effort to bring a LAN cable for the internet) and once I have finished I went at the elevator. Inside there was a blond guy with glasses, dressed with jeans, runners and an coloufull adidas shirt and seemed very calm and "safe". I have steped in the elevator and I have pressed (15 my floor) and I have noticed that the guy didnt press any button at all....Once the elevator door closed the guy looked at me and said : "DO YOU THINK THAT YOU ARE SAFE WITH ME IN THIS ELEVATOR ? " I have started shaking and I was not able to reply, I only shaked my head as a yes sign..in the meanwhile he still didnt press any button. Next he introduced and wanted to shake my hand ( and I accepted as I didnt know what to do), he said that he was from Suedia and he started to laugh for no reason. Next he said that I could not go to 15-th floor and I should have gone to the top. Than he continued to talk no sense......He was not violent and he never tried to phisically approach me and also didnt seem or smell like he was drunk ( I assume he was just a psyco). Finally the door opened and I went out first and he came after me. Luckily for me, he start walking faster than me and he was like 2-3 steps in front of me. I immidiatly run into the elevator again and I saw that he came back after me but lucklily for me the elevator door was closed again and he couldnt make it to come inside. I went downstars and called security and explained even on more details than above what happened. They couldnt care less and the reply I got was that it was just a bad joke from a young turist and than escorted me to the room. It was a happy ending for me ( as I was lucky and brave ).....as nothing serious happened, but it was really really frightening. Please take this seriously and pay a bit more for another hotel and be safe. I really hope that you will take my review in consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect much at all”
Reviews.Author: Godaddy_007
Reviews.Content: If it weren't for the fact that we were caught between a rock and hard place, we would have moved to another location. My conference was at hotel and we didn't have time to search for another. Having spent time in a thrid world country, allowed me to endure this place. The same dirt (and M & M candy) was left behind the night stand all week long. The carpets were worn out., and it had that "old" smell in the rooms. The hallways and rooms all need new paint. The overall impression is that it reminded me of some of the ruin down hotels used by ... well you know the type. Advice...Spend a little more in order to rest peacefully

Reviews.Title: “Live like a hobo”
Reviews.Author: Disneywld
Reviews.Content: Oh my God! The only thing missing was cardboard on the floor and walls. Rude staff started off the experience at the front desk. A lost reservation in their system and a paper confirmation in my hand - I was told that the confirmation was in error. A few phone calls later, I got my room. The bed had mysterious hairs in the sheets, the pillows were smelly, the maids totally into leaving as early as possible. Dust everywhere, dead bugs under the bed, paint coming off the walls and ceiling, soiled carpet, television was a joke (Don't ask for maintenance to come fix it), drippy faucets, rusted fixtures. I think the street people in NY have it better. I was booked there by a client who toured my room and promptly DOUBLED my fee for services.

Reviews.Title: “The photos on the website and virtual tours online are misleading.”
Reviews.Author: dsmatlock
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Not only are the amenities ancient, the level of service was well below average. When I received confirmation for the hotel, I was shown several pictures of the guest rooms, but when my family and I arrived, we were giving an old, unrenovated room in the back of the hotel. The room was too small to fit the two double beds, chest of drawers and mini refrigerator. We had to remove the lamp shade on the night stand to have better light. The refrigerator contained mold and the TV would not turn off. At one point right after we passed the maid staff in the hallway one morning, we saw them shortly after at the subway station. It appeared as though they were running errands during their shift. The staff were professional and pleasant, but not very accomodating. If you are considering to stay at this hotel, make sure you are given a room that has been renovated.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is HELL!”
Reviews.Author: goivan
Reviews.Content: If you want to know what hell is like, then stay in this hotel. Smelly, noisy, bathrooms leaking water, unfriendly personnel, bad and small beds and pillows. If you are lucky they will put you away from the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Its a good hotel, its near times square en all of other great buildings and facilities, friendly employers and good food”
Reviews.Author: LTHOLLAND
Reviews.Content: Its a good hotel, its near times square en all of other great buildings and facilities, friendly employers and good food. its across madison square garden and near by the subway and restaurants. its not extreme luxurious, but what you see is what you get, i like that. written by Leon Taal the Netherlands.

Reviews.Title: “Not worthiness”
Reviews.Author: sandrar77
Reviews.Content: The only helpful person there was Natasha. Everyone else yelled at us. Rooms are not what they look like. Bathroom leaked water. It's about 10 blocks from time square. The staff ruined my last day there won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great value for money excellent location no complaints”
Reviews.Author: kinnears
Reviews.Content: yes i read the reviews yes i was worried, but for what we paid no complaints at all £468 for duble room 5 nights hotel directly opposite penn station (we flew in to newark) used NJ transit $12.50pp we arrived 3 hours early to ask could we leave the luggage better than that we were checked in early. no queue at all! we had upgraded to penn 5000 room for £2 extra per night, this included continental breakfast (muffins and bagels were yummy) and use of internet and printer. Husband even got a coffee from there at various times of day Any time we attended reception for safety deposit box, check out, luggage room on last day, there were staff checking through the queues what you needed. So we never had to wait for any thing we wanted. This hotel is so busy reception area always full of people coming and going The hotel is so central, to me it was a classic american hotel. Our room was simply, tastfully decorated and clean. cleaned everyday, new towels, new toiletries. fridge for any drinks or food we brought in Our room overlooked macys, we were round corner from empire state building, times square. So what if there are a few scuffs on walls or bit of paint peeling. who goes to new york to sit in the hotel room. My feet were that battered everyday it was nice to have a central hotel to collapse into at end of everyday beds were very big and comfy even though probably would have slept anywhere!!!

Reviews.Title: “paying only for location”
Reviews.Author: mgd1204
Reviews.Content: location is vey close to time square, great shopping and subway. the hotel itself is not impressive at all, below average. rooms are small and a little scary, i was just waiting for a ghost to wake me on my sleep or something.

Reviews.Title: “Old... Expensive... dark.... dingy... scarey....”
Reviews.Author: Jo1309
Reviews.Content: We booked in for 7 Nights.... got out after 2..... the ONLY place in my 3.5 weeks in the USA where i didnt feel safe. Felt safer on the new york subway.... Staff where unpleasent and looked like they didnt want to be there... We where meant to get a complimentary breakfast...BUT no sign of it. Rooms where OK... BUT things where broken.. clock radio didnt work...television brooke after first day...and they eventually replace it.... Mold on shower curtain. For the price..... can do better.... would NOT recomened....

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare in New York!”
Reviews.Author: FLR
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because it was selected as our conference hotel. What a mistake. This hotel was filthy, filthy, filthy, smelly and small. The paint was peeling in the shower. The worst hotel i've ever stayed at. Then they had the nerve to charge me $25 to upgrade! The pictures on the their website do not look like the actual room you will be occupying. Keep searching this is not the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Oh dear..”
Reviews.Author: deathdude12
Reviews.Content: Hmm, read mixed reviews before leaving, but oh my god. It was the worst hotel i've ever stayed in. The bathroom walls were peeling, the air con units were as loud as a helicopter, the lobby was nice and it had a good location. Don't stay here.. its tacky and seriously disgusting, and not worth the price. So many better places to stay

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!!! DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: cmccombe
Reviews.Content: Word to the wise, $175 per night is way too much to spend, (I don't care if it is Manhattan), on a hotel that is absolutely dirty. Seriously soap costs how much? I expected not the most up to date decor but there is NO excuse for the filth, this place should be shut down!!!!! Spend the extra money to stay somewhere decent, I couldn't sleep staying at the hotel penn and I was afraid to use the washroom because it was so dirty... wrecked my trip and was a waste.... I am still grossed out about the whole experience....yuck!

Reviews.Title: “Very Bad!!! Filthy”
Reviews.Author: footprint123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is by far the worst hotel i have ever stayed in. Staff is rude... Rooms and bathrooms are FILTHY. Very dirty, dusty, moldy. Would never stay again.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: terioo7
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have stayed in ever! The rooms were shocking. The bathroom was grubby, bath stained and rusting, shower tap hanging off wall. thick mold covering the shower curtain, elec socket coming away from wall. The carpets hadn't seen a hover in months. Bed linen stained and coverings were falling apart. The staff were very unhelpful and rude. I have travelled to many countries and this is the worse. Comparable to staying in third world. Only good thing central to everything.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money, brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: mkgirl1981
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for 4 nights march 15th - march 19th, i had read reviews on here and was a bit worried so i took the option for upgrade to a penn 5000 club suite so maybe that makes a difference from the good and bad reviews - i booked through lastminute.com and it was £20 to upgrade for the whole 4 nights. getting to the hotel from jfk was very easy as it is opposite penn station so i was able to use the LIRR (long island railroad) instead to a cab which was alot cheaper and much quicker. when i arrived it was 3pm and there was quite a long queue but it didnt take too long work through it and other times i was in the lobby it was much quieter. there are 18 floors and plenty of lifts so didnt have to wait too long to get upto room. i was on 12th floor room 1216 - my room was facing 34th street so i could see macys and the very top (basically the aerials) of the empire state building from my room. the room was quite large with a king sized bed, the room was clean and could do with an update but was fine - i would probably compare it to a travelodge in the UK. i tried to open the window but i couldnt - i dont know whether it was because mine was broken on maybe it was a safety feature. the heater swicthed on and had 3 settings hi, med and low but the thermostat button came off so i couldnt fine tune the temperature but it didnt matter because i didnt use it anyway. room came with a flatscreen tv with come cable channels and pay for movies which included black swan, harry potter 7, 127 hours, some other new films and adult films which cost $10.75 each to watch. there was also games but you couldnt see what games where available until you paid. you could also use the tv to access the internet but it was quite expensive room also came with s small wardrobe with an iron and ironing board, a desk, two bedside tables and the tv was in a cabinet with more drawers. room also had a fridge was handy as you could buy drinks or snacks from the many duane reade stores and keep them in your room if you liked. the bathroom had a bath with shower and hair dryer, clean towels were brought daily and toilletries were provided with were also replaced daily. the 12th floor also had 2 vending machines i'm not sure uf there is one on every floor as i didnt check. i only used the drinks machine and both times could only get a coke as all the other drinks were sold out. downstairs in a coffee shop, a souvenier shop and a couple of restaurants, i never went to the statler grill so i can't comment on it and there is also a restaurant called lindys which i went to on my first morning and it was ok but a bit overpriced, i would recommend venturing out to find breakfast. at one point my room key stopped working but this was sorted out with no problems, when it came time to check out this was done nice and quickly and i had some time before my flight so i used the hotel to store my luggage until i left, they do charge a fee to store luggage, i can't remember if it was $4 per person or per item. they can also arrange transport to aiport which i used when leaving as i was flying home from newark and wasnt sure how to get there, the shuttle was $24. the driver was helpful but new york traffic is scary! i never wanted my own break pedal in a car more than i did in that ride to the airport. as most people say you dont spend that much time in your hotel room so if your looking for a bargain of a hotel, a good location and close to the subway (which now i would say personally for me is most important) then hotel pennsylvania is a good choice and i would stay here again if it wasnt being demolished.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Chinaman1972
Reviews.Content: This is an old hotel in need of a LOT of investment. However, the room was comfortable enough and clean...Comfy beds, clean linen, clean towels daily, clean but dated and rather shabby bathroom, interior of windows clean, outside of windows filthy, some poorly repaired walls The staff were mostly polite and helpful (just one exception on the front desk...obviously didn't give a hoot about anyone). Central location great for sight-seeing and subway station just outside hotel, but very noisy when trying to sleep. Massive choice of places to eat locally, even at Penn Station.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Budge Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tasha5390
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Newyork March 4th-10th for our 21st.. After reading reviews was abit worried about what I was gonna be faced with HOWEVER! When we first checked in we were given a ROOM right on the the end of the hotel the view was brilliant we could see the empire state from our window, but the room was abit shabby and run down! so we went downstairs to ask if we could be moved the staff had no problem & moved us straight away. The 2nd was nearer to the lifts this time it was fine, basic clean room, no frills hotel. To be honest we hardly spent any time in our room we were out most the time making the motif our time! The LOCATION of this hotel was excellent 5-10 mins walking distance to the centre of times square, rokerfella centre. Empire state and Madison Square gardens were right outside the hotel. Broadway about 10 mins walk. Would definatly recommend the hop on-off bus we took it everywhere an it lasted us 3 days worth the value! Overall was pleased with the hotel if you want somewhere just to get your head down in the night would recommend for the price! If your looking for a posh up market hotel look elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Great for what you pay negative reviews are false”
Reviews.Author: Matthew93
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel from march 14-17 and I was thoroughly dreading it after reading reviews on this site, however I was pleasantly surprised it took 10 minutes to check in and the room was great clean and comfortable. The shower was a little hot but that's not really something to worry about. The room was clean the beds were comfortable we had fresh towels everyday and location was suberb. Although the baggage handler was slow and frankly I could have taken my bags up quicker the staff were pleasant and considerate. It's a cheap hotel with a great location yes it could do with a lick of paint but most old buildings could. I'd stay here again as it was clean comfortable and central to pretty much everywhere and anywhere you wanted to go.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid At All Costs!”
Reviews.Author: AK533
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this...from inside the hotel. The slow internet connection allowing me to do so, not incidentally, is costing an absurd $10 per day. This is only the tip of the outrage iceberg: earlier today, checking in took nearly an hour. AN HOUR. For the pleasure of picking up my key. The staff was surly, unpleasant, and disingenuous when they suggested that this was an anomaly: I had in fact stopped by earlier to check in and had given up, because the line then was just as interminable. I will also briefly mention that the hotel is in mild disrepair, full of dingy carpets and scuffed paint. The lobby, even discounting the lines of bedraggled travelers, looks like an ode to Soviet Brutalism. These things as such would not be very damning for me, because I am not the sort of traveler who needs excessive luxury or hipness in the places he stays. But in conjunction with a nickel-and-dime internet policy and an unprofessional staff that allows their patrons to wait for unreasonable lengths of time, this place becomes absolutely inexcusable. Do not let this hotel continue to coast on its location: take your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “would definately stay again”
Reviews.Author: mich27
Reviews.Content: my partner and i have just returned from a weeks stay at the pennsylvania.I have to say that i read a lot of the reviews on trip adviser before we went and i was really worried as the majority of them were really bad,but we were both pleasantly surprised.The hotel is dated as it is an old hotel,but i cant complain about anything.Checking in was straight forward ,and we arrived mid afternoon,but the staff were very efficient and friendly.We upgraded to a penn suite which was very nice.The room was quite small but big enough for us.It had a king size bed which was clean and comfortable.The furniture was in good condition,there was a flat screen t v and also a fridge .The bathroom was very clean with clean towels that were changed every day.We had a great view of the empire state building from our window.The maids were very friendly and the room was cleaned every day.We had breakfast every morning which was basic but always fresh.The location is excellent and we would definately stay there again.All i can say is dont believe everything you read as i have found out for myself.

Reviews.Title: “This Place SUCKS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CYNsin
Reviews.Content: Hotel service is non existant. The whole staff is very rude and don't even try to work with you unless you makle a big scene. We had to rquest to be moved to another room. Most of their rooms are very old and dirty. Most of us didn't have hot water in either our bathroom sink or shower. The heaters didnt work properly. the heater has only one setting: High. It cant be lowered so you need to heat up the room and then turn it off later so you dont roast. The paint is peeling off the walls and the walls look like they havent been wiped in like NEVER. I would never recommend anyone stay at this place. I read a lot of reviews before I went and they were all horrible and negative but I thought it was simply their bad luck. However after staying here for a weekend I now know all the reviews are 100% true. DON'T stay at the Hotel Pensylvania

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A LOAD OF WHINGERS AND WHINERS!!!”
Reviews.Author: Aguahombre
Reviews.Content: After reading the many reviews of this section, you may wonder why you should bother staying in this hotel. Look, its a 2* hotel (perhaps more in its heyday). Its cheap, functional, clean and VERY VERY Central. Granted it is dated compared to other hotels. We were in NYC to celebrate 2 family birthdays and had 3 separate rooms on floor 11, 1194, 1186 and 1163. All 3 were fine and perfectly adequate. All 3 were denoted PENN 5000 club rooms, with either shower or baths. If you are after luxury or pampering then book the Ritz, Hilton, Penninsula or another 4-5 Star Hotel. If you're after a clean, cheap, central place to base from, this Hotel is more than adequate. I've stayed in 3/4/5 star Hotels in NYC & elsewhere, so I know the difference. We wanted to spend on going out, not staying in within this great city ;o) Facilities summary:- Blackout drapes/curtains Cable/satellite television channels Climate control Clock radio Electronic/magnetic keys Hair dryer Housekeeping Internet access (surcharge) Iron/ironing board Pay movies Private bathroom/shower facilities Refrigerator Voice mail Wake-up calls Window views (some good/ some bad) Breakfast service (PENN CLUB ONLY- not much for upgrade!): 12th floor- Tea/Coffee + pastries/bagels So lets summarise the and clarify/dispel the horror stories written within this section:- Pros:- Central location: Opposite PENN Station and Madison Square Gardens. A few blocks from Times Square and Empire State Building Great Lobby Friendly Staff: Yes they were friendly and helpful (the receptionist used to stay in Bognor Regis!). Guess what... if you smile, act civil and friendly to people, surprisingly they treat you the same way! NO QUEUES, Checkin took us (6 of us): 15 mins. Okay, were arrived at around 11pm EST. This could be busier at peak times. ROOM 1194: Clean, smaller than expected (but hardly something to moan about). No mould, no bed-bugs, no cockcroaches, no rats!, no food left in room. Provision of fridge, iron facilities, TV/(movie system- not tested), Functioning hot/cold shower and tolilet amenities- see above facilities Breakfast: see above. Even if you don't stay in PENN CLUB (Recommended), you have so much choice outside, given you've saved on stay. I did'nt check out the fitness provision nor the onsite restaurant. Several shops are provided within lobby area but not really required as you just go OUT!! I've read some confirmed reports that the Hotel will be demolished to make way for a very tall skyscraper: 15 Penn Plaza http://www.dnainfo.com/20100714/manhattan/hotel-pennsylvania-is-one-giant-step-closer-demolition http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/15_Penn_Plaza Cons:- ROOM: Dated fitments/soft furnishing. No room service: Do you really need this in NY? VERY BIG HOTEL: 1700 rooms on 22 floors Large corridors- OK these were dark- resembling something from the Shining in size!but nothing to be frightened off! So there you go, a positive review from a positive person. I spoke to several people staying at the hotel and they agreed with this review. Some had a few issues with their rooms, but these were attended too and again, it did'nt faze them. I'm sure there were people with bad experiences but you need a reality check- expectation management people! You have the choice to pick up a bargain before it gets demolished in May? not sure of exact timeframe. If you are travelling shortly, I think you should be more than fine!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean Rooms and pleasantly surprised after all the bad reviews!”
Reviews.Author: alibeeson
Reviews.Content: After reading all the awful reviews of this hotel on here, we were starting to dread what we might find....BUT we're pleased to report that we found Hotel Pennsylvania a real pleasure to stay at! To begin with, the location was ideal. It's across the road from Penn Station and very near the Metro, 10 mins walk from Times Square and 5 mins from the Empire State Building. When we arrived around 11.30pm, there were no queues and the lady on the front desk was chatty and helpful. We had upgraded (for only a few pounds more) to Penn 5000 King Rooms. We opened the doors (all our 3 rooms were on the 11th floor) to a spacious clean room....yes its nothing fancy, it is dated and old....but then you get what you pay for as its only a 2 star hotel!!! The beds were large and comfortable, we had a large plasma tv and a big fridge to store drinks and the such. The bathroom was also clean and the shower was really great! Our towels were changed each day and the beds made/rooms tidied each day.....what more could you ask for or expect?! On top of this, we also had access to the Penn 5000 Lounge where you have 24 hour access to tea/coffee and the internet. Plus complimentary breakfast served from 7am-11am which included bagels, croissants, fruit and danish pastries....a great (and free!) start to the day. All in all, we were very impressed but we would say pay the extra for the Penn 5000 rooms as obviously these are 'better' than the standard rooms that others have had bad experiences of! But for us, we would definitely stay there again and hope it isn't really being torn down later this year!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, grand lobby but awful rooms”
Reviews.Author: Loopy_CHampshire_uk
Reviews.Content: You can't beat this hotel for its location; within sight of Empire State building, across the road from Maddison Square Gardens, an easy walk to Times Square and right next to a main subway station. Lots of typical American delis/diners for a good, hearty breakfast - Stage Door Delicatessens was one of our favourites - great pancakes and waffles! The hotel has an impressive lobby with a couple of shops and a coffee shop which was open all night. The rooms were, in general, shabby and poorly presented. In some cases there was mould on bathroom ceilings, broken appliances, damaged /unclean bathroom fittings. Beds were OK and were clean. But if you're not fussy about the place you sleep and want to be in the heart of New York this is a good option.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: luke105
Reviews.Content: There are some terrible reviews but i was extremely pleased. The room was nice, good bed, great bathroom, shower was brilliant. I have heard there are some rooms that arnt nice but we where on the 2nd floor and the room was spotless and decorated to the finiest quality. The location is great, 5 min walk to times square, 5 mins to empire state building. Also next to a subway station and railway station so new york sites are easily reachable. it look 10 mins on the subway to reach statue of liberty and 20 mins on the train to reach the airport. i read the reviews and upon opening my room door i was dreading the room, but i was so suprised. this was my first trip to new york.....i would deffinately go back and would 100% stay here again. maybe we got lucky with the room i dont know, but take the chance! Also cheap cheap cheap!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, shame about the room BUT you don't go to NY to sit in a hotel room.”
Reviews.Author: InvernessMatt1971
Reviews.Content: Half hour taxi ride from JFK ($54 plus tip fixed fare). We were able to check at midday to our room which we thought was good. The room itself was tiny and could use a lick of paint. Bed linen was clean as were the towels in the bathroom. Bathroom was mouldy in places. I've stayed in better and worse but like I say the location of this hotel in key. Right opposite Penn station, Madison Square Gardens and Maceys. 2 min walk from the Empire State building and a 20 min walk from times square. As hotels in manhatten go this would take some beating in the value for money stakes. If you want luxury the you'd best stay at the Plaza and pay 5x what this costs.

Reviews.Title: “Pennsylvania 6-5-Oh-Oh-NO!”
Reviews.Author: Jake450
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at New York’s Pennsylvania Hotel, 2 years apart, each time for one night, and nothing has changed. The hotel was built in 1919 and it was surely a fine hotel at its height in its youth. It is a beautiful building from the outside and the lobby is spacious. The elevator doors remind us of the 1920s. But that is where the beauty stops. At the check-in counter, we were greeted by an extremely rude Indian clerk. He asked if we were checking out and I told him we were checking in. He replied that check in started at 3pm,and even when I told him we’d requested early check in, he repeated that check in was at 3pm and they had no rooms available before then. He refused to see if he could respect our early check in request. So – after10 minutes, he went took his break and my partner spoke to another clerk to see if we could get a room. We did and we checked in at about noon. Once off the elevator, you step into the waiting area for the elevators which leads to a dark and gloomy corridor that runs the length of the building from end to end. Along the corridor there are guest rooms, and there are several alcoves that lead to other guest rooms. You’ll have to read the signs above the entranceways to find your room. These corridors have wall-to-wall carpeting which is some shade of brown (I think) along the edge and some kind of floral design in the centre. If it’s dirty, you’ll never notice it because the carpet is dark and so is the corridor. We stayed in Room 1182 which was designated as a Penn 5000 room, whatever that means because I have no idea what benefits it grants. It was a small room, a little bigger than the average interior cruise-ship cabin, with too much furniture: an empty mini refrigerator, a large 3-drawer dresser, a large desk (which was very unstable) with a chair, and a bed. The bed was said to be a double bed, and it was small and thoroughly uncomfortable. On the ceiling above the table and not far from the bed, there was a black spot which I think was mould in a water mark. At certain places on the walls and doors, either the paint was peeling off or there were huge gouges in the plaster. There was no attempt to cover or fix it, though I did notice that near the door too much paint has been applied and it has run down the wall. The bathroom was small but fully tiled on the walls. The floor of the shower stall looked like it had been repaired badly, or painted and the paint was washing away. The shower head leaked continuously in spite of attempts to turn it completely off. On the inside of the door frame near the base of the shower, the wood of the frame had worn away or had been broken, thus exposing the cement wall inside. In spite of all these inconveniences, it is still a good location. It is one block up from Macy’s (Seventh Avenue and 34th Street) if you’re planning a shopping get-away, and it’s in the Fashion District. It is a great place to stay if you’re going to an event at Madison Square Gardens or if you wan tot visit the Empire State Building. It is ideal if you’re taking an early morning train (which was our reason for staying here) or you’re arriving late at night at Pennsylvania Station – it’s right across Seventh Avenue from the station. It is a great bargain (we paid $US109 for our 1-night stay) for midtown, but you can get better prices if you shop around and if you don’t mind taking the subway or buses. Other than all those reasons, I cannot imagine spending more than 2 nights at this hotel. If my description of our experience at this hotel has made you re-consider staying at New York’s Pennsylvania Hotel, it would probably be worth paying more to stay at a better hotel. [I’ve heard 2 opposing stories about the future of this hotel. One is that they are currently undergoing major renovations to upgrade the rooms and services, but they obviously missed the 2 rooms we stayed in. The other story says that this hotel is slated for demolition to make way for some new construction, but no one has told me what that is. They must done or the other because the hotel is falling apart, and that is a shame because it has history and it really is a nice an unique building.]

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel out of 1984 - A truly hellish experience.”
Reviews.Author: nakavi
Reviews.Content: I am a very avid world traveller who has been to over 40 countries, and I have literally stayed at every type of hotel around the world and I can honestly say I have never had such a hellish hotel experience in my life. My experience is as follows: - Arrived at Pennsylvania Hotel at 11 PM tired from a long drive - Waited 45 min in checkout line - Once I got a receptionist, she told me that she didn't have my reservation from priceline so I ended up waiting another 20 minutes until her manager supposedly sorted everything else. The woman working at the desk must have been either borderline mentally handicapped, on drugs or extremely overworked because she kept asking me for my ID or credit card when it was already on her desk. - Finally get to one of the most disgusting hotel rooms I have ever seen. One of those places where you are afraid of catching herpes just sleeping on the bed - When I got back home, I noticed an email from priceline that I had apparently never shown up to the Hotel but that I would be charged because I didn't notify early enough. That was strange considering that I HAD stayed at the hotel. - Then I noticed TWO charges from the hotel!! I had only stayed one night but they had double-charged me - I called the hotel and finally got to a person. That person asked me if I knew a Sandra...something. When I said I didn't, I was treated like an idiot. When she told me that a Sandra had booked a room online but paid with my card, my heart sunk - I told the woman that the receptionist was incompetent and likely made a mistake - Then this was the response she gave me "Umm no, we didn't make a mistake." - I finally hung up after she refused to refund me and called my bank to dispute the charge In conclusion: DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL NO MATTER HOW POOR YOU ARE. YOU ARE BETTER OFF AT A FLOPHOUSE OR AIRPORT HOTEL THAN THIS PLACE DESPITE ITS LOCATION IN THE HEART OF TOWN!!! I mean this hotel has more "terrible ratings" than any other ratings.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Loupa
Reviews.Content: Was worried about this hotel after reading other reviews but was pleasently surprised. The major downfall with this hotel is the ridiculous amount of time you have to wait to check in, we waited an hour! The reception area in the hotel does look a bit like a shopping centre as it is very large. Apart from this, the room (A Penn 2000) was more than adequate. It was clean, comfy bed, tv, fridge, iron, hairdryer etc. The bathroom was a bit dated but very clean and had fresh towels everyday plus complimentary toiletries. The location is second to none, walking distance to most major sights and across the road from Penn Station, Macy's, Madison Square Gardens. The breakfast was very good (tea/coffee, bagels, danish pastries, fruit, buns), although could get busy at times. Any staff we had to deal with were more than helpful and courteous. As it is a very large hotel, the corridors could feel a bit creepy if you were on your own. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting! Unsanitary and BAD attitude!”
Reviews.Author: shira_11
Reviews.Content: The room was disgusting!!! Wouldn't touch anything there without gloves… not to talk about walking around in the room with out shoes… YUCK!! There was BLACK MOLD on the walls, the walls were cracked and were about to peel off… the bathroom is nasty! The shower kept leaking the entire time (two days at least), you could not turn off the faucet and couldn't shut the door to the bathroom!!! On top of all that, they CHARGED MORE THAN THE PRICE I received when I made the reservations!!!!!!!!! I made the reservations by phone, and was told it would be $99 per night (that was the price on their website as well), but when I came to check out they said it was a mistake and that the price is actually $114 a night (not including tax) and they MADE ME PAY that amount!!! I called the manger, who BARKED at me and called me a liar!!!!!!!!! Bottom line: DO NOT GO THERE!!!!!! IT IS NOT WORTH IT!!!

Reviews.Title: “The room is colder than it is outside!”
Reviews.Author: Hilary0801
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two weeks and based on the website pictures, I thought it would be really nice. The lobby is very modern but once you get to the room it is a little disappointing. The decor is outdated and the hot water in the shower takes ages to heat up and it will scald you now and then too. The biggest issue for me was that the room was bitterly cold. There were no extra blankets and the heater was absolutely useless. The staff we met were lovely, there was no free wifi unfortunately but overall we enjoyed our stay. I didn't find the room dirty at all. There's also a restaurant in the hotel and although its quite pricey for what you get, it came in handy for us when it was too cold to go out. The location was perfect for us, I just wish the room was warmer because I found it very hard to sleep and relax when it felt as cold as outside!

Reviews.Title: “The reviews don't lie!”
Reviews.Author: tweetypiebabe1
Reviews.Content: If you've already made a reservation, I warn you don't read these reviews. I went on the trip with my Uni and like everyone else I must say the lobby is very quite deceiving.
