Upon receiving keys to our first room we made our way up the elevator and to the 14th floor. After walking down about three different halls we came to our designated door opened it and the first thing we saw were scuffs on the wall and peeling paint. We went deeper into the room to find that none of the three beds were made, a dusty old mirror had broken and was being propped up by the foot of one bed, the heater was set to a boiling temperature, dust was floating all around and last but not least the bathroom had a dirty towel, with a black stain no less, and a broken shower. Needless to say we went right back downstairs to change rooms and as another triple room wasn't available, even after the three hours it took for them to allot the one they had promised, we were given a room with two double beds. I have to stay this room was a steady improvement upon the first but the bathroom was still in need of maintenance, there was a bit of mould and dirt on the curtains and the fridge in the corner also had mould growing inside of it. My biggest issue with the hotel was the staff. Of all the employees that dealt with our situation only ONE was nice enough to at least try and make us feel comfortable and show some respect. Unfortunately by this time and after a 6 hour flight and another 1 hour drive my attitude was sky high. The staff have no manners and showed no respect to any of us, talking down to us or at us. If it wasn't for the fact that I was with a large group I would've left this hotel in a minute. It has an excellent location, directly across from madison square garden, underground is right across the street, deli's and cafe's in close distance and probably about 6 blocks from times square. That's it's only saving grace!

Reviews.Title: “Sick stains outside our room!!”
Reviews.Author: Babanrooroo
Reviews.Content: If your not planning on being in ny very long and will hardly be in the hotel, then it may be tolerable. Aside from that, expect the annoyance of bedbugs, peeling Walls, dirty bathrooms and old furniture. Some floors are being renovated. But most of the rooms and floors looked like something out of a horror movie. Very creepy and old fashioned, even the doors were creepy. Hair in the bath drain, peeling ceilings. Outside our door on floor three ( by room 131 ) there were bleached sick stains. Was a very uncomfortable visit. *itching from bed bug bites whilst typing this*

Reviews.Title: “THERE WAS A RAT IN OUR ROOM!!!”
Reviews.Author: Moscow_Pineapple
Reviews.Content: Honestly, this hotel is just disgusting!!! Yeah, it might look good from the outside... plus its location is just superb... but I would never recommend anybody to stay there! All the furniture in the room was old and falling apart... carpet and curtains were dirty and there was a weird smell... However, comparing to the bathroom our room looked just spectacular! The bathroom was SOOO DIRTY! There was even mold... and the water in the bath flushes soooo slowly, that by the time you have finished taking shower, the bath is full... But of course the "best" part was when we saw a rat that was running across our room! A RAT! IN A HOTEL!!!!!! And it's not worth trying to confront somebody from the staff.. they are just rude! So, a good advice for everybody - please, please, please avoid this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Twilight zone experience”
Reviews.Author: sailnstars
Reviews.Content: From the appearance this hotel looks super nice, the lobby is huge, the location is nice, and the price was pretty good and location is great. However, when we walked into our room for a second I thought we entered in the twilight zone. The walls were pealing off, the carpet looked like it was about 50 years old, the bed cover and the bed its self seemed about that old as well. The TV stand looked like it was just thrown in there, as it didn't fit and was positioned at a weird angle. The sink was running in the bathroom, there wasn't a toilet paper dispenser, and the shower was very small. I thought I would find something weird under the bed so I didn't look. I was half temped to leave and stay at a friends house but it was only one night.

Reviews.Title: “Place with great value and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: chika2012
Reviews.Content: The penn hotel isn't as bad as the negative reviews have reported. my boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for 4 days and 3 nights and we did not have any complaint when we cheked out. The room was cozy and all that is needed in NYC. We stayed at the 5000 club room which included breakfast. The room was clean it included as mini fridge, a flat screen TV and internet connection. The washroom wasn't as fancy as other washrooms you would find at the hilton. But for the price it was all that was needed. I recommend the hotel. There were no beg bugs or even cockroaches. I really don't know what other reviews are talking about. Great location and comfortable stay. All that is needed at NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Revolting”
Reviews.Author: HJS2011
Reviews.Content: To start off, the hotel seemed quite nice. It was opposite MSG (Maddison Square Gardens) and in a fantastic location. Then I went in to the rooms. Smelt of tobacco, the bathroom was rotting, wallpaper peeling off the walls and freezing. Breakfast was average. This really was the sort if stuff you'd find in a horror film. Only go if you want a cheap, one - night stay in NYC. (I was with a school group and it provided nothing that we wanted)

Reviews.Title: “Want rotting pizza and flooded bathrooms? visit this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Beth_Smith
Reviews.Content: At first glance its lovely, and the lobby is imaculate! The staff are very friendly too. HOWEVER I was sharing a room with three friends so what do they give us? TWO double beds. They sent our luggage up to the wrong floor and spent and hour and a half finding it. There was rotting pizza in our cupboard and dead insects everywhere. On the first night our bathroom flooded and we were moved to another room only it took them 4 hours and 20 minutes to get a key from the lobby to floor 4 so we were sitting in a damp flooded room for that long. It's an old building so the decor was to be expected but the bathroom looked like something out of a horror film. NYC in winter is very cold, obviously so you would think that they would provide duvets? oh noo. you get a sheet. The only thing stopping us from telling them where to stick it was the location. It was incredible right in the heart of NYC but i urge you to find a hotel near by, don't let this hotel ruin your american experience.

Reviews.Title: “One word Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: George4835
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews online and thinking how bad can it be? I was dead wrong, this place hasnt been cleaned in I dont know how long. Peeling paint in the rooms, mold on the walls and ceilings, carpet that is undescribable. The bed felt like I was sleeping on cardboard and I don't even want to think if my sheets were clean. Desk personnell seem unphased ( I am certain they hear it all the time) and not willing to accomodate. Don't stay there for a few dollars more you can be in the same neighborhood in seemingly cleaner and more comfortable surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews said dingy and needing updating - they forgot to mention dirty and disgusting”
Reviews.Author: Moonchild59
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I came to see the Westminster dog show and were so excited to stay where the dogs stay even though the reviews weren't great. Most noted it was an older hotel with small rooms that was somewhat dingy and in need of updating but that didn't deter us because we wanted to be where the dogs were. Dingy and old I could handle just fine. What I was not prepared for, and would not tolerate, was that the room was disgusting - the bathroom was dirty, there wasn't enough water pressure to take a shower (even though I was pretty skeeved out a shower would have been nice after a 3000 mile trip), and essentially the room was so unappetizing and gross we didn't even want to take our shoes off and kept our luggage on top of the television and the dresser to keep our things from touching the carpet. The room didn't have anything but sheer curtains and was bright all night from the outside light so we didn't sleep either. By 7 am I was making alternative arrangements and we moved out before breakfast. We came back to visit all the dogs in the lobby on our own time and had a perfectly lovely room at the Hilton Garden Inn on W28th for the rest of our stay for less money. Despite it's central location, there are simply too many hotel options in this wonderful city to tolerate such appalling conditions. I will say the staff we interacted with were pleasant enough. There I said something nice.

Reviews.Title: “You won't get better for cheaper”
Reviews.Author: m3110r
Reviews.Content: It would be easy to point out things that are wrong with Hotel Penn, but for the price, you simply can't complain! The location is unbeatable; Hotel Penn serves as a safe, warm, and suprisingly quiet base from which to see the best of New York. If you're planning sight-seeing holiday on a shoestring, this is definitely a worthy upgrade from hostelling (speaking from experience).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price, gorss rooms”
Reviews.Author: Lch86
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I have stayed at this hotel. This time the hotel room they gave my party was disgusting. It looked like a room from one of those shady pay-by-the-hour hotels. There was trash in the room, the paint was chipping, the carpet was filthy. This was surprising because the last two times, the rooms I got were newly remolded. All in all, the hotel room sucked but you can't beat the price or location. It's a shame the hotel isn't better taken care of because it has the potential to be a great property once again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute dump!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel in the world. Great location, but it is simply rubbish!! It is so old and run down. You really can't believe how bad this place is unless you experience it.

Reviews.Title: “It wasn't that bad, honest!”
Reviews.Author: BarryBarnstable
Reviews.Content: I'd read the reviews, but also seen the cheap price they were asking for our stay so took a gamble on the Pennsylvania. To be honest it wasn't that bad! Location : As most of the reviews have indicated the location is ideal. a tube station right outside the hotel giving access to virtually the whole city, and getting to some of the major sites on foot doesn't take too long (15 mins to Times Square, 5 mins to Empire State Building, etc.). Rooms : Our room was on the 16th floor and we had a pretty good view of both Madison Square Garden and 33rd street. The room was basic but clean, with 2 double beds which were comfortable. The bathroom wasn't great, the shower wouldn't turn off completely, but at least we couldn't hear it in bed and I'm sure they would have come and had a look at it if we'd bothered to call reception about it. The TV although old had a good few channels and room came equipped with both Iron/Ironing board and hair-dryer. Staff: The maids were all friendly and said hello when we passed outside the room and they kept our room clean. Reception staff were fast to check us in (we did arrive approx 15:00 which may have made the difference from the huge queues mentioned in other reviews) and also happy to chat about the hotel and the area. Additional : The cost of Taxi from Newark Airport to the hotel was $80 (that includes a tip) and $87 on our return journey back to the airport. I would recommend staying in this hotel if your looking for a cheap place to stay in a good location. The quality isn't great but the room we had was clean and the hotel made a great base for exploring the city, I'd stay here again (if it hasn't been knocked down by then as other reviews have mentioned)

Reviews.Title: “Run Away and never look back”
Reviews.Author: Alexa514
Reviews.Content: I was one team leader for a group of over 200 Univeristy students who stayed at this hotel. Keep in mind that yes we are Univeristy students who love a bargan and will happily stay at hostel and I would never want to stay in this hotel every again. First of all approx 20 of the rooms they gave us at check in were double booked. Meaning either there were guests already in the rooms or other guests not part of our group walked into our rooms with keys saying they were assigned to the same room. In my personal room the window was open (in february brrrr) and would not close. Solution Maintenance worker came and jumped up and down on the window frame until it closed shut. Then my boyfriend took a shower and the water would not stop running. Then the toilet started leaving from the bottom. No bed bugs or cockroaches. (Though last year one room at a cockroach sighting.) Then we had this guy come knock on all our doors offering to sell us drugs. This guys skipped all the doors except for the ones we, the univeristy students, checked into. (How did they know which ones were specifically assigned to us??) Oh and the key cards to the doors often stop working for reason whatsoever. Then one of the rooms had a break-in. The security staff was less then helpful. When I asked if they could call the police for us to file a report they refused. I emphasized that I had a Canadian Cell phone and that the roaming charges would cost me an arm and a left I would appricate their help.. Their repsonse was "It's your choice whether or not to call them." Seeing as a police report is necessary to claim the camera, cash and passports that were stolen I called from my cell phone. The police officer said they are called to the hotel frequently and it's a "sketchy" hotel. The officer informed me that the hotel will be torn down in a year so the staff really doesn't care about repeat business or their reputation anymore. The agent whom had booked our group said that we would have breakfast included on the first morning of our stay. Guess what... the hotel staff new absolutely nothing about this and said that they do not have a restaurant and they never include breakfast with their stays ever.... But then by some miracle the very few who go new rooms assigned to floor 17 and up got breakfast?!?!?!? And yes while roaming the vast hallways of this 1700 room hotel I feel that I was about to encounter two little twins that were going to ask me to come and play with them. The words REDRUM kept playing over and over in my head. The staff at the front though does what they can and are friendly. The hospitality staff smell of weed and walk into random rooms for no apparent reason. HAppened to two of our students that were relaxing in their rooms and some maintenance worker walked in... If you have already booked then leave your TV on and do not disturb sign at all times to make it sound like someone is home to ward off potential staff that are looking to rob you blind. Best of luck

Reviews.Title: “Never seen such a disgusting place before”
Reviews.Author: travel1892
Reviews.Content: The lobby downstairs lies to the eyes of anyone that stays here. As soon as you step out of the lift on your floor you know exactly what you've let yourself in for. Opening the door to the room and theres a stale smell. There was stains on the bed sheets and hair in another of the beds. The shower wouldn't turn on and after asking for help were told that it was 'rigged up wrong, like everything else'. The sink fell apart and there was mould all over the ceilings. When we rang to reception to ask for sheets we were told they would arrive and never did. As we were travelling as part of a school group someone else also rang to reception and went down to collect their new sheets and were told 'we're reception not housekeeping' I'm just glad I never had the oppurtunity to eat in the hotel. The only positive of the hotel was the location and the fact that I had to spend only 3 nights there! I'd much rather be a little further out of Manhattan and in a cleaner hotel with a better service next time!

Reviews.Title: “An eye opener”
Reviews.Author: Rove16
Reviews.Content: A no go zone. After waiting for at least 40 minutes to check in late at night and arriving in the rain from Australia what a Welcome to NYC. The people behind the counter were enjoying their chewing gum as they checked in customers. The door to the room looked liked a prision door, the place was flithy, mould on the curtins, window wide open and rain coming in . The bathroom was a digrace. we had paid for 3 nights and we just wanted somewhere clean basic and safe. Dogs were in the lift with their owners!!! We didnt stay and lost one night $$$ but it was worth checking out, standing in the rain waiting for a taxi in a strange country. we loved NYC stating the following day

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is waiting to retire...”
Reviews.Author: twa23
Reviews.Content: I was nervous booking this hotel due to the very bad reviews and because we were on a budget we took a chance due to the excellent location. Maybe because I prepared myself for the worst, I was pleasantly surprised to find the hotel at the hub of NYC, beautiful large lobby, smooth check in and helpful staff,. The room was very old and definitely needed more than a paint job (few cracks in the walls). The bathroom was basic with no frills. However the most important thing for me when booking cheap is cleanliness; the room was cleaned evryday with fresh sheets and towels. The room was also spacious compared to other rooms I viewed. I got a cheap rate for this hotel and that's why I took a chance, it was worth the risk for the amount of time I spent in the hotel (only washing and sleeping). If I had a bigger budget I would consider upgrading but would reccommend it for fellow non fussy travellers that can overlook a few negatives.

Reviews.Title: “No where near as bad as reported”
Reviews.Author: DenaryTen
Reviews.Content: Yes, it's an older building, but it was clean, the staff friendly and accomodating. The room was larger than expected. A/C would have been nice, as the room was quite warm, and I would have enjoyed better internet access, but these are small things. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Know what you are getting before you stay”
Reviews.Author: Flashpoint1
Reviews.Content: This is one of the hotels that is difficult to review. No matter if you stay at the best or the worst the overall rooms in NYC are small. They are typical big city sleeping arrangements, nothing but minimal space. Some of the rooms the bed is so close to the toilet your knees touch! We stayed on the 10 floor of this hotel. The lobby is a normal, semi-attractive lobby. Nothing about it would make you think you weren't getting a nice room. Once you get into the elevators and step onto your floor, things change. The large "bullet proof" 1950s vault doors are still in place for your room door. They have been drilled and redrilled with new locks over the past 50 years. When you step into your room, everything is cheap. The refrig was on the floor and unplugged. The window did not close and was cracked open about 4 inches. To compensate the staff has the heater on high and the room was about 100 degrees. The bathroom is typical 1950s black and white tile with everything heavy old fashion cast iron/porcelain. Everything was rusted and the facets corroded so they were difficult to turn on. The TV was old and barely worked. We had to purchase our own remote batteries to get the TV to change channels. Almost every day we had to ask for maid service even though there were maids working on our floor. Our business associates stayed 2 nights and finally had to leave due to the mold growing on their ceiling, that was causing one of them to have an allergic reaction. (They moved to the Marriott Marquee) The main draw of the hotel is that it is immediately adjacent to Madison Square Garden. For my purposes, the location was worth the room. I do recommend you inspect your room prior to accepting it. Just get the key, tell them to wait with the luggage and check it out. There is a definite difference in the rooms! We paid way to much to stay there ($259 per night) but rooms could be had for $79 in this hotel using the right booking service. I would recommend upgrading in room size (and these were going for $99) as we had a larger room than most people and it was easier to maneuver. We had friends at the Affinnia and New Yorker. Both very very close to our hotel. Those at the Affinnia said it was much nicer than the Penn. and those at the New Yorker said they had some updated and remodeled rooms which were nice. If you are sensitive to hotel and hotel quality do not stay here. Just cab over from the Eventi for a much much much better stay and service without killing yourself with costs. If you want to go high end the Marriott Marquee in Time Square is very nice with the 8th floor bar just amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Dump”
Reviews.Author: EvanAM
Reviews.Content: This is the dirtiest most disgusting place I have ever been to, not fit for human inhabitation. The carpets and bathroom was filthy. I didn't take my shoes off or sit down to use the toilet. This is after i asked for a better room, apparently this was supposed to be an improvement on the first. Even more disturbing, the smoke alarms are not interlinked, meaning if there was to be a fire on a lower floor, you wouldn't be alerted to the fact until the fire was well established. For some strange reason I seemed to be getting static electric shocks off everything I touched in the hotel. The long and short of this place is, it should be shut down and brought up to standard. The amount of visitors this large 22 storey hotel is receiving, they can more than afford to create a decent environment for their guests. It's an complete disgrace!!!

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed here twice - an honest and fair review!”
Reviews.Author: MadMax12345
Reviews.Content: Not a luxury hotel but the location is fantastic! Have stayed here twice once in summer and once in winter. In winter the rooms were really warm and comfortable. Rooms are basic and bathroom a bit dated but everything worked fine and the rooms were clean most importantly! I had read all the negative reviews before staying in this hotel but was willing to take the chance and I was pleasantly surprised. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “In NYC - it's all you need”
Reviews.Author: Ragan_Dragon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is admittedly old and worn but its all you need when you are in NYC. We spent 8 days there and the staff were kind enough to change our room from this tiny closet to a slightly more spacious room to accommodate our length of stay. You get what you pay for but how much time do you really spend in your hotel room when in NYC. We used it to sleep and shower and that was it! Location was fantastic if you are needing intercity trains, great for subway, close to Empire State building (managed to get there close to opening so queues were practically non-existent), Times Square only a few blocks away. Definitely did the trick for us!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Penn - Not the choice of regular travelers.”
Reviews.Author: STEVE131111
Reviews.Content: Hotel Pennsylvania is an old ,tired lodging.We stayed there for the West Minister Dog Show It is in need of a major upgrade ,from old and dirty to broken and worn out.The staff was friendly and helpfull.The rumor is that it will be torn down to make way for a large skyscraper. A prime location across from Madison Square Garden it needs to be renovated for the traveling public,as it has great potential for the future.

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: Nan_40
Reviews.Content: You go there because it's in a perfect location on manhattan. Walking distance to everything. Safe place, big hotel with good service. It's not at the Goùt du jour but clean enough for a good night of rest. Bathroom is very bad and old but lot of water pressure. Service from the genator was very nice since I locked myself out of my luggage. He happily help destroy the lock :) We got woke up by a flood coming from the ceiling (they never offered some credit or compensation) but they change us to another room. MSG, MACY'S, Empire State building and all the double decked buses company are on the next street. Warning, one bus ride has less buses than the other. You end up waiting 30 min without a ride...I love NY so much, all i need when i go is a room with a private bathroom on te Island. I have it with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Less than mediocre.”
Reviews.Author: Lee-Anne1
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my partner for 1 week in summer 2010. We arrived at the hotel around 2pm and had to wait a very long time to get checked in. When we got to the front desk we were told we needed to leave a deposit which we were never warned about. There are 10 elavators to all floors so you never need to wait for one which was great, and there is also an ice machine and vending machines on every floor. The room was ok. It was spacious and included a desk, drawers and a very small wardrobe. There was also a noisy fridge in the corner on the floor. The bed was comfy and there was no noise which was nice. There was also some useful information on things to do and places to eat in NYC in the room. The bathroom is a different story altogether. The floor tiles were chipped and dirty, the bath itself was chipped and worn and the wall tiles were falling off. The screws holding things in place were rusty and the mirror was cracked. We didn't mind staying in the room but we hated using that bathroom. Upon checking out we had to wait around 45 minutes in the queue as there were hardly any staff serving, so I would say the service was really bad. The hotel is in a great location, facing Madison Square Garden and just around the corner from the Empire State Building. There are also some lovely Deli's on the next block with nice fresh food.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the location”
Reviews.Author: Paul186518
Reviews.Content: On arrival at the hotel, there was no queue and we were quickly checked in. However, we were not even pointed in the direction of the lifts to get to our hotel rooms, so we had to find our own way. We are non-smokers but were placed in a smoking room which smelled vile, and the bathroom was unclean - there was makeup smeared on the shower curtain and black grime at the bottom of the bath. We didn't ask to change because we were on the same floor as the rest of our group and had a twin room- both things they seemed to have a challenge finding at check in. We cleaned the bathroom ourselves and sprayed some airfreshener which helped. The bed linen seemed clean and the room was spacious enough. On exploring the area, we found that the location of the hotel is excellent. On the second day while we were out, somebody came to clean our room. When we got back to the room, this person had spilled an unknown substance all over our dressing room table. This had leaked into the drawers below where we were storing our clothes. It had also made some marks in the varnish and our tv remote control was damp. They had removed the clothes from the drawer, put them on a chair and put a towel in the drawer (leaving us one towel short). The tv remote did not work after that and was the only way to use the tv. After this incident, we hung our 'do not disturb' sign up and left it there for the remainder of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “BEST hotel value in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: AmandaDee67
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to New York City, and after reading many reviews, and hearing about NYC hotel horror stories, I was skeptical... Hotel Penn was an amazing deal, at an amazing price, and we stayed there over New Years... so to get the kind of deal and pricing we did for that time of year... was amazing. I won't lie... the hotel is old. It was built in the 1920's or 30's or something like that. It shows in some of the decor, and in the doors to the rooms... but on a whole, let's be honest. *Hotel Penn is located across the street from Madison Square Gardens, and Macy's. It's located at 34th and 7th, less than 10 minutes from Times Square (walking)... and right next to Penn Station. You could not ASK for a better location in Manhattan. *Stories are true, there are long lineups to get to the front desk. Some of the people working at the desk look nasty... but let's be honest, with all the bad reviews on here, people come in with a bad attitude to begin with. We waited about 20 minutes in line to check in. We checked in on December 28th, which was one day after the HUGE blizzard that hit New York just before New Years... it was chaotic in the city. We just went up to the woman who checked us in with big smiles, asked her how her day was going, chatted a bit about all the chaos in the city... told her not to worry - her day would be over soon, etc. We were just nice to her... then after she checked us in, she went into the back room and brought us out an envelope FULL of discount coupons to use in the city at major attractions. She didn't have to do that, but she did. Super Nice!!! * The beds weren't overly comfortable, but they weren't bad either. I've heard about rooms in Manhattan where you can't even fit your luggage in the room, and there are shared bathrooms. This room had our own bathroom, and accomidated 3 girls, all with big luggage, and we were MORE than comfortable!!! The rooms may be dated, but they did their job. It's like staying at Holiday Inn from the 70's or 80's to me. And it's not horrible. To be completely honest, I can't WAIT to go back to NYC and stay at the Hotel Penn again. It serves as a great place to get some sleep at night, in a city that never sleeps. I am so pleased with my experience there. I think some people need to lighten up - and look at the value they get... vs. paying a great price and then complaining b/c it's not the 4 Seasons!!!

Reviews.Title: “NEVER STAYING HERE AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: linda3053
Reviews.Content: i ended making a huge mistake staying at this hotel. i randomly choose any cheap hotel i could find without reading reviews which was a HUGE HUGE error. always read reviews before staying at a hotel. sure the price is cheap the location is great but is it really worth what i experienced NO WAY. the lobby is really nice. when i arrived i was like OH okay fancy fancy i like it. i got my key went up stairs to my room and to my disgust as i was walking down the hallway i get a chill down my spine it felt like i had entered some sort of insane asylum. it was dark old looking broken room numbers straight out of a horror film. i get to my room the bath tub is yellow (i wanted to vomit) the towels were yellow and they smelled like corn chips. i noticed a red stain on the toilet paper. the water for the shower just trickled down no pressure at all. i didn't even want to use the bathroom it was too gross. the sheets were awful on the bed not comfortable AT ALL. the remote control for the tv didn't work so i had to get up and manually change the channels after walking so much feeling lazy and tired def not something i wanted to do. the chair at the vanity was disgusting. the seat was white like someone had some fun on it. overall i couldn't wait to leave the hotel go home take a real shower and feel clean once again. i will never ever make reservations at this hotel it needs to be remodeled ASAP.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, great location.”
Reviews.Author: sabrinasrfc
Reviews.Content: Just reading the reviews people have written about this hotel can't believe how bad they are. I stayed there with my mam and sister and we all found the hotel nice and we got what we need somewhere to go to sleep in a clean room after a days shopping. The location is ideal too.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely awful”
Reviews.Author: traveler1954_11
Reviews.Content: I hesitated for many months writing this review, but when I find that it still haunts me, I just had to mention a few things. We chose this hotel for location (had a 4:30 a.m. Amtrak departure across the street at Penn Station) and cost. Reasonable, but still $150 night. We entered the Lobby and the line was literally out the door! I could not believe it. There were literally hundreds of people in line! After waiting in line over one hour, we went up the elevator to our .... room/cubicle. The hallway leading to the room was unbelievable! Peeling paint, horribly stained carpets, it was like a Saturday Night Live satire! We opened the door and gasped. So filthy, peeling paint everywhere! a dirty towel in the bathroom! I took photos - see below. In 50 years of traveling I have only stayed in one other hotel so horrible.... sorry Hotel Penn..... LOVED New York, loved the convenience of the area, once Lobby was cleared out, Lobby was not too bad, actually pleasant, but the room!!! If you do stay here because of all the other conveniences, ask to see the room first. We were so tired when we arrive, and had to leave so early, waited in line sooooo long, and only staying one night we bit the bullet and didn't complain....

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not good either”
Reviews.Author: amy1189
Reviews.Content: Was very worried about our stay here having read the reviews on this site but here is my account - very briefly not nearly as bad as was expected/reported. Landed in Newark airport and boarded the train to Penn Station which is across the road from the hotel. Could not have been any easier - only $25 one way for both of us, considerably cheaper than a taxi if there is only 2 of you. Points for ease of access. Whilst standing in the queue we noticed a sign that said you could not check in until 3pm (it was about 2pm at this stage) but other people seemed to be getting served and issued keys so we just waited. There was 3 members of staff on and it did take a while before we were served but as it was before the official check in time can't complain too much. There was plenty of lifts for getting to our floor (12 lifts I think) so never had to wait long one one arriving. Once leaving the lift the hallway wasn't as grand as the reception but it was clean enough. On several occasions we saw staff using a carpet cleaning machine. Yes the paintwork needed redone and yes the carpet was showing signs of old age but it didn't matter, it was only a hallway. On entering the room there was an overwhelming smell of bleach/cleaning product. The room was very hot so I went to open the window but being on the 15th floor it did not open. Air conditioning system was a bit tempremental and noisy but did provide a little fresh air. Had a quick look around the room, there was a bit cupboard/wardrobe but very little drawer space...just the small unit the tv was on and the two small drawers in the desk. Not too much of a problem though just meant we kept most of our belongings in the case rather than unpack. The bathroom was ok, pretty old but clean enough, towels were clean so all fine on that front. The towels are rather small though and don't cover much haha. There was a picture on the walls and the frame was all cracked and broken - it would have just been better to remove the pic rather than displaying the broken one. Furniture was a bit bashed but didnt affect its purpose, still worked. Bed was clearly old but clean sheets and comfy enough - sheets weren't changed every day but were clean on arrival and we wouldn't change our bed every day at home so didn't bother us. TV worked fine - plenty of channels to choose from which is handy whilst getting ready in the morning. Hairdryer and iron were provided. We requested more pillows and towels which were both delivered within a half hour. Wouldn't say that the room was cleaned everyday, beds were made and bins were emptied but couldn't see anything more than that done. Only the things that looked untidy were cleaned if that makes sense? Some of the electrical sockets were a bit questionable, few wires sticking out in places but I'm still alive. Lighting in the room was bad. There was a light in the corridor area and then just a lamp to light the main body of the room. Overall, not bad but not good either. For the price we paid we didn't expect much - and we didn't get much. The room was clean but far from luxurious but for the amount of time we were in it, it did us fine. One of the tour guides said that permission had been granted to build a skyscraper on the site which makes it sound like it will be coming down at some point so it probably wont be there if we decide to go back. If it was there I probably would stay again. I would reccomend this hotel to people on the basis that you've read the reviews, you know what to expect and if you're happy with that then theres probably no greater location for exploring NYC!!

Reviews.Title: “would definately stay again (penn5000 club room)”
Reviews.Author: amartin102
Reviews.Content: stayed in the pennsylvannia for two nights from the 17th jan 2011, booked it with expedia as it was cheap and also right opposite msg where we were going to a concert , I paid about £2 a night extra for the penn 5000 club room as you get a free buffet breakfast (even if expedia says no breakfast ) because if you stay in the club rooms you have access to the club lounge were breakfast is laid out !!! ok the rooms are well worn and a little dusty around the edges but the hotel has so much character that it makes up for it , we have stayed in 2 other cheap hotels in new york and this was definately the best . I am a great believer in you get what you pay for so if you want 5* and everything that goes with it stay in a 5* if like me you just want a comfy bed and somewhere to crash in the centre of the city you cannot go far wrong (based on my experience of the penn 5000 club rooms) . would definately stay again and there really is no easier hotel for MSG .

Reviews.Title: “yes, it is the biggest "motel" i've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: lalatrips
Reviews.Content: it was my fault cause i wanted to save a couple hundred bucks to have spending $$$. i wasnt totally disgusted, i guess there is worse, but the 2 nights i stayed, i was scared to take a shower. the price really gives it away. you cannot get decent luxury in NYC paying that low of a price.

Reviews.Title: “Ruunnn foressstt rrruuunnn!!!”
Reviews.Author: Qiyamah100
Reviews.Content: I just checked I'n today this hotel looks more appealing from the outside the inside is outdated rooms are small I just found dirty towels bathroom looked dingy paint is chipping on the walls room doors look like jail cells carpets are dirty .. Walls are squalid .no inernet I'n rooms .overall looks like an old welfare prostitution camp and just think I have two night uuggh smh!!

Reviews.Title: “Budget central hotel - what more!”
Reviews.Author: Lovinscotland
Reviews.Content: We were very scared about this hotel after we book, but as i work in hotel management myself, I realise things can be exaggerated & this hotel is really not as bad as sone reviews below! Seriously, why pay the earth for a fancy hotel in NY!? The hotel Penn was so central, couldn't have been better!! Yes the decor was fairly old fashioned but our room was huge & clean -bed was super comfy! For the amount of time we actually spent in the hotel, this budget hotel was just the deal! Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible guest service”
Reviews.Author: isoblah
Reviews.Content: So the only good thing about this hotel is that it's right across the street from the Penn Station and a few miles from all the main attractions, but the service is just absolutely non-existent. All the front desk people were lousy and not service-oriented. Many were on their cell phones, in their own little world, and they treated us rudely. The one and only friendly staff we encountered in this entire hotel during our week-long stay was the morning luggage man downstairs. He should get a raise! As for the rooms? Worn out and disgusting. The carpet was sticky.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother”
Reviews.Author: CJH65
Reviews.Content: After waiting in the airport style check in reception for nearly an hour (at 11pm!) we eventually got to our room off a corridor that reaked of cigarette smoke and that looked as though it hadn't been redecorated since the 1960s. There was a fault in the room and we had to ring reception 3 times before the maintenance guy finally came up. BY this time it was after midnight and given we'd flown from France we were wrecked. Pretty poor service. The concierge desk was very helpful - really the only highlight in service for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Madubil
Reviews.Content: This place was just AWFUL. The lobby looked fine- like an older hotel, but the rooms & hotel interior looked like a crime scene. I really expected to find blood stains & chalk outlines in our "suite". The hallways were FILTHY & the carpet had huge stains on it- which looked like they had just had bottles of bleach poured on them to deal with any mystery DNA on the rug. The room we had was a "suite"- which contained two double sized beds & was the size of any other average hotel room- not a suite by any definition. We got to the room & tried to get booked into another hotel- this place was awful & I was concerned for both safety & hygiene. We had to prop the window open with a water bottle as it would not stay up on its own- the lamp shade had MASSIVE burns on it- which came from either a cigar or a crack pipe- I'm guessing the guests of this establishment are more inclined to have crack pipes on them not cigars. The lamps & TV did not seem to turn on or off on their own- the trick was to plug them in- and unplug them in when you wanted them on. We did not shower in the room- socks were worn at all times- we slept fully dressed. This place looked NOTHING like the rooms on their website. The only positive was that we were only here for one night. That said I'm willing to pay 3 times more & be in a less convenient location to avoid staying at the Pennsylvania. It was really just disgusting- it felt like a crystal palace or a shooting gallery- but NOT a hotel that people without a serious meth habit.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Arryg123
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in ny, and it was a pleasure to stay in this hotel. I was checked in within minutes, and was then shown up to the room by a very handsome young gentleman. The room was very clean and I had a selection of clean towels and complementary tea and coffee which was wonderful. The bed was a bit squeaky as I heard from the newly marrid couple next door. I visited the restaurant on several occasions and it was a very good quality meal. I highly reccomed this hotel and I am planning to visit again in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: TraceyH40
Reviews.Content: My first trip to New York and I had the misfortune to stay at this hotel. It is very run down and not clean. Whilst checking in was served by a very arrogent and rude receptionist who stated that we had not booked non smoking room. Luckily we had written confirmation. Then getting to my room I found long black hairs on my "clean towels" and on the floor. Room depressing to say the least with most of my electrical sockets partially hanging of the wall. Asked reception to fix this and they did send someone but they only fixed one. The sockets under the table were just bare wires with no casing. I had a very noisy couple in the room next door not the fault of the hotel but nothing was done about it. The only redeeming feature was the restaurant downstairs but later found out it had no connection with the hotel.(Hence the high quality) This hotel was by no means cheap (Christmas period working out at almost 1300 dollars for 4 nights but I wish I had paid more as it has left a bit of a black cloud over what was a great break.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Bad”
Reviews.Author: Daylove
Reviews.Content: Terrible customer service and the room was absolutely disgusting. I checked in and out in 10 minutes and moved to a nearby hotel. Personnel was extremely rude I have never been treated so rudely anywhere else. I rather sleep in the street than at this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, good location, low quality”
Reviews.Author: and7ey
Reviews.Content: This is the hotel in the center of NY and it has very good price for such location. So, it has a lot of people there. In result - half an hour queues for check-in, rude staff, inconvenient breakfast area. Double bed is too small for two people. No coffee machines in the room. And... they take money for keeping your bag before check out and after check in ($4 per bag). If you need to keep it before and after - you pay 2 times. I see that first time! Don't go there. Better to choose some other hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disgustingly dirty. DONT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: MaxGloucester9
Reviews.Content: Took 3 and half hrs to book in.They told us we were not booked in even though we had proof. Absolute idiots work here. All staff incredibly rude - shockingly so. Eventually got to room via nice reception and ok lifts - to the REAL hotel. God awful corridors and terrible doors to rooms- very depressing and dark and full of dust, dirty linen and bits of plaster from Walls and electric sockets covered in black soot. The rooms are even more depressing, very old and tired, plaster naming off Walls, cracks everywhere, all furniture is very old and every item was broken in some way, very old grey linen with one small pillow each (asked 3 times for.more but after 3 days still waiting), the lamps did not work, the phone did not work and the hairdryer did not work !! The bedroom was disgustingly dusty. And bits of dirt that I planted in a very obvious place on the carpet was never hoovered up. The maids quite obviously only come inane empty bins and make bed. The bathroom - enter at your own risk. I have never in all my years of travelling stayed in such a filthy bathroom. Ihad to clean the huge amount of dust from ALL and I mean ALL fixtures and fittings. The only good thing about this hotel is the location. Please don't waste your money pay extra and get a clean place.

Reviews.Title: “The worst I’ve ever stayed!”
Reviews.Author: wanessinha
Reviews.Content: Check-in: Line with 25/30 people. The room: filthy with broken furniture, dirty bathroom and clogged toilete. I complained to the front-desk manager the second night about the general cleanliness of the room and asked for early departure (I could not stay there even for a few hours) and he was wery rude and didn’t help me but, of course, that night I moved to another hotel without the money I had paid but happy for leaving that place. It was my 4th time in NYC and I alwayshave found good hotels for good prices. This choice was clearly a mistake.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: VivianVivacqua
Reviews.Content: Please do NOT stay at this hotel It should have been closed a long time ago. Apparently its owners do not care about preserving it. Rooms are filthy. Bathrooms as well. Staff is extremely rude.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Amelia040
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really terrible, the worst ive ever stayed in. The lobby is nice but it is just a show, we were shocked going up to our rooms walking through the hallways, the roof was falling apart and cracks in the walls. My friends commented that they have stayed in better hosetls in Bolivia. The rooms do improve though as the levels go up so if you do stay here, they expect you to complain and they'll then move you to a higher level. The staff including the bell captain and the receptionists were so rude and unhelpful, there wasn't even an offer to take bags up to the room and when we checked in the staff member didnt even speak a word and just handed me a key. The only good thing about this place is the location. I'd avoid dissapointment and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “First two rooms were disgusting”
Reviews.Author: Kixlin
Reviews.Content: Disgusting, moldy and dirty. On the third attempt we got a room on the 16th floor that was actually clean, apart from pizza and chewing gum on the walls. The roof in this room did not fall down in large chunks of paint and black mold. If you are allergic, afraid of fleas and like decent bedding - Avoid this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly thrilled!”
Reviews.Author: Ilovephish
Reviews.Content: I read countless reviews before my stay at hotel Penn 12/28/10-1/2/11. I was scared. We stayed here during three shows at Madison Square Garden, which is literally four feet from the hotel, really amazing location, very easy to explore the city and make it back without using any public transit, no need for taxi either. Check in had a long line, about 40 minutes, even at 11pm. There was not enough staff on for the holiday, however our guest agent was funny, friendly, and helpful. Be prepared to pay in full for your stay upon check in. Our room had a working refrigerator, very comfy king bed, clean sheets, clean carpets, clean bathroom with a funky old new York feel. The place is a hundred years old and by FAR the cheapest of it's location, it's only rational that the carpet and hallways were a bit outdated. (but VERY clean.). I received mail that was sent before my stay in the mail room with ease from a very friendly and helpful man. The housekeepers were sweet and friendly. I left a key at the desk for a visiting friend with no problem, not even having to wait in line. I was able to go to my valet'd car and get some items no problem. Extra pillows were brought within 30 minutes. Check out was a breeze, the car showed up promptly. I'm sure there are some crappy rooms in that huge place but my new years eve with Hotel Penn was an A+++

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but TEEEERRRRIIIBLLLEEE Services and Cleaning!”
Reviews.Author: guigo40
Reviews.Content: This might be a good hotel for young people, but I've stayed in better hostels than this hotel... The service is very poor and some of my mom's make up products disappeared... The location is great! One block away from Macys and the 34 St! But all the rest is terrible! The pictures at the web site seems that the room is very clear and bright, BUT IT IS NOT!!! I do not recommend this hotel and I would not stay there again with family... not a chance!

Reviews.Title: “Not even worth 1 star!!! Terrible - Avoid”
Reviews.Author: jgsfg
Reviews.Content: This is a filthy hotel that smells really bad! Its very run down and aged. Rooms were a good enough size but falling apart. As I started to unpack, two rats ran out from under my bed - i've never screamed so much in my life! I went straight down to the front desk (bags in tow) and asked to change rooms. they were very unhelpful and wouldn't change my room and got pushed to the back of the queue. We moved to a different hotel in the end. Not impressed and not worth a rating! Only thing the hotel has going for it is the location - but i'd rather the location be slightly further away and to have a hotel that is clean and smell free.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst places I have ever stayed!”
Reviews.Author: Barb617
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel in October. The location is excellent - I will give it that. The lobby is beautiful but wait until you get to your room. I am used to staying at Motel 6 and Super 8's so don't expect a lot of bells and whistles. I do expect a clean, secure room. Our first room was a disaster - filthy, broken furniture, unkept beds and the window wouldn't close any farther than 12 inches. We requested a different room. Our "upgrade" was slightly better - atleast the window was closed. Our beds did not have mattress covers, the sheets did not go the full length of the bed (short about 14 inches), the bathroom ceiling was covered with black mold spots, the heater cover was completey off and propped up against it, the porcelin was peeling from the bath tub with the chips laying in the bottom (probably a full cup of them) and the room was very dated with old broken furniture. We went to the store and bought bleach to clean the surfaces. We didn't shower for two days due to the condition of the bathroom - "spit baths" only. The toilets don't flush well. We really didn't feel safe even though the doors look like submarine doors where they have taken the old doors and welded metal over the glass area. I don't think there was a smoke alarm as I saw a sign when checking out that there were complimentary smoke alarms upon request. Hmmmm ..... It was a good thing we were gone all day and dog tired when we got back in to our room. The taxi's are so reasonably priced that it would be worthwhile to stay at a different location and catch a cab to Time's Square and walk to the different sights from there.

Reviews.Title: “Really gone way downhill”
Reviews.Author: TwoWheelRadio
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at and recommended to many the Hotel Pennsylvania in New York City for the primary reason that it is extraordinarily conveniently located for train travellers like me to train into the city, walk with my bags directly across the street, check in, then on checkout day, store bags at the hotel, do whatever and have a very easy trip in and out of a busy town. I've done this trip now 5 times. In the past, the Hotel Pennsylvania has provided a good value, even at Christmas time, and has had decent, if not perfect, rooms with good cleanliness, good value, good service. This trip, my first in 4 years, there was a marked decline in every aspect of the Hotel's service. The checkin lines, normally 8 or 10 people deep, were 20, and slower. The bank of 12(!) elevators consistently required waits of 5 to 10 minutes. Coming down, 5 or 6 cars would stop, completely full before one came with enough room to squeeze on, and then would stop at every floor on the way down only to see the desperation on the faces of all the people waiting there for the who-knows-how-many cars it took to find them space. Modern elevator systems can be used to make this better and it's a major hassle when you forego heading down to the street because you're afraid the elevator trip might not be worth it. Our room was on the 11th floor. Our radiator cover fell off every time you got close to it until we jammed a quarter into it to hold it closed. You don't want to see the inside of the radiator at this hotel, believe me. The window wasn't shut quite tight, so snow was coming into the room. This was obviously not a problem just in our room, as plaster was flaking from the ceiling above and water stains on the carpet said the people in 1018 were probably in the same boat. The room appeared not to have been vacuumed except cursorily in the past few weeks. There were odd stains on everything. The desk chair would have been more at home in a crime scene investigation for all the dents, stains, discolorations and foreign materials it was holding onto. Ask for an extra towel or two to cover this up if you go. There were all of 3 outlets in the room, so rather than add a power strip, the hotel simply plugged in only those things it could. With no overhead light in the room at all, this meant that when you had both lamps plugged in at full blast you had a whopping 80 watts of light in a 10x15 room. Apparently this is part of their redecorating and cleaning strategy, if you can't see the crap it might not be there. But with both lights plugged in, you couldn't use the cordless phone, or an internet connection that both needed to be plugged in to work. You also didn't have anywhere, but the bathroom, to plug in any phone charger. The bathroom was fine, if old. The shower water pressure was appropriate for stripping the varnish off old furniture, so any more than a 64th of a turn on either water valve and you were left cringing at the touch of the shower spray. The shower curtain was pretty new and the towels were good. If only we'd had enough to cover the rest of the room with them. The furniture was about a 1980 vintage, it appeared, and really showing age and wear. Corners were off every piece. Handles were missing on drawers. everything was worn. Beds were screwed to the wall, sort of. There was a mini-fridge to store stuff, which was nice. There was no free wifi available in the rooms. No plug in Internet unless you unplugged the light or TV. We received a complementary "continental breakfast" with our stay, which we initially tried the first day (and went back to verify the second). After a disastrous 10 minute wait to go up from the 11th to the 12th floor on the elevator, we wandered around looking for the place. At the lobby they tell you it's in room 1210A. Room 1210 had some surprised asians who did not offer us breakfast. 1210A it turns out is on the other side of the building from 1210. It's also not labeled with any sort of helpful room number. When we entered, it was a suite-sized room, maybe 15 x 20, filled with about 30 people. Three scattered bar tables were covered with trash. There were no coffee cups and the table that held the 20 gallon tin of orange juice which was giving up its last was covered in napkins and other trash. There was a bin unit that once apparently had bagels, bread pastries and the like, now had about 12 broken muffins amid a bunch of other trash. The room was dirty overall, overcrowded, disgusting. The one attendant stood without cleaning and did nothing. We left to go to a restaurant outside. I complained to the front-desk manager the first night about the general cleanliness of the room, the continental breakfast and was offered the following compensation: late checkout and a promise that they'd have more food there tomorrow. There were other glitches to the trip, since we were there during a snowstorm. Our room was not made up at all after our first night due to a shortage in the maid staff. We called for towels and they brought them. Lines were longer for checkout due to the storm, which we would have expected. Until such time as this hotel changes hands and has had a massive refurbishment of the elevator system, the rooms and the service staff, we will not consider it at any price, much less the nearly $300 a night they charge for this great location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: borzoidog
Reviews.Content: This is the second time my daughter and I have stayed here and I have to say although I agree the rooms are tired but you dont sleep on the walls and ceiling, sheets were changed and spotless towels changed everyday staff in general friendly superb location would recomend. Also would like to thank Flora personnally for all the help when our flights were cancelled then reinstated. Look forward to seeing you again in 2011:)

Reviews.Title: “In dire need of some TLC!!”
Reviews.Author: alison2901
Reviews.Content: We arrived by the side enterance, our first impression was 'Oh my god' the place stank of cooking and was full of smoke from the takeaway on one side and the restraunt on the other, the place looked awful, we proceeded to the front desk in the Lobby where our impression changed to one of relief,the lobby looked lovely with all the christmas lights, the staff at the desk were very helpfull (Sheila) was the lady who booked us in and out and on both occassions couldn'y do enough for us. W then proceeded to our room on the 16th floor and had to laugh at the absolute state of the place, peeling paint on the walls, carpets were old and dirty, the green door to our room looked like it was armour plated, the corridors looked like something out of the film 'The Shining' we half expected to see a young lad riding his bike, REDRUM!!! The rooms were just as bad, dirty, old, and in need of refurbishment, the shower was powerfull, but the bathroom itself must of been installed when the hotel was built, the cleaners changed the towels daily and our bed was changed the first two days but not for the further three days? A word of advice, if its somewhere to get your head down for the night then its ok, otherwise look elsewhere, the place is a mess!!

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: sway_br
Reviews.Content: High points: really great location (and i really mean it - just a few steps from Times Square, Macy's, 5th av. and just in front off Penn Station and Madison Square Garden. And the rooms and closets are really big. Low points: the rooms are old, and i don't think they clean the bathrooms every single day. They could improve that - about the rooms - , but if they did, the rates would be as high as in the other hotels in the area and i rather think that they'll stay just as they are now. huhuh Besides, if it's New York, you don't wanna waste time inside a hotel. Or do you? Bottom line: i'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect cheap hotel bang in the middle of it all”
Reviews.Author: saintsnick
Reviews.Content: I was getting worried having read the reviews but really shouldn't have. Hotel was everything we needed....easy checkin, room small but clean and tidied every day. Needed modernisation - coridoor leading to room reminded us of ghostbusters! Perfect location. This was spot on for us as we used it as a base to explore from. I think people have to link their expectations to the price they are paying and this was fantastic value

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel should be a Class Act ..... but isn't!”
Reviews.Author: strooka Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the dazzling foyer/lobby. This Hotel could be great but has been run into the ground. There appears to be no attempt at a major refurbishment of even a lick of paint. The brilliant location cannot hide the fact that the building needs serious attention. There were cracks in the bedroom walls, wallpaper was peeling, the shower room sink was off the wall and dangling by it's legs. The beds and cupboards haven't been moved in months so the floors were filthy. The windows didn't close making the noisy air conditionning/heating redundant. The electrical sockets were alarming to look at or use. The hardworking cleaning staff always did their best to make the room presentable and the bathroom towels were perfection. The Manager of this Hotel needs to seriously consider whether it wants to run a high class hotel or a slum! I won't be booking a room here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location; Rundown”
Reviews.Author: Guanimo
Reviews.Content: We traveled to NY City by train (Amtrak) arriving at Penn station. When booking the Amtrak fare, their site recommended the Hotel Pennsylvania. Pros: As we had a concert to attend at Madison Square Garden, this hotel was ideally situated... directly across the street form the Garden and a block from the train station. the price was right from Getaroom.com at $159/night which included acess to the "lounge" where there was free internet access (two computers), free coffee (many varieties) from two (one-cup-at-a-time machines) and a decent continental brekfast, juice, fresh bagels, muffins and danish. Cons: Room was dusty and rundown and tiny, barely larger than a cruise ship stateroom. Very weak water pressure for the shower and a full-sized not uncomfortable bed. My wife didn't sleep well (sneezing due to dust) but I did. Walls were scuffed.

Reviews.Title: “What is the fuss about?! this place was awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: daynabrooke
Reviews.Content: ok. seriously. what is everyone's problem? i booked this hotel on orbitz because i got an incredible deal. i will start by saying we did book the penn 5000 suite. maybe that is the secret? it was only 50 dollars more total for both of us to upgrade. i HIGHLY recommend this. i read the reviews and i was expecting the worse. some reviews on this site compare it to the hotel in the shining! I was worried, but the price and location couldn't be beat. I actually said "ok, babe, here it goes" when opening the door. the room was fantastic! it was clean, we had a full king size bed, amazing view, flat screen tv, fridge, desk, personal heat/air, and the bathroom had great water pressure. the room itself is small, yes, so if you are the type that like to go to a big city to lounge in your hotel room...this may not be the place for you. My fiance and I are very "go go go!" so we were only in the room to sleep and get ready for the evening. The hotel staff was awesome, we checked in early, and we loved the penn 5000 lounge because it was freezing outside so we always had somewhere to get a fresh cup of coffee (it is a personal one cup coffee maker and it comes with all sorts of great coffee flavors). The location is amazing, you are in the center of everything, and it's a nice safe place to come back to. we loved it. absolutely loved it! we will definitely be staying here in the future

Reviews.Title: “Pregnant and treated like crap by the staff at the Penn Hotel...worst experience ever”
Reviews.Author: pregnantatthepenn
Reviews.Content: This was supposed to be a "girls weekend" before I have my baby, and instead it put the biggest wrench into our vacation. We had an issue with our credit card for incidentals upon arrival (they wanted to run $40 on a card) and couldn't get a hold of my husband, I asked if we could just check in, pay the hotel room charge in full, pay the $40 in cash and have the card info by end of day, and they absolutely refused. The check in was at 3pm, my girlfriend and I arrived in NY at 6am and had kept ourselves busy by walking around sight seeing in the cold, we were very tired by the time we returned, especially with me being 7 1/2 months pregnant.!!! I offered to pay them double, they refused, I offered them whatever they wanted and they said "no" and asked me to stand aside and wait. I asked for the manager who came out and gave me attitude and said that there was nothing she could do and if I went else where we would be denied because we need a credit card. I said "but we just traveled here from Canada, where are we going to stay" and she answered "that's not my problem" and then motioned to the clerk to help the next person in line. I refused to leave the front desk and asked what did I need, because I wasn't sleeping in the street. She gave me a list of things she would need, jumping threw hoops is what she wanted and the only thing missing was that I light myself on fire. I walked over to the seating area and proceeded to call everyone I knew for help. By the time I got a hold of my husband with his credit card information (scanned copies of front and back of cc and of drivers license) that they wanted emailed, I was told the manager had left for the day. She left, and never said a word to me!! At this point we had been waiting an hour and a half. I asked to speak to whom ever was in charge, they made me wait 20min before a man emerged with the same "I'm not going to help you" attitude. I just stood there at the front desk waiting. I told them this was hard on my feet but this fell on deaf ears. They would usher me aside and move on to the next person in line. When we emailed them the info, they wanted more, when my husband emailed more, they said they didn't receive it. I asked to speak to the manager and he just all together stopped coming out from the back (he never stayed at the front desk to help solve this small issue). We were never shown any courtesy, manners or respect. We were cast aside, ignored and treated badly. We were just so tired and grateful that one person took pity on us at the front desk and helped me until he was finally pulled from the front and made to stop talking to us. We have no idea what we could have done to be treated so badly. The only reason we stayed was because the temperature was freezing, all other hotels were booked and I wasn't about to go lugging around my bags in NYC at this hour trying to find somewhere to stay. Just when I was so tired, frustrated and about to start crying, my husband called me and said he had called the hotel and yelled at the manager to check us in that I've been up for too long and that this isn't good for the baby I'm carrying. I walked over to the front desk for the last time, and a young man who wouldn't even look at me signed us in, gave me keys and then gave me a receipt and then looked past me to help the next person. No "I'm sorry for the wait" there were no apologies given, there were no words exchanged. I felt like I was in the Twilight Zone of the worst hotel experience of my life....and I've traveled! I've done cheap hostels, high end luxury hotels in Europe, South America, Canada, different parts of the US and never once in my life has this ever happened. This whole ordeal took almost 4hrs!!!! In the end we ended up having a half hour to get ready and then have to leave for our Broadway show, no resting, no showering, no relaxing before the show as we had planned. It put our whole trip off and we never really recovered from this. I dreadfully regret staying at the Penn and don't recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Suprised with Hotel after Reading reviews”
Reviews.Author: DanW2188
Reviews.Content: I just got back from the hotel and was suprised, I stayed in a Club Penn 5000 king room and it was really comfortable, the room was a decent size and had a fridge in and a flat screen tv, room was maded up daily with fresh towels, bathroom was basic but was clean, one of the good things of staying in club penn 5000 was on the 12th floor theres a guest room with sofas, free internet and printing and also tea and coffee available, its well worth the upgrade, i didnt find any bed bugs the bed was massive and really nice, never take the stairs as there are alot of floors and when you reach the basement its a maze, the location is amazing so close to everything, i would stay here again as didnt have a bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Rooms but excellet location”
Reviews.Author: Marco1976
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Pennsylvania Hotel from the 12 to the 14th of December and it was more or less what I expected after reading several Trip Advisor reports. I reserved (in October) 2 nights through “otel.com” (not “hotels.com”) and it was the best offer over the internet. Through internet I paid in advance 250 €, all taxes included, for the 2 nights, for a double bed room for 2 people. When I arrived everything was paid for. At the reception they asked me for ID and a credit card for security reasons. The hotel is super central, right across the street from Penn Station and Madison square Garden. It is located on 7th Avenue, 2 blocks from 5th Ave, about 5-10 min walk on 7th Avenue to Times Square (you could see it from the main door of the hotel), I think 3 blocks from the Empire State Building and 1 block from Macy's. Breakfast wasn’t included in the price but you could get something to eat at a Lindy’s restaurant that exists in the hotel. Breakfast with pancakes costs around US$14 (don’t forget: +tax, +tip). We ended up having breakfast at a “Sparrows” across the street. Here an “all you can eat” breakfast (although you have a guy putting what you want on a plastic plate) cost $10 (taxes included). Don’t need to leave tip here since it is self-service. This breakfast buffet was basically greasy foods (not the healthiest) and included sausages, potatoes, bacon, scrambled eggs, pancakes, toast (all pre-made and ready to serve). Not a delicious cozy place but good enough to start the day in NYC without spending a fortune on breakfast. They also served other things, like pre-made salads, fruit salads, coffee, and for dinner: pizzas, lasagnas, etc… Besides Sparrows, across the street from the hotel, you have a Mc.Donalds and small mini-markets where you can get milk, some cereals, and other basic food products. For cheaper junk food (pizzas, hot dogs, etc) you could also go to Penn Station. Be aware that this area, restaurants, fast-food joints and shops, have a big ethnic variety and many of them may not be the cleanest of places nor have big worries about hygiene. Many of the people that work in these places hardly speak English. The entire area around the hotel, 7th Avenue, from the hotel up to Times Square looks the same. It is very central, very colorful, with lots of people walking on the very busy streets giving you a feeling of safety and therefore I consider it the best area to be, although it is also quite dirty looking. As for the hotel, lobby was very nice and modern, with lots of middle/upper-middle class looking guests (Portuguese standardsJJ) from all over the world (coming and leaving, by the hundreds, with shopping bags). We were lucky and didn’t take more than 10 min in line for check-in. It is a very big hotel. With more than 1.000 rooms. I assume that around check-out time (12 pm) there could be a bigger line, since everybody could be trying to check-out at the same time. There are 4-5 counters at the reception desk. After reading trip advisor reviews we asked, during check-in, for a higher and newer room. We were told that all rooms were the same and that there were no new rooms so they gave us a room on the 7th floor. Didn’t see other rooms so can’t say if I got one of the better or the worst ones. The room wasn't all that nice: old and not spotless clean: The room had a window with view to another section of the hotel. Basically the view was to another part of the hotel’s building (but of course there are rooms facing the busy street. I don’t know how you get them thoughJ). On the side we could barely see the street. The floor in the room was a bit dirty (not spotless), a bit of dust and paint from the wall in back of the TV, in corners, around the electrical settings. The bed sheets looked clean (which was essential for us to stay in the room), one of the bathing towels was stained (don’t know if it had been washed or not so didn’t use it just in case). They had shampoos and soaps. Bathroom looked clean although things looked old. The shower had paint coming off from the floor and sides. If you are fussy better bring some sandals for the shower and slippers for the room. In the room, there is a phone (with the possibility of receiving calls and messages), a small closet and an ironing board. TV was also old but functional, it had the regular American channels for NYC. Not much space for the 2 suitcases we brought but we managed to move things around in order to have them open and on the floor so we could easily take things from them. The doors of the room looked reinforced so it seemed pretty safe inside. The corridors of the hotel could look a bit scary (especially for a woman alone) since they are old looking, wide and you don’t always have people walking around. There seem to be some video cameras in some parts of the corridors, I suppose for safety reasons. The safety is related to it being such a big hotel, with so many people, making it easy for an outsider to get in the hotel without being noticed. There are also other entrances to the hotel besides the main entrance. There is however a man, by the elevators, who is supposed to be asking the room keys as you go bye although he never asked us to show him the keys. The hotel also stores luggage after you check –out for US$4 a piece. Can’t say staff wasn’t polite. They were nice (not too nice) but nice and polite enough. I suppose for NYC standards they were ok. I had a small problem although that was rapidly solved: The night before I checked out I called the reception from the room and asked if it was possible to check-out at 3 pm since my flight was at the end of the day. At first they told me the latest I could check-out, free of extra-charge, would be at 1 pm but then they accepted the 3pm. The next, day, when I came to check-out, at the reception, they told me I was supposed to have left at 1 pm since there was nothing in the “computer system” that said I was allowed to check-out at 3 pm, so they charged me half a night (about US$60). I was upset and complained but was in a rush to get to the airport so I paid and left. They gave me an e-mail to complain to, so the first thing I did when I arrived home was to write to this e-mail address (I think it is the manager’s). They rapidly replied saying they would give me back the amount they charged, so I suppose overall I was well treated. Overall I think it was worth it and I would stay back at the same hotel...specially because of the excellent location and relatively low prices for NYC. But I knew what to expect and was prepared: It is an old, big, 2 star hotel. Maybe not advisable if you have a toddler that could put his hands or mouth everywhere like on the dirty floor or electrical wires in back of TV. If you are very fussy with cleanliness you better go somewhere else, but will certainly pay much more and will be hard to get something right in the center. Another inconvenience is that these other cleaner hotels (check Park Savoy near central park) could be on emptier streets which could make it more unsafe to walk, especially at night (in the winter it is dark at 4pm), to the main and popular points of interest, so take this into considerations before you reservation. Another possibility could be to stay at more distant hotels (located out of Manhattan, near the airports (Newark or LaGuardia) or somewhere else, that are served by the subway/train system allowing you to get a better and cleaner hotel for a cheaper price and fast access to Manhattan (beware of train fares that could get expensive depending on your location).

Reviews.Title: “shabby, shabby, shabby”
Reviews.Author: travel4fun20171
Reviews.Content: Overpriced, even during the holiday season. Asked for sheets for pullout and extra towels (yes, they knew there were 3 in the room) at 11:50p.m. Called front desk at 12:30 to inquire and was told to wait a little longer. Finally delivered at 1:30a.m. Brown water came out of the tub faucet. Desperately needs a paint job. Positive is convenience of hotel to subway.

Reviews.Title: “Its like a hotel room lottery”
Reviews.Author: Kay058
Reviews.Content: Weve been staying here for the last 10 years for 3 or 4 nights for the Big East Tournament at MSG across the street. The prices have been everywhere from 60 to 200 for 2 double beds and the rooms have been anywhere from a really nice room to a closet that had only a foot or so of clearance around the beds. One room had a waterfall in the hallway from the room above. One time we were by a lounge for airline employees and they were going in and out all night.. You just dont know what you are getting into till you open the door. We just sort of take it as part of the entertainment making fun of the rooms, but you can't beat the location for the tournament.

Reviews.Title: “Not to bad”
Reviews.Author: Essexdave80
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel before seeing the reviews for it I then got worried but after being there it was not bad at all yes the plaster is falling off Walls and ceilings in some places and there was a damp smell but soon got used to it. But for what you need the room for you couldn't ask for more the only problem I had with the hotel was the doorman was very rude and it seemed like he needed a good slap. Maids came round every day and made beds. The hotel is in need of a make over I think every thing has been left since Glenn millar stayed there but apart from that I really enjoyed my stay here

Reviews.Title: “Avoid like the plague”
Reviews.Author: jaymcee01
Reviews.Content: I'm not super picky when it comes to places I stay. I've read the reviews but honestly thought I could bear with it.
