Upon arrival (at 2:50pm, check in is at 3pm) we were 14th in line. We weren't checked in until about 4:45pm. Yes, it took them THAT long to check us in especially since they were letting others cut in front of us. The staff were just downright slow, rude and uncaring and the checkin process was hell. The room itself was a disaster. The walls were peeling, the carpet was dirty, the small fridge was LEAKING and the inside of it was filthy. The bathroom was disgusting, the window in the bathroom and the door would not close. The bed sheets were dated and the comforter was a bit dirty. Thankfully there were no bed bugs. The only positive thing about this place is what everyone else says: LOCATION. It's across the street from Madison Square Garden and Penn Station and only a few blocks away from Times Square, Macy's and the Empire State Building. But honestly, you're better off staying a block or more away for a bit more because I promise your trip would be less stressful.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: smassie
Reviews.Content: The reception was lovely, so it gave us high hopes. When we finally received our key and made our way to the elevator, the first thing we could smell when the doors opened was smoke. We were travelling with a 6 month old, so we specifically requested a non-smoking floor. When we entered the room, we were totally taken back with how old and decrepit it was. Paint flaking, rust, mould - it was disgusting. The bathroom was just an unholy room of darkness and the place had the eeriest feeling to it. We couldn't stay there and spent the night looking for another place. We found one, and went to the reception desk to ask for our money back. The manager was really nice and gave us our money back without any troubles. While we were down there, however, there was a couple complaining of bed bugs. She had large welts all over her legs and they looked absolutely terrible. I'm sure the place would be fine to stay at if you didn't have a family, but I don't recommend this hotel at all. Apart from it's location, only stay here if you're desperate.

Reviews.Title: “LOW QUALITY BUT EXCELLENT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: lofos114
Reviews.Content: Heard & read a lot about this hotel - mostly negative things so didn't expect much! It was better than expected and I slept better in this hotel than any other I have visited. Cleanliness needs addressing but beds were clean (NO bed buds) and room was serviced daily. No bar or restaurant on site but plenty nearby. Location of hotel made up for its shortcomings . Most attractions were in walking distance if you were up for it but Penn Station is right opposite hotel so we also used the subway a lot - it's quick, clean & very safe, even at night! I would use this hotel again as it's very economical and judging by the constant turnover of guests and the ever crowded foyer, it's also very popular with both national & international travellers!

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: LondonTeddy85
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is a brilliant location, the rooms are awful! The bathrroms in particular were bad with a constant leaking tap, peeling paster, stained bath etc! The windows are also very bad at blocking all the noise from madison sq gardens so bring ear plugs!

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel was a horrendous experience”
Reviews.Author: phoen
Reviews.Content: the entrance to the hotel is very deceiving, light and clean, do not be taken in by this. check in was exceedingly slow and disorganzied the rooms were horrendous, paint peeling from the walls, dirty and dust everywhere. Curtains and carpets were filthy. There were no facilities i.e. tea or coffee maker. Clean towels were provided daily and bed made. this room cost $300 a night. It was the worst hotel experience I have had in many years of travelling.

Reviews.Title: “Very very very disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: gprogers
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hotel are absolutely awful. Plaster falling off the walls,Paint cracking too. We found clumps of hair on the bath. Looks like it has not been touched since it was built in 1919. The doors are indescribable and have to be seen to be believed. The furniture is very dated. Not even a chair to sit on. Carpets need replacing. We did complain and they gave us another room but that was just as bad. There was always a huge queue for checking in. I felt very sorry for them knowing what they were going to get. I wanted to scream at them telling them to go elsewhere. No tea/coffee facilities in the room. I have never stayed in such a dire hotel Please dont even think of booking this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “DIRTY”
Reviews.Author: pafroggy1975
Reviews.Content: The photo's are not what the rooms look like. Our room was dirty, the shower/tub and sink backed up. There was absolute filth in the bathroom. Carpeting was extremely stained. Paint chips on the floor boards, walls had 4 big holes in them and I have photo's to prove it. The manager would not look at them nor would she talk about the filth. She was absolutely rude. I will be posting the photo's on facebook. You have to see them to believe how horrible this hotel is. I work in the hotel/restaurant industry and will never recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location- pity about the rest”
Reviews.Author: Benalcol
Reviews.Content: We have just returned back from a family trip to New York and we booked the holiday back in June for myself and my partner and our 2 grown up children. Upon arrival we thought the hotel looked very classy with a very handsome lobby. we were dealt with very expediently by a very pleasant receptionist who gave us our keys to our room on the 14th floor. This room was horrendous- peeling paint in the bathrooom,dusty tops and a very dangerous light switch and very very old furniture.I marched down to reception to complain and was immediately given another room on the 12th floor which we inspected prior to moving our luggage. This was just as bad with a very shabby looking bathroom and grubby furniture and carpets suffice to say we didnt move our luggage.My wife then went down to reception and was again given another room key on the 8th floor which after inspection was much better than the previous two. The rooms are very basic with only an old fashioned TV and radio and with very minimal facilities however at least this room had been refurbished. In my view the whole place needs a serious refurbishment and it is a crying shame that such a handsome looking building has such a grubby interior.The location despite all the downsides is superb and is walking distance to Times square,Broadway and 42nd street and smack facing Madison square garden.My advice to the owners would be to get this place refurbished as soon as possible as it has the potential to be one of New York's finest hotels. Sadly at the moment it is a long way from that which which is a real shame.

Reviews.Title: “Dire”
Reviews.Author: TripDrug
Reviews.Content: Ok, it was Thanksgiving - i.e. very busy, and with the location and size of the hotel we were not expecting a particulaly personalised service. However, we were not expecting a queue of several dozen people in a long long line to check in (think airport), slowly slowly moving forward because there were only 3 check-in staff working (slowly, slowly). This wasn't helped by a reception head / concierge faffing around behind the scenes but not rolling his sleeves up to help out. Upon arrival at the reception desk there was no apology for the delay (which would have been a nice touch) and the service was laconic, indifferent and slow. Finally we got to the room (late afternoon) to find that it hadn't been cleaned from the last guests... The hotel is actually very attractive, with a large marble lobby, a classical, somewhat art deco style and enough lifts operating to service the crowds. The room was pokey (par for the course in NY) and tatty. The furniture was circa 1972 (not in an ironic or retro way - ugly stained wood bulky commode and table), the sheets were ripped (but clean), the bedspread was sticky (lovely...) and under no circumstances would I recommend bare feet on the dark brown carpet. Naturally the TV remote control didn't work, the mold on the ceiling was unappealing and the bathroom a dingy shade of yellow (possibly a former white in decades past) with fittings that were servicable but unattractive. It was a place to lay your hat (but not a temporary home, by any stretch of the imagination). Upon check-out 2 days later we had to face the queue once more in order to buy a 4$ luggage tag for each piece of left luggage for the stock room downstairs (why they couldn't trust the downstairs personnel with this service is beyond me). I left a jacket in the wardrobe (in my hurry to check-out no doubt) but of the jacket there was no longer a sign based on subsequent phone call discussion with the hotel. You do get what you pay for in NY, but the hotel didn't come cheap at all - clearly the management just don't care about return bookings - there are enough tourists in line and the location and "iconic" renommé of the hotel keep them coming in. I would be surprised if they get any repeat business - I would rather stay on Penn station's platform 3 than go there again.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous :D”
Reviews.Author: Krispyv
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. A family with 2 children, on a budget, this worked for us. We were not expecting the Taj Mahal after reading the reviews, but we took the chance and were just fine with service and presentation. To our surprise, we were able to view the Macy's Parade Ballon's passing right out our room window. We would reccommend for not so picky, or lower budget families, who want to be be right in the heart of it all. Suggestion: Take the Q Train express to Cony Island and stop at the Auariam, what a great place!! Good luck! Restaurant Owners NH

Reviews.Title: “What is all the complaining about?”
Reviews.Author: cdblw
Reviews.Content: My brother & I arrived about 6pm on 11/22 and there was not one person in the check-in line!! However, at times throughout our stay, there were long lines - but always adequately staffed. You get what you pay for, for God sakes. It ain't the Ritz Carlton, but it doesn't cost what the Ritz charges...after all, you're in NYC - all you do is sleep in the room. Nice staff, large room with a walk-in closet (#1724). No noise, great water pressure, clean sheets. Only complaints: hallways are very dark, no internet in rooms and it costs you in the lobby (how tacky).

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: sharpmonica
Reviews.Content: Rude staff, walls and doors havin peelin paint. Walls os thin that when the guest in the next room couhs durin he niht we can hear. Furniture looks like was bought in a yard sale. I am glad I slept or tried to sleep only one niht at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we needed”
Reviews.Author: 302chrissie
Reviews.Content: Needless to say, I read a lot of the reviews and was willing to take a chance. You get what you pay for and more. We got there around 11 and needed to check our bag. We just paid and took it down to the lower level to store. We needed to use the bathrooms and you needed a key. We checked in around 4:45 and it was about a 30 min wait but we were prepared for that per all the reviews. We were pleasantly surprised when we got to our room. The room was huge with two double beds, large closet and high ceilings. It was outdated and the rugs needed to be cleaned but not as bad as i expected. We first checked for bedbugs and luckily found none. The bathroom was tiny but very clean. You can't beat the location - close to Penn Station, Empire State and the Thanksgiving Day Parade route. You also can't beat the price - I would recommend upgrading to the Penn 5000 Club. It was worth the $25 more for a better room and free breakfast (begals, pastries, coffee, juice, etc.). Would I stay here again???? It really depends on our NYC trip plans. There are so many better choices but this worked for us this time. I would not recommend it to others as there have been too many other bad experiences. I am very glad that it worked out for us.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: saltyAustralia
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. If you have children and are considering this and looking at other reviews and thinking it can't be that bad, well it is. The hotel staff told me that it is going to be closing down and that is why it has not been maintained. We arrived at 10pm and if I had been able to find another hotel I would have. We only stayed in the room till 9am and went to our next hotel where we showered. Don't waste your money on this hotel (dump).

Reviews.Title: “Basic but clean, GREAT location!”
Reviews.Author: tamleigh
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews on here I was initially scared of what I'd find upon arrival. However, the hotel itself was fine. It was clean (fresh towels every day) the room we had was a good size, working TV & the location was Great!! Although I'd pay a little extra for a better hotel if I were to go again, I found The Pennsylvania Hotel suitable to fit the needs of a hectic holiday (which is what you're in for in NY). The only thing I would suggest is if you want a taxi don't get it from outside the hotel as you will have to tip the concierge each time you do so and they can be quite forceful & dare I say rude.

Reviews.Title: “1 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sticasale
Reviews.Content: Being without an hotel during the marathon week, we have been directed there because it seemed to be the only one with some room available. Personnel very unpolite, we arrived in the morning before the room was ready and we had to pay for the luggage deposit. The room was horrible, smelly and with the carpet all worn out. It would be fine for a 1 star hotel, but having paid 300$ (without breakfast) for a room like this... It's incredible how it looks good if you visit their website, do not let them fool you!

Reviews.Title: “Dont be put off - FANTASTIC LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Kaye43
Reviews.Content: Having read all the reviews I was worried what we were letting ourselves in for - but was pleasantly surprised. The Hotel does need upgrading but for what you are paying it was fine. Should be a three star Hotel not two. The staff were very accommodating, friendly and very helpful. There was no long queues when we arrived late afternoon. Our room was huge, clean bedding and towels every day. No bed bugs - or any bugs for that matter. The bathroom looked like it had been renovated, new tiles etc. It reminded us of a travel lodge, on a larger scale. The location is absolutely fantastic - close to Times Square, Macys, MSG, Penn station. Everywhere within walking distance. We felt at ease when out and about. It can be very expensive, but, remember where u are. Would deffinately go again, and stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Lancashirelass021
Reviews.Content: Myself, mother and two sons aged 18 and 21 visited New York on the 10th November 2010. First impressions of the Pennyslvania Hotel were that it was a bit tired looking. It is an old hotel with PLENTY of rooms!! The location is excellent, with the Empire State Building, Macys, the cruise liners, hop on hop off buses all within walking distance. The rooms were tired looking but clean. The beds were changed every day and spotless. The bathroom was also tired looking but clean. Excellent stay, would stay again there. Breakfast was taken every morning at Lindys just inside the foyer of the hotel, very good but very busy. The Stead restaurant also alongside the hotel is excellent but pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay :)”
Reviews.Author: Brandon_James
Reviews.Content: After reading all the previous reviews we were a little bit worried about checking in to Hotel Pennsylvania. Last time we were in NYC we stayed at the New Yorker hotel nearby and liked the location. This time the New Yorker was fully booked and the Hotel Pennsylvania was only one 'reasonable priced' hotel near MSG/Macy's that we could find. We are too old for any hostels and don't want to spend a fortune for a room where we stay as little as possible :) We arrived at 6 PM and there were no queues at the check in. The service was pleasant and professional. We had booked a Penn 5000 room with one king bed and we got our room from 12th floor. The room just okay and clean enough to our standards. The bed was big & comfy and the sheets were clean and solid. It seemed that the air con unit was very old and had not been used regularly. As I turned it on some dust was flying out of it. The cleaning lady visited our room daily and changed the towels & sheets and did the daily cleaning/hoovering. First morning we went for the continental breakfast that included to room price but that wasn't so spectacular: coffee, tea, toast, marmalade, croissants, pastry. But you can live wit it or try some decent deli's near the hotel as we did :) But the best thing about this hotel is the location, location, location! Just cross the street from Madison Square Garden, one block from the Macy's and Manhattan Mall, one block from the Broadway, two blocks from Empire State Building. We had to use a cab only once when we went for a lunch to John's Pizza in 278 Bleecker St. (good but not excellent pizzas, but seemed to be quite popular pizzeria). Again we had a great time in NYC and the hotel did not spoil our trip! If you are not looking for luxury, but only a place to stay near all the sights, this might be your choice.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasently Surprised-highly reccomend this hotel to anyone looking to travel on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: mak2310
Reviews.Content: I had read all of the reviews and was dreading my stay at the hotel Pennsylvania but was very surprised with how great it turned out to be. I am a reservation agent for 4 and 5 star hotels so know good quality and the hotel penn was not the greatest but i would definatley give it more than a 2 star rating. We stayed on the 13th floor in a Pennsylvannia 5000 King room. The view sucked but the bed was huge and fairly comfy. The breakfast each morning was an added bonnus for just $150 a night and the location was amazing. You couldnt ask for anything closer to all attractions! The bathrooms desperatley need renovating and are extremley small but other than that we had a great experiance. NO bed bugs, Check-In staff were great, Security was fantastic, and i cant say enough about how great the location is! People really need to lighten up on this 2 star hotel, it definatley exceeded my expectations and if people want 4 and 5 star they need to learn that they will be stuck paying the price. You cant get 5 star hotels in New York for $150. Would highly reccomend this hotel to anyone looking to travel on a budget!

Reviews.Title: “Stay out! Sleep Quality is most important than location!”
Reviews.Author: fdslopes
Reviews.Content: Disgusting, very old and rude employees only interested in your wallet. Some might say that it is great located, ok… It is. But doesn’t worth your disappointment and dislikes about the hotel. We stayed for 4 nights; 4 nights of no sleep during the night. The lobby that looks like the worst bus station in the world! Those noise people are laughing and screaming during dawn in their rooms. The walls are so thin that you can hear everything inside your neighbor room. It’s impossible to park few seconds in front of the building just to care about your luggage. The concierge is there just to bother you and throw your luggage on the dirty sidewalk. There are many other options of hotel, cheaper and close to other subway stations. It’s better to take a metro or bus to your destination and have at least a great and cozy night of sleep.

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel but there are better ones”
Reviews.Author: LucioSilvaBrazil
Reviews.Content: I've been at Hotel Penn for one week. It's an old place with a great location, near subway and train station, and near Macy's, Empire State Building and Madison Square Garden. That was my first visit to NYC and I just loved the city, but the hotel wasn't exactly what I expected First they charge for wifi access, although you can get free access at many nearby stores, like Borders, McDonalds and Starbucks? So, why not deliver a free wifi access? Many hotels at the same price do the same. They also charge for luggage storage, I don't know if that's normal in NYC, but I believe they could do it as a courtesy for their guests. I've made a reservation for a 3 bed room, but when I got there, they said that there wasn't any room with 3 beds available. Luckily, when i got to the room, it had 3 beds. Maybe their reservation system wasn't ok or they fixed another room for me. The room was really big, with and old TV and no wardrobes. Its cleanliness wasn't great but that would be too much to demand a clean room with carpets all over the place. The bathroom wasn't clean enough too. Some days there were woman's hair on the floor, although we where 3 men. The shower didn't have a flow control, only temperature control, so taking a shower with less water was impossible. The corridors walls were a little bit dirt, and it looked like the Apache hotel of the movie The Shining. So, at the end we had a great stay at NYC, hoping to come back really soon, but definitely the next stay will be at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT Stay There...check in somewhere downtown instead”
Reviews.Author: daniel1583
Reviews.Content: Just got back, this hotel was the worst place I have ever experienced, and I was prepared after booking that it was bad, but this really shocked me. Even the cockroaches were checking out!! It's such a shame, because this hotel is rich with history, but in desperate need of TLC. I was moved 3 times because I just could not stay in the allocated room, the first was on the 8th floor and it really was the most disgusting thing I have seen. I went back to reception and the manager who must have heard it all before so was most unhelpful did give me another room which I thought was something from a horror movie. The paint was chipping off the walls, the bathroom had urine stains on the toilet seat, the curtains were non-existant, and then I did the ultimate. I checked under the sheets and mattress, and yes, you guessed it BED BUGS....By now, it was 12am and I was exhausted, so I slept fully clothes, even with my shoes on on top of the bed, using my coat to buffer the contact with the duvet, and moved out the next morning. This room was on the 2nd floor, which resembled a youth hostel with all the college kids hanging around, although even they were complaining! The next morning, I went back to reception and they moved me to the Penn Club Executive room on 13th floor, which was marginally better, in terms of the room being painted and the furniture not looking like it was found in the garbage. The maid even gave my room an extra clean, and the benefits of this room was the complimentary breakfast, which was a bonus, but served in the smallest room ever, so it was a cramped and rushed experience in the morning. The reason why I do not believe this hotel will spend $$$ to refurb is because it was full the entire week, so why spend $$$ when people are staying. Yes, location is a +, but I suggest stay in Soho at a small boutique hotel and really get a comfortable enjoyable stay. THis hotel is a stain on NYC and it should be ashamed to be standing amongst the great city, and I wonder how much repeat business they get so my advice is do not stay, find somewhere else and hopefully the more bad reviews and reduced business they get, will encourage the management to sort this place out. If you do stay, do not accept the first room allocated, and make sure you check for bed bugs, because they are still there. But staying here will negatively impact your stay in NYC, and that is the real shame of this place.

Reviews.Title: “terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: pichon_10
Reviews.Content: the most dirty and awful hotel I have never been in. I would never repeat the experience, for sure. It is worth to look for an hotel not so close to the center, but clean and tidy; even for sleeping. I would never recommended it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: VSPE
Reviews.Content: This is one of the mediocre hotel I have been in last 20 years. Location is one of the best. The 16 floor corridors have peeling paint on the walls and ceiling. Room is tiny and plumbing and tiles on the floor look like never been changed in 100 years of this hotel existence. AC unit is outdated and barely worked. Hotel is good for one night stand - that about all. My trip was only one day.

Reviews.Title: “Room is Small, Old, Wore Out, Shower Barely Works”
Reviews.Author: travelaround123_10
Reviews.Content: Terrable place to stay for the price and is not as the advertise. It is a dive. Room is small, old, wore out carpet and beds. Also has bed bugs, For the price of $200 a night stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend”
Reviews.Author: simw100
Reviews.Content: This hotel definetly needs a facelift but i'd still recommend. I stayed on the 16th floor with my sister, with views directly of Macy's and the Empire States building from one window and Madison square gardens from the other...Our room was big, admittedly it wasn't changed since the last guests left but they quickly dealt with it.The bed was huge, clean and comfortable.... glad I didn't know about the bed bugs then! We also had a huge TV and dressing table. It was perfect for our needs and couldnt believe the views! I'd recommend asking for these sort of qualities at check in....

Reviews.Title: “horrific experience. NEVER STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: jellis87
Reviews.Content: I waited in line for a long time to find out I had been 'upgraded' to a nice room. HA! If this was an upgrade, I don't want to know what they had originally planned for me. Walking to my room, the hallway was the scene of a slasher movie. Flickering lights, holes in the walls, really terrible smells... Then I get to my room and have the pleasure of inhaling bleach. Murder scene? The bathroom had a toilet without a toilet seat cover (similar to a public restroom) and you had the flusher that you usually press with a foot. The window was open and would not close and it was 50 degrees outside. I immediately left and found a new hotel and learned of a website, www.bedbugregistry.com, where I read accounts of bed bugs in this hotel from the day before. WHAT A HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE. NEVER, EVER GO HERE. There are other options. I went to the Comfort Inn Convention Center right down the road and it was the same price and SO clean.

Reviews.Title: “Grate Location But Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Dave_Sheffield999
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Pennsylvania must have one of the bet locations in New York only a few blocks from time square and the Empire State and right across the Street from Penn station witch is the biggest transport hub in Manhattan. However I would expect a lot more for $1500 a week the rooms are old and in a grate need of work our room was on the 10th floor and was quite a walk from the lifts the Light did not work (the lamps were fine so no big problem) the power socket was hanging off the wall and it did feel like you were taking your lift in your hands using it. Check in and Check out were seamless and the lobby is very nice and big (it needs to be the hotel is massif) to sum up Location Grate Hotel Bad (For the money) would i recommend NO far too expensive for what you get

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever - A Dump - Avoid at all costs.”
Reviews.Author: Scoopy_1
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this hotel from Wed 3rd November to Sat 6th November 2010. As my stay was just before the Marathon the rates were a complete rip off for what was offered. This hotel is a dump I booked into the Penn 5000 rooms which claim to be "A hotel within a hotel" with seperate check in - The special check in was not available nor was the Penn 5000 room staffed at any time. The staff at check in were laughing and joking with co-workers in foreign language while serving you - I'm all for enjoying your work but this took it to the extreme. This may explain the issues she had with trying to find my reservation in spite of the fact I handed her the number (which she paid no attention to) I am not expecting a large room in NY but the room was small. When you walked in first there is a stale smell in the room and to say the walls are flithly is an understatement. The bed was so small you could just about fit one adult never mind two. There was only one bedside locker for a double room with two people. The TV was un adjustable and at an angle you could not see it. The A/C did not work properly and I dread to think what the scratching noises I heard were. I did leave a complaint at the front desk but not no response. I finally sent an e-mail to the mail contact while still there asking if anyone was going to bother to respond and deal with my issues. I was not moved rooms but I was however given a complimentary night stay. The only good thing about this hotel is its location right across from Penn Station. Easy access to the airports. All in all $274 a night plus tax - A total rip off.. you might as well just bend over..

Reviews.Title: “There is a lot to do to improve on”
Reviews.Author: TjJoyner
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is its strength. Directly across the street from Penn Station, close to Times Square and the Empire State Building. There is supposedly a new manager and I feel for her because she has a lot of work to do. The hotel itself is in rough shape and several of the employees are as well. Lets just say not everyone is on the same page with the status and operations of the hotel. The computer registration systems are challenged and the employees know it and aren't afraid to tell the customers. There are supposedly good rooms but a lot of bad ones. Single night customers apparently get the old rooms. Peeling paint, old plumbing, dirty windows and worn out furniture were the experience. If you just need a place to sleep and aren't expecting much then this hotel could be an option because of its convenience and price. If you are looking to enjoy any room time I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Worse Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: DeSiReEMiami_Florida
Reviews.Content: A freind and I planned a trip to Ny for the first time on Halloween weekend 2010. We arrived at Hotel Pennsylvania Oct 30 around 4 am. Due to the fact that I had performed extensive research on the hotel I had decided to refuse to stay in any rooms or floors that had bad reviews about bed bugs. We were issued a room on the 3rd floor (323A) and as soon as I opened the door I was repulsed by the stained rug and chipping paint on ALL walls. Since it was so late at night I decided to enter the room anyways and see how bad it really was. Unsuprisingly it got worse, there were black hand prints on the walls and curtains and the bathroom looked like a crime scene. While I was going to find an alternative I tried to turn on the air and yea you guessed it, it didnt work. When I called the front desk for assistance the lady stated "you need to turn it to the right and if not to the left" when I told her that i tired both she told me I needed to read the print on the AC unit and that wouldve been great if it hadnt all been scratched off. I've gone from really bad to great in my life and this hotel is by far the worse room / hotel ive ever seen. I GIVE THIS HOTEL NEGATIVE 45 STARS. My friend swore the hotel is haunted as well. I wouldnt recommend this LOW CLASS MOTEL to anyone. In addition both her and I are still traumatized.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience. Nice hotel. Great location/value. Knowledgeable staff.”
Reviews.Author: abcdefgh12345
Reviews.Content: Hotel Pennsylvania, located across the street from Madison Square Garden/Penn Station, has one the the best locations in Manhattan. Near Macy's and other major attractions, including convenient shopping. Excellent access to Subway, and very centrally located. It is a nice hotel, and perhaps the best value in Manhattan. The staff is friendly and very knowledgeable. Not a single complaint, and will stay there again in the next couple of weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location , Bad Rooms”
Reviews.Author: TroyDunbar1
Reviews.Content: I like so many others stayed and I read the reviews. But I really like the Location. The Desk guy was very helpful but hte room was run down , I had a roach in the shower that was so big, I could have rode it down 7th Ave! , No Heat in the room , No towels, & when I asked the maid the next morning for some she acted like I was stealing them! No hot water, and I was just a poor excuse of a Hotel.....and this place was busy!! they will not fix this problem if people continue to book this place! I stood out side and watched the doorman only take cabs that would had him money!! Only in NY.. you gotta love it

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION / ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: PODGE19
Reviews.Content: The hotel was better than I had expected having read some of the recent reviews. The positives of this hotel for us were - SUPER LOCATION, right on the doorstep of Macys, Empire State Building, Madison Square Garden, clean very comfortable large bed, well-stocked bathroom, iron if needed, fridge in room. Negatives –In need of renovation (but you get what you pay for), very poor lighting in room, breakfast room far too small to accommodate guests so you end up practically sitting on each other’s knees (that’s if you’re lucky enough to get a seat in the first place), no tea/ coffee making facilities in room, corridors/hallways very dimly lit so a bit depressing. Despite the negatives (which are probably me being picky), I would stay here again because although clearly not a 5 star hotel it served the purpose for us e.g. clean bed in a super location. We didn’t go to N.Y. to stay in the hotel room, the hotel really was just a place to lay our heads at the end of a packed day and this was achieved with no problem at all. I've stated a thumbs up and 3 stars, based primarily on the very clean, comfy bed and the super location.

Reviews.Title: “It's not remotely as bad as some of the reviews here”
Reviews.Author: sarahc11
Reviews.Content: We have always stayed at the Pennsylvania when we go to NY. We go to shop and be out and about, so are not looking for 5 star luxury. We stayed in this hotel over halloween and it was perfectly adequate for our needs. I had come on trip advisor 2 nights prior to flying and the reviews were so bad we considered booking another hotel. On further reading it seems some reviews on here may be fake as they are very similar and advertising other hotels. We were a bit worried about what we might find. Yes the checkin is long (I started shopping while my husband queued!) about 45 ins. Our room was on level 14. The public areas are newly carpeted and furnished and smell clean. Our room was spotlessly clean, fully serviced every day and perfect for the price. The staff we met (room service, bell hop, bag storage, door man, reception) were freindly and helpful at all times . The hotel is well located for everything, shopping, a walk to the highline and next to subways for most lines. I have no hesitation in recommending it to anyone. We were very pleasantly surprised after the bad reviews on here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - but badly in need of cleaning and maintenance”
Reviews.Author: rja27360
Reviews.Content: As someone who frequently goes to NY for theater/shopping/fun weekends, I was hoping this hotel would be a good option for a reasonable stay at a reasonable rate. I don't need luxury - just clean. Despite hearing mixed reviews, we tried it. Once. Primarily because they have rooms with two beds, which is convenient when traveling with a friend. We arrived in the morning, and were told we'd have to come back in the afternoon. Expected. But we asked to leave our bags, and were told we had to buy a ticket, and then take our luggage downstairs to leave (tickets are $4/bag). Lobby was nice enough. The guys that staffed the luggage area were friendly and funny and really nice. From there, it went downhill. * We asked about a bathroom, having just traveled in and unable to get into a room. There were bathrooms downstairs near baggage, but they were being painted. Upstairs, a surly guard at the elevators told us 'this is a hotel, not a public restroom', even though we had just checked luggage and he knew we would be checking in. Someone finally sent us up to the third floor to a ballroom, saying it was open for hotel guests because they were painting downstairs. It was locked. We let the desk person know, and she told us we must be wrong! We finally left. When we returned, we checked in, picked up our luggage, and headed to the room. * Hallway carpets and walls were dirty and bare. * Walls in the room were badly deteriorated, carcked, dirty, with holes in the plaster. * Carpet in the room was filthy. * Bathroom had metal door - rusted through at base of door jamb. * Black mold down the wall below the window and behind the baseboard, which was lifting. * The refrigerator in the room did not work. I would have tried a different plug, but the plug cover was broken across the elctrical outlet and I was afriad to touch it with no cover. * The TV in the room did not work. * The front of the shower handle (that adjusted water temperature) was missing. * Tub was yellowed looking on inside. Sink basin was cracked. * Room was warm and stuffy, but couldn't open window for fresh air. Did find a catch on top that allowed window to tilt in - but cut my finger on broken metal at top of window, and there was no way to hold it open part way. So it either had to be closed, or the entire bottom half of the window was open. Dangerous if you had children, and too open - so we stayed with closed. * Two small lamps barely cast any light in the room. * Beds were very hard. I assume sheets were clean, but given the rest of the room, I wasn't sure. * Inside security lock was broken off. Not only couldn't use it, but it was literally broken, and the sharp metal edges were still there, along with the bent metal where it had been broken off at the door. What could even break off a solid metal security lock? No doubt I left out details somewhere - but you get it. It felt like a derelict building. We survived, mostly because we hardly spent time in the room and only spent two nights. But I'll look elsewhere for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Quite possibly the worst hotel I have (and will) ever stay in”
Reviews.Author: DaveR60
Reviews.Content: We arrived as a school party. The foyer looks impessive and vast, but the reception is always a waiting process, no matter what hour of the day and night. The standard of helpfulness of the staff varies from pleasant and effective to impolite bordering on hostile. There are apparently three standards of room, with the web site only showing the top two, corporate and 5000. If you end up with a standard room, beware! Out of 6 rooms allocated to our group, three had to be changed. One had a cockroach running about, mine had a brown oozing damp patch that smelled horrible, a third was a double bedded room when we asked for and were told it was a twin bedded room. Even getting a simple plug ( a stopper they call it in the US) proved beyond them. After the third time of asking, a maintenance man arrived and put the stopper on the key entry slot. To my dismay it was a bath stopper and didn't fit the sink. Internet access is not free, and varies from 2 dollars for 30 minutes to 10 dollars for the day. Given that all of the public buildings we visited AND Times Square have free open wifi access, I find this a bit quaint. The damp foul smelling patch I discovered by mistake and to my horror when trying to open the window and stood in the patch. Upon putting a hotel towel on the patch it immediately stained brown. Upon taking this down to reception and waiting the obligatory 20 minute minimum, I was treated discourteously for daring to have put their towel containing their filth on their counter,. The manager was consulted and to be fair to him, he was actually courteous and professional. My room was changed to a 5000 - even here the main room light didn't work. I would say this is the minimum standard one would expect of even the most modest hotel in the UK. The standard rooms come with cracked and falling off plaster and scuff marks along the wall, old, tired decor as standard. To finish off our stay, I went to sign out and place our luggage in the secure area we had been promised when we arrived. We were told that sometimes these are allocated, sometimes they are not, and in our case it was not. I expressed my dissatisfaction about this and was then given a key to a room for the party to use as a luggage store. I was advised that this was a room that wasn't normally occupied, so my expectations were already low. However, when I opened the door the room contained twin beds, one of which looked like it had just been vacated by its occupant, the bathroom had a towel on the floor and a hole in the ceiling. In the corridor, plaster had been botch repaired and not painted afterwards. I havre photographic evidence of all of the above. In conclusion, if you are looking for a place to stay in New York, I would advise to avoid the Penn like the plague or you just might catch it!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected - give them a break”
Reviews.Author: MartinH68
Reviews.Content: Firstly the hotel is cheap - if you want 5 star, pay for 5 star. The place does need renovating but it's not going to get the opportunity when people pay $100 a night and expect a $500 room. (Macy's needs a bit of renovating - how many complaining there?) We did not queue to check in, check out, leave or collect luggage. (What about those queues at the airport - 2 hours to check-in and pass through security? How many complaining there?) Noise caused by other guests is not the hotel's fault - some people are just selfish and you get that anywhere (we had no problems). The room was a little unclean - it wasn't dirty - it smelled fresh. The bed was fine and clean - only one pillow is our only complaint about the bed. But the sheets were not required because it was so warm - we rolled these up and stuck them under the pillows - no problem. The location is fantastic - right next to Penn Station, couple of blocks from ESB, one block from Macys. Don't eat in Lindys - there are many, many places to get breakfast within 2 mins walk of the hotel. Lindys is expensive and service is crap - for a 1/4 of the price you can get a decent bite to eat in any local deli. Couple of pubs around the corner too - again, decent food, decent price. Alcohol is expensive and watch out for the automatic addition of 18% gratuity on your bill when paying anywhere. We'd stay here again - this was our third time in NY - this hotel compares well to the others (more expensive) ones we stayed in. (Watch out for the comedy club tickets - $10 to get in. Minimum two drinks per person or $15. One bottle of bud is $5 in the bar before the show - $10 from the same bar, brought to your table by the waitress who also adds 18% tip)

Reviews.Title: “never go there!”
Reviews.Author: nammoc
Reviews.Content: It was a terrible experience. We expected a lot from this hotel since it is quite expensive. We found a dirty room, with hairs on the bed and on the floor, the floor was sticky, very little light, broken closet, paint on ceiling and on walls fell in pieces, cracks everywhere, broken framedoors. One day the houskeeper did not clean the room and they let sheets over the bed and we had to do their work. The beds are small and the sheets even more so when you turn you uncover the other person. There was no hair dryer, heating did not work. Is a hotel in which there are many young people and schools groups and at nights you can heard screams, laughter and people running. Finally when we went to complain to all this, the lady at reception was not at all sympathetic or understanding, just the opposite, she told us that why we were explaining all that things to her if she could not do anything! Nothing similar about what appears in the pictures on the web. Neither the rooms nor the service are good. There are better and cheapest hotels around.

Reviews.Title: “5 rooms later and they were all filthy”
Reviews.Author: Sunnyskies25
Reviews.Content: After waiting an hour to check in, we were given our room keys. We arrived on the 14th floor, the lift door opened and the smell of damp hit you. On opening the bedroom door, we noticed the plaster was coming off the walls, the bath had been painted and was still dirty, the bathroom actually looked like workmen had been in and hadn't cleaned up after themselves. We checked other rooms, some of the corridors had steel doors which gave the feel we were in a prison. No hot or cold on the taps - which isn't very good. Our room was the size of a postage stamp and we were told it would be cleaned when we went out, but when we came back at 10pm it still hadn't been cleaned. The asked the head receptionist if we could upgrade, his reply was "why would you want to do that, the rooms are the same", he also said if we didn't like it we could check out? After looking at 5 rooms, we went back to reception and the head receptionist refused to speak to us. Even the bellboy said the hotel is a 2 star going down to 1 and the hotel should be knocked down and rebuilt. The bed and towels were spotless and the location was great - the only positive things we could say about our visit. New York is getting so expensive these days.. This hotel may suit young people who are only looking for a cheap place to sleep!

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is a Dump”
Reviews.Author: j_k_stack
Reviews.Content: Please go somewhere else the rooms are the worse i have ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: TredegarJan
Reviews.Content: After reading the hotel reviews I'd imagined it to be a right slum and was concerned as I booked the holiday for 5 others as well. We had 3 rooms for 4 nights and I will admit they could have done with some renovation but they were clean, the beds were comfortable with crisp, white bedding and fresh towels were provided daily. The showers were the best I've experienced in any hotel. All hotel staff from check in to check out were cheerful, friendly and helpful, the location was excellent - we even had a great view of the Empire State Building from our room. Breakfast in Lindy's at the front of the foyer was great, as was the cheesecake. For the price I don't know what people expect. It's not 5 star luxury but it's more than acceptable. When you go to New York how much time do you want to spend in your room anyway?

Reviews.Title: “It's not that bad”
Reviews.Author: shellyn67
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 4-day stay at this hotel, and I really don't get what people are saying. The hotel is in a great location, everyone was very friendly, and--I don't know about everyone else here--but I booked the room because it was much less expensive than other ones I checked. Yes, the furniture is old and I'll even agree that it could be a lot cleaner. But I did not see any bugs, my room was adequately serviced daily, and I love the fact that they have plenty of people to expedite check in and check out. It was fine. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the reviews - and stay away”
Reviews.Author: Aussieabroad007_007
Reviews.Content: I am not that fussy. Dirty, NO INTERNET, and a constant knock in the wall forced me to wear ear plugs to get to sleep. Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Go There......just dont”
Reviews.Author: Annette091
Reviews.Content: We now Regret that we ignored trip advisor and others. We foolishly expected the place would be basic but clean, given the central location. Dont be fooled by the foyer either. We stepped out of the elevator to dirty worn carpets, paint peeling walls and a manky stale smell led us to a rusty metal door that opened into our room. The over head lights were very dull and our first impresion was ‘this cant be happening’. The room stank of mould, the furniture was broken, a thick layer of dust ran along the skirting boards embedded in the carpet. The ceiling in the bathroom was encrusted with mould and the breaking point for us were the cockroaches walking up along the shower curtain and out under the room door – they werent sticking around and neither were we. If the room was bad, the Managers attitude towards us was appalling. He pretended not to see us at first (as if he knew already) shrugged his shoulders with indifference and told us there was no guarantee that moving to another room would be any better, or cockroach free and there were plenty other hotels in the city.We Fled from this hotel, traumatised. Our trip would have been a complete disaster had it not been for the Affinia Hotel (2 blocks away in location, 2million light years away in terms of excellence). The friendly receptionist welcomed us and apologised for the other hotel – she told us that we were not the first to be rescued. I wont be returning to New York. Shame on the Management of this building – it is NOT a hotel, it is a hovel.

Reviews.Title: “Huge, soviet style hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Clk1969
Reviews.Content: The Penn hotel was booked for us by a production company in England. First impressions : The scale of this hotel is awesome, seemed almost more soviet than American. Except a commie hotel wouldn't have been so clean, efficient and had such powerful hot showers. Breakfast is a bit of a bunfight in a communal room on your floor, the TV in the elevator is a bore, it's a little impersonal as it's so big, and I wasn't a big fan of the midtown location, finding myself more at home in Greenwich village, several blocks to the south. But it does the job well enough, friendly bellhops and doormen were helpful, and the shops on the ground floor are as good for souvenirs as anything you'll find in the rather dull neighborhood. I liked it, but if you want something boutique or bijou, the Mighty Penn is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Latania08
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at this hotel enroute to Florida. Check in took a long time. It was really busy with a large queue formed in the spacious foyer. We arrived at 10 pm after a long flight. Got room key and staff were friendly. Got lift to room and upon lift door opening was faced with grubby carpet and smoky smell. Walked along numerous large corridors with no natural light and only dim lights to see. The carpet had rips, the paint was flaking off walks, it was horrible. We got to the room, it was light a dark dungeon but really large. The smell was off mould and the bathroom had seen better days. My son has asthma so we werent for staying with the smell as it would affect his chest. Went to reception and again was made line up after speaking about my complaint. Given another room and on checking it out it was no better, there were cigarette stubbs in an ashtray and the bed wasn't made. Again to reception and management give us another room. The smell was much better, but a very small and cramped room. By this time we were tired and accepted the room which had been paid for before arrival as it was a special offer (no wonder). If we had have arrived earlier in day I would have looked for another hotel. I can't say anything good about this hotel except its location. It reminded me of the film 'The Shining'.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: RalphScheider
Reviews.Content: Horrible, horrible room. Totally run down. Disgusting carpets, old paintwork. Even the enamel in the bath was worn off. Very expensive for what it was. Extremely noisy - can hear the busy road, sirens all night long. Hated the location too. Please don't stay at this hotel. You will just regret it.

Reviews.Title: “disgusting, disgusting, disgusting”
Reviews.Author: reilly1888
Reviews.Content: i actually had booked this fleapit back in april 2005 when myself and my partner thought we would treat ourselves and bookd through thomas cook so stupidly thought we would be okay, how wrong was i. our first time in the usa and first impression were excellent, looked great from outside, great location across from maddison sq gardens and even the foyer was quite nice although i have had better service in macdonalds than we got from the receptionist. here goes.....got out of the lift on the 5th floor and seriously thought we had entered the world of twighlight zone, hallway was dark, dingy, dirty and smelt awful, the walls and doors were dark brown and covered in stains, my heart sank. opned the door to an even worse smell and inside we noticed stains on the bedsheets, walls, carpet and skirting boards, the windows were so dirty you couldnt see outside, looked inside the so called bathroom to see hairs lying in the shower tray and the room covered head to toe in mould. broken curtain rail with dirty curtains and inches of dust all over the furniture. needless to say we left the room and were eventually shown two other rooms on different floors that were just as bad, in the second room there was dampness all over the walls and mould in the fridge, it was awful. we left and booked into the nearby redroom inn that was gorgeous. i used my credit card just so that we could stay somewhere clean. i would not have taken my shoes off in this hotel never mind stay overnight, i would not stay in this glorified hostel if it was free, this place should be condemned, shame on the travel agents that are still taking bookings for this doss house. this place should be condemned. please please dont waste your money on this awful place. we actually took photos of the rooms that i will upload soon

Reviews.Title: “Low Standards”
Reviews.Author: dnlthibault
Reviews.Content: Either New Yorkers have lowered their standards or the old saying "you get what you paid for" is no longer true. But at $300.00 per night you would expect a clean & well groomed room. The bed was clean and neat, but the carpeting was dirty, torn and worn. The window did not shut tight and all the street noise could be heard all night long. Even after requesting a repair is was not fixed correctly. The ceiling paint is peeling and large flakes hang over the tub/shower. The walls are all marked and could use a coat of paint. We made a reservation over a month in advanced, yet when we registered they had trouble getting us the room we requested. The hotel is very centrally located near Penn Station, Madison Square Garden & the Empire State Building.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel from Hell”
Reviews.Author: LucyAnnaHastings
Reviews.Content: Words cannot begin to describe how horrible this hotel was, do not be fooled by the location or the foyer it may look nice but trust me the rooms are a whole lot different. Firstly walking down the corridor to the room was like something out of a Horror Film, paint peeling off the walls, stains on the carpet, both electrical boxes on our floor were open and easily accessible to children. Then there were the rooms themselves, we were so horrified when we walked in the first room we couldn't believe we had paid so much money for it, there was mold all over the roof of the bathroom, cracks in the ceiling, it looked as if it hadn't been cleaned properly in years. There was also this small room inside the room itself that had nothing in it but a flickering light and could only be locked from the outside, it was like a cell. Worst of all was the response we received from the front desk, as if they new we would be back to complain, all the did was find us another room that would sleep 4 adults didn't check the quality or anything, we ended up seeing 2 other rooms which were exactly the same. Needless to say we did not stay more then a couple of hours.

Reviews.Title: “Dated I can live with-- dirty I can't.”
Reviews.Author: farleygoode
Reviews.Content: 2" dust to carpet edges. Skirtings dirty--we washed them. Bed thick muck beneath. No wonder we got bitten by the little friends. Why the hell spoil such a potentially great place for just a bit of cleaner supervision.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location would definatly go back”
Reviews.Author: phillipa_chester
Reviews.Content: I went to New York in February and it was bloody freezing!!! Thankfully the heating worked very well so it kept our cockles warm. Location for this hotel is amazing, Penn station, Macys and Maddison Square Garden on the doorstep and express train to wall street (4min if that) biggest Victoria Secret in New York 1 block behind the hotel (could spend all day in there). You can see Times Square from the front door and the Empire State Building is only about 2 blocks behind the hotel. Staff were amazing couldnt fault any of them. Although the hotel is very dated it is clean and beds are very comfortable. Couldnt fault this hotel in any way and would stay there tomorrow if I could. DO NOT BE PUT OFF WITH THE REVIEWS..... IF YOUR STAYING AT THIS HOTEL AS A CITY BREAK ITS PERFECT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for a cheap price”
Reviews.Author: NYCfanatic01
Reviews.Content: We arrived earlier than expected and didn't think we would be allowed early check in. Not the case. We were met by smiling faces and given our room key. The lobby is lovely, and as we were there for the Thanksgiving Day parade, it was all "decked out" with decorations and a lovely tree. The room was a little cramped, but since we had no intentions of "hanging out" in our room, it suited us just fine. I love history, and if you google the history of this hotel, it is amazing. Remember your monopoly board with the Pennsylvania railroad? We wandered up to the top floor, but didn't have access to the "balcony area". The location is amazing (right across from Madison Square Gardens) and there was a little Tim Hortons coffee stop just outside the lobby door. We would LOVE to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “A Clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Griegos
Reviews.Content: It is a clean hotel with helpful staff.It doesn't have modern or new rooms but it is the cheapest one (170€/day) . You can stay at this hotel either you are alone or with family. Also its location is excellent. If you travel in Europe this is not like the hotels that you have used to , it is a 2star hotel, with dirty carpet,old bathrooms but is is clean and in central location. We have stayed twice, the second time in Penn 2000 room it is a really better room , like the photos.For sure i will recommend it to you.

Reviews.Title: “Ugghh..”
Reviews.Author: vikkijg
Reviews.Content: Large hotel in a great location. Cheap compared to others, easy walk to Times Square. But... a realy bad feel in the hotel corridors and rooms. The rooms felt dirty and unclean and OLD. If you just want location with absolutely no frills, then go ahead.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Julia1945
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was friendly and the room was clean but we were in a room near the lifts and all night we could hear the lifts creaking and groaning.. Would stop there again if we were guaranteed a room away from the lifts

Reviews.Title: “Great location/1 BLOCK FROM SUBWAY/CLOSE TO TIME SQUARE!!”
Reviews.Author: novarose64
Reviews.Content: Hotel that I would recommend for someone looking for a central place to attractions but not loooking for 4star accomodations/ Rooms clean/no AC not too much a problem as we went in fall. We could go out and quickly return to room to recharge. Had a super time. Would recommend hotel if looking for clean place to lay ahead but if you stay in room alot-not probably your choice. I would stay next time in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Select this hotel if there are no other hotels”
Reviews.Author: digaUsa
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 11am at the desk and the African lady at the desk said we cannot check in at this time and to come after 3pm and if we need to keep the bags they will charge US$4.- per bag. So we went out with all our bags and came again at 4pm. This time the cleark was so good she said sorry for the morning incident. The room was cold and the heater was not working. Shower tap cannot close properly.(need a hammer to close it) There were two bags of garbage near my door and it was still there when I got up in the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Location GOOD, everything else... meh.”
Reviews.Author: Cricket975
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Pennsylvania for two nights in October of 2010 while on a business trip to Manhattan. I thought that the reasonable rate(for NYC), the centralized location, and the history of the hotel would make it an interesting place to stay. Check in took forever, due to the long queue of visitors also waiting to get into their rooms. It was like waiting in line at JFK airport to check your baggage! Finally we got up to our room (1240) and one of our key cards did not work. Fortunately, the other one DID, and we dragged our bags and our travel-weary bodies into the room. It was really small. The king-sized bed took up most of the space. The view from the window overlooked an alley. Our room was non-smoking, but my ex-smoker hubby's observant shnozz detected a smoky odor. TV was small, but worked. Same for the bathroom and everything in it. The closet contained an ironing board, but we had to call downstairs for an iron. Also, there were only two lackluster pillows on the bed, so I requested two more. These items were delivered to our room within ten minutes by a polite hotel assistant. Wi-fi is not free in the rooms. It's available for a "nominal fee" in the downstairs business center. (I didn't ask how much.) The business center is about the size of a small office and always seemed to be occupied. Wi-fi also is available in the always-busy lobby area, but I would recommend finding a Starbucks or going across the street to Border's. Maybe I've been spoiled, but I've come to expect internet for free at a hotel, if I'm paying to sleep there. Pros: Fabulous location, fast elevators, nice little shops within the building, good night's rest, housekeeping did a good job of making the bed and cleaning our bathroom. Cons: There was dust on the carpet under the desk. Saw a couple of empty plastic cups under the bed. And then there's that pesky internet charge. Other thoughts... There's a cafe and the famous Lindy's restaurant in the Hotel Penn, but I recommend getting out there to explore the area. See more, spend less, y'know? Also, there is SO much rich history in the Hotel Penn's past, as you will read in the booklet in every room. I think they could really play it up more... Have pics of the stars who played & stayed there in its heyday, maybe play some vintage video footage throughout the lobby, perhaps even have a little museum room inside the hotel. I think that if you don't read the booklet and learn all those little factoids, you'd just assume that the Hotel Penn is letting itself just fade away. Other than the modern, eye-catching lobby, the place looks and feels old. We probably would stay here again only if in a pinch. Recommending it because of location and cheapness only.

Reviews.Title: “no problems at all with the Penn”
Reviews.Author: nomad2309
Reviews.Content: After being let down with my first hotel due to a travel company going bankcrupt, i then booked 3 nights at the pennsylvania hotel after stopping there in 2004 Arrived 30 sept, plane late so arrived at the hotel at 20:00 hrs. No one in line to check in so walked straight to the desk, was checked in approx 5 mins and given a twin room on the 4th floor. After reading some of the comments on here i was a bit nervous as to what i would find .... The room was clean and tidy. two big beds and a good size tv.... the only negative comment would be that in the bathroom the paint was peeling off the walls and ceiling ... but heh.. not a problem to me ... staff there were friendly and opened a safe deposit box in less then 10 mins ... again no problems... At the end of the day this is a tourist hotel .. if youre expecting first class servive -go the Plaza .. its cheap(ish) and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “It was fine, good location.”
Reviews.Author: bernieb77
Reviews.Content: I read so many bad reviews before we stayed here we were seriously worried about what we might find!! We only stayed here because it was the only hotel in our price range that was available for the duration of our stay. Check in was not a good start, there was a huge queue and it took about 45 minutes - hour to check in. Every time we passed reception during our stay it was always the same, huge queues all the time. Once checked in we didn't need to use reception again so it wasn't a problem. The room was fine, nothing special but clean enough. The bathroom wasn't great but the shower was powerful and always hot. The bed was comfortable and sheets and towels were changed daily. For the amount of time we spent in the room/ hotel it wouldn't of made sense to stay anywhere more expensive. The hotel definatley needs a make over but considering how busy it is in the condition its in i can't see the owners spending millions to overhaul the rooms. The location is excellent and there's a great cafe in the foyer for breakfast. We didn't experience many problems with noise but i'm not sure we had anyone next to us for more than one night, we could here voices but when they're in another language it doesn't bother you so much! To sum it up stay here if you're on a budget, don't expect too much from the hotel New York itself will make up for it!!

Reviews.Title: “Any port in a storm”
Reviews.Author: LadyAmanita
Reviews.Content: I actually ended up at this hotel as something of a surprise- my flight home at the end of my trip to NYC was cancelled due to weather, and I had to scramble to find a place for the night. Super 8 right near the airport? Ugh, no! Sheraton for $300 a night in Brooklyn? Ouch! Just on a hunch, I asked the gentleman at the airport who was helping with hotel bookings if he could get me something cheaper in Manhattan. Hotel Pennsylvania, $139 a night. Okay, let's do that! So I booked that over the phone, and got the first cab back into the city. Gotta love the location- right in midtown, across from Penn Station, One Penn Plaza (one of my fave modern skyscrapers!), and close to the Empire State Building and Madison Square Garden. Niiice. No need to worry about finding food or being bored while I waited till the next day to fly out. My room was on the 12th floor, which is their premiere accomadations. They didn't tell me this at check-in, it was something I figured out for myself eventually. Aside from the bright and busy lobby, this hotel exudes an aura of faded glory. It must have been something else when rail travel was in its heyday, but now it really needs a facelift. I found my room was kinda dark, even with the lamps on. And the bathroom fixtures are in serious need of an update- they just looked dingy. The only place you could get wi-fi was in the lobby ($2 for a half hour) , other than that you had to pay for it in the business center, pay $10 per 24 hours if you had a club room, or wait to use one of the computers in the 12th floor lounge. After being spoiled by the free wi-fi at my previous hotel, this was a let-down. Ugh. The next day I had a few hours to kill before I had to head to the airport, so I decided to take a walk up 5th avenue. However, I was not going to haul a suitcase and two carry-ons all that distance. Unlike other places I have been to, this one charges to hold bags, even only for a few hours. Bleh. I got a distinct nickel-and-dime approach from this place, which was absent at my previous hotel. I'm not going to say that the place totally sucks. But I'm not going to rave, either. With a facelift and a few more free amenities thrown in, this place could be pretty cool. But as it is, it's nothing stellar.

Reviews.Title: “The "subway" is cleaner than this flea bag!!!”
Reviews.Author: brunetteshair
Reviews.Content: I absolutely HATED this hotel! It was a long wait to check in and when I did get to my floor it was HORRIBLE. I Absolutely hated it. It was like the elevator doors opened to the projects. The paint was chipping away, the wallpaper was hanging off the wall, the hallway was dark and dingy. I swore I was gonna get mugged! There was bleach stains on the carpets. But it gets better when I enter my room. The room was entirely outdated and grossly filthy. The bed had a sink hole in the middle and the bedding was soiled. After moving from room to room we settled in a room where we had to buy socks to walk around. Luckily we ran into a cleaning lady where she gave us practically all her clean linen off her cart. We made runners out of the towels to walk on. We made sleeping bags out of the sheets she gave us and slept on top of the made up bed linens. We lined the shower floors with the extra bath towels. And we used bottled water to brush our teeth. To sum it up ...... this place is Nasty and disgusting! And the staff actually has the nerve to have an attitude as if we were in a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “WORST hotel stay of my life”
Reviews.Author: girllovesworld
Reviews.Content: From the first impression to the last, Hotel Pennsylvania was horrible. The doors entering the hotel were greasy & smeared with dirt, plus the lobby was dark and filthy. The first "customer service rep" I spoke with was rude and just dismissed me by calling the next customer up, while I was in midsentence! I would have left and found another hotel but my friend had prepaid for the room so we stuck it out. We got up to our room and it only got worse. The room was actually a bit larger than other rooms I have seen in NYC, but that didn't make up for the fact that it was disgusting. I didn't want to shower or walk around barefoot, and setting things on top of the bed cover made me shudder. The carpet was dirty, there were hairs in the bathroom (on the floor, sink and even found one on a towel) and the bed linens looked dingy. Plus the entire room was old, outdated and ugly. The room was too hot & stuffy, but we couldn't control the air conditioning, or even open the windows because were no screens on them! Also, the bed was worse than sleeping on the floor. It was like sleeping on a cardboard piece with a thin blanket. AWFUL!!! The ONLY thing this hotel has going for it is the location. It's right across the street from Madison Square Garden, so if you just need a place to stay near there and don't care one bit about the state of the hotel, go for it... But still, there are plenty of other options within a few blocks that must be better than this!! The next night I stayed at a different hotel that was $195 per night for a queen room that was perfectly lovely (check it out - Hotel New Yorker)... MUCH better than $220 per night for the one double bed in a gross room at Hotel Pennsylvania.

Reviews.Title: “The WORST Hotel I've stayed in...EVER!”
Reviews.Author: StarSync
Reviews.Content: I'm always trying different Hotels in NYC and have never had to write a review like the following... I stayed here with some colleagues on the weekend of Oct 1st. We had 3 rooms. Let me start by giving you a fair Warning...Stay somewhere else!! This is THE WORST Hotel I've stayed in...EVER! The service is non-existant. I honestly believe everyone that works here Does Not Care. The Rooms were a mess at check in (and I mean a MESS) and no one wanted to do a thing about it. The hallways are dim and dingy. The rooms felt like the projects and I Know Projects! This is a Glorified Housing Project. The Lobby fools you with the dozen Flat Screen TVs and Lounge but the adventure starts in their dirty elevators and continues through the "Shining-like" hallways. Even the coffin-shaped doors to the rooms are filthy and painted a depressing olive green and white over non-sanded patches. The rooms have MOLD, are horrendously out-dated, the linen is unapproachable and the rugs are musty. The staff is arrogant and cold. There is no upkeep in this hotel. The Board of Health should be notified. The only thing that the Hotel has going for it is the location. It's directly across the street from Madison Square Garden and Macy's and is in close proximity to the Empire State Bldg and Times Square. But heed my Warning... STAY Elsewhere!!! This could possibly be The Source of the Bed Bug Epidemic! Pay the extra 50 to stay Anywhere Else it'll be worth your peace of mind and a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!!! Sleep in your Car!!!!”
Reviews.Author: boston978
Reviews.Content: This was the worst Hotel I have ever stayed in. It should be a Motel not a Hotel. Rooms are disgusting, theres mold in the rooms, smells bad, towels were yellowish, staff and manager (Jonathan) were horrible. I should of beleived the reviews. NEVER, EVER, AGAIN!!!! The Board of Heath should shut them down!!!

Reviews.Title: “old hotel really needs to renovate”
Reviews.Author: earthhaven
Reviews.Content: Not worth your money. Really long lines just to check-in, fortunately we were given a room immediately after check-in, others still had to wait for theirs. Thanks to the Fil-Am lady at the counter. Our hotel room looks & smells old. The bed was a little too small for both of us and we're just average built..

Reviews.Title: “PLEASANTLY SURPRISED!”
Reviews.Author: KarenM1969
Reviews.Content: I booked this trip, for myself andmy husband, back in March and since that time had been reading the reviews on this site with dread! On arrival at the Hotel Pennsylvania the lobby was huge, with lots of people around. There was a queue to check in, but we were sorted within 15 minutes. We had booked a Club Penn 5000 room on the 12th floor and as I opened the door to our room I actually said, "here goes!". The room was not huge, but was big enough. The furniture was a bit old, but in keeping with a very old hotel. The bed was ENORMOUS and really comfortable, we had a great sleep every night. We had a flat screen TV, clock radio andi-pod dock. The room was very clean, sheets were changed daily. Air con worked fine. The bathroom was small and the fittings old, but it was very clean. Fluffy towels again were changed daily. Nice array of freebie toiletries and the shower worked great, lovely and hot. The Club Penn 5000 rooms also give you access to the Club 5000 lounge on the 12th floor. Not really a lounge, this is just a room, but it provided us with a continental breakfast every morning, and free tea and coffee 24 hours a day. There was a TV in there and we also had free internet access in this room too. This is NOT a luxury hotel by any means but I didnt pay luxury money. The location is great. Righte next door to Macy's and 5 mins from Broadway, the Empire State Building and not much further to lots of other places of interest. We bought a 3-day pass for the CitySightsNY tour and would recommend this. I would definitely stay in this hotel if travelling to New York again.

Reviews.Title: “Central located, rude perssonel and dirty place”
Reviews.Author: Guhy087
Reviews.Content: This New York hotel is the most disgusting, time waster experience. If you want to spend over 60 min. wating to get checked in, sleep on a bed that does not give any confort of clean and you like unsannitary smells this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “it all depends what room you end up in.......”
Reviews.Author: Glumbug
Reviews.Content: This hotel has some notorious reviews, new yorkers will tell you not to touch it with a barge pole and if you look at some of the pictures you might very well be put off quite easily. I have stayed in this hotel on four occasions now over the ten years I've been visiting NY and I'd say it all depends on what room or I should say floor you end up in. Before my first visit I read that the hotel had had some kind or form of renovations going on, so before I travelled I emailed them and requested a 'renovated' floor, it was a simple as that. The room was standard but clean, my requests for extra pillows and blankets where dealt with quite easily and I found my walk in wardrobe housed plenty of space to store all my purchases and clothing without falling all over my belongings as I have in other hotels (The Edison for example). On my second visit, I flew in with my family just before Thanksgiving from the UK, the first room they offered was fine but the second family room was in a word unsuitable, stained carpet, leaky tap, industrial sounding air conditioning and peeling walls, off I went to the reception and told them point blankly there was no way I would be staying in that room and I wished to be moved, following 3 moves we found another perfect room. I found this a repeated pattern on our other visits, although not so many moves still I refused to settle into a room until I was happy with it. I know some might see this as too much effort to undertake but because of the holidays getting a good deal on rooms is always difficult so I'm willing to just put up with the chance of some manoeuvring. Its true that the hotel is no palace but I've paid for deluxe rooms in the past with plasma televisions and mini bars only to find that I only used the room to hit the pillow while spending as much time out in the big apple so what is the point, I'd rather use the money to treat myself to a new bag or even one of the fantastic to dining experiences that New York offers. The location is amazing, PENN station on your doorstep, in and out for a NY Knicks game and of course a cut through Old Navy to find yourself in Macy's or one of the larger Victoria Secret stores in Herald square so if your willing to use your well earned money else where then a luxury end hotel then this is the perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “livable but will not stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: lkeh1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is NOTHING fancy. It was clean but I wouldn't call it spotless. Old matress and less than desireable furnishings. Outlet in bathroom did not work, nor did 2 our of 3 lights in the room itself. My husband booked this hotel. He was going on business and trying to find something cheap. I later decided to tag along so I couldn't complain too much. the lines for check in were terribly long everytime we walked through the lobby. The hotel is in a good location with multiple subways within the block. Seem as though lots of international travelers stay here, but that may be anywhere in NYC. Next time I will book the hotel and NOT book this one. If you have already booked don't be too scared. It is livable but would not be my top choice.

Reviews.Title: “Please find yourself another Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: robin28083
Reviews.Content: As soon as i stepped in this room i was in shock. I was on the phone calling my travel agent.The first thing that hit me was "This cost us almost 400$ a night"Really??The room was so small with two twin "slabs of concrete" as i like to call them with matching rock hard pillows, Dirty dingy sheets.A desk and two kitchen like chairs.The bathroom was very small and very nasty and OMG the view outside the window well it was like something out of CSI New York where at any minute i expected to see a body lying there..The door made me think of a vault or maybe even a coffin lid!!
