Internet access in the lobby but you have to pay for it.Staff rude and very UNhelpfull.My back and shoulder are still killing me as a result of sleeping on the concerte slab. Added to all this i was on the lookout for bedbugs instead i had ANTS in my bed yep thats right ANTS.Never would i stay here again or recomend it to anyone..Very Disapointed.And at 400$ a night kinda makes me sick to my stomach.Way to over priced... Please go find yourself another place to stay...Robin Stokes.. North Carolina

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it. Even if you have an early train, stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: welly10187
Reviews.Content: Stayed here purely to avoid the morning rush hour traffic to Penn Station. Flew in to JFK from Australia via LA. 20+ hrs travelling and arrive to a 2hr wait to check in. Was after 8pm by the time we were checked in, and leaving at 6am to get a 7am train to Washington DC. seriously wished we'd waited 3hrs at the airport for the connecting flight, had seemed tedious when planning the trip but compared with the reality of Hotel Penn. First room was supposedly on non-smoking floor (per booking request) but seriously stank of smoke, as did the whole floor leading to room. Door wouldn't open intitially as lock was jammed, then once open would not lock due to jammed lock issue. Tap in bathroom not just dripping, running and could not be turned off, noisy air con, filthy carpets, curtains, windows and bed linens, blown lightbulbs in lamps and overall disgusting. When I called to complain (first time I've ever complained about a room) was told I'd have to go back to reception and ask for another room, told us to take our luggage and key back with us. Should have just left but was too tired to deal with finding another hotel so lugged the bags etc down and had to wait nearly 25 mins for the woman who originally checked me to finish with her current "guest" and help me out. She was extremely rude when asked for another room due to issues with the first room. Eventually gave us another room. Better but still pretty revolting, noisy and filthy carpets, drapes etc. If you do bother to stay make sure it's a really cheap rate, if you have to pay regular hotel rates you should stay in a real hotel. Our hotel on return to NY was $10 a night cheaper, about 100 times nicer and great location.

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL RWANDA”
Reviews.Author: kat787
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the terrible reviews of this hotel I decided to give it a chance and stay, I am not a snob and pretty much just needed a clean bed and clean bathroom. Upon check in I was greeted by a very annoyed rep @ the reception area, he did not want to be bothered with me and made me feel like I was bothering him ARGHHHH!! I tried to keep a positive attitude and dismissed his behavior (he probably had a bad day not my fault, but ohh well) I was given a room on the 3rd floor and let me just say this room was the WORST, and when I say WORST I mean the worst room I have seen in my life. I was too disturbed to even put my bags down (I seriously felt like I was in a 3rd world country) UNREAL. I immediately returned to the front desk and they did switch me to a WAAYYYYY better room on the 12th floor, my ?? was ok, so if you have this waaayyy better room (like a 2.5/3 star compared to a -10 of the 1st room) WHY would they give me one of the WORST rooms in the hotel and allow me to have this HORRIBLE first impression, not to mention when we arrived at our room on the 12th floor there was a guest who asked us if she could see my room because hers was horrible. My suggestion to anyone thinking of staying here is DON’T. The location is NOT worth the aggravation and did I mention the CUSTOMER SERVICE SUCKS!!!

Reviews.Title: “A throwback to the New York of the 80's - and that's NOT a compliment.”
Reviews.Author: amwallace8
Reviews.Content: Poor service - 30 minute check-in when there were only 6 people in the line. It was like the staff were stoned: anything that distracted them from the task in hand (checking people in), did. Grubby, shabby, poorly maintained room - peeling paint, dirty air conditioning unit (legionnaire's disease anyone?), carpets and bed linen all in need of a good clean Fitness centre - half the machines were out of service, there was no water fountain, adjacent rooms into which guests could wander were empty, or othewise had one or two broken chairs hanging about. And this was after I found it - top floor, end of corridor, another two flights of back stairs....don't take a wrong turn and go onto the roof by mistake! Price - unbelievable, for the service and quality. Really, unblievable. Safety - I'm a woman travelling by myself for work. Early hours of one morning around 3.30am, security guards were trying to get into the room next door, on and off for about an hour. On leaving my room at about 7.30am, there was a man, slumped aggainst the door in the hallway! I did not feel safe. The whole place stank - literally and metaphorically.

Reviews.Title: “not all bad”
Reviews.Author: meedee
Reviews.Content: Have just come back from a week's holiday in NY and stayed at this hotel.Booked it because son and girlfriend couldnt afford the hotel in upper Manhattan we stayed in last time.Yes, the hotel rooms are old fashioned and basic, and my sons room had peeling walls,but the bedding and towels were clean.The hairdryer in our room didnt work, but when we phoned the desk, one was delivered in minutes! We were lucky with the queue when we checked in (late afternoon) but we did notice that the queue at the desk always seemed to be a long one.The point is....we were in walking distance to most of the tourist locations and opposite Penn Street station for subway journeys to further afield! You get what you pay for...and this hotel is cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Not half as bad as expected”
Reviews.Author: world_here_i_come
Reviews.Content: Hi all I stayed in the hotel pann from 5th-8th september, and despite some of the reviews on here, I found it to be a brilliant stay! Got to the hotel at about 2:30pm, and checked in within 5 mins. Reception very helpful. Out of the elevator on floor 13, and yes, it was a bit like the shining, but quite frankly we wernt there to stay in the corridor. Also, the hotel date back to before titanic sunk, so what are you expecting? Into our room (1399) and it was large, spacious, clean and none of this mould/peeling paint. Bathroom was modernised, amazing powerful shower, huuuuge bed and tv/fridge/air con (did not use as happy to sleep with window open, soak in that nyc atmosphere). The furniture was slightly dated but we didnt mind that, as long as it was clean. The view was equally amazing, had a close up view of the empire state one side, macys on the other, what more could I ask for? For the money we paid, we were very very very impressed, you pay for 2 star so expect 2 star, but our room felt more like 3 star to be honest (Ive seen much worst 3 stars durning my holiday repping days)

Reviews.Title: “simple but satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: MAHA17
Reviews.Content: When arriving at the Hotel of course everybody of our group thougth: "Amazing Lobby - but horrible rooms". In fact the rooms have no comfort at all - you had a bed to sleep, a bathroom and furnishings and equipment from the last century. However, keep in mind you are in the center of the city, right next to the Empire State Building and Madison Square Garden and everyone can effort it. You have a place to stay and who really wants to stay in the hotel when visiting NY?

Reviews.Title: “do not stay here sleep in the gutter”
Reviews.Author: Paula01
Reviews.Content: my daughter and i stayed here from the 8th sept to the 12th lets say check in should have warned me (natasha) the check in clerk was rude, dissagreeable, no manners or customer service. well where do i start we walked into the room it was DISGUSTING there was paint peeling from the walls the aircon looked so prehistoric it sounded like a mack truck in the room black mould over the airvents, dusty smelling the skirting boards looked like they had never ever beenjcleaned dust all over the window sill,plaster falling off the walls. dust and i mean lots of it on the lamps and tv and cabinet.. now for the good part the bathroom its was so old and dirty the toilet was an old fashioned pottery one with the squarish base well it had pubic hair, dust and wee still on the bottom from many previous guests, there was mould in the shower the tap would not turn of properley so it dripped and the water would not drain away so you stood in about a foot of water everytime you showered, as i was busting to use the bathroom i did not register to we would not be able to change rooms when we went back down to complain yes natasha again we were told we couldnt i told her it WAS DISGUSTING BEYOUND WORDS.. it was only the location that did any thing to this place right opp madison square gardens and 5 to 10 walk to times square.. do not stay here pay more and go elsewhere this place i would not let my dog stay in..

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel in NY”
Reviews.Author: kikabelle
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms in this Hotel for two couples friend of mine. My gosh....... how embarrassed I was to check them in this dump! THIS IS THE FILTHIEST HOTEL THERE IS! Everything was horrible : even the door was dirty with gooey stuff! forget about the old, falling apart bathroom with mildew and hair all over the 100 + years old bath tub. Carpet of at least 2 decades ago was not only badly damaged but also the putrid odor made everyone nauseated. To make matter worst right on check in the guests were yelled at for not speaking perfect English (and this is a "Tourist Hotel"). I can't beg you enough not to come near to this hotel! you will regret! there are many choices around this big City, so avoid the disappointment and waist of money!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: Sunny_SJ
Reviews.Content: We came to NYC during the unfortunate week of 9/13/10 "fashion week" and had trouble finding lodgings at the discount but clean and basic hotels type (the Pod hotel, for example). And so I booked 3 nights at the Pennsylvania at an exhorbitant price even after reading all the horrible reviews on tripadvisors... The Pennsylvania hotel turn out to be every bit as horrible as what the reviews said if not more.... The dust and musty smell were so bad that my allergy kicked in the first night (scratchy, swollen throat and drippy nose!!) . A lot of people said that the condition of the hotel does not matter because you are out and about all day and will only need a place to sleep. True, but in this case the place was so bad that you are afraid to go back to your room! So I have to say : DO NOT BE TEMPTED TO STAY in this hotel because of the location or because of the price.... It is a filthy place. PERIOD. If you cannot find other lodging option, consider delay your trip or even consider staying outside Manhattan. The subway system can take you anywhere. Skip this hotel or you'll be sorry....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location.....”
Reviews.Author: PrincessSambuca
Reviews.Content: Here are the basics: - Clean sheets everyday - Clean soft towels everyday - The bed was soooo comfortable, fantastic nights sleep. Queen size too! - Room size perfect - Good views from the room - Great location - near everything! - I wouldn't recommend eating at the hotel or buying anything at all as it is sooooo expensive and you can get the same things round the corner for half the price or even less! 200 yards from the hotel are a few cafes etc... which are alot cheaper and the quality of the food is better too. - The queues the check in can be quite long. Overal we had a great time :)

Reviews.Title: “cesspit of nyc”
Reviews.Author: scotfalconer
Reviews.Content: i booked two roms for my wife and family we checked in to room on 8th floor on Monday 6th september,went to reception immediately to tell them that no way anyone could live in that room,paint plaster was falling of walls ,mould grown on walls also,carpet was a discgrace and bathroom was a health hazard , guy at reception gave us another room on 11th floor which had been "modernised" we went to 14th floor and opened room door to find the room exact same as room on 8th floor it was appalling,we knew it was a two star but realistically the two rooms we saw were barely one star.We returned to reception and asked for an upgrade and we were told we could be upgraded to Penn 5000 for an extra 25 u.s dollars per night per room we opted for this as a last resort,the Penn 5000 lounge gave us free24 hour internet access,breakfast,we went to room 1129 and to be honest it was lucky to be a two star,it had the same peeling paint,only difference was a flat screen tv,larger fridge and a connection for ipod that never worked,we reluctantly unpacked and went ight seeing,when we came back to room there was a massive cockroach in bathroom crawling on our toothbrushes and toilietries,couldnt sleep for the 1960's air con unit as it was so noisy,went to penn 5000 lounge next morning for breakfast and it was a medium size room with a couple trays of pastrys,an urn full of orange juice,no tea bags,two broken coffee machines and no staff member for assistance,despite requests for tea bags nothing was ever done,when i checked out on Monday 13th Sept 2010 i got a bill in excess of 400 US dollars for upgrade for both rooms,i argued the point with them but they were nothing but an arrogant bunch and were only interested in your cash and couldnt care about your stay.please please do not book a stay at this hotel stay well clear if Manhattan had an a***hole this would surely be it.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Awful Awful AWFUL!!!”
Reviews.Author: MEEEEEEEEEEE71
Reviews.Content: Huge hotel, huge lobby, darkly lit corridors reminiscent of an Eastern Europe prison for dissidents, tiny bedroom with very poorly maintained bathroom. Bath water is green and I am convinced I have seen bed bugs in the linen. Shower doesn't work. TV is from the 60s along with the decor. Probably an impressive hotel when the Red Indians were overthrown.... AVOID!

Reviews.Title: “The filthiest hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: SrnaH
Reviews.Content: This has to be the worst hotel I have ever booked, not actually stayed in, since I walked out within an hour of checking in. The whole place is incredibly filthy, paint is pealing off walls, there are stains and rubbish carpets and in lifts, everything is old and shabby. My room was very basic, which is not a problem by itself, but like the rest of the hotel it made me think I’d catch something if I stay in it for long. The carpet is vacuumed in the middle only, so there are layers of grey dust, and who knows what else, all around the edges of the room. The window was filthy, the air con unit a greasy disgrace. When I sat down at the table to read the info pack I noticed food stains on its glass top and remains of potato chips, clearly still there from previous guests. This is not what I would expect from a hotel that supposedly has 3 stars. Cleanliness is the basic requirement even in hostels, and this place fails to deliver. I checked out within an hour, even though I had booked for 12. There was no attempt to persuade me to stay and the lady at the reception looked like all my reasons were familiar to her already. I would say do not stay here, not even if you are desperate.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad if you upgrade to Penn 5000 Club!!!”
Reviews.Author: Virgo_V
Reviews.Content: Ok, I stayed in this hotel back in 2004 and although the entrance and lobby look grand, the room quality was quite poor. So this year due to cost, I stayed again but upgraded to Penn 5000 Club room and I'm happy that i did. the room size was ok, although a little on the small side. The bathroom was small but very clean. The bed was comfy and the flat screen tv worked well. Was also entitled to free breakfast, which was only bagels, cakes and hot drinks but was unexpected and better than nothing! However, the hotel corridors, rooom carpet and air-con units could do with a good clean and don't expect any good views from the window. My friend, however, who stayed in a standard room had the following complaints: Dirty floors and bathroom Room smelt Dingy walls Mildew on tiles in bathroom Bad a/c ventilation (which i agree with) However, the location is absolutely brilliant for exploring New York. Therefore, my advise is to book a Penn 5000 club room for a half decent room. But if you need more than a 2-3* room, pay more and book elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for sleeping only! Don't expect too much!”
Reviews.Author: taylorc19
Reviews.Content: Lobby looked promising but room was very shabby and bathroom was very bad! Couldn't use shower coz too powerful and scarey! Bath water was green! New York itself more than made up for it and couldn't have chosen better location but this hotel is in serious need of a revamp and maintenence check! Not for romantic stay bt with friends just for sleep is ok if you're not too fussy! x

Reviews.Title: “dont go ever”
Reviews.Author: juliesinger
Reviews.Content: its the worst hotel iv ever stayed in please dont go ever and if you have booked it try and get your money back the hotel is sh-------t

Reviews.Title: “Teensy Weensy Room - great location though”
Reviews.Author: Em_India
Reviews.Content: You could consider staying here if you don't expect to spend much time in the room and just need a roof over your head at night - the room we got was really tiny and the bathroom even smaller! I don't think the rooms were cleaned very thoroughly either. My husband and I kept bumping into each other in the room. We also had large suitcases which took up most of the other space in the room. The location is fantastic though - very close to Times square, Penn station, 6th Avenue, Broadway theatre, nummerable restaurants and the other New York highlights and the hotel lobby is always buzzing with people. Its cheap too but I think I would prefer to spend a bit more and stay in a more comfortable accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Penn NYC Good price-good room-long check-in”
Reviews.Author: ltlswiss
Reviews.Content: After reading several negative reviews about Hotel Penn we were apprehensive about making an online discounted reservation but did so as we had a 6 a.m train to catch at Penn Station. Afterwards, we felt we got our money's worth by NYC standards Other than a one hour wait to check in, the room was clean (we made a thorough check of mattress and bed linens for bed bugs before unpacking as reesult of some of the online negative comments). The guest in line in front us advised that this one hour wait was not uncommon as he had been booked a number of times by his comnpany and the waits were even longer on his previous stays. It seems they cater to tour and student groups. We had a corner room with two windows which enhanced the view but also incresed the street noise (are there any quiet hotel rooms in NYC?). Room even had a small refrig, decent tv and was larger than most NYC hotel rooms we have stayed in. Clean bathroom with plenty of hot water and water pressure. Best of all, it was right across the street from Penn Station. As an aside, we ate across the street at Harrington's Pub-good food but a bit pricy (two entrees-pasta dish and porkchops + two glasses of house wine = $70+). We woulod stay here again, especially if we had to catch a train at Penn Station or to attend an event at Madison Square Garden.

Reviews.Title: “pleasently surprised!!!”
Reviews.Author: andydiana
Reviews.Content: First of all my friends and i were completely dreading staying at the Hotel Penn after reading reviews.After a longish journey from Scotland, UK, we thought we would be in the line for hours to check in, to our shock, there was no line, a helpful receptionist Betty (chinese origin) checked us in in 5 minutes! Although during our stay we did see very lng lines to check in we were lucky i guess. We had 2 rooms booked, we found them spacious, clean, basic and generally ok! Listen, you are in New York for gods sake, how long do you spend in a room? aslong as our bathroom and bed was clean we didnt care, and it was clean and tidy! The location is FABULOUS!! I def would go back and stay there!!!! Greetings from Glasgow, Scotland!!!!

Reviews.Title: “only if there is no other choice”
Reviews.Author: uk2dubai
Reviews.Content: If the Democratic, or Republican for that matter, National Convention is in New York, and the city is completely and totally full, then you should consider booking the Pennsylvania. This monster of a hotel, to big to understand, obviously service is what you pay for. But staying cheap can be to expensive.... waited 1 hour and 25 min. to check into hotel, lobby is poorly lit and very dingy, would ahve felt unsafe had it not been for the 400 other people waiting in line to check in. Are we really so plentyfull?, the cheap ones i mean, the ones who will sacrifice 1 hour and 25 minuts of our lives to save 50$ on a real hotel.....makes you wonder.... rooms are absolutely horrible, dirty, smelly and very unpleasent. No curtains, tiles falling down in the bathroom, toilet seat loose. All in all, the only reason to stay here, is not to spend any time at the hotel... those savings came at a big price. Never again, absolutely never again

Reviews.Title: “Overcharged on credit card and have been refused refund”
Reviews.Author: Zoe045
Reviews.Content: Due to the staff''s incompetence we did not get to stay in the hotel. We were informed "Sorry you do not have a booking with us" Then it was "Oh yes you do have a booking but there is a problem with your credit card as we were from Australia and the hotel cann't accept it. So we cancelled and went elsewhere and have now been charged for not turning up. Apparently we have to have a cancellation number. We were not offered this by the staff. They will not reply to our emails now. I have paperwork to prove what happened but as they have their money now they do not care. Would not recommend dealing with them at all.

Reviews.Title: “Very small room”
Reviews.Author: Ranunculus-81
Reviews.Content: We bought a "budget-room", and yes, it was quite cheap but also so small that barely we could walk a few steps. The room was ok though. Staff was friendly but too busy, every day there was a veeery long line of people waiting to get sservice at the reception. A nice, trustworthy memory came from the incident when i went to shange shoes to our room and there was a housekeeper right there, with the door open. I said i just will take another shoes, but she said : "Stop. Please put your key card the the door lock so i can see this is really your room. It´s for your own safety." This was nice, i felt she really cares about customers stuff being safe .

Reviews.Title: “Don't pay attention to the bad reviews...”
Reviews.Author: bomber93
Reviews.Content: I made the mistake of reading all the reviews for Hotel Penn (a lot were negative) but I've learned from the past not to go by them. I took my husband to NYC for his first time & was looking for a reasonable priced hotel & within walking distance from Penn Station, Times Square, etc...This was the perfect place! Yes its old, but was still kept up & very very busy! So if it's soo bad, why are there a lot of people staying there!? The check in line was little busy, but nothing unusal. The staff were very friendly & helpful. we did experience the check baggage in the basement...that was fine & they were very friendly. No problems there. We had Penn5000 room, that was very nice. It was clean & room service was good. Requested more pillows & received them right away. The site seeing desk staff were very helpful & friendly. No problems there. Our experience there was very good & diffinitly would stay there again...unfortunantly I believe its going to be torn down according to the recent news. The location was perfect for lots of activities & reasonible price...face it...if your going to NYC...your not going to be staying in your hotel room much! If you are...then your at the wrong city to visit!

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel valet crashed my car”
Reviews.Author: Crashed86
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for one night. They took my car when I checked in and less than 24 hrs later when I got my car back the front end was smashed in. They claimed it was like that when they got it which it certainly wasn't. The manager dismissed me and could care less. I'm very angry with this Hotel. If anyone ever stays here with a vehicle beware. Maybe they will steal it and say you never had a car.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Butterfly_Vas
Reviews.Content: This place offers you a great location and spacious rooms but the rooms are quite average with old furniture and furnishing. I had to stay here after having stayed at a B&B because of my last-minute extension of stay. I was very dissappointed by the furnishing of the room. It oozed a foul odour and it took me some time to get used to it. But this doesn't bother you, this is a great place to stay at, given its location and room sizes.

Reviews.Title: “CHEAP - but your better off spending a lil more and enjoying yourself!”
Reviews.Author: GandM9410
Reviews.Content: I went to the Pennsylvania Inn with my fiance and a couple friends in Feb 2009. Her friends were staying at the nearby MUSE hotel but spend almost double per night then what I did - so I thanked Expedia in my head. The hotel looked great online and the lobby was not too shabby either. When I took the elevator up to the room I was unpleasantly surprised. The floor I stopped on (3rd) was very ancient and outdated compared to the lobby. The mirror was cracked, carpets old and stained and the doors/trim had paint peeling. Even wall paper on the walls if i remember correctly! I prayed the room would look better - i've stayed in less than acceptable places but this was far worse than I had seen before. I opened the door to my suite to find a tiny room. By tiny, I mean the size of a large walk in closet. The tv and stand were ancient there was wires running across the room?! and the bed was very outdated as was the bed sheets that were dusty and seemed unwashed. I took a deep breath and thought "we're only sleeping here - its NYC!". I walked into the bathroom or stepped in I should say, and its was horrible. Stained, ceiling peeling, water leaking. I could handle this, I'm a guy - but I knew my fiance would not be as understanding. I went to pick her up in a cab and when I walked into her friends hotel was amazed at the place. Very modern and clean and right off of Timesquare. I took her back to the hotel and pre-warned her. One look at the room and she walked out. I informed the front desk who provided me with a "superior" room. This room was larger than the original room but just as bad. The hotel definitely ruined our trip to beautiful NYC. I could not locate any hotels in Manhattan area so we were forced to stay here. If your going with a bunch of guys who could care less about the room and want to save money to spend in bars etc this place is alright its a pretty good location - across from Madison Square Gardens. If your taking your significant other or mind if the place you stay in looks like a shady motel - then this is NOT the place for you. Hope this helps! PS: the superior room's view was the brick wall from a neighboring building and we heard sirens all night long :)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Pennsylvania is a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: asudue
Reviews.Content: Customer service at the front desk was terrible. Can you imagined a chech-in personel telling you, "I can't help you," fine someone else? I had to call the manager to complete my check-in process. My wife and I were on honey moon and we made reservation months ahead for a "Superior Room" with 1 full or King size bed at hotel Pennsylvania. We were checked into RM #914. To my surprise, room #914 had two single beds. The room was stunk, walls cracked, bathroom dirty, the carpet filty brown and the phone, oh! my God, cream color turned brown. When I got back to the check-in desk to complain, there were no one to help my situation, so I requested the manager again. The Manager told me "Oh! I am so sorry, I thought you guys were three (refering to a friend that assisted us to the hotel)." And I said, "what on my honey moon?" At this point in time, I handled over to her the print out of my reservation. Then she said, I am so sorry and assigned me another room (1109A). The different b/w the 1st and 2nd room was a mini refrigerator and a 25-30" flat screen TV. There were two single beds again. I was now angry and went back to the front desk. At the desk, I was informed by a check-in lady that her manager said that the two single beds room was the only accommodation available; and I said that was not what I paid for. She responded, this is why we gave you a Penn 5000 room; and I said, I don't care cause a motel room is better than that crip you call Penn 5000. My wife later told me to let go and go to be because there were no where else we could go. At this point in time, it was after 11:45PM. My entired honeymoon was ruined at this filty hotel. On the flip side, the hote lobby is pretty, but don't get fooled by that, wait till you enter the rooms. I will give compliments to house keeping, they tried to clean that mess off the face of Hotel Pennsylvania, but a towel and other little utensil will not clean the mess created over the years. I am regreting why I had to spend $736.00 at that trash hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and decently priced”
Reviews.Author: karanrm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Pennsylvania Hotel in New York during out visit last summer. We managed to get a decent rate of $75 per night when most other hotels were showing over $100.. When we reached the hotel, the reception staff was very courteous.. The hotel is not a very flashy kind, and more of a 3* hotel.. but the best part we found about the hotel was its location.. which is right in the heart of Mid town.. and only few blocks away from Times Square.. we used to walk to times square quite often, and Madison Square Garden too was in the vicinity.. We stayed only for 3 nights at this hotel, but were happy with the room service and other facilities

Reviews.Title: “First time in 50 years of travel that I requested a room change”
Reviews.Author: westford
Reviews.Content: First we waited way too long to check in. We never checked out because the line was even longer. The room was horrible, we requested a room change and wouldn't even sit on the bed waiting for the new room number. We looked out a window at a wall, the rug was dirty, wrinkled and smelled. We were moved to a better room that looked identical on a higher floor. The hotel was just like Grand Central Station, so many people milling around. Positives: Price, no "creatures", and prompt and satisfactory resolution.

Reviews.Title: “Needs major work, where's the chandelier???”
Reviews.Author: CChattam
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times and each time have either gotton or been upgraded to a decent room. At this hotel decent is used "lightly"! All me and my daughter were expecting was clean linen (had a king bed, in which had a half sheet...possibly twin lying, crossways of the bed and only covering less than half of the mattress) The bedspread "stunk". and the bathroom was horrible. The sink had cracks in it, the old tub had lost much of it's iron coating around the drain. There were no face cloths, no pen, no paper and missing hardware in the room. The walls were filthy and spots were all over the walls, as if someone attempted to "spot paint". If at the very least the room was freshly painted and fresh linen were present it could have been do-able. The bed was extremely hard so do I recommend this hotel, "HECK NO'"!! Is there anything positive? Yes, the location is awesome!! If you can get a discounted price well under $200, just insist at check in that you recieve a decent room. Afterall there is a certain amount of satisfaction that even the worst hotel owe their guests. If you choose to stay....there are "FEW GOOD ROOMS" you just have to demand one and if you don't get it...DEMAND A REFUND!!! In my case, I wasn't able to get anyone on the phone to assist me and after a 14 hr. long drive to the city I was too exhausted to hassel with it. We could not sleep with the bead spread , however used the top sheet and the half sheet to bed down on...Uggg!! The next day I DEMANDED a do-over and received another room at "no charge" however I did incur a $40 per day parking fee. So now you have it!!! IT'S YOUR CHOICE!!!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: charlottepeg
Reviews.Content: The last time we came to NYC, we stayed at the New Yorker which was being renovated and therefore was a very reasonable price. We liked the location, but the rates had gone up substantially--so we looked in the same area and booked the Hotel Pennsylvania. Very small room, VERY small shower stall--no tub. I am not a big person, but I had trouble maneuvering in the shower!! Though the room had a bit of an odor, the air conditioner was very quiet, and we heard no noise from any other rooms or the hallway. So, all in all, when you come to NYC you don't spend much time in your room anyway! Clean sheets daily, extra pillows and towels brought up quickly when requested--and a reasonable price. Would we stay there again? I think we would look around.............

Reviews.Title: “If you want to step back in time this is the place for you”
Reviews.Author: travel_light58
Reviews.Content: This hotel is VERY 1940 my bath was 1960's. The Carpet in my room needed to be replaced along time ago but facilites were clean. The fith floor ice machine was broken and I have to travel to the floor above or below to get ice. Lobby is pretty ...staff is welcoming. :)

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever visited. Checked in and checked out immediately”
Reviews.Author: BoutiqueBabe76
Reviews.Content: The person who says this is the grimmest hotel ever is right. I checked in today to the Hotel Penn and 45 minutes later checked out - just as soon as I could find another hotel in the city. Not only was the hotel dirty and old fashioned, it also felt highly unsafe and I would caution anyone considering staying there. The main things I found were: - the hotel bore absolutely no resemblance to its website - the Hotel Pennsylvannia entrance listed on the website was derelict and boarded up - The interior is not like any hotel I have ever seen and it looked like a mix between a train station and casino entrance. I walked around the block several times before i walked in, convinced that this couldn't be the hotel before the sinking sense of dread kicked in and I realised that I wasn't in the wrong place. - There were dodgy, intimidating looking people hanging around in the corridors and there are patrolling armed guards which make it feel more like a hotel in Lagos rather than NYC. - My room (the Penn 5000 upgraded room at $50+taxes extra/night) was dirty, antiquated and unsafe. If this was a premium room then I dread to think what other horrors I could have walked into. There was a metal door, a heating unit that looked as if it was a death trap (NB any reception that has a notice saying 'smoke detectors are available from reception upon request' is highly worrying) and clearly no health or safety checks had been done recently throughout the hotel. The bathroom shower in my room was leaking and couldnt be switched off upon arrival and everything in the room was sticky and dirty including the bed and a rather manky, yellow sitting chair. All of the furniture was antiquated and it was certainly not a place I could work in - even in a room with an ethernet cable that formed one of several frayed and dangerous looking cables. When I explained the situation all 3 people I spoke to who worked in the hotel, expressed similar concerns and understood my reasons for wishing to check out immediately and receive a full refund. Infact 2 members of staff stated that they 'often had people who were unhappy with their rooms', 'the hotel is 90 years old and most of the rooms should be scrapped and built again they are so bad'. The only plus point I could say is that all of the staff members were very friendly and helpful. They dealt with a difficult situation very well (I couldnt hide my upset at finding myself in this situation) and tried their best to be helpful - I only wish the hotel they are working in wasn't such a hell hole.

Reviews.Title: “The grimmest hotel i have ever had the dubious pleasure of staying in”
Reviews.Author: fussy015
Reviews.Content: Have you ever read or seen Stephen king's The Shining? If you have, then you'll know what i mean when i say this hotel's corridors remind me of the film...long, dark and creepy. They're also extremely dirty and musty-smelling with huge chunks of plaster falling off the wall and just left in the corridors!!. the rooms are no better....dark, dusty (they do hoover the rooms - in fact most nights they still seemed to be doing so at 10.30 pm when we arrived back after a day's sightseeing!) but they don't do edges/skirting boards and there was at least a year's worth of dust and grime in our room at edges/corners. The plumbing is out of date and tempermental (the shower was pretty good - although we had no hot water one night) and the wiring the same (everything hanging off the walls) a/c worked (just) but was so full of dirt and grime that i shudder to think what it was chucking out for us to breathe. Paper thin walls meant we were able to hear conversations late at night in adjoining rooms.... Clientele...? Hmmm...reminded me of a youth hostel. On the plus side....staff on the whole were extremely friendly and willing to help (when we complained of our 'room' (hovel!) and were moved to a slightly better one), the room we eventually got was large (two rooms knocked into one i think) and fairly cool (as it was reaching 35 degrees during the day) and the beds fairly comfortable (bedding/towels were laundered but not to my standard!! it was difficult to find a towel that didn't have a stain on it) and the location was amazing. Times Sq. ten mins walk, tube just over the road... Would i go back or recommend it to another family?? NO!

Reviews.Title: “Not That Bad”
Reviews.Author: Deephine
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great value for what you pay for. Granted, the rooms are in need of a touch up and the air conditioning could have been more powerful, this hotel is in a great location. The room was for the most part clean and the staff was generally nice and helpful. If you are high maintenance and would like to stay the majority of you stay in your room instead of sightseeing, you should go somewhere else. This hotel will exceed your lowest expectations. I hope that it does not get torn down so I can stay there the next time I go to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: thechubber
Reviews.Content: Hotel Penn was probably the worst hotel that I've stayed in when I was travelling in the States for 5 months. First of all, be wary of the staff manning the booth (that sells opera tickets/day trips etc.) which is located near the entrance. Initially the guy tried to con and 'force' us to buy the opera tickets, which i later realised could be purchased at a cheaper price if you do not mind queueing up for the half priced tickets in NYC. Besides that, on the last day when we were leaving the hotel, as we were running late for our flight from NYC back to GA, we asked him about the available options to get to the airport from the hotel. He psyched us to buy the bus tickets which were priced at about $15/person and told us that the bus was leaving in a matter of minutes. We decided to choose the bus option instead of taking the taxi as he lied to us that it would be double the price per person if we were to take the taxi instead! After paying for the bus tickets, we immediately ran out to the bus stop to wait for the bus. After about 5 minutes of futile waiting, we returned to the booth where he was, only to find that the bus had already left without us. It made us wonder if he already knew that we would not be able to board the bus on time, but still insisted that we bought the tickets, so that he could get a commission from the sale. We wanted a refund but he strongly denied our request. And since we were in a rush for time, we left the hotel quickly to baord a taxi, thereafter realising that it was definitely cheaper to take the taxi to LGA airport instead of taking the bus! Besides the booth, the hotel experience was bad. The room that we stayed in, was located at the far end from the lift, and the a/c was not functioning properly in the room thus it felt as if we were in an oven during the 2 nights we spent there. Also, the room was very squeezy for 4 (girls) of us. The toilet was small and it wasn't very clean either. On the other hand, the other room that my friends stayed in were nearly twice the size of ours (despite paying the same price) so it really depends on your luck if you ever choose to book a room with Hotel Penn. Nevertheless, the only good thing about the hotel would be its location, as it is almost impossible to find such a price for the rooms at such an ideal location!

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE 1ST TIME IN NYC”
Reviews.Author: CHERYLM25901
Reviews.Content: After being on a train for 13 hours we recieved the most horrible customer service you could get I had reservations for 6 months and they turned my trip into a nightmare at 2am then gave me the worst looking room I have ever stayed in Not somewhere I would recommend and for the quality its over priced!

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel but what a location!!”
Reviews.Author: GK201065
Reviews.Content: Did not know what to expect with all the mixed reviews. Lobby huge and busy. We did not experience long queues to check in . We are arrived late evening. We had a room for 4 people which was enormous but very basic. Bathroom was in need of renovation but we had hot water and did not spend much time in the room only to sleep. Location unbelievable, walking distance to Empire State, Macy's and Times Square. Penn Station just across the road. Pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Your worst nightmare”
Reviews.Author: momofsclg
Reviews.Content: It is very out of character for me to book a hotel without thoroughly investigating it- but I found myself on a train into the city for the evening...desperate for accommodations. I found a room available at this place on Expedia and booked it. From the moment I walked up to it to find a homeless person urinating against the outside wall- to the 1 hour waiting line to check in- to the lobby filled with what seemed like hundreds of foreign student backpackers draped everywhere, this so called "hotel" was frightening!!!. I tried to find anyone in charge just to see if I could cancel my reservation, and it was literally impossible. The hotel is antiquated, dirty, and creepy. If it was empty- you could walk in and easily think it was an abandoned building, it is that neglected. I was so disgusted I walked out and checked into another hotel. There are soooooo many places in NYC to stay. Do not waste a MOMENT thinking of staying here. I would have been better off sleeping on the train I booked this reservation from.

Reviews.Title: “Stay could not have been worse”
Reviews.Author: FormerNYer_CJ
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel we had found that our reservation had been canceled due to the 1800Hotels.com bankruptcy. They were then extremely uncooperative in dealing with the situation. Eventually I paid for a room at a price exceeding the price I had booked for. Saying the room was shabby would be giving it a complement. Upon leaving I asked if they were renovating the rooms. I was told the room had already been renovated.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT FOR QUICK GETAWAY, LAST MINUTE SPLURGE TO NYC!”
Reviews.Author: Trinity_star
Reviews.Content: After reading the good, AND bad reviews on Hotel Pennsylvannia, I didn't really know what to expect of the place. I did not set myself with high expectations, but I did arrive under the premise that the following standards HAD to be in place if we were going to stay there: 1. CLEAN, SPACIOUS ROOM 2. KING SIZE BED with DECENT Bedding 3. Water Pressure in bathroom had to be GOLDEN! 4. LOCATION MUST BE ACCESSIBLE My husband I literally only used our room to catch up on sleep and night, and of course to get ready for our days adventures. We typically prefer no service when we're traveling for a short stay, as we find it unnecessary. Because of that, I can't speak to the room service that is provided here. When we first arrived, the concierge area/front lobby was quite busy, and crowded. We stood in a long line to check in, however the line went fast, and the people at the front desk were quick and efficient! The bar fridge was empty when we got to our room. It's not like other hotels where you are charged for what bottles you take out of it. Some people may prefer having options in their fridge, but because my husband and I are fitness and health fanatics, we prefer the fridge empty so we can fill it with our own food and beverages. Driving in NYC isn't ideal, so we checked our car in Valet, at a price of $20 per day. It made it easy and convenient for us as we pulled our car up to the front of the hotel, unloaded our luggage, and off we went! It was just as convenient getting our car back when we departed. Parking is very expensive in the city so if you think you'll be able to save by parking in other lots - trust me - you wont! Go the Valet route... it's well worth the money. Internet access was pretty limited in the hotel (speaking of Wifi here). They encourage the use of THEIR internet services, however keep in mind - you're in NYC!! You're pretty much connected anywhere you go so stick to Wifi, and save your cash for fun excursions! The hotel itself is in a perfect location, walking distance to Time Square, and conveniently located right across the street from Madison Square Garden. The Metro/Subway/Train route (whatever you call your transit system!!) is also located across the street as well. We walked a fair bit, and also used a rickshaw for getting around town - not just around Central Park. They seemed to be just as handy and quick to grab as taxi cabs were! If you prefer to travel in the city in the open, stick to walking about, or using a rickshaw! It was quite fun, and allowed us to experience the city a very open way. Loved it! I was stay at this hotel again for sure. The price was right for what we were looking for on our last minute getaway. It fit perfectly with our weekend plans.

Reviews.Title: “A former Legendary place that has hit the bottom....”
Reviews.Author: tattooedtraveller
Reviews.Content: stayed here and regretted every second of it. Im all for budget traveling....but this place charges Hilton prices for flop house accomodations....paper thin walls that allowed me to be woken up to a domestic squabble next door...and not the best of characters mulling around the front of the hotel after midnight.....dont bother with this place....stick to the New Yorker on the other side of Madison Square Garden

Reviews.Title: “This hotel had seen better times and its glory days are over”
Reviews.Author: touristparis
Reviews.Content: I have just experienced a weekend visit and 2 days were long enough in this tired, old, once-grand hotel. The good things? There's really two outstanding ones, and they are location and price. The not-so-good things? Well, when we arrived in the marble lobby everything looked fine until we stepped out of the elevator, walked down a narrow hallway and entered our room and then our hearts sank! Our room did not resemble the smart photos shown on the hotel web site which must have been taken years ago when the furnishings were still new. We were met with musty-smelling chocolate brown carpet, poor quality new towels that shed copious amounts of fluff when used for the first time, an original old bathroom tub with its stained and cracked enamel surface, scuffed, chipped and knocked-about paintwork throughout, and grubby windows that were almost impossible to open. At the time of booking we asked for a room for three and were told there would be an additional bed placed in our room. We arrived to find no extra bed. After calling reception it arrived an hour later. It was one of those steel framed fold-up contraptions on wheels with a mattress just a few inches thick! But in fairness, at least the king size bed was clean and comfortable, the air conditioning worked, some toiletries were placed in the bathroom, and there was a large closet with an iron and board. Our corner room was bright and well lit with two windows and view of Macy's store close by. But as the current owner of this hotel now has plans to demolish it and replace it with a 67-story office tower ( Google ' Penn Plaza tower OK'd ' ) I guess there will not be any more refurbishment until the day this hotel finally closes, which could explain the very obvious lack of maintenance. The baggage holding area in the lower lobby is an absolute third-world disgrace. Two out of three stalls in the mens toilets were out of order and the room was stinking, plus, to deposit our luggage for only 2 hours we had to pay $4 per bag. I don't think I would choose to stay at this hotel again as our sad-looking room did reduce the enjoyment of our stay in New York. It was just OK, above poor, but below average. As is usually the case you get what you pay for and this place, by Manhatten standards is inexpensive. I guess management don't have to please anyone or try for good reviews as possibly this hotel will no longer exist in just a short while.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rowan1975
Reviews.Content: We had 4 nights booked at this hotel and didn't stay for 1! The lobby was nice but as soon as you got out of the lifts it was like something froma horror film! The corridors were so dimly lit - probably to hide all the flaws. The first room they gave us was awful - rust stained curtains, rust running down the walls, walls crumbling, paint peeling off and filthy bathrooms. We complained and were offered a different room - much the same. Complained again and the manager told us if that room was no good she couldn't help us any further. I said I would rather sleep in the lobby and she told me that was up to me! We reluctantly left our luggage in the third room while we looked for somewhere else to stay. My son was in tears at the thought of having to stay in that hotel and the hotel staff were completely unconcerned and didn't even care when we told them we were leaving. Their website shows photos of the Penn 5000 rooms - it is NOT an accurate portrayal of the hotel at all. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “This was a horrible experience. we did not even take off our shoes in the room. The bathroom had rush everywhere, a/c wa”
Reviews.Author: diana1816
Reviews.Content: This was terrible. We never even took off our shoes in the room. The bathroom had rush all over it. The a/c was barely working, our curtains were falling down and were stained. The mattresses were old and the bedspreads were old. The lobby was very nice but as soon as you got off the elevator you didn't know what hit you. Then they wanted to charge you if you did not give them a 24 hour notice to leave. We paid 267.00 per night and it was horrible. We would leave early and come back as late as we could so we did not have to spend any time there. The location was wonderful and the building was nice. But OMG te rooms were bad. The bathroom in the lobby, you had to go downstairs and you were actually afraid for your life. And they were not nice at all. My husband said the mens bathroom was even worst. It looked like bums had been living there, toilet seats were raw wood and tile was falling off walls. The first room they put us in the ceiling was falling down. Ths hotel could be a very nice hotel with a little bit of attention and they could spend the money that they spend on all those little maps on key card to upgrade the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Will NEVER stay there EVER again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ans02c
Reviews.Content: Pictures are certainly deceiving!!!! This was the worst hotel on the planet!! The location was great and even the outside of the building and the lobby were nice, but as soon as we stepped off the elevator...hello hostel. No, worse than a hostel!! The hallway had a feeling of a mental institution and the floors and walls looked as if it were the murder scene from an episode of CSI NY or SVU!! Talk about scary!! The room was so small we couldn't even unfold the rollaway bed, and the bathroom...terrible and tiny!! And the air conditioner was broken- during summertime in NYC!! And to top it all off, they charge per bag to store your luggage, while most hotels store it complimentary...but not this place! I could go on forever. There are not enough words to describe this place...but "worst place imaginable" definitely sums it up!!

Reviews.Title: “You might confuse this hotel with the Port Authority Bus Station”
Reviews.Author: TraveljohnsonJ
Reviews.Content: Most visitors to New York will ever know the pedigree this once grand old hotel had. This hotel was one of the original Statler Hotels, the prototype for hotels offering consistent levels of standards and service back in the early 1900's. Most guests will think this hotel has very strange doors as they are made of steel and have a bulge on the front of them. These doors were one of Mr. Statler's original inventions known as Serva-doors. There purpose was to open from the outside to allow the hotel valets to return pressed clothing to the guest without disturbing or entering the guest room. But this hotel shows how much the standards of travelers have changed in the past century. The location of the hotel is hard to beat, immediately opposite Penn Station which is the heart of Amtrak and commuter trains. Best of all, it is easily accessible from all the area's airports via shuttle buses. Getting to this hotel is the most affordable destinations within the City and allows travelers to avoid the high cost of taxis. Considering this hotel has nearly 1,500 rooms, the hotels lacks a sufficient number of desk agents to handle the waves of customers. I was on line to check-in for nearly twenty minutes at 4:00 PM. The desk agent was fairly personable and being kind and warm to a desk agent makes them much more amenable to special requests. I had not stayed in this hotel for over 30-years and when I told the agent this, she said that I would be ugraded since I was a repeat guests and staying just the night. I was impressed with how I was treated at the front desk. When I got to the room all I could think was what kind a room would I have received if I had not been upgraded? There was hardly a trickle of water from cold tap at the sink. I had to plug my computer into the bathroom as the outlet on the desk lamp did not work and there were no other outlerts The kind bed had a mattress that was well past its prime. It was ironic the shower had the same pressure as a car wash yet it took over a minute to try an retrieve a glass of tap water from the sink. I am tall so it was inevitable I would bang my head on the corner of the metal towel shelf protruding from the side wall in the shower. This is one hotel where the more contemporary outward-bent shower curtain rod would help widen the tub area, especially since my one should touched the wall and the other stuck to the shower curtain. The bath lines were soft and I was surprised by the range and quality level of the soaps and shampoos in the bathroom. Perhaps this is what they meant by receiving an upgrade. Perhaps the single greatest disappointment as a business travel was the lack of WI-FI in the guest room. If you need this you have to go to the lobby or que up to use the bank of computers in the "business center". Bottom-line, this hotel is well suited for tourist just looking to crash while visiting the Big Apple and has all the charm of the dreadful Port Authority Bus Station located several blocks uptown. There is a complete absence of quality and service associated with this once great hotel and it is unfortunate the owners did not keep this hotel current over the decades. Would it have been too much to ask for the faucets work properly? Let the buyer beware...

Reviews.Title: “If you don't mind the hostel-feel, then this hotel will be ok for you.”
Reviews.Author: nhazle
Reviews.Content: We were warned. We had seen the reviews where the 1 hour long wait to check in were reported. And that was true. And actually, hostels are MUCH better than this hotel in that regard. I have never been to such a slow hotel. The room was what you'd expect; it was about on par with the Ibis brand of hotels in Europe. Flat pillows and only two. I called down at 10pm to ask for 2 more pillows. The woman cheerfully agreed to have two more pillows brought up. I waited for 1 hr and then turned off the light and made due with the one each. They never showed up. I guess 2 more pillows couldn't be found. Or perhaps no one could be found to bring them up to us. The Bell Captain was nice, as well as the people who parked our car. And the cost wasn't too bad for Manhattan. No one answers the phone. We were told to call about 1 hour before we wanted the car & I called and called. No one picked up. So we had to go and wait this hour before we could leave. Old old old. Rundown. Needs renovation. Cheap. Right across from Madison Square Garden and the Penn Station. Weigh your pros and cons.

Reviews.Title: “Old But Nice”
Reviews.Author: Mikyochoa
Reviews.Content: Really good location in downtown Manhattan in front of Madison Square Garden, 2 blocks from Macy's, 2 from Empire State Building and 10 from Times Square :D It's Old But it's really clean and good service. Really good price for the location

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: seanmcgrail
Reviews.Content: All the bad reviews ,,take no notice,, this hotel is very good before we went we read bad reviews it put us off but when we got there the staff were very good and the rooms were clean and tidy, we all could take a picture of the bad areas in our own homes so take no notice. GREAT HOTEL

Reviews.Title: “If you can afford ANYTHING else, don't stay in this dump”
Reviews.Author: kevinthomas
Reviews.Content: Seriously, if you can afford not to stay here, don't even consider it. I know, I know, it's comparatively cheap. But everything said about it in the other review is all true. It is truly an awful, awful hotel. Dirty, smelly, noisy, long waits to check in, the staff don't care if you live or die, uncomfortable, poky rooms, hopelessy outdated. The only two positives are, a) the location (but remember you're in New York, it's not a huge city, most locations will be good) and b) it is cheap (but it certainly isn't good value). So remember, if you can afford anything else, and you have a shred of self-respect, book somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, old & run down facilities”
Reviews.Author: tbumbrey
Reviews.Content: The paint was peeling off the walls. Bathroom has mold growing in the tiles and ceilings. The shower head leaked constantly and there was no bathtub. The shower stall was badly rusted. The carpets were dark and filthy. The room was dark and musty. My bed was too low to the ground and the matress was extremly soft and gave me a backache every night!

Reviews.Title: “Not fancy, but great location”
Reviews.Author: kat4444154995
Reviews.Content: First of all, I was worried about staying in this hotel after reading all of the horrible reviews. I wasn't sure what to expect when I got there, but was pleasantly surprised. The check in took about 30 minutes, but the staff were friendly and even upgraded our room without being asked. The rooms were not fancy, but they were clean and had everything you would need. The staff were very friendly and helped us to pick out attractions to go and see. They even booked the tickets and gave detailed directions. The location was FANTASTIC! Literally across the street from Pen Station and Madison Square Gardens. Times square was easy to walk to and Central Park was just a bit farther along the road. Can't beat the location and price. As long as you're not looking for luxury, you'll be happy with the hotel! There is even a Tim Horton's next door!

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Musty and Moldy Hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Lindsay027
Reviews.Content: Hotel Pennsylvania was awful. The check in and check out times took 2 hours each an no matter what time of day there was always a long line and only 1-3 people working the front desk. The website says it is a historic hotel which has been renovated and it is completely untrue. The hotel does not even have a public restroom in the lobby.The hallways and rooms smelled like must, the rooms have old dirty brown carpet, the walls look like they have never been painted, the beds were very small and uncomfortable, the bathroom ceiling was full of mold, the shower was dirty, and the hair dryer even caught on fire. The website said we would receive a free continental breakfast however, it failed to mention that this was only true if you were part of the "500 club". We had to pay to check our bags and then we had to bring them down into the creepy basement to drop them off. We tried to complain and were hung up on by the front desk staff and even the manager. They kept telling us to take up our complaints with "Expedia". I would NEVER stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel in my life, but convinient location”
Reviews.Author: CoolCrabber2k
Reviews.Content: This hotel was sooooo freakin awful that I just HAD to come online to write a review, which I never do! Don;t take me worng, its in the heart of NYC so very convinient and the price was a steal for us, just $98+tax. BUT -- the experience was something to remember, making it the worst hotel in the world I've ever stayed in. We waited for an hour to check in, which is ok given its busy. then when we got the room first, it was very dirty, all the bedding on the floor etc. went down changed the room, 2nd room was filled with cigarette butts all over. changed it again, 3rd room - bedding all on the floor once again - this was after the manager promised its a very nice room. all this happening while my 11 month old waits in the car in 90 degree wather outside, after coming back from a 1 week stay at a hospital. you can imagine the agony. anyways the 4th room finally worked, with no working tv, that they fixed after 3 hours. i was hesitating to lay down on the bed cuz it just didnt seem very clean. the whole floor was very suffocating, we could not wait to get out of the room. i am hoping i never need to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “All the necessities, great location”
Reviews.Author: kjobl97
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. The staff were friendly and helpful, the room was clean and a good size. All the necessities were provided, hairdryer, iron and ironing board. If you're expecting 5 star luxary then this hotel is not for you but if all you need is a clean. comfortable place to sleep and shower then this is perfect. It is in an amazing location, directly across from Penn station and within 10 blocks of Times Square and the Empire State building. It was good value and everything I needed.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: glms27
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I (and some friends) were attending a conference at the hotel. We don't live far from NYC, but since the last train home was earlier than we wanted to leave, we decided to get a room. The hotel website indicated they were sold out, but I was able to get a room from Easyclicktravel.com -- $170 (including taxes) for a room for 3 people. For this location in NYC, the price was a bargain. I read all the reviews here and was pretty much expecting the hotel to be completely horrible. I'd stayed in some awful NYC hotel in my 20s, but now at 30something, I'm not as forgiving as I used to be. My boyfriend had stayed at this hotel about 4 years ago, during the same conference. I told him about the reviews. He said, "yeah, it's an adventure." I then said the only thing that would freak me out would be bugs. I wasn't filled with confidence when he just kind of grimaced instead of telling me not to worry. We got to the conference around 10am on Friday. The hotel lobby is very nice, marble (?) and big flat screen TVs all over the place. There are also several leather sofas. It was crowded, but not too bad. We went to the 18th floor for the conference. The elevators were warm, but the 18th floor was very well air conditioned and new-looking. The ladies room there was brand new and spotless. Around 2:55, I decided I would go and try to check in, since I'd read about it taking forever to check in. I timed it with this review in mind: it was 18 minutes total -- that's including the time waiting in line, and then actually checking in. Piece of cake. And the woman who checked me in was very nice. I was given room 406. Made my way back to the elevators and headed up. The hallway is a little dark. Opened the door, expecting the worst... and I have to tell you, it really was not bad at all. There were 3 double beds (I'd thought it was going to be 3 twins, so this was a nice surprise). It was big, and CLEAN. Yes, clean. Smelled fine, and I could see vacuum lines on the carpet. TV was a 36" and worked fine, all the channels came in. The A.C. was on when I walked in, so it was nice and cool. I initially thought 2 of the lamps didn't work, but they were just unplugged. Plugged them in and they were fine. The bathroom was clean, though some of the paint on the ceiling was peeling (see pics). Honestly, that was the only problem with the room. The TV was in an armoire that had drawers underneath, and there was a writing desk in the room. There was also a sizable closet. I mean, we could've moved one of the beds in there if we wanted to. Very large. That's where the luggage racks, iron, ironing board, ice bucket, and hair dryer were. Hangers were also provided. Vending was not far from the room at all, and the ice maker worked fine. Seemed like there were a few stores in the lobby, but I didn't get around to going to any of them except the coffee shop/deli (coffee was very good). The room was nothing fancy - just a plain looking place, but like I said it was clean, no bugs (I checked the beds thoroughly), the beds were comfortable, and the location is unbeatable. I don't know if I just got lucky, and the rest of the hotel is a nightmare, but I would certainly return to this hotel if I could get that room again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!!!”
Reviews.Author: tinag1968
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a tip, could've cried when we got to our room after a hours wait in a queue to check in, the bathroom smelt of urine (had got under the flooring) there was a hole in the bath, the bath had been painted in what looked like gloss paint! The carpets were sticky and dirty, the paintwork was all peelong and had never been rubbed down just painted over and over, over the years, you could cup your hands and run along the skirting coming up with handfuls of accumulated filth. The Air-Con was hanging off the wall and made a banging sound 24/7 The furniture was from the 1970's the bed was as hard as nails, but overall the place was filthy, we changed rooms and the second one was just the same. we rung around other hotels but as it was 4th of July week everything was booked, so we were stuck!! I always thought the Americans were picky, but they did not seem to mind the squalour of this place, although it is centrally located, close to all sightseeing and attractions I would not recommend it to anyone, I'm not posh by any means, but this place was squalid, you had to wear shoes in the rooms as the floors were sticky, don't even look under or behind the beds, you'd be sick, they smelt horrid damp and of urine, the bedlinnen had cigarette burns in it. Dont be fooled by the website pictures, the rooms are nothing like it shows, when we complaine dthey did not bat an eyelid and told us all the rooms were the same and if we wanted to check out we'd get a full refund off our holiday company, you could tell they dealt with these complaints all the time, I took 100's of photo's of New York but not one of the interior of this hotel as it was so disgusting and such a let down. I travelled there with my Niece as a surprise for her 16th Birthday and this place was absymal and such a let down to what was supposed to be a great week. I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “From lukewarm to disgust”
Reviews.Author: nic_leb
Reviews.Content: I stayed here five years ago and had lukewarm feelings about the hotel then. For a recent trip, I decided to try the Hotel Pennsylvania again because of its location and price. I was sorely disappointed. Where to begin with what was wrong? First, there was an HOUR wait just to check in. Once we got to the room the place skidded downhill. The baseboards, corners of the carpeted room, and air conditioning vent looked like they hadn't been dusted in ten years (dead bugs and caked up dirt). The bedspread (in a non-smoking room) had cigarette burns and the bed was lumpy and uncomfortable. In the bathroom, which appeared not to have been updated since 1930, the porcelain on the tub was half flaked away and there was no vent. The beside lamp had a burned out lightbulb and the batteries were missing from the keyboard connected to the television. The seal had broken on the bottom half of the window making the entire thing fogged up and there were random wires sticking out of the wall that looked like a fire waiting to happen. I was awakened at 4am by someone repeatedly attempting to enter with a keycard until I told them through the door they had the wrong room and they moved along. On the upside for me, the air conditioning worked and worked well. A couple that got in the elevator with me said they had now been in TWO rooms where it was broken and had just gone out and purchased a fan.

Reviews.Title: “A Place to Shower & Sleep”
Reviews.Author: oooromyooo
Reviews.Content: This was my third time staying at this hotel; the first visit there were no issues, and the second we were unimpressed by the room, so they upgraded us, free of charge. This time we had rewards to use to book the hotel, and as I had stayed here before, so we said why not? We were unimpressed with the condition of the first room, as it was run down, and really made us a little nervous to sleep in. But we called, explaining we had been repeat guests and would like a better room. They sent the bellhop to pick up our stuff, no questions asked, and took us to a renovated section. The room was much larger, and so was the bed, which made up for the "hassle" we experienced. It is an old hotel, full of history, with 1,000+ rooms, but its in a great spot! Easy to access the subway, very close to all the tourist areas, and midtown so all of the city is fairly close! It really made a difference coming back late afternoon to take a nap, change, and then be able to walk to dinner & Broadway for a show, without having to worry about time! Even late at night the lobby was full of people which made it fun to go out and not worry about coming home to an "empty" room! The amount of time we spent in the hotel made up for any issues we had. We literally just had it as a place to shower and sleep, and for the convenience it makes the price worth it. Otherwise, pay the extra and stay at a branded hotel, because you don't really know what you're getting with location and quality! I would recommend this to someone who is looking for an affordable place to stay, with easy access, and who doesn't plan on showing off the room. Other than that, the amenities are not worth bragging about!

Reviews.Title: “first impressions - from bad to worse”
Reviews.Author: milo6456
Reviews.Content: Absolutely horrific one hour wait for check in. The staff were rude and inconsiderate, and took above 10 minutes to process each party. When we got to our floor, we were unable to locate the room, and the aimless wandering was made no better by the foul moldy odor emitting from the carpets. When we eventually did locate our room, the key would not work, nor would the janitor's. When we eventually did get into the room we took one look, inhaled the smell, noticed the abysmal state of the bathroom and ran out of there. Only plus side; the manager accepted our cancellation without charge. A regular occurrence perhaps?

Reviews.Title: “If you like the movie "The Shining", you'll love this place!”
Reviews.Author: hellototheworld
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend were traveling on a tight budget but did not want to stay at a hostel, so Hotel Penn was the best for our price range. The best thing about this place is the location, it's at the heart of everything! The subway was easily accessible and Penn Station was just next door. It's within walking distances to the Empire State building, great shopping, and delicious food at Korea Town. If you don't mind walking it's also about a 20 minute walk to Time Square. As my title suggested it was one of the first thing that popped into my mind when I went there. The hotel itself is very old, and even though they tried to renovate the lobby to be a bit more modern, there was no hiding the cracks in the wall and musky carpet. The decor is very dark and there isn't enough lighting in the halls or in the room. The room itself was small but manageable, and even though the bathroom was renovated, the bathtub had cracks and pipes were exposed. We didn't feel comfortable taking our shoes off and checked the bed thoroughly before sleeping on it. The most helpful thing the Hotel provided was probably the map they give up with your key card. The staff was not helpful at all with the exception of the pleasant storage boy in the basement, which by the way looks like another horror movie set. In fact, I think I got more help and smiles from the other patrons of the hotel than from the staff. They were also very slow and there are long check-in lines every day we went by the lobby. Overall, since NYC has so much to offer in terms of activities we didn't stay much in the hotel room, so it was fine, but if you are traveling with a family or like to stay in a comfortable room, I would find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very, very unpleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Loli14
Reviews.Content: I would strongly recommend against staying in this hotel. I have travelled a lot, and slept in all types of hostels, boarding houses, bed & breakfasts and hotels - this is the worst place I've ever had the misfortune to stay at. The lobby is completely open to the public (overfowing from people just out of Penn Station looking for a place to take a break), the staff is rude, check-in takes forever, you have to use pre-paid wifi in the lobby (the signal didn't make it to my 3rd floor room). However the most unpleasant part of the stay has to do with the room itself. Windows can not be opened and haven't been washed in years, paint is chipped and peeling, rusty shower fixtures, the dark-brown carpet is scary, and there is a strange, musty, lingering smell that permeates everything. It's worth a visit downstairs to see the safety boxes - if I hadn't been travelling alone, I might have seen the humor in it all, but one look at the broken safe doors hanging on their hinges made me turn around, go back upstairs and hide my computer and passport in a drawer and hope for the best. The highlight of this horroric stay is a walk down the halls. The stained carpet and poor lighting are downright creepy (remember "The Shining"?). There have got to be better places in the city for the money I paid. The location is the ONLY good thiing about it, however with the good subway system, what's the big deal about being right across the street from Penn Station?

Reviews.Title: “Very unhappy with my room”
Reviews.Author: carolinagirl1964
Reviews.Content: I recently went to New York for the first time with a friend and we stayed in the Hotel Penn. Check in and out was very slow, only a few people working behind the desk. Overall the hotel was worn out. The walls needed painting and the carpet needed to be replaced, at the very least a good cleaning. Our room was in the same worn out condition. It wasn't very clean. My major complaint was the very old air conditioner that didn't keep our room cool. It was very hot outside and we couldn't even come to our room to cool off. I literally laid on the bed and sweated. The bathroom didn't have a fan therefore when you took a shower, the room would be extremely hot and steamy. We were in New York for 3 nights and our room was only cleaned once. I can't wait to go back to New York but I can promise you that I will never stay at the Hotel Penn again.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated Dump”
Reviews.Author: 45rainmaker
Reviews.Content: I was shocked at the condition of room, ( a suite). First the service at check in was bad. If you view the web site pics, the room looks ok. What a classic bait and switch!! My room was sickening to me and my wife. We arrived late and exhausted so we slept in the room, but the next day we were awakened by construction drills and saws on the damn building! The furniture was stained, the paint cracking, the bathroom a dump- DO not stay there- I was able to have 50 dollars deducted at check out, ( after a 20 minute wait in line). It was absolutely the most filthy hotel I have ever stayed at- I will NEVER stay there again-

Reviews.Title: “Good location but worn out hotel”
Reviews.Author: PAULETINO
Reviews.Content: I have been wanting to stay at this hotel because of its location. I was very disapointed by the state of it. Smelly, old with cacking paint and worn out bathrooms. There is nothing to it apart from its location. Even though you only need to sleep, there is no feeling of tranquility when you go back to the hotel. The reception look like a Bingo Hall but the staff are friendly. Even though it was clean, it is still not right. After seeing the bedroom, I was not tempted to have breakfast there. The internet in the lobby is not free, most hotels are now offering it free as it is an essential. You can stay at the Holiday Inn express just down the road for the same price range as it is better. Don't be fooled by the flags outside and the location.I will never ever stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Really, not so bad!”
Reviews.Author: KimEaston_PA
Reviews.Content: After having read many of the reviews I was a little concerned about having friends make reservations for us at the Hotel Pennsylvania. The following is our experience:1 - Check in was slow - it took about a half hour, but they did have 5 people working at the front desk. 2 - Valet parking was quick and easy. 3 - Staff was friendly. This is a once upon a time grand hotel that is showing signs of wear, but our room was clean, the shower pressure was strong, the hotel was quiet. Most importantly, the price was good and the location was amazing. We walked up to Times Square and down to the Village very easily.
