The positives far outweigh any negaives when it comes to staqying at the Hotel Pennsylvania.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: cehunter
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked our long weekend getaway stay at the Hotel Pen based on the recommendation of a friend who frequently travels to NY. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a hotel with a great location at a reasonable price. Next to Pen Station, it was easy to get to the hotel from Newark Airport by public transportation. It is a stone's throw away from my favorite attractions', the Empire State Building. My boyfriend is also a huge sports fan / wanta be musician, we enjoyed being next to Madison Square Gardens. There was always something exciting happening 24/7!!!! We spent the days walking around the city, recuperated for a couple hours by watching tv and then headed out for a fun night on the town. The room was clean, spacious and an awesome location ....exactly what we needed for a fun and relaxing weekend in the big apple!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Touring NY”
Reviews.Author: andread1986
Reviews.Content: My sister and I checked into the hotel pennsylvania for two nights at the end of april. i was a bit put off by the review before i went that described the long wait for checkout, but this was not our experience. We checked in and out with roughly a 15 minute wait. We checked in on a thursday and out on a saturday. The hotel is not modern or particularly fancy but it does the job - we had a nice clean room, access to the lounge on our floor with complimentary bagels, coffee, juice and internet which was a big plus for a quick check of your emails before heading off shopping and sightseeing. I would definately go back to this hotel as i found the staff friendly, the rooms clean and the price favourable. It is the center of NYC for god sake.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience and very large room for three women--three beds and walk-in closet!”
Reviews.Author: LesliefromAustin
Reviews.Content: We loved our room on the second floor--three double beds, large walk-in closet and it was VERY CLEAN. I guess we lucked out and really enjoyed the Hotel Penn. We were given a small fold up map of the subway and written directions--everyone was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, dirty, dirty....”
Reviews.Author: vbravo83
Reviews.Content: I would never stay in this hotel again. EVER! The rooms are horrible, beds are not comfortable and the bathrooms were not good either. The shower felt like it was a fire-truck hose! The towels were small and didn't really dry you up and the door to the room looked scary - like you were being locked up in a safe. The only good thing about it was that it was right across the street from Penn Station and Madison Square Garden but I'm sure there are way better hotels that are also close to these places.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible rooms, good location.”
Reviews.Author: Delps
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Penn for 1 night because I knew I was working late into the night and didn't want to take a train home at 3AM. I wish I listened to the reviews. My boyfriend and I stayed in the hotel and while we got a wonderful rate the room was just filthy. I could not believe my eyes when I walked in. First of all, it was the size of a closet (which did not surprise me) but the bed was so tiny! There was writing on the walls... Paint peeling on the ceiling... dirty shower... hair in the sink... It gave me the creeps just being in there. Walking through the halls I felt like I was in the movie "The Shining." It took me about 30-40 minutes to check in. The staff was very friendly and the lobby is nice. That's pretty much where it ends. Oh, and the restaurant that's in the front of the hotel? $18 for a plate of eggs is a bit too much for me, and I'm used to NYC prices. Walk to 8th ave and go to the diner there if you end up staying at this hotel! But please, don't even bother!!

Reviews.Title: “Please trust me DO NOT STAY HERE UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES"”
Reviews.Author: johnandjaime
Reviews.Content: What a nightmare. I was forced to stay in this dump for 12 days for a business trip. My finance director prepaid, otherwise I wouldn't have made it past check in. In a nutshell, my room had blood stains on the carpet, the electrical sockets were dangling from a wire, the shower head was an exposed pipe, The telivision had rabbit ear antenas, and did not get any recption, and the hotel was absolutely filthy- not to mention the cockroach infestation, and the bedbugs. The staff are virtually useless, and frankly I feel sorry for them, as the 2 hour long line ( literally) is person after person complaining and screaming. The location is convenient, although not a particularly fantastic part of NY. Its directly across the street from Madison Square Garden, with access to public transport, including commuter rails to Long Island and New Jersey. A close proximity to times square- not something I was interested in. However if that's what your into, May I suggest ANY OTHER HOTEL IN MIDTOWN!!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated location”
Reviews.Author: Ariel_Mumbai
Reviews.Content: I disagree with the reviews that claim that the hotel's location is a redeeming factor. Its location right opposite Penn Station/Madison Square Garden (MSG) actually ruined our experience even more. Penn Station is a noisy chaotic train station from where people commute to and from New Jersey and Pennsylvania daily. The crowds in the mornings and evenings are intolerable and it's not even a genuine New York atmosphere since most of the people going through the station or MSG are visitors to the city. Almost all the NYC subway lines go through Penn Station, however, the walk from Hotel Pennsylvania to any of the nearest subway stops is so crowded, noisy and overwhelming that your day will be ruined before you even get in the subway. The hotel itself is filthy. We had to request new bed sheets twice and each time the staff took hours to come back to the room. During our stay, there was a group of noisy high school children playing football in the hallway and nobody stopped them.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, ghetto room!”
Reviews.Author: Imlivinthelife
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to Times Square, across the street from Penn Station. Nice lobby. It goes downhill from there. The rooms are filthy, with paint peeling from the walls and ceiling. You don't want to walk on the carpets with bare feet. It is a real scuzzy place!

Reviews.Title: “Give the place a chance !!!”
Reviews.Author: Devonboy_10
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Hotel Pennsylvania in New York and because I feel so strongly about some previous reviews on this site I am hoping to put some peoples minds at rest who like me booked this hotel before reading the reviews then feeling slightly sick at your choice of venue due to the mass amount of very poor reviews. Obviously everyone is entitled to there own view but mine is based on going there with an open mind and knowing its only 2 star and CHEAP,at the end of the day I had made my choice paid the money so thought I best get on with it. Location is outstanding and you are on the doorstep and walking distance to Times Square/Empire State/Macys/Broadway etc. Check in was within 10 minutes on a very busy day and I was greeted by a very helpful and sweet young lady at the front desk,please note that all the staff I had dealings with were most helpful and polite with all staff always talking to you if you passed in the hotel (NOT RUDE 1 BIT). the room itself was old fashioned and yes the doors are like they are from the titanic but very secure indeed,the room was roomy and pretty quiet considering you are in the middle of New York,remember the hotel has no control over noise outside the hotel which some people on previous reviews seem to have forgotten,the bed was a lovely super king with very CLEAN bedding and unlike a 4 star hotel I stayed in at Heathrow the nights before flight the hotel had a fridge,hairdryer,clock/radio,ironing board/iron etc,the bathroom was very clean with hot water when needed. Yes a lick of paint is needed as some of the paint was peeling but this really does not affect your stay 1 bit. If like me you stay at this hotel its because of financial restrictions so just dont go expecting the Ritz,I went hoping it would be clean and comfortable with freindly staff and all boxes were ticked ! I for one will have no hesitations in staying again !! Ps If you are after a cracking diner which is cheap then try Andrews Coffee shop near Macys on 7th Ave 5 mins walk from hotel,Breakfast of pancakes from $4.25 and great service.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed at the Pennsylvania Hotel & had great service.”
Reviews.Author: thetravellers70
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 1:00 PM & had only 2 people in line, so checked in quickly. Great service & we checked out using the drop box. We had breakfast around the corner for 99 cents (a roll & eggs as a sandwich).

Reviews.Title: “I cannot express my utter disgust in...”
Reviews.Author: Roxy1988
Reviews.Content: I cannot express my utter disgust in words over this hotel. It's only and I mean only good point is it's location. If you are going to leave anything in your room lock it in a bag or better yet don't being anything at all. We left an iPod in our room to return from our day and find the charger still plugged in bit no iPod. And the only remedy was to file a report? Not much use when you're leaving in avfew days. As is we are still in the hotel and searching for alternative accommodation because location or not NOTHING is worth this it's absolutely ruined our entire trip and security were the most arrogant people I have ever come across. Please god well find somewhere that staff can be trusted soon and actually be able to enjoy our trip without worrying.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ive had the misfortune to stay in !!”
Reviews.Author: jillmarion
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is the fantastic location, opposite Penn Station and Madison Square garden and also a couple of blocks away from the empire state building. My first impression on arriving in this hotel was the very grand lobby which is good, but thats as good as it gets, when you get upstairs the hallways are filthy, carpets are all worn and the doors look like coffins !! When I entered the room I thought where is the wardrobe, only to discover a wardrobe that was made for a baby as that is all you had room in it for (baby clothes), the carpets in the room were stained the skirting boards were absolutely filthy, cracked and stained tiles in the bathroom and top it off I got bitten by something and ended up at a pharmacy only to be told " I think they are flee bites" We moved out the day after and stayed at the Millieum Hotel which was beautiful. My advice to anyone planning on staying here is DON'T !!!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: money4nothing123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is incredibly bad! It started off the first day waiting over an hour at check in and the staff did not care. Then my room had bed bugs and I have over 100 bites on my body! They moved me to another room and the Internet did not work. It is very slow anyway. The bath in the first room was filthy - you could scrape the dirt off the bath tub. I seriously thought about reporting the hotel to the Department of Health

Reviews.Title: “Worst service ever!”
Reviews.Author: JoMaHip
Reviews.Content: Well, the hotel is quite good. On a very central locatian. The room with King Size bed was good as well. But what a pity that the room was next to a room which was renovated, and that the workers started at 7 o'clock in the morning. We heard that this renovation was already going on for two weeks. So the people of this hotel gave us our room while they knew about the renovation and the noise of the room next door. Well, when we complained about this, they gave us another room. But without saying sorry, without even saying 'what a pity', without even looking at us. On the contrary, the receptionist didn't give a damn. Good hotel, very very very very bad service!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and wonderful experience at Hotel Pennsylvania, New York.”
Reviews.Author: SKarim01
Reviews.Content: It been a splendid experience to me and my colleagues while our stay at the Hotel Pennsylvania, New York. The room tariff was good, spacious, neat and well maintained. Though it took us a while for checking in - as in those days it was a rush time and seeing the proximity to the Penn station it was justifiable. But what I liked the most was the facilities in the hotel. The Penn Club was our daily morning meeting place apart from the variety of breakfast served there. Every common necessity was in reach and made available in the hotel premises. The hotel staff were always available - even at odd times in the night. I would like to personally thank Ms. Maria (at the reception) for her undeterred time and patience while checking us in. THANKS MARIA. I would also like to thank the staff and management of Hotel Pennsylvania for making my stay a memorable and a pleasant one. Thanks once again. Warm Regards, - KARIM

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Vader1
Reviews.Content: Arrived at hotel which is directly opposite Madison Square Garden & Penn Station. The check-in was OK, no queues but it was around 21:00! Our room was on the 12th Floor, no problem until we walked down the corridor and noticed that all the doors were metal and grey in colour and not pleasant to look at. Opened the door to our room and it is small but clean. We had the King-size bed which was comfortable for us but the shower floor needed to be retiled as they were old and discoloured. Otherwise a pleasant stay for the 5 nights that we were there. The hotel is in a good location, about 15 minute walk to Times Square & Broadway and you are about 2blocks from Empire State Building. Would we stay there again? Most probably as we know what to expect and the price was good.

Reviews.Title: “The most awful hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: MDW44
Reviews.Content: Anyone who reviews this hotel and says, "Eh, its not that bad" is either a homeless person or someone who is comfortable not changing clothes for a month. Simply disgusting. The room smelled like urine. The beds were disgusting looking. The floor, which was an old worn-down carpet, felt damp. Two of the electric sockets, including the one in the bathroom, didn't work. The only ice machine that worked was 6 floors away...yes, I walked down six flights and checked 6 different machines before i found one working. No ice buckets in room. Suffice to say, we arrived at 8:30 PM, dropped our bags off and went out for the night, came home at 2:30 am and looked at our disgusting room again and decided to leave instead of sleeping in those revolting beds. And just so you know, I can stay just about anywhere. Basically, lived in a closet sized apartment for 2 years during college where the bathroom was down the hall. I don't expect much from hotels normally because i just want a place to crash. I'd never crash here even if I was roofied.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews put me off - but it's actually quite good!”
Reviews.Author: xyon87
Reviews.Content: I booked to stay at this hotel and then read all the reviews on here - oh dear! Many people seem to have complaints about cleanliness, broken lights, cracked sinks, etc., and claim the only good things about this hotel are the lobby and its location. My experience was actually very good! The location is excellent, being situated within minutes of Times Square and the Empire State Building. It's also opposite Penn Station where you can easily get to/from JFK in about 30 minutes, and handy for the subway. Check-in times seemed to be busiest around 7 or 8 o'clock in the evening, but there was no wait for us when we checked in on a Saturday night at 9p.m. There's also a FREE safe deposit box facility located next to reception. There's an internet place where you can get a card and go online quite cheaply. A luggage service costs $4 (ask at reception) for them to keep your bag in a secure place on the day you're leaving - just collect it by 7p.m. or ask the bell captain to get your bag for you after this time. Check-out went smoothly also, at about 10a.m. (can check-out up to 12 noon). Our room was quite small, but for a two star hotel, it's what you'd probably expect. It was clean and we had clean towels everyday, except once when all we had to do was ask at reception and new towels were delivered. The lid on the toilet seat was quite flimsy and broke when we put a bag on it, but it was replaced without charge. The sink drained quite slowly, but it was cleaned and without cracks. The bath had quite a few cracks but was still clean, and the shower was a perfect temperature (if a little too strong!) The bedding was clean and the bed was comfortable. As it's quite an old hotel, the decor felt a bit drab but what can you expect? I wasn't expecting air conditioning or a TV in the room, but we had both in excellent working order. All the lights worked and were fine. An iron and ironing board is provided in the cupboard, but their guide says they will provide these if for some reason they are missing. The information desk was always manned throughout the day, and the staff were generally quite helpful, although a bit quick to try and send you on your way. The gift shops seemed a bit of a rip-off - just try and find a Walgreens to buy water, etc. (There's one at the Empire State Building, about 4 minutes away). I think this hotel is for people who want to stay in a really well-situated location and who are comfortable with having clean yet modest furnishings. We may have been lucky with our room (everything seemed to work fine), but it seemed as though if there was something wrong, you could tell them and they would try to fix it (the other reviews seem to suggest this too). You'll want to be spending most of your time out seeing all that New York City has to offer, but this hotel is fine for your sleeping and mid-afternoon break needs.

Reviews.Title: “More interested in just being in the city and less in best hotel stay?”
Reviews.Author: 4kidmom
Reviews.Content: Then this is the hotel for you. It was relatively clean in the broadest definition of the word clean. Not filthy at all, but you can tell it's a really, really, really old hotel. Everything is old in this hotel, but the shower was ALWAYS hotter than hot, and after a few complaints, they fixed the air in our room to be as cold as a morgue:) Basic stuff southerners (like myself) expect in hotel automatically weren't there: wash cloths (had to request); Ice bucket (no such thing), ice didn't work on our floor at all. Go to 8th floor. Nice mattresses???? not so.. Non smoking floor, no such thing... Walked through smoke filled hallways off an on during the stay. Like all hotels, I never trust the top comforter, definitely didn't trust this one. All in all, in a pinch I'd stay again. However, if I plan to go to city again, I'll save more pennies to stay in the city but probably not here.

Reviews.Title: “very misleading and incompetent hotel”
Reviews.Author: caprica113
Reviews.Content: When viewing photos for this hotel, the room I booked looked pretty decent. My boyfriend and I got there and saw a luxurious looking lobby but when we got to our floor, it felt as if we had entered a completely different hotel, if not, MOTEL. Our room looked very shoddy, and here's what I have to complain about it: 1) half the lights in the room weren't working, 2) couldn't turn off the TV (the remote didn't work, the TV buttons didn't work...), 3) the outlets weren't working, 4) there were holes in the blanket, 5) the room wasn't cleaned whatsoever (used towel still hanging on the rack), 6) ceiling looked like it was going to collapse at any moment, and the list goes on!!! Seriously, spending close to $200 on a so-called "renowned" hotel that looks like crap on the interior is just really frustrating. Going to a motel, this sort of thing might be expected but definitely not in a hotel that ranks 3-4 stars. Some motels I've gone to in the past have looked nicer than this one!!! Anyway, we went downstairs to complain and they upgraded us to the Penn 5000 suite or something...well...it was a tad bit more spacious, came with a flat screen TV, everything worked fine, EXCEPT that there was yet another used towel hanging on the bathroom door. Also there was a half used bottle of mouthwash which says to me that again, the room was not cleaned. Even when we complained to the lobbyist, she shook her head and said, "ughhh I don't get why this keeps happening!!!"

Reviews.Title: “Not all that bad, I'd definately go there again next time”
Reviews.Author: Fenneke_Evers
Reviews.Content: Hi All, Before travelling I always check this page for reviews of the hotel. Since this hotel offered the best deal and also a great location we decided to book it eventhough the reviews were not all that positive. I must admit that I was kind of afraid of what we would find when reading through the reviews, some were ok, some were not positive at all. The location is absolutely fabulous, especially if you're travelling into NY by train, it's right across Penn Station. You turn right when exciting the hotel and you hit Time Square. Regarding the waiting times, I guess we were lucky, there were a few people in front of us but all in all we were at our hotel room within 15 minutes. I must admit that we did walk into the hotel several times during our stay and the check in line was up to the front door. It all depends on the time of arrival at the hotel. The rooms were fine, they could use a paint job but the room was clean, we had clean towels every day and the bathroom was clean as well. If you're in NY, you should not spend time in your hotel room unless you're ill. If you're in NY for sightseeing and shopping, you leave early in the morning and get back late in the evening with a stop in between to drop some bags and freshen up. If that's what you're looking for, this hotel is perfect. I'll definately book this hotel on my next trip to NY.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all!”
Reviews.Author: total_misfit
Reviews.Content: I was actually pleasantly suprised by hotel Pennsylvania! I stayed here with my college group in March and after reading the other reviews on here and seeing pictures i was actually petrified about staying here! First off, this hotel is in an amazing location as it is directly opposite Madison Square Gardens and literally a 2 minute walk from Macy's and other shops. Time square is just a few blocks away too. If you're looking for a luxurious and relaxing break then maybe this isn't for you, but in New York is there really need to stay cooped up in a hotel all day? There is so much to see so why spend lots on a room when your not there! OK, so it is all a bit dated but i would definately visit again. Our bathroom had a bath with shower which was very clean... apart from a few hairs on the corner of the bath... other classmates had rusty plugs but it was clean. Our room had 3 beds which were all fairly comfy! When we had adjusted to the time difference we slept fine. However, with the hotel being in such a good location all we could hear ALL night was taxi horns! So overall, the hotel is FINE! I'd much rather spend money shopping than on the best hotel! There were no cockroches, no rats, no cracks in the ceiling, no mould on the walls, no rust in our bath, and no coffin doors (as other people as referred to them). The hotel lobby is very large and is probably the best part of the hotel. There are comfy leather seats too. There is 3 shops and a cafe too which are all reasonably priced... however, i suggest buying souvenirs from china town or somewhere cheaper... the hotel will charge $20 for a t-shirt but at china town you can get 3 for $10! One of the shop owners was very friendly and informative and really made us feel welcome in New York! To the left of the hotel is Europacafe, this was great for breakfast as they had a huge selection of fresh food which they cook on order including bagels, pancakes, and oatmeal, and the staff in here are very friendly! I would reccommend ice skating at the rockefeller centre, this is great fun and really good to watch the more experiences skaters. This is really cheap too. I would also suggest a coach tour, we had an amazing tour guide which stopped off at different places over new york such as trump tower, the world trade centre site and central park. This gives you a great understanding of what you're actually seeing! For theatre students i would recommend visiting radio city hall; tour guides take you underneath the stage and show you the mechanical side of the moving stage area. And you must eat the four foods of new york!...pizza, cheescake, hotdogs, bagels! New York is a truly AMAZING city! And when i go back, i would seriously consider staying in hotel pennsylvania again!

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated, over-stated, over-priced and ... just AWFUL !!”
Reviews.Author: bigbeekay
Reviews.Content: Without doubt, the Hotel Pennsylvania is an experience where ones level of expectation and entitlement is SO much higher than the standard of service and most especially accommodation. Rather than any charm from the obvious age, lack of attention and investment paid to it, the quality and standard of both public areas and rooms is a disgrace to the owners of the hotel and the city in which it is located. Occupying a prime site opposite Penn Station and in a busy part of NYC, Hotel Pennsylvania could and should be SO much better but the reality is that it closely resembles 3rd world or old Eastern Europe standards - indeed, many hotels I have stayed in in both are significantly better than the Hotel Pennsylvania. With 2 notable exceptions, the staff are either low-profile or aggressively rude. Given the choice of accommodation in NYC, it's my hope that all potential customers will stay elsewhere and avoid the unsavoury and disappointing experience of 'The World's Most Popular Hotel' ... the Hotel Pennsylvania is just AWFUL !!

Reviews.Title: “Filthy, smelly, digusting..should be shut down by the board of health!”
Reviews.Author: Anmayer
Reviews.Content: After 45 minutes waiting in line to check in, we were told that Expedia had booked us a room with 2 twin beds, not 2 double beds and there were no other rooms available. After some "discussion" and showing them our receipt from Expedia, we were given the keys to a room with 2 double beds. We were a spec dubious, since our room was on the 13th floor. The keys didn't work. Security brought our new keys to us 1/2 hour later. Then we entered a flithy, smelly closet with two double beds. At first, we thought we could handle this since it was a one night stay. But the complaints were piling up. Grimy carpet, dust all over the furniture, smelled like stale smoke, cigarette burns in the bedding, stuff hanging off the lamp shade, no ice bucket, no menu for the TV, CRUSTY towels and candy wrappers on the floor, forgot to mention dirty tub. A lengthy call to Expedia got us a $50 refund and loud complaining got us an upgrade to an extremely large suite, that was adequate. It was dusty. One shower's force was a killer, but my brother in-law had back pain so that paid off. In the other shower you had to hold the shower handle in your hand. The water temperature would burst to very hot occassionly. This suite did have an ice bucket, WOW! Anyway, stay away from this place.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here for free”
Reviews.Author: MaLizGa
Reviews.Content: DIRTY: hair from previous visitors in bedsheets; carpet filthy; bathtub not cleaned. OLD: threadbare sheets; bad mattress; thin doors - noisy; no internet access in rooms. DIM: no overhead light - only two lamps. AMENITIES: no hairdryer, no coffeemaker, no toiletries, no safe. AND a $4 per bag charge to hold baggage! Avoid this place like the plague!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, terible place”
Reviews.Author: Cacakk
Reviews.Content: Its looks like the oldest hotel ever, amazing location (close to time square, subway, malls), My checking last abou half hour, but I got lucky, I saw people staying on the queue for about 2 hours (too many people) ariving at the same time that the staff can not support them all. next time i´m going to stay in a better place.

Reviews.Title: “First impressions count”
Reviews.Author: Thomsett
Reviews.Content: Waited in line to check in over one hour, most of that time only one clerk available. So far, customer service is dismal, room is old, aiur conditioner doesn't work effectively ... I've been here less than an hour and I already know I will never stay hjere again.

Reviews.Title: “Not exactly the nicest place I've ever...”
Reviews.Author: meghanmendoza
Reviews.Content: Not exactly the nicest place I've ever stayed. Tiny rooms. Location is great. If you're not gonna be spending much time in the room, it's worth the stay for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel EVER!!”
Reviews.Author: PoochieUk
Reviews.Content: What a flea pit of a squalid old-fashioned grubby hotel! The carpets looked like they'd been there since the 1930's - heavily stained and bleached. I agree with an earlier quote which read that the hotel was like a scene from The Shining - it is sooo true. The bathrooms were falling apart in all of the 4 rooms we booked. I had booked these rooms just after Christmas so I would have expected them to be together! They were not. I was told that my daughter and her husband to be would be upgraded ! Needless to say they were not! My sons bathroom had not been cleaned and there was a pubic hair on the wet soap! We complained after the first night and were told that they had been taking bookings for the last 4 months so couldn't put us together. What went wrong with our booking from January, when the hotel was empty?? The queue for Reception was a joke - only 2 people on and about 100 people wating ages to book in. I wouldn't recommend my worst enemy to stay here. Not worth 30p a night let alone $100! Ridiculous! No saving graces whatsoever!

Reviews.Title: “UNREAL.!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: beadwoman21
Reviews.Content: I read a review from the person from Bristol CT and couldn't have it better! Not only am I also from Bristol CT but had almost same thoughts with the exception of we did get double beds........Walking down the hallway was like walking on the Titanic with the metal doors and the lit numbers on the floor.......the hotel is a great location but check in was a nightmare and they charge you $4 a bag to store them! I have never heard of such a thing......checkout wasn't much better they had a line of peope and only 2 working the desk.....and FYI if you have Valet parking make sure you tell them and hour in advance you need you vehicle or you will pay over fees.....I frequent the city and I would give this hotel a 2 out 10.....My suggestion is pay a little more not to be squeeved out! Oh yea and don't eat at Lindy's for breakfast unless you want to pay $18 for pancakes!

Reviews.Title: “Historic Gem”
Reviews.Author: BarefootTom
Reviews.Content: Stayed here three nights on a business trip. This is an old New York gem, lots of history. Sure, they are small rooms, but it was built that way in 1919. So know what you are getting. First, if you hit at a busy time, check-in is long,. There are 1,400 rooms, so it can back up. Second, service is good, rooms are CLEAN and it was relatively quiet, so I could sleep well at night. It is not a Hyatt, it is not a Hilton. It is an historic hotel with a killer location that does fairly well despite it's age. I plan to be back in two weeks.

Reviews.Title: “I wiped my feet on the way out, not in.”
Reviews.Author: Dee892
Reviews.Content: My first impressions of this hotel were pretty good, walking in, the lobby looked amazing, and as a 17 year old girl away from home for the first time, i was excited. We got allocated our room, and as soon as we got in it went down hill from there. The radiator was covered in black dust, the walls were mouldy. We thought we could cope, until we pulled back the bed covers. They were stained black and yellow, there was no way we could sleep in that. While one of the girls went to complain to the leader of our group, the rest of us found more faults. As soon as you flushed the toilet or turned on the tap in the sink, the bathroom was flooded. Not really ideal. Then we went into the closet, that was probably bigger than the room itself, and found another door which we opened to find it led to someone elses room, and there was no way of locking. This ment these strangers could walk into our room any time they liked. We complained to reception immediatly, and they upgraded us to a bigger room. At first we were satisfied. The walls were cleaner, the door in the closet locked and the bathroom didnt flood. Thats where it stopped to be honest. It wasnt until i looked in the bath that i realised the plug was mouldy and had hair in it. I for one wasnt using that. As i turned on the tap, the water came out black, which ment for the next 5 days, each of us girls brought bottled water to wash with and brush our teeth. We complained to our leader, but they said the hotel manager wouldnt move us as we were being 'too picky'. We hoped thatd be the last of our bad experience, but sadly not. The first night, i got into bed, it sunk to one side. Yes, my bed had only three legs. I spent the worst 4 nights of my life in that bed, which left me in severe agony with my back. As if my nights sleep couldnt be any worse, the radiators in our room wouldnt turn off. This ment that all 4 of us girls in the room, got hardly any sleep, as we were so hot, and we all got ill as the room was so stuffy. As you can tell, this wasnt the great experience i was expecting. Dont get me wrong, i loved NYC itself, id go back tomorrow, but the hotel was such a let down, and i wouldnt recommend it to anybody. The only upside was the location.

Reviews.Title: “OUT DATED”
Reviews.Author: avec24
Reviews.Content: Let me start with check-in. One hour in line. Finally get our room. Go to room. ...Its more like a CLOSET. Twin beds, I reserved double beds. After calling the front desk they direct me back down to them which was the last place I wanted to be after the sweltering hour wait I had just experienced. Anyway, their mistake, get another room. A bigger closet. For the price of this hotel they need to definetly update. The guest room doors look like tops of coffins, not kidding. Not a good way to start your stay. We were provided NO washcloths, hairdryer was broken, although a second one was found in the closet. No fan in the small bathroom, no hook on the door (no big deal). but the water pressure....it was like being in a car wash, the pressure hurt your skin. I suppose it would have been worse with NO water pressure. This hotel is situated in a perfect spot and if they would update their antiquated rooms then I feel the price they charge would be warranted.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotel I have been at.”
Reviews.Author: ollorentzen
Reviews.Content: Bad service, Crappy room.. just terrible.. If I had paid 25-30 dollar pr night for this hotel, maybe I will shut upp.. But I did pay 100 dollar per night for 120 bed for two persons..

Reviews.Title: “Buyer beware!!”
Reviews.Author: ciaobla
Reviews.Content: Facts: took 40 minutes to check in (this place is hugely popular with foreign travelers), the room was miniscule and quite dark, you had to find the right spot on the TV remote or you were stuck on one station, no bathtub for the shower so the whole room was wet, and no room service. The good part is the great location to virtually everything and nice people for the most part (one of the bell people actually yelled at me for not knowing the cross avenue when I asked for directions). If you just want a covenient place to crash it's fine; just don't expect anything more.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: elizabethaberk
Reviews.Content: The staff is nice and responsive to questions, but you get what you pay for here. The area is a tourist trap, the rooms are tiny, and ours smelled like sewer. The "free breakfast" was nothing more than stale bagels, and the internet is unreliable. This hotel is not horrible or dirty, but you definitely get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “WORST hotel I have been!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sofiaebox
Reviews.Content: The room was small and very careless. The roof have stains and the bathroom was dirty. I have to shower with my flip-flops!!!. DONT STAY IN THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel! Give it a go!”
Reviews.Author: kittykp
Reviews.Content: After reading the mixed reviews on this place, My expectations were not all that high! I had visions of feeling like I was in a prison, and having to fend off creatures during the night, but I was pleasantly surprised! It's not a 5 star hotel - It's not even a 4 star - It is what it is and you get what you pay for! I don't understand why people pay what they pay for cheaper hotels, and then expect the earth from it!? If you expect the earth, fork out the cash and go and stay in the Ritz! - Room was clean, bathroom was yes, outdated, but clean. - I am a light sleeper and was worried about the so called noise that this place has.....Slept like a baby and didn't hear anything! - Coffee shop located in the foyer was great. - Staff that I dealt with were helpful and polite. - AMAZING location! You couldn't get a better location if you tried. Easy walking distance to Times Square and Empire State building. I won't be staying anywhere else when I come back to this wonderful city! (Well.....except if I win the lottery and can afford a 5 star one!)

Reviews.Title: “gross”
Reviews.Author: amle
Reviews.Content: this is the worst experience i've ever had staying at ANY hotel. the sevice was the worst. when i called for a hair conditioner the response was "we don't serve that on the tenth floor" hahah, besides us paying 300 dollars for a freaking room. it took over an hour to check in, and when it was my turn they were extremely rude. i've never had such an experience. the rooms were old, dirty, smelly and creepy. i don't know how else to describe it. besides the location, this hotel has NOTHING going on for them. it is way overprized for what you get. not to mention the next spot of new age bubonic plague outburst - the restrooms in the lobby. GROSS!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location !!!”
Reviews.Author: DonnaleeKerry
Reviews.Content: Before i went on my trip to New York i searched and searched websites of Hotels and in the end i gave in and booked this hotel. Many people told us we were mad to go there but 1 of my friends said she stayed there and it was basic but great location and she was correct. The only thing that i could complain about was the hour and a half we had to wait for check-in soooooo slow but very nice when we eventually got to the desk........ The rooms are basic but thats New York for you and what we paid. If its shoppin you are goin for it is the idea spot to be all you do is sleep and shower in the rooms. The bathrooms and rooms were cleaned everyday and towels changed everyday without having to be ask...... The staff in the information desk in the hotel are very very rude so have your research done before you go and just get a map and off you go !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as we expected...”
Reviews.Author: R_Vosters
Reviews.Content: We had read a lot of terrible reviews beforehand, and were kind of afraid... but in the end, it wasn't as bad as we expected. You basically get what you pay for: a very basic two-star hotel, whose biggest plus-side is it's very central location, in between Madison Sq Garden and the Empire State. The room was okay-ish. It was a bit dusty, but calling it dirty would go too far. I do think we were in one of the refurbished rooms -- apparantly, some other rooms are really bad. The worst was the reception: always very long cues, not very helpful staff, and you need too pay quite a lot extra to leave your suitcases the last day. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel, but went to a great breakfast restaurant just around the block every day.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hell hole in the entire world that made me want to wash my body with corrosive bleach”
Reviews.Author: Mashmellows
Reviews.Content: I'll bullet point this; AREA - hobos, dealers and hoodlims. NOISY QUEUE to check in - over and hour STAFF RUDE, walking away when asked a question, putting down the phone on people. Swear to god, I heard one receptionist charge some foreigners a higher for a room - what cheats.. ROOM: the most rancid disgusting level of hell you could imagine. Cigarette butts on the foot, bits of food even! Even FRESH cigarette butts found (from cleaners i expect?) workmen drilling into our wall outside our widow looking in without any warning, dark, crammed. Smelly, sink came off wall and nearly fell on us, bath had big black stains on it, lights made a hum that drilled into your head. TV remote didn't work, TV didn't even work with more fuzz than picture. EXTRAS?: they even charge you if you make a FREE call!! How crazy is this?! We couldn't even phone our airline without being charged. Internet? NO! It's all paid for with your credit card by the minute. (free internet was in McDonalds next door). Ridiculous prices. TO TOP IT OFF: ....BEDBUGS! I had to sleep with my clothes on as I kept getting bitten. Yes, that's right and there are plenty of other posts and pictures proving this. I expect the lovely people hanging outside the hotel bring in their homeless crack lady's who haven't washed to sleep in this bed. If I saw a gun imprint in the bed, I wouldn’t be surprised. I was lucky enough to have a fridge with DUST in the fridge. How the hell does dust survive in a fridge? By God's eyes it was there though. Only in Hotel Penn. PROOF?: i've uploaded videos and pictures. The hotel is so DARK because they want to hide the dust and cobwebs, the rust, the bits of food on the floor, the creepy crawly's crawling into your ears at night. Every day when we saw sunlight we rubbed our eyes outside the hotel and you could see people do this! It was quite funny. I don't care how cheap you can get this for, I don't care if you're just using this for a place to stay whilst you are shopping - I SLEPT AT THE AIRPORT AND IT WAS FAR BETTER! Yes, a hard floor, lights and the airport was so much better (and cheaper) than staying at this rancid place that should be turned into something more useful like a rock or a water fountain. Stranded from volcanic Ash, the mayor of NY requested all hotels lower the prices for those stranded. Did this hotel? No. I wouldn't stay here if the hotel paid me. Every night When i swatted myself fully clothed, i shivered with the thought i was in this godforsaken place and wondered why the world is so cruel that this place exists on earth. Sleeping felt like like lying in a pool of vomit in the dark with screaming kids and drilling being playing in the background. I don't even have the words to describe the experience of staying here. Tom Hanks in cast away I'm sure would rather stay on his little island, stranded if he saw what i saw. There you go, no words can describe the horror of this place. It's been a few weeks on and I still have to wash out my eyes with bleach just to get the nightmareish images out of my head. The ripp of merchants of this place took our money and gave us only what the apocalypse could bring. Bless you all if you stay here or if you are, you are surely being punished by a higher being or possibly you have committed terrible crimes in a previous life which brings me to my final line - I wish i had so many unpaid parking tickets they put me in a cell which would have been a luxurious break compared to this hole in the ground.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: antrim_ian
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel from 24th April to 1st may . Seven nights for around £300. In a great location 10 to 15 minute walk to Times Square , 2 minutes from Macy's and less than 10 minutes from the Empire State building. Maids cleaned room daily and were always friendly. Room could have done with a coat of paint , but other than that the hotel was fine. The main downside for me was Lindy's bar as it was expensive and grubby , so i ate out in the Blarney Rock bar or Stout bar round the corner on 33rd street , which was much better value. The stout bar also had a great selection of beers on draught.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kirsty_Glenn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night on a stopover and loved the location. The hotel is dated but holds so much history. The room was small and tired looking. The airconditioner did not work and it was noisy with the window open. My husband loved the history about the hotel and would stay again as would I for the price and location. The bed was comfy and there was hot water so we were happy. Don't expect anything fancy just a place to sleep and shower - all that is required in New York.

Reviews.Title: “This was the worst hotel I have ever been...”
Reviews.Author: sideshowbob25
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel I have ever been at. The rooms are small and outdated, the bathrooms are dirty and small. The walls on the rooms have dirt and grim all over it. We up graded our room which was the Penn 5000 club, which gave us a not so better room and continental breakfast which was a bagal and Orange juice. Honestly we got treated better by the homeless guy down the street then they did. Do not stay there unless you want to throw away money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: LemonSherbet
Reviews.Content: Before we travelled, I read some hurrendous reviews about this hotel so by the time i arrived i did not have high hopes. We arrived late in the evening and there was no-one in line at the check in desk so within 5 minutes of arriving we were in our room. There were long ques at the desk at peek times however this was understandable and the desk usually had around 6 people working so the lines went down quickly. The staff at the desk were very friendly and welcoming. Our room was basic but clean and had everything we needed. The bathroom was spottless and was fully equiped with toiletries, towels, hairdryer, and plastic cups. The decor was a little outdated yes, but who goes to new york city to sit in their hotel room anyway!? All you need is a place to sleep and get showered and ready, and for this, our room was spot on. There were also vending machines selling drinks and snacks at the end of the hallway incase of the late night muchies which was useful! Location could not have been better!! The hotel is directly opposite Madison Square garden and within walking distance of most of the main attractions. Times square is a 10 minute walk, and central park, 20 at the most. The empire state building is a stones throw away, as are the shops on 5th avenue! We were even able to walk to the circle line pier on 12th avenue to catch a ferry ride around the island and to see the statue of liberty. We did not use the subway or taxis to get around, however if wanting to visit the financial district or battery park this would be neccessary. However, I would NOT reccomend Lindy's resteraunt at all. It cost us less to have dinner at the hard rock cafe in times square, than to eat breakfast in Lindys which looked a little tatty to say the least. After seeing the prices we got up, handed back the menus and left. Other than that, I have no complaints about the hotel at all, it was everything we needed for our stay. Its not luxury but for the price its fantastic, its in the best location possible and I would most definatly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “stay away”
Reviews.Author: irisblue55
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel i have ever stayed in. Even though the check in was quick and the person i was dealing with was very nice, i knew i made a mistake choosing this hotel when i saw the hall ways which were dark and dingy. The next thing were the doors which looked like coffins. The walls in the room had cracks the bathroom was ok but whole room had musty smell. The tv was broken no remote called the desk told me someone would be up to help me but 30 minutes later no one came had to go down to main reception desk to ask what happened to my request said someone would be there in a few minutes when they finally showed up they told me i would have to wait till next day to get a remote which to me is unexceptable.finally next day fixed it. Also be aware if you have a cold day and night they have no heat we froze this was in april. they told me it was the spring season so no heat. I could not believ it. The blanket on the bed is so thin never again will i stay there.

Reviews.Title: “It is a budget hotel in a big city, don't expect 5* and go out a lot!”
Reviews.Author: Petal_Traveller
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel with a group of 14 ladies on a four night break. I checked out the reviews on here before I travelled and adjusted my expectations before leaving home. This hotel is a 1700 room hotel which was built in the 1920's. The bathrooms have the original fittings and may not be up to modern standards. What it does have is a brilliant location and budget prices. We did swap rooms mid-stay and on this occasion the male receptionist was very helpful. We found that a 4 person room was two double (4'6") beds that were very bouncy and uncomfortable. Several members of our party (we had four rooms in total) saw 'roaches in most of the rooms. We managed an upgrade to a room with four doubles which was so much better, at little extra cost. All in all, you get what you pay for. If you want a modern swish hotel then this is NOT the hotel for you. If you want somewhere to use as a base and are on a budget then I'm sure you could do worse. There was plenty of hot water and the heating worked in our rooms. There weren't any tea making facilities but you could buy tea/coffee etc. from a shop in the foyer - which is always open. I would recommend to a friend, but only after I had lowered their expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Great Room Size - total arrogant unfriendly Eastern European woman on the reception desk.”
Reviews.Author: gaucimilano
Reviews.Content: Very basic Hotel in a great location at a good price. If I went with my first instinct at check-in and told the rude uneducated cow at reception what I thought of her communication skills (think Axe murderer..) I would have missed a good hotel. If you book the hotel check your room booking and rate by phone a few days before. Ask for a suite, it's the same size as and average 2 bedroom apartment. Avoid the red headed Russian woman at reception! Or seek her out if you are in the mood for an argument..

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good stay”
Reviews.Author: ber5408
Reviews.Content: I had the chance to bring my teenage daughter to the city to see FENCES with Denzel Washington and needed a place to stay one night. Room rates were high in the city and Hotel Pennyslvania had the lowest rates - $125 for 2 beds. I was wary since I was familar with its reputation but booked it. We were pleasantly surprised with the stay. We checked in at 6 pm and the check in line moved quickly, but a young lady named Raquel came and got us out of line and brought us to another area to check us in even quicker. She was very friendly and gave us some background about the hotel and how much she liked working there. (Really? How often does that happen?) Our room was what I had expected - but cleaner. It was simply furnished -2 beds a desk, dresser and nightstand with mismatched but functional furniture. Old style tv, but if you are coming to NYC to watch tv, you should stay home. The beds were twin beds but comfortable. The bathroom was clean but the paint was peeling and there was a bit of an odd stain on the ceiling. However, there was great water pressure and hot water right away. I was surprised at how quiet it was at night since the lobby is a loud, crowded town square sort of place. No coffee maker in the room but the coffee shop in the lobby had great coffee and a very friendly group of workers. We stored our bags for the day for $4 and that worked perfectly. We had a great breakfast at a small convience store/deli for $3 each just a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Do not go there! They prey on the desperate.”
Reviews.Author: Lindagreenacre
Reviews.Content: We, husband and I and couple of friends had spent a fantastic week in New York when we were stranded due to the volcano in Iceland. On Fri. 16 Apr. we were trying, using the internet, to find a hotel for 3 nights and there was little availability. We clicked to confirm our booking at The Pennsylvania when the site came back to say they had raised the price by 100 US$. profitting from people's desperation! When we arrived at the hotel we queued for at least an hour to check in for our superior non-smoking rooms. On reception there were portable smoke detectors available - that should have warned us. The rooms we were given were on the smoking floor (not as booked). No apology. Trying to find the rooms was not easy as the signing was inadequate and there are so many side corridors. The room doors look like prison cell doors. Once in the room we found that it was disgusting. The sink had two large cracks in it and no plug. The bath was dirty, chipped and peeling, the carpet was dirty, paint was peeling from the walls, the TV was ancient with a keyboard in the cabinet whose batteries had rotted. The telephone looked as if it had not been cleaned this century, the ceiling had numerous water stains. My husband asked the housekeeper for a sink plug. Four hours later we asked again and a light bulb was brought! Why? I phoned reception and asked to speak to the manager and said that I was not happy with the room and that it was not a superior room. He said that it was and when I said that if it was a superior room, I would like to see what an inferior one was like, he asked if I did not want a superior one. Yes, I did but that was not one. At that point he put the phone down on me. At midnight, somebody started vacuuming in the adjoining room - why?! The only good thing about this hotel is the location. Apart from that there is absolutely nothing to recommend it. There are no facilities in the room and the whole place disgusts me. This does not even deserve one star. Keep well away. Are there trading standards/inspectors of hotels in New York?

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneSwannies
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I have just returned home after staying here for 11 nights. I am not sure what people are expecting of a huge, once regal hotel in NY that offers a reasonable rate and prime location but we chose to stay here again after a problem free stay same time last year. This year we had a lovely room with a view down 33rd st and it was spacious, clean and towels immaculate and changed every day. The signs of age are apparent but for the little time spent in a hotel room in NY, why are there so many people that knock this place? Several years ago we stayed in a more expensive hotel in NY and the room was so tiny we couldn't open our cases on the floor. This is a very good option for people who want an inexpensive, spacious, clean room in the best ever location in NY, but if you are going to be a whinger and pick at every little thing then go pay a lot more elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Worst ever, Don't do it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: gfus420
Reviews.Content: This place does appear to be like a train station when you walk in and the check in line is very busy with rude staff. When I checked in the lady gace me a room on the 2nd floor which is the lowest but that's cool. So I get out the elevator and think I have travelled back in time like 30 years with a strange smell and dirty old carpets with old paint on the walls. I have felt like I have made a huge mistake by booking this place. Then the room was so dirty and foggy windows with a dumpster below it and then the old sheets and dirty tub and horrible shower. Then I saw 3 cockroaches the size of my finger! I ended up getting a suite upgraded to me but that was a shower with missing tiles and still a horrible room, DO NOT STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “The Horror”
Reviews.Author: BC1358
Reviews.Content: I got a room for $189 and after spending a night in this dump, I suggest you keep your money and find a nice park bench instead. This hotel might have been nice 50 years ago, when they last likely renovated it. They are understaffed. I had to wait in line for over 45 minutes to check in. The room, while decent sized, had dirty carpet and walls not painted in several years, the furniture was old, cheap, banged up and I had a table in the room that shook every time I typed on my laptop it was so flimsy, the room smelled of stale smoke and the bathroom had cracked tiles, bad plumbing and a toilet that was bolted to the floor crooked so that you couldn't sit on it squarely. It boots a free breakfast. HA! You go to the 12th floor to a former room that has a few tables set up where you can pour yourself a glass of (bad) OJ, a tray with few rolls on it and a TV in the corner with a few seats around. A bad joke doesn't even begin to describe it. Stay away from this place if you have any standards at all.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T DO IT”
Reviews.Author: ice_dancers
Reviews.Content: I was one of the unfortunate people stranded in New York with my son and two friends, when the Volcano erupted in Iceland. We booked for several nights as we didn't know when we would be leaving. We stayed 1 night and couldn't wait to get out of the place. I first thought I was walking into the ticket office at Central Station, no correction, Central Station was much nicer. The hotel was old (which I could have lived with) but the room they put us in was awful. The windows were so dirty you couldn't see through them, the walls were grubby and in need of a coat of paint, the furniture was just a mismatch, and the beds were hard The shower was dreadful with missing tiles

Reviews.Title: “You gotta take the good with the bad”
Reviews.Author: WesternMassMom
Reviews.Content: My 10-year-old daughter and I stayed at the Hotel Pennslvania overnight in April 2010. The location was perfect-literally right next ot Penn Station, so we literally walked off the train and right into the hotel. It's close to Macy's, The Empire State Building, Herald Square, and Times Square. And there's subway stations around every corner for the places that aren't so close. And for the price, you can't beat it. The room (and the hotel) was a little dingy and old, but the room itself was clean, and the bathroom was adequate-we were just in the room to sleep and shower. After checking out early in the morning, we were able to check our suitcase for the day for only four dollars, and they didn't even charge me for the bag I had attached to the suitcase. The only thing I didn't like about this hotel was the front desk service. It took over an hour to check in and to check out, and the front desk staff member I dealt with (twice) was really rude-at one point she called a guest a name ( starts with "b" and rhymes with itch) and everyone standing in line heard her. Maybe if they had more than three people manning the front desk, there wouldn't be such a long line all the time, and the front desk staff wouldn't be so surly. Overall, the hotel was pretty much what I expected a New York City hotel to be, at that price level (we paid just over $100 for the night.) If you're looking for a hotel room to hang out and relax in, or something upscale and modern, then this isn't the hotel for you. But if you want a place to sleep and shower and store your suitcase, then Hotel Pennsylvania is a good choice. Just leave plenty of time in your schedule for check-in and check-out, and don't expect service with a smile-this is New York City, after all.

Reviews.Title: “Not all that bad”
Reviews.Author: NickCT63
Reviews.Content: I was a little tentative about this place after reading the reviews below. Having completed my stay, I have to say, I didn't think the place was all that bad. Allot of reviews mention a crazy wait at check-in. I arrived at ten o'clock, and had to wait 5-10 minutes in line, followed by a 5-10 minute check-in. I waited in line to check-out (you can do express checkout but I needed to check bags), and had to wait about 15 minutes (the actual checkout process took a minute). The check-in desk was certainly slow, but I wouldn't say it was egregiously so. The room was a little delapidated (i.e. ancient hvac system, poor bathroom tiling, apparent minor water damage in one or two places, a couple spots of pealing paint), but I didn't get the impression that it was unclean. The continental breakfast was served to too many guests in too small a room. In conclusion, this was probably a firm 2 star hotel, and I think it offer reasonable value for money (especially given the location). I'm going to be generous and give it 3, simply because so many other reviewers here seem predisposed to be critical.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: molliemouse
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. The staff were terrible, the room was filthy and the shower didn't work. The hotel also feels less than secure. Awful experience. I even paid to fly home a day early to avoid another night in this fleapit. If you are visiting NY for a break/holiday, staying here will ruin it. There are plenty of better hotels in NY for a similar price.

Reviews.Title: “What A Dump”
Reviews.Author: jezebell
Reviews.Content: We arrived as a party of 2 adults and 5 children at 1.00pm to be told at reception that the room was scheduled to be ready at 3.00pm so we could not have the room key. We were told to come back at 2.00pm. At 2.00pm after queuing for another 15mins in the check in line we were told that the room was still not ready and to wait until 3.00pm. We were not allowed to use the toilets in the hotel during this 2 hour wait until we had a room key. When I eventualy received the room key I used the gents toilets in the basement which were smelly, undermaintained and decorated. There were no locks on the cubicle doors so it was a case of feet up to block the door! The reception staff were not very pleasant and the bell staff were unhelpful and almost rude. We had booked two rooms for the seven of us in the family. Four of us were allocated to stay in room 504 and the other three in room 417. Room 504 for the older males was poor but just about bearable to save the hassle of complaining. We had though only one large bed for the three males. I asked for an extra bed at 4.30pm and was told to leave it with them. I arrived back in my room at 9.30pm to find no extra bed. At 9.45pm a camp bed arrived which was pushed through the door for self assembly. The air con was noisy and mouldy. The room must have not been decorated for years. It smelled musty and the fittings and soft furnishings were old and worn out. The bath was dirty and so too were the windows. Room 417 for the females and my 5 year old son was not bearable. It reminded me of a soup kitchen hostel. There were holes in the curtains and the beadspread. The bathroom was not cleaned adequately with hairs and traces of blood and brown stuff (goodness knows what it was) on the floors. There were only 2 small double beds for four people. My partner insisted on a move to another room and was allocated Room 489. Room 489 was marginally better but when preparing for bed at 10.00pm the sink started to leak like a tap all over the bathroom floor. She was transferred eventually to Room 1618A. This was a much better room and was adequate in terms of size for four people at least it was clean however there was only two small beds but an extra one was provided at no extra cost. The decor was still however poor and the light didnt work and the inside of the bath was chipped away. Our stay At Hotel Pennsylvania was a big disappointment and detracted a lot from our trip to New York. In my opinion it's underinvested, undermaintained, badly managed and milked to death.

Reviews.Title: “Brace yourself!”
Reviews.Author: MrsVleP
Reviews.Content: I have travelled extensively over the last 20 years and this is possibly the worst hotel I have ever encountered. It desperately needs a multi-million dollar refurbishment - either that or demolition! I'm amazed it hasn't been closed already for health and safety reasons. Most of the sockets are hanging off the walls. One of my colleagues had a dodgy socket in the bathroom with evidence of a previous fire all around it. Once you get through one of the prison cell doors, the furnishings are old and dirty. My bedside lamp didn't work; the TV didn't work; the carpet was filthy round the edges; the towels were brown with rust from the towel rails and the whole room smelled of damp and putrid air freshener. There is no room service - not that you'd want to spend any time in any of these rooms. IT'S HORRIBLE!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel experience i've ever encountered”
Reviews.Author: trucolors68
Reviews.Content: It is in a great location but the hotel room itself is horrible. if your there for more than one night that is not the hotel you will want to stay in. The hotel room offers nothing inside except a clock. The window is propped open and doesn't even have a screen on it to keep the bugs out. Bugs were in the room and the paint was chipped off the wall. This hotel needs to be remodeled. In the heart of downtown manhattan i was at lost for WORDS.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!!”
Reviews.Author: peachshelba
Reviews.Content: I must admit I was SO anxious about staying in this hotel after reading all the reviews especially as i'd booked the whole trip (including the hotel) as a surprise for my partners 30th birthday!! To be honest it' not a five star experience but you definitely get what you pay for... our room was adequate for the purpose of coming back from a full day of sightseeing and going to sleep!! We had no problems checking in but came to realise that we must've been quite lucky as every time we came down to the lobby it seemed to be packed full of large groups queing. The location is excellent especially if you get the train from the airport, it's close to the subway & more importantly the shops!!

Reviews.Title: “Patience is a virtue”
Reviews.Author: benny01720
Reviews.Content: Check in took over one hour, as a long line of weary travelers watched only two busy desk clerks man eight workstations. Fortunately, there was a wall of TV screens showing news bites, etc. Better, they should have scrolled short novels. That said, rooms were clean and comfortable. One does not book a hotel in NYC to sit around in it! Basement men's room opposite the luggage storage area (great for sight-seeing after check out) was truly scary. Must have been used as a location for recent NYC horror-thriller. Staff was friendly, though. The location is great for all sorts of perambulations...just blocks north of the West Village and south of Times Square. GREAT PRICE...NYC less than $100/nite! yes!

Reviews.Title: “Very central-across the street from Madison Square Garden”
Reviews.Author: LindyP2010
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very central it is across the street from Madison Square Garden, the hotel is less than a 5 min walk from Times Square. There is a subway station right by the hotel. It is 10 min walk from the Port Authority where buses to Jersey Gardens Oulet shopping centre depart from. Penn Station is across the street from the hotel. If u want a very central hotel this is it. The room was ok, the bathroom was very old fashioned like something out of the 70's. It is a no frills option, it's the budget option. The view from the window was of a wall on either side. The room didnt get much light, it was very dark. There is a lots of bars and restaurants nearby outside of the hotel complex. The restaurant in the hotel is very expensive, the bar Stout is an Irish bar and restaurant it is brill, extremely helpful staff, really lively bar, a lot of ppl seem to stop in there on their way home from work and ppl call in there before going to watch games in Madison Square Garden. The food was very good value, would definitely recommend calling into Stouts. There's an Old Navy store right be the hotel and Stouts. The concierge was helpful, recommended us not paying to go the boat trip to see the Statue of Liberty and to take the subway to Staten island ferry port and take the free ferry across to Staten island which goes past the Statue of Liberty, it cost us $4 between us to take the subway way cheaper than the other options

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: SophistiCatIreland
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel at the start and finish of our holidays in the states, we paid more then the basic rate for the first three nights and got a lovely room on the 11th floor, it was spacious, clean and very quiet. On our return stay we paid less and we got a smaller room on a lower floor, not the best room but I thought it was fair, considering the fantastic location and how cheap the hotel was. If you like fresh paint and a spacious room, then dont go for the cheapest room available, you really do get what you paid for here ! The location of this hotel was soo good, we walked everywhere. It was perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “Thus far in my 34 years of life I have...”
Reviews.Author: Grkmellie
Reviews.Content: Thus far in my 34 years of life I have yet to stay in a hotel as disgusting and unsanitary as the Hotel Pennsylvania !! They should change the name to the flop house motel ,.. Dirty , loud , crazy people running the halls day and night ! The rooms were dirty , the beds made noise and were not stable , the sheets had stains and so did the bathroom walls ! The toilet was filthy and had been left without flushing and the tile in the shower was coming up all over the floor !! Thank God we only had one night here but we changed rooms 3 times and they were all disgraceful !!

Reviews.Title: “Nice old hotel undeserving of negative comments! An honest review...”
Reviews.Author: JKF56
Reviews.Content: This is not a cookie cutter chain hotel. It was built in 1919. For some, those travellers used to a generic hotel that can be found anywhere in the U.S, this might bother them. A lot of the common areas are older in appearance, but are not really run down nor dirty. There are 1,700 rooms here, with a lobby constantly full of people, and yes, only a few desk clerks. Seriously, how fast and easy do you think checking in and out that many people, often with language difficulties, large tour/school groups, etc., would be for the staff? Honestly, there were 10 people in front of me and I was planning to sit for an hour or more based on other reviews. Surprisingly, check in was less than 15 minutes. All of the staff I encountered were friendly including maintenance who did have to plug my TV back in. The a/c unit was also unplugged, as well as the phone. Go figure. Maintenance came in less than 10 minutes after I called and fixed everything. Room was very clean and dust free even in the corners. Bathroom tile and sink looked almost brand new. The room was also quiet. With the a/c on, I did not even hear street noise, or hallway noise at all. If I had anything to complain about it would be the room could have used painting, but with a hotel doing this much business in volume, it's probably just from the wear and tear. For the price and location, I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Stay here for the lower price, location, decent facilities, and enjoy New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Bates Motel”
Reviews.Author: freespiritFlorida
Reviews.Content: This is the worst place I have ever seen! Small discusting rooms with old small beds that must never have been replaced in the last century. The bathroom was small and the outlets were cracked and barely held up on the wall. The walls were dirty not even a paint job could help this room. The a/c unit didnt turn on to circulate air and the windows didn't open. The rooms and hallways were dark and scary. I took my teenage daughter and got the hell out of there!! Never stay here if your looking for a decent bed, bathroom, lighting, security, peace of mind, or a nice trip! The pictures online for this Hotel are nothing like what you will be getting. This place is a rat hole!!!

Reviews.Title: “This place is a dump!”
Reviews.Author: NYCtravel10
Reviews.Content: All these reviews are right, this place is all about location. Be prepared when you go in to be deceived by the lobby. As soon as you get off the elevator you know you made a bad decision. Welcome to a scene from The Shinning. As you proceed down the hallway you'll pass door after door that look like coffins. The room instantly smelled like urine and the cigarette burned comforter was nasty. We took it off the bed immediately. The rooms are small and noisy. You can easily hear your neighbors. On the flip side, the staff was nice and friendly. Note: we did not stay in a renovated review.

Reviews.Title: “Low price, great location, free breakfast for $105!”
Reviews.Author: MarilynMJohnson
Reviews.Content: We arrived by Tripper bus from DC at 10:30 pm on Thursday, 2/25/10. There was a long check-in line and two clerks. It took about 25 minutes to complete the checkin. Went to the assigned room and it had not been made up. Two phone calls and another 25 minutes later we were taken to another room. It had two double beds, not the king we had requested, but was a lovely, large room with a view of the street below. The TV didn't work, but a plug had fallen out. The next morning, the free breakfast was quite excellent. We were able to arrange a shuttle to JFK that picked us up at a side door of the hotel. We paid $105. Considering the location in NYC, we did not mind the small inconveniences we had experienced and would certainly stay there again without hesitation. We had asked for a renovated room based on advice in this forum.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room- slow service”
Reviews.Author: finnmann
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a night here and it was fine. Checking in seemed a difficult process as there was a line of 10+ but the staff was slow and just shuffling papers. Not a good first impression. Beyond that - the room was nice for New York (small) but clean. The location is great for Penn Station and the garden right across the street. I got a great internet rate and with that in mind it was a nice stay. This is a large hotel and it seems the staff is dis interested in welcoming guests and showing nice manners.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, large clean room with...”
Reviews.Author: Ejn0617
Reviews.Content: Great location, large clean room with dated furniture. Pleasant surprise

Reviews.Title: “location good/hotel tired”
Reviews.Author: viplosh
Reviews.Content: We travelled to New York for a short family visit and used the Pennsylvania as our base. We have stayed there before and thought that as the hotel had changed names it may have been re-vamped and therefore updated. WRONG.. The Lobby area had been brought up to date, staff not overly helpful. Seemed that if you asked them anything it was a bit of an effort to help. We were given a room on the 8th floor which obviously had not been used for a while,as very strong smell of damp as we walked in. They had painted the room but by the front door you could see where the damp patch had been and they had just painted over it. Not even tried to hide it. The bathroom was small but we had no hot water when we first arrived and had to call house keeping to send someone up to sort that out. After a 8 hour flight and long delays at Newark Airport all you want when you get to the hotel is a decent shower/bath with hot water. The trick... let the shower run for 5-10 mins before you want a shower then you should be ok. The walls of the rooms are paper thin so if you have noisy neighbours dont expect to much sleep. Yes I hear you say why didnt we change rooms ... no can do as the hotel was very busy. Good point dont eat at Lindy's restaurant in the hotel for breakfast very expensive. We found a really nice diner up the road on 7th and 35th (I think) called Andrew's .. half the price and the food and service was really nice I suppose the main thing to say about this hotel is good location but the hotel needs a lot of T L C.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay At This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Clangley13
Reviews.Content: Hotel Pennsylvania over charged me a day's stay after I checked out and also for a movie I never watched. When I complained and sent a bank statement showing I was in London drawing cash at Heathrow airport at the time they said I was at the hotel -- you will scarcely believe this but it is true -- they claimed I had paid someone to go to Heathrow, with my cash card and pin number! to draw money from a cash machine so I could pretend I was not at the hotel. That is the kind of place it is, and those are the kind of gangsters running it. It is also not very smart and not very clean. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES. Charles Langley

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel have been across”
Reviews.Author: brownsugar97
Reviews.Content: the worst hotel Icame across so far. all the money have been spent in "the bling bling" lobby. Front desk staff not friendly at all especially if you are a foreigner even if speak good english. Looks like a FACTORY to me...very old dirty and noisy room.... STAY AWAY from the pennsylvania if you've got a minimum of standard !!!

Reviews.Title: “Fab location Hotel Penn”
Reviews.Author: BABYCHUCKS
Reviews.Content: have been to nyc 7 time already since 2004 and have stayed in pennsylvannia hotel everytime the hotel is clean and staff are friendly. the hotel is in a great location right accross from madison square gardens and macys is on the corner. empire state building is behind you and time square and 5th avenue are 10 mins away. you could'nt pick a better hotel unless like paris hilton your loaded. never had any complaints about the hotel there cleaned everyday would'nt pay money for brand hotels as they are all the same and i could think of better things to spend the money on when all you do is sleep in the room as your always out. All in all its a great hotel great location would reccomend to anyone. ++++++++++

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is all about location, not about the room.”
Reviews.Author: JaneHill
Reviews.Content: This hotel is all about location, location, location, its located directly across from Maddison Square Garden and a stone's throw from Macy's & Times Square. On arrival to hotel, its is very plush but be prepared for a shock when you go to your room, they are very basic & old but like I said its all about location. The rooms are closed but really really old. On the day I arrived to hotel, the front desks systems were down, so i had a 2 hr wait before i could check in, the queue was out the door. I would stay here again, purely because of its location, It is not ideal for a romantic getaway. The hotel is a base for dropping off the shopping bags or somewhere to lay your head for a few hours.
