And thats all you need when your in New York, its a city that doesn't sleep, your not planning on staying in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Smackbang in the centre and cheap!!”
Reviews.Author: johnboy1985
Reviews.Content: I went for St Patricks Day with my mate. We had a ball and even though the hotel is a bit antwacky you are never in you room. NYC is not about the hotel its about walking round siteseeing and embracing the city that never sleeps!!! For you girls its next door to Macys and a 10-15 minute walk from 5th ave and the shops!!

Reviews.Title: “dirty dirty dirty”
Reviews.Author: bunnyboy46
Reviews.Content: stayed in this DUMP 5 nights 'that could be a record' with friends16th-21st of march. i kid you not 4 hours in line to check in. thats after a 10 hour flight. i would safely say the staff never got a training day in their life, so rude and totally ignorant its beond words. finally got so called rooms on 3rd floor. i nearly fainted when i looked in. now i stayed in hotels all over the world and put up with all sorts but this place takes the biscuit. its filth every inch of it. i'm sure any american who stayed here is very embarrest. it was my friends first visit to the usa and it was not pleasant to say the least. its to late to send in the leigons of cleaners thats required just tear it down. its not a hotel. i felt cleaner sitting on a bench in central park. as for the safety boxes thats a laugh too you will have a job getting your own money from them because the staff are get this 'to busy'. please guys dont bring your wife or espically kids to this dump. i showered at a friends house in queens every second day. if you like filth and grime you'll fit right in other wise stay in a bin in central park its cleaner i mean that. i love new york city and will be back but not in this dump

Reviews.Title: “Bad, but not that bad”
Reviews.Author: tourist_Specialist
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd hotel in NYC. after the nice hotel park 79, we got to Pennsylvania hotel. we were amazed by the long queue to check in. we waited something like 45 minutes. the apathetic receptionist said that they just got a new computer system and that is why the queue is long. after 2 days when we saw the line is empty we believed him. but there is no excuses for the rude receptionist. the rooms looks like from the 70's. the bed is ok, not more than that. There is no free wifi . there's wifi only downstairs and you need to pay for it you get what you paid for. it is in a great location and the rooms are ok. not the Ritz but still ok. in NYC I come to travel and see the city. in the hotel I only sleep so I dont mind that it looks like from the 70's... when we checked out the receptionist was very nice, so I guess it is luck. bottom line - if you want a very nice hotel - its not the place for you. if you want a basic place in a good location - go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location..that's it”
Reviews.Author: GizemU
Reviews.Content: So I picked this hotel because it was close to Times Square and across the street from Madison Square Garden and close to Penn Station. When you first walk into the hotel, it's very nice and looks fancy, but then you go to your room and it's completely different. There was a nightstand and a desk and they were covered in dust. The beds only have flat sheets, so if you toss and turn at night, the sheets come off the bed, oh and there were tears in the sheets and holes in the blanket. I was there for four days and they only vacuumed once and the hair dryer was broken. So yeah..GREAT location, but that's about it..

Reviews.Title: “absolutely the pits!!!”
Reviews.Author: groovyma68
Reviews.Content: the hotel looked grand from the outside but inside was dropping to bits. rooms n corridors were scuffed old and dirty looking plaster hole 3ft x 2ft on 14th floor, rooms were shocking paint coming off the ceiling,cracked basin in bathroom and to top it all bath tap came off in my hand. oh and i forgot draught in the room window was stuffed with loo paper my advise dont go there i asked for a upgrade and what i described above was the upgrade!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location but...”
Reviews.Author: Shh1066
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel on a Monday evening. We were greeted by a porter who took care of our bags..good first impressions. Hotel lobby quite modern but never seen a hotel as busy before! The whole stay it was always packed with people checking-in and checking-out 24/7! Rooms were very dated but however somewhat clean. Bathroom was abit disappointing and not pleasant but didnt complain. It was bearable. Rooms were very large with lots of space. We stayed on the 4th floor..the view was non existent unless you count a courtyard full of rubbish! Rooms on the right side of the corridor looked out onto 7th Avenue and you could sit and watch the taxis going up and down. Friends stayed in this room and have to say it was much better than ours. I believe some rooms are better than others, its just pot luck! Hotel location was unbeatable - directly over the road from Penn Station and Madison Square Gardens. Macys 2min up the road! Walked uptown to Times Sqaure a few times which can be down in 10-15minutes otherwise a taxi would cost about 4-5dollars. Overall, if you are after a budget trip to NYC, stay here. Brilliant location, hotel not outstanding but its fine.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: 25London
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Pennsylvania for 4 nights in March. Was standing in check in que for 30 minutes just to meet rude receptionist. Was given twin room on 3rd floor. The room was tiny and there was damp on the wall with small two single beds. Went downstairs to change a room. Was given bigger room, but still not up to good standard. Room was cold, bathroom needed refurbisment. Doors looked like from prison cells and carpet was dirty. Although we had non smoking room we could smell cigarrets from next room. Hotel is far too big with unfriendly staff. I would never ever stay in this hotel again or recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “don't expect much, you'll be very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: leolabird
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we stayed there and both nights woken up by loud kids. They know they got you because it is cheap for the city. We waited in line over an hour to check in and they had 2 sometimes 3 people working the desk. There was no New York hustle going on there. The bathroom tub was peeling apart, the tub plug fixture hanging.There was a rubber stopper on the edge of the tub just in case you would want to take a bath. Black mold on the ceiling. One of the legs holding up the sink was lying on the floor behind the toilet. The hair dryer did not work and had to call for another one. The mirror was just about hanging on, you could see the inside wall. There was the old steam radiator in the bathroom, had to be original. It was all rusty and rust stains on the floor beneath it. I'm use to the hotel asking "how was your stay?", not here. They either don't care or don't have time for a long list. We paid $4 to have our bag held after check out so we can still spend the day in the city.That was convienient, however, when my husband went over to a table to fill out the ticket, a worker came by and rudely said he should not be writing there. It was a laminate table, you have got to be kidding! As if it was going to make a difference. Let me show you the bathroom. We put up with the appearance, you get what you pay for. But, I will not be back because you were rude and that has more of a lasting impression on me.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, that's about it.”
Reviews.Author: LarryLarnaca
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is the only positive thing I can think of. The lobby was nice, that's about it for the inside. We arrived during the Westminster Kennel Club dog show across the street at Madison Square Garden, my wife and I were one of the lucky ones, it took around an hour for us to be checked in, others 2 hours plus. There were only 4 clerks on duty, but there appeared to be about 6-8 unattended stations, this was due to bad planning on the part of management, when you are expecting a large number of check-ins you need the staff to take care of the customers. The clerk was friendly, but rather stressed. (BTW, most of the guests were checking in with their dogs, no problem with me, they were beautiful, well behaved animals and I am a dog person.) As we made our way to the room, we walked through long dingy corridors and found our room, plaster and paint were peeling in the bathroom, the shower didn't work...it did have a bath though. The bed room was also in need of a paint job, a little paint can do a lot to freshen up the atmosphere. The bed was ok. When we turned on the heating it made a terrible racket, so we left it off. The TV worked, but there was no program guide in our room to identify the channels, so you had to flip through them all to find ABC, CBS, etc. The hotel is in desperate need of modernization, it has probably been decades since it was last renovated. It's basically a tired old hotel. To top it off, it was freezing and snowy in the city, can't blame that on the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: calmidlands
Reviews.Content: very old hotel needed up dating, you get what you pay for. hotel internal pictures misleading.

Reviews.Title: “A taste of old New York - before the Times Square cleanup”
Reviews.Author: RStokes
Reviews.Content: Some people feel that New York has been too cleaned up - but if you miss the old grit and edge, you'll get a sense of it here at the Hotel Pennsylvania. I havent stayed here for several years but unless it has been seriously renovated and changed, this is a seriously depressing place to stay. Rooms are gloomy and filthy - no idea what the food is like here as the room quality gives no incentive to try it. On the upside, the location is convenient for Penn Station and Madison Square Garden and its reasonably priced for New York.

Reviews.Title: “dreary old fashioned hotel”
Reviews.Author: lee911
Reviews.Content: stayed there for 5 nights in march. lobby was fine but was disgusted when we got to the room. it was small, dark, dirty, the window wouldn't open, the air vent in the bathroom was broken. had to ask for a room change immediately, was moved to a bigger room at no extra expense. this was cleaner and bigger but very old fashioned and badly needs to be updated. staff were not very helpful at any stage. location was great. wouldn't recommend it to any friends, and wouldn't stay there again if i return to new york.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - hotel poor”
Reviews.Author: downunder007
Reviews.Content: Don't expect service, the hotel is in a good location but that is about it - the bathroom vents had so much dust so no air was getting in or out - a real health hazzard. from a traveller New South Wales, Australia

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location and price, with clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: AllAmericanGirlv1
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Pennsylvania offers the perfect package for a trip to NYC--great location, great price, and nice, clean rooms. It is right across the street from Macy's and Madison Square Garden, 10 blocks from Times Square, and less than a block from Penn Station trains and metro stop. The rooms weren't especially fancy, but they were nice and clean. The staff came and switched out the towels every day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: HHHHH_10
Reviews.Content: Hotel Penn is in an IDEAL location its a 5 minute walk to times square, its opposite madison square gardens and penn station. Its a 2 minute walk to the biggest department store in the world MACYS. The empire state building is visible from very near the hotel and is not very far away. If you're going to new york to do shopping then a hotel in this location is ideal. When you walk through the lobby the place looks beautiful! HOWEVER the rooms are in a bad state of disrepair. the rooms themselves are ok but the bathrooms are awful. so awful that we asked to be moved to another room. we moved twice before we were given an acceptable bathroom the room was a lot better but the view was non existent. i would still recommend this hotel is its in a great location and i didnt see any other hotels that were as close to all the things i listed above.

Reviews.Title: “If it was left up to the staff, I would probably still be in that queue now...”
Reviews.Author: LostTravellator
Reviews.Content: I was spending 24 hours in New York following a conference in New Haven and, though I had been warned by the other reviews I had read here about this hotel, i was in a 30 minute queue to check in and found this to be so fustrating and unacceptable because they have a huge check-in desk, but never more than one person on it at a time, though there appear to be loads of staff loitering around. They even have barriers to manage the queue like at the airport! when I finally did check in the one staff on duty was efficient (so to speak -how long does it take to check someone in?) and was able to find me a room even though it was not check in time, but he was not very friendly, I felt I had to really push him to give me a room. I have stayed in hotels the world over, I am a student so always choose the cheapest hotels i can find and i know what you get for your money -i have been to NYC before so know that for $80 you can get a rather dire room and I was prepared for all of that however, I was not prepared to be repeatedly told i had to wait to pay, that i couldnt pay yet, that i had to come back in the morning to pay etc etc -having seen the speed of service at check in I was not eager to embroil myself in that at check out, so once more i had to insist that they take my money which is an annoying thing to do when you basically have no time and do not want to spend it in a hotel lobby. The room once i got it was fine, completely as you would expect for such a price. for the room alone i would stay again but because of the rudeness of the staff i think i will pass. It is very central and can be very cheapif you get a good rate, and now you know why. On my next trip to New York, I will probably not spend any more money but choose somewhere less central. I have stayed in much better hotels, if further away, before. Stay here only if you REALLY dont mine the incompetency of their systems.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare Hotel - rude staff, dirty/damp rooms and complete rip off with phonecalls”
Reviews.Author: Carrie106
Reviews.Content: This is by far the worst hotel I have ever stayed in.. Myself and friend stayed here for 5 days..when we first arrived at our hotel room, the first thing to hit us was the smell of damp from the room, we actually dropped our bags and headed to the nearest chemist to get an air fresher, whilst unpacking we noticed the dingy brown carpets were damp, even at that we determined to make the best out of our holiday and put up with the conditions, the final straw came when part of the ceiling actually collapsed whilst we were in bed..when we rang reception to complain, they asked us to come down to the reception, when we explained what had happened, we did not even get an apology from the receptionist, we were just hadnt another room key, there was actually no conversation from the receptionist throughout, we were treated like we were bothering them, but isnt that their job!!! We were moved to the 11th floor, the room still had the same decor, but was in a better condition, no damp carpets, dingy smell or collapsed ceilings!! We travelled from Ireland..throughout the stay, I made 4 phonecalls home, comprising of a 4, 11, 10 and 3 minute conservations, when we checked out, I nearly fainted to find out the charge was over $300, we I objected to this, the receptionist was completely rude and kept saying 'its what THEY charge', but did not give me the name of the phone company, I was even charged for calls that did not connect..I was charged $24 dollars per call dialled that didnt even connect, I had a total of 3 calls like this..I had no other option but to pay, there was no room for negotiation with the receiption, she was completely abrupt and rude, not sympathetic, considering my bill for the week was $400 for the room and another $300 for phonecalls, complete rip off - when I questioned the rates, I was abruptly told the rate are on the phones on the rooms, WHICH THEY ARE NOT, If I was given a free holiday to stay in this hotel again, I WOULD GLADLY DECLINE - NIGHTMARE

Reviews.Title: “NYC”
Reviews.Author: swannydude
Reviews.Content: Good time was had by the whole family... Shows, Conan, Museums, Yankees, Music...

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as everyone says!”
Reviews.Author: Mandisha24
Reviews.Content: We had a Penn 5000 King suite on the 11th floor. The room was old, yes, but it was clean. The bed was comfortable as well. We came in later in the evening so we didnt really have a huge wait to check in. We didnt come to New York to sit in our hotel room so the dated atmosphere of the hotel didnt bother us. I did have a slightly rude operator when I called down to the desk with a question but it was just the "typical" New Yorker attitude! The little cafe downstairs has the best chai tea latte. The weird part is that they are cash only. Overall, I would stay in this hotel again if I were in the King Suite. Its about the same size as a small-ish regular sized hotel room so its not as cramped as the other rooms sound.

Reviews.Title: “when was that photo taken!!!”
Reviews.Author: LisaFife_Scotland
Reviews.Content: Looked lovely on the website, not quite like that in real life, hence the title. Fabulous location, but my room was a bit worn. Had previously been in the lobby, thought that next time I visited New York, I would like to stay in the hotel. Stayed 2 nights, had a good stay, toilet dripped all night, absolutely no view, well of the wall of the next part of the hotel, which made the room dark all the time. I suppose not every room can have a view. Took an eternity to book in, staff were friendly enough though

Reviews.Title: “Huge Rat in Prestigious Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KarinS2
Reviews.Content: I was suppose to stay in this hotel for one week paying $375 a day. The room was filled with antique furniture, the bed was creaking with every move, the curtains were weird looking like sommething from the 1940s. The only thing I liked about this hotel was the deep antique tub, and that is was across the street from Madison Square Garden. The second day of my stay there was a problem though. I was walking through the hall going for a late nut beer, and as I was approaching the elevator, a huge rat was crawling against the side of the wall. Then it squeezed underneath the nearest room door. OMG! I was so creeped out. I have NEVER seen a rat before and I NEVER seen a rat that big! I went over to Penn Station had pizza and beer and caught the train on up to Rochester.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE - what a dump!”
Reviews.Author: cookie81Ireland
Reviews.Content: Im just back from NYC - do not stay in this hotel. On the first day we walked into our 'superior' room and the most disgusting smell greeted us. We had to go to a chemist and buy an air freshener! Back in the room we notice about 3 square feet of dingy carpet was saturated over by the radiator that never worked (room freezing throughout our stay) and finally the ceiling caved in! A lump fell down and missed my open suitcase by inches and Ive photos of it! I also noticed there was more rust in the bathroom than actual chrome. When we asked to be moved rooms we were told go back down to reception and re-check in. So we had to get dressed, pack up out stuff go back down to reception and didnt get an apology or an acknowledgement of what had just happened. The 2nd 'superior' room we moved into was much better on the 11th floor yet the 1st one on the 9th floor was a sh!t heap! The staff were extrememly rude and the only thing that concerns them is getting money off you - I was hugely disappointed and have vowed to NEVER stay here again. I stayed here 5 years ago and it was no problem but this place has seriously gone downhill in every way - rooms, staff, service etc. Trust me you will be glad you didnt stay here, take my advice I learned a very hard and expensive way!

Reviews.Title: “Very surprised at the condition”
Reviews.Author: paulhis
Reviews.Content: The moment I entered the lobby and see how dirty it was, I was not surprised when I saw the hallways with trash on the floor. I asked for another room because the TV did not work, my blanket had a large stain, the bathroom had hair on the floor and in the tub. I was afraid to take off my shoes for the 2 days I stayed there. After a room change, I asked to be given back the same room I went to first and have the blanket changed. My thing is we all know the property is old. But it do not have to be DIRTY. Maintenance came to fix the remote/TV twice and it worked for a minute and the stop, tried operating manually and the buttons do not work. I press channel and the volume goes down......nice location but dirty - housekeeping staff needs to be addressed. They are doing a poor job. There was a homeless lady sleeping in the lobby, but on that note it was cold outside so I had no problem with that. The housekeepers are noisy and they keep so much dirty linen pile high on there carts, A horrible sight down the hallway-guest and kids walking by and the housekeepers seem to use bleach, you could smell it in the hallways and also see where the carpet is stained from the bleach. The coffee shop had the pastry uncovered (only covered to the front but open towards the attendant) However I must say my breakfast at Lindy's was great and Yen at the front desk receptionist was very professional and accommodating. Bottomline is this hotel has history, but Old should not mean Dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel in newyork”
Reviews.Author: dublinsun79
Reviews.Content: Stayed here cause i couldnt get any where else. I used to live in NYC and love going back and knew the reputation of this hotel. Good location but disgusting room, filthy, from another decade, possibly another century. Even walking through the halls is a disturbing experience. Well known to have mice and all sorts in the room. I would like to warn all nyc visitors NOT to stay here, dont be pulled in by the location, NYC is so wonderfull that you can stay anywhere in manhattan and experience everything and more. DONT DO IT!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible conditions”
Reviews.Author: Pyrviewsolan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Penn as we were entered for the first time at the Westminister dog show. After reading many of the reviews about this hotel I can tell you they are are true. The third floor where were were given a room was creepy and looked liked a asylum as someone else described in another review. The front deck is of no help to anyone, they all seem to be zombies is slow motion. I forgot my cell phone in the room and as I am hearing impaired I use it for a alarm. It was located in my pillow case set on vibrate. We called the front desk about an hour after check out and of course there was no phone found in our room. We were told to call the next day again nothing had been found. I don't know why other reviewers suggest this hotel is a good value with crappy rooms. There are other hotels in NYC much cheaper and I bet much nicer.....

Reviews.Title: “The doors to the rooms look like coffin tops...”
Reviews.Author: upterry
Reviews.Content: Paint pealing from the ceiling and walls. Tubs you would NEVER set foot in. Unexplainable stains on the rugs and walls. Filthy restaurant. All I thought about was bed bugs and getting out of there. Um.. nice looking lobby and great location. Don't stay at this hotel. Spend more money and walk!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms a bit outdated but who goes to NYC to stay in the Hotel??”
Reviews.Author: Wiggypants
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Room was ok, everyone in here had me scared I was going to get fleas or some horrible disease from here - THIS IS NOT THE CASE! If travelling on a budget this is the place to go. We never stayed in the room other than to sleep (I mean, come on, why would you if you're in NYC??!!) Right across the road from Madison Square Gardens and a little walk from Times Square you're right in the middle of all the action. Financial District and Statue are a bit of a walk but we are quite health conscious and didn't mind the exercise (plus you seem to find so much more in that city if you just walk).The internet service was incredibly inconvenient though as I had to pay by the hour and try to have a conversation on Skype with my family at home (Wi-Fi only available in lobby and of course with a strong Australian accent everyone notices). Just prepare yourself for the worst and you will be fine. For the price it's in a good location and lets face it's a warm place to sleep (no issues with heating and we were there right in the middle of their winter).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, Shame Thats The Only Positive Part!”
Reviews.Author: laurapixelheart
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my course for a weeks trip to NYC. After arriving at the hotel at 1am after a long travel all we wanted to do was to sleep as we had an early start. to our avail half of us found people staying in the rooms we had been assigned! To make it worse it took about 2 hours to get everyone into new rooms for us to find that there were 3 of us sharing a room that had 2 double beds! Bit awkward when you've only spend a term in class with the person you now have to sleep in a bed with. This was sorted when we complained the next day and got a fold out bed placed upstairs. The state of the rooms wasn't amazing. the mirror in the bathroom looked like it would drop if you placed anything on it. there was debris all over the bath and only 2 of the 8 plug sockets in our room worked (bit difficult when you have so many electrical items and one of the plugs is for the heater) the heater made a sound so horrible it sounded like an elephant screaming. Would have been nice if we were all notified of the arrival of dogs. Much to my displeasure i'm allergic to the things so spent half the week sneezing and looking as though someone had punched me in the face. (and that was me staying as far away from them as i could!) I did feel that the majority of the money did get spent on making the lobby look good. if they had dome that to the rest of the place it would have been impressive! one thing i cant fault however is the location. if you put aside all the problems within the hotel you see that its opposite an amazing stadium (madison sq gdns) and times square was only a 15 minute walk away (everything a girl could want!)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location with no frills”
Reviews.Author: TravellinTash
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with gang of friends for 5 nights. The hotel is located in Mid town directly opposite Madison Square Garden, 5 mins walk to Times Square. 1 min to Macys if your there to shop. The reception of the hotel is impressive but thats where it stops....check in was extremely busy and we were allocated rooms on the 3rd floor...BEWARE!!! On stepping out of the lift it was like stepping into the film The Shining, it was more like an asylum than a hotel. About 5 mins walking down manky corridors we came to our rooms....well the laughing....they were even worse....absolutely filthy....we later found out that this floor is sometimes used to shelter homeless people! We complained and after alot of fighting we got moved to the 5th Floor which was by no means plush but after the 3rd floor it was like the Ritz. Room was small with 2 double beds, bathroom was old but everything worked ok and when your in New York you don't spend much time in the hotel room anyway. After talking to other residents when taking the lift we were advised never to accept a room below the 5th Floor and the higher you go the nicer it gets but the 5th floor did us just fine for a week of shopping, clubbing and sightseeing. Did not have to spend much on transport due to central location and the subway is the quickest and easiest way to get about. Apart from the disaster on check in I would go back here again because of its location and price.

Reviews.Title: “Be afraid, be very afraid!”
Reviews.Author: Hate2Pay4Parking
Reviews.Content: This hotel was part of a trip my wife and I bid on at a charity auction for our local Boys & Girls Club. It was a 2 night stay combined with tickets to see the Rockettes Christmas Spectacular. We arrived at the hotel, started getting creeped out by the lack of security as we took the elevator up to our room. The room was just unbelievably gross. People have already described the lack of cleanliness and lack of maintenance. Called down to front desk and was told the hotel was full and there was nothing they could do. I went down to the payphones in the lobby and called Doubletree Guest Suites in Times Square. They were full. I explained that I was a past guest and I needed to be rescued from a disgusting hotel and proceeded to tell them my tale of woe! The clerk said let me see what I can do. She came back on a few moments later and said I was all set and to come on over! I checked out of this flea bag and went over to Doubletree where they gave me a beautiful room at an unbelievably low rate.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location; dreadful rooms!”
Reviews.Author: loripie
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I went with my parents to NYC for the Westminster Dog Show. On the website, the rooms looked clean and pleasant. To anyone who is searching for a hotel in NYC - do NOT believe the photos you see on their website. They are incredibly misleading. When we checked in, we were given two subpar rooms. The clerk told us, "you will not like these rooms - but we're full, and you can change them tomorrow." The rooms were terrible. The bathrooms were dirty, the paint was peeling off the walls and ceiling, there was mold on the air conditioning vents, and the room itself had a terrible odor. The next morning, we expressed our concerns to the staff, and were "upgraded" to another room. About the only thing better about this room was that it had a king sized bed instead of a full. There was mold all along the windows, and in the bathroom the wall was falling apart with large, orange rust stains. Several service calls were made. Many times, they would not answer the phone. When they did, they made many promises: to send a technician to fix the heating/cooling system, to bring more towels because they only provided one, etc. These things NEVER appeared. I've been to NYC over a dozen times, and have stayed in many hotels. This, by far, is the worst hotel I have stayed in. Please do yourself a favor and do not be lured in by their prices or their deceitful website. There are no redeeming qualities to this place except for its location across from Madison Square Garden.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Horrible Room Conditions”
Reviews.Author: candle1976
Reviews.Content: Don't believe the website, folks. The site makes the place looks great, the lobby is even very nice, but when you get to the rooms? Chipping paint, chipping wall facades, non-working wall air handling units, no response from hotel staff when service calls were made, staff yelling at each other in the hallways late at night at a volume loud enough for multiple people to leave their rooms and look around, security issues with non guests wandering floors and having to be trespassed (elevator guard didn't seem to be paying attention or give a damn). The only thing going for it is that it was right across from MSG.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother”
Reviews.Author: Wonboyn
Reviews.Content: Poor service, dirty rooms. The only reason to contemplate staying at this hotel is the location. It's close to a range of sites and the railway station.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location..!”
Reviews.Author: iheartdwight
Reviews.Content: Despite the hotel's imperfections, it is worth the stay just for its superb location! It is located directly acroos the road to Penn Station which is one of the main train stations in New York. It is also directly across from Maddison Square Garden, and within walking distance to alot of other main attractions. If you walk down the end of the street you will hit Times Square! We were pretty sceptical about staying here at first especially after reading some of the average reviews, but I think the good out weighs the bad. Yes it is a little old fashioned, and the rooms are quite small, but lets face it your there to see New York City not sit in your hotel room complaining about the out-dated furnishings!

Reviews.Title: “Filthy.”
Reviews.Author: linzatorte
Reviews.Content: It's been a couple of day's since I've been back, so thank God, no bed bugs....but I wouldn't put it past this hotel. Bathtub was filthy, floors filthy, staff (maid service) unprofessional at best....they had no problem standing outside our door for over an hour gossiping and screaming while we were trying to get a little peace and quiet. they also did not understand 'late checkout'....i don't know how many times we told them and we continually disturbed. Lights broken out in hallway, filth on the carpet.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: WatfordFloozie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Penn Hotel in January this year to celebrate my daughter's 21st. To keep the costs down we had a quad room (me, my husband, my daughter and her boyfriend). Took a bit of time checking in, but they couldn't have been more helpful. When they realised that we were 4 adults they changed our room to a larger one (to give us more space). The room needed a little TLC and there was some mildew in the bathroom but the carpet was clean, the beds spotless, clean sheets, towels etc. If you are going to NY on a whirlwind visit as we did you don't want to spend any time in your room, other than to wash and sleep, so it is great. 10 mins from Time Square and walking distance to almost everything. A bit too far to walk to Ground Zero (as we did) but the subway is opposite.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Lobby, poorly cared for rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Traveling-constant
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the comments about this hotel I really was feeling dubious about staying there. However, my friends had already booked their rooms and I was going to meet them for a couple of days. It was more convenient to stay where they did. It is convenient, in the heart of NYC, across from Penn Station, and I didn't pay too much for my room. They unfortunately paid a whopping amount for theirs. My room was clean, the bed passed the test, stripped it - checked mattress and boxspring. The rug decently clean, however I still wore socks or my shoes while walking on it. No view - just into the room across the way about 15 feet away. Double drapes for privacy helped. For some strange reason they provide a refrigerator, ice bucket of sorts, but no coffee pot, also no included breakfast of any type. I was in a ?renovated room, however the walls were all dirty and scratched. They had painted over old dirt and damage in the bathroom, and did an abominable job. The ceiling was coming down in the bathroom, tile floor had paint drips on it, back of door had been spray painted (did not cover). Extra security lock was broken. Hotel staff is cold and almost hostile. While I was waiting for my key two other families came back to the desk - they had been booked into occupied rooms!!! I had to go back to the desk - 13 floors down to get a new key, mine didn't work. No bathroom in the lobby, you have to go down to the lower floor - only one elevator goes there, it is dingy and has an uncomfortable feeling. After all of that I would give it good marks only for convenience! Oh, and no tours stop there you have to go somewhere else, Restaurants in the area - expensive, especially the one off the lobby!!! R Rogers

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: Silverparakeet
Reviews.Content: It was a lovely experience. It is right in the center and it is bang opposite Madison square!!! So many restaurants and shopping areas nearby. Of course broadway is just a couple of blocks away. It was great!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty”
Reviews.Author: TravisL3
Reviews.Content: The entrance lobby looked very eloquent but when arriving at the room, the floors, walls, ceilings and bathroom were all quite dirty.

Reviews.Title: “good base”
Reviews.Author: nycjones
Reviews.Content: i had gone to nyc for the wkend to visit friends. as we both came down w/the flu, i moved into the cheapest hotel i could book last minute. since i just needed a bed, i didn't mind where it was or what it looked like. the hotel outside and lobby are nice enough- though i did have to wait in line for 30min to check in. there's a coffee shop, convenient store and restaurant in the lobby which is helpful. i got off the elevator on my floor though and immediately thought it had to be the worst place i'd ever stayed. it honestly looks straight out of a horror film! when i opened my door, i was pleasantly surprised. the rooms are huge (for nyc standards) and they've all the basics. although there was a slight undertone of stale smoke, it was clean. the staff were lovely and helpful. the location is great. the only negative for me was the way the hallways/doors were maintained but if you just need a cheap and convenient place to crash, this is it!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: TwoAdventruers
Reviews.Content: Having read a number of negative reviews about the Pennsylvania before we went, I was worried about how the trip to New York (our first) would turn out. When we queued to check in at Reception, only to be told that we would have to come back after 3 pm, I thought "This is it, it's gonna be awful!", but the second time (just before the said time!) we only waited about 10 minutes, and then we were given a room on the 10th floor without any further problems. Though the room was quite basic and the furniture old, it was clean and the towels and toiletries were replaced every day. Very good shower and plenty of hot water. It was quiet at night, and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Being on 7th Ave it is central to all amenities, Penn Station is right across the road. We found the staff quite approachable, no problem at all with the lifts. The Reception area is nearly always busy, but has comfortable seating and TV screens. There is a small coffee shop at one side. We found that Fun Passes allowed us unrestricted travel on the buses and subway. The tickets are $8.25/day, or you can get one that lasts 72 hours. We bought ours at the subway station nearby from a ticket vending machine. We had no trouble with the buses - they were regular and cover nearly everywhere. All in all, despite the cold temperatures outside, we had a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “IF USING JUST AS A BASE, STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: wiganlass34
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our 10th wed anniversary in Aug 09 and i must admit i was dreading staying there after reading most of the reviews which 90% said it was terrible.. We arrived mid afternoon and the lobby was crazy busy, but in 30mins we were checked in and making our way to our room. Room was fairly clean with a queen size bed, all of the other furniture was so dated and worn. Bathroom was shockingly bad, sink falling off wall, shower head held in place with glue, cracks in walls and tiles, but was cleanish. Room door looked like a prison door and corridors are not very well lit. Wasnt the most enjoyable hotel stay, but we just slept there, so we tolerated it. The room was cleaned and hoovered every day. Excellent location for lots of tourist sites,which is the most positive thing about this hotel, and we found staff helpful.

Reviews.Title: “THE MOST DISGUSTING HOTEL...”
Reviews.Author: flyboi31
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awful! The lobby was full of people, crazy and dirty. The halls were filthy and stained. Some room number signs were falling off the wall. My door had lots of holes in it, apparently from old locks, etc. My room was horrible. The ceiling had black mold growning in places, and the paint was falling down. The night stand had something weird sprayed all over it. The doors and walls had major damages, like holes, dents, scrapes, stains, etc. The toilet had dried urine running down the side, and the seat was filthy. The sink looked like it was about to fall over or collapse. The electrical outlet was falling out of place. The desk chair had what looked like a bullet hole in it. I've been warned by out union (airline) to check for bed bugs here!!! Avoid at ALL costs!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “It was like being in the movie 'The Shinning'.”
Reviews.Author: ElQuerido
Reviews.Content: I was booked into this hotel by my company because of it's location (which is its only positive aspect). There always seemed to be many people in the lobby and at reception but I hardly ever saw anybody on my floor. There where very long dark corridors and I always half expected to see two little girls at the end of one looking back at me, as in the movie. The room was big but old and dirty, with paint peeling from the ceiling and cracks on the wall. The room had undergone some sort of redecoration because you could see lesser stained areas on the wall where there had previously been paintings or mirrors. The door looked as if someone had tried to get in using a crowbar. When I put on the air-conditioner it made the whole room smell like a fast food joint because of a nearby restaurant. I can safely say it was the worse hotel I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go!!!”
Reviews.Author: patyler
Reviews.Content: It's old, ugly and dirty! Rooms don't have LIGHTS, safe, refrigerator, nothing! They don't have wi-fi (just if you pay A LOT with credicard). At check in you have to give to them your credicard number and they keep it. They don't have breakfast. The rooms are dirty, ugly, old and REALLY DARK because they just have one lamp, no lights! The beds are small! The staff is terrible too, they don't even carry your bags. Terrible hotel and it's the same price as Roosevelt and others (a lot better). The ONLY good thing is the location, but definitely it's the worst hotel I've ever been in my whole life, even hostels are better

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: cbqbill
Reviews.Content: I chose a Penn 5000 Club room which didn't cost much more than the superior room. My 3:00pm check-in involved less than ten minutes. The Hotel Penn isa big old commercial hotel with the small rooms New York hotels are famous for. I wish New York hoteliers would stop trying to squeeze king-size beds into these rooms that were meant for nothing larger than a full size bed. The bed itself was very comfortable but the only place to sit in the room was the chair at the desk or on the bed. I don't know when I'll learn that king rooms don't indicate the size of the rooms! Overall, however, this hotel is worth the reasonable rates they charge. The location is excellent and my room was clean and well maintained. The staff was friendly and efficient. I didn't take advantage of the 5000 club amenities. When I return I will again choose the Penn 5000 Club rooms but will ask for a double- or queen-size bed.

Reviews.Title: “what a [--] hole”
Reviews.Author: JosefaPortugal
Reviews.Content: i've been in several hotels and hostels, but never seen such a bad hotel. it's dirty, ugly and old. We don't recomend it for honey moon or if you like to spend some quality time with your husband/wife. The lavatory was broken and untached from the wall, the ar condicioning didn't work and sounds like an air plane turbine. Only one sheet in bed with no blanket, garbage in the corredor floor and all guests seems to be homeless. Go to Empire Hotel like I did.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY!!! the picture on website is decieving”
Reviews.Author: liazard-king
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt the most disgustingly filthiest place I have ever stayed!!!!!!!!! The room had the most uncomfortable king size bed(mattress at least 30yrs old??) that took up the entire room.(since the room was only about 12x12). the "closet" bathroom had globs of mildewed caulk all around the shower that was rusting and chipping away. the toilet leaked from the bottom and the heater had one setting "suffocate" .The carpet was cheap indoor/ outdoor carpet that may have been vaccumed a few years ago.? The walls were in serious need of repair and a fresh coat of paint. they needed to be scraped, since there were "things" stuck to the wall. My wife and I woke up the next morning after tossing and turning all night and CHECKED OUT!!!! only after recieving an attitude from the manager?!! The pics on computer and the Lobby are very decieving. GO ELSEWHERE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Needs Updating”
Reviews.Author: LJTBristol
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to Times Square, Penn Station etc, but our room was small, dark and needed updating. The bathroom didn't feel clean, hairs on the floor and in the sink. The man at the front desk was sarcastic and quite rude when our room key failed to work, making it feel as if it was our fault.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Teamfever
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for five nights after new year with 2 girlfriends and was dreading it having read the reviews on this site. We arrived at midnight and walked straight to the check in desk, no problems. We were initially given a room on the 7th floor which when we got to it, had not been cleaned since the last guests left. This was quickly rectified and we were given a room on the 10th floor which was 2 rooms joined together, with 4 beds, so loads of space for us and the shopping we were about to do. It was very basic but it was clean, the shower was always hot and the heating worked fine. I stayed in a 5 star hotel the last time I came out to NYC but considering how much time was spent in the room, the hotels location wins hands down. You are right opposite Madison Square Garden and round the corner from Empire State. We found it really easy to walk from places like Central Park back to the hotel due to how central it was.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we needed”
Reviews.Author: ilovenycLondon
Reviews.Content: Before leaving we read some reviews which said the hotel was dreadful however we were advised to ask for a renovated room- we told them it was a special occasion. when we got there we had no problems checking in and staff were very helpful. We were on the 13th floor and every thing was what we needed. The room was a good size, with fresh towels and sheets everyday. The heating worked fine and the bath room was clean and tidy. Dont expect five star but who needs five star in new york. You're out for most of the time. For the time we were in our room it was comfortable and surprisingly quiet. The location is incredible; opposite Penn station and ten minutes walk to Times Square. You get what you pay for with this hotel as it was two star and cheap. if you want luxury in nyc you have to pay for it. Despite this we saw no evidence of the horror stories some describe in their reviews and would recommend this hotel to friends. Do ask for a renovated room though if possible.

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING - AVOID!!”
Reviews.Author: usblueflyer
Reviews.Content: I'm a member of an air crew who, recently, HAD to stay at this DUMP!! I totally appreciate that it is 'historic', place, BUT: I had 'spit out' chewing gum, used makeup remover pads, candy wrappers and other garbage under the bed. There was a 'left over' Coke bottle left in the refrigerator - someone else's garbage! The walls are FILTHY in the rooms. They look like someone threw glassfulls of swampwater against the walls. The bathroom had enough hair in it for me to knit another person. The door is probably the original from 1919 - which is when this place was built. (It's the possessor of the "Pennsylvania 6-5000" telephone number that was made famous in a song played by Tommy Dorsey, and other Big Bands). EVERYTHING in the rooms is covered with filth. It has a reputation for spreading Bed Bugs! I didn't have any 'bug' problems, but I would URGE EVERYONE with ANY sense of Hygiend to AVOID this horrible place! The heat - when you can get it - is either non-existant, or the same as being in a Bessemer Blast Furnace. If you call for assistance, you'll get several different excuses as to when someone will be there to fix it, or you'll get no response at all. If you're used to the surroundings of a dumpster, stay here. Location is great, and the Lobby is VERY DECEIVING. (It looks like something from the movies - the 1940's movies) As an aircrew member, I've seen several DISGUSTING places all over the world. THIS place is #2 on my list of NASTY! STAY AWAY unless you plan to disinfect the entire room (including the bathroom) on your own! HORRIBLE, DISGUSTING, FILTHY, UGLY and any other word that means GARBAGE!!

Reviews.Title: “to each his own”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaJimmy
Reviews.Content: have not stayed there yet, but will take the time to inform all ye prince and princess that its inexpensive and next door to MSG so what do you expect for the price. If you want the lap of luxury then PAY for it. I know that i wont be bothered by the friendly creatures who inhabited this earth long before us or the things that go bump in the night as all i want is a good night sleep and a place to lay me head after a good session.

Reviews.Title: “Will never go back to Hotel Pennsylvania”
Reviews.Author: jillerkitty
Reviews.Content: I wanted to send a complaint about staying at the Hotel Pennsylvania on January 2nd 2010. I have stayed here two other times in the past 5 years and this was the first time we ever had issues. The first room we reserved the water would not shut off in the shower. We reported this about 7:15pm on Jan 2nd and left to go to a show. We returned after 11pm and nobody had come up to the room to shut off the shower. They moved us to another room on the same floor, but when we got their the keys did not work. So we went back down they gave us yet another set of keys for 1106, but did not inform us there were two 1106 rooms. We couldn’t get the key to work so we went back down they sent someone up saying there was another Room 1106 around the corner. IT was very frustrating and due to these issues we will not be coming back to this hotel or referring to our friends even if its in a great location. We were not given any free upgrades or anything nice an accommodating to make us want to come back in the future. Very frustrating trip to New York.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY DISGUSTING!”
Reviews.Author: ZappaPalmdale
Reviews.Content: Rude front desk help, three hour check-in process, room w/ 2 double beds was 2 single beds. Moved to room w/ 2 doubles but both rooms were attrocious. All 4 of us slept in our clothes on top of covers and didn't shower the next morning... good thing it was only 1 night. Up and out early to the Marriott Marquis.

Reviews.Title: “It's haunted. Enough said.”
Reviews.Author: Wimpy79
Reviews.Content: Yep, it's haunted. Something was moving around our room while we slept. If it wasn't a ghost then it was a mouse or cockroach. Either way I'm not going back. The room was dirty and tired, the bathroom was probably the original one from when it was built and there were power sockets literally hanging off the wall. The only good point is the central location, but I won't be going back. (The movement stopped after a day or two which suggest the ghosts and vermin don't approve of it either).

Reviews.Title: “Depends on what floor you are on”
Reviews.Author: CoraG
Reviews.Content: The pictures on this website do not lie. We were in room 1019 first, pictures on this website describe the horrible room. We called downstairs for refund but was given an option for a refurbished room. The refurbished room on floor 13, room 1327 was completely different. Fresh paint, newer furniture, newer carpet, painted clean friendly/safe looking door. We didn't have towels in the room. Even when the room was nicer, I still didn't feel comfortable after seeing the first room-rusted bath tub, tight worn 60 year old carpet, caving ceiling, unsafe gross door, SCARY hallways.. I was worried about bed bugs in both rooms.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL AWFUL AWFUL!”
Reviews.Author: jemma546
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights after 4 nights in another hotel in the heart of Times Square, we didn't take much time researching the hotel as we had been in to the reception and it seemed to be ok...good location, good facilities etc...what a mistake we made!! We arrived at 8am and as it was too early to check in they charged us $4 per bag to store our bags!!! I think this is terrible, I have travelled the world and have never been charged for this service, we were also charged again when we checked out on our last day as we had a few hours to wait before leaving for the airport. When we went back that afternoon to check in we waited in a queue for 45 mins!!!! There was plenty of counters but only 2 staff working, when we eventually did check in the staff were not very interested or polite. We took the lift to the room and I was shocked when the doors opened...it was the most gloomiest, dullest hotel I have been in. The room we had was huge but the bed did not seem like a double and was rock solid. Me and my husband could just about both fit in...it was definitely not a double. The sheets were horrible and smelt, I slept on my own blanket. Yes you don't spend much time in the hotel room in NYC but it's not good when you're dreading having to go back to the hotel room at all! When we were checking out it took another 40 mins and again the employee was very abrupt and unhelpful. All I can say is I'm glad we only had 2 nights there and not our full trip. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone!!!! DO NOT STAY HERE!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Mike058
Reviews.Content: All you can really say about this hotel (which prides itself on being one of the oldest in NYC) is that it is central and within striking distance of major tourist attractions. The facilities have been franchised out and the Diner off the front lobby is overpriced (The Tick Tock or Starlight a couple of blocks away are better). There also plenty of local delis where you can get breakfast or sandwiches made up. The rooms and hallways are well past their sell by date and pretty gloomy - we were all struck by its resemblance to the backdrop of The Shining and half expected to bump into Jack Nicholson doing his psychopath impersonation every time we took the lift. Thankfully we didn't come to NY to stay in a hotel and preferred to eat and drink elsewhere mainly because we wanted to but also because you have no choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: eetimle
Reviews.Content: Hotel Pennsylvania is located in excellent location, next to Madison Square Garden and Manhattan penn station. About 1km south from Times square and about 0,5km from Empire State Building. I booked the hotel via hotels.com for three people for very very cheap price. Rooms are bit crappy and old style, but who wants to send their time in hotel in NYC? Room was large and there was plenty room, even if three large beds were included. Signing in and out took about 5minutes total (check in time about 18:00 in the evening and check out 10:00 in the morning). Staff were very polite. Recommended to everyone who respect great location and don't need to be in modern luxury hotel. Probably spent another visit in this hotel when coming back to NYC later.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as some of the reviews!!!”
Reviews.Author: hastingsfamily
Reviews.Content: Have just come back from a stay in the pennsylvania and it wasnt as bad as we expected. We arrived at around 11pm and we spent about ten mins waiting to check in the guy at the check in desk was fairly cheerfull, although i would add we had booked a Penn 500 club room and the supposed special check in area was closed. We were given keys to our room on the 12th floor, there are plenty of lifts to use and no waiting around for them. The hallyways were no where near as bad as people had made them out to be there was a very large window in the lobby facing the side view of macys, allowing plenty of light in people have to remember this is one of new yorks largest and oldest hotels its not the ritz or the hilton its a typicall new york hotel, yes it could do with a few gallons of paint, but your only sleeping there after all. We got to our room it was clean and a huge bed with fresh sheets. A nice flat screen Tv and a fair bathroom by new york standards. It had a bath with a shower over it which was nice. Ok it could have again done with a little freshen up but the main thing it was clean with fresh towels and i have to add our towels and sheets were changed daily.The maid service you could not fault they were friendly and efficient and always happy to oblige with any requests for extra towels and pillows. Included with the suite package came the penn guest louge where every morning there was a selction of fresh pastries juice teas and coffees. This was availble till 11am. The coffee and tea was availble all day. Also in the room was daily newspapers and two computer terminals with free internet access and free printing faciltes. Also a phone if required. The location of the hotel is fantastic within easy walking distance of many of the main tourist atractions i.e the empire state, times square and madision square gardens. Also very handy access to Penn station. All of the hotel staff were very friendly and helpfull.the security of the hotel was good too always someone at the lifts checking to see if you were a guest there. There were saftey deposit boxes at the main reception which were great and free of charge. My son and i enjoyed stayong at the hotel and would definately stay there again. I have stayed previously in new york at a much higher rated hotel and to be honest the room at the pennsylvania hotel was bigger and it also had a bath, compared to this other top hotel i have stayed in. This is why i would reccommend this hotel, but please remember to look past its dated apperance. Its very good value for money but would reccommend upgrading to the penn 500 club suites.

Reviews.Title: “New York's hotels”
Reviews.Author: MilosP
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a wonderful location, it's in the heart of Manhattan, but still not expensive, It is in front of Madison Square Garden, and two blocks from Empire State Building.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: DiogoC
Reviews.Content: Just across the road of Madison Square Garden and Penn Station, it has an excelent location in Midtown zone, Manhathan. It´s 15 min walk from Times square, 5 from Empire State building As an historical building in NY it deserved being better preserved. You pay too much for what you have.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly-no, wait-THE worst hotel I have EVER stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: yasminpessoa
Reviews.Content: I went to NYC in July and was hoping to get a nice hotel near Times Square, but when I heard that most were $300-600, I freaked. The best I could get on such short notice was the hotel pennsylvania, which doesn't even deserve a proper capital letter. The service was absolutely horrible; it took atleast four hours to check in, and they were extremely rude. We had to take our own LUGGAGE to a luggage room, which was tremendously covered in mold and rat feces, and rats themselves, and waited about another thirty minutes for someone to open the door. Once we finally got a room (around 8pm, we got there at about 3 pm), we were shocked to see that the horribly busted doors looked like old dark green coffins, and even the rooms were moldy. I woke up to a bitten feeling on my hand, which was under my pillow, and I look under to see tiny black dots of unknown matter. I slept on the covers, on the floor, which I actually believed was cleaner than the bed, where mold was constantly chipping away ceiling paint onto the headrest of the bed. The prime molding was terrible, and the bathrooms were absolutely disgusting. Although the lobby may look "great", the rooms are completely of terrible quality, and the restaurant in the hotel was terrible. Although it was a few blocks down from Times Square and right across the street from Madison Square Garden, I am sure that a stay any longer than the time I was there for would have driven me insane, full of lice or bedbugs and whatnot. There are no channels on the TV, which was probably from the 50's. Get this--the "fancy" occasion room you may see photos of was right next to the luggage room, which was in the moldy underground basement of the nauseating hotel, was apparently remodeled, and the room looked nothing like it did in the picture. Also, you had to pay to use the exercise room, that was full of sweat and nobody in there. The machines barely worked, to top it off. This is the worst place I have ever been to in my life. DO NOT fall under their trap of a "pretty lobby", which actually looks too shiny and demeaning. Seriously, they need to spend their money on the rooms, and provide in-room entertainment, instead of the screens behind the counter that just advertise and advertise and advertise.

Reviews.Title: “Think twice”
Reviews.Author: coppernobb
Reviews.Content: Room very big but dark even with lights on. Massive hole in sheets on first night. Bathroom door swollen and rotton on bottom 6 inches and would not close, toilet leaked all time and had to put towels down. Decor good untill you looked up and top of walls and ceiling very rough. Very clean other wise. Wall's very thin and neighbours VERY noisey till about 3am, did tell security who asked them to be quiet but soon as security went they carried on, doors banging up and down corridors all night. Entrance lobby very impressive. Three of us in room, all big people, and two had to share small double bed, not so good. If you are not bothered about the rooms this hotel is in an excellent possition.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: jah1103
Reviews.Content: I know location is important but this place is an old disgusting hotel that has not be upgraded. Don't let the lobby fool you. That is the only area that they have spent money - otherwise you would turn around at the door. They actually have a sign at the front desk that says if you want a smoke detector ask. Once I read that I should have just walked out - they know that there is no where else to go on a December NYC Saturday. You have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “So Bad It Was Commical”
Reviews.Author: njgraphicgirl
Reviews.Content: Definitely believe all the negative reviews you have read. I wish I did. The reason I chose this hotel was because of it's location. My two teenage daughters and their two friends were to attend Z100's Jingle Ball at Madison Square Garden on December 11. I knew the show would be over late so I decided to stay overnight. It was myself, my mother, and 4 teenagers. We got two rooms which when making the reservation I requested either adjoining rooms or rooms next door to each other. I was told they would try their best but couldn't guarantee. Upon check-in there was not a valet person or bellhop in sight. FINALLY, after hunting one down (who turned out to be very nice) we got our bags brought in and car valeted. When checking in I was told that not only were the two rooms not next to each other, they were on completely opposite sides of the hotel. I was told that they were sold out. Now, there is 1,700 rooms in this place and they couldn't find 2 together? So we go to our room and had a good laugh. The room was HUGE but barely had anything in it. And what was in it was so old and threadbare. The bathroom had large chunks of paint literally hanging off the ceiling and there was hair in the drain in tub. Our view was ok. Beds were uncomfortable but pleasantly surprised at the clean sheets and towels. The second room which was to be the teen room was smaller but nicer with no view at all. No paint peeling off ceiling but worse was a leak in bathroom. The girls refused to sleep under the covers or take a shower. Granted, they are a little spoiled but they were totally freaked out and rightfully so. I told them it could be worse and they could be the man sleeping by the bathroom at the McDonalds down the street. The ONLY good thing about this hotel was it's convenience.

Reviews.Title: “on the grotty side”
Reviews.Author: sim0n_and_lisa
Reviews.Content: since returning ive found some real horror stories about this hotel and i can well believe them. Our room wasn't as bad as some pictures on the internet. Our room was quite small, the paint was flaking from the walls. The furniture was OK although only one person could watch the tv at a time because of its positioning. The central heater had a towel rammed in it - presume to stop a leak. The gorridor smelt of damp. The reception staff were very unfriendly, the nicest staff were the bag drop people although we ad to pay for the experience - pay to leave our bags after check out ? Perhaps the wost hotel ever - probably not but its up there.... dont do it - find somewhere else.....

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hairdryer, good bed, otherwise reminded me of a classic horror movie!”
Reviews.Author: Babywarbbit
Reviews.Content: So, the corridors reminded me of The Shining and the bathroom a little of Psycho, but you know what... it wasn't that bad! It can't have many stars because for the price it was run down and hugely shabby. But, it was clean (sheets, toilet, sink even if the walls were covered in scuff marks). It's in a good location, the bed was very comfy and the hairdryer was fabulous! The staff were pretty courteous (but there weren't enough of them for the size of the hotel to make you feel loved!). If you want a central base for shopping and won't spend much time there it was FINE! But I was glad when I changed cities and hotels after 2 nights! Oh - and it feels like there are more people in the hotel lobby than on 5th Avenue :-)

Reviews.Title: “It's not that bad- Views and Location are excellent.”
Reviews.Author: Fabulousbigapple
Reviews.Content: I was expecting the worse after some of the reviews on here however we were pleasently surprised. The room we were given had new carpet and 2 huge windows which had excellent views of the city/ Macys etc. 2 weeks earlier I had stayed in the New Yorker and payed £100 extra for room with view and the view wasnt as good as this. Yes it has not been updated in a long time and does need doing even if its just the basics however the room we had was clean. Yes the corridors are dark however your only walking to and from the lift so whats the big deal if its a bit dark. My only complains are that our hairdryer didnt work so i rang down and asked for them to send one up.. after 1hr 10mins and 3 phone calls later we finally got one. I was sat with wet hair and waiting to go to bed so this was a bit of a pain. Also our heater didnt seem to be hot, just warm. Location is excellent, within walk of most things and right by main station -Penn. Rooms are big for New York standards, ive stayed in much much smaller room in NY & lots of hangars/wardobe space. Nothing else to report, all in all a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Allow an hour for check-in and don't expect anyone to care”
Reviews.Author: bkfisher
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Hotel Pennsylvania while in NYC for a basketball tournmanet at Madison Square Garden. Perfect location for this, great price, and the room was adequate. It is an older hotel, but it appears to be well-maintained. What really left a bad taste in our mouths, though, was the service. It took us exactly an hour to check in, which included about 55 minutes of standing in line with 30+ other people. A man in front of us said something to one of the two workers at the counter--he told her she ought to be embarrassed by the line of people and how long it was taking; her response was, "It's not my hotel." The other lady appeared apologetic and said that they had laid off five employees recently, and that the line was ALWAYS that long. We asked to speak with a manager, whose reply was, "What do you want me to do about it?" It was incredibly frustrating. Hotel check-in shouldn't take that long, and the manager should do something about it when it does (as in step in and help or do something to compensate for it). The customer service was some of the worst we have ever experienced. There were skid marks in our toilet upon arrival, which also didn't sit well.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is badly needing a makeover”
Reviews.Author: theorganizerScotland
Reviews.Content: Queued for over an hour to check-in,they then tried to tell us we had booked 3 rooms with double bed in each,despite having a print out from travel agent saying we had booked for 2 beds in each. They wanted to charge us $25 per room per night,this was after paying £900 per room for 5 nights. after phoning travel agent in Scotland(personal friend) they waived this fee. We went up to 3rd floor which is where our rooms were & oh my god,this is the worst hotel i have ever been in. The doors are like prison cells,it looks like they are all reinforced,then you step into the room,it was so awful, i could have sat down & cried. We decided to put up with it as we were only there to sleep. Half way through our break, friends in one of the other rooms had a visitor (cockroach) in bathroom & did eventually get moved. I WILL say the sheets & towels were clean & changed every day & hotel is in excellent location but once you get past lobby its like another world. The hotel staff are not the most helpful either. Would NEVER stay here again even if it was for free.

Reviews.Title: “Theres better than this in New york”
Reviews.Author: Twinxy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the pennysylvania in December 2006 because of the price and location. Returned this year and it was not that cheap to stay here because of the £ TO $ exchange rate. I was expecting a big refurbishment because it needed it 3 years ago, but the condition of this hotel has deteriorated beyond belief. The hotel staff were very nice and worked hard, unfortunately the uniforms on the front desk staff matched the whole drab rundown, worn out appearance of the hotel. The carpets were dirty, sockets sellotaped to the walls with bare wires hanging out. bathroom sink was supported with one plastic leg. TOWELS SMELLED OF FISH. (had to spray loads of sure all over to take away the smell of the towel). Bath was chipped after it had been repainted. Paintwork throughout the hotel was in an appauling state. Very poor lighting. Heating unit in the room was full of dust dirt and god knows what else. This was actually one of the better rooms on the 9th floor with a view of the top bit of the Empire State building. Passed a large pile of sick in the corridor this morning, remmenants were still there a couple of hours later after a clean up. I could go on.....and on, but whats the point. We stayed for a week in New York and quite honestly the condition of the place was starting to get me down. We should have been returning to a smart, clean, warm, welcoming hotel after great trips and days shopping in NY at christmas time, but its down market hotel with an upmarket price tag. Next time we are going to price up the New Yorker. Its got some great reviews.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: tjporter
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a beautiful lobby but, aside from that... It's TERRIBLE. When I arrived after a 7hr flight,my room was not ready so, I had to check in my bags and wait 2hrs. Mind you it was about 4pm. When I got upstairs to my room, I was actually a little scared. The room was dingy and smelled moldy. The paint was coming off the wall.The towels had yellow stains on them.The windows lookedlike the hadn't been cleaned in years. The walls are paper thin.The light by the entrance didnt work so, I had to depend on the dim desk light. The carpet was nasty and the tv has about 15 channels. This hotel is by far the nastiest hotel ever. Now on too the service... The maid just bust in the room several times without knocking and even with the PRIVACY sign on the door. Thank God I had the littlelatch thing on. Then I go to use the computer and find out it's $1 for every 5min. and $.75 to print. The people at the desk are rude adn have no answers for anything. I would not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Dont be put off... if its just somewhere to sleep and wash you'll be fine!!”
Reviews.Author: emmzy21
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i, went here with 5 other friends for my 21st birthday for 6 days at the end of november 2009. After reading the reveiws on here i was really worried about how i was going to cope! However things really were not that bad.. Check in was quick, we waited 20 mins at the most.... Hotel Lobby is beautiful and staff were very helpful. There are plenty of lifts so you wont be waiting around for long. Corridors are shabby looking and not alot of lighting, but who stays in the corridor right...? We had a lovely room on the 13th floor with a spectacular view of the empire state building. We also had a kingsize bed, a flat screen telly and lots of room to spread our mess out :) The bathroom was very small but had a shower, toilet and sink.. what else do you need? The sheets and towels were changed daily. The location is absolutely amazing.. directly opposite madison sqaure gardens.. and 2 minutes away from macy's!! All in all if you are just looking for somewhere to sleep and wash... nothing luxurious then this is the ideal place. My tip is to expect the worst like we did and then you can't be dissapointed.... After all you are going to the city that never sleeps so you shouldn't really be spending much time in the hotel anyway!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Low Price....comfortable but a little shabby.”
Reviews.Author: girl_jo1970
Reviews.Content: We had read a lot of reviews before we left Australia on this hotel. Most being unfavourable, however, going in with an open mind and no disillusions, we expected the worst. We were thrilled with the location, right around the corner from the Empire State Building and across the road from Penn Station ( subway and trains), a block from Macy's. Yes, the room was small and a bit shabby, in need of a bit of TLC, but all in all, we didn't spend much time in our room, only to sleep and found the convenience of being so close to everything the best thing about this hotel. We didn't eat in the restaurants here, opting for a trip to the Deli for breakfast and late night snacks. All in all our experience was a positive one, bearing in mind we stayed for 8 days and this was over a very busy period for this hotel , as they housed a lot of overseas competitors from the New York Marathon.

Reviews.Title: “Long Queue, Bad Service, Faulty TV - Rip Off”
Reviews.Author: edtal
Reviews.Content: After a 20 hour flight to have to camp in the lobby for 2 hours to get attended to by one of the 2 people on service for 40 waiting guests. Thje lobby looks wonderfull but this is only a scam hiding the fact that this hotel is run down and poorly maintained with incredibly bad service and cracked and peeling paint in the rooms. The TV was faulty and when i tried to complain there was no one to talk to. This hotel has a captive audience with some of the airlines and therefore YOU are not inportant to them but as room fillers.

Reviews.Title: “Its really not bad!!”
Reviews.Author: beckyboo726
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review whilst staying at the Hotel and after reading bad review after bad review on trip advisor was completly dreading my stay as i suppose all future visitors are. Yes the decoration is dated and certain things could be better but in all fairness the Location alone makes up for this. When we arrived we waited for about 30mins to check in as there was only two members off staff on the desk, however throughout our stay staff have been VERY friendly and eager to help in any way possible. Our room has been cleaned everyday and fresh towels have been placed in our room, anything we have requested from receptiption e.g extra pillows has been sent within 15mins. Yes the decoration in the room is a little dated and certian parts could need improvement but overall a very clean and well presented room, considering the time we spend in it, I dont think ive ever heard of anyone that has come to New York to stay in there hotel room. I would without a doubt recommend this hotel to anybody coming to stay in New York City, we are right in the centre of the Midtown and the biggest train station is over the raod, which accomidates to get around town. All in all dont believe all the bad reviews that you read its clearly people who are used too staying in luxury hotels and here its good value and fantastic loaction, and i wouldnt hesitate about staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location,would def recommend to all!!”
Reviews.Author: DamoandDen
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on the 25th of nov 2009 with my partner!brilliant location straight across the road from madison sq garden. i was able to watch the macys thanksgiving parade from our floor which was amazing! We wer on the 6th floor, the room was very basic but clean. yes,some paint was missing from the ceiling but who cares,people dont spend much time in their rooms in new york neway! On arrival there was a queue to check in ,service was slow but staff were kind and friendly. The only thing i could fault about the hotel was the restaurant,prices wer very expensive!I would not recommend people to eat in this restaurant!!! overall i would definatly recommend this hotel to everyone who wishes to have a pleasent stay in new york and be in the heart of the entertainment!!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT stay at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BumbleBea9
Reviews.Content: I work in the hotel industry and this is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. Picked it becauce I was arriving into Penn Station at 2:30 am and it is across the street. I paid over $200.00 on Expedia and it's a dump. The paint was peeling on the door, there were black hairs on the bathroom floor and there were staples on the carpet. Yet, the lobby was full of people checking out in the morning. There is a Club Penn floor so maybe that's where the "good" rooms were. You had to pay to use the internet and printing and the restaurant's price were expensive. Went to McDonalds down the street and then grapped a Timmys from the store just outside the front entrance.

Reviews.Title: “its not that bad!”
Reviews.Author: bigmawn
Reviews.Content: After reading the other reviews on here i was a little worried about staying at hotel penn. but i can say in all honesty its really not that bad, sure its old but the room we had was clean and the shower was hot and after 20 hours on a plane you need a good shower! its a great location so close to eveything,its nothing flash but it does the job. i would stay there again and lets be onest who goes to nyc to spend all day in a hotel room............

Reviews.Title: “Not a hysterical review.”
Reviews.Author: shed55
