Reviews.Content: I'd read the reviews on this site and approached our trip with a fair degree of concern. However, I had a mixed experience and wanted to try and write a balanced review. As most reviews (good and bad) seem to agree, you can't do much better for location. Checking in wasn't the horror I expected, it was pretty standard. I did see a big queue at reception once during our 5 days. I think if your unlucky enough to arrive at the same time as a lot of other people, then you'll have to wait, otherwise, not a problem. BAD STUFF: The room we were given was as poor as some of the reviews have suggested. Spartan, dated decor. Flaking plaster, film of dirt all over the bathroom from the open window. It clearly hadn't been cleaned or occupied in some time. Probably the worst room I've ever been given and believe me, I've stayed in some toilets in my time. GOOD STUFF: I went to reception, explained the situation and that I'd like to be moved. I was given the key card to another another room and asked to inspect to make sure I was satisfied before they moved us. The room I was offered was fine, clean and reasonably well appointed. Nothing fancy, but perfectly acceptable as a base for our purposes. In summary, this hotel clearly does have some poor rooms, but it also has some reasonably decent ones too. If you get one of those, then it's a good place to stay at a reasonable price in the centre of town. If you get a bad one, make sure you get moved. Oh, and agree with the person who liked the guys in the baggage room. Great guys!

Reviews.Title: “greetings!”
Reviews.Author: SandyR4
Reviews.Content: great hotel excellent service! i was fully satisficed i loveee the ubication ;) congrats!

Reviews.Title: “NEVER NEVER NEVER I Repeat NEVER will i stay in this hotel!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dubai-Mafia
Reviews.Content: Ok i saw a lot of good and bad reviews on this site about this hotel. Many people saying "I dont know why people leave bad reviews" Well i have EVERY RIGHT TO LEAVE THE WORST REVIEW FOR THE WORST HOTEL ON EARTH - FACT! I stayed int his hotel with a group for a conference back in March. It looked amazing and so did the website and pictures. Well the best thing about the hotel is the LOCATION! right outside madison square gardens, empire state and Macys so you in the heart of the big apple! Great huh? Well dont get your hopes up! The wonderful start. The que to check in took 1 hour. Yes 1 hour. 2 people serving 100's of guests = 1 hour. Not well staffed or managed + rude staff, not very friendly for a hotel in the big apple. I have traveled most of the world and have never came across a hotel like this! I am not the fussy person who says oh, the door handle was faded or the water was to hot!!!!! The interior of the corridors of the hotel was so old fashioned and run-down it looked like an old hospital from the 50's! Just out of a horror movie. That is the start. Our room was NOT for 3 people as i was sharing with 2 girls. They had to sleep together in one bed as they would not transfer us to a triple bedded room. Lucky i was not sharing with 2 boys!!!!! When asking to transfer room they would simply NOT!!! VERY RUDE STAFF!!!!!! Although half the hotel was empty!!!!! The room had STAINS ON THE FLOOR, BED, WALLS, AND BASICALLY ANYWHERE ELSE YOU CAN TOUCH!!!!!! Bed sheets were stained & ripped!!! Lights in the room were broken, central heating broken!! TV BROKEN!!!!!! The beautiful view you ask?? USA STYLE AMERICAN PRISON BARS!!! Not joking! Why this was the case i do not know. NO body would jump out the window because the room was in a middle of no where courtyard (a small flat land in middle of the hotel with no place to go or jump. So i see no need + the amount of litter thrown there was SHOCKING! The room had about 10% daylight, the rest of the time it was very dark and cold. Bathroom, where do i begin, mirror was cracked, mold and dirt ont he tiles and to finish it off the toilet seat was broken + the shower was VERY tempermental shooting hot and cold water in turn????? This is not the standard for American hotels and think it should be shut down. This has standards for a hostel. I am a genuine customer who stayed here and would never stay again. Please please e-mail me for about 30 pictures of the condition of my room. It was dreadful. This was not a way to start a conference in NYC. The most fun i had was out and about and dreadded the walk back to the hotel every night. I was shocked and appauled with the condition and since then sent several letters of complaint to the hotel which i have had no reply. You have been warned. Do not make the same mistake i made!!!!! & for £90 a night i do expect a LOT FOR MONEY!!! £90 a night is not cheap for a 1 star hotel!!!!!! This should not even have a star, it should be classed as a HOSTEL! In Europe for example Prague a 5 star hotel i stayed in cost me only £70 a night and that was 5 star. Pictures and website is 100% MISLEADING THAT IS NOT WHAT I GOT NOR ANYONE ELSE ON MY GROUP GOT. We are going back this March to NYC for the conference and have stayed well clear from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “In 62yrs. On Earth, This Was My Worst Stay In Any Hotel, Anywhere!!”
Reviews.Author: wildcat1012
Reviews.Content: This was my wife & I's 10th ANNIVERSARY. We live in QUEENS, NEW YORK and I decided that we spend the nght in Manhatton, and have dinner at an great restaurant. My wife works not far from the hotel, so she got there before me. When I finally reached the hotel room, after parking the car (VALET-PARKING $40.OO FOR 24-HOURS) my wife was sitting on the bed rocking back and forth, and I could smell the very strong odor of bleach. I looked around the room and found: Used toilet paper sticking out from under the bed, a dirty refrIgerater, dirt and dust in very corner and on everthing, bleach marked rug, and the most nasty thing of all, "THE TOILET HAD FECES YOU COULD SEE AROUND THE LIP OF THE BOWL". This room could not have been cleaned or inspected by anyone in "GOD KNOWS' how long. When I went to the phone to call the manager, it had a thick coat of dirt on it and I had to use my hankerchief to pick it up. I asked the manager to come up to see the room (#1094) and the only thing he said was, someone would be up to give us a key to a new room. It was late so we moved into the room, (#1210) which was still small and dingy, also having a bleached stained rug, no view, but I thought we could make it though the night . We got out of there as fast as we could, to get fresh air and dinner. (WHICH WAS EXCELLENT-LUGO'S CAFFE) Upon returning to the room and attempting to get some rest, (the room was not suited for romance) I kept hearing these noises. By the time I figured out what it was, my wife had fallen to sleep, but I couldn't. (ROOM # 1210 WAS IN BACK OF THE ELEVATOR SHAFT) Everytime one of them went up or down I would hear it. I thought we had checked into the " HOLLYWOOD HOTEL'' which is a ride in DISNEYLAND & DISNEYWORLD called the "TOWER OF TERROR'. Early in the morning I went down to the front desk, and told the morning manger about the horrible stay, (Carmen was her name) and she took half off of the price of the room, and said that we could stay in the room after the normal check out. (Yeah right) Before she cut the price, the room was $234.00 with tax. We should have gotten all the of our money back (INCLUDING THE PARKING MONEY) Why? Because this was worst than my three trips to VIETNAM and living in the jungle there, and it screwed up our 10TH ANNIVERSARY. Oh by the way, on the internet The lobby picutures are pretty accurate, but the rooms, FORGET ABOUT!! IN 200yrs. the rooms have taken a beating. In one night my wife and I took one. We cannot afford to do this again for awhile. I'll have to make this up to her later. The hotel has a lot of rooms in it, but as CLINT EASTWOOD said in the movie, "DO YOU FEEL LUCKY. (Our Stay was last week, NOV. 13, 2009, (FRIDAY THE 13TH> YOU THINK?) Sorry I'm late with the review, but I am trying to forget this, but I won't.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Friendliest, expected more in New York”
Reviews.Author: lizpinky
Reviews.Content: Yes, this place has got a very good location, but don't expect to be greeted with a smile. When we arrivedat the Hotel Pennsylvania we got the impression that 'this place is really something'. There were only two check in clerks when we arrived, and another just looking out from a smaller room behind the counter. He made no effort to assist anyone, and when our turn came to check in one of the clerks got up from his desk and just walked away, noone replaced him and we thought that was real strange. When we got to our room the plaster was peeling off the wall and during our stay of 6 nights that plaster stayed on the floor of the room the entire time, it did't get vacuumed up at all. I left my spare coins stacked up on the bed side chest and we we got back to the room that evening ALL my change was gone! HMMMM. When we checked out they had charged us $16.49 for a phone call that didn't even connect, and were totally uncooperative about a refund. The only highight of our stay were the two lovely gentlement in the baggage storage area - PERSONALITY PLUS. What a shame the rest of the front line staff didn't have the same attitude. It was the only place we stayed in in America where we were charged a fee for each bag for storage.

Reviews.Title: “I travel often, but will never again stay at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Lonil001
Reviews.Content: First: Checkin. Waited for over 1/2 hour to be told that I had to come back in 2 hours. Second time two hours later, I waited for another hour in the line because there were only 2 employees checking people in. The first room they gave me had not yet been cleaned from previous guests. The second room was extremely small. Second: The Room. Ok, so we were told that the lower level room were not worth staying in, and that the "good" rooms were on the 11th and 12th floors. The first room they gave us was on the 11th floor. The hallways smelled musty and moldy, with a hint of stale cigarrettes. Since they hadn't even cleaned the room yet, the next room they gave us was on the 12th floor. The room was so small we could barely walk around the bed. The bathroom was outdated with old early 1900's black and white tiles, the sink was about to fall off the wall and the tub looked like it hadn't been cleaned... ever. The room was also so hot that I felt like I was in an oven. We cranked up the "A/c" and went to explore the city with the friends we traveled with. When we got back to the room several hours later, the room was like the inner santum of hell. Called and asked for someone to come look at the A/c. When the gentleman arrived, we were told that the building doesn't have A/c, only heat. We had to open the window (no screens) and try to get air in the room. Third: Maid Service. We were in this hotel for 2 nights. During that time, the maids walked into my room without knocking so they could clean. Not once, but TWICE! When I mentioned it to the front desk, the gentleman behind the counter just shrugged. Lastly: The Staff. The staff at this hotel does not seem to care about anything. The only acception was one gentleman working at the Tours desk in the hotel lobby. He was friendly and helpful when I asked about transportation and the locations of places we wanted to visit. The only good point of this hotel is that it is local to everything in Midtown Manhattan. However, there is no way I would ever stay at this hotel again. If you plan to go, then good luck to you.

Reviews.Title: “SCAM ALERT!!!”
Reviews.Author: steelersfan58
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect and that's about all that is perfect about it! If you have ever wanted to have the experiance of being in a movie then this hotel is for you! i turned the corner and was waiting for a red ball to come bouncing down the hall with 2 little creepy girls riding a bike or something! i think steven king filmed the shining here! my wife and i could have sworn we heard REDRUM,REDRUM echoing through the halls! the room was about the size of a closet, a desk (with a chair that was pretty much touching the bed, chipped, dirty walls, scuffed all over, a carpet that was paper thin and brown(we think it may have been white back in 1945) Decent price yes, but come on! now i am not picky at all but this one really got me angry. When we checked in all was cool until the very nice man say's..you need credit card for $40 hold for any "charges" you may have( phone calls i guess) i didn't have a credit card and offered to pay cash for the deposit. He was very annoyed and kept insisting we use a credit card so it would be easier at check out. After explaining 12 times that we did not have a credit card he reluctanly took cash and "threw" it in the register and we were all set. No biggie, he kindly reminded me to return the following day to retrive my $40 i said i would( who wouldn't get their money back) anyway, my wife and i went to the metallica concert had a blast and returned to the room and had a good night's sleep. The next morning when we went to check out it started out fine we walked up handed the guy our room key and he did his thing. My wife mentioned that we had to get our car that the valet had parked the night before, that's when all hell broke loose. My wife looks at the valet ticket and it say's $40 for parking! ummm what?? there was no mention of any "parking fee" before hand at any point! so where is this coming from? my wife went to the bell captain guy and i stood there waiting for my "deposit" that i had paid the night before, the very annoying and rude guy who checked me out just ignored me and said "next guest please" i said umm excuse me but i left a deposit last night and i was told i was to pick it up today. The guy say's "you need your car right"? i said yeah and? he then tells me that $40 i left the night before was for parking! oh hell no, are you kidding me? now we know why they wanted a credit card, so they could charge for parking and who know's what else. The guy yells out really loud..."security" call security, huh? for what? i had only asked to speak to a manager. So we leave to go get our car. Now the bell hop ask's where is your recipt? we are confused again, and he say's ok well $40! another $40? i don't think so pal! he say's without your recipt that you stayed here and payed the $40 you will have to pay another $40! yeah right! we go back inside to get our recipt and the guy who just checked us out 10 minutes earlier claims he has no idea who i am and that he did not check me out! uh yeah you did jerf off! he screams again security! call security please! what the [--]?? we could not believe what was going on, he tried to say he did not check me out and had never seen me before! what a nightmare. Since when does a hotel charge you for parking in their hotel when you are staying in their hotel? baffling to say the least! so in closing, STAY REAL CLEAR OF THIS RAT HOLE! they are scam artist in every sense of the word! STAY AWAY FROM HOTEL PA!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “dont know what everybody is moaning about”
Reviews.Author: gizm0smum
Reviews.Content: Myself my husband and daughter had a three night stay in the Pennsylvania this October.I must admit i was dreading the stay in this hotel having read the reviews. We arrived at 9pm and had to queue for about haif an hour which was really no hardship. The staff werent over friendly but when you think of all the people they have to deal with going by the size of the hotel i dont think i would be that happy either,so note to hotel manager you do need more staff on your check in desk.The guy that booked us in was quite helpful in sorting out a problem with our booking because we asked for non smoking,anyway he dealt with this quite efficiently ,when we got out of the lift the hallway lighting was quite dull,but you dont spend all your time in the hallway do you !!! Once we got in the room we were very pleased the room was enormous,loads of cuboard and drawer space and the shower room was huge, i do wander wether we were given a disabled room ,but who cares it was great.The room was cleaned every day with fresh towels and sheets. The hotel is in a great location i cant believe how close we were to Empire state building,that was right behind us, Madison sq Garden and penn station right in front of us, Times sq about 200 yrds to our right ,also Macys one block away , also if you need any information go and see Frank on the desk he will give you loads of info, loads of places to eat nearby, We loved new york and we will definetly stay at this hotel again!!

Reviews.Title: “Just the job”
Reviews.Author: Traveller605
Reviews.Content: Right in the centre of it all. It's old, yes. It could certainly do with an update. But, for the price you couldn't get upset. Directly facing Maddison Square Garden, it's a short walk to all Manhatten has to offer. Room was cleaned every day, clean towels left every day and it was so busy all the people can't have got it wrong. Staff at the front desk could have been more ameniable, but done their job and that's the only critisism I could make. Will definately stay there again, providing they don't hike the prices.

Reviews.Title: “More like Hotel Transylvania”
Reviews.Author: dandizette
Reviews.Content: The poor reviews are true, and deserved. This isn't a hotel as such, I've stayed in better hostels, and the experience of staying here is quite simply bizarre; from the weird roped off line system at reception to the presence of big burly security men checking your room key as you get onto the elevator - I guess that didn't bode too well. The lobby is huge, impersonal and chaotic. As I walked around in a peculiar daze i wondered if everyone else was hating it as much as I was. I felt like I'd been transported straight back into 1980s New York, think Michael Jackson's 'BAD' - an era the rest of the city has long left behind. The room was worse; dirty, dank and depressing... i won't go on, the other reviews and user photos sum it up.

Reviews.Title: “A health nightmare!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dukecat
Reviews.Content: As I sit here writing this review, I'm taking a breathing treatment because of all the mold and mildew problems with this hotel. Just stay away from it if you can!! I have stayed here quite a number of times (all against my will) because of my job. Sure the location is decent, but there are other hotels around the area that are much nicer than this one. You might pay a little more, but it will be clean. There is mold everywhere, not just the rooms. It's in the hallways too. And everytime I have stayed there, they are always paintning the hallways. I think they are trying to cover up the smell of the mold. The halls look like they're from the movie the Shining and the rooms look like they haven't been thoroughly cleaned since 1950! I'm surprised that the Health Department of New York hasn't shut it down! They must be paying somebody off! When you check in the line is always long because they only have 2 people working the desk and thats it! For a hotel that has over 1700 rooms, you'd think they'd have more staff at the check in counter. Please NYC, please shut down this horrible hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful stay...don't believe everything you read on here!!”
Reviews.Author: engagedinNYC2008
Reviews.Content: I'm just about to check out after a 4night stay with my parents and sister!! Wanted to write this review, given that i was dreading coming to ths hotel after reading some of the previous posts!!! This is my 4th time in NY and first stay in this hotel!!! When we arribved at 1.00pm the check in line was empty, we were dealt with in a pleasant and efficient manner and were even given the room that we had specifically requested (i had looked at some reviews for the best room numbers)!! Our room was a great size, plenty of room for luggage, comfy and clean beds, clean but small bathrrom (ok there was a chip out of the bath but i didnt lose any sleep over it!!! yes the corridors are a bit dark and dated but i didn't sleep in the corridors or spend any amount of time pacng up and down them so i wasn't bothered!! Great coffee shop ini the lobby!! we got this hotel at an amazing price and i think anyone who expects more than what they paid for is rather foolish!!overall a very pleasant stay and i will definately return to this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel like the plague”
Reviews.Author: denmate1960
Reviews.Content: This is possibly the worst hotel my family has had the misfortune to stay in anywhere in Europe or the US. We moved out the first night to the Holiday Inn not too far away on Lafayette. It was a bit more expensive but at least the rooms were clean and the bathrooms weren't rotten. I mean even the plughole had rusted away. If you like rust, dirt, blistered paint and that old 'Beirut' look, fine. If you don't, avoid like the plague. Their website is so outrageously removed from reality it's untrue. In the UK they'd be sued under the Trade Descriptions Act. It's a shame because the building is magnificent and the location fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Don't blame the staff”
Reviews.Author: Gregory-Jones
Reviews.Content: You can't blame the staff for the condition of the hotel. The place is owned and operated by a company that does not know how to run a hotel, they were only interested in the property that it sits on. I agree the place needs to be cleaned up but when most of the money that you earn is taken from you and only the bare minimum is given to keep the place operational, what do you expect? This hotel was a grand old girl back in her day and has the potential to be on of the most spectacular places in NYC if ever run by a company that actually knew a thing or two about hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Shame on you New York”
Reviews.Author: HelenB50
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Pennsylvania in New York is possibly the dirtiest hotel I have ever stayed in. I expected a hotel with functional rooms and little in terms of facilities but I was unprepared for the dirt and shabbiness that was exposed. We moved to room after room. Problems included. Faeces in the toilet, nose pickings on the back of the bathroom doors. Towels already used and strewn across the bathroom. Dirty bedspreads. Lack of hovering and downright dull lack of light. The Front Managers of this hotel will not talk to you in person so you have to talk to them only over the phone. They said dirt was not their problem and that I should talk to housekeeping. Talking to housekeeping did not solve any problems, grabbing a cleaner and pointing to the problem helped but then one had to sleep in the room and use the dirty bathrooms before the cleaners are in the corridors in the morning. Windows stuck open on cold nights are also unacceptable. You can usually tell a hotel or company by the way they deal with any issues; they were rude, difficult, uncivil and unable to provide us with a clean room to stay in. I question the security in this hotel as the one man sitting outside the lifts seems not to notice anyone. The hotel is open to different entrances and I felt quite unsafe. All in all this hotel ruined my dream holiday in New York.

Reviews.Title: “It's a dump. If you're going to bother going to NY,pay the extra for something better”
Reviews.Author: Powerpaddy
Reviews.Content: The place is a tip. The hotel itself is absolutely huge, and facing Madison Square Garden, so when you roll up to the place, you think you 're in for a treat. You could not wish for a better location. Inside, it looks like a scene from "The Shining". The huge lobby is authentic 1930's (last time it was decorated or cleaned). The rooms are frankly a disgrace. We went back to the lobby and demanded to be moved , but the one we were moved to was no better. The rooms are dirty, dusty and smell. If I went again , I would not stay there. With the subway system as good and as widespread as it is, there's no need to stay absolutely slap bang in the middle of NY. Even if you did want to stay in the middle, and like me you have travelled halfway around the world to get there, pay the extra, get something better. Don't let this dump cast a shadow on your trip. I have to add that New York is my favourite city I have ever been to. I was a cynic before I went, but found the people the most genuine I have come across anywhere in the world. Just don't stay here. Please.

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere, don't waste your time!!”
Reviews.Author: ilovenycAnnapolis_Md
Reviews.Content: The website is VERY misleading. I chose this hotel for convienence to the train station and that is all it was, convienient. Upon entering the lobby you get the feeling that it is competive with other NYC hotels. But it is not. With 30 minutes in line for check in they could have had many more people working the front desk. Our room was on the 16th floor. Upon arrival to the floor is was the most dismal and eerie hallway. Apparently not ALL the rooms are renovated as advertised. We opened the door to flip on the light switch and found no lights....had to walk around in the dark to find a light and when we turned it on....wow....what an awful place to stay!! I immediately called down to have my room changed and was told that they were booked for the night....after the front desk just informed me that they were not full. When i questioned this I was told...my room type was booked for the night. 2 double beds. Talk about absolute bare bones. NOTHING on the walls, no pictures, NO mirror. It was just like a dorm room with not one ammenity. The bathroom was very old and the window stayed cracked at 2 inches. There were not enough towels to accomodate us so i called down for more towels and did not get what i had asked for. We were not in the room when they arrived and came back to find them thrown on the bed. The hallway was very noisy, The next day we were charged to have our luggage held in the cellar. After $340 for the room that was terrible you think they could have held our luggage for nothing. The luggage man informed us that the hotel was like a book that should never be judged from its cover. ALOT of misinformation from the website to the staff. Absolutely would NEVER stay in this hotel again for any reason.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel pennsylvania is not as bad as people are saying it is”
Reviews.Author: northpolelady
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 6 day stay in New York. We were a group of 8 people and after reading the reviews we were somewhat apprehensive about the hotel. The location is great, convenient to everything you will want to see.The room we had was huge O K it could do with a bit of a makeover but on the whole it wasent that bad.One of the joys of the hotel it is smack next door to a wonderful coffee and doughnut kiosk so we were able to have a wonderful coffee and fresh doughnut every morning before we went on our way to do some sightseeing. [ and only for 2 dollars ] My daughter is planning to go to New York next year and I have told her to go to Hotel Pennsylvania as a rule you only spend the night there. By the way the young man in the luggage hold dept is a pure joy...helpful..happy.. We couldnt ask for more Give Hotel Penn a try and judge for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: BetoM
Reviews.Content: Great location, easy check in - check out, old furniture but it´s OK.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: pc88
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location for visiting Manhattan. It's close to the subway and Penn Station, and you can walk to a lot of attractions. I needed a convenient, reasonably priced hotel for visiting the city with my 5 month old baby. Our room was small and the window looked directly into the windows of the building next door - but that also describes my first apartment in New York. The A/C wasn't working well, but a very pleasant man showed up minutes after I called and fixed it. The cafe in the lobby is great for grabbing some coffee or pastries in the morning. All in all, I was completely satisfied and would stay there again. It's not a luxury hotel. It's a clean, centrally located, relatively cheap place to sleep in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate.”
Reviews.Author: MarkHCapeTown
Reviews.Content: Central to Penn Station, Macys, Koreatown, but otherwise this part of midtown is a cultural desert. Times Square is relatively close. Hotel and lobby looks fine from outside. Rooms are a disappointment - small, dim, basic. I think they re-carpeted, but the furnishings were old and the paint peeling. OK for a place to crash and shower, but considering the price tag >$200 per night, don't expect to much.

Reviews.Title: “ok for the time we spent in there.”
Reviews.Author: angibabyok
Reviews.Content: just got back havin stayed here for 3 nights having just been to las vegas. Only got there late on so there where no waiting at reception. the hotel looks fine from the outside and reception is also fine.Once the lift door opened on the 16th floor i thought id gone back in time. Our room was small, the double bed was only a small double bed , if you turned over the whole bed shuck. The bathroom was old with paint pealing off walls . the hotel itself was situated in a good spot near to time square.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: jkae
Reviews.Content: I had read many reviews about this hotel and the majority of them said this hotel was the one to avoid, so I had my doubts about the room,staff,cleanliness etc. I was very impressed with the helpful staff and the high standards of the hotel in general, especially when I considered what a great deal I had got on the internet! The location is superb for all the main attractions and the subway is right across the road. I took my son for his 18th birthday and we both had a fantastic time, I would definitely recommend this hotel and a visit to NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Good location - dismal rooms and service.”
Reviews.Author: japansports
Reviews.Content: I needed to make a quick business trip to NYC and chose the Hotel Pennsylvania because of the location across from Penn Station. While on the surface it looks like a full-service hotel, don't expect much. Check-in on a Tuesday with only four people ahead of me in line was a 25 -minute wait. My room was dismal - very dark (no lighting except for a dim, bedside lamp) and unrenovated with a cramped bathroom with cracked walls and peeling paint. There was a refrigerator, which I did appreciate. The internet access (not wireless) was not working, but calls to get help were met with answering machines and no returned calls so I was forced to walk elsewhere for internet access to get some work done. The lobby is clean and gives the appearance of an updated, bustling hotel, and I did feel safe there. Location is the best thing this hotel has to offer, but if you are looking for even a decent room and amenities, look elsewhere. For the same rates, you can do better, even in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Pennsylvania is a great deal!”
Reviews.Author: uberaeth
Reviews.Content: The room is very basic, but since it's in NYC, we didn't spend too much time in the room other than sleeping and showering. The location is great, it's right across from Penn Station. It's a great value if all you're looking for is a place to sleep in a great location

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and value!”
Reviews.Author: ChelsD
Reviews.Content: We traveled to NY for a four day trip, and location and value were our key search criteria. Both were met and exceeded at this hotel. We booked early and got a great deal on a moderately sized room. The hotel had some classic charm, and some wear and tare, but we found the facilities clean and comfortable. The staff lacked some costumer service warmth, but were helpful when needed. Overall, a wonderful location. We will recommend to friends!

Reviews.Title: “The dirtiest hotel I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: taffyDavies
Reviews.Content: Yes the hotel is in a great location but it is filthy. I checked out at least 23 rooms and they were all dirty. I told the manager he should get rid of all his cleaning staff I would rather sleep on the street. I have travelled all over the World and have never come across such a dirty place. I would not stay here again if they paid me

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: ESCSpain
Reviews.Content: This hotel must be close for sanitary reasons. I was bitten by bed bugs all over my body, and apparently it is not the first time it happens... The room was dirty and smelly and the service is terrible. It is true that it is well located, but I'd rather stay in a well located metro station than in this hotel, for sure it'd be cleaner, and safer.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs, Rude Staff, Long Lines, Moldy, Worn Out, Filthy...”
Reviews.Author: MP8
Reviews.Content: Simply put, I had rather sleep in the gutter than ever return here. I came home with bed bugs. For most of the staff English is not yet a second language. The lobby is always crowed with pushy airline personnel. I waited in line for nearly three hours (combined) to check in/out. This place should be closed for sanitary reasons. It has a documented history of bed bugs and other unacceptable "features." DO NOT BE A FOOL.: NEVER EVER STAY HERE!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel for good price and fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: frankiemoo
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel and like the first it was fine. I searched high and low for something with a similar location and price and could find nothing. The hotel is in no way luxurious, the halls and doors are a little scary, the rooms are stained, musty and worn down. However, the room was generally clean, large and very comfortable. Arriving at the hotel at midnight I was expecting the worst judging by reviews but was pleasantly surprised. I had a nice street view and staff were friendly enough. Definitely not recommended for a long stay or special occassion but perfect for a few days sightseeing and a good nights sleep. It was very noisy at night but that is due to the excellent location as it is within easy walking distance from Macy's, the ESB, Times Sq and across the road from Madison Sq Gardens and Penn station. A tip is to email ahead and request a renovated room, I did this pretending it was my friends 21st b'day and was told that would be fine, however as we arrived so late they could not give us one and luckily we were happy enough with the room we received.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: elwinko
Reviews.Content: Wasnt sure what to expect from this hotel as booked it online about a month before we went and only paid £53 a night. However was pleasantly suprised, we got to hotel about 1pm and it did take about half an hour to get checked in but that was the only down side. Our room was a pretty good size, bed was comfy, good sized bath and very powerful shower. The air con was a little bit noisy but to be honest there is so much to do in NY, by the time we got back to the hotel we were asleep in minutes anyway. Overall I would defently stay here again, its about 10 min walk from times square and just opposite penn subway station so was very easy to get about. The room could of probably done with a fresh lick of paint but it was clean and a good size.

Reviews.Title: “The only good thing about this hotel is the location”
Reviews.Author: MissyFanus
Reviews.Content: My partner and I went to New York last year, we booked a 4 night stay at the Pennsylvania. It was the first time we had been to New York so needless to say we were very very excited. We arrived at the hotel in the afternoon and as we walked in I instantly thought wow what a hotel, it looked beautiful! We went straight to check in and we were seen very quickly which I was pleased with as when I read reviews I thought there would be a long wait. Everything was going well until we got to our room, it was small,dark and dingy, nothing like what we had seen on the website. The air conditioning made a noise which was annoying but luckily we could get past that but the room was so out dated and looked like it needed a good scrub. We had noticed our toilet was leaking and there was a puddle covering the bathroom floor so the next morning we went to the front desk to let someone know so they could fix it, when we got back that evening it still hadn't been done, again the next morning we went down and asked again about the toilet and still nothing was done all day, every morning we repeated the same thing! The staff were not at all helpful they didnt really care which was disappointing. The day before we were due to go home me and my partner were sitting on the bed sorting out our itinerary for the day when I looked down and got the shock of my life, there was a giant cockroach crawling up my leg, that was the final straw we packed our stuff and went down to reception and demanded a new room, we were reluctantly given a new room which to be honest wasn't much better than the first one but we dealt with it just because we were going home the next day, From the outside and the lobby the hotel looks lovely but the rooms were horrible, the staff were horrible and I would never stay there again. I was very disappointed overall, if the staff had been friendlier and helpful and we didnt get a cockroach in the room we could have dealt with it as being in New York you don't tend to spend alot of time in the room anyway but we were just completely ignored. As i said the only good thing about this hotel is the location, madison square garden opposite and everything is literally round the corner

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!!”
Reviews.Author: explorer50uk
Reviews.Content: My adult son, daughter and I stayed at the Penn from the 27th-29th August. Our check in was pretty slow, but what can you do? once at the counter the lady was very efficient and quickly set us up with our room. The room was quite large with 3 single beds, lots of room, not much of a view, but by the time we went to bed who cares!! OK the rooms could do with a bit of modernisation but for the price we paid it was fine!! everything worked fine. The elevators were quick and the location is excellent but not quite so busy as Times Square. which is a bonus!! We have stayed at the Penn and also at other hotels in NYC, but for value and location this is one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at the Penn!!! It's cheap for a reason”
Reviews.Author: NYJul2009
Reviews.Content: The Penn had a great location just 2minitues from Macys and across the street from the subway station. Looking for a cheap girly shopping trip to New York the Penn was the cheapest by far for its location, so knowing this we had little expectations apart from a clean room. However upon reaching our hotel room we had just realised why the hotel was so cheap. The room was dingy, old and disgustingly dirty, with questionable stains and scum left in the bath tub. We were very unfortunate as our hotel was pre-booked, we had no other choice but to stick it out and stay, however not before changing rooms 3times and spending an hour cleaning and desterilising our bathroom first. Yes this was the best room of 3 we moved to! To top it off however, we were staying next door (to what we thought) were a couple, who did not show any consideration for the other guests next door (us) of which we were repeatedly woken up by constant banging noises... The best is yet to come, as it was not actually a couple but turned out to be a lone male bringing indecent visitors to the hotel, to which most other hotels would have stopped them. New York is a lovely place to visit which we do plan to revisit soon, but we will never stay here again. If cleanliness is a priority of yours DO NOT stay here but if location is more of a priority the Penn is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as you`d think - but almost!”
Reviews.Author: beauxl2002
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in September, and having read previous TA reviews was not expecting much. However it was my girlfriends first visit to NYC, so we weren`t planning on spending alot of time in the room. Firstly, the check-in and out queues are as bad as previously suggested. And to store luggage in the lobby before a late flight home was a painful experience. Unlike every other hotel I`ve stayed in I had to PAY for the privilage($4 / bag), queue up AGAIN at check-in to get a luggage tag, then locate the lugage room via an elevator and a creepy walk down in the bowels of the hotel. Also there are no restrooms in the lobby. The staff were generally typical New York, direct and too the point, which is fine, but at least a please and thankyou would have been nice once in a while. The rooms were actually OK. I`d requested a `renovated` room, only to be told they had no such thing - honest at least! However the room was very clean, the TV worked fine, and the bathroom was acceptable for this price. Also, I found the hotel corridors to be perfectly well lit and not at all creep as previous reviewers have suggested. The only negatives to the rooms were the maid service. Towels got less and less each day, bed not properly made and attempting to walk in the room at 8am despite the `Do not disturb` sign! Overall, the location and price means that its a bit of a bargain really. It has a motel feel to it, and its clear the staff do not care. This maybe due to the fact the place is looking likely to be knocked down shortly for redevelopment.. Personally I would pay another $60 a night and stay at the Doubletree Met or Novotel uptown.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs! And very filthy! Even for this price it should be cleaner...”
Reviews.Author: Corina82
Reviews.Content: During my stay at the Penn.hotel I've complained about my room for the first time ever. I have been in shabby hotels before, but this was really unacceptable! During my first night I got bitten by bedbugs, that's wasn't fun at all.... Early in the morning I went to the front desk and the man at the desk didn't seem to be impressed by my complaint, he didn't even seem to do anything with it. I got another room, dough the first was spacious, I now got a room without any daylight, only one small lamp. As the first room was very filthy, many layers of dust, dirty hairs in the badroom and many stains and other dirt around the place. The next room was as filthy as the first, even dirthy towels... In the evening I got anohter unpleasant surprise, a huge spot on the sheet, groose!! So even if you don't have much of a budget, avoid this place! Even for this price it should be cleaner! But NYC is great!

Reviews.Title: “U Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: EDT3270
Reviews.Content: Just to get this out of the way...the hotel isn't stellar or great by any means. I didn't have a horror room like some of the other reviews but it did leave a lot to be desired. The halls were dark and a little scary..it reminded me of the movie 1408. The room was tiny and had a strange smell. The handles on the AC were broken and I couldn't tell what temperature I had it on so I had to just fiddle with it until I felt comfortable. But the thing is...you get what you pay for. I paid like $126 or something a night. I was right across from Madison Square Garden (which was great because I was there to see the legendary Britney Spears in concert..GREAT concert by the way..if you ever get a chance everyone should go). Across from the train station. Blocks from Times Square and pretty much convenient to a lot of the touristy things. And the subway was across the street to go to the other places I need to go. So if you really want a great hotel...go elsewhere and pay more. If you want a decent place to lay your head for the NYC equivalent of dirt cheap...stay here. Oh and the front desk person I always dealt with was nice. A little abrupt...but nice.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant place for a base - dont know what other people were expecting for the price!”
Reviews.Author: misslongworth
Reviews.Content: Ok, so I usually don't bother writing reviews as I find the reviews that are usually accurate on here. However after months of panicking and worrying how horrible the hotel would be and how it might ruin our holiday i was really really suprised. I'll run through the pro's first then hit you with the con's (because lets face it, all cheap hotels will have them) Pro's: -the hotel reception was really pretty nice and spacious and clean. -When we got to the hotel room (1181) it was a perfect size I wouldn't have expected any bigger as it IS a city hotel (many of the reviewers would do well to remember this). -The bed was HUGE and really comfy. - we were given a view of the empire state building which was beautiful, -everything was clean cons: Ok, so I have to admit that the hotel DOES shoot itsself in the foot on a LOT of occassions. -the queue was really long and by the end of it you kind of wanted to slap the people on front desk because they just seem to go so slowly, its also really frustrating because there are so many things that they could have done - like got you to fill out forms while waiting. -also the front desk staff aren't charismatic at all - and not at all friendly to be honest they just seemed a bit slow and dim (sorry if any of you read this!) -there was a luggage room, but it does cost £4 and the internet is quite expensive too. From a personal point of view I would not use this hotel again as for me although its location was brilliant for the touristy stuff I found that the things I loved so much about new york weren't really in that area and personally I would rather save a little longer and go to a better hotel just for the luxury of it. So my advice is that if you've booked the hotel and are just using it as a base, DON'T WORRY! My guess is that some people were just expecting something amazing for a tiny amount which is incredibly naive and arrogant. However, If you haven't booked it yet have a little look around on tripadvisor and spend a bit more for something in a little less of a touristy location and a bit more stylish rooms.

Reviews.Title: “disgustingly filthy”
Reviews.Author: mcshuggles
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about ths hotel is the location. The lobby is inviting displaying a grandeur which reflects its name. We were allocated room 411 which had fungus on the walls, the showerroom was broken tiles and dilapidated. The toilet once flushed wouldn't stop running and we had to call maintenance five minutes into the stay. The clothes wardrobe was a bare-bricked hole in the wall with a louvre door. When we complained to the duty manager he was most unhelpful and suggested we book out - so we did. Object lesson - examine the rooms before you register with this group as its not what you see on the brochure. McShuggles, Scotland

Reviews.Title: “front desk person was great.”
Reviews.Author: curlyNiagaraFAlls
Reviews.Content: We arrived early , about 10am. Was given a better & bigger room than we had booked , as there were three of us it worked out great. We put our luggage in left luggage down stairs, bought tickets at another desk for the hop on bus, had breakfast from Tim Hortons adjoining the hotel out front & was on the bus by 11am.Very efficient. Did the lower Manhatan loop, went back to the hotel to get our keys , put our luggage in the room, had lunch & back on the bus for the upper Manhattan loop, all in one day, but at least we saw everything & wrote down the places we wanted to get off & investigate the next day.We were in New York 4 days 3 nights & packed a lot into it. We all said we would go back to the Hotel Pennsylvania, it's not new , but we found it comfortable & handy to most things.

Reviews.Title: “It's not that bad. Read my review!”
Reviews.Author: vicky1983
Reviews.Content: It really is'nt that bad remember. That you are paying for what you get the location is perfect.The hotel is in a prime location, 5mins walk from anything of interest and 2secs from penn station to take you anywhere further, for the price you pay for this hotel you cant ask for any better, i come to new york every year and always try and stay in this hotel the years i have been unable to stay in this hotel i have been extremely dissapointed if you think this is bad go and stay in the new yorker then you will be able to Complain!!! just go to new york and enjoy your self just remember while your there shopping and site seeing how long will you actually be spending in the hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Creepy! Location only worth it if you're lucky to get a good room”
Reviews.Author: Mari_BR_SP
Reviews.Content: I made my trip arrangements trough a travel agent and had no choice concerning the hotel, since it was a great deal and prices were really a bargain. After reading the reviews, we were terrified and almost decided to cancel the reservations and get another hotel, even if we had to pay for high fees for that. But then we decided to relax and give it a try, if it was that terrible we would simply walk away and find another place to stay. We arrived around 1pm and there were only 3 guests waiting in the line for check in. I thought we had a great beginning since all reviews told about the huge lines. But when I walked up to the rude attendant, he yelled at me saying he had no rooms available for an early check-in. I tryed to explain that we didn't want an early check-in, we just wanted to do all the check-in procedures and leave our luggage while we waited and had a meal somewhere in the nearby. Impossible to communicate with the old schmuck, we gave up and decided to wait until the check-in time. When we got back to the lobby at around 3 pm, the line was huge! After waiting more than 1 hour, when it was my turn, I told the attendant (this time was a nice one) I wanted a refurbished room. He told me he would see what he had to offer us and I emphasized that it had to be either a refurbished room or a spacious room, since we requested a TPL. He was really nice and told me he had a good room for us and despite not being a renovated room, he was sure we would like it. And he also told us we could come back and talk to him if we were not satisfied with the room. While we were walking down the hall (on 2nd floor) we were really scared: it's the creepiest place I've ever been to, the smell of mold was disgusting and the carpet and walls looked really shabby. But when we got to our room, I can tell you: it wasn't bad at all. It was a huge room, with two double beds, plenty of place, walk-in closet with iron and ironboard, and the bathroom was one of the renovated ones. We were really relieved, the room was perfect for what we needed and also clean (no smell of mold). A/C was working properly, beds were ok, water pressure and temperature fine, everything was just fine. So, I wrote this huge review just to tell you the following: 1. The hotel is creepy, old and service is terrible. BUT, you might be lucky if you ask for a good room in the front desk by the check-in time. Don't forget to be polite, you get what you give; 2. Location is great, can't beat for this price in Manhattan; 3. Don't expect anything you are used to have in "standard" hotels, it will certainly be worse in the Penn. But remember that in Manhattan, the Penn's really a cheap place, so you will get cheap service and a cheap hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with a great location to get around NY”
Reviews.Author: RPereira2008
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Penn with my wife on Dec 2008 for the New Year Eve. The hotel is huge and that leads to a gigantic confusion whenever you want something from the reception (we took about 2 hours to check-in and 1 hour to check-out). Nevertheless the hotel staff was nice and friendly. The rooms could use a restyling... that green carpet on the bedroom floors doesn't look too fashionable or hygienic. The rooms are simple however they fulfilled all our needs (without exceding expectations) and seemed clean. The hotel biggest strenght is its location. It is only a few blocks away from times square and right in front of Macys and Madison Square Garden. It is also served directly by two different subway lines.

Reviews.Title: “The only good thing about this place is the location”
Reviews.Author: grampaSanDiego
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Saturday with friends from oversees. The check in line was ridiculously long. We paid extra for the "Penn 5000" club amenities. That was suppose to include a separate check in desk. Forget it, that place was never open the entire 4 days we stayed there. The rooms are NOT as they appear on their website. They are much smaller. The room we booked was supposed to have a comfortable chair. Not so. The room was dirty. The walls, carpet, bedspread (complete with cigarette burns) drapes, all dirty. The bathroom had cracked and missing tiles and an old radiator that leaked constantly. When we complained to the RUDE front desk agent about the lack of comfortable chair and dirty room, he told us we had to wait until after 4:00 pm to see if there would be another room available. The "Penn 5000" amenities also included a free breakfast. That was suppose to be for those guests with special access with their room cards. Forget it. Anyone could (and did) just walk right in and have breakfast. When we finally did get our room changed the room key card didn't work right. Between us and our friends we had to get our key cards rekeyed at least 4 times. And that meant standing in that ridiculously long line at check in every time. Don't pay extra for the "Penn 5000" club. You don't get anything extra for it. The business center and fitness center were both minimal. The only good thing going for this hotel is the location. Walking distance to everything.

Reviews.Title: “It's what you get for the price we paid”
Reviews.Author: rockss
Reviews.Content: ____________________________________________________________________ ----------Advantages------------ Great location. ____________________________________________________________________ --------Disadvantages---------- Taken from the website, "Inside our property, you'll find beautifully renovated rooms, with new furniture and carpeting, a comfortable work desk with reading lamp, flat screen color televisions, AM/FM clock radios, telephones with voice mail, individual air conditioning and climate control." That description was far from the many rooms that Hotel Pennsylvania has to offer. That description fits for only 1% of the hotel rooms, which will cost hundreds more. Misleading, of course. We booked a total of 3 rooms, each having appliances. I had no fridge, the other had a tiny fridge, and the other had a larger fridge. The floors where extremely dirty, you can definitely see how terrible the room/cleaning services are just by looking at the floor and the bathroom. As soon as I entered the room, a stench of foul odor and the dirty environment really steps you back, even my wife called me "cheap". Well I didn't expect the rooms to look like this, especially since they are apparently the "Most popular hotel" and "Visitor friendly." All three rooms where dirty, mine being the dirtiest :( The line up in the check-in was loooooong. The line up was close to reaching the entrance doors and they only had 2-3 services checking them in. I had to wait an hour! The bell man was RUDE RUDE RUDE. We bought a 12pack Green Tea Lipton icetea because it's expensive to buy it from coffee shops and all. We told him to take everything in the back trunk, and that included our drinks. Guess what? He opened it and said, "I might just get myself one." in front of my kids. They told me soon afterward, and I just told them 'ok that's his tip.' While I was lining up to check-in, my cousin (who was with me on another car) told me he came up to him asking for a tip, he was persistent too. I was mad at him of course. But I didn't see him again unfortunately. We paid him $10 and a drink just for him to bring them in the lobby. Yes, the lobby which we could have done effortlessly and for free... but he didn't tell us that we have to get another bell man inside to bring it upstairs to our rooms. At least the other bell man we got was nicer. Horrible services and staff! I don't believe there was a pool, if there was, I surely wouldn't want to go. The lobby looked pretty nice for what is a '1-star hotel', but after going up, the elevator was much like a time portal bringing you back to the WW1 theme. Ugly ugly ugly. The doors for the rooms had some weird design as if it was purely designed for stopping 30mm bullets.... The framing was made out of wood and was rotting. The paint on the wall was chipping. The window was stuck. The bathtub's paint was also peeling off. The ceiling paint was peeling off, and every so often some will fall on you. Door knob for bathroom was sticky. Soap was opened and used. Toilet was tainted yellow. Mirror was dirty. Bathroom lighting kept blinking. Floors where dirty, dusty, and stained. Last but not least - it stunk. Go figure. ____________________________________________________________________ Anyways, the location was great, facing Madison Square Garden and a few blocks away from Empire State Building. I would NEVER recommend this hotel, especially since it's expensive but yet 'cheap' in NY. I will pay more next time to get a better and comfortable stay in some other hotel. STAY AWAY!!!

Reviews.Title: “WORST Hotel on the Planet”
Reviews.Author: whiney
Reviews.Content: I am a world traveller, I selected this hotel because I was taking the train to Manhattan and this hotel was close by. BIG Mistake!! I thought the sencond time staying there, after a very bad review 15 years ago, that the 'newly renovated Hotel Penn' was going to be a great experience. Not So!! The only good thing about that hotel is the lobby. Once you hit the elevator buttons, it's all down hill. My room cost me over $116.00 It was dirty and small. The shower unit was so tiny with the painted shower floor all peeling. I could not put my feet on the tile. To make matters worse, a 'fire' or smoke damage" on the 7th floor caused all the guest to be evacuated. Their guest stood outside on the sidewalks in 92 degree heat until nearly 10.30 p.m. More than 6 hours past and not one of the management of this hotel showed their manners and came to see if their paying guest were okay. They never offered us not even 'water'. We could not get into the hotel and I can understand that, but there were sick people, including me. My medication was in my room. As we returned to the hotel lobby it was more confusion. Rather than organizing the guest to go in floor by floor to expedite the process, it was a free for all. The process took another hour of waiting. I will never recommend this hotel, not even to 'pets'!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is not that bad. Stop complaining”
Reviews.Author: ILOVENY99
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel before when my mother came to visit us. It was OK then. A few days ago my niece and her husband came to visit us, we took them to NY and stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. I had read most of the reviews, good and bad. I was worry about the cleanliness of this hotel and brought sheets and towels from home. When we arrived, the hotel staffs were very friendly, and it took us 10 - 15 minutes to check in. I was surprised, may be because there were not too many people at that time. The lobby hotel was pretty big and clean. The room was pretty small but enough for both of us. The bath room was old but in working order. There were no bed bugs or insects in the room or any where in the room or bed (I checked). I was worry about it. If you take shower before you go to bed, the bugs will stay away from you. This hotel is no frills, nothing fancy. The maid came to clean our room daily. Nothing was missing from us. When we returned from sightseeing, we saw so many people outside the hotel and the police officers told us that we were not allowed to come in on the lobby area. The hotel staff told us that there was a fire on the 7fl. Some one on the 7fl smoked cigarettes and accidentally set the mattress on fire. After a while we were allowed to stay on the lobby area. There were at least 100 people on the lobby and elevator area. We were sitting on the lobby area and talked to tourists from all over the world. I asked them what they think about the hotel. They were pretty much happy, because of the location. They all said that the room is pretty small but ok. Finally, when we got back to the room and there was no light. I called the front desk and it took over an hour for the engineer to come to fix it, due to high volume of people using the elevator. To tell you the truth, we were expecting the worse. We are not picky people The location of this hotel is great; a few blocks from the Empire States Building and restaurants, metro station and Madison Square Garden just a cross from the hotel. So, please stop complaining. What you need is a clean place to sleep at night and hot shower. I will definitely go back to stay at this hotel because of the location and price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Basic but wouldn't go past this place”
Reviews.Author: Avondhu
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pennsylvania Hotel for Thanksgiving 08 with my mam, this was my 4th time staying here, can't go past it for location, right across road from MSG, next to Macys, Manhattan Mall, ESB only two blocks away, short walk to Times Square. Tip, when checking in ask for renovated room, i have done this all 4 times and the room has been fine, very basic but clean, cleaning ladies came every day, plenty clean towels etc. Front desk staff can be fairly rude but you can find that with alot of places in NY. If your looking for something special pay more and stay somewhere else but if you like us, only looking for clean bed to sleep at night def worth the stay, i'd rather spend my money in Woodbury or Jersey Gardens!!! Going back in Dec for New Years and staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: SheepEl
Reviews.Content: First of all I would like to remind all the other people that tbis hotel is 90 YEARS OLD!  It went through a significant renovation in tge 1980's which actually stripped the hotel of it's original beauty.  If you know what your looking at, you can see the original decor hidden.  If you did not know this,  the hotel was actually the largest hotel in the world until 1927, and is the 4th largest hotel in Manhattan.  The hotel is also vety famous.  Back in the mid 1940's many famous politicians and musician stayed at the hotel.  Glenn Miller, one of the worlds most renowned Big Band, and Swing musicians stayed in, and also had concerts in the hotels Cafe Rouge.  getting back to the hotel today, the bedrooms are decent, they could use a a renovation but there a not at all unsightly.  The service was okay.  My friend and I actually came to Hotel Penn to sneak around the building and find all of the original rooms.  We dud find hidden remains ofthe 1919 structure.  I would also like to say that the hotel is being threatened for demolition.  The hotel still holds the original beauty!!  All th restoration was, was just covering up the original rooms!  Go to this links, and look at what this hotel used to look like.  Demand that Hotel Penn be saved, because I know they will renovate the hotel back to its original splendor.  The hotels most famous room called The Cafe Rouge, is actually under restoration.  Stay at this hotel and stay in a peice of history!  Attached to this are links to photographs of the original Lobby. http://dismuke.net/howimages/hotelpennsylvanialobby.jpg

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Shockingly rude desk staff & desperately in need of modernisation.”
Reviews.Author: Juicytravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as it was fairly cheap, (well, cheap for New York!), and was ideally located for Penn Station as well as Times Square & The Empire State Building. Upon arrival though it became apparent as to why it was cheaper than other alternatives. Firstly, the foyer was bedlam! There were hundreds of people milling around and it was difficult to get anywhere near the check in. Once we did get to check in, we were greeted by an incredibly rude receptionist who decided she didn't want to check us in and wandered off in a strop. After then waiting for a further 30 mins to check in we were finally dealt with, (again in a fairly surly manner) & eventually got to our room. To say the room was dated would be an understatement and the hotel itself was scruffy in general. The amenities in the room were poor to be honest but as we were only in New York for 3 days we didn't spend much time there anyway. The room was quite noisy, the bed needed throwing out 15 years before we got to it! And the bathroom was as old fashioned as it gets. When we left the room to see the sights, we would regularily pass the cleaning staff who were a welcome change from the idiots on reception. They always greeted us with a smile & exchanged pleasantries. The coffee shop in the foyer was great & resonably priced. The same however, could not be said for the onsite restaurant. Considering the USA bangs on about how great their food is, this was possibly the worst restaurant on the planet! For 2 two course meals, one glass of milk & a couple of Cokes we were charged $80+!!! They served Smash as, "creamed potatoes" & the waitress took it upon herself to add her 18% tip to the bill anyway! It was terrible. Overall, it's brilliantly located & Cheap for New York prices but I'm afraid that's all it has going for it.

Reviews.Title: “Cant fault the location”
Reviews.Author: Travellin-Tottie
Reviews.Content: New York was a destination i had wanted to go for many years so when my parents booked the trip in 2002, they wanted the experience to be one to remember!!!! And it was just that........ The location was perfect right across the road from Madison Sq Gardens adn within easy access of subways etc. After arriving on an long early morning flight all we wanted to do was freshen up and then sleep before beginning our holiday properly. After being greeted by a very rude receptionist we were taken to our rooms. The corridor made you feel you were in a old style gangster film (we were later told this floor had not be refurbished yet). After unpacking we decided to shower and sleep, the sight in the bathroom quickly changed our minds. Mould and damp greeted us in the bathroom. The bottom of the showercurtain was black with mould and the room smelt musty. We decided just to call it a night, the temp of the room kept fluctuating from ice cold to red hot making sleeping unbearable and if that was not bad enough we awoken at 5 in the morn by my youngest sister screaming their was something crawling in her bed. With my mum trying to calm her we checked her bed to find a HUGE coakroach!!! Yes a coakroach (we saw many other on our trip mainly in the corridors) netherless she refused to sleep in there afterwards. Lovely location but cant say much for the hotel

Reviews.Title: “It isn't THAT bad!!”
Reviews.Author: Cazbar99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in April 2007. We booked as part of a package deal and hadn't done any research beforehand so when I read the TA reviews I was really worried and was expecting all sorts. The room was pretty small and smelt like stale cigarettes even though I'm pretty sure we booked a none smoking room. Apart from that it was ok. The bathroom was clean and the bedding etc. The whole place is pretty dated and could use some major work. All we wanted was somewhere to throw our bags and sleep. There's so much to see and do in New York we were hardly ever there and it can't be beaten for location. However, if you know you're going to be spending some time in your room and want a little bit of luxury I wouldn't recommend, I'm pretty sure there are much nicer places for the price, it's just a case of doing some research.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: CarolineMal
Reviews.Content: I tried to cancel by hotel booking after reading the reviews on here. As it would've cost me nearly £100 to cancel I decided to take a chance with the hotel instead. I need'nt had worried. The room was very old, no frills but clean. No tacky wallpaper and paint and the carpet looked ok. We were at the front of the hotel (314a) which overlooked Madisson Square Gardens. I agree with others about the corridors... they looked a nightmare with chipping paint on doors etc. The front desk were polite and we must've arrived at a quite time (1430) as there was no que for check-in. I have no regrets staying here.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: Susie094
Reviews.Content: I had to spend a night in New York and my husband at home in Ireland found me a hotel via the internet, yes, I wanted a smoking room, but I was not prepared for the room I was given. It was very small and the colour of the carpet was suspect with lighter brown patches. I inspected the bathroom and nearly tripped over a loose wire runniing across the threshhold of the bathroom, then I went to put the air conditioner on, this machine was very rusty and as I bent over water fell on my head. I felt the carpet and it was very wet and I could see the water dripping through the ceiling. I phoned housekeeping straightaway and was told to wait for another key to be brought, no apology. The second room was marginally better, no drippping water and no tripping hazard but the state of the furnishings was disgusting, flaking paint on walls and skirtings, cracked wash basin, no plug for the bath, I could go on but.... and all for only $250 dollars for one night

Reviews.Title: “A terrible choice!”
Reviews.Author: Love-traveling-82
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very large and already the lobby gave us bad associations... cold, uncosy and loud. The room was very poorly cleaned and very old. We slept the night and went through with the trouble of cancelling the rest of the prepaid stay just to get away, that´s how bad this hotel is. We moved to a really nice and cosy hotel, also centrally located, with a high standard for only about 20USD more. If you´re looking for a nice place to stay, this isn´t it. It´s not even affordable either, then the hostels are a much better choice.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: FezOxfordshire
Reviews.Content: We had read some horror stories before we set off for a 5 day trip to NY. Added to this, the the travel agent went to great pains to stress the hotel was 1 star and that the hotel was being done up, but it was taking for ever..... I enquired about an upgrade before we set off and received an email from the hotel saying this was possible, just ask (and pay) on arrival. Again having read the reviews, we had expected long a long queue at the check-in, but in reality it took about 10 minutes. I asked about an upgrade and as a nice surprise was given a room with an upgrade free of charge. The room was spacious, but the view was awful, looking down a central shaft and directly into a hundred other rooms. Tip. Ask for a room with a view of Madison Square Gardens or a street view at the least. In terms of location, you cant beat this, 2 minute walk to Macys, 10 minutes to the Empire State. Very convenient and if you want to use the subway, Penn Station is a stone's throw away. We spent hardly any time in the room, slept and freshened up, so the lack of view and luxury was no hardship.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice lobby, everything else was very poor”
Reviews.Author: EddLynchburgVa
Reviews.Content: My grandson and I stayed on 8-7-2009 for one nite. We arrived about 2:00 PM and the line was almost to the door and there were 2 clerks working the counter. The hotel finally put 2 more clerks on the counter but we still had to wait for 1-1/2 hours to check in. after checkin we went to our room (374) and believe me it was the second worst room I have ever stayed in. The room was in bad need of renovation, the AC was making a lot of noise, the bathroom was horrible, the bed I had moved around a lot . I have never seen doors as old and the windows needed washing bad. I hate to never come back or never recommend to Hotel to anyone else because of the great location but that's the way it is.

Reviews.Title: “BE PREPARED FOR THE WORST!”
Reviews.Author: constantino2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel for a fun broadway experience and was prepared based on other reviews on this site. The room we were given was totally unacceptable, dim lighting, dirty walls and carpet chipped furniture and horrible bathtub. We turned around and went back into the looooong line to complain we were immediately upgraded to "corporate level" on the 12th floor! As soon as the elevator opened we knew it was better but it was still in dire need tender loving care! While it was an improvement to say it was corporate was probably a joke. Very humid inside the rooms and musty odor the highter the floor the better the condition! Be prepared and do not accept anything less. It didn't hinder my wonderful weekend because NYC has so much to offer you aren't in the room much anyway!

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is - a well-located bed in Midtown”
Reviews.Author: HfxGal
Reviews.Content: As a general rule, immediately lower your expectations when looking for budget accommodations in NYC. I booked Hotel Penn, after finding an online deal, on the recommendation of a friend who stayed there (who also travels on the cheap) and it completely met my expectations. I went to New York to experience the city, leaving the room around 7 am each day and returning at midnight each night. The hotel was safe, my belongings in tact, and the bed did its job when I got in it each night. I spent a total of 20 hours in the room over 3.5 days. It's shabby, the lobby is insanely busy, but it's in a terrific location, the towels were changed daily, and the beds were clean. The room was huge (again, by NYC standards), the bathroom smallish, but tolerable, and the staff were as pleasant as you would expect given the traffic. All of our staff interactions were pleasant to excellent. The tickets/tourist information desk is a great feature with friendly and helpful staff. Get the map of Manhattan provided by the hotel, it's a great size for purses and good level of detail for exploring Midtown-Times Square, and the rest of Manhattan generally. There's a subway station 10 ft from the door on W 32nd St to accommodate your transit needs. Head downtown or East to find more reasonably-priced food. Things go faster if you pre-pay and take advantage of express checkout. Depending on when you arrive, the lineup is long, but this should be expected at a hotel with 1,700 rooms. Hotel Pennsylvania is what it is, a bed, a good location, and a decent price. I'd stay again if I was planning on staying in Midtown and wanted to be close to Times Square/Theatre District. As an aside, I suspect a lot of the negative comments have to do with expectations of $500/nt room quality for $150/nt. If a cheap, fancy hotel room is what you want, go to Orlando, don't go to New York City.

Reviews.Title: “unfriendly personal in a worn down hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrtravel31415
Reviews.Content: if you arrive on a weekend at night, be prepared to wait more than one hour in line for check in. Then deal with unfriendly personal to get a room. (we needed to switch rooms three times because they gave us a smoking room or the toilet wouldn't work. The person behind the counter expressed annoyance to have to deal with this. after one and a half hour we had an acceptable room.) There is really obnoxious personal behind the front desk. The rooms are greasy, in our room the mattress was falling apart and the room was very dusty. The restaurant (Lindy's located in the hotel) serves VERY high priced low quality food and drinks. That is not New York City! That's just a tourist rip off!!! Altogether staying at this hotel left a unnecessary bad memory with a else joyful stay in the City.

Reviews.Title: “its ok”
Reviews.Author: IRA84
Reviews.Content: the place waws ok...nothing too special. The bathroomwas very small though. the bed was all right. the lobby was nice Ithopught, and theres a lot of places to eat near eat. I would stay there again if i wanted to stay on that side of NYC.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel I've EVER Stayed At”
Reviews.Author: Cherylcyn
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I took the train from Baltimore to NYC for a concert at Madison Square Garden. We had reservations for another hotel on Park Ave, but since we were meeting there, I decided to cancel that reservation and went across the street to Hotel Pennsylvania. Had to stand in line for about 30 minutes to check in and once I got my keys, headed up to the 3rd floor. As soon as I walked into the hallway, I knew I'd made a horrible mistake. The paint on the doors were chipped and scratched, the carpet was old and musty and THE SMELL...OMG!!!! I got to my room and Maintenence was in the room, "fixing" the air conditioner so I had to wait in the hallway for 10 minutes. When I got in, I couldn't believe my eyes! The A/C unit was old and had "stuff" in it (a combination of paint chips, dirt, bugs and God know what else). The bed was lumpy and had a huge dip in the middle, the corners of the walls were filthy, the bathroom fixtures were rusty, the hairdryers were not mounted on the wall (although the fixtures were left there). When my boyfriend called from the train to see how the room was, I said, just think "The Shining" (I laughed really hard when I read the previous review!! So true!). Haunted?? You bet. It was the creepiest, dirtiest hotel I've ever stayed in. Was it cheap? YES. But there's no excuse for the FILTH and poor customer service of this "renowned" hotel. The previous week we had stayed at the Best Western by the Javits Center and for the same price, got a clean, comfy, SAFE room. After we checked out we stored our bags there (for a hefty $4 per bag) and walked around the city. When we came back and still had time to kill before our train, the front desk/security wouldn't even let us use the restroom! We had to walk a block down to the Hotel Afinia and they were kind enough to let us use the facilities AND told us that we wouldn't believe how many people told them horror stores about Hotel Penn. Their rate was $199 a night and I wish we would have spent the extra money and stayed there!!!

Reviews.Title: “All around HORRIBLE experience!”
Reviews.Author: inkedmomma
Reviews.Content: The ONLY two positive things I have to say about this place is 1. The Location is excellent. Right across from Penn and 2. The lobby is updated and very spacious. That being said... the lobby has to be large to accomodate the ridiculous check in line. When I arrived at 11:30pm it was stretched almost to the door. There were 3 people working. One of whom repeatedly complained about how she wanted to scream. After waiting in the line for 1 hr 15 minutes we finally reached the front desk only to be told, as many others in front of us were, that our rooms were NOT paid for. The bride and groom next to us had recieved the room as a gift and were told the same thing. I think they were opening their wedding cards for money to pay for the room! Apparently our boss had to fax a bunch of papers to approve the billing. We called him, he advised he did fax the paperwork and provided us with the confirmation #s.
