The front desk clerk disappeared to check with the manager. He refused to the conf #s stating we needed to pay to stay. Mind you, he never came to the desk, just relayed the message. Our boss called him, he still claimed he didn't have the paperwork and asked our boss to go to the office (at 1am) to resend. I paid on my card, we got rooms. Mine was half the size of my coworkers but was cleaner, hers had blood splatters on the curtins and wall. We called the front desk, the manager didn't acknowledge the complaint, just told us to come back down and gave us new keys. He upgraded us to suites. Large but still a little stinky and old. The bathrooms have no counter top, just a standing sink. The toilets were like those in a public restroom. The most appauling of the bathroom was the used soap left in the soap dish complete with hair. Ewww. By that time it was 2am so we said screw it, no showers. Slept and got up and got the hell out. Bottom line is this is an OK room if you bring beer to drink while you wait in the LONG line and you get schnockered while you wait and just fall into bed but if you plan on being sober when you get to your room stay away!

Reviews.Title: “RUN AWAY!! Better hotels are close!”
Reviews.Author: amberhariton
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because I was attending a show that was being held there. It started to fall apart as soon as we arrived. I was the 34th person in line to check-in and there were at least that many behind me - the line went all the way to the door! They only had 2 agents at the front desk, so I called the hotel and asked for a manager and told them about the line to see if there was anybody else that could come help out the front desk. Her exact quote to me (in an extremely rude tone) was "who do you suggest we get to help out". I explained to her that I worked in the hotel industry and when there was a line at our hotel, other departments jumped in to check people in and out. She then said that "this is a union hotel and we don't do that". So, 45 minutes later, we finally get checked-in! Check-in time at this hotel is 3:00pm and we arrived at this hotel at 3:15pm, so there is no excuse for having such a short-staffed front desk. A hotel knows how many check-ins they are going to have that day! Now, on to the rooms - I have never seen such a nasty hotel. I will post pictures after we get home. Paint peeling off the doors and I am not joking, the hallways and doors make it look like a crack-house! The room does look like the pictures on the website as far as the decor, but those pictures must have been taken 20 years ago, because the room was nasty. There was even this huge hole in the wall next to the a/c and various stains on the walls. And in 2009, have you ever heard of a hotel with no wireless internet in the rooms? This hotel is dirty, offers no services, and has bad customer service. We loved the location since we took Amtrak up and had a toddler with us, so we took a walk and looked for another hotel. The AFFINA is a block over and they were sold out, so I didn't see the rooms. We ended up about 4 blocks away at the DOUBLETREE CHELSEA. It's only a 5 min walk and I highly recommend going there - our rate at the Doubletree was only $25 more than the Hotel Penn - well worth it. Brand new rooms, clean, wireless internet in the room, room service, ice machines, and the people here are so nice! All the stuff you expect from a hotel! When I went to check-out (it was about 6:00pm at this time), the line was still there making me think that this may be a normal thing for this hotel. Like I said before, RUN AWAY! You can see the AFFINA hotel from the Hotel Penn, and the DOUBLETREE CHELSEA is a quick walk away (and we did it with suitcases, a stroller and a 1 1/2 year old).

Reviews.Title: “We booked for 8 nights and stayed for a further 9”
Reviews.Author: DazamAustralia
Reviews.Content: The Penn is so large that I expect the range of rooms and their conditions is broad. We booked and paid in advance over the internet for a standard room. We had read about long check in queues but we waited only 10 minutes. The pleasant woman who dealt with us on our arrival said "I'm going to give you an upgrade - now let me find you something nice". She allocated us a large room (we had just been in Paris in tiny rooms) with a King size bed on the 11th floor facing 7th Ave. It was clean, there was nothing broken, the sheets (green in colour and a bit old) were changed each day and fresh linen was provided daily. The A/C worked and was adjustable and was not noisy. There was a quiet fridge and a standard hotel hair dryer. Unlike many hotels there was no plumbing noise and we didn't hear other guests toilets flushing or them showering. The room looked just like the one in the photos on the website. Because the room faced 7th Ave the noise managed to penetrate the double glazing. This was our only complaint - but we were in NY - a busy, 24hr non stop metropolis - and we enjoyed being in the middle of it. We are pretty self sufficient but when we needed help we received courteous and accurate advice from the staff including a recommendation for a great Italian place to eat and tips on how to navigate Penn Station to avoid the stairs. The coffee shop downstairs sold pretty good coffee (we didn't think much of the coffee in NY). Nearing the end of our booked stay we went and inquired about staying another 9 days (because we were really enjoying NY) on the basis that we wanted to stay in the same room. We were advised to use the internet to do this as the room rate would be better. We went to the Hotel's internet cafe, which I thought was pretty pricey, paid for a standard room then took the booking sheet back to the counter and they arranged for us to stay on in our same room - which had been upgraded from standard when we first arrived. When we checked out we used the luggage room in the basement and the staff there were terrific. They have a funny system where you can't pay for luggage storage with the Bell Captain you have to go to the main desk and line up - which was a bit annoying as we had just come away from the desk, but it only took a few minutes. In the 17 days we did see some longish queues at the desk and I expect people may have waited up to half an hour to check in - but we never waited more than 10 minutes on the 4 occasions we had to line up. We don't have anything bad to say about the hotel other than they seem to have a battle keeping the traffic noise out - but I suspect that would be the same for any hotel on a busy street in NY. I guess you might think that we have low standards given I haven't been complaining like the other reviewers; but be assured that isn't the case. Yes the Penn is a bit tired and it is very very large and you can feel invisible/insignificant and it doesn't feel "personal' but it is in a great location and it is reasonably priced for NY. Our experience was good and I would recommend the hotel to our friends - most of whom are likely to be out all day and half the night enjoying the city just like we were. It is possible to stay at the Penn and be satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, small and expensive”
Reviews.Author: onceuponalauren
Reviews.Content: Hotel Pennsylvania has a great midtown location and is right around the corner from Herald Sq and several subway lines but my room was dirty; the desk was greasy, the lamp shades were stained, the paint was peeling off the walls in the bathroom and the room just felt dark and outdated in general. There is nothing special about this hotel and is certainly not worth the price. I suggest going more uptown for a more neighborhood-y new york experience or more downtown for a more metropolitain experience. There are hundreds of other hotels in new york that are much better for the exact same price!

Reviews.Title: “I DONT STAY HERE MORE”
Reviews.Author: NANY88
Reviews.Content: The Place is good but the Hotel is terrible....old,

Reviews.Title: “An okay place for the low rate we paid”
Reviews.Author: princessjocie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because I was assigned to the hotel through a pricing website and didnt have an option to change it. The hotel was in a nice location and easy to get to. The lobby was very nice but we waited in line for over 10 minutes to check in and there was no reason for that when 5 people were working at the desk. I still have no idea what took the man so long to check us in once it was our turn!! The room was small but fine. It was VERY simple and not up to date at all. The bed linens were probably 10 years old and im sure the carpetting and drapes were older than that. The room was clean, just not homey. The bathroom was clean, but falling a part. Tiles were missing on the walls, the shower just had a gross dinginess to it with awful water pressure, and the cold water knob on the sink was stuck until we had to struggle for 10 minutes to force it loose. We requested more towels and never received them until we stopped a housekeeper in the hallway, and the concierge gave us incorrect information about a location we were trying to get to. The hotel is fine if you are looking for a basic, no frills, nothing fancy place for under $150. But I would not personally stay there again unless it was a last resort.

Reviews.Title: “It must have changed a lot!!”
Reviews.Author: Toby074
Reviews.Content: I see lovely looking hotel room in the photo. When I stayed there a year ago it was a dump and I saw no such rooms. The foyer was very impressive but that was all. The rooms were filthy with shower that did not work, dirty 'carpets', broken light fittings, scratched and damaged furniture etc. I had booked a superior room so God only knows what the standard rooms were like. We had booked for 5 nights but it was so bad we checked out after one simply because it wa\s late when we got there. They did offer us an upgrade for another $30-that was almost as bad! the location was excellent but everything else about the hotel was terrible-its a disgrace to even call it a hotel it was that bad, Maybe the hotel has been revamped in the meantime but I certainly saw nothing like that illustrated.

Reviews.Title: “hotel carter is supposed to be the dirtiest hotel in america. this one has it beat by a mile”
Reviews.Author: wanderer69_9
Reviews.Content: good location across from penn station but that is the only positive about this hotel. rude staff, small outdated and dirty rooms, public spaces worn, smell of food prep seems rampant. never again!!

Reviews.Title: “Aweful place! Misguiding website!”
Reviews.Author: NorgeNorway_Oslo2
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here for three nights. From the photos on the hotels website it looked like a nice hotell, but this was totally misguiding! Nice lobby and location, but a crappy room, so to speak. My boyfriend planned to propose to me in this wonderful hotell (!), but luckily he changed his plans when he got to see it. I would never stay here again inspite of the great location! Bedroom lamp was plugged in from the bathroom, so we couldn't close the door without having the other sit in the dark! Well, my best tip is to find another place to stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “3rd stay - Much improved”
Reviews.Author: Faith01
Reviews.Content: This is my third stay at this hotel. I chose it because of location and price. On my second stay I was a bit disappointed, particularly at the bathroom. However, I have just stayed again for 4 nights. My room had a newly renovated bathroom. Although the room is still slightly shabby, it is definitely a place I would stay again. The location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: ArchitectAylesbury
Reviews.Content: Location was good. You walk in to the Reception and all looks fine. Rude woman at desk. Collect key to room, up in grotty lift. Couldn't believe the room. Rusty air conditioning unit, broken electrical socket plates and grimy bathroom. Our stay was shortly after the twin towers disaster. It looks as if little has improved since our stay. The date above is entered only because the review will not load otherwise. It is not the actual dates.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location But................”
Reviews.Author: Nuttyal
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for its close location to Penn Station, booking through the internet, despite the numerous bad reviews in the hope that it wouldn't all be doom and gloom! On browsing the hotel website, we decided to go for the Club 5000 option which gave us extra comfort and other complimentary items. We arrived at hotel early afternoon 3rd July expecting to see long queues in reception lobby. To our surprise there were only a few guests waiting to check-in and there was only a wait of about 10 minutes. We were allocated a room on the 11th floor, which upon entering looked decidedly small for 2 adults and not what was described on the website. We initially thought that the room wasn't a Club 5000 but it was confirmed to us the following morning that it was! We also wanted to know about "complimentary" items described on website Club 5000 pages that we didn't have in our room. We were told that we would have to pay extra for those items! I thought that "complimentary" meant free with hotel compliments.......not likely at this hotel! If you wanted to have the complimentary breakfast, your room key had to be updated but you weren't informed about this when checking-in. Sound-proofing between rooms leaves a lot to be desired, especially at night when you are trying to sleep, and a couple down the corridor are in are in the throes ecstacy....not that we were complaining mind you!! Our allocated room was away from front of hotel, so there wasn't too much noise from the streets and we were able to get good nights' sleep. The Club 5000 lounge was something to be believed! It was just a small room on the 12 th floor - that was in need of decoration - with a few tables and chairs, a TV and a couple of computer terminals. A small breakfast table was set up in a corner for the continental breakfast. Although the bedroom was very small, it was relatively clean with fresh towels daily, bathroom had been slightly updated with new sink and plumbing and the maid service was very efficient. The room size is not what you are led to believe on the website. It looks like a king-size bed had been put into a single room and that left no space for any chairs apart from computer chair. We found the hotel staff to be very friendly and helpful despite the fact that the hotel was exceptionally busy. Internet access is available in rooms at $10 per 24 hours. The hotel has a fantastic location for all New York's tourist attractions and gives you a basic level of accommodation. Be careful if you are thinking of booking Club 5000.......it's not what you are led to believe! The website is a bit misleading! Apart from that, we had a very enjoyable 5 day stay.

Reviews.Title: “Much improved, great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: ChrisDearing
Reviews.Content: I first visited Hotel Pennsylvania in December 2007 and to be honest I was disgusted. We were supposed to have a double room and ended up sharing a single bed, the paint was coming off the walls and the bed bugs were horrific. We revisited New York in December 2008 and for price/location this hotel came up again. Initially I was reluctant but after learning they had a refurbishment I decided to give it another chance. I was pleasantly surprised! The room had been painted and they had definately changed the mattresses. Not only were they more comfortable, there were no lice! Oh, and we had two Queen Size beds this time. The shower was still so powerful it removed layers of skin everytime I used it but I would prefer this than a shower that wasn't powerful enough. The location is the best thing about this hotel, directly opposite Madison Square Garden (I saw the Knicks and the Rangers and can highly recommend both). It is also just round the corner from Macy's, a short walk from the Empire State Building and directly opposite Penn Station for easy transport. There are loads of good places to eat all around the hotel and Times Square is a 10 minute walk (unless you walk slow!). If people have had bad experiences here recently I would suggest they have been unlucky enough to have had a room that is yet to be refurbished because the room we had was much improved on our first experience. For price and location you won't find anywhere better in NYC, it's not luxurious but great value. We can't wait to go back again this Christmas if we can!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but poor rooms”
Reviews.Author: salsaddictNorway
Reviews.Content: I think part of the hotell is refurnished and we where staying in the old part and that is why the revieuws are so different. Our room was very spacious, but dirty. The bathroom was not clean and dust was piled up in the corners and on top of for example the closets (had to check how thorough they cleaned). The TV had just a vieuw channels working, the hairdryer didn't work, but this was fixed quickly. We where not much in the hotel and where aware of the poor quality thanks to the revieuws, so we weren't dissapointment and we gor a good price. But for full price you can get much better for your money. (booked hotel 373 on fifth avenue for the same price as this hotel)

Reviews.Title: “Average with Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BushelsOfFun
Reviews.Content: Our extended family traveled to NYC for the 4th of July weekend. We traveled from Greensburg, PA to NYC via Amtrak; Hotel Pennsylvania is ideally located directly across from Penn Station. Once arriving, the check-in time did take a little longer, but there were quite a few guests checking in at that time; however, the front desk was fully staffed. We reserved three (3) rooms via the internet (4 guests in 2 rooms; 2 guests in 1 room). AARP was accepted and given a 10% discount upon check-in. Our rooms were located on the second, fourth, and fifth floors with the second and fifth floor rooms located within the "A" section of the hotel. The room on the fifth floor had four (4) double beds in the very large-sized room for four (4) guests; the room on the second floor had two (2) double beds for two (2) guests). The room on the fourth floor had four (4) single beds for four (4) guests. The fifth-floor room had a great view of Penn Station and Madison Square Garden. The beds were quite comfortable. The "A" section rooms seem to be a little more updated. Compared to the standard NYC hotel room, these rooms were very large. Housekeeping was below average as popcorn was found under the bedskirting from a previous guest. Carpeting was a little shabby. Air conditioning was adequate. The bathroom was adequate. The water pressure in the shower was intense, but after a long day of sightseeing, it felt wonderful! Soap and shampoo were provided. We did have to ask for additional wash cloths but our request was overlooked; we found the housekeeping cart in the hall and took the additional cloths. Location is excellent and within walking distance to the Empire State Building. The subway is located on the corner (Metro Card one-day Fun Pass for $8.25 is an excellent buy allowing you unlimited subway trips and transfers). We have stayed in other NYC hotels only to feel like a sardine in the very small rooms; Although the hallways are a little drab and the room doors are a little battered, Hotel Pennsylvania definitely gives you the bigger room.

Reviews.Title: “Run down hotel - Good location - Average Breakfast - Good Staff”
Reviews.Author: VacationMeister
Reviews.Content: If you are used to clean, new hotels then this hotel is NOT for you. We stayed at the newly renovated section of the hotel and the rooms/hallways were still rather shabby and run down. We supposedly had a larger room with two double beds and a small washroom. Actually the room was quite cramped but manageable. The hotel felt more like a hostel than a hotel but after one day we sort of got used to it. The staff were pleasant enough. One thing that I thought was strange was how dark the hallways were - it was if all the bulbs were on a dimmer switch. The location was ideal and ultimately this is what you are paying for. My main concern were bed bugs which luckily did not appear. The fitness room was on the 19'th floor however the elevator only went up to the 18'th. From there you had to walk up a shabby set of stairs (kind of creepy) to the gym which had decent enough fitness machines. Ultimately you get what you pay for (150 per night) and if you want a nicer hotel you can either spend an extra 100 dollars per night or stay in Newport, New Jersey at the beautiful Westin Hotel for the same price and take the 10 minute Path train ride into and out of NYC.

Reviews.Title: “disgusting rooms in a great location”
Reviews.Author: qtqt17
Reviews.Content: seems like they never clean anything, lots of dust on everything, stained towels, bugs crawling out of shower drain, superloud a/c, plain disgusting as far ar quality of the rooms. The staff seemed a bit unmotivated. The only thing that speaks for this hotel is its location directly across from Madison Square Garden and about 2 blocks from Empire State Building. Penn Station is also right there.

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: TacoSalad
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ok given the price in NYC. If you expect a nicer place to stay, go for the more expensive ones.

Reviews.Title: “Big Disappointment - Huge Red Flag”
Reviews.Author: SwissMr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Penn on business. My first warning sign was the way too low prioce for New York / Manhatten! I worked for an idiot boss who was the poster child for penny wise pound foolish. This hotel had zero redeeming qualities. As a result, little work if any got accomplished due to poor and embarrassing conditions of the hotel. The only thing positive I can write, is that the location is convenient to all the major transportation and the convention center. Other than that, you will be far better off camping in Central Park. Filthy, would be the one word I use to describe this hotel - stay away. Folks, there are no bargains in Manhatten. I don't care if you get a $20/nt rate, you WILL get what you pay for in Manhatten. ~Safe and Pleasant Travels to All

Reviews.Title: “good for those on a budget”
Reviews.Author: jbritishtraveller
Reviews.Content: We read the other reviews and went to this hotel with great trepidation.We entered the large reception area,joined the queue,and immediately noticed that not all the desks were manned.1 man was signing in guests and manning the safe deposit box area,so would sign in a guest and then answer the bell for safe deposit use.The receptionist we signed in was very welcoming,but was repeatedly interupted by guests requireing something.We got our keys(room 666)it was dark ,faced on to other rooms,the room was adequate for our needs,the bed huge and very comfortable,the linen clean,and the chamber maids obviously did their best to make the room look good.however the room did need a complete renovation,the decor tired and dingy.furnishings in need of repair.and the aircon throwing out. But we only needed a clean bed and bath as we were in New York,lots to see and do,So if you just need a good nights sleep this is the place,if you want luxury,do not book in here,Central Perk coffee shop was open 24/7the staff lovely,the gift shops sold all manner of gift,(check out China town first).The boys in left luggage an absolute delight,their smiles wide,their banter wonderful,and sadly we only got there on our last day.as they were a mine of useful information,I and my partner checked out Lindys downstairs,oh dear it was dreadful,the beer not good and the decor appalling,However take the 33rd street exit and cross the road to your right 4 good bars,recommend highly Blarney rock,breakfasts huge,staff chatty,and at night the place is full of lots of folk that like a chat,Hickeys was a good place as well and the other 2 make for a decent pub crawl,all by walking in and out of one door to the next.All in all the Pennsylvania is good if you on a budget,Staff friendly,but avoid if its your honeymoon,special anniversary or you want something a bit special

Reviews.Title: “The Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Magic2002
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four miserable nights. The only reason we did not check out immediately is because we had pre paid and no longer had the additional funds for another hotel. We have stayed in many hotels around the world, this is deffinately the worst ever. The rooms were dirty and the furniture broken. The staff were amongst the most rude I have ever come across, paticularly at reception. Thank god we know how good America and the American people are, because this gave such a bad impression.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible. Infested with bed bugs - DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: PonyGirl25
Reviews.Content: Disgusting hotel. Hotel Pennsylvania is infested with bed bugs. I was bitten all over my legs which are now swollen, pussing, and look like I've got flesh eating disease. I'm on a rigorous round of penicillin and can't fit my feet into my shoes they're so swollen. Upon arriving home I had to disinfect everything I brought or bought in NY and launder my suitcase/purse. Moldy bathrooms from insufficient ventilation, common bathrooms by luggage rooms are revolting, pee all over the floors, look like they haven't been cleaned EVER. You couldn't pay me to stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “horrified and disgusted”
Reviews.Author: luceml
Reviews.Content: well what can i say! this hotel certainly looks impressive, on the website and from the out side, ill also admit the lobby is not too bad, despite the fact its so dark and there are queues up to an hour long to check in to your oh so gorgeous hotel room, yes that would be the room with the dirty sticky carpet covered in stains, and bathroom that was hard to move in, the power shower that felt like you were being sand blasted. oh and i daren't forget the unopening broken windows. in the first room, when we finally got to sleep, my mum sister and I woke up covered in plaster off the ceiling, how nice is that. and yes this was after we had changed room. how is it fair, especially after the hotel knew my mum was ill, to place us in a damp unventilated dark 9th floor room. we decided we could take no more of the horrible smell and sticky carpet and decided it would be better to spend another £300 and move hotel were the staff were actually friendly and gave you an answer. what a perfect way to celebrate my 18th, thankyou hotel pennsyvania, i owe you one. tip if you want a nice hotel thats not to expensive, go to the Radisson martinique on Broadway. the staff will actually fall over themselves to help you there, and its literally over the road!!!

Reviews.Title: “if we are lucky enough to revisit NYC then we will stay here”
Reviews.Author: EnglandGeoff
Reviews.Content: great value,there was a mix up over our reservation (not the hotels fault) and the staff on reception were very helpful (nicole),the rooms are dated but clean and serve their purpose has a base from which to explore new york. the location is spot on,,jush wish we were still there....geoff and tracey allcock

Reviews.Title: “THE most dreadful hotel - hands down!”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel91964
Reviews.Content: Don't let the lobby (or the amount of time spent in line to check-in) fool you. The rooms are nasty! Period! Our room had carpet stains that resembled a body outline at a crime scene. We expected to see something scurry across the floor at any moment. When we went to turn on the air conditioner, 100 years of dust and debris flew out of it and it started shaking violently. The noise it was making was SO loud that the front desk operator could not hear me when I called for maintenance. One hour after I called for the repair, a hotel employee arrived. At this point, we were ready to just check out because we had additionally realized that no electrical outlets worked, the toilet had something in it that would NOT flush, the shower wall looked as if the previous guests had taken a sledge hammer to it, the sink faucet fell in my hand while I was trying to wash the dust from the air conditioner off my hands and the room just plain ole smelled dreadful. All in all, it was the worst hotel experience of my life from check in to check out. Oh, and don't even get me started on the fact that they assured me that my credit card would not be charged (since we checked in/out in the same hour practically) --- only to find out much to my dismay that they did in fact charge me for 3 nights. It was an act of congress to get a hotel manager to assist me (2 days later) in getting the charges reversed. I can't for the life of me understand how Hotel Pennsylvania is still in business. Save your money and your sanity...stay somewhere else. (a park bench in Central Park would have been a better choice)

Reviews.Title: “no complaints at pennsylvania”
Reviews.Author: ismaela2
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband during the second week in June. The check in process only took 15 min. The staff answered all our questions patiently. After we checked in I asked for a fridge and they brought it immediately! IT is walking distance from all the major attractions. Penn station is across the street, fast foods and excellent restaurants around the corner. The housekeeping staff went out of their way to meet our every needs! We felt safe,the security guards would ask the guests to show our keys before entering the elevators. Our rooms were cleaned every day. we asked for a superior double bed room, and it was lovely!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: hw1103
Reviews.Content: Being from Pennsylvania, my mother and I make frequent trips into NYC for shopping and leisure. We have stayed many places, and always are willing to try new hotels. Hotel Pennsylvania was possibly the worst we have ever encountered. First of all, after spending the day in NYC we were eager to check in and get some rest. We stood in the check-in line for approx. 40 mins. So of course, our experience did not begin well. After checking in, we made our way to our room, which ended up being a smoking room, even though we had requested a non-smoking room. We asked for a room change, which was fine. The air conditioning in our room was malfunctioning and continued a loud vibrating noise when turned on. So of course, we were not able to sleep and had to turn it off. The next morning, the water pressure in the shower was overpowering. It almost hurt, definitely not a pleasant wake up. Finally, after heading downstairs to check out, we were told for them to keep our luggage while he spent the day in NYC we would have to go stand in the never ending check-in line to obtain luggage tags (they couldn't just get them for us), which by the way cost $4 a bag. Never in any of our stays in NYC have we had to pay a hotel, (in which we were staying!) to hold our luggage. We also were responsible for taking our luggage to the holding room in the basement. Not exactly convenient. We are not picky people, and for the most part can easily go with the flow. However, we were extremely disappointed, since Hotel PA is fairly well-known. Also, we have stayed in hotels for 1/2 the price of Hotel PA, and received hospitality and accomodation far superior to Hotel PA. One good thing...the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Cheap and clean”
Reviews.Author: Andrexel
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Staying at Hotel Penn which we got for 55GBP per night thru hotels.com. Location is perfect especially if you arrive at Newark airport as you can get direct train to Penn Station, just across road from hotel. One arrival approx midnight had to que for about 5 mins before checking. Hotel room was very clean although warn. Included big tv with lots of channels and free WIFI and very comfy bed...Bathroom was clean but dated, but did have good fluffy towels. Maid service was very efficient changing the sheets every day we stayed. All Staff where efficient and friendly. I would recommend this hotel for people who are visiting new york and need somewhere clean and central to stay.... For the money you pay it's great value so long as you are realistic of what you can reasonably expect for this price range in a big city.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: loopyloo78
Reviews.Content: Am disappointed reading these bad reviews. I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in March and it was excellent. We were booked in immediately upon arrival and given free upgrades to superior rooms. My room was spacious, clean and airy with a HUGE queen-size bed - possibly the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in. I had an awesome view of the Empire State Building from my room. All staff I came across were friendly and helpful, especially Mihaela, the owner of the Dresden Gift Shop in the lobby - so lovely and welcoming! This hotel is ideally located - right across the street from Penn Station and Madison Square Garden and about 10 mins walk from Times Square. I'll definitely be staying in this hotel when I return to New York!

Reviews.Title: “Average, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: nikhilmahajan71
Reviews.Content: Centrally located..the rooms were not great shakes, extremely functional, very limited food choices , extremely crowded reception, long waiitng time

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: newyorkvisitor99
Reviews.Content: I feel sorry for the people who have had bad experiences at the Penn. We stayed from 22may to 30 may and loved the place. I arrived very late in the evening so missed any queues at check in. The room was huge,clean,with a good big bathroom that was also very clean. Shower pressure great,lovely clean fluffy towels, plenty of soaps, shampoos, tissues. The tv and air-con worked fine. The security was tops with door latch bolt and swipe card. The room was serviced each day with fresh bed linen and towels replaced,also vacuumed and dusted. Everyone of the staff we spoke to were friendly and helpful. The lobby and lifts were impressive and tour desk and shops also very good. All in all (for us) a terrific Hotel right in the heart of Manhattan at a great price. I would certainly re book here for any future New York stay.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience from beginning to end.”
Reviews.Author: NeverAgainNewYork
Reviews.Content: Our Hotel Pennsylvania experience started when we arrived at 7:00 p.m. on a holiday weekend. While we waited online for approximately 1 hour to check in (which we were told is relatively short) in a lobby with no air conditioning, I needed to use the restroom. The concierge sent me to a basement area straight out of a slasher movie without telling me that you needed a room key to access the restroom itself. My husband got a temporary key while I took my turn in line and, upon return from the restroom, told me that it was filthy. Once we got our room key, we walked down a hallway with doors that looked like prison cells and entered our tiny and poorly maintained room that clearly had not gotten a paint job, a tub scrubbing, or any other maintenance since the hotel was built a century ago. The air conditioning wasn’t working so we called maintenance, who pulled out the most clogged filter I’ve ever seen and said that the AC should be working by the time we came back from dinner. It wasn’t and we had to switch rooms at 11:00 at night. The 2nd room’s AC wasn’t working either, by the way. A miserable experience from beginning to end.

Reviews.Title: “A Big NY Favela (Slum) !!!”
Reviews.Author: MartaRIO
Reviews.Content: This place should be close imediatly for renovation, it is a shame as the location is very good. The hotrel it is disgusting, dirth, old and very bad care, and is possible to hear everything from the rooms near. NO PRIVACY, No Internet, No Safety deposit box, No Service in Room or front desk. How can this being call a Hotel ? I coming from Brasil, Rio, and have my own B&B in Rio, them more I see Hotels more sure I am that I have a great place. The Hotels are rip of people, and not worried with anyone. The location do not bit my confort to sleep. So never again and dont reccomend even to a not friend .

Reviews.Title: “I come back”
Reviews.Author: vbari
Reviews.Content: Before booking I informed with friends and never created a great expectation. The hotel is not very clean but offered what we needed. A good bed to sleep, cabinets and a bathroom that works. The internet wirelles is poor. The service was good and location is excellent. If you go back to NY I will be there.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: DaneSydney
Reviews.Content: You can't really ask for a better location in Manhatten. Directly across from Madison Square Garden, Empire State Building and 5th Avenue Shopping is directly behind the hotel. Times Square is 5 min walk. Subway is across the road, so perfect location for a hotel. Lobby is huge, Rooms were huge. We had 3 double beds in our room. The rooms do look a bit dated, it's an older style hotel, so don't expect a plasma tv, buts its got everything you need. Only complaint is the shower, took 3-4 min for hot water to come, and the water pressure was very very very high. Shower was abit small, but good enough. Can't stress how good it was to be in this part of Manhatten, you can just walk outside the hotel and theres heaps of things to do. Would definatley stay here again. Great value, If you can afford it, get the Affina Hotel, which is next door.

Reviews.Title: “great value and ideal location”
Reviews.Author: upstateny5ny
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel. The location is excellent for exploring mid town Manhattan. Compared to other hotels in NYC. The rooms are a good size. The price is right. Sure it could use some updating and a coat of paint. But the location and price far out weigh the negatives. Definitely will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've ever been in”
Reviews.Author: trav1288
Reviews.Content: I came to NYC with a friend for a long, fun weekend. It was my first trip to the city. We had researched hotels online and finally settled on Hotel Pennsylvania. We chose it for the price and location, plus we felt like it would be fun to stay in an older New York hotel. The pictures we viewed online showed a grand lobby and clean rooms. We arrived at the hotel and after waiting almost an hour to check in, we finally were able to go upstairs to our room. The line to check in was insanely long and very slow moving. But we thought that was a reflection on what a great place it must be because surely it wouldn't be that busy if it weren't a nice place. We found out differently once we reached our room. There were so many things wrong with that room I'm not sure where to start. 1. The carpeting was very old and worn. There were multiple stains and it wrapped up over the baseboards around the edges of the room rather than being tacked down. 2. The tv cabinet was broken. It only had one door that was hanging slightly cock-eyed. The other door was missing. None of the drawers would close completely. 3. All of the furniture in the room was very worn and old and had bare spots where the finish had been worn off. 4. The cable for the television came from behind the cabinet and ran across the middle of the floor to a spot under the window right by an exposed water pipe. 5. None of the outlets in the room worked which we found out when we tried to plug in our cellphones to recharge them after a long trip. 6. The window was open and we had a very hard time getting it shut. We were told that we would be facing the Empire State Building. We WERE facing the Empire State Building but we couldn't see it because of the large brick building about 20 feet outside our window that extended up so far we could barely see the sky. 7. The faucet on the sink came off when we tried to use it. 8. The bathtub had a large hole in the side of it on the inside of the tub. Looked like it had been hit with a sledgehammer. 9. The toilet would barely flush. 10. Every corner in the room had the paint peeling off or worn off. 11. There was no deadbolt on the door. 12. When we turned on the air conditioner it sounded like a jet plane was landing in the room. We immediately called the front desk and requested to change rooms. We were told that engineering would have to check our a/c before they could move us. After a 45 min wait is when we discovered all the other things such as the outlets not working so we called and requested a manager. My friend spoke to Cynthia, who informed her that we could come to the front desk and check out and get a refund. We couldn't get our bags together quickly enough to get out of that room. Once downstairs, it took about 20 minutes to get someone to help us get checked out. My friend had paid for the room on her debit card and she requested something in writing showing that the full amount was going to be refunded. She called her bank and the charge had already gone through. She was given a piece of letterhead with an arrival and departure date but no amounts on it. When she asked for something with an amount on it she was told they were unable to do that. After informing the front desk person that we would not leave without such a paper, he finally gave her a copy of a screenshot on his computer showing the amount. Supposedly the amount would be credited to her account within 24 hours. Almost 48 hours later it still hadn't been done, so another call had to be made to a manager named Mark. Mark immediately called her bank and got the funds put back into her account. I know that this is a very lengthy review but I wanted other travelers to know that they shouldn't be fooled by pictures online or some of the other reviews that are out there. As I said before this was my first trip to NYC and I was very disappointed by how it started out. I was not expecting a 5 star hotel with 100s of amenities, especially for the price we were paying. But I did expect a clean, comfortable room that didn't make me fear for my health. Fortunately we were able to find another hotel but we were not lucky enough to find one in Manhattan like we wanted. I will post this review on every website, including Hotel Pennsylvania's.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably bad”
Reviews.Author: Brian_Rivera
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in and at the same time the most expensive I have ever stayed in. Not a good combination..... The staff is rude, the place is worn out, the rooms are dirty and the queue for checking in/out is huge. Try and go to the toilets in the reception area. It's like stepping straight in the heart of the Bronx. Truly unbelievable.

Reviews.Title: “Very Deceiving and Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkGirlTrip
Reviews.Content: Do not be deceived by the website. This hotel was aweful. Looks like never renovated. Thought we were entering an Alfred Hitchcock movie. Moved to 4 different rooms. Wanted to relocate, but child was there with a school group, so really had to stay. Bought flip flops for shower.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the $ at Hotel Penn.”
Reviews.Author: DestinationDreams
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews we decided to take a chance on Hotel Penn. since the location was excellent and we found an Expedia rate for only $100 a night. We checked in at 5pm on Sun with no line or wait. Our room, 1022, was huge with 2 queen beds, 2 arm chairs, TV amoire, desk/chair, large closet, and an old style bath. You could easily fit 1 or 2 rollaway beds in the room. The room was well worn, darkish, and not the cleanest we have ever been in, but, not horrible either. The bath had peeling paint, but, that was due to there being no ventilation. Since we would only be showering and sleeping in the room we were satisfied. The hallway did remind us of the movie THE SHINING. It was very long and went on forever in all directions. We rarely encountered anyone else. There was a bank of 8 elevators and we never had to wait long. Ice was readily available near the elevators. The only trouble we had with housekeeping was getting 6 bath towels for the 3 of us (1 for body and 1 for hair). The maid said we could only have 3 unless we called down and asked for more. We did and 3 more were always delivered. Strange. We used the 24 hour coffee shop and Dunkin Donuts next door at breakfast to bring back to the room to eat as we were getting ready in the morning. There was plenty of pizza, fast food, and local restaurants nearby. Location can't be beat across the street from Penn Station and on the bus line with major shopping in the area. Check out was a breeze using the Express Option on the TV and then dropping the key cards in the lobby box. No waiting in line at all. I would definitely stay here again if we could get another great deal. I wouldn't pay more than $150, however.

Reviews.Title: “The Pennsylvania Hotel that you EXPECT is the one you'll find!!!”
Reviews.Author: Yamma1
Reviews.Content: Everything you've either read or heard about Hotel Penn is 100% true, both bad and good. Most of the sticky carpets you've probably read about have been changed within the last 6 months. Yes there may or may not be cues in reception but then this place has 1000+ rooms so there's every chance at least 10 guests are gonna be either checking in or out or have a question at any given time. One staff member behind reception was spectacularly 'New York' rude but that was part of the experience. For the 4 days we were there we only spent 18 hours sleeping time in this hotel. I had a fantastic nights sleep though some of my family didn't because their room had a dripping tap which did disrupt their sleep. My own room had a huge damp patch on the shower ceiling and but after the first night I spoke with the Hotel manager and he got me a new room instantly, no questions asked. More importantly the location is fantastic and that has to be the reason that despite all the negative feedback this hotel receives people still keep booking. I would book again but I would also consider spending the least amount on accomodation and B&B it because I don't personally subscribe to going to NYC and sitting in a Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a dump!!!”
Reviews.Author: Scott6942
Reviews.Content: I booked this property due to its' location across from Penn Station. I booked onloine and chose the Penn 5000 club option. Their website is very misleading. The room I got was so small there was barely room for my suit case. i HAVE BEEN IN SOME RAT HOLES, BUT NOT AT THE PRICE I PAID FOR THIS! The King size bed smelled musky. The floor AC unit had a constant rattle (engineering never showed up to fix it). The bathroom had a very small shower only. The bare white walls showed numerous scuff marks. My friends in New York laughed about the hotel with the "I know" response to this property. I paid extra for the club amenties. I got very little in return. I would stay away this property. I would tell my worst enemy not to stay here. Word is the owners want to tear it down. I see why!

Reviews.Title: “There's good and there's bad. Price is great but there are drawbacks.”
Reviews.Author: dgoldyn
Reviews.Content: The pros: 1)the location can't be beat. close to theatre district, chelsea, penn station. 2) the price (I paid 60 per night on Last minute travel) can't be beat. If I paid 85 or more, I might be pissed 3) The beds are comfortable. 4) The rooms are clean except as noted below. The cons 1) the check in line can be long --there are 1705 rooms and 2 or 3 check in people 2) the first room I had was clean but had a layer of dust under the tv. I switched rooms and this problem did not excist in the second room 3) the ceiling paint was peeling in the first room. This was not the case in the seconde room 4) Climate control seems to be an ongoing problem.based on other comments. You leave the window open.. it was bearable. 5) The hair dryer was broken; The internet thingy needed batteries. 6) This hotel is in need of major major rennovation The bottom line> if you want to save bucks and be in a great location in an acceptable (hotel. this is a great choice. Just don't expect the Hilton . It is a run down bargain but acceptable hotel. and for the price i would stay there again But for 55 per night at this location this hotel is a deal. I wouldn't pay more than 90 for a room here. Then it is not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: ColbyHarris
Reviews.Content: this place was a total dump. from the second we walked in the lobby was filthy and the staff unprofessional and poorly trained. Our room was extremely hot and had no fan or AC. There was no fridge to keep our drinks cold. The walls were bare white and dirty with old nails hanging where a picture was supposed to hang. The hallway leading to our hotel was poorly lit and just gross. Basically the whole hotel was covered in dustbunnys and needs to be renivated and cleaned. They need more staff and room service aswell. All they care about is raking in your money. There was random trash, crumpled up papers and tons of dust balls in the hall ways and throughout the entire hotel. When we asked to speak to a manager on the way out of our ONE night stay the clerk went to get her and then disappeared. Then we asked another clerk to see a manager and they finally got her. She was rude and did not give us any type of refund or compensation and continued to tell us that New York was an expensive place etc. Overall just do not go there. dirty and overpriced

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel you can get”
Reviews.Author: ShaulAmran
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my girlfriend for 2 nights during the weekend. We got a room on the 7th floor. Great service, very clean, great location, very nice lobby. Nothing to complain about except the fact you need to pay extra for wireless internet connection which is available only in the hotel's lobby.

Reviews.Title: “manhatten madness! (good madness)”
Reviews.Author: surfergirl93
Reviews.Content: when you're in a city like manhatten, you dont spend alot of your time inside the hotel. but having a good location is a nessicity in the city! the pennsylvania hotel new york had exactly that. it is located right in the center of times square. if i remember correctly, right next to the madison stadium. though the hotel might not reach it's best standards, when going with friends and if your on a shopping spree, it wont matter much.

Reviews.Title: “Red Bites”
Reviews.Author: Jeffwoelfel
Reviews.Content: You walk into the hotel and the lobby is beautiful. Me being very cheap felt like I just found the best place in all of NY, but then i saw the line which stretched pass the black tape to the point where workers were out putting up new tape. Ok, this bugged me a bit but it wasn't all too bad. After about 45 minutes of waiting we got to the desk. I just discovered the problem - everyone working there had a collective IQ of about 50. Now I'm very tolerant but after fifteen minutes of trying to communicate with the woman at the desk I gave up and made my colleague do it. He too had to work with her for a solid fifteen minutes. Once we got our keys i wanted to go to the room and lay down a bit because my feet were killing me from standing in one place and it was late and I had practice at noon at Lincoln center. I was frightened by the room. It was small, dirty, and smelled. There was a hole in the wall with shards of glass, an empty box of beer, a shoe, and lots of loose insulation. The walls were covered in what felt like grime. The bed was not soft and one was broken. The fridge did not cool - rather it heated. It warmed the room to a good 90 degrees and it heated the drink i bought to where it hurt when i touched it. I even had some cookies which were melted. The sink broke twice and i had to fix it because the service guy never showed the 3 times we called. The shower had no pressure and at one point just stopped flowing. The toilet didn't flush after 11pm, and the tv would randomly turn on and off during the night making for a wonderful night's rest. Then the worst thing, the morning of practice i woke up with red bites all over me. Great. Bugs in the beds. My two other colleagues had red marks as well and with that we immediately checked out (which also took about an hour)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kroper
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel room on the recommendation of a friend who lives in New York. I was a little worried based on the poor reviews it received from websites like this one. My wife and I checked in at around 10 am and did not have to wait at all. Our room on the 12 floor was small, with a bed, dresser, tv, and desk. But this is Midtown Manhattan. Besides we were only in the room to sleep and shower. We left each morning around 8 and didnt return until Midnight. The location is amazing being really close to major attractions and access to subway lines. The bathroom was clean and the shower had great pressure althought controlling water temperature was a little tricky. Considering how tired we were each night the bed and sheets felt amazing. Overall despite it being a small room we really enjoyed staying at the Hotel Pennsylvania. If you are visiting New York to see the sights and city and don't won't to spend a lot of money on a hotel room then its great.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place with the BEST location and price !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LawrenceToronto
Reviews.Content: Im not sure what people expect for a room in Midtown Manhaten for 100 bucks a night. Im surprised at some of the reviews here. Good Luck finding ANYTHING this decent for this price in NYC This hotel, While in need of updating, is a great budget minded hotel right in the heart of all the action !!. The rooms are quite large for NYC. The beds are okay and the linens are clean. This is a NO FRILL hotel and is great for people who want a decent room in the heart of the city. its a 10 minute walk to Times square and right across the rd from Macys and Madison Square Gardens. If you are traveling to NY by train Penn station is right there as well. The lobby has a 24 hour coffee shop for late night snacks and beverages. IF you want a fluff hotel than this is not for you For fluff in NYC you will pay 4 to 500 per night so have fun with that. Who goes to NY to sit in ther room.. This place is a great place to rest your head. Oh and is right on the 1 and 3 subway lines which give you acsess to the whole city !!. all in all there is nothing wrong with this hotel for the price you are going to pay. People giving it bad reviews im sure have never stayed in other Budget hotels in NY this is by far the best Only downfall i found was the tv only recieved one fuzzy channel. ENJOY NY and ENJOY hotel Penn it has alot of history and even has a famous song written about it by Glenn Miller :D

Reviews.Title: “Horrifying”
Reviews.Author: princessdeb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because of the location and price, but found out that no price is worth the horror we encountered ., The lobby was beautiful and for a moment, we entertained some hope, but then we saw the long lobby line and five service stations with only one attendant present. While waiting in line I saw a sign that said that portable smoking dectors were available, but did not quite understand why they were being offered and dared to think the best. After an interminably long wait, we finally got our keys and went up to our room. The hallways were shabby ,and dirty, and the doors all looked like they neede to be changed. My mouth fell open when I saw the sparsley decorated dull and dingy room, and I felt dirty just standing inside it. I tseemed like someone had taken out all the furniture and just left the bare disgusting necessities. The shelf holding the TV was falling apart, the refridgerator had a big hole in the back of it and did not work, the bath looke dgreasy and the toilet did not flush at the end of the night. At around 10:30 pm one of the staff tried opening our door with a key without knocking, and replied that she was just checking the rooms when I questioned her unannounced entry. We stayed in the city until we could no longer walk just to be able to stay away from that disgusting place, then left by 8:30 the next morning, even though we had a 12 pm flight. The location was great, but not worth the disgusting interior.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting!”
Reviews.Author: theEyeLondon
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a really busy trip with a large group of teenagers. We weren't expecting luxury so no surprises there but....... boy those rooms were really decrepid. The bathroom I shared appeared to have been tiled by a mad DIYer with second hand materials, the sink hung at a precarious angle unsupported by its chrome legs which didn't quite reach the fixture and there were cracks in the ceiling were the shower rail was making a break for freedom. In the bedroom red gaffer tape sealed the window frames so you didn't try leaning out to clean the filthy windows while paint peeled from the walls. On the up side, we weren't there very much, the shower was hot and powerful, the beds were comfortable and clean, and of course the location was good for getting around.

Reviews.Title: “Location perfect, everything else totally wrong”
Reviews.Author: Steffff
Reviews.Content: Concept of this business is: run a perfectly located huge hotel in the very centre of Manhattan, minimize the maintenance expenses to the extent it seems to be practically non-existing for (with slight exaggeration) past 20 years, offer relatively competitive room rate and rely on the fact there is sufficient amount of customers here who give priority to price over the performance. Everything in the room was functioning (lamps, aircon, electric plugs, windows, bathroom) but literally everything was functioning badly. Well, beds were clean and not uncomfortable. I claimed to the receptionist the window frame was broken so that I could not close it and prevent the stream of ice-cold air draught (it was in January). They came and repaired the window, the only tool they used was a big hammer. Conclusion: yes, it's a one way of accomodation in Manhattan. But be prepared and think twice whether that's the one you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible management - really poor”
Reviews.Author: anidon
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend for 5 nights in this brilliantly located hotel. The decor is old and the rooms are quite small. The windows were filthy. On the 4 night of our stay our room was broken into while we slept - our phones and bags were taken. This was bad enough but the lack of care and attention we received from management and staff the next morning was incredible - they trid to convince us we left the door open! We then had to walk to the police station - they didnt even offer us a cab. We spent a few hours at the station and then the police came back to the hotel. Apparently this is a regular occurance! Funnily enough the bags showed up that evening with the wallets empty of course. Apparently staff found them on teh back stairs even though security had told us they had walked the stairs that morning!!!! There was definetly something suspicious about the way it was dealt with and i certainly will not return to that hotel. I couldnt reccommend it any less - not for the security consious anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad really considering reviews!!”
Reviews.Author: Lainey30
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights at the end of March with my mother. Check in was about 25 mins. I was dreading going to our room from all the reviews. The room was grand - nothing fancy but I wasn't expecting fancy from the reviews. It had a clean bed and clean bathroom - the room was darkish though and dated or old-fashioned (whatever way you want to put it). What more do you want in New York as we literally used the room to sleep in and that was it. There was no noise in the corridor and all we heard outside was the drum of the cars below and the sirens now and again. i think we were so tired that we slept. It is a fantastic base as you are literally 7 mins walk to Times Square, across the road from Penn Station (we got the air train in from JFK and ended up coming up from the metro right beside the hotel!!), Macys is 3 mins walk. Brilliant location. I will definitely stay here again. We previously stayed at the Affinia Manhattan and while a fab hotel and really spacious bright room, it was very expensive so the Pennsylvania is a great budget hotel. Well worth staying here so that you have all the extra money to spend on shopping. If it is you first time going to New York, stay at a different hotel if you are not prepared for a basic style hotel. Otherwise cannot complain!!

Reviews.Title: “Never again. Awful!”
Reviews.Author: Barney_G_09
Reviews.Content: Luckily I only stayed here one night, couldn't wait to leave. Waited in line 45min to get checked in by extremely rude front desk person with no smile, no friendliness and no apology for the wait. The hotel smelled old and stale. The Pennsylvania was the only hotel in which i have ever stayed where all the doors to the rooms slam shut, every other door in every other hotel has a closing mechanism. I could hear doors slamming all the way up the corridor- not the way to get a good night's sleep! Only good thing was the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, shame about the staff..”
Reviews.Author: missfruity
Reviews.Content: This huge hotel is in a great location, right opposite Madison Square Gardens and around the corner from Macy's. If our room was anything to go by, the room pictured above must be in a hotel around the corner. Our room was dark, dingy, not very appealing and in dire need of upgrading. However, as you are in New York, you don't spend too much time in your room anyway so we just made the best of it. We found New Yorkers very friendly people and had a great holiday, unfortunately, the staff in this hotel are the rudest I have come across. Particularly one lady who checked us in and clearly couldn't care less about the customers. I don't think I would stay here again even though its a great location. Note: we were 3 female friends on a shopping trip who booked and paid for a triple room... myself and one friend had to share a double bed as the company I booked it with classifies this as a triple room- worth clarifying with your provider if you are booking the same.

Reviews.Title: “Rodents in the hotel - good location but stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: rachelopps
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights with 4 other friends. Unfortunately we forgot to check the reviews on TripAdvisor before we went. Big mistake. We got a good rate and booked the hotel because not only was it reasonable, the location was great too. It is right opposite Madison Square Gardens and within walking distance of lots of the main stores. We enjoyed a Knicks game and to be fair, did not spend a lot of time in the hotel. However.....3 of us were in a top-floor room and despite it being very dated, it was ok. The shower wasn't great but as we spent most of our time out we did not really have an issue with this. 2 of our other friends were not so lucky. They requested a smoking room and were put in a room a few floors below us. On the first night, we got a hysterical phonecall. Getting ready to go out, our friends had suddenly seen a rodent. They claimed it was a rat, but could have been a mouse. They did not hang around to find out. They called Reception and demanded to be moved. After convincing Reception that they needed a new room, a member of staff was sent up. Bizarrely, with a plunger. He did nothing to help and as our friends were being moved out of their room, another member of staff was showing a new couple of guests in to move into the room! They then moved to another room. And the following night.....found more rats/mice (they weren't sure which, but definitely rodents) in their room again. It seriously affected their experience of the holiday as they spent most of the time at Hotel Penn scared and worried that they might find more vermin in their rooms. As well as the constant packing and unpacking. The hotel's attitude was even worse. Our friends had to argue persistently to even get a reduction on their rate, despite what they experienced. All of the rooms that we saw in the hotel had big gaps underneath the doors where we understand the vermin would run in....we saw many rooms where people had actually rolled up towels and stuffed them under the door. This hotel was disgusting. I am just glad we did not spend a lot of time there. I would never stay there again. The staff could have been more helpful/sympathetic yet they just acted as if seeing a mouse or rat in your room was an everyday occurance. Despite the good location, I won't be staying there again. Ironically, when we got back we checked the TripAdvisor website and saw lots of other reviews which had suffered the same experience as us. Moral of the story: check reviews before you go! I am surprised this hotel has not closed down.

Reviews.Title: “STAFF FRESH FROM CHARM SCHOOL”
Reviews.Author: fulovideas
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this hotel I stayed there one night and requested one of there REFURBISHED ROOMS with full working bathroom when I booked on the internet ,When i got to the desk the woman in charge would have made a good concentration camp commandant for the nazis ,so off hand about everything and said you booked a standard room and thats what your getting. so I said I would like to speak to the duty manager and he wasnt much better .I had stated on my booking form if the room wasnt to my liking I wanted to cancel and when I told the manager this and showed him my copy with it all in black and white ,he went all sweetness and like and gave me a room on the 11th floor which was quite nice ,I returned to the hotel three dayslater as I had been out of town and requested the same room ,this time the desk clerk????? was asian and again he had the same attitude as the first woman .saying who told you that you request a room you have the room that you are given ,so again I asked for the duty manager which the asian guy didnt like .anyway the room that I had before was occupied but I asked for another room on the 11th floor and again the room was quite nice with everything in full working order. Then when I went to check out 4 days later the guy on the desk said DO YOU OWE THIS HOTEL ANY MONEY .so yet again I asked for the manager and told him how BLOODY rude is staff were and they should all be sent to a charm school for a few months ,I told the manger that US the publice were keeping them in work and they think that they can treat you like dirt ,well DONT stand for it if your not satisfied with the room keep on looking at different ones until you find one that satisfies you after all we PAY enough to stay in these places ,and stand up to the staff dont let them walk all over you. Remember you are paying there wages and without us they wouldnt have jobs. VERY STRANGE HOW THEY ALL HAVE THIS ATTITUDE PROBLEM IN NEW YORK , I find the hotel ok for the money ,its not the hotel its the STAFF,

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Pennsylvania New York - What a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Bev1960
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 6 day stay at this hotel. Like other people mentioned in previous reviews I was dubious about staying here. Well you could not ask for a better location. The staff were all friendly. Admittedly it could do with a lick of paint here and there. The room was clean. Beds were made up on a daily basis and clean towels were provided everyday. This hotel is situated in the perfect place to explore New York. I recommend you take advantage of the hop on hop off bus tours. An excellent way to see both uptown and downtown. Do take advantage of the 11% discount given in the large stores such as Macys and Bloomingdales.

Reviews.Title: “I'll never go back”
Reviews.Author: CTUNCONNFAN
Reviews.Content: We came into NY for the Big East and wanted to stay next to MSG and Penn Station. We got what we asked for up to that point and then it ended. The check in took more then 45 minutes. Once we got to our room we were shocked at how dirty and run down the hotel was. The room had pant falling off the walls and ceiling. The furniture was old and falling apart. The bath room was well BAD. I will never stay there again. I felt like warning others that were checking in to run but bite my tongue.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced. Not worth it.”
Reviews.Author: cindel25
Reviews.Content: This was my second time coming to NYC for a concert. I decided to book at this hotel this time around instead of my previous one. It was right across the street from MSG and that's what I wanted. 1. Overpriced 2. My room was pleasant except for the noticeable cracks and paint peeling on the closet and bathroom doors/wall. 3. The hot water knob in the shower was loose and it took me a good 10mins to push the knob in so I can take a shower. 4. I booked through the hotel website and put the exact amount and some change on my credit card. They couldn't process it and demanded that I give them 50 bucks for a deposit. I told them no and to charge me for the exact amount of the room. I did this because I wasn't going to be in my room all the time. 5. The place was overcrowded as the lobby was full with kids. I would suggest going elsewhere; it's not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat location and that makes up for the rooms”
Reviews.Author: ladylise143
Reviews.Content: As a few others have stated the Penn Hotel is a bit shabby in it's furnishings etc but the room was clean and maid's came in every day and let's be honest in New York how much time does anyone actually spend in their room!! Bathrooms could do with a little updating fixtures bit shabby and as my husband said you had to do the hokey cokey in the shower as kept going hot and cold but at the end of the day we only needed somewhere to rest our head, have a shower and change of clothes and this provided everything we needed. Location wise couldn't ask for better right opposite Macy's and Maddison Square garden only about 10 blocks from times square. Please don't be put off by any negative reviews i have to say after booking and reading the mixed reviews we were really scared we had made a bad decison but as i say above you really only need the essentials when in New York and for the amount you pay for the rooms the location is a winner. Don't go to the diner Lindy's as others have said it really is a rip off and there are so many other options open to you. The little coffee shop place was great though! Concierge was also really helpful but i do agree the reception staff aren't all that!

Reviews.Title: “What a nightmare”
Reviews.Author: bernieo78
Reviews.Content: It started off waiting for ages to be checked in, the girls behind reception were so rude and ignorant. The rooms were a disgrace paint coming off walls, window would not open carpet dirty looking, if this hotel was in ireland it would be closed down. To be honest we have better cow sheds in ireland. The cafe or whatever it is down in lobby (lindy's) was a rip off. Also be aware not to use prepaid callcards in the hotel rooms you will be charged and will receive a fine big bill. They did it to me i no all about it a total rip off. I hated the hotel and there were 4 others with me they also hated it. We all loved new york and will go back next year but not to the pennsylvania hotel. No way. . .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Ed_Limerick
Reviews.Content: The Penn is fantastic value for the location. I stayed here with my fiancé for a week in march. Yes, the rooms are very basic, and could do with a refurb - but were clean. Towels and sheets changed every day after that. Bed was *really* comfy, and a powerful shower. The location cannot be faulted, across the road from Madison Sq and the subway. There is a real buzz around this hotel, and no matter what time you go to the lobby there are people around. Cons: Our TV was an old CRT, and didn't have a remote control (to be fair we didn't watch it, so we didn't ask for one). Rooms could do with a refurb. No extra pillows/blankets available in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location For The Money.”
Reviews.Author: rubberband
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a College trip this morning and wanted to reassure other folk that this hotel is really not as bad as some folk said it was. Firstly the location is brilliant, you are so close to the Empire State Building , Madison Square Gardens, Time Square, Macy's, Dunking Donuts is right next door (what more could a person want??!!!) lol. We all had a brilliant time and the room was extremely spacious with two king sized beds. One word of warning though, the bathroom really is as horrid as many say it is. On the plus side though, the shower was very efficient and plenty of clean towels. The maids always cleaned the rooms efficiently and made our beds nicely. A word of warning to all youngsters intending on staying here, we did not encounter a safety deposit box in our room, so be warned to look after your hard earned cash. The shopping in New York/Manhattan is absolutely wonderful however the department store staff are extremely pushy and try to force you to buy all sorts of stuff you may not want at all. If you have a very limited budget just tell them, otherwise you could waste a whole heap of cash on un-necessary goods you can't really afford. If you shop in Macy's or Bloomingdales and are British, you can tell them this info and show your passport, then they give you an 11% discount (possibly the tax). It really isn't that much cheaper to buy cosmetics or health and beauty items in the department stores in New York compared to the UK, however I discovered when I reached JFK that my Chanel perfumes and aftershaves were cheaper there, so take a tip and get them at JFK, if you are a lover of Chanel ...no Chanel make-up available at JFK though. One great tip to get around cheaply is, buy a Metro card and use the subway as its so much cheaper, quicker and easier than cabs. A word of warning to youngsters though if you do travel the subway..make sure you get off at the correct stop and don't over-shoot it, as we felt very conspicuous as a group of four, waiting for the next one to take us back to our stop. We were obviously tourists who were a little scared by the intimidating looks we were getting, luckily no harm came to us. Please be re-assured that the positive things about the hotel really do outweigh the negative, so go and enjoy the trip. Don't over buy your souvenirs though and exceed the luggage allowance as British Airways check-in at JFK would have charged us $50 a kilo had we been over our allowance.

Reviews.Title: “I love hotel penn!”
Reviews.Author: tylervirgo
Reviews.Content: Seriously, I don't see what people are talking about with all these penn horror stories?! I had read these reviews extensively AFTER I booked the hotel and I assure you I was completly horrorfied them but Hotel Penn is, in reality, exceptionally okay! Arriving, you are greeted by a stunning lobby! The rooms were incredibly spacious and though only two people were destined for the room we wer each treated to a king size bed! The views from the window were spectacular for such a hotel! Clear views of the empire state (so clear in fact we even took pictures in front of it!) and of course a little glimpse of macys. The rooms were cleaned spotlessly every day with copious towels and linen provided. The staff were friendly and helpful and unquestonably approachable. The location?! Superb! With times square, macys, Maddison Sq. Garden, pen plaza, fifth avenue and the empire state building all within walking distance what more could you possibly want?! You are in the centre of the hustle and bustle which really helpes because at the end of a day exploring - who really wanted to have to deal with the subways?! Hotel Penn has a very much undeserved reputation! Whilst you shouldn't go there expecting a generic travellers inn, there is no need to prepare for the worst! In summary: A clean, tidy and central place to stay in manhattan my tip would be to get yourself a ticket for the knicks who play just across the block at maddison Sq. Garden. I bookedbefore i traveled and the experience for me, as someone who had never bee into basketball before, wa profound and an excellent way to immerse yourself into that New York state of mind,

Reviews.Title: “Do you go to NY to see the sights or stay in your hotel?!”
Reviews.Author: Sm1lerNO1
Reviews.Content: Just back from a three night stay in this hotel. It was booked through 'Best @ Travel' by my partner as a surprise for my 30th. Before going i read countless reviews on this site and was dreading going. On entry to the hotel, it was gorgeous, huge and extremely busy. On entering the room, it was fairly small, there was views of the back of other extremely high buildings, it was in need of updating, the bathroom was old looking and the shower was a stick out the wall, but let me tell you. I ran a full bath in less than 3minutes, at home it would take me 20, the shower was very powerful and easy to use. The bed was clean and comfy. Every item in the room worked. The maid service was ace. We literally slept and washed in this room, and surely when you go to a place like NY you dont want to stay in your hotel for any longer than you have too. Yes this hotel could do with modernisation, but then they would up the payment to go with it. I dont normally do reviews, but i wanted to let people know, that are due to go to this hotel soon, not to worry about previous reviews, but dont have high expections either. I am 30 and my partner is 50, we both couldnt fault this hotel and would return. The location was amazing, couldnt really beat it. Your cases can be held on your day of departure for $2 a case, just incase that is of use to you!! Oh and there is a 'drop box' for your door cards (save waiting in the long queues to check out)

Reviews.Title: “New York and all it's glory at your finger tips!”
Reviews.Author: Disney_Debs_8O
Reviews.Content: Just got back from NYC and stayed at the Pennsylvania Hotel. I must admit before going i looked up reviews of this hotel on trip advisor and started panicking but having now stayed at this hotel with my College friends have had the best time. For one the room was fine I mean it's not the Ritz but it has all the basic essentials you could ask for. I have stayed in other Hotels in the USA with my family and have always stayed in 5 star hotels. Well the Pennsylvannia isn't 5 star on decor but for a place to wash, change, sleep and explore you can't go wrong. It's a huge hotel so obviously i don't know what every room is like but we stayed on the 17th floor and found the room spacious, clean and comfortable not at all like the rooms had been reviewed. The Location is the best it's only a 5 minute walk to Times Square. Only 5 stops on the train to Central Park the Empire State Building was also a 10 minute walk and OMG the shopping is fantastic right on your door step and all around. Without a doubt we stayed in a 5 star location and to be honest we went to NYC to enjoy the sights and shows not to rate how comfortable the bed was but believe me if you do the full days and nights like my friends and i did you'll go out like a light.
