Reviews.Title: “ideal location”
Reviews.Author: sean1888
Reviews.Content: This year will be my third year in hotel Pennsylvannia. Location wise, the hotel is second to none. You have the hustle and bustle of times square on your door step. NYC is a boys holiday for myself every year. If you are there to see the city..then fantastic.. a romantic get away.. no chance!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to explore NYC”
Reviews.Author: golfpro59
Reviews.Content: Our first time to NYC and our first time to America as well. After a ton of research on the web (and mainly tripadvisor.com!) I choose this hotel because of location and budget. I took my girlfriend (whom is now my fiance - i proposed in Shakespeare's Garden - Central Park) as she had always wanted to experience the Big Apple! We stayed for 7 nights in a queen size room on the 7th floor. Our room was okay but not very romantic, but it meant we could spend more on the sights of New York City. Being from Australia i noticed a few things that i found odd - 1. No switches on the powerpoints (which i think is a bit dangerous) 2. When you flush the toliet the bowl fills half way up ( which i think is a waste of water considering we're trying to conserve water!) 3. There are heaps more people out once the sun goes down! 4. Initially I found the locals quite rude but please remember that you are a tourist and they see them all day everyday and they actually like it if you treat them the same way! If your on a budget this is a great place to stay to simply sleep for few hours and then continue exploring this amazing city. We're keen to go back ASAP! Cheers Stephen P.S Our computer died only a few weeks ago and we lost all our New York photos which is quite shattering but a lesson learnt -keep a duplicate of all digital photos if not 3+ sets.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Choice”
Reviews.Author: LadyMP
Reviews.Content: I booked this through Alpharooms (never again) their website is misleading to say the least-yes this is a budget Hotel but what is the excuse for dirty rooms and dire customer service. I have never had such a dreadful experience as I had to check out and find myself an alternative. Alpharooms were most unhelpful as all they could offer was in an entirely different location, I was more than willing to upgrade but this didn;t do the trick either.

Reviews.Title: “loved New York”
Reviews.Author: hchatt
Reviews.Content: i was 18 at the time nad travelld alone, for the first time to new york. the hotel has excellent location. i had upgraded my room to include breakfast. room was good value for money ocnsidering location. the only thing i could find fault with in hte room was the poor lighting. there wasnt much lighting, but everything else was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: JaneyhBedfordshire
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel for my 40th birthday and I have to say it is the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. I never want to go back. The room was old, dated, yellow net curtains, stains on the floors. Disgusting,, foul and depressing. The staff were rude and arrogant. Although cheap do not stay there if you go to New York for the first time and have great expectations. Nothing more to say only YUCK!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE - THE WEBSITE IS MISLEADING AND ROOMS DISGUSTING!”
Reviews.Author: Demoralised
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 12 years ago and had a great experience sadly I can't say the same now. The lobby looks great but once you step out of the lift, it is depressing and beyond disgusting. The 1st room was dark, couldn't walk around the bed for the size of the room and the amount of furniture. We were offered another room which was dirty beyond words. The level of dust on the door closing mechanism was unreal, the carpets thread bare, paint was flaking off walls and ceiling; electrical socket hanging off the wall, furniture vandalised and a general sense that the room hadn't been thoroughly cleaned in months. We couldn't stay in that room due to the levels of dust and my husband is asthmatic (triggered by dust mites), we complained and the hotel manageress was downright rude and entirely unhelpful in every respect. My husband explained that the holiday was for our wedding anniversary and we expected a clean room - her reply "This isn't the hotel for a special occasion!" and the criticism of the lack of hygiene and basic cleanliness entlrely unfazed her. To be honest I don't know for what purpose you would stay at this hotel unless it was to wallow in a deep clinical depression or consider taking your own life. DO NOT FALL FOR THE WEBSITE AND THE REFURBISHMENT CLAIMS - THEY ARE BLATANT LIES! If we could find the NYC department responsible for tourism we would be reporting this hotel and showing them the photographic evidence we have. Sadly as our hotel was paid via an agent who was inaccessible to us at the time, we felt we had no choice but to get on a flight back to the UK as we had no budget to find another hotel. Sadly tainted my previous wonderful experience of NY. I hope no-one else has to experience the condition of this hotel and the rudeness of the manageress!

Reviews.Title: “Will not be recommending this hotel”
Reviews.Author: PinkBlush
Reviews.Content: After a 25 hour flight from Australia we arrived in NYC late at night and were really tired. The staff were rude and didn't have any enthusiasm. The lobby was full and we had to wait for a long time to check in. The room we entered was extremely average. The bathroom was old and tired and so was the paint on the walls. The bed linen could definately do with an update. The internet in the lobby was quite expensive which was a shame. The service at the desk was very slow when we needed more towels so we had to ask a few times before someone came up. The only good thing was the location,the room was cleaned daily and the lift was fast. We later went on to stay at the hotel elysees which was FANTASTIC so check it out if you are looking for a beautiful location, great staff and a french home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Midiman111
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel we thought what a great location everything you want is around you, walked into the hotel lobby that was great also, check in was easy and friendly then the nightmare begins after stepping out of the elevator i thought i was on the set of the shining (Stephen King Movie). The hotel looked not just old and in need of decoration but was a very unclean smell everywhere. We got to our room on the fifth floor and it was even worse the smell was terrible so obviously we complained and we carried cases back to reception i think they forget that some people had been on an 8 hour flight plus airports more like 12 hours to be messing around with dirty rooms, we were given another room this time on the 10th floor and told we have upgraded you to a superior room - this was a little better as in bigger room but the smell of dirty carpets and general uncleanliness as the skirtings looked as if they had never been cleaned or painted since the hotel opened in 1936 but we were tired so we asked if they could send up some extra pillows to the room after 1 hour they never arrived so we rang down again they apologised and said they would send them up right away - that night they never arrived at all. As we were only staying 3 nights we decided to accept a bad decision to stay at this hotel. After staying in New York last year at the Jolly Madison Towers we were deeply disappointed with Hotel Pennsylvania and i hope you will remember this review in case you book because the pictures they portray on their site look nothing like the room you will be given i am sure.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as people make out!”
Reviews.Author: Rossie08
Reviews.Content: Having read many of the reviews about this hotel after we had it booked I was worried about what we would encounter. We (my girlfriend and I) arrived on a Sat at about one and got the subway into the city from the airport. The hotel then is one block away from the subway which was very handy for bags etc and no need for the expense of a taxi. When we arrived in, we had feared the worst regarding the queue but wasnt to bad at all, max 30 mins. Its a big hotel so there is obviously goin to be a small bit of a waiting process like in any hotel. The receptionist was grand if not a bit odd. We were on floor 12 which by reading other reviews is away from the worst parts of the hotels. We had heard that the higher up the better the rooms so had gone on the hotels website prior to go and requested that we be in a newly renovated room. I dont know if this made any difference in the final outcome but worked out alright for us so would recommend doing it. The rooms itself was fine, basic and clean. I have seen some of the pic posted but our rooms was fine and the staff cleaned and charged the beds every morning so we had no complaints at all. The location of this hotel is 2nd to none, directly across the road from madison sq garden and max 15mins walk from times sq. As for as manhatton is concerned you wont find better. All in all we had no complaints with the hotel but maybe we just got lucky................

Reviews.Title: “Most uncomfortable beds in the world”
Reviews.Author: Sexytraveller2
Reviews.Content: OK ill get straight to the point. The bad things; 1. The line to check in was terrible (about 200 people) & only 2 staff on the desk. A joke considering it was christmas holidays. 2. Staff were rude (but you would expect that from people in NYC) 3. Beds were like concrete. You wouldnt of been able to drill a hole through it as ith was that hard. I would have slept better out on the sidewalk in -5 degrees. 4. Too bloody noisy. The walls were as thin as tissue paper & can hear every bit of noise from on the street or from the people next door. (even if ur on the 19th floor). 5. definantly not worth $290 a night. That was a joke! The good things; 1.Location was fantastic 2.The showers were good & the toilets actually flushed properly unlike most hotels in the US.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with 2 faces”
Reviews.Author: Oscar2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days, and reading all the other reviews I must say this hotel has 2 faces. The quality differs per floor and room very much. On arrival they offered us a horrible, worn out, dirty room (4th floor) (I thought that a corpse had been hidden under the bed for a month or so!!). We wisely refused to move in and insisted on a solution. That took some time but one of the receptionist made good effort and offerd us an excecutive room on 12th floor and that was reasonable. We had to pay an adittional $25 a day, but as an extra breakfast, coffe and tea, a fridge and internet acces (free) was included, not a bad deal. I cannot understand how such big differences are possible in one hotel. And we were not the only couple with this problem. We were with 4 couples together and without any doubt, they were offered the same lousy, dirty, [--] rooms at first also (and of course they refused as well). They also got upgraded after complaining. Strange place Hotel Penn!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Pennsylvania...You get what you oay for!”
Reviews.Author: BurnleyLancashire_UK
Reviews.Content: Having just flown into New York from London and being tired, we arrived at the hotel. Checking in took over an hour as the queue was long and there were only three people on the check in desk. We got to our room and it was very basic and cleaned to a minimal standard, the corridors in the hotel looked like something from a horror movie! The light was missing a cover and was buzzing, the housekeeper let herself into our room not realising we were in, she appologised and I asked her if all the rooms were like this. She told me that the hotel also scared her when she was on her own. Our window did not close properly and maintainence failed to sort it for us. Staff weren't particularly friendly and definitely not a hotel that we would recommend to anyone or use again! If you can afford to pay more then do it!

Reviews.Title: “clean and basic.”
Reviews.Author: superbunty
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel before in Feb 2008 on a friends recommendation for location and basic room. I was warned that its not a 5 star so dont expect much, but its clean and for the amount of time i spent in the room (8 hours to sleep and shower) it was fine. When i went in Feb, we paid less than 50 euros a night each which i thought was good value for location and basic room. I went again in Nov 08 at short notice and paid twice what I paid in Feb. All other hotels were booked out in the midtown area or were way more expensive. Again, it was a basic room but clean. The rooms advertised are not what is on their website. If you want good location with basic accomadation-then this is for you. if you want friendly staff, bright airy rooms then you would be advised to book somewhere else. I think if you go in nov/dec you would prob get a nicer hotel nearby for same price. Staff are not friendly and like to finish their conversations with each other before dealing with you, when you have waited around 10-15 mins in the check in/check out queue. Also its $3 a bag if you want to leave luggage for the day which used to be free at one point!

Reviews.Title: “old fasioned but clean”
Reviews.Author: donegalannie
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel from the 4th-8th dec, there was 4 in our group. i have to say that i was very apprehensive about staying at this hotel after reading some of the reviews on trip advisor & we also got a letter from the booking company 2 weeks before we were due to fly out telling us that the hotel was basic & under renovation & that we could change hotels at a cost, i was not impressed with that as we had the holiday booked since January 2008. anyway i'm glad we didn't change as i found the hotel fine, we arrived at about 12.30pm & we were able to check in straight away, we were on our way to the rooms at 1pm & as i said before i didn't know what to expect, but we got a great room on floor 3, room # 392 it was massive, it had a superking size bed in it & a tv, 2 walk in wardrobes/cupboards with an ironing board & iron, the shower was a bit low so i can understand maybe how taller people might have had a problem with that, but apart from the furniture being old fashioned, it was clean & the linen was changed everyday, we were so impressed with the cleaning staff we even tipped them, there was a bit of renovation work going on outside our room, they were replacing the window lintels so there was abit of noise from the drilling but that only went on during the day & we were out sightseeing so it didn't cause us any problems. on the other hand the other couple that went with us are smokers & were put on floor 6 & they got a pokey wee room with black marks across the walls, they rang reception & they got a change onto floor 3 no problem, their room had 2 double beds in it & wouldn't have been quite as big as ours but it was still a good size. i would recommend this hotel as long as you're not a smoker & if you are there for sightseeing or shopping so you won't be spending a long time in it during the day. it is in a good location beside macy's & madison square garden & about 15mins walk to time square, i would recommend that you go to time square & buy one of the bus tours on the first day of your stay as we left it until our last full day & we realised what we were missing, but when you only have 4 days!!! also there is a set of red steps in times square & at the back of those steps is a ticketmaster & they sell tickets for all the broadway shows at a reduced rate, we got tickets to see grease for $62.50 per ticket 5 rows from the stage if i had bought these online before i left they would have cost me $150 per ticket. all in all it was a grand holiday, but it was very cold especially on the sunday which is the day we took the open top bus tour so we were frozen stiff by the time we got back to the hotel so if you're planning to go in the winter wrap up warm & take a good long heavy coat with you. we had no problems checking out at all either & the concierge got us a taxi to the airport within 5 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Will Not Return-”
Reviews.Author: southernsurprise
Reviews.Content: This is A BUDGET HOTEL in NYC. The only thing seperating this hotel from a hostel or a boarding house is that you do not have shared baths. It will be about $45.00 to get a cab from LGA to this hotel. When you pull up and enter, you are being "hood-winked" or "bamboozeled" The lobby is beautiful. There is a large check in area, there were even fresh flowers when we checked in. Since we arrived so early, we were not able to check in, but we were told to go to the ground floor, and they would store our bags. Very sketchy looking area where they keep your bags. I had to go into DEEP prayer before I agreed to keep them down there. When we returned to check in, the hotel was packed! I took this as a good sign; thinking that the hotel was popular, and that a lot of people knew this was the place to stay. I WAS WRONG. The elevator was nice and clean with a flat screen tv. The minute you step off of the elevator you feel like you are in a different hotel. I felt like I went from a Hampton to Bates Motel. The air was not working in the hallways. It was dark, musty smelling, and HOT. There are holes in the walls, missing wall paper, FILTHY carpet. So I got to my room, and I opened the door, and just stood there. I told my friends to walk out cause I was not staying there. We went back to the front desk, and as I waited, I heard the couple behind me complaining about the same thing. When I got to the receiptionist, I demanded the room that was on the internet. He gave me some random excuse for why I could not get that room, but he did give me another room. Although this room was better than the first, it was not what I wanted. We took a shower in our flip flops. The next morning, I called my father and he asked me what the view was. So I got up (barefooted) and went to the window, and stepped in a puddle of water (water went above my foot). The air-conditionar (a window unit) had leaked all night, and all the water had accumulated in a dirty water puddle. So I got my friends up, and went downstairs AGAIN and requested another room. We were switched again, and the room was clean, it just looked very worn and old. We still took showers with our flip flops. I have been to better hotels, and mybe that is why I was not impressed with this. I did like that it was walking distance to many of the sights of the City. Other than that, I will never return.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: Dogtraveler_8
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, great location, friendly staff, check in and check out went smoothly, we timed it, there was long lines from 11:30am till late in the afternoon, valet was smooth and they had are car out in 15 minutes, the room was great considering that this was the cheaest hotel in Manhatten. We loved the dog friendly, no additional charge feature. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: BRTraveler10
Reviews.Content: The hotel has several problems as they have been frquently reported in this website. I experienced some of them during December 2008. I am a frequent traveler and never seen such a terrible place before. One day, the heating went off and we were really cold. Cold wind came into the room from the windows. My family and I stayed at the front part of the hotel where, at the street (7th), a taxi stand in front of Penn Station made a mix of sounds that included taxi horns and a loud whistle from a man organizing the taxi line: impossible to rest. May be better than sleeping at the streets during a cold month.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: jlyjoe
Reviews.Content: I had been on a train for 24 hours coming from illinois to new york to look at a school, i had chosen the Penn Hotel because it was conveniently located across from penn station, I had made my reservation almost two months before with Expedia. I had reserved a king smoking room.. after standing in line for 20 min. i went to check in and they said, " i apologize but we no longer have any king smoking available, i told the lady at that i had made the reservation over 2 months ago and she said there was nothing she could do about it, i asked for a discount but she couldn't give me one. (She was very polite tho..) So i said fine and was given a room with 2 double beds, i am 6'11" so that was mildly uncomfortable... The room was ok. the bathroom could have been cleaner, there was a ring of dirt around the drain, but thanx to my trusty lysol wipes that cleaned right up. I was expecting cockroaches and grime everywhere from reading the reviews. All in all it was not a bad hotel, just maybe a couple of improvements is all...

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!!!! Disgusting!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Valerie76
Reviews.Content: #1 hotel for bedbugs. The only thing that can improve this hotel is for it to be torn down. Dirty, dirty dirty. Nothing at all good to say about it. This hotel will ruin your stay in NYC. Paying more is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: swirlywirly
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews we were expecting to be staying in a dump, we were very pleasantly suprised! Waited around 15-20 minutes to check in, then off to our room, it was nice and spacious, two double beds, which were so so comfy, clean, best shower in any hotel i've stayed at, maids were in every day changing towels etc. Fantastic location, great for the subway and loads of food places for breakfast. We considered cancelling this hotel a few months ago, but so glad we didn't, it was great for everything we did. We were there 6 nights and were sorry to leave (no really, the bed was so comfy!)

Reviews.Title: “What a waste of money!”
Reviews.Author: EssexBonzo
Reviews.Content: Do not ruin your holiday by staying in this Hotel. This hotel looked really good on their website, pictures of lovely new rooms, oh what a shock when we got there. We had a room on the 8th floor which was breezier than the roof of the Empire State building. The curtains swayed in the breeze and kept the room cold even with the heater on. The bathroom was not much better all though the shower looked prehistoric it actually was nice and powerful with plenty of hot water on demand. These rooms really need a make over and where a huge disapointment considering how much we paid to stay there. The corridors to our room weren't much better with plaster and paint falling of the walls. It must also be the noisest hotel in the world, roughly every half hour during the night theres a garbage truck that pulls up on 32nd Street and picks up metal rubbish bins, this will keep you up all night.... trust me. I actually thought they were demolishing a building at the end of the block until I got up during the night and took a walk to see what the racket was. To complement this noise you have buses parking up down the same street revving there engines up. This seems to affect all floors at the rear and side of the hotel. I didn't have one good nights sleep in the week we stayed there. I was actually in the lobby when another 'trip advisor' member asked security about their room break in, they have left a review so please look for it and read it. I'm so glad we heard them talking about this as we didn't leave anything valuable in the room after that. The safe deposit boxes are a good idea if the staff would actually come and let you open them, you had a bell to ring which they just ignored. You had to keep running around to find the staff to do it for you. Allow at least half an hour if you need to get stuff out your box. Generally the staff were friendly and helpful, the maids do a fantastic job of keeping the rooms and corridors clean even with bits flaking of the walls, the concierge was very helpful and the doormen never let us down with tips on where to get good food. You can leave your bags in a secure (?) area after checking out but it costs US$8 per ticket. The guys down there were friendly to. Overall a big let down for the money we paid, but New York is good destination and if this hotel is ever fully refurbished with good sound proofing and double glazing it would be pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “"Quality time" in a [--] hole.”
Reviews.Author: jaf5024
Reviews.Content: Where do I even begin. My initial thoughts are to sue the manger of this hotel for false advertisement at the very least. I am a world traveler---I have seen about every hotel accomodation you can imagine and this was THE WORST. Everything from the despicable service, to the absolute appalling interior upkeep, to gigantic mold stains on the ceiling of our room, and the tampon sitting in the hallway or the smeared fecal matter across the wall--this place was not only disgusting but disturbing. I wouldn't recommend it to anyone in a million years . You would be better off just flushing $250 down the toilet and sleeping on a doorstep then booking a room here.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Clean Hotel - Well at least our stay was!”
Reviews.Author: Gooner
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the first week of December. Got a room for 3 people on the 14th floor, it had been renovated, with 3 single beds. It was clean and the cleaning staff were very nice. Location is just great. Room did get a bit cold though during the night, but we had a great view of The Empire State Building. This was our 6th time to stay at this hotel and lucky for us we have always got good rooms, sometimes the decor leaves a lot to be desired, but as long as its clean and lots of hot water in the shower, then its grand.

Reviews.Title: “A great disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Greek_engineer
Reviews.Content: The hotel boasted refurbished rooms. We booked one and compalined about the state of the room when we checked in. The replacement room was little better. So called refurbishment did not include modernisation. Dated fittings were replaced with equaly dated designs. The room was in need of decoration, the furniture tatty there was little clothes hanging space and the steel door entry to the room made one feel you were entering a coffin. On the plus side it was 10-15 minutes walk from Times Square. Overall, poor value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Don't leave your valuables in your room!”
Reviews.Author: sharon073
Reviews.Content: My initial relief at the hotel after reading the reviews on this website quickly subsided after we found that a camera case containing a camcorder and two digital cameras had been stolen from our room!! Strangely enough a secrurity man told us not to tell the police - instead they would provide us with a written verification for insurance purposes. We did inform the NYPD who have had many many reports of this nature and would like to urge people not to stay here!! The fact that they allocated us the wrong rooms and only changed them after we got stroppy with them seems quite incidental now!!!

Reviews.Title: “youth hostle prehaps !!!”
Reviews.Author: Edward999
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed in a youth hostle but am sure that they must be on a similar vain to this hotel. I left the booking of the said hotel to friends ! who were advised positively by a travel agent. I knew on arrival that trouble lay ahead. I have only ever stayed in 4 stars and above but my companions were on a budget and I thought that a 2star establishment could not be that bad, I was wrong !!. The staff were friendly on reception and were the hotels only redeeming feature. The queue was reminisent to that of an overused airport and check in was slow due to an undermaned desk. The common areas of the hotel were shaby and dingy and the rooms reflected what I would imagine to be a cheap brothel ( I only said imagine !! ) Dark carpets, flakeing paint, holes patched with a sheet of plaster board , and the bathrooms do not look like they have had an upgrade since the 1930s. The heating dates back to the arc and the non existent double glazing meant that you could hear the sound of the city ( and it is noisy ) 24 hours a day.I considered throwing myself from our room on the 16th floor but decided that New York had alot more to offer ( it did ) . The window safety cables incidently were all broken so it was possible to open them fully. Those wishing to take youngsters becareful. My advise. Stay well away and do not believe any positive reviews . The owners should be ashamed .

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: silvesy
Reviews.Content: Decent place and good value depending on when you are going. Just opposite Madison Square Gardens, and we actually watched a game. The room that we were in had a ginourmous bed and a nice view overlooking Madison Sq Gardens. Hotel Service was good as well. Overall a great place to commence you discovery of New York.

Reviews.Title: “Horrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: beth25
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed in this hotel last year - our rooms overlooked madison square gardens. The bedrooms had single pane glass - the room was freezing and unbearably loud but the strangest and most inconvenient thing was that the bathroom (from which you could wave into the well illuminated office block across the road) did`nt have any curtains/ blinds - I was informed by housekeeping that they did`nt see a problem with this and consequently spent our time anxiously taping towels to the huge window - we could even clearly identify our window with towels from street level. The hygiene of this establishment is very questionable. Lights did`nt work, the carpets were filthy and the place smelled disgusting. The shower head was broken and sprayed water onto the light switch - wardrobe doors would`nt open - in short avoid this hotel at all costs. Booking in took an hour of standing in a queue. We could`nt say a single positive thing about this hotel and found ourselves dreading returning to the hotel at night. Yes I know New York is expensive and some would argue its such a 24 hour city you only need a bed to crash for a few hours - but this hotel is a waste of your money, time and will put a huge downer on your trip - avoid ,avoid ,avoid. Beth

Reviews.Title: “Basic but good”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Chick100
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pennsylvania from 21st to 28th November, was a bit dubious after reading previous reviews but on arrival was pleasantly surprised. Took a short while to check in, lobby is lovely and very busy all the time. Room was reasonably big, huge bed and lots of tv channels. On arriving we were given plenty of extra towels by housekeeping when they heard we were there for a week. As it turns out they weren't needed as the sheets and towels were changed every day. Housekeeping staff were lovely, very pleasant and helpful. Room was warm and clean. Yes it was old and in need of a renovation but as somewhere to lay your head at night it was perfect. Requested extra pillows from reception and received them in a matter of minutes. Hotel is in an excellent location, many places within a very short walking distance. Upon checking out (which took about two minutes) we used the luggage storage room downstairs which was well worth the few dollars that it cost for the day. Also made use of the safety deposit boxes in reception which cost nothing. The only downside was the lack of staff at reception and as they also oversee the safety deposity boxes we often ended up waiting around for a few minutes to get to the safety deposit box. Overall a very enjoyable stay and would use the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Totally sucks!”
Reviews.Author: Vida_V
Reviews.Content: This hotel was located very nicely, and that prompted us to choose it for our vacation in NYC. big mistake!! besides the location, NOTHING else about it was worth it.. Rude lobby staff,dirty,small rooms with small dingy bathrooms.. Showers that did not work,no Internet facility,even if we were willing to pay for it! There are many other hotels which are in the same neighborhood and are much better, avoid this!

Reviews.Title: “Glad it didn't fall down while we were their”
Reviews.Author: leneanne
Reviews.Content: As a travel agent I have traveled alot and have stayed in many hotels. This is about the worst you can get. I had read the reviews thinking, it can't be that bad. IT IS.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: robertdublinDublin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic location Right across the road from Madison square gardens and Penn train staion. When we arrived we were given 2 rooms on the at tthe hotel we were given 2 twin rooms on the eig ht floor these rooms were a bit shabby so after a hour we went back down to the check in desk and told the girl so after a bit of haggigling the girl gave us 2 twin rooms on the 13th floor these must have been renovated as the rooms were lovely. and the girls who cleaned the romms were very pleasnt.re beautiful I think the trick to do when arriving is to ask for a renovated room. Would defintlley stay here again Good job Pennsylvania Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: LisaWestmeath
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel from the 24th of November till the 26th. I was part of 5 girls who went shopping and site seeing. After reading the reviews we were all nervous of the hotel. When we arrived we thought the reception area was lovely and was all done up for christmas which was really nice. It only took 5 mins to check in and we were given 2 rooms beside each other on the 11th floor. When we walked up to the room the corridors we not badly light at all as previous reviews stated. Both rooms were clean. The bathrooms were clean and had clean towels. The bedrooms were clean and warm very comfortable. The sheets and towels were changed everyday which was great and doesnt happen everywhere. The location of the hotel was ideal were were only 2 mins walk from Macy's and around the corner from the empire state building which i would recommend to go at night. Time square was 10 mins walk. We were only about 5 mins walk from 5th avenue which was lovely to walk down it was all light up with christmas lights and was beautiful. When we checked out again it only took 5 mins and they offered us a room to store our bags while we waited to go to the airport. There was a lovely man in the storage room who helped us with them and was no delay in claiming them back. I would have no hesitation to book this hotel again for the location and price its well worth the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Don´t stay here !”
Reviews.Author: Swed9
Reviews.Content: Rude and arrogant front desk staf. When we flush the toilett water came out on the floor. Bath tub filling up with dirty water from the sour when guest next door taking a shower. They didn´t offer us a new room and they couldn´t fix the problem. But the worst was the arrogant behavior from the front desk staf. This hotel must have new guests all the time. I can not imagin that a previous guest ever goes back.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel On Earth!!!! Caution Do Not Ever Stay At This Rat Hole!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Enrico728
Reviews.Content: Ladies and Gentlemen, what ever you do, do not ever stay at this place!!!! I live in lower Westchester and my girlfriend and I decided to stay in the city over night for a friends birthday, we booked this rathole because it was close to the party, WHAT A MISTAKE!!!!!!!!!! the place is FILTHY, the place is just gross!!!!!! I booked through orbitz, and paid with orbitz, a month later on my credit card bill I get almost a $300.00 charge from them...... FOR NO REASON, this place really sucks!!!! DONT EVER STAY THERE!!!!! but I will say orbitz was very helpful with getting the charge taken off for me!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “RIP-Off outdated and unhelpful”
Reviews.Author: wizzfizz24
Reviews.Content: What an awful hotel! the only positive thing was the location, as for the negatives,well where do i start: tiny roomy, we'd booked 1 room with 2 beds- in fact it onyl had one, shower didn't work, sink didn't work, carpet was stained, window didn't shut- beds didn't have proper duvets only cheap blankets(was v. cold in room!), no main light only a side lamp which didn't work! When we complained about the beds they denied we'd booked two and instead of changing rooms gave us a rusty roll out bed which had seen better days. There was a shortage of staff and the vast majority were rude and stroppy. Whilst this was a good location it didn't make up for all the horrors of it. We had a brilliant time in NYC, it was just a shame the hotel was such a disappointment and a complete rip-off. We stayed 3 nights in Oct. half term.On floor 5 (not yet rennovated) I know a hotel is just somewhere do sleep at night but frankly we didn't manage to get any!!! WOULD NOT RECOMMEND TO ANYONE! Also, would NOT recommend booking through hotels.com!

Reviews.Title: “What a dump”
Reviews.Author: What_a_h0le
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went for a long weekend to New York 6th - 10th Nov. We're both pretty laid back and not to keen to complain but this place is absolutely awful, so much so that I have felt the need to write a poor review about it! Everyone that we spoke to who was staying there, was of the same opinion and no one had anything positive to say about it other than the location is excellent. The hotel is very old and in dire need of a re-fit. The bathroom and the bedroom were both dirty (even after the cleaners had been in!), we couldn't open the window as it was so old, the air-con unit was letting out hot air only, there's no ceiling lights either so this makes the bedrooms very dark & dingy. It was a bit on the smelly side too. The worst thing though, was that my pyjamas were stolen from my room by one of the maid's and no-one helped me to find them and the hotel has refused to knock the cost of them off the bill! I loved New York and would go back there tomorrow if I could but there's absolutely no way that I'd stay at this hotel again, even if it was for free! My advice to anyone considering staying here is DON'T! Spend an extra £100 and stay somewhere that won't ruin your break away to such an amazing place.

Reviews.Title: “hated this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ruler8
Reviews.Content: this hotel has to be the worst i have ever stayed in. myself and three friends went for some shopping for six days. i know that most hotels in the states are basic but this was down right dirty. it was filthy and the staff were appalling. i was afraid to walk on the carpet it was so dirty. there was no stopper in the bath and it was cracked and peeling.the corridor was frightening. it was quite scary as there was no one checking the lift. anyone could come up to the corridor. myself and one friend had to travel a day earlier as we were airline staff and the flights were better that day so we had to do a separate booking for one night.well that was so confusing for the staff but they gave us a room which because of my airline i.d. they saId was an upgrade.well what a joke that was it was on the third floor and we since found ou that the first three floors are rented by the hour that says it all. there was no head boards on the beds the t.v. unit was falling apart and it felt as if the room had not been cleaned in years. this hotel was not cheap we paid 2500 euros and i paid 215 dollars for the extra night. we had friends staying in the new yorker and they had a suite for the same price and there was no comparison living room 2 ensuites an ironing room and plasma television. needlless to say we wont be going back again and i will be telling everyone i know to give it a wide berth. thanking you, gerardine kiernan

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: EnglandBeryl
Reviews.Content: the rooms were abit shabby especially the bathroom but it was clean and the staff were very friendly. can't fault the location it was perfect and for somewhere to lay ur head at night it was great would use this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: RoxanaMexicoDF
Reviews.Content: It was one of the worst experiences ever. The room was dirty, noisy and dark. The staff was rude. It definitely does not worth the price, Too expensive for what we get. Will never ever come back to this pigsty.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, great location and a little dated.”
Reviews.Author: Niall
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of October, booked in with a group of students. Had heard varying degrees of negative reports in regard to the condition of the place, unclean beds, bathrooms and really poor hotel. To begin with it was very average, ideal for a group of students who would only be using rooms for rest at night. They were not rooms to lounge around in, those comforts do not exist here!! The rooms were huge, basic facilities, showers ideal for someone four foot high!!!, clean towels and beds made everyday, that was our experience, but did not hear this from previous people who stayed there. Old style bathrooms, old enamel baths. All rooms had tv's. The location of the hotel is brilliant, across from Madison Sq. Garden and Penn Station, Macys is one block away and Empire State likewise behind hotel. Ideal place really to stay for a short break were little time is spent in the hotel. All we needed was a clean bed and clean bathroom, we got that. Doormen were excellent and bags were all sorted at a small charge from the bus. Shop on ground floor good for soft drinks and coffee. Checkout was depositing keys in a box, so no queuing. A very busy place, when we checked in there were only 19 rooms left out of the 1700. Lobby always busy, all sorts, from business men, to shoppers and tourists. Obviously alot of people like this hotel. Would stay here again with a group. Perfect for that. Basic hotel, great location..

Reviews.Title: “Filthty, smelly, old, avoid like the plague.”
Reviews.Author: helbabe
Reviews.Content: What a dump I have never in all my life stayed in such a filthty dirty grubby hotel. My husband had book a trip to New York for my 40th birthday and had book this hotel through Aerlingushotels thinking it would be ok because Aerlingus was a well known company. Avoid this hotel the corridors are like something you would see in a horror movie. This whole hotel needs to be pulled down and rebuilt it was so old and dirty. There was a smell of dirty dogs and stale smoke in our room. I can't go on anymore it is just an absolute dump.

Reviews.Title: “basic, claen, great location good all rounder!”
Reviews.Author: claireg31
Reviews.Content: Heard so many bad reviews on the hotel and was kinda worried about my stay there! I stayed with my husband; we are a young couple who were looking to shop and sight see and go to a few swanky bars – what a lot of young couples are looking to do when visiting NYC! The lobby is massive and impressive in the hotel – but very short staffed had to que for around 45mins just to check in. We were advised before we went that the rooms above the 12th floor are renovated so the best thing to do is ask for any rooms above the 12th floor. We were lucky enough to get the 15th floor and it was fine, basic but fine, clean everything in working order (oh apart from a lamp! So we called reception and someone came up right away and turned the switch rather than flicking it ….. But at least they came to our room ASAP!) The hotel is in the perfect location and only about 3 shops away from Macy’s, right next to the subway and opposite Manhattan Gardens. In the best location I had no complaints on the hotel apart form the que to check in – other than that was fine!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever stayed in... AVOID!”
Reviews.Author: SiobhanMcD
Reviews.Content: We had originally booked to stay the Penn Hotel for 4 nights but had to leave after the 1st night. The room was tiny, out-dated and filthy. Bed was barely made. Staff were rude, slow and not very helpful. Although they did waive the $50 early check-out fee. The location was good, but it definitely didn't out-weigh all the negatives.

Reviews.Title: “location is the ONLY plus about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelmas67
Reviews.Content: being right across from penn station, the location is fantastic with access to subways and many landmarks within walking distance. however, the room itself was small, dirty, no fitted sheet on the bed, no working heat and with a constant drip from the shower. as i was traveling by myself and only staying for a few nights, location was more important to me than "niceties"...so, this hotel fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: “awful!”
Reviews.Author: nikki073
Reviews.Content: The location was the only good thing about this hotel. I found it to be way overpriced and understaffed. My room had a terrible musty, damp smell, the roof was covered in mould. I could hear every single sound coming from the surrounding rooms. The room didn't even have basic facilities, only an iron, no fridge or even a coffee maker. So what you are paying for then I have no idea! It took over an hour and a half to check in and the staff at the front desk were so miserable. I would never ever stay there again and would highly advise other travellers to think twice before they do to.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: norwegiandawn
Reviews.Content: The only thing that this hotel has going for it is its location. My wife and I stayed there at the beginning of October prior to joining a cruise ship. The staff at reception were sullen and not at all friendly, our room was a poky little place with filthy windows and it seemed as though it had not had a proper clean for some time. There were plastic ties lying on the floor when we arrived and they were still there when we left and the dust at the carpet edges and skirting boards was unbelieveable. Being Brit's with the stiff upper lip we thought at least the bed is clean so we'll put up with it for the two nights we had booked. We paid $686.00 for a two night stay which to me after the experience is an absolute rip-off. The hotel is run down, in need of total re-furbishment as do the staff and management. Some might say why did you not point out your misgivings but my opinion is that I should not have them to start with.

Reviews.Title: “Stinky, dirty pit”
Reviews.Author: bookluvver1082
Reviews.Content: Flat out, if someone told me that they couldn't find another hotel to stay in, I'd advise them to reschedule their trip. Seriously. It felt like a roach motel you see in the movies. I saw mold in the bathrooms and either the sink or the toilet was leaking. It is true that you don't spend that much time in the hotel, but when you get out of the shower you want to feel clean and it was impossible for me to feel clean in that room. I didn't want to walk barefoot or sit on the bedspread. The beautiful lobby and the pictures on the web site are really misleading. They really should charge by the hour.

Reviews.Title: “a complete dive..”
Reviews.Author: feduplivinginuk
Reviews.Content: We went to new york in 2005 and stayed in this hotel, and it is a complete [-] hole, i wouldnt even give a single star, it needs completely renovating,its 60 years out of date, the check desk was heaving it took about 1.5 hours to check in there is no help offered with bags except the doorman outside, i suppose it is quite well situated being opposite madison sq garden. the room was disgusting, it stunk of mould, i wouldnt let my dog sleep in it. to be honest new york was a bit of a let down in general, the only saving grace was the empire state building, which the veiw from the top is probaly worth the air fare alone.. I would definately not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: stickyricelondon
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as it was the only one I could find at a reasonable price ($299 per night) as all others I was looking at were around $400-$500 per night. We arrived at around 11am and had no problems checking in and were able to get to our room straight away which was on the 5th floor. However, the room was horrible. It just seemed old and dirty, with stained carpets and filthy walls. The bathroom was grotty and disgusting with peeling paint, and wasn't helped by the fact that it didn't appear to get cleaned the whole time we were there (4 nights). The only good thing was that we had a room at the end of a corridor and it was pretty big, especially for a NY hotel room, and there was a good view of the Empire State Building that we could just make out through the filthy windows. In fact, it was so bad that, although we had booked for 6 nights, we moved after 4 when we found a special deal at the Millennium Broadway for $199 for an upgraded room (this hotel was lovely and we had an amazing room on the 50th floor). I would never stay in the Penn Hotel again and I would never recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not a bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissTruthful
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a fantastic 5 night break in NYC and loved every second. We stayed at Hotel Penn. There was a small line at check in but we were promptly taken through to the Penn 5000 reception area to speed up our check in so it took no time at all. Our room was small and could do with a refurb but the bed was huge and comfortable and provided a much needed good night's sleep after a busy day touring the delightful city. Our bed and towels were changed every day. Our luggage was stored on the last day and we found the $4 fee reasonable and staff very friendly. The staff on the tour desk couldn't have been more helpful either. The location is fantastic. If you're not looking for 5 star furnishings and just looking for somewhere to put your head down I'd recommend this hotel. At the end of the day it's New York City - how much time are you really going to spend in your hotel??!!

Reviews.Title: “Filthy dirty, wouldn't let my dog stay there”
Reviews.Author: eabhagrace
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here while in NY on a shopping trip. It was booked before we read the reviews obviously ! We were both very nervous having read the reviews and were expecting the worst, but believe it or not, there was worse to come. After 30 minutes waiting to check in with the receptionist who thought we were from Iran or Iraq instead of Ireland although we're both blonde ! She thought it was great that our husbands let us go away on our own ! After check in, we went up in the lift to our room and Oh My God ! It was absolutely disgusting. First of all, I got two electric shocks from the light switch in the bathroom !!!! The room was filthy dirty. The walls were crumbling, the carpet was filthy and the first thing we did was check the beds for animals, I called reception and told the receptionist about the electric shocks and that we wanted to be moved immediately. She sent up a lovely lady who goes around the hotel writing out incident reports (enough said). She took down the details of the electric shock and said she would have a porter come up to move us to a new room. After another 30 minutes, a knock came to the door. I opened the door and a male porter arrived in and his words, which I quote " So whats the problem, ladies, bedbugs, cockroaches or mice" !!!!!!!!! My sister went into shock, I think. I asked him if bedbugs etc were common in the hotel and he said they don't have a problem with mice, rats as they have exterminators in every month. However, the bedbugs can be a problem !! He brought us to a new room which to be honest wasn't much better, a little cleaner maybe. This room was tiny but we had paid for the hotel and they were not willing to give refunds. The porter checked the beds for bedbugs without us asking him to do it. Apparently, when you book into this hotel, you are obliged not to complain. This disclaimer was signed at the travel agent where the trip was booked but I was not aware of this at the time. We stayed at the hotel for four nights and I have to say it completely ruined our break. This hotel is like a dungeon and I cannot stress enough how dirty, disgusting and smelly it is. My advice would be to never, ever, ever, stay here. The Affinia next door is a lovely hotel and not much more expensive. I have attached photographs in the event anyone thinks I'm overreacting. I've travelled quite a lot in Asia, the US and Europe over the past ten years and I can honestly say that this is without a shadow of a doubt the worst hotel I have ever had to misfortune to stay in. BTW, this is the first hotel review I have ever submitted. BE WARNED !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I've Stayed in - NYC”
Reviews.Author: TexasNYCMom
Reviews.Content: We have traveled to NYC numerous times and unfortunately the hotels we normally book were not available. We settled on the Hotel Pennsylvania, which sadly we came to discover upong check-in was filthy, had broken fixtures and lights in the rooms and halls, torn and stained carpets, disgusting bathrooms, old broken-down beds, stiff cheap linens and the type of clientele that screams, sings, and runs up and down the halls all night. It took a hour to check in due to the line and their poor staffing. They refused to honor our booking preferences because we booked through Expedia. The staff is rude beyond belief. I would rather sleep on a park bench or in the subway than repeat this experience.

Reviews.Title: “horrible”
Reviews.Author: Gems151
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is the location which is excellent. Otherwise the desk staff were ineffiecient, the clerk could barely speak English. The other staff were surly and rude, especially those at the tour desk, needless to say we didn;t use those facitlities. The room was small and cramped, okay it is an old building, but the fixtures and fittings were broken and the room dirty, there was even mould growing in the refrigerator. The linen and towels were worn out, and had holes in them. The ice machines didn't work. There was no directory of hotel facitlites, or local attractions. In short an hotel to avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: mdh311
Reviews.Content: This is without doubt, one of the most over-priced, terrible hotels in New York City. It is badly in need of a renovation, or at least a thorough cleaning. The service is surly, the front desk under-staffed, the food overpriced and terrible. And, the "Penn 5000" VIP floor, for which you pay a premium price, is ridiculous. The free continental breakfast consisted of a few pieces of fruit, some muffins and bagels and coffee, served within a sparse room they call their VIP Lounge. I will never stay here again, and I highly recommend that you avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Horriable”
Reviews.Author: Englishdahlia
Reviews.Content: The Foyer must have once been very grand but whilst it was clean it was unwelcoming, the receptionist could not find our reservation, eventually she registered us and must have given us the worst room in the Hotel, when the lift door opened and we saw the old sad corridor that went on and on we hoped the room would be better, what a shock when we opened the Room Door, the room was small, old, and grubby, dirty thin nasty carpet, uncomfortable old bed the bathroom was clean but old and falling a part the window had an almighty drought coming through the frame, it was Christmas and the Hotel was full We used our shoes and coats to fill the gap between the thin curtains and the window sill, after 2 nights of the drought, cold and noisy, dry AC I became ill, after 5 days in bed my partner joined me in bed with a sore thought that became worst when the AC was running, we were so ill we both ended up in the worst Hospital on the planet St Vincent’s the Doctors were marvellous and gave us all the care we needed, The doctor said I had bronchitis and I should not smoke I have never smoked, my partner had laryngitis and never smoked. What a night mere.

Reviews.Title: “The kind of hotel you would stay in to off yourself-NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: jinxed72
Reviews.Content: This was the most disgusting hotel I have ever stayed in, it was $495 for a night, the furnishings were worn and filthy, it had awful moldy drapes, there was no bathroom fan so it was unbelievable humid and the ac didn't work, there was also mysterious [--] floating up from the sink that didn't drain properly and the whole bathroom flooded with water while I was taking a shower. The pillows were as flat as a piece of paper and the bedspread disgusting and filthy, the chair in the room looked like a dirty garage sale reject, carpet and walls were dirty and scuffed. It was outrageous and I wouldn't suggest anyone stay there ever.

Reviews.Title: “Location Great But Thats All”
Reviews.Author: YORK22
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay at this hotel for the location but had our reservations due to so many bad reports. But hey we thought we would give it a go. Walked into the hotel and thought wow great lobby cant be that bad. After what seemed forever checking in even though there were not too many people waiting we were handed our key and off we went to our den. Well what can I say I know New York hotel rooms are small but this was extreme the double bed would only have catered for my hubby on his own. The worst was to come everything in this room was run down rust in the bathroom and plug sockets we even spotted a mouse trap under the heater. We asked for our room to be changed which they did reluctantly not thinking there was anything wrong with the room we had. The room we were given was bigger with twin beds but still as run down and in desperate need of repair. This hotel could really do with a good refit and with its location would be great! Hey get it sorted out and would get travellers returning. We certainly wont :(

Reviews.Title: “Cockroach Central!”
Reviews.Author: MaryHen
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I chose the hotel for the location. That was the only good thing about it. Our room, a twin on the second floor had filthy stinking carpets, a TV that didn't work, bathroom shelf that was sloping so much nothing could be put on it, a filthy cracked bath and was barely big enough to swing a cat in! A cat would have been ideal though as when I woke up at 3 a.m i was greeted by a cockroach on the bedside table, 2 on the wall, one in my slippers and one in my bed..................................! I complained rather loudly in the lobby to the night manager who I told I had photographic evidence. It pays to complain as he moved us straight away to a huge room on the 4th floor. No more wildlife was found.....!

Reviews.Title: “the worst and dirtiest room i ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: fionacoakley
Reviews.Content: the room was filthy dead bugs on the floor lighting not working air con was rusted to death and ratteled loudly when it was turned on carpet in room was stained all over cigerate burns on bed clothes the bathroom was also filthy we would of been better off on a bench in central park we asked to be moved room and they moved us to an exactly the same room just no bugs visable any way thank god we only stayed their for three nights .it was our first time in NYC and it ruinned our first 3 days . and it wasnt all that cheap either stayed in another hotel for the remainder of the week paid the same money and it was a real palace ,park central hotel . Just really happy that we stayed in the shabby dump first . i would not even class this hotel as a one star and will never ever recommend it to any one, i was appalled at the standard dont let the internet pictures of rooms fool you, they are nothing like the reality that you will be sleeping in.if they spent more money in the rooms instead of the main lobby they would benifit more ........

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay.”
Reviews.Author: Renatamsg
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay. Simple rooms, old furniture, no room service. But the location is more than excelent to get to know NYC. Don't expect the best service ever... Acctually it is a huge hotel, with many people from all over the world, getting in and out all the time. So the attendants aren't that helpfull. But - again - the location is just the best if you're going to NYC for the first time. Many stores around, as well as subways lines really close.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: pamelaEngland
Reviews.Content: Was a bit apprehensive about staying at this hotel after reading the reviews on this website but the hotel was clean and the bedding and towels were changed every day. The rooms were a bit dark but at least we could not hear the traffic of a night so we got a good nights sleep. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: Lydia-o
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a brilliant location. On arrival it appears pretty decent. The rooms are more like those i have experienced in hostels rather than that of a hotel. That said we paid £90/$160 for 4 nights - i think they miscalculated, but I would have begrudged paying anymore. If you like no frills and just need a bed then stay here. Although, it may have just been me, but the sheets on the bed caused extreme amounts on static and i continually got static shocks from things, so bring your own sheet! I would not recommend against staying here, but there are better quality hostels in New York, for the same cost if not less in just as good an area of the city. It is a place i would recommend to friends but not my parents.

Reviews.Title: “Take a chance despite the reviews”
Reviews.Author: Ali76_8
Reviews.Content: I must admit I was wary of this hotel after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. Thankfully all the bad things other people had written did not happen to us. I stayed at the hotel for 6 nights early September 08. Location of the hotel was excellent - train station right across the road plus subways nearby too. Yes it took a bit of time to check in - there probably could've been more staff on the long reception but for a hotel with 1500+ rooms what do you expect? Our room was on the 12th floor. Location of the room meant it wasn't overlooking the main street and was therefore quiet enough. Bed was extremely comfortable. The decor in the room was dated but it was clean. Bed sheets and towels were changed daily - compliments to housekeeping. Other facilities within the hotel were internet access, coffee shop, luggage room and a gift shop. Maybe we just got lucky with our room but based on my experience I would stay here again and would recommend it. Fridge however was noisy but I just pulled it out at the plug!

Reviews.Title: “I would not even give this 2stars”
Reviews.Author: Poppy28
Reviews.Content: The room was pretty dire - very shabby furnishings, several large damp patches on the walls that were a bit mouldy and the paint was flaking off. On the second night I noticed 2 cockroaches in the bathroom and plugged the gap between the door and floor with a towel. On the final morning before 6am we were awoken by incessant banging (they were refurbishing rooms on the floor below), despite several complaints to reception the banging continued. All in all I would stay here again but only because I would hope to be in a refurbed room,its central and is cheap for what you get relative to other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Bare Necessities”
Reviews.Author: DuckyAugusta_GA
Reviews.Content: I made the mistake of visiting NY on Memorial Day weekend--yikes! From the check in at the hotel to the Empire State Building, the lines were ridiculous! You would've thought we didn't have a reservation it took an 1 1/2 hours to check in. Don't expect much more than a bed and a bathroom, the rooms are the smallest I've ever seen. Its a really old hotel and needs a lot of work, but it was only 2 nights and we were only in the room about 6 hours each night due to sight-seeing. The hallways were dimly lit, I didn't really feel safe. I think the guy in working in the luggage room was pocketing the luggage fees, he didn't even give us a receipt. The location was great but I would not stay here again, I would rather pay more.

Reviews.Title: “Location only good thing about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: harrassedmum
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was excellent, easy walking to a lot of sights and right across from Penn Station to go anywhere else. The room wasnt particularly clean, a couple of things on the carpet nexver moved in the 4 nights we were there, the shower dripped the whole time we were there, I mentionned it twice but it wasnt fixed, the noise kept us awake at night as did the exceptional noise from the street(we were on 10th floor),it needs double glazing. There was hardly storage space for our belongings and the room was very small for 2 people.The worst thing was when they charged us 4 dollars per case to leave our luggage for 2 hours, beware!

Reviews.Title: “It is not that bad”
Reviews.Author: usafareren
Reviews.Content: I was going to the hotel with a bad feeling because of all the bad things that are writing on this site.But I believe it all comes to what kind of expertation you have before if you think it is bad.Yes there was some things that didn't work, and yes it was not clean, but show my one person at the hotel that wasen't helpfull.I stayed there for 7 nights and everybody was so nice, smiling and helpfull. But mayby I have show more respect, and therefor got more respect back.So you can easily book the hotel if you can accept that the standard are too 2 star and no more. Kind regards Dorte from Denmark

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: TimetoRead
Reviews.Content: My son and I came to NYC to see the Yanks and wanted a place near Penn Station for 1 night We had stayed at the Affinia just two blocks away earlier in the Spring and wanted to go back there but they were sold out so we booked Hotel Pennsylvania. I will never go back. In the 1st room we were given the bathroom light kept flickering. They said they could fix it. I said we wanted another room. They switched us to a smaller room but at least the bathroom light worked. When my son pulled down the covers, he found a piece of plastic and a hair on the sheets. At that late hour, we didn't want to switch again (and what would we get) so we made the best of it. It was just one night. But in the room there was: no Bible, no pad of paper, no pen, no washcloths and no way we'll ever be there again. The only positive was that the 19th floor gym was okay - carpet reminded me of what my grandmother had 40 years ago but a good selection of equipment. The final kicker - they charged to hold my bags for the day. The Affinia had done it for free. That will be my first choice next time.

Reviews.Title: “need of an update, but clean”
Reviews.Author: bornadventurer
Reviews.Content: we have just got back from new york and we stayed in the pennsylvania. I was a bit worried after reading all the reviews , most of them not good. however we did enjoy our stay there,not because the hotel was luxurious but because of the great location .It was a few minutes from macys, the empire state building was just around the corner ,10 mins from times square and all the theatres,everything was within walking distance .The hotel is quite dated and shabby in places but although the room was a bit dark and old fashioned, the beds were clean and our bathroom had been updated with new toilet,basin and shower also newly tiled.It was not somewhere we had planned to spend alot of time in anyway so it served its purpose for us.The view from our window was a bit depressing though ,we were just facing other windows in the hotel and with the building being quite high (17 storeys ,I think.) we couldnt tell what sort of day it was outside as it always looked a bit dull and dark ( even though it was glorious sunshine) .I kept the curtains shut all the time ! The maids came in every day and changed the towels , which were lovely and white and made the beds , the check in was fast and efficient , overall our stay there was good but if you are looking for luxury this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Best for location”
Reviews.Author: crunchynut
Reviews.Content: The rooms are at the same standard as a british B & B ( The british will understand this.) Yes they could do with being done up but if your on a four or five day trip you're never in the room. The room was clean and warm with a good shower - what more could you want. If you're going to spend a lot of time in the room then this may not be for you. Where it is you can't fault the location, its perfect. Would use again as to us it was just a bed for the night, we was too busy to stay in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Our worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: paperclipflop
Reviews.Content: One and a quarter hours just to be checked in. The first night's rooms were on the 5th floor and were awful! After compaining we were moved to the 10th floor, at 11:30pm we supervised the cleaning of our own room!

Reviews.Title: “Price didn't match the room”
Reviews.Author: nelmedina
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel out of desperation. The rate was $280 for just one night. I waited in line to check in for about 20 minutes, while I waited I visited the restrooms in the lower lobby of the hotel. This was the first sign of a really old, poorly maintained hotel. The hotel has the common Art Deco-ish Manhattan design. When I got to the room I realized that this hotel must have been renovated many, many decades ago. The bathroom tile was covered in mold, the bathtub didn't drain. The carpet was filthy. Even the toilet paper was cheap, come on, it's toilet paper. Beds were OK. Don't expect a courteous staff, I've received better hospitality at a Travelodge next to I-75 in Lake City, Florida at 3am. Although, the people at the luggage storage room ($4 per bag) were somewhat courteous. If the owner's of this hotel were willing to spend a few dollars, renovating this hotel, it has the potential to become a hotel destination in Manhattan. It has a great location: across the street from Madison Square Garden, around the corner from Macy's, blocks away from the Empire State Building and Fifth Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Easily the worst Hotel I ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: FirstPrince
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed at Hotel Penn on August 16, 2008 and vowed never to stay there again. We checked in at 2P but we were late for a seminar and so didn't check the room out before we left. We came back that night and realized that the bathroom had old fittings and stuff. We were too tired to go down and complain plus we were leaving in a few hours. When we woke up in the morning we really saw the mess. Dusty table, dirty and stained windows, broken walls, broken tiles and decaying walls in the bathroom, messy bath-tub. We refused to take a shower and checked out as fast as we can. At the front desk we complained to the personnel and they just shrugged. One actually laughed when I mentioned that that will be the last time we stay there. It has a great location, in the middle of NYC and all, but avoid it if at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Hit or miss, avoid if you can”
Reviews.Author: chrystie83
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice now, once in April 2006 and again in May 2007. The first time around was fine. The room was great, very clean, no problems. The second year was a terrible. I requested a non-smoking/non-mold/non-fragrence room. The first one had a smoker, the 2nd one they went around and sprayed fragrence to cover the smoke smell, the 3rd one had mold all over the bathroom. Since I was in a group, i didn't make them move again and the hotel kept telling me they didn't have any other rooms, but i was miserable the whole trip from the amount of allergy medicine i had to take and the lack of showering since a few minutes in the bathroom would cause my throat to swell shut. I paid cash for the baggage check as agreed when booking the trip and they still charged the credit card for it even though i was told i HAD to pay cash to check the bags when i went to check the bags, so we were charged double for that. The staff was rude and thought i was the one being stupid for wanting to change out of a room i couldn't breathe in. My original clean room was given away to someone who was paying a little more. on my check in sheet, my original room was the one i stayed in on my first trip, and then they crossed it off and put me in the crap rooms. The location is amazing, but it really is a hit or miss hotel. It may be great, it may be awful. Book with caution.

Reviews.Title: “not the best but was ok”
Reviews.Author: nycluvr
Reviews.Content: After looking at hotel prices in NYC, the Pennsylannia had a decent price for the location. I was told in advance to reserve a renovated room . Once I got there, Maria at the front desk was really freindly and was able to answer all of my questions.She gave us a room on the 14th floor. The hallway had brand new carpets and lovely artwork on the walls. Our room was decent. It was a little dingy but I had a view of Madison Square gardens and it was clean. The bathroom could have been better. I had a hard time taking a shower the peron who installed the shower head must have been 5 feet tall because i had to bend my knees and crouch my head down to feel the spray (I am 5' 10). We were hardley in the room - and only used it to sleep. I slept good and had no problems. Its an old hotel but the location could not have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Lucky move by the maintenance guy!”
Reviews.Author: scotschic83
Reviews.Content: Myself and my sister arrived on the 30th July for a weeks stay at The Pennsylvania. We arrived at about 1pm and saw a notice at reception saying you couldn't check in till 3pm - not great after a 7 hr flight but we decided to play dumb and head to check-in anyways. Thankfully they had a room ready for us on the 7th floor and off we went. Oh actually, this was after we were told that we would need to be leaving credit card details and $75 per night of stay would be held on the card until departure! Maybe our travel agents should have been the one's to mention this but we refused and I don't think the lady behind the desk was surprised or it was the first time she had come accross this as she quickly said she would take $100 cash instead and we would get that back on departure provided we didn't use the phone etc. The doors to the rooms are unusual (look a bit like cell doors!). Anyway got to our room and were less than pleased with it - room was small, bed had no head board, room really did look dull and even though we were kind of expecting it after reading reviews on here - the thought of this being where we would come back to chill after busy days in the city was quite a downer. We were only in the room 10 mins when maintenance were knocking at the door - we were being vacated from the room (they needed to knock down a wall or something?!). So we headed back to reception where we had already been allocated another room by the time we got down. 15th floor this time and going by a review I read on here, the rooms above the 12th floor (i think) had been renovated, so we were quite intrigued. To our delight it was a slightly larger room, brighter - with a fresh coat of paint, new carpet also I think. Bathroom was fresher and you'd actually feel clean leaving it (unlike the last), the shower was amazing (high pressure), there was a hairdryer also. So it turned out good in the end!! You really can't fault this hotel for location - Its across the road from Penn Station which is great for getting up and down the city. We didn't need to get 1 taxi while we were there. A short walk from Time Square also.

Reviews.Title: “What A Dump”
Reviews.Author: fpd818
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a dump. Talk about a bait and switch. The rooms look nothing like the pictures on their website. Our first room was filthy and smelled god awful. We complained and were given another room on the 5 th floor. This room was better, but still left a whole lot to be desired. The entire floor smelled like feces. The hallways are dark, dingy, and have plaster falling off the walls. Our friends stayed on the 10 th floor and experienced the same. Also, they fail to tell you that if you book with a debit card, they charge an extra $75 a day for any damage. They claim they will refund it, but that remains to be seen. Do yourself a favor and find somewhere else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with standards”
Reviews.Author: fercoll
Reviews.Content: Hotel looks very good on it's own website and is reported to be one of the top hotels in New York for high standards. After staying at this hotel for 4 nights I would certainly not recommend it at it's present condition. The arrival was totally inadequate and on arrival from a 8 hour flight it took us 35 minutes to check in waiting in a long queue with only 2 staff serving but another 3 walking around behind the reception not assisting. No assistance offered with cases. The room was only what I can say is in a time warp and I expected al Capone to come out of the wardrobe! The shower area was disgraceful and general hygiene was poor. The windows were that filthy you could not see out of them and blocked light from entering room. We asked for extra pillows and it took 2 days after recontacting room service. The toilets in the receptoin area shouldnot have been left opened to anybody they were a health hazzard, the smell was unbelievable we did report it but nothing ever got done. I appreciate this hotel gets busy but it's no excuse to treat clients like cattle or infact it could have been a remake of the immigration centre on Ellis Island the way people were handled. The only good thing about it was the location was ideal for midtown but not for a ggod accomodation experience. This Hotel need serious attention but I doubt it would ever be affordable to refurbish however it does'nt cost musc for good customer service. We have been to New York several times and I would recommend to anyone if it's budget then use budget hotels they will be more pleasing than 4* hotels especially Penn Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dull & Dinghy”
Reviews.Author: Doreen8
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews I was more than interested to stay at this hotel. It was as bad as everyone had written. We arrived at 11.00 p.m. and still had to wait 15 mins to check in. The receptionists were unhelpful, we had sent 3 emails requesting twin beds and never got a reply until after we had arrived there. They only had a room with a double bed, which was really small. The corridor to the room was dull and dinghy and we approached the room with intrepidation. It was all in dark brown and off white. There was a large hole near the air conditioning unit. The bathrom was small with just a shower. The sheets and towels were clean and changed each day. As we were on the back, we thought it would be quiet. It was until 5.00 a.m. when 4 very large air conditioning outlets on the roof of the building next door came to life. It was like trying to sleep next to a jet engine. They said that they would be taking 75$ per night from our credit card, for incidentals and if we didn't have any it would be credited back to our account in about a weeks time. What incidentals. The phone didn't work and there wasn't a mini bar or fridge. Actually they didn't take anything. On checking out we asked if we could put our cases into the luggage room. Yes, but at a cost, 4$ a case. The hotel is situated very central and you could walk to Times Square etc.
