Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: phillyguy2580
Reviews.Content: Overpriced and completely not worth the trouble. I had to stay for one night in NYC. Check -in took about 20 minutes. The attendant was very rude to my travel partner and I. As we were talking, she decided to interject herself into our conversation. The room was very small. The comforter had burn marks. The bathroom was dirty. When we called for extra towels, they never came. After being told my check-out time was at 1PM, we were rudely called in the morning and asked when we were leaving. I would never recommend this place to anyone. If you have to stay someone for one night and/or longer, look for some other place. Not worth the money I spent. I have stayed at roadside motels that were cleaner, nicer, and with a friendlier staff. I feel sorry for anyone who stays more than one night as their vacation.

Reviews.Title: “was I in a submarine...there are cute doors to the rooms in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: GeorgioDublin
Reviews.Content: After arriving form Dublin and enduring a long delay at airport to see a long queue at reception desk in hotel was almost the last straw. No that was left to the unsmiling desk staff , has anyone ever heard of customer service in this hotel . No fridge in room and when I requested one I was told that would be fine provided I paid 20 dollars , another near arguement and they relented I got my fridge which was really great as the air conditionong was like behaving like an orchestra. Do not buy a ticket from the tourist desk within this hotel , we were charged 145 dollars for a 72 dollar seat for Mama Mia show on Broadway. The cleaning staff are lovely and do a good job on the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Worse than Expected--and Don't Use Valet Parking”
Reviews.Author: charlotteRochester
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel and then read the reviews online....mistake....but we figured "well how bad can it be?" As others wrote, waited at least 45 minutes in line to check in. Our room seemed small ("superior" room) and was very dark--bathroom seemed relatively clean, but shower was missing part of knob, and some wood was missing/rotted. Shower head is only 5 feet high, so if you are tall--difficult to shower. Mold or something similar to it in room caused allergic reaction by second night. Room was not very well dusted, especially things higher than eye level. We used the valet parking and discovered that their "$40/day" rate does not mean "24 hours"--it means that once parked you cannot take it out without paying another $40, even if you take your car out after only 2 hours AND, their "day" starts at 12:01 a.m. so even if you are only there for 2 nights, you will get charged for 3 days of parking. We were given mis-information about all of this by the bellhop desk, and their web site does not say they have a "no ion and out policy"--you are just supposed to figure this out--and you will, once you get your bill!!! Front desk manager--horrible! They do not care about customer satisfaction at all!

Reviews.Title: “The worst nightmare”
Reviews.Author: RoxyN
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my husband and our 3 year old daughter. We are frequent guests to NYC and since this hotel is in the short distance to all attractions we always booked it. However, last time we stayed in, we were robed by a maid. Nasty [--] took $4000 US from my purse when we were enjoying Christmas concert in Radio City. When we came back to the hotel after the concert I noticed that the room was cleaned second time, so I decided to check all my purses and suitcases. At that time I discovered that money were stolen. When I ran downstairs to complain the security guy did not even care, I was advised to wait till the morning. We had to call the cops but they said to forget about our money. Next day a manager on a duty told us that it happens very frequently here and we are not the first one being robed. I could not stop but wonder did I come to the third world country? Unfortunately that was a day when NYC lost its glamor in my eyes. So, if you are looking for a cheap deal do not come to this hotel. It doesn`t worth it. I could be reached by e-mail at: oxana142003@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Give it a chance”
Reviews.Author: Sarjo08
Reviews.Content: It was our first visit to USA. On arriving at the hotel the queue to book in was long and took a while but we were shocked by the standard of the room. It was old fashioned but clean but I was upset at the thought of staying 7 nights in the room. I talked to a manager who listened to my concerns and moved us to another room which was slightly larger. From there on our stay was fine, our room was cleaned 6 out of 7 days. The staff were always more than helpful and the location of the hotel is great for sightseeing, being in the hub of the activity. Overall if you are looking for a clean place (not modern) to stay convenient to everything it was fine. Be aware of the long queues at reception if you have any queries - phone guest services instead. Tour desk operators were fantastic and most helpful. Luggage Dept. were more than helpful. Overall we got what we paid for and we would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Not all that bad!”
Reviews.Author: jessIreland22
Reviews.Content: I don't know why everybody is saying this hotel is so bad, it isn't! I stayed here with my boyfriend in November 2007 for 6 nights & our experience was nothing to complain about. We arrived at the hotel about 7pm and we were not queing for check in at all, Check in was over in about 5 minutes. First impressions of the hotel were "wow". Lobby looks fantastic but is a very busy area. We were given a room on the sixth floor and in all honesty it was a bit of a let down, I'm not complaing I'm just telling it how it is. The room is dull & upon arrival we were greeted with a very weird smell but after opening the open and leaving it open while we went out for dinner the smell was soon gone. It smelt a bit like dettol to me. (it could have been worse I suppose) the room was small but again nothing to complain about, it was clean & quiet & that's all that matters. We didn't have a great view (we could see the store old navy) but who cares about the view when you're in NYC & who wants to stay in the bedroom when you have the whole city to see! People have said in other reviews that they paid $8 for luggage storage---- so! I don't remember paying this fee but if we had to I wouldn't have minded. At least the facility is there for you. There was no bell boy for us to tip as we were well able to access the storage area ourselves, it's not that hard to find, just follow the signs. No there are not safety deposit boxes in the bedrooms but they are in another area just off the lobby. This room to us was perfect for the use of a safety deposit box, it was private & safe. No complaints about it. I wouldn't recommend eating in the hotel at all. The cafe/restaurant which is to your right when entering the hotel is over priced & the service in the Irish bar/restaurant is terrible. There are plenty of places to eat in the city so go explore. We were just being lazy by eating in the hotel I think. The location of the hotel is fantastic which everybody knows by now as every review says so. All in all The Pennsylvania is an ok hotel to stay in. It's nothing special but it's perfect for somewhere to crash at night. If you're not satisifed with your room upon arrival just ask for another one. I would recommend this hotel if you are on a budget which my boyfriend & I were!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing - as long as you're not expecting luxury”
Reviews.Author: lewlewlondon
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the hotel for 5 nights during our first visit to NYC. I was expecting the worst after reading these reviews but was pleasantly surprised. From the airport, we arrived into Penn Station. The Hotel is literally across the road so it was perfect. The queue for the check-in was bizarrely slow-moving (about 45 mins) however I had contacted the hotel before arriving to ask them to provide a reference number for our booking and so our check-in process lasted about 5 mins. The reception area is not what you will be used to cosmetically but you will only ever be passing though! During the check-in, I politely asked the man behind the desk if he could put us in one of the more "recently refurbished rooms." He went away to check whether we could be "upgraded" and came back saying that he was putting us in a nice room with a view of the Empire State Building. At this point, I was still expecting the worst... The elevators are amazing - very old fashioned and I found this charming. Again the decor in the corridors isn't great and the carpet is a weird green colour but it's quite amusing to think that in its day this would have been considered pure luxury! Our room was clean and tidy and had enough space for our belongings. It had a wide-screen TV and a very nice shower/toilet. Remember to bring your own shower gel/shampoo/toothpaste as this was not provided. Our room was cleaned everyday along with clean towels. And right enough, we had a wonderful view of the Empire State Building - we could see it from about halfway up, all the way to the top! I screamed when I saw the view! We never used the heating/air con and it did look very old and dusty. The hotel is 5 min walk to Macy's and a 10 min walk to the Empire State Building (this means you can get up early to avoid the queues!) We basically walked everywhere (e.g. it probably takes 20-30 mins to walk to Central Park). I get the impression that it's an old hotel that has seen it's day but since the rooms are there, they might as well sell them to tourists. It is the epitome of "room-only" but it's great! We had an amazing time and would definitley stay there again the next time we visit NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Get a room above 12th floor!”
Reviews.Author: Rachdan
Reviews.Content: Got put into a room on the 6th floor and it was an awful rabbit hutch. Remembered that I read about this ages ago so asked for a room change (standard practice in the US?). Got put on the 13th and the room was much better. Someone said that if you are above the 12th floor the rooms are OK but below they are dire. Room was cleaned daily and sheets and towels replaced daily. Dont expect luxury here but for the money it is more than OK. The location is spot on. Stayed here 4 times (on a high floor) and would go again for the money. Yes, you will queue for ever at the check-in so be prepared. Booked on Octopustravel.com and got it for £450 for 4 nights! For the middle of NY, this is excellant. Outside hotel, Maddison Sq Gardens. Turn right, Macey's. Look right, Empire State Blg. Look down, subway. Buy a week long ticket for all in travel on tubes and buses. Well worth the money

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: Sez86
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Pennsylvania for 10 nights in June this year. I was very worried before we arrived, from reading the reviews on here! but my fears subsided when we checked in at around 8pm (quite late do to our flight) and there were no queues and the lady was funny and accommodating. It also could have helped that our friend who lives in NY was with us. The staff were friendly to us, as were we to them, which helped a lot. Our room was spacious, clean and comfortable and we were happy with that. We knew it wouldn't be a luxurious 5 star hotel, but for what we needed it was perfect - a place to crash at the end of a long day! and the location was fantastic. It was our first time in NY (and overseas) so everything was right on our doorstep which was great. Going to NY again I would probably stay in a quieter area, but I would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “ok, not more”
Reviews.Author: Dutchgirl999
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Penn for 3 nights. The location is great, the rooms are below basic meaning basic amenities are there (like private bathroom) but they are of such poor quality no hotel could offer this to its guests. We had large gaps in the bath for example. We booked this hotel because we thought we wouldn't be there much. But we underestimated the fact that after a long day of walking it is nice to have a place to rest. We paid Eur 170 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Grim”
Reviews.Author: travelgirlkk
Reviews.Content: Budget is the best way to describe this hotel. You get what you pay for. Arrived after a long flight and had to queue 30 minutes to check in. Our Hotel bedroom was stinking of cigarette smoke. It was so bad it would catch in your throat. Room was dark, small and grim. Bathroom was desperate. Our wash hand basin was loose, and there was a pubic hair in our bathtub. I asked for another room and was informed there were none available as it was thanksgiving weekend...... having said all that my friend was staying in a room a couple of floors above me and it was like it was in a different hotel. Large room, fresh decor and they even had bathrobes, guess we were just unlucky. Hotel interior asides the location was excellent, directly opposite MSG, five minutes from Macys. I definately wouldnt stay again. Happy to pay more for a better standard of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rip off dirty hotel”
Reviews.Author: AD76
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on 12th June 2008 and really wished I hadn't bothered, especially as it cost me £150/nearly US$300! We waited 40mins just to check in. There is a serious lack of staff. The room was filthy and smelt of smoke even though it was a non-smoking room. The bathroom was so old and had paint peeling off the ceiling above the shower. My financee and I didn't use the shower, it was cleaner not to wash. Lighting in the rooms is very poor and the ac is so old and noisy. Location is the only good thing about this hotel as it's right opposite Madison Square Gardens, Macy's and the Empire States. I'm glad that I only stayed here for 1 night. At £150 a night it's a rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Clean with no bedbugs.”
Reviews.Author: Whoyouare
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Penn Hotel from June 23-26, 2008. Once we saw where it was located, i realized why the old building that should've been torn down is still standing. It's literally right across the road from MSG, right next to the Empire State Building and just a few steps away from Time Square. The bathroom was very small but clean. I had read reviews on here about there being a problem with bedbugs so as soon as i walked in the room i lifted the bed clothes to scope out the mattress. I think i was so paranoid that there were bedbugs, i had myself convinced that one of the moles on my arm was a bite! My advice is to do your homework on bedbugs before hand then look around in the room once you get there. The staff i encountered were all friendly and helpful. It's well worth the price for the location it's in!

Reviews.Title: “Location is the key to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikeandlynne
Reviews.Content: Like a few others we had a great sense of trepidation about the hotel from previous reviews read. The first thing to say is that the location is just outstanding. We travelled by train from Boston on a swelteringly hot day so to just come out of Penn Station and cross the road to the hotel was a God-send. The hotel has a rather grand entrance which probably gives a false feel to the rest of what you could expect. Check-in, though busy, was friendly and efficient. It's when you're getting to the rooms that the dated feel of the hotel hits you. The cleaning staff do their best to keep up given the size of the place. It's obvious that the owners aren't prepared to spend anything on updating it. We understand that there are proposals for demolition but the zoning laws might prohibit this and don't expect any radical overhaul. The room was sparse, generally clean but don't touch the curtains with a barge pole!, bed fairly comfortable and the air conditioning worked (thankfully given the heat). As we only had a 2 day stay the hotel was just about adequate for our needs i.e. a comfy enough bed and a bathroom. Pricewise it was expensive for what you got (we stayed in 4 and 3 star hotels in Boston, Philidelphia and Washington DC for less) but they get away with it as it's Manhattan and it's that location thing which will attract people in the first place. It's this that's the real sell, as the location for getting around Manhattan is outstanding (e.g. Penn Station 30 second jog, Times Square 5 mins, Empire State 2 mins, Macys 1 min). If you're wanting something a bit more upmarket then look elsewhere (we certainly will in future), but if it's location and just a place to crash then this will do it for you..

Reviews.Title: “good location, so-so hotel”
Reviews.Author: Janichic
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Pennsylvania for 3 nights for a conference in NYC. The location was great for the ease of transportation options but less great for noise, particularly on saturday night. I waited an hour to check in, but the staff were friendly and courteous. I enjoyed the vintage bathroom but the older beds and decor were a little depressing.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the savings”
Reviews.Author: drpete9
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not worth the savings. Yes, you can save some money here relative to some of the other hotels in the same neighborhood, but you are risking wasting an enormous amount of time when you check in. We stayed in June of 2008 and arrived at 1pm in the afternoon. There are 1700 rooms and not nearly enough front desk clerks to accommodate that type of volume. After waiting on the queue for about fifteen minutes, we were told that the room wasn't ready and to return after 3pm. Fair enough, but it costs us $8 to store our bags in the lower storage area of the hotel and of course we had to tip the bellman who took us there (you can't access it on your own). We returned to check in around 4:15 pm and found a huge line of about 60 people trying to check in with three clerks at the front desk trying to accommodate. Having dinner reservations, we could not wait on the line for an hour, so we went downstairs to our stored luggage and changed in the bathroom! Later that night we returned at 11:30pm and still had to wait on a half hour line to check in. Our complaints fell on deaf ears and the room was less than mediocre and certainly not worth the wait and inconvenience. I do no t recommend this hotel unless you do not value your time.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Jamsieboi
Reviews.Content: As mentioned before i read the reviews online and feared the worst but i really couldnt have asked for anymore especially on a budget. On arrival at the hotel we experienced the much noted hotel que's which did appear rather long but we made our way through it in about 10 minutes which is unusual but not a particular burden. upon check in we where asked for a credit card which had not been mentioned before, but this is standard practice in most larger hotels so didnt really bother me. This charge is meant to be $75 dollars per night which they hold on your credit card but with a bit of negotiation i got it to $75 dollars for the whole week. We where given a room on the eighth floor which had a strong smell of smoke in, which to a non smoker was unacceptable but the room itself looked clean enough and apart from the smell would have been fine. Back down to the lobby and there was still large que's at check in so i just went into the penn 5000 club reception and they dealt with the matter very quickly with no issues regarding a change. I was even told if there was no other room available they would upgrade me, sadly there was but i was happy enough. The next room was on the 14th floor which was undergoing upgrade work but it didnt affect my stay at all. The room again was clean, smoke free and comfortable to stay in. Best of all outside the window was a perfect close up view of the empire state building, can't get that everywhere!! Back to the hotel in general it was clean, tidy and the staff where always polite and accomidating. Location wise it couldnt have been better 2 minutes takes you to Macys and a 10 minute walk your at times square. You are also located on top of the subway where you can go from outside the hotel to ground zero or battery park without much of a walk. Also Penn station is directly accross the road under madison square gardens taking you pretty much anywhere you want to go accross the states. Only downside was the lack of facilities in the hotel such as eating or bars which you might not think much of a problem in new york but when there are thunder and lightning storms outside you dont really fancy walking much. Other than that i probably wouldnt have eaten in the hotel anyway All in all i was very impressed with the hotel and would definiettly stay there again, You might not always get the right room first time but with 1700 rooms your bound to get one that suits you. My only concern is with the upgrade work going on next time i go this hotel might be out of my price range as it really is a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “A very good enough hotel!”
Reviews.Author: aitjetravel
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from New York. We stayed at this hotel and i must say i hadnot slept in the days before arrival, because of the bad reviews on the internet. The moment we arrived we looked at this hotel en saw the huge lobby! But no lines. So we were lucky. However we were early to check-in. It was just 14.00. Check-in is at 15.00. Bus still, we just waited in line en when is was our turn, we just asked if it was possible to check in right now. And guess what, we could if there was a room availible. And how lucky, there was a room availible. But there was 1 but, we had only cash and no credit card. Our travel agent forgot to tell us... (we are from the Netherlands and cash is never a problem). But in the end we could arrange a smaller cash amout for check-in (it was 500 dollars, but the could make it 300 dollars). Anyway the room wasnot that big, but is was clean, the bed and bathroom were clean and we got clean towels everyday. And hey in New York for this price of an hotel, we had a very good enough hotel! Finally i want to say that if you are looking for more comfort of luxery or more personal staff, than you should consider a 4 of 5 star hotel. There is 1 thing that we found funny, every day de lobby changed in a more complete hotel. When we arrived there werenot couches, but during our stay there were placed couches, lamps, tables, the walls had an other colour etc. Anyway, we didnot sleep much because we just were outside in New York City!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location BUT.......”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterChris
Reviews.Content: This hotel is huge with thousands of rooms.Upon arrival you enter a large busy lobby and an equally large queue.(The lobby is never not busy and has the atmostphere of a train station).When we arrived not only was the hotel full but it was overbooked.Some staff behind the desk are freindly and helpful but others lack even basic training and are nothing but rude... so be prepared!!!Check in can turn out to be a challenging experience.The staff have heard all the complaints before and are used to them.Three managers and 24hours later our group managed to aquire three rooms that were acceptable.It is essential that a superior room is booked as the standard rooms are very basic , dark , small and tatty.The corridors in the hotel are large, featureless and very dark.Not helped by the dark carpets. The bedroom doors are 'interesting' and you would you think someone painted them blindfolded. Even the superior rooms are in need of renovation as the decor is old and tired.The lights in the rooms are no better than candle power and we had to remove the lamp shades so we could see.The bathrooms have not changed since the day the hotel was built .On the postive side the hotel is in a great location as everything is nearby.The beds ( to my suprise) were comfortable.No sign of the bedbugs... I did check before accepting the room!!!! Clean sheets/towels arrived every day and the room was serviced to a reasonable standard.The coffee in the small deli downstairs was excellent.According to one of the managers the hotel was purchased for the value of the land and therefore as little money will be spent on it as possible.This is certainly very obvious and is such a shame.I wouldn't stay here again even it was free but New York was so great!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Risk”
Reviews.Author: tgolin
Reviews.Content: Me, my mother and my grandmother stayed here for 3 nights. We weren't attacked at night, didn't see any rodents and found the fixtures in the room bearable. That being said, I can only describe this hotel as depressing. The room gave a very unpleasant vibe, had poor lighting and was just not a nice place to come back to after a busy day. If you are considering staying here you are probably reading through the 1500 reviews for this hotel and seeing some raving praises next to horror stories. It would be stupid of me to say something similar to what I see in many reviews such as "don't believe the bad reviews!" or "It is the worst hotel in the world". Clearly a hotel of this size (1700 rooms) simply has good, OK and horrible rooms and I believe that some people have had a wonderful experience there. If you look at the average rating though, you will see that clearly many were not happy...question is, are you are willing to take the risk? Personally, I would rather pay 50$ more and not risk another similar or worse experience to what I have had in this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing wrong with the Pennsylvania”
Reviews.Author: Shortie22
Reviews.Content: This is the 4th time I have stayed at this hotel and have never had any problems. This time we had a room on the 14th floor with a view of the Empire State Building. This room was not as nice or as big as some of the other rooms we have had, but the view made up for it. This is not the best hotel you will stay in, but it is far from being the worst. We were checked it by a lovely chap called Yen (Jen?) we requested a room high up and he managed to find us one. He was ever so nice and polite, check in did seem to be a bit long winded, seeing as most people have already booked and pre-paid on-line. When we got to the room it had just been cleaned and although the decor and the furniture was a little worn and tired there was nothing essentially wrong with the room. We wanted a couple of extra pillows and as the cleaners were in the corridor we went and asked them if they were able to get us a couple and they brought them to us about 10 minutes later. The location of the hotel is fab, easy to reach everywhere. We got the airtrain to and from JFK which arrives into Penn Station directly opposite the Pennsylvania, much easier and quicker than getting a cab if there is only 2 of you (usd 10 per person) I enjoyed my stay at the Penn, and have no qualms at all about returning for a 5th stay.

Reviews.Title: “Agreed, what a stinking filthy hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KristinCarlson
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, this was a business trip where the client booked this hotel for us and we had no choice of leaving. There were inches on dust and grime on the large fake "chandeliers" and plastic flowers centered in the lobby area, grime all over the floor, dirt, smears, and broken glass in the lobby mirrors, homeless people somewhat loitering in the indoor payphone area (hidden from the front desk by a partition, but still part of the hotel lobby. near a long, scary looking hallway with another door to the street. front desk made me use a payphone instead of agreeing to call my husband on the front desk phone to make sure I was a legitimate guest, as we arrived on separate flights). The elevator was extremely dirty and rickety; hallways were dark, darkly carpeted, dirty. Room and bathroom you can imagine. They were no better. Stuffy, stale, itchy/stained bedding, rust and dirt stained ceiling tiles and bathroom appliances and fixtures, etc, etc. "Window" of an airshaft looking at a brick wall less than 12 inches away and a lot of pigeons, pigeon excrement, feathers, and debris built up in between. Plus, I believe they wanted an extra $15 per day to access the in-room internet. A very bad stay, unfriendly staff, unsettling atmosphere. We used to live in New York City for many years, and this is definitely not the way to experience the city. Nor is it ay cheaper than much better, cleaner hotels. As to the payphone experience, I also have to say the phones were disgustingly filmy, slimy, and grimy. My cell phone was dead and I was exhausted after a long flight alone from the west coast. I had to pay for the phone call to my husband's room upstairs on my credit card as I had no change on me, just bills. Which the front desk also would not change for me after refusing to call the room. I have never been treated so rudely at a hotel before and never been denied having them call up to a room to ask a guest if I can enter. That was just the icing on the cake compared to the state of the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “What a stinking filthy horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: emmajanedublin
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fantastic trip to New York during our stay we had booked 2 nights in the Pennysylvania Hotel we arrived and waited ages to book in. We had booked 2 rooms and they sent us up to the 14th floor when we got of the lift the corridor was very dark and quiet scary the doors to the rooms were like something from a horror movie. The rooms were filthy the carpet was dark brown and looked as if it had a life of it's own.Next there was a knock and the door and there was a man with an exterminator kit strapped to his back he wanted to spray the room. We picked up our bags and left. When we complained they offered us 2 different rooms these were not as bad but we counld not stay so we returned to New Jersey to the lovely hotel we had stayed in for our first 3 nights

Reviews.Title: “filthy dump”
Reviews.Author: chelseagirl2
Reviews.Content: Anyone contemplating this hotel - please spend a few extra dollars and go anywhere but here! Strong rumour that it is soon to be demolished and I can see why - it is horrible once you get past the elevators! I even tried all the tricks suggested by many fellow travellers to get upgraded (being nice to the checkin clerk, asking for a nice room, the birthday - it really was my birthday!) and if that worked I would hate to see what I would have got if I hadn't asked! The room was so dark and dirty that I was sorry I had decided to stay an extra night. When I complained at reception all I was told was that they were full and couldn't help! As i had prepaid through 1800-hotels I could not leave. Pleas take my advice and do not stay here.................ever!!!!

Reviews.Title: “this hotel was excellent”
Reviews.Author: ginaLiverpoolEngland
Reviews.Content: i have just returned from here from a 5 day stay at this hotel, and found it excellent for location, the staff was very helpful and friendly, our room was spotless the bed linen was crisp and clean, and changed each morning, and the towels were replaced daily, our maid was more than polite and helpful, our room was very clean and comfortable, and the bed was very comfortable also, i would highly recommend this hotel to any visitor to newyork, i am planning another trip soon, and would be more than happy to stay at this hotel again, so don't take any notice of some of the bad reveiws on this hotel, i think some people are just good at complainning about nothing! gina and jade from liverpool

Reviews.Title: “Great location and clean room”
Reviews.Author: sol1612
Reviews.Content: I payed a really good price to stay in this hotel. The room is small but clean, and not smelly like other hotels from the same price range. Just the staff is very rude, even the manager, her name is cintia and she is more than rude. i had a problem with one package that arrived from the mail and I had to talk with her. She was not helpful and treated me very bad!!!!!!!! So, I recomend that you stay in this hotel, but I hope you don't have to speak with the manager.... You are just one more guest in the middle of 3000 guests.....

Reviews.Title: “Good for a lds trip”
Reviews.Author: rhyd78
Reviews.Content: A very basic hotel with an excellent central location in mid-town NY directly opposite MSG and around a 100 yards from Times Square. The hotel was basic with the room just about habitable, remember to tip the chamber maid with a dollar each and they make a little more effort to keep it presentable. Good for a holiday with a bunch of mates when you're not around the hotel much but avoid if you're looking for a romantic/family trip.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: MaudGlasgow
Reviews.Content: I had such a laugh when I read the reviews for this hotel before my trip I felt I had to add my own review! The room was perfectly adequate. Above expectation - cleaned, new towels, hot showers etc every day. We were quite cold but extra blankets were delivered to the room in 15 minutes. Also asked for extra pillows which we got immediately. The room faced towards 7th Ave, still we had no trouble sleeping. The location is amazing. After having travelled across the atlantic and in to NY on the train, it was bliss to see the hotel just across the road when I came out of Penn Station. There are also so many sights on walking distance from this hotel. One word of warning - don't use the telephone in the room (I know, we should have known better!!). The rates are extortionate.

Reviews.Title: “Love the location!”
Reviews.Author: smlgrl
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in NY twice now, and this is the better hotel compared to my last trip. Pros 1. Nice sized room - for New York! 2. Great location! Only 2 blocks from Times Square or a quick subway ride down. 3. Subway entrance right at the foot of hotel 4. There is air conditioning! That works! 5. Always a good price Cons 1. The hotel seems to be constantly renovating 2. You do have to walk a bit to get to Times Square. But if you don't mind it's not a far walk and the subway really is easy to take.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible dirty rooms, surly unpleasant staff - avoid like the plague!”
Reviews.Author: Gutan
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through an "American holiday specialist" local travel agency. Although the travel agent herself admitted she had never stayed there (I assume they were getting a good profit margin from booking customers here). She said, and I quote "The hotel's not important as it's not as if you're going to be spending much time there", those words came back to haunt me during the whole miserable time I spent at the Penn. We arrived after a long tiring trip from UK and had to wait in a long line for over 30 minutes to check-in. When we finally got to our room it was filthy and the room literally stank of cigarette smoke. I was shocked at the state of the bathroom which was filthy too. We'd booked and asked at check-in for a non-smoking room and this clearly wasn't non-smoking. We went downstairs to reception and queued up again for another 20 mins to get another room. This was as bad as the first plus the bath taps were running constantly (not a drip but actually running) and the toilet seat was snapped in half and unusable. But it did have a fridge (more on this later) To be honest with the tiredness and stress I sat on the stained bed cover and cried tears of frustration and disbelief. I finally gee'd myself up and went downstairs again for yet another wait this time of about 15 minutes and requested yet another room. I spotted some other people actually noisly demanding a refund on their booking and leaving the hotel to stay elsewhere. I was planning to do that myself if the 3rd room was no good. The 3rd room was acceptable (just about) and at my GF's suggestion as we still had the keys to the 2nd room, we manhandled the fridge to the 3rd room. The Asian lady tourist in the lift looked surprised as we shuffled into the lift with the fridge and she said "I take towels, but never a fridge!". We stayed 3 nights and our room window faced a brickwall and overlooked an area where the garbage dumpsters were kept. The room was warmish (March in NY is cool in the evenings) and ok but very small, the fridge was useful as the hotel doesn't do food. The fixtures and fittings were tired and worn out or broken. The carpets were threadbare and filthy. The location is good but to be honest it's not worth it, stay elsewhere. This hotel really spoilt our holiday in New York, we dreaded returning to it at the end of the day. Next time I'd spend a lot more and get somewhere nice. After NY we got a hire car and drove East to the Pocono's and stayed at a bog standard HoJo, in comparison it was the height of luxury and utter bliss, so much so we stayed an extra night. Needless to say the "expert" travel agent hadn't booked that hotel for us... Finally regarding the Penn, "just say NO!" PS I hope that in the 5 years since I was there that it has had millions of dollars spent on it in a complete rejunvenation and is now wonderful - somehow I think that's unlikely.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: travelyun
Reviews.Content: We've seen all the bad reviews, but this is the cheapest hotel through our travel agent so we decided to give it a go. We arrived at 3am in the morning. Took about 10-15 minutes to check in, which wasn't too bad. Hotel room was on the 10th floor. You could tell the whole building is undergoing some kind of major renovation. Room itself was not too bad- decent size, clean, headboard didn't seem to be dirty, wall paper wasn't peeling. The room was probably not in a very "cozy" state, but certainly wasn't bad. Bathroom was basic and well used. Shower was not very easy to use - the direction of "hot" water was confusing. In the end it turned out you need to put the dial to "cold" water to get hot water. But it certainly got hot then, and pressure was fine. Noise from downstairs was a bit loud, but given the hotel's location which was right on 7th avenue, opposite Penn Station, this is understandable. Location was great - the Penn Station is a subway station. 2 minutes walk from the lobby and you get to Macy's, their massive department store. Don't think I would want to go back to this hotel, but if it's for a 2-3 days stay, it's actually ok - but only if you could get a good price for it! (we paid about 220USD per night)

Reviews.Title: “alot better than expected”
Reviews.Author: pcbunter
Reviews.Content: it was alot better than we expected! after reading poor reviews of it we were happy with pretty much the whole hotel. the location is excellent and the rooms were fine. worth a visit

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Penn”
Reviews.Author: Triphappy08
Reviews.Content: We had a hard time even getting accomodation in NY as every place we chose was unavailable, or the price jumped up severely. Our travel agent kept telling us to take the Penn but as we had read a few bad reviews we were hesitant. SO, yes the lines for check-in were huge and could take upto 40 minutes to be served but fortunately travelling with a toddler we were given some special treatment so we didn't have to wait (thankfully as we had been in transit for 20 hours). The room was adequate and the bathroom clean. We were right on seventh avenue on the second floor so very noisy but we wouldnt have it any other way. Word of warning don't make phone calls from the hotel room it cost us US$146 for a 20-minute phonecall to Australia! All in all it was central, clean and affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bas as it's made out to be”
Reviews.Author: scottcabal
Reviews.Content: I think a lot of the reviews of this hotel are based on other NY hotels, or on unreasonable expectations of the city from the glamour they've seen in guidebooks, tv shows etc. It's not the best hotel ever but it's far from being the worst I've encountered. We were pleased with our stay, especially for the price we paid - much lower than all the other hotels in a similar location. Firstly the location. You really can't fault the location of this hotel. It is above a subway station which takes you to Times Square and Central Park, one block from a subway station with direct transfer to the JFK AirTrain, opposite Pennsylvania Station, opposite Madison Square Garden, opposite a taxi rank, 2 blocks from the Empire State Building, one block from the New York - New Jersey PATH train, one block from Macy's, one block from the main post office, has a mall behind it and it literally has everything NY has to offer on the doorstep. Check in was a little slow. We waited five minutes to be told there weren't any rooms available with our specification (2 beds etc) for another hour or so. This wasn't a problem as we were early anyway so we took our luggage to the baggage room in the basement. The basement could do with some serious refurbishment but the entire hotel is currently being refurbished and I doubt a largely unused basement is top of their list of priorities. A piece of advice though - make sure you have some 1 dollar bills with you at all times. When we collected our bags we didn't have any small bills as we had just arrived in the country and the staff in the luggage room were quite rude to us for not leaving a tip. All we had were $20 and $50 bills though which we weren't leaving. This was an isolated incident though - most staff were friendly and helpful. We then proceeded to check in, with a 10 minute or so queue to get to the front desk. We had one of the rooms that hadn't been refurbished yet. The paint on the ceiling was chipped in a few places and the window was stiff to open but these were the only real problems - no horror stories that people have mentioned in other reviews. The hotel wasn't busy so we probably could have asked to be moved to a refurbished room but we were tired and I really couldnt be bothered. The room was clean enough, big enough and generally good enough for our needs - we were in NY so how long were we honestly going to spend in the room? There is a snack bar in the hotel which serves drinks, ice cream, coffee, breakfasts to go, danishes etc and we used it quite a lot. The food was nice considering they probably buy it in bulk. There is a restaurant behind the hotel with direct access from the hotel lobby but this was closed for refurbishment. It looked really nice though so I wish we had been there when it was open. For anybody, like my friend, who can't go 24 hours without checking facebook or e-mailing your family next to the snack bar there is a business suite with probably 8 computers, a printer and fax machine. It wasn't that expensive to connect to the internet so I checked my e-mail and directions to things a couple of times when there. It was occasionally full but I never had to wait more than 5 minutes for a computer to be available. One thing I did really like though in addition to the location - along with your swipe cards for your room they give you a little popup map with all the sights, subway connections etc in. It doubles as a place to store your key and we used it quite a lot. I'd probably recommend not using it to store your key as if you use it a lot you'll end up losing the key but it's a nice little map. Overall I would say this is a good hotel for the price you pay. It is literally half the price of other hotels in the same area or with the same location compared to transportation so it was never going to be a luxurious, world-class hotel I will remember forever. However I didn't mind staying there. It would most likely have been better in one of the refurbished rooms so if you don't like the room you're in then just ask to be moved - I've seen reports on here of people doing that, and the hotel has 1700 rooms so they're never without spare rooms. Overall I'd say there are definitely better hotels in NY. However we were on a strict budget and had quite picky requirements (we needed 2 separate beds and private facilities) so for what we paid, in the location it was, the hotel probably couldnt have been better. I'd recommend it to others on a budget but if you want a world-class hotel and don't mind paying extra then there are LOTS of hotels in New York so have a look around. As I've said in reviews of other hotels I think it just depends on your standards and how fussy a traveller you are. This is an acceptable hotel in this price range so I don't see what the fuss is about. Yes I am a seasoned traveller and have stayed in some really bad places, and camped at places with no facilities in Africa but this is nowhere near being the worst place I have encountered. I'm usually on a strict budget when I travel (well... more like keep the price as low as possible while keeping the hotel within acceptable limits) and will consider this hotel again. I'll look around for other places if I go to New York again but this hotel will be on my list of possibilities.

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: Honeyjj
Reviews.Content: Looks nice from the outside and in the lobby but our room was pretty awful, but then again its only 2 star. Had damp places and wall paper hanging off, crooked pictures. View of a brick wall. However it is an excellent location-opposite Madison square gardens and an easy walk to Times square. We found a couple of the staff quite rude aswell. We would be kept waiting for AGES just to get to our safe behind reception as there are none in the rooms. Probably wouldnt stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Glen Miller wouldn't be happy”
Reviews.Author: Manchester2Manhattan
Reviews.Content: This place is stuck in a time warp, the management clearly believe the place is number one in NY and in fact some of the rooms don't appear to have been cleaned since Glen Miller's era. The reception was consistently undermanned and the staff were by and large rude, perhaps there's a link there? A couple found the rooms were unacceptably dirty (i.e. much more than the rest) and immediately complained and were 'rehoused'. We were in a party of 16, one of the party booked in only to find the room was double booked and there was someone in the bed. A couple of us were thrown out of the rooms at a moments notice as they wanted to decorate the hallways. One person came back to his room to find all his luggage had been removed, when he enquired why he was told it was because he should have checked out! When the receptionist agreed he had one more night left he was directed to the luggage room where he found his belongings in a black bag. He was left to take the things back to the (same) room on his own! Get a grip Penn!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but.....”
Reviews.Author: philip861
Reviews.Content: Myself and my girlfriend stayed at the Hotel Pennsylvania in July 2007 for seven nights on our first visit to New York. It must be remembered that with this hotel you get what you pay for. It is one of the cheapest hotels in New York, which is an expensive city. Similarly, hotel rooms in the city are generally small by international standards, no matter what class of hotel you stay in. If you are on a budget- as we were- you can't beat the Pennsylvania for location. Having said that, the hotel itself is of a very poor standard. I believe the Pennsylvania was built in the 1920s, and I would be very suprised if it has been re-decorated since. The main (perhaps only) thing this place has going for it is its location. It is in the heart of Manhattan, right beside Madison Square Garden and Penn Station (which is connected to three subway lines- excellent for sight-seeing), five minutes from Macys, and ten from Times Square. So for the tourist going to the Big Apple for the first time, the Pennsylvania's central location is a huge plus. As for the hotel itself, the standard is pretty low. I would go so far as to say it is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. Firstly, when we arrived we spent 45 minutes in the line to check in. When we got to the top of the line, the lady who was supposed to check us in had just realised she made a mistake with the previous customer. She left us standing for approximately 30 minutes while she attempted to rectify her mistake. When she finally got back to us she insisted we pay for the entire stay up front. Finally, an hour and a half after we arrived at the hotel, we were given our key and went to our room. The room itself was small, but as it was New York- and clearly a budget hotel- I expected that. The walls were in bad need of re-painting, and the toilet facilities were also very basic. When we returned later that day I recieved a phone call from reception. It was the lady who checked us in. According to her, she had mis-counted the money we gave her at check in, and we had left her fifty dollars short. This only added to my feeling of frustration with the check in process. Throughout my stay I found the hotel staff quite disinterested in their work. Also, with so many people in the line to check in (no matter what time of the day or night) the lobby of the hotel was more reminiscent of a train station that a place of residence. So in summary, if you book the Pennsylvania you will know it is one of the cheapest places around. Therefore it is unreasonable to expect a top-drawer facility, and this hotel certainly does not fall into that category. In conclusion, given the (relatively) cheap rates and fantastic location, it is probably worth putting up with the Pennsylvania's faults. Just.

Reviews.Title: “No Poblems”
Reviews.Author: CumbriaSaint
Reviews.Content: Having read alot of reviews of this hotel, i must admit i was more than a little concerned.I had no need to worry. Within 5 minuets we had been checked in by a very helpful lady (it does help if you are friendly and polite to the staff). Our room although only standard had a spacious lounge, a large bedroom and a good clean bathroom.Yes the furnishings are a little dated however everything was very clean (the cleaners did a great job for the five days we stayed). The location is fantastic within walking distance of many of the sights. I recomend the hop on hop off guided bus tour by the city sights company. For $80 each this included 72 hours bus travel, addmision to the top of the empire state building, a boat cruise on the Hudson river, a boat trip to ellis island and the statue of liberty and entry to the museum of New York history. Local breakfasts are great and i suggest Folleys Irish pub (across from the empire state) for a really good meal.All in all my wife and i had a fantastic time and had no problem with this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Dump, Dump, Dump”
Reviews.Author: clairel29
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay in this property and it is a dump. Had room on 4th floor, very dark and dingy, bathroom disgusting. Looked like it hadnt been cleaned for months. Check-in a joke too, had to wait 2 hrs for room to be ready and the had to queue for 30 minutes to check out. Good location but other than that no positives. Stuck in a time warp.

Reviews.Title: “don't listen to wha to read!!!!”
Reviews.Author: craigyyyyy
Reviews.Content: DO NOT LISTEN TO ANY BAD REVIEWS REVIEWS YOU HEAR ABOUT THIS HOTEL!! I was at this hotel only a few weeks ago and I was dreading it before I went. The day before i went (15/4/08) I read lots and lots of reviews from this hotel and none were positive! I expected the worst, people were saying it was like a prison and very unpleasant and dirty. I could not believe how wrong I was before gonig here. I'm an 18 year old and went with 3 other friends between 18-22, we all expect 100% hygiene and are very picky at where we stay. On arrival New York is out of this world its a dream place to be. The hotel reception was as luxorious asit appeared in the pictures, although it was filled with a school trip load of people which I dreaded as I thought it would be very noisy. After checking in I asked if it were possible to be upgraded and the staff member who could have smiled a little more did so at no more cost. My friends and I had a luxorious king size room each which was up to my stanards of cleanliness. Each room was cleaned every morning with fresh sheets and clean lining towels. Overall, my stay was very pleasant and this hotel is extremely excellent for location - 3 blocks from the Empire State Builiding, 1000 yards from Times Square, 1 block from Macy's department store and also literally across the road from Madison Square Gardens. This hotel had a great location and had very helpful staff in arranging trips, broadway shows etc. The only bad thing about this hotel was the fact that the staff didn't look happy at all but were relatively helpful. The corridors were slightly out-dated and the showers turned from ice cold - scolding hot - we never got a decent temperature and had to keep jumping in and out of the shower. Also the hotel views from our window on the 13th floor were limited to looking into another building across the road. I would deffinetely recommend this hotel to anyone afterall you are in New York you are only in the hotel to sleep anyway!!

Reviews.Title: “oom....how do i rate this? not great hotel but good location.”
Reviews.Author: BlaineandAimee
Reviews.Content: After reading comments on tripadvisor, we've decided to take a chance on this hotel... and most reviews on this website are actually quite true. We could not believe it when we checked in, the lobby looked so nice so we were hoping that the room might be ok despite the bad reviews about the room but it was really as bad as they say. We asked to changed the room but the next room really wasn't much better. the doors on the inside were falling off, the paint were peeling off. The room we ended up taking was a non smoking room and if you're not a smoker, you should request a non smoking room as it was a little bit better. The location is fantastic so I guess for the price you pay, you can't expect much. ( We didn't expect much but we were still horrified!) Anyway, if you are at all abit fussy or expect a normal room in good condition, i wouldn't recommend it but if you don't mind about the room and the fact that you may come across some mice, you'd be ok here. ( we had mice in our room) Even the more deluxe room really wans't much better but it was about $100 more per night. Good location but that's it.

Reviews.Title: “Ok - not as bad as some of the reviews make out!”
Reviews.Author: Katyg80
Reviews.Content: Before we stayed at the Hotel Pennsylvania - I read a million reviews. Quite a few were bad so we went to the hotel expecting the worst! Well.. I have to admit it really wasn't that bad. The Room Our room was on the 10th floor and it was a twin room with two double beds. The room was quite big although abit dark as only lamps no ceiling lights. We had a large TV, radio clock, mini fridge, iron and board. The shower was extremely powerful and always hot. The room was cleaned everyday and we had fresh clean towels and sheets. The Hotel The hotel corridors are abit crazy and do remind you are the film the shining..so if you have never watched the shining do not watch it before statying at this hotel!!!! The door to the room again is abit crazy and does look like a big metal prison door but does a door really make a differance to your stay?!! The lobby was quite big and always very busy. You are able to get a safe, which is free of charge and there is a little coffee shop and some gift shops and internet access. The Location The location was amazing! We were right next to Macys and a 5 min stroll to the Empire State building..10mins to Times Sqaure and right across from Penn staion so you can get to most places easily. The Negatives I will admit that there are some negatives. The staff were all extremely rude apart from the guys who looked after you luggage on departure! So dont go and expect many please or thank yous! The hotel has a diner called Lindys - DO NOT under any circumstances eat here. It was revolting. We had a breakfast for $24 which is very expensive for New York and we couldnt eat it, it was horrible. There are so many other eating places which are cheap and edible so please do not go to Lindys! It should be on Gordan Ramsay Kitchen Nightmares! Summary Overall are 5 night stay was fine. We didnt come away hating the place. If you want a cheap room, which is basic but clean then I would recommend the hotel. Just remember its a 2 star hotel, so dont come here if you want luxury. I think if you go with the right attitude that this will be somewhere to just rest your head after a long day sightseeing then you will be happy with your stay. Happy to be contacted if you have any questions..

Reviews.Title: “Great location but disappointing”
Reviews.Author: montx
Reviews.Content: Montse (34), Barcelona Location is the best the hotel has, apart from that, rooms (we were staying in the 17th floor) were very dark and dull. I forgot my favourite pyjamas under the pillow, and has never been found!! That added a black note in my holidays.

Reviews.Title: “This is a realistic review”
Reviews.Author: Helentherealist
Reviews.Content: Myself and 3 others were booked in here last week. The first night however there were only two in our party and then we were going to be joined by two other guests for the remaining 2 nights. This is not a bargain hotel. The first day I arrived at 1 o clock. We were told to wait until 3 o clock to check in. By that time the line was like something you would find at disneyland. For these two hours we were told we could store each bag for $4 per bag. Then finally after lining up for about 45 minutes we got our room. It was satisfactory. Next morning we were being joined by the other two in our party (and getting a large double room for the 4 of us) so this meant we had to check out in the morning and re checkin again at 3 o clock (the same story as previous day - long lines, 45 minutes wait again). Then we had to pay another $4 per bag fee to allow us to leave the hotel for the day and not waste more time. Most hotels would be fairly accomodating in a situation like this. NOT this one. Avoid this place like the plague unless you want to waste endless amounts of time on a short trip like I had. Im not a complainer and Im generally easily satisfied where accomodation is concerned and Ive never taken the time to write a review like this before as Ive never had good enough reason. But this place sucked. AVOID AVOID AVOID

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: frankiers
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the huge Penn Hotel for 1 night. Good room, good bathroom too. Not too much noise from the street in room 507. For NY pretty clean as well. Just the curtains were very worn down, but we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: CarolAnnBrynMawr
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel the night of April 28th because I was attending a conference at the hotel on the 29th. It was a mistake. The staff was very, very nice, but there were just too many problems. I stayed in room 1224A. First, my room key would not work. Security had to let me into my room. The staff tried twice to get the computer to make a key that worked, but to no avail. It finally got so late that I told them to forget it; I wasn't going out and I would just stay in my room until check out. The next problem was that the 7 AM wake up call I requested did not materialize. Since I woke up on time anyway it didn't matter, but obviously it could have been a problem. Finally, there was no shower head, just a piece of pipe sticking out of the wall. It looked like there used to be a shower head at some point. It made it hard to get a shower. This was no huge problem, but together with the lack of a functional key and the lack of a wake up call, it added up to a less than optimal experience. I saw no other business travelers in the hotel. I imagine the hotel is in European guidebooks as an inexpensive place to stay in NYC, which it was. I saw plenty of young Europeans. I saw no other Americans as guests. Of course, this is not a problem at all; as a matter of fact it was fun to be around the guests from other countries. It just was not what I was looking for as a business traveler. Still, it was clean enough. The staff was not very good at doing their jobs, but they were definitely very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Just so so..”
Reviews.Author: Noytronet
Reviews.Content: I don't know.. I saw the reviews after I booked the hotel, and it made me kind of nervous. They ranged from rating the hotel the most awful place in the world to a very good one. I end somewhere in the middle. At least compared to the price.. The hotel is incredibly old; it was built 1920, I believe. And I do suspect them for not not doing anything to it since then. But it was clean and the room was spacious. Funny thing was that the very friendly receptionist from Western Africa (I got to practice my French ;) ) upgraded my parents' and a friend's room to some sort of business suite. It meant they got an extra room with 2 single beds in. My room was exactly the same laid out with the extra room, but I had a leather couch instead of the beds. I think they give out free "upgrades" like extra towels and soap. But it was really the same to us, but it was strange it was not possible to book a room for 3 at hotels.com or their own website.. The rooms were not at all very homey/cosy and the heat could have been turned up a notch. But all in all it was quite alright and clean.. Though I doubt I will return since I have through looking found much better alternatives and I know the city next time. For better accommodation at cheaper prices, I would try Brooklyn by the bridge for example. It's not that far over..

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for, I guess...”
Reviews.Author: Susan18
Reviews.Content: Lobby is much grander than the rooms--but we expected that. The halls/rooms were a throwback to about 50 years ago -- this is a hotel desperately in need of renovation! That said, our two-bedded room was very large for New York, sheets were clean, and bathroom was reasonably clean with nice toiletries. A strange thing was that the TV was in an amoire that faced a wall with no furniture -- it couldn't be seen either from the bed or the sofa. Wonder who thought of this one! Another thing I wished I known about was the $4 a bag charge for leaving your bag (in a luggage room) if you arrive before your room is ready and want to go out. This made our bargain hotel somewhat less of a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Warning - Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: lynchdabreu
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 4 nights in this awful place. We'd chosen this hotel because of the location and the price but please don't be fooled. Yes, it is in a great location but that doesn't compensate for the terrible standards and rudeness of the staff! My partner suffers from asthma, which was made considerably worse by the poor ventilation and dusty rooms/bedding. The front desk gave us possibly the smallest room I have ever seen, certainly one of the smallest rooms in the hotel, but we didn't complain. When we got to the room and couldn't see out of the windows for dirt and grime, we didn't complain. When I opened a bath towel up to find brown dried stains on it, I didn't even complain then (although, I was getting close to it). However on check out when the "Manager" charged me $50 for 5 minute phone call (not international, i might add), which was to book our bus tickets out of town, I had enough and DID complain. The woman claiming to be the Manager was both rude and unhelpful. Although we never expected anything more to be honest there wasn't one redeeming factor about this place. Oh and by the way, the hotel bar "Joe O's" - couldn't put my finger on the smell of that place at the time but it was vile, only went in there for one after dinner drink. The Irish pub accross the road was much nicer and had an atmosphere. Needless to say, we will never return to this hotel again and will be warning friends and colleagues to stay away from here too.

Reviews.Title: “A glorified Youth Hostel”
Reviews.Author: dumelarra
Reviews.Content: Having flown from Barranquilla in Colombia where I had a beautiful suite with five rooms for less than USD200, this dive was a shock to the system. The lobby, which is huge, looks like an underground station with all sorts of undesirables hanging around. Check-in was quite efficient which was good as I didn't want to hang around there longer than I had to. Just before the lifts is a rope barrier and signs saying, 'No alcohol beyond this point'. Nice. The room was absolutely awful - dark, dingy, filthy carpets and bits of the wall crumbling on to the floor. Food in one of the restaurants was OK but no more than that, and vastly overpriced, even by UK standards. At most times of the day, the pillars in the lobby were surrounded by vast, noisy groups of schoolkids with backpacks on, reinforcing the feel of a station. The location is good - you step out of the front door and are in central Manhattan but the hotel itself? One of the worst I have stayed in. They should rename it the Pennsylvania Youth Hostel and charge $25 a night.

Reviews.Title: “a honeymoon over xmas with best location ever”
Reviews.Author: Fiona_Wood
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked Hotel Pennsylvania over exciteholidays.com. On a tight budget but wanting a comfortable two week stay of our 5 week US honeymoon we decided to take our chances against all that was recommended on trip advisor and book going by how nice it looked on the hotel website. Weary that some rooms were said to be quite old, but a few rooms were renovated, we contacted the hotel from Australia before we arrived to get an upgrade of room before we got there. When we arrived we had a stunning Penn 5000 room reserved for us at no extra cost and the staff we all so friendly. The location was the BEST! Just a min walk acorss the road to Macy's, Maccas downstairs, view of Empire State from our window, no loud hotel noise in the middle of the night, 8 lifts all working to get up and down fast and subway entries all round, this hotel in the heart of Midtown made our trip! Rooms were old but barable, VERY spacious, bathrooms clean always, however hot water ran out quite quickly. Heater worked a gem in the xmas cold and tv stations available were endless. Penn 5000 guests also enjoyed free use of computers in the guest lounge (all other guests had to purchase internet minutes in the internet cafe downstairs), the guest lounge had all day coffee, tea, juices, danishes and continental breakfast. Coffee shop in the hotel was a luxury when everything else was closed xmas nite! Definitely want to go back to this hotel again - supurb value for money!

Reviews.Title: “OK - but no better ...”
Reviews.Author: FamilyPross
Reviews.Content: Despite having read the previous reviews, and mentally preparing my wife that this dream trip to New York may not meet all her expectations, she still burst into tears when we entered the room. Lobby is spacious which is fortunate beacuse it was full of dogs for the duration of our stay (Dogs show across the Street at Madison Square Gardens). Check-In was painfully slow. A guest interrupted my checking in to advise the staff member that he was not prepared to stay in the room he had been allocated; staff member changed his booking, but then tried to book me into the room that the other guy had refused! The room we did get was not much better. Reasonable size but it was "grubby". Child's crayon all over the walls, damp patches, scuff marks, filthy carpet, and bathroom was not much better. Thankfully the bedding was spotlessly clean or else we would have checked in elsewhere. Location is great but there are other similarly priced hotels in the same locale. We spent so little time in the hotel room that the holiday was not ruined, but the reviews are accurate and honest -I'm only sorry I didn't check this site before booking with local agent. A lesson learned!

Reviews.Title: “Old Hotel that needs work”
Reviews.Author: Frank3473
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 days in the hotel. While the location and staff were excellent, this old hotel needs a great deal of work. The room was old and looked it. It needed a new paint job. To call the lighting poor is an understatement. It was almost non-existent. The carpeting was stained. The heating didn't work and when we called for service, we were told no heating is supplied if the temperature outside is greater than 52%. The hotel was crowded and obviously bringing in money. They just do not have a desire to spend it.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: helenehe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is huge and has a very well kept lobby which i think fools people into believing it is more grand than it actually is. However, when we arrived, the hotel hadnt received notice of our booking, this made me panic instantly. The lady at the desk made a few phone calls and we were given the keys to our room. No problem. We stayed on 15th floor, the views from the lobby were fantastic. The views from our room were of the couple in the room opposite. We decided to keep the curtains shut. The bathroom and bedroom were both really clean and tidy. They were basic but the linens were all clean and the water was hot. We litterally used the room to sleep and shower and that was it. The only complaint really was that the walls were quite thin and you can hear people comming up the hallway late at night. The location couldnt be faulted though and i thought i got value for my money. I had been very wary before i arrived as i had read the reviews for Pennsylvania but it was fine. On the same budget, i would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and most certianly NOT cheerful.”
Reviews.Author: Lizz_W
Reviews.Content: I travelled here with a group of 30. When we arrived the lobby looked like it belonged to a high star hotel, however the second we stepped out of the elevator our view of the hotel changed compleatly. The carpet was a disgusting brown and the wall were the most discusting shade of green I've ever seen. The rooms varied in size greatly, and unlike the website had said, had deffinatly not been refurbished recently. The bathroom was tiny, and the water took about 5 minutes to drain after having taken a shower. Everyone felt a bit uneasy about going to sleep in the hotel that night, and when the 7 of us in one room woke up the next morning we were willing to make the most of the hotel and enjoy our stay, untill five minutes later we see a cockroach crawling about our room. it scurried away and then two minutes later we got two more cockroaches running around. running under beds and next to our suitcases. the next morning we only had one cockroach scurrying around our room. The only plus about this hotel is its situation, it is opposite maddison square gardens, and only a few blocks away from 5th avenue, where all the good shops are, central park and times square, it is also only a two mnute walk away from macys! I honeslty would not reccomend this hotel to anyone. I'm positive there are nicer hotels for less that what we were charged nearby.

Reviews.Title: “wouldnt keep a dog in it”
Reviews.Author: gingerSouthShields
Reviews.Content: worst hotel ive ever seen filthy, stunk of damp, expected to sleep on camp beds, surly staff black mould in bathroom flaky plasterwork plug sockets coming away from walls someone tried to get into our room after been given key to our door by reception staff absolute nightmare reminded me of the hotel from 'the shining' but dirtier dont let the foyer fool you ...its a dump

Reviews.Title: “Absolute nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: stalkee
Reviews.Content: I wish I brought a sleeping bag, we both ended up covered in bed bug bites after staying at Hotel Penn for 7nights. It was a disgrace. We were scared walking down the hallways when we first arrived, and we were in the "renovated section"!!!! One night I got into bed to realise there was only half a ripped sheet on the bed, no wonder I was bitten thanks to the the dirty bug infested mattress! There was one lamp in the room - no ceiling lights! All New Yorkers we met thought we were crazy for booking such a terrible hotel - as it is known to locals! YUCK!! Value for money? Let's just say we stayed at the beautiful 5star Bellagio in Vegas for LESS.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Hotel but GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: pinkfairygirl13
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I visited the hotel in September 2007. We had decided to book this hotel due to the website and the photos on the site, all I can say is I don`t know where the photos were of but I guarantee it`s not where you will be sleeping !! My friend rang home and cried for at least 30 minutes!! The hotel is decorated in a dreadful Dark Green which does nothing to cheer up the out of date rooms. The corridors look like something out of the Munsters !! Our Heater and most worryingly our door lock did not work, the bathroom had seen better days and the enamel was coming off which turned your bath water a filthy brown colour. HOWEVER................. The location of the hotel was excellent. A couple of blocks from the Empire State Building, Macys, Times Square and opposite Madison Square Gardens. The staff were all very friendly and we had a good joke with the guys in the luggage room, they thought us 2 girls were very funny trying to fit all of our purchases into our cases! If you go not expecting much room wise you will be Ok, the location does soften the blow of the trauma of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful lobby pathetic rooms”
Reviews.Author: mrstdn
Reviews.Content: We thought the lobby was beautiful and thought the rooms would be the same-wrong! The rooms were not lit well. One of the beds sagged in the middle. The bathroom was not in very good condition the door frame was rotted at the bottom, wasn't horrible, but could have used a really good scrubbing. The sink leg was propped in a metal "cup".The worst part was the boys allowed to stay from a school group in the room beside us with no adult in the room to supervise them. They used a particular cuss word as an adjective every time they spoke. They were extremly loud, stayed up all night talking and banging and kept us awake the first night. The 2nd night security was called, and they did get a bit quieter. The 3rd night I called security again, and they called a chaperone to deal with the problems they were causing as well as the person that had screamed in the hallway at the top of their lungs and caused multiple doors to open. If someone from the hotel reads this please note; I think that the hotel should have required an adult in the rooms. The view from our room was of the other side of the hotel which was a u shaped alley with no view. The heat worked but the a/c did not, which meant that we could not use it to muffle some of the noise from the people next door. The window was supposed to open, but would not. There were people in a room several doors down that were next to some people that were with us, and they smoked so much (in a non smoking room, mind you) that it could be smelled in our travel companions own room. When they complained, nothing was done. The hotel had a lot of elevators, but only ran a few. With so many people staying there it seemed that they would have ran more of them to help crowd control. One plus-I did not see any bugs, mice, etc. I personally would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Go There !!”
Reviews.Author: Travel2travel2
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 4 nights at the Pennslyvania hotel New York - what a dump i have never been so disgusted with a hotel room in my life ! The sink was falling off the wall the whole place was a shambles and when i complained i was told the hotel was full and there was nothing they could do! The lobby is like a mart all day full of noisy students everywhere and the attitude there is the worst in the world Take my advice and check out the Affinity Manhattan which is 1 minute down the street and has been recommended to us Either way the Management at the Pennslyvania dont care and its so obvious once you step inside the door of the dive! Also beware !!! Do not buy your tickets for shows or other attractionns from the 2 grumps behind the concierge desk its a rip off go to the venue yourself. Wont be going back and couldnt possibly recommend this dump to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Penn”
Reviews.Author: SayuriMeg
Reviews.Content: Why no tea or coffee in the room?! Why the gigantic mahogany TV cabinet in the corner and the bizarre fridge in the middle of the room? Seriously though, we had a nice big room and an old fashioned but clean and functional bathroom. Plenty of Gilbert and Soames smellies and lots of fresh towels, but the sink had a leg missing (much hilarity discovering that drunk at 1am). The hotel has a Lindys on the ground floor - much recommended for their bacon and tomato bagel and their cheesecake and is in a great location - right opposite Penn Station.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Appalling”
Reviews.Author: OnieG
Reviews.Content: Right from the beginning, The Hotel Pennsylvania was a dissapointment. We reserved our booking 2 months in advance over the internet as we live in Australia. When we arrive (after an exhausting 13 hour flight from Tokyo) we're told they gave our non smoking king room to someone else because of our late arrival. Thanks to the "Shuttle Bus Ride from HELL" from the airport, we were late by less than 10 minutes. When we walked into our room, our Non Smoking Room REAKED of stale cigarette smoke, the "clean" towels were stained with some kind of yellow substance, and there were cigarette burns on my sheets. All I expect in any hotel room regardless of the price is a clean room with clean linen & they couldnt even get that right. Absolutely Appalling

Reviews.Title: “A matures couple from Finland, Europe”
Reviews.Author: Lipfert
Reviews.Content: Satisfactory! My wife and I stayed in Hotel Penn for one whole week on March. The loacation is excellent and everything is near. We managed even visit Washington within a day since Amtrak trains leave a couple of hundred meters from hotel door. The rooms are adequate and they we cleaned often. We didnt notice any kind of bugs or that kind of thing. The worst part in hotel is overworked reception where is constant 30 meter line in que. Since the safety deposit boxes are behind the same reception and are supposed to be taken care of in (non existing) spare time your mone will be perfectly safe in boxes from thieves and yourself. Unless you come to fetch your things 3 a clock at night. There was not much to be seen from hotel room window. In our case it was dirty tile wall 20 meters from our window. But the room itself was old fashioned but good and we enjoyed our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of increased price when checking in if not american resident!”
Reviews.Author: Nelly83
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 6 nights in March 08 and would not recommend this to anyone. After lining up for 20 minutes to check in the receptionist told us in broken English that the rate we had booked our hotel (through hotel-rates.com) was not applicable and our stay would cost us an additional $20/30 a night. This was despite us having a booking confirmation in front of us with the confirmed price.
