They tried to explain that an AAA (discount) rate was given to us on the website when booking and as we were not american residents and didnt have a AAA card that we couldnt qualify for the discount. This was despite the fact that our address and country of origin was asked for before booking and no warning was given to this potential increase. The receptionist dissapeared for a minute and returned with our new price scribbled on a piece of paper in pencil which made this feel very suspect. It was easter week and we had no choice but to pay it but we felt very duped. Apart from this the hair dryer in the room did not work and hotel bar was a complete dive. The lobby was like a train station with constant lines at reception and school tours everywhere you look. The only thing going for this hotel was its location nothing else.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: js11
Reviews.Content: Firstly the negatives:- The decorating was seriously in need of updating Plaster falling off the walls No plug in bathroom sink Bathroom door swollen too big to close The positives:- We had a fantastic view of the Empire State Building and the Chrysler Building from our window Clean sheets and towels every day Lots of hot water from a great power shower. Superkingsize bed No bugs, mice,cockoaches or other un-invited room guests (as noted by some other reviewers) We'd read some really awful reviews before going and almost changed hotels. Glad we didn't - it was basic but location makes up for it. We asked the receptionist - Sheila - for a room with a view and she was only too happy to oblige. Close to lots of the sights and we would also recommend Andrews for great breakfasts (turn right out of Hotel a couple of blocks up on the same side as Hotel) Don't go expecting too much from Hotel Pennsylvania and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Biscuit1983
Reviews.Content: Really clean and tidy. Nothing amazing but perfectly nice and good locationn

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs!!!”
Reviews.Author: wandacleo
Reviews.Content: The first room they put us in was filthy--with black mold all over the tile around the tub. THEN, they put us in another room and during the night I got HUNDREDS of bug bites from bedbugs. They have a whole routine in place for bugs--the exterminator told me he's at the hotel all the time because there's bedbugs everywhere--especially on the 14th floor. They can't get rid of them because they get into the wiring. I've had to throw away my suitcase and double wash my clothes in hot water and disinfectant and spray them down with alcohol and I'm terrified I've brought bugs home. Stay at this pit at your own peril.

Reviews.Title: “Not horrific like the reviews I've read”
Reviews.Author: cdursm
Reviews.Content: I was like the other travellers and read the awful reviews suspecting the worst when we arrived. We had a 40 minute wait to check in , they were abit slow but the check in people we spoke to were very helpful. The lobby was very busy , as it's a cheap hotel a lot of younger people stay there so it feels abit like a youth hostel. We never tried any of the places to eat in the hotel, they were expensively priced and there are plenty of places round about to eat. Our room was on the 15th floor, the walls were abit grubby (it was a smoking room) and the cleaning could have been better but it was fine to sleep in. I got my husband to check the bed for any bugs and I had no sight of any bugs or furry friends during our stay. We got extra pillows with no problem when we asked. Our tv worked fine but there was a limited selection of channels but for all the time we were in our room it was enough. Everytime my husband tried to use the tv internet facility it wouldn't work, it always said it was busy. There are plenty of internet access places around like in the nearby Burger King. When we checked out it was $4 for left luggage - this applies to big cases, if you have wee bags as well they don't charge for them and you are only charged this fee for the day not per hour like I thought I had read on someone else's review. The location is great, better than being at Time Square as you have access to Penn station across the road, great if you fly in to Newark and get the train and just walk across the road. You are close to Herald Square, Macy's and the Empire State and Time Square is a short walk. I could not fault this hotel for location. I would say the Hotel could have been cleaner but for a people ona budget it's only a place to lay your head. If you want somwhere snazzy definitely go else where like the W Hotel in Time Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Hotel nothing special but location made up for it.”
Reviews.Author: AnonBucks67
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 night stay at the Pennsylvania. The hotel is very old hence the rooms really need updating. The paint was peeling in the bathroom and bedroom. Furniture in the rooms really dated. The rooms were cleaned every day with fresh linen and towels, so I guess you can't ask for more. The location of this hotel is first class, right in the heart of everything. We eat one night at the restaurant attached to the hotel called Joe's BIG MISTAKE. It was awful and I mean awful $130 for two for 2 steaks and a bottle of wine (soapy wine). We sent the steaks back as we asked for them well done only for them to be served pink. The staff at this restaurant need to learn manners in customer service as I think most of them or in the wrong jobs. The best place to go for breakfast each morning is a cafe called Andrews it was top class and great value for money. It's only a block away and the staff are polite and food excellent. Other excellent places to eat are John's Pizza's at W44 and Broadway and Bello Italian restaurant on 863 9th Avenue corner of 56th St. Overall hotel great location but avoid restaurants in hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Kitten78
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay in this hotel and because of all the bad reviews we were a bit sceptical. The lobby looked great. There was a great deal of people in there when i arrived, but the check in was fast and smoooth. The staff was helpfull and friendly. We got a corner room on the 17 th floor. Big, spacious, clean. The main door into the room was in terrible condition, but working non the less. Tv with all the main stations, clean bathroom and a great, comfortable bed. This is an ok hotel, so don`t expect something special. But it was good enough. You don`t spend your time in the hotel when you are in New York, but it was a good place to spend the night. The location is top notch!! We only stayed here for 1 night, but it was good. So we will definetly stay here the next time we`r in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy but great location!”
Reviews.Author: vkerryb
Reviews.Content: An "interesting" hotel. If you are looking for a clean bed and central location then this is a good choice. If you are looking for sparkling freshly painted decor and all the mod cons in your room, then maybe look elsewhere. The hotel needs a total refurbishment cosmetically but the basics are there. Value for money wise this was great....right opposite Madison Square Garden and the underground station and about 10 minutes walk to the main bus terminal near Times Square, 5 minutes to Empire State Building and short walk to 5th Avenue shopping. Our room had 2 double beds and cost $180 for weekend nights and $150 for week nights. Alternative locations were closer to $300. The room had a TV, beds, iron and ironing board and a really powerful shower (although the bathroom was a little tired). If you are looking to impress a loved one then this isn't a good choice but if you are looking for a room to use as a base whilst you explore fabulous New York then this is a perfect option and gives you more money for shopping!!

Reviews.Title: “Too dirty for my dog!”
Reviews.Author: NewHampshireHoneyPot
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Hotel Penn for several years while attending the Westminster Dog Show. This year will be our last as the thrill of being in the middle of all of the action has worn off and no longer compensates for the dirty, run down rooms...even the "premium" rooms have issues... My dog found two old rat traps behind the heater which still had poison on them but had obviously been placed and somehow "sprung long ago. She also found a pen cap and some other small items under the bed...a bead and something else, can't remember. The final straw this year was the valet parking causing $2,000.00 worth of damage to my vehicle without acknoweledging it was their fault or trying to compensate us at all. My friends $800.00 Zoom Lens was also "lost" in Luggage Storage while she waited for her room. We will probably try the Affinia next year, but we are definitly DONE with the Hotel Penn. Oh, and those dirty yellow and green striped comfortors look like something they bought, and last washed, in the 1970's!

Reviews.Title: “Pinch of salt??”
Reviews.Author: Pat57chad
Reviews.Content: My son and his girlfriend booked this hotel in July last year. They asked my husband and I in February if we wanted to go with them. We agreed and they amended their booking with the travel agent. Imagine my horror when I read some of the reports on Trip Advisor, there were some real horror stories. Well, to put the record straight, we stayed on the 4th floor, (I had heard that the upper floors were better, but we were told we couldn't get rooms near each other on other floors). The room was small, windows were filthy outside, but we were at the back of the hotel, so there was nothing to see anyway. The bed was clean, the bathroom was clean. The bed was made and clean sheets and towels left everyday. TV worked fine, the lightbulbs could have been stronger as this contributed to a rather dark and dull feel about the room, which was old-fashioned, but hey, we wanted a place to sleep!! We were next block to Macy's, 10 minutes walk from Times Square, seconds from the subway, so what more could we want. I was pleasantly surprised with the location and really found that all my concerns were totally unfounded. I've certainly found worse places in Greece. If you are only looking for a base and don't want to pay a fortune, this hotel is fine!!

Reviews.Title: “What a DUMP!”
Reviews.Author: NorthChicagoCouple
Reviews.Content: I had to attend a conference in NYC and for the 1st time left arranging my hotel to a travel agency. This was easily the filthiest, most run-down, unsafe and uncomfortable stay in any hotel in my life. The door to my room would not lock properly so I asked and was moved (hours later) to another equally disgusting room. The last renovation of this place had to be in the early seventies. Granted, there are hundreds of rooms but the peeling paint, the soggy saggy mattresses, the broken fixtures and the utter filth have no place in a hotel that charges over a hundred dollars a night. Thankfully I was in meetings all day every day and returned so tired I did not mind the stained blankets and torn sheets. The carpeting was threadbare and had hair and bits of dirt. The moldy rusted tub was so disgusting (there was hair in the tub too) that I just squatted and sprayed with water to clean off. I have been in cheap tourist hotels in Turkey, Mongolia and China but this takes the cake. I just read the "Dirtiest Hotel" feature and this hotel should be a runner-up!

Reviews.Title: “Happy to recommend”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_Visitors
Reviews.Content: I am very happy to recommend Hotel Pennsylvannia. We arrived and left New York by train so the location to Penn Station was excellent. It was an easy walk to Times Square and adjacent to Madison Square Garden. The rooms were nice and clean, the beds were comfortable and overall it's a pleasant place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “`Had a briillant time”
Reviews.Author: msward
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel in december last year and had a wonderful experience. The rooms were lovely and clean and cleaned every day. the staff were very helpful and polite. The lobby is amazing and the food in the restaurants were lovely. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. It is central to every thing. I booked in again for november this year and cant wait to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “how does it get away with it”
Reviews.Author: tiredoutUk
Reviews.Content: how does this hotel get away with it? busy reception not very helpful staff and a room for 3 that was terrible. My wife opened the door of the room and it stunk!! the cause we found was the black mil dew on the inside of the fridge door that had been left open. The bath room walls were black with dirt. we went back to reception complained and was taken to another room. Surprise we opened the door and it had not been made up Back to reception and another room on the 10th floor. a bit better but the floor hadn't been swept in months toe nail clippings and bits of cotton wool every where. Stopped 1 night and then moved on.

Reviews.Title: “Black Mold, Broken TV, Broken Heat, No Towels”
Reviews.Author: SalmagundiTraveler
Reviews.Content: There was dangerous black mold on the ceiling, the tv remote and radio were broken, the heat and air conditioner didn't work (luckily it was good weather and we could open the window), and there wre not towels. They refused to change our room, telling us the hotel was filled - we later found out that we were THE ONLY PEOPLE IN THE WING ON OUR FLOOR that night!!! All the other rooms were empty. They brought towels after 3 hours and multiple calls and fixed the radio, but we were forced to spend 3 days in a room with dangerous black mold, no tv, and the window open all night.

Reviews.Title: “Thank goodness it was only for one night!”
Reviews.Author: TishHugsTrees
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my school group after our travel company mucked up our flights back home- we had been staying in Vermont for the week in what at the time seemed to be far from luxury, until we arrived at this place! On arrival, the lobby was quite grand, very large and bustling- just as one would expect from the pictures on their website. We were greeted by some 'less than friendly' staff and took the packed lift up to the 3rd floor. Our suitcases were being unloaded on to patches of vomit which coated the carpet and that the cleaners had obviously failed to notice. The porters must have been blind and had no sense of smell not to notice where they were putting our suitcases! The hotel was vast and our group were staying at opposite ends of the corridor- a good 5 minutes walk away despite being on the same floor. The doors made the place look like a prison. Our group of girls obviously drew the short straw; our bathroom stank of urine, was filthy, the bath was cracked, mouldy and rotting, the taps didn't work properly, the room was not designed to fit 4 people and we struggled to fit in with our suitcases, the lights didn't work- constantly flickering, our view was of a brick wall accompanied by some large bins and it was absolutely freezing. However, the boys did at least get a large room and were near eachother with views of madison square gardens- this has led me to think that the people who seem to be writing good reviews of this dump have stayed in the less shabby rooms (which are by no means acceptable) but at least the vastness and view has them under the impression that the hotel is half decent. The only aspect this hotel has going for it is the location. Second to none for the price. I could not fault the location at all. But if you do want to stay in NY for more than one night, I would not suggest here as you would need a shower and we could not even venture into our shower with the lack of hot water and cleanliness. Maybe in the summer the lack of heating and cold water would be a good thing? I wouldn't want to see if that is the case. As if being delayed by a day wasn't bad enough, we got put in this [--]! I tried to refrain from using bad language but there's no other way to truly describe it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: KateFewins
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by the Hotel Pennsylvania. Having read some of the reviews on here and with it costing us only $100 a night for a double room we were slightly tentative but we really pleased with the outcome. We had a huge room which though slightly shabby was very clean and the cleaners came every day. The hotel is amazingly located right opposite Madison Square Gardens and next to Macy's. A total bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location, Shame about the Actual Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marky1978
Reviews.Content: I have landed in the UK today after 4 nights in the Hotel Pennsylvania. I was quite happy with the hotel at first, although it was a bit dated, and a bit like walking into 1964 - old, damaged furniture, brown carpets and a bathroom requiring a refurb - but I thought I could look past that, especially as it was a really good location. However, the more I saw of the hotel, the more I could see how dirty it was. The carpet in the room had chewing gum or such like ground into it. The grouting in the bathroom required fixing, the enamel on the bath was in great need of replacing. The corridors needed hoovering and the area by the vending machines was grotty. We stayed on the 2nd floor, and I didn't see any other floor, apart from the lobby (of course) and the lower lobby room, where you are charged $4 to store your cases for an hour or so. The lobby itself was not brilliant either. You could just tell that it was an old hotel that had not been updated for years. I try to make a point of not reading reviews before I go somewhere as I probably wouldn't stay anywhere, but I did with this hotel!! There were pictures on this site of cockroaches, which, I must say, put me off, but hey, it was all booked!!! Third day into the stay my partner went to run a bath and ran back into the room as there was a roach in the bath. Now, I am not a specialist in these things, but don't cockroaches go where it is dirty? This is the reason I would not return to this hotel. I would pay a little bit extra, and stay anywhere between 32nd street and 52nd street between 5th and 8th Avenue, as this would still be central to Time Square, the Chrysler and Empire State Buildings. The Crowne Plaza looks lovely - but I don't know about the price!?

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: edwardtate
Reviews.Content: This review turns out good. I booked with out looking at the reviews. Looked at price,saw what the hotel said about itself,then said "yes".(what a Wally!) The booking company I had used took £305.00 straight away for our 4 nights stay (approx $610.00) including taxes.This was for two adults,one room twin beds (me and my 13yr.son) After reading the reviews had second thoughts! Contacted the booking company saying please review..and get us a better hotel" okay was their repy..".pay us an extra £150.00($300.00).This was not an option.So. Contacted the Pennsylvania reservations. Yes..they would look out for us ..and take a little extra care? We arrived... took our booking reference...."Yep your here..NO WE AINT HEARDOF YOU BEFORE NOW"Checked in as usual (NO SPECIAL PREFRENCES>>>STANDARD ROOMS" My heart sank. Took the keys...too the room 16th.floor..Well the room was fine.Approx 15 paces long 6paces wide. T.V.Bath room 3/4bath and shower, twin comfortable beds, clean sheets,writing desk.No tea/coffee making facilities.One chair. Not 5 star but generally comfortable.The good stuff out weighed the poor. Question? Would I go there again...Well having stayed at Milford Plaza in 2003 and comparing it to "The Pennsylvania" I think the Penn is ever so slighty the better of the two(having said that the Milford Plaza is going through a refurbishment as I write).Note look around the web sites for the best deal...and look at trip advisor before parting with any monies! DO NOT BOOK WITH OUT AS MANY CHECKS AS RESONABLY POSSIBLE. My son and I had a great time in NewYork .What a great time.

Reviews.Title: “What a bargin”
Reviews.Author: kkricks
Reviews.Content: Hotel was older and not glamorous but was clean and an excellent bargain. Couldn't ask for a better place to stay for the price with such a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel- location location location!!!”
Reviews.Author: FidoDido
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel Feb 2008 and loved it. For me, location was the most vital aspect for me- who wants to go to NYC and spend alot of time in their room?!?! In regards to the room it was nice, 3 out of 5. Little old school in the decor however the hotel is gradually renovating all its room, modernising them, however we had an older room. The room was large, light, VERY clean (beds made and towels changed everyday!!) and had a tv/hairdryer/bath/shower and a walk in wardrobe! The hotel is constantly busy and when u come out of the elevator into the huge lobby the buzz of new york hits u right away! Staff are very polite, only flaw was the check in was a little slow but we got there in the end :) As you walk out the hotel, directly in front of you is Madison Square Garden. Legendary! Also, its a five minute walk to Times Square, one block from the Empire State Building and Macy's and there is a subway on each corner that will take you anywhere in NY. I loved my stay here and would defo recommend to everybody. If you got anymore questions about the hotel or NYC just ask!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel , great rooms , A++++”
Reviews.Author: veraTheNetherlands
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel I come to the Pennsylvania hotel every year in October, and every year i have a great time at my stayment there. Great rooms , Clean , and very helpfull peoples working in this hotel. Look for the rooms my pictures ( vkhk and andy7) See you in October !!!!

Reviews.Title: “good location...but the rest..”
Reviews.Author: kataract
Reviews.Content: oh my god, you're given a card which won't open the door and at the 3rd time you finally get to your room, with a lot of surprises such as: you reserved for a king bed but you get a double bed...without any explanation of course cannot use the electricity plugs cannot stop the water and find a huge cockroach having a walk in the bathroom. + the people at the desk are quite incompetent and if you wanna let your luggage after the check out, you are charged 4 bucks a bag. Thank you! better take anything near from a subway station...

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as its cracked up.”
Reviews.Author: Mitch91
Reviews.Content: Having read the slanderous reviews scattered throughout this page about the historical Pennsylvania Hotel, I was dubious about my visit in late January of 2008. Travelling with a large group with my 6th Form for a Philosophy Conference in the city on one of the days, made me even more worries. Mass groups almost always get the most torrid and unkempt rooms possible. As everyone else has said, the location is nothing short of spectacular, the view from the 18th floor is something to behold. And being central on 7th, opposite madison square,penn station and a very large borders and with Macys a 5 minute walk down the road.It couldnt be better possitioned. Since I came with no high expectations, the room came to know suprise to me, if youre from the UK, its not unlike travel lodges or equally 3 star motels that litter the US. They are comfortable. A safe base. Somewhere to rest and wash. While the bathroom was slightly small for 4 people, the room we had was huge and with a nice view. Simply put, if It wasnt being knocked down in the next year, I would definitely stay again, especially for the value for money you get. But it IS, and i cant stress this enough, value. Dont come to the Penn expecting the Ritz or the Hilton, if you want them, you better crack open that wallet. I hope this review helps, for anyone on a budget and not with stupidly high standards, shoot for this hotel. Come with low expectations and Im sure it will charm you.

Reviews.Title: “Your better off if you stay in the gutter!”
Reviews.Author: mdrj69
Reviews.Content: Near a subway! Across from from the Garden, ten blocks from time square all for $260. It must be to good to be true. WELL it was!!!! This place is horrid. The hotel rooms are small and my room faced a brick wall. I stayed in what was considered a "dump" in Santa Barabara for less and had a bigger room and bathroom. The smell was bad too. The maid service and the overall staff of the hotel do carry the typical NYC attitude like they are there by force and when you need or ask for help you get eyes rolled at you. IT might be the fact that there are litterally hundreds of europeans running around in the hotel. The internet service is bad. They block all wireless internet access within the hotel range so your internet on your cell phone wont work. THey force you to go to the lobbyand use a pay per minute interenet that always seems to be used by the European tourist looking up European news. The hotel also overcharged me $100 plus they never responded to my email about their service. Hotel.com was great in fixing the problem they immediately refunded my money and sent me a voucher so I could use their services again. Like my title says unless you are desperate and need a place to sleep and you wont really remember the experience. Pay the extra cash and stay at a Hilton, or the W.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible rooms with great location”
Reviews.Author: frank2travel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Penn for 4 days on a shopping trip to NY. Maybe I'm a small town guy but this was a whole ordeal. We checked in and they said they were out of rooms so we got upgraded to the "Corporate Rooms" which got me excited until I saw the room. The room was tiny and all though the furniture was nice the bathroom was a old beaten up disaster where the bathtub didn't work proper and just looked shabby for the money we spent! The location was great as its right next to times square and MSG but the staff expects a tip for every little thing. Now we came on a budget and tipped where we could ranging from $5 - $10 but they looked at us like we were cheap. Now I don't know how much people normally tip but where I come from I am happy with anything! Again I wont be staying here again it's just not worth the money spent.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs! Bed bugs! Bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_sales_grl
Reviews.Content: I do not want to whine about the hotel, I think the majority know exactly what it is like, it is basic, no frills and that (on paper at least) is okay. You know what to expect so I do not believe in moaning about the drabness of the decor or the lack of fluffiness in the towels BUT I DO NOT expect BED BUGS in a hotel. Yes, they have bed bugs, they may not be on all the floors but they were on the 7th floor and they will spread so go at your own risk. Also before you think about booking, think about the lack of hygiene here. Interestingly when you google bed bugs and the Hotel Pennsylvania you will see that they had a law suit brought against them in 2005 where 2 women were bitten to a ruby red pulp by their little room mates. Nice. My fiance and I were bitten countless of times there, it is rather repulsive to think how dirty their mattresses are. We shall not be staying there ever again. If you are silly enough to stay there after having read this here is a TIP - Ask for a room on the 13th floor - DO NOT TAKE ANY ON THE 7TH! The rooms are repulsive and smell. The 13th floor has been renovated (we only found this out after 3 nights) and were transferred only after we complained that a friend who was staying there too was on this floor and they were being charged $10 less. If you get resistance from the front desk (they were fine by the way, they did not retort when we told them how awful the hotel was. They are very much aware of the hell hole that they work in) I do not know what the other floors look like but in all honesty, even if you are lucky enough not to get bitten there are an array of more decent hotels in New York for the same price, if not less. I would rather stay in a cell with a brick bed and no sheeting than at the Hotel Pennsylvania.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel ever!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mangalore86
Reviews.Content: i would just like to say that this hotel was a great surprise!after reading the awful reviews about it on this website i was very nervous!however the hotel turned out to be excellent.the location is excellent, you step outside the door and madison square gardens is cross from you and macys is beside you. it was easy to walk to all the different attractions in new york!the hotel was very comfortable. the only problem is that the hotel is a bit dated but at the end of the day who cares!the beds were very comfortable and the shower always had piping hot water. i must say i thoroughly enjoyed my stay and i would highly recommend it. i am planning on going back to new york nxt year and i will defintly be staying in this hotel again!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location-shame about the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JayHaddley
Reviews.Content: We went to New York for Christmas and this hotel was recommend to us for its location. When we arrived our friend was right- it was a great location, at the centre of manhatten, empire state building around the corner, macy's 1 block away, madison square garden over the road!! However when checking in the queue was pretty long and slow-not the best after a 7 hour flight! The lobby looked clean and busy, but once we checked we made our way to our room, this was where the hotel went down hill. The corridors were pretty old fashioned and could do with a redecoration. The room was standard if a little small but was clean which is important. The bathroom showed signs of aging but it did not affect us as we only used the room for sleeping and washing, apart from that we spent very little other time in the room. I'd recommend this hotel for people travelling to New York on a tight budget as its probably the cheapest in manhatten and I'd also recommend it if people are planning on using the room as somewhere to keep your clothes for a night!

Reviews.Title: “An absolute NO!!!”
Reviews.Author: ange284
Reviews.Content: We are big fans of New York and frequent visitors. We stayed at the Penn a couple of times in the past, and to be honest we thought it was'n too bad, they were cheap rooms. So this time we booked an upgrade thinking this would be an improvement, as you really can't beat the location. There were 6 of us in total, so we booked 3 rooms. The rooms (on the 12th floor) appeared clean but they were incredibly small. They didn't look much different considering they were upgraded rooms. Over the course of our stay we had a dog next door (pet friendly hotel, I guess this explains the stains on the carpets) constantly barking.. My sister & aunt had to be moved 4 times in total as they also had dog in the next room. Each room worse then the last, and all the while hotel staff displaying their obvious annoyance and impatience with them for complaining. One room had a hole in the bathroom wall where the water just poured out into the bath. It really was horrendous. While my husband & I were waiting for the dog next door to be moved (the reception said the guest's must have sneaked the dog in as pets were only allowed on floor's 2 and 3) another guest on the same floor was checking out as she had a MOUSE in her BED!! I found the staff in the hotel extremely rude and unhelpful. Their reaction to the mice was 'this is New York City you get mice everywhere' This hotel appear's cheap but we paid $1700.00 for 6 nights so it wasn't cheap. The hotel facilities are very poor. Long creepy & smelly corridors. The lobby was home to groups of homeless people every night. The rooms are shabby to say the least. Full of old oversized furniture and discusting carpets, curtains. I cannot begin to explain how bad the bathrooms are. Trust me although this hotel is in a perfect location it's a serious hygiene compromise, a big NO NO!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't ever stay here!”
Reviews.Author: SpencerTW13
Reviews.Content: This was teh most horrific place I have ever stayed. The reception looked good, but when we got to our 1st room, it had a stain on the floor that looked like blodd stank of smoke and the curtiains were hanging on...so we changed room, the floor was not stained but the bathroom was vile. Thank good we was in New York so spent all our time out and about, we literally on used the room to sleep in. The location is great, but not worth staying in a for the location. Disgusting!

Reviews.Title: “You pay for what you get”
Reviews.Author: travelagent89
Reviews.Content: I really dont understand the fuss surrounding this hotel. I stayed here 3years ago and then again in Dec. Yes fine the reception is busy, but the hotel has over a thousand rooms, and why are people so bothered about the reception when new york is right outside? Its cheap as chips, and clean and tidy, no frills, but who cares, I would rather save 200 quid and spend it myself in macys! My room was massive and the sheets clean...two thumbs up. The staff were friendly, espec the guys who look after your suitcases when you check out. The shower in my bathroom was ace, boiling and powerful. The best thing is the position. A cheap clean hotel right opposite madison square gardens and macys! No paying for subs or taxis, fab! And 10 min walk to the Empire Sate Building. Right in tourist heaven! You are never in your room, as long as its clean and tidy whats the big deal? Its brilliant and would always stay here. You pay for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as the reviews make out”
Reviews.Author: Davc1h
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on here, i was dreading staying at the Penn. I have to say though it was not bad at all. We stayed in room 1675,(great view of the Empire State). The room was enormous, two double beds with clean sheets every day. Bathroom was nice and clean. For the money we paid, i really do find it hard to find fault with. Oh and the location is second to none. All in all, an enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Just Don't !!”
Reviews.Author: CitySlicker123
Reviews.Content: Really quite shocking. Just don't bother!! Good location, but with the problems associated with Penn Station being on your doorstep. Horrendous rooms, with mould, mildew, noisy air con. Corridors are like something out of The Shining !! Don't get taken in by the lobby pictures!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Pennslyvania, New York”
Reviews.Author: Oronoco
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our first trip to New York, three days was not long enough particularly with the long flight. I had used the travel advisor prior to going to look at the details of the Hotel Pennsiyvania, and they weren't too good. I had booked with tradewinds so I thought it was be a resonable Hotel. I have to say I agree with some of the reviews, as a base it was great and the staff were friendly and helpful and the rooms were cleaned each day. If you were lucky you had a view of The Empire State Building but that was it. If you were expecting plush and luxiourius the Hotel Penn is not for you. Apparently Glen Miller wrote the song Pennslyvannia 6-5000 (the hotel's telephone number) afters staying here in the 1940's, by the decorative state of our room, I don't think it has actually been decorate since. The rooms are very drab and sad and in total need of decoration, piant peeling of the walls and holes in the walls where pictures once hung. The bath although clean was chipped and stained and so were the tiles. However if you just want clean sheets and a clean room as a base then it was fairly cheap for the three days. I would definatley go back to New York as i didn't do or see half of what I wanted to do, the grey Line tour bus was great to get a feel of the city as was the night time tour. I loved Greenwich and Soho. Saving up already to go back. (but not to Hotel Pennslyvania.

Reviews.Title: “Worst HOTEL EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelerbug21
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went for a getaway and was extremely disappointed. The lobby looked great but as for everything else the service was terrible. We had booked a king size bed, through expedia and they pretty much told us that they couldn't guarantee that room only guarantee that there will be a room. The lady gave us a room with a 2 twin size bed fit for a 9 year old and the window wouldn't close. The hallway was dark and scary I felt like I was in a horror movie. when we asked to up grade they charged us and extra 100 to upgrade. When we went to see the room it was exactly the same except for the bed that was slightly bigger. By then we had decided to leave since we were only there for 10 mins they had charged us for one night. I was taken aback as I tried to comment that we just got there and the lady just yelled back and refused to serve us. We then had the manager check us out. We then left to a different hotel, we called expedia about the situation and the hotel already charged us for three nights that we didn't stay. The hotel's excuse was that everything is precharged before you even get there which I think is not totally unfair and I don't think that it is legal to do that. Luckily expedia had given us a refund on that. We ended up staying at best western hotel (which I would definitely recommend) at times square. a lot closer to everything. the room is not big but the bed is a decent size. Also a lot cheaper and way better service.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Awful”
Reviews.Author: Caz79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel back in September 2006. On arrival the lobby appears clean. There are however long queues to check into the hotel. Staff were not very helpful either. When we arrived into our room we immediately checked out. It was disgraceful. Very dark, riddled with damp and filthy beds and bedding. Never again. Would definitely recommend avoiding this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: Mobeth
Reviews.Content: Was slightly aprehensive about staying here after reading some reviews but was genuinely surprised by this hotel. The lobby is impressive and check in took less than 10 minutes. Yes the front door to the rooms are slightly odd however this is an old hotel! Our room was spacious and had two good size single beds. Only one pillow each but phoned housekeeping who bought up extra ones within 5 minutes. The location is suberb with Macy's only a block away and Times Square a 5-10 minute walk depending on how quick you go!! The Lindy's in reception is expensive so we ate at Andrew's cafe which is the otherside of Macy's. Great food, great price and great service, the waiter Chuck is a legend! The price of this hotel and its location make it a great place to stay. Yes, it's not as luxurious as the Ritz but for the price we paid, we really can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Umm... Never Again”
Reviews.Author: SchoolTraveler23
Reviews.Content: Just recently, I stayed at the Hotel Pennsylvania for a school function. Luckily, we weren't crammed into the hotel all day as it was probably one of the worst I have ever stayed in. When I entered the hotel, I was surprised at how elegant the lobby was. Checking in wasn't that bad, as some people said, and it only took about 10 minutes (and this included loading our bags into the cart to be taken to our rooms - which was a nice touch). Stepping onto our floor, I was a little confused seeing the doors to the rooms, as they looked very awkward with a disgusting 'cover' (?) over each that made each room look like a mini prison-cell. Yet, walking in, the prison-cell idea came to life. The room was far smaller than I imagined, with two VERY small beds that oddly took up the bulk of the room. We were also greeted with missing necessities, like a clock (we were forced to use phones/laptops/the TV for time), a refrigerator (which our neighbor had) and most importantly, clean sheets. To top off such a warming entrance, one of us decided to brush our teeth and was 'delighted' to see that the water had a yellow-tint for a few moments after being turned on. Although many describe the bathrooms as extremely old and disgusting, it isn't as bad as you may think. Yes, parts were old and moldy (like a corner with a rusted window), but the shower, toilet and sink were somewhat clean and usable. Yet, if I had the choice, I would never stay at this hotel again unless some drastic changes were made. This hotel was so much potential as it has a perfect location, (perfect for teenagers, young adults who like NYC experience) but lacks some of the bare qualities one expects in such a so-called 'high end' hotel. To conclude, the staff was friendly, the room was very below average, but at least the 24 hour cafe was good!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel, do not stay here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: redrmf
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel I've ever stayed in, the lobby looks lovely as do the photos of the rooms on the internet, when you arrive the que is a mile long for check in, when we got to our room, it was dark, damp and dirty. I rubbed my finger on the wall and you could clearly see the dust on my finger and the clean patch on the wall that I had rubbed. I stayed there for 3 nights and I refused to take a shower during my stay as the bathroom and shower were so dirty. The rooms also smelled, the corridors smelled. It was just painful to stay there so we contacted our travel agent and got moved to the Milford Plaza, which was heaven compared to this place. On a lighter note the hotel was so bad that it made us stay out longer which meant that we took in a lot more sights.

Reviews.Title: “Shouldn't have to forgo basics for location”
Reviews.Author: Smfarnsworth
Reviews.Content: I've not used a travel agent for almost 15 years and after this stay I will NEVER use one again...!!! I don't know what possessed me - for 15 years I've booked directly with airlines and hotels but this year I thought I'd use a travel agent and get a 'deal'. They descrived the Hotel Penn in glowing terms and said the location was great. I looked on the map - and it was. I only wish I'd read TripAdvisor before committing myself rather than afterwards when it was too late. It is true - you cannot fault the location. We got the airtrain from Newark to Penn Station and it is less than a 30 second walk from door to door. It's opposite Madison Sqaure Gardens, adjacent to Macy's, about 3 blocks from the Empire States Building, 10-12 minutes walk from Times Square and about 15 minutes from the Port Authority bus terminal. But that's all you can say about it. You could sleep on the pavement outside and get all of that. In this day and age you should not have to choose between location and standards. I agree that hotels can charge a premium for an amazing location but they cannot say, "you've got a dirty room, you've got no bath, the wallpaper is peeling off, you've got no closet space - but what do you expect - you've got a great location". Thankfully our stay was brief and we left the hotel early each morning and returned only to change and go out. I will say that the bed was comfortable - so that was a blessing. I would never stay there again and I would never use a travel agent again.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting Don't Do It”
Reviews.Author: sheba55
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice in the past 18 months. i should have known better after the 1st trip, so its my own fault for going back the 2nd time. location and price swayed it both times but never again!!!!! it is filthy, dark and depressing.the queues are a mile long checking in. the rooms are dirty and i suspect that any prison cell would be more cheerful to stay in. after a long flight it is nice to relax in a nice hotel room and also after a hard days shopping. it is depressing to return to the room in the evening. the bed is very poor quality. the bathroom is antiquated. mouldy tiles. please dont stay here. for a few dollars more try somewhere else. however it is only 2 blocks from macys and across the road from madison square garden

Reviews.Title: “Believe the bad reviews .. a filthy, gross old hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Sinoed
Reviews.Content: Essentially, there isn't much to say about this hotel other than to believe all of the previous bad reviews. I was unfortunate enough to stay herel on my recent trip to NYC. Personally I don't expect much, I just like to stay in a basically clean, maintained hotel - and this one does not fit that bill. One thing to note, is that I think *some* of the rooms may have been renovated - which is why there are a couple of positive reviews, but the chances of getting a nice room are very slim. The sole positive aspect of this hotel is the location right across from Madison Square Gardens and walking distance to Times Square, Macys & many shops, theatres, attractions and transportation. The hotel website pictures are very deceiving, since the lobby is the best looking part of the whole hotel and it goes way downhill from there. The few staff we encountered were generally pleasant and helpful, its too bad they have to work in such a rundown place. Take a look at the candid traveller photos - they accurately represent what you're getting! To begin with, the whole hotel is absolutely filthy - I couldn't find a single clean area during my visit. Everything from bangs, dents, stains and marks on walls to peeling paint, rusty fixtures, and broken furniture. Our room came complete with an electrical socket that hung out of the wall, a window that wouldn't close, a bathroom knob that actually came off in our hands and an unmentionable bathroom. The bed came supplied with a broken mattress, worn sheets and stained coverlet. I never took my shoes off in the room, didn't sleep well & did not feel clean there. Its tough to relax and have a nice hot shower after a long day of sightseeing with paint peeling around you and above your head. This may be *budget* New York, but personally I'd have paid a LOT more to not have to stay there. I would think that if you've planned a long awaited vacation and are spending a few days in the city you'll feel much more relaxed and comfortable in another hotel. Although I've never stayed there, my best friend who stayed with me recommended the "Edison", similar in price range but much nicer and cleaner overall. To that end, I saw several hotels around the area - so it would pay to do your homework here. Parents, don't bring little ones - I wouldn't want any of my kids on the filthy floor or touching any of the bare wires or broken things I saw all over this hotel. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone, much less a friend or family member. You'll only be happy here if you don't care at all about the cleanliness of the room you're staying in, just need a place to crash for a night or two and spend as little time as possible in the dank and dingy cells they call rooms. My two cents, cabs are cheap in NYC - if you can't find a hotel to fit your budget within walking distance of Times Square consider staying out of the district in a nicer hotel and use the money towards cab fare or transportation costs. I wish I'd had that option.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhere to sleep”
Reviews.Author: KSLWorkington
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel expecting the worse and actually it wasn't that bad, ok it could do with a facelift but who goes to new york to sit in their hotel room? its just somewhere to get your head down and refuel for the next day. Also you can't beat the location of this hotel in fact we've booked again for this year.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling”
Reviews.Author: KateDublin_8
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely the worst I have ever stayed in. Besides the fact that the place is dirty, dingy and looks like more like a prison than a hotel, the staff are downright rude and and even dishonest. I left some clothes behind me in my room when I checked out (accidently I should say) and when I returned from my friends house to retrieve them the staff lied to me saying that the guest who stayed there after me must have taken them, even though this was the very next day!! I never write reviews online but I was so upset after this awful "holiday" that I feel I have to warn other people about this place. It has put me off New York for good.

Reviews.Title: “what do you expect”
Reviews.Author: jmac69
Reviews.Content: I was worried when we read the reviews of this hotels. Yes it took a while to check in, the staff at the desk were very helpful. on entering our room we were surprised it was massive so much space,it could have done with a lick of paint. But apart from that nothing major to worry about., room service was fine we always had clean towels and the beds were made every day. Remember people this is New York a little bit of tipping goes along way !!!!!!! The location was fantastic could not be beaten right across the road from the garden and macy's. My advice if you want somewhere just as a base to sleep in NYC book the Penn, and us the money you save on shopping its easy people

Reviews.Title: “don't do it!!”
Reviews.Author: james1117
Reviews.Content: our first impression of New York was slighly tainted when we stepped into the Pennsylvania. dont be fooled by the marble clad reception and crystal chanderlier. you've seen the best of it. waiting for you when you step out of the lift are 'psycho' style corridors,dark,dingy,mouldy and smelly. The hotel room doors are like reinforced cell doors. Our room was very spacious and the beds were clean after we refused to stay in the first room. The bath was stained,carpets were heavily marked,paint was flaking off the walls and the heating ducts were black. The only good thing about this hotel is its location and this cannot be faulted,you are right in the thick of all the major attractions. this hotel is described as budget,it cost us £700 for a 5 night stay,not what id call value for money. overall would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “filth at its best!”
Reviews.Author: padz
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel though no fault of my own, my sister had already booked it.this is the worst hotel i have ever stayed in,stay well away.if you are a cheapskate stay at home at least you wont die of a fungal or mold infection.i am honestly flabbergasted that this hotel is allowed to take money off people to stay there.stay away its the worst.whoever is responsible for this hotel should be ashamed of the state of it and they should be held responsable for the dirt of it.YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is.”
Reviews.Author: valleyboy82
Reviews.Content: Was very apprehensive about going to the hotel after reading the reviews on here, but the actual experience wasn't half as bad. The hotel is very basic. It's in drastic need of a makeover and the overall feel is dowdy and neglected. The worst part of the stay was the one hour wait at reception when we arrived but otherwise nothing horrendous happened. The room was on the 14th floor. It was quite small and dull. However, my main relief was that the bed linen was clean and so was the bathroom (although a little mouldy in places). The sheets were replaced daily and the room was also cleaned on a daily basis. The bed was a little springy but was sleepable. The main advantage is the location which is FANTASTIC. You are literally in the middle of it all - you can't ask for better. We only ever stayed in the hotel to sleep so weren't bothered about the amenities etc. If you want a clean but very basic accommodation then stay here. If you want the Ritz go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Hell!!!”
Reviews.Author: BlondeOne13
Reviews.Content: Don't let the lobby fool you!! The place is disgusting! We found BLOOD on the comforter and on my daughter's pillow case. The comforter was dried blood, the case was fresh! Filthy rooms, old furnishings, OLD hotel! For $150 more a night you can be some place safe and CLEAN. I saw many foreign tourists there, no doubt they were steered there by some lowlife websites as I was, thinkng it was okay! Bathrooms are OUTDATED, the blowdryer was ripped off the wall, filthy tub, 1960's period furniture...GET YOUR $$$$ back if you have made a reservation!!!

Reviews.Title: “False Advertising???”
Reviews.Author: lvbcoving
Reviews.Content: In 20 years of travelling this is by far the WORST HOTEL i have stayed in, the only good thing about it is its location, took 1 hr to check in, then 2 hrs to find a room that was barely accecptable (tried 4 different rooms) only reason for staying was lack of availability in vaccinity, (arrived 28 december) Some staff seemed concerned by number of complaints, others uncaring. Had heard bad reports but upon viewing website decided to take a chance, BIG MISTAKE!!! definitely NOT RECOMMENDED!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Pennsylvania To Be Avoided At All Costs”
Reviews.Author: TorontoMexicofan
Reviews.Content: Seven of us traveled from Dublin, Ireland to New York and stayed at the Hotel Pennsylvania from December 6 to December 10, 2007. We had booked three rooms in total and paid the equivalent of $1,300US per night. I have to say shame on the Irish travel agent who recommended the Hotel Penn and charged so much money for the rooms which were just dreadful!!!! We had to change rooms three times – not that there was any noticeable difference between the rooms we were given on each occasion we moved – the rooms were unbelievable – dirty, dingy, large chunks of paint peeling from the walls, just terrible. If we had paid $100 a night per room that would be a different story as you wouldn’t expect much in New York at those prices, but to pay so much money per night to stay in what is in essence a dump is just criminal. Also we were locked out of our rooms on two occasions as the manager on duty at the time of check in lost our vouchers and then said we hadn’t paid for the fourth night - fortunately my friends had kept a photocopy of the vouchers– the staff at the reception desk were so rude and unhelpful – I couldn’t believe it – I was totally shocked – suffice to stay that customer service is non existent at the Penn. I would not advise any one to stay at this hotel – it should really be demolished.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Pigpennsylvania”
Reviews.Author: hotelking71
Reviews.Content: Room dirty; floor apparently under construction; filthy windows; disgusting bathroom. BAD,BAD, BAD!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “could be better”
Reviews.Author: quickcop
Reviews.Content: I arrived in New York, first time ever there. When we arrived we were greeted by the valet parking guy. We carried our luggage inside and began our long, long wait to be checked in. Busy time of the year and they only had 2 associates checking people in. Finally after checking in we received our room key and we began our journey to the 12th floor. We arrived to our room and the room was adequate and clean. We then went on about our day and slept there that night. Woke up in the morning and I called the front desk asking what the latest check out time was. They advised we could stay in the room until 1pm. We went out shopped came back to find that our door room key no longer opened our door. I called the front desk in distress because our personal belongings were locked inside the room and they advised us to go down stairs to 5000 club. We went down there and waited, waited and waited for the one man behind the desk to talk on the phone and move slower than slow. We finally got our turn and he issued up aother room card. We went up gathered our belongings and back downstairs to check out. We called for our car while in the room. We came down and again waited and waited for they same one man who eventually checked us out. We then waited and waited for our vehicle. The vehicle arrived and the valet paking guy "Paul" advised that we owed 40.00 for parking. I then informed him that we paid it already with the room. He said no go inside and again I went inside to the bell Captain who advised he did't understand what "Paul" was talking about and escorted me back outside. Him and Paul spoke and again I was directed back inside to see the slow man in Club 5000. Again I waited and waited until he finally advised me that I owe 40.00 for parking which I was not aware of. He had no personality or helpfulness to him. He just kept saying, 40.00 , 40.00 we can charge it to same credit card. I had no choice but to pay it against my will. I then went outside with my new receipt and handed it to Paul. Paul then said, no I need the receipt and I said no I want it for my records......he then once again sent me inside....again I waited and waited fianlly the bell Capain went and made a copy for me. I went ouside once again and Paul fianlly handed me my car keys we loaded up the car and drove off. Paul was obviously waiting for his tip. The tip is this........Provide better check in service, stick to youre word to hold the room open till 1pm when promising people, advise people up front of a "parking fee" and have more staff to accomidate the customers. Train the staff on customer services excluding the maid service which were the friendliest of all in the Hotel. I would love to know where any manger was for I seen none.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, What Did You Really Expect ?”
Reviews.Author: ILOVEMACYS
Reviews.Content: Okay, this was our first visit to the States and this included my wife and two kids (14-16) we were staying there 10 days from the 19th - 29th of Dec. Yes I had read the reports and seen the photographs and was fearing the worst, this is what I found. We arrived at the hotel at about 3.00pm and although I had seen queues during the stay I went straight to the desk and received my keys. We took the lift up and found room 707. Yes the room is basic and in need of updating. The bathroom is small but you have constant hot water, the shower is adequate with very good pressure. The sheets are changed every day and you receive clean towels every day. The maids were all very friendly and if wanted an extra pillow ect that wasn't a problem. Let's be honest I paid $102 a night, basically £51 for an adequate room in the centre in a city that really doesn't sleep. You knew what you were paying when you booked and if you can find those sort of prices in the centre of London as close to the centre as this is then basically I don't believe it. I wouldn't stay there again as I'll try a different part of the city but if you're after a hotel that's next to Macys, subway, Madison Sq Gardens and everything else then this is the place. Trust me all you will be doing is sleeping there after spending the day doing all sorts of stuff that you couldn't do at home for the same price!. I enjoyed it and so will you, if you want a posh hotel that you can look at as you leave and enter then go elsewhere. If you want a base that will do sufficiently for your stay then go nowhere else but the Penn.

Reviews.Title: “Not THAT bad!”
Reviews.Author: pianodog3
Reviews.Content: Well, honestly, it was not THAT bad. Initially, I was a bit scared to check into this hotel after reading all the nightmarish reviews other people had posted. However, my fears were somewhat assuaged when a friend recommended this hotel, primarily because of its location. Since he'd been to New York numerous times, each time staying at the Hotel Pennsylvania, I thought he'd be a reliable source. True to his word, the location really can't be beat. With a rail/subway hub right across the street and the Empire State Building right down the street, it could not get any more convenient. Granted, the building itself was a bit shady. Public bathrooms downstairs were pathetic to the point that after walking in, I walked right out, preferring to use the bathroom in my room instead. Also, the main waiting area on each floor looked like something out of a ghost story. (I later found out that the condition of the waiting area was a good indication of the condition of the rooms on the floor, which would explain why some people got it very good and some not.) Staff were both mean and friendly, depending on who you talked to. As far as the room goes, though, it was really, really OK. Although I did notice some wires hanging out of the wall, a vent without a grating, some rust on the pipes underneath the sink, and a heating apparatus that was a joke, it wasn't like anything wasn't working. Overall, the room was clean and tidy, though definitely nothing to brag about. Then again, the price I paid was a bit much for what I'm used to, especially given the no-frills nature of the hotel, so unless I need to be 100% centrally located the next time I'm in New York, I probably won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel of a Vintage Era”
Reviews.Author: Sarah92284
Reviews.Content: I just got back from staying 9 nights at this hotel and can't tell you enough how fabulous it was. My grandmother and I traveled by train from California to New York for Christmas vacation, so we chose Hotel Pennsylvania because it is directly across the street from Penn Station. Although she was born and raised in New York, and this was my first time to the Big City, she never stayed at the hotel while she was living there (she left NY in 1954) so we were excited to be staying in this historic landmark hotel. Prior to our departure we read some of the worrisome reviews given about this hotel but found they were not true and we were pleasantly surprised. After being on the train for 3 days we arrived Monday evening tired and wanting a good night's sleep. Check in was a breeze. The Lobby was clean, gorgeously decorated for the holidays, and beautiful. The Clerks were all cheerful and helpful and the Bell Captain, Fritz (yes that's his name), was wonderful. He took our luggage up to the room (we stayed on the 13th floor), turned on all the lights, turned on the television, made sure all the channels were working, opened the closet to show us our iron and board, and opened up the blinds to show us our view (which was spectacular of the Hudson River). Our room was clean and spacious, we had two double beds. The bed linens appeared new, they were clean, and the beds were comfortable, the paint and carpet appeared new and there were no stains, tears or mold, and there were no odd or bad smells, just the smell of a clean room. The furnishings including the mini fridge were in great condition and all perfectly functional. The bathroom was basic (but we did not pay to stay at the Ritz Carlton and who lives in the bathroom while on vacation anyhow) but it was very clean, functional, and had plenty of hot water at all times. Our maid (did not get her name) came daily to clean and did a wonderful job, she kept the bathroom well stocked with toiletries, supplied us with abundundant towels, changed the bedding, and if she happened to come while we were still in the room would leave saying she would come back later and always did. As for location...THIS HOTEL IS PERFECT. So many of the sights and major shopping stores are within walking distance and if you happen to want someplace a bit further then the subway, cab or bus system are all out the front door. As for the hotel restaurants...Lindy's was a bit pricey but the food was good. Joe's O's was more reasonably priced, the food was excellent, and the portions were big. City Perks is a little coffee shop that has very good and quick pick-me-ups. There was even a souvenier shop in the hotel that had reasonably priced items compared to other shops in the area. Right next door to the Hotel is a Dunkin Donuts, Roy Rogers, and Nathan's Hot Dogs. Kmart (for any last minute items you might need) is across the street. My first stay in New York was made very enjoyable because of Hotel Pennsylvania and their wonderful staff. I am trying to talk my mom into going back with me soon and when we do we will definitely be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!!”
Reviews.Author: graciex
Reviews.Content: We were so excited about going to New York, but were extremely dissapointed by this hotel. The girl that checked us in was completely rude, and the musty smell that greeted us every time we stepped out of the elevator will stay with me forever! The room was small and disgusting. One good thing the cleaners were very friendly. Will never stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Shame on Hotel Pennsylvania for selling such sub-standard rooms”
Reviews.Author: Cymac
Reviews.Content: to tour operators.Also shame on tour operators for not viewing what they are selling.Arrogant staff who were most unhelpful.We had to pay 50 dollars per night for an upgrade for the "executive rooms"which were just adequate.The room we were given initially was in a delapitated state with cracked plaster and a shower room that was in such poor condition that one would hesitate to use it.Don't touch it.

Reviews.Title: “Way better than the defunct Howard Johnson on Broadway”
Reviews.Author: Posmok
Reviews.Content: I'd stayed at one of the most shabby, disgusting, depressive and DIRTY hotels New York has (the Howard Johnson at Broadway, that was closed down) so after reading some of the reviews for this hotel, I was prepared for the worst; I ended up lowering my expectations and wanting only clean sheets and hot water. To my surprise, our room (1702 on the 17th floor) was big (two double beds -for three people-, a dressing room, bathroom, window, heater, a small fridge, desk and chair, a tv, table/iron and hair blower) and it was CLEAN. The bathroom is ugly and pretty basic, but functional, and it didn't leaked or anything, no funny smells. Maids and staff were really nice, always with a smile, always ready to help with directions. We hadn't even complained about a window that refused to stay closed in the bathroom, and they took care of it fast. The only trouble we had was with the really unpleasant woman at the front desk, (Reina was her name, but don't worry about her if your native language is English, she just seems ashamed to be nice to Spanish speaking guests) and room service that took forever to deliver extra hangers or cups. Other floors' lobbies looked terrible, so I recommend you request specifically the 17 floor. Maybe the rooms in there are better. Also, leave tips. They deserve it.

Reviews.Title: “Yuk...I thought Americans had higher standards”
Reviews.Author: TravellingBegg
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at this hotel in November. The check in was okay and they let us check in early. A bit of advice - if they tell you you are to early and have to come back, don't go to the diner attached to the hotel to wait as it is soooooo expensive and eating in New York is reasonably cheap. The hotel pics paint a nice picture, but the corridors and rooms are soooooo run down I was amazed and so disappointed!!! I thought Americans had high standards as they complain about everything in other countries but this hotel was not good. I can’t believe how many guests it holds, how busy it is and how shabby it is. Don’t stay here if you have any allergies or are asthmatic as it will probably hospitalise you and I am not exaggerating. The walls and carpets are all stained. The ac and heater are disgusting and covered in rust. There is mould everywhere. Oh I could go on! The only good thing is the location and the fact that it is relatively cheap by New York standards. However I have been to NYC several times and would advise staying in a nice hotel a bit further outside town if you can’t afford the waldorf but want to stay somewhere nice as the subways are a great way to whiz around and the taxis aren’t to expensive. A couple of touristy things to do include the obvious - A show on Broadway. Book a ticket directly at the theatre as they are much cheaper. - The station island ferry is free. - Macys and tiffany’s is a must. - Bubba Gumps on Times Square is great for dinner one night and have the shrimp platter - $20 and it’s amazing. Plus they do strawberry daiquiris - China town is a must for your fakes (you have to get off the subway at the canal street stop) - Soho has great shops Avoid NY in the summer as it gets really hot and is not the best idea if you are shopping or dragging a boyfriend/husband around with you. April/May is a great time to go as is the winter months running up to xmas as it gets very festive. If you want a prolonged stay or to get some sunbathing in either head to the hamptons or jump on a plane for £60 return from New York to Miami!

Reviews.Title: “Good location - but that is it.”
Reviews.Author: kcounter
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent four nights at the hotel (12/15-19/07) and weren't expecting much because of the price - and we were correct in lowering our expectations. We arrived early and couldn't check in, but they will graciously store your bags in their dungeon-like basement for $4 each. Check in wasn't a problem. The hotel corridors and rooms are stale and smelly. We kept our window cracked the entire time just to get fresh air (highs were in the mid-30's while we were visiting), but it was worth the cold air. Our room was clean, but very, very dated and overall depressing. The comforter was burned in several spots. Again, we knew not to expect much because of the price. The shower had hair in the drain and although the water pressure was good, hot water was NON EXISTANT. My complaints were ignored. Don't waste your money on upgrading to include the "breakfast" - it consisted of OJ, coffee/tea, and a very small selection of stale pastries and bagels. There was no fruit, bottle water, yogurt - nothing else. Also, the night manager (Mirium), called to wake me up one night so she could get a copy of my credit card so that she could close her books. OK, give me a break! No messages were left, no notes, nothing during the day - we had given the hotel our credit card and both of our cell numbers at check in. But instead of trying to contact us politely, the rude manager calls to wake me up to get my credit card. She was unbelievably unapologetic and rude. We weren't in the hotel much, thank goodness, but on our next trip to NYC we will DEFINITELY spend a little more money to get a better hotel. This one is not worth cutting corners on, I don't care how great the location. Dirty, noisy and rude.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Iceskater1
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is fantastic. It is opposite Madison Square Gardens and a 2 minute walk to Macy's and a five minute walk to the Empire State building. It's an hour's walk in one directions to Ground Zero, the Financial District and the island ferries, and an hour's walk in the other direction to Central Park. Times Square is 10 minutes away. (Yes we did walk everywhere!) Despite this hectic location, once insde the hotel it is calm and peaceful. The beautiful lobby however does not reflect the rooms. They were a little shabby and could do with a little care and attention. However they were very clean and turned down every day without fail during our four night stay. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants in the hotel so we can't comment on these. The reception staff on first approach were friendly however on checking out we had a bit of trouble. It was Sunday and the lobby was very busy, we had to wait in line for about 15 minutes, we checked out no problem and then went to leave our luggage in the luggage room. It was only then that we were told we needed to purchase tickets at Reception to leave our bags - this had not been mentioned at check out. So we had to go back to reception and queue up again - very frustrating. The tickets were $4 per bag and I told the receptionist we should have been advised when we were checking out that we needed to buy tickets for the luggage room. He was courteous and apologised.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DublinJessie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and can honestly say we had no problems with it . If you are looking for 4 star accomodation then pay 4 star prices but if you are looking for a large clean room with sheets and towels changed daily then this is the place for you.You will not find a better location for the price of this hotel.The staff are friendly and there is a coffee shop and restaurant attatched. There is also a small bistro type place that called lyndys that claims to have world famous cheese cake ..... we had coffee and a slice each and for the 2 of us the bill was $36.50 ..... they should tell you it's the price and not the taste that is famous.Will be booking for new york for next year as soon as it goes on sale and it will be the penn hotel i will be booking and recomending to my friends to do likewise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DebzPerth
Reviews.Content: The best thing undoubtedly, about Hotel Pennsylvania is the location. It's directly opposite Madison Square Gardens, and 2 mins from Macy's Dept Store. We also walked to the Empire State Building/Central Park/Times Square - but if you want to take the Subway, Penn St Station is across the road. We also caught a bus outside the hotel which went straight down to Battery Park where the ferries to the Statue of Liberty depart. Hotel Pennsylvania is a vast hotel, I believe one of the largest in NYC. The lobby reminded me of a large city station, with a lot of hustle and bustle and hundreds of people hanging around. There was a long queue to check in, but I learnt that's quite normal in USA. Rooms on the 12th floor give you access to the Penn5000 club which is basically a room with a few computers with internet access, a tv and coffee/tea making facilities. Also in the morning you can get free breakfast (which was bagels and fruit). Bearing in mind there are no coffee/tea making facilities in the room, we found this very useful! The rooms are pretty basic. Mine was rather dark and cramped and had a tiny bathroom, although the bed was comfortable enough. I saw 4 separate rooms visiting other family members, and they were all different. I'd recommend ear plugs, not just because you're in central Manhattan, but the walls are a bit thin! The hotel has some trivia too - apparently it was the largest hotel in New York back in t of history - apparently the Glenn Miller wrote "Pennsylvania 6500" in reference to the hotel's phone number. I think if you plan to spend a lot of time out sightseeing then the Hotel Pennsylvania is probably a good choice of hotel. Would I stay there again? Not sure. I was following relatives and fitting in with their plans. So I'd probably research a few other hotels first.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value. Excellent Location !!”
Reviews.Author: Natstar78
Reviews.Content: It amazes me to read ppl complaining about this hotel. NYC is expensive. You get what you pay for. Our room was clean and comfortable. You choose this hotel for it's central location. Macy's and the Empire State Building are on the next block. Broadway and Times Square are within easy walking distance. There is a diner downstairs for bkfst. I am a travel agent and I have no hesitations recommending this hotel to my 2/3-star clients. Don't be afraid to stay here. For those who expect better you'll need to dig deeper into your wallets !! Get real.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute dump!!!!”
Reviews.Author: FortPierce_FLDaisy
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 days in the greatest City in the world, but staying at the Hotel Pennsylvania was the worst experience of my life. THE HOTEL IS CLOSING JANUARY 2, 2008. Because of this, they have not done any refurbishing, decorating or even maintenance of the place in many years. The toilet leaked; the ceiling is peeling; there are no sprinklers; the tubs are ancient - all cracked and peeling; the bedspreads are disgustingly dirty and stained and no one cared about our complaints....just that it's closing. If it's not too late to change your reservations, please do so. The prices are outrageous for this terrible place.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy and unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: ronx59
Reviews.Content: This is one of the dirtiest and most poorly managed hotels I have ever stayed in. It is a huge hotel and obviously caters to block bookings of Brits and Irish, presumably on travel agent deals.The impression is that Its not trying as it can cram them in at extortionate rates with no effort. It's not an exaggeration to say that it is filthy. cobwebs, stained toilets, grimy bath tiles, heating that doesn't work, toilets that back up, (these were problems I and three traveliing companions all experienced, not isolated incidents.) The staff were rude, sullen and unhelpful, in one incident my friend was waiting on faxes and got text confirmation from the uk that they had arrived. Front desk denied that any faxes existed and refused to check. When we checked in they had lost our booking but and made us rebook on our credit cards before they would let us in, it was one a.m. and we had little choice. It took a whole morning of phone calls to the travel agent in the uk to resolve things but we never received a word of apology. And its not cheap! Avoid at all costs, a dirty, unfriendly, overpriced, horror of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Bad - But Great Location”
Reviews.Author: just_a_phase_uk
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Penn was a hotel that I did not book myself. This trip was actually a surprise that was booked by my girlfriends’ parents. As soon as we found out, I checked tripadvisor and immediately feared the worst. When we booked into the hotel, we were given an awful room. It was filthy, damp, dark, the TV didn't work and there were stains all over the carpet. We immediately asked to change room which was accepted by the staff (this must happen a lot!). When we walked into the 2nd room, we were greeted by a half naked Spanish man who had just stepped out of the shower - this guy hadn't even checked out, yet the hotel had given his room away. Worrying to say the least. Anyway, after the Spanish guy left, we called the desk to come clean the room. The room was slightly better, but still pretty tired looking. The only good thing I can say about the Penn is its superb location. It within walking distance of all the top attractions and Madison Sq Garden subway station is directly opposite. All in all, it’s worth staying if you are not going to spend any time in your room apart from sleeping. So, it's a pretty good job that New York is the City that never sleeps!

Reviews.Title: “Dont Do it ............!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ronan21
Reviews.Content: First impressions of this hotel was, the lobby is nice and busy – it looks nice enough.. It’s a complete kip and nobody should have to stay there – hotels should not be this terrible. I stayed there for 10 days, and I had to move room which was difficult to arrange. I eventually got to speak to the manager after standing in the queue for about 40 minuets about the flea marks on the sheets and the damp bed and they said they had no more rooms and basically tough luck. There was a lady booking in beside me and she asked me was there a problem with the rooms? I replied, just ask can you have a look at the room before you complete your reservation – this lady asked to see the room and basically the manager’s response sums this hotel up ‘no we do not show rooms’ – ‘that’s cause it’s the hotel of horrors’

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: spanlaketraveler
Reviews.Content: Room doors that look like coffin lids. Sea foam hotel sheets and towels bought from a prison supply store. Bedspread that maybe 10 years old.
