Somehow there was a flat screen TV in there, but it randomly turned itself on and the weirdest hours. Anything over $100 a night is not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “What was all the fuss!”
Reviews.Author: fuzziebear1977
Reviews.Content: Well firstly let me say I couldnt believe the bad reports this hotel was getting prior to my visit and I was indeed very worried about my stay! Well I couldnt have had a nicer stay. Yes hotel isnt the Hilton but it was clean, the staff were friendly and although busy what do you expect going to probably the busiest city in the world. Our room was upgraded to a king size room on arrival free of charge and although there were a few scuffs on the walls and the shower was constantly dripping what do you want when you only have to sleep in the room. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who doesnt want a 5 star hotel for 2 star hotel prices! I really couldnt believe some of the bad reports this hotel was getting!

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: krystalSpennymoor
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 6 night stay at the Pennsylvania Hotel. After reading the reviews before i went i was concerned. However i need not have worried as i thought the hotel was great and i had better things to do in New York than take photos of the toilet! The location of the hotel was excellent, the room was fine and there was no mould to be seen! The hotel is just 5 minutes walk to Times Square and Macys is even closer. This is a great value for money hotel and as a Travel Agent i would definatley recommend this hotel to my customers.

Reviews.Title: “Wish they had a zero star rating”
Reviews.Author: travelgus
Reviews.Content: By far the single worst hotel I have ever come across. I'm not a big stickler when it comes to hotels because most 1 star hotels have better rooms than this place and a pleasant auro and smell. My wife cried when we entered. Rat stench, urine smell in the hallway. nasty bathroom. I felt like I was holed up in a drug and prostitution den. I am not kidding here. Really bad. If you do stay hear and have a room overlooking the street be prepared for a sleepless night due to the noise of traffic outside eminating through the drafty windows. Made you feel home sick like you were in a b-movie horror flick. Stay in NJ and commute in to the city or stay in CT. or spend an arm and a leg for a somewhat decent hotel. BUT PLEASE DON"T SPEND ALOT OF MONEY FOR THIS DUMP!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “lucky”
Reviews.Author: mrsbrick
Reviews.Content: Guess we were lucky with our room. We arrived at the Hotel on Thurs 22nd Nov, at 8.30pm on Thanksgiving Day. Our trip was booked in Jan 07, (before I checked reviews on TA), and like everyone else was horrified with some of the reviews. Our expectations weren't high. We went straight up to check in, and was greeted by a very pleasant man who had a joke with us Scottish Girls, and give us some information about Maceys, and how to keep safe, the whole process took 10mins. Our room was on the 10th floor directly opposit to Madison Sq Gnds and Penn St. We reluctantly opened our room door dreading what we might find, however we were all very pleasantly surprised. However, I couldn't resist shouting "there's something running across the floor!" which made the girls scream and jump around like idiots. I nearly wet my pants laughing !!! We had to large rooms with 2 single beds and large working TV in each. The bathroom was large with plenty of constant hot water and clean. The rooms were cleaned on a daily basis and very comfortable for the little time that you spend in them anyway! So to finish off YES I would definately return to Hotel Pennsylvania good value for money in an excellent location, what more could you ask for!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok....”
Reviews.Author: charlier0204
Reviews.Content: I was only in New York for 2 nights. Any decent hotel in New York is going to cost money! This hotels location is as good as it gets for New York. The room was comfortable but was a bit worn out. The Hotel was nice but it could do with a face lift. The staff were polite but i did not have much contact with the staff to really comment. I would recommend this hotel as for the price you get a decent hotel right in the heart on New York.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as we thought, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: gemsw83
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on here we were a bit worried to say the least, so i thought it would add my views on here as it wasnt as bad as we thought at all. When arriving we were amazed how good the location was and its right opposite Madison Square Garden and Penn Station, Check in took a while but it was Thanks giving day so i guess there was alot of staff off that day as it was a bank holiday, we requested rooms close together as there were 4 of us travelling and that was no problem, we had rooms on the 14th floor and were a bit worried about what we were going to find behind the door when we opened it, we found that it was very basic but was actually ok compared to what we thought it was going to be, it is basic, old and dated but the bedding was clean and changed every day so the maid service was good, the bathroom wasnt the best but there was hot water which was good, i would go back here as the location was excellent and really close to the empire state building and time square is only a short walk away. Also we were hardly there because we were out all day so it was just a base to keep our stuff and get out head down at night.

Reviews.Title: “good location/ average hotel”
Reviews.Author: londonbhoy
Reviews.Content: The best thing i can say about Hotel Pennsylvania is the location. Our room was very disappointing on the 4th floor i will not go in to detail as we got moved after complaining. There is a great Irish bar called Blarney Rock across the street from side entrance.I probably would stay in this hotel again because of its excellent location

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: wendypooh9
Reviews.Content: My non stay was in February 06. Was not a member of trip advisor at time. But thought guests should know what awaits them. Horrible hotel. Waited for over an hour to just check in. Was visiting NY for business with sister , had been staying elsewhere, but decided to stay an extra day to see sights and pay my own room fees. Sister's first time in NY, I am frequent NY guest, but normally stay elsewhere. After checking in finally, no one would assist with luggage, my sister was pregnant, we had to haul luggage ourselves. Hallway was disgusting, doors reinforced, reminded me of being in the bowels of a military ship. Room was disgusting, smelled, carpet dirty, mold in room, bathroom dirty, hair on floor. Old decor from 70's. Television did not work. View of alley. Lock on door did not work properly, no phone in room. Requested two doubles, got a Queen. My sister was actually afraid to sit on bed, she also started to have panic attack. She was afraid to stay in room. I literally had to take her outside to calm her down, she refused to stay in hotel. We ended up leaving hotel after less than an hour. Hotel refused to refund any portion of money, and were unsympathetic, refused to move rooms. We ended up flying home that evening on late flight, experience spoiled mood and hard to find room in NY on last minute notice.

Reviews.Title: “got what i paid for”
Reviews.Author: johndelta50
Reviews.Content: seond visit to the pennsylvania, got a better room this year, looks like it was recently decorated, cleaned daily and even the carpet was hooovered twice in five days. proberly like most people chose the hotel for its great location and some inexpennsive diners in the area. would definetly stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good review”
Reviews.Author: LilDublin_Ireland
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from the Pennsylvania having stayed there for 5 nights. Have to say I was really worried after reading the reviews on here but needn't have. I booked through their website hotelpenn.com and booked penn5000 rooms, these are upgrades but were not available when we arrived. However we were given superior rooms but could use the penn5000 suite which provided tea, coffee, hot chocolate etc. and continental breakfast. Would definitely stay here again, the hotel in smack bang in the middle of everywhere

Reviews.Title: “Read this HONEST review. This place is TERRIBLE!!!! DON'T STAY THERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: cl9904
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell, the Hotel Pennsylvania in New York is an absolute mess. I've stayed in hundreds of hotels in Europe and North America for both leisure and business travel, and my 4-night stay at the Hotel Penn was easily the worst experience I've ever had. The entire experience was negative from the moment we arrived at the hotel. The reception staff (even those in the "exclusive" 5000 Club) were terribly rude, and gave us the impression that we were intruding on their time merely by being there and wanting to check in. We arrived a couple of hours before their check-in time (3 PM), and elected to check our bags in with the bell desk. We were more than bit surprised to find out that there would be a per-bag fee ($4) for this storage service (note: this was NOT a tip, but a FEE). You must take your own bags to the basement level to be stored, and then retrieve them on your own. I only bring this up because such service is complimentary in EVERY other hotel in which I've stayed in NYC. The main level lobby is still relatively nice, and gives a hint of the Hotel Penn's past glory. However, any signs of this hotel being a luxury property disappear as soon as you step inside the elevators. The elevators creak, moan, jerk unexpectedly, and seem to be on the verge of sticking between floors. When you arrive on your room floor, prepare yourself. The interior corridors remind you of the inside of a mental institution or a maximum security prison. They are dark, musty, stale, and utterly lifeless. The room doors are HUGE, concave-shaped (both on the inside and outside) steel monstrosities that are hideous to look at, and seem to not want to stay locked. The rooms are small, dark, and don't seem to have been refurbished in at least twenty years. The paint is cracking badly throughout (there were several people in our party, and this was present in every room). The televisions mysteriously turn off and on by themselves. The bathrooms are microscopic (approximately 6 wide by 3 feet deep, COUNTING the space for the shower). If you are 5'10 or taller, your knees will likely be pressed against the door when you're seated on the toilet. The water in the shower alternates between being scalding hot and icy cold -- there's really no good way to predict which one, and neither maintenace or management is going to care about it or do anything to remedy it if you call to complain). For some reason, all of the rooms were swelteringly hot. None of our rooms' air conditioners would work. Above all else, the Hotel Penn is ridiculously overpriced. The rooms at this hotel should be priced at no more than $75 per night -- despite the fact that it's in a great location. There really are no redeeming qualities for this hotel, except for the fact that it COULD be a great property if it's ever purchased by a large chain that would be willing to poor the millions of dollars that are needed into upgrading its interior -- and to train and hire a proper staff. I did not encounter a single person in the entire hotel who deserves to keep their job. I mentioned to one of the younger employees that I'd thought about cancelling and moving to another hotel after reading some of the reviews on here, but decided to give it a shot after reading several others which were positive. After experiencing this dump myself, I am certain that every single bad thing that you read about this hotel in these reviews is true, and every positive review is some sort of mistake. Avoid this hotel at ALL COSTS!!! If you're looking for a hotel with a good location that is reasonably priced, try the Paramount Hotel (on West 46th Street) or the Comfort Inn Times Square (West 39th Street). However, if you read this and stay at the Hotel Penn anyway -- don't say you weren't warned.

Reviews.Title: “could have been better!”
Reviews.Author: Ricka1
Reviews.Content: We arrived on the 15th of November in the afternoon. The hotel looked very promising on entry and the reception staff were very helpful and we checked in to our room on the 14th floor. We were first given a room that was occupied but it was quickly changed. From the lobby you enter the lifts to your accommodation and enter a completely different world. The corridors were dark and dirty and the doors to the rooms were reinforced which gave you a bad impression. The décor of the room we stayed in was shabby, the carpet was heavily stained cracks in the wall and chipped paint, the shower tiles were hanging off and the shower was cold. We also had chewing gum stuck to the wall in full view from a previous guest and the phone was ripped from the wall. We had a good view of 7th Avenue and the beds were clean. My grandmother stayed on the 16th floor and our friends on the same floor. Their rooms were very similar. We went to see the duty manager about the standard of the rooms just to bring it to their attention. The Manageress we spoke to immediately asked us if we wanted to vacate our rooms in a rude way and said that they are typical of the standard we paid for. We didn’t want to leave we just wanted to raise certain points. The excuse was that it was house keepings problem (but surely if you are a duty manager you would rectify there problems?!). She said if we wanted to leave we would have to find other accommodation within 30 minutes or we would be given a penalty, we were shocked by her attitude. We could tell she was not bothered by our complaint and knew she could sell our rooms again as it was a busy. The only good thing about this hotel is its location. Be warned, if you have a good room it is because you are paying an extra $50 per person per night plus tax and you are on the upper floors of the building. We will try a different hotel next time!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED”
Reviews.Author: davidf71
Reviews.Content: I Stayed At Penn5000 ,this is my second time there ,the rooms very clean ,toilets very clean tiled walls and floor ,rooms were cleaned every morning .we bought 2 tickets at hotel for radio city they were 2 excellent front row balcony seats .the hotel it self is in a prime location for shopping .staff very friendly .yes i will be back next year. yours sincerly David Foran { Ireland}

Reviews.Title: “Six in one, half dozen in the other”
Reviews.Author: phenomonique
Reviews.Content: The rate was perfect for a last minute stay, it was Thanksgiving Day, after all. I checked in and was given a very small room. I inspected the restroom first, it was old fashion but nice and clean. I flip on the light to the bedroom and OMG! Half the ceiling was coved with water spots and mold!! I called the front desk and the moved me to another room. As I left the first room I noticed when I pulled the door behind me that the lock did not engage so I went back in to try it from the inside. Oops, it didn't work....no other locking device on the door either. Ok, off to room #2. One problem to start-the hole in the ceiling with tissue plugged in it. Yikes, but I'll survive it. I turned on the television and the heater and got comfortable. Two hour later the room is still cold. So the moving starts again. They finally got me settled into a great room, with a view of 34th street, no holes, mold, and this one was warm. The rate was perfect and they also gave me a late check out.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I have ever stayed at by far”
Reviews.Author: shannon7212
Reviews.Content: By far the worst place I have ever stayed at. The room smelled of smoke and you could not open a window. The walls were covered in mold, my sheets were dirty they smelled of someone else’s perfume and had goop on them. When I asked for clean sheets they showed up and dropped the clean sheets on the floor and left. Oh and the floors were sticky. When I took a shower I had to stand on my tippy toes because the tub was so dirty and disgusting. I had two nights stay and made it through one night because I had no other choice and they would not switch my room. I paid $280 per night at this place. TAKE MY ADVICE AND FIND ANOTHER PLACE TO STAY.

Reviews.Title: “Location was brill - Dont believe what you read”
Reviews.Author: lillyireland
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from an 8 night stay at this hotel, to be honest upon reading the reviews before we went we were a little scared. Upon arrival it took about 15min to check in the lobby was really beautiful. We were given a room on the 15th floor yes the corridors had a bit of chiped paint but once your room is clean what else should you care about. The room was a bit small but very clean along with the bathroom (bed clothes, new towels every day). The only small fault I had with the room was the lighting was very poor. The location is fantasic 2 blocks away from Macy and around the corner from the Manhattan Mall. The bar at the hotel (JOES) is really nice and the food couldnt have been nicer and really friendly staff. We would stay at this hotel again without a doubt. Please dont believe what you read go and see for yourself. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad”
Reviews.Author: jimbob2100
Reviews.Content: We were both extremely scared about staying in this hotel after reading the reviews, but it really wasnt as bad as we thought it was going to be. We asked for one of the superior (newly redecorated room), but the happy man at reception (not) said he had given us 'good room with big bed,' he wasnt wrong, it was small (with a massive bed) and clean and we got a great view of macys, what more could you ask for when all you do in the hotel is shower and sleep. OK so the corridors look like something out of The Shining and it needed a bit of paint but generally I have no complaints. We didnt pay anything more and the room was perfectly OK. Stayed in room 611!

Reviews.Title: “A bed and the rooms are dry”
Reviews.Author: Irish_Traveller085
Reviews.Content: Before you book, be warned, this hotel is a dump!! It's big, it's old, the staff whilst friendly, are still working as if it's still the 50's!!! But for the price, you can't go wrong. The hotel is slap bang in the centre of New York. There are plenty of taxis generally outside to get you whereever you can't walk to. If you're visiting New York and just want somewhere clean and dry to lay your head for a few hours each night, at a decent price, this is your spot!!

Reviews.Title: “It's OK for the money”
Reviews.Content: This hotel couldn't be more centrally located and I think it offers reasonable accommodation considering the price. We stayed for a long weekend in one of their superior rooms which cost $250 per night. The room had two double beds and was really quite spacious and clean. The bathroom had seen better days but it was OK. I accept that this is not the hotel to stay in if you want lots of luxurious extras but it serves the purpose if you're just looking for a base from which to explore the city. I have certainly paid more and stayed in worse places on Manhattan. The only major criticism I have of the hotel is that it took nearly half an hour to check in due to the really long queue when we arrived. The check in process seemed unnecessarily protracted and that's not what you need after a long journey. But overall, I thought it was not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Better than we expected”
Reviews.Author: eezaway
Reviews.Content: My wife and I planned to stay in NYC for 3 nights in Nov 2007 en route to visit our daughter in Florida. I booked the Hotel, as it seemed reasonably cheap, BEFORE I read the reviews (Ooops). We were a little apprehensive when we arrived, but the staff were very friendly and very helpful and the check in process only took a few minutes. The room was small, the decor was a little drab (could have done with a fresh lick of paint) BUT it was clean and tidy, the bed was comfortable and everything in the room and the bathroom worked ! The location is great if you want to see the sights. Penn Station is directly opposite (ideal for us as we flew into Newark and used the Skytrain) with Subway to all parts of the city, and the Empire State Building is just 2 blocks and Macys 1 block away. Don't eat or drink at the hotel as the prices are expensive, but there are loads of bars, restaurants and diners within a few minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Grand location in a "grand" hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kalistrat
Reviews.Content: This trip was a personal/business trip for me, and I paid for the hotel myself. The goal was to find an inexpensive hotel in a walking distance from the place where I had to attend a training workshop. This hotel was a mile away and the rate was the best at the time of booking among many other hotels in Manhattan. When I arrived I was asked by the staff if I was checking in and taken to a separate room. The room I booked was not available, so they upgraded me to the Club 5000 room, which also had a free breakfast included in the deal. My room was in the corner. It was huge (actually two rooms) and it was a great view from two sides of the building. I guess, guests in the Club 5000 get better service, because my room was very clean and had everything changed daily when I was out. The internet was also free at the Club lounge. I really had nothing I could complain about and would stay there again if I was mindful of the hotel price. I guess I was a little more lucky than the other guys who didn't get upgraded to Club 5000.

Reviews.Title: “A step down from Guantanamo Bay!”
Reviews.Author: pinkjan
Reviews.Content: In short: 1) Staff were miserable. 2) When first entering our room we passed the cleaner at the door, who had kindly took a dump. 3) Wall paper hangin off walls. 4) Electricity sockets not working. 5) We had legs like second hand dart boards, following the fleas efforts residing in the bed. 6) changed money at reception - got ripped off compared to local bank. Better, cleaner and more pleasant accommodation availabe for less than this place. Be Wise!!

Reviews.Title: “I have been wanting to do this for a long time....”
Reviews.Author: Summersunt
Reviews.Content: ....this hotel is the singularly most disgusting place I have stayed in. I have only lived in stayed in one place worse and that was a bad hostel. My friend warned me that someone private messaged her to say we shouldn't stay at this hotel, we had fallen for the hotel's bright and shiny website and the fact, they claimed, they had renovated rooms. A lot of the pictures show on this website depict the experience. but what they don't show is the stench. When we arrived we were given a room that had blood and hair in one bed (I kid you not). There was thick dust everywhere (everything was gray because of it) We were shattered but we were forced to go down to reception. We were then given another room, this room was better but had not been cleaned. I thought they had given us someone else's room by mistake. because there was rubbish everywhere, beds looked like they had just been slept in. So back down we went. Finally they gave us a room which was better, but still has my room crawling. I remember the stench and the terrible old, bathroom. On my last day there I met a guy from another state who recounted almost exactly the same story to us, but he was smarter and had demanded his money back for the bad service. I would not recommend this place to anyone...I have stayed in hostels and hotels alike of varying levels and this is truly awful.

Reviews.Title: “Mold mold mold”
Reviews.Author: JonFromPeg
Reviews.Content: Omg I'm suprised Health Inspectors dont shut this hotel down. our hotel had soo much mold under the heater, there was a towel covering it up. Me and My girlfriend paid for a King Room... we got a twin bed..we complained ...we got our King But still... the room was nasty. we paid 400$ a night for 4 nights... we both got sick while sleeping in the room. And if ur hoping for a nyc view.... well u get a back alley view. the T.v is from the 70's the cable sucks hardly any reception. I do not recommend this Hotel to anyone. Only good thing about this hotel is its like 5 blocks away from Times Square and 50 feet from MSG. Never again I agree burn to the ground

Reviews.Title: “Sooooooo close”
Reviews.Author: flightsrus
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip through Expedia, found a flight to accomidate our needs both to and from and I wanted to make sure our hotel was in "midtown" Manhatten ( close to all the attaractions) We chose Hotel Pennsylvania, cause it was just that. We had tickets to a hockey game for the Saturday night and MSG was right across the street, as well the Penn station subway was as well. The hotel itself is VERY old. I am a very well travelled person so I can handle a little out dated or mold.( LOL) but what the previous reviews state are all true to an extent. Rooms are small, but clean, our maid however never changed our sheets, but at least we always had clean towels. When in NYC, how much time do u actually stay in your room? I know for us, we had 3 1/2 days to see as much as we could, so for us, a clean room, CLOSE to all attarctions, we were 1 block from Empire State building, 1 block from Macy's Department store, MSG across the street along with Penn Station. and 8 blocks to Times sq. i was VERY willing to over look the out dated small room. When looking to stay in NYC Make sure to stay in Midtown

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Disgusting, Cancel Your Booking, You Will Regret It”
Reviews.Author: Goodboy4444
Reviews.Content: This place is absolutely disgusting. Paint peeling off the bathroom, blood stains in the corridoor carpet, the stench, the rusted door frames, the disgusting dirty ratshit filled air conditioner. I can go on and on. I can't see how the New York authorities let this place stay open, it really is a hive, dump . My cats poo box is more hygienic I have stayed at over 500 hotel rooms in the last 7 years, THIS IS THE ABSOLUTE WORST!! Dont believe me, look at the pictures. Keep your socks on when walking on the carpet. Sanitise your clothes when finished. Also got sick of washing my hands in the bathtub because the basin tap wouldnt work. Please do not waste your money, we cancelled and stayed at the hotel milennium times square instead, real class real luxury, business grade hotel, and only cost us $50.00 per night more. Location!! Ha , you're in new york !!, anywhere between 5th and 7th and between 33 and 48 "IS THE LOCATION" To all of you who give this place more than 1 star or make any comment that it is ok, positive location etc, it would have been cleaner staying at the train station accross the road. Please do not make good comments if you arent a regular traveller, a hotel should be so clean you can eat ice cream off the toilet seat. I felt sick breathing the air in this HOLE! No seriously please dont waste your money. D o NOT stay at this hotel. You will get a totally incorrect perception and view of the affordable quality that is available in new york. Ps warn yourself, warn your friends, mate, warn your enemies, no one deserves to part with their hard earned money on this rip off , nuff said!!

Reviews.Title: “It should be burned to the ground”
Reviews.Author: scooper3571
Reviews.Content: Most of the reviews were correct...this had to be the dirtiest hotel in the United States! The bathrooms were old, out-dated, dirty and just down-right disgusting. If you just want a place to lay down, cross the street and stay at Penn Station...it's cleaner.

Reviews.Title: “low expectations”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkFlyer
Reviews.Content: I was very disapointed with the quality of the rooms in relation to the price paid $300 per night room only. first room had no clothes hangers or wardrobe, no fridge, no hair dryer, no iron, no ironing board, paint peeling off the walls in the bathroom, door unable to close properly and rotting away on the bottom. Our second room complete with all amenities bathroom walls in a very bad state with paint peeling from all four walls and ceiling, tap dripping and very poor temprature for hot water, loose wires hanging from sockets, Television cabinet warped from water ingress, in all very poor value for money.

Reviews.Title: “mouse eating hotel”
Reviews.Author: triciabkildare
Reviews.Content: hi i stayed in this hotel for a shopping trip to newyork, we just slept there and even that was too much, great location but woke up to find some kind of rodent had eaten a hole in my hand bag, the corridors were dark and dirty in this hotel and it stank. I would not recommend this hotel but I loved newyork and the people were fab and so helpful. I will be returning in august but staying in a different hotel which heres hoping is better than the last.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience in a hotel in my 49 years”
Reviews.Author: robyt
Reviews.Content: Worst experience I have ever had in my 49 years. at 300+ dollars a night when I walked into the room I exspected to see a taped outline of a body. I am not a prude and I understand that NY is exspensive but absolutely don't stay here. They attempted to put us in a suite for a 100.00 upgrade but it was even worse. The suite had 3 bedrooms with a common living room. The funny thing about it was they told me that they might have to rent the other bedrooms out which I was kind of OK with but once you came in the front door of the suite you could not lock the the individual bedrooms. You got to be kidding!!!!! We moved to the Marriot Residence Inn Time Square for 45 more dollars a night and what a relief. To top it of they tried to charge me for one night until I told them that I would refuse the charge with AMEX. If you stay there make sure you take the lysol and house shoe because you will not want to walk on the carpet bare footed. Better than that take a tent and stay in C. Park!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bike-Oregon
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent booked us into this hotel but we almost cancelled after reading the bad reviews. We decided to take a chance and were glad we did. The check in time was quick and the people behind the desk were very nice. Our room was obviously dated but was very clean and very comfortable. The rates we paid were half of what our friends paid at another hotel and I thought our room was better. You can't beat the location. It was perfect. The hotel is huge but that only added to the fun. It is quite entertaining just sitting in the lobby or standing out front and watching all the hustle and bustle. You are near to everything: Times Square, Penn Station, great restaurants, shopping, etc. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: no1_worldtraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Pennsylvania for 7 nights in the beginning of October 2007. Having read the dreadful reviews on this site I was a bit worried about this hotel… But it was just fine! The check-in took about 15 minutes (we arrived on a Monday at about 4 pm). The hotel corridors are a bit simple (I guess this means no paintings on the walls) but who cares? They’re just for transportation. The hotel room was big and clean. No problems there. (A bit cold during the nights, but no biggie.) Hotel Pennsylvania is an older hotel, yes, so if you’re in New York for a luxurious hotel stay you probably shouldn’t book this one. You probably should book Four Seasons or something similar. But if you’re happy with a simple (but OK hotel) this is just fine. The location is great and all the yellow cabs know exactly where it is. Just say “Hotel Pennsylvania” and they take you there. This is a fine hotel with normal standards. We had areally good stay and would book it again.

Reviews.Title: “Location is excellent”
Reviews.Author: Critic1Ireland
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, stayed in superior room, definitely worth upgrading. Spacious enough by Manahattan standards, old fashioned, lighting is terrible in the rooms. Requested extra pillows and towels, got them no problem. Walking distance to Macys(next door), Empire State Building, Broadway......Luggage room downstairs which is very handy if you have time to kill before your return flight for last minute shopping (small fee). An ideal base for trip to New York, plenty of restaurants, pubs nearby including the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location but tired building”
Reviews.Author: Reuben-Kincaid
Reviews.Content: As some others have said it was a great location but terrible property. You felt like you were in a hospital that was refurbed into a hotel. Its hard to get your head around the price in New York for what you get and this hotel was no exception. Luckily we were only there to sleep and were out most of the 4 days we were there. If your into enjoying the hotel, this isnt the place. It was little more than a glorified backpackers.

Reviews.Title: “"DISGUSTING FILTHY DUMP" DONT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: Tullalah
Reviews.Content: JUST RETURNED FROM HERE AND WOULD NOT WISH ANYONE ELSE TO GO TO THIS HORROR HOTEL!! Arrived early but was told if room ready we could check in (this lady was probably the only person who was responsive and civilised) we never saw her again - probably because she had been civilised - unfortunately room was not ready and asked to come back at 3pm and room would then be available. Returned just after 3pm to a 45 minute wait to check in again only to be told room was still not ready. Sent to another room which had not been cleaned, back to reception spent another 40-50 minutes while reception looked for another room. We were finally found a room. On leaving the grand but dingy entrance hall we were greeted by an equally dingy room. The furniture was so cumbersome and outdated I thought we had travelled back in time!!!!! The room was in desperate need of being decorated with paintwork peeling, walls peeling, ceiling was badly stained from some sort of leak in the past, carpet was covered in stains, bathroom was disgusting - so disgusting we didnt even want to leave our worn clothes on the floor to take a shower let alone sit on the toilet. The bath was chipped and dont think had been cleaned in months and not sure if the bath was orignally white but so old had discoloured to yellow, shower curtain was ripped and falling apart. One window looked out onto another room but the windows were so filthy inside and out you didnt need to draw the curtains as you couldnt see out and no one could see in(although the curtains did match on this window) the other window looked out onto the street was equally dirty but the curtains didnt match on this window!! The BED was not a KING as we had booked and am not sure it was even a double it was so tiny width and length ways - my husband feet hung over the edge (hes only 5'10'') by morning we ended up with the sheets and blanket in the middle of the bed as every time you moved everything slid everywhere ( I dont think the sheets were wide enough for this tiny bed. We had one bedside table but no lamps just one across the room (no electricity sockets near bed) Having been to NY before we did try to book Grand Union which is were we would normally stay but this time fully booked so opted for this - Never ever again - if this was the only hotel left in NY then I just wouldn't go - Its a disgusting filthy rotton dump of a building that either needs knocking down or renovating and as for the staff apart from the one lady who originally dealt with us on reception and the 2 at the information desk I dont think anyone else there had any idea of manners and seemed more interested in keeping the customer waiting than helping in any way.

Reviews.Title: “good value for location bad service from staff”
Reviews.Author: Divil
Reviews.Content: just back from a great time in NYC only 2 warnings to give... No.1 My wife suffers with bad clostrphobia and can not use elevators, I know New York is full of high rise hotels but I expected that there would be some give on problems such as these, I contacted the hotel one month before and requested the lowest floor possible explaining my wifes problem i was willing to upgrade if needs be. The hotel got back to me noting the issue on my booking. On arrival I went to the desk and spoke to Natalie?? tall girl with forign accent she was very abrupt towards me when i asked about the reqest stating the only floor available was the 8th room 805A I asked how we can get to it by stairs and she ranted on about seeing security. We were told to wait at a exit door and it was opened I had to heave 2 suit cases up 20 flights of stairs which nearly killed me. myself and my wife had to come to an arrangement so that she only had to go to the room twice a day to avoid exhaustion. No.2 Do not go near TGI Fridays on W 34th street they charge the most for a meal i have ever paid in my life 2 drinks 1 shared starter and a main course each $150.00 + $23.00 tip expected for a service that was worse then McDonalds

Reviews.Title: “Very convinient”
Reviews.Author: jcmontys
Reviews.Content: These was my second stay in Penn Hotel these year. Dont expect anything fancy, these is an old hotel. Check inn is always a problem, its always packed. But after a few waiting minutes everything is good. Excelent location infront of Madison Square Garden, a few blocks from the Fashion District and Times Square. Very good rate for NYC standards Ill defently try to use PH for my next trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as I thought”
Reviews.Author: kosmo1968
Reviews.Content: I did post a review here a month ago, however it never did show up. So here I go again. It was not as bad as I thought it would be, but if you are expecting anything better than a 2 star hotel, you will be disapointed. The building is very old and the owners have not spent the money just to keep up to average standards. We spent 6 nights here and the location is the best feature of this place, close to everything. It was clean enough, but not spotless, if that matters to you. We did arrive late at night, so check in was no problem, during the day you're not so lucky. My only major warning is to stay away from Lindy's Cafe in the hotel as it was a complete ripoff!! Breakfast for 3 was $56. Try Saborro's across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great start in New York”
Reviews.Author: Beebury1
Reviews.Content: We didnt get off to a great start in New York after being ripped off by an unlicensed taxi driver and having to pay $73 from JFK to Hotel Penn instead of the set price of $50 so we were not impressed! When we finally got there i was dreading what i had booked myself into after reading all the bad reviews but when i walked in i was like WOW! I thought the reception was lovely! Bit crowded but overall ok. We arrived around 4.30pm and there was no que to check in so i dont know what ppl are talking about saying get there early! No need. Staff friendly but abit distant which is ok becuase i dont like ingaging alot of conversation when im tired and jet lagged! Given key card for room and when we stepped out of the lift (which was fine, not dirty or cramped) the corridors were very basic but they didnt smell, they were warm and clean. We were in 4th floor. The werent colourful, but they are only corridors!! When i walked into our room thats when i thought, these ppl dont know what they are talking about! It was huge! Massive bed and tv! Very very clean and overall lovely! But again very basic and not colourful but who cares! In New York your outside all the time!!! For the price it was worth it! Small but adequate bathroom no blood on towels or any of that bollocks, maybe those ppl were just unlucky. Bed sheets clean, no bugs or stray hairs. Walls had a few scuff marks from shoes but again...dont be so bloody picky! Anyway i just want to clear up everyones doubts on this Hotel. Hotel Penn is absolutely fine, clean but basic, fresh but not colourful. Its very central, Penn station right opposite and will get you anywhere in Manhatten, loads of places to eat including the food court in the mall about 5 minutes away which has lovely shops. You couldnt choose a better Location or Hotel when staying in New York. Seriously, you just need a place to wash and put your head down, that clean and Hotel Penn can give you that! So dont worry!!!!!!!!! And you other reviewers are obviously really picky and would be better off in the Hilton or Ramada! Have a nice Holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: FishDublin_Ireland
Reviews.Content: It is nearly a year since I stayed in this hotel but was not a TripAdvisor member at that time. However, my experience was so bad I felt it necessary to post a review. The foyer is like a train station which is very un-inviting. You are assigned to your room of which I would say there are thousands, you get off the lift on your floor and are given the impression of a corridor of jail cells. Our room was so bad I would not even sit on the bed as I felt it was dirty. The bathroom was damp and the plaster was falling off the walls. It was raining heavily outside and I actually cried with the thought that I would have to spend the night in the hotel. My partner went back to reception and request that his credit card be credited as we were checking out. The receptionist did ask why and when told said the room could be upgraded but we would have to pay the extra cost. We did not stay!! The hotel has not redeeming features only that it is very centrally located. My advice is not to stay here, I have never been in or seen such a dreadful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, bad hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dj_jay_smith
Reviews.Content: While the location of the hotel and the services available around it can not be falted, we felt the hotel itself was sub standard. We had two seperate stays over 2 weeks and both times we had to wait a long time to check it, around 20-30mins. They had staff on the desk who were not polite, not friendly and didn't want to help at all. They also had staff sitting in the room behind reception doing nothing except gossiping but despite the queues would not help. On our second visit we were given a room which we found out had somebody already in it! On exchanging this for another we had the same thing yet again! So it took three attempts to get a room and we barely, on the second occasion got a mumbled "I am sorry about it". No eye contact, no explanation, and each time took 5 mins to sort out and meant that we had to take our luggage upstair 3 times! The room itself was a good size, as was the bed, TV and shower/bath. But the bathroom was small (yet we had a closet 1.5 times its size!) and everything was old with ground in dirt. The sheets had something underneath which was very slippery which meant that you woke up in a different place to the sheets in the morning. I will not suggest this hotel to anybody unless you have no other choice.

Reviews.Title: “It is THE perfect hotel for New York!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lachantelle
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 2 days stay in the Pennsylvania Hotel. We were reluctant after reading all the horrific critics on both this site and a Dutch site. Maybe because we came prepared or maybe due to the fact that it was supposed to be low-season (is there something like that in NY?!) everything was great! The check in maybe cost 15-20 minutes. Our watertab in the bathroom was broke and we called reception to check it. Almost immediately a repairman came! Even though it was a problem that could not be fixed in the 2 days we stayed we did not make a big deal about it. The hotel might not be too personal but what do you expect from one of the biggest hotels in New York?! If you ask for something, the staff is willing to help you at any time! The room we had was small but clean and comfortable! Even though being in the center of Manhattan no noise kept us up! The fact that is across the street from Madison Square Garden and around the corner of the Empire State, Broadway and Times Square made it the perfect place to stay! We can't wait to go back to the Big Apple and stay in the Pennsylvania Hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Expect to get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: SSHAW
Reviews.Content: Ok, so after reading all the below I was rather concerned about this hotel. We stayed here for 4 nights from the 25th of September and overall enjoyed our stay. On arriving at the hotel the lobby was lovely but we did have to wait about 45 mins before someone could check us in, there really slow on the desks and there's always a que. We stayed on the 15th floor and had a great view of the empire state building. When we got into our room it was very basic, a big (clean) bed, a tv and a randomly placed fridge. What I thought was the airconditioning unit turned out to be 4 big generators on the roof of the building next door, these were really noisey but did go off in the evening. The Bathroom: all I can say is it could have been better ... there was no plug in the bath, and the top of our toilet seat was filthy. We give the cleaners the benifit of the doubt but the next day it still hadn't been touch but they did manage to fold over the loo roll very nicely!! what the heck! We ended up cleaning ourselves. Everytime we took a shower the bath leaked leaving the floor soaking... luckly we had extra towels to put down. With this hotel you get what you pay for, the rooms are ok but if your just looking for somewhere to crash with a fantastic location I'd recommened it! Any questions just let me know.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy and overpriced even by midtown standards”
Reviews.Author: MetroNYCTraveler
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Pennsylvania a few times out of desperation. The rooms were filthy and the decor theme of the bathroom seemed to be "Mold-Mid Century". The beds leaved much to be desired. The only plus I could take out of this (other than not having to have a tetanus booster) was that the front desk was efficient and slightly friendly (I checked in very late, probably avoiding the rush) and the location is convenient to all mass transportation. I've learned my lesson though and now go a few blocks up to the Hilton Gerden on 8th. Worth the walk!

Reviews.Title: “No problems here”
Reviews.Author: BritishGreenhorn
Reviews.Content: This is a budget priced hotel, and as such offers, in my opinion, good value for money. I had previously stayed here many years ago, and had doubts about coming back after I saw some of the poor reviews it has been given. I need not have worried. There was a long line for check-in, but it was dealt with quickly. There are plenty of lifts, and they all work. The dark coloured furniture makes the rooms seem more crowded than they really are. My room was large, and spotlessly clean. The bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept in, and the bathroom looked brand new. This room was on the 11th floor and I didn't pay for any upgrades. The location of this hotel is hard to beat, and I will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gavdon49
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from our 4th stay at the Hotel Pennsylvania, I would like to say that we had no problems at all. Check-In was quick (even though we were early our room was ready). The staff were also very friendly. The room itself was on the 13th Floor and was in good condition, clean and everything was in working order. The Bar/Restaurant conected to the hotel served good food and was a good place to wind down after a hectic day in the city. I would recommend this hotel for people on a smaller budget due to its location and the fact that after four stays and no problems they must be doing somerthing right.

Reviews.Title: “Go big or go home...we found out”
Reviews.Author: beesir
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and five days...when we booked online we thought that we would take the 'superior' room thinking that it would be sufficient as we did not want to spend a lot of time in the room anyways...little did we know that it barely fit our luggage (which was not a lot)...also the bathroom looked like it was going to fall apart at anytime...we stayed in that room for 1 night and could not take anymore...so we upgraded to the Penn 5000 Club rooms....if you are ever going to stay at this hotel spend the extra cash and go to the Penn 5000 Club, the rooms are three times the size, sitting room with flat screen tv, desk, fridge, bedroom with flat screen tv and desk, and an actual bathroom....also you get a private check in, so you do not have to wait in line (which was always very long), the room also comes with continental breakfast (only on weekdays)...and use of the Penn 5000 Club room (if you are there on business)....also wanted to mention that they have a great luggage storage place in the basement, so if you have to check out earlier than you have to leave the city you can store luggage there for only a few dollars...overall once we upgrade I really liked the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Whatever you do don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: PAMinNY
Reviews.Content: Ugly, smelly, poor decor, poor lighting, got burned in the shower, the tv remote didn't work, overpriced, no wired or wireless in the rooms, felt unsafe in dark the hallways -- what more can I say. The ONLY redeeming quality was the staff. Absolutely the worst hotel I have ever stayed in...ever...anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “I do not know where they are hiding the rooms in the hotel pictures”
Reviews.Author: StephaniefromVA
Reviews.Content: The 1st room I was given was as small as a closet, mold and filth was every where and I was afraid to enter the bathroom I was so filthy. The second was was worst. It smelled and had dirt and dust all over the air conditioning system. I would like to know what the criteria is that this hotel have for assigning the good and bad rooms. I am sure that they know that most of their rooms are uninhabitable. I'll never stay at this place again. It should be condemed.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the Money we Paid”
Reviews.Author: Unit504
Reviews.Content: was a little worried about stay here but, the room we got, was all in order it was on the 3rd floor, it was basic but we wasn't expecting anything more as we was only gonna be sleeping in there and out for the rest of the time! Staff was friendly and helpful, We stay for 5 nights, and the loction to this hotel was perfect for us. With Penn Station & Madison Sq Garden right across the street on 7th ave, Macys up one block and walking distance to Time Square.

Reviews.Title: “Well!!!”
Reviews.Author: Myviews1112
Reviews.Content: Arrived at hotel an hour before check in opened. Receptionist was lovely and let us check in early without charging us anything extra. The lobby is amazing and very glamorous, i hoped the rooms would be the same. Our room was on the 13 floor and very basic, nothing like the lobby which had given me such a good impression. The air conditioning had been left on and although it was very warm outside the room was freezing, we then had to work out how to turn it off. Although the room was basic, it had been kept clean, needed to be updated though it was like i had been sent back in time. I have to say the best thing about the hotel was the location. If you dont have much cash and dont mind a very basic hotel, then i would suggest it as it is in an ideal place for sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Honest Review....Really Liked the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MadMax12345
Reviews.Content: This is a really honest review on this hotel. I booked this hotel for me and my boyfriend about 6 months ago. Since then I have been reading the reviews on the hotel and was so shocked at what I read. I contemplated booking other accommodation however this was a more expensive option. I was only staying for 1 week and just wanted a nice clean room to sleep in. When we got there on first impressions I was very impressed with the Lobby. We were 2.5 hrs early for check-in, however the staff were extremely friendly and polite and told us come back in half an hour. When we got checked in we went up to the rooms and I was pleasantly surprised when I saw our room. We were on the 6th floor. Our room was immaculate, you could not find fault with it. New furniture, bathroom spotless and it was very nice. The view was just of a building across the way which didnt bother me in the slightest. There was a huge tv. Our room was a superior king room and it honestly was just lovely. The cleaning staff were so polite and friendly always saying hello in the morning. Everyday the room was cleaned and fresh towels were put in the bathroom. The location of this hotel is unreal. You are smack bang in the centre of everything. I would definitely stay here again and I would reccommend it to anyone. If you want a really luxurious room this may not be the hotel for you but when your in NY your not there to sit in the room for the day. You ust want some where clean and safe to sleep. Please take this review into account as I was dreading going here having read the reviews for 6 months before hand....I was so surprised with what I saw, its a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel in Manhattan, no question”
Reviews.Author: JetSetScarlett
Reviews.Content: This hotel was smelly, dirty, disgusting and should be condemned. We had to switch rooms three times, (first one had no running water, second one had a leak in the ceiling) and even the third room was dirty, dingy and musty. I will never in my life stay at this hotel again and wouldn't wish an evening here on my worst enemy. To top it all off, I left a pair of expensive jeans in the closet and called a few hours after my departure and was told that they were not there. So some cleaning lady got very lucky that day.... I could go on and on about how terrible this experience was. Trust me, just stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure if we would go back”
Reviews.Author: mln
Reviews.Content: I think we would only go back to this hotel because of the location. We were going to a concert at Madison Square Garden, which was located across the street. Our check-in went great, but when we stepped off the elevator to our room on the 3rd floor we thought we were in a scary movie. Our room was clean, but really needed updating. There were too many other doors to other rooms....mold in the bathroom...exposed light fixtures on the ceiling..... The hotel is very busy, maybe there are other rooms that are better?

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel I have ever stayed in ! ! !”
Reviews.Author: GlennZA
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. The first room smelled strongly of sewer and was filthy. We ask to be moved and the second room that we moved too was even worse. It had electrical wires exposed at the baseboard. There were no light fixtures...bare bulb's. The hair dryer didn't work, the sheets didn't fit the bed and came off constantly. The room was very dirty, the aircondition unit had dust and debris in it and when you turned it on it blew all over the room. Security lock on the door was broken. No curtains on the windows. No smoke or fire detectors. This hotel is in need of serious updating and is presently a danger to your health and your life. I would not recommend ever staying in this hote. The date of our stay 9/11/07-9/12/07

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: ksugraduate
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for business and after reading the reviews I was terrified to see where I'd be living for the next 4 days. Surprisingly enough, I had a large room with two double beds on the 11th floor. It was a corner room with two windows, one of which framed the Empire State Building!! The bathroom was a bit small but was clean. The sheets appeared new as did the towels. The alarm clock and television appear new as well. The only cons are the noisy neighbors, which is out of my hands, and the loud AC. However, the AC drowns out the noise on the streets. I slept like a baby each night. If you have the money, spring for a more expensive room that includes access to the Penn 5000 Lounge. Free internet access and continental breakfast each morning. The staff was helpful as well. The hotel is in a great location and has many places to eat nearby. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Eusebio1970
Reviews.Content: I was sent to NYC on a rush on a business trip for three days, we booked at 11.30PM and our reservation was not in order, and the front desk service was less than helpfull, when we finally checked in, we find a dated room with a terrible smell of dampness, a lousy reception on the tv set, no remote, ditry carpets and a terrible view of the back of a building. Even when it was a business trip, we expected more for the US300 rate. Eusebio Balderas

Reviews.Title: “not bad .....although”
Reviews.Author: newryman
Reviews.Content: Having read some reviews about this hotel I was worried as I had already booked it for 3 nights for the 6th to the 9 of August. Before I left Ireland I e-mailed the hotel and voiced my concerns about the hotel that i read in the Trip Advisor I also asked for an early check in as I would be arriving around 12 noon,and I also requested a room on the 12th or 15 floor as they seemed to have got good reviews.I got a reply from a Barry Rauch who is in front of house operations,he told me that everything would be alright as they have 1700 rooms and the amount of complaints were minuscule and if their was a room ready at 12 noon that I could have it, Well I got to the hotel and the length of the queue was 20 feet long there was no indication if the queue was for checking in or out as their was only 1 person dealing with everybody,their was a good few areas with reception written over them with people behind the counter and nobody was going over to them,so I went over to 1 of them ,the man behind the counter informed me that the long queue was the one for check in i started to walk away when he called me back and told me that he would check me in it took about 3 minutes ( Happy days) I asked for twin beds and got them and he then gave me the key,when i got to the 5th floor room it was dreary but ok !the bathroom was clean and the towels were okish! the bed was clean I pulled back the covers and inspected the sheets and they were clean the only trouble with the room was the dreariness if they got proper lighting in the room it would be a big help,the fridge was working but you had to unplug either the tv or the table lamp in order to plug it in.Small things can ruin a stay and I feel that this is the problem with this hotel also avoid the restaurant in the bar at the back of the hotel breakfast was 29$ for 2 eggs and 2 rashers it was daylight robbery we got better breakfasts for half the price elsewhere, also Lindy's at the front of the hotel, we went in one night at 9.30 and the waitress gave us the menu and took a drinks order she came back with the drinks and then told us that the kitchen was closed but we could get snacks at the bar !! we upped and left and told her to keep the drinks! now down to business ,would I stay in this hotel again ?? yes I would it has a great location and the hotel itself is not that bad the 2 restaurants are probably franchised out so the hotel probably have no control over them I might have been lucky but I can honestly say that the hotel was jam packed and if it is as bad as some of the reviewers are saying then that would not be the case! getting a good room in an hotel is a bit like getting a good seat with leg room on an aeroplane if you don't ask for it you wont get it I had no cause to complain when I was their so I cannot comment on the response from the staff but any body I was in contact with were courteous I was travelling with my wife

Reviews.Title: “Overrated and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: jaygeeb
Reviews.Content: Location was good but it is not value for the money. We stayed three nights – at an average of US$275/night for one room. We were late arriving by train into Penn station and had no hotel booked and it was the first one we saw. We were too tired to bother trying elsewhere even when we heard the price. The hotel pictures online do not tell the real story. The lobby is impressive but it deteriorates from there. Our room was dingy (but clean) down the end of a long corridor on the 8th floor. Bathroom fittings were antiquated and need upgrading. Noise from night time roadworks and traffic was disturbing. The lesson is do more homework and book in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: stalbans1
Reviews.Content: I live in NY but stayed here with my mom while she was in town for a conference. We didn't have any plans for the weekend except ordering room service and a movie. We could handle the fact that HP doesn't have room service but our remote control didn't work so we couldn't order a movie. I called the desk 3 times before they sent someone up an hour later. When he brought a new remote, we found that it didn't work either. To make matters worse, the cable kept going out (it wasn't due to weather). We also found blood stains on the sheets and stains on the towels. However, it is a good location and has fast elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad”
Reviews.Author: RueVavin
Reviews.Content: Booked 8/30/07 for 5 nights at $135/night. I was ready for a very horrible experience after reading all the negative comments online. Our experience was not that bad. Of course, I was not expecting the W Hotel for the price we got. Though the room was old, we had clean carpet, clean bathroom, clean sheets and towels, good pressure on hot/cold water. Annika of the front desk was especially helpful and charming. Wait was one minute to check in.. around 5:00 PM. Of course, I saw a little paint peeling in the hallway, some in the baseboards of our room, but I've seen worse in Europe. We had a great view of 33rd Street/Old Navy. The best selling point of the hotel is the PERFECT LOCATION that can't be beat. We basically stayed in the hotel to sleep/shower/change clothes from midnight/early morning till abut 9:00 AM. The Hotel Penn is not a resort. It is just what it is... a hotel where one sleeps at night. For those who expect paradise, go to the W Hotel or Waldorf Astoria, stay inside, and forget leaving the building.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Pennsylvania was great for me!”
Reviews.Author: FLLovetotravel
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here July 28th-August 01, 2007 and we liked this hotel. We stayed for 4 nights and the total was $574.00, we booked through hotels.com. As everyone says it is in a GREAT location! We got there at about 3:30 and check-in only took less than 10 minutes. The lobby was pretty busy and had a lot of people in it all the time. The front desk was very friendly any time that we had to talk to them. We called down to the front desk soon after we got there and asked for extra towels and pillows and they brought them up right away. Our room was pretty small, but it was clean and the bathroom was clean too. I had no problems with this hotel. I would stay at this hotel again next time we vacation in NYC. For the price, it was awesome and we had a great time!!

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: In_love_in_NY
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Pennsylvania August 25th-27th. He booked the room and told me afterwards where we were going to stay. I was concerned because I read alot of reviews. I had e-mailed the Hotel staff prior to our arrival and expressed some of my concerns that I had read from other visitors to their hotel. I received a response in less then 24 hours from a Customer Service specialist and she reassured me that our stay would be a pleasant one. I had asked to have a King size bed and a more updated room. She said she was able to accomodate my requests and she said she was sure our stay there would be a pleasant one. There were three people on duty at the check in counter. I did wait about 20 minutes to check in (there were alot of people checking in). The staff was very friendly however. With 1700 rooms I think there should be more staff checking people in but expect to pretty much always be a line when you have a hotel that big. Our room hadn't been vacuumed I don't think. But other than that it was fine. Our AC didn't crank out too much cold air. But it was enough to keep us comfortable. I could care less about the view. We didn't have one and that was fine with me! Our bedding was clean. I did check the matress for bed bugs first thing! The matress looked brand new. Our bed was comfortable and our bathroom was clean! It was a typical hotel room. Not extra ordinary and nothing to complain about! We did enjoy our fridge too. The location was amazing and I loved it! We had a great time and we said when we go back we will ask for that room again! My advice contact the hotel ahead of time to let them know if you are concerned. That seemed to help in our case!

Reviews.Title: “Such a dump- room made me cry :-(”
Reviews.Author: aberdeenlass1903
Reviews.Content: I cried when i got to our room. We complained and were given an upgrade but it really put a damper on our trip. The room was dirty dingy smelled of damp and the bathroom-eughh!! I was impressed by the photos of the grand lobby thats why i booked- nice surprise for my boyfriend-NOT!! The upgraded room was bigger and cleaner but still in desperate need of a make over. The hotel owners need to spend their money on rooms not fancy marble(which was lovely in the lobby by the way!) I didnt spend a minute longer than we had to in the hotel and it was a real let down. The "candid photos" taken by other travellers in the hotel were exactly what we faced. Horrible. It was about £120 a night for 2 people and you can get a much nicer place elsewhere in New york so unless you are guarenteed a newly decorated room- do not go there!!

Reviews.Title: “It got worse (4th time here)”
Reviews.Author: matthijst
Reviews.Content: We've been here for 4 times. The first two stays were perfect: large, newly renovated rooms. The last time we were here (februari '07) the room was extremely small and not as clean (seemed like the renovation had worn off). This time I asked for a big room upon checkin, which the clerk said we would get. Well, we didn't: same small room, same worn bathroom. Since checkin already took about 1 hour (you have to stand in line for that long!) I didn't bother to ask for another room. Service seems to have degraded over time: no more free morning newspapers, and when the TV remote didn't seem to work, a guy came to change the batteries, which didn't help, since it was broke. He just shrugged and said: "well, OK", and walked off... We asked for an extra pillow, which the maid supervisor said we would get, but we didn't get one and had to ask again around 22:00... In-room internet didn't work: the cable was there, the TV had a screen saying: "press menu to access internet". So, back to the concierge, wait another 1 hour in line, just to be told: "If it doesn't work, it doesn't work". It looks like the rumours of a future demolition of the hotel are causing the staff to care less and less for their guests. If you go here, just don't expect anything, except for a stay in The Greatest City in the World, then you'll be fine. We'll probably give Ramada New Yorker another try though, as it's almost in the same location.

Reviews.Title: “Pennsylvania, bye-bye”
Reviews.Author: Sarment0
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pensylvania Hotel from Aug7th/Aug16th inst. and it wasn't a good experience. Everything is difficult at this huge monster of a hotel. The reception is indifferent and there are huge lines everytime you need any information or help from the staff. They even locked our doors one day because we had used the room telephone and I had to go back to the reception 3 times to have someone come and open my room for me. I don't recommend to anyone over 25 since it is quite like a hostel and not a hotel as they claim to be.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews made me nervous,turned out fine”
Reviews.Author: LVRick
Reviews.Content: I knew the location was great,but reviews had me a bit nervous.Check out many web sites,found a good deal on NYC Tourist web site for club 5000 room for $157 night for 4 nights. Arrived at 11:30am after overnight flight,lobby a madhouse,but club 5000 has seperate check in area,no line,given keys and room right away,king and not 2 double I reserved but it worked out. Room was small,old,but clean enough.Bathroom older,smallish,but also clean enough and functional.Asked maid for extra towels,she gave and had in extra in room rest of visit.A/C worked just enough to keep room comfortable.View of other wing of hotel,but didn't care.TV in cabinet with 3 drawers,which is what you get..Brown carpet,a bit worn,but no ill effects on white socks.Never heard sound from nieghbors.Also in the room is a desk and a office chair and small lounge chair.I was happy with housekeepings service. Club 5000 offersbreakfast,bagels,muffins,danish,numerous coffees and tea's and apples or oranges.Two computors with printer also available on floor in club room.I would look to go at least with Club 5000 as some I met didn't seem to be satisfied with their situations at the Hotel.Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Worst place in the world”
Reviews.Author: RaquelCayey
Reviews.Content: The holes in the curtains were bigger than the windows, We sleep with the open a little because it was broken. We found little "friends animals" in bed. Reception desk employees need training badly to work with people. The conforters were so old, it has holes. Painting work done in the bathroom were very cheap. Workers should be supervise when doing this work, door borders and hangers were painted with the same wall paint, instead of being change. In the morning water in the sink were red.

Reviews.Title: “Basic and good”
Reviews.Author: EconomyClass078
Reviews.Content: This is a huge hotel that seems to cater to international tourists. A bit impersonal but to be expected for a hotel of this size. Rooms are very basic but seemed clean although they are very small. Directly across from Penn Station so there is no need to worry about any transportation problems...you are in the middle of New York City and can easily visit on foot all of the great sights (Empire State Building is an 8 minute walk). The downside was that on the night I checked in there was a long wait (around 7:00 PM) to check in but everyone was friendly behind the desk. Hotel is a bit noisy if you are not used to the sounds of the city. There are loads of restaurants around and options pretty much around the clock. A good point about being across from Penn Station is that you can easily reach the hotel with the AirTrain/LIRR trains from JFK airport. There are definitely much more luxurious accomodations in New York but if you are looking for basic at a good price then you have the right place and will not be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Never Judge a Book By It's Cover-- Lesson Learned”
Reviews.Author: GTtraveler
Reviews.Content: Are the pictures on their website actually from this Hotel? Or did they go across the street and take some of the Crown Plaza? Our Story--- Upon arriving at the Hotel Penn, we we're greeted with a very well maintained and decorated lobby. Our hopes were high, did we find a hotel in New York worth staying in that wasn't over $800 per night? Our hopes were high as we stood in the lengthy line to reach the check in desk, which they were only running one clerk, but maybe it was break time we hoped. Finally we arrived at the counter, and going through the check in process, as we were about to procure our key, we are told the rooms are not ready. We're ok with this, we are about five minutes early for check in time (3:00). So we all run down to McDonalds and pick up a burger, about forty minutes later we return to again check in. Another wait, only to find out they still are not ready. Is this clerk the same person cleaning the rooms? Or maybe that is where all the other clerks are. We then sit in the lobby, with about a hundred other weary travelers, for another hour. Finally, after another line, we are ready to check in, and we check in! The cleaning Lady (no 's noted), has done her job. Boarding the elevator we are somewhat pleased with the overall quality of the facilities thus far, only if we knew what awaited us when those doors parted. Arriving on the 7th floor, the elevator doors began to open. Immediately the smell of mold and musk rushed into the elevator. The air must be really dense up here. Stepping out into the hallway we are immediately threw back in time to yesterday, no yesteryear, no yester-decade!!!! Walking down the hallway it takes me a few minutes to realize we are indeed still in the 21st century, and this is in fact not an episode of The Twilight Zone! We enter our room, and spend ten minutes making sure we are in the right hotel, that we didn't mistakingly go down a few extra blocks to the YMCA. We sit down on the Beds (after thourghly inspecting the sheets), to turn on the television. After numerous clicks of the remote, and then trying the buttons on the television itself, my friend kicks the Television Stand out of frustration, and much to our surprise it finally comes on!! Granted we can't change the channel, but the Chinese guy giving a lecture about Science is better than a black screen. We call the front desk to report or small inconvenience, "Someone will be right up" they say. Over an hour later we call back, "Someone should have already came up there, I'll call them again". Thirty minutes later someone finally shows up with a very poor looking television and a handful, no a sack full of remote controls. He tries all of the Remote Controls and finally finds one that works! Yay, we can change the Channel!!! Shower time, the first of our travelers goes to the shower, fifteen minutes later he comes out and the water is still running. "You can't turn the water off" we get from him. So we all have to leave the water running in order to take showers. We are finally able to get it to shut off after we all finish. Though it was not an easy endeavor. Time to get ready for the Play. We open up the Ironing Board. Ok, we try to open it. The ironing board is broken and will not stand up. We call the front desk, but remembering our earlier experience we head down to our other Friends room and borrow theirs. Pulling the Iron out to being ironing, guess what!! The iron doesn't work! So we call the front desk again. An hour later we get it from them. Needless to say... DON'T BELIEVE THE PHOTOS!!! They Photo shopped them or Stole Them from Another Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Listen to the bad reviews, we didn't”
Reviews.Author: emperorsclothes
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews on Trip Advisor and thought people were just being picky. Wrong!!! Please don't stay here. Learn from our mistake. This would be a great room to film a horror movie. The only thing missing from the decrepit ambiance was a chalk outline of a body on the nasty carpeting in our room! The maids are nice and try to keep it up, but everything is so beat up it is impossible. The Front Desk staff have obviously lost their will to live, considering that everyone in line was unhappy. What a shame to have to work in such a dump. The guys in the baggage check were nice (yes, it was $30 for them to keep our bags for 3 hours). I know it is possible for an older hotel to be renovated, but the cheap jerks that own this place just don't give a rat's [--]! Do yourself a favor, spend a little more and get a decent room. Don't say we didn't warn you.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Hotel, basic rooms”
Reviews.Author: erodgerssecl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is huge! Some floors are more modern than others. we got one of the old style rooms. Very very basic but our room was cleaned every day. Would return, but i think the price has risen since our stay so i would probably get a nicer place for the same price elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade if you can”
Reviews.Author: clarabell_55
Reviews.Content: I know it was a while since i stayed there but i know people who have recently returned and i dont think it has changed at all! We arrived in Dec, obviously very very busy. Many people had been double booked had no rooms, so i think on that account we were lucky. The lobby was beautiful, all marble and shiney, the lifts recently refurbished with TV's in them, we thought we had dropped on. Then we got to our floor think it was 15 or something, it was like a different hotel! It was in urgent need of decoration, it smelt musty, and the carpets were rotten. The only thing new was the door locks, which had been changed to the swipe card type. We opened the door to the room and it didn't improve. The floor very dirty, couln't walk around without shoes on. Couldn't see out of the window as it was that dirty. The bathroom however was dated but it had been cleaned i could smell bleach and it became bareable. I checked the bed and the linen was clean also. It was a base, in an ideal location for all the attractions but i am glad we only stayed 3 nights. The room was that grotty i slept with the light on each night as i was convinced the cockroaches would come out (a couple of months earlier and i believe they would, think we were only saved by the cold weather). During our stay we visited a couple of other floors, many the same but a couple obviously recently refurbished and quite nice. As some of the other people have said they thought it was ok but they had upgraded. If you have booked i would urge you to upgrade when you get there or even stay somewhere else. If it had not been 2 weeks before christmas i would of gone and booked into another hotel and paid twice, only everywhere was booked. I would not recommend it at all as there are hotels for similar price nearer times square etc... this is what i have learned since, i have also learned to fully research where i am staying in future without booking first!

Reviews.Title: “Fab Vacation just upgrade to Club level”
Reviews.Author: tanmit
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the middle of it all! And it offers affordable rooms. We upgraded to a Club Level room which are on the top two floors of the hotel. We had breakfast with great food/coffee/internet, inc in the upgrade. Also our room had two fab views and windows one of the Empire State Building. The check in was excellent and when our TV wouldn't work we were helped by hotel staff instantly and effectively. I would and will stay again at this old world hotel. The lobby is beautiful and grand and our room was large and clean. I don't know why people are complaining about chipping paint and green towels. I liked my stay and the hotel and had a great experience here. We left or luggage with the hotel after check out to sightsee some more and everything was in order. I got more then I expected and had a great stay here. I suggest you upgrade your room for a slight upcharge the breakfast and lounge itself is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “loved it...”
Reviews.Author: sammo26
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the penn it was okay you get what you pay for some of the reviews on here are a bit over the top.. central to manhattan on seventh ave no problems at all for us if you are going to the penn judge it for yourself...
