Reviews.Title: “not worth the location”
Reviews.Author: kaz1978
Reviews.Content: our fears were justified after reading reviews! I was prepared for the worst and got it, a 4th floor hovel, I couldn't believe that it passed health and safety checks. As I opened the door I saw an unmade bed, dressing table covered in litter and make-up, overflowing litter bin and carrier bags on floor. The air con was off wall and a shout from my husband told me he had found the bathroom! Disgusting does not give a true picture!! Blackened tiles and the toilet had excretement in it that looked like it had been there a week! We returned to the desk where I must admit the girl was very apologetic and gave us a room on the 13th floor which although very old was clean. Even though the location was excellent I would not stay there again.. and where are these renovated rooms???? Karen. Durham.England

Reviews.Title: “Slum In The City”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghEuan
Reviews.Content: We recently had the misfortune of staying at this hotel. We queued for almost an hour to check in. When we finally got our room, it was dirty, wall paper was peeling off the walls; it smelled strongly of smoke despite it being a non-smoking room; and the cold water tap didn't work - the only redeeming features of the hotel were the location and the price....

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, mediocre hotel”
Reviews.Author: questo
Reviews.Content: My teenaged daughter and I stayed at the Hotel Penn for 4 nights during the 4th of July holiday. This is our second trip to the city from the West Coast. During our last stay we stayed at a hotel on the Upper West Side. Since we were looking for a more central location, we chose the Hotel Penn. You can't beat the location of this hotel. It is smack dab in the center of everywhere you want to go. The subway is literally 2-3 minutes away. The hotel itself, I would rate as a 2 1/2 star hotel. We arrived early and had to leave our bags in the luggage room in the basement until our room was ready. They charge $8.00 per bag which I was not particularly happy about. When we returned later that day to check in, the room I had requested was not available, so we settled for a room w/ 2 twin beds overlooking the avenue. We were up on the 13th floor. The room was quiet (considering we were overlooking the avenue) and was adequate sizewise. There was a refrigerator, desk and chest of drawers. THe beds were o.k. The bathroom was a decent size, however there was some mold in the shower/tub area. This is an old hotel and could use a total remodel. However, the rate we paid was very reasonable considering what one usually has to pay for hotel rooms in New York. I would stay here again, only because of it's location, not for the rooms or ammenities.And besides, who goes to New York to stay in the room? We were gone all day shopping and sightseeing and at night out to Broadway shows.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying at a Morgue”
Reviews.Author: travelman9
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so bad that it inspired me to write my first review warning all of you who are considering it. The hallways leading to the room were dark and dingy and I felt like we were in a Morgue. The room and hallways are extremely musty, and the stench in the air was almost intolerable. I would bet that the rooms have not been updated since the 1950's which wouldn't matter much to me, although the curtains, carpet, and bedding all appeared to be 20+ years old. The paint on the walls was coming off, and the air conditioner barely worked. The blanket on the bed actually had holes in it, and the bedspread was soiled. I was actually concerned when I went to plug my cell phone into the outlet, as they looked so old that the though of electrocution came into my mind. My kids were walking around in the room in their bare feet, and after about an hour their feet were black. We had friends staying here as well, so we visited their room and it was basically the same setup and highly disappointing experience. If you are a college student or a young traveler, these things may not bother you, but if you have children or are a couple please take my advice and look elsewhere. Even if you get a great deal it is not worth it. I normally do not care too much about hotel rooms as I don't spend much time in them other than sleeping, but I can honestly say that I was counting the hours until I could get up and leave this place.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: bexvena
Reviews.Content: Simple rooms, good location. 1st room we were given has not been cleaned and a tiny room. When we complained we were then given a smoking room. Electricity in the room a bit dodgy, plugs and hairdryer hanging out the wall... visible wires but perfect location, times square within walking distance... right next to Macy's and the Empire State building... tube station very close so can get about anywhere easily!!! and perfect for what we wanted... we were there to see New York not the hotel room! Went for my 21st and had the most fantastic time ever!

Reviews.Title: “Pennsylvania Hotel positive review!”
Reviews.Author: Neilboy
Reviews.Content: Travelled to New York for fun weekend break with brother hoping to see all the sights of the big apple so a good location to base ourselves was a high priority. We had read reviews on this hotel and were a bit worried. However, we found that although the hotel rooms are very basic, they are clean, secure and we found no major problem. The location of the hotel is the best thing though-it is centrally located in manhatten and in easy reach of all means of travel. Everything you could want is in the immediate area (as is probably the case with anything in new york!). So basically, don't believe all the negative reviews that you may have heard about this hotel-if you are unhappy with your room, apparently the staff are more than happy to relocate you to another room; so just ask. But like I have said, we were more than happy.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: jadapespa
Reviews.Content: At last we developed the Pennsylvania Hotel mistery (for us), it wasn't a nigthmare, we had really good time. We knew that we weren't going to a Florida's new hotel. We booked through Expedia. Our reservation had no problems. Raymond let us check in an hour early. Room 1134, Club Penn 5000 was not a Marriot one, this is an old tourist hotel, but exceeded our expectations: Yes it's old and a little dark, but clean, always smells clean and new, good beds, no bugs, new linens, a new TV, fridge, enough space, desk, robe, free newspaper, etc, etc,as you see in the hotel's site. We received all that they offered. There's no exclusive elevator now for the Penn 5000 but who needs it....they are plenty of fast elevators. They did the room daily. The bathroom: Tube needs paint, but you have hot water, plenty of soft towels, shampoo,rinse, mouth wash,body lotion, blower, etc Complementary continental breakfast (excellent), plenty of all kind of coffee, there's two complementary pc's with free internet. On Tv you had NBC or a news channel. Safe boxes at the front desk, vending machines, etc,etc The most important : Very nice and helping people in a superb location. People, if you want a safe, clean and a good location hotel, just for to charge batteries to enjoy NYC, paying best fares than others in Manhattan you must stay at de Club Penn 5000. If you are looking for a fancy place, go get it and pay it.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Star!”
Reviews.Author: schnauzerlady
Reviews.Content: We booked a Penn 5000 room -- and the dedicated check-in process went quite smoothly. However, for those who had not paid the extra charge for the "premium" rooms, the line for the standard rooms was not a pretty sight. I have yet to find out how --other than the quick check-in and the access to the club room-- the "premium" rooms differed from the standard. Both the rooms we had --the first had no phone service, so we asked for a transfer; the second was missing light bulbs-- were small and well worn. These are premium rooms? The only redeeming feature is that hotel staff responded quickly to our "comments"; unfortunately they were totally unable to help us. When we were there, there were two computers in the club room -- both loaded with pornography. The club room TV was on the WB, and no one from the hotel could find a remote, or other way, to change the channel. The hotel's website indicates that there is not only a a separate check-in but also a separate elevator ([--]). We asked and asked, but we never found anyone who had heard of the separate elevator service. I've seen reports that the Penn is scheduled to be demolished to make way for an office complex. I would hate to see this happen; however, I would also hate to see the Penn continue to operate as it has in the past few years. It's time for the Penn, and its owners, to either fish or cut bait. Either they should restore this hotel to its glory days or they should consign it to the dust heap.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't That bad”
Reviews.Author: derno
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in July and it wasn't as bad as everyone is saying. We asked for a view of the empire state building, they had no trouble in doing so. Check-in line took about 5-10 mins. Room was clean and didn't smell, even though it was a smoking room. Great Location!!! In the center of everything awesome. I had a great stay at this hotel. Only complaint: I would have liked internet in the rooms instead of having to go down to the lobby where there was 5 seats to connect to the internet.

Reviews.Title: “do not go here KIP is not the word”
Reviews.Author: EgyptJen
Reviews.Content: im only back from NYC and we booked the pennsylania hotal , please please please dont stay here. there is urine on the walls and on the floors the beds are stained and the smell is HORRIFIC , I WOULD NOT PUT A DOG IN THIS SO CALL HOTEL.. if you have booked to go there i would advised you to cancel NOW! I spoke to the manager and he couldn care less. we walked out and never got a refund $700.00 dollers for 3 nights a joke . please dont go here you will be sick. jennifer ireland

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel for central Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: SallyKGuernseyUK
Reviews.Content: Having read some terrible reviews of this hotel, I was very nervous about going there with my teenage daughter. I needn't have been. Yes, the hotel is old and a bit dated, but it was perfectly clean, although there was some rust on the fitting under the sink. However, rust is not dirt. We were not in one of the refurbished rooms and so the furniture was quite old but everything worked - TV, air con, all lights, hairdryer, etc. The shower was brilliant. We actually stayed on 2 separate occasions, on our way to and from Niagara Falls, the rooms were on different floors but both were perfectly acceptable. All the staff were helpful and there were plenty of places to eat. The location was brilliant, right opposite Penn Station (where you can get the Air Train to Newark) and just a few minutes walk from Times Square, Empire State, Macy's, Manhattan Mall etc. This is not an expensive hotel and travellers must accept that not everything will be shiny new but we had no problems and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Nightmare on 7th Avenue! Please stay away from it!”
Reviews.Author: Fer_Traveler
Reviews.Content: We are from Mexico City, sorry if our English is not perfect. It was our first visit to NYC and the experience in this hotel was terrible (to say the least). Check-in line was very long and took us about 40 minutes to get our key. Lobby looked old, dirty and seemed always crowded. We stayed at a room in the 12th floor and it was so dark that I had to buy a light bulb because the one in the lamp didn't provide enough illumination. The carpet was very old and dirty. The view from our little tiny window was an alley and another very old and tall building, preventing daylight to enter the room. Room was small and there was no space for our suitcase. The high amount paid for this scary and creepy hotel felt like a robbery. I have been to Manhattan after that and didn't stay in this hotel. We definitely won't recomend it to our friends and relatives, in fact we discourage them to stay here. DO NOT trust the pictures shown in the hotel's website. They have nothing to do with the reality!!! A much better option for budget travelers staying in NYC is the Holiday Inn Express a few blocks away from MSG and the Pennsylvania Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The worst”
Reviews.Author: brandi77
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the worst place on Earth. The room was very old and dirty. The bothroom did not have a hair dryer, the towels were stained, and the window in the bathroom was open and would not close.The furniture was very out dated and did not look like the pictures on the website. After complaining they offered us another room where the window would not close and when we attempted to close the window it fell out. The lobby is a mess and crowded with lots of children who were traveling with high school groups. There is no security and anyone was allowed to take the elevator up. Overall this place is not worth the money you will save. If you want to enjoy your trip to New York spend the extra money and stay in a nice clean place.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Dreadful”
Reviews.Author: adamsalkeld
Reviews.Content: Someone once said to me "no-where does seedy quite like New York". I never believed it, always had a great time in NYC hotels at all prices. That was until last week at the Pennsylvania. I was over an hour in line for check-in - I have never had that anywhere in the world, even Soviet Russia. Then the room...cramped, dirty, peeling walls, broken furniture, scuzzy shower. I don't know whether I had a view or not because the windows were so filthy. The hotel sells itself as "the World's most popular hotel" I don't get the joke. Please don't stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad.”
Reviews.Author: ShadyJones
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews here I was expecting the worst, but it really wasn't that bad, although the hotel is very old and run down. The service was excellent. When we got there there was a bit of a line waiting to check in so a very nice young lady took us to the business check-in desk even though were just staying in a standard room, so check in was fast and easy. We got a very large room on the 15th floor, which was OK, but somewhat marked by years of wear and tear. The hot water in the shower wouldn't turn off completely, the TV remote worked a bit erraticly and the door lock would sometimes stick open so we would have to giggle the door knob a bit in order for the door to lock. But the room was very clean and the bedding looked absolutely new and spotless each day. And that was most important to us, since we were out sightseeing most of the days anyway. If you are expecting luxury you'll be very dissappointed with this hotel because the standard is low. If you're on a budget it's an OK place to stay and it's in a very good location.

Reviews.Title: “good location - too pricy!”
Reviews.Author: Italiansinireland
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this Hotel only to people who really don't care about the condition of the room and just look for a good location. The Hotel is opposite to Madison Square garden and you can go everywhere from Penn station... the NON-service and the crazy price are too bad to make a good recommendation for this HOTEL. I was told from a friend of mine that the Hotel had bad old rooms and new ones, so we should have asked for a nicer room in case the first one was bad.... of course for the price, 200$ per night we wanted a nice room, instead we got a crappy one... people at the desk are machine, no human at all, we changed room 3 times before I started speaking in spanish with a guy who at the end upgrated our room for free so we stayed 9 nights in a nice room, otherwise it would be an HORRIBLE experience... the standard room are stinky, dirty and OLD, no wardrobe... TERRIBLE! They didn't want to keep us the upgraded room for the last night, because we had a different reservation for the lst night, so we had to check in together, so even tough they had our room still free, they gave us the [--] room for the lst night! UNBELIEVABLE!

Reviews.Title: “What a terrible start to the holiday”
Reviews.Author: harmsy
Reviews.Content: We arrived late from Toronto having had flight problems and hold ups. Despite our room being booked months in advance, they obviously don't allocate rooms to individuals, so we were really surprise d to be given a room with dirty carpet, dirty bathroom, broken TV, half the light bulbs were missing, broken air conditioning, etc. This was our most expensive hotel in a trip around north america - we would NEVER go back to New York again, as this experience ruined our holiday. We asked to move rooms (in fact, my wife and I were celebrating our 2nd wedding anniversary, my wife was in tears) and they moved us to a room with a single bed - but at least the TV worked. We asked to move back to our original room as we really needed a double bed. Crashing into bed to sleep, we were surprised that the fitted sheet didn't fit - our feet were on the matress. This hotel is HUGE and is hugely underinvested. They hadn't updated the decor in any of the 3 rooms we stayed in (they moved us on our second day to a barely 20th century room - I've stayed in better hotels in the 3rd world!) for 30+ years. They probably hadn't cleaned the rooms for a decade either. In short: do not stay at this hotel until they spend just a small amount of money on it. A complete and utter rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Okay Price.”
Reviews.Author: Charm20
Reviews.Content: The location is GREAT! Right Across from Madison Square Garden, close to Subways, lots to see in the area around the Hotel. With that Said, now we booked our Hotel about a month in advance online, asked for 2-Double Beds, we arrived at 5:15 p.m. and no double beds available and the staff didn't care at all to accomodate us in anyway, it was all no, no, no... It was three of us to a room so we really needed double beds and nope no matter how much we complained or whatever nothing doing, so we ended up with a King Size Bed. Now the Room is probably the smallest room I have ever seen, but it was clean and I guess that is what matters most. We were on the 12th floor I would say stay up as high as possible.. Again the room is very, very tiny, and the air conditiioner didn't work that well and it is very hot in June but again the room was clean and neat, the hotel was nice and neat but the Staff well the two clerks we encountered at check in had the worst attitudes I have ever came in contact with. Would I stay again, yes the location is Great... But upon check out one of my friends did get a chance to visit the Affinia Hotel which is about 2 minutes away and she said the rooms were nice and huge and if she had a choice she said she would stay there....

Reviews.Title: “worst filthy hotel ever been in”
Reviews.Author: sonnyek
Reviews.Content: my husband and I had just finished a cruise and decide to spend 3 days in NY. This is the WORST hotel we have ever stayed in, had I not pre paid the room we would have stayed elsewhere. Looks like a prison camp with big horrible metal, scratched doors. 1ST ROOM, woke up the next morning covered in bite marks from BED BUGS and itching all over. My husband waited 40 mins at reception just to speak to someone to get us moved. 2ND ROOM, filthy, graffiti on walls, ripped carpets, smelling of urine, mouldy shower. I wouldnt have had a shower in there if you paid me!. My husband again waited 45 mins in another queue to get the room changed again. 3RD ROOM, best of a bad lot, still smelt of urine, mouldy shower, ripped carpet, very noisy a/c, view of another side of a building. Reception staff couldnt care less and our complaints seem to be common from guests at this hotel, they just move you to another room until you finally give up and stay in a filthy room anyway. Dont think you are getting a good deal because of the price, your not. Its cheap and nasty.

Reviews.Title: “Worked out okay in the end, but absolute nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Dawnywawny
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I, and another couple went to america for two weeks - only back since Sunday. We went to LA first and then on to Vegas, finishing our trip with four days of shopping in New York. We had pre booked everything through an agent so our hotels were already paid for. On arrival at the hotel we had to join a queue for about 30 mins. They could have easily had more workers checking ppl in. I specifically called the hotel the previous week requesting our rooms be located together and that we would be travellin a long day and would appreciate nice rooms. MY GOD !!! The rooms we got were horrific. The doors are like space shuttle doors, the air con was like a tractor - the smell of urine and dirt was unreal. The place was filthy. I went downstairs to complain and we got moved to a different floor where the rooms were even worse!! I had enough at this point as we were nearly at the hotel 2.5 hours and still hadnt got to sit down. I went back downstairs and spoke with a very nice lady in reservations and explained the whole thing to her - I said that only for the fact that we were pre paid through an agent we would be out the door. she moved the four of us in to a 2 bedroomed penthouse suite which was a bit dated but perfect for us and most importantly fresh and clean. The location of this hotel is fantastic, 10 minute walk to times sq and across the rd from penn station. The shopping aroudn the hotel as well is ideal. But my advice to anyone who is staying here - be very carefull - u may think ur getting a deal but u certainly are not.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting, Horrible, More like a Crime Scene”
Reviews.Author: iheartnyc_7
Reviews.Content: In all my travels to NYC, I have stayed at over seven different hotels. Never have I seen anything like this. As soon as we walked in our room, we didn't even sit our bags down before turning around, going back downstairs, and demanding a better room. We were upgraded to a "suite", but I use that term very loosely. Thank God for Expedia. It was because we booked through them that we were able to get a King room. Honestly, I have seen better quality in a Super 8. Everything was filthy (floors, bedspread, walls, bathroom), and the staff was incredibly rude. But I guess with all the complaints they get every day, who wouldn't be? There are so many other nice and affordable places to stay in NY...don't make the mistake of staying in this rat hole.

Reviews.Title: “Just a place to sleep.....in your clothes, on top of the blankets.........”
Reviews.Author: Erika52385
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend took me to NY for the first time for my birthday on May 26th, he chose the Hotel Pennsylvania for our weekend stay. What can I say besides absolutley horrible!? We waited almost an hour to check in and went upstairs to the 12th floor to out "250 sq ft" room (which is still tiny). The hotel is old, dirty, and smells. Everything is outdated. The doors to the rooms look like bomb shelters. Big heavy metal doors, and you have to step down into the room like you are going in a bomb shelter. We opened the door and the door hit the tv stand, we turned to the left and had to squuze past the bed, we went into the moldy, nasty bathroom and ran right out. We had a great view of a brick wall. The room was a shoebox. You couldnt open the closet door all the way because it hit the mini fridge, which was on the floor next to the tv stand. The air was broken for 1 1/2 out of the 2 days we stayed there. We called the manager & said the room was supposed to be 250 sq ft. He said "not all of the standard rooms are 250, some are 100 sq feet, you are still in a standard room, which is what you paid for." We asked to be moved, they would not do anything about it. We were mad but thought "oh well, we just have to sleep here, we will be out the whole time". Well then my bf went to use his travel money visa, the prepaid money card and there was nothing left on it. He said there should be $200 still. We called & it said the room took out an extra $150 from his card. We called downstairs and they said they charged his card $150 in case we order any movies. WHAT!? That is ridiculous anyway AND this is a cash card, they took all of his spending money. We tried to get it refunded, someone told us to call at 9am and the manager would do it. We called at 9am and the manager told us it would take 5 business days after the holiday to refund the money. The place was just horrible & disgusting, there were stains all over the walls & floors. We also called the manager about the dirty, moldy bathroom and they sent a maid up to spray it with bleach. The maid told us they paint over the mold in the shower, but it usually washes away in 2 weeks, thats why it's there again. Great excuse. We paint over the mold. My advice....................stay far away from this place. For $200-300 a night for a standard room, I would rather sleep on the street then stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaGalway
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Pennsylvania and I must say the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. It was filthy. I asked to use the stairs as my friends got stuck in the lift and I never have seen such dirt in my life. I also had the pleasure to meet not one but two mice at different occasions. Our room was terrible, TV didnt work, carpet filthy, bathroom disgusting. I showered with my shoes on. I have stayed in New York on a few occasions & this was definitley my worst experience. Proximitey to Penn station good but to be honest would rather have stayed in the station.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelCork
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a lot of hotels over the years and I can without doubt say that this was the worse one ever. We checked in and went up to our room which had not been made up from the previous occupants. I went back down and complained and was given another room which was disgusting so again I went down and complained and got another room. This happened 5 times and the only reason we stopped was that I couldn’t take it any more. The staff were not at all helpful – they did not seem to think that what was happening was at all unusual or unacceptable. We ended up with a room that had a dirty bathroom, the carpet was stained and filthy, the paint was coming off the walls, the tiles were broken and the sinks and tubs stained. There was also always a queue at reception so every time you wanted to talk to them you were looking at a 10-15 minute wait. The only thing about this hotel that was any good was the location but it just wasn’t worth it.

Reviews.Title: “FIRST CLASS”
Reviews.Author: Kayles8936
Reviews.Content: WOW i was so apprehensive as to whether or not to stay in this hotel, after all the awful reviews i had read! it looks amazing on the hotels website, so i rang the manager and he assured me i would get a great room, as they were renovating the hotel, he explained why some of the reviews i had read may have been of a distasteful nature!! OMG i think we got the best room available, very spacious, maids v. pleasant and the place was spotless when we arrived back each evening!the desk staff were more than helpful and v friendly! And to top it all off My Fiance proposed to me in central park! I am DEF goin back next year for my anniversary! GREAT HOTEL!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for a New York hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveller43
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on two subsequent weekends. The location is fantastic. The rooms are big for New York standards. They are also clearn. The bed was king size and very comfortable. However, the rooms are old. Our shower was poorly designed and flooded easily. In order to store baggage after check-out, we had to pay $4 per bag, which I had never done before. There was no free internet access in the room or lobby. Overall, it was a pleasant experience and I would stay at this hotel again, given it is New York.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Cheap”
Reviews.Author: orlaith21
Reviews.Content: Well if you want to stay somewhere thats clean and cheap this is the place. It is in the middle of everywhere which is great... I mean people who pay stupid money to stay in expensive hotels for a holiday in new york are silly, we basically came in dropped the bags and left again, the only time we spend much time there was to sleep and shower. Macy's around the block and times square 10 minutes walk away you are set once you stay here. The only thing i can think of that i think it needs in each room would be a kettle and cups to have tea/coffee in the morning but that is my only down-side to this place. Staff were very nice, room cleaned everyday, what more could you ask for. I read some terrible reviews on this website about this place and i was going to cancel because of them and i'm glad i didn't, its what you pay for. When i do go back to New York i would stay there again no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Its OK”
Reviews.Author: jetbags
Reviews.Content: After reading many of the hotels reviews on here I was dreading our stay at the Hotel Penn. Tales of woe and alike had really convinced me that this place was going to be really bad. We arrived late on Saturday night, the lobby was extremely busy with hundreds of people going about their business, a lot of these appeared to be young males who were very loud and intimidating, but after 5-10 minutes it was clear that there was nothing to worry about,they were just having a night out like the rest of Manhattan. We were given a room on the 16th floor, the elevators were spotlessly clean and very fast, there were 12 in total serving our floor ! on reaching our floor we stepped out into a large communal area with corridors leading off in all directions, yes these were a little dated and the decor needs a little touch up, but its ok. We stood outside our door and took a deep breath in, inserted the digital key and stepped in. The room was large with two double beds inside, there was air conditioning via a unit under the window that really worked well. The decor was reasonable, nothing scary at all. The only down side was the bath, it did look a little tired, but this was made up for by the shower which pumped out steaming hot water relentlessly every morning and evening on demand. The staff at the hotel were always polite, helpful if not a little eager to get you sorted and move on to the next guest (after all it is new york). So in conclusion, the hotel penn is ok, be very specific as to exactly what yu want and they will endeavour to make you happy. Jetbags.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: toletiquesbysam
Reviews.Content: I was certainly nervous after reading some reviews, and the hallways and rooms were not great but we enjoyed our time in NY! The check in went smooth and she said they only had 2 twin beds for us instead of King but she said if you'll wait a minute she'll check to see if the maids have cleaned up a room that hasn't been put back in inventory yet. She quickly returned and we had a room with one bed, granted it was not a King but better than twins for my husband and I! As everyone has said for the price we paid, we couldn't have gotten a better location it was great being able to walk right to Time Square, we walked to Central Station, Empire State building and to the Grayline office for our bus tour. We did not have any problems with noises from the other rooms around us, just the "hot" water never got "hot" so it was mostly lukewarm showers! I'd have no problems staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: loves-to-travel76
Reviews.Content: My parents recomended this hotel after having stayed in a large room with fantastic view. My husband and I were not so lucky. The room was small and shabby and under the bed we even found a magazine with a date suggesting that the room had not been properly cleaned in two months! The view was also non existing and the walls between the rooms were very thin. We could hear the man next door beating his wife and when we asked the maid to call security to stop what was going on, she just answered "Can't you do it?". The only positive thing I have to say about this hotel is that the location is great. There are plenty of great restaurants and bars Just 15 min walk down the road. However, next time I am in new york I will stay closer to the west village area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but.....”
Reviews.Author: jeremiahobediah
Reviews.Content: I'll start by saying that this hotel has an excellent location for getting about the city. The room was no worse than we had anticipated but could do with some redecoration. My main gripe with the hotel was the inadequacy of the sound proofing. A neighbouring room had for some reason a CD or radio playing the same song continuously all through the night every night. After ringing security the music stopped only to start again the following night. To top it off we got a wake-up call at 5.45am on our check-out morning which we hadn't requested. When I went down to reception to investigate, the lady asked me if the room was under...and gave me my name without so much as querying who I actually was. I would normally expect to be asked "what name is the room under?" All in all we were happy enough if a little tired at the end of our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: CarolinaGirl07
Reviews.Content: I have to preface this by saying that for the money, you simply cannot beat the location. We walked to Times Square, the Empire State buiding, Central Park (though that was a bit of a hike), and pretty much everywhere else during our stay. There was food, shopping, and all kinds of entertainment right outside our door and Penn Station was right across the street making for the utmost of convience. That being said, we booked two rooms for four nights. The king room had some strange sort of mold growing all over the shower that was completely disgusting. While they did offer to move us to another room, the next room had similar growth in the bathroom. The gem of this room however, was the view of the ESB! We decided to stay. The other room had two twin beds. There was obvious fading on the walls where the headboards had once been. The room showed signs of age and wear; little things that could have been kept up with but were not. The view from this room was straight into another room. Even straining as far as possible, no glimpse of Manhattan could be seen. All in all though, we were hardly ever in the room other than to sleep and the beds worked just fine for what we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as I thought”
Reviews.Author: irish666
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel Pennsylvania at the last minute through a travel agent and when I viewed some of the photos on this website afterwards I nearly cried, but.....when I got there it was a huge relief. I got an upgrade, staff were friendly-but extremely busy, pretty much all the time. The room wasn't amazing, it could use a lick of paint, and a bit of general DIY but it did the job! As a female staying by myself I felt very safe and its in a great area so walking back to the hotel in the evening was grand. I stayed on the 6th floor and happened to be right next to the service lifts, so had noise from 7am every morn - but overall the hotel was nice enough stay and NOT as bad as its made out to be! Mags, Dublin.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy room”
Reviews.Author: Kag5
Reviews.Content: Don't stay at this squalid place! The rooms are FILTHY. Our bath was constantly half full of backed up disgusting waste! We couldn't use the shower for fear of catching something from the slurry. The hotel was full for Memorial day and we couldn't change rooms - nor were we given discount (returned from trip this morning - 30 May 2007). Also the bed linen and towels smelled horrid and carpet was revolting. We are seasoned travellers who visit India and the sub-continent regularly. We stay in very basic accomodation there and we have never experienced such filth as we have at the Pennsylvania. The rooms are a major health hazard. STAY THERE AT YOUR PERIL!

Reviews.Title: “Oh God Dont Go!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: IrelandChristine
Reviews.Content: The travel agent did say there had been a few problems with decor etc....but hey my house isnt exactly perfect either. So we booked... no long queues., went up to the room....Room seemed fine, beds comfy etc.unpacked very quickly to see the sights and out we went...no problems. Arrived back and into bed,I was preparing our day ahead when I spotted something out of the corner of my eye(assumed it was tiredness),Then again and again. The only thing I can describe it as,is a silver coloured newt type insect,moving v fast along the wall.We left the room and went to reception(avoid the queues by heading straight to security or other staff and demanding the manager) My mistake was standing in the queue in my pyjamas(hey I was tired and v pissed off and told everyone in the queue) then when I was finally given an alternative room, I went running to check it out. My God the rooms are all dodgy.I was told I had an upgrade(ok double beds but the lights did not work and there was a hole in the wall)The only satisfaction I got was by politely demanding to see the manager and have him take me to a decent room..All sorted.Even the bell boy, who helped me to pack our belongings told me that the hotel was infested with vermin,insects etc and each day they have to relocate at least half the bookings and those people still are not happy....Not worth the hassle,there are lots of better hotels in new york for a few xtra dollars..Would not recomend this place to anyone, and I have been backbacking aroung europe,asia,africa,australia.Would stay in a hostel quicker than that dump...Please take my advice and cancel. If not I hope you are one of the lucky ones.... Good Luck

Reviews.Title: “Won't go back”
Reviews.Author: winelover15
Reviews.Content: After searching multiple sources for a hotel room for under $200/night, I came across this hotel. I did read the reviews here on Trip Advisor but was based on the price and location of the hotel, I went ahead and booked. The only positive I can say about this place is that it's in a great location, right next to the subway and in the heart of midtown. Very easy to get anywhere from this hotel. As far as negatives, there are quite a few: - Check in line was excessively long. They need to improve this process - I asked for a recently renovated room, which they said they could not accomodate. I got a basic room. The door to the room was FILTHY. I was grossed out having to open it. The room had pealing paint everwhere, including a nice one inch pile of it in the corner. The carpet was stained. The wallpaper was peeling and stained. The remote control didn't work (we did ask for a new one and housekeeping did bring it up) - The bathroom was horrific. An unexplainable blue stain in the tub. I couldn't even take a decent shower due to the water being either too hot or too cold. The water pressure was horrible as well. I knew the risk in coming here. It's a shame you can't get a decent hotel room in NYC for $200. I guess we got what we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service and dirty rooms”
Reviews.Author: unberleavable
Reviews.Content: We have just completed a world trip and I must say this was the worst hotel of our Travels. Upon arrival we were advised there was no reservations made for us, for which we had legit vouchers and confirmation numbers They advised us the hotel was booked out, but still had rooms available via the net. The Check In staff and Manager (Glen) were unapproachable and we sat guarding our luggage in their lobby for 2 and 1/2 hours while our travel agent in OZ rebooked a room for us via the net. They would not allow us to go somewhere else other than the lobby, or store our luggage while something was sorted out. Eventually a room was found for us through the oz travel agent, but in the room, the smell of urine and condition of the room was appauling. With windows that half closed. Writing and marks??? on the walls. Please be warned this is not a hotel you wish to stay at for their lack of service and consideration for the weary traveller.

Reviews.Title: “If you can possibly avoid it, do so!”
Reviews.Author: aliwally
Reviews.Content: My travel department made a mistake with my trip to New York - I was supposed to be at the Hotel Dream, but when I got there, they had the wrong dates confirmed for me. I was directed to use a lobby computer to use hotels.com to find something...in a panic, I went with this hotel (paying $380 per night instead of $2,160 at some luxury chain) - you know how it is with New York, never a room when you need one. When I arrived, I knew it was going to be grim. It was pretty late at night at the desk people all looked like they hadn't bathed in a month and were the most miserable group of people...I really can't go into all the details, it would take me too long. The room was really a joke - more peeled paint on the ceiling and bath-tub than paint left. It was one of those rooms where you don't want to walk bare foot. Massive crack in the sink, curtains that wouldn't close and hanging off the curtain rod...no internet except in the lobby for some extortionate rate. I don't know if it's a "crack" hotel as others claim - but it is a place where entire families are living in rooms - you can tell by the noise, the people coming and going. Location is all that's going for this place - but seriously - avoid it at all costs if you can - I know you're only sleeping there, but it would put a damper on your trip to New York if you do.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good hotel, but depends what room you get”
Reviews.Author: CB1978
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few years ago. The reason for the variety in the reviews here is the hotel has obviously undergone some renovation, but some of its rooms are still in desparate need of a make-over. We stayed in three separate rooms during the course of our stay - as we were travelling around and using New York as a 'Base'. The first room was great (and thankfully that was the longest leg of our stay). The second room we got was a little smaller and in need of a lick of paint, but still not too bad. The third room we go (which thankfully was just for one night) was a little dodgey. Mildew in the bathroom, stains on the carpet etc. It wasn't terrible, but compared to the first room we'd gotten it was as if we were in a different hotel. All that aside, it is a GREAT hotel in a FANTASTIC location. I booked through Hotels.com and got a much cheaper rate than the hotel's own website. I wouldn't warn anyone against this hotel, but I would sugest if you find yourself with a nasty room, perhaps it might be worth a go to see if they will move you to another room, because the nicer rooms do exist for the same price!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: mazziem
Reviews.Content: I was attending a coference in another hotel which unfortunately was full and this booking was made for me by the event planners. I arrived to stay 2 nights Tues 8th and Wed 9th May to be told that I had been booked in for the Wed 9th and Thurs 10th. I assured the unfriendly receptionist the booking was for the nights I stated and gave her the booking form but she said she could give me a room for Tuesday night for $499 or come back tomorrow and stay the two nights the hotel had me booked in for. I was adamant their booking was incorrect. I then had to go and buy an internet access card to print off the rest of the paperwork. After standing in line again for another 30 mins, I handed over the paperwork to be told the booking was for 8th & 9th May 2008. The booking was not going to be changed unless I paid another $150 per night to take it to $499 I had been offered if I wanted to stay. I asked for the manager and the girl disappeared with all the papers. She surfaced 10 mins later and said they would change it as it was their mistake. I was given a key for room 211 - this was the most disgusting room I have ever seen and went straight back down to be moved. The other room was better but still dirty and very tatty. I had to call security to get the window closed at it was stuck half open. On returning to my room on the second day I could not get in as the security latch was on from the inside. Once again I called security who showed up 40 minutes later and told me it was easy to break through the locks......very reassuring. It is the only hotel I have ever stayed at that I locked everything in my suitcase before going out. Another person I met had booked in there and been given the key to a room that had not been serviced. The second room he was given was the same and on seeing the third room, left the hotel and went elsewhere. I understand for many people a hotel is just a base as they are out all day. Paying $350 per night, the hotel should be more than a base and it should offer good security and be clean. The towels and floor mat all had holes in them and were grubby. The soundproofing was terrible and I could clearly hear the person next door in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Crack Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaTraveler5
Reviews.Content: It's a crack hotel. Everything is filthy. Urine smell in the halls, dirty windows, dark creepy hallways, strange forgotten connecting rooms, broken doors, missing doorknobs, peeling paint, broken tiles, filthy bedspreads, filthy rugs, filthy blankets, no service, stained mattresses, dead bugs, had to switch rooms three times and still uninhabitable, brought me to tears. I only stayed here for one night on business because everything else was sold out and was fooled by the nice looking lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Dismal, disgusting, moved to another hotel”
Reviews.Author: tripmonsters
Reviews.Content: This place is disgusting. I took a group of people there last year for a conference and wished I hadn't. The room looked like nobody had been in it to revamp or clean since the 1950s. There were stains on the walls and holes in the doors. There was a horrid smell in my room and others in my party made similar comments and worse. We stayed here because we wanted to all be in one place and this place is huge so it was one of the few places we were able to book. Half way through our stay I moved to another hotel, roughly the same price and bang in the middle of times square. It was a tiny place and a tiny room but very clean and much more up to date. The others stayed behind as they were unable to find anywhere else to stay. Disaster - stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Clean , comfortable , affordable !! Joe . Lucan , Co. Dublin”
Reviews.Author: comraid
Reviews.Content: Hi We stayed here on Apr. 18th for two nights before moving on to Boston . A bit apprehensive after reading some terrible and some mixed reviews but decided to go for it as the location was perfect for us. Hotel was busy but no time at all to book in and we were given a room on the 9th floor. We had looked for king size bed but as this was unavaiable we were given room with two doubles instead and this was fine with us. The room itself was large , clean and quiet and without any evidence of the shock horror photos from some reviewers of some peeling paint in the bathroom !! Peeling paint - get over it !! We were offered a safe deposit box free of charge as is standard here but not in other hotels which of course provided peace of mind. After shopping , sightseeing , eating out etc. for two nights we crossed the road to Penn Station to catch the train to Boston. No taxi fare , no delays , no hassle, If you're looking for a luxury hotel pick somewhere else and pay the difference. If you're looking for a reasonably priced hotel in a terrific location pick this and you won't go too far wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, pity about the room”
Reviews.Author: mgtHants
Reviews.Content: For location it would be hard to beat this hotel, with the westside subway across the road and the eastside subway one block away. Most of the tourist honey-traps are within reasonable walking distance. The hotel itself is worn and tired. Our room was on the 9th floor, poorly lit, adequately furnished but with a poorly fitting window, cracked paintwork and worn bathroom fittings. The staff were good but morale seemed low. The internet business facility is terrible. The price looks reasonable but half the PCs were never working, the response time was very slow with requests being lost some of the time requiring a restart. The reception staff are well aware of the problem and raised it with the management but they take no action.

Reviews.Title: “great location but not ideal for children!”
Reviews.Author: honeynutsherios
Reviews.Content: First of all the hotel's location is great! Next door to macy's and manhattan mall. Few blocks away to times square. The room we stayed in had stains on the carpet.The bad part was it was about 70 degress out ,very warm and there was NO AC in the building...including the rooms..I asked if they could spare us a fan since my 2 yr old couldn't fall asleep,it was so warm. All they could do was open the windows and well that was worse coz you could hear everything from the streets and smell everything too! Oh and i asked why they didn't have any AC on...they told me they couldn't control mother nature!! I asked a friend who was staying in hotel nearby if they had AC..and they did...so what did mother nature have to do with that? If you're planning to stay there anytime soon and its warm out, do call them ahead of time and ask if they have AC..also ask for newly renovated rooms or else you get a tiny room with no fridge. Let them know you have kids too so they'll give you a bigger room. A MUST TO LET THEM KNOW WHAT YOU NEED.

Reviews.Title: “Booking again for next year!!!”
Reviews.Author: CatherinaKildare
Reviews.Content: Hi, me and my husband are just back from a weeks stay at the Pennsylvania Hotel, we were very nervous booking in after seeing all the bad reviews. I asked for a renovated room and we got a lovely room on the 13th floor it was spotless and the cleaners came in every day and cleaned it and gave us clean towels. The location is just perfect too right across from Madison Square Gardens, Macys is only a few doors away, the Empire State Building is a couple of blocks behind and its only a 5 minute walk to Times Square. Overall we were very very pleased with our stay there and are definitly going to book again for next year, i would say if you are looking for a 5star hotel go and book one because this isnt at all but if you want a hotel that is not expensive and is clean in a great location this is the one for you. I would recommend asking for a renovated floor or even a room on the 13th floor as ours was perfect!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad as expected”
Reviews.Author: LiebeMom
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 6 nights in the beginning of December with mom. The reason we chose there was because it was the only affordable and available hotel for us. We planned our trip about 3 weeks before our departure. Well, I was prepared to be disappointed after reading all the negative reviews, but it wasn't as bad as I've expected it'd be. True, the room was very small, a king size bed filled the room and not enough space to open 2 suit cases, no view at all, bathroom wall paints were coming off. But considering the price and the location, it was a fair deal, at least in New York City. We had a room close to elevator in the 6th Fl. Positive side is... I went to see Broadway musicals every night and could walk back to the hotel after the show without any problem, enough restaurants/ cafes around, only few minutes walk to subway stations. OK, if you want to relax and spend a luxurious time in the hotel, this is not your hotel. But if you're thinking of only sleeping, and want to spend your money elsewhere, the place is quite ideal!

Reviews.Title: “great location and value!”
Reviews.Author: ibflee
Reviews.Content: The rooms were small, but they had private baths. That was a real draw. The rooms were clean and the lobby was expansive. The gift shop on the first floor had some great souveniers for cheap. The location right across the street from Penn Station and Madison Square Garden was wonderful. It was easy to catch a train or walk to any place we wanted. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Time Travel”
Reviews.Author: Crestview_BK
Reviews.Content: Our trip to New York for a career forum held next to Hotel Pennsylvania got off to a sour start when our flight out of LasVegas was cancelled due to bad weather in other parts of the country. We finally arrived at the hotel at 2 in the morning, without our luggage! My son asked the receptionist if there were two beds in the room and she took the extra time to find a room with two beds as he requested. The vintage decor of the halls and rooms was so charming. The beds were very comfortable and the halls were always free from clutter. The next morning when I asked about the Internet connection, the receptionist recommended we use the business center on our floor where we could also have a continental breakfast. The staff were all very friendly and helpful, and really made us feel at home with their hospitality. This was my second visit to New York in six months, and I must say that I would recommend Hotel Pennsylvania over the more expensive hotel where I stayed in August. Hope to be a loyal customer in the coming years.

Reviews.Title: “wasnt the best but its cheap, great location.”
Reviews.Author: kerrycat
Reviews.Content: Me and 4 friends stayed here last summer. We booked a triple room and got 2 double beds and a camp bed. my other friends booked a twin room and they got a nice view of the streeets(ours was of a wall). The hotel was fine. the decor was horrible ( brown and green theme) but we didnt spend much time in the hotel itself so it didnt bother us. While the room were old they were cleaned every day and new towels(and plenty of them) put in fresh every day. We just finish college so we were looking for somethin cheap and this matched our criteria. the location was brilliant we walked everywhere and its only 10 minutes to the main bus station and right across from madison square gardens. Information desk located right inside the front door was very helpful. We tried booking tickets to a play but they said they were all booked out but they only get allocated a certain amount so check directly with the booking office. overall we had an enjoyable stay, nothing too fancy, didnt have to complain about anything and after reading some of these reviews I was prepared for battle. would recommend it if you just want somewhere cheap to lay your head at night.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay there again - a great value”
Reviews.Author: stmer
Reviews.Content: This hotel worked out great for us. It is not easy finding hotel rooms in Manhattan that will accommodate a family of 4, unless you spend a ton of money for a suite or 2 double rooms. Hotel Pennsylvania gave us a very big, comfortable room that could sleep all 4 of us for an unbeatable price. Yes, the check-in process was slow, but the person who checked us in was friendly and helpful. Yes, the hallways are a bit old and faded, but the room was fine. The hotel has a nice big lobby that is always bustling - I get the impression this is a popular choice with conventioneers and other large groups. And the location is fantastic. A pleasant walk to Times Square, right next to Penn Station and the subway, a block or two from the Emprie State building. (We got in late after a long flight, but took advantage of the proximity to the ESB to go up at midnight, and were rewarded with a wonderful nighttime view). Note: we had occasion to see one of the updated "business" rooms on the higher floors. They cost a bit more, but are even roomier, with nicer furnishings, and are still a good value if that's important to you. P.S. For an authentic NY diner experience, check out Cheyenne Diner a couple of blocks away - good diner grub at unbeatable prices (e.g. good breakfasts for about $5).

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad, but here is the trick!”
Reviews.Author: TheThriftyTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a wedding. I had read the horror stories, and they were true for my freind, but not for me. First of all, they always put people who book on the internet in the "Standard" rooms. If you get a bad room, most of the time they will move you to a better one. Do NOT be afraid to tell them the first room is disgusting, because if it is on one of the first 4 floors, I promise you, it is nasty. We were in a wedding party with a lot of people, so I saw a lot of the rooms. Most people really got a nasty surprise! I paid 40 dollars extra for their club level. The club is not worth it , but the room was. Just get the superior room and you will be fine. Maybe 20 dollars more, if that. If you just take a lower level room, paint chips will fall in your mouth as you sleep. Pubic hair is all over the place. It truly looks like a horror movie. The staff were ok, but it's NY, whaddaya expect.... Also, the prices when you call up the hotel direct are almost always cheaper than even the big web sites....unusual. So, if price is a big concern to you, stay here. I have seen much worse in NY!

Reviews.Title: “Never Never Never again”
Reviews.Author: Alan A
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from staying at the Penn Hotel NYC and if your thinking of staying here, I can give you one word of advice....DON'T! I too was confused due to the mixed bag of feedback I had read online. To be honest from my experiences it does seem to be the luck of the draw with this hotel as to whether you get a reasonable room or a dundgeon, this very shabby hotel is slowly improving on the 11th 12th and 13th floors.....do not be taken in by the grand lobby! Upon my arrival after a fourteen hour journey from the UK ,I was greeted by a further 45 minute wait having to line up for check in at reception. Reception was manned by only two very slow, disinterested, demotivated, totally fed up individuals who couldn't even raise a smile. Next is where my nightmare began. The room I was given was on the eighth floor which resembled a rabbit hutch with an outside wall for a view....upon complaining the next day I was given a larger room on the tenth floor which I was prepared to live with untill I discovered it was already occupied! Wait for it! another person I hear you think? Not so lucky I'm afraid, no less than a RAT running along the floor and disappearing behind the air con unit. I did see it three times so I was in no doubt......(Lord help the next guests to occupy this room) when I reported this at 6am the best they could do was to send a guy who stuffed towels along the front of the air con unit....I have no idea what that was suppose to achieve. anyway I was then roomless for the next seven hours waiting for guests to check out in order to be given my third room thanks to Miss Vivian which was better but with 24hr noise and the window filthy. I am amazed that given the large number of guests this hotel has, that the management do not use their initiative to bring this old hotel up to date. Guests do not even get a complimentary cup of coffee in the rooms and not a flower in sight. Extremely disappointing!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and great value”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteCollins
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last week for the remaining 3 nights of my trip to NY beacsue the original hotel booked was awful we had to move. I found the hotel staff very helpful and I was upgraded free of charge to a more superior room, the room was much larger than expected, clean and very comfortable. A couple of friends had stayed here previosuly and had said it was great value and clean, they were not happy with the first room they were given, complained and were given a much bigger room. I think the higher up you go in this hotel the better the rooms, I was on floor 13 out of about 18. For the money it's a great place to stay and somwhere you'd take your parents, friends or partner. I'd definitely book this hotel again and not bother researching others, what you see on their website (photos etc) is exactly what you get.

Reviews.Title: “A Faded Gem. Living History.”
Reviews.Author: EmmaAust
Reviews.Content: The thing about the Hotel Pennsylvania is that it's an old hotel. Personally, I loved it - the hotel was built in 1919, in the days of big band, and at the peak of railroad travel. It's glamourous inside - long, sweeping corridors, a bank of old elevators, chandeliers and a beautiful marble lobby. It's a bit daggy - the paint was peeling off the walls, the windows were dirty and the electric wiring looked dodgy. It's sanitary, though - and the maids are really nice. You get what you pay for. And I'm not going to spend an extra $100 per night for a hotel room that's slightly more up to date. After all, you're in New York - what the hell are you doing if you're in your hotel room for more than 8 hours at a time? It's big - 1700 rooms on 18 floors - so some of them are bound to be less than perfect. I wouldn't recommend it for a romantic weekend away or a honeymoon - splurge on the Radisson Martinique for that. But if you're a traveller on a budget, a vacationing family, away for a girly weekend, or a business traveller, the plain, functional rooms (with a touch of faded glory) are just perfect. One thing I found frustrating was that there was no information in the room - I had no idea how much the phone cost, if there was breakfast available, if there was a laundry, or what time check out was. The only other bad point that I could find was that there was no in-room internet access. There's wireless access in the lobby, for $2 per half-hour, so the lobby's full of people on their laptops. Many people have commented on the location, and I agree completely. The sole reason I chose the hotel was because of it's proximity to Penn Station. I don't travel light, and after lugging my suitcases out of the station, it was just brilliant to see the hotel lobby right across the crosswalk - who wants to bother with a cab after a long train ride? For all those that gripe about it, you might just get your wish. The site owners, Vornado, announced in January 2007 that they plan on razing the hotel to build an office tower. Affordable accommodation for rail travellers may become a thing of the past in New York...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Brisvegain
Reviews.Content: I don't understand all the bad reviews posted about this hotel. This hotel is exactly what it says it is - a 2 star property. For the price, its definately value for money. Our room was basic, clean but actually quite large for a NY hotel room. Plus it had a fantastic view of the empire state building. The decor is a little dated, but who cares? In a city like New York this is simply a place to sleep (and the beds were comfy too!) Plus the shower had great water pressure, our room had an iron and hairdryer, and the towels and sheets were clean. The location is great too - very handy to everything you want in NY. I will be staying here again on my next trip to NY.

Reviews.Title: “Pennsylvania Hotel - not so bad - but watch out for the airport scam”
Reviews.Author: Allenfa
Reviews.Content: As one of the oldest great hotels in New york, we really wanted to try it. We booked the Pennsylvania through HotelsRus but subsequently read the reviews and horror stories. When we arrived there, we found the receptionist extremely friendly given the queues and I immediately asked for a refurbished room - (floors 10 to 15?). The receptionist advised us that: - our booking through the hotel reservation (HotelsRus) was for a standard (unrefurbished) room - refurbished rooms carried a $50/night surcharge and we could could not be automatically upgraded - the hotel was full - limiting our negotiation capacity - we should see the room on offer before paying for an upgrade. Taking this as sensible advice, we found the room was basic, a little tired, but generally clean, with working air-conditioning and shower, no mould, etc - a more than reasonable room for a tourist rate hotel in NYC. We enjoyed the experience. Another point worth noting - nothing to do with the hotel but a JFK airport scam. I was so focussed on the hotel issue, that arriving at JFK (tired), we allowed ourselves to be intercepted by someone claiming to be part of a subsidiary of the SuperShuttle service (JFK to NYC hotels). Called himself Dave Ross (??) and gathered about 9 couples allocating then to ShuttleVans which would be arriving shortly. He took three couples to his own vehicle - a Toyota Sienna -about 5 minutes walk away in the Airport parking area. He talked about insurance certificates, loaded the vehicle & chatted away. Talked a lot about new transfer fees across the bridges, tunnels, etc and eventually stung us for another $40 at the hotel in addition to the usual transfer fee. (The other 6 couples probably had a long wait for non-existent vans but saved themselves some money and a hair-raising drive.) With hindsight, he was clearly targeting long haul travellers (tired, more gullible & less likely to confront); his van did not carry the SuperShuttle logo; he probably was not insured. We should have asked for ID a look at the insurance but didn't and paid the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gazp5
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in Dec for my bday. I made a reservation for a different hotel on [--], and received a call 24hrs later to say it wasnt avaiable and due to the time of year all that was left was Hotel Penn. After reading reviews i was a little worried but thought it cant be that bad. We arrived there a little early, the staff were friendly so we headed for a drink. The corridors are quite long and the rooms v.big. Had a problem with the key entry a couple of times but it was easily resolved after speaking to reception. My view of hotel rooms is how long do you expect to stay in a room if you are visiting New York? As long as the bed is comfy and clean you dont need much else. I am planning to return to the hotel next month for another break.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel we ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: hollie2007
Reviews.Content: on arrival we found the hotel to be in a great location, very close to all amenities, however we found the reception staff to be very unhelpful, extremely ignorant and rude. On top of this we found our roon on the 16th floor to be in a distraceful condition, 2 single beds which the reception told us to push together although we had a double room booked. It was very dirty and smelled of urine with pubic hairs all over the bathroom, dirty floors and well worn beds, not the sort of hotel you should find in manhattan. We definitely will not be staying here again and would not recommend it to anyone. Save your money spend it at the Radisson

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful, our 4th stay”
Reviews.Author: Harold_S_UK
Reviews.Content: Every year for the past four years we've stayed at Hotel Pennsylvania. We've read the reviews, we've had holiday companies refuse to book us into the hotel...you really would think it's the worst place on earth. We now book direct with the hotel and always get a fantastic rate booking directly. For less than the average price of a nights stay in any UK town/city you care to mention, you can stay in one of the best locations possible in the best city in the world. It's incredibly cheap, it's a 2 star hotel, yet most people seem to expect the Plaza Hotel. Sure it's seen better days, sure everything could do with a lick of paint, but from our experience it's never been dirty, unsanitary or uncomfortable. The rooms are huge, the beds are comfy and we've never had an issue with the staff, check-in/out or anything else at the hotel. As I've mentioned, we've stayed there 4 times in the cheapest rooms available, the law of averages should be well and truely against us if so many rooms are as bad as people make out. But we keep going back, and touch wood we've never had a problem. If people expect luxury they should also expect to pay for it, but if you want somewhere to sleep at night and have a bath/shower every morning before going out and experiencing New York all day, there isn't a better place to stay that is remotely within the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Slobberpot
Reviews.Content: Check in time was 3pm and I checked in just after that. The room wasn't quite ready when I got there and had to wait about 10 minutes in the hall until it was done being made up. The front desk staff weren't too friendly but they seemed efficient. Otherwise it was a generally clean place and an average size room and I was happy with the price ($115) for NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Mischeif
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great once you are not expecting a lavish and luxurious stay. The rooms are very very clean and resonable size. They were cleaned everyday which included the bed linen & towels. The location of this hotel is fantastic as almost all tourist spots are within walking distance or if not then the subway is not too far.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: dcpiano
Reviews.Content: Don't let the great location and the lure of the price fool you into staying at this disgusting hotel. When I arrived in my room, it smelled like straight up body odor, the air conditioning didn't work and the bathroom was stained with brown spots from head to toe. My friends who were staying a few floors up from us got the unfortunate surprise of blood stains on their sheets and in their bathtub, so I guess I shouldn't complain too much. My suggestion? Spend a few extra bucks for a nicer hotel. The Hotel Penn isn't worth the savings.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, just an old hotel. Polite Staff.”
Reviews.Author: g10001
Reviews.Content: Hotel not as bad as some reviews would lead you to believe. My room had a great view of the Empire State building, was clean enough (some smell of disinfectant on arrival, which dissapated, furniture fairly new, bed clean and comfortable, bathroom fixtures somewhat worn but servicable. Truly, the only issue with this hotel is that it is old. There did seem to be remodeling work being done in various places so there is some attempt to make it better overall. This was clearly one of the great old 'railroad' hotels of the 20th century in its day, and the large bank of fast elevators reminded me of other old railroad hotels such as the Royal York in Toronto (which is in a lot better shape than the Pennsylvania). I attended a conference there, and the conference facilities were in better shape than the rest of the hotel. One thing that stood out was the efficiency and friendliness of the hotel staff. I was always treated with respect and any issues dealt with quickly and professionally. The restaurants at the hotel however where quite overpriced with mediocre food (again, the wait staff was quite friendly). Excellent location, if you are taking the train in and out of Penn Station as I was. Not an awful hotel, not great... just old.

Reviews.Title: “Worst! Hotel!! Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: ChosenOne413
Reviews.Content: If you've heard the stories and figured they were exaggerations, don't fool yourself. Do not stay at this hotel if you desire anything in terms of quality and service. We have been going to NYC for the Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show for quite a while now. The Penn is the host hotel for this show, and it is convenient, but up until this year, we had never stayed there because of all the stories that we had heard. Unfortunatly, due to extenuating circumstances, we had to make our reservation at the Penn because we made our reservations late and the hotel that we usually booked was full. We figured "it can't be that bad," and "it's so close to the Garden." I don't care if they move the center court line at MSG to the lobby of the Penn, we will not be staying there again. When we arrived, we had to wait FOREVER for a bellman to assist us with our bags, and they won't LET you do it yourself -- some kind of union thing. We got into our room, and while it wasn't as bad as we had anticipated, we were less than impressed. It was a TINY room. An exciting part was the VERY LARGE bathtub, just perfect for a bubble bath - except when you collect the water in the tub, it was a brownish green color - EWW. So all was going well, until we came back from siteseeing our second day there - unable to get back into our room. Our key would not work. We went to the front desk for duplicate keys - they didn't work either. We waited in the hallway outside our room - mind you our show dogs were still locked inside our room - for 3 hours for someone to fix our door. After we finally were able to enter our door, they told us that we would have to move rooms, because they didn't know for sure what was wrong with our door and couldn't know for sure if it would happen again. So we loaded all of our stuff up on carts - we were there FOR the dog show and we had A LOT of stuff. And headed to the next room. This one was even tinier, AND the wall outside the bathroom was literally disintegrating, meanwhile dropping debris on the carpet. When we told the bellman that this room was unacceptable, he said that his shift was over and he had to go home, so he left our things in the hallway, and we waited for a different room, and a new bellman. Two more substantard rooms were offered before we arrived at one that would work. It was actually a room upgrade for us, and was quite spacious. Not good enough to make me ever want to go back. The next few days went by without anything remarkable to note. Then came time to check out. A storm was coming, and we wanted to leave in time to make it home (ohio) before we would be affected. So we got up early the day of check out and called down to the front desk to call for our car. They said when the car arrived we should call for a bellman. We waited almost an hour for the car, and when we called for the bellman, he said there would be an hour wait. It eneded up that we did get stuck in the snow and hour away from home, and if they hadn't made us wait twice - we likely would have made it home safely the same day. The bad things you hear about this hotel are true. I've heard other stories, but never any of them any good. Don't waste your money. If this is the area of town you want to stay in, shorten your trip by a day if money is an issue and stay in the Affinia Manhattan where they do care about how they treat you, and what you think of their accomodations. I will never stay in the Penn again.

Reviews.Title: “You just have to be LUCKY!”
Reviews.Author: soryps
Reviews.Content: There is something about the pensylvania hotel that only a few visitors get the chance to find out... Although i had read so many reviews (good and bad) before staying at the pensylvania hotel, i couldn't have a clear image of what i was about to face...the truth revealed as soon as i got there! It happened to get the worst room ever, very dark and dirty with rather old furniture (3rd flooor) and immediately asked to be given another one.The second room was spacious,very clean and shiny with a magnificent view to the Empire state building (13th floor).Then i noticed that the whole floor was completely renovated comparing to the 3rd floor which had endless corridors of damaged wallpapers and carpets... The pensylvania hotel, as it is a 16story hotel with nearly 1000 rooms isn't yet fully renovated....you just have to be lucky enough to get the "right room"!!

Reviews.Title: “Quite satisfied”
Reviews.Author: bonnieandturbo
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from an 8 night stay with my boyfriend at this hotel, and to say I was nervous on arriving is an understatement!! There was quite a long queue to check in as we arrived at 2:30pm, but it moved quite quickly and in about 10 mins we were checking in. 8th floor we were placed on, room 898, when i heard we were so low down in the floors i asked for a higher floor but they were all taken.. apparently.. So we made our way to the elevators.. On getting out of the lift.. it didnt smell toooooo bad, but definitely reminded me of the shining.. I as expecting the young boy to come around the corner on his tricycle... We got to our room, blessed our selves, and opened the room... only to be.... Very shocked.. It was not bad at all, the bed was MASSIVE as you can see from the picture.. Clean, comfy, and cosy... Tv worked.. View not bad (straight over to macys) Bathroom clean, small, but functional.. All in all we were happy with the room.. There was no kettle but I had suspected that there wouldnt be and brought one.. And even if I hadnt there was a great little coffee shop in the lobby.. The water pressure in the bathroom was far to heavy, skin peeling, but a constant streem of hot water.. We didnt get our beds changed every day as we didnt see the need, but the lady offered every day, and we did get clean towels every day.. Would I reccommend it?? Certainly!! Im sure there are worse rooms, and its probably hit a miss.. But we were happy out!! Loads of room, and nice quiet floor.. Give it a go.. it served us well!!

Reviews.Title: “Kind of Miserable--But Cheap”
Reviews.Author: rachelpink
Reviews.Content: I live in the city, but when my mom came in for a day of sightseeing, she asked me to book a room here for one night for the sake of convenience. I was really hesitant because of the price. And with good reason. The bathroom was clean enough. Shower pressure rocked. One of the two headboards in our room was completely askew. Looked horrible and made me wonder. No sign of bed bugs (thank god--I've had them in an apartment and they are the stuff of nightmares) but I did find lipstick/nailpolish? on the bedspread and sheets. Overall, the room and the hallways skeeved me out. If I were a 20-yr. old college student trying to save cash I wouldn't have a problem staying there again. I'm not. The reception-desk staff was rude. Worse--they charge $4 a bag to hold luggage after you check out. Seriously? And you have to go down to the skeevy lower level to put it away yourself. Here's the weird thing--the most friendly, positive service we experienced was from the bag-check guys in the basement. Seriously--they were polite and professional. So--it's a money saver. That can definitely be a great thing in NYC. But the whole scene is so darn depressing, I'd never recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “don,t worry”
Reviews.Author: gaztinytears
