Reviews.Content: we stayed at the penn a couple of times before a few years ago and found it very good so when we booked again for feb 2007 we then found tripadvisor and we was very worried when we saw the reviews. checkin was fine the corridors were a bit dull not dark. the rooms were big and cleaned everyday there are marks on the walls which i'm sure are just luggage marks bathroom was clean tiny bits of paint coming off walls high up where the tiles stop the location is the best anybody who thinks that is not good enough for a stay in new york then they should pay for a five star because this hotel is as good as any we've stayed in in new york.

Reviews.Title: “just adequate, very mediocre”
Reviews.Author: buddmar
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Pennsylvania from Feb. 21 through Feb. 27, 2007. My employer booked the room and paid for it, but I saw the invoice and saw he paid about $110 per night except on Fri and Sat nights when it jumped to about $180 per night. The location is good, not great (the Hilton, the Plaza, the Waldorf - are in the Great Locations!) The place clean and tidy, some fine cracks in the bathroom sink and toilet, a very unremarkable room. The view was of little more than an airshaft. The housekeeping staff were friendly and delivered extra pillow, soaps, etc cheerfully. On the other hand, the "exercize room" on the 18th floor was awful: unclean, broken fitness machines - very shabby and neglected! There was almost no pretension of luxury or class. This place is but a step or two above a YMCA or a "super-budget" motel. The room was very small. The lobby, which had some interesting murals of skyscrapers was busy like a train station from dawn until past midnight. Flight crews from Third World Nations airlines like to stay here. The bottom line: pay a little more and stay someplace nice. If you are really on a budget and can't find anything cheaper, you know that at least this 90 year old hotel (scheduled to be demolished in 2 or 3 years I hear!) is well located, clean, and safe ... just don't have any expectations of charm, luxury, or loveliness. And don't eat in the crummy overpriced restaurants off the lobby on the ground floor!

Reviews.Title: “The Pennsylvania ?”
Reviews.Author: Seanie_pc
Reviews.Content: Ok so heres the thing. You have travelled to New York, you're excited, buzzing with sensory overload , the buildings are tall, no HUGE, the traffic crazy, the people "colorful". You pull up outside what appears to be a serious contender of a hotel, you walk into the lobby, WOW. This could be it, you might have just found the bargain of a lifetime right here in New York City !!! You check in, sooo excited and cant wait to see the room, open the door and .............. Aww its not what you expected. .. Ok so the rooms, or at least the one I stayed in was very big. However it was sooo basic and tired looking. I'd say it wasn't too clean either. Would I say I was let down?? maybe not.... its all started to come back to me. I got an excellent rate for a hotel that covers your basic needs, its in a seriously good location, walking distance to Times Square, right around the corner from the Empire state building. And you know what its in NEW YORK CITY the Grrreatest City in the world!!. Honestly when you travel to NY you should forget what the hotel is like, you will be only minimal time there and after a day or night in the big apple you would sleep on a bed of nails if that all that was available. If you want to see NY and are easy about the hotel then the penn is for you.

Reviews.Title: “it really isn't as bad as some have suggested!”
Reviews.Author: Dorsettraveller2
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews on here I was quite worried what we would find. I went with my sister for 6 days, 17th Feb 07. All the staff we dealt with could not have been more polite or any more helpful. OK this isn't the Ritz but the room was funtional and clean. We had the superior 2x double bed room and took the advise offered on here and asked for a recently refurbished room and it was on a par with most average city rooms and it was most certainly clean. Location is perfect and for the price you really can't complain - I will be staying here again thats for sure Lesley Dorset UK

Reviews.Title: “I Wasted my money...”
Reviews.Author: Bigmamamimi
Reviews.Content: The lobby is a complete decoy to what your room is going to be. I walked in and thought, "Yes, this is beautiful, I can't wait to stay." I paid my money, and 1st got the wrong room. Then when I got to the right room. The hallways alone were dissapointing. Run down, stained, shabby. I entered my room to find peeling paint stained sheets, a broken window, a dirty USED bathroom (toilet paper was almost gone, and the toilet itself looked liked it had been "broken in" for me. For the price I paid, it was not worth it. It was disturbing actually. Then at the end of the day they over charged me twice and i've yet to get my security deposit back. Overall, I could have stayed in the projects where i was from for that kind of living. THIS PLACE SUCKED!! Mimi, NYC

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tates
Reviews.Content: I have never come across such a horrible hotel. We came to NYC from FLorida as part of our Holiday. Drew up outside and thought WOW what a great hotel and location. this didn't last long when we were eventually shown to our rooms. Not only was there paint peeling of the ceiling, part of the ceiling was missing!!!! Unfortunately I dont have any photos as I didnt want to stay any long er than necessary. After showing us several rooms, all just as disgusting, but larger, we checked out and found a lovely hotel just behind this one called the standford hotel. Just the same price, but much superior. Do yourself a favour and stay away from the Pennsylvannia Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: BrianNJ
Reviews.Content: Hotel prices in Manhattan are on the insane side, so most people will take anything they can get less than $200. Hotel Penn fits this niche. Yes, you have a room right in the middle of things and right next to Penn Station. But, the quality of everything, from the beds, linens, and towels to the showers were quite poor. I only needed a room for one night, and I would not want to stay here longer than a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Read this review ****”
Reviews.Author: LancashireKate
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend stayed at the Pennsylvania Hotel for five nights at the beginning of November 2006. The staff were very helpful and friendly when we arrived and we were soon in our hotel room. We stayed on the 15th floor and the room was very roomy but quite dark as it only had one lamp! We asked for another and it was soon delivered. Over all, the room wasn't the cleanest but it is a budget hotel so you get what you pay for! It just needed modernising more than anything. As for the location... it's absolutley fantastic! We were facing Madison Square Gardens,10 min walk to Times Square and 5 mins to the Empire State Building. If your staying local one night, make sure you check out Harringtons bar across the road. It's an Irish bar and the lads are really freindly and are a good laugh. I would stay at the Pennsylvania again coz its not THAT bad as most of the reviews say!

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: UsaSarah
Reviews.Content: I dont understand why people are complaining so much about this hotel. When my family and I went I was 15 and had a great time. The hotel staff was amazing at helping us find things around the city. The room was a little smaller than I thought, but you are not in NYC for the hotel. The hotel was clean, and welcoming. Also this is the best location for a hotel to be!! It is by everything! Times square is walking distance, and shopping is just a miniutes walk! I had a great experience at this hotel, and I am planning on staying here in april. I hope that everyone can please ignore the rude comments, this is a great hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Nicatt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Pennsylvania Hotel and had no problems. We booked through Expedia and they had all our details when we arrived. The location was great and we could walk to most attractions such as the Empire Building and even to Central Park. The rooms were old but the hotel is old. The bathroom was old and does need refurbishing but it was always clean and for the price was comfortable. We stayed for 9 nights and were really happy with the accommodation. We are budget travellers but generally like to have our own bathroom so this was good for our budget and we were more than happy with our stay. The Irish Pub Stout which is around the corner was good and we had some nice toasted bagels as the Salt and Pepper which is next to the pub.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE, do not stay here.”
Reviews.Author: mkenmass2000
Reviews.Content: This place is TERRIBLE, the worst I have ever seen. Staff are rude and clueless. the first room they put me in was the wrong bed size, it was filthly. The second room was even worse. Window would not close, food on floor, paint falling off the walls, carpet looked nasty and door took some time and creativity to get locked. Never would I wish this place on anyone. The web site lies too and if you decide to risk it do not pre-pay by credit card or you will be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: kittyuk77
Reviews.Content: After reading the appauling reveiws about this hotel I was extremely worried about what would face me at the hotel, when we arrived the reception was quick to deal with us and was extremely friendly and efficient, when we arrived at our room it was very clean and more than value for money. The room was cleaned everyday and this is the first hotel in new york i have stayed in where you get a full size fridge and a new york post delivered to your door everyday. Not only was the hotel good but the location was excellent out of the hotel door and you can see times square at the top of the street its excellent, also only 1 block away from macy's what more can anyone ask for. I shall be returning to new york next september and I will look at staying at the pennsylvania before any other hotel in manhattan. If I was anyone looking for a cheap holiday to new york so as to save the money for shopping stay here its well worth it and ignore all the bad reviews its just not true.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely apalling. Disgusted with this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: myzzpyggi
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. I am disgusted in the fact that this hotel is offering rooms out in the condition they are in. The room was tiny, dirty and mouldy. There were large amounts of paint peeling off and mildew and mould on the ceiling. We had a visitor by night, a little mouse! Our room backed onto six lifts so that's all we could hear ALL night! The ice machine was near our room and the platform that you would place your bucket on was broken so that you could see inside, it looked like it hadn't been cleaned ever, there were cigarette butts, dust and cups inside it. Someone had been sick outside it one night and it hadn't been cleaned up 16 hours later!. The one thing to it's credit is that it's location is good and that you don't spend much time in it!. Please, if possible stay away from this hotel as it will ruin your holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: scoobydoo3000
Reviews.Content: I was leery at first by staying at this hotel, but after I stayed there, I would even recommend it. The bed was huge and comfortable, the room was spacious, the water pressure was great, everything was clean, tv worked great and it had a nice view. The only problem was we found a drink lid on the floor beside the bed. I wasn't even going to mention it, but that was our only problem and it wasn't even a problem. The hotel is close to Times Square and Broadway. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: masinorfolk
Reviews.Content: Really worried after reading so many bad reviews. Not so bad. We were on the 12th floor which has a private business room, which your key can open and you can get a free breakfast every morning and tea and coffee all day. Room small for two adults and one child but comfortable. Needs updating and painting but clean. Ideal for sightseeing and shopping. Lobby very busy all the time more like a railway station. Staff pleasant. Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “wasnt that bad”
Reviews.Author: Gnomes
Reviews.Content: Having saw many reviews for this hotel, was rather worried!! when we arrived we had no problems checking in, but our first room was dirty/very small/with a bit of a smell. So we politely asked for another room, which we got no problems, this room was alot better, still in need of decoration and an upgrade, and some warmer bedding, but the hotel is in such a great position!! and we LOVE NYC. Next time i will try the New Yorker, just at the next block, friends of ours stayed there and loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: biddy06
Reviews.Content: just back from a 4 night stay at the hotel pennsylvania. the hotel itself is very old and run down. the rooms are in badly need of a refurbishment. there is paint coming off the walls. the baths are all rusty, the carpet is sticky and the windows and doors have all mold and mildue aroung them. the room was very big and had two queen size beds. the bed sheets were clean and the towels were changed everyday. the location is brilliant. right across the street from madison square gardens and macys two streets away. but overall this hotel is in bad need of being closed down and refurbished. the lobby is fabalous with lovely chandelers but its very deceiving. the rooms are awfull and badly need to be redecorated as does the hall carpets and walls. did not see one mouse but pest control is the most dialed number in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - But Terrible Rooms Unhealthy”
Reviews.Author: belfast61
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay - and think the last. Hotel has got worse, needs cleaning up. One of our party had to be moved three times due to Mice, Cockroches and was'nt the room they had asked and payed for. Spoke to people arriving and they were disgusted could'nt believe the state of some rooms, really is luck, some rooms seam to be ok and others just terrible! We had small children with us and one was very ill due to eating food in the area. Brilliant location and central to every thing - Macy's just at the corner and the empire state is 10min walk. Its just a pity they would'nt clean the hotel up nothing fancy just CLEAN! because you should'nt really spend much time in your room there's too much to see and do! Just LOVE NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Atrocious Room, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LynseyJ
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Hotel Pennsylvania for a weeks stay in December to do some shopping in New York and can't fault the location. Right next to Maceys. Hotel reception was lovely, staff average. Had booked a twin room but we're given a double room with no choice of changing as all twins were booked up. The room itself was horrendous and we're only lucky we didnt spend too much time in it. Paint was peeling off the walls, there was damp marks and one night there was definately the sounds of something scurrying around on the floor. Plus sleep was made difficult by the fact that you could hear everyone else on the same floor. Went with a friend and the city was amazing, so much to do but I would definately not go back to the Pennsylvania Hotel, they should pay you to stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Whats with the bad reviews?”
Reviews.Author: alisonoc
Reviews.Content: What is with the bad reviews?! My mother, my aunt and myself stayed in the Pennslyvania in NYC in Nov 06 and I must say after reading some of the reviews I was terrified about what was waiting for us......... The lobby of the Penn if just fantastic, the hotel also has a 24 hr cafe in the lobby which serves english tea! Very handy. The elevators are a little dated but there are plenty of them available and they are quite fast so you're never wating long! The corridors leading to the hotel rooms are a little off putting because the hallways are dark and the carpet and doors are dated, this didnt really put me off thought because every floor was provided with an ice and soda machine. More than making up for it in my eyes! The room was just fantastic, we where located on the 5th floor and overlooked madison sq gardens. The room itself was huge for an NYC hotel room, it comfortably fit two double beds a telephone table and lamp table and a big television stand! There was loads of space for our suitcases and plently of room to move around. There was even a mini hallway to the en suite with a wardrobe!!! The bathroom was basic but clean and had shampoo, conditioner and a hairdryer. I was really massively pleased with the rooms which were undoubtably the cheapest and yet had everything you could want, they where clean, spacious and not lacking in any facility. I will definitly be staying in this hotle from now on and wouldnt hesitate to recommend it to any of my friends. My mother had previously visited New York and she commented that the rooms in the Milford Plaza where almost double the price and half the size! Who really cares if the carpet isnt the newest one available? All you need from a New York hotel is a place to catch a few hours sleep.......... enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: da_monkeymafia
Reviews.Content: If you are shopping, catching a game or sight seeing, this hotel is a must. Location is excellent! This hotel is situated directly across the road from Maddison Square Gardens and a 5 minute walk from the Empire state building. If you come out of the main doors and turn right - walk straight for 15 minutes you are at Time Square. The rooms are basic, but clean (nice bathroom) comfortable, secure and cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Brill location”
Reviews.Author: matildalou
Reviews.Content: Absolute great location you cannot get any better, right across the road from Madison Square Garden, and 5min walk to Time Square. We stayed here for the New Year 2006, and def worth the stay. The hotel room was so clean and big, clean laundry every day. Could not fault this hotel, would definetely recommend it to anyone. Dont get put off by the musty smell in the halls when you come in, it's just an old hotel and make sure you ask for the refurbished rooms. You also get a free safe where it is kept in reception which i would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump”
Reviews.Author: TN-Bill
Reviews.Content: This place is a dump. Dirty, run-down rooms. Un-friendly, un-helpful staff. Luckily I stayed here on business before some friends and I were to come back a week later for fun. We were able to change hotels to one a couple of blocks down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful”
Reviews.Author: dooleySurrey
Reviews.Content: We changed our room twice. The first one was small and the shower was broken with paint peeling of the ceiling. The window in the second room we were offered did not close. It was open at least 9 inches, there were holes in the wall where various items had been removed and the shower did not work. The third room (which we accepted) was large and absolutly freezing. The heating totally inadequate. We asked for extra heating but to no avail, they gave us extra blankets. We ended up filling the holes in the gaps around the windows with newspaper, The sheets on the bed were clean but torn. One of the light fittings had no cover on it, the plug that the lamp was plugged into was broken. When I said to one of the receptionist that the place should be closed down, she said it was being closed in three months time for redevelopment. My advice is go to a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not so bad”
Reviews.Author: Tatadaan
Reviews.Content: All te reviews read, the opinion of them is not so good. After staying there for a week, the hotel was not so bad at all. A very big room, clean bathroom, all day good cleaning. It is not the most modern and technical hotel, but it was good where we used it for. So I really mean it, If you want to go to NY, in the middle of where it all happens, go to this hotel. The price is just good for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “it was good”
Reviews.Author: chlovesnyc
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at Hotel Pennsylvania last June and we had a great time. The employees were all very friendly and made you feel welcome. The location is great, only a 10 minute walk from Times Square which was ideal for myself! The room we stayed in was clean and tidy although we could of had a better view :D but that didn't bother us as we were hardly coming to NYC to sit in our room! The only thing that wasn't so good was the decor. Too much brown makes the halls look some what gloomy!

Reviews.Title: “We would recomend this hotel. From Lurgan Co Armagh N,Ireland”
Reviews.Author: Thesaint72
Reviews.Content: Would We recomend this hotel.Yes. Before we went we heard nothing but bad reports. I got on to City and show.com who we booked with they were very helpful and said they would get us another hotel if we wanted .But we wanted some wear central.They said that they would request a renovated room for us.So when we got there what do you think. The staff were very friendly and helpfull.The rooms were clean and tidy .There was fresh towels every day and the sheets were changed every second day.Now we were very lucky that we got such a good room.I was talking to a lady who had been moved 3 times.Please bear in mind that this only a 2** hotel but very central to everywear.We were out of our room from 8.00am to 11.30pm every day you are only in the room at night time.But if I was going to this hotel again I would want to try and get the same room or asked to be moved if it was not what I wanted hope this is helpfull to anyone reading this

Reviews.Title: “Amazing trip!! You dont need a great hotel.. its all about fun and exploring!”
Reviews.Author: emma31188
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed at this hotel for 3 nights!! We had an amzing trip!! The hotel was great if you are only stayin there a short time and all you want to do is explore!! As you can imagin when visiting NEW YORK you are rarely in your hotel... its just like a base!! The hotel was very busy and not that welcoming and the room basic! However..... I had the best time ever on my trip... it doesnt matter what hotel you stay in as there are sooo many things to do and see!! I would recommend this hotel if you are not looking to spend a great deal of time in your room!! Plus great location!!!

Reviews.Title: “I should have listened to the reviews on here...Awful, Dishonest Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: PlazaBoy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely awful. I have been to NY many times before and have previously stated at the Marriott and Radisson and for a change thought I'd try Hotel Penn. What a big big mistake!! The reception/lobby looks nice but thats about it. You then realise all the unsavoury characters walking in and around. We booked a Penn 5000 Club room which are suppose to be the best rooms and offer seperate check in, seperate lifts and so on. 1. Check in was very rude and seperate check in means if and when open and is a side room wth rude staff. 2. No seperate lifts for Penn 5000 - this is just dishonesty on their website 3. Upon getting to the room, it was awful. Tatty towels and bathroom was disgusting, no views and bedroom very dark and no good lighting. Very tired after a long flight yet could hear everything from room next door. After hard complaining, given another room. 4. Second room equally as bad!! 5. Complimentary breakfast in the "exclusive lounge" was just a small dirty room and breakfast was a drinks machine and "continental" equated to some muffins 6. We decided to battle it out and checked out after 2 nights and stayed at the Radisson as we just couldnt cope as the hotel was so uncomfortable- not even good enough to take your shoes off! 7. Upon early check out, presented with a bill that included $20 + tax per day for internet use when their internet site states it is free and we specifically phoned up from the UK beforehand to check on this to see whether PC provided in room or whether we needed to take our own laptop. Staff were very rude and accusatory and just completely unhelpful. For the sake of approx $40, you would think for good customer practice they would as a gesture of goodwill remove this charge. Very argumentative staff who havent got a clue about customer service. 8. I didnt authorise payment and told them to call when I got back to the UK yet they left me a message whilst I was still in NY and then charged my card!! I made the big mistake of taking into all the reviews on this site and wish I had. I travel a lot and have never in 10 years ever come across such a bad excuse for a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad”
Reviews.Author: citygirl223
Reviews.Content: The first room they gave us was HORRIBLE. We asked to be switched to another room and they did this for us without a problem at all. The new room was great! Clean with an amazing view. My suggestion: when you book a room here, ask for a renovated, non-smoking room. Seriously, I'm pretty picky and this place wasn't ALL THAT BAD!

Reviews.Title: “It's not that bad”
Reviews.Author: member101
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to post a review on here for those people who have just booked and then you check these pages and it's full of people complaining. I went to New York for my boyfriends birthday and the Pennsylvania was absolutely fine. When you're in a city as amazing as New York you don't want to spend all your time in the hotel, as we saw it, it was somewhere to sleep, wash and then go back out! Maybe we were easily pleased but I honestly do not think that the hotel is as bad as people on here make out! The location is absolutely perfect, you are right next to Macy's, The Empire State, Madison Square Garden and Times Square is a pleasant walk away - that was the main thing to us!

Reviews.Title: “mouse founded”
Reviews.Author: mazzolini
Reviews.Content: We expected to find one cleanliness not exceptional but the rat in the room just not… it was gone around calm between the suitcases, and this is one seccante what truly. Naturally they have changed to us endured room, and we have understood that all the plans are not equal, some are more decent in how much restructures to you more than recent. Little sagacities, type would be enough not to find the bath or the room with the rests of the previous hosts. However the hotel is in the central position, a lot very connected with all.

Reviews.Title: “hmmm”
Reviews.Author: oac966
Reviews.Content: Well just got back from a 2 week stay at the penn hotel. Mixed feelings on the stay. Overall it was not a great experience. The room was a ok size with 2 double beds, with torn bedsheets and linen. Bathroom was a bit small, and quite dirty as well. Location is also ok but nothing great. (it depends on what you want to do ) In terms of the hotel, i would say that if price is a issue its not tooo bad a place to stay however if you can find something along the same price probably take that option. Couple of reasons for the above comment , the caprpet in the room is filthy and is not vaccummed everyday (it was probably done once in the two weeks we stayed there ). In addition housekeeping has no idea what dusting means. Their idea of housekeeping is making the bed and replacing the towels, and literally thats it, dont expect anything more, on a few days they did nto even bother to empty the rubbish bin in the room. While there i also kept my bags permanently locked and kept all valuables in my locked bags, just go this feeling of uneasyness around the place. They do have safety deposit boxes but after you wait for half an hour to try and get a box and no one answer you really wonder if you want to leave valuables in a place like that. The other thing that is quite bad about the hotel is that you have to checkout by 12:00 pm (fair enough) but they charge you $4 storage fee for each bag that you want to leave in their luggage room after you have checked out. (most other hotesl will keep your bags for free) In terms of the staff they are about as usefull as a chocolate teapot. We had people in the room next door smoking on a non smoking floor and the smell kept coming in to our room, When i complained I was told there is nothign we can do maybe housekeeping can spray somehting. (No staff member at that hotel seems to care about anything ) So overall if you are looking for a very basic roof over your head, and basically a place to slepp this place if ok. If you plan on spending time relaxing in the room please book somehwere else, even the bed sheets feel dirty. In conclusion this hotel is one that needs to be shut down, all the staff ssacked and remaned in to a upper class hostel. Because that is what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Dirtiest hotel i've ever stopped in !!!”
Reviews.Author: b8njw
Reviews.Content: I don't often write reports on sites like these but I’ve just got back from the Pennsylvania Hotel New York and though this deserved one...... People are being far too polite, this was the dirtiest most run down hotel I have ever been to. We go away every New Years Eve, and always book early; we booked this hotel in Feb 2006 and arrived on Dec 29th for four nights. After a long day's travelling, we just wanted to relax, quick shower etc then hit the sights of New York. 3 hrs later we did!! The first room we checked into was tiny and very dusty. The bathroom didn't look as if it had been cleaned in months and there was a packet of condoms on the bedside table!! The second, third and fourth rooms we were shown were in similar states of disrepair, furniture legs missing, dirty furniture, stale smells in alleged "non smoking" rooms etc. We eventually demanded a refund and to be re-located. The reception staff offered us an "upgrade" to a clean room, when we inspected this room it was clean but still not three star standard, We accepted the room but refused to pay the $50 per night upgrade fee (I don't see why you should have to pay extra for cleanliness!!) This wasn't just us being fussy brits either; there was a long queue of complainants by the time we came back down. So I guess in summary, if you have to stay here then request to see other rooms, 1152 was the one we ended up in. Great location, needs closing down, fumigating, decorating and re-launching. I won't be going back!!

Reviews.Title: “horrible! very disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: friniace
Reviews.Content: I was really disappointed by this hotel. Very well located but that's all. hall of reception not badly but the room superior is very disappointing for 150$: dirty, old… A advice, avoid absolutely!! Look at the photos, better than words.

Reviews.Title: “Unglamorous Surroundings”
Reviews.Author: Xeres25
Reviews.Content: This place once you get past the huge lobby is so like the hotel in The Shining that it's uncanny. You really do expect an axe murderer to break your door down. Thankfully, the doors are made of metal which is most reassuring. The whole place is in dire need of a refurbish and the staff a change of uniform. Having said all that it is not too bad for location or price. The room had some well dodgy stains on the carpet, but the linen was clean. The bathroom was tiny, with a door frame that was clearly rotting. Not sure how clean you can get in this place. A place that is bearable for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: OhioApril
Reviews.Content: Our family just made the first trip to NY the big city. We stayed here at the Hotel Pennsylvania, like most the reviews scared me, but once we had the booking done and time to leave, we arrived and was very pleased with the room, the lighting was dem but not bad at all, the bath was small and could use some updating but the closet was so big a big walk in, they could afford to spare closet space and extend the bath. The room was clean and did not smell, Our sheets were WHITE and clean. The door to the rooms are nice and very sound proof. as for the hotel very nice at least the lobby and 7th floor. There was only one problem that was taken care of each day we needed at least 5 wash cloths a day showers and washing the face at night, and we got 2 a day but a simple request and they arrived to our room. We were not mis treated and we booked off Hotels.com. not a difference. Great place the city right ou the door or try the sub way $7 a day will take you any where you would like to go, Liberty Island to Empire. This was the best trip I have taken in my life, We will be returning. My little girl who is 8 had a blast. I would recommend this hotel to any one.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Hac123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good enough value for money. Location was good. Rooms was a good size with a larger than king size double bed which was one of the comfiest hotel beds i have slept in. We felt it couldve been cleaned a bit better round the skirting boards, carpet hoovered round the skirting boards and behing the bed. The sheets and the bed however were very clean and so was the bathroom althought the decor was not the best but it was a very comfortable stay for the 5 nights we were there. The only thing I would strongly recommend against is eating in the Lindeys restauraunt!! It was awful! Breakfast was double the price of other diners outside and the food was just awful. The sausage I had was the cheapest sausage ive seen with large 'bits' through it. And the orange juice was watered down. Very bad quality food for a very high price! OJ's restaurant on the other hand is much nicer food and cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “again loved it”
Reviews.Author: nyc-newcastle
Reviews.Content: Haved just returned from my 3rd stay @ this hotel, again loved it all 3 times i have been on 7th floor again think the hotel staff very friendly,lobby excellent and the location tops it off fully I have just booked again for dec07 and am lookin forward already. The hotel is always really busy and does get alot of repeat customers.I personally would recoment this hotel to any of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Central and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: newyorknut
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at this hotel for 9 nights on our big adventure to New York. The room we had was spacious and clean. It could have done with a revamp - but hey - we were in New York and it was a great place as it was central to everthing. We walked everywhere from here - even to Central Park - a two hour stroll. The staff were helpful and we would definitely go back. In fact we will!!

Reviews.Title: “Love New York, HATE THIS TERRIBLE HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: Gastronaught
Reviews.Content: Ok - good things first. If you've never been to NY, it is probably the best city in the world ( I speak as a Londoner) The hotel is well located for all the touristy things although its not where I would chose to be based for a holiday. (Stay somewhere around Greenwich Village or Soho instead, its ten times better than where the Pennsylvania is located and you are still only a short cab ride or tube journey to all the attractions.) I was in NY on business and had to stay at the Pennsylvania. The hotel is vast and needed to be redecorated about 15 years ago. The lobby is like the waiting room of a central London train station: impersonal, busy and chaotic. Staff are too few and far between and they are generally rude. In my dark little room I had plaster falling off the walls in chunks. The bathroom was small and had plastic peeling off the base of the shower cubicle. There were rust marks on practically every metal surface. The TV had terrrible reception and was about 15 years old. I had no Kettle, no cups and no safe. Only when I arrived was I told that formal check in time is at 3pm! I got there at 11.30am and was hoping for a short wait. Instead I had to wait around after a long flight until a room was ready. The only thing positive I can say is that I left my luggage with the lugagge porter for about 5 hours after I checked out and he looked after it well and nothing went missing. There are scores of decent hotels in New York: don't be duped into staying at this one just because its a bit cheaper and in what looks like a good location if you've never been to NY before. Heed my advice, I've been to the city six times: if you want a youngish trendy scene and lots of bars and cafes stay further south than this (West Village, Soho or Tribeca are best - or if your're feeling extremely trendy and don't mind a bit of grime stay in the East Village, but it's probably not for families) or if you want a more sedate stay go further north and stay in the tres classy upper east somewhere between 55th and 80th on the East Side of Manhattan! Consider yourselves told.

Reviews.Title: “awful hotel room - prehistoric”
Reviews.Author: terimeri
Reviews.Content: Went to New York for a week and really enjoyed it. Mostly out during the day and evening for the whole week, however when in the hotel room did not like it one bit. Very poor standard room and I had expected something good. Staff member was abrupt and I had not finished talking to him before he turned and started talking to someone else owever i'm told this is what to expect in New York. The air conditioning unit was huge, old and ridiculously noisy when on and had to be considering it was July. Did not have any meals in the hotel so no comment here. I think the like for like standard compared to an equivalent European hotel is very poor. Also the bathroom styles differ from European ones. The strange American toilets bowl overflowed it was awful.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you can help it”
Reviews.Author: toilgal
Reviews.Content: Overall, I was not pleased with this hotel in the least. Although the location was good, the service and security lacked. I would not stay here again and certainly would not recommend to a friend. As I was checking in (after waiting in line for about 15 minutes), I noted 3 separate people come the counter upset and complaining that their key did not work. Upon entering my room, the smell was musty and I noticed peeling paint and mold in the bathroom. The overall condition of the room was clean, but very shabby and in much need of rennovation. I also noticed that my dead bolt had been removed from the wall. Being that I was staying by myself and had overheard that there were some problems with keys working properly, I did not feel safe sleeping in that condition. I called security and told them my lock was broken and I was told they would send someone up. One hour later, no one had come yet, so I called again. I waited another 30-45 min....still no one. So I packed all of my stuff up, and waited in line to request a new room (about 10 mintues this time). The woman who helped me had no concern why I was requesting a new room, but quickly granted my request. When I made it up to my new room, low and behold...no dead bolt again! I was very tired at this point and decided to risk it and go to sleep. I put my suitcase in front of the door, not like that would do any good, and left the bathroom light on so I could feel safer. Needless to say, I didn't sleep well. The room was pretty quiet overall, you could hear running water from the neighbors and I could hear someone peeing...but the halls were quiet. Overall, the service was horrible and conditions were very, very shabby. Most importantly, I did not feel safe. If you are on a budget and just need a place to stay where security and quality is not your top priority, this place may suit you just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: hotelgst
Reviews.Content: I went to NY in October with friends to shop for a week. After having booked the hotel, i read teh reveiws and started to worry so much so I contacted the hotel and asked for an renovated room. Upon arriving at the hotel, after a taxi journey from hell, we were greated by a queue which moved quite quickly. Our room was very big and was what seemed to be two room where the wall was taken down between to make 1 large room. the room was clean and comfortable and great value for money. We stayed for 4 nights although booked for 5 as our flight was not until 10pm and we wanted to keep our room. This hotel is a rooms factory. With 1700 rooms what more can you expect. Its location is fantastic, the rooms are clean and comfortable and it is great value for money. The only thing I would say is stay away from the restaurant. The food is dreadful and there is a 15% service charge that you are not told about which I wouldn't mind but the service is the worst i have experienced

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Horrible Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: pack513
Reviews.Content: My mom, sister, and booked a room for the weekend of the 8th-11th for a girls weekend shopping trip. We paid almost $400 a night. On arrival, the lobby was gorgeous and looks like a high end hotel. Our stay began horribly when we checked in. The woman at the reception desk demanded our passports, which we did not have or bring because we are all NY residents. When we handed over our driver's licences she let out a big huff. The rest of the check in was rather normal. We waited about 10 minutes just to get an elevator to the 8th floor even though there are about 12 elevators. We got into our room it was not at all what we expected. The hotel's website says that all of the rooms have been renovated....they definitely werent. Our room looked like the inside of a roach motel, not a $400/night hotel. The lamp shades were not on the lamps and some of the bulbs were completely blackened and burned out. The heaters knobs were broken off and there were no adjustments. We called maintenance since the heater wouldnt turn on. They told us all we could do was plug it in to use it and unplug it to turn it off. So the room would either be blazing hot or freezing cold. When we began to settle in we realized the bathroom was not clean and there was even feces (poo) left on the toilet seat. In utter disgust we complained and were moved to a room on the 6th floor. We were told we were being upgraded to a Junior Suite. We got the new room key and went to enter the room but to our surprise the room was occupied! A woman shrieked...when we realized what was happening we apologized and went back down to the reception desk. This time we were sent to the 10th floor. The room we got was much more acceptable but certainly not worth $400/night. It was more like a "Comfort Inn" type room. At any rate it was clean and had new furniture, but for being one of the "renovated" rooms it wasn't all that great. Looks like they only put half the effort into the renovations. Another downside is that they charge you $4 per bag to store luggage. Checkout is at noon and if your flight is not until later in the day you will have to pay per piece to store the luggage in the basement. I will not be staying here again. The location is great. It's right across from Madison Square Garden and less than 1 block from Macy's. If you don't care what the accommodations are like....

Reviews.Title: “Good rodent home”
Reviews.Author: Tetleydrinker
Reviews.Content: It is now 11 months since my stay here but the not very pleasant memories of this place are still fresh. It was my first visit to the USA and was on a two night stopover to see the sights of New York before moving on to a business trip. The hotel was booked by my colleague and when I looked at the hotel website before the trip I thought wow, what a great looking hotel for the money. On arriving, tired after our flight and walking into the impressive lobby I was still thinking this is great. Up to the 6th floor in the fast lift-still impressed- then out into the corridor-OK not quite as nice but still pretty good, strange looking prison cell like doors. Then when I entered my room I realised why it was so cheap. Everything was shabby, the carpet was bare and sticky, the bathroom was dirty and rusty, all in all very dingy. I put my case down and at that moment a mouse scuttled out from under the radiator to see who had disturbed it and then scuttled back again. Just what you want to see in your hotel room! When I complained about it to reception the guy just laughed. I asked to be moved but there were no rooms available. It was just somewhere to rest my head and put up with it as this was secondary to my excitement of being in New York for the first time and seeing all the sights. We had one full day in New York and made the most of it. On the plus side the guy at the hotel tourist desk was very helpful and we booked our open topped bus tour through him. It was fantastic to see all the famous sights and is an experience I will never forget. The only downside is the hotel. The location, as everybody says is perfect and the double bed was actually quiet comfortable and clean. Would I recommend it? Definitley not- unless you are fond of mice!!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Carola1
Reviews.Content: We were quite worried after booking this hotel for a short break, having then read the reviews. Need not have been! Location could not have been better. We were on the 16th floor - not much of a view - but we were really not in the room in daylight hours so that didn't matter. The staff were really helpful. Rooms were a little tired but we were very impressed by the fact that sheets and towels were changed on a daily basis. Overall - can't fault it!

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad”
Reviews.Author: Sussexdown
Reviews.Content: Date : 8th December 2006 I have just return after staying at the Pennsylvania Hotel and I must say that it wasn't that bad. I had read so many bad reviews that I contacted the hotel and asked for one of the renovated rooms as I had read that these were better. The room was clean and the beds comfortable, as we only intended to sleep there, this suited us fine. If you want 5 star then you will have to pay 5 star prices and as I would prefer to use the money on all the shopping that is available, I feel that for what I paid, the hotel was fine.

Reviews.Title: “A dump!! ”
Reviews.Author: Toams
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the worst hotels I have ever experienced. I stayed there for 3 nights from 30th Nov till 3 Dec with my mum and I can tell you I will never set foot there again. The lobby (reception) is reminiscent of a train station , it's too busy and the queues are massive to check in/check out. Our room was on the 14th floor, the wall paper was peeling off, our pillows were as flat as a pancake (No spares). The bathroom was disgusting, our toilet was leaking from the pipe so a puddle of water was forming on the side of the bathroom. The bath tub was also peeling and we only got very lukewarm water to wash in which was not easy to get. To top it all off I used the bedroom phone to make a 3 mins international call (bearing in mind that there were no call prices available), when I checked out my bill mounted to$60!!!!!!! What a shocker to the system. I think it's a tragic hotel and I can think of better places to go such as the Ramada New Yorker down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: V.V.Happy
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this hotel we were tempted to try and change our hotel 4 weeks before leaving -- glad we didn't! We had called the company we had our booking with in order to request a rennovated room but the hotel did not have a note of this. We were given our first room on the 4th floor and as soon as we opend the door the smell of smoke hit you (we had not requested a smoking room). It also had connecting doors which we had said we didn't want. We went back to request a change and asked for a higher room but were told that there were none available and were given another room on the 4th floor. Again it had connecting doors, so off we went downstairs again with our cases and were given a room on the 16th floor (1606). It was a lot smaller and had single beds instead of doubles but we hadn't gone to New York to sit in the room. It was clean and even though the ceiling of the bathroom and the bath had peeling paint it was clean. The pealing paint wasn't too much of a big deal, none of it fell on you in the shower of came off when you were soaking your tired feet in the bath. The view was really good and looked over Macy's with the Empire State Building behind it. . During these changes the staff could not have been more helpful. The rooms had maid service every day and the bathroom was always cleaned. The only complaint about this was that the room wasn't hoovered at all in the 4 nights we were there and didn't look like it had been hoovered before we got there. Also we used the Hotel Services desk to book tickets for our bus tour and our boat tour as well as to get some addresses -- they were extremely helpful and patient. They gave us the receipts which we just handed over to the operators. The location is amazing and I don't think it could have been better for anyone looking to be close to everything. You walk out of the front door of the hotel and have Madison Square Garden in front of you, turn to the right and walk for 10 minutes and come to Times Square. We would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Hotel Pennsylvania”
Reviews.Author: goodos
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed in the Hotel Pennsylvania, New York from 29th Nov til 4th Dec. We were very apprehensive from reading all the reviews and were mentally prepared to have to stand our ground with the reception. On arrival we had to queue for no more than 5 mins (though at other times there were hundreds of people in line). I immediately asked the receptionist for a refurbished room and was told that unless I had booked one he could not upgrade me as the hotel was full, but he managed to find us a resonable room on the 3rd floor. We checked the room thorougly before accepting it and although it was old, decor was past best, it was fine. The bath was rusty around the plug but the shower was fab. The only draw back was the smell of stale smoke, but by leaving the windows open for a day or two the smell had gone. The location of the Hotel was fantastic. Any staff I encountered were polite and helpful, especially as the place was packed at all hours of the day.. and to be honest we spent very little time in the place we were too busy out seeing the wonderful city of New York. We had a fabulous time and just like everyone else cannot wait to go back. I would stay at the Penn again but I would book a superior home so I wouldn't have all the anxiety before arrival like we did this time.

Reviews.Title: “It was fine, basic but fine!”
Reviews.Author: theowlhouse
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Penn for 5 nights in November 2006. We were quite anxious about our stay - especially as we didn't see any of these reviews until we'd paid for our stay in advance through last minute. The check in staff were friendly and we only had to wait for a few minutes. Our room on the 16th floor was fine. It wasn't huge, but wasn't tiny either. Yes the furniture was old, but you could tell the carpet had been hoovered recently - and indeed it was hoovered everyday, the sheets and towels changed, and the bathroom cleaned. the room was warm and the bed reasonably comforatbly. The bathroom was fine too - lots of hot water, powerful shower. We could moan about the small patch of flakey paint on the ceiling, but in the grand scheme of things it didn't seem like a big deal. yes the window was slightly open, and we couldn't shut it, but it didn't bother us. the air conditioning unit was a bit old and not terribly effective, but in November it doesn't matter so much. Either we had a lucky escape, or this place isn't as bad as people say. We went prepared - i took cleaning things, bug spray, ear plugs, sleeping bag liner, slippers, air freshener...we used none of it. The location is fantastic, and when i think back to our time in new york, i'm remembering the atmosphere, the shops, the food, the sights...and not the bit of flakey paint on the ceiling of the room!

Reviews.Title: “Whats the problem??”
Reviews.Author: JEM21
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I must admit to feeling a little worried....however, it was fine! The location is fantastic. For the amount of time we were actually in our room (just to lay our heads and rest our very sore feet) there was no problem. OK it does need a little updating but our beds and towels were changed each day. What I would say to people is that if you want a five star hotel then book one and pay the price!!!

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay here......How Any Could Is Unreal...”
Reviews.Author: augustakel
Reviews.Content: Very simple do not stay there, it is a total kip.. Checked in Checked out in 10 mins would not stay there. Found a gorgous hotel on 31st st Wolcott hotel.........There is so much better in New York just take the time to look honestly......................

Reviews.Title: “A Filthy Dump Never Again”
Reviews.Author: carolcass
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here for 4 nights in November, what a filthy grotty hotel. after booking a twin room we arrived to be told that the hotel only had double rooms left but they would provide a foldaway bed. The foldaway was paper thin spings sticking in your back. The worst part was the bathroom one morning I found a cockroach in the bath the hotel simply sent someone to take it away wrapped in a towel from the bathroom. never again would I stay here not even in a deluxe room given to me for FREE.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: br8kodawn
Reviews.Content: As god as my witness, this hotel is it's own Ellis Island. People not familiar with NYC - just coming in and out of the City are checking into this hotel and accepting it as their destination. YOU DONT HAVE TO STAY HERE!! I checked in, went to my room, and turned right around within 30 secs. of what I saw. The furniture is dirty and hallways long and dark. I asked to see another room and that was even Worse! Go to the Marriott Residence Inn on 39th and 6th. For about 40.00 more a night, you get a suite. Treat yourself better than staying at a place like hotel pennyslvania

Reviews.Title: “go to the 15th floor++++++++++++”
Reviews.Author: bingoshirls
Reviews.Content: we stayed from the 23rd nov. 28th nov . the room was clean tidy. alittle dated however but you can live with that. we had a view facing the empire state, it was an awesome sight!!!! they are slowly doing the rooms up which i suppose takes time so it looks like an on going job as there are about 1700 rooms!! i have no complaints other than the lobby is nicer than the rooms!!! i dont know how the rooms were on other floors but the 15th was ok. i did e mail them asking for a room with a view on the 15th floor or above which i had been advised to do because they work from the top down i believe! so it was well woth the effort! try it!!!! the location was excellent the subway across the road and central to everywhere superb! we had no problems at all. and believe me i had read nearly all the reports before i went and was very nervous about the whole thing, i am glad i saw it for myself and it was nothing like what was written about it. like i have already said, it does need bringing up to date, the cleaning could be of a higher standard but my bed, towels and room were very clean. what more can i say

Reviews.Title: “Run a1000 Miles from this place”
Reviews.Author: Bidone
Reviews.Content: We were booked into Hotel Pennsylvania on the 11th. Nov..2006. It was our first time to New York. What a Nightmare. I would just like to say we found this Hotel filthy dirty smelly bedrooms, broken bathroom fittings, holes in walls,dirty stinking pillows, mice and cockroaches, public toilets with slime on walls, urine scale on toilets. And last but by no means least dead flies in our drinks. This place had absoutly no hygene standards anywhere. It is a walking timebomb for all kinds of diseases brought about by unhygenic practises. They have the nerve to charge for five nights 1250$ = approx.(994 euros)

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: mikemartyn
Reviews.Content: the first room they palmed us off with was grotty,stained walls ,thread bare carpets,and smelled musty,this room was on the sixth floor. after complaining they put us on the eleventh floor,this room was decent,so if you stay here stay on the eleventh or twelth floor.

Reviews.Title: “this place IS a kip (dive)”
Reviews.Author: sdciqbal
Reviews.Content: oohh we checked in and we checked out in the space of 4 hours. the 2 rooms we were allocated one stank of cigarettes the other of mould. the linens were nasty esp the towels in the bathroom. the beds looked like 100 souls had slept in them. the fridge i espcially called and asked for to store medication was a relic from the 70s and was not switched on. when plugged in i realised why as the humming was in direct competion with the window airconditioning unit. it was depressing. very depressing. the whole place needs an uplift. i wouldnt have minded if it was a 2 nights stay but we were booked in for a week. and it was expensive some nights $250. we moved to "the Time" check it out its lovely. this place is for back packers who can afford $250 a night (?!) and dont want to wash - nasty towels and yellow bath tub. Horrid, dont go.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Lins1983
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting this hotel to be that great having read other reviews on this website, however, i was pleasantly suprised. The hotel has an amazing location close to Times Square and the Empire State. The actual hotel i found to be clean, though the rooms were small, however, little time was spent in it. The hotel staff i also found to be very pleasant and were extremely helpful when i found out that i had picked up the wrong suitcase in the aiport (oops!) and sorted everything out for me. Thankfully i got the right suitacse dropped off a few hours later! Overall i found this hotel to be good value for money - many other hotels were much more expensive, and the loaction was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “not bad, not good”
Reviews.Author: bluepc
Reviews.Content: Not as bad as some reviews said. It is very slow to check in,staff kept walking off from behind the desk even though people are waiting,a bit rude! Stayed on 2nd floor, room needs updating- new plaster and a fresh paint job to start with, bath was rusty with some enamel missing. My room had 2 adjoining doors that leads to rooms next door. You could hear everything, not good as the ladies next door always got up at 6. Also had a dog staying on our corridor, very annoying. Sheets and towels were clean and changed every day. Power very low in rooms, takes ages to dry hair.No heating,bring a sweater to wear at night.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Pennsylvania - the good, the bad and the ugly”
Reviews.Author: Merlin5
Reviews.Content: I was at the Penn for 4 nights with an educational party from 19 - 23 November - there were around 35 of us in total. Was not looking forward to the hotel stay as had read the reviews and knew what to expect (which actually helped a lot - I had imagined it eve worse than it is). Starting with the good: Excellent location - can't fault it for accessibility. Check in was fast. New carpets in the hallways (certainly on floors 2 and 14 anyway). New carpet in our room on the 2nd floor, powerful, hot shower, clean bed linen and towels changed daily, no musty smell, no evidence of roaches or mice and no bed bugs. Fantastic view of Empire State Building (and Chrysler) from our room on 14th floor. Most of the bell hops are truly miserable, but if you can find Frank the bellhop he is a wonderful guy - cheerful and helpful and recommended so many good restaurants and places to go and marked them all on a map for us - if only there were more Franks around. The bad: Dim lighting (although this is fairly common in hotels). The bath you would not want to use (in our 2nd floor room) - not dirty but rusty and was OK to put your feet into while having a shower but wouldn't want to lie in it. Incredibly noisy. 2nd floor is so close to the busy street that never stops and there is no double glazing so the noise is incredible. We had ear plugs with us which I would adivse for anyone staying there. Our room on the 14th floor (I'll get to why we had to switch rooms) had filthy carpets which you would not want to put bare feet on (we had slippers) and the plaster was coming away at various points due to damp I would imagine and it did smell musty. The corridoors on the 14th floor were particularly damaged and had crumbling plaster. The ugly: We had 2 connecting doors in our room on the 2nd floor (not to other members of our party). On the first night we were woken at 3am by a man coming back into one of the connecting rooms who was speaking loudly into a mobile phone I presume - but he sounded as if he was in the room with us. OK, I can put up with this, everyone is entitled to make a little noise. However, 2nd night we are woken up at the same time, only this time the guy next door has other males with him (I would say 3 in all) who try to break down the interconnecting door - they weren't just "testing" it, there were trying to get in and were shouting too. Quite frightening for two women on their own, half a mile down a coridoor from the elevators. Foolishly perhaps, we didn't do anything (should have called security I know - but to be honest we didn't want to make a noise as I didn't want to confirm that we were women on our own and I wasn't confident that security would come to our aid anyway). Next morning we went to the front desk to ask someone to speak with the people in this room and tell them that if it happened again we would dial 911 immediately. Front desk sent us to security. Security guy spoke with us, didn't take us that seriously (didn't even stand up while talking to us, so rude) told us we should have called security at the time and there was nothing he could do now, and that we shouldn't worry as it is impossible to get into a connecting door from the other room if you have locked your side (fortunately I had checked it when we first got the room and had locked it as it was open). As he could see we were distressed, he did say that he would speak with the deputy duty manager to see if we could move room. Spoke with the ddm, who did not once apologise for what had happened. He gave us the room on the 14th floor and said he thought it didn't have a connecting door. Well, it did, and the room was in so much more dis-repair than the 2nd floor one, but as it was a much quieter room and had a view to die for, and we knew we just wouldn't feel safe back in our old room, we moved. Two other members of our party had to move rooms too - but this was due to mice. No one saw any roaches and no one had any bed bugs. Did it spoil my trip to New York? No way, New York is a truly wonderful city and we had a blast. The galleries and museums (we are an art and design class) are absolutely top rate and we could have spent months looking round them. We had some great experiences and I can't wait to go back with my husband - but we will stay at another hotel if at all possible. If you are booked into the Penn, go prepared. Knowing what to expect helps a lot and it is then bearable. How do they get away with it? I guess it must be the location and the prices. Thanks to all of you who gave me good advice before going - it really helped.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is a Kip!”
Reviews.Author: Heno34
Reviews.Content: Just back from a staying in the Pennsylania Hotel, and what a Kip (Dump) this is. We booked a "Superior Room" and had to move rooms after 5 mins. We got a somewhat better room, but it was still a Kip. Dark and dingy rooms, and the smell of damp was strong. So we just made the most of a bad thing. The staff never batted an eyelid at our complaint as I'm sure they heard it all before, it way like water of a duck's back to them. Never again will I stay in that kip and I'd strongly recommend you to stay away from it. On checking out, the staff never asked if we enjoyed our stay, or asked if we'd return to their "Hotel", because they know it's a Kip too.

Reviews.Title: “Pennsylvania Pit”
Reviews.Author: education16
Reviews.Content: Gross...only thing good is the location. Everything else sucked. MOld on the walls, rooms small, 1/2 hr to check into the place. Huge dissappointment, don't stay. Trying to get my money back!

Reviews.Title: “not as bad as i was expecting!!”
Reviews.Author: goonerific
Reviews.Content: having had to rearrange our travel plans at the 11th hour and re-route to new york,we frantically spent an hour looking for accomodation online, we found a deal for the hotel pennsylvania at a reasonable price. a quick check on trip advisor revealed some "mixed" reviews but we decided to press on and run with it.have to say i was pleasantly surprised,lobby and front desk were welcoming,check in was efficient and the room was a decent size by ny standards.the walls could do with a new layer of plaster and wallpaper to cover up the multitude of holes in them but it's not something that would have me screaming for a new room. bathroom had clean towels every day,bed was always changed and floor always hoovered. the hotel is in an excellent location and is probably worth the price for that alone and would recommend it as a good budget hotel in new york.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend to anyone looking for convenience and value”
Reviews.Author: campfiar
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Pennsylvania Nov. 15 & 16, 2006 while in NY on business; one of five trips to NY in 2006. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a convenient place to sleep and store your personal belongings while visiting New York. It just a few blocks from the Empire State Bldg, Broadway, Times Square, etc. I paid $199 here at a time when other hotels were charging $400 to $500 at night. After reading all of the reviews here (mostly negative) I have to say I was expecting much worse conditions than I found. At check-in I requested one of the "new rooms" that I read about on Tripadvisor and the front desk clerk upgraded me to an executive suite at no extra charge. The room was fairly spacious with all the amenities you would expect from a 3- to 4-star hotel. It even had a small refrigerator in it - something you don't get in NY very often, even at hotels charging twice as much. I would describe the hotel quality as somewhere between Holiday Inn and Marriott. This was definitely the busiest hotel I've ever stayed at; mostly school groups and international visitors. The most memorable attribute was the freakin' water pressure in the shower. (Good!) It was like standing in front of a fire hydrant. Never went cold on me though. Please tip maids and service workers well wherever you travel. Tips mean so much to these people.

Reviews.Title: “Looked at 2 rooms and LEFT!”
Reviews.Author: anna_cornell
Reviews.Content: Unless you can do Penn 5000 (the only decent rooms), do NOT stay at this hotel. We were in NYC on business. I booked "Superior" rooms and were told they were lovely. I checked in and found dirty hallways, rooms without numbers (some were written in by hand in marker), and a tiny, grimy, unsanitary room. The walls looked like they hadn't been painted in 30 years, covered with scuffs and dirt, the areas around light switches dark from use. The grout around the tile in the standup shower was black. The ceiling in the bathroom was heavily peeling with plaster puckering out. Remember, this was "Superior"!! I asked for another room and was assured it would be better. The second room had stained and dirty carpet, a heavily worn toilet seat, broken furniture...I couldn't even bring myself to sit on the bed. I was with a group of 5, including my boss. One of my colleagues had already checked in and her room was also horrible. She found long strands of hair on the towels. NYC was nearly sold out, but I managed to find other hotels for us and we left. The manager did not charge us for canceling and did offer to move us to the Penn 5000 rooms, but it was too late. So many international travelers stay at the Penn -- it's embarrassing to think that this is their only impression of American hotels. The place is a DUMP.

Reviews.Title: “terrible hotel, avoid if you can”
Reviews.Author: martinaC
Reviews.Content: on returning from my stay i felt i needed to inform future "goers" on what they are gettin themselves into! the location is indeed satisfying however the hotel itself is a hugh let down and also some of our clothes( just bought) where stolen from our room! my reccomendations would be to avoid this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Biglass
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I have just returned from a 4 night stay in Hotel Penn, after reading some of the appalling reviews we were dreading what we might find. The lobby is impressive although very busy, the check in line was short and the desk clerk very helpful and polite. As we exited the elevator on the 16th floor the hallway did remind us of 'The Shining'with a very musty smell but once in the room there was no smell at all. The window was stuck open but after a call to housekeeping this was rectified within 15 mins. The bedding and towels were very clean and there was lots of hot water. The TV did not work but we had so much to do this didn't matter and the location is excellent, we were able to walk to Times Square in about 15 mins and Macys is only one block down. We had a brilliant time and had no problem at all with staff, would reccommend to anyone because of excellent location!!

Reviews.Title: “In my opinion - GO!”
Reviews.Author: MW3230
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights in the hotel from 1st November 2006. Having read the mixed reviews on this site (we booked to a budget £800 for the six nights) we travelled to New York fully prepared to fight for a good room. We were allocated room 1214 (12th floor) and we very satisfied. True, the room was compact as was the bathroom, but it was clean, well equipped and the maids were efficient and friendly, always wishing us a cheery "Have a good day". Too our suprise, being on the 12th floor gave us access to the Pennsylvania 5000 club lounge which offered free tea, coffee and continental breakfast along with free unlimited internet access and free newspapers. We didn't pay anything extra for this facility - perhaps it was the luck of the draw. In summary, we were very pleased with the hotel, the location (Macy's as a corner shop!!!) and of course the Big Apple. I cannot comment on other bedrooms, but the public areas were fine as were the reception staff. All in all, a hotel which we would use again and which we would recommend. It seems clear to us that there are a number of reviewers on this site who are too damn fussy - perhaps nothing will ever please some people.

Reviews.Title: “What a surprise !”
Reviews.Author: Chillywhinger
Reviews.Content: Trip Advisor member Yorkshire England I traveled to New York with my best friend Sarah to celebrate our 40th birthday's had read some hit and miss reports about the hotel, but it was cheap so I thought maybe you do get what you pay for, but what a surprise the room was very clean with two large beds a chair, table and a desk. we also had a fridge. There was a dressing area and an iron and ironing board. If you do go you should ask for ROOM 1612a on the 16th floor. We found all the staff to be very efficient and polite. The location of the hotel cannot be beaten, especially if you fly into Newark, all you need to do is get the sky train then a train to Penn Station, the hotel is just across the road from Penn Station and Madison Square Garden. Hope you found this review helpful. Andrea Chilcott.

Reviews.Title: “not as bad as others are saying”
Reviews.Author: gfmk23
Reviews.Content: just back from the big apple and stayed in the pennsylvania hotel. there were 5 of us staying so we requested a double and a triple....we arrived in the middle of the new york marathon so it was extremely busy. the double room was located on the 15th floor and the triple on the 3rd. i have to say the room on the 3rd was not good at all and we did change rooms. then again i had been told to request a room from the 12th floor up as they are much better and far quieter. loads of room in the second triple room had a walk in wardrobe and 3 single beds. it was so central and access to everything was so simple. however my only complaint with the exception of the reception staff and one of the tourist info guys (poss named andrew he looks like johnny depp) i found the staff very ignorant like in most places...they are rude and have an awful lot to learn from the Irish about customer relations. in all i really enjoyed my stay at the pennsylvania hotel... it was warm and clean and bar a few staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lal32
Reviews.Content: The price is good for New York and it is in a great location. However, the bad reviews and nasty photos on this site regarding the Hotel Pennsylvania are no joke. This is easily the worst hotel I have ever stayed in my life. The first room they put us was nothing short of disgusting. After traveling 40 hours from Australia to New York it was heart breaking opening the door to our room. It stank of something I have never smelled before in my life. There were wires hanging out from the wall. The carpet was dirty and had stains all over it. The bed sheets were too small for the bed and had multiple cigarette burns in them. The shower leaked. We complained and got a different room. This room was better than the first one but had many of the same problems. We complained again and got a different room that was once again only marginally better. We settled with this room simply because we were tired of complaining and arguing with staff. For two laid back Aussies who rarely get into disagreements with people, my wife and I had to battle staff to get any kind of service. We dealt with a total of eleven staff members in one way or the other. One was very friendly and helpful. Another was not very helpful but was at least polite. The other nine were rude, unhelpful, inefficient and disinterested. We met other tourists around New York who were paying only a little bit more for their accommodation and said their hotels had none of the problems we were having. For our next visit to this fabulous city I’m going to dig much harder for better accommodation for around this price. I know for a fact that it exists.

Reviews.Title: “A huge makeover needed!!!”
Reviews.Author: mariamimi
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 5 night stay in the Pennsylvania Hotel, NYC. On arriving to the hotel I thought the lobby was not a impressive as other people had stated, I was expecting something more elaborate, it was more like a shopping mall. One arrival to our rooms I was horrified, the smell was very musky, the windows did not close in one of the rooms and freezing inside. Down I trot the the reception insisting we have new rooms to be told that as the marathon was on they did not have many rooms, I was not moving from there until they gave us new rooms, which were only a mere improvement. No hangers, a dodgy hairdryer falling off the bathroom wall (we complained 3 times regarding the hairdryer and still nothing was done), paint peeling off the bathroom walls and we were also unable to turn the shower off properly, it was forever dripping! The carpets needed a good clean and hoover too. The only good thing was that there beds were clean. Apart from all my moans the location was brilliant, the Americans still as friendly and polite as ever and we had a great holiday in the Big Apple.

Reviews.Title: “crap”
Reviews.Author: PenLeeKirstyTracey
Reviews.Content: All the "bad' reviews are correct. Do not stay here. The rooms are old, smelly (especially the smoking rooms), not clean, wires hanging out of walls. Staff were not helpful. Requested rooms together, 6 months earlier, but they put us 5 floors apart. All rooms were at one stage smoking rooms & they have now made some rooms "non-smoking" therefore still smelly. Air conditioning did not work, television did not work either. The photo attached does not do the room any justice, you need it to be a "scratch & smell picture". The doors are extremely heavy. The lobby looks fantastic, but the rooms are very old.

Reviews.Title: “Not So Bad”
Reviews.Author: PerthGeezer
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a pleasant stay at the Pennsylvania. No problems checking in or out. Our room on the 16th floor was clean, with plenty of hot water. The maid always said good morning and the one time I had to call housekeeping for a replacement hairdryer they were very pleasant on the phone, and a replacement dryer arrived in 5 minutes. The Hotel is in a great location, with a coffee shop in the lobby and a couple of nice places to eat. Yes it's busy, yes it's old, if you want to stay at fancy 5 star establishments there are plenty around, but if you want to save your money to spend on everything New York has to offer, stay at the Pennsylvania. It's good value for money and doesn't pretend to be anything it's not.

Reviews.Title: “Factory blues”
Reviews.Author: iompaighhart
Reviews.Content: Hi my name is Alan and i stayed with Gillian at the Hotel . I endorse all she said but will add a few things . The web site photo of the room did not correspond to the ghastly reality . I am in the Irish Armed forces so i am not hard to please but you get what you pay for so i did expect more for my dollars . Black boot mark skid s straight off some parade ground adorned the faded cream walls , maybe some frustrated recruit was let loose in the room i mused ... how and ever when i complained i was sent to a hotel customer phone were this manager came on to speak . When i gave him our complaint he said he'd pass me on to the head of house keeping ...and promptly hung up as the dial tone engaged so i could wait to speak to this individual ... i hung up and rang the manager back and he told me to go to reception and give my complaint in there ... i tried but the line up was huge and i had jet lag at this stage and was in no mood to que for half an hour again .. so i rang him back and asked him " do you do anything face to face in New York ? I want to speak to you directly !" with this he came over all apoligectic and offered me a different upgrade room with a kingsize bed etc etc .. i called round to see him just five seconds walk from the phone ( so why couldnt he have done this earlier ?) i collected my new keys and the new room was great and was what i had expected in the first place .... stay at this hotel if you dont mind indifferent bad mannered staff who seem like disinterested factory workers putting cogs on long convoyer belts and if you have a pet spider .. Great location though beside Penn station etc

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed here many times”
Reviews.Author: Sweeegh
Reviews.Content: I do business in New York City, and have stayed at many hotels in Manhattan.
