The first thing I must say is that you truly cannot beat the Pennsylvania for location, and what you get for your money. The rooms are small but clean. Keep in mind that nearly ALL rooms in Manhattan are small; if you want a large room, you will spend close to 500 dollars a night. As a businessman this is not practical for me. This is an old hotel, and it shows it's age somewhat. As I said, however, the rooms are clean, and when you are asleep you arent looking at the room anyway. This hotel is very convinient to JFK airport, as all you have to do is take the airtrain to Jamaica station, then change to the Long Island Railroad, which will drop you off at Madison Square Garden, which is directly across the street!. It is close to Times Square, Midtown, the bar district of Clinton, Macy's and all of the Broadway theatres. I sincerely recommend this hotel, and urge you to not listen to the negative reviews, as these people are clearly neophytes to Manhattan, where I am not. The best thing about this hotel is that I can always get a room there; yeah, the check-in, check-out lines can be long; this is true of ANY 1700 room hotel. When I go back to the city, I plan to stay here again. And don't forget, there is a Lindy's restaurant adjacent to this hotel, which has the best Cheesecake in NYC!.....Happy travels to New York!...Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as we expected!”
Reviews.Author: SPspectre
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a four night stay in the hotel Pennsylvania. After reading all the bad reviews I was so worried about staying at this hotel and even had made arrangement for my son, husband and I to stay elsewhere as a back-up plan. When we arrived at the hotel i was nearly sick thinking about what lay ahead. Checking in took about ten minutes and the staff were very friendly and helpful (apart from grumpy in the newsagents, who wouldn't crack a smile if her life depended on it! We were assigned a room on the ninth floor and when we got out of the elevator I was slightly relieved, it didn't really look that bad maybe just a little dated. I made my husband check the room first for any living things but we were in luck. Our room was really clean and nothing at all wrong with it at all. Please don't believe all the reports I think people over exaggerate a little and if you get a room on the ninth floor your in luck! Check out lindys in the foyer the food is really nice and the beer goes down well too! ENJOY NEW YORK ITS BRILLIANT

Reviews.Title: “Bad place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Magoobaby
Reviews.Content: October 20, 2006: Paid $275 for room 513A with 2 beds . No view. Very dim light bulbs. Bathroom filled with mildew. Only one set of towels for 2 persons. Concierge did not know of any Korean restaurants which were one block away in Koreatown. Would not recommend this hotel at all. Covenient location in front of Madison Square Garden and Penn Staation.

Reviews.Title: “Horrific!”
Reviews.Author: Gillian3
Reviews.Content: We checked into this hotel by queuing in a foyer which ressembled a busy bus station, when we got to the counter we were 'greeted' by a rude disinterested woman who obviously liked to spend her day looking at her fake nails and applying extra make up. She actually scowled as a matter of course and didnt feel the need to answer a question when put directly to her - we were being nice! As we walked to our room through a very long series of dark corridors reality began to sink in as to the quality of our surroundings, the carpet was faded either grey or green and the walls were much similar, there was a distinctly dusty, musty smell so I wasnt looking forward to seeing the bedroom. But we had to wait to see that as the maid was still working away and just 5 minutes did it. Our bedroom was small and the decor was not just old but very old and musky. The bedside lamp had a very obvious layer of dust even a few cobwebs. The bathroom had cracked tiles and the shower floor tiles were also cracked and stained a nasty yellow colour. We did complain and insisted on seeing the manager who offered us a decent room in the business accomodation of the hotel. I have been in cleaner $2 hostels in Thailand

Reviews.Title: “Needs a facelift”
Reviews.Author: wilfed
Reviews.Content: Stayed here October 2006 very disapointed with the hotel as soon as we got of the lift i new what was coming.Needs a big clean up.

Reviews.Title: “You pay for the location and nothing else”
Reviews.Author: SamReynolds
Reviews.Content: We arrived in New York after having spent the best part of a day travelling. All we wanted to do was to relax and clean ourselves up before hitting the streets. No such luck. Our room was disgusting, it smelt musty-as though we were breathing in somebody else's stale air. This we could have coped with if we could have opened the windows fully. The bathroom was horrible- there were black hairs in the sink and the bath. After two unanswered pleas to housekeeping for a cleaner, finally a little man turned up. He had no idea what we were asking him to do and merely flushed the toilet and turned the hoover on and off. I am not exaggerating! The black hairs were still there! We felt so dissapointed, having spent hours on trip advisor chosing our hotel. The last thing we wanted to do was to have to gather up all of our things and drag our weary bodies down to reception to ask for another room as we aren't normally complainers but it had to be done. We were given another room, (the reception staff didn't seem at all suprised by our request) and it was much nicer, in retrospect, it was obvious that our first room hadn't been cleaned at all. Choose this hotel wisely. Its not all bad, the location is amazing and the diner at the front of the hotel is good, but don't expect any good views or for that matter any good service from the staff.

Reviews.Title: “i,m not fussy,but......”
Reviews.Author: tonyshep
Reviews.Content: my wife booked a trip to new york for my 40th birthday.I,ve always wanted to go and visit the place since being a kid.New york was everything i hoped it would be and more,apart from one thing,the hotel.i,m not fussy when it comes to accommodation but the place was terrible.Dirty,scruffy,are the first two words that come to mind.When we arrived we went into the room and found the bath half full,and one of the windows stuck open.Remember this was in january in new york,.we asked to be moved and settled for the room we were given.I stay in a bed and breakfast place in the uk a couple of times a year to watch drag racing at santa pod in northamptonshire.We pay £20 per night for that and its better than the pennsylvania,and no i,m not exaggerating.

Reviews.Title: “Not a scary murder death hotel at all!!”
Reviews.Author: elmo78
Reviews.Content: I had read a lot of negative and scary reviews about this hotel prior to my trip and was a little apprehensive to say the least! especially as I booked through a cheap holidays website! There were 3 of us travelling and we were assigned a double room on the 17th floor. It was amazing!! After a quick and easy check in with a very pleasant desk clerk, we went up to our room and I did not cry like I was expecting to! It was clean, spacious and lovely! The beds were comfy, tv worked perfectly, we had a great view of surrounding New York and there was even room to fit 2 more double beds in there!! The only minor thing is that they should not put wallpaper in the bathroom because the steam makes it peel. They were doing a lot of rennovations in rooms around us but they were not making a lot of noise or cause a disturbance in any way. One man even wished us an enjoyable stay and hoped we would return! The hotel is right opposite madison square gardens and about 3 minutes away from Macy's! There is also a great Italian restaurant 2 minutes away that does an awesome breakfast buffet for $6.99!! Sorted. What more could you want?! Please give this hotel a chance! You ahve to experience it for yourself and not pay too much attention to these boards!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: judeccta
Reviews.Content: Was very worried about the hotel as it had some really bad reviews but we had nothing to fear. The hotel has a great location. It is opposite Penn station which has a direct express link to Newark airport making transfers quick and easy. It is in walking distance of many attractions and underground stations. Reception was friendly and efficient along with all other staff we encountered at the hotel. The room was spotlessly clean with fresh towels and bed linen daily. There was plenty of hot water at all hours of the day and the bathroom was clean. The room had a king size bed and large telly. We did find the room a little dark but a telephone call to housekeeping resulted in the prompt delivery of another lamp. Reasonably priced accommodation in New York. A good choice of hotel for the tourist who wants a clean, comfortable nights rest after a long day exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Pay for a renovated room!”
Reviews.Author: JOC44
Reviews.Content: I had to write due to all the horrific stories posted about this hotel. You get what you pay for! I booked on the hotels own website and paid for a renovated room (room 1122) which was fine, had 2 windows, 1 facing Macys and down to the river, 1 facing madison sq gardens. Did not have to deal with staff other than to check in so can't say if they are rude or not. The fact that the hotel offer a higher rate for renovated rooms should ring alarm bells. If it has not been renovated and is cheap just stay away from it and book a RENOVATED room. Location is fantastic and I'd deffo stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Just Gross”
Reviews.Author: WackyTourist
Reviews.Content: To be honest it felt more like Hotel TRANsylvania. What creeps! The line for check-in was an Ellis Island tribute. The bell hop was something out of a police line-up. The luggage room attendant (read thug) temporarily held your bags whilst collecting tips in a margarine container. Later that evening I was to enjoy a performance of Dirty Rotten Scoundrels. The staff of Hotel Pennsylvania could be the cast. Upon entering the room, more trouble. We had neglected to call ahead and request light bulbs be placed in each of the lamps. The room was dark. I pulled back the drapes and found the window open, no screen. Could the last guest have jumped? This “room” would give him good reason. Plaster in the corners of the room bespoke falling ceilings and lazy housekeepers. Specks of black along the ceiling provided a mold faux finish. One each wall, faded wallpaper with rectangles of less-faded wallpaper and empty nails that cried out “something once hung here!” I had neither the courage nor the inclination to pull back the comforter and check out the bed. But the chair? The STAINS had stains. The phone? Not with rubber goves, baby. I used my cell phone to call and complain and STILL felt like I needed to bathe in a gallon of Purell. In a word, foul. Now, I am aware that hotels in NYC are pricey and please understand - I was not expecting the Ritz. But for $320/night I could just as well buy a new TV and watch a horror film, I don’t need to live one. They say that hotels often tell a story. This one seemd to be telling me to leave, and just as fast as I could. A quick call to hotels.com. I informed the friendly person who answered that I was not interested in staying at a crime scene-themed hotel and needed to make other arrangements. Shortly I was booked at the New York Helmsley and headed on my way. In all, my stay at Hotel Pennsylvania lasted 63 minutes. Too long.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: HVMA
Reviews.Content: Last July, a friend and I spent a fun weekend in NYC. Fun at least until we saw the hotel. I'm from Massachusetts so I travel to NYC quite often. On this occasion in July we stayed at the Hotel Pennsylvania. BIG mistake! It is undoubtly the worse hotel I've ever stayed in anywhere. I'd say it's one step up from a Motel 6 roadside hotel. The hotel is large, busy, and walking distance to everything but that was no consolation compared to the quality (or lack thereof) of this place. We were put on a floor that had not been renovated. It felt like we were in the movie "The Shining." I would not have been surprised to see Jack Nicholson walking down the long, dark, dreary, dirty halls yelling "here's Johnnie." They put us in a room that looked as if we stepped back into the 1930s! The room had two cots (not even ral beds) and green wool army type blankets on the cots. The curtins were filthy and the bathroom NASTY! We ended up going to the management and DEMANDING they put us in a real room. If at all possible, stay away from this hotel!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Love It - Basic but Convenient”
Reviews.Author: AndD
Reviews.Content: In a few weeks time, I will have my fourth stay at this hotel and if it really was as bad as some of the reviews I have read then I would not have returned for a 2nd stay let alone a 4th stay! It is true that the rooms are very basic but on all 3 of my previous stays (June 2003, December 2004 and January 2005), the rooms we have been given have been clean and yes the furniture/decoration is outdated but how much time do you spend having to look at this? You cannot fault this hotel for location (Madison Square Garden, Empire State Building, Shopping, Theatre, etc.), it is so easy to get to from JFK (Air Train and then LIRR to Penn Station over the road). It is true that if you are looking for grandeur then you will not find it here, but as with most places, the key thing here is LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!! Very convenient and value for money - you get what you pay for guys!!!

Reviews.Title: “so brillant”
Reviews.Author: levinid
Reviews.Content: im just after returning from the big apple and we stayed in new york's hotel pennsylvania, we went for 5 days and it was the best 5 days we had, the hotel is lovely, the staff are helpful & friendly, our hotel room was huge there was 2 double beds in it plenty of space for all the shopping, it is a bit old fashioned but it didnt bother us its what you make of it yourself for all the time you'd spend in the hotel room anyway. ii is so central to everything it' s across the road from madison sq gardens 10 mins from empire state building, the mahattan mall is only around the corner from the pennsylvania hotel, times square is just down the road rockefeller centre is only about 15 mins away all worth goin to, its brillant, i would definitely go back in the morning without a doubt i just fell in love wit the city

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Great Views... ok Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SebMer
Reviews.Content: As many people noted here, there are some problems with this hotel... It is seriously run down - but hey - location location location! Talk about central! Though it might be old and out of style, this hotel offers great rates! On average, a hotel room in Manhattan goes for 300$ /night - I paid 1/2 of that during my short stay in the Big Apple. I first laughed when I got to my floor - the walls are filthy - water dammage all over the place - and the shabby lighting does in fact remind me of Stanley Kubrick's film "The Shining" starring Jack Nicholson. (as noted on a previous post) As the saying goes -YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR - so don't expect to have top class service nor top class accomodations when you are paying a fraction of the prices asked in hotels in the vicinity of Hotel Pennsylvannia. I would recommend this hotel for people with short stays in Manhattan and don't plan on staying in their hotel rooms during the day - enjoy the city - you're in the heart of it!

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: toucher
Reviews.Content: 20 10 06 Adamson West Yorkshire We have just spent 6 nights in the Pennsylvania in New York. We booked and was recommened by American Express, anyway to cut a long story short it is the worst hotel for a large city that we have ever stayed in. When we arrived we were given a room on the 9th floor which was supposed to be a double room and it was the size of a box room. The plaster was all off the wall and left all over the floor, I rang reception and told them we were not staying in this room, we had booked the room in April this year. We were then given a room on the 6th floor which again was dirty, dark, and dismal. The t v did not work, the hairdryer did not work the shower fittings and plug were hanging of the wall. The skirting board was all mouldy and the air conditioner box stank when you put it on. I would say to anyone thinking of staying there DON'T it will really spoil your holiday please believe what you read and the photos because there are all true.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic, but what do expect for the price!!”
Reviews.Author: Suey.c
Reviews.Content: There was a party of 8 of us staying at the hotel in October for 4 nights. Some of us were dreading it after all the reports on this site. We were checked into 3 rooms. 2 triples which consisted of 2 double beds, or 2 single beds. My friend had heard that some rooms had been renovated and were hoping ours would be one. It turns out we were based on the 2nd, 7th and 15th floors and none were renovated. Our room was quite 'snug' , but my friends rooms were large and one even had a walk in wardrobe. With all the reports on this site we even checked the mattresses and behind the bedstead for bed bugs before we unpacked!!! The mattresses looked new and although the room was v. basic we were quite happy with it considering how much we paid. I agree the hall ways are quite scary and the room numbers are a bit mad, but you're not there to look at the wallpaper! It's ideal if your on a cheap first trip to the city and are planning to be out your room most of the time. It's located at a good tourist spot, with the subway outside, as well as the Gray line tourist bus and Macey's on the corner with Times Square a 10 min walk away. There's a nice coffee shop downstairs and the men on the tourist counter are very nice and helpful. They are not pushy for sales and even gave us free tickets to Pascha nightclub. Overall we were pleased with our stay, concierge were nice and no queues for checking in / out. If youv'e already booked for this place be warned it is very basic but don't be afraid ,and if you're not happy then complain or just stay out all night!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrors!!”
Reviews.Author: Beachseeker12
Reviews.Content: In spite of all the bad reviews, we decided to stay there anyway out of convenience to Times Square, thinking "how bad could it be?". We did ask for a renovated room at the suggestion of several people on this forum. We REALLY weren't expecting much and this was worse than we could have imagined. It MIGHT have been renovated in 1960! It was filthy! The least they could do is put a fresh coat of paint on the walls every 10 years or so! There were sticky stains on the door to our room, paint peeling on the ceilings, the remote to our TV didn't work, the bed made a horrible squeaking sound and the carpet was this brown, felt-like material that had stains on it. To say it was DATED is an understatement. I am not one to stay in a high priced hotel when traveling...I always look for the basics. I like a clean, comfortable, no frills room...along the lines of a Courtyard by Marriott or even Extended Stay. This place was worse than any hotel I've ever stayed in. The only positive thing I have to say it that you can check your bags here even if you're not staying here. We came in to Penn Station and needed a place to leave our bags for a few hours and we were able to pay a fee to leave them at Hotel Pennsylvania.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time, very pleased.”
Reviews.Author: davidgrant
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on her I was dubious to book this hotel. I booked through[-] and although it is not the best hotel I have stopped in, it is by no means the worst. I got a shuttle from JFK to the Pennsylvania, I was pleasently greeted by the doorman who pointed me in the right direction towards reception. Once I got there, my room was ready and waiting and for the price I paid the room was satisfactory. The only problem I had was getting to sleep due to all the "Sirens" going off all night, but just as in the movies it happens all the time and i'm sure others in more expensive hotels has the same problem now and again. As with most New York hotels you are paying to be right in the middle of the action, the only time you are in your room is when you are asleep. I was pleased with my room and the service i received the whole 4 days. I would go back again in a second and happily stay at the Pennsylvania Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: manofallmen
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend & i are just back from New York & we stayed in this hotel for a week. After reading the reviews of the hotel all year, to say i was not looking forward to staying here would be a massive understatement. Upon our arrival, we checked in quicker than expected (we were only waiting about 5 mins in the que) & the guy at the check-in desk was really really nice. I think his name was Carlos. He advised us of all the right places to go in New York & even gave us vouchers which enabled us to get a free gift from shops in Woodbury Common & Century 21, if we spent over $50.00 there. I had read about staff being unfriendly but from our time there, every member of staff we spoke to were great. They could not have been nicer so i really am wondering about some of the reviews on here about the staff's attitude. We were given a room on the 7th Floor which had 2 double beds in it. As it was not what we booked, (we had booked just the 1 double) we were told we could change rooms the next day if we wished. There is a 'musty' smell in the corriders & probably most of the rooms but i think that is the general smell of the hotel. Don't forget how old this place is. If the smell is a problem in your room (& it really was'nt for us), just buy an airfreshener. Our room, whilst it could have done with a paint job & new carpet, was fine. The bed was more than comfortable (slept like a log everynight), no hint of any bed bugs or anything like that, our towels & bedclothes were changed every day by the maids. The hot & cold water even worked fine!!! What i would advise everyone to do is get a safety deposit box-there is no charge for this. There is a guy sitting in front of the elevators all the time alright, as security but its a different guy every morning & evening & they can really have no clue as to who is staying in the hotel as it's so busy. All-in-all, all my fears were proved to be totally unfounded. It was a comfortable experience, a lot better than i had expected. I think people have to remember that this is a budget hotel. For the price & location of this hotel, its hard to better it. Obviously some people have had bad experience's here but i could see nothing hugely wrong with it. Would i stay here again....Yes i would.

Reviews.Title: “horrible”
Reviews.Author: votepalantine
Reviews.Content: the only thing that i liked about staying at this hotel was its location. in my opinion, i believe that the price per night is too high for what you get (again, if location is ALL that your looking for- go for it). the entire hotel smelled like staleness, even the bed pillows- which eventually just after two nights could make you sick. no ice buckets or hotel booklets in the room, the vending machines didn't work and wouldn't give your change back, there was a rusty, old mini-fridge, the tub and bathroom altogether had mold in spots, the bathroom wasn't clean (there was an old soap left in the shower for who knows how long), desk drawer fell apart when it was opened. there were people across the hall being very loud and smoking pot that we could smell from our room. we didnt say anything to hotel staff until you could actually see smoke in the hallway coming from their room. at that time we called hotel staff and security said it would be taken care of, but instead, security kocked on our door and asked what the problem was because he couldn't smell or see anything...which was funny because when we opened the door we could smell it!! security did nothing. don't expect to be treated like a guest. at the end of my stay i was glad to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Pennsylvania- False Advertisement!!!!”
Reviews.Author: meglb89
Reviews.Content: I booked a smoking, king sized bed, "superior room" at the Pennsylvania Hotel. When I went to check into my room, my first thought was how rude the gentlemen, Lou, was that was waiting on me. First he told me there was no king size bed room available, then he continued to say there was no smoking room available with a king size bed in it. What was the point of making a reservation if it can not be held? After a slight wait I was given my key and headed up to the room. The hallway its self was in awful shape. The numbers to direct you to your room were confusing and the lighting was terrible. When I opened the door to my room I saw a room that I most definetly did NOT see in the pictures at Hotels.com. It was a terribly old room, very moist, outdated, dirty and just eerie. I even payed extra to stay in a "superior room" and there was nothing superior about it. I took one glace at it and demanded a refund. This hotel is one big fraud. It is portraying false advertisement and I would advise everyone and anyone NOT to stay at Hotel Pennsylvania. The service and the atmosphere are definetly not worth it for what you will be paying.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy, Do Not Stay Here!!”
Reviews.Author: lalax
Reviews.Content: Mum and I booked our hols in April and at that point we didn’t know anything about the hotel. We were told then that the hotel was under renovation and that the travel agent would request a renovated room. Awhile after that I happened to do a google search for this hotel and came across this website and the reviews, Mum was arranging the trip so she pointed out her concerns to our travel agent, they checked with there supplier who said they hadn’t had any complaints and they assured us it would be fine. Well we arrived at the hotel on 19th Sept. and were abruptly sent to the small reception room, which didn’t look that clean either. We were allocated a room which we went to – the carpets in the hall outside the elevator were disgusting with areas not fitted properly (surprised there’s not been an accident!!) Went to the room – it stank, had huge damp patch on the ceiling with paint peeling off, loose bathroom fitting on the floor, window was wide open obviously to try and get rid of the smell, and the whole room generally was small, dark and grubby!! Definitely not renovated. We only wanted somewhere to sleep but in a clean room. Mum spoke to the Receptionist who said there were no more rooms available, that it was a 'request' for a renovated room and that renovated rooms are more expensive anyway. (After seeing the first room we couldn’t have stayed there anyway!!) After speaking to a wonderful, helpful concierge at Marriott Marquis we ended up staying at a Marriott hotel in NJ (short bus ride to New York City) which I have to say I would definitely stick with in the future – the staff were helpful, it wasn’t too pricey and it was very clean so thankfully our holiday was saved and we had an amazing time during our stay. Do not stay in Hotel Pennsylvania, it is disgusting!! The receptionists were not helpful at all. We came out of there after just 5 minutes and felt like we needed a shower. I can well believe there are bedbugs and all sorts in this hotel. If you are booked in already – change your booking now and don’t be naive like we were thinking that it couldn’t be that bad, it’s worse!!

Reviews.Title: “What a Rip!”
Reviews.Author: mab313
Reviews.Content: A warning to all business travelers looking for a reasonable rate in the vastly over-priced NYC hotel market-stay away from the Hotel Pennsylvania! For $220.00/night, you will get rooms with peeling paint, dim lighting, crumbling bathrooms, general uncleanliness and a bad musty smell throughout the hallways and room. Throw in long check-in lines and indifferent workers, and you have a totally miserable stay. They cater to tourist groups from overseas; what a sad 1st imprssion of New York they will get staying here.

Reviews.Title: “A bit like the shining but much better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: doctorbecs
Reviews.Content: We expected to stay in a total dive, based on the reviews. But were pleasantly surprised...checked in early and were upgraded to a room with two singles instead of 1 double bed as the lady at the check-in desk said we'd be more comfortable. We were in a corner room on floor 14 with a view of the empire state building just 1 block away. The room was clean tho a little outdated, and the beds were wobbly, and the shower was a little scary. The tv worked, the water pressure was great, the noise wasn't a problem at all. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The location is amazing-opposite Penn station and madison square garden, you can walk to all the main attractions including Times Square. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants literally a bed to sleep in - this is NYC - you're hardly going to spend any time in the room. I would def go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but lousy room”
Reviews.Author: Lantis
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Pennsylvania hotel for five nights in june 2006. The location is fantastic, opposite Madison Square garden. The check-in was fast (we arrived in the evening). Though it's a huge hotel, there where many elevators so you didn't have to wait long to get up and down. Our room was on the 15th floor. We had a room for three persons. It was quite small. There was no wardrobe where you could hang your clothes, and no place for the shoes, and also no place to put the suitcases except on the floor. When we came, there where towels for only one person, but roomservice was quite fast and brought some more. In the bathroom the tap was dripping during the whole stay. The plumber obviously tried to fix it but without results. Fortunately you could close the door to the bathroom so it didn't disturb our sleep. The zink was also quite clogged, the plumber couldnt fix that either. So the rooms are not very good, but if you are not very particular the location excuses a lot.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Dublin 11
Reviews.Content: The promise engendered by the grandour of the entrance lobby with its marble and chandeliers quickly turned to dismay when we arrived on the 14th floor and were met with a musty damp smell in the corridor. There was a general feeling of shabbiness about the place. The walls were marked and the external corners looked like they had been attacked with a hammer. The room door looked like something from a prison or a mental asylum. Inside, while the linen was clean, the room itself was shabby and badly in need of renovating. A small rusty fridge sat on the floor. The bathroom looked like it hadn't been touched since the hotel was built in the early 20th century. The bottom of the door frame was rotten from dampness as the shower tended to spill onto the floor. The plain white tiles showed signs of mould in the grout. On the positive side, the hotel is very centrally located on 7th Ave at 33rd Street just opposite Madison Square Garden and Penn station. Empire State Building is just around the corner and Times Square just a few blocks away. We didn't spend much time in the hotel as we were on a sight-seeing trip. However, if you are looking for luxury, give the Pennsylvania a miss.

Reviews.Title: “Great cheap and cheerful with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: maccahallam
Reviews.Content: excellent location!!! was very concerned after reading so many bad reports on the hotel. Was very pleased to find that our room was clean, comfortable and had everything required for a good stay. Stayed for three nights and the main advantage to the hotel is its excellent location, no more than five minutes from attractions such as times square and the empire state building. would deffiantly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “weathered”
Reviews.Author: nadinekettering
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews prior to my partner and i travelling out for a split break, (2 nights penns, 4 nights vegas, 2 nights penns) we were a little apprehensive about staying at the said hotel. On arrival we were able to check in at least two hours early which was good, the hotel lobby is impressive in a dated sort of way. Our room on the 17th floor, although large, was in dire need of redecoration, the carpet was rucked and worn and the tiles in the bathroom had blown from the wall. However, the bed was clean, large and comfortable so we made do in the hope that our return trip might find us placed in a better room. No such luck! room was half the size, much smaller bed barely a double, and decoration just as shabby. We didnt complain, simply because we didnt intend to spend much time in our room, but would reccomend any one reading this review to either ask for a redecorated room or pay for an upgrade. Would i stay again? Yes because location is unbeatable, but would want updated room.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Go There!”
Reviews.Author: JHAD
Reviews.Content: Well after reading the recent reviews I can see that is has not changed since we were ther in 2002. Mould in bathroom. Dirty rooms and staff not good so how does it stay open only thing going for is is the location, June from England

Reviews.Title: “One Word: Bedbugs!”
Reviews.Author: LATEEDAH
Reviews.Content: The company I work for contracted with tthe Hotel Pennsylvania for rooms. I heard that the hotel was not very nice but did not stay there until September. I stayed 3 different times for one night each. I had been warned by other co-workers that there were bedbugs but thought it was probably just "drama". On my second stay (10th floor) within 24 hours the bites showed up all over my arms, shoulders and neck. It is now a week later and the itching is UNBELIEVABLE... My advice is Stay Away from this hotel no matter what the price!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value or lucky escape ?”
Reviews.Author: rufcrufc
Reviews.Content: Well lets kick off back a few months when we was looking for a midtown Manhattan hotel to stay for 3 nights. Lets be 100% honest here all the other hotels were $300-$700 per night and this was $165 so we looked at the Pens website and booked. OH MY GOD! then we read the reviews on this forum we almost about cancelled the booking fearing anything from armed robbery to mould on the walls homeless people sleeping outside the room to septicaemia from the shower if the reviews were to be believed. OK we arrived at 12 noon on the Amtrak at Pen station, the Pen hotel is about 20 seconds away from the station across 7th avenue opposite Madison square gardens in a somewhat lively part of town, to say the least. The hotel says no check in until 3pm but we had no trouble what so ever checking in at 1pm and the member of staff on the check in was polite and very helpful. I explained the fact that I was petrified about staying after reading the reviews on this site to the check in lady an she told me not to worry. We were given room 1369, well it’s the last room from the elevator on that floor but believe me its worth the walk. It’s the corner roomon the block facing the Empire state building and Chrysler tower from one window and towards the world trade (ground zero) centre from the other. From this room you can lay on the bed fall a sleep looking at the empire state building, a really remarkable experience. The room was very big, clean and the bedding was spotless the bathroom was clean and the room had recently had a revamp. Make no mistake this is not a 4 or 5 star room but its not charging 4 or 5 star prices so don’t expect that kind of refinement. The door on the cupboard was too big and would not close, a old refrigerator was bizarrely on the floor in the room but this did not really matter. I would say this, it’s a low cost central Manhattan hotel, so do not expect anything fancy, ask for a renovated room at check in, what’s the worst that they can say? Overall for $165 a night on a Friday to Monday stay in September I was more than happy with the Pen. I really don’t think its as bad as its made out to be, I think a lot of people are paying peanuts and expecting 5* treatment, if you want that then book a $500 a night joint, not the pen. We really enjoyed our stay and would return in the future without hesitation. Please do not be afraid its a nice htel and not the the wild west saloon.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for..”
Reviews.Author: matthewlapos
Reviews.Content: I booked a one nite stay with a friend who is a travel agent, because it was one of the cheepest available rooms for the nite of my visit, and was conveniently located to where i needed to be that nite. I knew it was a dump, but stayed anyway, because i wasn't planning on staying in the the room very much. Upon entry into the room, i was greeted with a musty smell, dirty carpet, and best of all, a large mold spot on the wall, next to the air conditioning unit. I didn't complain, so i cant say what the managemet would have done about it, because I was in a hurry to go to an event. Enjoy the photo of the mold spot from the room, and do yourself a favor, and stay somewhere else, (hilton, sheraton, holiday inn). One more thing. In most hotels, if you have the do not disturb sign on your door, they leave you alone. Not here. The cleaning lady kept pushing on the door, as if something was wrong with it 15 minutes before check out time. Do Not Stay Here. Enjoy the pic.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: lisa1983
Reviews.Content: We styed at this hotel from 2-7 sept and i loved it, i am depressed since i am home, fair enough when you check in there was bit of a que we waited about 20 minutes before it was our turn to check in after all its such a big hotel you have to expect this bit of delays and there was 5 people working at the receiption desk. I emailed the hotel prior to our arrival, we booked a standard room and paid 600euros for 5 nights for 2 people i asked them for a free upgrade and they gave it to me. we got upgraded to a supior room on 12th floor room 1243 lovely room, with all mod cons and clean bathroom with shampoo conditior mouthwash etc... the hotel interior is a bit old fashioned but remeber the hotel is donkeys years old.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Annalie
Reviews.Content: A friend and I went on a 4 night break to New York (my first time, her second) last December. New York itself is fantastic and I will definitely be going back.....only this time, I will be staying well away from Hotel Pennsylvania!! It was a promising start with a nice lobby and old-fashioned lifts but once we'd checked in and got the lift to our floor things changed. The whole hotel is in need of a major overhaul - all the floors we saw stank of cigarette smoke and had stains on the carpets/wallpaper peeling from the walls. In the first room we were given, one of the beds actually had the springs poking out of the mattress! We called down to reception to complain to be told to come back down. We did and were given another room by possibly the most surly receptionist in New York, who didn't say one word to us throughout the transaction. The second room was better but the bathroom was awful, with mould on the walls and peeling paint.....made more unfortunate because this was where I ended up spending a large part of the holiday as I came down with food poisoning. In all, not the first experience I was hoping for in New York. Hotel Pennsylvania is cheap and in a convenient location but if there's any way at all you can go up a star rating or so and stay somewhere else, I'd recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “stay away!”
Reviews.Author: De2006
Reviews.Content: the only thing this hotel has going for it is it's location. across the street from penn station, madison sq garden, 3 blocks from empire state, walking distance to time sq etc. the hotel itself is old fashioned and out dated, badly in need of a make over! my partner and i arrived for a four night stay and were shocked to say the least at the poor quality of service, not to mention the bedroom. our room was tiny, with just about enough space for the bed! the en suite door didnt close properly and the shower leaked all over the floor. the room was not particularly clean and we noticed that housekeeping staff didnt pay much attention to the basics. we were given two key cards for our room, both of which didnt work! i wouldnt recommend this hotel nor would i consider returning!

Reviews.Title: “loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: dawnie0_13
Reviews.Content: I have just arrived back home to London following a 7 day stay in NYC staying in the Hotel Pennsylvania myself and my boyfriend both in our early twenties, After reading the reviews I was least to say I was left petrified and after flying for 7 and half hours dreaded the arrival of the hotel. I have to say on my arrival I was gob smacked at the size of this hotel the lobby was beautiful and I was greeted out of my cab by the hotel ushers (for a small fee of course lol). This hotel is directly opposite Madison square gardens and Pen Station and one street up from MACY's it was in fab location and only three blocks away from the Empire State Building. I checked in smoothly and the receptionist explained all that I needed to know. On the arrival to my room which was on the 9th floor I was pleasantly surprised we had a king sized bed a 22 inch TV with Satellite and internet TV. The bathrooms was adequate and the lightening was a little dull but you couldn’t complain. The room had an air conditioning unit and also for women like myself who straighten their hair a 1600 watt hair dryer in the bathroom. Maid service was amazing my room was cleaned every day with fresh sheets, covers, pillows and towels every day and the maids were lovely and friendly. I would definitely recommend this hotel the lifts were always empty although the hotel was full which has over 1700 rooms. Lindys diner was delicious with huge portions and Joe O's has the friendliest staff ever and I definitely would book again. Best tip of the holiday: bring your walking shoes as NYC as best way to see all the sites and get to time square (which is only 10 mins away). If your a young couple like myself definitely head on down to Greenwich village and for the shoppers of you who like look alike (lol) head down to Canal Street aka little china town.

Reviews.Title: “Fire on the 11th Floor”
Reviews.Author: TheSimpsonsat36
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 11-14th July. On the 13th of July there was a fire on the 11th floor around 1.30pm. We were woken by hotel staff to evacuate the floor which was quite frightening. The smoke was so thick you could hardly see. There was no fire alarm, no evacuation signal and no sprinklers on the 11th floor. When I questioned the firemen in attendance about this, they told me to take it up with management. The location may be very good but my advice is, DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T GO !! ROOMS DIRTY AND BUG RIDDEN”
Reviews.Author: aitchjayes
Reviews.Content: I have just clicked on the reviews for this hotel and see it has not changed since we stayed there 2 years ago. My husband was so badly bitten by bed bugs we had to go to the local hospital. We were moved to a different room after complaining and although a little cleaner I couldn't wait to leave. Thoroughly spoilt our first visit to New York DO NOT stay at this hotel. I have since visited another couple of times, this time staying at the Milford Plaza, which is a little tired in places but a wonderful location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: small1976
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a bit overwhelming at first although the location was awesome - just opposite Penn Station, when I went to check in there was a huge line. However, this moved quickly and I checked in for my 2 night stay. The room was really nice, especially for the price. It had a lovely bed, Tv and bathroom, very spacious for NYC. I would recommend this to anyone who wants a good location for Empire State building and Macy's and of course Maddison Square Garden opposite too.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: tjwhitaker
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel, it is unclean and very untidy, in fact i would go as far as saying it was disgusting! I checked out after 2 minutes of walking in to the room. I stayed next door at the Affinia, and i must say it was 100% better than the Pennsylvania and around the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Awful! Don't go there. No really, don't.”
Reviews.Author: xSmithx
Reviews.Content: We booked it for our wedding anniversary as a package deal with lastminute. Hotel seemed ideally located and photos of the hotel looked great. However, upon arrival we were eventually given keys to a "room" which in no way resembled the photographs on the website. With it being our first visit to NYC we were somewhat disappointed. It wasn't particularly cheap either, so we went back to reception and asked for an upgrade as it was our anniversary. The receptionist looked at us like we had just peed in her shoes and said "er, there is no "upgrade", all rooms are like that" - and then turned away and dealt with the next person. Nice touch I thought. The bed was filthy, wallpaper was peeling off and the room smelled disgusting, and as for the bathroom - eeeeugh. The missus wont let me book any more "surprise" trips away now because of the terrible experience and ALWAYS checks this site first before booking anything herself.

Reviews.Title: “Burned into my memory!”
Reviews.Author: Ddraig
Reviews.Content: This was a rare trip to New York given the price of the hotel I expected great things. Being a city centre hotel (good location then!) the lobby was busy - but the staff were completely disinterested in the customers - there was no organisation - so the whole check in process was a battle and quite stressful. You really had to fight to get attended to cos all the other people were determined to get to the front first! But the most memorable moment, which really is burned into my memory was when my girlfriend and I opened the door to our room. The smell, the stained walls, the fridge that looked like it had belonged to a homeless person (filthy, battered, rusty, empty and incidentally not working), no t.v. filthy carpets and windows that wouldnt open, even a little - all added up to a very strong impression. We were stunned, in an attempt to alleviate the feeling (bear in mind 9 hours travelling led to this) I suggested that perhaps they were expecting us to pay by the hour - but I think my girlfriend thought I meant she looked like a hooker - so it didnt really help! Really, if we had walked into the hotel and been greeted by a receptionist sitting in his stained vest behind a mesh screen (not that I have ever been to a rent by the hour hotel of course) and then been led to this room having been releaved of 20 bucks it may have been ok - but not for what we were paying. A trip back to reception was greeted with indifference - I got the impression the phrase "I need another room" was something they heard roughly every four and a half minutes - cos the response was slick - "this is a city hotel and we are full, there are not rooms" - not even a sir at the end of the sentence. So we were stuck with it - four nights - little sleep because of the heat and smell, and because the mattress had been mugged away from that homeless person - come to thing of it maybe he was still underneath it, cos boy was there a lump in that mattress. I stay in hotels on business every week - across Europe - and I can honestly say that this is the only hotel stay that is going to stay with me unti I start getting senile - unless of course I caught some dreadful disease when I was in the room and my days are already numbered....... Have fun at the Pensylvannia Hotel, New York my friends...

Reviews.Title: “Red room Red room”
Reviews.Author: jrain
Reviews.Content: for thoses of us who have seen the movie the shinning and visit this hotel you will think about this review. this hotel is very large and not kept up. the room was extremly small the bathroom was a jail cell. i went out for a night on the town and once my girlfriends and i returned we found a homelessman sleeping on our door we called security who was so busy playi ng his psp and eating the only way i get his attention was by bribing him with a chicken kabob. can you belive he let me in my room with out asking who i was or asking for id scary ! the homelss man was asked to move and that he did across the hall just down stairs is the maury show. on a + note the location is amazing in the heart of time square across the street from the manhattan mall, and you can always get a cab. your check in process is long and very unorganized. we also paid way to much for that dump truk they want to call a hotel, the hall way looked just like the scene in the shinning when corey feildman began to scream "red room" . please do the right thing run for you life in the direction of a hotel. on a scale from1-10 this hotel gets a 1 only because it has a bed and a door. save your self please.

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel, a real nightmare”
Reviews.Author: JSFR
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on a last minute business trip to New York and our experience was a real nightmare. From the moment we checked in, we waited 40 minutes to be greated by staff who are indifferent and even rude to customers. As per the rooms, they are old, dirty and there is that smell... When we check out, we discoverd that we were charged more than $ 300 of phone calls to various states in the midwest, when we never used once the phones. Trying to explain to the reception lady that we did not place these call and that we did not know of anyone in Missouri, was truly a nightmare. After more than 40 minutes of arguments, the manager finally came and after a proper verification, they cancelled these long distance calls from our bill without even a word of apology. You can find much better hotels in New York for $ 199, with good location and great staff. Avoid at all cost the Pensylvannia.

Reviews.Title: “I Do Not Recommend Hotel Pennsylvania”
Reviews.Author: ime9889
Reviews.Content: I stayed there on a business trip. The reception at the front desk was rude. I called in many times with my travel agent that I need to have internet access and it is high speed. When I arrived it was late and that the so called "internet access" for them is DIAL UP. I cannot believe it. I think they are MISLEADING. I made SPECIFIC instructions and requirement when making a reservation on my hotel stay. And this is the ONLY time when someone told me internet access DOES NOT MEAN DSL or Wireless, but DIAL UP. HA! Not to mention they DID NOT state this when I called and ask about DSL/Wireless. And of course they charge you when you make local calls using their "dial up" internet access. Besides this, the room has paints fall off, DIRTY and it SMELLS. The bath room has a whole in the ceiling and everything is not on what they described in the website. I complaint to the manager at the front desk and he told me to pay for an upgrade. I personally DO NOT RECOMMEND ANYONE TO STAY IN THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Dog Toilet!!!”
Reviews.Author: DHuggins
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel a few years ago, but i was reading some of your reviews and felt I had to have my say. The hotel IS cheap and nasty, and I wouldnt go back there, especially after watching a 'Top 10 Best' programme on the Discovery channel recently. The hotel wasnt the best in New York but it did come 2nd in the list as having one of the best bathrooms in the world-not for humans but for DOGS. Apparently the annual dog show is held there and the organisors book an entire ballroom just so the dogs can crap on the floor. Enough said.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth It!!”
Reviews.Author: chococarol
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel in the last minute, wasnt expecting it much as its a 3-star and cheap, and it perfectly proves: you want cheap, cheap is what you get. We stayed 8 nights, totally not worth it ( $185/night) We had a double-bed room on 8th floor, the room is filthy and humid, the AC hardly works, there is always a strange smell in the room. We tried to open the window, and the window stuck in so bad that a 36-yr-old gym-goer had to try really HARD to get it open. The maid is not friendly at all, when we ask for 4 extra pillows (as the ones the room had are thin as a sheet of paper), she replied with an attitude: " I will get you two , I can't get you four." The bathroom is only equipped with a hair dryer, which is broken, totally useless. Lobby staff is snobby as if we owe money when we ask for secod pair of key card. The only advantage of the hotel is its location, right across from Madison Square Garden and Macys, close to all the shopping places, subway lines and tons of restaurants.... but the hotel itself is completely a disaster, seriously.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, disorganized, bad, bad, bad”
Reviews.Author: jtpenman64
Reviews.Content: Their phone reservation system is aweful -- no one answers. The hallways and rooms could be the filmset for the movie "Taxi". The rooms are very out of date, dirty, and smell bad. Stay away, unless you can't afford better.

Reviews.Title: “Give it a go!”
Reviews.Author: dubdub123
Reviews.Content: Obviously people with bad experiiences are more inclined to write up reviews, but im telling you if you get a renovated room this hotel is perfect. Excellant location, cheap price, the friendliest tour booking staff i have met in my life(although i think they might work for a seperate company). Rooms were scrubbed everyday which was nice to come back to. Across the road from Madison Square Garden and down the street from Times square. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: josabeli
Reviews.Content: The room smelled of mould and urine. The smell seemed to come fron the A/C-unit The bed was awful and gave both of us back pain. The wall paper had come off the wall and there were cracks in the walls. When we complained about the nasty small, they did not at all seem suprised, but gave us a room on the 3rd floor. That room was a lot better, even acceptable. Staff was not very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “The Overlook”
Reviews.Author: chrislea100
Reviews.Content: Oh my word. This hotel is so so bad you simply must stay in it. The bed broke. The sink broke. The bath was broken. The bathroom lock was broken. There was mud, yes mud, dripping from the windows. We wrote our names in it. The hotel is so cavernous and abandoned you'd swear it was haunted. The travel agents called it the 'Roach Motel'. Need I say more? Yes. We had to queue, QUEUE, in a line of people to complain. The maid walked in twice. The iron was dangerously wired. The view was of a brick wall. The location was difficult to get to. There was blood crashing in giant waves from the elevators. That's not true but we half expected Johnny to come a knowcking with his axe. Avoid

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: landykizzy
Reviews.Content: We went to New York to see the New Year in. It was my partners first time and my second. We were really excited about going and no it wasn't cheap. When we got to the hotel we were like other people have stated very impressed with the lobby. There was a police passing out parade going on at the time and all the New York police were in the lobby so this gave it a great atmosphere. When we got to our room I wasn't impressed, it looked grimy and the bathroom looked like it could do with a good clean. The carpet looked like it hadn't been hoovered and when I looked under the bed I found a pair of boxer shorts. I called the front desk and told them and also said we would like to move to another room and was told all the rooms were taken and we had to stay there. The maid who was very cheerful and nice came and picked up the boxers shorts and said sorry. We used the hotel as a base and spent all our time out walking around and visiting sites. I didn't like going back there in the evening as I previously said it looked very grimy. We were there for 6 nights and just had to grit and bear it. I wouldn't book this hotel again as the hotel I stayed in previously when I went to New York was the same rating but much much cleaner.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing time”
Reviews.Author: LanLan
Reviews.Content: I can't believe all the bad reviews I've read, its a cheap hotel! What exactly were you expecting?! I went in Feb 06 and happened to be staying over the period of the dog show which made it very busy, but it was still a briliant stay, staff were friendly and helpful, rooms were very clean, everything worked, it was comfortable, I had no problems whatsoever I spent a week there with my friend and because of the snow we did spend a lot of time in the hotel, the corridors do make u think it is going to be dreadful, but there rooms are fine! All in all, I had a briliant stay and nothing whatsoever to complain about.... If you book a cheap hotel, don't expect 5 *

Reviews.Title: “Ok for price”
Reviews.Author: gempul83
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the pennsylvania hotel for two nights in june with a group of friends. Spacious lobby area and free safe which is in the lobby, although it took a while to get served both at the safe desk and on reception. The room was big but needed a lick of paint at the least, carpet a bit dingy but good working shower hot water etc. Location is great just a block from macy's, and a short walk from times square. Overall for what we paid and the location we got we couldn't complain- would consider staying here again although would probably look for somewhere else first.

Reviews.Title: “grim”
Reviews.Author: Jordy
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 3 years ago, and vowed never to return. First of all, unless you use Penn. Station, the location is not that hot. And quite qrim and dirty. We lived in NYC for35 years, and returned for a visit after an absence of about 10. Try finding a decent deli in the location. The room was very large, but the whole atmosphere had sort of a down at the heels Willy Lohman look and feel. The three cockroaches were the largest we have ever seen, and we now live in Hawaii where there are many, but not like those! For 50 years, we have stayed in second and third class hotels in Europe and Asia, but never anything like this.

Reviews.Title: “what a dissappointment”
Reviews.Author: katieklux
Reviews.Content: After looking forward to the trip of a lifetime and my first trip abroad with my friend to say my experience was spoiled is an understatement. The hotel lobby on the whole looks very nice but the rooms were an absolute disgrace and I have never seen such filth. We settled under duress for the third room we were allocated, simply because we were too tired to argue any further. All three rooms were extremely dirty and unfit to stay in with rat poison laid out for all to see. Pipes were open so were an invite to the rats of New York to enter at any time. The bathroom was a disgrace with rusty fittings and grime everywhere. The wallpaper even had graffitti written all over it. A mouse was even seen in Lindy's restaurant which is situated within the hotel complex. To top it all the hotel staff were most unfriendly, very, very rude by New York standards and all had a couldn't care less attitude. This hotel stay spoiled my whole experience and my friend and I shall definately not being visiting New York again.

Reviews.Title: “It went on fire and nobody woke us up!”
Reviews.Author: Katherine00
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin? Stayed from July 9th to July 17th and the best bit about the holiday was coming home. On the Wednesday night the 11th floor went on fire, the block was evacuated but not the rooms! On the Thursday morning we smelled smoke but thought no more of it. AFTER we checked out another resident told us about the fire and the 11th floor was damaged...we were on the 12th. We complained and received $193.64......I emailed the manager on the 18th July from Ireland and haven't received a reply as to why we werent woken up.... Room was dingy, but good cleaning service. If I could go back I would stay elsewhere...good location, but they have a downright rude hotel reception staff! Those staff on the information desk where you buy tickets for broadway and tours etc. were very nice and helpful though!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here.”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTraveler7
Reviews.Content: Just in case you don't believe the other reviews posted, I'm adding my voice to the chorus. This was the dirtiest, least pleasant hotel I've ever stayed in. Our room was filthy; the carpet wasn't vacuumed, and there was dirt on many bathroom surfaces. The fixtures were ancient and the room had almost no lighting. We were near the elevators and all night heard the elevators making incredible amounts of noise-- possibly because the elevators were in as poor repair as the rest of the property? I think our sheets were clean, which is about the best thing I can say. If you're visiting NYC, do everything you can to find somewhere else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Brace yourselves!”
Reviews.Author: ALIBOO
Reviews.Content: This hotel is by far the worst that I have ever encountered. Three friends and I stayed there for a weekend in July, and believe me, it was the most unpleasant experience for all of us. The hotel is so run down that it should be demolished. It is astonishing to me that this hotel is open for business. And to make matters worse, they have the audacity to charge $189 per night! I just don't feel that you should have to spend that much money for crap. The sheets were soiled, the hotels smells old and musty, the bathroom fixtures were unravelling, and I could go on and on.. The only plus to this hotel is the location. Other than that, it is a definate waste of money. Brace yourselves for the worse!!!

Reviews.Title: “I expected the worst, but not so bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pennsvylvannia from the 5th to the 11th of July. I've rode all the post about it on this website, and i expected the worst. In fact, it was not too bad. I was on room 1420 on the 14th floor. It's a non renovated room. It was old, but clean. The room was made every day, i left a lot of stuff in the room, even money, and never something desapear. The location is really excellent, 5 minutes from time square, in front of Penn Station, where you can find train for every great locations in New York. If i come back in New York, i will probably go there again. I repeat : old room but clean. But what ask more in New York for this price and this location ?

Reviews.Title: “Please don't do it”
Reviews.Author: PJholiday
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our one and only trip to New York, and just happened to be flying out the same day as my sister and her husband, which was not intentional. We stayed here and they stayed in Parc Central. They were about the same price due to a special offer they got. However they were truely not in the same class. When we checked in the staff couldn't really be bothered to speak to us, and we practically got our key thrown at us, which was not the best start. We then went up to the room, and there were stains on the walls that looked like water stains, and I don't mean small ones, they were about a rulers length in diameter, and the room smelt horrible. At which time we went down to ask for a different room. Now I hate complaining about things on holiday, but the room was actually disgusting. The second room we were given was definately better, but by no means good. It still looked like it needed a good clean. We then saw my sisters hotel, and we were gutted that we didn't stay there. We did even think about transferring, even though we would not have got our money back. I would strongly recommend that you don't use this hotel, however, if you are looking for a nice one, the Parc Central is lovely, and it is where we will stay next time!!! It also has a very nice Bar, which was good as I needed a big drink!

Reviews.Title: “hotel stuck in a time warp”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: myself and my partner stayed here for 4 nights during holiday season.We had been told not to expect to much so we went with an open mind.on arrival the lobby was very glam (lots of gold and marble)we had to que for 40 mins to check in which was not great but the reception staff were very nice and very helpfull. our room however was a disaster,it had damp/mould patches on the walls our bed consisted of 2 mattresses piled on top of oneanother covered in a sheet (damp),the carpet was worn,there was rust in the sink/bath and a damp smell throughout the room.we had a window which looked out on to what looked like the main airconditioning fans for the hotel which needless to say made noise constatnly.we asked could we be upgraded to a better room and when asked for our room number were told that our room had been recently renovated and was the best they had.we opened the window on our first night and it became loose in our hands and was then stuck open for the entire stay, we complained but nobody came to fix it.we spent nearly every minute (apart from time asleep)out of the hotel. the hotel apart from the above mentioned was very central which was its only good point. i would never return to this hotel, i would never even think about satying in a hotel like this again.its been a real eyeopener.

Reviews.Title: “OK-- have a sense of humor...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went in with expecting the worst. But the rate was great for the holiday season; $150 a night. Yes, it was dirty, old and the clientele was sketchy. The hallways had a smell of ode de pot.. yeah we could of got a second hand high... The fixtures in the bathroom were something outta 1962 Lindy's in the lobby... eek... bad news there. We laughed about it.. knowing we were paying $150 on a holiday weekend and that is unheard of in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “It's far from perfect, but who cares?”
Reviews.Author: Travellingdutchie023
Reviews.Content: Most previous reviews are accurate, this hotel needs some serious rennovation and it is not very clean. But at least in our room there were no bugs or anything and the beds were clean. But who wants to stay in his/her room, when you are in the centre of all the best that NY has to offer?

Reviews.Title: “great location good hotel”
Reviews.Author: junetheprune
Reviews.Content: We have just had a great week at the Pennsylvania Hotel in New York. After reading the reviews on this site we were not optimistic about the hotel but we were in for a pleasant surprise. Check -in was dealt with promply in a friendly and competent manner, the receptionist insisting that we have a nice big room for the 3 of us. The room was on the 2nd floor overlooking Macy's. It was very spacious with 2 double beds an entertainment centre/drawers unit, a large desk. the lighting was good and plentiful and the air conditioner worked a treat. We had two integral closets with hanging rails plus a room that was as big as a single bedroom with a further hanging rail and ironing board and iron. The bathroom although small contained everything needed and was spotlessly clean with plentiful clean towels every day. I might add that it was a splendid shower, really powerful and we were provided with toiletries when required. The location of this hotel was ideal with many fo the top sights within a few blocks. Finally the housekeeping staff were excellent servicing the bedrooms with clean sheets towels and hoovering everyday, they were not noisy or obtrusive and if their help was required they were courteous and obliging. Likewise all the staff in the hotel, I could not fault one of them. So would we stay their again, you bet, we didnt expect luxury for the price that we paid and we didnt get it but we did get a clean , comfortable hotel within a superb location with very pleasant staff, what more could you want!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having read previous reviews I was dubious about staying here. First impressions left a lot to be desired. Furnishings were old and tatty with a slightly musty odour. However the room was cheap and clean. The hotel is only a short walk to times square and across the road from Pennsylvania Station (which was very handy). Staff were very pleasant. Windows could be opened for fresh air. Compared to prices of other New York Hotels the Pennsylvania was a reasonable price and I think you get what you pay for. If you want 5 star luxury don't stay here, but if you want a clean bed, hot water, central position and budget price it is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, hotel needs a LOT of renovation”
Reviews.Author: Kelsey1023
Reviews.Content: My family of three stayed here last year in July, but the picture of the hotel is still clear in my mind! My advice to ANYONE is not to book things through Expedia. When we arrived at our local airport, we found out that our flight to NYC had been cancelled. The airline (Delta) was very unhelpful since we had booked through Expedia and gave us no other options for different flights going to NYC throughout the day. We went over to the JetBlue desk and the happened to have three seats left that they gave us for cheaper than we paid for Delta. The flight was boarding in ten minutes and the crew made sure that the plane waited until we got on to take off. The flight crew was extremely pleasent to be around and offered my son extra snacks for the much to short plane ride. We had arranged for a shuttle to pick us up through Expedia and when we got off the plane we had to wait an hour and a half for the people to call the shuttle because the "maximum amount of people" were not all present. Words to the wise, just take a cab. Most cabs have the flat rate of $50.00 to take you from the airport to wherever you are going in the city, once again cheaper than what we paid for the shuttle. I had read what other reviers wrote before we stayed at hotel Penn, but there was no way that we could cancel on Expedia because we didn't purchase the cancellation policy. We arrived at Hotel Penn a little earlier than check in time and they gave us a room right away. The hallways were old and not very well lit, while the elevators had TV's in them and you couldn't get on them from the lobby unless you showed the man your room key. We got into the room and we were hit with a burst of old moldy air. I walked in and didn't even bother to put our luggage in the room. I got on the phone to call the front desk to see if they had any other rooms available. The front desk MUST know what you are doing because after TEN minutes of waiting for them to pick up, my husband had the idea to just push zero. Tried that and they picked up right away. I asked very politly if they had any other rooms and they said no, even though I was pretty sure they had something else. I had my husband get on the phone and after 30 minutes of back and forth, they agreed to take us to another room. A bellhop came almost immediatly and brought us to five other rooms before we found one that wouldn't kill us if we breathed the air. We somehow got upgraded to a suite that must have been reserved for extremely rich people who decide to stay there, for no extra charge. There were two double beds with a large old desk and some light. The bathroom was filled with mold and not cleaned, but the water was ok for taking showers. The room was still moldy and dusty as all the others were, but at least it was spacious. My son tried to open the window (we were facing a building so no view) and the blinds came tumbling down on top of him. The air worked, but you had to give it some time. We ate at the little resteraunt downstairs and that was OK, nothing fancy just a little burger joint. It was a few minutes away from Time Square and was right across the street from Penn Station, Macys, Old Navy, Madison Square Gardens, and the Empire state building. There is also a subway station right underneath the hotel! I would definitly stay there again if they managed to clean up the rooms tremendously and maybe changed the towels once in a while. It was a GREAT location, however I don't see us staying there again this summer! We honestly did not stay in the hotel that much except for sleeping because you're in NYC the center of it all so why spend time in a hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Not Worh it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bigwuhead
Reviews.Content: True, it is a GREAT location, but in need of renovation. The Valet parking was the highlight of the stay. HOWEVER, check-in and check-out took WAY tooo long. The hotel is large and on an overnight Friday say is PACKED. 30 min. atleast to check-out. There are plenty of other nice hotels in the city that are worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: uk_vegas
Reviews.Content: Booked in to stay at the hotel and after reading these reviews was a little worried. Found the hotel no problem with excellent links to Penn Station from the airport. Check-in was easy, hardly any queue and the receptionist was happy to accommodate my request for a high floor (having read on the reviews that the higher floors were refurbished.) Got to our room and although basic was clean and fine for the little amount of time we would be in our room. Went out to explore the fab location the hotel is in (right next to Macy's!) and got back to find a mouse running across the floor! Rang reception and were immediately given another room on the 14th floor (a much better standard of room - Queen beds, nicer furniture), but the way the member of staff said "Good Luck" when he left our room made me think that we were just unlucky to see the mouse and that it was a problem the hotel has! Despite that we had a great stay. You can't beat the hotel for the location at a good price. Easily within walking distance of Times Square, Macy's next door, Empire State just round the corner, Maddison Square Gardens across the road and Penn Station to take you wherever else you want to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price and location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Penn in NYC and found it to be higher than our expectations based on other reviews. The room was clean and quiet and the location is incredible since you are right across the street from Penn Station in the heart of Midtown Manhattan. The staff was friendly and courteous and the limited time we actually spent in our room met all of our travel requirements. When in NYC, how much time do you spend in your hotel room anyway? This is the perfect "base camp" for visitors who need to get around the city with minimal hassles. I will definitely stay here the next trip to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is possibly the worst hotel that I have ever stayed in. I booked three rooms for a recent visit with friends after viewing the Penn Hotels website which describes beautiful rooms all backed up by nice photographs. The description and photographs are deliberately mis-leading. We did notice that there was a separate check in area for airline crew and I suspect that the rooms described are reserved for them. All Three rooms were small and cramped and very old fashioned with small beds, old furniture and ever older televisions. The wallpaper was hanging off of the walls and the rooms were badly in need of re-decoration. The bathrooms were from a different era altogether and were in need of modernising. Our bath had actually been painted and the paint had started to come off. The only good thing to say about this hotel is that it is in a superb location.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel, but clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend booked this holiday as a surprise for me, so as soon as i found out where i was going, i checked the internet to see about the hotels i was staying at. When i read the reviews of the Pennsylvania, i was a little worried to say the least. When we got there however, we had no problems at all. To be fair, we arrived late, and therefore experienced none of the queues others had spoken of, but although the lobby looked fairly busy the next morning, the queues didn't look too long. Our room was basic, but it was clean, and combined with the great location and price of this hotel, we had no complaints. Yes, the decor could do with updating, but who in their right mind stays in their hotel room all day bemoaning the wallpaper and carpet with a city like New York beckoning?!? If you don't want to break the bank, want a central location, and don't mind basic hotel rooms so long as they are clean, then this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I paid $299 for a room that had a lumpy twin bed and dresser in a tiny room that could fit no other furniture. The bathroom was disgusting; rugs were stained and everything looked dirty. I kept socks on as I did not want to walk on the floors. The water not only ran brown but had particulate matter floating in it. The lobby was misleading as it looks quite lovely. When you get off the elevator on your floor you immediately know this was not the place to stay in. I cancelled my other two nights and found a new hotel. Try the Radisson on 48th and Lexington-same price for a spotless room.

Reviews.Title: “3 words; Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: LongBeachCal
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the hotel Pennsylvania many times over the years. If you are looking for a 5 star hotel, look someplace else! If you want a basic hotel centrally located next to everything, then this is the place for you. Penn Station is right across the street. In addition you will find the flag ship store of Macys around the corner along with excellent shopping along 34 street. Most major subway lines stop right at your door step. Take the Long Island Railroad out to East Hampton or Long Beach, take a stroll up to Times Square, or take the subway to the Village. I felt safe and the rooms are basic. cs June 2006

Reviews.Title: “Served it's purpose, perfect location..Basic room, no frills”
Reviews.Author: dvevers
Reviews.Content: The outside, lobby, and hallways are great, the room however is very basic, no frills. Hot & Cold running water works just fine, secure and safe door. No View from the window, and the A/C needs some rehauling. This was my only problem, even though I had cranked the A/C on "ice cold" it was rather humid..but still sleepable. Keep in mind that this hotel has been in business since 1919, I believe. BUT also keep in mind when in NYC how much time will you actually be spending in your hotel room anyways ? Location is perfect right across the street from Penn Station (as I took the train) - subway - and 8 blocks from Times Sq. It serves it purpose, quiet floors, safe and secure room, decent bed, with Hot & cold running water. Staff was very friendly. I WOULD STAY THERE AGAIN
