Reviews.Title: “Great for location & cheapness”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel Pennsylvania is situated directly opposite Madison Square Gardens & is in walking distance from Times Square, (Hard Rock, Planet Hollywood, Empire State, Macy's, Virgin & Hersey's - to name a few)! The hotel is massive & looks amazing as you stroll through the lobby & reception! There is a cafe, restaurant & mini shop in the hotel! However, the quality of the hotel declines as you move to the halls & your room! There was nothing noticably wrong with the hotel room, maybe a bit of work could be done on the appearance of the heater in the room, but otehr than that, it was a secure, warm room with a clean bathroom & a working TV. The room was a good size for 2 people & their was a guide to NYC provided. Although we checked the room from top to bottom to find any bugs - there were none & the week was a comfortable stay! Rated for cheapness & location, however if you want luxury then look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: beggen
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the hotel the reception seemed ok but we had to wait nearly 2 hours to get the room the staff was very unfriendly. When we got in the room i could not believe my eyes the wall paper fell of was humid and dirty it was digusting. We aske for an another room an that one was a little bit better but still dirty filzy just awful. The hotel needs to be urgently renovated an the direction is not working either. I never met such a rude personal like in that hotel. Never again to this hotel an if it would be the only one in new york Just stay away there

Reviews.Title: “Not the best hotel i have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Westlothian
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a week in December 2005. My first impression was not to good. The hotel rooms are very basis, the furniture was old not that it really mattered. The bed was clean and our rooms where cleaned regularly. The shower was not to good, hardly any water came out of it. I ran a bath and the water was brown, it looked like a mud bath. I had to let the water run for a while before i took a bath. We found our smoke detector broken and behind the front door. The location was great. I think the most important thing is to have a clean bed and clean towels etc, the hotel covered this. The bath was fine when you let the water run for a while. I would probably stay here again. You only get what you pay for at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Completely Appalled”
Reviews.Author: MJC2007
Reviews.Content: Filthy room. Unbearably filthy. Actually broke down into tears when I realized the rude staff could not/would not change our room.

Reviews.Title: “Gross”
Reviews.Author: pjdz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 1 night may 26. Check in was very disorganized. I recently took a trip to London and before I went I kept reading that the less $ hotels were awful per american standards. People from the states kept writting bad reviews about the hotels in london. NO WAY I stayed in a 2 star hotel in center london that put this place to shame This hotel is a dump. FIrst we got put in room 664 when we walked in, I thought I would be sick, the walls were black with dirt, the lamp shade had burn marks in them,the place looked very seeded. the curtains had mold all over them, So we called the front desk and complained, we were moved to the 11th floor and even tho the room was alittle bigger it was still dirty and full of mold. As many others have said the only good thing is the location of the hotel. The staff are rude. and the place is a dump. It should be closed by the health department I am surpise it hasn't been investesgated

Reviews.Title: “Filthy!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 3 night stay at Hotel Penn and I would not recommend it to my worst enemy! Its deceiving because when you see the lobby you think it wont be so bad but once you see the rooms its a different story. Our first room was on the 6th floor, was disgustingly dirty and had gum stuck to the walls near the window. The carpets are old and dirty, there was no air conditioning and the room was very small. We then asked for a cleaner room and had to pay extra for it which I didnt have a problem with so they moved us to the 12th floor Corporate Penn suites. Not much better than the 6th floor but at least it was a little bit bigger. This hotel needs to be torn down and totally renovated. The only good thing about it was the location but even so I would rather stay in a hotel not so centrally located as long as it was clean. I will never return to this hotel thats for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Grim, dirty & filthy”
Reviews.Author: Tango1967
Reviews.Content: Although in a great location just opposite Penn Station in Mid town - an absolutely awful hotel. Grim, dirty, filthy, unclean room, curtains that didn't close, net curtains that used to be white, now grey and no towels. Poor check in service - took over 30 minutes, at least 20 people in the queue and only 4 reception staff. Rust and mould in bathroom with constantly dripping bath tap and used chewing gum on floor by bed!!! Charged an extra $95 for late check out (no choice due to late evening departure flight) Maybe our English accents helped when talking to housekeeping and luggage storage staff, as received positive attitude and responses. Glad we only booked accommodation only, spent as little time in hotel as possible. Whoever is in charge of Housekeeping isn't doing their job properly. A great shame because it's a beautiful building and could be so much more. Definitely not recommended

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just back from NYC and this is the 2nd time I've stayed here at this hotel. Last time we booked off hotels.com and got a less than average room but this time I read that if you book off their own site (--) you can upgrade to a renovated room for no extra charge, and thats exactly what we did! A class room, large double bed, new carpet, very very clean bathroom, there was even a new smell of mahogany from the new sideboard and TV cabinet! All in all a very enjoyable stay. Wouldn't look into staying anywhere else when travelling to New York again :-)

Reviews.Title: “An Absolute Disgrace - Great Shame!”
Reviews.Author: egogogo37
Reviews.Content: My partner and I chose the Penn because she had stayed there a couple of years back, and whilst she admitted it was nothing special, it was ok and would suit our needs - what a difference 2 years makes. WHAT A SHOCK! The first room we were given was tiny, a 4 foot 6 bed just fitted in, there was nowhere to put our cases. The room was damp, dirty, and there was a horrible smell coming from somewhere. A large section of the bathroom door had actually started to rot/rust away. WORST HOTEL ROOM I'VE EVER SEEN! We approached the desk clerk and told her that we were not prepared to stay there, only to be told that there wasn't much else available, as it was a saturday night. We stated that if not, then we would stay in a top Hotel, and ensure that either the Penn, or expedia - who we had booked through - would pay for it. Suddenly a room was made available, on the same floor as the other (the 5th Floor - 559). This room was by far superior, much bigger, huge bed, and a cleaner bathroom. There were resident mice sharing our room, and I noticed under the air-conditioning unit a lot of dust and dirt. Only 1 pillow each, and not many towels, so I tipped the maid, and the following day we had an extra pillow each, and more towels. The pillows remained for the duration of our stay, but unfortunately the towels didn't. The rest of the Hotel was pretty much run down and grubby. Apparently they are having a refit, and looking on the Penn's own website this is evident as the rooms they advertise look very modern and clean - however throughout the week I saw only 2 Contractors. The Penn is nearly a hundred years old, so I reckon it'll take these 2 men another hundred years to do the refit. On a plus side - we were able to use the Penn as our base to wander off and look at the many other "better quality and just as cheap" hotels in the area, so we know where to stay next time now. Staff were quite ignorant and rude, apart from the Maids. The Security is not quite as advertised - Keys were rarely checked for residents using the lifts to go up to the floors; and the hotel advertises CCTV on all floors - the floors are huge, with lots of Corridors - only 1 camera on each floor, right by the lifts! I doubt if anybody was watching it anyway! I had noticed during the week that there was a lot of Flight Crew from various Airlines staying in certain areas on our floor (5th). On check-out day, I took the opportunity to bribe staff to let me see these rooms, which to my amazement were excellent!! If I didn't know better I would say that the Hotel were looking after the guaranteed "money" of the Airline Company's, and giving the Tourists the poor rooms - but then maybe..... Either way, we won't be staying here again!!!!!! It's a massive shame, the hotel has a lot of history, and you can see where the once Grandeur stood. It's just been allowed to fall into disarray. You wouldn't believe it was owned by the same people as the Waldorf Astoria. At most, a 1 - Star hotel. A few tips: If you're not 100% happy with your room, DO change it! If they say no other rooms are available, ask to see the Manager, or say you'll go somewhere better and charge it to them. Food at Lindy's is average, and expensive. There's a couple of Breakfast places just up the street past Macy's. Don't go by the Penn's own web site otherwise you will be very disappointed. Remember, if staff are rude - You're paying their Wages!!!

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: ALR24
Reviews.Content: There is nothing positive to say about the hotel. The staff are either rude or incompetent. It took 45 minutes to check in, only to find myself in a squalid room, which was in a state--not clean, and falling apart. The gym is barely functioning, there are no amenities nor staff available to assist you. Check out was equally traumatic, taking another 45 minutes while the front desk manager yelled at me because they had charged the wrong credit card. Insane. Judging by the people standing next to me they were all equally annoyed with one complaining of the room not being cleaned all week, and another one who faced both bugs and a mouse in their room!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but suprisingly cheerful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Hotel Pennsylvani,New York.I must admit that I was a bit apprehensive about staying there after readinmg all the mixed reviews.When we got there we were told that although we had paid for a twin room there had been a mistake with the booking agents and they could only provide us with a double room instead.They offered us a fold away bed but said that because of the mix up they would give us a room with a view. We were situated on the 17th floor.It wasn't perfect.You could tell that the hotel was in desperate need of renovation b.Our room definately needed a lick of paint but it was very comfortable and extremely clean.We didn't really spend much time in there but when we did it did the job.For the price we paid for the hotel we got what we expected. The big plus point of this hotel is the location.Only two blocks away from Macy's and the Empire State and only eight blocks away from Times Square.With a location like that I cannot find fault.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Robblps
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights in May 2006. I've stayed here twice before, so I know it aint exaclty the best hotel in the world. We checked in, queued for around 5 mins max. Had a room on the 2nd floor. After reading everything on here...........i was like ohhhhhh no, we are under the 5th floor, thats bad. We got to the room. IT WAS HUGE. 2 double beds, 3 walk in wardrobes. 21inch TV. Fridge. Everything was clean and tidy. I personally think the floor was getting done up at the time mind, there were painters around in the corridors all week. NYC you basically need a place to shower and crash, thats all we wanted. WE GOT ALOT MORE THAN THAT. IF you go to NYC and worry about what the inside of the hotel is like, its kinda worrying. You sleep in the hotel and thats about it. Excellent location.............and I will stay they again for the 4th time, probally next year X

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As you say, you get what you pay for, but even chain Motels are better than this! I would NEVER advise any friend of mine to stay here as I would be to embaressed. Excellant location, but oh dear what a dump! Dreadful!

Reviews.Title: “totally central”
Reviews.Author: jmr64
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend have just stayed at the Hotel Pennsylvania for 5 days in room 414 on the 4th floor, the room itself was big (2 double beds, very comfortable), a large tv and dressing table, the room had beige carpet which was slightly stained but ok, the bathroom was ok but the radiator was very rusty,but with the door open you didnt notice it, the maids came in every day changed the sheets and changed the towels, which did make a difference, the room overlooked Madison Square Gardens and was at the front of the hotel on the main road, we thought the view and location of the hotel was fantastic, it is completely central for everything, at nite you can hear the traffic and noise but that is part of being in new york city,we would stay in this hotel again. if your going to go on any trips ie;- a mets/yankees baseball game, go on the metro its cheaper $4 each return. Try a meal at Planet Hollywood in Times Square and have a cocktail in one of the quirky glasses theyre fab!!, Book your Broadway show at the theatre itself again this is cheaper than booking through your hotel. At the end of the day your holiday is what you make it, this is a centrally located hotel, not very posh at all, but your room is cleaned every day and basically you do only sleep there after all. Hope this helps, any questions email me!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute disgrace an excuse for a hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for 3 nights in this establishment with my sister and child on a 4 day trip to New York and I have to say I have never been so disgusted in all my life. I would say that I am a avid traveller and have never stayed anywhere so dirty. This hotel needs to be closed down and fumigated!! Our window in the room didn't open, there was no ventilation, NO pillowcases on the bed, bedding was filfthy... the carpet well was beyond explaination and the bathroom, well I would describe as third world conditions. IF you have booked this hotel please change your booking before you travel !!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we needed.”
Reviews.Author: twanny1976
Reviews.Content: Maybe the rooms, mainly the bathroom, could do with some renovation, but it was fine. The room, towels and sheets were clean, the towels changed every day, we got a massive room, it even had an iron and iron board and a big walk in wardrobe. It was very quite and never had to wait long for the elevator and also we never had to queue for check in or luggage. There was a tv in the room but we never turned it on cause we were a;ways out. Also the location is fantastic, you can walk everywhere. Macy's, Penn Station, Times Square, Empire... all within walking distance. For the price we paid we definitely cannot complain. And for our purpose it was fantastic. We were after a clean room, not expensive, central location and that is what we got. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor”
Reviews.Author: EllieA
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through a teletext travel agent which was possibly the wrong thing to do to begin with however this is a terrible hotel. Bad service, dreadful standard of room. We were given the key to our room which was awful. We complained and were given the key to another room which was equally bad. Couldn't stay in this hotel. Went to the nearest internet cafe and found another hotel. (which was infact wonderful)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location- Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LauraE1983
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from the spending 5 nights at the Penn. After reading some of the reviews I really don't know what people expect from a 3 star hotel! Ok, so it's not the Ritz but neither is the price! We arrived at 1.45pm, and despite a sign saying check-in at 3pm, we checking in straight away, as did everyone else who was waiting. The guy said to come back if we had any problems with the room. It was a bit basic, but clean and tidy with plenty of space- even a seperate room with an iron and board. However, the best thing about this hotel really is the location. It is fantastic. Right opposite Penn station/ Madison Square Gardens. Macys is two blocks away. If you're looking for a budget hotel in a suitable location to see all the sights this is ideal. Who comes to New York to sit in the hotel all day anyway? I'm already saving up for my next trip and I will definately be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for!...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights during april. You could not ask for a better location in Manhattan, subways nearby, the MSG, Times Square and the Empire state building 5 minutes away. It was a 2 star hotel & it lived up to that rating. poor service on check-in (very slow), the lobby looks great but wait until you see some of the floors. stayed on the 15th floor & you would not believe it, wallpaper in the corridors looked like it had been touched by freddy crugers claw, the doors looked like they had been borrowed from a padded cell in mental home. I dont think many of the floors are renovated & i think the best are reserved for the penn 5000 guests which costs a lot more. The room was basic with very old fashioned furnishings, the veiw, well there was no veiw just other rooms across the way and there will be many roooms with the same. A few positive things though the room was very clean, beds, bathroom and furniture. We had cable tv, messaging & gerenal services and house keeping every morning. If you are on a budget holiday stay at the hotel penn there is a bar & restaurant & basic gym to use so to wrap things up it is ideal if you're not planning to be in the hotel that often You get what you pay for!...

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: brazenxvirtue
Reviews.Content: I was just in New York for a 2 day interview so I wanted to stay someplace inexpensive yet not too far away from the office I had to go to (near Grand Central). My mother and I looked online and saw that Hotel Pennsylvania had a reasonable rate and was in a good location. I arrived at the hotel late Monday night and stepped out of the cab into a rather motley mix of people, some not so appealing looking. But I chalked that up to the area probably being a hangout for teenagers and whatnot. I walked into the lobby and it was the same thing. I wasn't worried, however. Sure there were more random people walking around the hotel than I was used to, but it was near a station after all. Most hotels would ask non-patrons and loiterers to leave... but I shrugged it off. In the midst of my check in, a man came up to the front desk yelling about some problem that was supposed to have been resolved already. He had an unfamiliar accent so I couldn't make out just what the issue was. I did notice, however, that the front desk girl conducted herself rather unprofessionally. But I figured it was late so she was probably tired and frustrated by now. I wrote it off. I headed for the elevators where I had to show my room key before I could even enter the elevator area. This was the point where I actually first braced myself. While this sounds like a comforting security measure, I've been to hundreds of hotels all around the world and have never seen such a practice. I found myself a little wary wondering why they would need such a precaution. Maybe the area wasn't as safe as Time Square where I usually stay. When I stepped off the elevator and onto the 4th floor, I knew with a sinking feeling that my time there would not be pleasant. I was hit with a rush of stale cigarette smoke. Apparently my non-smoking room was on a smoking floor which rather negated its efficacy. The hall carpet looked as though its original color was buried underneath quite a few layers of dirt and grime. Stains large and small were everywhere. I was a little frightened of seeing so many stains considering that the lighting was inordinately dim and further hampered by a mist of smoke. If that's what I could see, how much was I missing? Many of the directional signs to the rooms where hand drawn as quite a few of the signs had fallen off probably long ago. What was even more fun for me, there were no signs to my room at all. I had to roam the dark, dank hallway aimlessly. Fortunately I found it just before I was about to go downstairs to complain. Many of the doors to the rooms were covered with some sort of green, plastic decoration. It's hard to describe, but they were obviously old and tattered. Quite a few of the doors were missing them and the ones that were still hanging often had holes. I arrived in my room only to find that my carpet was filthier than the carpet in the hallways. So filthy was it that I never took off my shoes. There was a double bed with an obviously worn bedspread, an armchair about 30 years old that looked as though it had never been cleaned in all that time, and a desk that looked only a few years old but that had a chair whose cushion was already covered in stains. As I walked in I immediately smelled the musky odor of mold, and soon I found ONE of its sources. There was a little mini-fridge of the floor with black mold visible on the outside of it. I was horrified. I timidly entered the bathroom hoping for a bright spot but afraid of something worse. The towels and washclothes were folded on what looked like the type of bathroom shelving you'd find in a high school locker room. The problem was that the holes that were part of the shelving design, probably meant to prevent water buildup, were full of rust and dirt. Apparently noone at this hotel had ever heard of LYSOL (fortunately I had and came armed with a bottle). I read one review where someone walked into a room there and it reeked of bleach, they were appalled. Me, I only wish I'd had the smell of bleach in my room. I gingerly pulled back the shower curtain to spray the area with Lysol, only to find that no amount of Lysol would convince me to bathe myself in such a place. There was no plug for the drain so I could clearly see the corroded, rusted, and dirt encrusted area around and inside it. The enamel on the tub was cracked and peeling in many places, creating partially opened crevices where it was impossible to clean. Maybe if the whole thing had been soaked in pure bleach..... From what I saw, either the tub wasn't cleaned after the last guest (or few guests) or whoever cleaned it didn't know how to do their job. To be fair, maybe they were just as grossed out as I was a preferred to avoid it. All I wanted to do was survive till morning when I could find other accommodations. I went to the window to close the curtains (my room looked into another room) and I happened to glance down at the ancient fan/heater attached to the wall. To my horror and nausea even now, the vent was filled with mold, grime, dirt and only the Lord knows what else. It was black with layer upon layer of filth. Absolutely disgusting and I'm sure a health hazard and code violation of some sort. It's just as well the window was stuck and didn't close because I felt I would rather freeze all night than even let my pinky touch the dial on that contraption. And I did. I spent a restless night hearing people come down the fire escape through my hopelessly ajar window. I'll try to cut this longwinded story short on only mention in passing things like the stains on the inside of the bedspread, the filthy ironing board, the lack of a bolt lock on the door, and the fleas. Needless to say I hightailed it out of there early in the morning. I checked out a couple of housekeeping carts on my way out and noticed that there were no cleaning products whatsoever. There were only refills of toilet paper and changes of linen. Actually, this place was such that you had to put a sign on your door saying that you wanted them to clean the room to get service at all. They have a $50 early check out fee that got waived for me, which is just as well for them as I was appalled enough to make my complaints known which is something I'm usually loathe to do. I ended up staying at the Comfort Inn on 46th St. which turned out to be $10 cheaper a night, almost on the corner of Times Square, closer to my interview, and CLEAN. Granted, I had just left hell so anything else felt like heaven. I know others have mentioned that their in the midst of renovating and that some of the rooms are ok. But as for me, I wouldn't take the risk. Friends don't let friends stay at the Hotel Pennsylvania.

Reviews.Title: “NOT BAD AT ALL!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and My Father stayed in The Penn for 6 nights from 22 April to the 28th and i read alot of bad reviews in the weeks leading up to the holiday and to be honest was dreading it. We arrived at 2pm and had to wait until 3pm to check in, not a problem as they are the rules as advertised. The Room, we stayed in a room on the 7th floor (room 722A), room was basic but great, 2 twin beds, fairly big T.V, bathroom was very clean, window view of city and for the price what more can you ask for. The Staff, we found the staff to be very helpful, really couldnt do enough for you, rooms were cleaned every day, new towels and plenty of them, new sheets, everything was great. Only disgruntlement i had with the staff is when we checked out at 12 on the last day, when they brought our room up on screen and found no charges, they couldnt wait to get rid of us. The Location, what more could you ask for less than 10 mins walk from Times Square, less than 5 mins to Empire State and for those who take thier wifes and girlfriends, MACY's almost next door. Getting food near the hotel, no problem, there were alot of places very close to the hotel, from Wendy's to Popeyes chicken, KFC, Dunkin Donuts and plenty of local food stores or DELI's where you can also buy all different kinds of foods, all within a minute walk. I am actually going to the travel agent in the next few days to book NEW YORK for next year and will definatly be staying at the Penn. The funny thing is, people slate this hotel, when i went to book this hotel they advertised it as a 2 star hotel, with great location, I would agree but in NEW YORK, LOCATION IS EVERYTHING, when we were walking around we saw the Grand Hyatt near Grand Central Terminal, a 4 star hotel, and its location isnt as good as that of the Penn. And lets be honest in New York how long are you going to be in your hotel........ I would recommend this hotel to anyone, like i said i will definatly be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location shame about the rooms”
Reviews.Author: zophie100
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May 2004 and couldn't understand the terrible reviews, now however I do! The hotel is in a fantastic location for sight seeing and the price is very reasonable. However... Our room was a good size, we had a view of Madison Square Garden out of our window..... and our very own pet mouse!!!! When I informed the staff of our little visitor she told me it was my fault for having food in the room...which we didn't! I did however speak to the bell captain who informed me that the previous owner had taken every penny profit and left the hotel to fall to rack and ruin. The new owners are refurbishing room by room which if you have ever seen the size of the place you will realise is no small task. I would strongly recommend staying here if you can get a refurbished room, as it really is the best location in New York. Enjoy your stay! No amount of rodents can spoil New York!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never Ever Again!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at the Hotel Penn for 9 days, and in all honesty the hotel was the worst part. The staff unfriendly, barely accomodating, and the rooms HORRIBLE! We unfortunately had to check into the hotel at around 11pm because of our flight, and the first room we received (1161) was disgusting. It was not big enough for two people, it would have barely sufficed for one. The room was not vaccumed, we found an earring on the floor and hair all over the sink. So we requested a new room. The attendant tried to get us to stay in that room, but there was no way we were going to. We then got moved to another room (1119) which was much better. Clean, and enough room for two people. Even though we had to share a bed. For the rest of the trip we did have a problem with the room rate, but on the last day they caved and fixed it. As for the room attendants leaving enough towels and supplies we constantly had to call to get them, apparently leaving two towels and face cloths for two people is difficult. I don't recommend this hotel to anyone, stay at a Super 8, it will be much better. Also that whole cliche about New Yorkers being rude only applies for this hotel staff, everyone else in that city is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Get a refurbished room... fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was very apprehensive about staying here after reading reviews, especially because I was going to be there for a night by myself before my partner arrived. The lobby is fantastic and so was our room. After reading reviews I requested a refurbished room above the 9th floor. We stayed on the 11th and the room was lovely. Small but brand new super king and super comfy bed. News drapes and furniture, big TV, desk and plently of closet space. Bedroom was serviced each day and linen was lovely and new. Hotel is very central and there is a restaurant in the building if you can't be bothered going out to eat every night. It is one of the oldest and largest hotels in NY which further adds to it's charm.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but fine”
Reviews.Author: Sark
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel Pennsylvania for 4 nights in April as part of a group of 6. We had booked two triple rooms and on check in were given one room on the fifth floor and another on the fourteenth floor. The fifth floor room (No. 537) was basic and tiny. It had two double beds so was not suitable for three people sharing. The decor was old and tired although kept clean and the room smelled of fried food from the various food outlets nearby. The second room on the fourteenth floor (No. 1452) was much better in comparison. It was made up of two bedrooms with two single beds in each so one person allocated to the fifth floor room moved up. The room was spacious and clean and although sparsely furnished was in ok condition. The bathrooms are slightly old fashioned but clean and the shower is hot and powerful. Overall we were pleasantly surprised with the experience having read the reviews before arriving. It's true that the corridors and general public areas of the hotel are dingy and could do with a good clean but obviously the hotel has found that the location guarantees permanent bookings and so are content to skimp on renovations. If you are on a first time visit to New York it is in a perfect location. There are plenty of shops nearby, it's across the street from Macy's and a few blocks from Times Square and the Empire State Building. However, there are no restaurants or bars nearby and if you're looking for interesting food you have to travel. Also, because you're on a main throughfare, there is constant noise and traffic 24/7. I wouldn't choose this hotel again simply because I would prefer to stay in a more local area but if you're looking for cheap, central accommodation this is fine. Just make sure that you're not expecting too much and ask for a room above the 13th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location poor hotel The room was dirty, the customer service was poor both before and during the stay i would not recommend this hotel for anyone . it relies on its brand and history rather than its actions

Reviews.Title: “Interior reminds me of The Shining's Overlook Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SommerWind
Reviews.Content: OK, technically, I didn't stay here. Friends did while I booked at the Red Roof Inn up the street. I'll say this...the lobby was hoppin' -- there were long lines for check-in -- so it appears that plenty of people stay here. However, when I saw my friends' room on the 12th floor, I felt a little skeeved. Was it HORRIBLE? No. Could you survive a stay here? Most likely. But it *is* an OLD hotel -- dark & dank with a musty smell and somewhat of a creepy vibe. Personally, I would rather pay a few more bucks and be in a clean & comfortable room.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience to date”
Reviews.Author: neenz_911
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to NYC so I booked Hotel Pennsylvania on the grounds that it seemed like a good mid-range compromise. Upon arrival, the lobby gave a good impression but our room was APPALLING. It seems most of the good reviews go for suites or rooms on the 13th floor but if you consider the size of the hotel you're really taking a chance on getting a good room! We booked a non-smoking room with a queen-sized bed and found the room to be quite small. This was not a problem compared to the dirty, worn out carpets and the fact that all soft furnishings were impregnated with a stench of stale smoke. There were prominent mould colonies in the bathroom and our room overlooked a brick wall barely a street-width apart. The highlight was the bedside lamp which was operated by sitting on the bed! For the price, you would expect at least a clean room. I would not recommend anyone to stay at the Hotel Pennsylvania, at least until the refurbishments are fully completed.

Reviews.Title: “First time to New York? Stay here in this great cheap hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Like many people who have read reviews of this hotel I was a bit worried. However, as soon as we got there I was relieved to find it is a great hotel. Firstly, I think people who spend a lot of time in hotels expect a certain level of service and this hotel does not provide anything other than the room. You get your room, en-suite bathroom and TV. No breakfast, room service, massage, gym or any other extras that you don't really need. The hotel is right in the middle of everything however. Empire State Building, Macys and Times Square are within a short walk away. Penn Station (and Subway access) and Madison Square Gardens are opposite the hotel. We arrived at Newark Airport, got the monorail tram from the terminals to the train station at the airport. Train ride to Penn Station and then we crossed the road and we were there. No expensive bus or taxi journeys and hardly any walking. The staff are nice and friendly and helpful. This hotel is perfect for anyone who is going to New York for the first time and is looking for somewhere decent and cheap to stay in the middle of everywhere. This is a functional hotel and will meet all your needs and which is all you need on a trip. Anything its missing you can find in the city anyway. Like I said if this is your first trip or you have been before and just want a room to sleep in then this is perfect. If your use to the better things in life than this hotel is not for you. Some tips. 1. Book on the hotels own website early as you can see how much each type room is for each day. It may be cheaper to go a week earlier. I could not beat the deal the hotel offered on the website depsite searching all the websites that supposdely offer cheaper deals. Also booking with the hotel direct apparently gets you a decent room or upgraded to better. Lindys diner in the hotel lobby is hyped but seemed expensive and very little choice. Much better is an Italian resturant called Sbarrow which is 2min walk away from the hotel (turn right as you come out the main entrance). Food is on paper plates but they do a hot breakfast buffet for $7 with really nice food (but get there early). Oh and don't drink tea anywhere! E-mail me if you want any advice or further info or any more tips.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I've Ever Stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: Traveller_of_World
Reviews.Content: This place is a dump. It should be turned into a hostel. I have included photos - you can compare them to the deceptive photos and wording on the Hotel Pennsylvania website. Bad Points: - Blatant False Advertising (Website is extremely deceptive, claiming “Inside, you'll find beautifully renovated rooms, with new furniture and carpeting”. But only a few suites have been redecorated. Standard rooms definitely do not match the website photos). - Terrible “hotel” rooms. After reading the Tripadvisor reviews, we requested a renovated room, but our request was completely ignored. - Broken bed in our first room, meant that reluctantly they moved us to second, equally appalling room. - Extremely dated interior (15 years +) - Stained and worn-out carpet - Smells of cigarette smoke - Chunks of flaking ceiling paint falling off (really nice to wake up to) - Faded wall-paper peeling off - Marks, stains, and writing on walls. - Paint missing from doors to each room (looked like they had all been broken into) - Light switch hanging off of wall (dangerous) - Bathrooms not cleaned properly (walls, door and shelves had scum, toilet was unflushed) - Bathroom Linen had holes and stains - Bed Linen had dirt marks. - Shower swamped water over bathroom floor - Buttons on phone did not work properly (reported to reception, but nothing done) - Noisy air-conditioning - No room service or mini-bar - No breakfast included - Huge Security Problem (guy sitting by elevators lets every single person through without checking for room keys). - 1700 rooms, but only usually 2 staff on reception desk. Therefore long, slow moving queues. - Extremely Poor Customer Service (no point complaining, they have clearly heard it many, many times before). - $4 fee per bag for storage on depature day. - $50 fee for early departures (Seems this has been a real problem for them. Once people see the rooms, they realise that they have been ripped off, and want to check out. So the hotel has turned this into a money making opportunity! Good Points: - Location (opposite Madison Square Garden, 1 block from Macy’s, 15 minute walk to Time Square, close to clothes shops) - Transport (above Penn Station / red subway line, 1 block from yellow subway line) - Cheaper than a Hilton or Marriott hotel. - Nice Lobby (doesn’t match the rest of the hotel) - If you are prepared to spend even more, you can get a renovated suite Recommendations: - Only consider this hotel if you are on a very, verty strict budget. - Under no circumstances should you book a standard room (refer to the photos). The condition of the rooms and bathrooms in a hostel will be far superior to this dump. This place has so many terrible ratings on Tripadvisor… how could so many people be wrong? They are not! This place is shocking. It is the worst accommodation I have ever stayed in, with the worst customer service. I am not being harsh - I am just stating the absolute truth.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Bertis
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel as it was relatively cheap for NY and in a good location. From the reviews I knew in terms of quality it would only be OK. The plan was to stay at this hotel for 1 night only and move to a nicer one the next day as we would not arrive in NY until 10pm, so it seemed a waste to spend so much on a room that we were only going to spend a few hours in. The hotel itself was in desperate need of refurbishment, I was on the 16th Floor and the massive corridors looked tired and dated. Upon entering the room I noticed that the windows were open the reason soon being obvious – there was a musty smell from damp (not sure where water was coming in from). The room itself was huge and sparsely furnished and again needed refurbishment, it really looked like it hasn’t been touched since the 50s. However it did have everything you would need in a hotel room: bed, clean sheets, bath/shower even a small fridge dumped in the middle of the room. Not wanting to stay in this room any longer unless I was unconscious, we wondered out to check out some bars, 25 minute walk from the hotel and we were in Chelsea so hotel location was very good. So overall I can see why so many people stay at this hotel – it ticks many boxes:- good location, keenly priced and large rooms. As I mentioned my expectations before I arrived was low and from experiencing this hotel – it came in lower than what I expected, I will not stay here again and was glad that it was only for 1 night I would be happy to spend more on a better hotel. My only thought was that the hotel seemed very busy all the time – with all this revenue the hotel is generating surely they could afford to keep it at a higher standard

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place”
Reviews.Author: cheftaz
Reviews.Content: After booking part of our family vaction here before seeing the reviews the family was very nervous when we arrived we were astonished we had a huge suite super clean awesome staff great location only advice i would give when booking ask for one of the renovated floors we were on the 13 th and it was awesome we would defitently stay there again

Reviews.Title: “No problems here”
Reviews.Author: Gerite
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Penn for 3 nights in March and boy was i dreading it! some of the reviews were just appauling. waited to checkin for about 10 mins -I was 2 hours early. the que wasn't moving so a member of staff directed us to the penn 5000 checkin desk. very plesent guy checked us in and as I had requested a nice quiet room and gave him a smile . We got upgraded - yeppi. The room wasn't huge but had everything we needed and was clean. I think the people posting pictures of specks of dirt etc. are being really fussy - it isn't The Ritz. You get what you pay for and in this case I was happy. Staff were plesent, free buffet breakfast was basic but did the job. Only bad thing was they charge you $3 per bag if you have need to use the luggage room. With checkout at 12 and our flight at 19.00 this was a necessary - Shoppers beward we had 6 bags!!

Reviews.Title: “The Penn is a dump”
Reviews.Author: CoastGirl
Reviews.Content: My family & I stayed at the Hotel Pennsylvania in Oct 2005. On arrival we were surprised at the length of queue at he desk i.e. 50metres/ 45mins but this was New York so what the hell. The foyer was lovely - polished brass and chandeliers everywhere, quite impressive actually. The rooms however, were quite a different story. The carpet was filthy, stank of cigarette smoke and had cigarette burns all over. The paint was peeling from all walls. The bathroom was full of rusty pipes and mouldy grout. The furniture was either damaged or had bits missing ie. drawers gone. On a positive note: the sheets were clean, fresh and white as were the bathroom towels. Thank goodness for small mercies for I was ready to sleep on the street!!

Reviews.Title: “beware”
Reviews.Author: sheap
Reviews.Content: As you walk into the lobby it looks a lovely hotel, but as soon as we got from the lift on floor 2 it was like your worst nightmare. The walls in the hallway had holes in them doors had not been painted for years and holes in the ceilings. One of our rooms had not been cleaned and the other overlooked a flat roof which was FULL of rubbish. there was a pipe leading from one radiator which obviously didnt belong there and one rooms windows didnt stop the wind coming in. The hotel is in a great location but dont be fooled by that.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe all of these reviews...Hotel Was great.”
Reviews.Author: snowman28
Reviews.Content: Ok.. Been back a about a week now and thought i would put my review on line.. Booked the Hotel for a 6 day stay before seeing all of the bad reviews on tripadvisor and was really REALLY worried about what the room was going to turn out like. But all of my fears were put to rest... Room 1340.. 13th floor, great... clean carpet, clean beds sheets, good decoration, clean bathroom, all facilities working... The maids were fantastic with clean towels every morning and making the bed every day, taking away all of our shopping bags that we seemed to accumulate!! lots of shopping !! I would say that the front desk staff are a little pushed, but remember this hotel has about 1700 rooms, sure there going to be busy.. I would like to thank all of the staff at the hotel and especially Barry Rauch who is Director of Front Desk Operations. I gave Barry a couple of emails before we left the UK as i wanted to get some tickets sorted to see the Knicks play..Barry was a gem..tickets waiting at check-in... Would def go back... Cheers Warren I'll add some pics soon.. or email me at warren.hubbard@burtonh-tr.wmids.nhs.uk

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Service Ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel a few nights ago and it was one of the worst experiences i have ever had! They were rude to us from the moment we first checked in, they mixed our room up twice, at one point causing our stuff to be locked in a room we couldn't get into then proceeded to blame us for the mistake. When we asked to speak to management and tried to explain our dissatisfaction through describing our experience, we were literally told by a member of management to "get to the point" and never once received so much as an apology. The rooms were pretty crappy and i got charged extra money on my account and still have not been able to get in touch with someone who can fix it. If you you don't want your New York experience to be ruined like mine, Don't stay at this hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Appalling.”
Reviews.Author: Hannahd
Reviews.Content: For the price, I expected a small, basic room. It was disgusting. There was wallpaper peeling from the wall, cracks in all the tiles in the bathroom, a hairdryer next to the sink (i.e over it) and wires hanging out under the desk. Behind the aircon unit there was loads of broken parts of the wall at the back, as though it had crumbled off. The carpet was not vacuumed for our entire stay. The bed sheets were not changed every day. The state of the floor under the bed - was simply repulsive. I also (my fault entirely) left some goods in the very well disguised wardrobe. Worth about $200. The hotel claim not to have found it in there when I am 200% sure I left in there. I think we all know where that has gone....don't trust the cleaners, take any valuable goods with you during the day. Appalling. Its a perfect location, and a lovely building. What a waste.

Reviews.Title: “it was cool!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i was dreading going to the hotel on my school trip after reading the awful reviews, but i was very surprised. the hotel was fine, i stayed on the 2nd floor room number 217a and the room was great with 4 of us sharing. it was spacious, everything worked, we had a fridge and hair dryer and the bathroom was of a good standard (which after reading the reviews i didnt think it would be!) the lobby was lovely like others said and the rooms included all of the basics, had clean sheets every night, the bins were cleaned everyday and there were fresh towels everyday (as well as hot water all of the time) unfortuanalty the only view we had out of the windows were of the back on 'dunkin doughnuts' so we had a fresh smell of doughnuts everynight, but my other friends had fantastic views including the empire state and madison square gardens. anyway we had a great time and i dont think there were any down sides to the hotel, they lets us kids carpet skate around the corridors on the 2nd floor, and it was nice of them not to say anything or complain because they must have heard us. ps- theres a cafe (city perk) that sells the nicest hot chocolate at, like, 11pm lol

Reviews.Title: “False Advertising”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at Hotel Pennsylvania for a trip that I planned almost two years ago. I visited the official website and various other multi-purpose websites to get an overview of the hotel before making a reservation. Based on the information and photos provided, it seemed like a decent hotel for a very reasonable price...false advertising!! During our long walk to our room, we noticed that the walls in the hallway were falling apart with holes and marks everywhere and paint peeling off. The room that we were given looked nothing like that which was shown on any website that I visited for information about the hotel; as soon as we walked in, we were overwhelmed with the smell of Clorox Bleach, the television was set on a box (literally four pieces of wood) in the corner, the window curtains were falling apart, there was a lovely view of a brick wall which didn't help the fact that the room was extremely dark as it was with very little electrical lighting provided, and the room was so tiny that we could hardly move around!...also, inside the bathroom, the tub was stained, whether they be rust or something else (who knows?!). Overall, the room and the hotel itself were absolutely tacky! We found another hotel and checked out of Hotel Pennsylvania within twenty minutes of checking in. Upon checking out, we were asked why we were leaving so soon; I explained to the front desk worker that we were greatly dissatisfied with our room as it was not at all what we expected. I explained that I had booked a Standard room for two people and gave a brief description of what I was expecting, to which the employee told me that the room which I had described was not what I booked! I viewed pictures of the hotel's Standard rooms and the room that was given to us - a Standard room - was not what was advertised on any website that I looked at. Are there two or more types of Standard rooms?! The hotel is in a great location but needs serious renovations! I would never even consider making a reservation there again!

Reviews.Title: “Dont!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a very poor Hotel. Please go somewhere else! The lobby looks nice and youre fooled into thinking that its nice upstairs but you'd be VERY wrong. Waited 2 hours before we could check in. TV didnt work Internet didt work Carpet was filthy Pulled back the bedsheet to find large BROWN and YELLOW stains!! I ended up sleeping ON TOP of the dovet with a towel as a blanket! i kid you not. The only good thing i can say about this hotel is that it is a perfect distance for everything. Central station vitually accross the road, brilliant Irish bar next door and Macey's next door also.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Location is good, price is good but..............YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR! Lobby is beautiful, everything above that needs an overhaul. It ws 25 degrees, the heater didn't work. The refrigerator looked a hundred years old, the electrical outlets were falling out of the wall, bathroom was dirty....this was a renovated room. I hate to think what a no renovated room is like. We won't go back.

Reviews.Title: “This is a nice basic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my friend back in 2004. It was my first holiday to America so I didnt really know what to expect. It is a basic hotel, and it has all the basic aminities cable tv, bathroom and we had two large double beds and the room we had a view of the Empire State Building. It is in a great location on about 10 minute walk from Times Square and Macy's is across the road there is easy access to the underground. The staff are friendly and helpful. People have written terrible reviews about this hotel as the internet access isnt very good, you go to New York to see the sights have fun and not sit about surfing the internet. I have just booked to stay here again and I cant wait. This is a nice hotel in an excellent location at a good price. If you want a basic hotel in a good location pick the Pensylvannia.

Reviews.Title: “Dust, Bedbugs and Blood”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had to stay at this hotel when I went to New York for a conference back in December. The photos on the website suggested a decent place to stay. The word "historic" mde me think of smallish, outdated rooms with not much in terms of decor and technology. That is what I expected... and I got much more than that. First the service in the Lobby was terrible. I got in at about 5am and tired.. just wanting to clean up a little before going to the conference center. They wouldn't let me check in because their accounting department had not given them my reservation paperwork and they had all the intention of charging me $900 for one night's stay. When I finally got to check in, the gal at the front desk, said that she was going to give me one of the rooms on the top floors because those were the best ones. I don't want to know what the others looked like. 1-. Telephone dialing did not work. 2-. The outlet in the bathroom was above the sink (electrocution hazard) 3-. The hot water was not hot at all (in December you want hot water in New York) 4-. The bed was creeky and sagy 5-. The conforter was dirty and coming apart at the seams 6-. There were BLOOD stains on the sheets and bedbugs 7-. The carpet looked like it had not been vaccuumed since the hotel opened 8-. The tub had cracks 9-. The wallpaper was peeling 10- The air conditioner/heating unit was extremely noisy. As I left, I chatted with someone else staying there, and the feedback was pretty much similar - this hotel is DISGUSTING! I hope they do something with it.. it's a wonderful building and should be brought back into it's original glory.... but the way it's looking... it's ready for a wecking ball!

Reviews.Title: “not as bad as expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had already booked my stay at the Hotelpenn before i came across tripadvisor. Needless to say, once i read the reviews i tried reviewing my booking with the agent and then tried pleading with the hotel themselves to see if i could be get a renovated room above the 8th floor. I was told there was no guarantee especially since i booked thru an agent( apparentlly due to the lower rate, you will get the worst rooms!). After that i guess there was nothing to do but pray. Anyway i arrived at the hotel after taking a shuttle from JFK airport and arrived at the hotel around 1:30pm. At first i was worried i'd would have to hang around till 3:00pm before i was allowed to check in but this wasn't the case. The line was long but moved reasonably quickly. I was attended to by a lovely lady with flaming red hair. I presented my booking details and pleaded/groveled/begged to be put anywhere above the 8th floor. I'm not sure the lady understood me but hallelujah i was placed on the 16th floor. There were ample lifts which moved quite fastI was given a beautiful corner room which i can say was awesome. It had two large windows and i had this spectacular view of the empire state building and macys. The room was large and had plentiful storage space. The bathroom was spotless( i guess recently retiled) with bright lights. Functioning iron and a little fridge. Nothing spectacular but after reading the reviews i was really relieved . Yes the carpet was rather worn, the paint was peeling round the edges and the the bathroom ceiling was cracked and the radiator had a mind of it's own but i think for the price (along ith the fantastic view) it was worth it. The cleaning was regular, the bed was big and firm , and even the antiquated plumbing in the bathroom worked after you figured out how to use it the few down sides included lack of internet acess, apparently there was none on my floor and a call to the IT deprtment didn't help. I was able to pick up some weak signals from some open acess networks though although this proved highly erratic. the TV was also quite archaic. There are two restuartants within the hotel which were Ok but a bit pricey. And of course the hotel is close to all the sights and sounds of new york. All in all it was an OK stay but since i ended up spending a lot of time in doors, i think next time i'll just squeeze out the extra money and go stay in the Chelsea Hampton Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice room on 12th floor. A bit uncomfortable as temps were unseasonably warm, no a/c available until April 15, couldn't figure out how to open window for fresh air. Very comfortable bed. Good shower. Great location. Friendly staff. Dropped off keys rather than full check-out (long line at counter). Credit card bill seemed high, so I called and was told that I was charged for two days parking at $37.50 per day, which is rather unbelievable since I arrived and left in taxi and never had a car. Several more phone calls, e-mails, and waiting for resolution. Non-apologetic attitude from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: ArkansasWeston
Reviews.Content: From what I had read prior to my stay, I was a bit leery, to say the least. However, my stay was very nice. The location is hard to beat, as is the price for a hotel in NYC. We were checked-in quickly. We were on the 9th floor, which looked fine to me. The hallways were not at all "dark and scary". They were very wide and accomodating, and while not very bright, were far from scary. The carpet reminds me of some older resort-type hotels in the Caribbean. The doors to the rooms are weird, but very secure...I don't think anyone could break into them very easily! Our room was very small, though not as small as some rooms in Europe I've been in, and we faced another wall just like ours, which did not make for a nice view, but was great for quietness at night...hardly any street noise at all. But, we weren't there for the view anyway. The bed was clean and the sheets/towels were changed every day. The matress, while thin, was not lumpy or uncomfortable at all, and I am a very light sleeper, and very ticky about my creature-comforts. I do not like the new-type beds in some modern hotels that are simply a matress on top of a wooden box...this bed had real box-springs. The carpet, while thin and old, was OK, and the room had no odors at all. The room was overheated at first, which we solved by turning the (very old) wall heater off, and cracking the window a bit. The windows also had blackout curtains, which really kept out the light, even though they were nothing to look at. The bathroom was very clean, though the paint was peeling behind the door (it had been repainted without being sanded...a waste of time and effort). The tub was HUGE and made of old-fashioned porcelain...a great soaking tub! The water pressure was fantastic and we always had tons of hot water. The sink is a pedestal kind, but there is a "marble" ledge under the mirror to put your stuff on, so there was room enough to spread out a bit. Our only problem was the TV wouldn't work. We informed the front desk and everything was fine when we returned to the room a few hours later. We also had a clock-radio. The room was cleaned every day in a timely manner, and we never heard a maid knocking or screaming "maid service!" at early hours, which is more than I can say about several $500 a night hotels where I've stayed! The cleaning staff were all friendly and spoke to me each time I saw them. There is a "security" guy stationed downstairs by the elevators and you're supposed to show your room key for elevator access, even though we were never asked after the first time. I never felt unsafe (and I am female and was traveling w/ another female) at any time. Also, there are 12 (!) elevators, so we never had to wait more than about 30 seconds to get one. The lobby is huge and bustling at all hours, and there is a good coffee shop. There is a Lindy's for bar service, which I thought was over-priced, but better than nothing. There are always plenty of taxis outside since the entrance is across from Penn Station...also great access to the subways from there or Herald Square. There is a deli across 34th Street, a newstand next to Penn Station, a K-Mart across the street, and you can walk to Times Square if you want...super location. I never saw an insect or rodent of any kind, nor did I ever get the feeling that there were any around. I was very pleased with my stay. While there are certainly nicer places in NYC, for that kind of price it's hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews before i left i was very nervous about staying at the Hotel Penn. And it seems I was right to a certain extent!! On arriving after a long flight we went to our room and it was awful!! The bathroom had mould everywhere and it was extremely shabby. I went straight back to reception and asked to be moved.This was done without any problems and we got a decent room.A cleaner came everyday and the room was basic but ideal for our trip.The location was excellent. However hot water was in short supply. Overall the hotel was cheap and clean(when we moved room)I would recommend it for anyone who is not planning on spending a lot of time indoors!! I would recommend anyone thinking of staying here to ask for as high a room number as possible as these are the rooms that have had recent renovations.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a couple of nights...”
Reviews.Author: St_Johns_Girl1
Reviews.Content: I'd give this hotel a 2/5. This was my 3rd trip to NYC, so I knew what to expect for this price range. The room was bigger than I expected and the bed and linens were clean. There was a lot of dust in the nooks and crannies of the room and the carpet and bathroom were not the cleanest. The hotel provided the basic necessities but needs major renovation. It's so old that it seems dingy even when it's cleaned. The hallways had plaster falling off the walls and the doors looked like cabin doors on an old ferry. I was travelling as a single female and felt fairly safe with the deadbolt on the door. My room was very far at the the end of a hall so I'd request a room closer to the elevator next time to feel a little more secure. (This is a huge hotel.) I'd stay in this hotel again if the price is right, but I'd certainly try somewhere else first.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad, not so good...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The two star rating could not be more accurate. My boyfriend and I needed a cheap place to stay to go see the Maury Show. The hotel Pennsylvania, at 153 dollars a night, was the cheapest we could find, and just happens to be where the Maury Show is located. Check in was fast. I asked about being upgraded to a renovated room and they said "we don't have renovated rooms, we used to, but the 12th and 13th floors now belong to businesses." I think she was just feeding me a line of bull, because 2 nights beforehand I had called to ask for a renovated room and they said they only give renovated rooms to people who books directly through them. I had booked through hotels (hi louis!). Hotels saved me only 6 dollars over booking directly with the hotel pennsylvania, and by booking with hotels I was guaranteed NOT to get a renovated room. Anyway... I have no idea what's up with the renovated rooms. So on with the review. We were on the 7th floor. Our view was a brick wall. The room appeared clean enough although the room was a bit drab. Literally 2 beds and a TV. Nothing more. The bathroom was acceptable, the shower worked fine. There was only "conditioning shampoo" and no conditioner so bring your own, ladies. I'd asked for one bed but we got two.. I didn't fuss. We like getting close. The location is right in the center of everything (penn station, madison sq. garden, times square, the fashion district). Everything is insanely expensive around here but luckily Louis at Hotels was able to give us some advice about how to get things cheap. To sum it up: we weren't expecting luxury and we certainly didn't get luxury. This hotel is great if you're looking for something cheap, and if you're not planning to stay very much in the hotel room at all. If you're staying in NYC for more than one or two nights I'd cough up the dough for a nicer hotel. I wasn't disappointed as I knew what to expect from a 2 star... but this was easily the oldest looking, least renovated appearing, dreary hotel I've ever stayed in. Don't let the shiny pictures of the hotel lobby fool you. This is not a hotel where you go "ooooh, aaaah!" it's a hotel where you crash for the night and get the heck out! They do have a baggage handling service in the basement - four dollars a bag. -Aretha

Reviews.Title: “Should Change Name to Motel 6!”
Reviews.Author: rcr86
Reviews.Content: To begin, this is the scariest hotel I have ever stayed in. Now granted, I usually stay in Hampton Inns, Fairmont Inns, or when I can afford it, Hilton or Marriot. However, I have had to shack up in some pretty shabby motels over the course of traveling for my work and this place in the middle of NYC was far worse than any I have seen before. Beware! There is complete deception going on here. The lobby is grandiose, brightly lit, and well decorated. The fun ends there however. Once the elevator doors open at your floor, the scene changes drastically. I cannot speak for every floor but the one I was on had burnt out lights, peeling wallpaper (yes it was actually hanging off the wall in a giant flap), and grubby stained carpet. The room looked no better with its drab color scheme and worn appearance. The floor was exceptionally hard (no padding I suspect) and the bath was badly in need of updating. The linen and bathroom cleanliness was acceptable but the condition of the rest of this building suggests that the Penn was ready for the wrecking ball years ago. Avoid this place at all costs! For those who talk about this place being "affordable" and a "good value" I would suggest doing a little more research next time. For the same price as this dump, much better accommodations can be had in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “A real Let down”
Reviews.Author: PaulWhiting
Reviews.Content: We have just returned and feel really let down by the hotel. As all say when you arrive lobby great. Service at reception was OK and we were quickly sent to floor 3. If you get a room starting with a 3 ask for a change. It was terrible, floors dirty , carpet horrible , head boards filthy , The windows did not close completely , ligthing poor. we were really not happy at all. We went to reception to be informed that as we did not book direct with hotel we get the cheap rooms they put out to booking agents. That was not the reply we wanted and wanted moving. I did use a white lie and told reception we were a party of travel agents finding hotels in USA for our new company to use, I also told them we would complain to the city autority about the standards of the rooms and the fire alarms and safety equipmet on the floor (as i am a firefighter but didnt mention that). With this method of negotioating we were moved. Floors 8 / 15 / 16 these have had some renovation and are better but not great BUT CLEANISH. Beware if you get room 1647 - the shower has a mind of its own. one minute your having a great de stress after walking for hours the next your diving out like a bullett as your being steam cleaned or its throwing ice at you. This I did mention to reception but nothing done. After 1 night in this room cleaners went for it and it was lovelyish , next day they didnt do anything and the last we came back to find another bed had been delivered??? Your guess as good as ours. For a plus as others have said, Great location , good coffee shop , nice pub / restaurant . This is a budget hotel, Dont be fooled it would not get more than 2 star in UK for sure. If your happy with just somewhere to get you head down with major attractions around you then it will be ok. If you know your one to complain about anything dont go here, you will ruin your trip with time complaining, this city has a lot to offer and great fun to be had go there with the intention of having fun, it will provide that for sure. If you want to know more feel free to ask my email address will be displayed.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jasmine2007
Reviews.Content: just returned from staying in the hotel pennsylvania, I had read dozens of reviews so I was ready to expect the worse but I was pleasantly supprised. The lobby was spotlessly clean and staff friendly. Check in only took a couple of minutes. Our room was on the sixth floor, it was small rather dated but very clean the only downside was the bath it had broken taps and green stains. But for what we paid to be in the centre of New York it was fantastic and would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. great room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am a seasoned international traveler, older man,and found this hotel to be clean and comfortable. I booked a single on-line just a day before. Rates were reasonable considering how expensive New York City can be. There is a revoling front door. They installed a little elevator to allow those who could not walk the few steps from street level to lobby level. Remember this is an old hotel. It was not a very long wait for check in. The hotel has a large elevator lobby with many elevators. I did not see one elevator with an out-of-service sign. Elevators were fast. It is a big hotel so check for location of room upon exiting elevator. Rooms have card keys. The room was on the 12TH floor on the 33rd street side of the hotel. The decor was pleasant with a queen size bed, 3 pillows, desk with chair, lounge chair with ottoman, TV and small refrigerator. I booked a single and did not ask for anything special. The window opened to allow fresh air and the great sounds of an exciting city. The bathroom was clean and had a good assortment of toiletries including a bar of soap shaped like a seashell. Hot water was available all the time and shower worked fine. There was a magnifying mirror and a hair dryer. The bathroom mirror could have had a better attachment to the wall. The best part its location. Arrived and left hotel via Penn Station. Hotel is across street from 7th Ave entrance to Penn Station (Amtrak, Long Island Railroad and New Jersey Transit), MAdison Square Garden and just a short walk to subways on 7th and 8th Aves. Very convenient from JFK airport to Penn Station. Easy walk to Empire State Bldg, Grand Central, Times Square, the river cruise piers at 38th and 12th Ave. I will consider a return stay.

Reviews.Title: “A week in the hotel Pennsylvania Party Room”
Reviews.Author: wilson372
Reviews.Content: I have read many negative reviews regarding the hotel Pennsylvania but I decided to book two rooms for myself and 5 friends as I had visited previously. We booked a twin room and a huge party room which consisted of four beds (single ones I might add). The rooms are not exactly of high quality but they are clean enough with great maid service every day. The rooms are reasonably priced and I suggest for a group of Scottish guys then this is the perfect place. However, we did receive electrical shocks from almost everywhere in the hotel....get it sorted!! Depending on which receptionist you get at check in could determine your satisfaction of the hotel. The first 'lady' was very abrupt and rude. Upon checking in later on that day we were all greeted by a very polite helpful girl who gave us rooms on the same floor. The same girl helped me out on other occasions. For all the guys out there, I can advise that there are usually hot, young girls staying at this hotel. There were two young English girls in particular who were stunning to say the least. They joined us for a few beers(which were returned the very next morning so thank you!). Hi to you two if you're reading! Overall this hotel is in an excellent location. Across from MSG for sport, close to Times Square, and numerous pubs for your drinking pleasure are in close proximity. Email the hotel beforehand to request a renovated room. I hear the 'unrenovated' rooms are rather disgusting. Don't listen to all the bad reviews about this place; they are just haters. P.S Apologies for the state of our rooms Hotel Penn; especially the broken bed! What can I say; It wasn't our fault!

Reviews.Title: “What a place!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As we arrived in the hotel lobby, jet lagged and tired from our flight from the UK, we were greeted by one of the hotels reception team. She asked us if we would like to check in and took us to a private members check in point. Thumbs up! As she checked us in she made polite conversation and asked us the nature of our stay. We told her we were here to celebrate pur birthdays. She tapped away at her keyboard and 10 minutes later, we were up on the 5th floor in the biggest suite I have EVER seen! With 3 huge double bed rooms (one of which had two king sized beds in) all ensuite, a lounge with TV and dining area and a fully equiped kitchen we couldn't believe our luck! We had read reviews on this site and to be quite honest, were dreading our stay a little bit. However, EVERYTHING we perfect. The maid came every day with towels, linen and some big smiles. The cleanliness was second to none. Another thing I had my doubts about. I did worry about how we would be greeted by staff and people in general. What a suprise we got! Everyone was so friendly and helpful - they couldn't do enough for you. The lady at the tourist info point within the hotel went out of her way to accomodate us. All in all, our stay was superb. We saw the sights, we meet some great people and we shopped til we dropped! A bit of advise - call or email the hotel before you arrive if you are going to NY for a special occasion. Alturnatively, when you check in ask for an upgrade - they can only say no!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Penn - Fantastic Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Hotel Penn after spending 6 nights there. I am really suprised at some of the reveiws on this website - and i must admit they made me a little aprehensive before i went. Basically you get what you pay for in New York. Our room was 1518A (15th floor) - clean and comfortable and quiet. Nice view over Madison Square Gardens. Apparently you are much better off with a room above the 13th floor (they have been refurbed). Yes the corridors were a bit shabby and the hotel does generally need a refurb, but how much time are you going to spend in your hotel anyway. The room was cleaned to a high standard everyday and we had lots of fresh clean towels. We did leave the chambermaid a nice tip at the end of the stay as she did a great job. This was our second trip to NYC. We last stayed at the Amsterdam Court on 50th Street. However i would thoroughly recommend the Hotel Penn on location and price - around the corner from Macys and Empire State and opposite Penn Station. One warning - we were ripped off in the Irish Bar within the hotel. Gave $50 for 2 drinks and was only given change for $20. Lucky i noticed and they gave the correct change straight away - seemed to us to be a bit of a scam as they readily gave me the correct change and could hardly bare to say sorry!! Needless to say we didn't go back. One great tip - to get cheap tickets for Broadway show go to the OTHER TKTS booth at South Street Seaport - unlike the one in Times Square - there was no queue. We saw Phantom - fantastic. Hope you have found this usefull. We will def. go back to the Hotel Penn.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as I expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent our holidays in this well-located NYC hotel (its main entrance is opposite Penn Station, where you have access to almost all subway lines, and it's placed only nine streets south from Times Square) from 3rd to 8th March. In the beginning, we had to change of room because its lock system stopped working. It was the first night and we were waiting almost one hour to have our things back and get to other room (I had to call four times to the room service, it was 11 pm). Our first room was very dirty, in particular the bath with had old-guests "rests". The second room was cleaner but smaller. The staff hopefully changed our towels and cleaned and dried the bathroom. We had, as many other guests, some electrical problems in the sense we usually received some little electrical shocks with the knobs... I think the carpet floor and the bad electrical network configuration they had (some cables behind the fridge were opened-circuit) could be the problems. The air-conditionner didn't work properly so we were uncomfortable because the weather outside was very cold. In our opinion this hotel is OK, it's very well situated and very affordable. I recommend this hotel for budget travelers who only stay in the hotel for sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “I do not know what other's are seeing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pennsyvania during the dates of March 4 - March 8. I walked in and the lobby was beautiful. The front desk was very friendly, even though it seemed expedia had reserved the wrong dates for me. I got to the room and it was what I expected, not very large but nice. The bathroom was a decent size and the two beds which were in the room were firm and in good condition. I had a problem with the heating and someone came up right away. The bellman went out to the drugstore for me without an additional charge (I gave him $15.00 for his efforts). Overall my experience was great. The city was amazing and the hotel was good.

Reviews.Title: “Never, ever again”
Reviews.Author: Yblodyntatws
Reviews.Content: After being checked in by a very dour female I was sent up to the 5th floor. Whilst the lobby and main corridors looked fine, the corridor towards my room was dark and looked dirty. The door to the room itself was marked as though it had been forced at some point - which made me feel really insecure (especially as a single female). Inside the room I was greeted by peeling paint on the ceiling and walls, and huge patches of damp on one wall. The walls had shadows where pictures and items of furniture had been moved. However, the bed had clean sheets and was reasonably comfortable. The shower-room (no bath)was small with ingrained dirt between the tiles. The shower tray was cracked and the showertaps were impossible to control - so I was doused in scalding hot water followed by freezing cold water. I would never stay here again - ever!

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Pensylvania”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
