Reviews.Content: This is a very dirty shabby hotel. We were offered 3 rooms none of which were clean. The bathrooms all had mouldy tiles and peeling baths. We expected basic but not dirty. A very disappointing start to our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: sjj69
Reviews.Content: Ok, so we went to this hotel and were very dubious after reading some of the reports on this site. So I wanted to write and set the story straight so that everyone is aware of the hotel. We checked in on Thursday 23rd February with Sheila, she was lovely - very chatty, gave us plenty of hints as to what to do and where to go. We were allocated a room on the 17th floor. Room 1722A had the best views in the hotel - you can see past Madison Square Gardens to New Jersey through one window and down to Times Square, past Macy's through the other (it's a corner room). Now dont get me wrong, the room looked tired, paint and wallpaper peeling off - but we are in New York!! All we want is a place to sleep and dress. The bed linen was changed daily, we had fresh fluffy towels, iron and ironing board, TV and radio alarm clock. For those of us wanting to explore New York and not just sit in the room all day it is fantastic! So, some handy hints for any future visitors - lets share the knowledge. Times Square has a Ticket shop in the middle - Queue early. They open at 10:00 to sell cheaper tickets for the daily shows - we saw Chicago at a 35% reduced price. Empire States Building - no queues if you go at 08:00 when they open, but make sure it is a nice day as the vioews are fantastic. Canal Street is where you can buy your designer (but not at designer price) hand bags. Go on a coach tour of the film and tv locations - we wish we had done it at the start as it is great to see everywhere and really cheap. I've sat on the steps of the Cosby's house and seen where the Friends buiding is. Go to the Tribecker area - that's where all the famous people live! And if you are lucky you'll see someone famous! If you want any info - please feel free to email as we had such a great time we would be happy to share our experiences with you. Oh, and if you are going now - take ear muffs, scarf, warm coat and gloves. Its freezing. AND you have to see Phanton of the Opera - it was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “EASILY ONE OF THE BEST LOCATIONS IN NYC”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay at this hotel. I had also read many of the reviews on the site and was dreading the stay. Once you leave the lobby (how many people?!) you do feel that the hotel is a bit 'tired' looking. But we didn't pay Hilton rates and so we didn't expect Hilton-type quality. We have to say, the room isn't that bad at all. My only gripe (and I never thought I would complain about this as the opposite is usually typical) is that the shower was too powerful in our room - I mean almost painful to stand under especially if you are, ahem, a male!! Secondly, the bedding never seemed to stay on very well and wasn't adequate for my liking (in the UK we usually get duvets and so I guess I'm used to this)- my travelling companion didn't mind this and so I guess it just depends on you. We had no problem with the staff - we had mistakenly booked a standard room (this means a room with a double bed) and we were quickly changed to a room with two singles. The deposit box service is also very useful and free (unless you lose your key, in which case you have to pay $100)although I did occasionally have to wait a while for staff to come and serve me in the little safety deposit box room. There is also a good Luggage leaving service in the basement(if for example, you want to leave your bags in the morning after checking out before flying, and costs about $4 per bag). Easily the best thing about this hotel is its location. You are a 20 min walk from Times Square, 10 mins from the Empire State building and 2 mins walk from Penn Station which is right opposite. Penn Station is huge and will basically connect you to anywhere in the USA including subways to all areas of New York. We even got the train to Washington for the day from here (a good idea if you want to get out of the Big Apple for a while - it takes about 3 hours). I would have to recommend the hotel - we basically treated it as a place to sleep. If you're looking for an all-singing all-dancing experience (and you're loaded) then go elsewhere. We went to Lindy's diner (attached to the front of the hotel) each morning for breakfast and had really good bacon, eggs and coffee. I would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was excited to go to NEW YORK, but a little scared too because of what I read about this hotel...When we arrived, I was astonished !! What a big hotel !!!!! And very well situated. The lobby is wonderfull. There are like 12 elevators that can take you to your room ! About our room, it was nice. We had an amazing view on the street and the buildings. The bathroom was clean : toilets, shower...Everything was OK ! The two beds were clean and comfortable, we had the TV...I liked this hotel a lot. Next time I'm going to NEW YORK, I go back to this hotel. This hotel is nice and not expensive! It is situated in the heart of MANHATTAN, close to the subway. I loved it !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Zero Stars for this Dump”
Reviews.Author: demonspawn
Reviews.Content: The hotel is across the street from Madison Square Garden. That's the only positive thing I can think of to write about what might be the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. Please understand that I've stayed in some real pits in Guatemala, Indonesia, Costa Rica, and Eastern Europe. Generally I can go with the flow - what can one expect for $10 a night in Costa Rica? Well, the $10 hotel in Costa Rica was infinitely better than the grossly overpriced dump that is Hotel Pennsylvania. Check-in was a nightmare. After waiting in line for 30 minutes to check into my room, I was advised that my reservation had been "downgraded" to a king rather than two doubles despite our "confirmed" and "guaranteed" reservation. This was not good news for me and my uncle - two decent-sized men. There was nothing the hotel could do, it would not adjust the rate, and the indifferent staff was totally insensitive and unresponsive to our plight. Judging by the numerous unhappy faces and occasional profanities uttered by others leaving checkout, we weren't the only victims of such unpleasant check-in surprises. The room was tiny, outdated, and astoundingly dirty. As filthy as the room was the common bathrooms and hallways were worse. Words cannot express the magnitude of filth that has permeated this property. How does it survive inspection? We were able to get a rollaway bed. The only place in the room it would fit was wedged between the foot of the bed and the opposing wall. We essentially had a tiny room with almost wall-to-wall uncomfortable bedding. Avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: sarahlisa
Reviews.Content: My roommate and I chose this hotel after we were displaced by a fire in our apartment in Chelsea, NYC. (Still displaced as I'm writing this, but staying in the Skyline Hotel on 50th & 10th and having such a better experience). We chose this hotel because they take pets. We had a fire in our building on Sunday, February 19th, and had/have nowhere to live until they repair our building. The front Desk attendants at the Pennsylvania are horrible, with the exception of Lou and Irina, the desk Manager. I wish I'd had the luxury of reading Trip Advisor before chosing to stay at the Pennsylvania, because now I see what we were up against, but in an emergency, we took what we could. We were kicked out of our original room when they started doing construction on that floor. We were originally in room 758, which was a smoking room, but STUNK. Stunk like 40,000 people had been chain-smoking in there. We were moved to room 313A. This is the room that (as I saw on other posts on here), looks like something out of the movie Saw. I had the same thought exactly!!! I was thinking more Bates Motel, but it truly reminded me of a crime scene. Do yourselves a favor, folks, do NOT stay here. If you need a hotel that takes pets, stay at the SKYLINE Hotel. It's a bit out of the way, but you'll thank your lucky stars when you go to sleep in a nice, clean room at night.

Reviews.Title: “Unhappy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back from taking my wife to NY for her first time. Hotel Pennsylvania was the wrong choice for a a first timer. We made reservations ahead of time(about a week in advance). They couldn't find any record of that at first. Even though we called ahead of time to verify our reservations. The valet/bell hops are rude and only care who is parking directly in front of the hotel. The room we got stuck in was old and frumpy. It was clean however. The room was very out-dated. We resevered a standard room with a king size bed and got a standard(or below standards)room with two double beds. The heater in the room was like a sauna. We brought our dog because of how the Hotel Penn boasts on being pet friendly. When we got there no one who worked there could tell us where we could walk our dog to go to the bathroom. Upon check out, we did what was stated and called and hour ahead of time to have valet bring our car. We waited 2 hours after the scheduled time to recieve our car. And then the valet guys were miffed because we didn't tip them. It wasn't all it was made to be, according to their website.

Reviews.Title: “Give The Penn a break!”
Reviews.Author: LindseySpeaking
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a stay at The Pennsylvania. I was expecting the worst having read some of the reviews, but I have to say that my experience was a positive one. We had a little trouble after checking in - we were given 3 twin rooms instead of 1 double and 2 twins, but this was rectified straight away. We did have to queue a little for reception, but this is a major tourist hotel in an extremely busy city so fair enough. The hotel's location couldn't have been better, slap bang in the middle of Manhattan, with The Empire State Building and Broadway/Times Sq a short walk away. Just opposite were Penn Stn and Madison Sq Gdn. The rooms were a little dated, but were clean, safe and fairly roomy - we were on the 16th floor. Overall, The Pennsylvania is a superbly located hotel that seems to offer value for money. I would definitely stay there again. It doesn't offer the personal service that you may get from a more exclusive hotel, but it does the job at a reasonable price. If you do have a problem during your stay, be vocal about it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very dissapointing. I had hoped for better quality and much cleaner rooms. Unfortunetly, we where met with dirty rooms and a very small space. It looked like this hotel has gone very down hill. This property is not being taken care of. Please do not waste your money here!! There are "X's" on the doors and brown stains and filth inside the showers. You will not want to shower with out wearing shower shoes. Also, the phones don't work and the sheets have not been washed. They are very dirty and thin. They do not keep you warm and are like sand paper. Also the windows may not open. Not a good way to begin a vacation. The people working at the front desk also do not seemed surprised with the problems that arise. They will offer to fix it. But, the rooms do not improve.

Reviews.Title: “Laughably terrible, but terribly cheap”
Reviews.Author: Queen_of_NW2
Reviews.Content: Booked in for two nights, but only lasted the one. My (smoking) room was enormous: Two queen beds, separate dressing area and walk in closet, but hadn't been decorated since at least 1960. For me, the problem wasn't the decor, but the lack of Internet access. There is broadband Internet in the hotel on selected floors. But when I asked to pay for a new Internet-enabled room, the reception staff claimed none was available. Their loss; they could have made more money from me. After all, I had pre-paid for two nights. So I just walked out and spent $200 in another hotel with free broadband. Evaluate your priorities: if you don't need to be wired and you're on a budget, consider the Hotel Pennsylvania. Ask for a smoking room and they might give you a huge unrenovated room. Location is great, and bed comfortable enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is situated in one of the best parts of New York City, BUT, do not expect to much of the rooms in this hotel. They are poor, poor, poor and the price is high, high, high, but then it is New York and every hotel is overpriced. All in all I think the good outweighs the bad, due to the great location of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pay extra and stay elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the worst stay at a hotel ever. It began with the crummy service from the front desk staff. They were not helpful. They didn't even try. They seemed to not want to address the issues we were bringing to their attention. Our first room was on the 6th floor. It was in a corner with two windows. Our beds were below the windows and there was a majorly cold draft coming in from them. We turned on the heat and couldn't seem to get a happy medium in the way of tempurature. If the heat was on, it was on full blast. Then we all thought we'd shower. Well, the shower would only give cold water. No hot water coming from the shower. So we call and the poor maintenance man (he was very nice. He was sick with a cold and was the only maintenance person working for the entire hotel). He told us there was a broken mechanism and that it couldn't be fixed that evening. So he called the front desk and tried to get us a new room. He advised us that there were none available. He was able to get us a room to simply shower in. Thank God! That room was as disgusting as ours, with stains on the carpet, crud in all the corners and a shower stall from what one might find in one of those hotels that rents rooms by the week! I felt sorry for my feet down there on the dirty shower stall floor! So we stayed the night in that room. We called the front desk the following day to try and get a new room. After repeat phone calls, and an attempt to ignore us by not picking up their phones (they must have caller I.D. because they knew which room was calling them) we finally got the keys to a new room. This room was no different from our first room. Nastiness in all the corners, stains on the carpet, falling curtains, a crummy shower stall, no plug ins in the bathroom, and barely any plug ins in the room...To sum it up, it was horrible (in capital letters!) The location is nice but the rooms and front desk staff were the pits. I would not waste money staying there. If I could give any advice it would be to pay a few extra dollars to stay somewhere fit for humans. Or you may even find something for less that's fit for humans! I would never go back to the Hotel Slumsylvania.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: kate1111Ireland
Reviews.Content: Just back from New York and I have to say that I was really nervous about what to expect having read the reviews. Our room was on the 14th floor and I was pleasantly surprised when we finally got into the room(be prepared to queue at reception!)The room itself was small but it was cleaned daily. There was no mould or damp and the bathroom was spotless. I think the higher the room number the better it is. The corridors were dark and I dont think they were hoovered that often!The location is perfect - straight across from Penn station and one subway stop from Times Square. Would definately stay here again ....although not when the dog show is on (feb) as you have mutts sharing the lift with you and weirdo's in dog jumpers everywhere!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad..Not so great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby is beautiful. The elevators are quick. We liked having the tv's in the elevators giving CNN updates. Our room was a queen room on the 12th floor. It was clean. The bedding was clean. The bathroom was in good shape too, only there was no ventilation fan. The walls are paper thin. You can hear conversations in the room beside you. And our room was very small. The view of the Empire State building was superb. The location of the hotel can not be beat. Overall, I would stay there again. You just have to ask for business class to get the better rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Hell on earth”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from taking a school group to this hotel for 3 nights, and the experience was terrible. The rooms were small and still had the last guests rubbish on the floor. The heating did not work on anything but full, which meant that we had to have the window open - in February, during the worst snow season for years. The piece de resistance however, has to be the uninvited guests-we had mice in the room, and they did not change our room for us. The hotel exterminator said that they were common place in the hotel. Oh, there were also 1000 dogs in the hotel-some with fleas, as there was a dog show on-not that we were told in advance. The barking made a change at night from the mice eating in our room! Stay there at your peril, no cheap room is worth all this!!

Reviews.Title: “Good for those on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Bellers
Reviews.Content: I was a bit concerned about the hotel after reading reviews before arriving but they were unfounded. The bed bugs were a worry but there were none in site. An room upgrade was offered at check-in from a twin to two doubles. The room given in the 300's was a twin. Coupled with the corner view over looking 33rd Street it was back to reception where I was moved to a quieter room on the 500's. Over the road from Penn Station and MSG the location is a good base with it just a block from Macys and two from the ESB. I would certainly have no hesitation staying there again new time I'm in town.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as the reviews suggested”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Pennsylvania Hotel in September of last year. I booked and paid for the trip in June, before I saw the awful reviews on this website. To say we were a little nervous is the understatement of the year. When we finally got there, it was not as bad as some of the reviews led us to believe. There was a long check in/check out queue but this was dealt with quickly and efficently. The lobby is very spacious and well laid out. The room we had was nothing to write home about. It was small but very clean as was the bathroom. If you are looking for a cheap hotel in New York then this will suit your needs. It's in a great location, near to all the sights and shopping areas. You will not spend much time in the room anyway. Bear in mind, it is a two star hotel, don't expect too much and you will not be disappointed. New York is for seeing the sights, not spending time in the hotel. Have a ball!

Reviews.Title: “Well...”
Reviews.Author: villageoaf2000
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Pennyslvania is a very touch-and-go hotel. its either a clean room with shiny renovated bathroom or drab and mouldy room with awful stench. Well luckily we got a clean and shiny room, although we caught sight of the ghastly others when we passed newcomers to the hotel only to hear them gasp in shock. With luck you will have a nice room like we did. heres hoping.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Decent”
Reviews.Author: AdamJohns
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Penn is a brilliant place to stay if you are a tourist looking for a base camp for your explorations. The rooms are nice and the views are astounding. The price is great for the location and facilities. WE HAD 2 TELLIES BETWEEN 4 PEOPLE! The giftshops are brilliant for some last minute present grabbing and its in an excellent location on Seventh Avenue, well served by 2 subway stops and countless places to buy food and supplies as well as being DIRECTLY opposite Madison Square Garden arena.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal, Good Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here expecting very little and were pleasently surprised! The room was large and spacious. It had a desk, chair by the window, and large closet. The bathroom was small and not that great, but it was clean. The carpet wasnt the best, but nothing that bad. I reccomend this place if you want an inexpensive, decent hotel that is pretty close to everyhthing. Feel free to contact me with questions.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: haysboat
Reviews.Content: When we read previous reviews we thought we were in for a really bad time! There were 6 of us in two rooms and we had the best time. The Hotel is not the best Hotel ever but the price is great and you get what you pay for! The beds were very comfy and clean, the towels were white and clean, the bath was alittle damaged but there was loads of powerful hot water so who cares! The whole room and bathroom was lovely and spacious. We were at the front and overlooked Maddison Square Garden our other room was more central and didn't overlook anything but we were hardly ever in the room to worry about that! It is perfectly located, just around the block from Empire State, straight up the road to Broadway/Times Square/Central Park, 5th Avenue etc. I would have no worries at all about going back, just don't go expecting the Ritz and you will be fine. The staff were great - expecially the boys in the luggage room - what a laugh. Just ask for a "good room", if your room is not to your liking tell them. The room was cleaned and the towels changed I think daily (the days went do quickly I can't remember!) I have ticked the excellent rate not really for the Hotel but for the location and value for money. At the end of the day it was clean and safe - go for it and have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Beware the Hotel Pennsylvania”
Reviews.Author: Kat8545
Reviews.Content: If the city's hotels were not already filled, I would never have stayed here. The lobby is elegant and deceiving, because the rooms are Terrible. We had to look at 3 different rooms before we could find one barely tolerable. It was extremely small, outdated, and smelled of urine. (And to think, it was the best of the 3 we looked at.) Sure, it is fun to stay in Manhattan, but this dump is not worth it. I would stay in Jersey or Queens or Brooklyn if you cannot find a different hotel in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “It would be overpriced anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Penn for 4 nights at the end of a 2 week holiday in the states, and it was the worst of the four hotels we stayed in. But it wasn't awful. We chose it as a couple of our friends had stayed there and siad it was ok. It was also amongst the cheapest hotels in midtown. We checked in after 1am and were shown to our room by a very enthusiastic bell boy. Unfortunately the room was horrible. With it being so late, we decided to wait until the morning to change. The room smelt awful, was very small and poorly laid out (the tv stand was at the side of the bed) and the walls were dirty and in a poor state of repair. We went to the desk in the morning where we learnt that it was in fact a smoking room. THis angered me because I had gone to the trouble of e-mailing the hotel with my name and booking reference to ask for a non-smoking room, only to be told that most rooms were non-smoking, and you wouldn't be given a smoking room unless you asked. It was a slap in the face therefore to be tols by the clerk that I should have specified non-smoking on our arrival. Our next room was much better, though not great. It was larger and cleaner and did not smell. THe bathroom was much better as well. On our third night, our neighbour decided to play loud music after 11pm. We called reception, and the music was turned off promptly. At 1.45am, the music returned. Once again, we called, and the music was turned off. UNfortunately, there was an additional noise which drove us mad. We never did discover what it was, but it sounded like a pneumatic drill going for 2 seconds, every 9 seconds, from somewhere outside, which had been going since we returned to our room. THe repetitiveness of it was maddening, and it was impossible to sleep. At 3:30 we gave up and went down to reception, who could only suggest changing rooms. We tried another room, but the noise coul dbe heard there as well, so back downstairs we went. The next room was quiet, but was a smoking room again, so we went down again, at our wit's end. FOrtunately, the next room was both quieter and free from odour and we managed to get to sleep around 4.30am. I must point out that the lady on the desk was very helpful and did not seem to mind us continually returning to her. We do not know if the noise was within the control of the hotel or not, but it was gone by the morning and did not return on our fourth night. THe best thing about the hotel is its location, and its relative cost. It was the most expensive hotel we stayed at, and yet the worst. I guess that's NYC for you. It is very handy for Penn Station, and there are plenty of shops within walking distance if you are so inclined. Had we been given our eventual rooms intitially, and not had noise problems I would have been happier, but I'm afraid I would look elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Another bad review of Pennsylvania - with important information for asthmatics!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having read hundreds of reviews on Hotel Pennsylvania, my boyfriend and I still decided to stay here for five nights in December last year, as we were travelling on a budget. Simply because, as so many others already have mentioned, the price and the location is unbeatable! We were given a room in the 14th floor, and we laughed our heads off all the way to the room: Everything was EXACTLY as we had imagined! The hallway was creepy and became darker the further in we went. The carpets were dirty and the wallpaper was coming off the wall several places. Hotel Pennsylvania was quickly renamed Hotel Trannsylvania, by which it is still referred to. However, the room was actually better than we had feared. The bathroom was clean (although water was constantly dripping into the bathtub), and we were given fresh towels and sheets every day. The heater/AC worked fine, but made a lot of noise! So much that we, because the windows were badly isolated and it was sooo cold!, decided to get drunk so that we would get some sleep while the heater was on. (a good, old Norwegian trick) Oh well. My main concern, which I wanted to write about because I haven't seen anyone commenting this, is how badly suited this hotel is for asthmatics and those who are allergic. There are carpets on all the floors, both in the rooms and in the hallways, and they are rarely - if ever - vacuumed. I had an allergic reaction almost immediately after entering the room; luckily I had brought antihistamins, and I continued taking these every day of my stay in this hotel, which definitely saved our holiday. I also used a lot more asthma medicine while staying here, although this probably also was caused by the cold weather. At last, I have included a very funny picture from our room in Trannsylvania. It is of a HUGE orange .. err, thing, that was placed on the top of the closet. It had no function whatsoever, it was just a very ugly ball-shaped sort of decoration that collected a lot of dust. I hope it will give you as many laughs as it has given us! (PS: During our one-week-stay in NY, we spent five nights in this hotel to save money - and then spent the last two nights in a reeeeally nice hotel just because "we're worth it"! This was definitely a good solution - which I can recommend.) Have a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel -well worth a try”
Reviews.Author: Lilbill
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 6 nights with 2 friends. We chose the hotel for location and cost which was brillaint for 3 of us for this length of time in NY. The hotel is clean and rooms are cleaned and Towels changed daily. The view out of our window was the top of the empire state so this made it even better!! No horror stories to tell, the staff were friendly but watch the bar it was V expeive. Well worth staying at if you dont want to splash out and only want a place to lay your head after a v long day taking in the Fantastic sights and sounds of NY....we loved and are going back same time next this year and we will be staying at the Pennsylvania. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “It's not good”
Reviews.Author: tenoclock
Reviews.Content: My friends and i knew this wasn't going to be a glamourous place - for $98/night, but we had expectations of general cleanliness. we've all stayed in hotels, rooms, and hostels all over the world, and this was the worst place any of us had ever seen. I think part of the problem was that it was an "expedia" room, so don't book through them. My bed was at a 20 degree slant, there was no internet even though they say it's available, and the carpet, beds, and walls were filthy. Left in the room was garbage from the people before us, including a pair of dirty women's stockings. it was flat out scary.

Reviews.Title: “I was pleasently surprised.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read many scary reviews of this hotel just before I left for my trip to NYC. I was a bit apprehensive to say the least. At check in I faced a huge line. When I was up next a nice gentleman with an Italian accent excorted me to the Penn 500 Club check in station. It was quiet, pleasant, and FAST! He was extra nice when I requested to be near my friends room. Our room, #448, was exceptionally clean and neat.Comfy beds and pillows. No horror stories, sorry. This is an old hotel but kept nicley. My parents honeymooned there 55 years ago. I would recommend it for an inexpensive place to stay in Big Apple.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel in May 05 with my boyfriend for our anniverary and i spent the whole day in tears as the room was so small we were unable to even unpack or open the cases on the floor, the bathroom was filthy and the bath was peeling on the bottom, the staff did try and seem interested but didn't care how much the holiday cost. Our room smelt and the window didn't shut properly.I was disgusted and was devasted by the quality of this hotel in a city that prides itself on being fantastic. Avoid this hotel at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: DONT STAY IN THIS HOTEL! Myself and my boyfriend stayed there for one week when we got to our room there was faeces on the bathroom floor and cigarette butts in the bath when we told the reception we were told well thats what you paid for i quote! Dont stay there please it will ruin your view of New York. We had to buy our own cleaning products to clean the bathroom as the cleaners would not do it. Awful hotel staff horrible. Very rude staff. Worst hotel in the world. Dont be fooled by the reception.

Reviews.Title: “worth the chance”
Reviews.Author: ejjay
Reviews.Content: I never really write these reviews, but on this occasion I thought that i would just try and put some people minds at ease. I stayed at the Hotel Pennsylvannia for 4 nights with my partner. We chose this hotel innitially off the net, based on its FANTASTIC location and the price.. which was very very attractive. The rooms on the net looked fine so we thought .. sounds great. Then we read various reviewson the hotel .. tales of horror and filth, mean staff, broken bathrooms & barron rooms. I was full of fear at what i would find when i arrived. After having Stepped out of JFK, on to the Sky Train and then The Long Island rail Road I arrived at Penn station in a stress free 30min and walked accross the st to the hotel (not bad for NY)... This alone give Hotel Pennsylvannia a star rating. The lobby as expected .. was flash . but armed with my reviews of not to be fooled, i held my breath as i opened the door.... only to find a well appointed fairly spacious double room. Clean, decorated in rich warm colours, loads of fluffy white towels, in the clean bathroom, big TV warm bed... So while i'm sure that maybe i was lucky, I just wanted to let people know who have booked into this Hotel not to be filled with dread because I thought it was great. Enjoy New York

Reviews.Title: “I think it is a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: pupasina
Reviews.Content: I spent a weekend at this hotel and I enjoyed it. The hotel is huge. At time of check in I mentioned right away to the clerk that I read some bad reviews about the hotel and that I wanted a renovated room. She gave me a room on the 11th floor, which was fine. The room was clean, with clean linens. There was a few marks on the lower wall and I believe that the fire alarm wasn't plug properly, but other than that, everything was good. The staff was very friendly, the location is great and you can leave your luggage ($4.00 a piece) in the luggage room if your train or plane is in the afternoon, after check out time, and you want to keep on visiting the city. I would definitely book this hotel again as it is good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “worth it for the location”
Reviews.Author: waveydavey
Reviews.Content: Yes the rooms are not that great, but then it's cheap and one of the best locations in town. If the hotel is the most important part of your stay then go elsewhere. If it's just a bed for the night then this hotel is superb. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great location and okay rooms - you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went with a school trip in february and after reading other reviews i was dreading it. However, i was nicely surprised by the lobby and location. Although the rooms were shabby they were an okay size and clean which seemed acceptable given its only a 2* hotel. If you want a romantic luxury weekend away its inadvisable but for sightseeing and shopping its perfectly adequate and relatively cheap. Definitely not as bad as some people say.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay in this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Checked in to hotel all looked well until we got out of lift.The room was so dirty we would not let our son out of his buggy, after 5 mins & few photos we checked out,told guy at reception the place was a dump he did not even argue with us & gave us our money back (must be used to it).This place should be a museum for the homeless so we can see how they lived before they moved on to the streets as the streets of NY are without a doubt a safer & cleaner place to stay.DO NOT stay in this place my wife cried when she saw the room.I know it was not expensive but this dump lacked the basics (safe & clean).Better off to bring a bin bag to NY & sleep in it.DO NOT STAY HERE.If you decide to stay here visit your GP beforehand for the relevant injections YOU WILL NEED THEM!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Please do not let this put you off NY what a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Great...Just dont use the phones internationally”
Reviews.Author: emdee
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel for the price, when compared to other prices, but is very dated, and cold. Seriously needs a buyer (trump) to renovate it, great location, Some crap views, but we asked to be moved and was right opposite madison square garden. Hotel cleaners tried to rob my phone but obviously couldnt unlock the security on it. The best thing about the hotel, was roy rogers next door to the left, GO FOR A BREAKFAST BAGEL... unbeleivable!! Hold language classes so loads of students around lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel if you are on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: BIGSAMENGLAND
Reviews.Content: Happy New Year Everyone Just returned from a 7 day trip. Our taxi from JFK accidentally took us to the hotel Peninsula. When we got to our hotel we wish we had got out at the Peninsula. Firstly the Building itself is very impressive and as many have said the lobby is beautiful. On exiting the lift a strange musty smell hits you but that’s easy to live with. We weren’t impressed with the room what so ever. We were up for asking for another room but decided to wait till morning. We had a good night sleep and the maids cleaned the room and got new towels. We decided we would stick with it. As i say the hotel is perfect for anyone on a budget. In other words if you have come to New York for the sights and not the hotel it’s acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Penn”
Reviews.Author: Mikey27
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel. The first time was 2 years ago with 4 friends. We had 2 rooms both of which were massive with TV etc - everything clean, very outdated but it didnt really matter to us! This time my boyfriend and I got an absolutely tiny room with a tiny bed (barely double) and got no sleep at all on our first night. However, the next morning I asked at reception to change rooms and a really lovely lady called Betty gave us a refurbished room with a massive bed! Just a shower cubicle but that was fine with us, again everything really clean & maid service daily. The room was quiet too. The location is so good - the Subway outside goes everywhere you need to go and you can walk most places really easily too. Macys & loads of other good shops 2 mins walk. Overall, the hotel was fine because we moved rooms but if we had stayed in the first room we would have gone to another hotel. Dont worry, just ask to be moved and go out & enjoy New York!

Reviews.Title: “Good value basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Penn while celebrating my 21st (woohoo). The word that comes to mind to describe this hotel is...fine. Its a basic hotel which is more than adequate if all you want is a bed, shower/bath and tv. We did get quite a shock hen we first entered our room. I think they must have made a mistake and thought that it had been cleaned, but oh my god it so had not. We thought we'd walked into some seedy crack den, with paint chipping off the roof, the bed and bathroom a mess. We went straight back to the reception where they were more than apologetic and gave us another room which was fine. The location of the hotel is easy walking distance to times square, and of course opposite madision sqr gardens. The mistake we made was always turning right, otu of the hotel, and thus (sort of) missing little italy and chinatown which looked like good fun, defintely have a stroll down there. Great time shopping, although you really do need a map, as things aren't really that easy. Sitck your nose in the air and glide down park avenue to see the dog walkers getting paid $15 for 30 mins or $20 for an hour. Dine in the meatpacking distric for some cosy romantic dinner. And if broadways not your thing, try to see a comedy show - we saw steve buschemy and others and it was fab. If you love your TFI Firdays, starbucks and subways (there pratically one on every corner) you'll never starve. Either way you'll love new york, and a hotels a hotel a the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Moderate Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Keeping in mind the usual price range for hotels in new york city the pennsylvania is still at moderate prices. We've just returned from the States. We had a clean room, good roomservice. The view was not spectacular - it was next house's wall - this time, but honestly, spending my time with sightseeing and partying I couldn't care less about the view. In any case we've been way too tired to care. :-) The staff at the reception was not friendly above average, but all business and professional, so no complaints concerning that. I've seen hotels way worse in NYC (Try the 'Carter Hotel' for example!). If you require a cheap hotel accomodation and a room to sleep in, you can definitely try the Penn. Marion

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as i tought”
Reviews.Author: montrealtraveler
Reviews.Content: Hi, i just came back from this hotel, and finally i was very surprised to see the room. No bedbugs by the way (room 718a) with the view of the madison square garden. Yes it's smells humidity and the water of the shower dropped very slowly but it was ok. The gentleman at the reception was very sympathic. We requested an hair dryer and we got it 5 minutes later.. The location is great (near macy's !!). Nothing bad to say against this hotel. Very happily surprised. I was worried ! But i guess my room was a renovated room. Bye

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Traveller068
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a christmas shopping trip to new york city. Stayed at the Pensylvannia hotel, on 34th and 7th. Our party was very pleasantly surprised with the hotel following some of the negative reviews posted on this website by other visitors to the hotel. We felt that the hotel was in an excellent location (opposite Madison Square gardens and just a 3 minute walk to Macys.) Our first impression was of a very large hotel with beautiful chandeliers in the lobby. The corridors leading to the rooms were in need of some tender loving care BUT our room on the 10th floor was adequate with 2 double beds, bathroom with shower (clean large fluffy white towells changed every day)and a great view of the empire state buiding from our window!! We ate breakfast in the restaurant and at the diner (bit pricey for a cooked breakfast in both) but really enjoyable. Reception staff and tour operator staff are particularly helpful if it's your first visit and need some advice. We would certainly return to the hotel when we make a return trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Never never ever againI cannot”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I can't understand how this hotel can still be operating considering it's condition. We were moved at our request to three different rooms one no better than the other--torn wallpaper,dirty, worn and stained carpeting along with rotted woodwork. The room was so depressing we checked out a day earlier forfeiting $200.00. Dont't let the impressive lobby fool you.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I ever visit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In my line of work I travel a lot to Europe, USA and I have seen Hotels from 2 Stars to 5 Deluxe. 2 Stars Hotels in Madrid or in London that I have been are "Deluxe" comparing whit this horrible Hotel, the rooms dirty and filty, the reception staff very rude and not polide. They just don't care about you. In top of all I put my luggage in the luggage room, (charge service) and when I come back the next morning, a lot of items were missing!!! I reported to security but nothing was done. I will never even think to come back to this terrible and filty Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wolf in sheeps clothing”
Reviews.Author: picklefactory
Reviews.Content: I booked this on the internet based on the lovely photos and location. The location cannot be faulted, central to everything you want on a trip to Manhattan. The lobby is beautiful and sumptious on arrival. Check in service was quick and polite. However, when we stepped out of the lift on our floor, I thought we had entered an episode of Kojak. The corridors were filthy and looked like something that had remained uncleaned for years. There was what looked like blood spattered all over the door to our room. All the doors along our corridor looked as though they had resisted attempts to kick them in. The furniture in our room was pleasant and in good condition. The linen and carpets were clean as was the bathroom, but the room, like the corridors, looked like it had not been decorated or painted since the hotel was built. Overall we were dissapointed that the hotel photos on the net are obviously very selective and do not give a very honest impression. We enjoyed our stay, but had we known in advance of the state of the rooms, I would have booked elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Like other reviews i have read, myself and my partner booked this up through an agent without hearing about the reviews. I was horrified when i read them but we wasn't going to let it put a downer on our holiday. When we arrived the Hotel lobby is fantastic. Really modern and very busy with people coming in and out. We were on the 3rd floor and our room was very basic but clean. It was cleaned everyday with new towels and sheets and the staff were very friendly. Hotel Penn is an excellent location. Macy's round the corner, Times Square 15 minute walk away. Madison Square Gardens across the road, what more could you ask for. I would reccomend this Hotel to anyone and would definatley saty there if i was to visit New York again. After all, how much time do you actually spend in the Hotel when you are in a beautiful city like New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...shabby but clean!!”
Reviews.Author: Spirited
Reviews.Content: I initialy stayed in this hotel two years ago on a christmas shopping trip with my mum ( aged 30's and a young 60's) The location is fabulous with easy access to the downtown areas Soho, East and West Village etc and the shopping around Rockerfeller centre to the North. It is right on Macy's doorstep which was handy given the three day snow storm that blew in with our arrival. The hotel itself is shabby but is currently under renovation. Our room on that occasion was tired looking but clean. The bathroom was fine...black and white 1930's style ( original maybe?) but lots of hot water, good shower and clean white towels daily.There is a coffee shop in the lobby that does good English Breakfast tea for UK visitors in the morning and a bar restaurant that does good food for evenings when the weather gets the better of you My mum has since returned on two occasions both for shopping and sight seeing and has just returned from another christms shopping trip.( no funny smell) Again she was in an unrefurbished room but found it comfortable and clean. In short this is not a hotel for a luxury trip or romantic weekend away. It will remind you of the Shining but if all you need is a comfortable clean place to sleep in a great location this is fine. After all the money you save on the hotel can help with the shopping!!

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I brought a bus group of 56 people to New York and unfortunately stayed at this hotel. I requested the refurbished rooms but they were a disaster. The rooms were dirty with mold in many of the bathrooms. We requested upgrades but they were not any better. I asked for some compensation and that was refused. Don't be fooled by the lobby. I will never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at All Costs”
Reviews.Author: Leyton
Reviews.Content: Believe the reviews. This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. Its cheap (by New York standards) for a reason! We thought we were getting a bargain - we were had. The lobby is great but when the elevator door opens on your floor the smell hits you. Carpets are filthy. It makes me shudder just thinking about it.

Reviews.Title: “no 3rd time...”
Reviews.Author: Gloria77
Reviews.Content: we've booked this hotel for the 2nd time. But there won't be a 3rd. In 3 years, nothing changed and the rooms looked (and smelled) the same.

Reviews.Title: “i thought it was okay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I made a trip to the usa at the end of Nov with Nyc being our first stop - after reading the reviews on here i thought it was going to be a nightmare that i actually rang my tour operator to change but in the end i decided to stick with it because of the most excellent location - it was so central right by madison square garden, victorias secrets, macys etc. all the main attractions you go to nyc for were on the door step. The hotel itself is well old fashioned, we stayed on the 8th floor and it does look like the hotel from the shining and there is a funny smell, but nonetheless we checked in fast and there are lots of lifts so no waiting around. When we got to our room i opened the door to a dingy but very spacious room, 2 double beds so we could dump all the cases on one bed, it was tidy, bedding was all clean, big tv (not that we really watched it) and the bathroom was clean enough with white fluffy towels, the maids came in everyday and changed the towels and made the bed - basically we werent expecting the hilton after all the hotel is only 2* and why go to nyc if you are going to inspect your hotel for every piece of dust. We were out literally all day because all the shops are open till late and we wanted to make the most of it - this hotel will do if your looking for cheap and cheerful. Clean bedding and towels AND A GREAT LOCATION

Reviews.Title: “Worst Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: ALERT to anyone thinking of staying in this hotel DONT, I have never seen such a disgusting hotel in my life. Dirty is an understatement. We where offered 2 rooms but both where mouldy and just down right Yuck.We checked in then checked out almost immediately.It Was not a good start to a holiday which was supposed to be a birthday come shopping trip. Please read this and save yourself alot of hassle and disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money with great location”
Reviews.Author: SixContinents
Reviews.Content: Convenient, central location. Fast (5 min.) check in and out. Hotel fitness center adequate (2 good ellipticals, 4 treadmills, 2 bikes and a universal) but if you've got more time to work out maybe try their discount at a full scale club next door. My room had a good, comfortable king sized mattress, everything in working order, looked recently renovated except bathroom which was clean and functional but original tile and fixtures. Overall found the hotel good value for the money and fine for a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The lobby of this hotel is great and the Irish Pub restarant was very good. The room were very old, dark & dreary. The clerks were not helpful in trying to find us another room. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs!!”
Reviews.Author: DixieNI
Reviews.Content: I couldn't believe a hotel in this state was allowed to trade!! Just awful - dirty and dated rooms. The only redeeming feature is the hotel's central location but it's still not worth putting yourself through the horror of it all!!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: MentalMan
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel online. After showing up I checked out almost immediately and went to the Crowne Plaza. Hotel Pennsylvania is a complete dump and is a perfect candidate for gutting and remodelling.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very important to warn people to book this hotel. I´ve never been in such a terrble hotel. The rooms are dirty and cold.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel with my boyfriend in early november and we wanted every thing to be perfect. I had hurd that the hotel had reputation for cockroches but i didn't see any, (or any other bugs). On are arrival we were upgraded as a gesture of good will, we had a excellent veiw of the empire state building from are room. The room could of done with a lick of paint but it was clean and very comfortable and the fridge was very handy. The staff we friendly and the location excellent, round the corner from everything!i will be staying at this hotel again in april and i recomend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: OWIE
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 4 night stay in this hotel. I had read some reviews prior to going to New York and thought I was prepared for the state of the hotel but was not. The place is totally neglected and shabby. It is crying out for a lick of paint and a good carpet shampoo. Thankfully the room we were allocated was not too bad. Again it needed redecorating and there was rubbish left over from a previous guest but thankfully the bedding and towels were clean and the bathroom although the fixtures and fittings had seen better days it was functional. By New York standards it is not the best hotel to stay in if you are on a budget but it's location is ideal. However unless it undergoes serious redecoration and renovation I don't think I would rush to stay in it again.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay in this Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just back from a long weekend in New York. We stayed in Hotel Pennsylvania on our last night and I'm just thankful we didn't decide to stay her for the whole trip. We requested a non-smoking room and got a smoking room, so off I went to reception to ask to be switched to a non-smoking room. When we got there we discovered someone else was there, so off to reception again! I must also point out the rooms are very dated and didn't even seem clean. The wallpaper was hanging off the walls in places and toilet seat was 'yellow'. I'd read that some off the rooms were 'tired', but that some floors had been refurbished. So when I went back to reception to change rooms AGAIN I asked for one of the refurbished rooms. If you had never seen one of the older rooms you would be forgiven for thinking that you were in one of the 'tired' rooms. We couldn't even bear to step in the shower the next morning and washed by the sink instead!! I would never stay here again and wouldn't recommend it to anyone. Also the staff were rude and unhelpful. Mind you I don't blame them as I'm sure they have to deal with unsatified customers everyday! I only wish I'd taken photos of the rooms to post here to prove how bad they actually are! Even if it ends up being the cheaper option, spend a bit more and stay somewhere else, you'll be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time !”
Reviews.Author: madmaxgirl
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 6 night break in New York and we stayed at the Hotel Pennsylvania. After reading the reviews on here we tried several times to change our hotel, as i'd just found out that I was pregnant but we were unsuccesful.. so we decided to just turn up at the hotel and see what state the room was in. We arrived at the hotel very tired after 2 flights and were suprised as there wasn't a queue to check in. Ok so the corridors look like something out of the Shining and the doors are strange, but we weren't bothered about that as long as the room was decent. We'd prepared ourselves for the worst and I can honestly say that we were really suprised. We stayed on the 14th floor and the rooms were old and did need redecorating.. but they were clean, tidy and comfortable. The bathroom was spotless and the maids came in the room every day to hoover and put new towels out. All the staff that we spoke to were very friendly and helpful. We didnt spend alot of time in the hotel.. after all, who goes to New York to stay in the hotel room ?. The hotel is in a great location.. we found it easy to get to all the sights and shops from this hotel. Your also very close to alot of places to eat. If we ever visit New York again, i'd book this Hotel again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Don't accept Room 697!!”
Reviews.Author: mau083
Reviews.Content: Room 697 has NO heating, and although the outside temperature was below freezing, a call to the maintenance engineer produced no action! Reception and Left Luggage staff were very helpful and friendly, and the position of this hotel is superb - in the centre of EVERYTHING, and one block from Macey's! Room equipped with hair dryer (we used ours as a rather ineffective mini fan heater!), ironing board and iron, plenty of clean towels, bed linen changed etc. - but a drink-making facility would have been welcome. A cavernously-huge hotel, famous in the 20s, 30s, 40s, but long overdue for a refurbishment. For a short stay, in the centre of NY when time is important, it's OK, but if visiting in the winter - check the heating in the room is working!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Transylvania is more like it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Due to the recent bug bites reported at the Hotel Transylvania, I felt it was necessary to write this review. In January of 2003, I visited Manhattan with 6 other middle school teachers. The blonde of the group decided to book us at this hotel, due to it's cheap rate (lesson #1 - get what you pay for). We arrive to the hotel and spend two hours checking in because, though we reserved the quad and another double, we ended up with a single and a double. One of our group members attempted to provide her confirmation number and reason that 7 women could not fit into a single and double, only to met with an attitude that rivaled that of any of my high school students. The only way to obtain our promised rooms was to react as the front desk clerk had; rudely (lesson #2 do unto others as....). So after asking for a manager and reporting the whole mess, we were put in the 'penthouse'. Oh. My. Gosh. If this penthouse is still in the same condition, it should just be opened as a homeless shelter. No, not good enough, a pig sty. The place obviously hadn't been vacuumed, dusted, mopped, wiped down, etc. in months. The windows had a coat of grime so thick we could write messages like it was snow. And, best part, there was a fridge smaller than the one I kept in my dorm room. If you are planning a 'trash-your-hotel-room' party, this is your place. If you want a hotel where you don't have to wear your shoes in the room (and the shower), then stay elsewhere. No hate to the hotel itself, but if Extreme Makeover doesn't show up soon, that place should be razed.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare, beware!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just arrived home after spending 6 days here. The city itself was fantastic but as for the hotel, well it should be closed down. As the other reviews state the moment we arrived at the front desk the staff were unfriendly and rude, which was just the start. Once given our room, it was an utter disgrace it hadn't been cleaned from the people who were in there before us, with old sheets on the bed and dirty towels on the bathroom floor. Went straight down to complain, here the staff didn't seem at all surprised, they obviously have got use to it. I would never ever go back here you would have to pay me to stay there again, even then I would still not go. Maybe the management of this hotel (if there is any!) should read through these reviews maybe then something will be done, and maybe health and safety, and the environmental agency should be advised on the state of this place!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a surprise”
Reviews.Author: shielaIreland
Reviews.Content: My company of 12 girls had booked the pennsylvania and during the last two months I was reading the reports on trip adviser, so I was well prepared and knew what to do in case of the worst case would happen to us. However we got a surprise when we opened our room doors, two double beds in every room, very clean sheets, it was the first thing we checked, bathroom was clean, but will admit a bit aged, but plenty of hot water, old fashioned but It was clean and done us fine. We only slept in it as we were gone all day. but I must say what we got was nothing like we expected and got quite a surprise. We were on the 14th floor and I would definatly stay there again and request the same room or another one on the same floor. The staff were friendly and changed our sheets every day and gave us clean towels, never touched a thing in our rooms and if there was any drinks left in cans etc they were put to one side, only rubbish in the bins was thrown out and the rooms were hoovered daily. So give it a try, you'll never know

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from this hotel today 1st Dec 2005. On walking in we thought wow what an excellent choice, the entrance is very grand and very busy. Recepion staff very slow and not very helpful at all. Allocated us our room only to find that the person who had checked in immediately before us also had the same room!! 2nd room allocated was dirty, floors not hoovered, beds old and rickety but clean, the walls were painted but clearly not recently as they were stained. the bathroom was a disgrace, walls were dirty, hair was stuck to the walls, suite very old and cast iron bath, sweet papers on the floor behind the door when we went in were still there 4 days later. The shower was certainly a power shower and took the top layer of skin off you as you washed. View was excellent as macy's out of one window, empire state building out of the other window. Altough the hotel is in obvious need of refurbishment if you can tolorate it then it is very cheep and in an excellent locaton on 7th avenue and within 10 - 15 mintes walk of Broadway, Times Square, Empire state building is 2 blocks away and maddison Square Guarden is directly opposite. If I was to return to New York I would return to this hotel due to its central location and cheapness.

Reviews.Title: “Gross”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After booking this hotel online because of it's location and price... we arrived. After the shock of the horrible and dirty room (fresh gum in the peep hole and everything) we demanded a refund and opted to sleep on the floor of a friends appartment rather than this place. Really, don't stay here... I've stayed in camp sites where your bathroom was in another building nicer than this. It's really, really gross.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and slightly cheerful”
Reviews.Author: macca1Uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pensylvania Hotel Nov 2005, when we arrived at the hotel we walked into the foyer and thought WOW we have done good for our money, however the rooms are very shabby, basically clean, but wouldn't go so far as to sway clean. The best thing about this hotel is its cheap and a location to dream about.

Reviews.Title: “3rd time staying here this year”
Reviews.Author: cookie2crumb
Reviews.Content: This was the third time I have stayed at the Pennsylvania this year. Please do not be put off by other reviews. It may not be the ritz, but you get an excellent location, clean rooms and friendly staff for affordable prices! I will definitely stay here again when I go back to NYC!

Reviews.Title: “A dump”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I only wish I had read the reviews on this Hotel before I booked. The first room they gave us was a nightmare paint peeling from the walls, water stains on the ceiling, handles on the dresser were broken off. My wife went down to the lobby to request another room which they gave us and was somewhat better with only the paint peeling from the ceiling and the shower fixture was barely hanging on. If I could have gotten out of staying here I definately would have.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay, don't be put off!!”
Reviews.Author: Ceri99_uk
Reviews.Content: I know the idea of the reviews is to give people an honest picture of the hotel but these reviews had me really worried!! When we arrived, the rooms are basic, a bit of paint was peeling off the wall and the sink in the bathroom was a bit unsteady but the important thing is YOU ARE IN NEW YORK!!! How long are you realistically going to spend in your room? We left at 8.30am everyday and didn't return until about 7pm so we were hardly there! The room was clean, the maids came to make the beds and hoover each day and we found the staff really friendly. Plus you are in an excellent location for everything. Please don't worry too much if you've already book, chances are you'll find your stay will be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for the memories...none of them good.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I actually stayed at the Pennsylvania back in July so why, you may ask, am I choosing to put up a review now, over 4 months later. Well, last night we watched one of the SciFi Channel's spectactularly bad movies entitled "Dagon". The story revolved around a group of 4 friends run aground in their yacht in a storm who then end up in a small coastal town somewhere in Spain (I think). The town is populated by strange fishlike people who sacrifice unsuspecting travelers to their fish god. One hapless guy attempts to escape the rain by checking into the only local hotel. We see his room, peeling wallpaper, gurgling, spluttering plumbing, dirty sheets, uncommunicative staff... If yo've stayed at the Pennsylvania you already know where I'm going with this. Yes, it was the Hotel Pennslyvania...minus the gills and sacrificial pit of course - it's bad but not QUITE that bad! I wouldn't recommend it but if you're going to stay here (or you're already booked and can't back out now as was our situation) then just be prepared. They WILL put you in the room from hell at first but just be ready to go straight back down and ask for another room until you get one you can live with. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be put off”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm so pleased I didn't read these reviews before staying at the Pennsylvania! Don't be completely put off if you've already booked. No it isn't the Mandarin Oriental but its blooming cheap and smack back in the middle of everything... its opposite Madison Square Garden, Macys and Penn St Station and its within walking distance of practically everything! We found the staff to be really friendly and helpful, they even let us check in 2hrs early and only waited 10 mins or so. Ok so our room wasn't exactly glamorous BUT it was clean and tidy. Maids visited everyday and left lovely clean towels/flannels/bathmat etc etc (who were I have to say really, really friendly - wished us good morning and a nice day etc etc). Granted the rooms and corridors could probably do with a lick of paint etc. To be honest we knew before we went that it wasn't going to be special but figured we were only there to sleep so it didn't matter so much. Its really not that bad!

Reviews.Title: “Sorry - It's another Health Warning on this place!”
Reviews.Author: mallard2
Reviews.Content: No No No No No - just don't go here. It should be a good experience - the hotel is in a great location and the lobby lulls you into a very false sense of security. Sadly the rooms, the service and the overall experience are just one steep downhill plunge into a pretty abysmal hostel environment. Pity the prices charged don't reflect this, as you might then have some idea of what you're letting yourself in for. I can only echo most of the other comments about dingy rooms, poor decorative state, staff who seem so used to complaints that they just don't care...the list of problems just goes on. Do yourself a favour - if you've booked a room in this hotel, go round the back and sleep in their dumpster - it will be better than the room they provide!

Reviews.Title: “Watch your credit card statement afterwards”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The disconnected smoke alarm was hidden by the fact that there was no ceiling light. We had to keep the bathroom light on and the door open the entire time (even in daylight hours) in order to see as it was so dark. What makes me most angry is that I've just got home and found they've charged $185 to my credit card. We'd paid in full, checked in and out on time, didn't use the phone, didn't buy pay per view movies or use the internet and left the room in perfect order, so I have no idea what it's about. The ever surly staff refused to deal with it when I just called, told me to use another number and not to bother for a while as all their computers are down. Also don't expect to sleep in this hotel, the plumbing is such that if anyone in the nearby rooms flushes their toilet in the night, the whole corridor wakes up.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a trip to NY. After reading the reviews regarding the Pennsylvania we were terrified going. But we were worring over nothing, the rooms were very clean and spacious. The maid came in everyday and clean towels were given each day. We had breakfast and dinner in the hotel (Joes), and the food was outstanding. All the staff in the hotel were very friendly. The location of the hotel was super, accross the road from Macys, Penn Station (20 mins to Newark Airport), Madison Gardens. Would recommend to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had the unfortunate experience of staying in this hotel for a group trip. They require you to stand on a long line to PURCHASE a ticket in order to store your luggage - definitely not the norm (even in NYC hotels). Then you have to take your luggage down to the basement on your own. Very inconvenient. Also, while the lobby is nice the rooms are hideous. Tiny and dirty! There were scuff marks all over the walls. A colleague of mine had a used bar of soap in his shower. The sheets were scratchy. I could go on and on, but to make it simple DO NOT STAY HERE!!

Reviews.Title: “thank you mr shah”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 4 days during october 2005 it was fantastic this is my second time and I would be happy to go back again I can't praise the staff enough especially Mr Shah who booked us in on the 12th floor my mother was 85 on the day we arrived and she was made to feel very welcome and loved the room given to her. I heared whilst I was there that it made be sold for conversion to part housing and hotel use what a loss of a piece of NYC'S history and to the budget hotel user.

Reviews.Title: “fawlty towers!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned form a 6 night stay in this hotel. I had read the reviews only after booking. I travelled with my friend from Germany who had booked the hotel through a local travel agent. The first room we were given was small with one double bed and very shabby surroundings. We asked for another room with 2 beds as promised by travel agent. 2nd room had 2 twin beds but no electricity and grafitti next to the main light switch indicating this had been a longstanding problem. Once again we returned to the desk with luggage in tow to be given another room. This room had a blind on the window which was ripped and falling off the window. The enamel on the bath was all chipping off. By this time we bacame quite angry and were told by the person at the desk that indeed he agreed some of the rooms were sub-standard. We were asked at this point to return in 2 hours at 4pm to see what could be done. At 4pm we were given the keys for room number 4 which had 2 double beds and this was of a more acceptable standard. The hotel has obviously been lovely in it's day but is in dire need of refurbishment throughout to bring it up to expected standards of today.The maid service was fine with a complete change of towels every day and the beds were clean. The best thing about the hotel is its location. Very central and within walking distance of most attractions but centainly nearer the basic budget accomodation and not 2 star. 2 weeks prior to this I stayed in 2 star accomodation in Tenerife and found the hotel pensylvannia of a poorer standard.

Reviews.Title: “No Problems at the Pennsylvania”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Feeling a little nervous about staying in the Pennsylvania after having read the awful reviews, my friend and I arrived there with some trepidation. The lobby was exactly as expected, huge and busy and exactly like the photos... We checked in nearly an hour before official check in time with no problem, the staff were really friendly and helpful. (not really what we expected) We were given a room on the 16th floor with a fabulous view of the Empire State building. The room was basic, but extremely clean with crisp white sheets and fluffy towels, the only downside being lack of a kettle... but being bang smack in the centre of New York this didn't present much of a problem. Also the travel adaptor we had brought didn't work, but having no mobile phone was a refreshing change!! The hotel staff at the tourist desk where really efficient, giving advice on tour tickets, show tickets, shuttle bus tickets etc. Pennsylvania is moments away from Macy's, over the road from the Madison Square garden, and a couple of blocks from the Empire State Building. Who could ask for more? If you are going on a tourist holiday for shopping and sightseeing,and not expecting the Ritz, then this is the hotel for you!

Reviews.Title: “Location,location,location!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just retutned from a five night stay in the Hotel Pennsylvania,we were completely ignorant of the bad reviews and checked in with virgin innocence! We were soon to be drawn into the dark side. I thought the lobby was fairly grand and busy with well dressed tourists and happy looking people,checking in did take a while but it was really only when we were deposited on the 2nd floor that I felt the fear kick in. The corridors were eerily gloomy,the dungeon doors to the rooms were losing their stuffing at the bottoms,the carpets were taped down in areas,we half expected to bump into the spookt twins from the shining,and then we entered our room!! The reassuring technological blip from the modernised door entry system had my hopes high but as soon as we stepped over the entrance those hopes were dashed. I felt pole axed the room was so gloomy,grotty and grungey, the ceiling had pretty bad water damage from some ancient time and the adjoining doors creeped me out if we had found a dead body in a room it wouldn't have surprised me. Enraged I marched straight back down to reception and we were offered a 2nd room,this was much the same standard thoroughly annoyed we demanded a third room this time on the 13th floor,there was some improvement but 3 separate beds wasn't really what we were after! The lightbulbs didn't work so once again we were allocated a new room,our 4th room proved to be the best,all the athrooms were pretty grotty and you probably wouldn't have a bath but the shower was powerful enough,the towels were all fluffy white fresh,the bed linen crisp and white every day.I suppose the moral is that if you are allocated a grotty room then get right back down to reception and complain (the staff are obviously well used to it)we were so horrified by the first couple of rooms that we nearly checked out and went home,but I'm glad we persevered with the complaints because we did have a great holiday and our last room was honestly not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel of my life”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Don't ever stay here, period. Stains and burns on the carpet, walls and curtains. I would rather stay in Central Park, than here. REALLY! I asked to be moved 3-times, finally to shut-me up, to the 11th-floor, which is exectutive, from what I understand. The staff told me they can almost tell who will go to their rooms and say "oh, hell no" and come marching back down stairs. I have never, in my 44-years on earth, seen anything this bad. I did not get any rest there, I can't sleep with mold over my head. I called my cousin who told me to get multiple sheet-sets from housekeeping, which I did. She then told to cover everything, like rich people do when they go to Florida for the winer, with the sheets. So, I did, but still in all, it was GROSS.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It all looked so good on the website. The doorman and the swish chandeliered foyer were very impressive, and we were looking forward to a comfortable stay. The room we were offered was appalling however. Wallpaper and paint peeling, tiles missing in the bathroom, and a very nasty smell. They changed us to another room which was just as bad, but half the size. At the third attempt, we were "upgraded" to a more expensive room at no extra cost. This was marginally better, but still tatty and dirty. Vacuuming was cursory, and the handbasin wasn't cleaned during the 7 days we stayed there. The whole corridor stank of cigarette smoke, and our room adjoined another, where Spanish was spoken loudly at all hours and the television was on full blast until the early hours of the morning, so we got little sleep. The Reception staff were surly. The hotel does have a great location, but there are so many others in the neighbourhood to choose from. We certainly wouldn't stay here again, and would advise anyone else to go elsewhere too. We love New York, but not the Hotel Pennsylvania.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't put a dog in there”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked a weekend break to New York as a present for my hysband's 40th birthday. We were assured that the Pennsylvania Hotel is a "really nice hotel". When we got there, we queued for ages to get checked in, my husband had to write his name on a piece of paper so that the receptionist could copy it onto the computer. Our room was still being cleaned when we went up to it. In the corridors, the walls were crumbling from the damp and there was a very strong smell of air freshener. When we got into our room, well, the dark brown carpet was dirty and sticky, the paint was peeling off the skirting boards and the white tiled ceiling had great big brown stains on them. In the bathroom the towel rail was rusty, the bath was stained and the tiles had black (mouldy) grout in between. There was an adjoining door to a suite next door, the walls were so thin we could hear the conversation of the people next door. They said this was a three star hotel when I booked it, I would not put a dog in there!!!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: loopee
Reviews.Content: i went to ny for 4 nights with my best friend and i was very apprehensive about staying at this hotel as i had read the reviews on trip advisor before i left. i do admit that the hotel is a bit "tired" in its decor but for location and service it could not be faulted. our room over looked macys and you could see the chryssler buliding from our room also. the staff were amazing and i big thumbs up to the guy that looked after our luggage on the last day. i just wanted to add some positive feed back for a change.so if you are not too bothered what your room looks like then stay at this hotel . ot was clean and tidy. thats all you need.

Reviews.Title: “Should be condemned”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the worst hotel I've ever stayed at. The price of the room is VERY misleading ($225). TOTALLY overpriced.....this hotel should be condemned.
