Reviews.Title: “Hotel from hell”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Would never stay here again in million years it remined me of a nursing home i use to work in and believe me that smelt nicer than this hotel, the wallpaper was hanging off ,the carpets were all damp which after a few hours started to soak into my husbands suitcase, the staff were not the friendliest of people took 3hrs to book in only allowed to cash $100 dollars a day in city that size i think that was a joke and not a very funny one at that, wa came in one afternoon and the maid had been in to do the bed etc and found a pubic hair on the sink which just knocked us sick, the hole place was dissgusting and if i were to go back to new york i wouldn't care about the location the place should be pulled down not renovated like they say they did five years ago more like 500 if you as me. pease if your thinking of staying here think again the city is a fantastic experience but he hotel is what i said in the begining it's the hotel from hell and believe me i would rather go to hell than ever stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine if you just want a place to crash”
Reviews.Author: l0is1ane
Reviews.Content: I had read many awful reviews of this hotel and approached it with a sense of fear but it was completely sufficient for our purposes - a base to sleep in when we returned from site seeing. It was a surprisingly large room with two queen beds. All the basics were there - a television, hairdryer and powerful shower (best suited to the shorter members of society though!). Yes it was a bit scruffy and I wouldn't take children there as the electrical wires twisted and turned across the floor by the walls! We had an extra ironing room with a seperate door which was a little odd but not something to complain about! The service at the hotel was good - alpharooms booked us a king bed room when our invoice said a twin bedded room but the reception staff happy exchanged the rooms and on the one occassion that the room was not cleaned (because we were in it) we rang housekeeping late in the evening and they quickly brought up new towels. Basically this hotel is not somewhere to be scared of. If you want a room to sleep in, a place to take a shower and recover from the day then it is totally fine. Do not go expecting any kind of luxury or refinement, but then personally I don't think you should be expecting that from a two star hotel anyway. Enjoy NY :)

Reviews.Title: “Staying here is like playing Russian Roulette”
Reviews.Author: Annoula
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had to queue at the reception desk for AGES when we first arrived. There was always lots of people in the lobby at whatever time of day we went through there, but I suppose that was due to it being mid December and a busy period. LOTS of irate guests around! We had booked a 'superior' room rather than a standard. The woman on reception gave us our room key and we went up to find it, when we opened the door we could not believe what we saw! DISGUSTING! constantly running tap in the bathroom, filthy carpets, TINY bed, and it STUNK of smoke. Well we went straight back down to reception and started to queue again. But a porter spotted us and said 'oh, you two complaining about your room? Come straight to the front of the queue - you don't have to queue twice.' So we saw the woman again and complained that the room was disgusting and demanded a better room. (on the way down in the lift we talked with another English couple who were on their way to say the same thing! Apparently its pretty common practice for them to put you in a crappy room first and wait to see if you complain.) So anyway, woman on reception said 'booking a superior room doesn't guarantee you one. There are none available, sorry.' So my boyfriend got very angry at this - at which point she glanced at the computer and an available superior room MIRACULOUSLY appeared to become available. She gave us these new keys and THAT room was a world apart. Huge queen size bed, big TV, clean. It was like a different hotel. The lesson to be learned from this experience - complain until they give you a satisfactory room! They give the nicest rooms to the ones willing to fight for them, and believe me, you do NOT want to see the horrendous state of their worst rooms. Be prepared for a lot of running up and down between rooms and reception desk - NOT the most relaxing start to your holiday after a long flight. Also I remember a school trip of girls staying in our corridoor running up and down and screaming all night long, and leaving toilet roll scattered around outside. Having said all that, the breakfast was yummy, and it was handy for the subway - but not in my opinion a 'fantastic location.' VERY touristy area. There were other English people everywhere! The hotel is next to a real rip-off Sbarro! Quite difficult to find places to eat round here. Next time I'm staying in a hotel in Central Park West which gives more of a taste of the real New York, away from tourist central.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the reviews say-READ AND FIND OUT..NOT THAT BAD”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was preparing for the worst after I had read the reviews for the Hotel Pennsylvania. People talked about how dirty the rooms are and how there are stains everywhere....I was scared. I am normally a Hilton kinda girl, so I do expect the best, but I was traveling with my college so did not have a choice in where we stayed. Again, after reading most of the reviews, I was terrified. However, when I got there, it was not as bad as everyone made it out to be. Yes, the rooms look old and the bathroom was very small, but there were no stains, the room was attended to daily, and it was clean. I am not sure how much it costs becuase we got a group rate, but like I said, if you have read the reviews and are scared, don't be. It is no Hilton or Ritz, hey, the hampton may even be better, but it is not nearly as bad as others make it out to be. The staff was okay, not great, but not horrible either. Would I recommend the HP? It's location is amazing-about 10 min walkind dis from Times Square and right across the street from Madison Square Garden; The service is ok, unless you want to be waited on hand and foot. I mean, you don't go to NY to stay in the hotel-so yes, I would recommend it, even if it's just for the location. And again, don't be scared, it's not that bad. FEEL FREE TO E-MAIL ME WITH QUESTIONS!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: Neil123
Reviews.Content: The first thing that struck me about the Hotel was its fantastic location. Directly opposite Madison Square Garden and Penn Station. Furthermore, it was within easy walking distance of both Times Square and the Empire State Building, so as far as good locations go, you cant beat it! The Hotel itself was reasonable. The rooms were a decent size and clean and tidy and the rooms were cleaned daily The only disappointing thing really was the lobby. The queues to check in and out were quite bad, what is really annoying is that i've read other reviews saying the same thing, yet so many desks were empty, surely the hotel can staff it better in busy periods! The lobby was also constantly busy all the time it was more like walking through a busy train station in rush hour! Didn't eat anything from the hotel other than a few items from a deli located in the lobby area, which was quite a useful thing to have. On the whole, not too bad, I got what I expected for the reasonable price paid.

Reviews.Title: “Know how to book”
Reviews.Author: tbu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights the last week of May. After reading previous reviews, we booked our room thru the hotel's website. I called the hotel before booking to ask about getting a renovated room, and the lady told me that it would be guaranteed if I book the superior king size room thru their website. If I booked thru other discount websites it will only be a run of the house room, ie not renovated. When I booked the superior king size room thru their website, it ended up being way cheaper with an AAA discount then booking thru expedia for a regular unrenovated room. And we were guaranteed a renovated room, or so they say. We were definitely apprehensive before we arrived and were ready to do battle to get a renovated room, but when we got there it wasn't that bad at all. We arrived at 12:30pm, waited about 10-15 minutes to check in. To help out with the line, the lady took us to the Penn 5000 club room to check in. We told the lady we wanted to make sure it was a renovated room and she said that we did book for one and she is looking for a renovated floor. She found us a room on the 10th floor. She then mentioned they may not have had time to clean the room yet since check out was at 12pm, but she will make sure someone cleans it very soon if that was the case. She even paged the maids on that floor while we were there to make sure. When we got to the room, which was not hard to find at all, it was already cleaned! It was a renovated room, smaller that we anticipated based on the web site pictures, but had the same bed and bedcovers as shown on the website for that size room and was clean and decent enough for a 2-3 stars hotel. The bathroom was not the newest, but was clean and there was no mold or dripping taps or hair in sinks etc. We had hot water anytime we wanted it, no problem with water pressure, clean towels, clean sheets and new soaps everyday. The only downsides we had were the air con was not very cold when we were hot, and our room faces another hotel wing, so we had to have our curtains closed all the time. I can definitely see the air con becoming an issue during the summer. Since it was not that hot while we were in NY, the air con was good enough for us. While we were there I barely heard other guests on the floor, except for the shower running next door (We must have been lucky on that floor) We never had to wait more than 20 seconds for the elevators either, though we mostly used them after 12pm and after 8pm. There were always a ton of people in the lobby, but I did not witness lineups that may take hours to check in in the regular check in. One group line up was quite big on the memorial holiday weekend. Overall we were quite satisfied with the hotel, especially considering what we paid per night. It was about $30 less than the cheapest room on expedia. The location is excellent. Easy access to the subway stations, quick walk to Times Square and tons of shopping all around. For the price you cannot beat the location and value for money as one reviewer said, spend your money elsewhere while in New York. Know that you are only paying for a 2-3 stars hotel, don't expect 5 stars and book thru the hotel website. It will save you many a headache! We stayed at the Howard Johnson's across the street at Penn Station the year before and that was so much worse and more expensive than what we got at this hotel. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: dragonannie
Reviews.Content: I approached this hotel with trepidation as I had not told my husband about all the negative reviews - but it was so cheap for the location and we were only staying a couple of nights. We arrived by car and first impressions were awful as the staff on reception were unbelievably rude, very unhelpful about parking the car, and refused to check me in as I did not have the passports available. By the time we had sorted out the car and the passports, the rooms we had booked were taken. (We were 2 adults and 4 children). We were then given a key to an enormous apartment on the 17th floor, entrance hall, huge lounge/dining room, 2 very large en-suite bedrooms. Sure it was old and shabby, but very clean and fantastic views! My previous experience of New York hotel rooms is that they are no bigger than cupboards so boy weren't the kids impressed! So all was forgiven. But why, oh why, do they have to be so rude?

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location and Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jilly2007
Reviews.Content: Stayed here end of Oct/start of Nov and thought it was brilliantly located couldnt have asked for better, staff very friendly and helpful and room very adequate, for all the time you spend in it. Would definitely stay here again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: Ti-An D
Reviews.Content: I have been to this hotel twice, and the second stay was a little better than the first. This hotel was one of the cheapest ones we could find in a decent place in the city, and the location alone makes it worth while. Right across the street is Penn Station, and down the street are the lights of Times Square. Macy's and the Empire State building are also within very close walking distance. In fact, I had a great view of the Empire State from my hotel window which was really nice. The rooms were not the cleanest, as there were some stains on the carpet and the bathroom had some mold, but the beds were clean and we had fresh towels and soaps so that was good enough. Television worked fine. There was an issue with noise however. The air conditioner was quite loud and the walls were paper thin, so I was kept up all night by an angry couple having an argument next door. For a few nights stay, this place is pretty decent. Just spend less time in the room and more time outside enjoying all the great attractions close by.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Pennsylvania”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I had a shopping trip to New York in April and stayed in the Hotel Pennsylvania. We had read mixed reviews, as some rooms are renovated and some not. The 14th floor was not renovated but the room was perfectly adequate and clean, nothing at all to complain about. Linen was changed daily and the room was always clean. As for the location it could not be better for shopping just opposite Maddison Square Gardens and very near Herald Square, with lots of convenient eating places nearby. I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep rough, it'll be cleaner!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival hotel is situated in a great spot with Madisson Square Garden just across the road and only a short walk to Times Square. Despite many other reviews i have seen the check in was not very busy, we were quickly handed our card and set off to the room. My partner and I were only in the City for 1 night to do a quick bit of shopping so the fact that the hotel started to look a bit old fashioned and in need of a good clean and makeover didn't worry us too much. When we got to our allocated room on the third floor we eventually found the room (it's rather hard to find doors as the numbering on some floors seems somewhat unusual to say the least). I opened the door and the room was very small, the carpet was dirty, the bathroom was disgusting, a tap that dripped constantly, stains all around the bath, paint peeling off everywhere. The aircon didn't work in the room either, the view out the window was of a concrete wall. The last straw was when i looked at the alleged double bed! I've slept in bigger single beds! I went down to the front desk and told tem i was not happy and was not prepared to stay in the room. With no further questions i was moved to a kingsize room! This to was fairly disgusting, stains everywhere again, but no dripping tap, and it was a front facing room so we looked straight down on the Madisson Garden complex, this really made up for the problems. Like all New York hotels it was very noisy and we had to keep the window open as again the aircon unit was useless. The hot water took about 10 minutes to get hot and the remote control on the tv didn't work, nor did the internet connections. I would not stay there again, if i'd have not been given the second room i would have made friends with the local homeless folks! Also reception staff upon checking out where not the most helpful or polite people, it may be an idea to have more than 2 members of staff on duty for a hotel that alleges to have 1700 rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are just back from staying 4 nights in the Pennsylvania and to be honest it wasn't as bad as we had feared after reading some of the reviews. Its a 2 star hotel in the center of Manhatten and for the price we paid we thought it was decent value for money. I was nervous arriving to the hotel in anticipation of staying in some "by the hour hotel" but had the attitude that when you're in New York you should only be spending a minimum of time in your hotel room. We arrived at 5pm and there was only about 3 people in the queue waiting to be checked in so I started to feel better as some people say they have waited hours to check in. You're supposed to show your room key to a guy who sits by the elevators so that he can stop people who aren't guests going to the rooms but not once over our stay did these guys ever ask us to show him our key which kind of defeats the purpose of him being there. We found the elevators to be very quick and were never waiting more than 20 seconds for one. We were staying on the 7th floor and when we got off the elevator my concerns returned. The carpet looked like it was put down in the 70s and had numerous stains on it. It took us about 10 mins to find our room cause its like a rabbit warren on the floors. Eventually we found it and held our breath as we opened the weirdest looking door I have ever seen. They looked like something you'd see in a mental institution. The room was old but clean. The bathroom had seen better days as some of the enamel had chipped off the bath but the shower was warm and powerful. The air conditioning was non existant but luckily it wasn't that warm so its wasn't missed but that would be a big problem in july and august. We had a "beautiful view" of another room about 20 feet away from us so the curtains needed to stay closed as anybody could see in. The beds were made every day which is more than I've had in some better hotels. If you want a location thats right in the heart of everything and not pay for it then this place is for you but if you want to have some creature comforts then look elsewhere. We had a great time in New York and would consider going back to the Pennsylvania again because there's so many better things to spend your money on in New York than your hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Watch for furry friends ??”
Reviews.Author: Richoooo
Reviews.Content: I checked in and was disapointed with the room, It was dull and dreary. I tried to change rooms, but all 1,700 rooms fully booked, I was told this. I dont think so. Bath was filthy, had to run tap for 10mins before hot water came to shower. A mouse was running along the floor and we took 2hours trying to catch it. It then ran into the connecting room, so someone else was chasing this mouse. Spoke to the cleaning supervisor and she said that they would investigate, heard nothing more. It is probaly still going from room to room. The hotel is in a great location. The amount of people in the lobby each day is amazing. The hotel needs a good facelift, and extra staff on check in days as queue's very long. I stayed on the 3rd floor, but the lift made journeys to all floors which I had to take - unwillingly. before it returned to the lobby. These other rooms could be ok.

Reviews.Title: “close to macys”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we booked before reading all the terrible reviews & was tempted to cancel... the room was basic but alright.. my mobile charger would not work in any of the sockets.. but the location was FANTASTIC.. and am planning to go this december again but will book an upgrade

Reviews.Title: “Horror”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: May 2005 The worst I have ever seen. Should be shut down! mold on the carpets and dirt ,night table was slopped on foot prints on drinks slopped on ,I'd be surprised if it was washed this year.Wall paper falling off,blinds were in a heap on the floor.We changed our flight and left.Oh by the way this was the second room we had,after we complained and got an upgrade.Horror films should be shot in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not that good, but not terrible!”
Reviews.Author: droflaw26
Reviews.Content: I just got back from my brief stay at the Hotel Pennsylvania. After reading numerous reviews for this hotel, I did not know what to expect. Almost all of the reviews are really negative, while a few others are quite positive. I was pretty excited to get to this hotel, simply because I wanted to judge it for myself. So, when I arrived I was not surprised that the lobby was nice and the staff was so-so (not terrible, but not overly friendly). I have to agree that the hallways were rather dingy(and kinda creepy) but not so bad that I feared for my safety or anything. My room was quite small, the bed was not very big, and I did not have a very nice view. My biggest issue in the room would have to be the thin walls. I could hear just about every word and every t.v coming from the rooms around me. That was just a little issue for me. However, there were not any rats, stray hairs, unusuall stains, or whatever else I was expecting. Granted it was not the cleanest room ever, but by no means was it "filthy" ( as I have read). If anything the worst part is that the hotel is sooo crowded. Getting on an elevator takes foreverrr, I seriously considered taking the steps 14 floors up, cause it got to be ridiculous. Overall, I would rate the hotel a C-. If you are looking for a pretty nice place for a longer stay, I would go somewhere else. If you just need a place for a night or two it's not so bad...and if you already booked the hotel, don't expect anything great, but by no means should you be nervous or afraid.. most reviews are exaggerated. My final thought... I booked a 2-star hotel and that's what I got!

Reviews.Title: “Well I thought it was just fine!”
Reviews.Author: Steve1804
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a friend's recommendation. I am very glad I didn't look at any of these reviews before I arrived. Large, old hotel with plenty of character (don't mean shabby and awful). Room was very comfortable. I did have a problem with the shower but the staff were helpful and it was sorted on the same day. View from my 11th floor room was outstanding...a very nice view of the Empire State. Location is excellent with Penn Station on the other side of the road. This must be one of the easiest hotels in midtown to get to from JFK. Catch the airtrain to Jamaica and then the Long Island Expressway to Penn Station. Total cost $12 peak time and it takes 30 min. Based on my experience I would recommend this hotel to anyone. For the price, location and character it's unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid it if you like modern conveniences.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The WORST. No A/C, no Internet connection, my "renovated" room had plaster falling off the walls and busted/missing baseboards, shower deviated between scalding and lukewarm. Never again. Location is good but the New Yorker is in the same area. Next time I'll try it since it CAN'T be any worse. Possibly the worst hotel experience I've encountered in 15 years of business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Pennsylvania Six Five Sucked Sucked Sucked”
Reviews.Author: PikePlaceTraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel may be immortalized in song, but its 21st century incarnation is AWFUL. The lobby is clean, but the hallways and rooms are utterly filthy. Once you step off the elevators, you may as well be visiting a fleabag motel off I-90 in the midwest somewhere. A complete ripoff...and I don't care about the ideal location or the storied history -- this hotel is being marketed as a great value and safe place to stay in NYC. FUGGEDABOUTIT. This place is a complete dive.

Reviews.Title: “We had Rats!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed in the hotel in mid feb 2005 and when we arrived and saw the lobby we thought it was gonna be a nice room how wrong we were. when we got to our room it was like being taken back to the 1930's it was dark and dissapointing but we thought its ok we only need to sleep here most of the time we'll be out until we got back one day 2 find that a rat had eaten some sweets we had in the room there was even tiny teeth marks in the chocolate, and when we went down to complain all they did was laugh. we will not be staying there again and do not recomend anyone that is visiting the city should stay there.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that contempts its guests?”
Reviews.Author: Hollander
Reviews.Content: With the risk of being repetitive, since my review won't be all the different from the ones before me. Unfortunately, I did not check this site before booking a room at the Pennsylvania. It would have saved us from one of the worst hotel-experiences so far, and we have traveled all continents. The basic foundation of any hotel should be: clean (hygienic), safe and value for money. With a budget hotel you cannot expect a swimming pool, fitness centre, room service and so on. You can however, even in the cheapest hotel, expect that rooms are well-cleaned and hygienic. The fact that hotel Penn. could only offer us rooms which contained mildew, heaps of dust, dirt and water/pee spots. Not to mention the presence of hair on the 'clean' sheets. The doors didn't appear to be burglar proof, but I immediately state that I am not an expert in this. Wallpaper was coming down at places in the hallway, it all looked shaby and unsafe. Strange, cause with its great location, this hotel could be a winner. It is however, not. The staff is not overly friendly, but when complaining about the room they swiftly relocated us to the next dirty room. An A for effort I guess. Is this all normal? I don't think so. Work in progress? Hardly, judging from the negative comments of other visitors that stretch a period of years now. It seems more like a choice of the management to simply ignore basic requirements and simply contempt and disregard its visiting guests. Unfortunately, so far out letter of complaint has not been answered yet by them. I would love to hear their view on these numerous complaints from people all over the world.

Reviews.Title: “Fine!...ok it's a bit old and shabby but in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pennsylvannia for 4 nights in May. Contrary to earlier reviews, we found the hotel reception staff very friendly and helpful. The room was on the 8th floor, and although somewhat shabby and aged decor, it was big with 2 double beds and clean. No noise disturbance from other guests or the street which was a surprise given the very central location. We probably only stayed in there to sleep but it was fine for the money and the location. Our tips; don't eat in the diner in hotel..it's double the price of other's out on the street and the easiest way to get back to the airport (JFK) is to take the train from Penn station (just over the road) to Jamaica and then get the new Airport sky train (total cost only $10) and took 40 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Someone Broke Into Our Room... While We Were In It”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After walking around with a friend who lives outside of the city and the two friends I went with, we decided to head back to our room. After a while of just sitting around, at about 4 AM, he decided to go home to get some sleep before he had to come back the next morning to be our tour guide again. It was just us three girls in the room. One friend slept on one bed and I shared with the other. I slept with my head at the foot end of the bed, so I could see the front door clearly. After being asleep for maybe an hour, I heard a slight noise coming from the door and somehow it woke me up. I lifted my head and a man was peeking his head in. With only a lap top light in the room, it was hard to tell what was going on, not to mention me being half asleep. I thought it might have been my friend coming back to stay with us because he missed his train. so I said, "Is that you?" the man stood there and looked at me for about 15 seconds, then he crept into the bathroom. I sat up and said quietly, "there's someone in the room you guys." the girl I was in the bed with got up and said something. the friend in the other bed woke up and thought I was just hearing things, so she got up to look in the bathroom. she saw him and immediately started screaming, which started a chain reaction of screaming girls. we thought maybe someone would hear us and bust in to save us. he just sat in the bathroom. one of the girls went to call 911 and tried to turn on the lamp by the beds... it didn't work. we just dialed 0 to get the front desk. when someone finally answered, my friend said, "THERE'S SOMEONE IN OUR ROOM, WE NEED HELP." she was told to "hold on" and while she was on hold, she heard the person who answered say, "guess who it is." it took them at least 10 minutes to send someone from security up to the room. after about 3 minutes, my other friend used her cell phone to call NYPD. they got there just before the hotel's security arrived at our door. somewhere in between all this, the guy who snuck into the room snuck back out. the man from security, who was a little creepy-looking, seemed to have an attitude with us because we called the cops. so the real cops left and the man from security took us up to a different room going through some back elevators that were really creepy. the security man was asking us questions about the person and they decided it was probably housekeeping. excuse me? I didn't know housekeeping just walked into peoples rooms and had afros and wore neon orange t-shirts and jeans for uniforms! and apparently, the same thing had happened the night before because the lock on the door was broken! we had to call my friend to come back and stay in the new room with us because we were still so shooken up. needless to say, we were not charged for the night. we spent the rest of our nights with the friend who lives nearby. I was so scared the rest of our trip. I must have only got about 8 hours of sleep the entire time. so, the location and prices are really good, but it's not worth it. who knows what would have happened had I not been woken up by the door?

Reviews.Title: “Oh My God ...”
Reviews.Author: Bonnsoir
Reviews.Content: What can I say ... except I wish I'd known about TripAdvisor before I booked for the Pennsylvania. Mind it was a bit naive to think it would be great just because Glenn Miller and his Orchestra stayed and played there - in all honesty ... that and the hotel location ARE the ONLY things going for it. I agree that the lobby was great but oh-so deceptive as when you got off the lift and onto the hallways ... well, I thought I was in a different hotel. The stains on the carpets / walls / ceilings were v.scary and led me to wonder just what had been going on @ this hotel ... immediate visions of pimps & murderers sprang to mind ... and I'm not a paranoid person. It got worse tho ... the rooms ... UGH! Stains were NO better and the furniture was like someting out of a bad 70's porno ... call me old-fashioned but peeling, filthy wallpaper just ain't my style. Anyway, got the room changed which was marginally better (nice beige, neutral tones as opposed to the grey / pink / splatter / strangely floral look of the previous room) ... some attempt @ rennovation had been made tho the square patch of "old" paint on the wall where the previous mirror had been was quite amusing. The bathroom was clean as were the beds but the carpets ... well, I didn't care to look that closely after the 1st room. If I'd gotten this room in the first instance, I probably wouldn't have minded so much ... even not being able to close the window wasn't so bad in the end. On my return to the UK - a conversation with a colleague led to the discovery that he had also stayed there years before ... we didn't need to say much about it, the knowing glances said it all. So there you go ... not a lot being done by the hotel / management to improve the situation.

Reviews.Title: “Dang!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although the lobby was crowded it was very grand and nice...just like the web site picture. This was when the horror began........after exiting the time machine (elevator) we felt like we were in the movie "The Shining"!!! The green glow from the hallways went well with the mold on the ceilings, walls, curtains, bathroom, floor, and decorative sphere on the TV. The shower was reminicent of my elementary school camping years. The yellow stains on the sheets were also reminicent of my elementary school days!!! After immeadiately leaving to change our hotel room, a housekeeper told us "we'd be better off asking for Section 8!!!" After Yen "upgraded" our room, we received a larger version of the first; RIPPED CURTAINS, WINDOWS WOULDN'T OPEN, NO AC, STAINED SHEETS, DIRT, CAMPING BATHROOM, RIPPED CARPET. Needless to say, two hours later we switched hotels for slightly more a night. Our experience would explain the crowded lobby with other hotel guests waiting to leave just like us.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money - Excellant location”
Reviews.Author: Dawn73
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend stayed in this hotel in January 2005- apologies as haven't got around to writing until now. We stayed for 9 nights in january and despite the rain had a fantastic time! We read the terrible reviews and approached the hotel with a great deal of trepidation, however i can safely say that previous reviews were somewhat exaggerated and the hotel more than met our needs. We arrived and yes, did have to be moved from the first room we were placed in. As other reviewers have mentioned it was almost as though reception were testing us- with a small room that stank of smoke and looked out onto a brick wall. Once we complained about the first room we were moved to a perfectly adequate room that looked out onto Macy's! I am certain that if we had asked to be moved again we would have been given a better room but at the end of the day we were exhausted from travelling and settled on the 9th floor. Things to note- the location is fantastic. Madison Sq gardens just over the road- beware of the touts selling tickets outside the hotel- they are more or less the same price in the ground and guarenteed genuine. Macy's is literally two mins walk away- great for stocking up on shopping- tip for any brits visiting- if you visit the customer services desk they'll give you an overseas discount card (when you show your passport) allowing a further 15% discount off all purchses- well worth it! Hote is also just over the road from subway- saver for feet after you've been walking for hours. The empire state building is approx 5 mins walk from the hotel and times square 10 mins. This really was a great location as we found that we could walk down broadway to little italy and china town but could also walk uptown to MOMA, central park etc. Yes the room s aren't great but we had large TV, clean bathroom (free toiletries replaced every day) maid service was excellant- cleared up our shopping bags and misc rubbish every day. Bed was very small but hey, we were happy to cuddle! Tips for NYC- Zagat guide is great for searching out good restaurants, national history museam free in evenings- bargain! Bloomingdales v expensive compared to saks and macy's. You must take the free staten island ferry to statue of liberty- just as good as the trips. Be prepared for tipping everywhere. Don't take shampoo, shower gel etc,- it's riduculously cheap and comes in huge bottles over in states. Century 21 is a massive discount store next to ground zero- my boyfriend bought DKNY ties for $10 each.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT GOING BACK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked to stay at this at this hotel in december after reading review was very worried,tried to change but unable to after arriving at this hotel was very suprised as i really loved it, location 10 out of 10 service excellent rooms basis but for,such a well price mid town location well worth it. My advised to anyone complaining pay more to go somewhere else!!! I myself and my friends who travelled will be returning this december and very excetied... p.s excellent location (macys) right next door

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, be prepared to request a different room!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just spent 7 nights at the Hotel Pennslyvania, although on first impressions Hotel Translyvannia may be more appropriate! We were recommended this hotel by a Travel Agent who had stayed there previously so thought that it would be ok. We booked before reading the reviews on Tripadvisor which made me very apprehensive but I thought I would go with an open mind and as we were not expecting much being 2 star. We arrived about 2am Saturday Morning, to be told that we were allocated a room with only one bed, the receptionist managed to find us another room which was on the 17th floor. When the elevator doors opened we were very nervous, the corridor was poorly lit and need of redecoration. We eventually found our room (this hotel has over 1000 rooms & corridors are vast) the doors looked like a cross between coffins and fridge freezers..very strange. We dreaded opening the door to our room and rightly so. Albeit a very large room, it was a smoking room, which we had not requested, there were no ceiling lights, just bedside lights and table lamps, the curtains had long been ripped down, the blinds were hanging off and the nets were grey from smoke. The wallpaper was peeling off, there were no headboards, the ceiling looked water damaged with plaster peeling off etc and the bathroom walls and ceiling were covered with mold infested wallpaper. Positive note.. shower was powerful. As it was so late we decided to brave the night as the beds were clean and comfy. In the morning we headed straight to reception to complain. The clerk 'Yen' didn't seem at all surprised we were complaining, the only worrying thing was he couldn't find our booking, and he told us that floors 16 & 17 were closed and to come back after 1pm as he had no other rooms available. We went back, got given another room, on the 7th floor with one king bed! We thought if the room was better we would be willing to share... we said we would check it out first before accepting it...well the room was worse it was tiny no bath just a shower, even more mold, plaster was flaking off the walls, the bedcover was dirty and stained, so we went straight back. This time they found us a twin room which was acceptable, a little mold on the bathroom ceiling but this is due to the inadequate ventilation in the bathroom. The walls had scuff marks on them, but apart from that, a good room for a 2 star hotel, (looks like the standard room on the website but needs painting again, as these rooms were renovated 5 years ago, the clerks confirmed this and also that not all the floors were renovated and it is still undergoing renovation). When we were moving our stuff out of the original room we were talking to one of the cleaners she said that floor 17 was having all the furnture replaced and we shouldn't have been given this room in the first place. We told her that our new room was on floor 9 (981) and she said ah yes this is a lot better. The only problem was that we were above a building sight and they started work as early as 2am in the morning. Good view of the Empire States building though! My overall opinion is that the hotel is in a great & safe location, 5 minute walk to timesquare, we walked everywhere and at the end of the day, the beds were comfortable and clean and the room & bathroom was cleaned daily with fresh towels. It is worth while keep going back to reception and requesting a different room as they do not mind changing them for you and eventually you will get something acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Hated it!”
Reviews.Author: lshelley218
Reviews.Content: I wish I would have listened to the reviews. This hotel was nothing but problems for us. First we were given a room that was completely demolished and was under renovations. Oops. Then the next room had stains on the furniture, peeling wallpaper, smelled of smoke and was so scary that we slept with the bathroom light on. I can't forget to mention the mouse that found its way into our room and decided to greet us. We were then given another room which was much better but after my experience at this hotel, I would never stay there again! The only good thing about it was the bar connected to the hotel where we met some some great people.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Pennsylvania is A Disgrace to New York's Image”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First of all the hallways were very dreary and scary to say the least, I felt like I was on my way to my cell instead of hotel room. Then God help when I finally reached room 1260, the door was thick, iron, dented, rusted and built like a vault. When I entered the room I was so disgusted with its decor and uncleanliness (rust everywhere, water stains, view of a building's wall, curtains were half hung, and green dingy, hard towels to say the least). I was so disgusted and afraid that something would come crawling out the bed or the floor, that I sat up in the chair and refused to sleep that night. I told my firm about my experience and the attorneys refuse to use this hotel EVER AGAIN!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a great price”
Reviews.Author: catbee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I found this hotel on the web. It is directly across from Maddison Square Gradens and is great for a couple of nights stay in the Big Apple. After all who wants to stay indoors in New York.... It is basic, has great little coffee shop and at the end of a long day, a clean room. Cathy Northern Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Despite some bad reviews, we found this hotel to be fine. We stayed there for 5 nights - 3 of us shared a double room, which was spacious. The room itself was clean and was cleaned daily. Shower and bathroom facilities were fine. The room looked a little shabby but apart from this was perfect for the price we paid. You could not get a better location in NYC. Madison Sq Gardens is opposite the hotel and Macys, Empire State just minutes away. Most attractions/shopping areas were within walking distance and it was perfect to go back to this hotel and dump bags there and head back out again. Food wise, we found it better to eat in nearby cafes/diners than to eat in the restaurants in the hotel complex though it was handy to have a coffee shop in the hotel to get take out teas/coffees etc. Overall, we had a great experience here and would come back and stay again! Would recommend it for a budget hotel and perfect for a few days shopping in the city!!

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is AWFUL!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL! It is filthy and the rooms have mold on the ceilings! It smells and the staff is NOT HELPFUL! I will never recommend this hotel or stay here ever again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't worry”
Reviews.Author: the2scots
Reviews.Content: I am grading this as above average as after reading other reviews it is. The room we had was clean and cleaned every day. The house staff were friendly. We didn't have a great view from the window but didn't spend a great deal of time in the room anyway. We only paid £420 for the week for two of us and we would go back again and plan to later this year. So don't worry or be put off, It's fine

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel we have ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place deserves no stars, but that's not an option, sadly. This hotel is the worst piece of garbage ever constructed. All this talk of "you're going to be in the city; how much time are you going to spend in your hotel?" is absurd. If you're going to spend the whole day walking around NYC, you need a decent place to sleep or you're going to get progressively more sore and tired as the days pass. You are not going to get a decent night's sleep at the Hotel Pennsylvania, AKA The World's Worst Hotel. The beds are not just bad, they are substandard. Are you comfortable sleeping on a slab of concrete covered by a sheet? Then book away. Do you enjoy sleeping in a room with a door and walls so thin you can hear everything that goes on on your floor? Then this is the place! Do you enjoy rude front desk employees, peeling paint, stained carpet and bedding, and pipes that make noise? Then you've found your hotel. If you don't enjoy any of these things, then please, for the love of everything, stay somewhere else. Anywhere else. I seriously had a better night's sleep the last time I slept outside for concert tickets.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It is not cheap. I paid C$240 (tax & services charge included) for two nights. The carpet was dirty and the bed sucks! There was water stain near the window. The bath room was a joke. I am glad I only suffered for two nights.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I needed - and even better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel for a 2*. My husband and I stayed at Pennsylvania for 7 nights and I was dreading it after reading the reviews on here. Lobby is very impressive. I arrived early and check in wasn't until 3.00. Didn't have any problems with long queues. I was checked in to a room on the 8th floor. Very big and spacious, huge King size bed, walk in dresser and deccorated a little dated (flowery) but this made it homely. The bathroom was quite small but you only go in there to wash and use the toilet. Everything was clean, towels changed daily and bedding. Bed was very comfy and we had a huge TV with lots of channels. Staff were very friendly, including house keeping and the hotel is in a perfect spot, very close to everything. If you take the train from the airport it takes you straight to Penn station, which is directly across the road. Please don't be put off by all the negative reviews, This is a 2* not 4* I thing the others expectations are to high. It is a lovely old hotel and at the end of the day, you will be exploring the city and spending little time in your room. Don't opt for breakfast and Lindys at the hotel, there are very cheap deli's all over where you can get a coffee and bagel for $1.50. Excellent one on east 30th street called chez gourmaiz

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Penn”
Reviews.Author: TravellingMam
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems to certainly pack them in. The beautiful foyer was heaving on arrival, we were issued our keys and set off to our floor. I can only imagine that each floor has a different pay scale as the room we were assigned wouldn’t have been fit for a business traveller. The corridors are straight outta The Shining which was pretty ace after a night on the tiles but the room was totally shocking… The bed was grim the furniture looked like it’d be grabbed from a skip, the carpet was stained with what could have been Jack Nickolson’s blood.... we could hear everything going on next door but hey its New York, if you cant beat them join them. I don’t think I’d stay there again, its just a shame the Chelsea Star was fully booked.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel- Great Holiday”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to write a review on this web page because of all the bad stuff i heard on this site , i read so much bad stuff about this hotel and was expecting the worst. I stayed on the fifteeth floor. The Room was great and hotel staff were great ( apart from having to wait ages to get stuff out of THE FREE SAFTY DEPOSIT BOX). Everything was fine- Its not the Plaza but its clean and safe dry and nice rooms with clean bathrooms. If you want a safe and great location hotel stay at the HOTEL PENNSYLVANIA

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel experience I have ever had in my life. Worse than the motels on the highway. The room we first walked into was disgusting. Nothing was fully cleaned. There was still comet or something in and on the toliet. There were dirty tissues on the floor. There were stains all over the floor. The comforter was so gross, with stains all over in, including some food stains that hadn't been cleaned yet. I couldn't even put my stuff down because of what all I could imagine getting on it. So, we went downstairs and asked for a different room. We got the "manager's pick" which was a complete dump as well. The door of the room was falling apart, as included pictures shows. The floor still had stains all over it. The best part was the pull out couch which had iron burns all over it. The TV remote didn't work at all and the TV barely worked because the buttons on the TV were broken. The comforters were still stained. The only good thing was at least in this room there were no dirty tissues on the floor. We kept the light and tv on all night in fear of rats and roaches. The rooms are huge, the second room even had a walk in closet, so I don't understand why they don't keep them up.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was fine, cheap.”
Reviews.Author: mjgalway
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights just before Christmas 2003. It looks OK from the outside, even the reception area looks impressive. We were given a room on the 14th floor, whe we got up to it, it was not very good at all, it was quite small and it was just a bit grubby and the curtains were dirty. My girlfriend was quite upset with it so we went back down and complained and there were no questions asked they just put us in a different room on the 9th floor, which was much nicer. Huge bed, huge TV, clean bathroom, very satisfied with our second room. Some staff were quite helpful, others were not. Unfortunately, my girlfriend suffered an accident while we were there (not in the hotel), torn ligaments in her ankle and could not walk towards the end. I requested a wheelchair to take her down to the lobby so she could go to the hospital, and they only had 2, for approx 3,500 guests and both were missing, not happy with that. They did arrange for her to go down on a bellcart and the bellboy was very helpful, which was acceptable. They even tried to charge me for a late checkout after saying that it was no problem in the circumstances to have it for free. However, I wouldn't discount the hotel because of our unfortunate circumstances, it is a fantastic location, across from Madison Square Garden, next to Macy's and 8 blocks from Times Square, 1 block from Penn Station. It was cheap although it the price seems to be creeping up a small bit. I would advise anyone to stay here, because you'll save money and there are loads of other things in New York to spend it on. But, if you get a bad room, do go and complain because I got the feeling that they'll try and stick you in a bad one first to fill it up, but they will have no problem changing you around to a different room.

Reviews.Title: “Run....there are other hotels for the same price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I keep seeing people talking about how cheap it is to stay here......."so they say get over the mold!" We stayed there less than 24 hours and were charged $374.60! I don't think that's BUDGET! Yes, we checked out the next day......yes, two different rooms......horrible smell......ceiling falling down........furniture that should be put out for the trash (if it was no one would pick it up, it's not even fit to sell at a garage sale). Let me expain....no drawer handles, broken legs, the dresser tops were broken off. The sheets were so worn and rotten they were filled with holes. The pictures you see are real, the stories you hear are true! The first time I talked to the desk clerk, I was told............."These are the types of rooms hotels contracts for, if you have a problem...call them." Hotels got me a different room......same quality. Since we were there for 10 days, we found another hotel. Won't book on hotels again, cost too much!Won't EVER go back to the Pennsylvania Hotel, Central Park really is better! There might be nice rooms here, but why chance it, especially if you have your family with you? I really think the people who had nice rooms were real lucky or are employess and others who were paid to give this place a good rating! BEWARE!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Vidalia08
Reviews.Content: When we booked this hotel we were told by the travel agent that it wasn't a luxury hotel by any means but it was in a fantastic position, it was a safe area for walking round as a family and it was clean. And that is exactly what we got. The kids room with twin beds was far nicer than ours, with lovely old furniture and an amazing view and our double room was melamine furniture with a view of a wall but we were out exploring the city from 8am to 10pm and just wanted to sleep when we got back so anything more luxurious would have been wasted on us. It was clean and warm and I'd recommend it for a safe budget hotel for a weekend family trip.

Reviews.Title: “Only Location and Access”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: You may go there, but do not wish all expect the location and the access. It is true that all of the rooms are not clean. It does not matter,because I only sleep and take a shower in the hotel. All of my important time was spent outside. If you would stay a cheep hotel, which has a bath, I recommend there. You may be able to get a room under $100 per day in Net. Do your best!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself and two friends went to New York on 1 April 2005 and stayed at this hotel for four nights. After reading some of the reviews on this website we were worried at to what awaited us however we were plesantly suprised. Our room was clean, bright and spacious - more than double the size of some rooms in New York that I have stayed in and we were given fresh towels and bedding daily. No more horror stories on dirty bathrooms and mouldy floors to report I'm afraid! Staff were curteous and helpful and more than happy to arrange our trips out etc -the head porter even phoned a club and managed to get us a q-jumper and us all in for free on a Saturday night!! All in all a good budget hotel in an excellent and somewhere where I would certainley stay again.

Reviews.Title: “for budget travellers”
Reviews.Author: NikiXO
Reviews.Content: Do you know that a room at the YMCA is more expensive for a family of three? Also, I recently paid $90 for a room for two with one double bed and a shared bath. I checked on hostelworld and you can't even get a room at most hostels for this price. You cannot find another room in MIDTOWN for three or four people at this rate. I paid $116 per night for a "superior room" for three people (March 28-31). Small and outdated but clean. No big problems. EXCELLENT LOCATION. Helpful staff-guess you just have to show respect when you ask for help. Maybe a lot of reviewers have never been to Manhattan before. This is DIRT CHEAP for a hotel room in Midtown with a private bath that accomodates more than 2 people. You should pay more if you want luxury. Or stay in an outlying area. I can't figure what some of these reviewers were expecting for such a ridiculously low price. Plus, sooooooo many people from various countries stay here...it's fascinating to talk to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Ever”
Reviews.Author: araineri
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel experience ever. The room was a shamble. The heat wouldn't shut off so we had to open the window. There was water stains on the ceilings. The wall paper was peeling off of the walls. The tv was the size of a shoe box with no remote. I would definitely not recommend this hotel to anyone - Don't be deceived by the lobby it is nothing like the rest of the hotel. You are better off staying out all night than staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away from Hotel Pennsylvania - The Owners Have No Integrity”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The web site fools you completely. I stayed at Hotel Pennsylvania from Wednesday, March 30, 2005 and checked out on Saturday, April 2, 2005. You may be wondering why did I stay so long if I considered it awful. Because I was with a group of 21 people from Michigan that prepaid for the trip. This hotel came "highly" recommended from the travel agency in Michigan which went through an agency in New York. Not only will I ever go through the travel agency again, but I will shout to the rooftops not to stay at this hotel. Yes, the location was a good one, but you could easily walk to different locations because the streets are not long at all, or you could quickly catch a subway, bus, or cab to where you want to go. As far as I'm concerned, Vornado Realty Trust (the hotel owner indicated on their website) and the managers have no integrity. I say this because it is no way that they would stay at a place with blood-like stains on the floor, sink, and shower curtain, mold in the shower, rust on the vents, stains on the lamp shade and telephone, carpet that causes you to never walk barefoot, stained walls, peeling wallpaper in the hallway, duct tape keeping the hallway carpet together (in plain site), and decrepit doors. Not only was the entire room decrepit, but the entire floor was decrepit. Mind you, I was with 21 other people. There were three of us in the room. If you risk going to the Hotel Pennsylvania, view the rooms or floors first. They actually have crappy floors, meaning that all the rooms are similar by the floor. I was on the 3rd floor. My last day, after hearing that one of the people in my group went and complained for the 2nd time and insisted that the manager walk up with her to view the room that they placed her in after her first complaint, she finally received a decent room after initially being placed in a room that looked as if yellow crime scene tape should be placed around it (that is how she described it), we decided to take a look at her final room. It was very small, but cute. She had a bathtub and shower with minimal mold (I feel all hotels should pull out tile in the bathroom if they are not going to take the time to clean it properly). She had a cherry oak headboard and small entertainment center that held her television. She also had a clock/radio and refrigerator. It took her to complain two times in order to get a decent room. This room was located on the 6th floor. We were on the 3rd floor and had none of these things. And don't think it got better the higher you went because the 18th floor seemed crappy too. We walked around on a few floors as housekeeping was cleaning the rooms. Now the person that gave this hotel a decent review because they've stayed in crappier hotels, I feel sorry for him/her. But I have traveled on business for years and this was supposed to be a leisure trip so I'm assuming my expectations are either much higher or his/her expectations are lower because of the experiences. And since I travel so much, I will make sure that my previous employer and current employer know to stay away from this hotel. Yes, they have nice rooms, but Vornado Realty Trust should not be trusted. After returning home, I noticed that their website does not describe the amenities in the Standard rooms. This seems to be the "type" of room that we had. On the site, the pillows on the bed are covering up the fact that you do not have a headboard and that the walls are stained. You also do not see the bathroom for these "standard" rooms. And the lighting is not an accurate account on the website compared to what was our reality. Stay away, stay away, stay away. And if you have invested in Vornado Realty Trust, you are investing with a company that has no integrity. On the home (main) page of their site, in the second paragraph, they state "Inside of New York's Hotel Pennsylvania, you'll find beautifully renovated rooms, with new furniture and carpeting, a work desk with reading lamp, large color televisions, AM/FM clock radios, telephones with voice mail, individual AC and climate control are only featured in select New York City hotels." We should have assumed "compared to what." Well, we found out it that it was compared to the crappy rooms that they have. Read between the lines. You will find these renovated rooms, but you may not get one. This is an integrity issue displayed on their website. On the Accommodations page, it states in the second paragraph "The comfort and security of our guests are always important to us." Maybe the security because they have a security guard by the elevators, but definitely not the comfort. We were guests and our comfort did not seem to be important because they would not have placed us in a room like that. Again, proving their lack of integrity. I was not comfortable enough to step in the shower barefoot, therefore I constantly called housekeeping to bring extra towels, lay them in the shower and on the bathroom floor in order to avoid contact with any surface. And if I did, I would rewash that spot that touched the surface. Does that seem comfortable? We were so uncomfortable that we avoided the room as much as possible. The only good thing I have to say about the staff is that the man that brought me extra towels each morning seemed nice and the lady in housekeeping that I called to request for the towels would say "right away mam." Also, the people at the information desk seemed nice and helpful. We would sit in the lobby if we knew we were not going right up to bed. And now that I think about it, maybe I can assume that most of the people that sat in the lobby had rooms on at least the 3rd and 18th floor (the crappy floors that we saw). We were not comfortable at all. This is still fresh in my mind and although my description may seem over-the-top, we were the ones that stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel rooms i've ever entered”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This must be the worst hotel room I have experienced. We were given a room which when we entered I new I would not be staying here. The sheets were grey (probably white at some stage in there lifetime), the bathroom was mouldy, doorframes rotten and the shower tray black with dirth. Went to reception and complained, we were then given a second room which had clean sheets and bathroom was cleaner but still had mould on walls, courtins would not close and blind was old and dusty. In my opinion this is the worst hotel you could ever stay in. Take my advice and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Pennsylvania stay was miserable”
Reviews.Author: karissa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Pennsylvania for 4 miserable nights. Found out about this site only 4 days before our trip. Read the terrible reviews about the hotel so tried to book with other hotels but could not get a comparible price. So called the hotel with our concerns and was assured that the people that write those reviews request the cheapest room available and get "unrenovated" rooms, and that since we had booked through a web travel agency we would be assured a "renovated" room. We decided to take our chances and stay there. Big Mistake!!! Our room had mold on the bathroom ceiling and tiles and the paint was chipping of the ceiling. The toilet leaked. The curtains were torn and filthy. Shower curtain was filthy. This was the first hotel I stayed in that I felt dirtier after showering than before. There was vomit on the floor in front of a tenth floor elevator that despite 2 phone calls to Housekeeping and then the front desk did not get cleaned up for over 2 days. This was all shared with the manager who seemed unconcerned about the problems and more concerned about getting off the phone and rid of me.(would not meet face to face with me). Lesson Learned: It's better to pay $100-$150 more a night for a nice, clean room.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Pennsylvania”
Reviews.Author: Madramsfan
Reviews.Content: This is just a quick update so that you can see the photographs I took back in April, 2004. P.S. - if anybody needs more information send me an e-mail.

Reviews.Title: “Putting your mind at rest!!!!”
Reviews.Author: challis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Pennsylvania last year. You do get what you pay for! It's basic but clean. We didn't like the first room we were given and were moved straight away, no questions asked. The location is fab and to be honest, you don't spend much time in the hotel anyway!! New York is fab and a brown carpet and small room wouldn't put me off going back!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: someguy_2005
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in August 2004 for 7 nights. I will echo the views of previous reviewers. The location is second to none for a budget hotel. The rooms are very basic, not very clean and a bit dull. My advice would be to stay here if you are on a budget, not very particular about the hotel room and want a convienient location. Don't stay here if you expect or can afford the 4 seasons. Personally i would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Prime Place”
Reviews.Author: brooklyn james
Reviews.Content: I have been to the Hotel Pennsylvania three times in the last 2 1/2 years and I will be going back again in May. The rooms and bathrooms are kept up daily by the housekeeping staff. I have had no problem with rusty water, dirty floors, filthy sheets or unmade beds (try leaving a couple of bucks on the bed for housekeeping and you might see a difference!!!) Check in time is 3:00pm. The people who are complaining that they get there at noon and have to wait 3 hours should check the hotel policy. (By the way most hotels are 3:00pm check in time.) The hotel is in a prime location, Madison Square Garden is right across the street, Macy's department store is 2 blocks north, Times Square is 7 blocks north, the Empire State building in 4 blocks east and the world famous Blarney Stone Authentic Irish Bar and Grill is just a 1/2 a block away on W. 32nd st. You should stop in and ask for Martin at night. Anyway, I am more than pleased with the Pennsylvania and get wait to go back in May.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it... Go Elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: davidt0526
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice now, and hated it both times. Because of Hotel Penn's price, I decided to give it a second chance after the first stay. Bad Idea. I go to NYC about every month, so I know about other hotels to give a fair comparison. Sure, it's in a good location across from Penn Station in lower Midtown, but look around the area, there are many more hotels in the same appx. area. Based on my two stays here (In the past 4 months), this is the rundown: Upon walking in the hotel, notice the amount of people sitting around in the lobby. Hundreds of people just waiting to check in because rooms are not ready yet. Be prepared to wait in line for at least 30 minutes to simply check in, if they have a room available. After checking in and heading to elevator area, notice the sign saying "No Alcoholic Beverages Beyond this point." I'll talk about this more later. After getting to my floor (the 13th floor that is... hmmmm... most half decent places don't have a 13th floor) I immediately noticed the Coffin like doors, peeling wallpaper, and smell of vomit. Got to room, was not too bad until I went in the bathroom. Mold was all over the ceiling of the bathroom. Both times I have stayed at Hotel Penn, I have gotten sick. I believed it to be food poisining until the second stay, and am now thinking it was the Hotel. I really wish I would have taken pictures of the mold to post on this site... Beds are very uncomfortable. Heater makes tons of noise, and the temperature knob could not be adjusted in ours. After 5 minutes of the heater being on, it must have gotten to be 80 degrees in our room. After a call to the front desk about issues, they say they would be happy to move us to another room, but they don't have one available, and they "couldn't do anything about the mold." Bottom line, go someplace else, and spend a little more money. This place is a nightmare. Club Quarters Midtown is nice, and not much more money.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel specifically because of it's superb location, and Madison Square Gardens venue right across the road where I had tickets for a band. Was taken aback at the splendour of the huge, glistening lobby. Found my room to be quite large compared to other more expensive hotels I've stayed in, in this city. Apart from the brown carpet (not my colour) I thought the room to be very clean, spacious and cosy. I had all the room facilities I needed - iron, hairdryer, bath AND shower, tv and radio. For the excellent rates I paid, I can not fault this place one bit, in fact I've told anyone I know who is thinking of going to New York - to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “A Trip to the Twilight Zone”
Reviews.Author: hbg2pgh
Reviews.Content: I was a part of a group that stayed at this hotel for a weekend getaway. When we arrived in the lobby it was absolutely beautiful. The elevators were equipped with televisions so that you could watch CNN on the way to our floor. When you stepped off of the elevator, that's when you entered the TWILIGHT ZONE! We went to our rooms...it smelled, was dirty and just old. And we were in the newly renovated wing. There were no towels and it took us hours to receive them. I had a bed that looked like it had been slept in, so I called maid service to have it changed, and was reprimanded by the maid on duty. My friends and I couldn't even get a good night sleep because we were so uncomfortable. We then had native New Yorkers visit us at the hotel, they were so excited because they heard so many wonderful things about this hotel, until they too entered the TWILIGHT ZONE!!! My only advice after this experience is to enter at your own risk!!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Date of Staty 3/18/05 All the negative reviews are correct. This is one of the worst hotels out there. Arrived around 1 pm. The bellman took the bags and brought me to the check in area. He never told me that we could not check in early. There were no signs indicating only checkin after 3 pm. Waited a half hour and was greeted by a miserable front desk clerk who advised us we could not check in. I requested to check my bags and was told that it would cost $4 per bag and I had to walk down into the basement to check the bags. The room was like a cell block with cinder block walls, 13 inch tv that did not work, filthy bathtub filled with rust and threadbare towels. The beds were clean thank heaven! There was no security when we returned to the room at 1 am checking to make sure we were guests. I expected a tourist class hotel, but it did not even make that grade. The only positive is the location in midtown. I am glad we were just staying one night. If longer, I would have had to change hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Fair deal at the Hotel Penn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My group of five friends were very nervous to stay at this hotel after reading such poor reviews on this site. But the price was right and the location was good. Much to our surprise, everything exceeded our expectations. Make no mistake, the place is OLD- but it was clean, with decent water pressure and out suite was v. spacious. We had a junior suite with 4 single beds. For it being our first time in NYC- the location was great for site seeing. We were on the 16th floor and the elevators weren't that slow either. Dont be expecting amazing, but its also not the dive that we thought it would be. I would definitely stay here again. But don't eat at the restaurant at the hotel- its v. expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here! It is a Pig Sty.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are not picky in anyway. This hotel is the most horrible thing we have ever seen. Homeless shelters are fancier and cleaner. Do not be fooled by the lobby or the exterior. The front desk hates working there and it is apparent in their customer service. It was so bad, that we thought we were on some Candid Camera type show. We were waiting for the host of the TV show to surprise it with "We got you!"

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Penn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked on Hotels. I specifically booked a room type and also called to confirm and when I arrived did not get the room type. After ------ at the never friendly staff, they upgraded me to a suite!. The suite had cracks in the walls, stained furniture, badly stained carpets, as well as filthy windows. Rusty and dusty ac nosiy AC units... ah welcome back to NYC city! I paid $150 per night. Very cheap for NYC. Very large room though..... Will never go back, or book a room on Hotels again. Paul

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location!”
Reviews.Author: Smudger579
Reviews.Content: Ok, so the hotel isn't the best in town but the location is excellent! We were three ladies heading for New York for some shopping and site-seeing. I admit our first impressions of our room wasn't good but after a close inspection of the beds and testing of the shower and toilet, we were pretty happy. The beds were clean, the shower was hot and the toilet flushed. What more do you want for that price! We hardly spent anytime in the hotel anyway. The hotel staff we very nice and friendly. There was security staff in the lobby so you did feel safe. The security deposit boxes provided by the hotel were free, provided you didn't lose the key then you would have to pay $100. All in all a good value for money hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, disgusting pit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Worst rooms i've ever seen - smelly, dirty, tub chipped and cracked. I did not want to touch anything. Hotel is extremely understaffed and the staff it does have is rude and unhelpful. We relocated to a Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Not Hot!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After a long flight and long queues at the airport we arrived at the hotel at about 1pm only to stumble upon another massive queue for check in! The hotel lobby was quite impressive apart from the hundreds of people and luggage sprawled all over the place. We waited for about half an hour before we were given our key by a very rude member of staff. We made our own way up to our room which was on the 15th floor. The hotel corridors were not good, obviously not been vacuumed for years, wall paper pealing off the wall and disgusting carpets! The door to our room looked like it had been kicked in several times which was not encouraging! The room was basic, bed was small for a double, we had an air conditioning vent right out side our window that hummed all night long, bathroom was ok but shower was very unpredictable (went from hot to cold for no apparent reason)! When we checked out they tried to charge us an extra check out fee of $40.00, which we were never informed of. Because of this they didn't charge us in the end, but do watch out for it. The only good thing about the hotel is the location. My advice to anyone that is thinking of staying here and likes their creature comforts, is pay the extra and stay in nice, well maintained hotel with friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible place”
Reviews.Author: CathyBethlehem
Reviews.Content: Due to bad weather we were stuck in the city and got a reservation here. After a 45 minute wait to check in (during which a man came down and said he had made four calls to report that not only did his heat not work, but his heater was taken apart, and had gotten no action) we finally got checked in. The hotel is so big it is like a maze getting to your room. The doors look like old fashioned refridgerators. We finally made it to our room only to discover a very small outdated bad smelling room with a window that was wide open and could not be closed. We were there due to snow and high winds so you can imagine the temperature in the room with the window open. Luckily we had booked with American Express, we called them and they got us another hotel that night. I would never stay there. IT was horrible. I wasn't expecting fancy, but I was expecting clean and heated.

Reviews.Title: “hated it”
Reviews.Author: colby
Reviews.Content: my husband and i have just came back from there it was terrible , dirty , paper and paint peeling from walls and ceiling,plus holes in walls,carpets filthy and threadbare,i did not sleep whilst there as would not sleep in the bed .

Reviews.Title: “smoke gets in your eyes”
Reviews.Author: Louisa847
Reviews.Content: I was really worried about this hotel after reading the reviews. Some of my worries were justified. When we checked in there was no line, but when we got out on the second floor my heart sunk. The wallpaper was peeling off the walls in the hall and some of the doors were rusty and looked liked the had been forced. Our room was large but none of the lights were working, and it stunk of ciggarette smoke, it was dirty,smelled of damp and had a huge brown stain and part of the tiling was hanging down. We had paid for what was called a 'standard special' website which was described a recently refurbished. This wasn't. We went down to recption where our room was changed to the type we had actually paid for. This was on the fifth floor. It was alot better. Again the room smelled of ciggarettes and was smaller, but it was clean and had been refurbished. However we still wern't completly happy but the hotel now didn't care. We were told that this was one of the better rooms and that a refund wasn't the hotels responsiblity, but the firm we had booked with online. The hotel had our money and didn't give a damm. Apprantly the refurbishment was done six years ago which seems to conflict with what other reviewers have said. Maybe the hotel cant get thier stories streight. After a good nights sleep (as the beds were comfy) we decided to stay in our room as the smoke smell was getting less and it meant we could spend more money on the important things like having a good time. To give that room it's dues it ha really comfy beds and a great shower. The only problem was some peeling paint in the bathroom and the smell of smoke. However when you have bad jet lag and have been on a flight for 7 hours the last thing you want to deal with is problems with the hotel. I wouldn't stay in this hotel again. Somtimes it's not worth the hassle.

Reviews.Title: “"It's worth the money & not a dumpster"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Penn a while ago and I just want to say, if I go back to NYC I will be staying there again. Good price, great location. Right across from Madison Square Garden, the train stations are right across the street, wonderful shopping, a short little hop down to times square. This is not a 5 star by any means but I certainly recommend it to those who go the NYC to shop.
