The room was clean, the bed sheets were clean, the pillows comfy, the room was a good temperature, the bathroom was well maintained. The only problem was the water wasn't staying at a constant temp, it would get hot then luke warm, hot again. It never got so hot that I was scolded but that was the ONLY downfall. The lobby is beautiful, and the last time I was there they had a person by the elevators who would make sure you had a room key to go onto the elevators. My cell phone worked in the hotel just fine. I also want to mention that if you have a late flight on check out day and you don't want to extend the time you stay in your room there is a bacggage room downstairs where you can check your baggage there and come pick it up later. It was a cheap baggage check and the staff was very friendly and very helpful. I know this year when I go back to NYC I will stay at Hotel Pennsylvania and use the money I saved on the room to go shopping... again.

Reviews.Title: “It was great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed there, and had payd for two non-renovated rooms. One of them was GREAT, on 17th floor, facing the Empire State Building. The other one had a light that would not work, so requested another room, renovated if possible, and they put us no objection! They gave us a renovated one. Staff was so nice, also the chinese room makers. Next time I visit NYC; no doubts, Hotel Pennsylvania!!

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First of all to be fair, I will say that we stayed here a couple of years ago and possibly things have changed for the better. Our room was tiny - no bedspreads or headboards on the beds. Worst of all was that our beds were against a wall that contained the bank of elevators. All night long, we heard the elevators going up and down. We would have left immediately, but the price and location were good and we didn't feel like searching around for another hotel with 2 children in tow.

Reviews.Title: “Hey, its NYC not an interstate motel”
Reviews.Author: FredTheYounger
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Pennsylvania in mid January. We go to NYC two to three time a year on business -- primarily at the Javitz center -- and always shop around before we go. We've stayed at a dozen or so hotels; the Hotel Pennsylvania deserves its "neutral" rating. Not great, but not bad. I'd stay there again. If this is your once-in-a-lifetime trip, you're best served by spending the extra money and staying somewhere else. This is just a workaday place with no pretence at being more than it is: a place to sleep with indoor plumbing. Imangine what you'd get in Hong Kong at the same tarrif! Staff was quick, courteous and efficient. What I like in a business hotel. I've never experienced the horrors of other posters (I think I'd find the AKC going on fascinating, but that may just be me) of "bad decor", malodor, or -- most important -- indifference on the part of the staff. I had one real problem which was dealt with to my satisfaction with dispatch. One can imagine with the large number of rooms they have the number of, shall we say, niggling complaints is huge. They pay attention to the important ones. In sum: Servicable. Avoid if you expect absolute perfection. Translating the tarrif to what you'd get off the interstate is about $30. So, now you know what to expect.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Waste your money!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Seattle099
Reviews.Content: I'll be honest, I read the reviews that came before me and thought they were all just being overdramatic. It's a two-star in NY, what do you expect? So we went anyway. We checked in on 2/16/05 and were supposed to stay 7 nights. We checked out the next day. Two stars are two too many for this dump. Most places in our price range were already booked for the weekend, but we were lucky enough to find the Super 8 in Times Sqare, a one-star according to this website that was head and shoulders above the Pennsylvania. Everything that has been said in the other reviews is accurate. It's not even worth it by budget hotel standards.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldnt recommend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotels lobby is very decieving - looks amazing, shame the rest of the hotel isnt like that. Our first room stank of damp, had a ripped up yellow pages book scattered across it, and had a bucket full of a yellow coloured liquid, and the bathroom was filthy. The hotel room doors arent very appealing either, to me they look like orginals from when the place first opened. So after complaining (the guy at reception looked like he had heard it all before) we got shifted to a slightly better room didnt stink, and had a nicer door, was still very dingy tho. Realise the hotel is only a 2 star, but to be honest i dont think it deserves it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel From Hell”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Last Weekend I took a group of studetns on a school tour to find the hotel occupied by at least 1000 dogs. The smell was unbarable. Dogs urine was present outside the main recepiton of the hotel. It wasnt hosed away and guest were waking into it and then walking into the hotel spreading it aroung the carpert. The carpets were filthy. The hotel smelled really bad by Sunday. There was a 12 minute wait for elevators. We decided to take the stairs but when we asked where the stairs was were located we were told by a hotel employee that the stairs were not available and were locked. So what would happen in case of a fire!!!!!! Cigarette buts were present on the third floor of the hotel. We phoned reception and alerted them to this on the Saturday Night they said that they would send somebody up to investigate the cigarette butt was still there on Tuedsay Morning. The staff at the hotel were dismissive of us. This hotel is an ABSOLUTE DISGRACE. If it existed in Ireland it would be closed down from a Health and Safety Point of view. Dont stay there

Reviews.Title: “WHAT YOU PAY FOR IS WHAT YOU GET!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went to New York and stayed at the Hotel Penn from 10/02/05 to the 13/02/05 with friends. The lobby is excellent with a restaurant, gift shop, coffee shop etc. This is where all the money has been spent and the Hotel looks plush on the outside. The rooms were really basic but it is clean. Yes it could do with some paintwork and a change of decor. Some of the curtains were really ghastly. T.V and even the central heating at times did not work but I did not feel cold. Basically what you pay for is what you get and yes I would stay there again. The main reason being it is right in the centre of New York. Everything is in walking distance like Empire States Building, Macys, Time Square, Central Park etc. It also has great view from the windows and is really in a very convienient place. Penn Station is literally across the road and a regular bus service goes to JFK. The price is also a bargain. However the receptionists can be rather rude. It is not that bad and I felt perfectly safe there. Subrata ( LONDON).

Reviews.Title: “Checked in and RIGHT BACK OUT!”
Reviews.Author: momof3atl
Reviews.Content: The staff at the front desk was rude. They yelled at a woman who was locked out of her room that she needed to "WAIT A SECOND!" I checked in and paid with a credit card (MISTAKE!) My room was on th 7th fl and unrenovated. My 10yr old and I went up there. The lobby is beautiful. They floors upstairs are NOT! The hallway was so dirty and had more stains than I had ever seen. There was a homeless woman sitting on the floor in the hallway. There were 2 large garbage bags of trash beside our door. The room was awful. Dirty, old, stained. I went downstairs and asked to leave. I was EXTRA nice and very polite. I just said "we dont wish to stay, can we check out?"They refused to give me any proof that my credit card wouldnt be charged "TRUST ME" she said. I insisted to have some receipt, because I know my credit card company would insist on it. Finally when I asked for a manager, she printed out the check out form for me (took like 3 seconds) As for now, the authorization ($50 OVER the room cost...which is customary, but they didnt ask me first) is STILL on my credit card. It has only been 2 days, but after a week I have to work hard to get it off. Let me state-I am NOT picky. I am easy to please, great tipper REALLY polite. I wouldnt let my dog stay here. It was like something I have only seen on TV.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Savvy_Sandy
Reviews.Content: So, Hotel Pennsylvania? It was great. Location great, service great, room great, people great!! We had room 319, 3rd floor. It was quiet, (apart from the ventilation humming outside, but after the first night it was kinda soothing) very clean, surprisingly fresh and it was cleaned everyday. Loads of towels replaced everyday too. The bathroom was very clean, and the shower was to die for. They say New York is the City that never sleeps, but if all you need is a shower and a kip, this hotel is ideal. We arrived at JFK on Thursday morning, 3rd Feb, and after a grueling hour getting through the arivals process, (JFK security was very intimidating, but reasuring in hindsight) we hopped onto a bus to Penn Station, (We booked in advance a transfer bus at --------------) Manhattan, that cost about $27 return. We checked into our room at the hotel about 1pm. They advertise that checking in time is 3pm, but they seem to be very flexible. They have security deposit boxes at the hotel, which you can hire for free. I would reccomend to ask about these as soon as you check in, they're taken very fast. I felt very reasured knowing my valuables we're safe every day. I even left most of my cash in the boxes and just took what I needed for the day. Left my passport in the box too, you can't be too careful. However, I must add that New York is a surprisingly safe place to be in the day, (and in the evening too) we had our cameras out and never got any touble, nor did we see any. You'll find NYPD all over the place, a cop at every corner. The security and the Zero Tollerance attitude in the city is very reasuring. We even used the Subway (which we were advised not to do) a few times in the evening and there was no trouble at all. Although, we did have a very amusing encounter with a blind man singing and dancing for some change, on the trains. We reccomend:- Empire State Building at night, Buying souvenirs from the tiny shops in Time Square, between west 48th and 50th Sts (we found T-Shirts 7 for $10, bargain!) However, try to avoid the shop owned by the Chinese man, he will try to confuse you by going into silly tales about silver, gold and five fingers (???), very amusing, but the shop next door will give you an extra t-shirt for your $10. Ellen's Stardust Diner, corner of Broadway and west 51st St (singing waiters and waitresses! Pay for dinner and get free entertainment New York style!) And watching the squirrels in Central Park, (if you share the same sense of humour as I have, you'll find this entertainment hillarious!) You should aviod:- Applebees Restauraunts. There are two of these restauants in Midtown, and we had a very horrible dinner at the one on west 42st and it was appalling! We received inexcuseable service, which they had a cheek to charge us 18% Gratuity for, and the food was unfit for human consumption. I ordered the Chicken and Cheese and it might as well have come swimming in vegetable fat. Very gross! All in all, we had a very memorable holiday and would reccomend this hotel to anyone, especially couples with no quarms about discount accommodation. And only a few blocks from Time Square, could you get any more central?! Should you need to know more about this hotel or New York itself, please email me at savvytiger1@hotmail.com Have a nice holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideal for a budget holiday. If you are trying to save the pennies to splash out when you get there stay here. Its in a great location (a couple of minutes to Macys, opposite Madison Square Gardens, etc), the subway is over the road. The rooms, granted, are not top rate and the place could do with an full refurb, but I would in no way call this place unpleasant. Service is as you'd expect from such a massive, busy hotel so w had to queue for about 10-15mins to check in. The key drop meant we walked straight out (we didn't have any extras to settle). Lindys (the restaurant attached) is nice if slightly overpriced. If you are planning on a trip to NYC where you will spend most of your time out and about, this place is ideal. Two words to sum it up cheap and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there!”
Reviews.Author: Mark Cartwright
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from New York City. I usually stay in the Red Roof, Wolcott or Herald Square, but was forced to locate in the Hotel Pennsylvania, as it formed part of an organised trip. The lobby is fabulous -clearly this is where all the money has been spent, as the room we had was in need of much care and attention. A stained ceiling - the victim of damp, a TV which was broken on the first day, and once repaired, kept turning itself back on in the middle of the night, a telephone which you couldn't use for outside calls, and a smoke detector which looked disconnected. The whole place, apart from the lobby and top floor, all looked tatty and neglected. But the sheets were clean!

Reviews.Title: “It's really not that bad.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed there for nine nights. It's not as bad as people say it is. Room was ok, cleaned every day, towels and sheats changed daily and the staff was very polite and friendly. It's really not that bad. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Scary- believe the reviews!”
Reviews.Author: MGPNewport_RI
Reviews.Content: "You get what you pay for". Hotel Penn is loud, dark & dirty. The sheets are scratchy and coarse. The characters roaming the hallway are suspicious. I had a general feeling of being unsafe in the hallways and elevators in daylight! The only upside is the central location, directly across from Penn Station. Staying here made the difference between an unpleasant and enjoyable stay. I stayed 2 days for a meeting- d/n get a fax sent to me, nobody knew where our meeting room was located, internet access down. Scores of fellow employees complaining. Spend the extra $50/night to stay elsewhere. You'll be glad you did!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ddinc
Reviews.Content: Although we had a written confirmation for a superior room they gave us a small room with a small double bed and a at least 50 ! year old bath room with a shover. It was not even to be considered as "standard " After two telefon complaints we transferred to a bigger room with a heater which sounded like a truck engine and a carpet which seemed never been vacuum cleaned with thosands of stains. For the rate of 99 $ there are far better hotels in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Luck of the draw!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this site my partner and I were very worried what we might find on arrival. However, when we got to the Penn there were no long queues and the staff were fairly helpful if a little abrupt. The room we were given was on the fourth floor after i requested a lower floor. It was clean, very warm and the bed was comfortable. I do think it had something to do with an 'A' being after the number (eg 423A), i think these rooms were less old and delapidated, although we paid no extra and booked on the internet. I think we also travelled at a quiet time (January)which means less queuing and a larger selection of rooms for check-in to choose from. My advice is argue if you get a horrible room as nice rooms do exist! Enjoy New York regardless as you shouldn't be spending any time in your room anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Really not that bad!”
Reviews.Author: Shar72
Reviews.Content: Ok so its not the Waldorf but what do you expect to get for the price you pay! Im just back after staying with my boyfriend for 4 nights and we had a fantastic time. Admittedly we werent happy with the first room..it was clean but a little shabby. When we informed them we were unhappy they were happy to give us a different room which was great! Huge bed and tv and even came with a fridge! The beds were made up everyday and fresh towels everyday too! Who spends time in their room anyway..ur in New York!! The location is fantastic..you are in the heart of everything! If ur going dont worry like i did..i was freaking out after reading these reviews! If ur not happy with ur room just change it until you are! In a hotel with so many rooms in it you can expect the odd dodgy room, it is such an old hotel with a history behind it. Just enjoy being in NY!

Reviews.Title: “Basic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having come accross this site before I went to New York I was really worried about the state this hotel was going to be. On arriving at the hotel I was pleasantly surprised. The lobby was lovely! On arriving at our room (12th floor) I was slightly horrified by the 'decor', but it was clean. The room was cleaned and bed linen changed on a daily basis. For location this hotel is great. For what you pay you should not expect a 5 star hotel, basic but clean. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What are you all complaining about?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What is all the fuss about? I have just come back from New York on Wednesday after spending 4 nights at the Hotel Pennsylvania. I cannot complain about a thing. We stayed on the 16th floor where admittedly, the decor in the corridor could have been nicer but the room was great. It was huge with 3 single beds, fair sized bathroom and walk in closet. Our room was cleaned every day and fresh towels left by the maids. The little cafe in the lobby was open 24 hours and very reasonably priced. I would definitely stay here again. I have stayed in New York before at a hotel I paid much more for and it was no better. Maybe we were just lucky with our room but there are definitely decent rooms in this hotel - and you couldn't ask for a better location.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for price and location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: myself and my boyfriend stayed in this hotel for seven nights over new years. having booked on a discount hotel website for a price of just over €100 per night, and then reading some of the reviews on this website, we were very worried about staying in this hotel. we needn't have worried. we were given a room on the 16th floor, and while the room was basic, it was very big, and very clean. the bathroom was also very clean and towels and sheets changed every day. this hotel is definitely 'no frills', but for the location and the price we paid, it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “huge room, LONG check-in wait, unhelpful service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last August for business. The rooms are quite large, but I had to stand in line for an hour to check in at 7 pm. When I got the desk, there was a slight hitch due to my name being misspelled in their computer and the woman "helping" me not bothering to ask me for my credit card OR confirmation number, even after I volunteered that I had them at the ready. After announcing there was no reservation for me, she stared at me blankly until I lost my temper, at which point she rudely informed me she was trying to help me and asked for the confirmation number. Overall, it was not the experience I was looking for after a long day of travel and work.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Scotland_UKLouise
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for new year 2004/2005 for 4 nights. Upon arrival we checked in and were told that our rooms were not renovated rooms as they had none left, we specifically booked renovated rooms through our travel agent. Upon leaving the lift to floor 3, the carpets were old and dirty and the doors were in a terrible state. The room was disgusting like the hotel out of the shining, the curtains didn't close, the blinds were hanging off, the windows were filthy etc etc, hadn't been done since the seventies. I refused to stay in such a hell hole and we complained at reception so were given 'free upgrades.' These rooms were much better but still not the renovated rooms and maybe only rated a 2 star. The location was fabulous however. My advice is don't book this hotel under any circumstances, it should be closed down whilst it is renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel. Dreadful beyond words.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We live in NJ and decided to spend the night in the city. We reserved two rooms on line. Both rooms were simply dreadful. They were absolutely filthy. No one had cleaned in the back of the radiators and window sills for years and I doubt very much if the sheets had been changed. The bad looked rock hard, thin and ancient (I didn't even want to sit on it). The walls were stained and both bathrooms had missing tile. In fact, the rooms were so bad that we decided to just call it a loss, pack up and leave. We ended up spending the night at the Grand Hyatt, which I continue to find one of the best bargains in the city. It's a bit remote from everything, but in a city where you can always catch a cab, that isn't a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from New York after staying with my sister and two friends at the Hotel Pensylvannia. We managed 1 nights stay when we had booked in for four nights. The Hotel was disgusting. Luckily we found a Holiday Inn to check into which was a million times better. An example of the state of the rooms we were given are as follows:- 1)(Cigarette) burns in bed covers. 2)Dirty bathrooms. 3)Mould on ceilings. 4)Electric wiring hanging out. 5)Stains on carpets, curtains and shower curtain. 6)Holes in ceiling. 7)Dodgy black marks on bed sheets. Overall between us we were transferred to 3 different rooms which were all of the same quality, all I can say is do not stay here if you like your room clean and hygenic.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable/ good location”
Reviews.Author: blue_eyed_boy
Reviews.Content: Key words here: Budget, clean, dry, warm and secure! I have just returned from a week in New York. During that time I stayed at the Pennsylvaina hotel, located at the junction of 33rd Street and 7th Avenue (directly opposite Madison Square Gardens). The hotel is a basic "no frills" hotel with good access to Manhattan. The incredible thing about this hotel, however, is the price I paid ($79 + tax per room per night) for a basic two double bedded room with ensuite. Other reviewers have criticised the standard of decoration and/or the leaking taps. The decoration, I have to agree, is pretty old and would benefit from a lick of paint here and there but I didn't experience any leaking plumbing! If you wish to visit one of the most vibrant cities in the world and start picking fault with minor problems in the hotel room then go ahead but personally I spent most of my time out and about sightseeing. I stayed at this hotel roughly one year ago and had no hesitiation in booking it again this time. I am looking forward to my next annual visit to New York where I will use the Penn again! Use a budget website to book the room rather than booking direct and you may save even more money.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible rooms! Beware!”
Reviews.Author: jc319
Reviews.Content: Beware of the "cheaper" rooms that you book online. We booked a single bed room for only ~120 a night, which we thought was great for that price in Manhattan. We weren't expecting anything fancy, just a normal room of the caliber you expect from a typical motel (Day's Inn, Motel 6, etc). The room was HORRIBLE. Non working blinds, dirty walls, mold in the bathroom walls, peeling paint, very weak water for the showers. I would compare it to low cost housing, maybe even worse. In hindsight, I would have to wonder if that room met building codes. Do not be fooled by the beautiful lobby, once you get up to your floor, the hallways are dark and the rooms horrible. Granted, I can only speak for room in that price range, it is possible if you pay for the higher priced rooms, it may be habitable.

Reviews.Title: “A real lottery”
Reviews.Author: fairland
Reviews.Content: Stayed there from Dec 25 for 5 nights. Surly receptionist informed us there were no renovated rooms so with trepidation we went to our room and it was EXACTLY as so many others have described. The 6th floor itself and the room in particular reminded me of the detective programmes where the hero goes to arrest someone in a seedy motel room. Furniture was ancient, bathroom was filthy. We returned to reception where a more helpful receptionist said 'try this one' and to be fair it was much better - still on the wrong side of adequate for me but it was cleaner and morew modern. Room was cleaned daily although personally I had the quickest daily shower possible as the bath was old and rusty! On the plus side the lady at the expedia desk was really helpful in getting us theatre tickets and it certainly didn't spoil what was a marvellous first stay in New York. Fortunately having read the reviews on this site we were prepared for the worse but the lesson is that this hotel is too much of a lottery so in future we'll pay more for a better hotel. By the way, we really enjoyed Joe Allen's restaurant in Restaurant Row. Empire State Building was good but don't be fooled into thinking the queues outside are the only ones - you queue for just as long again when you are actually in the building.

Reviews.Title: “Bad but bearable. Clean at least.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was absolutely appalled when I arrived at the hotel & saw the quality of the rooms versus how they look on the site. Once I got over the initial shabbiness of the hotel it was actually ok although I can't say I'd go back. Since I was just there for a long weekend with friends & the location is great we just put up with it. If you can bear the shabbiness, dark hallways, sometimes weirdo guests & musty smell it's ok. NEVER come here if you're looking for somewhere nice for a romantic weekend of anything, you'll be sadly disappointed. I'd give it about 2/10, that'd just be for location & relative cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “loved new york shame about the hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Went to New York 28th December 2004, The hotel when you book in looks fine, but when you get to your room the shock hits you. Rooms are very small not cleaned very well at all and the bathroom was disgusting, there were chips in the bath and it looked like it had been hand painted over, there was no way we were going to take a bath in that. When complained we were moved. Yes the room was slighty better than the first but not what you would of expected at a cost of £600 for 4 nights stay. The best way to explain it was that of Butlins budget. If you can afford a little extra go for a better hotel. Okay its central for all the attractions but that is all. But besides that we had a great time in New York spent as little time in the hotel as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: You may find this place for a cheap price but it is definitely NOT worth it. You can find plenty of other places for about $20 more per night that are 1000 times better than this place. After consulting this site I booked the hotel with the mentality that it "can't be that bad." I was right...it is worse. Filthy walls, picture missing that accented the filth, broken curtain, broken window, moldy bathroom tiles and shower curtain, every electric socket plate in the room was cracked in half, and I can't imagine when the last time was that someone cleaned under the bed as there was a thick layer of dusk and plenty of garbage. Don't be fooled by the beautiful lobby, when the elevator doors open on your room floor you will be in for a shock. If you do, for some unfortunate reason, stay here, then take a can of Lysol with you. You will want to hose the room down with it before you let your bags touch the floor. I didn't go there expecting much and I may have only paid $100 for a night in the room, but I think I deserve a room that may not be spectacular, but at least is clean. The only reason I wound up staying was that I was there for only 1 night, and just for a few hours to sleep (the sheets appeared to be clean, the comforter was not and I removed it from the bed immediately). But looking back, this is not something I will ever do again. I will just pay slightly more for something much better.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor service”
Reviews.Author: gvanzoest
Reviews.Content: Service in the hotel is very poor. Room was not made up and cleaned yet at check-in. We were provided for another room, but in a very unpersonal way. No bell-boy was availble to help us carry our luggage. Storing luggage after check-out was charged for $ 4 per piece (!). We have never ever experienced such a thing before. Ridiculous! A frigidaire to store some perishable goods was not available. The staff was completely unwilling to cooperate finding a solution for us. For that reason, we had to throw away our food worth over $ 40. Very unwilling, unfriendly staff. We will certainly not go there ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Complete Dump”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the biggest dump I have ever stayed at in my entire life. The paint on the ceiling was cracking off, the carpet hadn't been vaccumed in months, and the bar of soap that the maids left in the bathroom had someone else's hair all over it. The employees at the receptionist desk also seemed to be unconcerned about the situation with my room.

Reviews.Title: “it's falling apart, but okay generally!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived on the 30th of December, and I for one was expecting something combining fawlty towers and say, the darkest depths of hell! Apart from a chunk of the doorframe to the bathroom being missing, and a shower that flooded the floor everytime you washed it was alright. We would have had a nice view of nyc but it looked like the windows had been cleaned sometime during the 1950's! The room was clean, tidy and the shower was hot. Overall, the hotel needs some serious work, but who cares when you're in new york!

Reviews.Title: “What Happened at Our Favorite Hotel????”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have been very happy guests at Hotel Pennsylvania for the past five years at Xmas time - except for this past Xmas. We had four different rooms! The first two rooms assigned were absolutely too horrible to stay in: filthy, dingy; paint and wall paper peeling, small 20 inch TV on a nightstand; broken bedlamp, no chest of drawers; rusty bath faucets; filthy carpet and no drapes in one room - just a windowshade! After complaints, management put us in a third room. The room felt very cold and drafty but was nice. Later realized one of the windows was broken and had a one inch gap - it was 28 degrees outside! Was moved into the fourth and final room. Hallways are filthy, dingy and peeling. Room doors look like dirty coffins. We're unhappy about this cuz we loved coming here - must be under new management which brings up another issue. At check-in time, the database was down and the clerk was very rude in saying "step aside". After a few minutes she began checking in other guests as we stood in her face waiting our turn. We finally had to interrupt her which she sighed and reluctantly checked us in. Never Again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dump”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place should have been condemmed years ago ..... we tried 3 different rooms: Room #1 - No shades or curtains, one window would not shut, filthy carpet and odors ... after complaining to the desk clerk we were given another room Room #2 - Bed not made, dirty linens and towels, phone upside down in middle of room and stunk of vodka ... Totally gross and unaccceptable .... after complaining to the Manager we were given another room Room #3 - Again dirty, looked like an Army barracks, had two very small single beds, but was the best of the 3 rooms, we stayed in this room for 3 nights and hated it !!!

Reviews.Title: “Lock on door did not work”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hooker in next room wins Oscar. Hotel was dirty, scary, and crumbling. The lock on my door did not work. I prayed my floor did not fall through. Shower was dirty and bathroom littered with trash. Furniture broken and very old. Remote for TV was under bed and boy am I sorry I looked under there! Flea bag! Don't let the lobby fool you.

Reviews.Title: “terrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights in this hotel. the room when we arrived, was very dirty,I went down to reception,after a long wait, I spoke to manager, I was told it was the only room they had 690. I was told to speek to housekeeping, this I did. When we returned later, the room was just as dirty. It was like this the whole holiday. I took about 10 photos of the dirt.eg. stains on carpet, black mould on three legged fridge, also bathroom wall. Thick dust on skirting boards, broken toilet flusher, also table drawer missing. It was the dirtiest hotel we have ever stayed in

Reviews.Title: “not a problem”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: like a lot of people I was worried after reading the reviews so I am going to dispell some myths: no long check in/out queue friendly staff clean rooms with lots of fresh towels, good beds without stains good security no rubbish under beds no smell in hallways The hotel also had a desk where you could book tours and get information about the area and they were very knowledgable and useful indeed. I had absoulutely no problem with the hotel whatsoever, i actually found it very lovely and would recommend anyone to stay there, particularly if they are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Its Just Perfect..!”
Reviews.Author: NYCVisitor
Reviews.Content: I choose Hotel Pennsylvania for its location. If you want to explore real new york, and to spend most of your time in the big apple, places like central park, times square (I loved at night :-) ) then this is the perfect place. Its close to everywhere virtually. I was delighted to book this one for only 96 dollars per night for a double room on findnewyorkrooms,com where as the average rate for a double room at this hotel is 115 dollars. Staff was very friendly, and only problem was long que at the check-in. Will definately stay here again and reccomend to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “More Than happy!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews I started to panic, so much so I decided to email the Hotel. I got a reply nearly straight away. The email stated that we had only booked a standard room and that the hotel is only 2* however he would try and get us a room with more comfort. We arrived and were given our keys straight away. The lobby area is lovely, and there is never a long wait for a lift. Walked along the corridor and when you see the doors all we could think of was "vault" or "padded cell", by this time I am really worried!! Opened the door, HUGE SIGH OF RELIEF, lovely view, Clean bedding, Clean Bathroom, TV, Nice curtains. It is so true, you get what you pay for. All these bad reviews I don't think are fair. A 2* hotel is going to be basic, as long as it is clean you carn't say fairer than that. If you want luxury then book a 3*+. For what we paid it was more than fine. All staff were very helpful and very friendly. The hotel is a great place to just put your head down, it has a great location and all I can say on the rooms the price reflects the standard (I am more than happy) We went for a meal in the restaurant downstairs ("joes") we all said it is one of the best meals we have had in a long time. The Irish bar "hickeys" over the road is also a very friendly place . All in all a fantastic holiday and more than happy with the hotel. I will be using the Hotel again!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a worthwhile base in NY”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Its not going to ruin your trip - if you don't let it! My friend and I booked our trip to NY Feb 2004 to go in late September for my birthday. For the majority of the time inbetween my friend read nothing but bad reviews about the hotel and we got very worried, I went to the travel agents and was reassured we would have a renovated room - Great! When we got there though we did have an old room and it was very, very horrible, paint peeling off the walls yucky looking bed sheets. To say we were disappointed would be an understatement, but being a very tired, stubborn Brit. I went down stairs explained the situation to the desk person who told me if I went back to see her at 8pm she should have another room for me - not a problem, we took in a few sites, had a drink in the very nice bar in the hotel and at 8pm we we're given a king size room - yippee - and what a room! Two double beds, a huge T.V, masses of space, nice bathroom. Worth it after all. This was my first trip to the states and I have learnt that their standards of hotels are nothing like ours, but for a few days of site seeing this is one of the best hotels, nearly everything is walking distance, the garment district, times square, central park and if you can't be bothered walking the station is under the hotel. There is a lovely bar and coffee shop in the hotel and in case you get flashed at by a tramp through your viewer in you hotel door (yes this did happen to me but its New York, stranger thing happen) the security guards are built like brick ---- houses - very reassuring! I would definately stay again - in a renovated room!

Reviews.Title: “Dire”
Reviews.Author: KennyMacD
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in August 2004. Great location in midtown but that's all. Terrible queues at reception, reception staff with minimal English and who were extremely unhelpful. To cap it all after I checked in and underlined I was staying for three nights, I returned on day 2 to find myself having been automatically checked out of my room - and (after another long queue at reception) the guy who'd checked me in denied having had any conversation with me. Really, really poor hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't worry -- not as bad as some reviews say......”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ok - I was scared out of my mind to stay at this hotel after reading many of the posted reviews. I admit it, I'm a high maint. gal -- after I read several reviews I was on the phone to my sister, freaking out, telling her I wasn't going! She finally calmed me down - said it "would be an adventure" and I couldn't NOT go, since this was my first trip to NYC. So we get there, checked in (which wasn't too bad - took about 20 minutes for us to get through the line). We are assigned a room on the 6th floor - it is NOT a renovated room (so now I'm starting to get nervous). We exit the elevator on our floor and I'm waiting for the musty, mildew stench to hit me -- it never does. The hotel smells fine. We get to our room and again, I'm waiting to see, smell or step on bad things -- never happens. The room smells fine, it could have used a little better vacuum job but it's ok. I check out the bathroom - it's fine. WHEW -- I can relax now. The hotel is old, it looks old and I'm sure when they finish with their renovation it will be fine. In the mean time they could do a little better job with general maint. i.e. a fresh coat of paint, some new tile grout, take care of scuff marks on the walls in the hallways, etc. All of the hotel staff was very pleasant. And their cafe makes just as good a java as Starbucks - and it's cheaper. Our view was of an alley and into other hotel rooms (which was rather interesting at times) - but that didn't really matter since we were out roaming NYC most of the time. You can't beat the location -- it's smack dab in the middle of EVERYTHING! And if you book early, you can't beat the price. I would stay at this hotel again. ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “Yuck”
Reviews.Author: Manderina
Reviews.Content: By far, the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. I stayed with my boyfriend for one night to see a broadway show. We tried to stay out as late as possible to avoid going back to the room. We definitely did not stay in one of the renovated rooms. Check in took about 45 minutes. The lobby looked nice. That's where it ended. When we got off of the elevator, I felt like we were in a slum apartment unit. It was like right out of a movie about crackheads. This hotel was probably in beautiful shape in the 1950's. Maybe earlier. It was shady in the hallway - I felt like someone was going to pop out of the corner and rob us. The room. The bathroom was surprisingly pretty clean - not too many complaints here. Although I refused to shower in the morning, since we had a quick 30 minute trip home. Furniture - gross Bedding - gross Carpet - gross Catching onto a theme here? Everything was so dirty and old. Wallpaper falling off the wall, dirty linens, dirty carpet. Completely EWWW. I think I slept with my shoes & jacket on. The room was pretty cold and the TV really freaked us out. It turned on and off by itself. We awoke in the middle of the night to the TV on really loud. The remote was out of reach. It wouldn't surprise me if the place was haunted. Our room looked like it could have been a crime scene at one point in time. I remember the curtains looked like they could have been from 1910 - they were so dirty and disgusting. I wouldn't expect that room to cost more than $20.00 US per night. That's how low quality it was. On the upside, we had a nice view of the Empire State Building. That's the only upside.

Reviews.Title: “rooms booked online worse than direct booking”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our room was very bad, and we learned through the desk clerk that our booking through hotels was part of a block that did not include the rennovated rooms. The website for hotels gives the impression you will get a rennovated room. The hotel clerk told us that because we booked through hotels we could not upgrade to a rennovated room. Our room on the 13th floor was bad: wet carpet, mold in corners, curtain broken, wallpaper peeling, pictures off the hooks, grimy. The closet was not clean. It took the strength of two people on a chair and the window sill to close the window and apply the one window lock that was working (the other was broken). The shade was broken. The hallways had the appearance of a slop house and dangerous. The fire alarm went off at 11:00 PM. I called the desk clerk to ask what we should do. He said the person in charge of the system was working on it, and we should stay in our room. The alarm rang on and off for another ten minutes and it was loud. Because the look of the place made it feel very dangerous and we had just arrived that night, I finally called 911 directly. This did not make for a restful night. We paid a lot for this room. When we checked in I noticed on the side of the desk clerk's printer the taxes listed for the different-priced rooms. None were as expensive as what we paid through hotels.com When I asked the desk clerk if we paid too much, they said that we should book directly next time. The lobby, staff, elevators, clientele, and location are fine. The bathroom was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Far better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just back from staying 5 nights at this hotel. I was really worried as i had read the reviews and had prepared to demand a room change , etc however pleasantly suprised when we got there. there were 6 in our party - we had booked three double rooms but when we arrived we asked for 3 twin rooms and there was no problem at all. The rooms were basic but clean. Beds made daily and fresh towels daily. We only really slept there and it was so handy for everything. Macy's is around the corner and short walk to other attraction. I'd recommend Jack Dempseys pub 2 blocks away beside Empire state building (& you can get a free pass for here if you have something to eat) - food is great by the way!! If you want somewhere to lay your head at the end of a busy day, central to almost every site in NYC and especially if you're over shopping for all the bargins you should stay here. I'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “squallor”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel thru the internet from Ireland, my husband said he heard bad reports from it, and I said that it couldnt be that bad, how wrong I was. We checked in on the 21 december x 1 night, were going to a show in manhattan. When we got off the lift on the ninth floor I knew there was something wrong..... it was dark and dirty and the carpet looked like it had not seen a vaccum for quite some time... When we went to our room 935 I could not believe my eyes,,, the bathroom was filthy, leaking water from I dont know where, hair in the bath the sink and the walls. The bath tub was chipped and had a ring around it and the taps were dripping constantly. The bedroom was quite frightening. The walls were filthy, chipped paint and the carpet was dirty and had a layer of dust on it. I was afraid to look at the bed. The curtains were dirty and the windows were filthy. We went to our show but just went back to the hotel to pack and leave at 1am. This hotel sould not be allowed to offer what it does just on the basis of its central location. We deserve more. It should be shut down and totally ripped out.

Reviews.Title: “It's not that bad.......”
Reviews.Author: LittlegreenBelfast
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Pennsylvania form 8th - 13th December. I was so nervous about staying there after reading the reviews on this site I even considered changing hotels! We arrived at around 11.30pm exhausted after travelling from Belfast, check in was great, took just a few minutes! The first room they gave us was, quite frankly disgusting! And one bed short! We had booked a three bedroom room and there were only two. The two beds that were there were unmade, there were full ashtrays and the whole room smelt of cigarette smoke. So, we went back down to reception and asked to be moved, we were told the hotel was full and being moved was not an option. But we stood our ground and explained we definitely would not be staying in an unclean, smelly room for two people when there were three of us. The receptionist hung around for a while, I think she was hoping we would give up (we didn't!), then she came back and offered us a suite on the 16th floor which turned out to be fabulous! Big living room, two wide screen TVs, massive king-size bed, and a single bed, lovely clean bathroom and a small kitchen (which had seen better days however, we didn't need to use it) House keeping was brilliant, our room was cleaned every day and they left lovely bright white towels everyday also. So, lesson to be learned is if you get a bad room, just complain - and don't give up! There are better rooms to be had! The location of this hotel is so worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Take this for what its worth.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Pennsylania from December 15 to December 19, 2004. I read the other reviews about how the rooms were dirty from the 10th floor and higher and it made me nervous about staying there. I called the day before we arrived and requested a room on the lowest floor possible. I made up a lie that my girlfriend had a phobia about heights and we needed to be as low as possible. We were assigned to room 579, 5th floor. When we approached our room, both of us took a deep breath when I opened the door. Although our room was small, which was no problem, it was pretty much clean. It did have the "lived in" feel to it but it was clean. The carpet had a spot or two, like someone spilled something and they couldnt get the stain out, but the carpet was clean. I walked around on the carpet with my bare feet and it didnt feel nasty or dirty.The walls had a mark here and there, but no holes or major damage. The bathroom was very basic but clean. The shower curtain was alittle short at the bottom and some water got on the floor from the shower and a couple of the tiles were alittle worn but no real unsafe or unsanitary effects. Maid service was good. We asked for two extra towels and although we weren't in the room when they came, a maid brought us four towels and two hand towels. The iron, ironing board and hair dryer in the room worked fine. The AC/Heater worked fine and the TV was a pretty good size also. Although I didnt see any of the "nasty dirty rooms", overall in this case, it was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “filthy”
Reviews.Author: marymc
Reviews.Content: myself and three friends stayed in the Pennsylvania hotel for 5 nights! we booked two rooms and the first room we were given on the 13th floor was filthy dirty, the curtains were black with dirt, there were stains on the carpet and the room smelled even though they had the window open when we went into the room. So we went straight back down to reception and demanded that they change our room, we did get changed to the 8th floor, our room there was a little bit cleaner but not much. The wallpaper was stained from smoke and someparts were peeling off in the corridors. This is the worst hotel i have ever stayed in, we even saw some people had pets in their room which i think is disgraceful in an 18 story hotel!!!! the only good thing about the hotel is the location (5mins from Macys). I would not recommend anyone stay in this dirty hotel it is in serious need of a renovation. We had some friends visit us in the hotel and they said they stayed in a hostel in NYC that was nicer than this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a go- if you can last 3 days”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not the best hotel I have stayed at, although was impresed when i wlaked in, Nice lobby. Howvere soon as i got into the lift and out on the hallway. what a dump.. it looked like a sleazy hotel, the rooms were old and mouldy with plaster falling off!

Reviews.Title: “pile of rubbish and should be torn down!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel after a long day of travelling to a disgusting smoking room on the 16th floor, the dirt and the dust was unliveable in so we went to reception and was told that all the standard rooms are like this, so we asked for a no smoking room thinking it may be cleaner. It was a bit better but had mould and damp in one corner of the ceiling, paper coming off the walls, paint chipped in the bath and dust all over! The tv didnt work and the blind was coming off the window! The only good thing was the change of towels every day and the location, which was next door to macys! I would recommend the blarney rock irish bar thats also next door because you may need to get drunk just to go back into your room!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Could cope with long queues at reception. Could cope with small size of room. However, the Hotel Pennsylvania is just filthy dirty...its as simple as that. The corridors, the lifts, the doors to the rooms, the rooms themselves and especially the carpets and curtains are covered in dark stains and grime. Even the foyer, which other reviewers have complimented, looks cheap and trashy. The excellent location does not make up for the fact that after a tiring days sightseeing, you dread going back to this smelly building. On a more positive note, towels were clean and beds were made each day. Staff helpfulness was average. Would definately not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “tired of the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell. Stayed at the Hotel Penn 1 night on Nov2nd. (yes, election day). 2 rooms were booked by my company for a customer visit: 1 for me and 1 for a colleague. Our sales rep was skeptical of booking there, and did not want to put us up at a "flea bag" hotel. Took train from Baltimore to Penn Station. Walked across the street, checked in (no line, no wait) about 6pm. Nice lobby. Took elevator to our rooms. (sorry, cannot remember floor #, but rooms were definitely the "Superior" King rooms a la the web photos) Rooms were clean, all amenities I needed. Bathroom was small, (CLEAN, no hair no mold) but I had a hair dryer and makeup mirror so who's compaining! I had a King size bed, DRAPES over the window (although, I do have to admit that I too had one the "windows that would not shut", but it was only open about 3" and it was a warm Nov night) Carpet clean, TV worked fine (watched election coverage till 11:30 was too depressed to continue.) and to be honest, in retrospect, the room looked almost identical to web photo(s) Adding to that, I have to say, the MOST COMFORTABLE hotel bed I've slept on in a long time. We ate dinner directly off of the lobby at Lindy's. Too expensive and I wouldn't do it again. Walked off dinner and ended up near Rock Center and back. Beautiful evening for a stroll. Got back to room about 10:30pm. (location, location, location!) Next morning we checked out. We also had them hold our luggage (cost me about $3; definitely worth not carrying our bags with us AND we were just across the street from the Penn Station) All in all, not bad. Granted, it wasn't money out of my wallet, but I've stayed in far worse, for more$$. As a matter of fact, I am planning on returning with family in tow. (3 families as a matter of fact) What have I learned? GET A SUPERIOR ROOM. If I can't, I won't stay. By the way: my colleague agrees. Decent room and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Transylvania!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a four night five day trip to New York where we stayed in the Hotel Pennsylvania. Having read previous reviews I was quite nervous about staying there and had in fact contacted my travel agent well in advance who assured me that they have been booking people into this hotel for years and have never had a complaint! We arrived on Friday 4th December 2004 at approximately 2.00pm. There was a long line for checking in but it moved along nicely. I had booked two rooms, one for my husband and myself and the other for my two grown up children. When my husband and myself went to our room we nearly died. Black net curtains on windows, curtains falling down, blinds broken. The carpet was covered in stains of an unknown nature, cigarette burns and bleach stains. Bedspreads were filthy and covered in stains as well. The plaster was peeling off the walls. The bathroom was full of black mold. It was truly awful. The other room wasn't much better. We went down to reception and like other reviewers they agreed to change the rooms without any protest. We were given the key to a new room and said we'd look at it on the condition that we would then decide what room we would stay in. However, our names were taken off the system immediately and while we were in our original room dicussing what to do a German gentleman and his son came in and wanted to know what we were doing in their room!! The second set of rooms that we checked out were a bit better than the original rooms but they were still not up to any standard. When we told the gentleman on reception this he told us to contact our travel agent - this was at 5.00pm which was 10.00pm at home!!. We took the new rooms. Our room was clean but it was very very hot. After we had settled in I noticed that the window was open I tried to close it but soon discovered that it wouldn't close. I requested that it be fixed but needless to say it wasn't. As it happened because of the heat in the room if it wasn't open we probably would have roasted. There were no curtains in the room only a torn blind so once it got to 5.30am it was impossible to sleep with the noise of the traffic!!. The room that the children ended up in was really awful. Again no curtains and there was blck mold in the bathroom and behind their beds. The plaster was also peeling off the walls in their room. They were so fed up that they decided to take the room but my daughter didn't sleep the first night as she was so nervous. We ended up having a great time but when you are going away for only a few days you do not want to spend the first 2/3 hours of your holiday traipsing around from room to room and then settling for something that you would never stay in at home. There must be some body in America that polices hotel accommodation. Don't get me wrong I did not expect the Ritz. I knew that this was a very basic hotel but there's a difference between basic and falling apart! By the way one of the reviewers said that the rooms ending in A are better - they're not - the four rooms that we were in had an A at the end of their number!!

Reviews.Title: “not the nicest place in the world”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel from the 8/12/04 for 3 nights had no problams checking in the lobby was clean and tidy, wish i could say the same for the rooms, mold on the ceiling's wall paper hanging of the walls which i think was the original paper from the 1920's shower was dirty, luckely we did not have to spend a minute longer in the hotel room than we had to,only good point about this hotel is it's locaitioun, which is central to most of the sights........

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Just don't be fooled by the photo's that u see on the web.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from New York on Dec 8. Don't be fooled by the photographs shown on there web-page or any other web-page that you may find this hotel. The entrance to the hotel is grand, marble floor, etc., once inside the lift and you head to your floor., doors open nice huge entrance on the floor, turn the corner down the corridor, and that's when you see the problems., unwashed walls., wallpaper peeling of, paint coming of the ceiling, unfinished doors., the corridors look well dodgy and the rooms aren't that much better, just your standard hotel room [bed, tv, shower etc]- we bumped into another couple who where staying on the same floor as us , and they expected to see to see the twin girls from the film "the shining" standing at the bottom of the corridor as the lighting of the hallway is poor. However on saying that - The hotel is in a excellent location and the staff are very friendly and willing to help you out if you need any assistance, It's a 15 mins walk to time square/broadway, 20-25 mins walk to central park, macy's is just around the corner, empire state building is 15 mins away, Grand Central Station and Rockafeller Center is 20-25 mins walk away from hotel. I wouldn't eat in the restuarant in as its expensive and you can get a really good food across the street at Blarneys Rock pub [this Irish pub is excellent - well worth a visit for the food, drink and general chit/chat] Would i stay there again - Probably yes, due to its excellent location., but i would request a room on floors 1 to 4 as i've been told by guests that where the best rooms are., and we were on the 16th floor and its no penthouse up there i can tell you that for a fact.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location/Accomadation not up to standard”
Reviews.Author: eneri39
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pennsylvana Hotel for 5 nights from 22nd October 20. The hotel has a good location to get to all the must-see sights of New York. We found the accomadation poor, the first room we were allocated was scruffy and in need of refurnbishment. The second room allocated was slighty better, but not really up to the standards that we have previously found when travelling on U.S. This was quite a let down when pictures shown of this hotel on websites show a smart looking hotel with a lavish reception area.

Reviews.Title: “Mold and Mildew”
Reviews.Author: jennysch
Reviews.Content: The room was basic, which is what we were looking for. However, the bathroom was full of mold and mildew. Just want a clean room.

Reviews.Title: “never again!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I have just returned from staying 5 nights in this flee hole (actually I didn't realise I had been bitten until I saw the 3 red bites on my body). We were initially allocated a room on the 7th floor. We could not believe our eyes when we saw the state of the room. In all the years of travelling all over the world this ranked as the worst we have ever seen. The ceiling was falling down, the room stank from dampness, the carpet was dirty and the shower and toilet were covered in rust. These are just a few of the things which we noticed in the 5 minutes it took us to refuse to sleep there. Not one for complaining normally, I did not hesitate to ask reception for another room. As already commented on in other reviews the reception staff accepted our complaints without comment (so used to them!). We were then given another room to look at "to see if it was any better". This one was just as bad and with a small double bed rather than the twin beds which we had booked. The third room was not much better but at least it had a king size bed. There were no curtains at the window - only a pulldown blind which didn't even pull right down, the bedding was dirty -the sheet had hairs on them and the bedspread had never seen a washing machine in months. The carpet was so dirty we dare not walk on it with bare feet. The chairs were dirty and we did not even sit on them for fear of catching something. The bath was rusted and peeling, the handbasin falling off the wall (our soap fell behind the basin and there was no way we were attempting to get it back) and the electric socket was out of action. Only one bulb in the light instead of two - the fitting was broken. Oh, the toilet did work. The cleaner never washed the basin the whole time we were there. One day the bed was not even made. Towels were replaced every day although hairs had to be removed from them before you could use them. Need I go on!!! NEVER AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally Located”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are just back from a short trip to New york where we stayed in the Hotel Pennsylvania. The hotel was OK but yes there were problems. If it's location you want, this hotel is ideally located. Times square - 15 mins walk, Subway across the road, Macy's across the Road, Bus station (to get to Woodbury Common) 15 mins walk and countless other places within easy stricking distance. Our plan was to get out and about as much as possible so we would not be spending much time in the our hotel room. We wanted a clean comfortable bed with clean sheets and we got that. But outside of the bed was a different story. The bathroom was not clean. Hairs on the floor, bath, sink - hairs everywhere. The bath / shower was dirty. The bathroom walls were dirty. The bedroom carpet looked like it had seen better days too. Neither of us would walk bare-foot in this room. Reception told us that this was one of the re-furbished rooms. (hmmmmm?) But don't forget, we only wanted only somewhere clean to put our head down at night and we got that. Would I stay there again? I would. But only after packing my flip-flops and a bathroom cleaner.

Reviews.Title: “dirty, ------- pit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: this hotel is the most dirty, disgusting place i have ever stayed in, in my life. the room doors were filthy, the carpet was black rotten, there was only one curtain up which didnt close. the ceiling had plaster dropping from it and was covered in mould. the bath had fungus in it and the wall vent was covered in i dont know what. the bedroom lamp fitting had the bare wires showing as it had no cover. the staff are very rude and unhelpful. i would not recommend this hotel to street rats as even they wouldn't stay in that place.

Reviews.Title: “Second room almost good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I were staying there for 11 days (11/24 - 12/05. The hotelstaff was very busy when we checked in because it was the day before thanksgiving. In spite of the line the check in did go fast.. We did not get the room we ordered at our travel agency in Germany just a tiny room with one small bed for two persons. They said we would get a roll-away bed as a second bed. A dirty room, no cold running water - just drippling. Mold in the clauset and worst of all - a very bad clicking sound the whole night. After a two hours sleep a roll-away bed was brought by a very busy and exhaustet gentleman. Because of jet lag and the bad noise we had a short night. We got a new room the next day. Two fine bed, a small refrigerator in the room (also I would never put any food in it if I had it at home). No loud clicking ( but we could hear the neighbours in the rooms around us.) The bathroom was dirty, nothing you could just clean of. The bath tub - I always was glad when I could step out of it. In the room the wall paper came down. I only could close the the window by standing just above the air- conditioning and push it down with my foot. But the staff was great, friendly, a call and we got everthing we needed -more clean towels, a hair-dryer (within 10 minutes). they cleaned the room fine, changed bedspreads every day. We had no extra fee to pay for having a friend with us. We enjoyed our trip to N.Y.C., had a great time in our room during one day of rain and in the evenings and were looking forward to our clean bathroom at home.

Reviews.Title: “We joined the queue to complain”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pennsylvania from Nov 12th to 16th the lobby was a very grand affair with marble floors and crystal chandeliers, we were told the staff were unfriendly but found them to be quite freindly and helpful. We then arrived in the rooms and oh deary me what a shock. Plaster was falling from the ceiling and the place had not been decorated for years and years the painted walls were dirty and the carpet was sticky. 2minutes later our friends came to tell us they were not stopping in their room after a quick inspection of their room we could see why, it made ours look positively opulent with a stale mildewy type smell so we went to reception with them and joined the queue to complain which was quite lengthy they were then given another room which still quite discusting was better than the first. I would not stay in the hotel again rent free though in it,s favour the location is first class.

Reviews.Title: “No problems for us”
Reviews.Author: smithireland
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at the hotel Penn. To be honest we were really nervous after reading other reviews and had thought about changing but as it was the weekend post Thanksgiving all hotels were booked solid. We arrived, yes the lobby is wonderfull, however after reading reviews we knew not to be fooled by this. We stood in line at 2.00 pm (check in is not supposed to be until 3). The line moved quickly and we were dealt with by a very nice lady who greeted us with a smile and pleasant service. We had booked a Superior refurbished room, we were directed to the 12th floor - our rooms had the letter A after the number seemingly this is important. We were very happy with the room, it was clean, bright, the bathroom was also clean, the room had a large king bed, very comfortable - although the room wasn't huge it was very adequate and as we had not paid Waldorf prices, we were happy. The location of this hotel is one of the best I have ever stayed in, especially if you are a shopper like me. Very convenient almost at Macy's front door. The only problem we had during our stay is that we were supplied with one pillow only and my husband likes to sleep with two pillows. We did ring up housekeeping who told us that she would put us on a list but that they did not have any as the hotel was full. I told her not to worry as Kmart had plenty and we went around the corner and bought one - end of problem. On the day of check out we organised express check out with the desk clerk early in the morning, he very kindly arranged for us to hold our room until 2.00 pm even though check out was at 12.00 - so we could shower just before leaving for the airport and return flight to Ireland. Our experience with the hotel Pennsylvania was fine. It is not a luxury hotel but then you are not paying luxury prices. Once you stay in a refurbished room you should have no problems. As far as I could tell from floor 10 upwards the rooms were good. The location was excellent and the staff were always friendly and helpfull. We would consider returning there again just for the location alone.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful, just dreadful.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Party of 8 (four 2X room reservations) arrived Nov 04 early afternoon in a wonderfully ornate lobby thinking, hey this is the place for us. We merrily proceeded to our rooms once given the keys. This is where the use of such words as wonderful and merry come to a sobering end. If NY is the city that never sleeps, then this is the hotel there that never sweeps. The dirty, trashed walls and musty damp smell that graced the 7th floor corridor was just a pointer of things to come. All four of our rooms (on different floors) were absolutely disgusting. Dark, dingy, filthy, wallpaper creeping off the walls, flood damage stains, mould growing in the bathroom .. I could go on and on. You would need an electric sander to clean the antique grime off the windows. Went immediately back to lobby and joined the hordes complaining to completely disinterested rooms manager to be told that all rooms are like that. A lie, because I had already asked opinion of a room cleaner who said some rooms were renovated and that ours was not. Not getting anywhere, we lost the first day of our vacation seeking clean accommodation, eventually upping sticks to the Milton Plaza without opening our suitcases. It was as bad as that. Horrendous.

Reviews.Title: “It's either hit or miss!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I recently spent a total of 5 nights at the Hotel Pennsylvania; 3 nights at the start of our holiday, and 2 at the end. When I booked our original 3 nights online, I asked for a non-smoking room that had been renovated. When we arrived at our room on the 6th floor (room # 624!), to say we were disgusted and upset would be an understatement! The room was tiny, in a very bad state of repair, and absolutely stunk of cigar smoke. We weren't putting up with this, so I went back downstairs to the front desk, explained the disgusting nature of the room, and the receptionist was very understandable, and put us in another room. As this was on a Saturday night, the availability of rooms was very limited, so the receptionist said if our replacement room wasn't acceptable, then to put up with it for one night, and then ask for another replacement on the Sunday, when many of the guests would have checked out leaving more rooms available. When we reached our replacement room, the anticipation/trepidation was like that in a horror movie scene, when you're not quite sure what awaits you behind the door! Luckily, the room they'd given us had been renovated, was very comfortable, and had a Queen sized bed. However, the fact the main room had been renovated couldn't also be said of the bathroom! It was in a pretty bad state, but at the end of the day, if you're worried about the state of a room you spend hardly anytime in, then perhaps you should be booking into the Ritz! There was hot water at all times though, but the shower must have been designed with people who stand less than 5 foot high in mind! I'm over 6 foot tall, and had to significantly crouch when having a shower! When we returned to the hotel for the last 2 nights of our trip, we specifically asked the receptionist for a renovated room again, and on this occasion, we couldn't have been given a better room. It was a very spacious corner room on the 11th floor (# 1169 if you want to ask for it!), very well decorated, the bathroom was very nice (with a nicely positioned shower head!), and the room also had a good size desk, as well as 2 sofa chairs with foot-rests. However, the real bonus was when we opened the curtains, and had an amazing view of the Empire State Building. For this part of the stay, we'd give the hotel 5 stars, but based on our experiences first time round, we'd give it a 1 rating. So overall, we have to say this hotel is only average. However, for the price we paid, and the location of the hotel, we really can't complain too much. I'd suggest speaking to the hotel directly before arriving, especially if you book through an independent hotel website.

Reviews.Title: “don't go there!”
Reviews.Author: holidaymaker83
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel, we were really impressed by the lovely reception. There was a group of 7 of us, with 3 rooms booked. When we were all issued with our room keys we were all on different floors! When I got out the lift at the 7th floor, the smell of mould & oldness hit me. I was dreading going into the my room (thank god i wasn't there on my own - the room was along a dark, smelly corridor). The room was an absolute discrace, the window wouldnt close right, there was mould all over the walls, the carpet was all stained, the toilet leaked when it was flushed, the bedside cabinet didn't have any drawers, there was cables hanging from everywhere and the sockets weren't even attached to the wall! The rest of the groups rooms weren't much better either. When we went to complain there was already 3 different groups of people complaining. When we complained and advised that our room was on the 7th floor a member of staff said that that is one of the worst floors in the hotel and should be shut down! We all managed to get new rooms and they were much better - I couldnt beleive it was the same hotel. When we were speaking to people that live in New York and told them where we were staying there - their faces said it all.

Reviews.Title: “No problems for us!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews it got myself and my boyfriend were pretty nervous and considered looking for somewhere else to stay. But the price and location were to good to give up. We stayed there for 7nights and I'm so happy we did. The location is fantastic. My room was spacious and clean. Housekeeping was always done on time. We didn't have one problem with the hotel, and I am quite fussy!! One evening I got talking to people in the lift and found out that their room was terrible. I think with this hotel you can be lucky, depending on what floor you are on! I guess we were one of the lucky ones! I would recommend this hotel if location and price are important.

Reviews.Title: “grotty hotel, nice location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location but this is the only redeeming feature to this hotel. We did have clean sheets ( i had taken my own after reading the reviews on here...) but everything else in the room was dirty, past its user date and in need of a good scrub! Friends of ours stayed on a lower floor and it was in a much better state than our floor...the wall paper was falling off, the curtains did not close as the rail was broken, the smoke alarm was bleeping (we called the guy to fix it and as he could not reach he asked my husband to climb up and change the battery as he was taller....amused us for hours!), the bathroom shelf was not hinged down, the arm chair was worm away and filthy etc, etc... We only had a night and were able to laugh about it...if I had been staying any longer i would have have asked to be moved but hey we were only in the room for sleeping! Be warned!

Reviews.Title: “Great location....but”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The only positive of this hotel is the location, you really could not ask for better. Arrived at the hotel after a long day travelling from a trip to las Vegas. Long long wait to book in. Finally given a room, openend the door to be faced with what looked like a prison cell it was so small. The bathroom was filthy, paint coming off the walls, the shower tray peeling and worst of all the room was still dirty from the previous user. Filthy sheets, rubbish bins full to over flowing. Why were we given a filthy dirty room? It was quite late in the day and not early morning soon after the previous occupant had left. We immediately returned downstairs and refused to stay in the room and asked for another. The sad thing was that the person who booked us in was not suprised to see us back at all, it seemed as though this was quite normal to him. We were given a much better room although I did get bitten by some insect living in the room...5 times infact. I have since been on the hotel web site and they only show rooms that look good and certainly not what we were given which to me is false representation. I don't think in the 3 days we stayed there did I meet anyone who was happy with the hotel. The main cause of complaint was the rooms and how dirty they were. 2 couples were even moved to different hotels as the ceiling to their rooms was falling down!!!! I have stayed in Travel Lodges in the US at a fraction of the price we paid and the rooms have been considerably better.

Reviews.Title: “No Problems”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights and had no problems what so ever. Again like everyone a bit apprehensive after reviews, but once in the room and settled down there was no problems. The amount of people staying in this hotel is quite a lot judging by the foyer, which was packed all the time. As for waiting for 40 minutes to check in the longest we waited for was 2 mins.(we arrived about 16.40 just after the rush which seemed to be about 15.00 after everyone has checked out). We got the air train from JFK to Penn station(cost about 20$ for 2 people) and where pleasantly suprised to see the hotel as soon as we got out of the station. Overall great location average place to stay, but if you pay less dont expect Trump Towers. Would stay here again and if you get a dodgy room ask to be moved because there is certainly enough of them.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not as bad as most reviews make out!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned (23/11/04) from a 5 night stay at the Hotel Pennsylvania. We have to agree with the most recent reviews that the hotel is definitely not as bad as most of the reviews on this site make out. Before going to New York we read the reviews and were very apprehensive about staying at this hotel. We even tried to change our accommodation but were unsuccessful.
