We arrived at the hotel expecting the worse and thankfully things were not that bad!! We arrived at 2:30pm and people were already checking in so we decided to join the queue. We only had to wait 15 minutes and then we checked in without any difficulty. We had requested a renovated room and were given one. Our room was on the 16th floor and when the lift door opened we were definitely not hit by a strong smell of damp. If anything it smelt slightly dusty. The landings were clean and litter free. Our room was small and yes the wallpaper was discoloured with age, the paintwork needed a wipe and the carpet had seen better days but overall the room was clean. The blankets were clean and the sheets brilliant white with no suspect stains. Our bedding was changed three times during our 5 night stay. The bathroom was spotlessly clean and we had plenty of clean, fluffy white towels which were changed daily. Our shower curtain was clean and you could tell it had been changed for our stay. We did not have a magnificent view of New York from our window but then again we were only in our room to sleep and shower. The window had a blind, nets and curtains so we definitely had privacy. Whilst staying at the hotel we never once felt threatened by other guests, homeless people etc. There was always a security presence besides the lifts in the main lobby. The only thing we would say against the hotel is the price of breakfast in the Joe O's restaurant. It is expensive compared with cafes etc outside of the hotel. We went to the Bagel Maven Cafe (just along the street from Penn Station) everyday for breakfast and paid half of what the hotel charged. The cafe even do great takeouts. The hotel is in an excellent location. Penn Station, Madison Square Gardens, Macy's and the Empire State Building are right on the hotel's doorstep. Times Square, Broadway and other main attractions are within easy walking distance. Overall we would say that the hotel is fine and do not be worried about the bad reviews on this site. We have stayed in far worse accommodation than this hotel in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I have ever seen”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Hotel Pennsylvania was horrible. It took 40 minutes to check in and upon finally arriving in my room, I found it to be completely run down. Paint was chipping off all of the walls, the carpet was stained everywhere and plaster fell off the ceiling all night long on to all of my things. As if that wasn't enough, I woke up at 2:00 am to the sound of someone opening the door to my room. The front desk had given a key to my room to a complete stranger. Their only response was to this incident was to tell me I shouldn't be concerned because it was a nice person.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as I thought!”
Reviews.Author: Sc0tt27
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews of this hotel I was a liitle concerned to what I was going to find. I am happy to say that my experience at the Hotel Penn was nothing like what other people have apparently experienced. Sure, its an old hotel and there is a kinda of a 'musty' smell in the corridors but my room was more than adequate for my needs. It was small, but cosy. The bed was great, the doors locked securely and I had fresh towels and maid service every day. The shower took a little while to heat up and there was no view from my window. It definately wasn't luxurious, but in NYC you get what you pay for - for those expecting luxury prepare to spend a few extra dollars!! Anyway, the hotel met my needs and is in a fantastic location in the heart of Midtown Manhattan. All the main sights are in walking distance and having Penn Station directly across the road (with trains to Newark airport) is an added bonus. I probably would only recommend this hotel to younger toursits in the city for a few days - a great base to explore the chaotic experience that is NEW YORK CITY!!!

Reviews.Title: “its an ok hotel, maybe i was lucky”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: this hotel is not as bad as i feared, to be honest reading the reviews on this site i was fearing the worst but when i go there i found the Staff friendly and helpful, was shown to my room within ten mins of entering the building, the floor i was on was the 14, it seemed a bit drab but nothing worth moaning about, it was clean and smelled ok, so i then entered my room, large clean and tidy, a few fag buns on the carpet, but that's all that was wrong, the bathroom was clean had fresh towels, colour tv weith remote!!! the location is brill, 5mins walk to Time Sq, Emprie State, i don't know what half of the people are going on about in here, the place is not a dump, would stay there again!!! if you want pictures of the hotel, let me know will glady email them to you the place is great, cheap ish, v v well located and the people are fun, happy and helpful!!! i had the greatest time ever in NY!!!! PEACE

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't even let an in-law stay there”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was horrible. Check in took 45 minutes, as did check out when they incorrectly charged us. Had booked non-smoking on non-smoking floor, guess what, room smelled so strongly of smoke we had to ask for another room. Finally got moved to a different room, where we could hear every word our neighbour spoke on the phone, due to paper thin walls and adjoining door. They decided that it was time to turn off the heat on our second day in the entire hotel, and even though it was still cold enough for winter coats outside. I complained, they told me that the law permitted them to let us freeze, and didn't even offer extra blankets, which I would have been afraid to use due to unidentified stains. After all the problems I had, they had the nerve to try to charge me to keep my bags in a lockup for half a day. When I complained, they finally waived the stupid $5 fee. All-in -all a horrible experience, smelly rooms and floor, and oh yeah, the lobby bathroom, and the bathroom at the entrance to the so-called health club (which was locked and I couldn't get a key to) was over-flowing into the hallway. Yuk. Pay the staff an extra dollar an hour, and maybe they would actually clean and check people in!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Heard a lot about this hotel, so we were a bit apprehensive when we checked in. No delay in the lobby, room was on the 5th floor, a bit old fashioned but clean. Bedding was clean, decorations a bit outdated but OK, everything worked. Towels and sheets changed daily. Small cafe in the lobby, cheap and fast service, internet connection via the TV in the room (reasonable charge), polite but unremarkable service from the staff. All in all, a comfortable hotel at reasonable cost, and excellent central location.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe 95% of the reviews you read on this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Arrived with my husband for a three night stay on November 11th. I had read some of the reviews of this hotel and was really expecting something awful but it's really not that bad. The check in staff at reception were very pleasant and check in took all of two minutes not the half hour to one hour stuff that I had read on the reviews. Our room was on the 8th floor and while very basic and in need of renovation, it was clean, warm, sheets were changed every day and we got new towels every day. The hotel landing did not stink, the staff were not unpleasant and the rooms were not disgustingly dirty as reported. So if you want a New York City hotel in a great location at a great price stay here. If you want the Ritz, and are willing to pay for it then stay there. Afterall you get what you pay for and you pay for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad......”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: IMHO this hotel is not as bad as most reviews are stating. I have stayed here twice this year. The first visit was in an un-renovated room(not recommended!) and most recently last weekend a renovated room. There was nothing wrong with my room at all. I had two large double beds, TV and a clean bathroom. It fitted my needs as I don't waste time sitting in the room. At £90 a room/night you can't go wrong. This hotel is situated in the most prime position in NYC for the tourist. If you want five star comfort then go pay £200/300 a night. My advice is don't be put off by other reviews, just make sure you book a renovated room and get out and explore.

Reviews.Title: “Love the location and inexpensive rates”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Hotel Pennsylvania in NY City while my daughter ran in the NY Marathon. There were a lot of other Marathon runners staying there too. They too must have been on tight budgets like us. We had a total of 8 people staying in 4 different rooms. I stayed from 3 nites, and the others stayed a week and went shopping and further sight seeing. We had great service from the Front Desk Manager making arrangements to stay there, all the way through to housekeeping and until check out. Our room had two beds, nice curtains, lamps, and etc. a couch, and a large walkin closet with an ironing board and iron in it. The hotel is located directly across the street from Madison Square Gardens, one block from Macy's, several blocks from Time Square and etc. I highly recommend this hotel if you want to save $50 to $100 per night and use that on the finer sights of New York. Call the hotel, and tell them what type of room meets your needs and they will comply with your requests.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but OK”
Reviews.Author: dgordon624
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel and found it perfectly adequate. The room was tired and the decor faded, but it was clean and the maid service was first class. For the location and price, this is a bargain. We would certainly stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Filthiest room I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are budge travelers so all we expect from a room is that it be clean and have a bed. Seriously we do not ask for much. Well this past Saturday, Nov 13, 2004, we went to see a show in the city and since my mother-in-law was willing we let her take my son for the night. It was our fist night out in the 7 months since he was born. We figured we would get a hotel and go back to NJ in the morning. Check in at the hotel was fine; the lobby was beautiful and clean. Our room was on the 15th floor when we stepped of the elevator we knew we were in trouble. The hallways smelled disgusting and all the doors and ceiling were decaying. We got to our room and our room smelled just as bad if not worse than the hallway. The walls were actually peeling and furniture was falling apart the walls and floors were filthy it was the worst room I have ever stayed in. They could not even bother to replace a cheap lamp cover that was falling apart. I felt horrible touching anything. We have stayed in cheap hotels before and they were fine. All we are looking for is a place to sleep but I would at least like a place to sleep that I was not afraid to put down my personal belongings. I would never recommend this rattrap. I have written an email to the hotel and am waiting for an explanation. If I had been staying for more than one night I would have raised heck at the front desk. As it was my one night out in ages was ruined.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldent kennel the dog here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room was smelly, bedding was damp, no curtains on window, cockroach type creatures crawling around, room dirty. Other room offered same. Decided to get another hotel which at gone midnight, staff were very un cooperative, would not let us use phone or even call the holiday company to sort it out. In desperation we stayed at the astoria, just to get somewhere decent. The room was so bad that I wouldent even have put my dog to stay in it. This is the worst hotel I have ever come accross, outside of third world countries.

Reviews.Title: “Short Stay ONLY!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Arrived 01/11/04 at 13:00, and we were allowed to check in early. By 13:30 we had changed our room three times, the receptionist was happy to keep changing until I was happy(ish). Some rooms are better than others, the worst rooms are uninhabitable, the best rooms are just acceptable. The web site is about 5 years out of date, the receptionist told me that the refurbishment was carried out about the same time. Knowing what I know now, I would return to this hotel (great price), but I wouldn't stay here longer than 2 nights. I've been told that the YMCA is just as good, and only costs a couple of dollars a night. It's a great location, you get clean towels, your room cleaned and bed made up every day, but don't expect anymore than that. You shouldn't have any problems with the staff, some are very friendly, the rest are polite. Take the journey, New York is the new Rome, but don't forget some comfortable shoes!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is definitely the worst hotel I've ever come across. Please don't be fooled by the hotel lobby. It is the grimiest, shabbiest place. There were stains on walls, bare spots where the carpet wore off, shabby furniture, mold everywhere! I was genuinely concerned of mice and roaches. The staff was extremely hostile. Please please don't make the same mistake I made; there are definitely cheaper cleaner alternatives in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but ok!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I must say that most of these reviews are seriously exaggerated! When I read these before I left for New York I became quite panicky but now I want to write a small word for future visitors of hotel Pennsylvania. Upon arrival (2 pm) we checked in within 15 minutes. We requested for a refurbished room (because of these awful reviews) but the deskclerk told us there were none available because the hotel was fully booked (New York marathon). We would stay 3 nights and he proposed another room for our last night (after marathon). But after checking out our room it was perfectly fine! Ok, it was old but clean! The hallway did centainly not smell bad, it was more a carpetcleaner odeur. The room was indeed rather small and the biggest issue was the bed. My husband and I are both 5.10 ft and the bed was way too small and narrow for us, it was also quite wobbly, so we put the mattras on the floor and slept perfectly fine! There were absolutely no pets and no homelesspeople in sight! If you are planning to stay more than 5 nights another hotel might be worth looking for because of the space. The air in the room was very dry but there was hardly any noise at night, so we had a good night's rest! To give you a clue what we are like, I used to be a flight attendant for six years so I've seen A LOT of hotels and my husband is a business manager. So people who are planning to stay here, do not worry!

Reviews.Title: “don't know what the fuss is about”
Reviews.Author: bigmama45
Reviews.Content: Ok, so their redecorating but it doesn't affect guests. The location is fantastic, the staff were friendly and for what we paid we really can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “My worst experience with a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: WorldVisitor
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last New Years night and had a similar experience. We were dead tired and had to call 5 times to get the promised roll-a-way. The room definitely had an odor. The best description I could give for the room would be very old with little maintenance. We were put on the thirteenth floor and I assumed that since I had never seen a hotel use the number that they just didn't use the floor except for overflow at New Years.

Reviews.Title: “stay away”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I got a room here for the NYC marathon. I was not expecting a lot, but I thought some basic things like hot water would be included. I had to take a cold shower because the hot water was out on the 6th floor. When I went to complain the hotel would not move me to a different room or give me a discount. The rooms looked horrible, the carpet was so old I was afraid to walk on it with out shoes. Stay far away from this hotel, you would be better off sleeping in a tent in central park.

Reviews.Title: “stand up for your rights”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ive just got back from manhattan and apart from the hotel i had a great time. On checking in we were given a room on the 16th floor. Before i could turn and pick up our bags on getting our room key, there were 2 couples waiting to complain, one wife was crying about their room. On opening our room door the smell hit us like old smoke and mould, there was a telly sitting on a box in the middle of the room, the bedding was grey with age and the carpet was badly stained. We went back down to the lobby with our bags and met one of the couples who told us they were given a new room on the 9th floor and it seemed ok, so i went and asked for the manager and told her we wanted a clean room, one that didnt smell, she told us that we got what we paid for and then i said i wanted our money back. We ended up on the 9th floor and the room was alot better but if you dont fight for it you wont get it. Also dont use the stairs from the 2nd floor down we found needles and the smell of **** and **** was unreal. Its best to take a lift down. I met a lad from kerry who said he was offered 3 rooms the second one had **** on a wall. I know its only a 2 star and its in mid-town manhattan. But we are human!

Reviews.Title: “Better off in jail...”
Reviews.Author: Lockjaw43
Reviews.Content: Look up 'funky' and there should be a picture of this place... Old, old old everything - my room looked like a set from CSI Manhattan- all that was missing was the chalk outline. It took 4 calls and 25 minutes just to get the phone turned on. Two stars is gracious in the extreme- keep looking is my advice.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Pennsylvania should spend time and money...stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I booked 2 nights recently at the hotel Pennsylvania. We were looking forward to our stay in the city. We arrived to the hotel and our first impression of the lobby and shop area was that it was "nice". As we proceeded to the elevators, getting off at our floor and walking to our room, it just got worse. We entered the room and all we could do was laugh at initial shock. The carpet was stained, the lamp shades were torn and discolored, I found an empty soda bottle under the bed, the dresser was missing a drawer handle, the bathroom sink had a minor leak, the mini fridge was lop-sided and worse of all there was NO A/C. I contacted the front desk to be informed that after the summer, the air conditioning is turned off. (the outside temp during our stay was low 60's) We were roughly 18 stories high, in a tiny room with no AC or air vents. I was exremeley disappointed with the appearance of this hotel considering the rates they charge and how close to times square and other attractions it was too. I would think the hotel mgt. would want to make rennovationd or even just pay to clean the rugs to make a good impression on guests - So they would want to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad but take a renovated/superior room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel last year - 11th December to 17 December. The location is excellent, close to all the shops & sights, however the room was quite bad. I didn't mind too much as I spent most of the day shopping & really only slept in the room. The carpet was dirty and if you opened the window you couldn't close it again! The doors also really do look like coffins. I am going back to New York this year and have booked this hotel again but this time I have booked a Superior Room which is apparently a renovated one. Some of the floors are renovated and you really can see the difference between the good & bad floors when stopping in the lift. Hopefully it will be nicer than the last but if not I don't think I will mind too much. For the price it is really good value & the location for shopping is brilliant. I would also advise people not to eat in the cafe/restaurant in the lobby. It is totally overpriced - $7 for a bowl of cereal & $4 for 2 slices of toast. You are better off to go somewhere close by or get a takeaway and bring it back to your room. I would recommend this hotel - it is quite cheap & I would prefer to have an extra $600 in my pocket to spend shopping than paying it for a better hotel that I am really only going to sleep in

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Arrived in the Hotel Pennsylvania for a 7 night stay on 24 October. To say that we were dreading this Hotel is an understatement, but were we in for a surprise. Check in was quick and efficient. When opening the door to our room we held our breath... but were we happy with the room. It was spacious, clean, and all u could ask for when you pay $100 a night. The bathroom was clean and towels were changed every day. Also when we returned to the hotel every night it was freshly cleaned. There is a bar in the Hotel with a restaurant attached which is definitely worth a visit. Very nice staff, food, drink etc! So for anyone who is thinking of staying in this Hotel but who is apprehensive, go ahead it’s in a great location and it’s all in all a great place with friendly and helpful staff. When I visit NY again I will certainly stay at the Hotel Pennsylvania.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this dump in May 2002. Booked it through private travel operators who assured us what a wonderful hotel it was. Researching it on the internet (before I discovered the godsend that is tripadvisor) the hotel looked ok; nice rooms and a plush, expensive looking lobby. The lobby turned out to be the only part of the hotel that looked anything like the pictures on the net. Shiny and expensive looking, the marble flooring should have been an indication of what the rooms would be like upstairs. Oh, how wrong we were. Once we stepped out of the lift, it was like we had started in the Waldorf Astoria and ended up at the Norman Bates/Psycho motel. The corridors were dark and dingy and painted in a manky pea green colour. Even the doors to the rooms were odd and looked like the hatch doors of a submarine. Once inside, it only got worse. The pea green paint continued and the flickering light only made the shabbyness of the room more apparent. The one chipped and stained lamp did not work and the curtains and bed linen looked like they'd seen better days. The bathroom looked like ones that you would see in the tenement buildings of an old late 70's/early 80's movie. Really, the Pennsylvania looks exactly what it is; a hotel that in its heyday would have been the epitome of 1930's art deco glamour, but which has sadly been allowed to fall into disrepair. Unfortunately now, the only thing right with this hotel is it's location (it's bang opposite Madison Sq Gardens, Penn Station is next door and the Empire State Building is at the end of the road) but with so many other cheap but nicer hotels right nearby, even it's location does not warrant you risking fleabites to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “So Butt!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel room I have ever had. The outside and lobby make you think that the place is ok. The room was disgusting. It smelled like someone had been smoking pot for 6 months straight in our room. There was pubic hair in the sink and shower. There was dirt and grime everywhere. I don't know how we slept there. Thank god we got tanked at a wedding before returning to the hotel. I would never, never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A filthy, disgusting dump with nasty staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We got to the hotel at 11:00 AM to check in and thought the lobby was beautiful and the location great. The "check in" line was a mile long but we finally got to the front in about 45 minutes. The clerk looked at me and asked "checking out?" I replied that I was checking in so she then asked for the next person in the line who was checking out. This went on for about 15 minutes and I finally asked her when she would help me. She pointed to a sign and screamed at me "can't you read - check in is at 3:00PM". I asked if I could check my luggage until then and she motioned to the elevators and said "downstairs". I took my luggage downstairs and waited about 15 minutes until being told that I needed "check tags" that were available at the front desk. Back at the front desk, I finally saw a line for "baggage tags" and was then told that it would be $4 a bag to check luggage - I have never seen this at a hotel. I finally checked in after 3:00 PM (after waiting for another 30 minutes) and found my room - we were just sick. The place was filthy and in total disrepair. The rug looked like it was the original put in when the place was built, plaster was falling off the ceiling, the water in the tub would not turn off, etc. We had no towels in the room (they were finally delivered 4 hours later after 3 phone calls). Our neighbors had no heat in their room but were offered blankets because their heating system did not work. We complained to the front desk and were told rather rudely that if we wanted a better room we should have reserved a refurbished room. They would not let us move even after offering to pay more but would not tell us why - perhaps the place was full??? On a possitive note, we did not see rats in the room. I would not stay in this place again if it were free. We have stayed in some cheap places in New York and other major cities but have never seen a dump like this. Rather than spending money to make the lobby look elaborate, they should be concerned about repairs and cleaning of guest rooms

Reviews.Title: “From Penn Station go anywhere but here!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked our room over hotel. We could've done much better ourselves. The room stank of cigarettes so that our eyes burned. The walls were scuffed and dingy, the ceilings, moldy, and there wasn't physical space to walk around the bed normally. The person I spoke to in the elevator from the room next door-same thing. Something should be done by hapless tourists who have been burned by this dump!

Reviews.Title: “Dump!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our first time to New York and was so excited about the whole event. The Pennsylvania hotel was disgusting. When we arrived, we thought we had made a great choice by the sight of the hotel lobby, but once out of the elevator onto the 9th floor..........shock. The corridors had a musky smell. Our room was drab, dull and filthy. My sisters room was even worse, mould on ceiling, plaster falling off walls, cobwebs and the wardrobe was a cubbie hole with hooks along the back wall and she had flea bites on her face and neck the following first morning. We hated every minute of it. We had to get on with it and only used the room as a base. Someone told us they had better rooms on other floors, but the few floors we seen were no different. Staff told us most of the hotel had been renovated 2 years ago........dont know what part. Dont be taken for a fool like us. DONT STAY!!

Reviews.Title: “Please don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Please do not ignore the reviews about this hotel. My boyfriend and I stayed in this God forsaken hell hole on a recent trip to NYC. We, like many other poor souls, took a chance, thinking that the hotel could not possibly be that bad. WRONG! This hotel is absolutely vile!!!! In fairness the hotel is quite central but believe me, this is the only perk. It really is worth a few extra pounds to stay in a half decent hotel and enjoy your stay without the dread of returning to the house of horrors at night.

Reviews.Title: “About those weird room doors . . .”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel twice in the early 80s. Then it was called The Statler. In those days, it was a decent place, not too fancy, but clean and comfortable. I'm surprised to read the reviews of it now. It seems to have really deteriorated. Those doors with the bulges once served a purpose. When we were there, we were curious and opened the panel on our door. Inside, there was a shelf and some paperwork. On closer inspection, we found that the shelf was for a pair of shoes. You put your shoes in there, filled out the paperwork, put a tag on the doorknob and someone would come along, take the shoes and get them shined! I'm sure that service has long since disappeared. This was once a grand hotel. It's original name was the Hotel Pennsylvania, as it is now. Before staying there, we heard the big band song, Pennsylvania 6-5000. When we checked in, we noticed that number on the phone. I asked my father, who grew up in NYC, if the song was about the hotel and he told me that, yes it was. I see that the hotel still uses that phone number. Anyway, after the Statler, it became the Hotel Penta, and now uses the original name. From the descriptions, it sounds like the furniture is still the same as it was when we stayed there--and believe me, it wasn't exactly new when we were there! It's a shame that the present owners care so little about the history of this place and have let it fall into such disrepair.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel ever...(Bates Motel)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the absolute worst...please don't waste your money and stay here...we had a total of 6 rooms in all and each one was no better then the last.. there were dirty carpets, nasty shower, mold on the walls...everything bad you can imagine this hotel had it..please do not be fooled by the lobby..its beautiful! once you get in the elevator and hit your floor..it all goes to hell from there.... if you read this review or the many poor reviews on this hotel,..and decided to stay there..well then that your fault..cant say you were't warned..wish i was!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here !!!!”
Reviews.Author: dmcflorida
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay in New York and we had heard that as the Pennsylvania was close to everything and therefore it was a good place to stay - and I would agree with that point. However everything that everyone has posted regarding the condition of the rooms / bathrooms etc is all true - don't believe the pictures on the website - most of the rooms don't look like them. Having read some of the reports I asked at the time of booking for a refurbished room. Check-in was very very slow it took 45 mins with only 15 people in front of us at the time we joined the line. When we checked - in agian we asked for refurbished room and was told that they were able to meet our request, but when we got to the room it was awful, it was small with mould on the ceiling / the bathroom fittings were rusty and the room smelled damp. We went back down and had a word at front desk only to be told "that the rooms was better than most in the hotel" - I suggested that they might not want to mention that too loudly !!! But they did move us and the room was pretty much the same as the last one minus the mould. We stuck with it mainly becuase we had wasted too much time already and were too tired to go surching for another Hotel and pay twice for a 3 night sat. If you are just looking for a place to store your bags then its fine - for anything else like sleeping then forget it - I would never stay there again no matter how cheap and convienant it is - pay the extra and walk a little further !!!

Reviews.Title: “really not to bad”
Reviews.Author: Amanda_Hartley_2004
Reviews.Content: i was very worried about our trip due to the really bad reviews it had recieved however it was not too bad.the 1st room had a horrible bathroom so we asked if we could change which we did and the next room was fine.the location is fab really close to penn station for the subway and after all how long are you going to be in your hotel room when you are in new york city?????

Reviews.Title: “Still having nightmares.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The was the worst, most DISTGUSTINGLY unsanitary hotel I have ever stayed at. When booking the reservation, I knew it wasn't 5 star or anything but was told it was a quality 3 star place and had been recently renovated. However my room definitely had not been renovated (or cleaned for that matter) in a long long time. Don't be fooled by the hotel lobby which is decent the rooms are a nightmare. There were holes and mysterious substances on the walls/carpeting. All of the furniture was broken and stained & looked like it was picked out of a trash dump. The beds only had a thin blanket and sheets and didnt look very clean. The bathroom had what looked like blood stains and was very dirty. The shower flooded the bathroom when it was on. We complained to the staff and were told they could offer us an upgrade for an additional $100, but when I pressed the desk clerk she said that she couldn't guarentee it would be any nicer. It was so bad I was afraid that I was going to catch something from being in the room so my friend and I stayed out all nite just to avoid being in the room. It was the worst hotel experience I've ever had and am shocked the hotel assoc or health dept doesn't shut them down. Dont let the ratings fool you it is a 1-star, maybe 2-star place at best.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price but urgently needs a facelift”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Lets face it when it comes to hotels us Brits are a lot less fussy than the Americans if only because we have to be. Yes this hotel was dirty, had threadbare linen on the beds and it seems the bathrooms haven't been updated since the 1940's but it was still a damn site better than any B&B I've had the misfortune to stay in around the UK!! It's a stones throw away from Macy's, Madison Square Garden and the Empire State and is significantly cheaper than anything else I could find in that part of the city. Every subway train seems to go through Penn station opposite and 5 minutes ride either way you've got Central Park or the Statue of Liberty. If you only intend to spend short periods of time asleep in this hotel it's the one for you but if you want room service etc don't bother!! Be warned about the tourist desk in the lobby they are extremely helpful in organising anything you want but they'll charge a lot of commision. We ended up payinf $75 for $40 tickets for the Mets!! You live and learn!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel we have ever stayed in...anywhere!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and son and I stayed in the Hotel Pennsylvania for one night on our way back from Spain in July 2004, having chosen the place because we were going to catch a train home early the next morning across the street at Penn Station--and with this hotel, the earlier in the morning, the better!. Our AAA travel agent had steered us away from the hotel the summer before, based on its bad reputation (though we didn't realize just how bad its reputation was--and now we understand why it has it!), but the hotel we wanted to stay in this year was booked up, so we took a chance on the Hotel Pennsylvania. We have stayed in various types of hostals and hotels around the world, and this place was the worse, and not just for the old and hideously dirty rooms (the letters "AC" hand-written on the wall above the AC switch, pills on the floor, stains everywhere in our first room; food under furniture and urine in the toilet in our second and supposedly improved room--my wife checked every possible inch for bed bugs) but also for its staff's "Hey, this is what our hotel is like" attitude. They knew it was a dump and had heard so many complaints, it seems, from so many that it was no big deal to them. Several foreign tourists arrived while we were there, and I was embarrassed, frankly, for the United States, as well as sorry that these folks had spent good money to stay in this place during what was probably a package tour to New York! What a dump!

Reviews.Title: “why not stay in a derelict hotel room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the room allocated can only be described as derelict as were the other 5 rooms we were offered.the staff couldnt care less and just shrugged.i am surprised the New York Tourist people dont close this place down its got to be a health hazard.now looking at the other reviews i cannot understand why the management/owners dont do something to the place , i guess they have your money and care a hoot whether you stay again , why should they there'll be another poor sucker along in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “old fashioned but central”
Reviews.Author: zoobie
Reviews.Content: Like many before, I was dreading staying at this hotel as there were 7 of us and it was a birthday surprise for my brother. Out of the 4 rooms we had, only my room required changing due to a dirty white blind instead of curtains, rust in the bath tub, no shower curtain and very dubious brown stains just above the pillows (no headboard). We managed to get our room changed by a receptionist well versed in complaints (we were only half way through our list when we were given our new room key) and although the room was smaller, it was clean. The lobby is beautiful and the location could not be faulted. Stay here if it is dirt cheap but my previous stay in the New yorker was far preferable and in a similar central location

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel on Earth!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This could be the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. The rooms were so run down, it was as if they hadn't been renovated since the 50's. The hotel room was so small it was barely big enough for one person. It was terrible!!! it is not worth $25 nevermind $200. Do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “New York brothel springs to mind”
Reviews.Author: ericcon
Reviews.Content: We arrrived at this "-------" of a hotel at 2am ready for a 4 night stay. Greeting us was a magnificent lobby and pleasant staff. Then we got to our rooms..... mouldy walls, wet beds and carpets, hairs in the bathrooms stuck to the mould, A/C units hanging off the walls, someone's dried up vomit on the floor.... we went in 3 rooms and all the same. One of the rooms hadnt even been made up from the previous guests stay..... dirty beds and towels awaited us....... we did keep the $5.00 tip which was left for the cleaner though !!!! She obviously didnt need it. NEVER AGAIN. We stayed until morning and slept on the outside of the bed on towels and checked out. We will fight to have our money returned....... PLEASE DONT GO. People who say this hotel is OK must need their heads testing or they live in that kind of filth at home and must be used to it........ it could even be the hotel management writing this good things...... TAKE MY WORD FOR IT...... IT IS A --------!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Complete Dump”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This Place is a complete Dump. Stayed there from 31st august to the 5th september. Like a lot of others I had read the reviews and thought, "it can't be that bad surely, not on 7th ave., in midtown NYC". IT IS WORSE, IT IS A PIT, A HOLE, JUST PLAIN CRAP. Got up to the first room allocated to us (my wife and 2 teenage kids and myself)., after the shock of getting out of the lift and into the set of the shining. There was already someone in it !!! Back to reception for another try. recptionist didnt seem at all surprised. Second room total crap and noy enough beds, no curtains, plain white blinds, (well they had been white at some stage in history). which didnt work, Mould in the bathroom etc. Back down to recption. Again the recptionist wasnt surprised and actually said all the decent rooms had been allocated to a conference that was happening across the road. Normally , he said, he would have plenty of rooms for me to try until I found one that was up to standard. He said there were to many rooms to know which ones were habitable and which ones wernt, so normally he just kept trying till he found one. Third room was still crap and short a bed but that was it there were no others. Could go on forever but wont.......Just do yourself a favour DO NOT STAY THERE. Ps. Stayed in three other hotels whilst in the states. The Loews hotel in Beverly Hills, Beautiful and cheaper than this dump. Circus Circus in Las Vegas, Standard but perfectly acceptable to good and the Crowne Plaza in Pittsfield Mass., two thirds of the cost and 10 times as good.

Reviews.Title: “Never again, not even this time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On arrival late at night we were pleasantly suprised by the entrance lobby. Cracked it we thought. We were a party of six (2 Elderly) and we were allocated rooms, not all together to our dissappointment. During the search for room one we were approached by a bemused gent who was shaking his head slowly and repeating "you are not going to believe this". We looked into what only could be described as a cess pit. It was that damp the bedding and curtains stood up and greeted us. The vomit on the floor (yes Vomit) was one of the small hurdles we had to overcome to get to the broken window to get rid of the smell. Room 2. We peeped round the corner of the mouldy door to find the beds had not been made since the last poor occupier and the wet towels from the mouldy shower were still on the floor. Room 3. Youve got the picture, need I say more. only to be mightyly unimpressed at the attitude of the staff. Suffice to say, we checked out before we checked in and went 2 blocks to the fantastic Southgate Towers. Under no circumstances go to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely one of the worst hotels I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had to make a last minute trip to NYC when the UN General Assembly was in session and every hotel was booked but the Hotel Pennsylvania. I paid $219.95/night plus tax for a room that looked like it was in a flop house. I've stayed in all forms of accomodations around the world including youth hostels,pensions and various motels and none were as dirty or in poor condition as the room I got at the Hotel Pennsylvania. The service at the hotel is equal to the conditions of the facilities with the front desk being unhelpful and rude. This has truly got to be one of the worst hotels in NYC. If you can avoid it stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The pennsylvania Hotel,where do I start This hotel looks very exciting when you arrive in the lobby and you think you have cracked it when you see it but wait until you are allocated your room we got a room on the 7th floor(775) and it was disgusting the curtains were hanging off the toilet was dirty the whole room was dirty,stains on carpets,light switches hanging off broken etc the room was cold the air condition did not work,we complained and the staff at reception did not care until we asked for someone higher up,we got someone and he could not change our room until the next day and he said himself he would not stay at this hotel unless he got rooms on the 11th or 12th floor which had been re-conductiond to a higher standard,that was the assistant manager.If you get this hotel tell your travel agent to get somewhere else,DO NOT STAY HERE,I am not telling you a lie,DO NOT GO HERE

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare at the Hotel Penn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were traveling to New York for a business trip. It was close to the convention center and a reasonable price. Once there the nightmare began. There was mold and mildew on the wall. The bathroom door wouldn't close. The bottom frame of the bathroom door was rotted out. The sink was missing a leg. The shower curtain was missing half it's hooks and the floor got flooded at times. There were two people in the room and the maid service left only one face cloth. We requested additional towels and they took them when they cleaned the room. The hallway carpets were disgusting. We tried to change rooms but were told the other rooms were worse...WORSE! Management wouldn't even talk to us. I would NEVER stay or recommend this hotel to anyone. Buyer beware! If it sounds to good to be true it usually is.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Pennsylvania from 13th - 19th New York. After reading the reviews on this website I had prepared myself for the worse, however I was pleasantly surprised. The checkout line was only about 15 minutes long and as long as you are polite and friendly to the staff they are the same to you. We had a room on the 3rd floor (332) which hadn't been renovated. After getting out of the elavator I was expecting to be hit by an awful smell. This was not the case though. There was a faint old smell, but nothing that would bother you. When getting to the room I was again expecting the worse, but instead was met by a large clean room. Sure it wasn't perfect (small amounts of mould in the bath, wet carpet by the air conditioning, leakinging sink and part of the blind was falling down) but it was bearable. The blind and sink both were fixed during the week with out us having to complain and it was visable that the cleaner had attempted to get the mould stains out of the bath as there was very little left by the end of the week. The shower was extremely powerful and the air conditioning worked well. There were two windows in the room and one in the bathroom all of which we were able to open. Fair enough the windows and the carpet were dirty, but not so it was unbearable. It was obvious that the cleaner vacumed at least twice a week and the towels were changed daily. The cleaning staff were always friendly. The latest the room was ever cleaned was 5pm and if you are in the room the cleaners ask what you want cleaning. There is also a gym on the 18th floor that is free to guests and open 24 hours a day (you use your room card to open the door to gain access). If you ever are short of towels there is a huge supply in the fitness room. I would definatley stay at this hotel again. The imperfections aren't major and don't spoil your holdiay, after all you won't be in the room very often. Next time I may take a rennovated room to see the difference between the two. It is worth taking a trip to the different floors so you can see the difference in the halls - it is easy to tell the rennovated floors - the 18th floor (with conference rooms) is actually quite posh! If anyone is interested I have some photos of inside the hotel and am willing to email to them if you are worried.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading so many horror reviews of the hotel, I was prepared for the worst. To my pleasant surprise, my renovated room on the 11th floor was better than expected - the sheets were crisp, and the bathroom was clean. Definitely good value for money. The location was great and the staff efficient and polite! My boyfriend and I had a most memorable time there :)) !!

Reviews.Title: “The location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i went to new york city for vacations and i stayed at the hotel pennsylvania which is located on 34 st across the street from madison square garden. it was a well centralized hotel and u have everything close to you and there is no need to take a taxi . i had the penn station across the street from me and the train #9 or 2 would take u to ground zero. the hotel was nice and clean and yes i would stay there again. i will give it a 3 star sept 9, 2004 . thanks linda and alex

Reviews.Title: “What a Fab location!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After booking the hotel i read some terrible reviews of the hotel on this site and was quite worried about what we had booked! Needless to say i didn't need to worry at all...the hotel is in a fab location, it's right in the centre of everything about a 10 minute walk to Times Square with Maddison Square Gardens directly opposite. The hotel lobby is beautiful i think it has recently been refurbished, the room we had was basic and wasn't decorated to highest standard, but the bed was comfortable and clean as was the bathroom. In my opinion if you are in such a fantastic city as New York the decor of my hotel room is not highest on my list of priorities...there is so much better stuff to be looking at! All the hotel staff were friendly and helpful and also they were fine with you taking food to your rooms. We are planing to return to New York again and the Hotel Pennyslvania would be our first choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hell on earth”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel isnt even worth rating, its hell on earth trust me!!!! me and my boyfriend stayed for 8 nights in this hotel at the start of september and i would never set foot in it again. we were very anxious about staying here after reading all the reviews and were thinking surely it cant be that bad, BELIEVE ME IT IS!!!!. we had to change rooms five times to even get a room that you could actually stay in. Between the smell of urine and cockrouches i had my fill by day eight. it totally put a damper on our first time in new york, believe me it is well worth paying the xtra to stay somewhere else!!!!! ANYWHERE ELSE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad really”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself and 3 friends spent 5 nights in the Pennsylvania in August 2004. The hotel is very central, right opposite Penn Station, and easy walking distance from Time's Sq. etc. However, the interior is a bit on the very shabby side. If we imagine the Hotel had a budget of $1 million, they spent about $2 on upgrading the 1300 rooms and $999 998 on the lobby. The doors to the rooms are a little like something from a 1970s aeroplane exit. The rooms are huge and bit dingy, but for the price they are not too bad. All in all this is a good hotel, particularly as there are some real dumps in midtown NYC :-)

Reviews.Title: “It was awful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel from September 1st through the 8th. I just wanted to say that I was totally disappointed in the room. From all the pictures on their website the hotel looked beautiful. When I arrived we were given a room that was very small and covered in mold. I went and complained to the front desk and I was given a different room. It was a little better in the fact that there was no mold but, the dresser was missing handle to the drawers. The carpet was filthy. I left a twist tie on the floor in plain view and it was never picked up the whole time I was there. So I doubt the floor was vacuumed the whole week. I think if they are going to show the nice rooms that are on their site they should deliver. I have even looked at pictures on other sites that have pictures of the rooms. I know some have been renovated and some haven’t and still our room didn’t look like anything shown. I am surprised that they haven’t been sued for false advertising. If I could have found something else in such a short time I would have. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. I will be telling everyone not to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Honestly.........”
Reviews.Author: corhiain
Reviews.Content: Booked to stay here for 5 days with another female friend in April 2004, our first time to New York. Got an amazing deal on it so really didnt expect to much. ARrived 3am and booked in, went up to the room, it was huge....5 BIG walk in wardrobes a huge bed/sitting room and bathroom. The furnatue was very 1940's but being two young-ish girls were very scared of the size of the room....a family of 20 could have lived in it with ease, so we had our room changed with no prblems at all and were moved up the the 9th floor, to a much smaller room but lovely furnature, clean, nicely decorated and with all working amenities that we needed with a lovely view of the Empire State building. Had a few prblems with the phones in the rooms found it hard to call home to the uk but had that problem at all the phones in NYC!!! The maid's were lovely, my spanish did come in handy though, and were so grateful when we left them a tip at the end of the week. Same goes for the lovely lads in the luggae hold area at the back of the hotel they couldnt do enough for you. LOcation was within walking distance of Macy's, Opposite Maddisen S G and 5 mins walk from Times Square was an amazing 5 days with great rooms and friendly staff. If you want to go and are budgeted go here, if your not happy in your room get it changed until you are happy the staff are helpful- although the reception staff dont smile to much! Have a good time!;)

Reviews.Title: “Bum Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I live in NYC. my lady and I booked a night there beacuse we were traveling to Canada by train Penn Station which is right across the street. The room they gave us was not fit for a doberman. The hotel room was disgusting. I truly belive that they save the clean rooms for the upscale entertianers that visit NEWYORK. I could not wait to leave that hotel. AS A NATIVE NEW YORKER BEWARE IF YOU ARE NOT SOMEONE IMPORTANT DONT STAY THERE

Reviews.Title: “Better than the Rest!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Seeing as I'm a down to earth British girl I'm easily pleased, the rooms are very spacious, mine had a walk-in wardrobe...huge bed, huge TV....Please don't listen to the American reviews who always expect too much, maybe they should talk to their therapists or just get a life! - good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “It served it's purpose”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It served it's purpose. It was a place to sleep and shower. We did not spend much of our time in the hotel being that there is so much to do in NYC. The carpet is disgusting, it was so bad that we didn't take our shoes off unless we were going to sleep or going to take a shower. The bathroom (luckily) wasn't that bad, it seemed pretty clean. As for the doors, they did looked coffins ~really strange~ !!My advice is spend just a little more money and stay in a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hated it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We got to the hotel around midnight after a long flight. We checked in, got our key, went to the room only to find someone else was already staying in that room!! We went back to the front desk and told them of the situation. They gave us another room. When we finally drug all of our luggage to the NEXT room, we found that there were dirty towels on the floor, one of the two beds was unmade, dirty cups and candy wrappers on the bed! We again hauled our luggage back down to the front desk. They gave us yet another key to a room that smelled of mold and mildew. There was mold and mildew in the bathroom and the ceiling was a mess-paint chipping-just a mess. The air conditioner was not able to keep up with the heat and after walking the streets of New York in the summer, it would have been nice to have a room that would cool us down. I won't EVER stay there again and will suggest to my friends and family when they visit New York, not to stay at the Hotel Pennsylvania.

Reviews.Title: “So in need of a renovation!”
Reviews.Author: porcelinnadoll
Reviews.Content: Ok so i have stayed at this hotel a couple of times. The main reason not being that i like it but because its close to the Penn station and where i have business mettings. On 28th. Anyway i have stayed in the regular rooms and the so called 500 Penn rooms that sound like they are special. Both rooms had old faucets and the air conditioning was bad. The regular rooms have bathrooms that i have to use a plastic bag to stand over because im afraid of what i will get. The celling on all the bathrooms in the regular rooms are pealing! above the tub area. the 500 Penn rooms are a bit better. If you have not gone to say westins before u will not be so discusted as i am. But even a young traveler will notice this hotel needs a make over. Did i mention that one time house keeping came to my room at 11:30 at nite? yes they did! usually you dont get them to your room till 3-4 p.m. Even down stairs at the loby if you look up you will see that the borders and that the celling need a remodeling fast you can see wires all over this place. And god forbit you get any help in this hotel in less than a hour.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for the money”
Reviews.Author: italy531
Reviews.Content: Yes it is an old hotel but it was clean and extremely reasonable for NYC. We were terrified by the reviews on here and so happy when we opened our door to fine a clean but small room. We also went during the weekend before the Republican convention and while the place was packed the staff was very helpful. Also, great location.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT DEAL -- You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For under $90 per night, myself and my girlfriend spent a week in New York City directly accross the street from Madison Square Garden! Sure, it was dirty, sure it was smelly. It was nothing you cannot handle unless you are the kind of people that want to hang out in their room and waste their time watching TV instead of experiencing NEW YORK CITY. The staff was helpful for the most part. The cleaning crew, at least from our experience, was thorough and cared that we enjoyed our stay. We had a bad mattress too. We asked for another one and they replaced it immediately with a brand new mattress AND box spring with no hassle. Quit complaining and go see the city.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Location, Great Value, A Vintage NY Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GSVA
Reviews.Content: Hotel Pennsylvania is my favorite hotel in NYC. The staff is always friendly and accommodating. True, the room is small - but it is New York...Who wants to spend much time in the room when there's so much to do right outside the front door? There is a wonderful, affordable coffee shop in the main lobby and the crystal knobs on the doors are so nostalgic. I always enjoy meeting friends and family in the beautiful vintage lobby!

Reviews.Title: “A Well Preserved, Historical Hotel for any Traveler on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: siouxzy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Pennsylvania for one night in May 2004. After reading various reviews on this hotel I was a bit skeptical, however, I was pleasantly surprised to find that the hotel was not horrible as many people have described. You must keep in mind that you are visiting NYC therefore any hotel under $200/night will not be luxury accommodations, if that's what you are looking for you will need to shell out the $$. However, if you are looking for a decent priced, clean hotel that is full of history, meets a traveler's basic needs & is in an excellent location, then Hotel Pennsylvania will be a fine choice. I found the hotel interesting because it was like stepping back in time, the famous Glen Miller song "Pennsylvania 6-5000" was written about this hotel, it is also one of the 5 largest hotels in Manhattan. Because Hotel Pennsylvania is so large & popular, the lobby is very busy & you will most likely experience a longer check in wait then you would at most hotels. The room we stayed in was one of the "non- renovated" rooms which was fine; it was a large, clean room with vintage furniture that seemed to be the original furniture from back in the day; we also had a great view of Manhattan. I like to think of it as staying in a well preserved 1940's hotel, you can picture all of the greats from the Big Band era who used to frequent this hotel wandering the halls, having a great time in NYC. While Hotel Pennsylvania is far from a 4 star hotel, I found it to be a well priced, interesting choice in an outstanding location directly across the street from Penn Station & less then a block form Macy's.

Reviews.Title: “Eww...”
Reviews.Author: nyckid99
Reviews.Content: My mom, sis, and grandma stayed at this...hotel...for one night in August 2003. Whoever said the beauty of the lobby fooled you was 100 percent right. I thought I had walked into the Four Seasons! But that's where this comparison ends...I was immediately turned off by the hallways, and noticed that the doors of the rooms looked quite unusual lol...Thankfully my half of the family was staying at the Crowne Plaza UN, so I didn't have to sleep in this room, and although I didn't notice anything horrid in the room (other than the dated look of the room and furniture), I took a peek in the bathroom...and well, let's just say, it wasn't pretty. One of the un-pretty things I found were nail clippings! Nail clippings! Jeez, makes you wonder what use is housekeeping at this hotel?

Reviews.Title: “What do you expect for $57,- a night?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok. We spent three days there in a non-restored room. Staff was friendly, hot running water, tv-set worked ok, airco was good. What does everyone expect from a $57,- pppn hotel, in the middle of Manhattan of all places. Why don't all you naggers travel a bit further than the Days-Inn in Nebraska and than judge again!

Reviews.Title: “turn of the century dump”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was classified as a turn of the century hotel, which was to have been restored. Well, I felt it must have been restored in the turn of the century. There is a big sign over the check in desk saying " you may rent a smoke detector at an additional price... I thought all hotels had to meet standards. There was peeling paint on the walls, the showers and shower curtains had mold on them. They also say that there where data ports in rooms. i asked whyI didnt have one in my room. they said i had to pay more for a better room. Well can tell you i will not stay here again not worth the money....

Reviews.Title: “GET RENOVATED ROOM!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel Pennsylvaina on June 6, 2004. Have heard complaints about the Hotel for years. Decided to stay because it was close to Penn Station and because I wanted to scratch my nostalga itch. Got to the hotel three hours before check-in time and was accomodated without any problem. I stayed in a 'renovated' room. It was not elaborately decorated but was tasteful and clean. Carpet was clean. Closet was adequate and clean. All doors, drawers, windows worked. The bathroom was absolutely spotless, smelled clean, had more than enough clean good quality towels, shampoo, conditioner, well lighted. AC worked fine. Curtians on window. Bed linnens clean. Bed comfortable. The room was small but I didn't intend to spend a lot of waking hours in the room. Easy access to Penn Station, subway, block away from Macy's. 32nd and 33rd streets were a little "interesting" late at night but 7th avenue was fine. I have an eager need to explorer so found that not all floors are as nice as the one I was on (9th floor I think). The picture of the hall on the HP website was accurate for my floor. Make sure you reserve a "renovated" room, NOT a "standard" room. I booked through the HP website. Got a better rate there than on Expedia or Travelocity or Orbitz. You are able to select the quality of the room on the HP website. Not sure you can on the booking services. There is a higher level of service available than the "renovated" room. Might try that next time I stay. There are also rooms that are less than "standard." Having read the reports here I'm not sure I would even consider looking into them. My experience was good and I would stay there again. For the location, it you get a "renovated" room or higher you are getting a really good deal. Just make sure you get renovated, not standard.

Reviews.Title: “Who paid off the Health Inspector?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As we entered the hotel lobby we were tricked into believing what a beautiful, classy place it was. Soon enough we would enter the point of no return, meaning we did not want to return to our room! Between pieces of the wall falling off, holes in the doors, black mildew on the ceiling and shower, and unpleasant smell in the room the size of a closet we would not recommend this hotel to anyone average standards of what a hotel should be.

Reviews.Title: “Cant see the problem”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel rooms were clean. For the price and the location, I would well recomended it for a stay in New York if you are watching the budget. Obviously if you want 4 star accomadation pay the extra price. But i could not see a problem with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Any way to give a rating less than 1?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We get to the hotel on Thursday night around midnight, looking forward to getting some rest before an early Friday business meeting. As we're checking in, two other guests are at the front counter complaining, so we start to get a little worried. The lobby is pretty nice. There's a little trash on the elevator..not a huge deal. We get off the elevator and really start to get worried. There's a considerable amount of litter in the hallways and the paint/wallpaper are in horrible shape. We open the door to our room, and that was it. It smells like a dark, damp basement, the walls are crumbling. There are visible stains on our bedspread. The furniture was broken down and stained. Our closet had a leaky water pipe in it. The bathroom actually didn't look as bad as the rest of the room, but we didn't stick around to explore. I got on the phone with hotels... They quickly transferred what we paid to the Helmsley Park Lane on Central Park South. It cost about $100 more per night, but at that point we would've paid $1000 just to get the hell out of there.

Reviews.Title: “Pay the extra $'s and stay somewhere else!!”
Reviews.Author: Br0
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through hotels...(and thank the lord for that...cause after our experience they were wonderful). We arrived at the Pennsylvania at 2 pm tired after driving for 8 hours to hopefully get an early check in, which we did and we were quite pleased UNTIL THE ELEVATOR DOORS OPENED...on the 7th FLOOR...and the nightmare began....the paint was peeling off the walls the carpet looked as though it had been there for a century...we entered what they called a hotel room (more like a dump!).....no headboard instead a stained stood on the wall above our two neatly stacked mattresses. The sheets looked worst that something in prison movie and oh yes there were no towels to be found. When we called down to reception to switch room, they stated that "this was one of the best rooms they had"...we were mortified after explaining to the lady that we refused to sleep in a bed with a rather sizable stain suspended above our heads...she switched us to a room on the 10th floor which was slightly less appalling. The staff overall were not nice, I actually feared the housekeeping on our floor and was rather cautious in asking for a set of clean towels (since there were none). We stayed at the Pennsylvania Hotel ONE NIGHT (because every other hotel in NYC seem to be sold out) and switched the next day to the Millenium hotel on Broadway, which was only $20.00 dollars more a night and was absolutely breathtaking! PLEASE THINK TWICE ABOUT STAYING AT THE PENNSYLVANIA NO AMOUT OF SAVINGS IS WORTH THIS!!

Reviews.Title: “STEER CLEAR OF THIS HELL HOLE!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although we have stayed in "cheap" hotels and hostels around the world, this takes the cake for the worst mistake any traveler could make-- this is the WORST, MOST HORRIFIC place we could have selected for our 5 nights in NYC. After a 30 minute wait to check in we almost cried when we walked in to our room--the carpet was damp and stained and the smell was worse than a fraternity house on a Sunday morning. After complaining we received another room which had paint literally peeling in chunks from the ceiling, another damp and stained carpet, mold growing in the corners and curtains that could have been used to sweep 7th Ave. And no smoke detector. The shower, with the spigot at about 4 feet high, didn't drain, forcing us to re-wash our feet after getting out--with shoes close by b/c there was no way you'd want to touch the floor w/bare feet. After trying to sleep on the top of the tiny bed (too gross to even consider looking under the covers) we checked out early the next am and found another place (actually a palace!) for not too much more...we booked w/ Hotels and I am just starting the fight to get reimbursed for the 4 nights we booked but didn't use--I took pictures of the filth to support my claims because no one in the hotel industry would believe what this place is trying to pull off as acceptable accommodations ...the staff was very nice I must say--but if the front desk people had any idea of the quality of the rooms they were assigning they would be ashamed to work there. The lobby is deceiving--it is nice. This teaches me to ask to see a room before I sign anything--and I will never use Hotels again either. My hope is that some news media have reservations there for the upcoming Repub. Convention across the street at MSG and are as disgusted as we were and decide to do a story on it. The place needs to be condemned.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...BUT”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As far as location goes, it was undeniably the best. It was close to all tourist attractions and based on that alone, I would definately stay again. However, the rooms were absolutely disgusting. My friend had left with these strange swollen bitemarks, we deduced were bedbugs!! The room stank, it had a moldy, dampness to it, the room was cramped and the previous people who stayed left their foodstuffs in the mini-fridge! Obviously the maids forgot to clean that out. One room was found with cockroaches!! I think with all the business the Hotel is getting, they could afford to clean-up and make some upgrades to the rooms. The staff could've been more friendly too. I hope whoever stays has a more pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Never had a problem -”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel Penn for events three times now, and I don't know what everyone is talking about. The Hotel is a landmark, so everything is not brand-new. I actually like the "classic" bathroom fixtures. Everything has always worked. The rooms have always been clean and quiet and I got a good night's sleep. I've never seen mold on anything. The renovated floors are definately more up to date, the unrenovated ones look like they were done in the 70's, but they are perfectly servicable and an excellent buy for $89 in a city where $225 is more common. My only problem was one time the A/C didn't work, they got me a new room within an hour and the bellman moved all my gear and wouldn't take a tip for a "relocation". If spoken to in a civil tone the staff are pleasant and competent . If you start out screaming you won't get far, but this is New York, people are not easily intimidated. Don't talk to the cleaning staff, they don't speak english and can't help you anyway. Call the front desk if you have a problem. The place isn't the Taj Mahal, but it's cheap and excellently located. I would stay there again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “lobby was nice, but that's about it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: when i walked into the hotel i thought it looked very elegant. it took over a half hour to check in. finally i went to the 13th floor where our room was located and found the room. once in the room i could not beleive my eyes! broken knobs off the dresser and night tables, stains all over the bed mattress and box spring (on the side of bed), a bathroom so cramped i could hardly move, and a tub stained so bad it looked horrible. people were not friendly who worked in this hotel. no wash cloths in our room. i told the maid in the hall that they had forgotten to put washcloths in our room. i found two the nes day, but never to appear again in our 5 day stay. i would not recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay if it were free!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was by far, the worst hotel I have ever been in. I have stayed in hotels off of the interstate when I have taken road trips and they are far more acceptable than this dump that someone calls a hotel! When my air conditioner started spitting out brown liquid, that sent me right over the edge. What else was wrong? The peeling paint, the stinky, musty smelling room, the gross carpet and the fact that my clothes were damp when I put them on. Please. This was a business trip. AVOID IT AT ALL COSTS!

Reviews.Title: “How to have a good stay at the Pennsylvania! READ THIS!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed in two different rooms, one standard one renovaited. The renovaited room we give an 8/10... this room loses marks because the room was dark with no natural light entering the room, and there was no little bottles of shampoo that we all love. The standard room we give 4/10... the bed was really lumpy! The room smelt of sweety socks. Mould coming from the walls. Mould all around the bathroom taps. Stale food stuck to the floor. AND the room was completely shabby!!! The hotel over all was not that bad and if you choose to stay in a renorvated room then you will be just fine!!! have a good trip!

Reviews.Title: “I thought Hell was in the Cayman Islands?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hell, and yes it did include coffins. The doors of your room actually look like a coffin cover. After 30 minute check in, I proceeded to my room. Upon entering, I noticed women's clothes on the floor, but at least I was greeted by two nice small dogs looking at me and bouncing on the bed!! Back downstairs for another room. Ok, nobody in this room but the mold in the bathroom. Leaving to go to dinner, I was greeted by yet another small dog running around the 9th floor hallway. Back from dinner and too afraid to stay in my room, I wander to the bar for a night cap. Nice bar. They were even nice to the undercover stripper trying to pick up Johns. Back to the room. I didn't even want to pull the sheets off the bed, but I did venture to use the pillows. 1:30, falling asleep. Wide awake at 6:15 to get the hell out of there. I had to wait until 7:30 to leave though, cause it takes an hour to retrieve your $35.00 valet parked car - which of course didn't come fast enough as I then had the pleasure of seeing a transvestite coming out of the hotel. I thought someone told me there was no room service at this hotel? I'd rather stay under Madison Square Garden than here.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as you think”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading alot of the reviews, I was scared to stay at the hotel pennsylvania. I spoke to Irena and she was very helpful, she asked me if i made the reservations directly through the hotel or from the internet. I told her that I made the reservations by calling the hotel directly. I think I got a reasonable rate paying 109.00 a night. I stayed 5 nights. When speaking to Irena she made sure that I was going to get a nice room. I did indeed getting a room on the 10th floor. I found everyone to be friendly, helpful. The room did get a little damp, I believe it was from the air conditioner running all day and night. The carpet was a little dirty but couldnt tell unless you had a child on the floor crawling around. His knees did get dirty. but again we are talking about New York City, people walking and not taking shoes off. Housekeeping kept the room clean and gave plenty of towels, blankets etc. If I needed anything they responded very quickly. I even left a day early and way after check out time and wasnt charged any additional money. It was a nice hotel, and dont worry about the doors looking like coffins. the doors were sound proof. I would definately stay there again. Just remember if your not happy go to the desk and ask for another room. It is a very old hotel but very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Last May i was in NY for 6 days, I read all the reviews after making the reservation and I was scared. I got a room on the 13th floor, it's an old floor, the walls looked awful damaged, some doors too. The room was nothing special it was clean. I don't have any complain to make about the room, it wasn't very nice (old), everyday was cleaned and they put fresh towels and sheets. I haven't seen any bugs, but it's possible they exist.... don't forget it's a very OLD building. I only needed a clean place to sleep and take a bath, i had a great view and NY to enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Why did I pay to stay in this piece of (fill in the blank)!?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First off, let me just say, yes, the lobby is nice. And that is the last nice thing I will say about this dump. We stayed in this hotel in March and I still am questioning why the heck I paid to stay here. It took an hour to check in for one, and that should have told us something. We proceed to the elevator. Oooooh, tv's. Boy, am I excited. The elevator doors open to our floor and all of our mouths drop immediately. The stench of that place hit us and we immediately closed our mouths for fear we might catch some airborne disease. We slowly walk down the dim hallway and pray that our room is better. We notice the doors on all the rooms look like...no that can't be right. Yep. Coffins! What the he....We open our door and are welcomed to peeling wallpaper, nasty furniture, dirty carpet, murky water dripping from the faucet, a horrible stench, an unsanitary bathroom, no towels, a broken lamp, crummy curtains, grimy windows, noise from next door, and dust for days. We are scared to put our bags down for fear we might take some kind of exotic breed of roach back home. I'm telling you that place was so crappy I was scared to pull my pants down to use the bathroom! We attempted to exchange our room and guess what we found in our new room? We walked in on people undressing! There were people in our new room. How do you give someone an occupied room!? How bad is that!? We go BACK down to the lobby and ended up with the same dump for a room. I slept in the chair because I was scared of what I might find when I pulled the sheets back off the bed. I also showered with my slippers on for fear of falling and actually having to touch that grimy tub. Not to mention, the water pressure was so freaking high in the shower I truly believe I lost a layer of skin.
