If I was smart, I would have caused some commotion, got arrested, and ended up in jail because I bet money the jail would have been more updated and cleaner. It's that freaking bad! DONT STAY AT THIS RAT HOLE! Matter of fact rats won't even stay here.

Reviews.Title: “what a dump”
Reviews.Author: yorkiespurs
Reviews.Content: OH MY GOD WHAT A DUMP! i stayed here May 18th-20th 2004.The hotel lobby was nice and check-in took about 20 mins,our room was booked direct with the hotel on their web-site and i requested the nicest possible room as it was my girlfriends first trip to the states, and the upgrade was confirmed at check-in.God what must the other rooms have been like? where do i start? once leaving the elevator the smell hit you and the decor of the walkway to our room was dated to say the least,our room was dark & depressing and smelt of tobacco,the bathroom was cramped, dirty and with the shower base peeling. when we each took showers the water pressure pinned us against the wall,and when we had finished showering we needed to check that one or two of our body parts were still there.on the first morning we decided to take breakfast in one of the two hotel restaurants which cost over $50 and was at best average considering the waitress looked like robert de-niro in drag with an attitude to match (the tip was already included in the bill) i wonder why that was?. On the plus side, the hotel was across the street from penn station which was handy as we travelled on the Amtrak at 7.15am and was close to Macy's and the Empire State Building

Reviews.Title: “Terrible - believe the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: Coley1969
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in December '04. Pictures on web site looked very nice. Lobby lived up to pictures but rooms were appalling. We arrived to find they only had one room reserved for 5 adults despite having paperwork showing 2 rooms! Out of lift into hallway - terrible dirty carpets and hiddeous doors. One room had dirty towels and rubbish left by previous occupant, walls were full of holes from where picture have been hung and paper was hanging off the walls. The other room smelt of damp and smoke and the curtain was hanging from the window. We joined the huge queue of others complaining and were eventually given another room, still smoky but down as a none smoking room. Complained again and were moved a 3rd time, this room was still sub standard but we were only there 3 nights and didn't want to spend all our time in lobby with unhelpful staff complaining. Others we spoke to found bed linen dirty with hairs in, another walked into the room they were given to find someone else in bed! Everyone was complaining. Hotel APPALLING and staff UNHELPFUL - AVOID IT AT ALL COSTS!!!! It is famous for being where Glenn Millers stayed and wrote Pennsylvania 65000 - don't think it has been refurbished since he stayed there!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant holiday, poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After discovering tripadvisor a week before a friend and I were due to fly out to New York I was very worried, but I thought as long as we felt safe (as we are not even in our twenties) and our room was clean it would be OK. I suppose the one good thing was that when we got there I was expecting the worst - and that was what we got. Having checked in we went in the lift to our room on the third floor. As soon as the lift doors opened the smell hit us - it was terrible - like it hadn't been cleaned for years. However as we knew we were only going to be in the corridors for a short amount of time each day, we tried to over look it and proceeded to our room. Walking down the corridors, the carpets were stained, as were the walls, in addition to which the doors of the rooms were mouldy and broken - I can now also see what other tripadvisors meant when they said the doors looked like coffins. When we found our room it was dark and dingy, the beds hadn't been made and there was used towels all over the bathroom. I felt quite sure this would happen - it would seem it happens to most people. We then went back to reception where we were allocated a new room, but recieved no appolgy for the state of the original room. When we got to the new room on floor seven, the room was notabley better, which seems unfair on those who are on lower (worse) floors and have paid the same price. However, this is not to say that our room was nice, although the lighting was better, the main lamp did not work. I notice some people have commented that they had stained curtains - we didn't even have curtains. The bathroom was by far the WORST part of the hotel, there was a hole in the ceiling, the bath was literally flaking away, and it was hit or miss as to whether or not our water was BROWN. In terms of the staff, some were very friendly and helpful, others weren't - either way do not always trust what they tell you as we were informed that the shuttle bus back to the airport would take about a hour/hour and a half tops - it took over two. I would also recommend to avoid the rip off prices in the shop, a few stamps, a drink and a chocolate bar cost me $14. If like us you are booked into The Pennsylvania Hotel and are now very concerned about what you have read, try not to worry too much, despite everything that I have told you above, we still had a GREAT holiday, aided by the hotel's brillant location (it's best feature). At the end of the day, we just laughed about it and got on with enjoying our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “candid camera”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: ok,great joke,where`s the camera,take us to our rooms now- please? the worst room we`ve ever spent a night in. stained carpets,peeling wallpaper,filthy curtains,one of the seven dwarfs beds,the list go`s on. Do not stay here. KEEP AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid like the plague!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was planning a short trip to New York Dec 03 & on searching Expedia I found what I thought looked like a reasonably priced Hotel. My decision to book this hotel was largely based on the photographs shown. Big mistake! The lobby looks great, & the rooms looked pretty reasonable. On arriving the lobby looked exactly as it did from the photo, but boy oh boy, did my boyfriend & I get a huge shock. On stepping out of the elevator, the corridors were manky & the doors to the rooms were awful. We had booked a non smoking room, but on entering our room, it stank of cigarette smoke & was dark & miserable. We rang down to reception who informed us that it was supposed to be a non-smoking room! Then in order to get moved to another room we had to go all the way back down to reception. Fortunately we did not have to queue again & we were assured that our next room was non-smoking. The room was still pretty dismal & the bathroom barely hygenic. And there was still cigarette smoke wafting into our room, probably from the air vents. The bed was terrible, so we didn't sleep particulary well. I know we spent very little time in the room during the day & evening, but even still, you want somewhere clean & comfortable. The only good thing I can say about the place is that it's directly opposite Penn station & Maddisin Sqare gardens & Macy's is just around the corner. Wish I had heard about Travel Advisor before I booked!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Pennsylvania / A good hotel for the price.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend in NYC over the 4th of July. I stayed at the Hotel Pennsylvania. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. It was definitely 'bare bones'....only a shade on the window overlooking Macy's. However, the location is prime especially if you plan to use Penn Station as a transfer point. The staff is helpful but not friendly. All in all, a good hotel for under $100 a night.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is hell on earth....”
Reviews.Author: Carl427
Reviews.Content: Brown sludge ozzing out from the bathroom tap; a dry stale air in the room that doesnt move; claw marks on the fungus on the bathroom wall; mold bubbling the wallpaper above the bed; a bed that folded in the middle when you lay on it; filth, the glorious filth everywhere; five miles of people complaining at the front desk; miles and miles of filthy carpet to trudge to our stagnant room; in the morning instead of feeling refreshed and ready to go - i wanted to slit my wrist. PLease for the love of god do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing like the pictures! HORRIBLE & DIRTY! Please read before you stay here!”
Reviews.Author: vikkij1980
Reviews.Content: We got told that this hotel was "nothing special but clean, cheap and in a great location", so we thought that would be ok as we would not really be in the hotel very often in NY. Well, the hotel was not clean at all! The outside and reception looked ok, apart from a bucket of water catching water dripping from a hole in the ceiling. When the elevator opened on the floor to our room, we got a horrible surprise! The carpets were damp and the wallpaper was practically hanging off the wall with dampness! The room was tiny, dirty and disgusting! We asked to get moved to another room, which we did but it was exactly the same! Very dirty, damp and smelly! The first night we got to NY we spent the first few hours trying to find another hotel, it was that bad! As for this hotel being ok and clean, that is not the case! I would have rather slept in the back seat of my car than this hotel. It really was terrible!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A disgraceful messy shabby hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel Pennsylvania for 3 nights...Don't let the fancy lobby or snazzy internet photos fool you.. This is an awful place..Our room was tiny and dirty and they had forgotten to leave towels for us on the second night and it took over an hour to bring them to our room despite us wondering if they got lost on the way up...The ONLY PLUS is its location...right near everything...but it was a hard earned lesson..What a dump! Stay away....

Reviews.Title: “Beware, not as legendary as they say!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Awesome area, but god awful rooms! We got a room that was to be for 4 people, the 2 beds were smaller than twin bed, barely fitting one person, let alone 2 in each bed! Rooms extremely small, and overall unpleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Keep Away”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with 3friends on 31st May for 3nights.NEVER,NEVER AGAIN. The staff on reception were rude, when we tried to make a complaint to the manager we had to speak to him by phone,would not come out to see us. The room was a disgrace, dirty windows,filthy carpet thank goodness I had taken slippers, behind the unit with the TV on, I doubt if it had ever seen a hoover in years. The ceiling in the hallway on our floor started to fall down and it was left there on the dirty hall carpet. At least there were clean bed linen and towels. A good location, but this hotel definately needs money spent on it big time, their reception staff need training in customer relations.

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mcludublin
Reviews.Content: stayed at the penn hotel for 5 nights in june 2004, we arrived about 11 pm expecting the worse .no delays we were given our room .having read the reviews we were worried going to the room . we found the room clean with 2 beds . the bathroom was fine with clean towels everyday . we found the staff very helpful . we enjoyed our stay and would go back again .its in a great location. we didnt have a renovated room but could have no complaints about our stay

Reviews.Title: “A very shabby hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If I had arrived here earlier in the day, I would have left and found another hotel. The room I was given was incredibly shabby. The carpet and wallpaper were stained, the door looked like it had suffered water damage, the window shade wouldn't close, the air conditioner was broken, the lamp wouldn't stay upright on the wall, there were stains on the bathroom walls and the leg of the basin in the bathroom had fallen off and was on the floor. A very unpleasant place to stay at any price.

Reviews.Title: “Pensylvannia Hotel, i want to go home!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If i knew then what i know now i am off to new york for the second time this november, but must tell you about my previous visit in may 2000 and my stay at the pensylvannia hotel. I had booked a two centre holiday first stop was las vegas which was magic 2nd stop new york was very excited as this was my first time there. it already started badly as we were a day late as there were storms, our luggage had went to new york but we had not! We finally arrived 24 hours later still excited saw the front of the hotel all excited saw the famous chandelier still excited but from the moment we got to our room we wished the storms had continued and we could have gone straight home to dear old rainy england. There were three of us, the room they gave us had a twin bed and a cot bed! good start they changed our room to a twin bedded room, which looked onto a brick wall the the room was incredibly shabby the bathroom was un-clean, the staff were not exactely helpful. did not feel safe at night even though there was a guard in the lift lobby. the only upside is the location it is near all the sights and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Pennsylvania Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Pennsylvania Hotel, NY., in December, 2002. After a long flight from the UK we were exhausted. We firstly had to argue with the hotel manager who said our rooms had been over-booked and we could stay at the airport! We had booked and confirmed the rooms January of that year. He eventually conceeded and said we could have our two rooms, but we could not exchange them. As the hotel lobby was fantastic, we had no fears - wrong!! All the floors of the hotel were dirty and dingy. Our rooms were shabby to say the least, the baths were peeling. But the bed linen and beds were clean. We tried to go else where, but unfortunately at that time of year everywhere was solidly booked. As we only slept in the rooms - we shopped till we dropped - we didn't suffer too much. We complained when we were there and again when we returned. We were given compensation of £25. each.

Reviews.Title: “Mickey and Minnie mouse are scared to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Sk8rgrl
Reviews.Content: Beautiful lobby, but the decor stops here! This hotel has NOT grown old gracefully! Superficial beauty treatments and even microdermabrasion or laser could not help that which plastic surgery has little chance to save! The first room that we entered had mould on the ceilings, plaster was buckling in the bedroom, stains all over the carpet, someones fingernail clippings in corners inaccessible by vacuums and a bed that would not be inviting to a rat! Thankfully, the room appeared to be insect and rodent free! Immediately, we tried to call front desk to switch rooms. The phone just rang and rang and rang. Finally, after 3 consecutive tries, we went down to the lobby and stood in the 15 minute line to speak with a front desk clerk (the shortest line we stood in at the hotel waiting for service). There we were met with "there are no rooms available at this time...however, try back after 5pm and ask to speak to the front desk manager". I called back at 2 instead and was placed into a "nicer room". At least it was bearable, one of their "upgraded, newly renovated rooms". All that means is more creative patchwork...underneath lie the skeleton of the beast waiting to show its ugly face. The bonus of this hotel is obviously the price point and location. If you don't plan on spending much time in your room and aren't afraid to ask to be transferred if your room is a beast, it is the hotel for you! Another bonus is the friendly staff at the luggage holding area - they were the friendliest staff we spoke with - both when we dropped off the luggage and when we picked it up (Wierd part though is that the hotel will charge you 4$ a bag for holding it through the day - I have stayed at many hotels where there is no price on this service). Good luck...its a craps shoot...but in New York...who wants to stay in their room?!

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but needs a refit.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The lobby lives up to the photos and is fantastic, the other levels however are pretty dismall. Step out of the elevators and into what was once and could be again a wonderful hotel. However, it has been neglected. Dirty, stained and ripped walls, stained carpets and a stale smell. Antique furniture turned shabby. The first room we were assigned was pokey and still had other peoples luggage in. We were quickly given a second much larger room but still in a state of disrepair. The windows were dirty and the view non-existent and there was little natural light. The sheets and towels were clean and changed daily and the beds were really comfy so it was habitable. We had free use of safety deposit boxes and the location is great so if you are on a budget and dont plan on spending much time within the hotel then great go for it.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed at Hotel Pennsylvania 6/19. We all booked via the web and what would you expect for $99 per night? Our room smelled like a swimming pool and was a moist as one too, the ceiling was chipping away, and the a/c didn't work all that well. Our other friends had similiar rooms but they all varied in size. We thought it was fine for what we were there for which was to sleep. If you are expecting the Ritz for $99/night, dream on. It's a great economical place to stay if you can deal with the faults.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the price, then read reviews. I was very worried about the hotel. I went prepared with flip-flops and a sleep sack. Glad I did. The room was very small, booked a room with 2 beds, ended up with one bed and the hotel wouldn't change our room, said we would have to pay more. We decided to tough it out. The carpet was very dirty and was peeling up on the ends, very dusty in the corners, there was mold in the bathroom, but not as bad as I expected. There was good water pressure and plenty of hot water. Never had a problem in 4 days. The smell was pretty bad, take a candle or something to help out. And definitly ear plugs if you plan on sleeping past 8 am. The staff is very loud. Don't expect great service, don't expect anything wonderful, and don't look in the corners of the room and I think you will be ok. The next time I am in NY I will definitly spend the extra $$ and go somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Are you kidding? You paid £100 a night!”
Reviews.Author: dmickley
Reviews.Content: Anyone who has just booked here and is now worried, Don't be. My family and I stayed here in march this year, and obviously we were expecting something from the shining from all the accounts we had read!! Checked in at about 6pm, no queues and really friendly staff. Got straight into a very new lift that took us to the twelfth floor, where we found our room, tidy, clean and most importantly comfortable and secure. We had hot running water at all times of day. It snowed heavily while we were there so the warm cosy beds were heaven after a long day of sightseeing! Lobby is beautiful, Staff are efficient, sure the hotel is old and maybe some rooms sould do with a lick of paint, but remember there are 1700 rooms, and you are not paying plaza prices! for £100 a night, a central location, handy for just about everywhere, YOU CANNOT GO WRONG!! STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “I'd think twice about staying here”
Reviews.Author: gnom:o)
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at this hotel 6/5 and was shocked by the poor upkeep of their standard room. Had a faulty shower in the bathroom which housekeeping could not address immediately.. they needed a day or two to get their plumber in!! Room was dusty and musty- did not appear at all like the internet version; bedsheets, pillowcases, towels didn't look clean, appeared very used with some stains. Thank goodness we only had a night's stay here before heading to Boston the next day... on our return trip to NYC, we stayed at a much better hotel- The Bedford. This may be one of the larger & older NY hotels but you would expect a certain standard of upkeep & cleanliness of their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “not as bad as everyone says”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Bookedthis then read\ reviews and was worried but not as bad as most ppl reckon Sure could have done with a lick of paint but the room was cleaned everyday and was tidy and comfortable We stayed there October 2003 Location was great price was better

Reviews.Title: “Herman Munster Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 6/17/04 This hotel is creepy, dirty and deceiving. The lobby is beautiful - but when you arrive at your floor, it's like you stepped into the Twilight Zone. Peeling wallpaper with splatter stains, stains on the carpet...the bathtub looked like a bomb had exploded in it and had a dirt ring to boot. Wore my flip-flops everytime I showered, as I was afraid I would catch something. The smell was a combo of mold and dirt. We had to burn scented candles in our room. When we complained, we were told that since we booked online we would have to contact the service we used in order to upgrade. We decided after viewing another floor, it wasn't worth spending another dime here to upgrade to a slightly better but still creepy room. I will NEVER stay here again. The only good thing is, it's in a good location. But next time, I will gladly pay more to not stay at the Herman Munster Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “That lobby is deceiving!”
Reviews.Author: howied
Reviews.Content: One of the Pennsylvania's biggest problems in my opinion is the staff. Firstly the hotel is very understaffed and the skeletal staff that they do have are very rude (front desk), very loud (maids) and just not very helpful. After asking 4 different members of staff if there was a toilet in the lobby I gave up as each gave different directions. Waiting for someone to come and open your safety deposit box was a joke. The line to check in is ridiculous. When we eventually checked in and got upstairs we found our card key would not work, after using three different keys and going up and down to the lobby three different times and as anyone who has stayed there will know is a chore in itself we eventually go into our room, (boy is that lobby deceiving). I think we had it quite lucky at the Hotel Penn after reading some of the other reviews. Our room didn't smell although it was badly in need of a good hoovering and polishing. The location is great can't fault that but the hotel itself is in bad need of a makeover, staff and decor. It seems it's the luck of the draw when you stay at the Pennsylvania. Just dont complain if your lucks not in!!!

Reviews.Title: “Get a renovated room and you'll be just fine!”
Reviews.Author: emil_abreu
Reviews.Content: I went to NYC with my wife for a small vacation and after I made the reservation (through the hotel's website ---hotelpenn---) I read these terrible reviews. I called the hotel to make sure I was going to get a renovated room, and they comfirmed it. We received a tiny but nicely decorated room, A/C worked fine, the bathroom was shiny, and we had our room cleaned every day. Nothing to complain about, specially If you see the nice price for such great location. In summary: get a renovated room and you'll do just fine! Never take a non-renovated room.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Awful Awful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place was God-awful---although the location was perfect, I'll admit. I came to NYC to see a Dixie Chicks concert and thought that booking a room right across the street would prove to be very convenient. I would've rather walked 10 blocks to a hotel that would've been acceptable. Stained sheets, awful mattress (the coils actually left marks on my back when I woke up in the morning), damp/danky/musty smell, stained carpets, dilapidated hallways, filthy tub..... For those of you who think that the convenience of this hotel (right across from Penn Station) is worth staying here, I caution you...your money is wasted here. Stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely revolting”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked on a site that had no reviews for a discount, and that was my big mistake. The first room they took me to - a squatter had slept there! And the room was like the nightmare scenes in "Barton Fink." They moved me to a better room which was worse...stained carpets and bedclothes, musty smell, moldy ceilings, crumbling walls, holes in the bathroom walls...I killed 2 cockroaches the size of my toothbrush. The the cracked, stained faucet leaked for 3 days while they ignored my complaints. There was only a wooden desk chair. I finally bought my own bottle of Febreeze and 2 roach motels...the next day they cleaned up the traps but didn't get the exterminator in. The whole time the staff were curt and patronizing. ("Cockroaches sir...I'm shocked!" snort.) Don't stay here. Campgrounds would be cleaner.

Reviews.Title: “OK for budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Madonnalicious
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights, in May 2004. After reading the reviews, I tried to find alternative accommodation prior to our arrival, but everywhere was full! As I had booked directly with the hotel and not through an agent, I felt that perhaps it would be OK. I was dreading the queue for check-in but it took less then 5 mins. Our room was located on the 5th floor and certainly showed it had been renovated. New carpet on the corridor floors. The doors do have the coffin lid appearance, but then this hotel was built in the '30's. Our room was OK - with new furniture; the bed was huge and so too was the TV. For a 2 star hotel, I was impressed there was an iron and ironing board in the wardrobe. The bathroom was not that great - the tiles had been painted, but I have to say, the shower had amazing power; although it did flood the floor abit! You can hear through the walls, but we went to bed late, so never had any problems after midnight. The room was serviced every day and clean towels provided -I was surprised at this; I had made the bed on the first morning thinking that we wouldn't get maid service. With 1700 rooms you can appreciate why the porters ask to see your room key; at least you know its only residents going upstairs. The location was perfect. However, I probably wouldn't stay here again - unless it was the last hotel with availability!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried when I read all of these terrible reviews. I found my experience to be almost completely opposite of everyone elses. We were checked in withing 5 minutes. The reception people were very nice. The room was old and shabby, but clean. It's not the Ritz, but considering it was about $110 per night, and was a 5 minute walk to Times Sq., it was worth every penny. If you are a bit of a snob, and expect to get the Waldorf and Super 8 prices, this place is not for you. If all you plan to do is sleep there, go for it. It's not a room to lounge around in all day.

Reviews.Title: “Like two different hotels”
Reviews.Author: rvonr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 5/27-29. After reading the reviews, I too was apprehensive about staying here. I found the lobby to be very nice and having mini tv's in the elevators was an added touch leading you to believe of nice rooms to come. However, when you step out of the elevator to your floor (14), it's like you are now in a different hotel in terms of modernity. One goes from modern and high tech to back in time 50+ years. There was rather an odd odor and the now famously called "coffin lid" doors seemed to emphasize the age of the hotel. They are really ugly, but I found out that there was a reason for their design. In the old days, if you had clothing to be cleaned, you would place your clothes inside the door and then the porter could retrieve them from the hallway side of the door. Interesting, but still ugly. I found our room to be large enough and it was quiet. There is some shabbiness, but it was clean enough for me. We had maid service every day and received clean towels. The bathroom was okay, but we did manage to knock one of the sink legs out from under it. Had to be careful around that. Someone else had mentioned that problem, I wonder if we had the same room? I'd like to give special mention to one of the porters, Chris. He was very helpful, nice and friendly. It allayed some of my fears of this hotel. When I come back to NY, I will not stay here. There are plenty of hotels with this same great location and for a few extra bucks I'll stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during April 2004. After reading this web site I really didn't know whether to laugh or cry and very nearly cancelled the whole trip! Decided to go through with it though and was very pleasantly suprised. As every one else says - the reception is very grand and beautiful. We stayed in a room on the 3rd floor. Upon stepping out of the lift on our floor I again didn'tknow whether to laugh or cry as we were greeted by awful pink decor that was obviously well past its refurb date - also a very unusual smell which did make me feel a little nauseous!! The door to our room was disgusting with mould all over the bottom!! After much hesitation we finally braced it and went in the room which turned out to be fine- very basic and a little shabby but it was clean and we had maid service everyday. I would go back to this hotel as it was in a fantastic location but I think i would upgrade to a renovated room!!

Reviews.Title: “Okay for overnight, but not for a long term stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 4 ages from 25-30 and we went to NY for the Rolling Stones concert in February 2003 and stayed at the hotel Pennsylvania. This hotel was okay for what we were there for.. just a night out in the city, but I wouldn't recommend it for a long stay. It was having some work done and it was pretty much hit or miss if you got a nice room. We got a pretty shabby room (19th floor I think), but the other couple we were with had a very nice room (6th floor). The rooms are very small and old, but overall, it had everything we needed and we had a nice time in NY.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: RichSBarnsley_UK
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on my first trip to NY in 1999, I've been back to the city twice since and this had been the best hotel of the 3 so I had no reservations about returning in May 2004. Having read some of the reviews on this site (mixed to say the least), I booked using the hotels website rather than a 3rd party as I believe this gives you more chance of a renovated room. I arrived at the hotel just before 4pm but was checked in within about 10 mins and a room on the 10th floor. So I was in my room with 15 mins of getting to the hotel - my room was smaller than before but perfectly adequate. Large bed, TV with plenty of channels including YES to keep up on the baseball and Fox Sports World to keep up to date on English footie (strange experience watching Sky Sports News before heading out for a night in NY!) The room was clean, made up every day, quiet, ok so the windows were dirty but I was up on the 10th floor! The bathroom was ok, clean, no mould, no hot water when I arrived but no problems with that in the mornings when I wanted to shave/shower. Value for money (by NY standards) and a wonderful location. I'll be staying here on my next trip to NY - my advice would be to book through the hotels own site - they even send you a reminder by email a few days before your trip which puts your mind at rest that they have your reservation. As to what someone said about international phones - go outside to the news stand on the corner...ask for a phone card to phone the UK (costs $10 - they might do cheaper ones) and then use this with any payphone (including those in the lobby) - I called the UK every day for 5 days at about 5 mins a time and only used about $2 worth of the card!

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Pennsylvania Hotel after a very long journey from England hoping to find the friendly Americans which we had been told about. Instead we had to queue up at Reception for approximately 10 minutes and were greeted by a very unfriendly receptionist. We asked if any renovated rooms were available and were ignored. On asking again we were more or less shouted at that there were none available! Two members of our party were then told that they had no reservations and to "wait there". We waited for approximately 45 minutes before a "manager" came out and told us to calm down, even though we hadn't said anything. I tried to talk to her but was talked over all the time and she wouldn't let me speak! She then said she wouldn't talk to me anymore and walked off! We were treated as if we were totally at fault, no apologies at all. I agree with the other comments about the standard of the rooms - damp smell, dirty windows, badly in need of a good clean and paint. We tried to change rooms but none were available. I definitely would not recommend this hotel to anyone and was very disappointed as this was my first visit to the USA.

Reviews.Title: “Great Locations, disgusting hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading several bad reviews on the Pennsylvania I was expecting the worst. I had heard that renovations had been taking place at the hotel, so I had my fingers crossed. Arrived at the hotel, into the posh marble lobby,very impressive. Queued for a good ten minutes and was expecting a warm welcome, a happy smiley face, etc but instead had to settle for a few grunts from the staff. Room was on the 7th floor, and as in other comments, the lift doors open to find a dirty green carpet... the musky smell in the air.. the wallpaper hanging off, the damp patches on the ceilings. The room was not much better, inside very basic and in need of a good clean. I'm convinced I had the same 3 towels on each of my 3 nights stay, just folded up again. The shower stops working when next door is using it and goes very cold and I couldnt see out of the window as it was filthy. The only thing good about this hotel is the location, 2 blocks from Empire State, and believe me you will be wanting to stay out as long as you can! My girlfriend wouldnt even dare walk barefoot on the carpet! Pay a bit more and go somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “good and bad news regarding the HOtel Pa.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our senior group arrived approx. 40 people. On checking out the room we were assigned, we found it was very SMALL. The drapes were partically hung. The TV was not working - (not pluged in) as was the radio--- had to call someoneat 10:30 at night- so we could check the wather for the next day. The bathroom was not up to clean standards, especiall the tub -- which was DIRTY. We found the cleaning staff -- annoyed, when we asked for towels. Our friends room had NO drapes,,,, and they used drapes for bedspreads. But the good news was no cock roaches.

Reviews.Title: “Needs renovating”
Reviews.Author: Freeflyer55
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews, I was concerned about staying at this hotel. In my room, the carpet needed cleaning, the windows were grimy and the curtains were stuck half way. There was a strip of peeling wallpaper above the bed and the lampshade was torn. However, the bedding was clean, the bathroom was fine with plenty of towels and the TV worked perfectly well. There was no problem with noise. I did have to wait for a while to get the safety deposit box every time. My advice would be: if you want nice surroundings, pay a bit more and go elsewhere. If you're not bothered, enjoy the great location with the whole of New York on your doorstep!

Reviews.Title: “avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Small, dark room with a very dirty window. Terrible bathroom with mold and peeling walls. Daily houskeeping was good and that was the only positive thing. I'm not planning to stay there again. Major renovation and clean up badly needed.

Reviews.Title: “I should have listened”
Reviews.Author: BillsMaryland
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at Hotel Pennsylvania. I should have listened to the reviews. If you were suffering from asthma or respiratory problems you wouldn't have come home. The room was covered with dust and dirt. The ancient bathroom spewed brown water in the tub. ADVOID- They need to renovate or close. It's really a shame as location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, great location.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My son and I returned yesterday from a 5 night stay at the Pennsylvania. After reading the reviews on here we booked in with trepidation. No queues at reception and we were given our room at 1pm. We had booked a standard room and our request for two beds and a view were met. Yes, the room was tatty and small, but adequate. The beds were clean and made up daily. The bathroom seemed new and everything worked fine, even the fridge. We were not disturbed once by any noise inside the hotel at night and the only wildlife we saw in the room was one ant on the dressing table. Towels and toiletries were plentiful. The staff were pleasant and helpful. For the price we paid we were not expecting and did not get luxury. The hotel can hardly be beaten for location. If you are expecting a 5 star hotel, then don't book this one, but for a cheap trip to NYC we were more than satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Worry - its ok when you get there.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just come back (yesterday). One of us stayed here in 1998 and did not think it was too bad old but clean etc. After reading reviews on here we were really apprehensive but on arrival check in took about 10 minutes, the rooms on 7th floor are not renovated but were clean. Ok so dont look under the beds but no food or anything else left in room. The location is brilliant, near subway and central for everything. Dont be put off by some of these reviews. New York is fantastic the people are lovely and the staff at the hotel were v helpful not rude at all. Stay here its reasonable and if you want to spend your dollars on shopping and sightseeing you wont spend much time there anyway. One word of warning there is a camera shop on 5th Avenue near the library its only little dont go there! V pushy got ripped off !go to B & H on 9th Avenue and 33rd not open from 2pm friday & Saturday but if you want a camera then go there If you have already booked for Hotel Pennsylvania and are worried like we were dont be its fine when you get there any problems like showers not working were sorted out quickly and efficiently. Enjoy yourselves!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for a tourist's needs”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading the bad reviews, I was a little apprehensive at what I would find at this hotel. It was fine & I cannot fault it in any way - I paid for a tourist hotel & that's what I got. It was clean & comfortable. Any requests were dealt with promptly. We requested a room change as we had a double room & preferred a twin & this was arranged easily. It fulfilled my needs for a break in New York when I was very rarely in the room. However, with 1700 rooms, it must be difficult to offer complete efficiency at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Skanky place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in October 2003 and was shocked by how grimy the place was. The room was TINY, the walls were dirty, and there was no clock. When I was ready to sleep I turned the TV off and heard SCURRYING so I turned it back on in fear. I was NOT impressed. If you're really trying to save money, sure, stay here. Otherwise, avoid it!

Reviews.Title: “Depressing, Dingy and Dirty”
Reviews.Author: Wildpoppy
Reviews.Content: Stayed in December 2003. After two nights at New York Helmsley (Excellent) coming to stay here was a bitter disappointment. Check in took over half hour but it is a large hotel. We had a renovated room with mould in the corners, carpet not fit to walk on and only just big enough to fit the bed in. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was absolutely the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. It looked all nice in the lobby until I got to my room and found tons of random hair all over my bed and pillow cases. Sound bizarre? It was the sickest thing I have ever encountered. DONT STAY HERE if you're looking for a clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: bohnbutler
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at The Hotel Pennsylvania. It is in a great location. On this trip I arrived via Amtrak and the hotel was just a short jump across the street. This hotel is not for everyone, but for $109.00 a night (the price I paid)it is a good value. My room on the 10th floor was clean and not all that small. The bathroom was clean and functional although it did need updating. For a budget minded tourist, this is a great hotel. For those that have higher expectations, please stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “What You Get for a 2 Star”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: April 16th - 21st Kidderminster, England The staff were more than helpful and the location was good. The rooms were very basic but if you're going to New York to shop all you need is a bed, loo and hot water. The rooms could of done with a lick of paint and maybe a few picture to cover holes. The walls were a bit thin so you could hear next door. Over all you don't spend much of the day in your room, so not too bad for a break.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews on this site, me and a friend cancelled our booking at the Carter Hotel and booked at the Penn instead. Thank god we did. This hotel is slated on this site for being old and dated, and it is old, but it is obviously trying to modernise itself. The lobby is great with plenty of space to sit, obvioulsy the reception is going to be busy but there are 1700 rooms. We had to wait 5 mins to check in, which is nothing. The receptionist was very friendly and chatty. We didn't ask for a renivated room. I was pretty worried to be honest as we headed up to our 15th floor room, the doors are strange, but as i opened the door I was totally relieved. The room was spotless, ok the carpet was a bit stained but it was clean, ok the windows were dirty on the outside, but it is 15 floors up! It even had a couple of nice art works on the walls. The beds were clean and made every morning, the tv was good with a good choice of channels, the bathroom was also spotless and was cleaned every day. It also had the best shower i have ever had!! perfect for hangover cures! In all i would recommend anybody to stay here, we spent 5 nights and i would again, for $100 a night for a twin room you can't really argue.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having read endless reviews on this website before staying at this hotel, I arrived with a huge amount of worry as to what sort of experience we would get. I was pleasantly surprised!! Firstly, the woman who checked us in couldn’t have been kinder – she even advised us not to phone home from the room phones as they were such a rip off!!! Our room on the 14th floor was admittedly basic. The curtains didn’t meet in the middle and the bathroom was a little tatty, but on the whole it was bearable for the five night stay we had. The room was quiet at night and we had a view of the Empire State Building out of our window, which was lovely at night when it was lit up. The room was cleaned daily with fresh towels and bed sheets (the cleaners even folded our clothes and put them on the bed each day for us!!!). The water was hot every day, allowing us to freshen up before we went out for the day/night. I take the points from other reviewers that this place is a bit tatty (renovated rooms are probably a safer bet than the standard we had) but the location is unbeatable with Madison Square Garden across the road, Penn Station over the road and Macy’s one block away. Joe O’s bar and restaurant, which has an entrance in the hotel lobby, serves amazing food and is a great place for a night cap at the end of the evening. Try especially Fri/Sat nights in there as there was some good entertainment as well!!! Don’t be put off by reviews on here – it’s not brilliant, but there are some real high points which more than make up for the room!! How long are you in your hotel room in NY anyway??? PS. Both check in and out times were never above four minutes!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Accommodation in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Pennsylvania Hotel on Sunday 11 April 2004 for a week. I had read the reviews and feared the worst. When checking in I requested a renovated room but there was none available. When we got to our room the bed was not made and the last guests rubbish and used towels were on the floor. The carpet was brown (which is a major pet hate of mine), the walls were grubby and the bathroom wasn't much better. The walls of the shower has plaster peeling off which made it look very un-inviting! We complained to a member of staff and decided to go for a walk while our room was being cleaned. When we returned to the room it was much better. The bed was made with crisp clean sheets. The carpet was cleaned and overall the room looked much tidier. The bathroom still wasn't the best and I would not recommend having a shower without wearing flip flops but other than that it was fine. There is a nice big TV with lots of channels and also a fridge (came in v handy for beer!) The toilet wouldn't flush on two occasions but a member of staff came up immediately to fix it. Do not expect breakfast to come cheap in Linda's cafe in the Hotel. Cereal & toast and egg & toast with orange juice cost us $31!!.. Overall I could not fault this hotel. You get what you pay for in a great location in New York City. Don't be put off by people who expect too much from a hotel with such low rates.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel that time forgot .”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Remnant of the thirties , with dirty toenails on the floor to prove it , paint pealing off the walls and bath , net curtains so dirty that they would not be used to bury the dead . Windows that would not open . Curtains that would not close . Blinds that did not work . Carpets that were used to train horses . Views from the window of years of articles thrown onto interior flat roofs , bottles , underpants cigarette buts . A health hazard and a dump . Hotels like this turn away tourists . New York City Officials should inspect hotels and insist on acceptable standards . Rating 0 out of 10 .

Reviews.Title: “Don't ever stay here”
Reviews.Author: Juzwa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel on business. I dropped my company vehicle off upon arrival and picked it up at the end of the week. The valet parkers drank Budweiser in the car, reclined the seats, and dumped beer all over the seats and the floor of the van. I was told by hotel management that I purposely dumped beer in the car to get a free stay. I took them to the Better Business Bureau, and they have not reponded for months.PLEASE do not stay here.....!

Reviews.Title: “What do you want???”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in August of last year. I personally thought the hotel was pretty decent! For the price you absolutely can not beat it in new york!!! We searched high and low for a room at a decent rate, and when we found this one we decided to go. The rooms werent the best thing since sliced bread, but they were sleepable. In new york, you shouldnt be doing much in your room other than sleeping, so I dont see what the problem is. Some stuff might be older, and the rooms arent the biggest nor the most nicely furnished, but for around 100 across the street from MSG, Macys and a slew of other stuff is a steal!! They have some really cool bars and restaurants around there also! If you are expecting the Plaza, you need to make a reservation there. if you want a place to shower and sleep after a long day of sightseeing, then this is your place. I just booked here for a may trip as well, 97 dollars a night thru travelzoo!

Reviews.Title: “Pennsylvania! Stay Away! details..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Took a trip there on monday April 12, 2004. I have to say i wish i read this board before i went. THIS HOTEL IS THE WORSE! I got a deal(110.00 a night) , and was a prime pick so i gave it a shot. The lobby looked great and clean. The checkin lines were very very long. A tleast a 10 minute wait. When I got to my floor (seventh) i could tell it wasnt going to be good. The walls were very very dirty, and the carpet was stained. When i got in the room it wasnt much better. You had to wear something just so you wouldnt get your socks dirty! No view from my window at all, and the windows could not even open! The room was very dusty and looks like it wasnt taken care of. No bags in the garbage, the tub looked like it been there for years without cleaning with all the stains. The only thing that did this room justice was that it had web t.v. ($5 for half an hour and $3 every hour after that), it also had on demand movies to pay for like pay-per-view ($12 a movie) and you can check out of your room using your t.v. so you dont have to stand again in that long line. At Hotels site they have pictures there of the rooms in Pennsylvania. ITS A LIE! ITS NOTING LIKE THAT AT ALL!! RUN! UNLIKE MOST HOETLS IN NY, THERE WAS NOTING IN THE ROOM WORTH "TAKING AS A KEEPSAKE IF YOU KNOW WHAT I MEAN ;) ....THIS IS THE WORST EVER!!

Reviews.Title: “The Armpit of New York City”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pennsylvania about two years ago with my husband and a friend. From the recent reviews here I can see that little if anything has changed. It took about 40 minutes to check in, which I can understand since this is a large hotel, but BEWARE--those beautiful photos of the lobby mean nothing. The rooms are an abomination. Ours had dirty carpet (I never walked around with my socks off) and the furniture and bedspreads had cigarette burns in them. Once I had to pick up an item which had fallen behind a dresser; there must have been a quarter inch of dust underneath it, thick as dryer lint. The grouting in the bath was black with mold, and the sink drain was full of hair (no stopper). Also, don't stay here if you enjoy water pressure with your morning shower. The mattresses were threadbare. I slept on a rollaway cot and got the best end of the deal. Honestly, our room looked and felt like 20 guys had held a bachelor party in it the night before and someone had spent maybe 15 minutes cleaning it up. The management could offer me free stays anytime I wanted for life and I'd refuse it.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: thwups
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed in the Hotel Pennsylvania on our 4th trip to NY - we wanted something cheap and central - this is exactly what we got - we booked thru midashotels and got the room for $50 for the 2 of us - what a bargain! Yes the room was small and a bit minging but the bedsheets and towels were completely fine and the bed was HUGE!! we had a fab time. All the hotel is - is a base for warming up, washing, and sleeping in - if you want all the comforts of The Ritz then you know what you have to do..... This is certainly not for someone that wants the best, but for someone that wants a great location and something cheap, then this place is great - you completely get what you pay for. We would DEFINITELY go again.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Yes, believe all the negative reviews you are reading here! Wished I read the reviews before booking the reservation. We paid the rooms in advance so there was no way of getting our $ back. Absolutely not worth $150/night... matter of fact, not even worth $5/night. I have never witnessed such horror in my life. Do not let those "nice" pictures you find on the internet fool you. Do not let the nice lobby fool you. First room was so digusting...stained carpets, fifthy bathroom, twin size bed w/dirty linen. We went back to the lobby & asked for another room. Second room...more of the same fifth. Third room...more of the same...with as an added bonus....blood stains on the sheets. By this time we were so exhausted by all the drama so we settled for a 4th room on the 9th floor. It was still disgusting but better than the other 3. We had to shower w/our slippers on just to paint you a picture. My advice...PLEASE DO NOT STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay at Hotel Pennsylvania again!! Ask for the 11th or 12th floor.”
Reviews.Author: Crystal6648
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently. Very good location. Were very trepidatious after reading on-line reviews. Requested quiet, newly renovated room. First room was next to the elevator...very noisy, so we changed, w/no problems, to another room on the 11th floor. Room very small, 1 king bed, had a refrigerator, clean and comfortable and in good repair. Window opens a little bit which was nice. It's fixed so a kid can't fall out and window can't be opened far. Lobby beautiful and always busy...allow time for check-in. If you want to swim, it's a $12.00 pass to go near-by to a health club. It was cold, so we didn't use it. Coffee shop in lobby has good coffee and danishes. Gift shops in hotel were never open, but this was not a problem for us. The only lock on your room door is one of those sliding locks that let you open the door part way while keeping others out. Keep it in LOCKED position when in room!!! A drunk couple tried to get in our room one night, glad we had read about keeping that little lock on!!! That was the only probelm we had. Overall, it was quiet, clean and comfy. Toilet flushes great...sometimes a problem in older hotels. 12 elevators so no long waits was nice. TV's in elevators w/CNN. You might be looking for who's talking and it's the TV !!! Would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be misled, this'll do nicely”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a cross section of opinion! Like others, after reading each and every review of this hotel I was dreading arriving and I had considered bribing the reception staff for a good room. I took my chance and was given room 678, small and not recently decorated but above all the bed linen was clean and there was clean, hot running water. Some fittings were loose and at other times of year I could easily imagine some creepy crawling appearing from behind them but I saw no evidence of any uninvited squatters. There were none of these in the lobby either and the staff at reception were helpful and courteous. For the money I paid I was delighted with this hotel and would stay here again without hesitation. For those who live like kings each and every day, stop scrooging around and pay for what you are accustomed to and leave the very reasonable budget hotels like the Pennsylvania for those who need them. We can do without your grossly unhelpful reviews when attempting to see the world on a shoestring.

Reviews.Title: “Some assessments here are an absolute impudence!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are two German girls and spent four nights in March in the hotel Pennsylvania. We already have in advance read the different reviews here and were prepared for the worst one. Okay, the finery scrolls in some places of the walls and the doors remind of coffins. But our room was always clean. The beds weren't dirtily and it didn't smell musty either. We got fresh towels every day. For the price you cannot live more centrally in New York. I regard as an impudence of some people of making the hotel absolutely bad. If they expect more, then they simply shall pay more. We have investigated whole Manhattan on foot which for certain also was due to the central situation of the hotel. In the hotel were we only for sleeping and for taking a shower. And it fulfills absolutely his purpose there.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A very long check-in queue after a long day of travelling. I could not believe my eyes when I saw the room. The carpet had bleach stains in front of the bathroom door, there was a huge black stain on the ceiling. The windows were so dirty I could not see out of the one that was not boarded up! The net curtains were black and the main curtain could not be drawn for privacy - it covered a boarded up window. The whole room was in dire need of redecorating and refurnishing - I was of the opinion that nothing had been done to this hotel since the day it was built. It certainly had not beencleaned properly. The hotel manager gave the reason for the dirt was that the hotel was old. My house is older than this hotel but it is a lot cleaner. The only saving grace was that the towels and bedding were clean, but there was not enough of either. The bathroom was not cleaned at all during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “So Bad!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Seriously, the good reviews here are either planted by the hotel or are from people who put a rediculous premium on location and price. A terrible, nasty hotel. As soon as I stepped off the elavator I knew I was in the worst hotel I had ever seen. Scary hallway. Dirty and old room. Stained carpets and peeling walls. Wouldn't touch the bathroom - though it appeared somewhat clean. If I had time, I would have left. It really is bad. Couldn't wait to leave in the morning. Total waste of money at any price. If you have any standards at all for cleanliness and service, you will not be happy here.

Reviews.Title: “Not so Bad!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was absolutly dreading staying in this hotel after reading the reviews on here! I contacted my agent and asked that they request that I get a decent room to stay in as I did not want my trip to New York ruined. I got to the Hotel and althought there was a queue I found that it moved quite quickly, I was in at the front desk in no time. They gave me a room on the 5th floor and it was tidy and clean with no bed bugs or any of the other nasties that have been described on this website. The cleaners on our floor were very good and I was so impressed with the who ever cleaned our room that I left them a tip when I checked out. The Bathroom was clean and the shower was powerfull although I did spot a little rust under our sink and I could hear my neighbour singing in the shower quite clearly!! I got a good price on this hotel and for the money I paid I was quite prepared to put up with a little shabbyness however It just wasn't that bad. My advise is to get in touch with your agent and advise them of this site and request that you get a good room (maybe on the 5th floor). P.s One review on here mentioned Homeless people sleeping rough in the corridors however I found that there were no homeless people sleeping in our corridor when I stayed as they have a man who checks guests for room keys when entering the lifts in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Shocked beyond belief”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my friends where pleased to see a nice hotel lobby and reception , when we had checked in and got in the lifts to go to our bedroom, when the lift doors opened to our floor level we where met by the smell of damp and rott. We then got to the room which was what i would call a dump, with net curtains stained with dirt and was black in colour also dirty curtains, bedding look ok i suppose but did not intend to sleep in the bed in fear of being bitten. also the floor was never hooverd while we there, we also noticed sick which had dried along the corridor carpets, the furniture looked dated and dirty, also we had some youths trying to let themselfs into our room on one accasion also when we so the room attendants there trolleys where empty, god knows whats goes on at this hotel but they should be closed down to health and hygine , the best laugh was the carpet that never fit to the sides of the room and had spikes showing around the edges . what more can i say apart from its a health risk to anyone staying there. Enter the hotel at your own risk is what i would say. me and my freinds stayed there march 25th 2004 and never again.

Reviews.Title: “Interior Designer Needed!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have to say having read all reviews I was dreading the hotel. It did live up to the expectations. We had to queue for a long while to check-in and were given a pass for a room on 7th floor. When we opened the door, the horror on our faces! Paint and plaster were peeling off walls, hole in wall with bare wires exposed, the carpet was grubby and obviously had not been vaccumed for quite some time. Room was dusty and again, this probably had not seen a polish and duster for a couple of weeks. Bath tub was rusty and gourting had come away from tiles. Bathroom did not appear to have been cleaned. There was no wardrobe facility, no dressing table/mirror. There were two beds but I was scepticle in sleeping in these after having seen the decor and the cleanliness of room. We promptly complained and was told by reception there were no rooms available. I asked to see Manager and joined the long queue! I explained to Manager our room was unacceptable and dirty and that I ran a cleaning company and if my staff operated like that they would be dismissed immediately. He did not argue as I was armed with previous internet reviews!! He issued me with another pass to a room on 5th floor, which I must say was much better than the first, although it still did not meet up to what I expected. The corridors on all floors are pretty grubby and dingy and need redecoration throughout and yes the doors do look like coffin lids! The lobby however is pretty presentable in comparison to the rest of the hotel. The only good thing going for the hotel is the fact that its location is pretty central. I don't think I would go back to this hotel again unless they redecorated it!! Trust me, I have pictures to prove it.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First room was tiny, musty, bathroom had mould, when I complained I was offered another room at double the cost. Very disappointing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Met my expectations.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A good example of "you get what you pay for" in New York City. At $89.95 per night our expectations were not very high, and we had read many of the reviews that appear on the Trip Advisor web site. As a result, we were not disappointed. Our hotel room showed its age (1919) and wear, and was badly in need of new carpet and paint. The bed was comfortable and clean, and the plumbing worked fine. The hotel employees were friendly and helpful, and tried to be accommodating. The hotel's location is ideal for the vacationer. My wife and I were able to walk to most of the sites we wanted to see. All things considered, we got our money's worth; but will probably spend a little more on a room elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “What happened to good costumer service?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is Great!!! Is a shame that their costumer service is so terrible. There was a mistake with the date of my reservation, and all the MANAGER could say was "Call the people you made your reservation with. Next person on line.!!! He didn't even bother to offer a room or any other solution, if I had been closer to home, I would have come back and not stay there.The room was clean, but because it was a last-minute-reservation we got a 10" wide window room with a view to the other three walls of the back of the hotel. Lobby is impressive, halls on upper rooms are horrible and old. Only because is cheap and has a good location can be useful. Don't expect anything nice.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: sunluvva
Reviews.Content: You're on holiday and you expect to get a friendly welcome from the staff but this did not happen! The exterior of the hotel and the ground floor reception area is impressive. This hotel is in a great location too. However, the decor of the room was terrible (holes in the wall and grubby curtains that did not close). The services menu on the televison did not work and neither did the internet access. The queen bed was massive though and at least the room and bathroom was clean. Good hotel if you're on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad!!”
Reviews.Author: ATGManchester_UK
Reviews.Content: Just got back from New York a couple of days ago after staying 5 nights at the Pennsylvania. Was a little nervous after reading the reviews but have stayed in plenty of worse places in my time. First room we were shown had broken glass on the carpet so we were quickly shown to another room. (not renovated). The bedlinen and towels were changed everyday but the room was scruffy but clean. The location of this hotel is fantastic and I recommend Joe O's restaurant at the back of the lobby for brilliant food and friendly staff! Overall if you are just using this as a base just to rest your weary head at night - it is perfect but just dont expect luxury!!

Reviews.Title: “no good”
Reviews.Author: daveva
Reviews.Content: stayed in this hotel for st patricks week. checked in at 7.00pm the recept could not find my reservation. found it after some time,checked in went to my room at 7.45pm to find that it was not made up?? went bach to reception did nit have to say what was wrong they had guesed. room wass made up at 9.30pm and what a room. a small fridge dirt on the wallpaper and bathroom walls. hot water available ad hoc depending what time of the day it was.my wife not impressed at all, but location great.around the corner from empire state building/hotel does have a 24hr coffee shop and a bar that stays open till 04.00am. no coffee.tea making facilities tough. got it cheap on the internet what u see is what u get just be carefull.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!!! I wouldn't recommend this to my worst enemy!!!”
Reviews.Author: FrequentIpswichFlyer
Reviews.Content: MAIN LOWLIGHTS:- 2 men given access to enter girls' room - comment from reception "it was a mistake anyone could have made" Night Staff at hotel didn't give a hoot Beds and bedding requested never appeared. Hotel lost 2 out of the 6 bookings and we were told that it was between us and our travel agent.ACTUAL REVIEW When my party of 6 first arrived and waited to check in in the Lobby, we thought how fantastic it looked! Then it all went downhill. Firstly, the hotel did not have all our names - only 4 of us were booked in and although we had the proof, we were told it was between us and our travel agents. Then there weren't enough rooms available because they were still being cleaned. Myself and my friend were able to go to our room because it was ready and left the others downstairs. Our room (224) was awful beyond belief. The adjoining door to whoever's room next door was open and the only way to shut it was to apply force, ie a run up using my shoulder to slam it shut. It then wasn't lockable so I wedged a chair under the door knob and we also used our cases to block it too. In the meantime our friends had been put up in the so called "Presidential Suite" which was just as bad! Peeling paper, dirty carpets and furniture, exposed wiring, a hole to the outside wall barely covered by a piece of plywood sums up the decor. We then decided to go out for a quick drink. Me and my friend went back to our room, had showers etc and settled down to sleep thinking, we'll make the best of this, we're only sleeping here. We just dropped off and then our door opened!! Fortunately the chain was on as there were 2 drunk men trying to get into our room! I phoned security and at first they said that we weren't in our room, we should be in the Presidential Suite! Then they said there was no way that the men could have got in our room and I then got a bit upset as they most certainly had. The explanation was that the men should have gone to 224a but as I then pointed out, how come our room was enabled if they should have had a completely different one! Me and my friend did not feel safe staying in our room so we told reception we were moving to the Presidential Suite and that their security was disgusting. We then had to wake up our friends to get into the suite. However, there were no spare beds there. We asked for 2 put up beds and bedding 3 times and got none. We asked for coffee and only got 2 cups as apparently only 2 of our party were distressed. When one of my friends went downstairs to complain to reception that 2 men were given access to a room with 2 girls in it the reply was it was a mistake anyone could have made. Also, the receptionist commented that I had told them that everything was ok now. It certainly wasn't! The only member of staff who has customer service skills is Harry - he's lovely. The rest of them don't give a toss. The next day we spoke to the manager who apologiesed and said bedding and beds whould be in the room that day. They weren't. We had to phone down at least twice to get these. The heaters in the suite only worked for 1 day. We asked for portable heaters - they never arrived. However when we did complain it was implied by the manager that we were lucky to have the Presidential Suite - yeah right. Whilst staying at this hotel, we met someone who had moved rooms 4 times, another whose ceiling had collapsed on them and another who had green mould in the bath. This is not an acceptable hotel to stay in. I and my friend never got a proper bed to sleep in. There's a difference between budget accommodation and crap, this is just crap!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: BevStedford
Reviews.Content: Having read the scathing reviews of this hotel after I had booked it, I arrived with much trepidation and insisted my father stayed in the lobby while I checked out the room, fully expecting to have to change it. We arrived Friday lunchtime 5th March and expected queues. There were none. Yes, the bedroom doors do resemble coffin lids. I was so pleasantly surprised when I entered the room (309A). It wasn't renovated, but the room was very big, with a spotlessly clean new bathroom and we even had a separate room with wardrobes, iron and ironing board. However, it was very noisy during the night and I discovered after the first night that the room was above the main generator and the fire station! I went to reception and said that though we liked the room, would it be possible to be moved to something a little quieter. This was no problem at all and Betty directed me to room 350 at the other end of the hotel. This room was absolutely huge (40ft x 20ft). This was also an unrenoved room, though it also had a separate room with wardrobes as well as a clean new bathroom. Our room was cleaned and the beds made up every day, with clean bedlinen every 2nd day (we stayed for 7 nights). We were given fresh clean towels every day and the staff were friendly and efficient. The location of the hotel is fantastic and we were able to get to most places on foot or from Penn Station which is 10 steps from the hotel. Because of the great central location, we could pop back to the hotel during the day to freshen up before embarking on another trip out. There is a diner 4 doors from the hotel called EA&H which served excellent food at really cheap prices (2 bagels with butter or cream cheese and 2 speciality coffees for under $3). They also have an awesome buffet consisting of too many dishes to choose from. You help yourself and then get the food weighed. You pay for your meal by weight! Taxis were cheap, subway was cheap. New Yorkers were friendly and helpful. I will definitely be returning to the Hotel Pennsylvania.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel - stay here but book a Renovated room!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself and my two friends headed to New York in early December for a shopping Trip. We booked this hotel through the internet due to it being one of the cheapest. Although having read the reviews on this website, we were a wee bit nervous. But some of the them couldn't be more wrong! Everyone seems to complain about the queue at check-in but what do you expect with 1700 rooms? All the receptionists work really quick so you aren't there for longer than half an hour. We book a renovated room - which I seriously recommend as all the bad rooms seem to go up as far as Floor 5 or 6. When we booked in, we had reserved a room for 3 people however the Reception explained that they were overbooked. So they gave us a King size room with a fold up bed. We were a bit anxious at this but it was great!!! Lovely clean and spacious room with a massive T.V. (came in handy for watching for the Blizzard reports!) and a really clean bathroom with daily towel change. Great Location, we litterally did not get a taxi once. However the resturant in the Hotel (Lindy's - I think) is ridiculously overpriced - so avoid!! Overall a great place to stay but book a Renovated room!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here May 2003, absolutely disgusting! Don't be fooled by the grand lobby or the history of the hotel. We stayed on the 7th floor and it was one of the worst hotel rooms I have ever had the displeasure to see. The room was old with crumbling plaster on the walls and large holes with wires hanging out, seriously! The lamp in the room was extremely worn and was probably original hotel furniture, the tv was tiny and there were doors through to the rooms either side that were sealed by locks and door chains. The bathroom was adequate until you realised that there was no hot water at certain times of the day. The concierge is absolutely rubbish and after asking her to advise us of a nice Italien restaurant she sent us to one of the most limited and expensive restaurants I've ever seen (and I live in London) where the menu consisted of about 20 dishes in total mostly oysters and other exotic overpriced and overated foods. The Lindy's "restaurant" in the hotel is also disgustingly overpriced with a meal for 3 consisting of 3 soft drinks, a sandwich, a burger, and chicken nuggets accompanied by two pieces of cake cost $80!! No kinding DO NOT eat here! Finally on our final morning not only was there NO water in the shower, but the water in the sink was BROWN! Needless to say I had a very smelly journey home! Do not stay here unless absolutely neccessary!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent price, great location”
Reviews.Author: dalangdon
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Pennsylvania was built by the Pennsylvania Railroad for the business traveler, in a style to match their once-beautiful station which was demolished in 1963. It is a great bargain for Manhattan hotels. It's spartan, with no valet or room service, and check-in and check-outs are strictly "old school" (i.e. you stand in line - no video check-outs or anything like that) but hot water is adequate, the rooms are reasonably clean, and - once again - the price is right. If you have a problem, be polite but firm, and the staff will do their best to resolve it. If you want to be a diva, you have to pay the big bucks at the hotels that care about such things. That's not the purpose of the Hotel Pennsylvania. They are strictly "roof over head".But if you go into the situation knowing that, you'll find that a stay at the Hotel Pennsylvania can be quite pleasant. If you are a budget traveler, and don't need your hand held in the "big city", the Hotel Pennsylvania is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you are on a budget”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed in this hotel while on a shopping trip to New York. I had read all the reviews beforehand and was very apprehensive about the hotel. Upon check-in, I asked for a renovated room, we were told by a rather rude receptionist that we had not paid for one but that she had given us a 'good room'. Our room was on the 4th floor. It wasn't as bad as expected. It did need to be redecorated badly as the carpet and walls were badly stained, but it was clean and warm. The room was cleaned everyday. One thing I would say is that the rooms are not very sound proof, also, the people in the room next to us must have been smokers as we got a very strong smell of cigarette smoke in our room every so often. The Pennsylvania is fine to stay in if you are on a budget, but I would recommend to pay a bit more if you are looking for some luxury.

Reviews.Title: “hotel penn Good for what you pay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms the first week of December and found the hotel to be Vintage [old] but clean and confortable I have spent double the amount in NY and will admit got better but I would recomend it for budget or bussiness travelers A very good value

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but that's all”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the outside it would appear that this is a very nice hotel, even the large reception area gives you the feeling of a quality hotel. That's until you enter the rooms. Dirty and smelly. The bathrooms are very dirty - obviously havent been decorated in some time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location but....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just completed my third trip the New York and on each occassion I have stayed at the Pensylvannia Hotel opporite Madison Square Gardens. The location is fantastic, central for everything and everywhere, but when we arrived we were allocated a standard room, this was dirty, had paper hanging off the walls, the shower didn't work properly and was in general very dated. I complained to reception and was moved to another room, as substandard as the first and on complaining again and speaking to a manager I was moved to a renovated room(which is what I had received on each of previous two visits). This was clean, airy and of a good size. So a word of advice.. If you are booked into the Pensylvannia they have renovated the rooms on the 9th and 10th Floors ask for one of them!!.
