Lyn's dumpling house in China town is fantastic for seriously the best dumplings I have ever tried, and is very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Ritz but good value for NY”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some terrible reviews about this hotel, I almost cancelled, but decided to chance it to avoid paying a penalty.I was pleasantly surprised. This is not The Ritz. The hotel is run down and bare bones but (except for the in-room carpet which looked about 50 years old and badly needs replacement) clean. I found all the staff unfailingly helpful and, for such a huge hotel, twelve efficient elevators would put some expensive hotels to shame.Above all it is cheap by NY standards and a fabulous location with a subway station and Penn station a few steps away and Macy's just a block.I would say it's good value for money but like all hotels it is possible for things to go seriously wrong if you are unlucky.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having booked to stay in this hotel for 5 nights and then seeing the reviews of it on this site, me and my partner were very worried about our dream trip to New York. There are a lot of negative reviews on here, some may be true and some may just be picky! If you are planning on a budget trip to New York to see all the main attractions and saving money on accommodation then you can?t go far wrong with this hotel. Yeah it is an old hotel (1914 I think) and it does have 1700 rooms so what can you expect a lobby to be like with that many guests staying? When we arrived at the hotel it was approx 9pm on a Saturday. After a long flight with 1 stop in Philadelphia all we wanted to do was to check in and get to our room. There was no queue for the check in and it was processed quickly by a very helpful member of staff. We where given a room on the 5th floor (501A). When we exited the lift on this floor it just reminder me of the corridors from the film the shining (which I thought was quite funny!) but it was clean and no trace of a damp smell which I had read about on here! On entering the room it was (for the price) a standard room. The room was clean, a very large bed, fresh bed linen and the bathroom had been also cleaned with fresh towels. There was also a large 34 inch TV in the corner which came to good use after tiring long walks through the city. A wall mounted air conditioner always kept the room nice and warm too! There was also a fridge in the room which helped when to cool those refreshments after the long day. Over the 5 nights/days the room was well kept and new sheets every couple of days were done by the cleaner who always said hello when passing! (Would you like to clean 1700 rooms on minimum wage). The location of the hotel is the best you could ask for. For all those sports fans (like me) Madison Square Garden across the road. Shopping, Macy's was next door but one. Empire state building was around the corner a 10 minute walk and Times Square/Broadway was 600/800m away, again a 15 minute walk. Subways were always close by and a taxi rank over the road. You can't ask for more than that! The only complaint that we do have is due to the age of the hotel, there was a lack of water pressure between 8 and 9.30 in the morning. The shower was a bit cold. BUT the hot water out of the taps was still available. It took 1 minute to fill a bath, just as quick as a shower! All in all we had a really great time and we would go back to this hotel again. We hope this helps you if you have booked and are worrying about this hotel. It is not as bad as some of these reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is possibly the worst i have erer stayed in. we had to change rooms three times, floor was filfthy, rusty fittings in the bathroom, paper falling off the walls, damp, need i go on??? JUST DONT EVER STAY HERE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay at a homeless shelter it's cleaner and the staff is nicer”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Where do I start, how about the lines moving to slowly, the mice crawling through the walls the mold on the ceiling in the bedroom(s), I moved twice, the bathroom ceiling cracking or the dust balls going through the lobby like tumble weeds at the OK Corral. The see through towels or the dust balls again under the furniture. The corrridor walls cracking down and the carpet looks like it is from WWII era. I have stayed there before about a year ago and it was okay at least it was clean then. Security was curt and the front desk was miserable at best Housekeeping was run much better when I was there back in 02. What ever was going on then do it again. Until then I wouldn't go back and this from a native New Yorker. Shame on The Hotel Pennsylvania some should call the news show Help Me Howard to get this place closed down!

Reviews.Title: “it's alright!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Price: Reasonable. Location: Being right next to Penn Station is EXCELLENT. It's quite convenient if you are considering roaming around town via the subway. Service: The reception could be a little irritating because of the constant lineup - about a 10 - 15 minutes wait on average. Around 11am - 4pm is a mad house at the lobby (especially wkends) so be alarmed. The Rooms: Yes, they are ok. They are quite acceptable if you are not picky - we know coz we had a big group and we were on different floors. In general the rooms are kind of a B-/C+ and the bathrooms are a C+. Extras: Some rooms have internet access at the desk (like around 10 dollars a day - cheaper then t-mobile at starbucks), while all TVs could serve the internet, check billing, and check-out. You can put your luggage in the storage for $4. None of us had changed rooms or anything. We enjoyed our stay and didn't really run into any problem (well we knew it's no 5 stars) The price is quite reasonable and awesome location makes it better. I'd recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for 1 night”
Reviews.Author: DebbaJoy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Valentine's Day weekend (Sun-Mon). Got a great internet rate - $89 a night. While waiting in line to check in I heard a lot of negative comments about the hotel and it started to worry me. During check-in we were informed that there were no more rooms available at the special internet rate and they had to upgrade up at the same price. The room was great! Small, but totally renovated. Very clean and the bed was king-sized and comfy. The only problem we had was a bunch a teenage girls in the next room having a "sing-along" at midnight! We called the front desk, who sent up security immediately. We felt bad, but it was late and we were tired. The girls did comply, though and all was well. All in all, for a decent night's stay in a great location for not a lot of money I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location hotel okay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the Valentines Weekend 2004 we went with our 7 year old daughter, after reading the reviews on here I was dreading it to say the least. We arrived at 4pm and we where checked in within 5 mins by very polite staff. Our room was on the 8th floor, it was dated looking but the room ,beds and towels were clean. We had hot water and a place to sleep. As a parent I would not tke my child anywhere unsafe or unclean. The location was fantastic, the staff were great and the staff in Lindy's downstairs were lovely. Basically I think you get what you pay for and I would liken it to a travel lodge in England. So get on and Enjoy New York, your're not there to stay in your room!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Rat hole, avoid like the plague it is”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to the penn for the Creation Farscape con in 2001, and oh my god what a pain in the butt. We get there and the lobby is packed, because in adition to our con, there was a Star Trek con and a Micheal Jackson concert. So you have all these people and only five chairs on the side of the lobby. So I park my butt on the floor with some of my friends who managed to grab the seats and start doing my homework, while I wait for my sister to get through the endless line to the desk. I wasn't in anyone's way, I made myself as small as possible, and yet I got harangued by some over glorified bell boy who told me I couldn't be sitting on the floor. After an hour we finally get our keys, two of them, even though there are three of us. After much nagging we get a third key, but they deactivated the other time, for whatever inane reason they had. We didn't realize this at first of course, it was after my sister and her husband went back to the room after a party and couldn't get in. When they went down to the desk complain, they gave my sister a hard time cause she wasn't wearing her shoes, which were of course, in the locked room. The room itself, which was supposed to be a triple but was instead a double, wasn't all that bad, just horribly stuffy, especially the bathroom. Our friend was less lucky, as she got a room with the door coming off the hinges. The con was on the top floor, in a large auditorium with atrocious acoustics, so the people in the back couldn't hear anything that was being said. The closest bathrooms were on the sixth floor, even for the people backstage. The sad thing is, after reading all these reviews, I realize how lucky we were. Avoid this hotel, it's not worth any amount of money you save.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel. Go elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel with my husband and some friends for Valentines weekend 2004. I had read the reviews on trip-advisor but as it was already booked I decided to remain optomistic and hope that the negative reviews were exagerated. They were not. It was worse than I ever could have imagined. When we pulled up outside it looked fine and we were pleased with its great location. We entered the lobby and that was still okay. It was big and busy so I was still hopeful! We checked in quickly and made our way up to our room on the 15th floor. As soon as we stepped from the lift I got a taste of things to come. It was nt too bad, just looked dated and a bit rough around the edges. As we approached our room I was noticing the doors they were terrible, dirty, tatty and very old fashioned. Nevermind I thought, lets just get in there. We opened the door and the smell that hit us was attrocious. The window was wide open despsite the temperature outside being minus to try and mask the smell. To be honest there was nothing good about the room. The carpet was dirty, the wallpaper was thick with grime and hanging off the walls, the ceiling was yellow and the paint was peeling. The curtains and nets were also thick with grime and very dirty, there is too many things to mention. It was late by then so there was nt much we could do, we just got into bed (which thankfully was clean). In the morning I had a fuzzy head from the smell so we went to see our friends room. Although theirs was as tatty as ours at least it did nt smell. As we knew it was just ours we asked reception to change. We were told we could but would need to ask again after 3pm. When we came back to do this we were told under no circumstances could this happen because there had been a flood and 40 rooms had been affected. The man was stressed as he had alot of people to deal with but he was sarcastic with me when I told him why we were unhappy. He said to me 'Madam, this is only a 2* hotel you know' I was well aware of that and basic I dont mind but dirt and smells are unacceptable. We had a further 2 nights in this room and were very unhappy. We had some lovely days out but felt really down when we had to come back to the hotel. There was no chance of having a mid day lay down or a lie in, we could nt wait to get out. We were lucky that it was an active holiday. We finally found out what the smell was when we heard a dog barking down the corridoor. Animals in a hotel!!! what on earth is that about!!? That is gross. It was also obviosuly a smoking room and years and years of dog smells and smoke had built up to stink out this foul room. The only good things in the hotel were its location and the housekeeping-the beds and towels were always clean. The rest was a disgrace I had to buy slippers so I did nt put my feet on the dirty carpet, I had to sleep fully clothed as it was so cold with the window open and we had to buy air freshner to attempt to hide the smell!! What a great Valentines, not!!!!!!! Do not stay in this hotel it really is horrible. Pay the small amount extra and find yourself somewhere decent!!!

Reviews.Title: “Only good for a nap...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Do yourselves a favor and find another place to stay, unless you travel with flip flops for the tub and to walk around the room. THe drab wallpaper was peeling, the bed was very lumpy, and the bathroom has pre-WWII plumbing. Room was a little funny-smelling. The hallways are wide but dreary. Elevators look like they've been recently updated, but the renovations apparently stopped there. Only thing good about it is the location. If you only need to sleep for a few hours, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great water pressure turns out to be a flood!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to go to NYC for Valentine's Day to catch a show and see some friends. We had found the Hotel Pennsylvania on line for a very good price ($118). We knew that the location was very good. We accidently stood in the Penn 5000 club line, but for $4 were checked into a room. Well, the room we were checked into was one of the worst rooms that either my husband and I have ever saw. We knew the hotel was old, but the room looked like it was not renovated since the 1940's. Wallpaper peeling, paint chipping and a full sized bed that felt like a water bed. We figured that we would deal with it for one night. Well, we went to seeour show and came back to freshen up before our dinner. I go to take a shower. I think "Well at least there is great water pressure!" I try to turn off the water. I can't. I notice some of the water streaming outside of the fixture. My husband comes in and I tell him that I can't turn off the water. He tries and more water comes out of the fixture. He calls the front desk and tells them that we are having problems. By the time he's done and I'm dressed, the water is coming out of the tile and onto the floor. He calls again then goes downstairs to tell them that they have a big problem. Someone did come up and started to fix it, which the water is now into the main room and getting close to the bed. They changed our room immediately (which is much to their credit). We were given a slightly bigger room in a smoking section, but it had a King sized bed, which when I called to comfirm our room days before, they said they didn't have anymore. All in all, good for a one night stay, but be careful what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “A big waste of $$$$$$”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Pennsylvania was the worst part of my trip to New York. The lobby emminates a feeling of grandeur, however thats where it ends. Our room was a disaster to say the least!!! The door looked like it would fall apart any minute. The room had not been painted in years, and the floor was absolutely filty. I wouldn't have wanted my dog to stay in the room. There was used soap in the bathroom and used napkins on the table. The tv remote didn't work and there wasn't even a phone book. The hair dryer was broken and the mirror in the bathroom was probably last cleaned about 5 years ago. I was not surprised when I heard that is where people stay for the Westminster Dog Show because of its proximity to madison Square Garden (right across the street). However, these rooms weren't fit for any dog!!!!!! Pay the extra cash and stay at the Hilton or Marriot.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Pennsylvania is brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel Pennsylvania last year and found it to be wonderful. The rooms were relatively inexpensive and we even had a view of the Empire State Building! To seal the whole holiday we even went to see Maury Povich who filmed his programmes in the Hotel - we even got free pizza. I left my silver chain in my room and they kindly sent it all the way to Scotland at no charge - exceptional!

Reviews.Title: “not worth the savings”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have to say that Hotel Pennsylvania is the absolute worst hotel that I have ever stayed in in my life. The pictures on their website were completely misleading. They might actually have one guest room that looks like the one in the picture, but I'm pretty sure that most rooms there are not that nice. The rooms look like they haven't had any kind of renovations since the 60s. Our room was incredibly small, the carpet had stains on it, the walls needed painting, there was a hole in the wall where the cable was coming into the room, and the shower was so gross that I refused to use it in the 2 days we were there. My husband and I tried to stay out as late as possible so that we wouldn't have to spend much time in our room. I wish I had found these reviews before we stayed there because I'm sure we would have booked another hotel, even if it meant spending more money. If you are interested in staying near the action (Times Square, etc), this is definately not the place to stay (unless you don't mind walking.) Do not waste your money here.

Reviews.Title: “horrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: as soon as you walk in you feel special, big chandelier, big lobby, big reception...............big queue. we were given door passes that didnt work/also allocated a room that was occupied. The corridors are long and the doors to the rooms, look like massive security doors, very scary. The room was smelly (dampness) need a lick of paint. We wouldnt stay here ever again. New York however is fantastic, love it love it love it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Like pretty much everyone else, I read all the reviews about this hotel before we went, and was absolutely dreading my trip. We arrived at about 3.00pm and checked in straight away. There was a bit of a queue but the receptionists (of which there were always 4 or more) got through the imposing queue very quickly. Our room was on the 7th floor and was actually much better than some rooms I've stayed in! It was fairly large, with a TV, bed, dresser, side tables and bathroom. The room was exceptionally clean, although it was in need of a lick of paint. We ventured out on our first day to get our bearings and popped back to the hotel a couple of hours later. We went straight to our room and saw that some of the ceiling tiles were missing. A note on our pillow told us to call the Front Desk as our room needed to be changed. This was because the heating had broken and they needed to fix it. We were then moved to the room next door, where we saw exactly the same thing. We rang the Front Desk again and told them what we found. The chap I spoke to was very apologetic and asked if we could stay there for one night, we would be moved the next day for the remainder of our stay. The room we were moved to was on the 10th floor and was the biggest room I have ever seen in my life!! We had been upgraded to a suite at no extra cost to ourselves. All in all, we had a wonderful first time in New York and the Hotel Pen is conveniently located for all the major site seeing places. It could do with a coat of paint but is very clean and all the staff are very helpful. The one thing I will say is don't try to cash your travellers cheques here - they only cash $100 per day - which in some cases just isn't enough. There is another place at the American Express place in Macy's which is just a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in December 2003. Our room looked like it had never been cleaned, stained walls, carpets etc or changed its decor since 60s/70s. Bathroom was very nice and clean though, with a good supply of hot water all the time. Dingy corridors with vile green carpets, with loads of heavily bolted bedroom doors, reminiscent of being in a crypt. Very unfriendly, with long queues to speak to anyone on reception at all times. Quite souless. However it suited our needs, close to amenities, a bed to sleep in and a good TV. However our stay was summed up when on informing a member of staff on reception that our room was pretty crap, he replied, yes all the rooms are!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I've stayed in...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here because of work - it was the show hotel recommended through an expo at Javitz - and had problems with reservations and billing before I even arrived. Upon checking into my non-smoking room on a non-smoking hall which smelled like smoke, I knew that the problems would continue. Unlike most good hotels, the HP won't let you handle ssues from your room, but instead require you to come down to the lobby where the lines are long beyond belief. The room was dingy and dark, but just clean enough to pass. My room continued to smell like smoke despite opening the window all day when I was out (this is in sub-zero temperatures outside), and I finally realized it was coming from down the hall - from a room apparently occupied by human smokestacks - and it was coming in under the 1 inch gap under my door. I finally had to resort to the bath mat rolled up and put across the door to keep the smoke out. Security did not care enough to respond do my call about smoking on a non-smoking hall. I am allergic, and the only reason I didn't request to change rooms is that I was scared I would get one that was worse. I repeatedly had problems with the phone, receiving messages and getting calls from outside. The day before I checked out - when I was convinced this hotel experience could not get any worse - the pipes burst, water leaked all over the lobby and put the elevators out of commission, so guests were forced to use the service elevators. Although they were left to largely figure this out themselves as signs were not put up and it was difficult to find the service elevators once in the halls (which by the way, are painted government issue gray and the doors literally look like coffin covers). The icing on the cake compelling me to write this review is that the hotel triple charged me on my credit card and I cannot get through to anyone in accounting and they are not returning my calls. Beware!

Reviews.Title: “Total Dive”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A girlfriend and I chose this hotel based on location and price - of which both were great. But that's the only redeeming quality of this hotel. The rooms were tiny, smelly and looked as if they were decorated in the 60's and haven't been touched since. The staff were okay but seemed more interested in conversing with themselves as opposed to working. Overall, the place is a dive and not worth your time.

Reviews.Title: “Disgraceful Treatment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booking a room for a friend ($189) who is confined to a wheelchair I was assured by this hotel that they were totally wheelchair accessable. When we arrived the first room we were shown my friend could not fit through the door. Second room he could not fit into the bathroom. After 2 hours and rude treatment we finally got a dive of a room that they had to take the door off the bathroom for him to fit through and as he also had a friend with him the friend had to leave the room when he needed to use the bathroom. The hotel room itself was like something you would see in a horror movie. Staff were rude and unhelpful. The trip turned out to be a nightmare and very embarrasing for my friend.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful lobby shame about the BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights, in November didn't realise that we would be sharing with unwelcome guests and paid in blood

Reviews.Title: “Bare Necessities”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On a scale of 1-10, 10 being best, this Hotel gets a 5, our Rm. (895) a low 4. Very little amenities and no view. When requested the staff would promptly bring what you needed, if available. No wash cloths provided, one bar soap, one sm. shampoo, no hair dryer. For $86 we were given a 10x15 bedroom/sm. bathroom. All very auster, ill maintained but functional and some what clean. TV on box, sm. refig. on floor. I was told that this was a true bargan for the location. Subway access, walk to Time Sq., shopping all around, good food everywhere. There is no place in NY you couldn't get to and return cheaply using the MTA (subway) or on a good day, walking. Pen Station accross the street, catch the Penn. Sta. shuttle for $10 O/W to LG Airport. If your priority is to see NY on a tight budget this is a good place to start. No frills, be creative and assertive!

Reviews.Title: “Only in America”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A quickly arranged four day trip to the Big Apple last november left me with little choice of hotel. Yes I had read the reviews on this site but to my own cost I cherry picked the few good one's about the Penn and stayed for four nights. The wait at reception was not that bad about fifteen minutes, my room door opened and wow!. This could, no wrong this should have been a hotel room in Bagdad during the bombing. The plaster had been ripped off the walls in place's and every thing movable was up on the bed, the window was open onto 7th Ave, it was freezing and I was going into shock. My bag I used to keep the door open and went in search of somebody, anybody who might help, finding a cleaning person she did not fully understand my accent and asked what room. I returned to the scene of the crime no better off. Then the cleaning lady who had juristiction of my room showed up, I was thinking great this will be sorted but she's sayin "i get the vacum and the janitor". After a few minutes she gave up trying to get the drywall out of the floor and I headed for reception. Funny but I met an English couple in the lift and needed someone to share my ordeal with quess what, they had just been satisfied by the fourth room and yes the Bagdad suite was also their first experience of the Penn. No problems with second room if you dont mind a very drafy window and dodgy heater. This brings my to my heading, Only in America or third world countries could this happen. Does the american hotel industry not have any watchdog, where's the pride in treating tourists like this.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I were there just before Christmas and we enjoyed every minute of our stay. I particularly liked the fact that the windows open in the room. The location is perfect for anywhere you wish to go. The staff was as nice as anyplace I have ever been. I am looking forward to staying there again in the Spring.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed at the Pennsylvania Hotel between 17th Dec - 22nd Dec 2003, and found it to be everything we expected - very basic. The rooms are small and dingy, and are in desperate need of refurbishment. However, we knew the hotel was a basic 2* hotel, and we got what we paid for. There is no better location on the island - a 5 minute walk to Times Square, 20 mins to Central Park and 2 minutes from Macy's and the Empire State Building. Madison Square Garden is directly opposite the hotel, although I would recommend taking the subway to the financial district - it's a good hour-and-a-half walk. We applied for a New York Greeter before we travelled, and I would highly recommend this free service. Hara met us and showed us around Soho, Chinatown and Little Italy - all of which are worth seeing even though it is off the tourist track. I would advise going to the Empire State Building first thing in the morning if you don't want to face long queues, and try to pick a clear day. Ground Zero is eerily quiet amidst all of the noise in adjoing streets, and is worth visiting not as a tourist attraction but more to pay tribute to the people who lost their lives on September 11th. New Yorkers will talk about the events of the World Trade Centre attacks quite openly, although you can sense that there is not a day that goes by without them remembering something about that day. Drinks are pricey ($14 for a small wine and a pint of Guinness!!!), as are most restaurants as you would expect from a major city. Ice skating in Central Park is extortionate but worth it for the experience, and visit the zoo ($6) whilst you're there. Christmas time is magical in New York, but take plenty of warm clothes - the wind chill is biting cold. Overall, it is the best place we have ever been to and we will definitely return to NYC - probably in summer next time.

Reviews.Title: “no problem”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Penn in Feb 2000 with my 11-year-old son. For the price we paid I hadn't expected more. The room was small, old furniture, small bathroom, but everything was clean and working. I know other Austrians who stayed there (seems to be a favourite budget place for Austrian agencies) and didn't hear any complaints about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Pennsylvania is not as bad as previous reviews have made out. Me and my boufriend went for a week over Valentine's Day, and had a great time. Not only has it a perfect location but the rooms are completely adequate in relation to how much you pay for them. What are people expecting for £50 a night in the Worlds No1 city?? The Bedroom was clean and we had a huge double bed, the Sky TV kept my boyfriend entertained and was completely free. The cupboard space isn't huge but we always live out of our suitcase anyway. In a huge city with so much to explore where you stay isn't really a huge factor to us, mearly just a place to rest tired feet and kip at night. If people want a nice room then get your dosh out and pay for it! The Information Desk in the lobby is great, they sorted us out tickets to see New York Knicks V Houston Rockets, and it was on our doorstep as Madison Square Garden is just outside the hotel. The corridors are long but are well lit. The corridor carpets may be abit old but give them time to refurbish such a big hotel. I would recommend the Hotel Pennsylvnia for cheap adequate accomodation, and if you'll use it as a stopping off point from all the activities you have planned. If you want anything better then be prepared to pay a little more.

Reviews.Title: “Guess I got Lucky”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I travelled to New York with my girlfriend. We stayed in the Hotel Pennsylvania from 8-11 January 2004. When I checked this website for reviews I was shocked at what I read. I was very worried about whether I would be staying in some sort of cess pitt. We arrived and was very impressed with the look of the place, the lobby is huge, there wasn't much seating though. I read lots of stories about queing for hours to check in. We arrived about 1800 ready for a long wait, but there was only about 4 people queing. We queued for about 10 mins before seeing a receptionist. She was polite and quickly gave us our room key. Room 706. I agree with the comments about the 'shining' corridors, I expected Jack Nicholson to be lurking somewhere. We got in the room and there was someones luggage still in the room. We called reception and was told to come straight back down. Here we go I thought. We went back down and was given 722. Now when we arrived at 722 I have never been so nervous at entering a hotel room before. What was behind the door?? We opened it up and was pleasantly suprised at the room, It was massive, with 2 double beds all with clean bedding, walk in wardrobe and tv. The bathroom was very clean. The decor was dated, bit of wallpaper peeling and a few stains in one of the corners, but hey nothing like I had read about. The carpet was also fine, no dirt, or cockroaches. The room was warm and we had a heater in-case we needed to turn it up. First thing when I woke up the next morning was the hot water situation. I had read many stories of no hot water. Turned on the shower and hot water poured out, same with the sink. The maids tend to turn up at around 0930. I get the impression that if you are in your room when they come, they wont come in, probably till the next day. We made sure we was out before then anyway...we were in New York!!, can't see much laying in bed. We got new bedding and towells every day, all were clean and fresh. To top it off I don't think you can beat the location, its great. Basically a 5 min walk or under to everything. Macy's is 1 min away and there is a few pizza resturants and a mcdonalds on the next block for quick eats. All in all I would say that I had a enjoyable stay in the Hotel Pennsylvania. It sounds like I got very lucky with everything but there are good rooms in there. Remember you probably won't have paid much for the accomodation. I paid about $70 a night, so don't expect the Ritz, with picassos on the walls. I wish you good luck, and remember a good room is there. Just cross your fingers.

Reviews.Title: “perfectly fine....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read the previous reviews before i left for my trip, I was horrified but was unable to change hotels as it was a package deal. It was my first trip to New York and it was just me and one friend so I was a bit worried how it would turn out. We arrived at 9:30am,you are not supposed to be able to check in untill 3pm but the man at the desk said if we came back in an hr we could check in. It only took 5 mins - The room was good,2 double beds,plenty of room and the whole place (including bathroom) was very clean and tidy. The maids were all very friendly when we saw them and the room was cleaned everyday. There was one staff member on the front desk who wasnt very welcoming - Sheila but besides that everyone we came in contact with was lovely. The hotel is in an ideal location - opposite Maddison Square Garden,just down the road from Macys and a block away from Empire State Building. The only thing I can reccomend is requesting a renovated room which is what I did after reading the other reviews. Our room was on the 9th floor,view was only of another building but you don't spend much time in your hotel room when you're in New York!! I'd go back there without hesitation,it's cheap,clean and in a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: SuziR
Reviews.Content: Went on a girly weekend to NYC and booked this hotel as part of a cheap internet deal. We were a bit disappointed on arrival that the rest of the hotel wasn't as nice as the lobby. 2 of us had to change our room immediately as the lights didn't work and the window was stuck open. We ended up a 5 minute walk (on the same floor) from our friends. Our rooms did look like they had been decorated in the seventies but they were fairly clean and one had a fridge, the other had a fantastic view of the Empire State building. Anyway as we didn't plan to spend too much time here we got over our disappointment and relished in the fantastic location. Close to loads of top attractions and near the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Very shabby”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights while Christmas shopping in December 2003. I had read the reviews so I was prepared for the horrors to be found at this hotel. I wasn't disappointed! The room we were first given looked like a slum. There were two tiny beds, no curtains, dirty linen and the room was miniscule, even by English standards. After complaining to the reception staff, we were given a much better room. It was still shabby and I wouldn't walk on the carpet without slippers or shoes but the bathroom and towels were clean, as was the bed linen. Good value and great location but next time I will spend more money and stay at a nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “MINGING MINGING MINGING!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: NottinghamSwimmer
Reviews.Content: booked a 5 day new year break at this excuse for a hotel,that was my first mistake.Arrived to a 1hour queue at reception to be given a twin room after booking a double then after half an hour complaining being given a room out of trainspotting.more complaining i at last got a 5th rate, 1940s, the room that time forgot,hovel.the reception area was gorgeous shame i couldnt of slept here.the adjoining resturant was superb(Ojays)but those rooms are so dirty that i didnt dare think what half the stains were.so my advice is pay a bit more and do some research.

Reviews.Title: “okay for the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from NYC this weekend. I read reviews after I had booked this hotel online. For the price (~$78/night incl. tax) , it wasn't bad at all. I was expecting the worst from what I had read. The room was on the 14th floor. The bed/sheets was clean. The bathroom was clean. A few stains were on the bathroom ceiling. But one corner of the room between the window and the wall looked terrible. If anything of mine had fell there, I would have left it there! But the hotel was very close to the subway so you could go anywhere in the city you wanted to go. Very close to Times Square and a lot of the sights were in walking distance. The train station was directly across from the hotel. If you take the train into NYC, you don't need to take a taxi or anything, just cross the street. If you can stay somewhere else, you should. I don't think I would stay here again. Our room was okay, but who knows what would happen next time

Reviews.Title: “Yuggi!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this palace for a couple of days in December and am still recovering from the experience. Delighted to find, when I first arrived at my room, a half-eaten fruit salad in a plastic take-out tray on the stained overstuffed chair. Enthused to discover two large bags of trash tucked away in the bathroom. Took them outside to the hall where they remained until after I regretfully departed. Perhaps they are still there. Amused to observe a French woman screaming for the manager, while I patiently waited in the registration line, proclaiming that her room was not fit for a pig. Ah, the French. Why can't we all just get along?

Reviews.Title: “Friggin Dump!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Pennsylvania is a FRIGGIN DUMP! DO NOT STAY THERE! Filthy Rooms. I couldn't even plug in my laptop because their outlets were two prongs only. It is not worth even 50 bucks a night to stay there. My friends room had a left over fruit salad and garbage all over the room for check in. This place BLOWS!

Reviews.Title: “Very basic but warm and claen”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After booking this hotel my friend and I were absolutley dreading our stay. We only read the reviews after we had booked and were really not looking forward to it at all, all we could think about all the way there was what our room was goin to be like. We went Xmas shopping and had saved for months, so we wanted something that was going to be clean and warm and nice to go back to after a days shopping and sightseeing. The lobby is beautiful, always bustling with people, and the gift shop and coffee shop is not bad either. We were staying on the 14th floor and in the lift on the way up we were terrified of what we were going to find after reading certain reviews. The one review that said the corridors looked like something off the "SHINING" were so true because they really did, just went on forever. First glance at our room was that it was very basic, quite small too but adequate for 3 nights. We were not going to be spending that much time in it anyway, its just a bed, because your out most of the day anyway. Bathroom was clean, apart from no hot water, so we complained and they got it sorted for us-very helpful staff. The room had a hairdryer, tv, mirror, wardrobe, everything you need really-walls are very thin, you can hear everything. Perferct location though, couldnt ask for anything closer. Would for sure stay there again, value for money. your there to see the city not the hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were booked at the Hotel Pen on 10 Dec 2003 for 5 nights. We had read the reviews and were fearing the worst.... When we arrived we asked for a renovated room but am not sure what we got. Our room was on the 6th floor. When I saw the room it was much better than I expected, it was small and one of the lights was not working but apart from that it was fine. The bed sheets were clean, as was the bathroom and it was cleaned everyday with fresh towels. We had a fully working TV, hairdryer. But be warned the walls are extremely thin, you can hear EVERYTHING. I found all staff very helpful and polite at all times. This hotel is in an ideal location. We watched basketball at MSG and it was great to be able to just walk across the road back to the hotel. Macys, Time Square and the Empire state building are all a few minutes walk away. This was my first trip to New York and I had a fantastic time with no bad memories.

Reviews.Title: “Not the worlds greatest hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BREG
Reviews.Content: As like everyone else I had read the reviews on here and was dreading it. I had also read that if you were lucky enough to get a room above the 10th floor you would be ok and that the rooms were re-furbished. This is NOT the case. We were allocated the 16th floor(room 1631). The room was absolutely huge but very old and very basic. There were curtain rails but no curtains! The carpets were very worn, bedding shabby etc but it was warm and clean. I did request a change of room but the reception staff as obviously used to this request and point blank refused, telling us that the hotel was full and that we weren't able to swop rooms with a later arrival that wasn't yet there. They asked us to return the next day at 2pm, which quite obviously you wouldnt do as you wouldnt waste a day of your holidays (a fact I am sure they are well aware of). To be fair by day two we were used to it and it wasn't all that bad. At the end of the day you only sleep there and the loaction is fantastic. What you get in your room is very hit and miss , some have hairdryers and fridges and some dont, its just pot luck! I requested a hairdryer one evening to be told it was on route , after various calls for 2 hours I was told in actual fact they didn't have any! The New Yorkers are quite abrupt but this is just there way so dont take it personally.

Reviews.Title: “Nil”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went in this hotel in Summer 2001. After 45 mn of waiting to get a room previously booked through a travel agent (I do not make this error), we entered in a tiny room. It was dirty without daylight. The ceiling was stained by numerous prior water damage (see the picture on Virtual tourist). The sheets are also dirty with a piece of chewing gum glued on one of them. The sign "on remodeling" was in the stairs. Reading the previous reviews I see the hotel is still in remodeling two years after our stay (good excuse). There was an expensive valet parking : 35$ daily. We had to ask our car one hour before the departure. So I did. But I had to wait my car 30 mn more because my request done on time was not registred. The employee was surprised to have no tip. Stingy Frenchman !

Reviews.Title: “Don't go”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am just back from New York a few days and would advise anyone to avoid this hotel. I have been to New York twice before so I knew what to expect. The hotel has only one thing going for it, it's location! The first two rooms we were given were filthy, the carpets were stained, the walls and ceiling were peeling. After much complaining the third room was a little better and due to having travelled for hours we settled for it. I was not looking for anything fancy all I wanted was a clean room! My advice there are far nicer hotels for around similar prices - don't go here.

Reviews.Title: “Would return tomorrow, if we could and stay at the PA.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Arrived Dec. 11 and departed Dec. 16. The hotel was great, lobby was beautiful, the City Perk coffee shop in lobby and Lindy's were so convenient and had good food. After I read all the reviews, we were so afraid, that we would be stuck, and this was our 40th wedding anniversary and my first trip to the Big Apple. I couldn't have been more pleasantly surprised. We checked in within 15 minutes by Yen, and his service was friendly and professional. We were on the 11th floor, and the room was clean, spacious, comfortable and quiet. We will return to NYC again and would have no problem staying at the Pennsylvania. Location is awesome, across from MSG, Penn Station and down the street from Macy's and you can walk to Times Square. There are 2 subway stations within 2 blocks, which you can go anywhere in the city on. Take the Airport Bus, it is $10 one way, and they take you to Grand Central you transfer to Penn Station and you are at the Pennsylvania. Do not buy tickets in the lobby for the bus, or theatre tickets, too expensive and you can buy them on the bus, and theatre tickets at the 1/2 price booth on 47th St. in Times Square. Had no problems with check-out, as you can do it via your TV and the remote control. Loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would I Stay There Again????”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Like everyone else, we booked a deal through an Agent in June this year and then found this site and have been reading it over the last few months with mounting horror. I booked for myself and 8 others so I obviously lost a lot of sleep worrying what they would make of it. I tried to change the hotel but the agent we booked with said that they had only ever had one complaint from a traveller about the Pennsylvania and assured us it would be fine. We arrived on the 10 December (for 5 nights) and were given three triple rooms on floor 3. We made our way up fully expecting horrors. The rooms were bad, no view, dirty, and smelly. We returned to reception and after asking to see the manager (who never appeared) were given a suite consisting of three triple rooms on the 15th floor. These rooms were marginally better, at least the bathrooms were clean, we were together and we had a magnificent view of the Empire State Building. On our last day, I asked my friends if they would stay at this hotel, some would and some said not. For the price (we paid about Â£20 a night per person) - we couldn't really complain - I think it could have been a lot worse. I have just read on the site that someone had bed bug bites (I was wondering what the bites were on my neck and arms - now I know!!). For myself, I don't think I would stay there again, I would save up a little extra and research any hotel on this site before I booked anything. I have, since returning (yesterday) checked my credit card account to find that the hotel have put in a charge of Â£450.00 - you can imagine, I was in tears!. Apparently this is something that some hotels do, and my cc company have informed my that it should be taken off in a few days. I will let you know if they don't.

Reviews.Title: “roadside motel in midtown”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 12/10/03. As others have said, the lower floors are ugly. I'd like to add that the corner rooms for singles have little heat and lots of noise. No hot water in the morning, shower the night before. You can hear neighbors 2 doors away so bring ear plugs. The place is dirty, needs paint, and the bathroom was 1920's, except for the ugly caulking. The location is fantastic, across from penn station, but given the excellent subway system, who cares?? If you can take a train into Penn Station then just take a subway from there and go to a different hotel. Or luck out and get above the 10th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our room was disgusting from Dec. 9 through Dec. 15. We found blood splatters on the bedspreads, walls, sheets and mattresses. The place was filthy! Stains all over. Elevator stopped on level M and we stared back at a cement wall! I would NEVER stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We didn't have high expectations but thought the value for the size of the room and location was great. Perfect location if you are going to MSG, Macy's, Time Square... It is an old hotel but staff were friendly and the room was clean. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Former Glory, Current Bargain”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Penn is a wonderful old building (designed by Stanford White). With 1700 rooms, it's possible to get lost in the shuffle. When we checked in, our assigned room had no curtains or bedding. It took a few calls to the front desk to get things straightened out, but after that things were fine. We chose the bargain rooms, which were OK considering the price. Not great, but satisfactory. The bathroom was the nicest feature: black and white tile...very art deco. On one evening we had a noisy neighbor, but that could happen anywhere. The whole place is slowly being renovated, so some halls/rooms are in better shape than others. In short, if you have modest expectations, this is a good hotel for those on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “It brought me to tears”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel a few months ago. It was my girlfriend's first time to New York and I wanted everything to be perfect. The hotel looks great from the outside and the lobby makes you think you are going to be staying somewhere nice. OH NO!!!!!!!!!!! When we got on our floor, we were met by an odor, we finally got to our room and was very disappointed. The furniture was old, the wall paper was peeling and had lots of pen drawings on it from past guests, the bathroom was very basic and gross. The shower curtain had mildew on it. We had to hunt down our own towels. The tv didn't work. The room smelled. I was so skeeved out. I literally cried. It was horrible. We decided to leave the hotel and enjoy the city. Before we left we called for an iron. When we came back we had to call 6 more times before someone finally sent it over. I WOULD NEVER STAY THERE AGAIN. Actually the second time we went to NYC, we stayed in a Super 8 motel in Times Square (which you expect to be bad). However, it was sooooooooo much nicer than Hotel Pennsylvania and a lot cheaper! The service was great. The rooms were really clean, they provided a free breakfast each morning, and they had an iron in the room. I would definetly stay at the Super 8 way before I would ever step foot in the Hotel Pennsylvania.

Reviews.Title: “December 2003 - Not recommended!”
Reviews.Author: natk13
Reviews.Content: After reading the worrying reviews on this site we decided to ask to view our room first... the corridors looked like something out of 'Stephen Kings - The Shining' and the rooms were even worse, especially the bathroom, again, like something out of another horror film 'Physco'. In detail there was no electricity for one, the room stank of stale smoke, there was mold on the doors, wallpaper peeling off walls, urine over the toilet seat from a previous guest, toilet tissue stuffed in the windows to supposedly stop the draft, no curtains and blinds that didnt work.....the list goes on................! We complained to the Manager who told us to come back tomorrow as all 1600 rooms were full, he also gave us the line of 'what do you expect for a 2 1/2 star hotel',! In my books, I at least expect hygiene! The Staff are obviously used to complaints and not at all baffled by the amount of guests we witnessed in the same boat! We therefore spent our 1st night in NY trapsing around the city trying to find another hotel, but unfortunately everywhere was fully-booked due to the christmas period and staff at other hotels even laughed when we told them where we were staying! It has got a terrible reputation in NY. However, we did finally manage to change our room the following afternoon but its wasnt much better, but at least clean(ish)- I still kept my socks on to walk about the room!!! At the end of the day we were only in the hotel to shower and sleep but 3 nights were definately enough for us. Apart from the hotel, NY is a brilliant place.......... But one word of advice - CHANGE YOUR HOTEL, NOW!!!

Reviews.Title: “Go with low expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My advice would be to avoid this hotel or at least have low expectations of what you will get for your money. We travelled in early December so paid more than usual which made the hotel experience even more disappointing - take no notice of any picture you see of the hotel - the nice rooms may exist but they are in the minority. Reception is chaotic with largely unhelpful staff, and resembled a back-packers dorm with all the students sitting on the floor!! The room was poor, really shabby - tired decor, dirty bathroom, ripped and stained bedsheets - a generally depressing room - we moved to a better one when we found there was no hot water but it was still a big disappointment - but as we were there to enjoy New York we weren't in the room much - just as well!! We even had to pay to leave luggage for 2 hours after we checked out!! Only positive is the location which is a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “Don't worry : it's fine!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I won a 4 day trip to New York at work, and the Hotel Penn was booked over the net. The day before we left, we read the reviews - and nearly didn't go! However, on the plane on the 28th Nov 2003, we met a New Yorker who'd been there and she said it was fine. We stayed from the 28/11/03 to the 2nd Dec, and it was packed (Thanksgiving, Macy's, Xmas etc). Told reception about what we'd read and asked for "a nice room". Got room 995 - could see Empire State from window. Room was basic, but clean - cleaned every day, fresh sheets. Sure, we could have found things to complain about - but it was fine for us - value for money, clean, friendly staff (including the notorious Valda on reception!) and superb location. Didn't hear or see one person asked to be moved or complain. You want luxury - go pay for it. But who wants to stay in their room listing petty complaints when you could be in Times Square? If you're English, don't worry about Hotel Penn - be nice when you arrive and don't expect the Waldorf!

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in November and although I wasn't expecting much, I was disgusted by the room I was given. It was small, shabby, dirty. The window wouldn't close all the way. The towels had stains on them. There was a wet towel on the floor of the shower stall when I checked in. There were holes, dents, scuff marks on the walls. And to top if all off, I left the place with bed bug bites on my arm. I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Whats all the fuss about?”
Reviews.Author: funkydunk
Reviews.Content: I booked the Pennsylvania on the internet then read the reviews a few days later with mounting horror.My wife was almost refusing to travel when she read them but as we were booked for thanksgiving weekend, it was impossible to get alternative accommodation at a similar price anywhere central in New York.Air France managed to delay our connecting flight from Aberdeen to Paris so we missed our New York flight and had to sit around in Paris for an extra three hours.When we got to the Pennsylvania, there was an enormous queue waiting to check in. We waited over 45minutes and were expecting the harridans fondly described by previous reviewers. Instead, a nice young lady called Sherry apologised for the delay and booked us in very promptly. We had only booked the standard room and were given one on the seventh floor. Expecting the worst, we were pleasantly surprised by the size of the room and although the decor was minimal, it was very clean.There were two large double beds and although the carpet wasn't the newest, it was also clean. The toilet was very clean and although there sometimes was no hot water for the shower, there was always plenty for the bath.The towels were changed daily, the room was cleaned daily and the bed linen was clean and fresh. Considering the size of the hotel and the number of occupants, especially last weekend,(Thanksgiving), I thought the staff did an excellent job and I would recommend it to any of my friends.If you want luxury, pay the going rate. If you want value for money, stay in the Hotel Pennsylvania.

Reviews.Title: “A Nightmarish Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pennsylvania from 26th Nov - 1st Dec it was our first trip to NY and I can honestly say it's the worst hotel I have ever stayed in!!! Admittedly I knew it wasn't going to be the best hotel in NY for the money were were paying, but i did expect it to be clean. First impressions were good, the lobby was really nice and clean. However it went downhill from there. We complained about the first room we were given on the 4th floor, the room a 'superior king size room' was disgusting, it was cramped, dusty, the carpet was filthy, and the bathroom must have been built for a midget and had very suspicious stains in the bathtub. The second room no 736 was bigger, but not much, had a king size bed with a newish bed cover and a cleaner bathroom. However the carpet looked as though it had never been hoovered. We weren't happy but the hotel was full due to thanksgiving, so we conceded as long as the carpet was vacuumed, which the guy in the grey suit (looked inportant) said he would sort for us. This didn't happen so I called housekeeping and still it wasn't sorted so when we got back from our meal on the evening, I spotted one of the maids on our floor and asked if I could use the hoover, she obliged and at least afterwards we could walk around without our shoes on. We also had a wonderful experience with 'Cyril' the cockroache, i couldn't work out whether he arrived in the bathroom via the plughole or via the hole in the bathroom ceiling. We'd also love to know if anyone is planning to stay here soon if the 3 jelly babies are still on the floor by the lifts on the 7th floor? On the plus side though, the location is great, it didn't take us long to check in and out, and we did have fresh towels every day and the bed was changed daily. We have now learnt a valuable lesson and we will always read reviews of any hotels that we planning to visit in future. We wouldn't recommend for anyone to stay in this hotel but we didn't let it spoil our trip to New York.

Reviews.Title: “It Wasn't The Best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Pennsylvania on November 25. My boyfriend and I were up the for the Jay-z concert at Madison Square Garden. The hotel is in a excellent location. The rooms weren't so excellent. My just reminded ourselves that it was somewhere that we was just resting our heads for just for one night. The paint on the walls were chipping,there was a stain on our comforter. The refrigerator look horrible it made you afraid to put anything in there. The carpet and walls had stains. The best part to me must have been the bathroom that was somewhat clean. I wouldn't say that I would not stay here again but I would look around first. The price and the lobby looks good but thats it.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a short stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I visited the Pennsylvania Hotel this November. I expected the hotel to be basic but not to the extent where i had to clean the room myself. The rooms were dirty (you needed to keep shoes on at all times!) and the bathroom definately hadn't been cleaned between guests. If you dont mind a bit of dirt this hotel is perfect for sight seeing in New York and is central to all the main shopping areas. The lobby area is large and clean and the staff seemed really friendly. My advice to anyone visiting this hotel would be not to expect too much, and stay out of the shower, you might catch something!!!!

Reviews.Title: “4-star facade but 3-star comfort in midtown Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: aukahkay
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Pennsylvania from November 9 - 16 2003. The location of the hotel is excellent - just directly opposite Penn Station with the subway just next to it. I paid $109 per night plus tax for a standard double room. Room 239 was spacious - it had a walk-in wardrobe complete with ironing facilities. However, the room showed signs of ageing. Wallpaper was peeling off from the wall. When I turned on the bathtub tap, rusty water flowed out. There was little space on the ledge above the washbasin to put toileteries. Information in the folder was outdated and there was no hotel stationery provided. The telephone charges are exhorbitant - toll-free calls cost 95 cents per call and a 5-minute long-distant call to New Jersey cost $19!! The hotel lobby, although spacious, was always crowded with people checking in and checking out or loitering around the theater booking counter. The front desk staff were unfriendly and robotic - not a single smile on their face when checking in. I was not even informed that I had to present a credit card in order to activate the telephone line in the hotel room and there was no information on the telephone call charges. Check out was a big hassle - the queue was long and the service slow - it took about half an hour to check out. Luggage storage was charged at $4 per piece. If you want a room in an excellent midtown Manhattan location with a reasonable price, Hotel Pennsylvania has it but be prepared for what I have just mentioned.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be worried”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews on this site AFTER we had booked and were pretty worried. The first room they gave us was dreadful (wallpaper pealing off the wall, holes in the carpet etc.) but having read the reviews about the 'refurbished' floors we went straight back down to reception. Without any arguments at all they gave us a room on the 9th floor which was absolutely fine. We were so happy, that we came back to this hotel a second time during our stay in the US! This hotel is in such an unbeatable location (right opposite Madison Sq Gdn), it really can't be beaten on price. Just go for it but demand a room on a refurbished floor! Good Luck :o)

Reviews.Title: “Much better than I thought!”
Reviews.Author: tustij
Reviews.Content: This was a surprise 21st Birthday present for my daughter, I read the reviews after I had booked it and was petrified! What was I taking her to? We were checked in by Flora who did her best to put us on the 12th floor as these are refurbished rooms but instead upgraded us to a junior suite on the 10th floor which was huge! two double beds, three piece suite, 2 TV's, admittedly the bathroom wasn't great but had a good mirror for doing hair and make up! I relaxed immediately and our stay was very pleasant. I found the staff quite friendly but I think that because its such a big hotel it is rather inpersonal. My only advice if you stay there is try and request a room on 10th floor or above.

Reviews.Title: “I survived it....just!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a mess! The bathroom looked like someone had died in the bath, likewise the carpet. I'm all for New York attitude but the staff were rude to the point of hostility. The final straw was having NO hot water EVERY morning. Pay a bit more and go elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as people are making out!!”
Reviews.Author: nataliej79
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from Hotel Penn after spending 4 nights there. The hotel in itself is pretty basic but our room on the 7th floor was ok. The room was cleaned every day and there was no sign of any mould or exposed wires!! The only gripes i do have about the hotel and NY people in general is how unfriendly people are!! Flora and Vlada on reception are very unhelpful and treat you like a piece of dirt off their shoe!! The hotel phone is very very expensive, try not to use it. Only other gripe is waiting for someone to help you when you want something from your safety deposit box, it takes forever and people had took to writing 'hurry up' on the signs in there!! All in all, the hotel room was adequate, pretty basic but clean, tidyand warm with all amenities. As the saying goes, 'you get what you pay for" so if people don't want a budget hotel they need to be prepared to pay for a hotel that isn't budget class instead of moaning!!

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as people said!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel online as its cheap and the location looked good. As we were gonna spend 15 nghts in NYC, we needed something with a decent price. After booking, we read the reviews on this website and were absolutely petrified at what we were going to see on our arrival to Hotel pennsylvania. As people said before, the lobby is good and there is ample seating for a hotel lobby i believe although it did get crowded some days. We arrived at about 12-1pm and were afriad we'd be sat around as it said on some reviews that we werent allowed to check in before 3pm. We went straight u to the desk and checked in. It took about 15 minutes to queue and to actually check in. Then we went to our room on the 14th floor. The room was basic, it had a double bed, a TV, a cupboard and a chest of draws. The bed was clean and was changed daily. People who said their bed didnt get changed, you can request this by calling the number PROVIDED to you on your check in, although we didnt have to. The room itself was pretty clean looking and there were no sign of the black curtains or the brown stains on the walls anywhere (as other people reported on this site). There is no food offered in the hotel, lindys is based in the hotel but is expensive. The next block over, you have an italian resaurant, a greek restaurant, a subway restaurant, a Mcdonalds, a chinese restaurant, a help yourself to all different kinds of food (very cheap and very good food) restaurant. They are all in a row. Once we found them, we never ate at lindys again. As people have said, location is awesome, across the street from Madison square garden, you are literally 20 yards from the red line 1+9 subway entrance and over the road from penn station. The information desk is really helpful. They book tickets, and answer any general questions about NYC or the hotel in general. The check in desk also acts as a cashier and you are allowed to cash cheques up to $100 per room free of charge which was for travellers cheques. Also someone complained about the New York airport service, saying they dropped them off so many blocks from the hotel. What happens is they drop you off at grand central station, and then you transfer to another NYAS bus which drops you off outside of the restaurants i mentioned before (20 yards from your hotel door). Pick up is the same aswell. If you've already booked and are worried as my girlfriend and i were, dont worry. If you're thinking of going, its a clean cheap room with perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “okay already, its a bed at least”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to NYC (Nov 5th - 9th)and my friend booked through an English based operator offering budget deals. We were impressed by the photos, and booked. Everything they said was correct, great location, you are bang in the middle of Manhattan with the Empire State 5 mins away and Macy`s just two blocks away, and the convienience of transport right on your doorstep. Reception was busy, queued for ten mins,and a not particularily pleasant woman checked us in. Security to the lifts was good, and the elevators had cameras and Tv screens showing CNN. (only in America) Then we got to our 7th floor room?? After fiddling with our electronic key, we pushed open the heaviest metal door ever, passing graffiti on the wall "I want your money" It was a large room with 2 beds and a bathroom with a bath and shower. The thing that dissapointed us was that the websites we had seen had described the hotel as being refurbished. We found out that the pictures are of mainly superior and business class rooms, and not what you get for budget (£58 per night.)which plainly have not been refurbished. The bath was badly chipped and had been painted! the toilet had the slowest weakest flush I have ever seen, but best was the hairdryer that was positioned so close to the sink that you could easily knock it when washing?? The shower worked and we had hot water. The closet had not been cleaned, the ironing board was filthy, and the carpet was stained throughout. There was a bloodied band aid on one of the beds, and one bed had crumbs all over it. The lighting was poor, we had a window but this looked into the side of the front of the hotel, (other rooms) and the window opened, with great difficulty to be governed by a wire allowing it only to open 6 inches?? The curtains were black mouldy and stained. The colour tv worked, (fab choice) but there were wires exposed everywhere all over the room and holes where gawd only knows what lurked within. We complained at the desk and were told the hotel was full, but "Harry" was really nice, and let us see another room, but to our horror this was the tiniest room ever with a huge mould patch growing up the wall. We decided to stay in ours. We werent in NYC to stay in our room and it was safe, cleaned everyday, fresh sheets, towels etc, and a bonus, it was quiet, no noisy neighbours or street sounds. I wouldnt neccesarily stay again and by some of the other reviews it looks like we were lucky, however if you want budget location, and are willing to take a gamble as to what sort of room you get, then this is the place. I always thought Americans were quite fussy about things like this but this hotel gave a different view. All said though we had a fantastic time and the people of NYC are the friendliest I have ever met, and TIMES SQ.. wow, ,....Piccadilly Circus you can keep. I have since complained to the website we booked through and told them they need to review their descriptions.

Reviews.Title: “Truly awful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Thankfully had read the bad reviews before going so did not expect much. First point of contact was obviously reception and someone should tell Vlada to get the sour expression from her face...a smile does not cost anything! Corridors were filthy and smelly, room was dingy but bedding at least was clean. The door to our room kept jamming and we could not get out of it the first morning and with bars on the windows it is a real fire hazard. Do not book anything through the hotel information desk as they give out the wrong information saying packages are not available when they are, book direct with the operators.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Pennsylvania”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I can highly recommend the Hotel Pennsylvania to anyone wanting a clean, moderately priced ($130.00?night) hotel in an excellent location in midtown Manhattan. It is just across the street from Madison Square Garden (Penn Station), a major subway hub, and is within easy walking distance of many major attractions. Rooms are large and clean, although in some cases somewhat dated.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been worse.”
Reviews.Author: mammacaz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the pits.Budget I can handle - even tatty but this was down right filthy. The 1st room allocated was already occupied, the 2nd was disgusting and the 3rd was real Tat'. Weekend of marathon so had little choice but to stay but never,never, never again. Don't do it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived in NYC for a five night stay and were due to spend one night at the Hotel Penn before moving onto the Hudson. When we got into the lobby there were exposed cables and wires everywhere and the carpets were filthy. Upon arrival in the room there was blood on the walls! The bathroom was also very grimy with dead wasps floating in the toilet bowl. Even though it was already 10pm we checked out the same evening and went to the Edison - I would never return to this hotel. Please do not waste your money!

Reviews.Title: “It had its period”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There was menstruation in the toilet bowl when we got there. I'd rather go on a death march than be forced to step in the lobby. If there was someone threatening to kill me if I didn't stay there, suicide would be my Disney World. It was supposed to be my boyfriend and my first romantic getaway. We broke up because Hotel Pennsylvania.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room at the Pennsylvania Hotel was one of the worst I've ever stayed in (and that includes some really bad fishing camps). The bathroom was filthy! Cables exposed in several locations with holes in the walls. Shower head sprayed water all over the bathroom. When we arrived the room smelled like a bottle of bleach! The ads for this hotel appear to be inaccurate - the room we stayed in had not been remodeled in 50 years! It was a terrible selection - we wouldn't recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “i loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: after watching many films on new york,I thought the hotel would be very grubby and dirty with some women hanging around the lobby offering sex for sale.That was just in the movies.Based on the price that i paid,all I wanted was a base to start my sight seeing every morning and a place to rest my tired feet.Fantastic lobby,good doorman,nice lifts,warm comfy room with on suite bathroom,what more could you ask for.Up stairs they record the sally show and they give you free coffee and food when you go to watch the recording and you end up on the screen,cool. Everything I wanted was around the hotel,Empire state building,Macys,mc donalds,madison square gardens and jacks dept store (must visit) and penn station right under the hotel. I have recommended this hotel to my friends and after thier stay,they have done the same.If you want to be pampered go else where,if you want value for money stay here. 10 out of 10

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: simonharris
Reviews.Content: I would never stay here again. It was truly the worst place i have stayed. The rooms are dark, dirty and you get teh feeling that the carpets. curtains, if you can call them that, and the blankets have not been cleaned since the hday the place was built. The final straw for me was when i ran teh shower : i was greated with torrents of brown water filling the bath. I stayed one night and left. Never again. I spend the rest of my stay and my other trips at the Park Central on 7th Avenue. Great place

Reviews.Title: “Total Disaster”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Hotel Pennsylvania was terrible. Very poor check in service; the room was grimy and dirty. Light fixtures were broken and the ones that worked were so dim that the room was barely lit at all. The furniture was broken down. No clocks in the room and the telephone was broken and very dirty. I would never stay here again nor would I recommend anyone else stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel RoomEver”
Reviews.Author: Howie70
Reviews.Content: After a long flight from the West Coast my wife and I checked into our room only to find we had been assigned a closet; well not actually a closet, but a room slightly larger than a closet. We had been promised a queen bed, but we got a single and a half with the lower two feet cut off. Space to pass between the bed and wall was maybe 10 inches. If we opened both suitcased on the floor there was no room to walk. The actual closed held about four hangars worth. The tiny bathroom had a shower that, no matter what you did, flooded the bathroom with water. The worst part? No air. The air conditioning didn't work and the window didn't open. The room stayed a toasty 85 degrees plus all night. This was the most miserable room I have every stayed in. Oh, and did I mention, it was filthy dirty. Walk in white socks on the carpet (if you can find the room) and they turn black in a few minutes. Room changes/upgrades? Unavailable.

Reviews.Title: “Warning”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Exposed wiring, holes in the walls, mold, thin old linens, broken TV, No air conditioning and no screens on windows...enough said..

Reviews.Title: “overall good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in hp in december 2002,this was my second visit to new yok but not this hotel.Although check-in was quite slow i did find reception helpful.I made 2 calls to England to speak to my children,the first call lasted around 2 and a half minutes but when i put the phone down i could here my son crying so i called back for another 30 seconds.When i went downstairs to pay for my bill it cost around $137 which was ridiculous,i spoke to someone and she knocked off $100 dollars,my advice is never use there phone.The location of the hotel is excellent and our room wasn't bad,we had a side view,i could just see curmet the frog on macy's but i must say the bathroom was awful and mouldy but the room was quite large.I would go and stay there again as i think it is good value for money(except the telephone).

Reviews.Title: “cheap quality”
Reviews.Author: NicDBrusselsBelgium
Reviews.Content: I thought "the Penn" to be an "old glory" and a bargain, and it was just that: in Midtown Manhattan, were will you find a clean, safe room with private bathroom@ 140£/night for two persons? In a B & B, maybe, or in "the Penn".... of course, long queues at the reception desk, no breakfast... not much of a sight from our room (we stayed there twice) Get there from Newark by taking the shuttle train at , then the 11$ train to Pennstation: :much easier and faster than any bus or taxi and cheaper too!

Reviews.Title: “Great rate and location, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: amricnpie
Reviews.Content: I am from a small town and was scared to death when I arrived in New York, but the people at the Pennsylvania were very friendly. They went out of their way to be helpful and courteous. The lobby area was gorgeous.
