My room, although clean and comfortable, was a bit basic, which is what I expected considering it cost about half of what other hotels in the area were charging. I will be staying at the Penn on my next trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Hotel, Good Location.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in June 2002 for 5 days. Before booking we viewed their website and the hotel & rooms looked clean and tidy.However on arriving at the hotel at about 11pm at night we where dropped off at the side entrance which looked like a run down building. We managed to find our way to the marble cladded lobby and we breathed a sigh of relief because it looked nice and exactly matched what we had seen on their website previously. This however was short lived once arrived at our room as I have never seen such a dull, shabby and dirty hole in all our travelling. The bed linen and walls were dirty and the fridge whined and smelled. The bathroom was shabby with a hole and mould on the ceiling. Our view through the window was other hotel windows and the curtains where dirty. Its was now about 11.30pm at night and we complained to the management as we had asked for a room with a view that was clean. They told us that they only had another 1 room available and that we would have to speak to the manager in the morning. We were given another room but were told that it had not yet been refurbished. We nearly died when we arrived at this room. The door was smashed in and just about locked and another two doors lead to other rooms and didnt even lock. I managed to push a sofa against one to stop it opening. The curtains had a natural black tinge that had been amassed over years and again the bedsheets were filthy. The carpet was worn right through to the floor in certain areas and the bathroom was falling apart. It was now 12pm at night and we had no alternative but to sleep on our coats on top of the bed. I phoned our travel agent in the uk at about 4am and he arranged another room overlooking madison square garden which was better but again wasnt that clean and extremely basic. While we stayed there no one ever cleaned our room but only changed the towels every other day and the personnel were very unhelpful. Please be careful if you do chose this hotel as New York is a wonderful holiday and this hotel may spoil it for you. Please note We were also ripped off by a company called the new york airport service who kept us waiting for almost 45 mins at the airport after telling us we would only be there about 10 mins and also dropped us of in the middle of New York when they stated they would drop us of at our hotel this cost us $45. It cost us another $20 to get to the hotel from where they dropped us off. They didnt want to know ethier when i rung them up. My advice stay somewhere else and get yellow cabs everywhere cause they are cheaper, direct and easier to use.

Reviews.Title: “Not sooo bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel Penn during the blackout on August 14th - it was a horrible place just like any hotel in NY at this time. Everyone was sleeping on the floor in the lobby. (But I heard they did the same at the Walldorf Astoria) . When they opened checkin again they gave us a room on 5th floor and a free glow-in-the-dark stick to find the room and a wise 'take care'. As electricity wasn't working water didn't work either and air condition was leaking so there was a big water stain on the floor. As electricity came back I can just say that for the price of $61 per person in a double room this was just great value. Rooms were clean and cleaned every day. Well the design is outdated green and grey can get youz into a depressive mood but you are not staying in NY to stay at the hotel. So we basically spent the nights there. Penn Station is across the street - The Empire State Building is a 5 minutes walk. Subway is around the corner - Saborro and McDonalds is right 1 minute away from the hotels doorstep. What else do you want in NY? I would definitly come back and stay the the Hotel Penn if I am looking for a Budget Host.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just come back from our first trip to the USA.We stayed at the hotel pennsylvania for 3 nights from 22-26 august.I like many read the reviews after i had booked this hotel and was not looking forward to my trip to NY.I am not sure where these others stayed that have written bad reviews,but i am sure it can not be same hotel??.We had booked 3 rooms in total,2 on the 12th floor and 1 on the 10th.All the rooms were very clean clean,had great views of the empire state building and were cleaned ever day.We were provided with plenty of room,good size bathroom,fridge,and tv(who needs tv in NY??).I would like to add that you must remember that there is going to be more bad than good reviews as it is human nature to complain when things are not right, and most do not bother to write a report when there are no problems at all.This hotel is basic,as in,it does not have gold furnishings,but for the price i paid it is excellent.Ignore the bad reviews,if you are on a budget or just looking for something cheaper and clean,i recommend this hotel.Excellent stay,will be booking a return trip.Also in a great location and easy to get around the whole city when you walk out the front door.Feel free to contact me with any questions

Reviews.Title: “Basic but warm (in Dec)!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked the Penn as a friend of mine recommended it as 'basic but ok for a base to explore the city'. The hotels reception area is very impressive but nothing like how you would expect the rest of the hotel!! The corridors to the rooms were'nt the best, abit like walking through a prison and needed a good vaccuum but we didnt go to spend time in the corridors!! Our room was small, basic but warm. It was clean and had a colour TV. The bathroom needed updating but we were only there for 3 nights so we didnt care about decor! I would recommend the Penn as a great location hotel (5 mins to Times Square, 1 min to Macys, 5 mins to Empire State and right opposite Madison Sq Gardens) for those looking to explore NYC.

Reviews.Title: “The WORST Hotel in NYC!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kristofd
Reviews.Content: You have to read this before you go! I stayed at this hotel in April 2004. I checked in at about 10PM. After having to stand in a queue for about 1 hour with all my suitcases and really tired, i finally got my key chucked at me, by a girl that did not even care who I was. I went up to my room, walking down the corridors, I got this really bad feeling the room was going to be bad, because the corridors look like something out of a Horror movie. I got into my room. Shock Horror, the bed had dirty sheets, someones blood on it. I did not open the closet or drawres for the week I was there, because they where AWEFULL. I lived out of my suitcase. I was worried of even having a shower there, it was filthy. My TV set was just standing there on a wooden apple box, and to top it off, my room overlooked another roof on the next building, and every morning there where people walking on that roof, and they would look into my room, as there where no curtains. This hotel should be either knocked down, or shut down and renovated. I still can't believe I chose this hotel. It's the first time I chose a hotel because it was cheap, and whitout looking in the books, and I have stayed in NYC often, I should have gone to my known hotels. If you are going to stay here, get a REFUND, and get another hotel....If not for yourself, this WILL ruin your time in NYC!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not my first choise...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Okey, I got som problems during my stay at this hotel. 1: I've seen clearer tap water before.. 2: They tried to make me pay more money than I actually spent. 3: A lady knocked on my door asking for help because she had lost her sister the day before and still hadn't got the chance to call the police. The in-room phone was blocked for such calls, and the people working in the reception "couldn't help her". It's amazing! She borrowed my cell phone.

Reviews.Title: “1 star property despite renovation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would suggest this hotel be used as a last resort. While it does have a "perfect" location to Madison Sq. Garden and Empire St. Building ... the staff are for themost part useless. You should not be shocked to wait in line for a couple hours to get your room. The hotel restaurant, "Lindys" is an example of the phrase "greasy spoon". The hotel underwent a recent renovation so it is actually improved from years past. But halls are dark. Rumors of "friends" visiting at night are a typical complaint as are complaints of smelling an odor of urine. If you are just staying one night, will likely be intoxicated, and coming from a Nicks game ... this might be the hotel for you. Otherwise, there are other options in this property's price range.

Reviews.Title: “Great! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First, let me say that contrary to my standard operating procedure I booked this reservation on Hotels THEN I read all the reviews that it was disgusting, horrid, etc. Initially I wanted to back out but I managed to get an upgrade before I went. That said, it must seem as though every reviewer stayed in a different room. In my case, I was on the 12th floor and I managed to check out other rooms when the housekeeper was doing her rounds. My room, and the other rooms, were fine. No stains, cracks in the ceiling or other problems. There were no bad odors and no cockroaches. Our room did not have the best decor, but it was EXCELLENT for the price! I think that some of the other reviewers were either (a) spoiled (b) in a really bad room below the renovated levels or (c) work for another hotel and are trying to make the HP look bad. Here are the facts. - I was in and out of chec-kin, and allowed to check in early. Same for check out. - 2 The elevators were speedy and cool. I could watch CNN on my way up and down. The facade and lobby are historic and cool.- 3 As a train buff, I was able to run across the street while my wife got ready and check out the subways and trains leaving and departing the station. It was awesome.- 4 The location was ideal and close to just about everything we needed.- 5 Our room smelled fine and though the view left much to be desired, we only used the room to sleep and change. We had clean bedding and towels. Everything was as it should be expected.-6 Cable TV was working properly. -7 For $85.00 a night, it was unbeatable. But remember - I got the upgrade and did not see the rooms below.-8 My brother in law stayed in a suite upstairs. That one DID have a stinky, stained carpet and refridgerator. The cieling was cracked. But it was huge and they were happy. - 9 If you're a person who cannot stand to be without fine decor, a fantastic view and beautiful acoomodations, fork over $1000 a night and stay somewhere else.- 10 If you are a frequent traveler, enjoy taking in sights instead of watching TV in your room, or are just there for a place to sleep, it's PERFECT.NOW all of this in mind, I did some undercover work before I went there and got one of the employees to admit that there ARE TERRIBLE ROOMS below the renovated levels, with cockroaches, cracks, odors, etc. So make sure you stay in the renovated area. Good luck!!!

Reviews.Title: “Urine for a bad time at Hotel Penn”
Reviews.Author: TheEyeInEvanston
Reviews.Content: This is a disgrace to itself and to NYC. It is filthy and smelly - none of which is for you to know until you get there. (If you were us, you were locked in by a "airline ticket-hotel" package. NEVER again!)The rooms are old and lack even paint. The walls are peeling and haven't been washed since Fred Astaire was a boy. The bathroom fixtures are old and leak - don't drink the water: you don't know where it's been! - and the tiles are cracked. Most of all it is that smell of old urine and God knows what else that overwhelms you. We did all we could to stay away from the hotel from morning until late, late at night when we were so tired we wouldn't notice it as much. Note to the mayor of NYC: condemn it!

Reviews.Title: “caution”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: At first when I stepped into the reception area with all It's lovely decorated walls and busy staff I thought I was on a winner. But when I got to my room I nearly checked out again, the room was dirty(ther was even a footprint on my pillowcase, the toilet seat was hanging off! and the bathroom had a horrid smell. After complaining to the manager all I got was "what do you expect for the price". Eventually I was given another room, a bit more space but could have done with a whip round with the hoover! I'm sorry this Is one I shall not be re-visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were especially pleased to be able to walk across the street from the train station and be able to check into our hotel before 11 am. The temperature was perfect for the entire time we were in the room. It was a hot day and air conditioners generally are cranked so high that the extreme is unbearable. Not so with Hotel Pennsylvania. It was not the Taj Mahal, but that's not what we paid for and not what we were expecting. The staff was very friendly and we very happy to be able to store our bags in a safe place for the day at a minimal fee. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed at the pennsylvania hotel in april 2004 and thought it was a great place. very large room nicely decorated and very clean.loacation was superb.can't believe people moan,you must sit in your rooms all day and think of things to moan about, you should get out more and enjoy nyc .had a fantastic time in nyc and would certainly stay at the hotel pennsylvania again.to all you moaners GET A LIFE!!!!!!!.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had booked a room here online, and admittedly had some doubts about it after reading these postings, however I decided to give it a try anyways. I had pre-paid for the room and arrived around 9 pm. When I went up to my room, it had not been cleaned yet, so I had to go out for a while to let the housekeeper change the sheets, etc. The carpet and walls were filthy, even had some graffiti on the wall. The air conditioner unit was falling out of the wall, bottoms of the furniture hanging out, holes in the wall where either a picture or mirror had hung but you could see the outline from years of cigaratte smoke. The worst thing about this place was the noise! I had to endure listening to the people in the room talking until 3 am...the walls were paper-thin. I honestly could not recommend this place...next time I won't be so cheap and will stay in a better place.

Reviews.Title: “Help!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My son who lives in Washington, my sister who lives in Mississippi and I stayed at this Hotel in late April 2003. The lobby was lovely (not enough seating). The rooms however leave much to be desired. The walls are bare and the room we stayed in had a funky odor to it. The bathroom looked AWFUL. Over the sink they have a countered made out of a piece of wood with brackets holding it up. Reminded me of something a 12 year old would make in shop class in junior high school. Make sure you don't eat in the resturant located at the front of the hotel. The prices are WAY to high. Go to the corner and get something to eat at the pizza place. They have fantastic prises and the food is great. In ending, I won't EVER stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “colored water, hah??”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed this hotel for 1night(luckly) and was surprised by the water from tab or shower. Small brown crumble DIRT came out constantly!!! It didn't stop!!! Normally it should stop in first few munites or so, but it didn not stop my entire shower time at all!! BUT not only DIRT, also water was not clear, it was yellow.....Well you should watch water for few munites or so BEFORE you take shower!!

Reviews.Title: “No complaints here for a two-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Needed a convenient location for last Saturday night, and got a good rate for a basic non-smoking room through an online bargain site. Luckily we had a renovated room on the 12th floor. Big enough for the two of us - new orthopedic kingsized bed, updated furniture, large TV w/remote, portable phone (we didn't use it), pc connection, clock radio w/cd player, in-room fridge, amusing view of another brick wall, clean bathroom with older fixtures, carpet could have been brighter, but nothing to cringe at. Someone mentioned the "servidoor" and I guess that referred to the door of the room -- we thought we were entering a submarine or cockpit. Obviously an original -- I don't know what the intent was. Housekeeping staff was friendly; registration desk had a line with six or seven pleasant staff; we were in the room well before 3. Couldn't use the automated check-out because we'd reserved through the online service. Would definitely choose Hotel PA again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Pennsylvania New York
HotelInfo.Address: 401 Seventh Avenue at 33rd Street, New York City, NY 10001
